1.description: I just need to give this place 1 star for how cheesy it is.  Before they put the name up it used to have a big sign that said "Fine Art".  First of all you don't need to advertise it as FINE if it is really great art.  Then there is the squigly neon lights in the windows.  Its not the late 80s or early 90s so please don't do that.This place is pricey and has sales all the time.  Why not just price it where it can be sold instead of a 50% off everything sale.The art inside is not my favorite.  I really like Sacred Art.

0.description: How can you not love this gallery?  If you like this kind of art (and there are plenty of other galleries for all tastes), then Chicago Contemporary Art is for you.  The artwork is beautiful, the owners/artists are pleasures to deal with and, best of all, they will gladly create something unique and original if requested.  We brought in certain colors that we wanted to use for a room in our new house and their creation worked perfectly.  For the reasonable prices of existing pieces, customized designed and personal service, this place is hard to beat.  I suppose if neon signs offend you then perhaps.....

28.description: A good location in Chicago Old Town.  Good amount of parking and the quality is good - normative Panera! The French Onion has been going down hill at all locations and it is the same for this spot.

1.description: This is a difficult review to post because I like the sandwich combinations Panera creates. The turkey, apple & cheddar sandwich is a very good example of this. The "challenge" is the amount of meat you get for the price of said sandwich!Net-net, I go here for a change not because I'm famished. if your really hungry, do Potbelly's, Jimmy Johns or Jersey Mikes. If you want a semi-elitist experience or you're having a casual lunch with a client, pick Panera for the ambiance...

9.description: I was the only person here i ordered one sandwich and they took 20 minutes to prepare my order. Very dissapointed

29.description: I prefer this Panera to others in the city because there is a better layout and overall the customer service is better. There is always somewhere to sit and get your work done.

23.description: Panera has decent food, but it's overpriced. The amount you pay does not correlate to the amount of food you are given. I know, I know, American portions are typically part of the reason our country is obese... For real talk though, if I just spent $20 for a sandwich, a drink, and some soup or salad, my appetite should be satiated. It never is... Then, you have the people who buy one cup of coffee and sit on their laptops all day long with nothing better to do than to hog the booths.  It's why I don't hang out at coffee shops and is not my cup of tea... Haha oh man.... See what I did there?Screw Panera. It's completely overrated and overpriced.

5.description: Been here once and service was pretty fast the place was pretty busy over here this is a slower than the others that are in the surrounding areas. Sam was the manager that helped me out with my orders and questions. ..surprised as I thought he was at another location.   Very professional. ...always said sir and had an answer for everything. The place itself is nice...spread out...some secluded areas...plugs galore which other places seemed to lack.  Private lot with in a jewel mall...and security so no tomfoolery afoot.

31.description: I'm glad that a new panera bread opened up close to me.I go here every few weeks for a delicious breakfast sandwich.They have a french toast bagel that really can't be beat.Once this place first opened they had a few kinks to work out and my order took a lot longer than it should and was missing items (ie BACON!)They do seem to have worked out the issues and I'm getting decent service at a decent price and pace.I am a fan.

25.description: I like it here. Good food, quick, free wifi. Clean.Lost a star based off multiple incorrect to-go orders. 3 out of the last 4 times my food has been incorrect when I opened the bag at home. Always checking my order at the restaurant from here on out.Lost a star because the employees seem unhappy. They can be helpful, but I'd like to see a smile.I like the rewards program.

12.description: This panera bread restaurant is the worst. Others I've been to is great. The sand which tasted old and looked old. I couldn't eat the rest. On my friends order they forgot his apple and chips. Nor did they add the extra olives. Steer clear of this one folks.

37.description: We tried this new Panera location for the first time today. I'm sure most people are already familiar with their high-quality (but a tad spendy) menu, so I'll focus on the other issues:The interior is well-appointed and cheery, the service was snappy, there is plenty of free parking, and best of all, it is very easy to drive to! Most driving in this area is a pain in the posterior, but this particular location is right in the vacuum created by the demise of Cabrini Green, and as such has very light traffic. I'm sure that won't last, but it's great for now!Also, there is some outdoor seating, great for dining al fresco with your puppy.

21.description: Get there at 10:31 AM and they won't make me a breakfast sandwich.  I get it that breakfast ends at 10:30, but what about accomodating the customer.   Then the cashier did this back and forth with the kitchen to check if they had eggs.  Kitchen says no.  Then they ask if the kitchen has egg whites.  Kitchen says no.. WTF.

16.description: Who runs out of bagels? On a Sunday? When you're a bagel and bread place?! Poor management--the manager is just standing behind the counter like a deer in headlights as a dozen customers come in and all exclaim,"you're out of bagels?!"

17.description: Food ok.  Tables dirty  Floor dirty. Women's restroom. One toilet not working. No toilet paper in the other stalls.  Won't be back

10.description: The Pesto Sacchitini is to DIE for! I cannot come to Panera without getting it.  Though this location is a "typical" Panera, in my opinion it's a little crowded most of the time.  Definitely not really a spot where I would get lost in my headphones and get some work done.  It's definitely more of a happening restaurant location.  Eat. Talk. Chill. That is all.

11.description: Fast, friendly, affordable & delicious ! I sure wish we can get one on the south side of Chicago.

26.description: This Panera is my favorite of all time. I stopped by for my favorite chocolate chip cookie and since they were out the Manager made batch fresh and I got to enjoy my favorite cookie  still warm from the oven. This was such a nice experience and he was so nice that I'll be coming to this location often.. This is now my " go to" Panera!! Thanks for the treat..you made my day!!

27.description: I went in for a dozen bagels today to bring to work. I wanted assorted but told him the bagels I wanted included. The GM was waiting on me and he gave me a three everything bagels. He even punched in the bagels I asked for which also show up on my receipt, and not one said everything! I worked at Panera over 10 years ago when it was called St. Louis Bread Company, and even then I knew...you put the everything bagels in their own bag! So not only did I not want any everything bagels, I got three and as a bonus, all 13 taste like it. Gross and poor form for the business meeting I brought them to.Actually the whole experience was wacky. There was another cashier and 2 other people in line, so definitely not a busy morning (it was 7 AM), but he was so flustered, racing around, barely paying attention to me et.c. I guess it's not surprise he ruined my order.

35.description: I just wished this place opened when I was still working in the Navy Recruiting Office 2 min walk away.As everyone knows, you can't really go wrong with this place.  Good sandwiches, fresh bread and good soup.  What else can you ask for?  No military discount though.  Oh well.

8.description: I was very disappointed with my visit to panera today. I ordered a bowl of soup and a chicken ceaser sandwich. I paid just under $1400. The chicken sandwich had next to no chicken on it. I hadn't eaten all day and was very hungry and anxious for a great sandwich. However I was left wanting much more after I got home opened my sandwich and saw nothing but lettuce onion and tomatoe, w just a couple crumbs of chicken. For nearly 14$ I pretty much got ripped off and was still very hungry after my meal. I will not be going back there for sure.

0.description: A little after Christmas shopping called for a fast yet healthy and good breakfast sandwich! First time at this Panera location, service was friendly and fast. Ordered a simple bacon egg and cheese sandwich on ciabatta. Delish!

38.description: Yay! Happy for a Panera at this location. Free parking,free wi-fi,  nice interior space, same good food :)

20.description: I am not sure why this place only has three stars. Its Panera.... If you are expecting something more fancy or more tasty than what Panera offers, then don't go to Panera. But for a Panera store, its great! Its big, food tastes exactly how panera food items are supposed to taste like, has a huge parking lot, location is great.... I just don't really know what to complain about. If I'm getting a soup and salad and want to keep moving with my day, this is the spot I will go to. Also, the internet is really good here if you're trying to study.

19.description: Met a friend there for lunch and we both ordered the pick 2 combo at the same time but they somehow mixed up the order which led to one of us having eaten the meal before the other was even ready... The food was good though. Would give a 2 star but the staff were helpful and accommodating once they realized the mistake...Will be back.

33.description: I like that this place is cleanly, and the staff is always friendly. The food always comes out fresh and the wait isn't very long! I would recommend it except it closes so early! I can rarely stop by after work because they close at 9pm :( Otherwise YES!!!

2.description: I come to Panera every Sunday morning to get breakfast for my family and over the last 6 months I've watched the service at the Division street location deteriorate.  It is to the point now that I will not return to this location.  I'm pretty sure they are not even close to ready to open at 7:00 am.  I've tried utilizing the online "Rapid pick up" and the last three weeks it hasn't been ready until 7:45.  The soufflés are almost impossible to get so to remedy this, I put the order in the night before for their very first available pick up time.  It was a larger order so it no doubt took them longer to put it together, which means they gave the soufflé I ordered to someone else and I was forced to order something else.  Some of the staff here was friendly and helpful but as of now, I haven't seen anything to make me want to return to this location.  It's just too bad Panera is awesome food, otherwise I would patronize another restaurant altogether.

34.description: Love this place, nice and cozy

32.description: Ok I feel really lame updating my review on Panera Bread, but for those that like to do some work & use Wifi while you're here I gotta say that the Wifi here is SUPER ANNOYING. Always have a hard time getting connected, not enough plug-ins for charging & they have a time limit on wifi usage. wtf!wifi usage aside i do love panera & their "you pick 2" menu options for lunch & the rewards they give you for free food.

18.description: It's Panera...They always get it right.I shoot for the chipotle Chicken sandwich and the french onion soup. I also love the asian wonton salad.Now why 5 stars?  The customer service was phenomenal!Keep up the friendly service and welcome to the neighborhood!

13.description: This is probably the worst location of Panera I've been to. I always grab something to go when I pass by and guess what 3 times out of 4 my order gets screwed up. Today I got a flatbread and a casear salad the flatbread was ok just like it should be and for my Caesar I got lettuce leafes and croutons- that's all.

4.description: Free parking and a clean environment.  This is a very nice Panera with wifi and a large seating area.  I had the new thai garden chicken wonton soup which was very good.  I also tried their new roasted turkey caramelized kale panini.  The panini was just ok.  Seemed very bland but it was my choice to try it.  The soups are always good.  I'm a Panera fan.  When I just want a simple sandwich and soup you can't beat it!

24.description: Overall this Panera Bread has a great atmosphere. Not too many places for outlets, as I usually bring my computer to eat and study. It usually feels cold as well whenever I go. But the customer service is nice. The only thing is, they usually never have the items that I want - twice I went there, and they didn't have broccoli cheddar soup! I thought that was surprising because it's a popular item. I chose their other soup but was not as satisfied. Other than that the place is clean and pretty spacious.

6.description: Its a Panera! The food was good, the people were relatively friendly and our food was good.

22.description: Ive been to plenty of Paneras before. This one however, gets my order wrong EVERY single time I'm there. I get the wrong sandwiches, wrong soups, a lot of times i only get a half of a sandwich.. which always pisses me of because I pay full price for half the food. Bogus. Today was the last time I'll be going there, unfortunately.  Im tired of getting ripped off :/

15.description: Panera has decent food, but it's overpriced. The amount you pay does not correlate to the amount of food you are given. I know, I know, American portions are typically part of the reason our country is obese... For real talk though, if I just spent $20 for a sandwich, a drink, and some soup or salad, my appetite should be satiated. It never is... Then, you have the people who buy one cup of coffee and sit on their laptops all day long with nothing better to do than to hog the booths.  It's why I don't hang out at coffee shops and is not my cup of tea... Haha oh man.... See what I did there?Screw Panera. It's completely overrated and overpriced.

7.description: Always a good place to eat I love the half sandwich have salad nice and healthy I had the Asian salad today off the chain so good

36.description: It's Panera...They always get it right.I shoot for the chipotle Chicken sandwich and the french onion soup. I also love the asian wonton salad.Now why 5 stars?  The customer service was phenomenal!Keep up the friendly service and welcome to the neighborhood!

30.description: As far as Panera goes this one is nice and new and clean.  It has plenty of parking because it shares the lot with the grocery store and strip mall.  It's a good size and lay out and everyone was very friendly.

3.description: SOOOOOO GOOD! When I don't have the energy to cook this place is always a great option. Clean environment, excellent service and really yummy food. Just wish it was closer to home bu then I'd never cook!

14.description: I'm glad that a new panera bread opened up close to me.I go here every few weeks for a delicious breakfast sandwich.They have a french toast bagel that really can't be beat.Once this place first opened they had a few kinks to work out and my order took a lot longer than it should and was missing items (ie BACON!)They do seem to have worked out the issues and I'm getting decent service at a decent price and pace.I am a fan.

28.description: After yelping around for a place to get my hair done, I finally decided on Art of Hair Design Salon. I was a little skeptical of the salon because it does not look like the upscale Chicago salons that I am used to. However, the salon had so many good reviews that I decided I had to try it. The reviews were spot on! I had my hair cut, colored, and highlighted by Diana. It turned out exactly how I wanted it. She dyed my hair the exact shade of dark brown I was looking for (no red undertones) and only cut the 2 inches off of my hair that I asked her to. Additionally, the salon was relaxing and friendly - not pretentious like other salons I had been to. Finally, the price was extremely reasonable. I have been charged up to $250 for similar services (with worse results!) at other Chicago salons and Diana only charged me $160. I will definitely be back!

1.description: My boyfriend's hair was...out of control. He insisted he didn't need a haircut, but really...he needed it badly. Anyway, the only way that hair was getting cut was if I was going to take matters into my own hands and book him a damn appointment! So around 10am on a Friday, I started calling around Old Town (I live around the area). Most of the places just had terrible phone etiquette, which I could handle if their prices were reasonable. But literally the majority of responses I got on pricing were "well, for men it starts at $45 if you go with a newer stylist but like..$80 if you go with a pro." ...I literally called 5 places before I called Art of Hair Design Salon. The phone call was straight forward. "$20 if he doesn't need us to wash his hair; $25 if he does." I wanted the last appointment of the day - keep in mind this was Friday and I wanted a same-day appointment. The lady was super nice and said, "oh, 6:15/6:30 work?" ..hell yeah it did!Anyhow, he popped in and out within 20 minutes - the shaggy mop on his head turned into something recognizable and I was happy.Thank you Art of Hair Design Salon!

39.description: I have lived in Chicago for 4 years and haven't stayed loyal to 1 salon! This is crazy because I get my hair done every 3 months! I have struggled (until now) to find: people who "get it," give me exactly what I ask for and have reasonable pricing in a relaxed environment. Is that too much to ask for?! :)I live a street over- on Dearborn but had never noticed the little space, probably because there's always a lot going on at that Clark & North intersection. It's right next to that old theater on Clark that has been shut down for a while. The place was more of a barber shop until the new owners moved in about a year ago. They do hair, waxing, treading, etc. The sweetest ladies run this salon. I really enjoyed chatting with genuinely nice, down to Earth women who are the furthest thing from snobby. At other salons you are left waiting while the stylist goes to another client, I've even been asked to blow dry my own hair if I didn't want to pay ($60) for a blow out! These ladies made me feel well taken care of and attended to. I felt like she really understood my hair and made well thought out suggestions based on how I explained my goals for my color. I got exactly what I wanted for a GREAT price. I felt so comfortable, like I was hanging out with friends. Art of Hair Design is a true hidden gem. I can't wait to go back!

9.description: First trip to Chicago and stayed at Hotel Lincoln. My hair needed styling badly. I wanted a shop nearby that I could walk to.  I needed Yelp Help. I did a quick search and read the glowing reviews on Art of Hair Design. I got in quickly and immediately fell in love with the " adorable sisters -in-laws with a lot of experience" that another reviewer talked about. Bono and Lena are cute, polite, professional, hip, up to date, funny and wonderful; to say nothing of their beautiful smiles. Bona not only gave a great cut but also gave me some wonderful styling tips that in 40 years I haven't been given. Do yourself a favor if you have hair you can't do a thing with and you just had a cut the day before. If the cut is great you can make your hair do things you never thought was possible!! If it's bad even the one style you have will look dated.Good luck!!

29.description: Came here on a Monday at 10.45am so cannot comment on how things are on a weekend/during a really busy time but... the two ladies in the Salon were very friendly and spent a good deal of time cutting my hair, made adjustments when requested and the cut was $20 (without wash, think a wash is an extra $5). The haircut I left with was great and turned out way better than some of the other cuts I have had in the area. I have finally found my hairdresser in Lincoln Park/Old Town :)

23.description: I just moved to the city and needed some hair help badly! Looking for full foil highlights and a great cut at a reasonable price is nearly impossible, but I turned to this place based on the yelp reviews. I am SO GLAD I DID! I was very, VERY skeptical when I walked in because I'm used to high end salons (You know, the type that gives you wine but charges for blowdrying). This place isn't a spa, but the reviews are spot on - Bona fixed me right up with very little direction on my part. Her and Lina are sweet as pie. Everything came out perfect. She is like a ninja with foils (super fast but soooo close to the root) and gave me one of the best cuts I've ever had. The place itself seems to be a staple in the neighborhood, with dozens of regulars who the lovely ladies working there had an amazing relationship. People walking by often stopped in to just say hi! It was a refreshing experience, I WILL be back often, and I cannot recommend it highly enough.

5.description: I live in the neighborhood and I read the reviews here on Yelp and it was everything I was hoping for. Bona cut my hair and I will definitely be back. Thank you.

31.description: I live in the neighborhood and usually find somewhere in River North to go get wax/threadings.I walk by this place everyday on my way to the gym and one day decided to stop by for eyebrow threading. The two ladies that work in there are SO nice! I can not recall her name, but the one who took care of me was super good. She did a fantastic job and was very professional and friendly.$12.00 for great eyebrow threading less than a block away from you house... what else would you ask for.I've found a hair salon I love up in Lakeview so don't think I'm going to change anytime soon, but will definitely go back to Art of Hair Design for any waxing or threading need.

25.description: Eyebrow threading? This is where you come. I don't do waxing. I also am particular and these ladies are my favorites. They do lots of things in this salon (hair cuts, color, threading services etc) and they are honest and forthright. Any threading services you should do here. cash tip only, please.

12.description: Friendly service. Did a great job with haircuts. I also appreciate their little tips on managing my hair.

37.description: Great Job Lina....I finnaly found someone who can bloiw dry curly hair in the city!!!!

21.description: Pretty much just made a yelp acct so I could give this salon 5 stars. I have been super busy lately, let my hair cut and color go way too long, and finally had an afternoon free. I called a bunch of salons to see who could take me same day, and Art of Hair Design could.  Based on yelp reviews, I thought, why not?  SO HAPPY I DID. The salon itself is outdated, but the ladies who work there are FABULOUS. I've been getting my hair highlighted for about a decade now, and tried several salons across the US. This prob ranks top 5 highlight and cut jobs.  I have very thin hair and my highlights and low lights have to be done extremely thin as well, otherwise I look like a blonde zebra.  My blonde was the exact shade I wanted, my low lights were perfect, and my cut is adorable as well - all with very little direction for me. Also, the price was extremely reasonable! Especially for how well it came out.Highly Recommend.

16.description: I hate to write this review because I was genuinely happy with my cut and color, but my blouse was completely stained with dye (a few spots on the sleeves, back and front). Before starting I asked if I should take it off, but she assured me there would be no issue. Lesson learned...listen to your gut. The worst part was that they didn't point out the stains so I returned to work looking like a crazy hot mess. I would have had a lot more respect if they  addressed the situation immediately.

17.description: I had one of those 911: need a haircut TODAY moments yesterday. Another salon cancelled my appointment hours beforehand (so annoying), so I was in a bit of a bind. Especially because most salons are not open on Mondays or close very, very early. This world is simply not made for the working woman.Art of Hair Design is right next to my usual nail salon in the neighborhood, and I thought, why not? I called around 2PM and got an appointment at 6:15PM, which was perfect. I noticed on their door that they accept walk-ins, too, which is great.Some things I enjoyed about my experience include the speed (in and out in about 45 minutes), the friendliness of the two hairdressers, the unpretentious atmosphere, and the extreme quality of the service. Sure, this place is no frills. But I don't need a cup of Armenian mint tea while I wait 20 minutes past my appointment time. I'd rather sit down right away and get to it.Bona gave a great shampoo and a really beautiful haircut. I'm growing my hair out a little, and she knew exactly how to layer it to give it more texture while not compromising the length.The salon is usually a rushed, anxiety-provoking experience because of confusing pass-offs between shampoo people and hairdressers, and lots of bizarre tipping rituals like dropping an envelope of cash into a small Buddha and stashing singles in your bra quickly to give to a shampoo girl. When I leave work, I don't want to think. I don't want to have to figure out where to stash my coat and how to get back to a stylist's station in a 4000 square foot space with no direction.When all was said and done, I paid $50 and got a really great haircut. She tackled all my split ends and I feel like I will be able to go longer than usual between haircuts because it was so well-done.If you go to the salon for the Kiehl's lotion in the bathroom or the sensory oils massaged on your scalp, please just keep paying for your $90 haircut from a guy named Sebastian with an angular haircut and a Gucci logo belt.

10.description: I was in Chicago for work and agonizing over whether to dye my gray roots or just grow them out.  A friend who works with hair recommended a way to grow it out.  I called Art of Hair Design and when I went for my appointment with Lena, she said exactly the same tonight about how to grow it out.  Her highlights and cut were impeccable and I have gotten a ton of compliments.  She did a great threading of my eyebrows as well.  It is a big airy clean salon with such a great staff!If I am ever in Chicago again, I will go to Art of Hair Design!

11.description: If you r looking for a fancy, "be seen" scene, u'll want to look for another salon.  This is a friendly, neighborhood salon that welcomes appts or walk ins.  I've had my hair colored and cut by all 3 of the stylists there and their work is great, reasonable and consistent.  The owner, Lena, takes great pride in her shop and services.  Bona and Diana are equally talented and friendly. I definitely recommend Art of Hair.

26.description: Came here for a hair cut, after reading all the great reviews on yelp. Scheduling my appointment was super easy. The haircut was quite good and the stylist did listen to my concerns and suggestions. They use Moroccan Oil products (in my case they used a light moroccan oil styling creme), and I was really impressed with the end product.While I was getting my hair done I got a chance to talk to Lina and Bona, who were very friendly and a pleasure to talk to. It is not everyday you see neighborhood folks waving hello to Lina and Bona as they walked by, or even peak to say hello in person and crack a joke - so refreshing to see.  I will definitely go back to Art of Hair Design Salon and even experiment a little more with color in the future.

27.description: I called in for same day app, and they got me in, which was nice. The ladies are very friendly, and the haircut was ok, but not exactly what I asked for. I asked for shoulder length haircut, and came out with hair right below my jaw line. Quite disappointing to tell the truth. Because they took me in as a walk in, and were friendly, I will give a 3/5. The stylist needs to pay a little more attention, and remember that when hair is wet it looks a lot longer than when it dries. Thank God hair grows back.

35.description: Bona and Lina are terrific.  I have been getting my hair cut there for years and Bona does it exactly the way I like it and they could not be any friendlier.  Oh! And the hours are terrific..don't have to make an appointment

8.description: I called today, two days before Christmas and one hour before I had to be at work.  As I called I knew it would be a long shot to get an appointment.  I was told if I was there soon I could probably be fit in.I showed in 5 minutes later and thought maybe I should be worried that it seemed I was being "squeezed in" it seemed, but what's the worst that could happen?  This place has great reviews. Lina takes me over, her hands moving quickly and her conversation stimulating and interesting.  Some ten minutes later, we are done and I was very impressed how a quick haircut could come out looking so great!  I've had plenty of good haircuts (and some awful) but everything about this experience was top of the line.  I don't always have great chats with stylists since I'm a pretty shy person, but today she brought it out of me like we were good friends. Maybe one day we will be, because I'll definitely be back next month.

0.description: It took me a while to find a perfect place to do my hair in Chicago. I came to Art of Hair Design Salon and never wanted to go anywhere else again. Everyone is super friendly and welcoming, all the hairdressers are capable of understanding my thoughts about how I want my hair to look and bringing it to life.Thank you for a great job guys!

38.description: I must admit, I never really yelp, mostly out of laziness...However this place was so amazing I feel the need to share it with the Yelp community!Thank goodness for FINALLY finding that place I've been looking for!I have been looking for a great go to place where the stylists actually listen to you...and somewhere that is nice and relaxing...doesn't charge you an arm and a leg...and the stylists are nice and relaxed.  Check, check and CHECK!I went in to have them thread my eyebrows because the salon is literally a block from my apartment.  They were so nice and honest and gave me some great tips about what I can do to make my eyebrows better...I figured if they were that considerate and helpful with eyebrows then they would have to be great with hair!  Impulsively I decided to go back a half an hour later and get my hair hi-lighted.The women that run the salon took the time to listen to exactly what I wanted...they were genuinely a pleasure to talk to...my time there flew and I can't wait to go back.  As an added bonus, I have been wanting side-swept bangs for quite some time...every time I attempt them the stylist has cut them way to short and I end up spending the next few months doing everything in my power to hide them!  My stylist happened to have the bangs I've been DYING for and I asked if she would mind trimming my bangs to look like hers, even though I wasn't getting a cut.  She was so great about it...and they also blow dried my hair even though I didn't get a cut.  I've had many a hi-light experiences where they send me out with wet hair...not so fun.  My hi-lights look AMAZING...and somehow even without a cut they managed to make my hair look amazing too.  Now I just can't wait for my boyfriend to get home...somehow I have a feeling he is going to like the new do, too! :)  P.S...Did I mention that for the hi-lights, good company and bang trim cost a mere $75!?!?!?  I have officially found my go-to place...and can't wait to go back.

20.description: I should have probably written this review a long time ago, but better late than never.I used to live on the 1400 block of Dearborn, therefore this place was a hop and skip away. The owners are adorable sisters -in-laws with a lot of experience. After moving to Chicago in 2008, I had several hair appointments all around the city, trying to find the right one. I first came here on a whim, because they take walk ins. Now I wonder what I would do if Lina and Bona ever closed up shop or if I moved away. These are some of the nicest ladies I have ever met. The always give me tea, ask me about my family, and chat me up like they appreciate me as a pal. I have never had a bad experience here and their prices are very reasonable. And oh, my hair always looks good!Their shop is immaculate, super clean. I don't go as often as I used to because I grew my hair out so it requires less work, but these gals totally rock my socks off.

19.description: I can't say enough about this salon.  My husband and I  (along with daughter, niece) have been customers for several years, and have never been disappointed.  Lina is the owner-operator who is an expert in her field and a professional in her own right.   Her coloring and styling techniques are amazing, as is her ability to beautifully handle all types of hair  (I have very curly hair).  Like any good salon owner she has surrounded herself with quality stylists:  Bona, Diana and Tanya, all of which are  great.  In summary, and what keeps me going back, is the high level of skill, flexibility, location (I live next door), cleanliness of salon, and superb customer service. Yes, they're stuck with me and mine....

33.description: In my last post, I said that I hadn't had a cut or color there yet.  Well, I recently had both a cut and color (single process and highlights) both by Bona, and she did a fabulous job.  Much better than my cut and color experience at the Marianne Strokirk (sp?) in the past (and at a fraction of the cost).  I can't say enough about this little salon!  So pleased.

2.description: I had a terrible experience at Art of Hair Design.  The Latina stylist insisted I had lice halfway through the haircut and ended it immediately.  I bought a lice treatment, did it twice that night, yet in my careful comb-throughs each time I didn't find a thing in my hair (if you have lice then you find sesame seed-sized critters and their eggs).  I think she was wrong (I've had zero itching as well), yet she said it with utter, horrified certainty, before ushering me out of the salon.  I checked where I'd been sleeping, and the people I was staying with checked their hair, and we all had nothing.  We scoured the bed and couch where I'd been the day before.  I did a nighttime's worth of laundry washing and heat-drying (heat apparently kills lice) anything my head might have touched. When I returned the next day to finish the cut, the stylist insisted I throw everything at home out - that washing and drying are not enough (despite that my researching lice revealed that heat exposure is all you really need, and that lice will die after two days without being on a human head anyway).  When I asked her what the lice looked like the day before, she immediately insisted "I didn't make it up," which made me curious why she ran to that self-defense so quickly.Every interaction with her seemed to be negative and subtly demeaning.  A part of me wondered if she just wanted to ruin someone's day.When I asked her the next day if my lice was better now, she couldn't bring herself to say yes.  She just grunted that it was "fine."  The haircut itself, too, has left a long lock of hair at the front that should have been cut, but now just falls out of place and looks silly.If she'd been courteous in these interactions, or warm and understanding as she maybe suspected there could be lice, and I should get it checked out?  Then I would've been appreciative.  But her overall tone gave me more the sense that she is carrying a lot of resentment and found a poor customer to take it out on.

34.description: I live a block away and just walked in for a quick trim. Amazing, exact, exactly what I asked for at a very reasonable price.

32.description: i LOVE this place! i have been hopping around to different hair places and never quite get what i want for the price i'm paying.  here, they listened, Lina made a few suggestions and explained why i had probably not been pleased with past results, and offered an idea.  the results were excellent, a cut that still looks great a few months later and highlights that blend well.  the price is also a plus.

18.description: Came here for a hair cut, after reading all the great reviews on yelp. Scheduling my appointment was super easy. The haircut was quite good and the stylist did listen to my concerns and suggestions. They use Moroccan Oil products (in my case they used a light moroccan oil styling creme), and I was really impressed with the end product.While I was getting my hair done I got a chance to talk to Lina and Bona, who were very friendly and a pleasure to talk to. It is not everyday you see neighborhood folks waving hello to Lina and Bona as they walked by, or even peak to say hello in person and crack a joke - so refreshing to see.  I will definitely go back to Art of Hair Design Salon and even experiment a little more with color in the future.

13.description: I found this place on Yelp two years ago.  I am soo blessed to have found them.  They know your name every time you walk in the door and the service and price are amazing!  I get tons of compliments from my co-workers every time I get my hair cut or colored.I highly recommend them!

4.description: What an amazing place! Lina has done a wonderful job with her new store!!! The salon on wells is the new place and it looks amazing! Very cozy and very comfortable. The service is amazing and everyone is so friendly. Lina cuts my hair and does an amazing job every single time. You can not go wrong with this place. I casually went in one day to the old store to try it out and ever since then I haven't cheated on her! It would be a shame to let someone else touch my hair!GO HERE YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED!!!!!

24.description: I can't say enough about this salon.  My husband and I  (along with daughter, niece) have been customers for several years, and have never been disappointed.  Lina is the owner-operator who is an expert in her field and a professional in her own right.   Her coloring and styling techniques are amazing, as is her ability to beautifully handle all types of hair  (I have very curly hair).  Like any good salon owner she has surrounded herself with quality stylists:  Bona, Diana and Tanya, all of which are  great.  In summary, and what keeps me going back, is the high level of skill, flexibility, location (I live next door), cleanliness of salon, and superb customer service. Yes, they're stuck with me and mine....

6.description: Went by for my appointment yesterday - wow - Lena and Bona (and their talented spouses) have done a gorgeous job on the new salon.  Its elegant and beautiful but, still, has the same friendly atmosphere as the old one on Clark St.  Just the opposite of my old salon which was so cold and intimidating.Well done.....plus my hair is fantastic - Lena, this is just the style, cut and color to make me want to look forward to summer and miles of running but still having a cute hair style when I'm done.  THANK YOU.

22.description: I decided to schedule a haircut here after reading the great Yelp reviews. I was pleasantly surprised that I was able to schedule a Saturday afternoon appointment the night before.When I arrived, I was greeted by both of the women working there. They offered me a bottle of water while I waited, (which my hungover self really appreciated!)  Tanya asked me what I wanted done, and gave me some great suggestions. She did a fantastic job, and it only cost me $25 -- pocket change compared to what many Chicago salons charge. I was very impressed by Art of Hair Design Salon!

15.description: I should have probably written this review a long time ago, but better late than never.I used to live on the 1400 block of Dearborn, therefore this place was a hop and skip away. The owners are adorable sisters -in-laws with a lot of experience. After moving to Chicago in 2008, I had several hair appointments all around the city, trying to find the right one. I first came here on a whim, because they take walk ins. Now I wonder what I would do if Lina and Bona ever closed up shop or if I moved away. These are some of the nicest ladies I have ever met. The always give me tea, ask me about my family, and chat me up like they appreciate me as a pal. I have never had a bad experience here and their prices are very reasonable. And oh, my hair always looks good!Their shop is immaculate, super clean. I don't go as often as I used to because I grew my hair out so it requires less work, but these gals totally rock my socks off.

7.description: Phenomenal hair cut. Usually hair dressers have a hard time with my thick straight mess, but not here. Gave me exactly what I was looking for and more. Offered great tips and advice and never tried to upsell me on product I didn't need. All this at the best price you'll find in the city. AND free touch ups in between cuts. I've found my go-to spot.

36.description: Is it possible to give 6 stars??  Lina and Bona are great!  I've never met two people who are so consistently in a good mood - especially when their job requires them to stand on their feet most of the day and work long hours!I live 2 blocks away and stop in about every 2 weeks on my way home from work.  I rarely need to wait...and if I do, it's only 5 or 10 minutes.  They both have a great sense of humor and Bona will laugh at just about anything you say, which is great for me because my jokes aren't very funny.I'm very picky about my haircuts because I have very straight hair and it can't really be "styled."  It just sticks out on the sides, so I need a nice tight cut on the sides so my head doesn't look like a giant Q-Tip.  It's hard to find someone who gets this.  They get it.  They listen.  They put the mirror up and ask what you think, and then cut it some more if it's needed.  However, that's just a formality now, as they got it down.  I go in looking like Kevin Bacon and come out looking like Tom Cruise (Top Gun Tom Cruise, not crazy Tom Cruise).A few tips - Bona likes chocolate, so if you happen to come in on a Tuesday when she's off (and she finds out)...this is a good way to get out of the doghouse.  Lina doesn't let herself eat chocolate...but I gave her some for the holidays anyway last year.  She gave it to Bona, but I'm sure she snuck a piece or two when no one was looking.  I've never met a woman that can resist chocolate, so I don't believe her when she says she doesn't eat it.I even got a date there once...well almost.  I got a phone number from the girl in the chair next to me.  She seemed interested at first, but pretty much blew me off after a series of calls and text messages.  Her loss! ;)  I hadn't been completely blown off in a while, so it was a little embarrassing, but well worth it because Lina and Bona got a kick out of it.  I have to say it was the first time I ever asked anyone out in a barber shop, but that's the type of environment you're in - very friendly and comfortable...to the point where you don't mind asking out some random next to you.Don't worry ladies, I've learned my lesson.  Go visit Lina and Bona without the fear of some random guy hitting on you!  ;)

30.description: I just got the best haircut I've ever gotten in this town.  I have been literally driving to St. Louis to a my stylist there because nobody in this town knows how to cut straight hair!!!  Every once in a while I venture out and try someone knew in hopes of finding my next stylist.  I'm done looking.  This friendly full service salon doesn't try to be fancy schmancy.  They do what you ask without trying to sell you or schmooze you.  The price is reasonable and you get what you want.  No more spending a bunch of money and getting weird hair.  They spend the time and give you the attention to detail as needed.  Bona cut my hair and is exactly what I'm looking for in a stylist, her quality was superb.  While there, I watched happy customers (men and women, some from out of town) come to the other stylists to get their hair done here.   School was out for the day and a couple of the stylist kids were there and were well behaved and they helped out with things.  I hope this place stays this way for a long time to come.  I hate to share but there have to be others out there just like me.  Give them a try.

3.description: I love this place. Two very sweet sisters and a couple of cute friends. All  talented stylists, charming people. Reasonably priced, efficient service. Happy welcoming place.

14.description: Super kind and friendly. She listened to me and gave me exactly what I wanted. Cute place.

58.description: I stopped here on a whim and am so glad I did.  It is recently renamed "Polish & Pour" and it's an accurate description - this is a nail salon with full-service bar.  It is nice and clean inside, the staff is great and they were playing Sex and the City - so fun!  Four stars because I already have chips in the polish less than 24 hours later.  But will return for the atmosphere (and wine, of course).

56.description: I went here yesterday for a friends birthday. It was a great experience, very fun! I got a manicure with the vinylux polish and it looks amazing! Katie (I think that's her name) did my manicure and she did an amazing job, she was very gentle and took her time, even though they were very busy. I will definitely be going back!!

29.description: The nail technicians here are the best!! (Nelly and Oksana are two personal favorites :) They take such great care of you and really give you a 5-star pampering. And who doesn't want to sip chardonnay (they have a full bar) and watch re-runs of HBO Classics (Sex & the City) while getting your nails done?!

42.description: See Valerie for laser services. She and Dr. Sawan share a space in the back of this super clean salon. Valerie loves to study skin and is an excellent technician for photofacials and RF.

23.description: Best mani/pedi with Melissa!!!  Great experience every time with super friendly staff.

47.description: I love my mani-pedi. They made sure I was happy with everything.

8.description: Oxana was AMAZING. She did such a detailed job on my finger nails like I've never seen before! Too bad I don't live in Chicago anymore, or she'll definitely be my go to. Can't say enough thanks to Oxana!

31.description: Was here with a group of girls as part of our bachelorette party weekend in Chicago. They were able to accommodate all of us which was nice but the environment wasn't very relaxing. We were expecting more of a spa type place but it is just a normal nail salon that allows you to bring alcohol. My pedicure was nice (but quick) and the lady who did it literally didn't speak a single word to me...she just pointed... Which was odd.It was also a bit pricey for the service. I've had a pedicure at a realllly nice spa for the same price.

34.description: I docked a star because they don't have a great selection of colors for gel manicures and the price is steep. $40 for a gel mani.I'm not opposed to paying for quality, but we will see how long they last.Melissa did my nails, she spoke perfect English and did a great job. She was absolutely sweet, adorable and attentive. It was about me without being weird - we just sort of hit it off.They have a full bar. Bring your boyfriend and sit him at the bar and enjoy yourself. You can only tip in cash, but they made an exception for me (with the stipulation that you can only ever tip on a credit card once.) I thought that was nice, they let me slide.Overall good experience. New age nail studio on state has WAY more colors, but it's a little pretentious.

16.description: I never leave Yelp reviews, but everyone needs to know how much this place sucks.I booked a bachelorette party here months in advance and we all picked the most expensive treatments, put money towards a group bar package - all of which is essential in understanding how poorly we were treated.We arrived on time but weren't able to get into pedicure chairs for 15 minutes. Finally, 4 chairs open up and then I have to wait another 10-15 minutes to be seated - AWAY from the entire group. I told the receptionist this was unacceptable and super disappointing since I had made these reservations so far in advance and we really were spending a lot. I almost felt bad for her, because she clearly had no idea how to handle the situation. She just said "oh, well some people were seated right in the middle of you guys." Yes, because you sat them there knowing you had a 5-person party coming in minutes later...? I went to the manager working the bar to try to see what could be done, and she just barked back that she was bartending so didn't know anything about it and clearly wasn't going to help.The kicker - when we all sat down to get our manicures (still not next to each other), one of the technicians had the nerve to ask one of our girls to move so that another group of girls could sit together.Aside from our bad experience, the place just isn't cool. It's overcrowded, the bar is gross but you pay premium prices for drinks, the  mani/pedi experience is standard at best, and the chick flicks, which I thought were to be the focal point of this place, play such a minor part. I'd equate it to watching bootleg DVD's on a bunch of crappy 10-year-old, standard def dorm room TV's. I don't feel good about asking for my money back from this place - they clearly need it. Just avoid spending yours there.

13.description: The prices were decent for the pedicure that I got but the woman sliced the side of my foot with the pumice stone! They didn't even give me a discount after that. Not worth going back after that.

11.description: I loved my  experience here! I came here with my mom on her birthday because we had received a gift card from friends. It is very clean and cutely decorated. They had "Sex & The City" playing on a few TVs with the volume down - even though I don't like that show, it did add to the girly ambience :-) Our manicures were great; we both got gel no chips, and they lasted over 2 weeks in *perfect* condition for both of us! (17 days for me) I've never had a gel mani last that long, so they definitely know what they're doing with the various coats & application. The price is a little steep: $40 for a gel manicure, but it was worth it. The staff was very friendly; talkative, but not overbearing as we were also able to have our own conversations. Unfortunately, gift cards don't apply to the full bar, but the staff did give us free mimosas, which was so nice of them. Not sure if it was because we had a bit left on our gift card or because I mentioned it was my moms birthday, but either way, it was wonderful. My mom & I are planning to come back here for sure!

39.description: Been going here for years. My last no chip lasted over two weeks.  My last manicure only lasted 2 days - I think my nails were in bad shape.  They are always clean friendly and professional.

37.description: I came in with my Aunt and two Friends for a little Suday-Funday pedicure and to have some drinks. I want to start by saying that the place is nice and clean, and the work they did was awesome. My Aunt went as far as to say its the nicest looking pedicure she's ever had.However, the customer service was definitely lacking. When we first walked in it was..... awkward, is probably the best word for it. We were just standing there at the bar. There was no welcome, there was no one at the desk. No one said hello, no one came over to check us in. Finally I took off my jacket and a girl came over to grab it from me, but still, she said nothing. Three girls just stood in the back of the salon with their arms folded across their chests, just staring at us. Finally a nice lady came over and took our drink orders. And then shortly after that someone asked who we were. But after that, we didn't hear another word from them.I'm not saying that they needed to sit down and have conversations with us. But a friendly attitude goes a long way. I've read this in a few other reviews for this location. It seems to be an on-going issue. It might be worth management having a little refresher course on customer service. Again, a friendly attitude goes a long way. (especially when it comes to your tip)

0.description: Let's get the important stuff out of the way: there is a full bar, Sex and the City plays in the background (Team Aiden, forever), and most importantly, you have the dream team of Oksana and Olesea.My bestie and I came in for an afternoon of pampering. Sure, we're dudes and probably care less about things like whether our nails chip, but we wanted a fun, relaxing experience and its exactly what we got. We did the mani/pedi combo (with the hand wax) with Oksana and Olesea, who were not only thorough but also a blast to interact with.I can always judge an experience by how soon I want to return and considering we already made return appointments, it means it was really that good!

38.description: Be careful what you order here. I said "organic manicure" thinking I was getting the $19 version...and was charged 35 for the Signature. Why it is double for some lotion and a bit of scrub I have no idea...every place I've ever gone include a scrub, some lotion and even a shoulder rub (not here). And there was nothing special about the polish that suggested it was organic. I guess define organic for a material made mostly of chemicals? I insisted that they honor my original request and I walked out paying 25. Get a groupon and go somewhere else for 35-40 you'll get a mani and pedi. Atmosphere was nice and drinks were strong. That why I'm giving 3 stars. But having to pull out my credit card and pay twice- for service and for drinks (and they didn't ask for payment beforehand b/c of wet nails...grrr) was annoying. It should be combined.This place needs to get their act together.

51.description: I brought my husband here when we first moved to the city. I was pretty disappointed with the experience. The bar and bartender were the only great things about this salon. The technicians were all unfriendly and seemed to want to get us out as quickly as possible instead of letting us enjoy the experience. I was expecting more for $90 not including tip or drinks. It might be better with a larger group.

27.description: Still love this place even though my girl Lynn isn't there anymore (not sure why, but sad). Instead, going to try to start seeing Francesca (maybe that's her name?). Went for a mani/pedi a week and a half ago and she did a wonderful job. Not much of a talker, very quiet, but sometimes that's what you need.I have to say though, I do agree with some of the comments on here about the staff being rude. One technician in particular was going a pedicure and when she got up to go get the hot towel she stood behind a pole away from her client so she could get on her cell phone for several minutes. I started thinking that if I had been that client I would have thought, where the heck did she go? Talk about unprofessional, which is why I'll stick with Francesca.

32.description: Oxana was AMAZING. She did such a detailed job on my finger nails like I've never seen before! Too bad I don't live in Chicago anymore, or she'll definitely be my go to. Can't say enough thanks to Oxana!

54.description: I have been here twice and have had bad experiences both times, I will never go back.  The staff is not very friendly and they don't make you feel comfortable. If you are marketing yourself as a salon that serves drinks when you are getting services, you should be offered something to drink when you are picking out your color/services. I had to ask both times I was there mid way through the pedicure if I could get a glass of wine.  Isn't the name of your business, Polish and Pour??The no-chip manicure I got ruined my nails for weeks. I get no-chip all the time and have never had problems at the other salon I go to usually. The product they used was cheap, the nail polish looked so bad when I left and ended up staining my nail.80% of the pedicure chairs are broken and the massage doesn't work. The water in the pedicure tub was cold. They do not have foot or hand dryers that work properly. I walked out of there with wet nails because I was so annoyed and needed to get out of the negative atmosphere that lingers in that place.

48.description: I went there with a girlfriend for a polish and a pour- right.The bartender was not there? The host barely greeted us and when we asked her for cocktails she told us no bartender.... ok -that is why we were going there and spending the extra money you charge for nails.... for the experience.....So she said she'd make us a drink but it had to be wine because she could just pour that and not have to make anything. I told her I  did not want wine I'd like the vodka lemonade.... Vodka + Lemonade = Easy . She said she did not know how to make it.Ok - I will have a glass of X wine.... They did not have it.Moving on.... Our nail techs were both very friendly and the chairs and room are nice . My nail tech took Forever!!!! Ah 2+ Hours for a mani pedi - She was doing a nice job but she just took forever- I was so ready to leave this place. Over all- the nail techs were nice and the place is nice- the drink prices are high ( you are not a club.) Their nail prices are also higher than competition- What they have is a bar - that most do not- it is for the Experience of something nicer and different  and to feel pampered and girly- to have a nice time and be greeted nicely-- I got none of these and paid more for it.

44.description: I purchased a groupon for laser hair removal and had a horrible experience. I made an appointment for 4:30PM with Valerie. She left me a voicemail stating that she would move up my appointment time to 4:00PM instead, the same day of the appointment and I did not have enough time to get to there. I was planning to travel from further away and needed more than thirty minutes to travel. She stated that she would not wait more than fifteen minutes for me since she didn't want to be caught up in traffic and wanted to leave earlier. I think this is a terrible way to run a business and appointment times should not be given if they can't be honored. I planned my whole day around this appointment and I'm out my money. THEY DO NOT UNDERSTAND CUSTOMER SERVICE.

24.description: Melissa is the BEST! She is so professional and my nails last longer than usual! She is also very friendly and fun to chat with. By far this is the best place in chicago to do your nails. Definitely try Melissa - she is the best nail technician I have ever tried and I plan to keep coming back to her!!!!!

7.description: Still love this place even though my girl Lynn isn't there anymore (not sure why, but sad). Instead, going to try to start seeing Francesca (maybe that's her name?). Went for a mani/pedi a week and a half ago and she did a wonderful job. Not much of a talker, very quiet, but sometimes that's what you need.I have to say though, I do agree with some of the comments on here about the staff being rude. One technician in particular was going a pedicure and when she got up to go get the hot towel she stood behind a pole away from her client so she could get on her cell phone for several minutes. I started thinking that if I had been that client I would have thought, where the heck did she go? Talk about unprofessional, which is why I'll stick with Francesca.

49.description: Tanya gave me a mani & pedi with the Monday / Tuesday deal ($40). It was an excellent mani/pedi and Tanya was so nice. I also loved her nails so much that I ended up being a bit of a dork and asking for the same color she had on (Essie Periwinkle?). The salon was flexible when I tried to cram too many things into a short time frame and they let me come back to finish polish on my fingers after a quick errand. **Tips in cash only!

40.description: Nice ambience.. but grossly overpriced.They were very slow... QUALITY POLISH SELECTION NO RIFF/RAFTOVERALL GOOD SERVICE at first glance.GAVE 3 stars because my husband and I made a 630p appointment the day prior for which we arrived punctually. Despite there only being 4 customers and 10 pedi chairs in the salon they sat my hubby in a broke chair (no massage/power) and made him wait 20 mins for service. When I finished my feet were dry because the lady forgot lotion my skin (Im African-American so this is completely noticeable and unacceptable #ashy). Lol We left a 25% tip and bid our farewells.I've had better pedi/mani for $10-15 cheaper. They seem to be more concerned with the cleanliness of the salon than quality of the service provided. The staff were very nice... but for $100 (2 people) one should expect something different. I could go to Trump or Waldorf for that price. Cute concept... but I won't return!

53.description: Polish and Pour is my favorite salon. The staff is always very friendly and accommodating and my nails never fail to look wonderful. Their No-Chip polish is excellent.  I have tried a few other salons and found that the polish never stayed more than a week before the chipping began.  My No-Chip manicures from Polish and Pour last 2 weeks minimum before the polish begins to chip.  My technician is very knowledgeable about all the products and colors and I consistently get positive comments from people, including strangers.  It's always nice when someone standing next to you says "I love your nails!"

30.description: It's gotten so busy it's hard to get an appointment now. But I love it here. And it helps they serve a decent scotch while I get my nails down.

46.description: I hate to do this but I went in on a last minute decision and totally regret it. $40 for a no chip and it cracked the next day. It took the same amount of time for me to get a no chip that it did my friend that got a normal manicure. First warning sign. It was so quick and so effortless. Pretty upset my nails looks so poorly done. Definitely not going back and would not recommend it.

1.description: I'm not a girly girl. I don't get my hair done (it's in dreads!), I don't do my nails (I keep them nicely trimmed, thank you very much), I don't care for makeup or beauty tips. Although I used to get my eyebrows threaded, I get along just fine for plucking them myself... whenever I feel like it. Beauty salons? Pshh... What's the point of those?So, when a good friend of mine got married earlier this year and had part of her bachelorette party at Polish and Pour, a tiny bit of me kind of freaked out.  I was going to have to get my nails done. And drop tons of money to do so. Eeeek!For some, this is a regular routine. Not me. I have never really been able to justify spending that kind of money on something like painting your nails. However, since it was a big party for a dear friend, I was all in.... and this would be an experience! The maid of honor booked the party and we were all set!A group of twenty or so of us gathered one Saturday afternoon for the bachelorette. The salon is long and narrow with a little bar in front, and several mani-pedi stations. We all pitched in pay extra for a "room" so we wouldn't have to cluster together in the salon area. The "room" was a small seating area in the back of the salon with some couches and access to an outdoor balcony area. It was nice to have that space, but I don't think we should've paid extra for it -- if we hadn't paid, we probably would have used that room anyway because there was nowhere else in the salon to gather! Anyway... the polish and pour process was pretty smooth. We all took turns (several at a time) getting our nails done while the others sat around drinking in the room. It was BYOB for beer and wine, but a corkage fee if you wanted to mix drinks (since you'd have to use their glasses).... even if you brought the stuff yourself! Whaaat! Lame (for those who wanted that). Sex and the City episodes were on repeat the whole time. Since most of the women in the party group were deaf, and we couldn't talk with our hands because they were getting polished, we spent a lot of time watching TV as we waited. Heh. At least we could chat and sip wine during our pedicures! That was nice.My $50-ish mani-pedi lasted a few weeks. I was pretty impressed with that. That was the only thing that impressed me. Salons like this just aren't for me. But hey, it was good for the start of a special occasion girl's night out!

55.description: If you are looking to host a private event at a salon, keep looking. I was thoroughly disappointed and embarrassed after hosting a bridal shower at Polish and Pour. I had booked my event 4 months earlier - I opted to rent the whole salon out because intimacy and having a private event was important to me. When I arrived at the salon 45 mins prior to my party (with my food trays/paper products/nail polish favors), I was surprised to find a full salon of customers in various stages of their treatments (including people waiting for services). I expressed my concern and spoke to the owner - Sonny - who assured me that everyone would be out by the time my party was scheduled to begin.  She stressed that this was her business and the salon held these types of events all the time without issue. When my guests began to arrive at my scheduled party time - a time that I had paid to rent out the entire salon - 7 other customers were getting manicures (note there are 9 manicure stations total). The last of these customers did not leave until 37 minutes into my 2 hour party slot.Part of the reason I picked Polish and Pour was for the full service bar. What a wonderful idea and treat for my guests. When I booked I also informed the salon that I would like to serve mimosas. Notwithstanding, the bartender didn't arrive until 1/2 an hour into my 2 hour party slot and the bar did not have orange juice - they ended up running to Plum Market to buy some. All in all, the concept is a great one.  However, the execution and poor customer service and planning should cause you to look elsewhere for your next private event. I certainly will be.

9.description: Was here with a group of girls as part of our bachelorette party weekend in Chicago. They were able to accommodate all of us which was nice but the environment wasn't very relaxing. We were expecting more of a spa type place but it is just a normal nail salon that allows you to bring alcohol. My pedicure was nice (but quick) and the lady who did it literally didn't speak a single word to me...she just pointed... Which was odd.It was also a bit pricey for the service. I've had a pedicure at a realllly nice spa for the same price.

26.description: I got a manicure from Melissa here last week and it was great. She was very professional and thorough, asking before she started exactly how short I wanted my nails cut, what shape I wanted, and checking with me about the color after she did the first nail. This wasn't a gel manicure, but my nails are still perfect after 5 days (usually my nails start chipping after 2-3 days).

25.description: I really needed a Manicure for my birthday PLUS a Dirty Martini. So me and my guy decided to stop in Polish and Pour. He sat at the bar while Melissa did an awesome job on my nails. I sipped on my drink SLOWLY as I watched Sex & the City. I know I shouldn't waited so long to post but my manicure lasted almost three weeks. It was the new Polish by OPI with the silver tops. Holy Smoke!! Not a darn chip! Thanks Melissa for such an awesome job and I will see you again!!!

12.description: I enjoyed a girls night with a group of 15-17 ladies. The party room and staff were great! The nail service was OK. Nonetheless, I would definitely return for another event because that's what made the visit worthwhile.

59.description: I have been here twice- first for a manicure then more recently for a pedicure. The staff is friendly but not overly talkative, which I prefer. It is clean and both technicians I had did a great job. Prices are reasonable, comparable to most small salons. Tips are cash only so come prepared. Reservation not required. Bonus: they have a bar and play SATC all day. What girl doesn't love a little Carrie Bradshaw?

21.description: I got my first manicure EVER from Melissa a few weeks ago. She was very professional and personable. A great experience overall! :)

17.description: After a long painful search for a go to nail place I have finally found it!  Having lived in the area for years I regret my having found this place and Melissa sooner.  She is amazing! I was very weary during my first appointment but she was so sweet and friendly that I quickly felt comfortable!  Aside from her awesome demeanor I can't say enough about the best manis and pedis she's given me :). My cuticles have never looked better and I finally found someone that understands when I say I want my nail shape 'oval'...not square...not round...oval!  Not to mention that my manicures have never lasted longer!  It's magic :). At other places they'd chip day three but I get a solid week with them now.  Melissa is awesome!  It's also really nice that I can order a glass of wine (or two) during my services! I highly recommend this place and definitely ask for Melissa!

10.description: Love this place! Took my sister to Polish and Pour for a no chip mani and signature pedi - she had never had either before visiting Chicago, They treated her so well and did such a wonderful job. She and I are so impressed with the upscale atmosphere and polite conversation with the technicians. Will def be returning for my bi-weekly no chip!

5.description: Loved this place!! As soon as you walk in you are greeted with friendly faces! Melissa who did my nails was amazing. She cut my cuticles really well, which is the main thing i go to get my manicures done. I loved the color and the french tip design. Ally made me an orange cosmo which was the icing on the cake! Would definitely recommend this place  to friends.

3.description: My boyfriend and I come to polish and pour at least once a month. He is practically obsessed with the Manhattans made by the fabulous miss Ally and the rest of the bar menu is not to be ignored. I can't remember the last time I got a pedicure anywhere else. Calling ahead is highly recommended as they stay busy and it's easy to see why! The technicians do a great job and the atmosphere is absolutely perfect. Currently drying in their massage chair with drink in hand. Looking forward to our next visit!

35.description: I loved my  experience here! I came here with my mom on her birthday because we had received a gift card from friends. It is very clean and cutely decorated. They had "Sex & The City" playing on a few TVs with the volume down - even though I don't like that show, it did add to the girly ambience :-) Our manicures were great; we both got gel no chips, and they lasted over 2 weeks in *perfect* condition for both of us! (17 days for me) I've never had a gel mani last that long, so they definitely know what they're doing with the various coats & application. The price is a little steep: $40 for a gel manicure, but it was worth it. The staff was very friendly; talkative, but not overbearing as we were also able to have our own conversations. Unfortunately, gift cards don't apply to the full bar, but the staff did give us free mimosas, which was so nice of them. Not sure if it was because we had a bit left on our gift card or because I mentioned it was my moms birthday, but either way, it was wonderful. My mom & I are planning to come back here for sure!

19.description: I really needed a Manicure for my birthday PLUS a Dirty Martini. So me and my guy decided to stop in Polish and Pour. He sat at the bar while Melissa did an awesome job on my nails. I sipped on my drink SLOWLY as I watched Sex & the City. I know I shouldn't waited so long to post but my manicure lasted almost three weeks. It was the new Polish by OPI with the silver tops. Holy Smoke!! Not a darn chip! Thanks Melissa for such an awesome job and I will see you again!!!

28.description: Nice manicure, but many members of the staff are just plain rude.I was there this weekend with about 15 friends and family members ahead of my cousin's wedding. With so many of us there, a few of us had to wait a while for our services, and I was one of them. Fine -- glass of champagne in hand, talking with family, no problem! After about an hour I checked in with the host to see if he had an ETA, and he curtly said my technician would find me when she was ready. Thirty more minutes passed, and at this point, I was cutting it close to the time I'd have to leave for the church rehearsal. So I went back to him to ask if I could drop my pedicure and just do a manicure, and instead of a simple "Sure," I was snapped at with something like "It's not my fault people in your party asked for additional services and everyone's in the same time crunch." (Not true, only about seven of us had to leave early, including the mother of the bride, who ended up having to drop her pedicure, too.) Shortly after, I was seated for my manicure, and my manicurist did a great job, though I sensed she was less than thrilled that I'd dropped half my services, and she didn't say a word to me. The whole experience just left a bad taste in my mouth -- we were there for a celebratory occasion and they seem to do these group-type experiences a lot, so while some of this was on our group for lengthening appointments with extra services, they could've been more accommodating (and if nothing else, much more polite). With so many nice places in the city to get a manicure, I never need to come back here -- and I'm not surprised to see other reviews with the same feedback as mine.

45.description: Great nail salon in old town The staff are all very nice and attentive Oksana is the best for manicures!Thank you

33.description: if you like rude people, go here.  just went there to get my nails done for my wedding and brought some of the girls along.  There were 4 of us....two appointments at 12:30, one at 1:00, and one at 1:30.  After we arrived, another lady showed up claiming she had an appt at 12:30.  the girl behind the desk said she wasn't coming up and they didn't have her down for an appointment.  she complained for about 5 minutes so they told her they would let her have her mani and pedi.  they had set up 2 tubs so our 12:30 appointments could get started.  we sat down to soak our feet but only 1 technician came over....the other one went to the lady who never really had an appointment.  i was the only one who was able to get my nails done.  my friend who had been soaking her feet left after a half an hour of waiting.  At 1 pm, my friend tried to check in on if someone was coming to help them.  A male who had been behind the bar bar earlier was behind the desk with the other receptionist and they were very rude and seemed annoyed she was questioning them about it.  when she walked away they gave each other dirty looks.  no one really seemed sorry....just annoyed that we were annoyed with them.  they offered 20% off coupons for my 3 friends who weren't able to get their nails done.  my technician was great.  however, the receptionist was even rude to her while i was paying.  it just wasn't a positive atmosphere here and i am bummed i used this place to get my nails done before my wedding.

43.description: I did my no chip manicure two weeks ago. Girl named Lora  did a great job and now even after  2 week my nails look good and almost didn't chip.

2.description: I only chose this place because I wanted to surprise my boyfriend with his first pedicure and thought the whole BYOB experience would be more exciting for him. As soon as I walked in, I left like we weren't welcomed. No one noticed that we came in, so i approached a woman that worked there and told her i had an appointment for 6:45. She didn't even reply back to me, all she did was point to the desk and walk away... okay. I told the lady at the front desk that i was here for an appointment. Without even making eye contact with me she told me to just pick a color and go ahead and take a seat.I had a mani/pedi done that day, the pedicure experience was perfect. But when it was time for the manicure,  i told the technician that i was thinking of getting ombre nails. She immediately told me that they didn't do that there...um what? Then I proceeded to explain to her that i just wanted a different tone of red to create an ombre look. (I got the idea of the ombre look from their Yelp pictures) Tech told me again that they didn't do that there. I understand we had our appointment at 6:45  and they closed at 8. But i felt like they were annoyed that we were there so late, and just wanted to get rid of us. The customer service is terrible. I rather go elsewhere.

18.description: I come here regularly because it's near where I live and I like how they do the express manicure.But with each subsequent visit, I find the quality of the service gets worse and worse.Today, I was told first of all that the loyalty card is *not* to be used for express manicures ($12), only for full manicures ($17).  But all my previous visits, both to this location & the Streeterville location, had been validated for express manicures.Then, after my payment, the receptionist asked if I'd like a glass of water with ice.  I replied, "Sure."  She dropped the glass off with another customer & totally forgot about mine.As if that wasn't bad enough, after the technician took off my previous polish, she told me to go wash in the sink.  (Usually they have a dish of water with which to rinse off the chemicals from the removal of the old polish.)  I looked back at her, puzzled.  She told me, "The sink is back there.  Go wash off."I don't know if she was having a bad day, but when I returned, she seemed genuinely contrite and tried to make up for it by making sure I was happy with the results.But first impressions after a long Monday linger, and I'm hesitant to return, at least to *this* location.

41.description: I live right around the corner from this location and walk past it a lot. Last week, I finally made an appointment with some girlfriends. I got a no-chip manicure. The woman that did my manicure was very, very nice and knowledgable. She spoke clear English, which is quite rare in my experience with pedicure/manicures. Her technique was really nice, but the coating of my nails was really awful, even after two coats. It may have been the polish, but typically there is more coating when the first two are streaky.Secondly, the polish started chipping not even 5 days later. Really dissapointing. I thought that $40 was really steep for the job that I got. I didn't order a drink, but I can't imagine how much more it would be if I did. Not super impressed by everything.

52.description: I have been a client here for almost 2 years and I religiously and exclusively see Nellie! She is ah-mazing! My nails and toes have never been better or healthier! They have a huge selection of colors and I love that the new reception staff are so polite and friendly! Do yourself a favor and book an appointment with Nellie today!
