50.description: Had part one of a birthday party here.  6 girls. Drinks nice. Great service and  excellent job  on the express manicure. It's been over 2 weeks and it still looks fabulous  with just minor chips.  Leg massage for 25 min was just what I needed. Overall great!

4.description: I walked in and a young woman wearing a flattering black dress was speaking sternly (and rudely) to her coworker, "No! First you have to wax her lip and then do her nails!" She repeated that multiple times loud enough for everyone in the spa to hear. I was embarrassed for the esthetician to whom she was speaking."Are you a manager? I noticed that you speak with some authority." I asked her."Oh no!" She laughed, "I'm only a receptionist, but I'm in charge of the schedule and you really have to stay on top of them otherwise we get backed up."She prepared the water in the basin for my feet. I sat there sipping my cocktail from the to-go cup I brought from home. Episodes from Sex in the City played for me on the nearby television. Some episodes had captions and some did not.My esthetician came over and started laconically working on my feet. Sometimes she leaned forward to get a particular tool and she sighed cigarette smoke. I was unnerved that she did not completely strip my nails of the old polish but I did not want to add to the disparage given by the bossy receptionist minutes earlier. I winced as she pulled and cut my cuticles (not just the dead skin).My tolerance juice started kicking in and we conversed. The neighboring estheticians joined in and we had pleasant chatter about their respective countries and the Russian language.Polish & Pour is a great spot for a nail party with some friends as a precursor to going out. There was a group of about three young women who seemed to be having a lovely time. The other guests who came solo were awkwardly quiet. It's just important to note that they have a corkage fee if you use their glasses and bottle openers otherwise they have a nicely stocked cash bar.I paid with my card but was told that I could only tip with cash. I walked to a nearby ATM and returned with a tip. The receptionist gave me a punch card for future discounts.I can't imagine returning to Polish & Pour. It seemed like such an acrimonious work environment and the quality of my pedicure was unsatisfying. The polish was bumpy (due to the underlying old polish) instead of smooth little candies. It began chipping within a week while my usual pedicures can last about a month.

6.description: Another Mani and pedi later, I feel like this place can't get any better. It wasn't as busy as it normally is so they were able to fit in a pedicure with my manicure appointment. I was really happy with how accommodating they are. The lovely bartender Ally knew I wanted a bloody marry but they were out of the ingredients but the replacement cocktail was still as amazing. Love going to this place. So welcoming. If my nails could talk, they'd all say "Thank you Melissa" (my manicurist who I've become loyal to now). Can't wait to go back again.

22.description: I love going to Polish and Pour! Moving from New York this is my second family! You have great people which is number 1! Also great service, great technicians and the best drinks ! The best :) Marina Guzun, Ally, Oksana and Kyle ! Thank you for an amazing experience every time !

15.description: RUDE. RUDE. RUDE. I gave two stars ONLY because the lady who checked us in was very nice and professional. My friend and I were the last ones in for a mani/pedi on a Monday night. We were in good spirits with champagne in hand. The nail techs were extremely rude and visibly annoyed at our mere existence. I'm mad at myself for allowing them to act so ugly towards us. Never again!!!! Nails were average, ambiance nice, too expensive topped with VERY NASTY UNPROFESSIONAL attitudes. Beware!!!!

57.description: WOW - I got a manicure last Thursday. It's been over a week and my manicure has ZERO chips. This phenomenon is unheard of - usually, if I'm lucky, I can last about 4 days. I haven't been more careful and been less "active" with my nails - in fact, I'm typing away on the computer every single day for work. I am very impressed. If this is not a fluke, then this is THE place to go for manicures.

20.description: This place is terrible. I went in over the weekend with my friend's bachelorette party, and despite having an appointment for a pedicure and a no-chip, I was told my technician did not know how to do no-chip, and she "didn't have time" to pair me with someone else. She gave me a regular manicure which chipped before I even walked out the door. I didn't pay $65 for that! Overpriced and rude - I won't be coming back or recommending it to any of my pals.

36.description: This review pertains to a pedi and no-chip mani I got last week.  The pedi was good, I think I just prefer a little more "pressure" during the massage but it was fine, the woman who took care of me was nice.  Pedi=3 stars  My no chip mani.....I chose white and, after leaving, I noticed that the 2 coats of nail polish was definitely not enough.  But what was done was done, I should've caught that earlier and asked for another coat.  I would still have given the no-chip a 3, since the girl was nice.  However, I am on my 6th day and 3 of my nails are chipped and 2 have polish completely peeling off.  I am not sure if it was the polish used, as my no-chips almost always last for 2.5-3 weeks before completely peeling off.  I am leaving on a trip today, otherwise I'd have called and gone back, seeing as how I spent $85 (not including tip).  No-chip=1 star  IThe service was good, though.  The receptionist was sweet and the byob is a huge plus.

14.description: I have had many manicures in my life and this was by far the best! If you ever go to the salon you have to ask for Melissa. I never used to get compliments on my manicures but everyone's noticed them recently and it's all because of her! Great vibe and a full bar!

58.description: Really good food and huge portions. The half chicken was amazing wish all of its side dished and they Fire dry rub hot wings are best hot wings I've had in the city

56.description: I dined at Fireplace about a month ago and thought I should share my food experience.I had a pulled pork sandwich with fries and both were horrible.  The sandwich had so much BBQ sauce, it was ridiculous and my fries were cold and under seasoned.  Do not get this.

29.description: Great ribs!!   wow I love ribs and these were tender juicy with an amazing flavor...I just started to work in old town at State Street barbers and I have to say good service great food ...real cold beer!!!! My new afterwork hangout..

42.description: Had a late lunch at the bar last week.  Food was mediocre and sloppy joes shouldn't take 40 min.  Bartender seemed annoyed by just about everything but some obvious friends.  We were completely ignored and had to practically jump up and down to order a second drink.  We were the only people at the bar aside from the bartender's friends.  Honestly, we were made to feel as though we were intruding.  Unacceptable .  Will not return (and we live across the street!).

23.description: I have been coming to the fireplace inn for years now.  I really enjoy coming here watching football, or with a bunch of friends  normally we will order lots of different items and shareTheir BBQ pulled pork pizza is amazing, the sliders all all very good, excellent onion rings, and of course the ribs are very good here.I have always thought the waitstaff was attentive, and yesterday we sat at the bar and found the bartender very friendly and was very good at serving our food   The old style decor is warm and inviting, and much different than the other newer sterile restaurants in the neighborhood

47.description: Jimmy! Jimmy! Jimmy! Awesome server, better singer! Meet him now before he makes it big!

8.description: I did not think the food was very good here. It was recommended to me by my door guy when I first moved to the neighborhood. I left underwhelmed.It's a good place for drinks though, and they have a nice patio in the summer. Good people watching off wells. But so many better places for food. Need to revamp the menu or hire a better chef.

31.description: Didn't eat here, but I came for drinks. Didn't like the beer I ordered and the waitress noticed so she offered to get me one I liked instead. I would have finished the other beer, but how nice of her to bring me a Guinness to make up for my failed attempt at trying something new. Was the Guinness poured perfectly? No, but was it better than the other beer and drink-worthy? Absolutely. For that type of service, I'm definitely a fan. Plus, she was super attentive to us and friendly and you can't ask for anything more than that!

34.description: The food is decent, but they have poor customer service. The hostess was very rude when seating us.

16.description: I went here with a few friends for a trivia night. The trivia was cool, and the guy doing it was very good at it, but my service from our table's server, Angela, was not. I do want to say off the top that I am not one to leave a negative review about any place, and that I generally give people the benefit of the doubt when it comes to waitstaff being busy and coming around less, but there was more than one interaction with Angela that left a very bad taste in my mouth. Right off the top she seemed very impatient, and the fact that we did not have a drink orders ready immediately upon getting to the table did not seem to sit well with her. She did not come back to check on us again for at least 20 minutes, and I can say with no exaggeration that in the entire 3 hours we were there, we could count on one hand how many times she came around without being waved down by one us. We had inquired about some food and drink prices for the night because there were some trivia specials going on, and when the bill came we were charged much more for the trivia items than Angela had initially told us. To top it all off, when we provided a couple of cards to pay with and gave her the breakdown of how we wanted them to be split (which was even), she charged my card more money than other. I did not make a big deal about it at the time seeing as how I was friends and don't mind spending my money on them, but the principal of the matter is that Angela, knowingly or not, provided poor service that left our whole table unsatisfied. The fact that she charged my card the most did make it feel like there was some sort of personal level of spite happening, despite it being the first time I had ever met her, and the fact that I was also nice to her the entire night even with the lack of service we received from her. Terrible server. Terrible place. Never coming back.

13.description: They are known for their bbq and boy does it not disappoint.  The BBQ pulled pork sandwich was drizzled in sauce, easier to eat with a fork than the hands, but wow was it delicious and the sauce was on point.  It came with fries, which are thick cottage style, so I was not a fan of those.  The full rack of ribs were just as good as the pork, the meat so easily ripped away from the bone so you could get every last piece.  While light on the sauce, it was rich on the flavor and didn't need anything else.  The ribs came with 2 sides and we selected the mashed potatoes w/ gravy and side salad.  Mashed potatoes were tasty but the gravy was a bit lacking in flavor.  The side salad was nice and large, and the balsamic vinaigrette was good (so I thought but the girlfriend thought it a bit too strong).  Overall a solid meal and worth the price.  We went right around lunch on the weekend and there weren't too many people there so we got great service.  I think it's deserving 4 stars and can't believe that the Yelp average is 2.5.

11.description: This is my go-to restaurant in Old Town. Been here about every other week for 2 years. The food is amazing (especially for meat lovers). I'm addicted to the FPI BBQ salad. The guacamole is probably the best I have ever had. And the price is very reasonable for Old Town. I splurge on their ribs or steak from time to time and don't break the bank. I would say this is the most underrated Bar B Que joint I have been to in Chicago. I love the wait staff - they are very conversational and offer excellent service. I have been given discounted bills a few times for being a regular. Atmosphere is excellent. By day, this is a fantastic restaurant. For Hawks games and Friday / Saturday nights it will be a bit more crowded and lively, but not obnoxious by any means. One con - I have noticed a few people complain about rude host / hostess.. this is very true. It has been the same girl for the most part in the 2 years I have been going here and she has a bit of an attitude problem. Don't let that taint your overall experience. One last note - FPI is currently for sale. I am not sure what effect this will have on future service.. but if I had $7 million.. I would own my first restaurant.

39.description: I like the staff and the sangria... not a good food place.   Ribs are expense and should be much better. Sea bass over cooked and dry.  Crab cakes too bready. .. only saviour was an awesome summer nite in Chicago!

37.description: I find it interesting that there are 272 reviews shown and 75 hidden.  What happens when more are hidden than shown?  What a distortion of truth.

0.description: HAPPY HOUR REVIEW!Swung by here the other day and was able to catch the end of happy hour. Happy hour is weekdays from 5pm til 7pm. Features the following as I remember:$5 bbq pizza (chicken or pork)$0.75 chicken wings $2 sliders$3 beer of the month (every month always seems to be 312 for some reason)$6 select "top shelf" cocktails Food was just alright, nothing to really rave about, but overall a good value. Would be cool if they made all appetizers available on happy hour specials. Staff is friendly and attentive. The recently remodeled interior is pretty nice and has a open feeling. And TVs everywhere make it easy if you're trying to watch a game here.'Til next time, cheers!

38.description: Went for a walk from Wicker Park to Old Town on a hot day with the goal of Vodka Lemonade and patio people watching at the end.What did I get from Fire Place Inn? A table set on an angle that had me sideways and no one approached my table for 10 minutes. Might have been more had I waited around.Eff this place in everyway.

51.description: I came here first on a Saturday night with friends and we got some (pricey) drinks. They played decent music and there was enough sitting space for us upstairs.Today I came with friends to eat. I got the FIP French Dip which sounded amazing but could not have been any more tasteless... The steak fries were also extremely tasteless. Will not come back here for food...

27.description: Great place to watch a Hawks game and munch on some ribs. While not the hippest place to hang out in Old Town it's one of the more douche free establishments in the area and the food and service is always good.

32.description: Do not order delivery from this horrible restaurant!!!!! We ordered two French onion soups and garlic bread for delivery Two doors down on wells. When we got the order the soup was cold and had no cheese. They forgot the cheese! So basically we got cold onion broth. On the first phone call they refused to send two new soups. They said they would have the cheese delivered alone and we could add the cheese slices. Seriously???? 1.5 hours later NO Cheese. I called three times to get my credit card charged back. I explained that we live two buildings over and have ordered before. They replied that they would refund us for the broth but not the bread. I explained that we had spent hundreds of dollars there and if they didn't refund the extra $5 bucks they would lose us as a customer forever. The manager actually said OK. So the moral of this story is that apparently the Fireplace Inn is having financial trouble so badly that it chose to lose a Customer over bread. Well at least i live on Wells street where we have dozens of great restaurants to take my money in the future. Shame on you Fireplace!

54.description: Worst experience ever, food took over 2 hours for no reason. Do not come here, seriously!!!

48.description: I wanted to say that this place had bad service, but the truth is there is ZERO service.  I was there last summer and was totally ignored by two bartenders who chose to talk to each other instead of my friend and myself.  I thought this was unbelievable, and I never post reviews but meant to do so.  It just slipped my mind . . . Until I found myself there THIS summer and had the exact same experience on the patio.  We sat down and waitresses were attending to tables around us but didn't so much as make eye contact with us.  There were two waitresses, and at no point did either one acknowledge our existence.  We got our beers from the bar, finished them, got another round, and the only people who interacted with us were the two very attentive and friendly bus boys who filled our waters and took our empties (wish they could have brought us some full ones).  Here is the kicker.  We saw a middle aged guy stroking the waitress' arm while he was talking to her.  This got us thinking that maybe we had to sexually harass people to get service?The bottom line is that this place is need of a new manager to fire some people and get some better attitudes around there.  And if my two experiences here aren't enough to convince you of the ineptitude in service, just scroll through some of the other reviews.

44.description: Love this place.  Have been coming here for years. Great patio and vodka lemonades. Perry was a great server, always made sure we were taken care of,  even on a crowded Sunday. FPI is an Old Town staple. How can you not like it?

24.description: I like the gritty feel of the place, the Mr. T doorman is super cool. Yes, the food is prepackaged, you could totally tell by looking at it, but it's not bad believe it or not. All of the servers seem pretty responsive so that was cool. Overall, it's a cool place because it's not trying to be something it's not. If you wanna feel high society you got a bunch of different options down the block.

7.description: My boyfriend and I went to Fireplace Inn on New Years Eve.  It was our first time visiting since the new part of the bar was opened and were pleasantly surprised.  We had an absolutely fantastic time and have been back twice.  Melissa, the hostess was extremely nice to us and we really appreciated it.  The food we ordered (a fried chicken sandwich and ribs) was awesome.   I'm a big fan of the new FPI.

49.description: We had tickets for the 8pm show at Second City, so we just walked down Wells looking for some food.  We had 'gourmet' burgers that were all pretty good. Service was interesting - we had a waiter and a waiter-in-training.  One person wanted the Grecial-Style Chicken, but the waiter warned us it would take 45 mins - so they ordered Grecian Pork Chops, which got the thumbs up.  Food took a long time - maybe 30 minutes, so we had to eat quickly and beat it.  So food good, service OK, atmosphere good. I'd recommend this place for a pre-show burger.

40.description: Came in to celebrate with a group and it was supremely disappointing. Waited close to two hours for the food. When it arrived at our table, half of it was cold. Also, avoid the Baked Onion Soup. Its just not good. At all.

53.description: Food took an hour and a half. Other than it being slow, my halibut steak sandwich was fantastic. It's a shame because I don't see myself going there anymore...

30.description: I like the food at The Fireplace Inn. There are many good things on their menu.

46.description: I just ordered a plate of ribs from this establishment. It is the worst example of ribs I have encountered. The sauce is awful, the ribs themselves were yellowish and disgusting. Avoid this place if you are in the mood for a nice plate of ribs.

1.description: We came here for the last UFC fights Lawler Vs Condent. We knew that getting there at the start of the fights would mean waiting in line so that wasn't a big deal once we got to the front of the line the door man announced that no one else could get in until the end of the current fight, again not a big deal. What was a big deal was that these sleezy blonde girls a few places behind us in line decided cut everyone else and proceed to flirt with the bouncer until he lets them in. Have some self respect door man, you weren't getting anywhere with them, most likely for the best though.There was standing room only and the servers were extremely rude to us and those around us when trying to pass by. Mind you we were not in front of the kitchen or bar.The bartenders were nice enough and looked to be the hardest working employees. While the drinks were a bit pricey for my taste they were poured heavy!I wont be back, normally I'll give everywhere a 2nd chance but my experience here combined with the snobby privileged patrons of this establishment have turned me off.

55.description: Wanted to try a new place for a Saturday night. Rating this place as a bar and only a bar, it was a great time! Good music everyone liked, good drinks. Would definitely come back.

9.description: Really good drinks and it wasn't too packed on a Thursday night. Also, by "really good drinks," I mean they had 44oz vodka lemonade a that were strong and not a ripoff. They were half-priced the night we went so we spent like $15. You can choose from any flavor of vodka (they have ~15), sweet tea vodka or honey whiskey. The crowd was laid back and everyone was really nice. Our server was a little rude but I was unfazed. I'm definitely trying to come back ASAP!

26.description: If you want poor service from the moment you walk in the door, then this is the place for you. The greeter is rude. The servers ignore you, yet they walk by and stare. And you'll notice that no one is actually eating. Eventually you'll get fed up and dine at a better place.

25.description: This was meh. I would not be back but I wouldn't be apposed to it. The service was friendly but the fries had an old/freezer burn taste. The rack of ribs was decent. I could tell this would be a great place for drinks for watching a game.

12.description: First off what is up with Chicago weather!!! It was around 80 degrees when I left out in shorts and 60 degrees by the time I got to this restaurant.Anyways because of the hawks game they only had outdoor seating ...strike #1 to a freezing cold girl (not blaming them on the weather though)For our meals I got the French Dip on garlic bread (not bad, but steak fries need work). My friend got the brisket (ok) and my other friend got the fried chicken tenders which came with some weird tasting blue cheese sauce (I know what blue cheese taste like and that ain't it) Service was extremely slow from getting our food to even getting our check. They apologized with complementary bread (yay more carbs...just what I need...lol) Just an OK experience for me.

59.description: I was in here last night and I really enjoyed it. Our server Ryan was very nice, helped us through the menu, and was really accommodating. I would definitely go again.

21.description: We had a great time at dinner for my son's birthday. ..the food was excellent and service was outstanding as well.  This place is a great place to wait for Second City.

17.description: Marking the Wells St. in Old territory, these guys probably chose this place like Manifest Destiny of the 1800s. They staked a flag in this spot and said...Let's do BBQ since nobody has it yet.From the semi-trained servers to the frat boy noxious customers to a basic outdoor patio mosh pit... surprised they even serve food.Came with friends to catch a game. Cool place that! Had to try their infamous ribs. Nothing to brag about. The prices were def something to rag about. The service was ok just not as frequent in checking in.This is another case of a bar on steroids trying to create an alter ego as a restaurant.IF you're tired of the club scene, but still want the noise, crowd and lewdness... step into the chaos and enjoy! BUT if you're out for ribs def a better place a few blocks away on Sedgwick off North Ave.

10.description: I've been to a lot of mistakes lately and its just that I cant really fathom how guys work.Very professional, they communicate with their customers very well that is why they'll know sooner or later what food your into.Baby back ribs & chicken was their recommendation. They said it was based on my taste so I waited and see how that chicken taste like.They arrived on the promised time, good thing they uphold to their promises. However, the chicken was really good, didn't have second thoughts and ordered for another plate. I really love the taste of this one, its a pleasure to eat in this fancy place.

5.description: I like this place. One of my good friends, Willie McNickle ("the captain") has come here like 5 times a week for the last 25 years I think. The bartenders and waiters (like Mr. Perry) are all really cool. It can get crowded but they just did renovations and expanded. Cool management, just overall cool place to hang out whether you're 24 or 64.

3.description: Dang.  Two days in Chicago and two "meh" experiences.  So disappointing, since Chicago is such a cool city and I KNOW there are dozens of better choices.  Pretty much everywhere you look.  The Fireplace Inn is a nondescript bar in Old Town that has apparently been around a long time.  The highlight of this bar seems to be the many TV's.   I'm guessing this might be the only sports bar in Old Town.  It's also a BBQ restaurant, although you'd never think this place was any kind of restaurant if you stumbled in off the street.  Maybe some bar food, but barbeque?  Maybe since I'm from way down south (St. Louis - it's a joke) I'm used to barbeque restaurants having a little, I don't know, homey/southern character.   Maybe that kind of ambience doesn't translate well in Chicago.  I do have to say, though, the serves here were absolutely spectacular.  We had a large party and they worked really hard to keep everybody happy, even our daughter, who was clearly way out of her element.  In fact, they were so good I'll have to bump them up a star to three.  They did have a really good beer list, too.  I'd come back to watch a game sometime, especially if I lived in the neighborhood.  We didn't eat this time since we had just had Portillo's, but even if I did live nearby, my expectations would be low.

35.description: Decent king crab, light beer, and fun staff.  That's all I need.

19.description: With their 44oz vodka lemonades how could you not love this place? Great bar atmosphere & the food is actually pretty delicious for bar food. By far one of my favorite bars in the city!

28.description: our waiter took very good care of us.  It was a very positive experience.  I would recommend this place for dinner or even. a casual drink.  If there was anything unexpected, the waiter took great care to deal with it.  The food was really good too!

45.description: ZERO STARS DUE TO NO ONE WAITING ON US.  My girlfriend and I decided to sit on the patio.  We were greeted promptly by the bus boy with waters.  After a few minutes and noticing a 4 servers on the patio we were wondering who was our waiter.  After about 15 minutes we realized we weren't going to be waited on.  The place was a little busy but there is no excuse for this happening.  We decided to leave and I asked for the manager, one of the servers went to get him.  About 7-8 minutes later the server walked by me and said that the manager was in the office.  Poor management+a staff that doesn't care=ZERO STARS.  I will gladly spend my hard earned money elsewhere.

33.description: Marking the Wells St. in Old territory, these guys probably chose this place like Manifest Destiny of the 1800s. They staked a flag in this spot and said...Let's do BBQ since nobody has it yet.From the semi-trained servers to the frat boy noxious customers to a basic outdoor patio mosh pit... surprised they even serve food.Came with friends to catch a game. Cool place that! Had to try their infamous ribs. Nothing to brag about. The prices were def something to rag about. The service was ok just not as frequent in checking in.This is another case of a bar on steroids trying to create an alter ego as a restaurant.IF you're tired of the club scene, but still want the noise, crowd and lewdness... step into the chaos and enjoy! BUT if you're out for ribs def a better place a few blocks away on Sedgwick off North Ave.

43.description: Food was delicious, wait staff could have been better but to be fair it was incredibly busy, the patio and atmosphere was good, but not straight up amazing. Solid choice if there's no wait and you live nearby

2.description: Trusty standby on Wells...tends to be a bit less crowded than some of the other trendier places on the block, but can be a crazy late night.  You can get your standard beers, drinks and buckets (yes 44 oz basically buckets) of vodka lemonades - half price on Saturdays, Recently stopped by for an afternoon drink on the weekend for the first time since they opened the renovated patio into an new indoor space.  Quite the dichotomy now between the shiny new side and the old side with a lot of character.  There are TONS of tv's on the new side, so good place to stop in to watch a game.  Bartenders etc. are always really nice here, though full disclosure, my friend bartends here and she is the best :)

18.description: Came for March Madness Purdue game. The atmosphere is great for Purdue fans and there are tons of tvs to watch games from literally every angle. Bartender was great and that's where the positives end. Ordered nachos and they were terrible, on the verge of being inedible. They had too many gross canned chili beans. The sliders were better but nothing id come back for. Table service was slow and inattentive. If you're coming for a beer and a game, this could be a decent place, just make sure to eat beforehand...

41.description: Tell you what.  This place is great for what it is.  One of.if not the only place left on wells street with character from the later days.   Come here for great convo  from the old worldly regulars.  And the broads working the bar are lovely and friendly (keep your eyes peeled for the blonde. Tasty). And honestly this is a goddamn bar not a restaurant so please disregard the food reviews. (Food is honestly bar fare). And come out and check out old towns hidden gem

52.description: No food complaints (aside from super slow delivery (we were ready to leave since it was so late) I almost ordered twice since it was so long waiting that I forgot whether I had already ordered). The manager was great but the waitress needed an attitude check and some stress relief (understaffed wait staff). The kitchen needs to get their turn times down - they are affecting the waitresses ability to serve and the overall experience.Lastly: we had to figure out our own tips until the manager told the waitress to figure our bill out... A little too much hassle.

50.description: First off what is up with Chicago weather!!! It was around 80 degrees when I left out in shorts and 60 degrees by the time I got to this restaurant.Anyways because of the hawks game they only had outdoor seating ...strike #1 to a freezing cold girl (not blaming them on the weather though)For our meals I got the French Dip on garlic bread (not bad, but steak fries need work). My friend got the brisket (ok) and my other friend got the fried chicken tenders which came with some weird tasting blue cheese sauce (I know what blue cheese taste like and that ain't it) Service was extremely slow from getting our food to even getting our check. They apologized with complementary bread (yay more carbs...just what I need...lol) Just an OK experience for me.

4.description: The bar gets packed easily now that the large outdoor space is gone and they are left with just a tiny front patio.  Not sure what is going on with the old outdoor space as I heard that the restaurant was for sale.  They are open for lunch on Friday and it was fairly empty.  As mentioned before the food seemed prepackaged.  I had the rib sandwich and it was decent but definitely prepackaged.  Think of it as a slightly better McRib.

6.description: This is a pic of the salt that I needed for everything but the waiter. This place is not the worst place I've ever eaten. It's like the waiting room for the worst place I've ever eaten. Waiter was slow but nice. Like Forrest Gump, if he served you burnt chicken.

22.description: Came for March Madness Purdue game. The atmosphere is great for Purdue fans and there are tons of tvs to watch games from literally every angle. Bartender was great and that's where the positives end. Ordered nachos and they were terrible, on the verge of being inedible. They had too many gross canned chili beans. The sliders were better but nothing id come back for. Table service was slow and inattentive. If you're coming for a beer and a game, this could be a decent place, just make sure to eat beforehand...

15.description: Our experience at this place tonight was a sh*tstorm.  Their "famous" ribs were so "fall off the bone" that they were like pot roast.  But, that was not the biggest problem.  The major issue was that they felt compelled to show some pay for view fight on every tv, with the volume blaring.  Trying to eat while fighters are bleeding out was not my idea of a nice dinner out.  Never again for this place.An update:  my daughter now is vomiting and we suspect food poisoning from the crab cakes from this place.

57.description: Being from out of town, my boyfriend and I were just looking for a good reasonably priced dinner when we walked by the Fireplace Inn. We glanced at the menu before deciding to stay and it look incredibly reasonable. Our server (Ryan) was extremely friendly and helpful while we asked a few questions. I ordered the FPI French dip and my boyfriend got the brisket sandwich. Mine was excellent! Served on a garlic roll, the roast beef was piping hot and it was huge! (The steak fries were also pretty good!) I tried my boyfriend brisket sandwich and to be honest it wasn't for me, but only because the BBQ sauce wasn't my style. (He finished the whole plate, so no complaints there!) The food was not only good but it was VERY fast! All in all, good food, good service, and the atmosphere was great! (Played a lot of 90s music, which was fantastic!)

20.description: We stopped in for Dinner before the Second City show on a weeknight. First of all I liked the neighborhood feel of the place, it felt like Old Chicago. We had BBQ Ribs and Chicken, Shrimp cocktail & Pulled Pork sandwich, it was all very good. The BBQ was tasty and the service was very attentive. We will be back.

36.description: In a pretty competitive stretch of bars and restaurants in old town, it was surprising how rude, unhelpful, and lackadaisical the hostess was. We tried to get a drink and an appetizer and she couldn't care less when we walked in and was more interested in her cell phone ax we walked out. Went down the street and had a better meal and drinks. Not worth the drama.

14.description: Terrible bar. Much better choices nearby. I wouldn't recommend this place. This bar manufactured lines for a near empty bar.

58.description: Fun place to grab a drink after Second City shows. Hilarious art on the walls. They did not serve food that I know of and it's cash only.

56.description: Scandalized. I tell you, I was scandalized. Nude and, at times, wildly inappropriate paintings of politicians and other famous people everywhere you look. Actually, that was the best part and I give it 5 stars because it kept me entertained. The inside is pretty drab, the beer isn't too unique or special, and the Friday crowd was sort of odd the day we stopped in. Parking in the area can be a pain, but it's an easy walk from the El. Cash only is a big downside for me.

29.description: Love gems like this. Simply incredible. Greeted by a wonderful gentleman (Bill?) who discussed the origins of my last name and many other interesting tidbits while he pretended to actually card me. I like it here. It's genuine, it's not 'bro-ey'. Some would call it a dive, but I call it a diamond. Can't wait to be back.

42.description: Have you ever wanted to party with Kim Jong Il? You can finally do that by stopping by Old Town Ale House.  This place is worth stopping by if only to check out the crazy art on the wall of politicians and luminaries. It's open late, so I'm a fan!

23.description: This place is where I learned a lot about improv outside the stage and classroom. Great place for a last drink when you don't want the night to end.

47.description: A good spot for an eyeful of bizarre and darkly entertaining paintings and the people watching is almost as fun.  A kaleidoscope of Chicago debauchery.

8.description: If you are looking for a quiet bar, hangout for artists and intellectuals-- this is it. No loud music. No hipsters. No bankers or business types. Cash only.

31.description: Nothing says "we prefer grown-ups" like irreverent paintings featuring naked politicians. No Party is safe, no cheek too outre.The beer list is pretty good, doesn't try too hard. Really, the place is more about the magnificent juke box and the dive-bar atmosphere, which seem to bring on a synesthetic perception of cigarette smoke and old-guy after-shave.Come here on a first date if you are confident in the first impression you'll make and your date's sure-footedness in the world. But heads-up: it's a cash-only joint.

34.description: This is the best bar I have been to outside of NYC, and it beats most places there. A true intellectual hangout and not a commercialized den of tweaks and hipsters committing industrial sodomy on each other in front of you and your date.

16.description: This is a first class dive bar, if there is such a think.  They have unique artwork on the walls, a jukebox full of blues and jazz, Guinness on tap, friendly folks and it is right across the street from the Second City Comedy Club.  It is a fine place to be able to have a conversation with a friend.

13.description: Definitely a low key place! The nude pictures on the wall are fun to try & guess who the celebrity is! The owner made her own dip & pulled pork that she offered to everyone as complimentary. We didn't try any, but I thought it was pretty cool she did that.

11.description: Awesome bar! We went here after a Second City show on a Friday night. The space is small and the crowd is thick, but squeeze in and the fun begins. The walls are essentially an art gallery of interesting modern portraits. There's a fun, urban energy in here -- a few old-timers on the stools and with-it bartenders. I hope to visit again someday.

39.description: I've been here between 4 and 7 one day a week for the last couple weeks, and have really enjoyed the place. It has a great atmosphere if you don't mind smutty drawings of politicians on the walls, and the clientele is a nice mix of people ranging from septuagenarian curmudgeons to twenty-something hipsters in graphic design.I've only interacted with one bartender so far but she is very friendly, attentive, and just generally good at her job. Even when the place starts to get pretty busy, I've never had to wait more than a minute for a refill.The beer selection is pretty good, too. They have Revolution Anti-Hero, Lagunitas IPA, Bell's Oberon, and a few other craft beers, to go with the standard macro brews like Miller Lite, etc. Craft beers are a very reasonable $5 and the cheapies are $3.75. These are definitely cheaper-than-normal prices for Chicago, but I suppose that goes with dive bar territory.My biggest complaint is the fact that the only bathroom stall in the men's room doesn't have a door. If I need to use the restroom, I don't think it's that insane to think I should be able to do it without the potential for an audience. Still, this is really the only problem I have with the place. It's clean for a dive, with great service and reasonable prices. What more could you want, aside from a bathroom door?

37.description: This is my absolute favorite bar to frequent. As a Second City employee/student I find myself there after every show! Great for a bit of a divey ambiance, the nude paintings are the absolute best, and they have a great beer selection. Not to mention, the "bouncers" are some of the coolest guys around. I only deducted a star for these small reasons: I am not a huge fan of anywhere that is strictly "Cash Only" and sometimes it gets pretty crowded.Otherwise, I LOVE IT!

0.description: Classic spot in Old Town. Cash only. It can be busy so you may have to stand/wait for a table but that isn't a bad thing. It's easier to check out all the artwork that way. P.s. may not be the best place to bring Mom ;)

38.description: I'm so glad I finally made it to this place. I've been dying to go since I heard Anthony Bourdain is a big fan and that it's frequented by comedians from Second City and Zanies down the street. As is the reputation, it has a great dive bar atmosphere. I tried to explain "dive bar" to someone the other day and this one exactly fits the bill: the drinks are cheap, you can come dressed however you want and you'll end up staying for hours without realizing it. While we were there, a couple comedians who you would recognize from TV came in and were just hanging out. No one bothered them and which is probably why they come here.  The beers were super cheap ($5 for craft beer) and the bartenders were helpful with suggestions. I loved the portraits on the wall but this might not be a place you bring your friend who freaks out at the sight of risque art. If you're looking to grab a few drinks with your buddies or want a really chill night with your significant other, I highly recommend this place. It will be my go-to for any out-of-town guests moving forward.

51.description: To be honest, I didn't spend much time here. I stopped by here because a friend I was waiting for was running pretty late, and I didn't want to stand outside alone. It's a very charming dive bar; the kind that I could see myself coming here everyday for a drink with some good company and maybe meet someone here and fall in love like in some cliche chick flick. I didn't meet anyone there, but I just like the idea of that happening at this kind of place. The drinks were nothing special, but the bar just felt warm and welcoming. Too bad I don't live right below it like in HIMYM.

27.description: An excellent, classic dive bar, in the best sense of the name!  Good service, good prices, good drinks.  A timeless atmosphere.  Music/noise level was just right - quiet enough to have a conversation, but not quiet as a tomb or a library, either.  Hanging out here made me want to be a local so I could become a regular.  I would not hesitate to return.

32.description: I loved Old Town Ale House.  Great drinks, reasonable prices.  I loved the humorous political pictures on the walls.  As a small time local Brooklyn politician, I do hope one day I can make the wall!

54.description: The late great Roger Ebert said that the Old Town Ale House was the best bar in the world that he knew about.  I don't necessarily agree with Mr. Ebert on his comment, but the place was pretty cool.  The jukebox is stuffed with mostly jazz music which makes for great listening and the drinks are bottom of the barrel cheap.  My draft ran me $2.50.  As most have commented, there are some bizarre naked cartoons on the wall (the walls are plastered with head shot drawings of famous people including the aforementioned Mr. Ebert) which are a little creepy to look at.  But overall, it is a cool place to hang for a couple of drinks and soaking in some jazz.

48.description: Decent and reasonably priced drinks.The artwork all over the walls makes this place worth visiting. One could easily spend a few hours looking at all the different paintings, trying to figure them out. There's a lot of seating, but I think that this place does get pretty crowded after Second City shows. Everyone in the bar seems to know each other, which is really nice! Also, they do not serve food....but they don't have any issues with bringing in food from other places.

44.description: This bar has a very laid back atmosphere. Add that to the tasteful artwork and I'm sold. This place has a soul of its one and is one of a kind in the Old Town neighborhood. If you're looking for a dive feel with reasonably priced drinks, it's not to be missed.

24.description: friendly and old school chicago oasis in bastion of copycat bars that could be anywhere in the country. Loved the walls and atmosphere.

7.description: Shabby. Slightly smelly. Run down.FULL OF HISTORY.What more needs to be said? It's a Chicago institution. Great bar, lots of booze, and friendly bartenders.

49.description: If you don't give this place 5 stars for the artwork alone, you're an idiot. It's a stinky dive with more character than any other bar in Chicago.

40.description: Really enjoyed this place. Me, my brother, and his wife went out on the town to just have a few drinks and enjoy the city, and this was the first place we stopped at. It was exactly what we wanted to start up our evening. Got a few drinks, the bartender was lovely and helpful, and afterwards went on our way. Great, cozy place. The prices were not half bad either, and I liked the 3-beer sampler they offered.

53.description: Just an awesome place to end the night.  Bummed that they took out the pinball machine, but doesn't deter me from going there at all.

30.description: Cash only bar that is well worn and visited. Several regulars that make up a small daily crowd. Old beaten up wooden bar top and bar face. There is a good rail and box footrest. Stools are padded, kind of, since they are beaten to shit. Most wobble. Bar back is a smattering of pictures, tvs, shelves, and alcohol. Floors are also well worn wooden planks. Cartoon caricatures of famous celebs adorn the walls. Windows in the front and corner allow sunlight in the afternoon. If you come in the front door, the bar is on the right (15 or so stools) with lower round table seating opposite the bar. Service is efficient and friendly.

46.description: I was really excited to come here due to the history of this spot.  While I did find it an ok spot, I didn't really find it welcoming.  It's kind of dark and dingy (as dive bars go), and definitely had a smell of a gross college bar.  However, if you can get in and get a seat, it does have interesting art to talk about and a good beer selection.  The bathrom could use a little cleaning, but I supposed it IS a dive....

1.description: We stopped in here before a show at Second City and were welcomed by a guest at the bar screaming "HIPSTERS" at us. His girlfriend that looked like his daughter told him to stop because he was embarrassing her. Weird.. ok.. keep walking...Sat down and looked around.. I think we were the least hipster in the place! Oh well. The bar is cash only, and there are pictures of naked people everywhere. Entertaining and a good place to go before the show since I'm not sure there is anywhere else around there.

55.description: It stinks. The drinks are OK. The art is entertaining. It's a dive.  I like the cash only rule and the the tunes are great.

9.description: I'll preface this review with saying, i came in on a Monday early evening. There was a few people there having drinks but no music, just a tv with the news on. I came in alone from out of town. Looking for a cool place to have a beer and maybe some decent tunes, nope. Also the bartender did not seem very friendly, or eager to help me get a drink, even though there was virtually no demand of her. I had one drink and left. Meh. No what i was expecting,not even for a dive.

26.description: Shabby. Slightly smelly. Run down.FULL OF HISTORY.What more needs to be said? It's a Chicago institution. Great bar, lots of booze, and friendly bartenders.

25.description: This place puts me in a good mood. Many laughs at the artwork and the bartenders. The doorman is also usually in good spirits. Love it.

12.description: 1. Great jukebox 2. Open until 4 or 5am 3. Great artwork .... Just don't forget cash only. Totally recommend it as best dive bar in Chicago.

59.description: Blue Moon with a lemon, got it Liz? (Who's Liz? I started my review while I was plastered. So now I have no memory. Thanks, Hangover.) Also, if you need to see the Naked Art of Sarah Palin, this is the spot. #elephantintheroom

21.description: My favorite bar in the city!  Why?  Well, it smells stale, looks run down, bar tenders are friendly, and the decor...I'll let you all find out.  What really sets this bar above the rest is the jukebox.  Jazz, Blues, and even some Opera if you are into that sort of thing.  It's to bad this place is insanely packed on any given night.  However, if you happen to be there with only a hand full of people, this place becomes beautiful, very unique,  Chicago experience.

17.description: Old Town Ale House is one of the best dive bars in Chicago. Everyone should go to this bar at least once. There's so much history here.

10.description: Small dive bar right across the street from the Second City Theatre. Music is played from a Jukebox. Local beers on tap for reasonable prices ($11 for 2 pints). Also have canned and bottled beer selection as well as a full liquor bar. Worth a try for a quick drink while in the area. Walking distance from Lincoln Park and North Avenue Beach.  Cash only!

5.description: I was here a few days ago with s friend. It was a hot day and public transit was screwed up and we were each unpleasantly delayed for lunch. So we came here for a couple beers. What a great place! Decent selection of draft beers that were nicely cold and really interesting paintings.I think the beer made our lunch better than it had any right to be.

3.description: Ahhh, the birth place of comedy, so glad I got to go here.  It's not what you know, but who you know, and the people who have walked in here, kicked back and had a few are pretty legendary but all that bs aside, it's just a very chill fun, bar with amazing shit all over the walls, and a great friendly staff to keep you entertained.  HORRAY!  Love this place!  Thank you, thank you!

35.description: The room smells funny but its worth a beer to see all the art.  They have a naked Sarah Palin holding a shotgun. lol

19.description: They have great art.  Cash only, and good cheap beer.  My friend got a Schiltz and she seemed happy with it.  We were about to pick up our race packets.

28.description: I often come here after my Friday Second City improv class.  The prices are great for a city bar, the ambiance is great, it has a great selection on the jukebox, and a guy comes in and sells the best tamales in the city.  The art work on the walls is interesting also.  The only draw back is that it is a cash only bar, but that's a small price to pay for such a great place.

45.description: Finally found the welcoming, bit more unusual bar I was looking for. Good music and friendly staff.

33.description: Interesting paintings here. I'm going to go out on a limb and say the owner isn't that into Republicans, and is also into nudity. Had a Revolution IPA. Nice.

43.description: If you are leaving Wells street or Old Town Social at close and you are looking for somewhere to go, Old Town Ale House is your place. The combination of the cozyness, jutebox being the only music, cash only bar, and history behind this place I feel like this is another hidden gem of Old Town.Its a dive so don't be expecting it to be spotless and smell great. Doesn't serve food but there is really no point in eating there because the drink selection is far too great. Everyone is very welcoming! My 87 year old grandmother who loves Saturday night live requested to stop in here for a drink because she had heard about this place and its history. Worth a visit!

2.description: Nude paintings. Tamales. Michael Shannon. This bar across the street from The Second City is the coziest hole-in-the-wall you will ever frequent. The smell of Old Town Ale House will stir college memories and the prices will make you forget that you live in a city that taxes you to breathe. This spot is super divey with wall to wall nude paintings and a juke box filled with smooth jazz. Hungry at 1AM and not ready to leave? Not a problem-- there is a very high chance that your favorite tamale guy is around offering patrons a handful of warm tamales for a buck or two. The only semi-inconveniece of Old Town Ale House is that it is a cash only bar. The low prices are worth it, though.Lastly, I have been here a handful of times and have seen Michael Shannon chilling in his socks and mandals more than once. So, that's something.Definitely recommend.

18.description: Small bar close to Chicago downtown, run down. Lot of locals and regulars here. Bartender gives you a "what are you doing here" kind of look for first timers i guess. But good crowd, and divey ambience.

41.description: One of Chicago's finest.  If you're visiting, break out of downtown and come grab a few here.

52.description: We stopped here for a couple of drinks before dinner. It's definitely an old school, comfortable bar. The furniture looks like it's been here forever. There's a good wooden booth area at the back of the bar. As most have mentioned, there are interesting pictures everywhere on the walls! Fun to look at, laugh at & talk about! Cheap drinks so it's a nice reprieve from virtually every other bar in the area. It is not a "specialty craft drinks" sort of bar, but a laid back & easy going place.

50.description: Old Town Ale House is a great, chill bar, definitely the best in the neighborhood.  Interesting, quirky decor, awesome jukebox, and proper bartenders.  It's also the only bar for a couple miles that stays open late night.  Drinks are priced right, and the locals are friendly.  I'm no longer in Chicago, but always happy to stop by.

4.description: Perfect place to duck in before or after something. You know...work, a show, a party, dinner, a movie, etc. Friendly, old school, order simple. Paintings are awesome. More than just Guiness as a stout would be good, though.

6.description: Mostly beer is sold here.  A legit dive bar for all the actors from Second City.  I had a few drinks here while visiting.  The places was really crowded when I arrived and then died down a bit then started to get packed again, kind of weird.

22.description: The best bar ever and most friendly staff! I was a newbie and accepted like an oldie. Go Cubs. Yay for Californians. 10/10 would bone bartender.

15.description: The nicotine patina behind the outstanding artwork make this place the neighborhood staple that it is. The prices are a bit higher than one might expect for a "dive," though are still the cheapest on the street--I guess that's Chicago for you!

57.description: I very much enjoyed this bar. It is a dive bar. There are nude paintings of politicians (mostly conservatives) on all the walls. It is funny and a great conversation starter if you lose things to talk about. They have booze, they might have food, I'm not really sure. I'll come back next time I walk by.

20.description: If you are looking for a quiet bar, hangout for artists and intellectuals-- this is it. No loud music. No hipsters. No bankers or business types. Cash only.

36.description: One of my fav Dive bars. Killer art work close to bus and train

14.description: Old Town Ale house would normally get 3 stars due to being an extremely average neighborhood bar with nothing foodie or cocktail oriented beyond the normal tap beers and rail liquors but since they have the most amazing cozy neighborhood atmosphere full of lude/naked political caricatures this place gets a bump for its entertaining decor.  You also can't beat the price, most beers and house drinks are right around $5.

58.description: Just got home from a girl's night gathering here. I have very mixed feelings about my experience. Being very indecisive, I generally look to professionals to assist in the decision-making process and the overall inspiration for projects at crafty places as such. So here's how it went down. It was a Sunday night and we had a table of 6 girls with us. So they automatically charge a $10 fee per person for their help. Okay, fair enough. But keep in mind that there were six of us and really no other patrons. There were 4 employees working the store. I personally had three different employees trying to assist me, but then I would say "is this going to be a lot of work, or expensive or too challenging" and they would each have a different answer that usually drove me away from my original idea. Then they would just walk away. Finally, I got frustrated and headed back to the table empty-handed saying I was ready to cry because I was so overwhelmed (yes, sometimes I can be overly dramatic) and one of the employees offered to help me. She was great and didn't try to talk me out of what I wanted to do. So that was a step in the right direction. We gathered all the things we needed and went back. Now the three employees and the six of us sat doing our projects. The employees were like one of us, chatting away and exchanging anecdotes and being very personable and pleasant. Another plus. The chairs we sat on were cute to look at, but functional they were not. They were basically little beautiful tree stumps. This has very little to do with the experience, but thought I would throw that out there. While doing our projects the employees didn't really show us what to do as much as they took over our earrings and more or less just made them for us. I repeatedly mentioned that I wanted a chain to run through my beaded necklace and alas, my necklace came back completed sans chain. All of this would have been fine, not great, but if it weren't for the horrific end result which was the checking out I would have said this was an okay experience. So things aren't very clearly marked or labeled so it's easy to get carried away without realizing what you're spending but for the life of me I can't figure out how my simple little beaded necklace, like the kind you get at a Claire's cost me $60. My friend spent $90 on a necklace and now has to eat ramen for the rest of the week. Not a single one of us left without paying a minimum of $50 for things that we weren't overly impressed with. I now learned that to do the type of beading we did today, we could have easily bought beads, pliers, clasps, and rings at a craft store and made these things for a fraction of the price. I loved the idea of a place like this, but I just can't justify the cost especially because it was complete sticker shock! I also looked at the classes and for $60 you get to "learn" how to make something and a bracelet and earrings are included in that price - a much better deal than I feel we got. Like I said, I really liked the girls that we were working with if we were out at a bar let's say, but I'm sad that I can't love this place more and give it a better review.

56.description: I looove this place, the only thing I hate about it is how much money I spend when I checkout. There is something for everyone, and every budget. Somehow, I always look for the expensive stuff :o/ Oh well. Staff extremely knowledgable and helpful, and SWEET! Looking forward to taking my craft mother there for her birthday next month.Oh and I need to mention all the compliments I get on the unique jewelry that I have either made or bought from there, thats worth 5 stars in it's self. and it's all one of a kind!

29.description: I went in with an idea and Lauren was an expert in helping me actualize my vision into a beautiful piece of jewelry. I am so grateful. This place is amazing.

42.description: It was my very 1st time here today. I was instantly greeted by a very nice girl. The overall flow of the store is great - as well as the incense aroma of the store. I was tempted in taking so many more beads, however, the price per stone/strand held me back. As a beginner, I'm not quite ready to spend as much. I will be back for those special projects in the future :) I kinda wish the other girl who rang me out was a bit friendlier - she needs to smile like the Buddha in the entrance.

23.description: Overpriced and does not carry many basic beading items. The staff is rude to the customers and snooty to fellow jewelry makers.  Its as if they only want your business if they can teach you themselves but they don't like discussing beading and beading tips.

47.description: Mary helped alot. This is a great bead store with tons of different beads to select from, I got about $80 worth of beads on a whim& they hooked up a sweet discount card! I spoil my child. They have sushi beads! Turn off the TV, get in here and make some crafts, enjoy ur life!

8.description: We went to this store because we were curious about their beads. If you are into making your own jewelry this is definitely a store to visit. They have a great selection of beads and offer a nice variety of jewelry making classes. The people working there were friendly and didn't bother us much unless we had a question, they just seemed to have fun together. The store doesn't only offer materials to make your own jewelry, they have a nice selection of jewelry too. We didn't end up buying anything, but we loved checking out this store. We spent a good hour in there checking out everything they have in stock.

31.description: Love this place! My new black cameo necklace is fabulous!! The girls working were so friendly and helpful and she picked out the perfect chain to match the vintage piece I had. My friends and I are coming back to do a jewelry class soon.

34.description: If you want a one-of-a-kind piece of jewelry, come here. The staff is super friendly and very willing to help. Just pick out your beads and for $3 they will make a bracelet for you! Must visit.

16.description: The girls that work at beadniks are awesome. They are super friendly and knowledgeable. I needed to get some jump rings to fix two purses and they fixed it in one minute, no questions asked for the price of the rings ($3). You can always stop in here and get exactly what you need w great service.

13.description: Yelp decided to delete my last comment for "lack of detail" which given the comment was a strange reason. Here is the comment:"The bead selection was great, there was a ton of great and interesting stuff, however the service was not so great. The woman who "helped" us was snarky and rude and did not seem to want our business.With service like this you may as well go to a generic craft store to put beads together."But since yelp wanted more detail I will oblige. My girlfriend and I decided that we would go to beadniks for her birthday and we called ahead the night before to make sure that we didn't need an appointment to get personal help with the process - they told us it would be fine to walk in. So we come in to the store the following day and our presence is not really noticed -so far no big deal I like having personal space to check out a store before someone attempts to sell me something. We wanted to make jewelry however and after a while of browsing through their beads we sought help. We had also brought in stones that we already had to ask if they drill them there.The response the woman had to that was quite snarky and off putting. We had expected that this could not be done there, though at that point we were fairly annoyed by the response about it, and asked for help with making something using the beads they have there. The woman gave us a tray and pointed us to a table where we were completely ignored from then on. No one told us about the materials to use or what to do. We sat there looking at beads for a while before inquiring further. When we did we were given a short response, that was not helpful, and the woman went about something else. Finally, were annoyed enough to leave an when we did so no one said anything to us. From the looks of the other comments they give better service to groups, but as a walk in we were ignored and given short rude responses that had an air of arrogance and sarcasm. Our experience there was far from pleasant.

11.description: I celebrated my birthday by reserving a private party at Beadniks. We all had a great time! The Beadnik staff are so helpful. I love the variety of beads. My friend and I made a Mala. It was a great experience.  I love this place!!

39.description: How I love my beadniks! I have brought friends here for classes and even my Mother-in-law for an earring making class! I LOVE taking their classes! Their staff is so patient (honestly, dealing with a group of girls, who most of them have no clue on how to make jewelry, you have to be!). I have taken the ring class two times (fabulous rings! I love them and get compliements on them!), and the earring class, which was tons of fun as well!  The classes range from about $20 and up and then  you pay for your beads, so you can make it as expensive or inexpensive as you'd like! Honestly, the classes I have taken were about $25, and I spent about $25 on beads...so you are looking at aabout $50ish per class...not to shabby to make your own jewelry (3 rings/3 earrings!).  They also have a ton of jewelry for sale made by the employees! Quite pricey, but they have a bunch of fun and funky items!  Their earrings are pretty reasonable though! I bought a pair of earrings today for $10! Not too shabby!!!!Check it out if you want to make your own jewelry, design your own, take a class or just check out the funky jewelry for sale!!!

37.description: OMG!  It's beads.  How silly but now I am completely addicted.  I spent 3 weekends out of the last 4 at this place and have started inviting new friends because the ones I have already taken think I'm nuts.I understand.  It is the artist in me.  They are not beads.  The selection is so good that they are really like little gems.  Each bead has a story about its manufacture or quality or history.  I make this stuff that I know only I care about but I CARE about them.

0.description: My friend organized an event here for 8 girls and it was such a fun and unique way to spend a weekday night!For a fee (think it was $35 plus whatever beads you choose) the staff will show you how to put together your creation, help you do it, and let you use their tools. You can bring in wine and snacks and they have a nice area in the back for groups.They have the largest selection of beads that I've ever seen & also fashionable pieces that have already been put together that you can buy.The staff was extremely helpful and made great suggestions-they were also really funny/enjoyable to be around! The only downfall is that the beads can be expensive, but this is standard with every bead place I've ever been in.

38.description: I really really want to love this place. I have a little box full of beads that I've bought over the years - all sorts of items made of bone, wood, coral, agate etc, with lots of hand carving. They have these kind of beads here and lots more to boot, but all I can ever do is walk around, look at the beads and gasp at the prices. It's ridiculous what they charge for simple filler beads, not to mention centerpiece items. Basic supplies like wire, thread, ear hoops and claps are alarmingly expensive. I walk around and look and then I leave because there's no point in even starting a project here. I'd blow $100 just to make my own necklace. Ridiculous.

51.description: This place has great selection of beads, materials for wraps bracelets, clasps, and lots of great ideas. The staff is super helpful too. They also have a pretty extensive class schedule. Hoping to get some friends together and go sometime. Definitely one of the better bead places in the city!

27.description: They have so many different kinds of beads it's amazing! First time I went in there I was so wowed by this place. They also have accessory making class. They provide you with the tools you need and they will help you to make what you want to take home. It's a great way for a date, or for a girls hangout. Very reasonable price too.

32.description: I came into Beadniks last night with a crafty gift in mind for my mom. I was super impressed by the selection and will revisit only for this reason. However, while I was the ONLY customer in the store, neither employee asked me if I needed any help as they were chatting away to one another. Based upon other reviews, this behavior does not seem out of the ordinary and is kind of off putting when you're looking for something particular among the selection of hundreds of beads.

54.description: These girls are quite frankly awesome! They made a great gift for my girlfriend, who absolutely loved it!

48.description: Love this place - still:) Once again staff took a ton of time helping me bring my vision to a reality:) Thanks guys! Hope you'll let me back in even though I took hours of your time:)

44.description: Great selection of beads and whatever, easy to call in and have a gift card waiting there for my sister's birthday!  thanks Loren!

24.description: Really enjoy this store.  The sales people are always very helpful when you want to do your own designs.  It is a bit on the pricey side.  But they do have a few unique pieces and it is a very interesting store.  I really enjoy shopping here.

7.description: I came to beadniks during the Do Division fest. They do have a variety of interesting items and you can spend at least an hour looking at things. They help you with projects and give recommendations on what looks good or how to approach a project. We asked them to make some necklaces for us, they were happy to oblige. I would recommend that you ask them for an estimate for parts and labor costs before they start making things, just so you dont get a surprise at the end when they charge you. Overall, cute store, nice designs and ideas and friendly people. You can even sit at the back and make jewelry and use their tools so in case you have repair projects you can do them here.

49.description: I don't know how to rate this - kinda hoped we were walking into a place where we'd design our bracelets and they would be made for us.  Happened for the cute guy who walked in but we were stuck making our bracelets.3 hours later and me and my friend (admittedly not arts and crafts people) were losing our minds trying to finish our bracelets.  The staff was not very helpful.  And the bracelet lobster claw has already tarnished a week later and some of the bead colors washed off.Sorry but didn't love this experience.

40.description: Beadniks on Division at Damen is a cute little shop.  You walk in and immediately feel like you're going to walk out with something unique and pricey.  The truth is, yes, you'll have your own, unique creation but unless you're going banzai, the price you'll pay for your end product is VERY reasonable!I walked in kind of knowing what I wanted to do - a gift for my boyfriend: a... what do you call it? a choker? a man-necklace? Anyway, I wanted THAT.  Here are the pros and cons of my experience:Pro:  Score on price! I paid $12, tax includedPro:  I walked out with something unique, creative, and coolCon: Music is a universal thing.  Why u no have more music beads, Beadniks?Con: Even though I stood waiting for help for a good 5 minutes and two employees stood around chatting about their Friday night, I finally had to flag someone down and say, "I need help! Do you work here?" This is a major pet peeve of mine and it was the only thing that really bothered me about my visit.  It's cool to leave me alone if I look like I'm busy but if I'm standing at the counter, then come see if I need something.  Also, ladies, know your prices.  The associate who did finally help me kept asking me how much the beads I'd selected cost.  Hello? Shouldn't you be telling me that?I like Beadniks - to say I love it would probably be a bit of a stretch.  Still, the good does far outweigh the bad so four stars it is!

53.description: I've taken 2 classes here - the crash course in findings was very helpful since i am new to beading & jewelry making. You learn how to  use all the basic findings to string beads and make a simple wire loop. I thought it was a good value at $60 for a necklace, bracelet, earrings and you get 3 tools to keep. I also took the bead & chain class to get a little more in depth some of the techniques. I enjoyed both classes and thought they were very valuable, but I recommend taking one of the classes with supplies included because everything is so expensive! But they do have a very good selection of unique beads and chains

30.description: I. love. this. place.The girls that work here are wonderful. They are great at helping you create beautiful pieces and giving suggestions that make your jewelry look beautiful.So many of the things I have made I get compliments on.  Their selection is awesome and they have different things in all the time.My only watch-out is that making jewelry is not cheap--it all adds up and they don't really talk to you about price until you are being rung up. It would be nice to know while the work is in progress what you are spending.  But I take responsibility for that--I should have asked!I will be back here again and can't wait!

46.description: These ladies are absolutely fabulous! The selection and overall experience is fantastic too, but the women who work here go above and beyond and are one of the reasons I always want to come back. I work for a small company, and we have had our holiday soiree there the past several years - we bring in snacks and bubbly, chat, and make jewelry - which always requires plenty of assistance. I've been so impressed that I brought my bridal party to make our wedding jewelry. Another great experience, and lots of help narrowing down visions in what can be creatively overwhelming. I can't say enough about how much I love this place!

1.description: Stopped in yesterday, not only did the ladies working quickly help me fix a piece of jewelry, I walked out with two amazing bracelets (amethyst and rose quartz) and a fabulous tourmaline ring that, to me, look like they cost way more than they did!I also laughed a lot during my time in the store, which is the main reason I decided to Yelp, I'm not much of a yelper but my experience today gave me something to Yelp about for sure. I actually ended up staying in the store to hang for quite a bit longer than expected!Also I'm an acupuncturist and I work with crystals, I like how the staff knows about the healing properties of stones.Beautiful stones and beads, great people working who can help you, nice vibes......I will be back soon! My favorite jewelry store, hands down :)

55.description: My favorite bead store!

9.description: My friends and I came to Beadniks to create custom jewelry for her wedding.  The staff, especially Jessie and Mary, were incredibly helpful both with helping us come up with design ideas for our statement pieces then with helping us create them.  When we ran out of time (our time not theirs) they offered to create our second piece for us to pick up at a later date.  The shop is incredibly unique with many bead options, chain options and beautiful pieces already created to buy or use as inspiration for your own design.  I'll be back very soon, and would absolutely recommend this place to friends.  p.s. We brought our own wine and snacks.  Creating jewelry beats the hell out of a painting party any day.

26.description: Beadniks was recommended by my boyfriend and wow I was not disappointed.  My best friend and I were approached by several Beadniks employees offering help and asking questions.  We were first approached by Lauren, who listened to our story behind our little bead and vision of what we wanted.  Thank Beadniks!  Your customer service was incredible and the care you gave us was fantastic!

25.description: This review is based on my extreme need for a particular bead and the staff at beadniks sense of urgency and customer service. I called ahead to make sure they had what I needed to repair a headband and not only did they have it but they repaired it and charged me nothing for the item and the repair! I offered but they refused and said it was on the house for a new customer! Talk about making your customers happy! I will definitely be using them in the future for all my beading needs :)

12.description: I went to Beadniks looking to make a simple strand necklace tailored to an outfit. The bead selection was wonderful, and the necklace ended up costing about $20 from start to finish. (I used a strand of beads; purchasing individuals beads for a necklace would be more expensive.) A staff member helped me design a bracelet to go along with the necklace using a mix of beads, and it is simply lovely. I will definitely go back!

59.description: this place is ridiculously overpriced. you can find similar stuff for a third the price at caravan beads at lincoln and roscoe. just sayin.

21.description: Beadniks is simply the BEST spot in Chicago (and probably Chicagoland) to not only find unique and beautiful supplies for jewelry making, but also to receive unbelievable support.  My mom is a super talented jewelry maker - all self taught.  Whenever she comes to visit me from Milwaukee we head to Beadniks with the intention of just shopping.  And, we always end up spending a few hours shopping and learning.  Lauryn and her staff are so incredibly sweet.  They are patient and understanding - answering any and all questions we have...even repeating tutorials that haven't yet settled in.  I can't say enough good about the Beadniks team and the Beadniks inventory.  What a blessing it is to have these resources located in such a convenient Chicago neighborhood.

17.description: They have a nice selection of beads etc but the employees are no help at all and they are rude.

10.description: I used to work at a bead shop in 2004-2006. I liked this place overall. There is a lot to choose from, but they don't have a lot of really nice gem strands.  I had a gift card, otherwise, I'm not sure I'd stop in here unless I was really needing something.  The girl behind the counter was helpful.  If you want something pre-made or need assistance, I'm sure they would be happy to help you.  But, for someone who is already seasoned, I think this is not the place for us as we can get findings/materials much cheaper elsewhere.  I would have given them 4 stars... but for someone advanced in jewelry making, I say this is a 3 star.
