5.description: I am an avid jewelry maker and have been to my fair share of bead stores across the countryI was first impressed with how expansive and huge this store was and how much unique items they hadLots of raw stones, wood, metal findings and my most favorite--every finish of chain they had, they also had the coordinating finish in everything-- jump rings, clasps etcAnd they had a lot of unique metal finishes --polished gold and silver, antiqued finishes, very pretty and reasonably pricedI would say they are short on staff for such a large store which was tough at times but I think its because they are so nice and helpful to very inexperienced jewelry makers which I appreciated even though I personally didn't need the help, I think they made the process much more welcoming for new people who just want to give it a whirlI wish I lived closer since I could really do some damage with their frequent buyer discountDefinitely worth the trip out if you want to learn how to make something or want some great inspirationThat's the other thing too, the housemade jewelry (I assume made by employees) was stunning --I was tempted to buy some myselfThey have some really cool stuff that I'm sure would go for 2-3x as much on etsyI'm only knocking one star off because of the INSANE amount of incense they were burning in the store for no apparent reason--really a bad idea and almost forces you to leave the store faster than if you had a welcoming environmentIt was so bad my husband and friend had to leave because they were getting headaches and my friend has asthma and was having trouble breathingI unfortunately pushed past it because I really wanted to grab some unique stuff but they really need to recognize that overly powerful scents can trigger migraines and headaches in people and cause respiratory issues for people

3.description: My friends took me here for a belated birthday gift and all I can say is WOW - for the variety of beads, stones, chains, gold, silver, every quality imaginable and supplies. Everything is so wonderful! My friend brought in a photo from the September Vogue and made the necklace for a fraction of the ridiculous price. Sadly, it was still pricey. If greenbacks were more plentiful and careers more secure, I would recommend Beadniks to every jewelry lover like myself, and would schedule time to make a wardrobe of necklaces, bracelets and earrings at least every month. Until that's a reality, I'll recommend with a slight bit of caution. You'll love your jewelry creation as much as I do mine. But if you're planning on veering on the side of frugality, I would head elsewhere. This place is for serious jewelry and gem lovers!

35.description: We came here with a group for a "girls night out" and had a blast!! The store has a wide selection of everything you need from beads to findings to chain to cords. Excellent selection of materials and lots of pre-made jewelry around the store for inspiration. The two things that were kind of a bummer was the prices and the staff. The prices of the beads was astronomical! Probably at least 5 times what you would pay for beads pretty much anywhere else. However, the findings and other materials were reasonable. There were three girls working the night we went. Two of them were super friendly and helpful, but one girl was completely rude. Allison was really friendly and helpful!! She was so nice to everyone and was great! Another girl with long dark brown hair with big glasses (don't know here name because she didn't introduce herself) was majorly rude and condescending to us on several occasions. I would never ask her for help upon returning. She should rethink her job in customer service. BUT...overall we had a great time and will definitely return!!

19.description: They have so many different kinds of beads it's amazing! First time I went in there I was so wowed by this place. They also have accessory making class. They provide you with the tools you need and they will help you to make what you want to take home. It's a great way for a date, or for a girls hangout. Very reasonable price too.

28.description: I came to Beadniks today to create a necklace with a specific vision in mind. I couldn't have been happier when I found everything I needed to make exactly what I had been looking for. The store had a brilliant selection of beads, stones, chains, and even pre-made jewelry. The associates were super friendly--very patient and helpful as my friends and I were making our selections and ultimately assembling our new pieces. I would definitely recommend Beadniks to friends and plan to come back in the near future.

45.description: Ok. Let me start off by saying that I do enjoy the selection they offer. My friend and I just discovered our knack for making jewelry, and Beadniks has a few things that fit our style. However, the first time I came to Beadniks I didn't exactly understand how the store worked. Why would I? I had never been there. Apparently this made me look stupid because the sales associate rolled her eyes at me when I asked. Aside from that, when I saw the price of a particular item, my natural reaction was to say "oh wow". . Before I could even finish my thought, the associate walked away and started mocking me behind the counter to her coworkers. Really? I've worked in customer service for 10 years. I get it, people can be crazy and at the end of the day you can giggle at customers that you experienced throughout your day. But to do it within earshot of shoppers? Awkward, and insulting.I came back a few days later to talk to the owner about my experience, and just to let her know how I felt. She was very apologetic and open, and although I appreciate her understanding, I will make sure not to say a word when I walk in there for fear of leaving feeling like a lowlife.

33.description: My best friend had her birthday party here on Saturday and it was fabulous. What can be better than making fun jewelry while drinking wine. The staff was great and helpful throughout the whole process of designing the bracelet I made. :) I would absolutely return.

43.description: i love beadniks, and they have a great selection & beautiful shop.  their employees are friendly and very helpful.  but holy cow, please go easier on the incense, phew!

2.description: I give Beadniks 4/5 stars because the selection of beads here is truly exquisite. Genuine crystals of every type and color, varied styles and shapes, high quality findings and materials make it a highly useful source for serious or casual jewelry designers. High quality means high prices here, so be prepared to drop solid coins here. On the flip side, other beads and findings they sell which are not particularly high quality are priced in line with the higher quality items. So, come here for the good stuff only, and find the rest elsewhere; no need to pay a premium for glass here. You can also buy pre-designed items and fine findings such as ruby pendants and diamond-encrusted clasps; it's nice to know where to find such things if you're in the market for them.

18.description: This review is based on my extreme need for a particular bead and the staff at beadniks sense of urgency and customer service. I called ahead to make sure they had what I needed to repair a headband and not only did they have it but they repaired it and charged me nothing for the item and the repair! I offered but they refused and said it was on the house for a new customer! Talk about making your customers happy! I will definitely be using them in the future for all my beading needs :)

41.description: Cool place tons of beads good staff but kind of expensive

52.description: I used to travel further North to a bead shop I had found there until I ran across this local jewel. The locale is perfect being that I live in a nearby neighborhood.Recently, I had my second and third visits to Beadniks. I was helped by a very helpful staffer Wendy. She helped me with everything I could have needed for all my projects and was patient enough to teach me what I felt I should or wanted to know myself! I'd definitely go back. If there is one downside, it would be the pricing...you definitely don't just pay for the pricing of your beads, and the additional couple of bucks may have you wanting to see the itemized printout of what you paid for, but from my experience, this holds true for an make it yourself Jewelry spot..but it's all worth it when you walk out loving what you made and it's all worth while when it becomes the topic of conversation when you're out and about or when someone offers to buy your jewelry right off of you! When I need some new conversation pieces or have a moment I want to commemorate a piece of jewlry for..I'll be at Beadniks..looking for Wendy!

50.description: This place has soooo much stuff! I couldn't even look through all of it.I will definitely return to get a few supplies and make more jewelry.Sisters took me here to make chandelier earrings as part of my bachelorette party. They reserved a spot in the back in which an expert helped us in designing and making our earrings.I came up with a stupid complicated design and the lady not only helped make it a reality, she did the whole thing herself. That was a slight disappointment for me but she was insisting that she wanted me to go home with a nice looking pair. I probably would've been proud with misaligned and crappy looking earrings had I made them (think a kid's crappy scribbled drawing that gets put up on a fridge). However, I do appreciate that she cared that much and that I do have nice earrings to take home.It came out to be a bit pricey for what they were but I will come back for some of their unique supplies.

4.description: I needed a gift for my mom and remembered this place has jewelry for sale. I found gold-colored "leaf" earrings that were very inexpensive and asked the salesperson if they had anything to go with. She said "No, but let me see what we can do." She took another kind of leaf pendant, a garnet-colored stone (January birthstone) and slipped them onto a long chain (so my elderly mother doesn't have to deal with a clasp. It was a great idea, not matchy-matchy, and not expensive but elegant. The salesperson put it together on the spot although she was busy and I offered to come back. She knew her stock, she had a good idea and she made it happen in minutes. I was extremely pleased.There's a ton of materials to choose from in Beadzniks; maybe I should try to make something.

6.description: We came here for a bridal shower and the experience was awesome. Allison helped me make the perfect necklace!

22.description: WARNING! This place is highly addictive! They have the cutest jewelry pieces! They have an eclectic assortment of things and I had to stop myself from picking up everything I wanted. They have a wide range of chains and fabrics to choose from to either make a necklace or bracelets, etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I'm coming back next time I'm out here.

15.description: Beadniks is simply the BEST spot in Chicago (and probably Chicagoland) to not only find unique and beautiful supplies for jewelry making, but also to receive unbelievable support.  My mom is a super talented jewelry maker - all self taught.  Whenever she comes to visit me from Milwaukee we head to Beadniks with the intention of just shopping.  And, we always end up spending a few hours shopping and learning.  Lauryn and her staff are so incredibly sweet.  They are patient and understanding - answering any and all questions we have...even repeating tutorials that haven't yet settled in.  I can't say enough good about the Beadniks team and the Beadniks inventory.  What a blessing it is to have these resources located in such a convenient Chicago neighborhood.

57.description: Stopped by yesterday and was amazed by this wonderful little spot :)They had a great selection of beads including stuff I have not seen anywhere else. I bought some chain, they have a deal going on... buy 5 ft get 1 free. Overall great experience, will be back soon!

20.description: From the moment you walk into this store, you are creatively inspired. Bead nicks is extremely well organized so you do not get too overwhelmed with all of the choices you have available. Each one of the staff members is kind, and willing to help with questions, wire wrap, or even design ideas. There is a big table in the back to sit down , as well as one in the front, so you never feel rushed if you want to stay and learn more. I have taken a couple of classes here, and the projects turned out AMAZING! The class was taught at a perfect pace. My 10 year old daughter and her friend also took a wrap bracelet class here and they loved it! They sat still for the entire 2 hours and both took home adorable bracelets that they are still wearing 2 weeks later!!!

36.description: I have been here a total of 2 times and both times I walked away with beautiful, one of a kind piece of jewelry along with a pleasurable experience.Don't let their huge amount of inventory intimidate you, beginner jewelry maker, there is a great staff who are more than happy to collaborate and build you a fantastic piece.I came in to get one of my favorite necklaces fixed and I didn't see the right chain to match; Allison worked with me and together we came up with the perfect solution. I then decided to make my friend a necklace for her bday with which, Alison helped. It turned out amazing and more importantly for me, very affordable!!Thanks Beadniks! I'll be back for sure, sooner rather than later. That ain't no jive, man. (get it? beatniks say that...ha ha)

14.description: I made a reservation with Beadnik's as one of the first stops for my sister's bachelorette party. She had been here before and always talks about how much fun she had.  I made a reservation for about 7 of us. It was $10 per person plus whatever jewelry you created. For a $10 fee per person I wish the workers would have walked us through the store more and given us more details about different areas of what they had.I honestly felt like it was a waste of $10 and we should have just stopped by to make jewelry as there were a bunch of other people there too.

58.description: I'm giving this place a great rating because it's close to home, our kids love it, and BYOB w/ no corkage fee. Maki-rolls are spot on and consistently fresh. My only issue is smelling like fried tempura after leaving....we've noticed this in multiple sushi restaurants, but definitely here. Very casual atmosphere and service. Great for a BYO wine/cheap-sushi night.

56.description: Great atmosphere, love the BYOB and people watching if you can get a table outside.  The honeybee roll is out of this world

29.description: Favorite sushi restaurant in the chicago area! I am hard pressed to find a restaurant that doesn't douse their spicy tuna rolls in the white devil aka mayonnaise, but cafe sushi does just this!.. Cafe sushi's spicy tuna roll and honey bee roll are perfection!

42.description: This place has stepped up their game since a few years back. The sushi has gotten substantially better. BYOB- awesome and has outside seating.The service is not very goodProps on making better rolls- but if you wanna charge $15 like some of your competition then you should be as good or better and have the same decor and atmosphere.

23.description: Believe all the reviews, I didn't and made the mistake to give it a try. The only thing good here is the fact that it is BYOB. Service is mediocre, it's a decent looking restaurant that is run by staff. Seems though the owner has forgotten it exists.The chef's are probably rejects from other sushi restaurants and thus available for cheap and hired here. The sushi was below quality and taste. It did not even look appealing. The order took over 30mins to arrive we were waiting forever. Tasted greasy, stale and lacked any essence of real sushi.It is sad this place is still running.Spare yourself and don't bother going here.

47.description: just ok sushi...great for BYOB.  Their inside is super boring, outside is great if the weather cooperates.

8.description: Today is Christmas Eve I know a lot place is close . So I choose this restaurant and once I step in the cooking smell and and done the dinner my clothes and hair smells totally like I just working at the kitchen and the food it's average blow and there only one waitress service are below average . The entire bring out I only had one bite I and done with this restaurant . Just not recommend anyone go there . Food and service are below and time take so long .

31.description: This is my go-to sushi place with my girlfriends. The sushi is delicious and so reasonably priced! We always bring a bottle of wine or two and have a great time. It's a small place, especially in the winter when the patio is closed, but we've only had to wait for a table one time for about 10 minutes on a Friday night. It doesn't have the most stunning interior decor, but the service and the prices more than make up for that.

34.description: Cafe sushi. ... This place is too legit to quit like MC Hammer pants. Come here to get some amazing sushi!! Off the chain ya heard.

16.description: I've been twice now, I'm not going to lie the place smells bad, like fishy and a warmness humidifier smell to it as well. The sushi isn't bad though. Despite the smell, the sushi is great, so I guess they've got that going for them.But come on.. they need to get a better ventilation system. Even in the winter when you walk by, you can't see in their restaurant because all their windows are fogged up!!

13.description: I LOVE this place!!! Ordered salmon nigiri, 3 peices, philly with daikon radish added to it.. AMAZING!, and spicy salmon maki comes with avocado and scallions and spicy mayo... Oh man! Perfect sized pieces! I'm so full and so happy and it didn't break the bank! What a diamond in the rough!! I don't understand the bad reviews because I can eat here everyday! My dad had the teriyaki salmon and just short of licked the plate clean. Will def be back whenever I'm anywhere near this place!

11.description: I like this place for the convenience and the BYOB with no cork fee. Service was all young boys who did not seem very interested in being attentive or welcoming. The sushi was okay but the dumplings we had were terrible! Falling apart and over cooked. I think I will only continue to come here for the convenience since it is close to my apartment and the fact that they have a patio with BYOB.

39.description: Solid sushi place.  BYOB.  Great outdoor seating.  Nice people working there.  Honey Bee roll is great.

37.description: I'm surprised by how many people are saying this place has attentive service because my experience did not reflect that at all.  I went with 3 friends before we went to a show at Zanie's down the street.  As far as I could tell, there were 2 servers on staff.  There were many more tables outside (where we were sitting) than inside and maybe they split the sections that way.  It took our server about 20 minutes to even ask if we wanted anything to drink or to take our order.  When our food did come, she never checked on us.  One of our friends arrived a little late but we had ordered for her and she had to wait about 5 minutes for a place setting.  Later on, one of my friends asked for more water when she went in to use the restroom.  Several minutes later, someone came to fill her glass but no one else's even though they were all empty.  She started to walk away and I had to ask her to fill mine.  And even though everything is on a computer, they don't do split checks.As far as the food, it was ok.  Not exceptional.  And it took FOREVER for the food to come out.  A good 30 minutes after we placed the order.  It really wasn't that busy.  Just last week, I had gone with a friend to Wasabi Café in Lincoln Square for their $21 all you can eat sushi.  It was packed and our food came out much faster that night then it had at Sushi Café.  And it's just as good (if not better).I will never go back to this place.  I felt the décor inside was cold and bare.  The service was awful and the food nothing to write home about.  And Old Town is widely considered as a yuppy uptight neighborhood.  I'm a bit surprised this place is doing as well as it is.

0.description: So I used to come here a lot when I lived in the hood...about 10 years ago.  Haven't been in awhile but was going to Zanie's for a show and us girls wanted sushi and BYOB.  Service was super slow as was getting our sushi. But our sushi was really good and fresh. We had a mexican roll, a spider, himachi and avo, sweet potato, and two others.  All were rolled really well and very good.The no corkage was a huge plus.  For three of us it was $75.  Agree with another yelper - Bathroom is HORRIBLE.  Seriously folks - clean that thing.

38.description: The honey bee roll is really good here. Although not sure it's worth 16 bucks. I believe the rest of the sushi is just average. I like how it's BYOB though and they have a nice outdoor patio on Wells St. It's one of the less crowded places in Old Town which is nice for a relaxing evening.

51.description: Delivery was fast and the food was great.  We ordered a couple of the different specialty rolls, several pieces of nigiri and potstickers.  The sushi was fresh, rolls were very tasty, and the potstickers some of the better I've had in a while!I have to say, I was a little nervous ordering sushi delivery...but this place did it right, all at a reasonable price.  I will be a repeat customer.

27.description: BYOB, no corkage fee, and mostly good sushi. I've had a few rolls that were just okay, but I've been enough times now to know what I like there! The best rolls are the Philly and Mexican roll. Last time, my edamame was a little over done and too soggy, but that's not enough to keep me from coming back and ordering again. Good prices too - two of us had edamame, each a cup of miso soup, and three rolls for about $30.

32.description: The sushi here is good, but the service is disappointing. Very unaccommodating and unfriendly. Not a good place for groups of 4 or more.  They will not allow you to book reservations for larger parties, which is disappointing.

54.description: The only reason this isn't a 5 is because I've had better sushi. It's still fresh but I've had more inventive sushi. The service is amazing. Amazing. Amazing. And it's BYOB.  Way better than any wait service I've had in a while. It's a huge relief. I had a great time thanks to the waiter.

48.description: Love the sushi here. My favorite is the Mexican roll. Awesome that it's BYOB. Tends to get crowded on Thurs-Sat nights.

44.description: I was heading to watch a show at Second City and decided to grab some sushi that was nearby. We ended up at Cafe Sushi and were pleased with interesting rolls at decent prices. My friend Brie and I shared 4 rolls, 2 of which were small rolls and 2 of whichever were large rolls. The portion sizes were decent and all the ingredients were fresh and flavorful. We got a rainbow, dragon, spicy tuna, and Mexican maki roll. The first 3 were solid standards and the last one was new to us. The yellowtail in the Mexican maki roll was pretty mild but I loved the fresh kick of cilantro. In addition to the tasty sushi, customer service was pretty decent. Our waitress seemed to be training a newbie so service was a little slower than usual, but still good!

24.description: BYO.  Had mxied service experiences over a couple different times.  The simple sushi is decent, the more complex specialty rolls were mediocre and mushy.

7.description: Worst. Service. Ever. If you enjoy being ignored for thirty minute stretches, this is the place for you!I was there an hour and a half total, and did not get offered a single refill on my water!Waited a full hour for my sushi (I had a timer running for the parking meter), and I seriously have to question if the tuna was sushi grade. All wrong.

49.description: Some of the most fresh and tasty sushi in town! Its nice and quiet with a great patio. Plus BYOB always makes dinner easier on the wallet...although the menu prices are great! I have been back 3 times in 2 weeks! The staff is very sweet and attentive. Highly recommend it!

40.description: Probably one of my favorite sushi places in the city. It was once kind of a hidden gem, but now it gets pretty crowded on Fridays and Saturdays.  I would definitely recommend the Honey Roll!!  Definitely sushi worth trying. Don't forget BYOB!

53.description: - BYOB. - Slow service. Was pretty busy on a Friday night though. Took awhile for everything: water, wine opener, & check! Food came out in a timely manner though.- Decent sushi. Snow White roll was ok, kind of plain. Not enough crunch as advertised. Strawberry roll was really good. So many flavors and the fruit gives it that nice edge. Salmon, white tuna, and eel sashimi were fresh but not the best.- Cheap prices. BYOB helps but regardless, $50 date night isn't bad.

30.description: The sushi was really just ok. I actually think it was a little overpriced too. However, the restaurant is BYOB with no corkage fee which was great. Remember to ask for a bucket of ice to chill your wine. They are very accommodating. I don't think I will be back unless I am in the area and it is super convenient. There isn't much ambiance, and like I said, the sushi  is nothing to write home about. There are plenty of BYOB sushi places in the city to try before coming back to this place frankly.

46.description: Loved the cozy feel of this place. Nice server. Byob is always a super plus! Tried the dumpling appetizer, Snow White roll, sweet potato tempura roll, Mexican maki, and spicy tuna maki. No complaints. Food was good. I feel I'm reaching a point in my sushi eating career that I'm comfortable ordering and eating. Tonight's meal felt a bit like any other sushi experience I have had. That's not a bad thing. Food was good. No wow factor. Just good. Again, not a bad thing.

1.description: I struggle to review this place due to fact that it didn't seem like anything awesome to write about and nothing bad happened either. We decided to give it a shot since it is in the neighborhood and it was a beautiful Wed evening.The good or ok:- BYOB with no corkage fee and you can get an ice bucket too. - they have outdoor seating which is 1st come 1st serve...maybe 6 tables?- Mexican roll and the Viagra rolls was decent. I'd order again- Service was friendly- the place has moderate décor but not fancy or pretentious.The "eh" or bad or "could be better":- it took a while to get our 4 rolls when it was not busy at all. we were the 1 of 2 tables on the inside- the rolls were just okay...maybe just a small step above grocery store sushi. the rice was slightly dry?- the spider roll was meh...too much eel sauce.I really won't go out of the way to come here...but I can still see myself dining here again since it is near me.

55.description: The food was amazinggggg!!! Best sushi I've had in a while. However when we walked in no one greeted us, we sat ourself, and we had to wait about 10 mins til he took our order. It was worth the wait definitely but if they step up their customer service it would be a 5 star.

9.description: The sushi was really just ok. I actually think it was a little overpriced too. However, the restaurant is BYOB with no corkage fee which was great. Remember to ask for a bucket of ice to chill your wine. They are very accommodating. I don't think I will be back unless I am in the area and it is super convenient. There isn't much ambiance, and like I said, the sushi  is nothing to write home about. There are plenty of BYOB sushi places in the city to try before coming back to this place frankly.

26.description: This is my go-to sushi place in the Old Town neighborhood. It's nothing fancy, but the quality of the sushi is fantastic. All items are reasonably priced (which you cannot say for many sushi restaurants) and they change the menu and add new rolls frequently. Also, it's BYOB and no corkage fee- which is awesome!

25.description: I struggle to review this place due to fact that it didn't seem like anything awesome to write about and nothing bad happened either. We decided to give it a shot since it is in the neighborhood and it was a beautiful Wed evening.The good or ok:- BYOB with no corkage fee and you can get an ice bucket too. - they have outdoor seating which is 1st come 1st serve...maybe 6 tables?- Mexican roll and the Viagra rolls was decent. I'd order again- Service was friendly- the place has moderate décor but not fancy or pretentious.The "eh" or bad or "could be better":- it took a while to get our 4 rolls when it was not busy at all. we were the 1 of 2 tables on the inside- the rolls were just okay...maybe just a small step above grocery store sushi. the rice was slightly dry?- the spider roll was meh...too much eel sauce.I really won't go out of the way to come here...but I can still see myself dining here again since it is near me.

12.description: My husband and I checked out Cafe Sushi in Old Town tonight and the sushi was just "ok". We were disappointed that it took 45 minutes to get our food!!! Very slow service as we arrived a little before 7pm and there were only 3 other tables full at the time. I ordered yellowtail nigiri and their specialty "Hawaiian" roll. My husband ordered the philly, salmon tempura, and miami roll. All of these rolls were tasty but not great. The place itself looks great on the inside, nice decor and ambience. Overall, we are not impressed and would not recommend for sushi lovers.

59.description: I kind of hesitated writing about Cafe Sushi, since I don't want the secret to get out. But here goes.This place is perfect. The servers are all incredibly sweet and attentive, it's BYOB with no corkage fee and the sushi can't be beat. (Try the Honey Bee and the Snow White. Both are phenomenal.) It's a great place for an evening with friends, since it's delicious and intimate. Plus, I've never had to wait longer than 2 minutes, and I regularly come on weekend nights. I seriously wish I could give it more than 5 stars!

21.description: I like this place for the convenience and the BYOB with no cork fee. Service was all young boys who did not seem very interested in being attentive or welcoming. The sushi was okay but the dumplings we had were terrible! Falling apart and over cooked. I think I will only continue to come here for the convenience since it is close to my apartment and the fact that they have a patio with BYOB.

17.description: Overall, the sushi is pretty mediocre. There are interesting rolls on the menu, but not executed very well. The inside of the restaurant looks a bit dated. On the plus side, the prices are cheap and there is a great patio with a spectacular view of the city.

10.description: The food here is good. But unfortunately, the service is terrible (hence the one star). We wanted a Friday night reservation. My friend called on her lunch break, and they said they didn't make reservations, but to call again 15 minutes before we came. When we called again when we were on your way, they told us they "didn't do that." Whatever that means. So we waited at least 15 minutes. When we sat down at our table, we told our waiter immediately that a member of our party had a sulfa allergy and could not have imitation crab. The waiter said he would either let us know if the rolls we ordered had imitation crab, or sub it out for regular crab. He told us there were no issues with our order. However, when we got our rolls, my friend with the allergy was smart enough to double check. The food runner told us in fact one of the rolls did have imitation crab, and we could keep it and sub it for another roll. We asked our waiter to sub us another roll, he still charged us for the one with sulfa. We asked to speak to the manager, who said he would take half off a roll, but never did. Terrible service. If my friend hadn't been smart enough to double check, she would be in the hospital. The service shouldn't promise to comp things and then not follow through. Very rude overall. Will not be coming back, ever, and will not recommend to anyone.

5.description: My favorite sushi place in Chicago! It's BYOB and all of the sushi always taste fresh! Must order the Honey Bee roll!

3.description: BYOB is always a perk to any sushi joint.Avoid the bathroom at all costs if you can...definitely disgusting.Food was mediocore to average and service was super slow.  Overall there are plenty of other spots to enjoy a bite of sushi in the city and I wouldn't recommend this spot.

35.description: BYOB and no corkage fee, this place is great! But seriously their sushi is wonderful. I'm relatively new to the world sushi. Not great with chopsticks and at one point I just picked the food up with my hands, probably a faux pas but hey the rolls were good and I was struggling to keep them intact with the chopsticks. Fortunately my friends were more amused than annoyed with manners.We ordered the edamame and I think I am one of few people who are not a fan of it. I didn't care for the stringy outside line bordering the pod. Not sure how else to describe it but it actually got caught going down my throat. My friends on the other hand, loved it. I did enjoy my rainbow roll and tuna roll. The prices were a lot cheaper than expected. Our server checked in on us regularly. Overall, an enjoyable dining experience and I plan to go back.

19.description: This review is only for one item on the menu, I got the "Tuna Teriyaki" Entree, which was $19.99.The fish was dry and excessive doused in sauce. It tasted about as good as a TV dinner. I get better quality food at a grocery store hot food bar for $7 than what I just consumed last night.Like, seriously, it was bad. I advise the ownership to seriously improve it, or just remove the item from the menu. I was there with a friend, and she ordered the sushi and seemed to enjoy it. But don't get the entrees. Absolutely brutal.

28.description: I've been twice now, I'm not going to lie the place smells bad, like fishy and a warmness humidifier smell to it as well. The sushi isn't bad though. Despite the smell, the sushi is great, so I guess they've got that going for them.But come on.. they need to get a better ventilation system. Even in the winter when you walk by, you can't see in their restaurant because all their windows are fogged up!!

45.description: Stopped in here before a no food Yelp event last night.  I really like how cute this place is.  Is it ok to call a sushi restaurant cute?  I hope so.Our server was super sweet and I was only mildly embarrassed when I realized that they do not take Discover card.  The gyoza was really good.  In fact, one of my favorites.  The sushi was all just ok.  I liked the sweet potato tempura roll the best...and I don't think a sushi restaurant wants that to be the case.I had high hopes for the snow white and the mexican but they were not as flavorful as they sounded.  I was expecting some serious heat from the mexican roll and what I got was a luke warm bath.  Sorry, that sounds gross.  It tall tasted good but no wow factor.I think I'll come back to try some different rolls, maybe I just didn't know what to order.

33.description: This review is only for one item on the menu, I got the "Tuna Teriyaki" Entree, which was $19.99.The fish was dry and excessive doused in sauce. It tasted about as good as a TV dinner. I get better quality food at a grocery store hot food bar for $7 than what I just consumed last night.Like, seriously, it was bad. I advise the ownership to seriously improve it, or just remove the item from the menu. I was there with a friend, and she ordered the sushi and seemed to enjoy it. But don't get the entrees. Absolutely brutal.

43.description: Great inexpensive BYOB sushi spot in the area. Just a heads up: no hard liquor allowed. The maki rolls and sashimi are fresh. I'm addicted to their Mexican maki. I could those every day. Not the best sushi I've ever had, but you get what you pay for. Make sure you make a reservation. The place is always packed.

2.description: The good thing about the place is its BYOB. Very slow service nothing extraordinary about the sushi.

18.description: I ordered take out entrée Makimono Karai. (spicy tuna, spicy salmon & crab roll).......  Somewhat disappointed. The rice is too dry and miss the sweetness of the vinegar taste. Too spicy on tuna roll. Two stars will fit this restaurant.

41.description: Service is abysmally poor. Called in a takeout order last night, arrived a half hour later as advised to pick it up--they hadn't even started to prep my order yet. Sushi is gas station quality at best. I watched the chefs remove the pre-sliced fish from a giant, non-refrigerated Tupperware bin on the floor. Good sushi is not supposed to smell or taste so fishy.

52.description: this place is the best and that's all there is to it.outdoor seating. amazing sushi. BYOB. order the honeybee, caterpillar, rainbow, mango habanero, kiwi strawberry, orange, & mexican. everything is fresh and the rolls aren't super massive/loaded with rice. go forth and be in sushi heaven, my friends.and say hi to Jong for me.

50.description: One of my favorite BYOB go to neighborhood spots. They have good sushi, service is ok, it has a very laid back vibe. Great place to get together with friends to catch up without feeling rushed. Fridays are always crowded, so be prepared to wait. They also deliver in the neighborhood which is a plus, if you don't feel like venturing out but want your sushi fix. The Honey Bee and Mango Habanero are two of my favorite specialty rolls.

4.description: BYOB and no corkage fee, this place is great! But seriously their sushi is wonderful. I'm relatively new to the world sushi. Not great with chopsticks and at one point I just picked the food up with my hands, probably a faux pas but hey the rolls were good and I was struggling to keep them intact with the chopsticks. Fortunately my friends were more amused than annoyed with manners.We ordered the edamame and I think I am one of few people who are not a fan of it. I didn't care for the stringy outside line bordering the pod. Not sure how else to describe it but it actually got caught going down my throat. My friends on the other hand, loved it. I did enjoy my rainbow roll and tuna roll. The prices were a lot cheaper than expected. Our server checked in on us regularly. Overall, an enjoyable dining experience and I plan to go back.

6.description: The service here is slower than the slowest slow. Do NOT come here starving, and make sure to bring extra wine (they have a BYOB policy, no cork fee) to make the waiting easier. Don't shy away from ordering the Honey Bee - it sounds weird, but is completely amazing. Basically, this roll keeps me coming back. The rest of the sushi is great too, but that Honey Bee... it's something else. Grab a spot on the patio if you can!

22.description: The "Con's" far outweigh any "Pro's" (patio, BYOB) at this 3rd-rate sushi joint. This is one of those sushi restaurants where they blatantly scam you. Avoid it.1st I ordered the Viagra Maki Roll which was supposed to contain: "salmon, tuna, scallop, red snapper, squid, tako, shrimp, masago and avocado."  But surprise!, it arrived full of FAKE krab stick, mostly. When I asked for it to be re-made, it was still missing a couple ingredients!!!  BTW, this is also one of these disreputable places where they don't list fake crabmeat as "Surimi", "Krab", or "imitation." It is listed on their menu as "Kani Kana" with an accompanying translation of "crab" with a "c", which is illegal in many states, as when I pressed the waiter, he told me it was fake "krab."2nd I ordered the Snow White Roll which had the smallest shrimp tempura inside I've ever seen and it wasn't even served with the tail. It was covered with "Super white tuna", which the English-speaking Japanese waiter couldn't confirm that it was ACTUAL Tuna! (It is often a "marketing term" for Escolar, but this didn't even taste like that fish). For $15, this roll was tiny and completely flavorless.

15.description: I'm not sure where to begin as there is nothing bad to say but neither is there anything good to say.  Cafe Sushi was eh.  An underwhelming experience.  Not delicious.  Just okay.  I definitely do not recommend the Red Dragon.  There was something weird about the flavors and the different textures - they just didn't work well together in my opinion.On the plus side, we had a great seat by the window on a blustery fall evening and decent service.  And I really like that Café Sushi is BYOB and there is no corkage free.  Plus, you get an ice bucket.

57.description: Indulge your inner sushi snob!Okay, let me clarify -- I don't mean 'snob' in the way that you may be thinking. It's not that I gravitate towards high-quality sushi (or would even be able to tell you what would be considered quality sushi as opposed to not) -- but I seem to have an unfortunate knack for liking 'special' things. For example, after finally expanding my seafood horizons to include crab legs -- I immediately took a liking to King Crab -- and an even more immediate *dis*liking to those other crab legs (see, I dislike them so much I can't even remember what they're called). Little did I know that I was setting myself up for disappointment, as King Crab is a rarity unless you're willing to shell out bigger bucks. Another testament to this is my unintentional tuna prejudice. And this segues nicely into the focus of this review...I'm fairly new to the sushi world. Until maybe a year or so ago, I was the girl at the AYCE sushi spot trying to get her $$$ worth by filling up on gyoza, miso soup, chicken yakitori, and whatever random non-sushi items included on the menu (one can only have so many mandarin orange slices). I then graduated to rolls -- so long as they were cooked. This still left me somewhat restricted, as beyond the shrimp tempura roll and unagi -- there wasn't too much that I could really order. Wanting to be a bit more adventurous, I set out to try raw sushi. Now, a gigantic piece of raw tuna probably wasn't the way to ease into it, but that's what I went with -- and I nearly lost my lunch. True story. It took me a good minute to swallow -- and it only went down because I chased it with a giant gulp of water. Ugh. "Never again!" I exclaimed.  And so for awhile, I played it safe with my trusty shrimp tempura rolls. And then entered the super white tuna (cue heavenly music). Now THIS was a piece of raw tuna I could delight in. So light...not overly fishy...melts in your mouth...mmm. I had found my go-to sushi.But wait...super white tuna isn't on every sushi menu?! Especially not most AYCE sushi menus? What's a girl to do? Go to Café Sushi, that's what! Their menu boasts not one, but at least 3 options made with the elusive pale fishy! Super white tuna lovers rejoice!We started with the much talked-about 'Honey Bee' roll. White tuna, avocado and cucumber, topped with tempura crunch -- and drizzled with honey! Very unexpected, but oh-so-delicious! The honey had a way of tying all the other flavors together, without being in-your-face sweet. But my true Love -- The 'Snow White' roll. I have to pause for a moment before I continue, as I get a bit overwhelmed just thinking about it. Avocado and shrimp tempura inside -- topped with super white tuna and the prettiest red tobiko. It was perfection on a plate! On presentation alone, this roll was already a winner. And then I put it in my mouth. Total. Food Porn. Moment. Mmmmmmm. And actually, super white tuna aside -- EVERYTHING we had was amazing. The 'Mango Habanero' was a delightful blend of sweet and spicy, while the 'Hawaiian Maki' was a nice take on a warm sushi roll.  And if you really want to spice up your night -- the 'Mexican Maki' (with jalapeno!) won't disappoint!And bonus -- this is a BYOB joint! Another bonus? No corkage fee! Just be sure to bring an adequate beverage supply to last you through dinner, as with all the must-try options on Café Sushi's menu -- you may be there awhile!

20.description: Great sushi, the worst service. You wait forever and the waiters aren't attentive but the sushi is worth it, so if you're willing to wait forever and don't want good service but love sushi, then come here

36.description: fish not so fresh. old oil used on the fried foods

14.description: Believe all the reviews, I didn't and made the mistake to give it a try. The only thing good here is the fact that it is BYOB. Service is mediocre, it's a decent looking restaurant that is run by staff. Seems though the owner has forgotten it exists.The chef's are probably rejects from other sushi restaurants and thus available for cheap and hired here. The sushi was below quality and taste. It did not even look appealing. The order took over 30mins to arrive we were waiting forever. Tasted greasy, stale and lacked any essence of real sushi.It is sad this place is still running.Spare yourself and don't bother going here.

58.description: Was pretty happy when this place opened up around the corner from us.  Its really cool as it's a restaurant inside an old house. It will be really quite large once the back area is complete where it looks like it will be more of a standing bar area, with the restaurant up front. We came here on a Saturday night and although it was busy, we were able to walk in and grab a table for two pretty easily. Service was good, particularly for a new place. They hand you 4 different menus - drinks menu (with huge beer selection.. only one cider that I could see which I had ($11 tho!))...a few more would add nicely to the large beer list), smaller plates, entrées and specials.I got the blackened fish of the day which was yummy with a good amount of spice (a little more mashed potatoes on the side wouldn't hurt - but then again I'm addicted to the stuff). My bf got one of the burgers with pork belly which he said was up there with the burgers he's tried so far in Chi. The food preso is home style, but for $13 for an entrée that's about what you expect. They also have a heap of TVs with different sport playing so you'll be able to find the game you're after (I wonder if they'll ever play AFL aka Aussie footy?! hehe) All in all a great neighborly spot which I feel you could just hang out in for a while and enjoy the night away.

56.description: Service - 5 Stars - They doted on us, making sure we sampled different whiskeys before choosing the one we wanted. They quickly replaced the app that we didn't like. Fun, friendly, and fast.Food - 4 Stars - Really 3.5, but that is not an option. Poutine is flavorful with a substantial portion. The sliders were small, but tasty. This place does pork well. The Mac and cheese needs help. It's like a soupy pile of boxed macaroni with no flavor. We sent ours back.Environment - 3 Stars - A little loud, but lively. The front door needs a cover to keep the cold out. The decor needs a little more character. It's a bit sparse. Good people watching. The long, narrow space feels cozy. Nice bathroom!Location - 5 Stars - Steps away from the Brown line, and surrounded by many other bars and restaurants. This place needs to work out the kinks, but will probably end up being a nice neighborhood spot.

29.description: Great times. Good service. Even when busy they make you feel welcome. Nick is a great bartender and very knowledgeable.

42.description: I was excited to see Sedgwick Stop pop up in the neighborhood and tried it out last night. The ambiance was really nice--beautiful wood bar, chill yet welcoming environment. The only complaint I have was around the burgers. My husband and I both ordered one at medium rare and medium. They came out well done, if not overcooked. If they can get the burgers right, we'll be loyal patrons!

23.description: A friend and I enjoyed their signature Stockyard Melt, a sandwich with braised beef, caramelized onions and cheese on grilled marble rye bread, accompanied by sweet potato fries.  It was absolutely delicious.  We can't comment on service--only four other people were in the place--but our food came quickly enough and overall attention was prompt and personalized.  I suspect the owner waited on us.  He was very solicitous, suggesting that we might want to split a sandwich since they are substantial, and giving us tastes of beers and wines available by the glass.   Other items on the menu looked very appealing.  I will definitely return on my next visit to Chicago.

47.description: Full disclosure: the owner is a friend of mine. That said, I'm a big fan of the Sedgwick Stop. Good food, great atmosphere, excellent beer selection. My girlfriend planned a surprise 50th birthday party for me there. Hillary and Bruce were awesome getting everything set up and making sure everyone was taken care of. We're moving to the neighborhood soon, so we'll be regulars!

8.description: This place is a gem! I hope Jay is your bartender as he is the best! Very funny interesting guy.  we weakness from the Gold Coast which was about 25 minutes but totally worth it. Beautiful neighborhoods and people along the way. As for the bar, it's very nice and clean with tv's and cool bare ware. Highly recommend.

31.description: Great neighborhood spot. Service could be a bit improved as both times I've been there I've had to wait a while to get asked for my drink order. The sandwiches are delicious on their menu - can't wait until they roll out more brunch options!Tons of beer options and HALF OFF WINES on Wednesday!

34.description: The food was okay, but the experience was marred by the poor service. We arrived for lunch on Sunday- there were a couple customers at the bar while a group of women behind us finished paying, so there were really only a few tables our server had to tend to. After not bringing over enough menus, he then made a remark along the lines of "What, you thought I l left you out because you're black?, which was incredibly out of line. Past that, it took ten minutes for him to take our order, and another thirty for us to get one appetizer. One couple came in, and after waiting for fifteen minutes for anyone to come over and at least say hello, left. On to the food- the smoked gouda mac and cheese was really good, and my BBQ bacon burger was okay. The tempura fried bacon was disappointing, especially because the deep fried batter took away from the taste of the bacon, but it was a well cooked burger. At the end of the meal when we asked for separate checks, our server was visibly irritated by it- that's the first time that's ever happened to me in any restaurant. I probably won't come back unless I'm in the neighborhood, and even then, I'll think twice before I say yes.

16.description: I recently joined my friends who frequently dine here and they recommended we all go here because they have had good experiences here before. Our waitress was very nice and the service was good. I had the friend cauliflower buffalo sauce appetizer which was just ok and a raspberry beer which again was just ok as well. The issue came when we were closing our tabs. We all were closing our tabs when the manager confronted our group and asked to check IDs because only 21+ are allowed past a certain time, so that's fine. We all are in our mid-late twenties so there was no issue however the manager was VERY rude to us when asking for IDs and was claiming that someone was not 21 even though we all just showed them proof. It came off a little rude and made it awkward but I understand she was trying to do her job and make sure we weren't underage. So a girl in our group pulled the manager aside to let just let her know that the way she asked us was rude and for regularly attending customers, she didn't appreciate the way she made us feel, which was not welcomed. Instead of the manager taking responsibility and apologizing for thinking we were underage, the manager argued with my friend and got our waitress involved stating that we were trying to blow off our waitress by not showing her our IDs. She also made claims that we are supposed to leave within 10 minutes of closing our tabs. I understand, the business of a restaurant is to turn tables over to make money but when your customer is still finishing their drinks, they are not going to just leave (and especially when the whole place is empty so there's not a line of people waiting). This was such a stupid experience and I hate to be explaining this but all in all, I work in the service industry and the way the manager conducted herself and made our whole group feel terrible after we just dined there is NOT the way to treat customers. Instead of simply apologizing and taking ownership she argued and made other excuses for why she took the tone with us. This poor review is solely based on the management and the wait staff as our waitress did not defend us and lied to her manager to probably save her job. I HOPE the owners read this and look into who is running their bar and think about changing the way this manager conducts herself because she is driving away business. I will not be coming back to this place along with the rest of our group. I know a lot of people in the area and I will not be recommending this place from now on unless management changes. I do not know the relationship of the manager to the establishment but I hope someone holds her accountable.

13.description: We tried out the beer and whiskey flights and appetizers with the aid of a Groupon (mentioned upfront) on a quiet Sunday afternoon and received some of the best service, drinks, and bites we've had in the city.The server, who had, in all, about 7 tables to wait, was definitively gracious with advice and patient in assisting us in navigating the beverage choices which were modest in number yet impressive in quality.  The local craft beers were well-selected and the whiskey pours were more than generous.  Casual in atmosphere, the SS is tastefully-appointed while not being more than it promises: a local bar with good eats.Upon ordering our apps, the waiter took care to mention that the chef was experimenting with a few off-menu dishes, including some amazing shrimp salad-topped brioche triangles which were immaculately savory, filling, and in a word: divine.  We followed up with some fried pickles, slowly made our way through our drinks and left with tummies full and happy.  The fare at Sedgwick Shop is more than just bar food yet unpretentious all while generous and tasty, delivered with personable and genuine service.  What's not to love? 5 stars.

11.description: This place has been in my neighborhood for a while so I decided to try it with my friend (who also lives close and comes often). I had Bloody Mary, chicken sandwich, and beers (which happened to be on special for happy hour). I really didn't know what to expect, but surprisingly everything was very good. I loved my sandwich and the Bloody Mary was decent too. Prices are pretty average for Chicago, service was friendly, and I'll definitely be back.

39.description: Went here on a game night so it was rather crowded. Service was pretty slow but the wait staff was friendly.  The thing that turned me off was the owner of the bar- very rude and very drunk. Won't be going back.

37.description: Awful - some of the worst service I've experienced in a long time.  They weren't even that busy compared to other bars in the neighborhood, and they really couldn't handle a somewhat full space.  After asking for a table to be cleared and sitting for quite some time, we resorted to getting our own menus.  We then ordered our drinks twice (not sure what happened to our first order) and waited way too long for beers to arrive.  Once we finally got food, it was just okay.  Nothing special, and not worth the tab.  I'll stick to the Wells Street bars next time I'm out in Old Town.

0.description: My foodie friend and I decided to visit Chicago and explore the food scene. I stumbled upon a Groupon for this place and the menu instantly called our attention. Great flight selection. You can choose from beer, wine or whiskey. The beer flights are a great deal considering the quantity you get.The food was phenomenal! Their shrimp and grits was one of the most amazing things we've ever tried! Creamy, chest grits with Gouda cheese, tired with sauteed onions, mushrooms, shrimp and bacon. It was to die for! The hangover poutine with pork belly and scallions was a terrific appetizer and their tomato soup was delicious and creamy. Service was great, server (Alina, if I remember correctly) was extremely attentive. I will definitely be visiting again on my next trip to Chicago!

38.description: Fun place. Good atmosphere. But 9 bucks for a can of cider? Get over yourself, almost dive bar.

51.description: Celebrating my birthday lunch. Food is so good!! Mac and cheese, grown up style! Salad, sandwich (mozzarella, basil, tomatoes, pesto), carrot cake, fries (great, big salt!), wine. All perfectly wonderful. Will definitely be back very soon!! So glad to have discovered this little place!!

27.description: This place fits perfectly into the Old Town neighborhood. Just like the people the food appears to be really glamorous but it's underwhelming at best. On top of the shit food it's overpriced. The renovations scream some yuppie dick wad owner skimped on the important "bones" of the rehab for the gaudy bar. The other patrons at lunch must have lived on the block and shared a condo building with the bartender - rude and pretentious. The best scenario for this place is for the Brown Line to derail and take the Sedgwick Stop out in its course of destruction along with a few of the rude neighborhood patrons and staff.

32.description: Let me start out with I USED to love this place (management are you READING this??)I've been here around 10 times over the past 6 months. The beer selection was great and the food was outstanding. Service has always been a bit of an issue (they don't deal with busy times well). I was here for a couple of world cup games and the service definitely suffered.That said the food was so good I got over it. Fast forward to today....our food was a very simple order, two orders of chicken fingers and an order of fries. First off the food took an eternity. I seriously finished two beers in the time it took to cook our food. Dude are you killing the chicken back there??? To top it off they were NOT busy. There was ONE other table in the entire place. When the food arrived I was HORRIBLY dissapointed. Mind you I've eaten this exact thing before so I was expecting what I had received all of the other times I'd ordered this, 5 good sized, juicy, spicy chicken fingers. Not so much. What arrives is three tiny chicken fingers on a plate(for $8 no less, sides are extra people), and our "side" order of fries was about the same as a Mcdonald's child size order of fries on a tiny plate. Is there a potato shortage I haven't read about? Aside from the tiny portions the chicken fingers were way overcooked. So dry you had to drowned them in ranch to choke them down, and the ends were hard like they were either freezer burned or had been refried.Staff said the old chef left, I'd met him as when it was slower he'd walk around and see how everything was. This new guy walked by us about 5 times and never said boo even though it was totally dead. He must not have wanted to hear that he doesn't even know how to fry a chicken finger. Hell I can do that.I'd love to know where  the old chef went to work so I can eat there. I certainly won't be back here. There are way better places in the hood to spend my money. What a shame, so much potential.

54.description: Been here twice. I live in the neighborhood. First off, respect to the white bartender with the Jheri curl, hence the two stars. Second, I just spent OVER $41 dollars on a beer and a shot for myself and my friend... You tell me, right or wrong? We decided to leave when we determined that if we spent $300 we'd still pass a sobriety test. In conclusion, "gastropub" is just a shamwow saying for "we're gonna put our hands in your pockets." Sorry, but you're just a corner bar.

48.description: Very impressed!  Came into town to visit friends for St. Patrick's Day and found this neighborhood bar-restaurant.  The Blue Cheese Mac n Cheese is to die for!  Sliders are spicy.  Great selection of beers and whiskey.  I am officially stuffed!  They had live music tonight.  Beautiful old period bar from the 1920's.   I had such a great time with my friends.  Definitely coming back any time I am in town.

44.description: This place is fantastic!!!! Great beer, Whisky & wine selections!!! Delicious food, great service and awesome owners! Def a place to bring your friends and have a good time. I been to a trivia night on a Sunday and it was so much fun!!! Can't wait for the patio to open, great job Sedgwick stop!!!!

24.description: Great place. Not in my hood, but always solid when I'm around. Very respectable bourbon selection and food is better than average. Owner behind bar?  Good guy for sure.  Worth the trip.

7.description: This place has a really nice casual and comfortable vibe to it. Brought a friend to use a groupon here for a beer, wine, or whiskey flight and appetizer. Because it's only for 1 flight and a shared app, I'm not sure why the groupon requires two people, and it's awkward to share a flight of anything, but that was really my only complaint. My friend and I weren't in the mood to drink much anyway, so the red wine flight providing four tastings, giving us 2 tastings each worked out. The wines weren't my favorite, but I'm no connoisseur and drank them anyway.For our app, we ordered the mushroom and goat cheese quesadilla and were told it was small, so we ordered the plain chicken tenders as well. The quesadilla was quite flavorful and goat cheesy, which I love, and the chicken tenders were crisp and well-seasoned. Our server was friendly and attentive and the crowd seemed fun and easygoing, early on a Friday night. I would definitely come back.

49.description: The half price bottles of wine on Wednesdays is fabulous!  We only ordered the guacamole as a snack.  Chips very good - could have bought a guacamole and sliced it up was their recipe - needs major improvement or a how to make guacamole class.

40.description: My husband and I stopped in for a quick beer and snack, and overall our experience was great. We had the baked Brie, which was nice, and the bar tender was very attentive and quick, especially considering that he was the only front of house employee (as far as I could tell). So I was happy with our snack and didn't think anything else of it: until I got home and checked my e-mail. I had an email waiting for me from the bar as if I was on some mailing list. I absolutely did not give out my email address to them (I never give out my email information). I was using my phone while I was there so possibly they have some way of getting my email address from that...? But although I was using my phone, I did not log onto their wireless. So I really can't fathom how they got my email address. In any case, I was pretty annoyed that they somehow sneakily got my email address and added me to a mailing list. Feels like an invasion of privacy. Furthermore, if they're able to lift my email address off my phone, what other private information can they see? Very disturbing and I've never seen or heard of anything like this before.

53.description: I've been here a handful of times and always leave happy. They have an extensive craft beer and wine list with just about anything imaginable. The food is fantastic, too. The wings are huge and all of the sandwiches are great. It's definitely not the cheapest place but you get what you pay for. Everything is very good quality.

30.description: I almost didn't go inside after reading all of the negative comments about service, but I gave it a shot, only to receive some of the most attentive service I have had in an Old Town pub.  It was 7pm on a Thursday night, NFL on the TVs, shows at zanies and second city, so the hood was full.  This was a great alternate to fighting through the Welles street overpriced "gastro"pubs.  The menu is a little small but varied.  Their ham and turkey sandwiches appear to be deli meat with other homemade ingredients so I would probably avoid those.  Normally, if I never eat one more side of French fries, I would be confused but not sad about it.  However, their seasoned fries actually make me want to go back. It's subjective but I can't stop thinking about them.  I think this is a true hidden gem considering the location.

46.description: Nice friendly place with good food and beer selections. Service was excellent and we were there on Super Bowl Sunday! They even had a chilli competition going.

1.description: This place is definitely a dive bar, but the food was great, the whiskey flight fun, and the service good. It was pretty quiet the night we went, but we preferred that.We ordered the poutine and, while I wouldn't call it a poutine in the traditional sense, it was still extremely delicious and very filling. One order easily fills up two people and as an app could be good for 4 - 6 people. The whiskey flight was fun; I have no whiskey experience so I can't speak to quality, but we enjoyed it and are server was nice and explained the different ones. Overall, not a bad place to start out your night with a cheap app and some whiskey.

55.description: Wow! We'll! That was unexpected! Awesome food at a Bar! I had the pork chop special with perfect mashed potatoes and spinach! Delicious! Terri my waitress was Okay. A little more interested in her iPhone and TV than me but whatever. Highly recommend this new addition to the neighborhood!

9.description: Popped in for a quick drink as part of the chicago craft beer week on may 21. they had sweetwater brewery beers on tap, it was cool and quiet, got served quickly, i was barely there so i cant fully review it i feel, but it was not packed and has a good location by the brown line, id be up to go back

26.description: We tried out the beer and whiskey flights and appetizers with the aid of a Groupon (mentioned upfront) on a quiet Sunday afternoon and received some of the best service, drinks, and bites we've had in the city.The server, who had, in all, about 7 tables to wait, was definitively gracious with advice and patient in assisting us in navigating the beverage choices which were modest in number yet impressive in quality.  The local craft beers were well-selected and the whiskey pours were more than generous.  Casual in atmosphere, the SS is tastefully-appointed while not being more than it promises: a local bar with good eats.Upon ordering our apps, the waiter took care to mention that the chef was experimenting with a few off-menu dishes, including some amazing shrimp salad-topped brioche triangles which were immaculately savory, filling, and in a word: divine.  We followed up with some fried pickles, slowly made our way through our drinks and left with tummies full and happy.  The fare at Sedgwick Shop is more than just bar food yet unpretentious all while generous and tasty, delivered with personable and genuine service.  What's not to love? 5 stars.

25.description: My girlfriend and I went here after she got the Groupon for whiskey flights and food. It was great. The service was wonderful, I got to try some new bourbon, she tried some new beers. Our server was knowledgeable and helped us order some food to complement the drinks. We started with the pulled pork nachos to maximize the value from the Groupon. They were excellent. GET THE MEATLOAF. It was a meatloaf cupcake that we split. It had some green beans and mashed potatoes that I can't say enough good things about. I'm writing this review months later and I vividly remember how good this meatloaf dish was.

12.description: Since one of my best friends is an aspiring performer, I wind up at a lot of Second City shows. A LOT. Sedgwick Stop is my new go-to for dinner (or just drinks) before heading to the theater. It's never been too crowded, and service has been excellent. They have an extensive selection of beers and specialize in whiskey. Their flights seem to be a really good value if you're interested in sampling new drinks! They have some standard bar fare on the menu, but I tried (and loved) the pulled pork nachos. I will definitely keep coming back!

59.description: As good as it gets. I wanted to write a review while still in the restaurant- it is that good. Extensive beer list-(coughcoughgetyourBourbonCountyStoutwhileyouc­ancough) great wines, and exceptional food. I also loved the atmosphere and service. Fantastic neighborhood vibe - family-friendly, foodie fab, and screens playing every type of game. I recommend the Taste the Rainbow (baked layered potato, rainbow chard w/ parmesan, cheddar, & feta) and The Stock Yard (a massive beef short rib plate of goodness with Yukon potatoes and garlic spinach). I can't wait to return!

21.description: This place has a really nice casual and comfortable vibe to it. Brought a friend to use a groupon here for a beer, wine, or whiskey flight and appetizer. Because it's only for 1 flight and a shared app, I'm not sure why the groupon requires two people, and it's awkward to share a flight of anything, but that was really my only complaint. My friend and I weren't in the mood to drink much anyway, so the red wine flight providing four tastings, giving us 2 tastings each worked out. The wines weren't my favorite, but I'm no connoisseur and drank them anyway.For our app, we ordered the mushroom and goat cheese quesadilla and were told it was small, so we ordered the plain chicken tenders as well. The quesadilla was quite flavorful and goat cheesy, which I love, and the chicken tenders were crisp and well-seasoned. Our server was friendly and attentive and the crowd seemed fun and easygoing, early on a Friday night. I would definitely come back.

17.description: Burgers were cooked perfectly, beer selection is decent. Service was ok, we would have appreciated acknowledgement when we came in.

10.description: The chicken tenders were great and almost a full meals worth.  I ordered the Stockyard melt for my main course - it was good but not great.  It was a lot of food for $12, but I thought that it was way too greasy.  It did take a little longer than I would have thought to get our food though.It's a pretty chill bar on the edge of Old Town - a pretty good beer selection and some TVs to watch a game.  But it is small with limited seating so I wouldn't try coming here with a large group.

5.description: Went here with my fiance for lunch on a Saturday. Is a small and quiet bar. They had good beer selections. The wings were amazing and some of the best French fries I ever had. Give The wings a chance when you are there, you won't be disappointed. The staff were very nice. Is a place I plan to go back to often. It was very welcoming.

3.description: Always noticed this place when hopping on the brown line at Sedwick, and jumped on the opportunity to check it out when I noticed a groupon deal. Stopped by on a Sunday afternoon for a snack, and it was pretty mellow and laid back. Our server was super friendly and had recommended the pork belly poutine to share between my friend and I. I'm still drooling over remember how tender and juicy the pork belly was. Instead of using traditional fries they used potato wedges which was also a nice touch. The craft beer selection is great and they have a nice variety of styles. Definitely worth a stop by! Til next time cheers!

35.description: Love, love, love this place! The food, service, and atmosphere are all great and it is just a perfect neighborhood bar. The bartenders really know their stuff and make great (and strong) drinks and each time I have been there my food has come out very quickly which is always a plus!They are known for their great selection of Whiskey and they even have their own Angels Envy blend and they have 14 rotating craft beers on tap.Great location and fun times!!

19.description: Not a bad place. My former Manhattan, KS self loves the K-State flag outside. I ordered the standard burger with avocado. A tad pricey, but it was good. Nice portion of avocado, a toasted bun, and nicely cook beef. Nomz. Plus, their fries are cool shaped. The kid in me got a kick out of that.

28.description: The shrimp Poorboy was epic and the beer selection was great.  Will definitely be going back to explore the menu.

45.description: I've lived in Old Town for a few years now... it's nice to see a great new bar/restaurant open up here! (It's even nicer that they have good service & reasonable prices!) -Friday night- a good, upscale attractive crowd of late 20's-early 40's people. Service was fast even though it was busy. Bartender was smart & funny (not too often do you find both!) I'll be back!

33.description: Food was okay, service wasn't good at all. I felt bad because it was a Sunday night and they hardly had any staff there but trivia was going on so it got really packed which then made the service not so great. I'll check it out again just because I'm three blocks away.

43.description: I feel badly leaving a negative review on Yelp, and I've only done it one other time. But my experience here was so negative, something must be said.My friend and I were meeting here for a couple drinks and some food after work on Friday. I finish work about an hour before my friend so I decided to come early and have a drink at the bar while I waited for her. Service at the bar was fine. The bartender was attentive and I had no issues with him. (That's why I'm giving two stars instead of one.)My friend arrived so I cashed out and we got a table. That's when things took a turn for the worse. Our waitress took our food order. I order the shrimp scampi special and my friend ordered the turkey sandwich. About 10 minutes later my friend's turkey sandwich arrives and the waitress leaves without mention of my meal. I'm thinking my food must be on its way. So we wait. And wait. And wait. Where is my food? Where is our waitress? About 15 minutes later she finally comes back to check on us. I'm not sure what the hold up was as there very few people here at this point. "I ordered the shrimp scampi" I say. "Oh, you did? I thought you were just recommending that for your friend." Huh? No, that's not at all what happened. Waitress asked what we were having. I said shrimp scampi. My friend said turkey sandwich. It really was that straightforward. "Oh we had some miscommunication there," says the waitress. I do not appreciate the insinuation that I was the one miscommunicating. I am the customer and I am always right. After some back and forth the waitress finally leaves to put in my order. Thanks to the kitchen staff for rushing that one through for me, because at this point I was starving. I inhaled my meal in about two minutes, but the portion was quite insufficient. After leaving, I stopped elsewhere for a much more satisfying dinner number two of the evening. Our waitress did apologize, but at that point it was too late. The experience was ruined.But that's not all. During our meal a woman came by with an iPad asking us to sign up for their rewards program. After explaining that we weren't interested, she moved on to the next table. So I was very surprised this morning to see two emails from the Sedgwick Stop about the new rewards program I joined. I definitely did not sign up for this. I realize that it's 2014 and my email address is connected to my credit card and anything can happen with that information, but really? Is this something new that restaurants and bars are doing, because this has never happened to me before? The email has I have to opt out! What? I never signed up for this...Bottom line: Poor service. Portions too small. If you pay with your credit card you are entered into their rewards program whether you like it or not. There are so many good bars in Chicago. This isn't one of them, and I won't be coming back.

2.description: I love this place. I used to live around the corner before moving to San Francisco, and whenever I am in Chicago I try to make it here. It is cozy, friendly, the food is decent - this ain't no haute cuisine mind you, it is more like a sports bar menu - and the owners and staff are friendly. If you live in Lincoln Park, Old Town, you should definitely stop by.

18.description: My girlfriend and I went here after she got the Groupon for whiskey flights and food. It was great. The service was wonderful, I got to try some new bourbon, she tried some new beers. Our server was knowledgeable and helped us order some food to complement the drinks. We started with the pulled pork nachos to maximize the value from the Groupon. They were excellent. GET THE MEATLOAF. It was a meatloaf cupcake that we split. It had some green beans and mashed potatoes that I can't say enough good things about. I'm writing this review months later and I vividly remember how good this meatloaf dish was.

41.description: Okay beer selection, 14 taps and closest to swill is Guinness and 312. Cool. Lots of good bourbon up there, good!"Gastro" it's not, except for pricing. $14 for a hamburger and it had really great bacon but it was a frozen patty. Really?

52.description: Sedgwick Stop is a tale of two bars (or maybe tale of two restaurants).  On the one hand it has great food and an awesome beer selection. On the other hand - the service is ATROCIOUS.  I live on Sedgwick St. so I was excited for this place to open as i've walked by the empty space for over a year and was hoping someone would put in an awesome bar.  Let's walk through all of aspects worthy of discussion:1.  Atmosphere - Overall it's pretty good.  The lighting is soft, there are a decent amount of TVs if you're there to watch sports, the bar is friendly and there are quite a few high tables (which I prefer).  They have these cool lantern lamps that hang from the ceiling, which are neat - but can actually block your view of the tv.  They haven't quite figured out the music situation either.  Every time i've been in there, the barkeep will put on his iphone but there is no consistency to the TYPE of music he/they play and sometimes they will just skip to a new song before the previous song has finished.  It's a bit... indecisive2. Food - Everything I've had has been delicious.  I am a big fan of the pork sliders!  I also had the greek salad which was great, as well as the "Hungry Man" breakfast sandwich, which is perfect for a hungover weekend brunch.  They also have great fries.3.Beer - Not much to say here other than the fact that they have a large (and great) selection. Something for everyone, and they are happy to let you sample beers you've never tried.4.Service - Abysmal.  Unfortunately THIS is the reason I have given Sedgwick Stop 2 stars despite all of the positives I have listed above.  The service is PAINFULLY slow and the wait staff seems uninformed regarding the menu.  I've waited this out a bit - hoping it would get better as people settled in to working there, but no dice.  The first time I was there I was actually holding my empty wine glass outstretched into the aisle and nobody really noticed or cared.  Their inability to turn drinks around in a timely fashion is mind-boggling and relatively infuriating if you are, ahem, thirsty.
