I would be less harsh on this point if they were consistently really BUSY but, in actuality, it's usually just a few tables of people when I am in there.  One Sunday afternoon I walked in and ordered a 312 and it took them 10 minutes (at least) to get it to me.  Perhaps this doesn't sound that egregious but it should've taken about 30 seconds considering the rest of the waitstaff and bartender were just standing around, and I was only sitting about 7 feet from the bar. The very last point I would like to make is that Sedgwick Stop is definitely expensive.  Drinks are $1-3 more than they should be, but i guess it evens out since I have about 2-4 FEWER drinks than i normally would given how slow the service is (I feel like I should've put "ZING" at the end of that statement, but I'm just being truthful.The place is still relatively new and if they turn this around I will be first in line to be a "regular".  Here's hoping....

50.description: True story:  WAY back in the day (ok, 7+ years ago) this was Angelo's Taverna, and I used to work here.  Not the more recent Angelo's, but the Mediterranean restaurant Angelo's that was right around the corner from the homestead.  I have not been back since my last day there but always thought the right bar and/or right restaurant would shine here.Sedgwick Stop is not one of them.  Lots of things are so wrong about this place, and I know they are new, so I am hoping that they can get it right.  But to highlight a few notables...The service.  I felt bad for our poor, apologetic waitress, as she seemed like she was either new to serving altogether or just severely in over her head.  Granted, she did not really have the support system she needed.  I took a look around the place and noticed the presence of 1 (possible) food runner, 2 bartenders, and another guy just kind of running all over the place.  It was kind of annoying that there were 2 bartenders tending to a bar of people sitting and casually sipping beverages.  If it was a college bar with drunk 20-somethings waving Benjamins in your face every 3 seconds trying to buy a bucket of Coors Light, sure, have some extra ammo behind the bar.  If not, get the bartenders checking on tables.  As a result, service on the floor suffered.  Oy vey.The menu.  Not bad, but pretty limited overall.  Standard bar fare, including appetizers, sandwiches and large plates.  I built my own burger for $14.00, which could be a deal or not based on what toppings you choose for your 3.  I was most appreciative of the fact that you could substitute a salad for fries as a side without an upcharge.  I never understood why restaurants will charge $1.50+ for a handful of leaves on your plate.  The drink menu was, really, my biggest issue.  The list is moderately sized, with several taps and quite a few bottles, and is comprised mainly of local and craft beer selections.  The first three beers I wanted were out of stock so I had to spend an abnormal amount of time finding one I wanted.  Most beers were over $6 and, kid you not, I nearly crapped myself when I saw a bottle of Lagunitas Lil Sumpin' Sumpin' was $8.  EIGHT DOLLARS?!  Complete highway robbery.  I am sure it's tough to open a bar and know what to price things, but... wow.  I think the beer special that night was a $5 312, which is hardly a special.  I decided on an IPA and it came back with a bit too much head for my liking (and I love head, obviously).  I am pretty sure I ended up with about 3/4 of a beer once it went down (bahahaha, get it?!).If I were coming to this bar for longer than just a drink and a quick bite I would easily have dropped an excessive amount of money.  It was a bit of a let down considering there are so many cheaper bars with a better overall experience within 2 blocks.  But, with anything new, there is hope, so I won't write them off completely just yet.  Besides, they have that killer patio... if Winter ever ends.

4.description: Great place to catch up with friends and grab drinks. Food is really good for a pub/bar I ordered a chicken sandwich and all the ingredients seemed really fresh. The sweet potatoe fries were a little over cooked but let's be real I still ate every single one. I'd definitely come back for food and drinks.

6.description: The mac and cheese is surprisingly the best mac and cheese in Old town, maybe in all of Chicago. That might be saying a lot but it's seriously awesome. My husband and I have gotten the groupon her a few times so we've tried a few of the appetizers and enjoy the often change in tap. We've also been here for a couple of big events (craft beer week and bcb tapping). The staff is always friendly, which we can greatly appreciate.

22.description: For all of you math geeks, I'll describe this place with some pretty simple arithmetic:Good food + good ambiance + good draft beer menu + good waitstaff + good location + knowledgeable bartender = always a good experience!And, did I mention beer flights??

15.description: For all of you math geeks, I'll describe this place with some pretty simple arithmetic:Good food + good ambiance + good draft beer menu + good waitstaff + good location + knowledgeable bartender = always a good experience!And, did I mention beer flights??

57.description: This place is a joke. Incredibly overpriced (a small ramekin of potatoes was $8) and the food is not that great (burger was over seasoned). Yes, the beer selection is good, unfortunately the staff behind the bar (bartender with perm wig) is incompetent and inexperienced. My $11 ten-ounce pour of Bourbon County was poured with an overly exaggerated head so the glass 'looked full.' An Amstel Light is $7.

20.description: Since one of my best friends is an aspiring performer, I wind up at a lot of Second City shows. A LOT. Sedgwick Stop is my new go-to for dinner (or just drinks) before heading to the theater. It's never been too crowded, and service has been excellent. They have an extensive selection of beers and specialize in whiskey. Their flights seem to be a really good value if you're interested in sampling new drinks! They have some standard bar fare on the menu, but I tried (and loved) the pulled pork nachos. I will definitely keep coming back!

36.description: Bad service? Try no service.  After standing near the bar to get a drink before we sat down and were ignored by two bartenders who made eye contact and then turned their backs on us as if they did not see us, we were ignored by the cocktail waitress who greeted another table that came in five minutes after us.  it can happen on a Friday night you say?  Yes, but at 5:30 on a Tuesday evening, with only ten other patrons in the whole place?  Bad first impression.

14.description: Great place. Not in my hood, but always solid when I'm around. Very respectable bourbon selection and food is better than average. Owner behind bar?  Good guy for sure.  Worth the trip.

58.description: I wish I would have read the reviews before going here.  I agree with everyone saying it was too rushed.  We went for pedicures.  They were so fast and the quality suffered because of it.  My heels were in the same condition as they were going in, my cuticles weren't removed, all in all not a lot changed!  The 2nd coat of polish went on immediately after the 1st, and top coat immediately after that.  Don't they need to dry a little???  I use OPI and experience tells me to wait until the layer is dry to the touch before putting on the next or they will never dry!  Our pedicurists stuck us under drying machines and then went home - we sat there for a long time wondering when we could get up.  Finally we asked a lady and she rushed us up and out and we didn't realize the person I was with had a huge gash through her polish from being yanked out from under the drying machine.  I bet that wouldn't have happened if they let the layers underneath dry a bit!  Not impressed and I won't be going back!

56.description: What a great little place -- it may not be the sleekest or chicest -- but it's good enough for me to go get my "no chip" manicure at.  (Haven't had a chance to test their pedicure skills).I am LOVING this "no chip" manicure.  First time I went it lasted me nearly 3 weeks -- the ONLY reason I went in was because they needed filling at the bottom and I actually wanted to change the color to match the dress for the wedding I'm in.  This "no chip" is a God-send.  I'll be back for sure!

29.description: I have been coming here for more than 5 years.  It's clean and affordable and the staff is great.  Very consistent with their services.  My favorite days to come are Mondays and Tuesdays because they have cheap deals those days and it's not so busy then.  They do get crowded and a little loud on the weekends but the staff is eager to be quick and try to take you as soon as possible. They accept credit cards but you have to tip in cash.

42.description: This is my go-to spot for mani-pedis. They have an option for a mani/pedi that isn't in the spa chair for $5 less. It involves sitting in a chair at the manicure table and having your feet in one of those bubbling tubs. It's everything without the massage chair, but I don't have a problem with that. There are lots of tables and chairs, so I usually don't have to wait very long to get in. Additionally, they have every brand of no-chip in what seems like every color! Every time I have gotten a no-chip manicure, they have done an excellent job (and I have had about 5 different nail technicians). The color never chips and is always right up against my cuticle. My biggest pet peeve is walking out of a nail salon with a manicure that already looks like it's grown out, and that has never been an issue for me at Old Town Nails. They also do an excellent job with callouses during the pedicure, which is also something I appreciate. Overall, this is not a frilly place. It's efficient and fairly priced.

23.description: I've tried every nail salon in Old Town and this salon is the only one that offers not only a great experience but fabulous mani and pedi's that last, don't chip quickly, aren't sloppily done or bubble.  I HIGHLY recommend.

47.description: I confess. I cheated. But Old Town Nails has WAY more color choices for no chip manicures. Literally the short side of a hundred options; many of them new. Some choices are $35 and some are $40. They took a little longer (middle of the weekday chit chatting) but the music was fine and the girls were nice. The price and the speed of their manicure is what has me pulling back a star...I literally thought I would have a ticket on my car from an expired meter. No appointments necessary and they do take credit cards!

8.description: Love my no-chips from Old Town Nails! They look awesome every time.

31.description: I have been meaning to write this review for a while and am finally taking the time to do so because the more I come to Old Town Nails, the more I am convinced they are definitely one of the best local nail salons in the city. I discovered Old Town Nails almost 10 years ago upon moving to Old Town and was always very pleased with the quality of both my manicures and pedicures everytime I would go.  I also loved that without making an appointment it was never a long wait (even on the busiest of days) and that no matter who did my nails, they always turned out great! And you can't beat $12 manicures and $20 regular pedicures! After moving out of Old Town, I stopped going to Old Town Nails and started frequenting a salon much closer to my house. Not only was it a lot more convenient, but I like supporting my neighborhood businesses. While my nails were always fine, it was always a toss up how they would turn out and the cost was higher. Yet, I persisted because it was local. However, I started to slowly head back to Old Town Nails for their no chip manicures because they are the best! And then decided that a short car ride and even a few bucks in the meter were worth the better nails! And I am so happy I did! Not only am I always pleased when I leave there, they make an extra effort to ensure that I am happy. I am picky and if ever I am displeased with something while still in the salon, they are so accommodating and will not let me leave until I am satisfied!  While I feel badly to not support I neighborhood place, I am happy to give my business to a deserving salon with a group of very deserving women who have worked there since I started coming 10 years ago! Until I leave the city for good, I will make the extra effort to go to Old Town Nails!

34.description: This is a great, neighborhood nail salon!  I pretty much always get right in for a mani and/or pedi.  The Spa Chairs are cushy and relaxing.They recently updated and refreshed the decor in the salon which is nice too.  Nice people to do business with.

16.description: I've been going to Old Town Nails for 15 years!I travel all over the U.S. and I have never found a place that can provide the same service as here.  It's clean, affordable, professional and everyone is friendly. I always get compliments on my nails when I go here & the new products work great for not chipping. I highly recommend this nail salon. Chau is the owner & who I use.  If you want a fantastic mani - pedi & are tired of trying places with poor results than Old Town Nails is perfect.

13.description: Really rushed... I got acrylic nails done. The nails are okay but she couldn't comprehend that I wanted them more pointy not squared off. Also they don't do any designs at all? I just want like a "V" on one finger and they complained about doing it even though when I first came in and showed them a picture they said they were capable. So half way about to be done I realized I just wasted $40 because they didn't even do what I asked AT ALL, end of session total was $75... It included a polish change on my toes though. Also my nail technician took about 10-12 cell phones calls so all of this took 3.5 hours!!

11.description: I've been going to Old Town Nails for a couple months now after moving to the area and I am nothing but impressed with the customer service and hospitality of this salon. Not only do they acknowledge me every time I come in but always accommodate me even if (like last night) it's close to closing time. The owner stayed with me to finish my amazing gel fill and took her time to make sure my nails we're pristine. This is such a great place with a great bunch of women working there! I highly recommend Old Town Nails to anyone who is looking for a perfect set!

39.description: Great place !!! Mani-ped $28 on Monday &Tuesday.

37.description: Yesterday was my first and only time I will ever come to this salon. My cousin just moved to the neighborhood from Charlotte and I wanted to take her to a nail shop in her area. The original nail place that was recommended for us wasn't taking any more clients for the day. So her and I walked over to Old Town nails and were able to get in right away. They were such in a rush to sit us down that we didn't even get to pick out our polish yet. We started off with the pedicure and that was a nightmare itself. The older lady I had was very rude. The water was luke warm and she never asked if the temperature was ok. She was extremely rough with my feet to the point I am not wearing 2 bandages on my feet because she cut me in 2 different spots. Then she asked what color I wanted and I explained an electric yellow... instead of her grabbing a few colors for me she hands me my flip flops and tells me to go look for the color myself.... Mind you the young girl who was doing my cousin's pedicure brought her quite a few different color shades of the color she wanted. The polish job on my toes looks very streaky and not smooth at all.Then I got my no chip manicure and this lady was a little nicer but not personable what so ever.... Also when she did a half ass job on massaging my hands I was very disappointed... also she never filed my nails or asked what shape I wanted... she filed my nails after she already finished with polishing my nails and still didn't ask me what shape I wanted.... I will def never come back to this place.... I should of just waited and gone to the other salon.... Lesson Learned

0.description: I've been looking for the right place for a good set of gels since we moved to Chicago last summer. Best set I've had since moving to the city. Thin, shaped perfectly and in and out in less than an hour. I'm a fan! I will be back!

38.description: I usually have bad luck with nail places.  I don't know if it's because of the work I do, or if I have some crazy weird nails, but no chip manicures never stay on me for more than a few days without lifting or chipping.  And forget regular manicures...they chip within hours.  However, I'm on my second no chip manicure from this salon with no chipping or anything for over two weeks.  Color me impressed.  Helen has done my nails the past few times, and I'll definitely ask for her in the future.  She's a miracle worker. This place has the typical feel of a walk in, cost effective nail salon.  Nothing too special, nothing out of the ordinary.  Prices are close to most other places I've been to in Chicago.  However, since they do such a great job with my nails, I'll definitely be back again and again.

51.description: Do not come here if you are expecting a relaxing and pampering mani/pedi. Do not come here if you want to hear tranquil music and be treated to a luxurious experience.Do come here if you want a cheap, fast, and great mani/pedi. Old Town Nails is the Ford Assembly line of mani/pedi spas and efficiency is the name of the game. They get you in, they get you out, and they provide the barest service possible that gets the job done. I stumbled here on a Sunday afternoon after trying another place where I was told it was an hour wait. They did ask me if I wanted a regular pedi or a "spa" pedi. I felt like regular pedi was the right way to go and I was instructed to go sit in a swivel chair at one of the desks. A woman came up shortly with a small foot bath (like you'd buy at Walgreens) had me soak for a few minutes and then got right to work with my feet propped up on a stool. Someone came after the pedi was finished and worked on my nails. All in all, I was in and out in under an hour for only $32 for both services. Awesome. And on a side note, I loved their selection of colors. I've been staring at my hands for the past few days loving the color I chose.

27.description: Perfect, long lasting nails every time, you get your bang for your buck,  friendly staff, wonderful owner. There is absolutely nothing I could complain about. I love it here!

32.description: My manicures from here (even before no-chip became onto the scene) lasted almost two weeks without any chips!  They lay the color so well and take their time, so whatever they're doing seems to work, here.  I used to go to Arbre a lot but I'd always have some nail chip within a day, which is infuriating. The place is cute, but gets super crowded so at times it gets noisy and a little claustrophobic. Go as soon as they open, or you'll be waiting.

54.description: Four stars for nail techs that DON'T tsk-tsk me for the condition of my cuticles. Yes, I pick at them. Yes, they look dry and bloody and horrible. Hello, isn't that why I'm getting a manicure? I will never understand this. But I will come back again and again for nail techs that clean up your cuticles while keeping their mouths shut.Regular manicures are the longest-lasting I've ever had, and if you didn't already get my drift, I am HARD on my hands.Recently had my first no-chip manicure. Nearly two weeks in, and still ... no chipping. Polish is shiny as the day I left the salon. I can easily get another week out of them. Best $35 manicure I've ever gotten! Barring my nails being damaged beyond repair underneath this no-chip stuff (I have NO idea how they're going to get it off!), I'll be back for this service again and again.Thanks for courteous, well-priced service with a smile, Old Town Nails!

48.description: Just got my first manicure at Old Town Nails, and got exactly what I wanted: a fast, cheap, high quality manicure. Linda did a great job, the tools were clean, the location convenient and my nails look great! I'll definitely be back for a mani/pedi in the near future.

44.description: Ugh, I'm sorry but this place is the worst....I made an appointment for 4:45pm on a Tuesday evening. I got there, and it was very busy. Normally I understand, as I'm a pretty patient person. In this instance, I had been waited 30 minutes for an APPOINTMENT, and they still sat a girl who walked in immediately before me, who did not have an appointment. Common sense tells me that is wrong, but whatever... first red flag.Second red flag... it's dirty. I don't even think they changed the towels before giving a new no-chip manicure.The stations were all very disorganized.  When the lady was scrapping off my previous manicure, she actually scrapped my nail with HER nasty finger nail. I almost walked out right then. I told her I prefer for her to use the file, so she did, but seemed irritated. Seriously, who does that?! YUCK!Yes, they have a TON of no-chip colors, but when they chip after only a week, that's not worth it. I even waited to write this review to see A.) if my frustrations would stop and B.) if the manicure would actually last. Both are no's. I'm obviously going back to my "old faithful" salons where my no-chips last 3.5 weeks with less colors and be 10X happier.

24.description: I've been going to Old Town Nails for a couple months now after moving to the area and I am nothing but impressed with the customer service and hospitality of this salon. Not only do they acknowledge me every time I come in but always accommodate me even if (like last night) it's close to closing time. The owner stayed with me to finish my amazing gel fill and took her time to make sure my nails we're pristine. This is such a great place with a great bunch of women working there! I highly recommend Old Town Nails to anyone who is looking for a perfect set!

7.description: My daughter and I had a wonderful experience getting our nails done by Chau and Trin. They gave us outstanding French manicures. Top notch service quality. We look forward to going back and would highly recommend them !

49.description: BEWARE!!!!! I asked for GEL and I kept on telling them it looks like acrylic and the lady just yelled at me.  She made me pay for gel even though they looked like acrylic.  2 weeks later I went to another salon and they said what I had was acrylic and NOT Gel. So I recommend you not to go here if you are getting GEL nails, because they are just going to lie to you

40.description: My greatest frustration with Old Town Nails is that it's overcrowded and they don't honor their appointments.  I've waited too long, too many times.  Today my pedicure took 90 minutes despite an appointment because it took them 30 minutes to get started.  It's only when I get up to leave that they fawn over me and beg me to stay.

53.description: From now on, I'm only going to Old Town Nails for mani/pedis. Every manicure I've had here has been fantastic, and whenever I go somewhere else, I'm always disappointed. I'm generally pretty picky about how my nails are filed and they do an excellent job! The polish lasts for a good week and they always clean up my cuticles without it being painful.It's usually pretty busy, so if you're looking to go with a friend, I'd definitely make an appointment.

30.description: I try to go  to a nail salon at wells and division and those people might have had fancier chairs and alcohol but had the crappiest attitude. I come here, we are acknowledged, greeted, short wait time and nice people. Might be less fancy but will take this any day for quick polite service.

46.description: It is kind of like the female version of Norm walking into a girl's rendition of "Cheers"Go there a few times...and everyone who works there knows your name. When you come through the door, the employees all look up and greet you by name. Even if you haven't stopped by in a while...they still remember you. It is a neighborhood staple for me. It is not a pampered salon experience. They get you in and get you out at an incredibly reasonable price!!! The girls that work there are really nice and they do a great job!

1.description: I love these ladies!!! Chou is amazing at no chip and silk nails!! She's very kind, knows everyone by nail and is very caring. Also, great prices!!!! It's always busy here so book appt or have time to get wit a little bit

55.description: I always have a pleasant experience here. It gets busy - really busy but they always have time to fit you in. If you are looking for a relaxing quiet atmosphere this isn't the place but if you are looking for flexible staff and good service it is! I also got the "No chip" manicure which is fantastic. It almost seems like they put a layer of acrylic over your nail but it's something else... My nails stayed shiny and didn't chip for two weeks. Eventually they grow out and you need to go back in for another but it's worth it. Takes about one hour. I highly recommend this place!

9.description: After disappointing experience at other salons I went to Old Town Nails and I LOVED IT!  They have an almost overwhelming selection of gel options to choose from.  Everyone who works there couldn't have been nicer.  The actual manicure was perfect.  They even stayed open an hour late to accommodate all of the appointments. I've recommended Old Town Nails to lots of friends and they've all been just as happy with their nails!It's a little pricey (even though it's totally worth it) and the wait can be a little long even when you make an appointment.  But, when they didn't have time for me one day, the owner gave me a 10% off coupon for when I came back.  I wasn't mad at all about having to come back another day.  I thought it was a really nice gesture.  They are ALWAYS honest about how long the wait will be so you can decide if you have time to wait or want to come back another day.

26.description: Chau is the absolute best.  I've had my nails done all over the country and no one ever takes the time and care with polish that Chau does.  She is meticulous and also makes sure that everyone in her salon does it right.  I just paid 8X the price for a manicure (on vacation at a spa) and was sooo wishing that I was in Chitown with Chau.  Honestly, I can't wait to come home and have my nails done the way that both Chau and I expect. She's  both a great lady and a wonderful perfectionist.  The best ever!  Thank-you, Chau...for showing me that perfect nails are possible!  Honestly, don't settle for second best, if you can get yourself to Old Town Nails!  Btw-- a perfect manicure with Polish is only $12!!!

25.description: It's only a 5 minute walk from the Sedgewick brownline, it's in Old Town which is a nice location to be in, the price is very reasonable and they offer a quality service. Got the no chip french manicure here and its been holding up very well. Definitely a place I will be coming back to with my friends. It's a fun place to go with a group to have your trimonthly nail maintenance.

12.description: After reading reviews on Yelp, I decided to give Old Town Nails a try back in October. I've been a regular customer ever since. The salon is clean, the staff is relatively friendly, and the owner Chau does an awesome job.

59.description: After a day at the beach some friends and I decide to get our nails done and walk over to Old Town Nails.  Since I just had a mani/pedi a week before I opted just for a manicure.  The place was packed and you are literally tripping over people getting pedicures in those home spa foot massagers.  After what was the quickest manicure I have ever my nails were still not set over 2 hours later!  I ended up taking off the polish the next day.

21.description: LOVE Old Town Nails !! Couldn't have spent my Thursday afternoon better than being pampered here by the exceptional nail stylists. I had a mani-pedi done at the exact same time and was in and out of the salon in a matter of 20 min. My nails look amazing and I couldn't be happier with how perfect they look and feel. Ask for Sue or Susan, they both did a great job! If you want fast-service that's super attentive and friendly, than make sure you schedule your next appointment at Old Town Nails !!

17.description: I just can't seem to find a decent place in my neighborhood to get my nails done. Stopped by this afternoon with a friend while killing some time. We asked for mani pedis. They asked us to take a seat in the massage chairs.The girl who did my pedicure took a really long time, yet the finished product was done pretty poorly. Plus the foot massage was weak. As time went by, more and more people came in to get their nails done. I noticed that one of the ladies was asking these women if they want a regular pedicure or the chair, (pointing over to where we were sitting). Wait a minute now. I was never asked this question. We were just directed right over the chairs. The women who were not in the massage chairs just had their feet in a bucket of water. Hmmm... I was under the assumption that the special of the day was $28 for a mani/pedi. When it was all said and done I ended up paying $37 before tip. I was too exhausted from having sat there forever for a mediocre nail job to even confront anyone. All the employees were pretty rude and bossy. They were also pretty rough with my hands and feet. I'm not impressed. Even the crappy little nail salons closer to me charge less than this and have done a better job. The search continues...

10.description: There isn't a better nail salon in the area. I have been a customer of Old Town Nails since I moved home nearly 2 years ago. Chow and her employees take pride in their work, they've always been accommodating, super kind, and they have the largest selection of color options. Love this place! Highly recommended!

5.description: These ladies are amazing!!! They go out of their way to take care of all of us, (i.e staying open late, changing the way they do things to make customers happy, stocking the latest products) and they work their buns off! I have been coming here for 8 years! And I travel a lot but no one does nails like Chao!

3.description: Favorite nail salon in the WHOLE CITY! Everyone who works here is so friendly and talented. I have been getting no chip manicures for almost three years and I recently decided to switch it up because I wanted a little more length. The owner, Chau, (who by the way goes out of her way to learn EVERY customers name!) told me about a silk wrap manicure which is better for your nails than acrylic or gel. I was seriously blown away by how gorgeous and natural my nails look. P.S. - it's nearly two weeks later and they are still perfect. Bottom line, no better nail salon in Chicago.

35.description: Honestly, I am very surprised by a big number of 4 and 5 stars review for this place.While they sometimes can provide decent service  for decent price the place is a bit dirty, disorganized and crowded. IMO they need some serious renovation.CONS - besides those already mentioned above, not a good quality service. Every time I leave with uneven nails, sometimes cuticles sticking out, with very thick layer of nail polish which chips off the next day. Pedicure is not very good either. Everything is done in a rush.PROS - cheap, conveniently located in the heart of Old Town, you DON'T NEED TO SCHEDULE in advance, they will seat you the moment you walk in at anytime - that's amazing actually!So, if you are desperate and in a hurry - go for it, otherwise find something else.

19.description: Most certainly the best nail salon in Chicago. The staff is wonderful, no matter who you have. Will never go elsewhere.

28.description: I HAD A ONCE IN A LIFETIME EXPERIENCE @ OLD TOWN NAILS!!!I'm just a come & go customer and I don't book appointments.  Even though the team at Old Town Nails doesn't know my name, they recognize me each time I visit.  A couple of days ago, I was paying for my service and the owner noticed my mesh purse.  She inquired about the mesh purse and presented me with an identical one filled with a VERY significant amount of money.  Apparently, I had left the small mesh bag at the salon over 2 years ago and the owner held onto it for the entire time--waiting for the customer who owned it!!I was dumbfounded when we confirmed it was indeed mine.  All work stopped and everyone in the salon discussed the episode with a lot of tears.  I promised myself I'd make it up to the owner, so I am sharing this experience. I want everyone to know about the integrity, character and honesty the owner and her team possess.  Besides the great service, inviting atmosphere and wonderful manicures, Old Town Nails has provided me with an experience that stands out among many that I have had with shop owners.I am so very grateful to the proprietor and her fantastic team at Old Town Nails!!!!

45.description: The Best. There's a reason why, even though there are 5 other nail salons within walking distance of here, they are always busy when those places are empty. Everyone knows they have the best color selection of regular and no chip and do the best job on your nails in  a short amount of time. Chau, Julie, and the others will know your name after a few visits and will keep you coming back. If you're in a hurry, they'll get you done fast, if you come in with a friend, they'll seat you next to one another. Don't let the hustle and bustle fool you, they do a great job and that's why they have so many regulars. While you don't need any appointment, sometimes they get really busy toward the later part of the day, so it's best to call if you have limited time. Expect to wait 10-15 minutes after 3pm on busier days. Either way, you'll be satisfied once you leave. I used to go to any old nail salon to get my fill-ins done, but now I won't go anywhere else.

33.description: Old town nails is the best, most affordable nail salon around. I have lived in the area for 6 years and I have literally gone everywhere. And every time I go somewhere else (usually because I happen to be walking by and it's convenient) I end up disappointed and think I should have just gone to Old Town Nails.They are consistent, have a great selection of colors, and are very reasonably priced.They can get busy at times so I always recommend calling ahead and making an appointment, that way if there are people waiting you can skip ahead of those who don't have appointments.One thing that has made me realize this place is great, I always see familiar faces of other repeat customers. If other people have been coming back for as long as I have, they must think it's great too.Much better than your average nail place!

43.description: I usually do not write a review but today's experience takes the cake.  I will NEVER come here again.I have been coming to this salon for over a year and it has usually been good.Not the swankiest and cleanest place but you get your nails done fast and they offer non-chip manicure.Today, I went in for my usual non-chip French Manicure and normal pedicure but was served by a new manicurist who was new to me.  I selected my colors and she worked on my nails.  At the end of it, I found bubbles and fur from the towels in my nails and asked her to redo.  She also seem to have trouble applying my coats as she claims that the colors I selected (light pink and white) were not carried in a good brand that allows the colors to be applied easily.As a customer, I am NOT expected to know which colors come in which brands and have counted on the salon to advise me if so.  They did not.  Also, they said that the bubbles and fur could be caused by my drying in the UV dryer - I said NO.  It was clearly from the applicator brush and also the manicurist SHOULD HAVE noticed it and cleaned it up before allowing it to dry.I sat there for 2.5 hours having another manicurist work on my nails trying to rectify the problems caused by the first manicurist - who seemed disgruntled and never once apologised.  Her worked as checked occasionally by Judy the manager on duty who was working beside her on another customer.  While I did not understand Vietnamese which they were speaking, I felt that she was experiencing some difficulty and challenge with my nails.The final straw was when I discovered I sustained a cut on my finger - which was bleeding slightly as a result of the manicurist's rough handling.  I asked Judy how they will resolve this and they put some antiseptic on me and asked me for a reduced payment.  After calling her boss, she said that they will reduce my charges to $45 in total for the services rendered as "they still have to make some money".  She apologised for the cut but said that it is common sometimes.  I was very shocked that cuts are deemed as COMMON in this salon. I paid the money nevertheless but know in my heart that they have lost me as customer for good.

2.description: Best manicure I have ever had. Chou is the best at the no chip and really makes sure that every nail gets the special care it deserves. If you find an error or flaw, you can ask her to fix it and come back within a week if there is any chips. I have never been so grateful for a good no chip especially at such a busy location. Each customer got the best service and I've never seen so many happy individuals leave

18.description: They were able to take me as a walk-in on Christmas Eve, which was fantastic. However, I got a full set of acrylics and it has been a week and the edges are already popping up. Looks like I'll need a fill much sooner than I thought. I would go back, just not for acrylics.

41.description: I have never written a review before but am compelled to now.  Sadly I have gone to Old Nails repeatedly and never had a problem until last week when I got a horrible fungal infection!  My toenails are peeling off!  It is disgusting.  Find another place!

52.description: A friend and I went into get a mani/pedi since Old Town Nails is right across the street from me. We went to sit down in the pedicure chairs and were greeted by two additional women to do our nails. Normally I would enjoy this, but I had 4 Vietnamese women screaming to each other within two feet of me in their native tongue which was very unrelaxing. I could get past the blah decor, and rude staff, but the place is also kind of dirty. If you're looking for a cheap mani/pedi on a Monday or Tuesday I guess this would be a safe bet. If you're looking for a relaxing mani/pedi on a Sat (when there are no deals) I would suggest going somewhere else.

50.description: I love this place and have been going here for years.  Julie is my girl who can file a straight line like nobody's business and lets not forget Jane, my beloved pedi gal who knows how to scrub a tired foot pretty.  I always meet new fun people while we sit under the lights drying or see other die hard regulars coming in for their own nail fix.  Well priced, clean, and always a happy customer.  I seriously think I've been going here for ten years...I'd hate for Suze Orman to show me that math on that one!

4.description: Best nail salon in Old Town/Lincoln Park/Near North area! Very clean, open, and bright walk up. Service is top-notch and they always work with you to get you in - mani, pedi, no chip, gel, silk - they do it all and at a great price. Employees are very friendly and polite - the owner remembers everyone's name! I won't go anywhere else :)

6.description: They did a wonderful job.  I got a no-chip manicure and pedicure there.   Five days later they still look great.  What I didn't like  was the immature behavior of the staff.  The technician that did my manicure  was rude.  I unknowingly smudged my left big toe and she screams to the other tech, "She smudged her nail.!"  The place was packed.  She continued to shriek, 'Did you drink beer?  I can tell." I apologized and explained that it must have just happened.  The first technician fixed my big toe.  It was a Saturday.  I was enjoying a day off in the city.  I called myself killing time before dinner.  I went there because the wait at Polish and Pour was too long,I think these little girls forget that they are providing a service that people can choose to go elsewhere. They  need to choose their words carefully.  I paid for the service and I'm a good tipper. If that exchange hadn't occurred, and credit tips were allowed, I would have left more.

22.description: Mixed bag of quality. I went here with 2 friends for manis- theirs turned out well but mine was pretty bad... Polish on my skin and cuticles and about an hour later I noticed bubbling on the nails on my left hand. Will not be returning

15.description: Plus: Nails look nice afterwardsEmployees are not very kind or professional. I am never greeted or talked to except what you want and sit here and then they talk to each other  (Seinfeld clip)Prices are same or higher than other places . Meh

57.description: Ouch!  The manicurist was ROUGH.  I started bleeding!  Not good....I went for the Mon-Tues special.  It is $28 for mani/pedi that is not in the pedicure chair, and $33 for the mani/pedi + pedicure chair.  For some stupid reason, I thought paying $5 for the pedicure chair would be better....it's not.  Perhaps even worse than the bleeding of my thumb and the subsequent need to take Advil to relieve the pain was the fact that the nail technicians here yell at one another.  They are sooo loud that it is anything but comfortable, much less enjoyable.  I don't care if the mani/pedi's are free, please don't go here.  Go anywhere but here.

20.description: They were able to take me as a walk-in on Christmas Eve, which was fantastic. However, I got a full set of acrylics and it has been a week and the edges are already popping up. Looks like I'll need a fill much sooner than I thought. I would go back, just not for acrylics.

36.description: I just can't seem to find a decent place in my neighborhood to get my nails done. Stopped by this afternoon with a friend while killing some time. We asked for mani pedis. They asked us to take a seat in the massage chairs.The girl who did my pedicure took a really long time, yet the finished product was done pretty poorly. Plus the foot massage was weak. As time went by, more and more people came in to get their nails done. I noticed that one of the ladies was asking these women if they want a regular pedicure or the chair, (pointing over to where we were sitting). Wait a minute now. I was never asked this question. We were just directed right over the chairs. The women who were not in the massage chairs just had their feet in a bucket of water. Hmmm... I was under the assumption that the special of the day was $28 for a mani/pedi. When it was all said and done I ended up paying $37 before tip. I was too exhausted from having sat there forever for a mediocre nail job to even confront anyone. All the employees were pretty rude and bossy. They were also pretty rough with my hands and feet. I'm not impressed. Even the crappy little nail salons closer to me charge less than this and have done a better job. The search continues...

14.description: It's only a 5 minute walk from the Sedgewick brownline, it's in Old Town which is a nice location to be in, the price is very reasonable and they offer a quality service. Got the no chip french manicure here and its been holding up very well. Definitely a place I will be coming back to with my friends. It's a fun place to go with a group to have your trimonthly nail maintenance.

28.description: Absolutely brilliant pizza comparable to the infamous Pizzeria Bianco in PHX. Pristine bathrooms. Great service!

1.description: I had not been to the new Dinotto's, but a recent play at nearby Red Orchid Theatre made it a likely choice -- that and my chronic jones for Neapolitan pizza. There's a decent menu of 9 or 10 pizzas, a nice selection of appetizers, a few salads, a handful of pasta dishes, and a compact selection of wines at affordable prices. Good luck parking in this neighborhood -- spots can be scarce, and meters on North Ave and south are $4/hr.VIBE: A cozy, compact storefront. No reservations for small parties.SERVICE: Cordial and helpful, but serious communication problems between the servers and the two kitchens. Our pizza came before our app; when we questioned this, we we're told by the runner, 'well, they're from separate kitchens." Not my problem. The party at a neighboring table was served with the wrong pizza, and it was not to their liking, so they apparently left unsatisfied.LIKED: Everything was OK, but not as good as, say, Spacca Napoli. Grilled veggies were fresh & tasty, but lacked the depth & unctuousness of those at SN. Pizza was tasty enough, but crust not as crispy/blistered as I'd expect.DISLIKED: Lack of service coordination & ownership.I might return if I'm in the neighborhood again, but I won't likely choose Dinotto as a destination in itself.

39.description: Lovely ambiance. Attentive service. Solid food. They need to cook the pizza a tad bit longer. The crust gets soggy underneath. It should be crispy and the edges should not be pale. Love that some of the menu from the old Dinotto's has come over too.

9.description: Great pizza joint in Old Town with a great wine selection. A bit expensive so expect to drop a decent amount of cash. Go on Wednesdays for 1/2 price bottle of wine.

29.description: If 2nd City is your destination for comedy, Dinottos should be your restaurant before or after the show! Located just down the block from the famous comedy venue our group of 4 almost enjoyed our 2 hours at this eclectic, high energy, intimate Italian restaurant. Staff from top to bottom was great, Wine list met our needs with an excellent La Postolle Cuvee Cab, followed by an equally bold Super Tuscan Al Passo! Appetizers and food will bring you back. We attended the 11PM show so arrived at Dinottos at 8:15. No reservations allowed, but staff got us a table within 15 minutes. Great evening. If you are looking for a quiet  place then this should not be your choice. This place is lively, entertaining and will bring you back!

42.description: Bellissima!Hey Old Towners - Have you heard?  Dinotto's has a new Ristorante specializing in Neapolitan style pizzas cooked in an oven imported from Naples!And guess what?  It's delicioso!I was craving some of that Neapolitan pizza goodness, so I suggested it as a venue for a recent dinner out with my best gal pals.  It was a perfect venue.  Right on a hopping stretch of Wells in the heart of Old Town.  Cozy.  Comfortable seating.  Nice enough to be a good destination, but not stuffy.  Just what we wanted.Having only been open for I think 1 day, they don't have their liquor license yet, but it's anticipated to arrive in the next few weeks, so if you're speedy, you can bring in a bottle of vino to compliment your Italian feast.On the the food.Swoon.We sampled the polenta fries (to die), arugula salad, burrata and arancini.  All were fab, but the real winners were the polenta fries with their crispy exterior and creamy center served with truffled mayo dipping sauce and the creamy, dreamy burrata with toast and an arugula salad.  The pizza was amazing, too.  We sampled the simple and perfect margherita, sausage, 4 cheese and prosciutto.  I love, love, loved the prosciutto.  I also fell for the margherita.  The crust is nicely charred and chewy and just thick enough to hold up the toppings.The prices are a hair high, but given the neighborhood it's to be expected.  Pizzas ran anywhere from 13-20 bucks.I would absolutely go again.  Dare I say I enjoyed the pizza better than Spacca Nappoli???

23.description: lovely place with very good food and nice service. The  lore of the Old Town trattoria scene maintains that Toppo Gigio started it, then bought the property across the street (current location).  That spot became Trattoria Roma (now Woodies).  Dinottos located around the corner on North Ave. All three of these places have some connection with the people involved. Allegedly, this was the nucleus of  a Chicago Italian  restaurant style that was something  other than Italian/American red gravy.Go figure. The 1551 Wine bar failed at this spot, the rent went crazy on the North/Wells corner (now alll empty) and Dintto gets certified as a Neapolitan Pizza expert, imports a super high end oven (which is reflected in the excellent pies) and Bob's your Uncle!  I intend to become a regular here as I uncover the menu options.  The chicken dishes were excellent.  The pizza is fantastic and expensive.  My pie of the day did not include the green peppers as noted and was $18.  They have lunchtime pies for $10--a great value.  We had a caesar salad that was very ordinary for $7 and they did not offer bread. Had these 2 items been absent, I would give five stars.  I will be back.   They do know how to cook here.NOTE--a friend of mine, who is a very fussy restaurant customer and is Italian/American always talks about Italian restaurants where everything tastes the same.  This is not the case here!

5.description: Wow! The customer service here was fabulous. I originally came in with a party of 3 and had some unexpected friends show up. The owners helped accommodate our bigger party without any issue. The ambiance was wonderful with a friendly warm customer service. The food was delicious all around our table. If you enjoy a warm friendly ambiance with some delicious food I would highly recommend this place.

31.description: Hello pizza! This restaurant has moved from north ave over to a better location on wells. Honestly the food is great. Absolutely the best pizza in the neighborhood, great wine list and interesting beers on tap. The atmosphere is warm and cozy. Their pizza oven even looks cool. Don't miss this spot....perfect before a show at second city!

25.description: Love this place the pizza amazing and the service is awesome. The beer selections are good.

12.description: We love Dinotto and have dined there many times. It is great to have a true thin crust pizza so close to home. The Bufulina pizza is an absolute stand out! The sauce is full of flavor and when you add their burrata on top it is fantastic! Their owner, Dino, is a great example of how an owner can keep his customers happy. He is passionate about the food , his restaurant and the experience diners have. I would also highly recommend their arugula salad, pasta, and homemade sausage pizza. Great addition to Old Town!

37.description: Coming from an italian, this place is great! Not pretentious, good prices, cool/quaint ambiance and awesome Food.Peroni on draft too...GO!!

21.description: Stopped in late Friday night thinking the kitchen would be closed, but the waiter kindly told us they could make a pizza for us. We had a great table outside and the pizza was excellent. Waiter could not have been nicer.

16.description: A solid dining experience...service was great.  Started with arancini which was decent and the meatballs which were very good(with a side of focaccia bread- which was more of a garlic pizza dough bread, still delicious). Pumpkin ravioli special was good, a little salty and sausage pizza was on point, crust was perfect.  Good wine selection...and desserts all sounded great.  Had a pistachio cannoli but wish we had opted for the tiramisu.  Wish I lived in Chicago, would definitely be a regular!

17.description: Excellent appetizers (we got the polenta fries and the calamari fritti). The lasagna was decent and deliciously cheesy. The farfalle was sub-par and needed extra salt. The tiramisu was probably the best I've ever had, and was paired with a perfect cappuccino. Overall, a good experience.

10.description: We selected this restaurant for dinner before Second City show, and suggest you DON'T. First, our party of five was squeezed onto a table meant for four and request for a move was refused. Although Starter and Main Course selections were adequate, no choice of dessert given. We were told the course was tiramisu only, even though none of us liked. They served it anyway and was unfortunately wasted. Only one of ourarty of five tried one bite and confirmed their dislike. So, we actually aid for something none of us liked or wanted. We will NEVER return and suggest you bypass.

11.description: Amazing pizza, great drinks, great salad, great service. Yes. Service was friendly and attentive, even when we were in a hurry to get to our nearby second city show.

26.description: Good food.  Great service.  Try the special draft beers.  I had the Italian beer and it was quite good

27.description: My family and I live down the street and have been anxious to try this place out.  We had been to the location on North Ave a number of times over the years.  We decided to go on a Wednesday night while my father in town.  The other reviews on Yelp before are glowing, but that was not our experience.  We left dissatisfied after all was said and done.  In the food area:  we ordered the meatballs.  They were cold on the inside and they took forever to come out. The sauce they were served in was OK - nothing special.  The pizza, which we were really forward to wasn't anything special.  The crust tasted a bit undercooked, not enough cheese (literally half the pizza was bread only) and just overall not satisfying.  The veal lasagna was OK.  Lots of meat, but not crazy about the sauce, but again - OK.  We had one of the salads and that was tasty.  Now on to the service.  The food took a long time to come out.  Meatballs and pizza should not take as long as they did.  These are Italian staples we've had at MANY restaurants and the food took a long time to come to the table.  The waitstaff didn't seem to be quite with it.  We were sharing the lasagna and had to ask for plates to share - they should have just brought out plates or asked if we wanted plates.  I asked for a side of marinara sauce for the pizza and it took 5 minutes.  That should be a one minute, run to the kitchen and bring it back thing.  We also had to ask for silverware replacements after they removed silverware from various courses. If I had not asked I wouldn't have anything to eat my main course with.  Replacing silverware is "restaurant 101" type of stuff.   The music was way too loud for the space especially considering how many guests were there.  I asked multiple times to turn it down and while the music went down for one song, the volume went back up again.  We gave up asking because we already had asked twice.  It was impossible for my father-in-law to hear us and we took him to the restaurant special while he was in from out of town.  Overall, very disappointed and a place I can't recommend and don't see myself coming back to.  I wish the experience had been better and my wife and I had to apologize to my father-in-law about our restaurant selection.  Maybe you'll have a better experience than us, and there are other reviewers here who seemed to have had great experiences, but there are a lot of choices on Wells and we'll go with the others at this point unless something changes.Update 5/15/15:  I emailed the restaurant through their web site and I provided the details from above and no one ever replied to me.

35.description: Went to Dinotto on a snowy Wednesday night.  I was surprised to see how many seats they were able to slam into a small dining area. Whoever decorated the place did a great job.  We ordered a 1/2 off bottle of Modus which was a great buy.  On to the pizza.  I don't mind when places advertise wood burning pizza and stick to that, but when places advertise Neapolitan pizza when they do not even understand the concept or traditions behind it I become very upset.  The taste of the pizza itself wasn't horrible but it was the farthest thing from pizza napoletana.  It was very dry hard and crunchy.  So please a note to the owners please stop faking and trying to capitalize off other peoples hard work and better yet stop lying to your customers and to yourself!

8.description: Dinottos has been one of our fav Italian restaurants for years.  We recently visited there new location and were really disappointed.  The new location is not as nice as the last but we could have overlooked that if the food was still excellent, but sadly it wasnt. The space is crowded and the bench seating is so uncomfortable, its no longer cozy and romantic thats for sure. I ordered the risotto and it was probably one of the worst dishes i have ever had. It was a patty of white unseasoned rice fried or baked so the whole thing was chewy and greasy and bland.The bad kind of chewy were it gets stuck to your teeth and hard to chew. It was topped with tomatoes,onions and pesto which was ok. It also had a few small pathetic low quality shrimp on the side that looked that looked like the shrimp you get from jewel seafood counter,flavorless and bland. My boyfriend got the lemon chicken with potatoes and said it was ok but not special.  Its too bad,i have such fond memories of dishes like there old lobster ravioli in a saffron cream sauce etc...i guess those days are gone,and so is Dinottos from our list of great italian restaurants.

0.description: The food: 4/5. We came with a large group and were seated right away on a Friday night. I got aranchini as for an app and margarita pizza for my main. I enjoyed both. The service: 3/5. Sadly, the service was a little lacking, that's probably why the restaurant was half-empty on a Friday night. Overall: 3.5. Good pizza, mediocre service.

38.description: Cute place. Relaxed atmosphere. Fair portions and price ($17-20 entree). The server was helpful and friendly. He seemed knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the food I had the pasta special and my boyfriend had the risotto. Both are fabulous! Definitely get the tiramisu!!

20.description: We 'won' a $25 gift certificate at this place when Dino did a demo @ The Garden Show on Navy Pier. We went for dinner on a Sunday night. I was pretty surprised when management refused to honor the certificate as it was issued from the old location. I was told that it was a different corporation. So, I guess Dino skipped out on a few debts. I called on Tues. and talked to Dino. He refused to do anything to help me get my $25 back. This is the worst customer service I've experienced. OK, they comped us with a free piece of crappy (Sysco) tira mi su.We had the polenta fries which were just fine if you ignored to petroleum flavored 'truffle oil' in the Sysco mayo. They've got a great looking wood burning oven. It's too bad nobody taught the cook how to use it. Our pizza was flaccid.

19.description: Had a few pints at old town ale house then a couple of pies here - 1/2 bottles on Wednesday. Good times were had.

33.description: I moved to Old Town from NY late fall. This is the best pizza in the neighborhood--better than EATaly and Balena may be the only competitor for thin crust, Italian pizza. Great staff, decent wine by the glass menu. A fab neighborhood spot.

2.description: Omg let's please keep this gem a secret! This place is too die for! From the location, to the ambiance, to the decor of the restaurant, to the service, and of course the food! Came here with my boyfriend and we were lucky to get the last table in the place right in the back of the narrow and romantic restaurant. We had a front row seat to the beautiful pizza oven and chef working his magic on the pizza. We started with the bread appetizer which was seasoned pizza dough and oh wow was it amazing! They also have a garlic olive oil option that wasperfection! onto the pizza... it was fresh and delicious! i cannot wait to come back again when I'm craving good authentic pizza and an awesome atmosphere.

34.description: This place is so good i had to review it. Best pizza I've ever had !  I went here with a group so we tried a lot if different pizzas and I've never had anything like it. Not very cheesy but so much flavor its awesome. I had a nitro stout which was really good.

32.description: Omg let's please keep this gem a secret! This place is too die for! From the location, to the ambiance, to the decor of the restaurant, to the service, and of course the food! Came here with my boyfriend and we were lucky to get the last table in the place right in the back of the narrow and romantic restaurant. We had a front row seat to the beautiful pizza oven and chef working his magic on the pizza. We started with the bread appetizer which was seasoned pizza dough and oh wow was it amazing! They also have a garlic olive oil option that wasperfection! onto the pizza... it was fresh and delicious! i cannot wait to come back again when I'm craving good authentic pizza and an awesome atmosphere.

18.description: Came for my sisters birthday. Had a bigger group, but not huge. From the time we arrived it just seemed we were an inconvenience. My older sisters arrived before the rest of the group. They tried to sit at our table at the front of the restaurant and were immediately told they were not allowed to sit there. Not exactly how guests of a large group that is making you good money should be treated. They also provided no solution for splitting a bill. Wouldn't go by seat, wouldn't let us split among credit cards, and blamed us for not telling them we were going to want to split the bill somehow. Sorry, but that is your responsibility, not ours. The rest of the night fell apart. From dishes being not even close to what they were described on the menu as (chicken and sun dried tomatoes does not equal chicken smothered in red sauce) to soggy pizza and an extraordinarily salty chicken dish, the food left much to be desired. In short, not good for large groups. Not good for eating. Not good service. Just not good.

41.description: Work in progress, but it has potential. We tried Dinotto's new pizza venture the other day and were somewhat disappointed overall with our experience. BYOB until they get their liquor license. Our waiter needs a course on how to pour wine, as he filled our glasses to the brim every chance he got. We both had full glasses and were planning on taking the rest of our bottle home but he dumped the rest into our glasses and ran off with the empty bottle. It was pretty strange service. Pizza - We got the sausage pizza and although it tasted good enough, the crust was a major disappointment. They are emphasizing their wood fired oven that cooks pizza super fast, but I think they need to leave the pizzas in a little longer. Our pizza's crust was only crispy on the edges, and when I lifted a piece off the pan it flopped over and all the cheeze/sausage slid right off. When you go out for thin crust, you want a nice crispy crust and not the "soupy" version we got here. Given that it's right in our neighborhood and so new, I'm willing to give it another try after they have worked some of the kinks out.

13.description: lovely place with very good food and nice service. The  lore of the Old Town trattoria scene maintains that Toppo Gigio started it, then bought the property across the street (current location).  That spot became Trattoria Roma (now Woodies).  Dinottos located around the corner on North Ave. All three of these places have some connection with the people involved. Allegedly, this was the nucleus of  a Chicago Italian  restaurant style that was something  other than Italian/American red gravy.Go figure. The 1551 Wine bar failed at this spot, the rent went crazy on the North/Wells corner (now alll empty) and Dintto gets certified as a Neapolitan Pizza expert, imports a super high end oven (which is reflected in the excellent pies) and Bob's your Uncle!  I intend to become a regular here as I uncover the menu options.  The chicken dishes were excellent.  The pizza is fantastic and expensive.  My pie of the day did not include the green peppers as noted and was $18.  They have lunchtime pies for $10--a great value.  We had a caesar salad that was very ordinary for $7 and they did not offer bread. Had these 2 items been absent, I would give five stars.  I will be back.   They do know how to cook here.NOTE--a friend of mine, who is a very fussy restaurant customer and is Italian/American always talks about Italian restaurants where everything tastes the same.  This is not the case here!

4.description: So good! Went with a party of 3 and some of the best things I have ever had! We started off with the Bruschetta and got small pizzas and pasta entrées. Everything was delish but BOY I wish I could remember the name of the eggplant/ricotta dish because I Kid you not If I could of I would of lick the plate clean!! So Good! The service was very attentive and no rush for us to leave. I had a great time :)

24.description: We spent more than $400 on the patio on a nice day. The owner KICKED US out so he could have the table for dinner.

6.description: Was here last night 10/02 with my gf. We tried their $21 pizza & pasta. Now, if you're a dinosaur don't eat here. Food is in small portions & pizzas are thin as hell like they ran out of dough.

22.description: Amazing pizza, great drinks, great salad, great service. Yes. Service was friendly and attentive, even when we were in a hurry to get to our nearby second city show.

15.description: If you find yourself in Old Town, do yourself a favor and stop at Dinotto Pizza e Vino. They have the best pizza in town .  Baked in a wood-burning oven.  Try the Caprese salad, or grilled calamari.  Their Rotolo is one of the best I've ever tried! Love the ambiance!

40.description: Very enjoyable experience. We decided to order main course only after finishing appetisers, and that made the pace of the meal just right. Polenta fries excellent. I had chicken Milanese, which was good, not dried out. Others had different pasta dishes: portions just right for the prices, tasty. Panetone was enough for three to share. Waiter was attentive and not clingy. Prices reasonable, so perhaps 4.5 stars deserved. Music was a bit loud, even if it kept the background chatter level down.

7.description: Love Dinotto. The Hungry hound led me here. Very pleased with the food and service.  Great pizza chef. Yum.

36.description: Very cozy room for a cold Chicago night. The service here is endearing; some of the servers act like they own the place. In a good way: I think they actually do, and my favorite restaurants are those where the owners and chefs come out and chat with their guests--and actually make you feel like one. I like the vibe here much more than I did Dinotto on North. (Not that there was anything wrong with that joint.)We started with cocktails, which is a Friday Night Club tradition with my friends. I had the Monkey Tail. If my memory serves me, it had whiskey and Frangelico, among other ingredients. Regardless, it was good, but the flavor and bite of the whiskey could have been a little more aggressive. The polenta fries were wonderful starters, crisp on the outside and soft on the inside, though I'm not a huge mayo guy; so I might have paired them with a spicy tomato sauce. Then again, I'm not the chef. The meatballs were fine, but uninspiring to my palate. I had the Barese pizza, and it was dynamite, the crust cooked perfectly crisp with just a hint of char, fragrant fennel sausage and just the right amount of caramelized onions. At first look, I thought there wasn't enough fresh mozzarella, but it was a perfect accompaniment rather than being the prime instrument in the dish.The six of us rotated the tiramisu and panna cotta around the table until they disappeared, the former with delicious, well-defined flavors and the latter more subtle, but equally good, each a good complement to the other.Our eyes bulged at the bill in the end, but we were eating, drinking and being merry--especially drinking--and those cocktails and wine bottles add up! So let that be a lesson about the effects of alcohol, kids.

30.description: This is my kind of date night spot! Living in Chicago you try to avoid the major pizza restaurants and hour long waits. We put our name in and got a table in less than 30 minutes. Great wine list and amazing appetizers!

3.description: Very cozy room for a cold Chicago night. The service here is endearing; some of the servers act like they own the place. In a good way: I think they actually do, and my favorite restaurants are those where the owners and chefs come out and chat with their guests--and actually make you feel like one. I like the vibe here much more than I did Dinotto on North. (Not that there was anything wrong with that joint.)We started with cocktails, which is a Friday Night Club tradition with my friends. I had the Monkey Tail. If my memory serves me, it had whiskey and Frangelico, among other ingredients. Regardless, it was good, but the flavor and bite of the whiskey could have been a little more aggressive. The polenta fries were wonderful starters, crisp on the outside and soft on the inside, though I'm not a huge mayo guy; so I might have paired them with a spicy tomato sauce. Then again, I'm not the chef. The meatballs were fine, but uninspiring to my palate. I had the Barese pizza, and it was dynamite, the crust cooked perfectly crisp with just a hint of char, fragrant fennel sausage and just the right amount of caramelized onions. At first look, I thought there wasn't enough fresh mozzarella, but it was a perfect accompaniment rather than being the prime instrument in the dish.The six of us rotated the tiramisu and panna cotta around the table until they disappeared, the former with delicious, well-defined flavors and the latter more subtle, but equally good, each a good complement to the other.Our eyes bulged at the bill in the end, but we were eating, drinking and being merry--especially drinking--and those cocktails and wine bottles add up! So let that be a lesson about the effects of alcohol, kids.

14.description: Bellissima!Hey Old Towners - Have you heard?  Dinotto's has a new Ristorante specializing in Neapolitan style pizzas cooked in an oven imported from Naples!And guess what?  It's delicioso!I was craving some of that Neapolitan pizza goodness, so I suggested it as a venue for a recent dinner out with my best gal pals.  It was a perfect venue.  Right on a hopping stretch of Wells in the heart of Old Town.  Cozy.  Comfortable seating.  Nice enough to be a good destination, but not stuffy.  Just what we wanted.Having only been open for I think 1 day, they don't have their liquor license yet, but it's anticipated to arrive in the next few weeks, so if you're speedy, you can bring in a bottle of vino to compliment your Italian feast.On the the food.Swoon.We sampled the polenta fries (to die), arugula salad, burrata and arancini.  All were fab, but the real winners were the polenta fries with their crispy exterior and creamy center served with truffled mayo dipping sauce and the creamy, dreamy burrata with toast and an arugula salad.  The pizza was amazing, too.  We sampled the simple and perfect margherita, sausage, 4 cheese and prosciutto.  I love, love, loved the prosciutto.  I also fell for the margherita.  The crust is nicely charred and chewy and just thick enough to hold up the toppings.The prices are a hair high, but given the neighborhood it's to be expected.  Pizzas ran anywhere from 13-20 bucks.I would absolutely go again.  Dare I say I enjoyed the pizza better than Spacca Nappoli???

58.description: Great Place, Great Management, Great Staff & Great People, I am real fan of this spot and I have a good time every time I'm there.

56.description: I love Suite Lounge. It's usually my first choice for a night out with friends. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. Reserving a table is a painless experience. The cocktails are definitely worth trying. I love the atmosphere, although it can get pretty crowded and loud on the weekends (it's a long narrow space). I love that the crowd is diverse and that I've only had to wait in line here once or twice. Neither time was very long and I recommend passing the time by chatting with whoever happens to be working the door.There are still curtains on the stalls but the sliding glass doors have been replaced with wooden doors.

29.description: I kind of was hesitant to write a review about this place because I feel like its my little hidden gem in Old Town!A black canopy with its name in bold white letters is really the only indication this this bar exists. Its tucked in the basement of a building with a cave like atmosphere. Its dark and cozy with a great ambiance. All the staff is super nice and accommodating. They allow private parties to be thrown here (I was thinking about doing my birthday party this year). They have a DJ who is amazing in the back part of the bar. He is super nice about taking requests and turns the back bar into a dance floor. Its open till 3. I live in Old Town so when we venture to the strip, Suite Lounge is usually the only place we go!

42.description: Don't waste your time... this place sucks.

23.description: This place is great for groups when drinks are what you're all after. Food not do much. Good time though.

47.description: Old Town is not my idea of a good time, but I came here for a birthday party.  We had the front room reserved, and it was nice.  It's fairly small, but has some seating, so that's a plus.  The bar itself is kind of cool, it has like a wine cellar feel.  The bathrooms are nice, but the curtain "doors" are confusing because it's hard to tell if someone is in there or just forgot to leave the curtain open.  And two stalls are really not enough, this place gets pretty packed.The bar purports to serve craft cocktails, and the drink menu looked promising, but the execution is not exactly on par with the numerous great cocktail spots the city has to offer.  Having been to Sable the night before, Suite Lounge was a let down.  Even the French 75, a favorite of mine, was ruined by using Tanqueray.  The gin and pear liqueur drink tasted like a sugary drink you could order anywhere.  If it hadn't claimed to be a craft cocktail bar, my expectations would have been more modest.I'll stick with real craft cocktails spots in the future.

8.description: Four stars??? For what? My boyfriend came here for happy hour drinks soon after they opened for the evening. There was only one person working- he was the bouncer, the DJ, the bartender, and the cashier. The multitasking is fine, but dude, wash your hands if you're gonna make my drink. The drink specials for happy hour are pretty lame. The prices do not all match up with the advertisements and signs outside-- deceiving. There is only one cocktail drink special and it's not posted anywhere. We had to ask. Sadly, it wasn't good at all and tasted like watered down soda with no alcohol. Everything else on the menu was pretty pricey. Perhaps this is not a place for "happy hour" but more of a late-night kinda deal. Too bad I'll never find out... So many other options in Chicago to check out when I'm back!

31.description: Much more my speed! Classy, yet sporty.Place was dead. It was only 630pm. With their happy hour. That confused me.But I chatted up their bartender for an hour. He was witty & had character. He attended nicely to me. Absolute winAMAZING CONVERSATION.And his family is from NYC.Revisited my childhood and college years with him.Music amazing too. Rap, alternative, contemporary, R&B, etc...Drinks super strong!Perfect bar visitWinning status.Ok!

34.description: I hadn't been here in at least 2 years, but came a couple of weeks ago at the suggestion of some friends. The music was SO good! Everything that I would want to hear to get me in the zone. Love it!

16.description: Much more my speed! Classy, yet sporty.Place was dead. It was only 630pm. With their happy hour. That confused me.But I chatted up their bartender for an hour. He was witty & had character. He attended nicely to me. Absolute winAMAZING CONVERSATION.And his family is from NYC.Revisited my childhood and college years with him.Music amazing too. Rap, alternative, contemporary, R&B, etc...Drinks super strong!Perfect bar visitWinning status.Ok!

13.description: Coat Hooks: noAlso: pretty cool despite the giant pile of coats taking up space in our booth. decent option when you're in the neighborhood.

11.description: We came in around 1am on a Monday night. It was only us and the bartender. I felt a bit guilty because I'm pretty sure he wanted to close early before we arrived. Look for an awning with an "S" from the street. The entrance is located on the left side followed by a set of stairs going down.Their drink menu is pretty cool. I ordered the Pretty Princess martini which was rimmed with sugar. It was sweet, but not my glass of alcohol. I don't like drinks where you can taste the alcohol. The birthday girl in our group didn't like her drink too much either. It's our problem we don't know how to drink. The bartender was kind enough to make her another drink. I tasted it and it was good with cream cheese frosting on the rim. He also made a fantastic chocolate concoction for her. He offered to make me another drink too, but I felt guilty so I declined his generous offer. The bartender is what made the lounge 5 star worthy.

39.description: I was looking for a venue to host a surprise engagement party with 30 guests; something casual, laid-back and reasonably priced.  I decided on the Suite Lounge and couldn't have been happier with my decision; the venue and staff exceeded all of my expectations!I had coordinated with Michelle (GM) for nearly 3 months, working to plan and finalize all details (e.g., decorations, drinks, music).  She and her staff were attentive, flexible and prompt.  We had the "back bar" area reserved for us, equipped with a personal bar, several bar-stools and 5-6 cocktail tables. There were no minimum or space rental fees required (which is rare to find given the location and size of the party).The ambiance is reminiscent of a modern/chic speak-easy; quaint, yet not overcrowded, with a fantastic DJ.  The location is perfect for cabs, food and other late-night bars.  Overall, I'd highly recommend the Suite Lounge and am looking forward to going back soon!

37.description: Came here this past Saturday and I LOOOOOOVE IT!!!! Music is always AWESOME!! The bartender, Wilson, is great!! I can't brag enough about this place. I found it on Google looking a new place to try and have been hooked ever since, and that was over 2 years ago!! I wish it wasn't so expensive to reserve a table.

0.description: Awesome underground bar lounge in Old Town along the strip of Wells street bars between Schiller and North Ave. All of the bartenders are all pretty cool, down to earth and super easy to talk to. Friday's and Saturdays are the most poppin' nights here and they usually have a DJ spinning in the back. I once ran into Shawn Marion from the Dallas Mavericks here once and gave him a high five. Definitely a memorable night!Anyways, worth a stop if you looking to grab drinks and your rolling with a group. Music isn't too loud so grab a seat and catch up with your friends! I recommend their Old Town Hattan, their spin on a traditional Manhattan using woodford reserve & not bad for $11! 'Til next time, cheers!
