38.description: was here a few weeks ago after a long night elsewhere :)I was here a few years ago and I was served drinks in a plastic cup.I dont remember if it was plastic this time or now.On a Thursday night after 9PM it was packed to the gills with people.Also is a good place to go after the wine crush on wells which is in a few weeksIM just sayin"

51.description: Was visiting some friends in Chicago who live in the Old Town area. We wanted a place to lounge, have few drinks and listen to music. Just randomly walked into this place and it turned out to be a good choice.Its a small cozy place, they play good music and I was able to get drinks without waiting in line too long. They have a small area I believe you can rent out for private parties.The crowd seemed to be young professionals just hanging out having a good time.Overall I would visit this place again if I am in the area. My go to lounge in Old Town.

27.description: This is a great place for chilling out to some cocktails. We come here often for either a pre or post dinner drink. They have one of my favorite cocktails in the city: the Gin Tartara! It consists of Gin, Pear Liquor, St. Germain, housemade ginger simple syrup, and lime. The staff is always super friendly and attentive. The place is below ground level, and lo-lit with a very nice ambience.

32.description: i didn't find this place to be as impressive as it acclaimed it to be.  the drink names were more impressive than the actual drinks.  i got the mojito and it wasn't very strong, or very sweet.  it tasted like water down lime-ade.  prices are as you can imagine it to be for Old Town.  the space is quite small as well, and on a Saturday night it is very uncomfortable.  the DJ was great though.  that was probably the only reason why i found this place nice.  btw.  in the ladies' restroom, the doors are shower curtains so be cautious before flinging the curtains back.

54.description: Very comfortable bar with solid music both Friday and Saturday night.I frequent this spot often. It's where I learned that in order to have a good time you've gotta want a good time.Friends become family and this spot collects some great people.

48.description: No idea how I ended up here. Oh! Yes, no i remember... it was a suggestion from a friend of a friend. You know, the type who wants to "play it safe." In other words, Lame-o. My apartment is more spacious than this little hidden dungeon. Well, I suppose it's good if you're old town bar hopping but the crowd was MEH, not my cup of tea. Let's bizzounce.

44.description: This is not a place you get a bang for your buck. 12 dollar martinis then a tip and after 2 I still had no buzz whatsoever. I don't have the best job for making money, so blowing another 24 bucks on Pretty Princess martini's would have been tasty but not worth it. When I drink alcohol, I expect that I'll get a little buzz out of it, you know? Their black cherry martini tasted like straight plain vodka at first and I wish I had a little straw or something to twirl the flavors around for the entire drinking experience. The Pretty Princess which is a champagne based drink is delicious but halfway through you realize that you are sucking down something REALLY sweet and it almost becomes too much. Their raspberry mojitos were great though all around and drink sizes are a little larger than average but it's not like when you get a margarita at Caesar's. It's very dim, the music was good, and the 'party room' we were in was like a closet with an open door (space wise) I was not thrilled at all to be so uncomfortable the whole night.Overall though I had a nice time, mostly for the company I kept however, and that excludes the waitresses' who were flirting with other dudes for tips outside of our party and super unavailable and not that pleasant with our group whatsoever for whatever reason. Kind of pisses me off when that sort of thing occurs.

24.description: Drinks are great. Music is terrible my brother payed the DJ to change it up and gave him a different genre and they played one different song then continued with terrible music. I've been here twice and twice the same thing not somewhere I'd like to go again.I had my Birthday here and I wouldn't recommend anyone else have it here.

7.description: Came here around 1 am w/ a group of friends. Great place with a long bar, comfy booths, and a dance floor towards the back. The drinks are strong, yet they're so tasty you can't even tell (aka they pack a punch aka a great bang for your buck). I had The Blackberry Smash, which is a must if you're a fan of blackberries. Will definitely come back if I'm in the area!

49.description: Sa-weet little dungeonesque bar...it was seriously awesome.  A couple friends and I went here after checking out a festival in Lincoln Park.  We ordered some martinis and they were delish...and quite strong...excellent combination.My friend told me that it gets really crowded later in the evening .  We were there fairly early (7:00 PM) so we didn't have to fight any crowds.

40.description: This is probably my favorite bar in Old Town.  The atmosphere of this place alone is like a lit-up cave party.  The music is good, and you don't need a dance floor to dance around all shamelessly.  The bouncers and bartenders are always the sweetest and friendliest people that make you feel welcome.  I never waited long for a drink, and the place is always clean.  The drink selection is pretty good, but they could pick up their IPA selection a bit.  As long as this place remains unpretentious and stays away from the top 40s, I will be back here as much as I can!

53.description: I would give 0 stars if possible. The door staff is very rude and disrespectful to their patrons. There are plenty of other options in Old Town to choose from. Do not recommend this place at all.

30.description: Looks a little different from the website photos, and didn't realize it was underground. However, a nice off the beaten path spot in Old Town. Went to a party there, and the hostesses said Suite Lounge was one of the very few places in the area that didn't require a fee to reserve a space for the party, which was cool. The staff was nice, and can't say much about the drinks as drinks were provided with the event. However, a couple people kept ordering pop rocks martinis, and those looked fun. Would recommend stopping in if you're in the area.

46.description: I was looking for a place to celebrate my birthday.  I have pretty relaxed standards: a place to sit, preferably non-douche atmosphere, and plays music but isn't a club.  I randomly found this bar on here (had never been there prior), they already had great reviews.  I emailed a few places, but this place called me back right away.  They were very prompt in returning phone calls and emails, and confirming that I wanted certain things.  We had the penthouse area reserved for us, with a bottle (and It didn't cost an arm and a leg- like some places).  Everyone had a place to sit.  And about everyone in the group (about 20 people) was pleased with service and the bar itself.  I will definitely be back again! The noise level is loud- but not so that you can't carry on conversation, our waitress was very good, and very nice, and the overall feel of the bar is really cool and kind of cellar-chic.

1.description: #25The bartenders and servers are absolutely fantastic at Suite Lounge.  We fell into this place late on one of our crazy Chicago nights and were not disappointed.  We had been bar hopping (Fireplace, Pour House, Benchmark, yada, yada, yada...) and it turned into a "crawl" somehow, but that is a whole other story.Next stop: Suite Lounge.When we arrived, we were greeted by two of the friendliest bouncers this side of the Mason Dixon.  They were all, "Welcome to Suite, have a great time."  Okay, am I on an episode of Punked?  Where is Ashton?  Why are these bouncers so sweet? Well, not to worry, I mean I have never met bouncers this cool, but there is a first for everything.  And if this is any indicator of the bar service we are going to receive I am in for another great night in Chi-town.We had to meander down some interesting steps into an almost basement like atmosphere and into the packed out Suite Lounge. Upon entering the narrow, bizarre little space we were able to grab a table after a little group left and we had such a great time.  The music was wonderful, and the people were dancing everywhere.Suite offers several mixed (and strong) drinks and never had us wait long.  The service inside was perfect, so it was true--the bouncers were an excellent preview of the impeccable service inside (and down stairs).  They have this amazing martini menu that is absolutely ridiculously packed with options. Monday thru Thursday Suite offers drink specials including a $5 martini of the day--WOW! This is freaking awesome!  The people we came into contact with were all having fun dancing, drinking, etc., and were just as interesting as the martini menu.  I felt like I was at home in the Bay Area with all the culture and wonderment.   After perusing this plush martini menu, I chose the 007 martini and Lauren opted for the Pop Rock, yes, replete with freaking pop rock candy. WTF???  For a little over $10 a piece we got decent martinis--one with crazy candy all around the rim and a distinctly pink color, and the other very sophisticated and yummy.  I had one, and then I decided "fun" martinis are not my style, so I reverted back to a regular old vodka martini, which was every bit as delicious as I wanted it to be. We met a guy named Sean, I think he was either the manager or the owner from how much he attended to us, our needs and seemed to be interested in our whole "I lived here when I was young" but now I am from "out of town" doing the visiting thing.  He was genuinely interested in our trip and how we heard about the place.  I also would like to mention how pretty all the servers/bartenders were.  Great hiring Sean ;)Stephani Smiles for Suite Lounge ;)#dontwearstilettosonthosestairsifyouredrunk

55.description: I am totally a fan (mind you this review speaks for Friday only). The people were friendly, the music was BANGING, and the drinks were quite tasty. I came here because I was dying to check it out. When me and my friend arrived, we didn't know what to expect since there was a line outside to get it.. While we waited the security person was awesome and the lounge was fantastic for having a drink menu on display so we can decide on which craft cocktails we wanted.We walk down into the basement into this large space. People are grooving and drinking. My kinda spot. It didn't take us too long to get drinks either. The later we stayed, the more the place filtered out a bit, which was nice for us! If I didn't know any better, that could be a lot of people's pre-party spots if lounging is not their thing.I had an opportunity to talk to the DJ and he was MAD cool. He did an amazing job of bringing classics and today's top 40 together and seamlessly. I think my head rocked the entire time.I'll be back sooner than later! I am almost afraid to post this review.

9.description: For me, the highlight of any trip to Suite Lounge is to get drinks made by and to chat with Paul, the bartender.I personally prefer when it is quieter earlier in the evening here, but I've also been here when it is absolutely packed. The service is just as good either way.

26.description: This place is very cute and had a cool vibe to it. Not very big but the bartenders and waiters were very attentive. Usually in other places you have to beg bartenders to help you. The drinks make up for the lack of space and the horrible bathrooms. In the bathroom instead of stalls they have shower curtains. Or they look like big ugly brown shower curtains!!! The highlight of my night was definitely the prom queen drink! Saw it on one of the pictures on this page and thought I should try it. Boy I was happy I did!!! So it's  vodka and champagne which was rimmed with candy sugar yumm !!! Will be back to try the carrot cake martini !!! Fix your bathrooms and I will so give you the four stars!!!

25.description: Love it here! Had a few get togethers here and it was awesome! The staff is very friendly and the service is quick! The bottles are cheap, especially a place that's in the city. The location is great. The only possible downfalls are the bathrooms! The two stalls are divided by curtains and you can easily see the person next to you doing their thing.

12.description: Stopped in with some friends after a Second City show that were craving something sweet. At 6:30 the place was empty but that's to be expected at that time. The bartender was very friendly and eager to hear our opinions on the drinks. Everything was delicious! The key lime, black cherry, and carrot cake were to die for. And the chocoholic was strong but very tasty. Prices were about $12 per martini which seemed okay and service was great. Only thing that would be nice is some snack items. Since the drinks are strong just some popcorn or pretzels would help.

59.description: hands down my favorite bar in Chicago thus far.  It kind of reminds me of the old speakeasies in San Diego, California (Gaslamp district) in that it is underground and a bit dark.The bartenders are nice (a good mix between attentive and indifferent), the drinks are great (although they'll run you about $9 a drink if i remember correctly), and there tends to be no line if you go early enough.The bathroom is a bit weird, as the other reviewers have stated, but honestly...it wasn't that bad, guys.Good music and not overly loud.I can't wait to go back.

21.description: I love this lounge.  Jason is a great bartender! Chill music, relaxed atmosphere... my creed (Desiderata) is the owners' creed as well... it's #fate.  Check it out if you want a chill night with friends... you can dance if you want ;)

17.description: Suite Lounge is a nice bar that really stands out among some of the more "frat" spots in Old Town.  The place is small, but I would describe it more as intimate.  There are fun and flirty cocktails if you like the sweeter side or drinks like an old fashioned if you want something a little more traditional.  Great for a night cap with a girlfriend or a date with a guy friend ;-)

10.description: Was visiting from LA and met up with a friend. She suggested this place saying she has a great time every time she's here. We were not disappointed! Wasn't too crowded at the time we went and we managed to find a table & couch to the side. it was a great spot to talk and catch up!What made our experience really stand out was our bartender/server person -- Bridget! She was very patient with our drunk asses (haha) and was helpful and friendly. She gave us suggestions on what to get, was so nice, and had a positive attitude. Thanks Bridget! :)

5.description: I have to say, this place strikes me as bit eclectic but a fun hole in the wall, errr ground as the case may be.  As you descend the small staircase into the burrows of the establishment, the smell of cheap perfume and booze rush up to meet you.  The thrum of the music let's you know this could be a fun time.  The bar is a bit small and feels incredibly intimate.  If you aren't comfortable squeezing in at the bar or one of the small tables with your friends while strangers gyrate to the music right next to you, this might not be your place.  I felt the music selection was mean to appeal to the 25-35 something demographic, so I found it enjoyable.  Drinks were decent and relatively well priced.

3.description: Two words . . ."Killer Martinis".But if you need more incentive . . read on my friends . . .read on.You might have to be looking for this place as the small doorway has had me walking right by for many years.  Go down the stairs and you will find yourself in a cozy environment, perfect for that martini you were craving.Not craving a martini?  No problem.  The bartenders here can pretty much create any drink known to man, but those martinis are really special (I think they have mind altering components in them . .but that's another story for another day!)We stayed, we drank, we drank some more. And then we left.And the story must end there.  For what happens at the Suite Lounge . . .really needs to stay at the Suite Lounge.

35.description: I threw a cocktail party here last year for about 15 people, we had a great time. I am looking at planning another party here this Christmas.

19.description: We stopped by this place as we worked our way back to the hotel. I love underground bars. The entrance was very nice as was the interior. It was empty but it was a Sunday night and it was raining out which is fine because we don't like crowded areas. Especially not bars with the obnoxious crowd that's ballin on a budget. We are about quality not quantity and this place is all high quality. Plus the bartender was extremely friendly and took the time to converse with us. We'll be back.

28.description: Cute place with nice booths and tables.  Lively atmosphere!This place gets crazy as the night goes on!  I had a glass of wine there but my girlfriends ordered some of the martini drinks and raved about them. My glass of wine was okay, so I would probably try one of their cocktails next time.  The servers are super friendly and keep checking on you. If you get there early enough, you can easily snag a cool booth and do some great people watching as the night goes on!

45.description: I had been searching for a long time on where to have my birthday. I decided on suite lounge because of the good reviews and great pictures. I called ahead and rsvpd bottle service for 10-15 people in the penthouse. The atmosphere is classy and laid back. The music is great as well, but not a big place for dancing. The dress code seemed pretty laid back and definitely not what my group was expecting (a lot of people in the crowd were wearing jeans). Our bartender was great i wish i could remember her name. My only complaint was that i had reserved the section for 10-15 people, and was told that my party can come between 10-10:30 no line, and after 10:30 they had to wait in line. I was okay with that until my friends got to the front of the line at 11 something and was told that we were at full capacity REGARDLESS OF MY RSVP. BEST PART WAS I ONLY HAD 6 PEOPLE AT MY SECTION SO FAR. After calling my friends and having them return i had to bring 2 employees outside to try and tell the door man that i had purchased a bottle and have a reservation. My section was not crowded what so ever so i don't understand how they could have promised me 10-15 people in my rsvp. All together everyone was very nice but i do not recommend coming here for a birthday event if you want to make sure all of your friends get in. This is more of a place to go after work for a few drinks.

33.description: I have been here twice on Saturday nights. It does get relatively full but not until after 10pm. I have tried a few of their martinis and loved them all. Great place to go for a date night or with a group of friends. You walk down into the bar with dim lighting and a cave-like feel. Great spot to go after dinner for drinks. The old-school mainstream music is a bit loud but gives it a more upbeat, lively feel.

43.description: We went on a Sunday night after a wedding. The bar knew we were coming and had the front bar. They worked with the group and had some vodka, lemonade and ice buckets to make our own refreshing cocktails. The basement look and feel was awesome. I did think it was a bit warm in there, there may be a ventilation issue. If I'm back in Chicago I'd check it out again.

2.description: Had the best night here while visiting Chicago. If you're a 90's music fiend, this is it! Go down a hallway off Wells St. in old town, and you get to this lounge. Down the stairs, and you're in some musical time warp. There's great cocktails for cheap (LA standards), and the service is spot on. Waitress checked on us multiple times in the night without being pushy, and the bartender took a free shot with us at the end of the night just for coming in. Had no problem snagging a premier booth for the night around 10pm, and it was full of people but not packed to the point of being uncomfortable or no longer full. Great crowd, with everyone having a blast and being midwestern nice.We loved it so much we tried to come back here every other night we were visiting the city. Highly recommended for a girls night out, friends bar crawl, or any other excuse you want to knock a few down and dance the night away. Would kill to have a neighborhood bar like this in my hometown!

18.description: was here a few weeks ago after a long night elsewhere :)I was here a few years ago and I was served drinks in a plastic cup.I dont remember if it was plastic this time or now.On a Thursday night after 9PM it was packed to the gills with people.Also is a good place to go after the wine crush on wells which is in a few weeksIM just sayin"

41.description: just hosted an 18-girls' event and they were great to work with -- good service, good music, spacious, okay crowd but who cares when it's 18 of us bringing the party ourselves..

52.description: Came here to celebrate a friend's promotion, but I was also here the week before, that is why we decided to come back!  What a lovely cozy place to hang with friends, it's not a club club, it's quiet small and is set up more of a lounge.  The place is underground, looks like your going into a dungeon almost.  Love the seating arrangements and the decor (at this time of year, they put up a Christmas tree)The only negative part is finding parking.  The valet guys usually close by 11, but since I couldn't find parking, they were nice enough to valet it for an hour and at 11, they found me a parking spot in front of the place.  Which is nice of them...obviously I still payed for that stupid hour but I appreciated their assistance in finding me a close spot.Must check out, it's in Old Town, great area to bar hop and whatnot.

50.description: I was here for my last birthday in April and I have to say I had fun. The drinks are good and the staff is very nice. The place is very narrow and small but it's a nice place to hangout and have some drinks.

4.description: I came here for a friend's birthday party on a Saturday night and had a very enjoyable time.Décor: It's very easy to find the entry (from the sidewalk) but once I was past the bouncer I was immediately confused... all I saw was an alleyway! Luckily a bachelorette party came up the stairs and out the doorway immediately to my left so I was back on track from there. Once downstairs it's a cool lounge space. It's longer than it is wide but they have two bars and an overall chill feel. We had a reserved table up near the front, which was nice because it became rather crowded in the rear (where you, unfortunately have to fight your way through to get to the bathrooms). The bouncers did a great job of monitoring the amount of people b/c it was never to a point that I'd describe as "over crowded." Anyway, nice place, pretty clean, dimly lit (keeps the mood) and entertaining DJ (just music though, no one was really dancing).Bathroom: typical bar bathroom, not the cleanest place but it is well lit and not deplorably filthyStaff: Our waitress was terrible, so I just went to the bar. The bartender, I forget her name, was totally awesome though. She was VERY fast with drinks, super chill, and was a delight to chat with. The moment that really stuck out in my mind was when someone in our group ended up not liking the drink she ordered and our bartender made her something different. What a total class act. A+ service!Drinks: They have a full bar and a SOLID selection of bourbon. I mean, they have Blanton's so I was in heaven. They also make a bunch of signature cocktails (martinis) that people really seemed to enjoy. Fun fact, they have 40oz. of Miller High Life! Haha Everything was great and they have a heavy handed pour as well.Value: This place is worth every penny. GREAT service (except our waitress...), delicious drinks, prices on par - such great value for your money.I was unsure how this place was going to turn out, I was afraid of it being populated by a much younger crowd, but it totally surpassed expectation. This place is a gem and I cannot wait to come back for more drinks or another party (either a friend's or my own!)

6.description: We came here on Saturday for some drinks after a show at the Second City. It was empty, which was actually kind of nice. The bartenders were very friendly and the menu was big. I liked the variety of drinks, but I guess I expected ice cream-based cocktails, I don't know why. I had the Pretty Princess and the Chocoholic. The Pretty Princess was beautiful and pink with pink sprinkles and it was very good. I like X-rated liquer, so this was perfect for me! The Chocoholic was just okay, too strong for me so I gave it to my friend. I liked the Oreos on the rim though. My friends had a bunch of different stuff, including the Carrot Cake, Cappucino, and the Cat's Pajamas. I liked the Cat's Pajamas and I was the odd man out who didn't like the Cappucino cocktail, I'm not much of a coffee drinker though, so that could be it. Cocktails were about $12/each, which wasn't terrible for the amount of booze you were getting. I do wish they had a tiny munchies menu or something, because we ended up walking down the street for food afterwards. It would have been nice to stay in the same place all night. I am giving three stars because in my opinion, ALL the drinks were incredibly strong, which is a good value, but it's not good for just a casual drink. You come here to get drunk. I ordered a Moscow Mule and it was mostly vodka with a tiny hint of ginger. Also, they need to be more honest about their specials. I checked in on Facebook because there was a banner saying that you get 15% if you check in, and when I showed the bartender, he said it was only on weekdays. The banner doesn't say that. Oh well. Not a terrible experience, the space is very nice and cozy, especially now for winter and it's very modern looking.

22.description: Just want to give a quick shout out to suite lounge. Had my birthday party here last weekend and had one of the best times! My friends all enjoyed the place too. Good music, awesome bar tenders and the layout itself was really clean. Will definitely be back

15.description: Cute place with nice booths and tables.  Lively atmosphere!This place gets crazy as the night goes on!  I had a glass of wine there but my girlfriends ordered some of the martini drinks and raved about them. My glass of wine was okay, so I would probably try one of their cocktails next time.  The servers are super friendly and keep checking on you. If you get there early enough, you can easily snag a cool booth and do some great people watching as the night goes on!

57.description: Specialty martinis and cocktails are a must-try. I got three different drinks and they were all awesome and not watered down. Paulie is a great bartender, very kind and knowledgeable. The great drinks really made my experience here. I cannot speak to the pricing as, due to circumstances beyond my control, I did not pay and do not know the prices! But they were well made and I would expect ~$9-10 reasonably.The atmosphere was not really totally my style. The layout makes it a bit cramped when it gets busy. ("A bit" may be an understatement on a very very busy night!) There was a mix of semi-hipsters, bros, and girls who looked bachelorette-ish. Music was decent on the night I was there (a friday night).The absolute worst was the bathroom! What kind of place doesn't have stall doors??? I don't know if they were in the process of remodeling or what, but the two "stalls" were sectioned off by curtains. You couldn't tell if anyone was in it so basically not being walked in on would be a rarity. Plus the door opens so that pretty much anyone could see right in to the virtually open stalls. This creeped me out, I definitely would not want to spend the whole night at this bar for fear I would have to go use the restroom more than once.

20.description: Decent place as far as lounges go....drinks were expensive....as to be expected. I like that it was super casual  and the bouncer was cool and when I  asked if it was cool to park my bike in front, he suggested to park across the street since the valet might think it was in d way. Waitress never came around to serve any of us at the table though. I also ran into the mirror tgsts in d back of the room...lol

36.description: We came in around 1am on a Monday night. It was only us and the bartender. I felt a bit guilty because I'm pretty sure he wanted to close early before we arrived. Look for an awning with an "S" from the street. The entrance is located on the left side followed by a set of stairs going down.Their drink menu is pretty cool. I ordered the Pretty Princess martini which was rimmed with sugar. It was sweet, but not my glass of alcohol. I don't like drinks where you can taste the alcohol. The birthday girl in our group didn't like her drink too much either. It's our problem we don't know how to drink. The bartender was kind enough to make her another drink. I tasted it and it was good with cream cheese frosting on the rim. He also made a fantastic chocolate concoction for her. He offered to make me another drink too, but I felt guilty so I declined his generous offer. The bartender is what made the lounge 5 star worthy.

14.description: I visited the Suite Lounge on a Sunday night. Great relaxing atmosphere. Excellent customer service. I loved the pretty princess martini. It is delicious and fun.

3.description: It's brand new so why in the world doesn't the WIFi work here?  The Barista told me it's because of the 10 teenagers gathered there after school but I work at other locations regularly and share WIFI connection with easily 20 people at a time, just making excuses.  Most of the seating here is at a communal counter which is killer on your back and doesn't give you much room away from teen chatter.  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone over 18 trying to get anything done.  And, of course, it's cold in there.

1.description: I love this Starbucks! It is in the middle of Old Town and so convenient. I like this one better than the one on Division. It is very modern styled and usually has just enough people to not feel overly crowded but not too empty. They also serve cold pressed coffee which is AMAZING. It is like iced coffee with a kick. They have amazing baristas who explain the processes to you and are always very eager to help. I highly recommend this Starbucks!

2.description: Great Starbucks when the weather is warm because it has outside seating on both Wells and Scott.  It has a decent amount of space inside, most of it is dedicated to elevated seating which I don't find very comfortable.  Other than that, the service is friendly, decently quick and they have a clover.  This location doesn't seem to be overly busy (which is good) because of the North Ave and Division locations.

0.description: Really great and accommodating staff. They have some comfy seats and a great patio. I also like that it's less crowded than the other Starbucks nearby so it seems quieter and more cozy!

4.description: It's a brand new Starbucks and is very nice in that regard. The WiFi, however, is TERRIBLY SLOW! I heartily recommend going somewhere else if you have work to do that requires WiFi.

58.description: Went here on a Tuesday night and it was fairly busy. I think it was a service industry event. The special was pretty decent with five dollar fatpour drafts and three dollar tacos. I had the Greek burger though and i think it is easily one of the best burgers I've had in Chicago hands down. The tunes were good too. New manager too who is eager to please.

56.description: Updated Review: Upon seeing my initial review (below), Blanca, the manager at Woodie's, reached out to me and invited me and my boyfriend back to give WF another shot. This was very sweet of her (I Yelp a lot and no one has ever taken the time to do this). Anyway, we went back last night and honestly had such a great time! Even though it was March Madness and games were playing it wasn't unpleasantly loud at all, which was great. And our server was Amy (I swear that was her name...), and she's amazing, so kudos to her. My BF got the burger with bacon and an egg on it and basically devoured it. I got the WFC (Woodie's Flat Chicken) and man, that's a lot of food! Also, super tasty. It comes with a biscuit, bacon mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. SO good. And the chicken was perfectly cooked. I got to meet Blanca and she was super sweet, and ended up giving us a discount, which was a lovely gesture we really appreciated. Anyway, I'm converted. Food, service, ambiance all top-notch. We'll definitely be back for more. Thanks again, Blanca!

29.description: Their Fireball is fresh, lines are long, music videos old #jarule #gobucks #flamingfishbowls

42.description: Went there last night and was berated by the bouncer over seating, literally screamed at like a child. Meanwhile I was completely sober, 1 beer in, and behaving myself. He looked like the guy from the Miller High Life commercial but acted like he was doing me a favor by letting this bar charge me $10 a beer. The idea is supposed to be that you pay more but get some intangible, like service.  Instead I got some bouncer on a power trip. Won't be returning.

23.description: Great establishment that you can take your buddies or family to. Different dynamic at different hours is suiting for the neighborhood. Also, the food is really quite good, especially for a bar that is currently categorized as a "dive bar." 2 thumbs up.

47.description: Cool spot, nothing to write home about. I enjoyed my Bloody Mary, chicken & waffle bites and trailer trash tacos. I'd definitely go back if I'm in the neighborhood.

8.description: Okay.  Before you all start scratching your heads wondering what I was doing in this place, a place that is clearly for a younger crowd than the one I run around with, I was there for Sunday brunch.I think the manager was as surprised as we were that we were there as he came over and warmly welcomed us, telling us after we asked, that the average age was usually in the mid 20's but if we came early in the evening, we'd be okay.  Ha!  Made me laugh!  Figured we took his average age up for the month!!!But back to brunch.  Not bad although know that it's a bar that serves some egg products and pancakes.  I was in a good place with the salad I ordered but my friend's scrambled eggs and bacon were a little uninspired.  But they got my other friends special order perfect so big points for that.  And if you like cheap drinks, the mimosas and bloodies are on sale during brunch which is perfect for the clientele.The inside is actually very cute with sort of a northwoods ambiance.  AndI liked the multi colored stools around the communal tables.  Our server was nice as was the bartender and the food came up relatively quickly.All in all, I doubt Woodies is going to be my new "go to" spot, but in a pinch when you want something and all the other places are packed, it's worth a stop in to enjoy a bloody out front watching the world walk by.

31.description: Barely got in here because we weren't 21 even though we just wanted to eat. They let us in and gave us a tiny table. It was really loud inside, to the point where you kind of have to scream a little just so you can be heard a few feet away but it was a very cool place. I got the Mac attack burger which was really good! I loved the bacon Mac and cheese spin to it, especially with the sriracha mayo. It wasn't spicy at all but a very creamy, juicy burger. It also came with a side salad which was nice. We also ordered some sweet potato fries which were very standard. The service was extremely slow though throughout the meal, even just bringing back out credit cards even though the place was empty. Overall the food here is good but don't make the same mistake we did of just stopping by because we were hungry, it's definitely more about the socializing and the experience.

34.description: Stopped in for dinner after Second City show on a Monday night.  Lucky us, the woodies burger was the special of the night!  We each got a burger and beer.  I ordered my burger with a turkey party fully expecting to pay full price, but my burger was on special as well.  The cheapest meal we had during our week in Chicago and one of the tastiest.  Great burgers, solid beer, and great service.  Decided to write a review nearly a week later based on a terrible experience I had at Stout burger in Louisville yesterday.  Made me long for a meal at Woodies and realized more people need to know about good burger joints.

16.description: After walking by a thousand times we decided to come in on a weekend afternoon. We were seated upstairs and immediately I was impressed with the unique retro decor and ambiance. It's a really cool place with a cool vibe. I had the Baja Shrimp tacos and they were great! A little kick to them but the slaw with mango salsa ontop balanced it out. I would love to come back and try a burger or since that looks like more their forte, but for a first time try it was good!

13.description: Woodies is definitely a place worth trying in the Old Town/Wells area. It's welcoming from the street, with music and a nice outdoor seating area. We were seated on the second floor. The atmosphere is nice, some of the decorations are a bit cheesy but overall it's a nice space, that's been recently renovated. We were originally seated at a four seat high top table with a party of four.  We were were a bit cramped and asked if we could switch to a larger booth which included a pour your own beer style tap system. The manager was really welcoming and accommodating. It was barely noon and we were asking them if we could use the booth-side beer tap system and they were more than happy to turn it on and didn't charge us for the initial "foamy beers" which was much appreciated. We were torn between breakfast and lunch when we decided to order food. I ended up splitting a breakfast burger and a Mac attack with one of my friends. The breakfast burger was interesting, but good: a burger with bacon, cheese and a fried egg on top, on a French toast bun. The Mac attach burger is what really stole the show though. It was honestly one of the best burgers I've had in a long time. Great artisan/pretzel-y type bun, with a nice burger patty, cheese, bacon, of course the Mac and cheese on top and finished off with a Sriracha mayo. We barely spoke once the food was out lol. Woodies is a great spot to grab food and drinks with friends. The service was excellent, as well as the food. The do-it-yourself tap service was a fun novelty that we hadn't seen before. The frosted mugs they give you are a nice touch. The decor and plates could use some changes IMO, but everything is new, comfortable and clean. Overall, very satisfied with our decision to stop at Woodies.

11.description: Its one of the more fun bars on Wells for sure. The food is solid, good for bar food. I like the burgers, the Woodie turkey burger is pretty good, Umami is my favorite so far.The servers are really nice, however it seems a little short staffed most of the time. That said, the service is a little slow if you're at a table.The great thing about Woodies is the proximity to North Ave Beach and the Lincoln Park South fields. If you're on an intramural team, this is one of the best sponsorship deals in the area. They currently sponsor a kickball and volleyball team of mine, haven't let us down yet. Although it always seems busy, they easily find a table for our team.

39.description: Its one of the more fun bars on Wells for sure. The food is solid, good for bar food. I like the burgers, the Woodie turkey burger is pretty good, Umami is my favorite so far.The servers are really nice, however it seems a little short staffed most of the time. That said, the service is a little slow if you're at a table.The great thing about Woodies is the proximity to North Ave Beach and the Lincoln Park South fields. If you're on an intramural team, this is one of the best sponsorship deals in the area. They currently sponsor a kickball and volleyball team of mine, haven't let us down yet. Although it always seems busy, they easily find a table for our team.

37.description: Woodies is definitely a place worth trying in the Old Town/Wells area. It's welcoming from the street, with music and a nice outdoor seating area. We were seated on the second floor. The atmosphere is nice, some of the decorations are a bit cheesy but overall it's a nice space, that's been recently renovated. We were originally seated at a four seat high top table with a party of four.  We were were a bit cramped and asked if we could switch to a larger booth which included a pour your own beer style tap system. The manager was really welcoming and accommodating. It was barely noon and we were asking them if we could use the booth-side beer tap system and they were more than happy to turn it on and didn't charge us for the initial "foamy beers" which was much appreciated. We were torn between breakfast and lunch when we decided to order food. I ended up splitting a breakfast burger and a Mac attack with one of my friends. The breakfast burger was interesting, but good: a burger with bacon, cheese and a fried egg on top, on a French toast bun. The Mac attach burger is what really stole the show though. It was honestly one of the best burgers I've had in a long time. Great artisan/pretzel-y type bun, with a nice burger patty, cheese, bacon, of course the Mac and cheese on top and finished off with a Sriracha mayo. We barely spoke once the food was out lol. Woodies is a great spot to grab food and drinks with friends. The service was excellent, as well as the food. The do-it-yourself tap service was a fun novelty that we hadn't seen before. The frosted mugs they give you are a nice touch. The decor and plates could use some changes IMO, but everything is new, comfortable and clean. Overall, very satisfied with our decision to stop at Woodies.

0.description: I came here with 4 other people around 9pm on a Friday night. We were seated right away. They took us upstairs since it was packed downstairs. We got a booth. About 30 minutes later, the top floor was packed.I got the Mac Attack Burger with fries. There weren't many macaroni noodles on my burger but overall, it was still pretty good. It would have been better with more cheesy macaroni noodles though! The fries though- I did not like them at all. There wasn't much flavor to them and the texture was too crunchy for my taste. I also was not a fan of their fake paper plates and fake solo cup. I thought it was tacky. Also, they made their laminated menus purposely look stained... I don't get why they thought that added character...My hubby got the Big O Burger with fries. There were sooo many onion rings- it was deeelicous!Overall, pretty good. I'd come again to try some other burger. But not the fries!

38.description: Had such a great experience at Woodie's Flat! Thank you so much to our server Jess for her great hospitality. Looking forward to coming back soon!

51.description: Second time visiting here, and wow!  The food was fantastic, servers attentive, and ambiance was outstanding.  If you go, please make sure to try their pretzel sticks.  The dipping sauces are wonderful!  My husband and I plan to visit here as much as we can.  I can't wait to go back!!!

27.description: I live in the neighborhood so in reviewing I'm looking at how it is for sober dinner/a few drinks and out on the weekend. Weekday few drinks and dinner saved Woodies from zero stars and brought it up 2. Weekends here are awful. I have literally tried to go 10 times and every time is worse than the last (fool me once shame on you. Fool me twice shame on me ..fool me 10 times, I'm an idiot). They're always 1 in, 1 out. And rude- I'd be too if I were the bouncers here to be fair! They overbook birthdays- it's bad!! Not fun! Moral of the story- Stay clear on the weekends. If you can get an outdoor spot on a weekday, food is decent and large drink list.

32.description: The food here just wasn't up to par. The entire group of people I went with walked away pretty disappointed :/

54.description: Crazy friendly service! Good select and knowledge of local brews. If you like root beer Try the root beer on tap, strong stuff almost 10%apv. Chris perry the asst mgr was very helpful and very nice. The place can be on the LOUD side however. I luv it when bartenders alwAys face you and never turn their back to the customers. Remember to ask patrons ..."what would you change" in stead of how is everything? I'll be back

48.description: I wanted to like the food more than I did because this was a cool little spot... But the food was very basic and the beer selection for draft was not the best. We started with their Soggys and my guys liked them a lot, to me they were bland sandwiches cut up small to dip is basic broth. He had a turkey club, which was nothing special. And I have the Ramen noodle bowl, which was good, but nothing I would go back for. The service was very good and our server was right on point.  The place was clean and decorated in a hip retro feel. If I lived in the area I would go back... But go in knowing that the food is pretty basic.

44.description: We enjoyed the food so much that the table fell silent. There was no pretense of politeness amongst friends as we fought each other for the last bits.Those chicken and waffle bites! Those pretzel bites! That pork belly! Phenomenal food.

24.description: Last Sunday stopped for a Bears game.  Thinking we'll grab a drink and be on our way.  But, when we saw the food going to other tables, decided to stay awhile.  My Sister had Chicken Waffle Bites - All I can say is wholly goodness.  Hubby had a burger that he devoured.  The fries super crispy.  I had a Cesar salad that was above "bar" food quality.  Very good and fresh.  The atmosphere fun, relaxed and good service.  Don't pass this one up.

7.description: Great service and food that's affordable and taste good....what more could you ask for?!Came to Woodie's on a Sunday night with friends and received a warm greeting as soon as we came through the doors. The place was packed for a Sunday night which was a little surprising, but made the environment that much more exciting.For dinner I got the Mac Attack Burger which was so good my mouth is still watering. I ordered a side of sweet potato fries which were just OK.Dessert was the Skillet Cookie and we ate that faster than you could say, "the Bears traded who?!"I'll definitely be back go Woodie's Flat.

49.description: So, the service was good. The hostesses were great and they were training our server, but everything went well. We ordered the lettuce wraps were pretty decent (we'd give them a B+). But we ordered their bucket of wings, which was supposed to be their special of the night (but they weren't even discounted). One of the servers told us you get 5-6 pieces of chicken...we got 3. And the chicken wasn't even that great (a C-). The mac and cheese and potatoes they served with it were small portions and mediocre at best. It's an unfortunate review, but we were not satisfied.

40.description: Been here a number of times since many of our teams have been sponsored by woodies (which is a great deal by the way).Beer list is meh, just nothing special. I used to really enjoy woodies, food was always solid never too crowded but the last handful of times have changed. The menu is new which you would think is nice, but the higher crowds seem to have drastically effected good quality. Ordered the WFC, considered on of their specialties. I received school lunch quality mashed potatoes, that were cold by the way, Mac and cheese, and horribly overlooked/dry chicken wings. For $14 I could have actually gone to KFC and gotten much higher quality food (which isn't saying much).Overall, woodies is a decent spot they just need to improve consistency in the kitchen when serving larger crowds.

53.description: Okay.  Before you all start scratching your heads wondering what I was doing in this place, a place that is clearly for a younger crowd than the one I run around with, I was there for Sunday brunch.I think the manager was as surprised as we were that we were there as he came over and warmly welcomed us, telling us after we asked, that the average age was usually in the mid 20's but if we came early in the evening, we'd be okay.  Ha!  Made me laugh!  Figured we took his average age up for the month!!!But back to brunch.  Not bad although know that it's a bar that serves some egg products and pancakes.  I was in a good place with the salad I ordered but my friend's scrambled eggs and bacon were a little uninspired.  But they got my other friends special order perfect so big points for that.  And if you like cheap drinks, the mimosas and bloodies are on sale during brunch which is perfect for the clientele.The inside is actually very cute with sort of a northwoods ambiance.  AndI liked the multi colored stools around the communal tables.  Our server was nice as was the bartender and the food came up relatively quickly.All in all, I doubt Woodies is going to be my new "go to" spot, but in a pinch when you want something and all the other places are packed, it's worth a stop in to enjoy a bloody out front watching the world walk by.

30.description: Found this place while bike riding...had a taste for a salad. Too much meat, not enough veggies. Nachos were enormous, too sweet for my taste.

46.description: Food is legit! If you have a table of 4-5 people, split the pulled pork nachos. It's probably the biggest plate of nachos I've seen, and they don't skimp on the good stuff!Fried chicken was awesome with a sweet/spicy Asian dipping sauce. Service could improve but what can you expect at a bar.

1.description: 3 point 5 for me. Cruised thru for a late dinner with some friends looking to grab some beers at a reduced price. On Tuesdays they do $5 fat pours (22oz) of all draft beers... Squad going up, on a Tuesday! They also do $3 tacos on Tuesdays as well, but I'm a bit "taco'ed" out as of late. Website lists their daily specials if you're interested in knowing ahead of time!I really wanted to try their WFC bucket which was their fried chicken galore platter, but they were all out :( so I ended up going with their Porky's Revenge think of like a Cuban sandwich meets burger ~ lean pork patty, ham, Swiss, spicy mustard (dim sum places in Chicago pls take note), fried pickles, lettuce, tomato, and onion. I was a bit thrown off when the waitress asked how I wanted that cooked... Can you even eat pork undercooked? Well done, prease! -_- Anyways, my burger was a bit underwhelming and the sweet potato fries for my side was just aiiiite. Food wise I was actually enjoying taking bites of everyone else's food. My buddy ordered the double layer nachos with chicken which is large enough to split for two maybe even three people and no joke probably some of the best nachos I've had in Chicago. My gf ordered the foghorn leghorn sandwich which I enjoyed much more than my burger from the one or two bites that I took.Music selection here I recall being early to late 90s throwback. Good stuff! Anyone else notice the fluctuating heating / cooling system? No idea what was going on but there were times when the heater was blasting and then 5 min later the A/C was blasting. I prefer consistency prease!Anyways, that's all Fran wrote! 'til next time, cheers!

55.description: Stopped by with a friend around dinner time. Thursday specials include 1/2 off sangria pitchers, wine, salads, and wraps.We sat outside and ordered the sangria and I ordered the Foghorn Leghorn chicken sandwich and my friend ordered the cobb salad. The sangria was really good and refreshing even though it was getting cooler out. The chicken sandwich comes fried or grilled, I opted for fried. The sandwich is topped with crispy onions, lettuce, tomato and a house sauce. It's a fairly large sandwich and was quite  tasty. The fries were great too! Only thing is the plate was too small, so the food was falling off the edges onto the table. The cobb salad looked great and the ratio of lettuce to toppings, favored toppings. The salad came with diced grilled chicken, fresh avocado, hardboiled egg, choice of cheese, tomato and bacon. Seemed like a popular place as the inside was pretty busy and outdoor seating was occupied. Friendly service and good food. I'll be back.

9.description: My cousin was looking for an OSU based bar in the city and I remember having gone to this place in the past. We had a couple of beers and looked over the menu. The place was packed on a Sunday late afternoon. We definitely will return as this is close to my house and it looks like a good place to watch an OSU game. They have 2 floors and a patio in the front.

26.description: Woodies is a great spot to go to during the day on the weekends or during the week. I love all their food. It's great bar food. I love the chicken nachos- huge portion! Pretzels, lettuce wraps and wings are good too. My friend and I always get the burgers and bloody Mary's on Sunday's. I beleive theyre on special for 5 bucks. Good deal and theyre very tasty too. Pretty decent beer list too. Each floor has a different theme which is kinda cool. I'd avoid this place on Friday and Saturday nights though, as its way too young and crowded for me.

25.description: My cousin was looking for an OSU based bar in the city and I remember having gone to this place in the past. We had a couple of beers and looked over the menu. The place was packed on a Sunday late afternoon. We definitely will return as this is close to my house and it looks like a good place to watch an OSU game. They have 2 floors and a patio in the front.

12.description: Been here a number of times since many of our teams have been sponsored by woodies (which is a great deal by the way).Beer list is meh, just nothing special. I used to really enjoy woodies, food was always solid never too crowded but the last handful of times have changed. The menu is new which you would think is nice, but the higher crowds seem to have drastically effected good quality. Ordered the WFC, considered on of their specialties. I received school lunch quality mashed potatoes, that were cold by the way, Mac and cheese, and horribly overlooked/dry chicken wings. For $14 I could have actually gone to KFC and gotten much higher quality food (which isn't saying much).Overall, woodies is a decent spot they just need to improve consistency in the kitchen when serving larger crowds.

59.description: I'm a new fan of this place for sure. I am definitely returning for those pretzels and burgerI decided to try a new place for Thursday girls night. Seems like a great bar to catch a game and burger with a good beer. Service was friendly and the manager/owner came around to introduce himself. It was nice to see people who show passion for what they offer. The decor was tasteful. There was DJ music too later. It actually didn't feel like too much of a dive bar at all.We had the following:- the (magic crack) soft pretzels - so I am never one to order what I think are high carb bland foods. This was all my friends choice. These pretzels were incredibly soft and tasted great. I ate 2 whole ones. It comes with 3 dips. The beer cheese dip (made in house informed the manager) was very good too.- big o burger was pretty decent too. The bread was too big for me so I took it off but no complaints otherwise- the skillet cookie with 3 scoops of ice cream is sizable to share with 3 or 4 people. Our waitress was also excited for us that we ordered it.

21.description: After walking by a thousand times we decided to come in on a weekend afternoon. We were seated upstairs and immediately I was impressed with the unique retro decor and ambiance. It's a really cool place with a cool vibe. I had the Baja Shrimp tacos and they were great! A little kick to them but the slaw with mango salsa ontop balanced it out. I would love to come back and try a burger or since that looks like more their forte, but for a first time try it was good!

17.description: This place was appropriately packed when I went. Just what we were looking for. The Monday specials are great and beer selection has something for everyone. Friendly and quick service. Great casual bar and family friendly. Would definitely like to come back.

10.description: Bobby is one of the best bartenders I've ever come across. Shes incredibly personable, and knows just how to make a customer happy. I left this bar incredibly satisfied. She made me try the Green Lakes Christmas Ale with the brown sugar rim, and being weary, I still tried it. It was SIMPLY AMAZING!  I got upset the bus boy took my last brown sugar sip away, but she gave me a sample right after she noticed! WONDERFUL service. I will most definitely come again. -Sophie

5.description: Good spot on Wells. Low key and they have some good week night specials. Went with a friend on a Wednesday night (1/2 off salads and wine!) and had no problem getting seated. Food and service were good! We sat on the level that you walk in on but there is an upstairs and basement for the weekend nights when it's more crowded and bar- like.

3.description: Great place! The beers are a good size but the best part of the experience is the bartender Tessa! She is a great conversationalist and bartender

35.description: I was visiting my brother who lives in Chicago and we decided to stop here for lunch.  We got seated immediately, which was nice. We were waiting for 15 minutes before we were greeted by a waitress. Since we had been left with so much so much time to look over the menu, we knew what we wanted and told her we would like to order appetizers and drinks. Our group of 4 ordered, and that was the last we saw of our waitress. We ordered the chicken and waffle bites and nachos to share. Shortly after we ordered a friendly cook brought our food to the table. Shortly after we got our food we saw our waitress walk out of the restaurant with her purse. I had to go ask a bartender for silverware and napkins. Our food was awesome and the portions were a good size. I had to go ask a different waitress for our bill. She unapologetically mentioned our waitress left but she'd grab us our bill. If our waitress had some sort of emergency where she had to leave it would have been nice to have one of the three employees standing at the door come to wait on us. We understand that things happen and she had to leave, but we were disappointed that no other employee took over our table and were just left alone. It's upsetting to spend $50+ dollars on lunch and have such awful service.

19.description: Went here to watch a game. During the commercials they play video clips and music videos. Great wraps, huge nachos. Good. Great. Grand.

28.description: I have been blowing past this place on my bike for the last couple of months and every time the place is brimming with people how appear to have having a good time.  I like a good time so I stopped in.  After a quick stop in, I decided I will def be back.  I was rolling solo and found a spot at the bar, didnt feel weird, met a couple interesting folks, had some great lettuce wraps, a half-off bourbon shot and a decent beer in a big-ass frosted mug.  This place knows whats going on.  It was great.

45.description: Great burgers, atmosphere, and service... Fries were very greasy and not much seasoning. All the food looked great though!

33.description: Really enjoyed the burgers and beer selection. A little cramped in the lower level but otherwise a great experience!

43.description: Great burger energetic atmosphere. Wonderful service. I will return tonWoodie's Flat real soon

2.description: Went here with a friend last week. We both ordered and enjoyed our burgers, but the pretzel sticks and beer cheese were the real winners.Tip: Don't go here if you hate OSU.

18.description: I'm a new fan of this place for sure. I am definitely returning for those pretzels and burgerI decided to try a new place for Thursday girls night. Seems like a great bar to catch a game and burger with a good beer. Service was friendly and the manager/owner came around to introduce himself. It was nice to see people who show passion for what they offer. The decor was tasteful. There was DJ music too later. It actually didn't feel like too much of a dive bar at all.We had the following:- the (magic crack) soft pretzels - so I am never one to order what I think are high carb bland foods. This was all my friends choice. These pretzels were incredibly soft and tasted great. I ate 2 whole ones. It comes with 3 dips. The beer cheese dip (made in house informed the manager) was very good too.- big o burger was pretty decent too. The bread was too big for me so I took it off but no complaints otherwise- the skillet cookie with 3 scoops of ice cream is sizable to share with 3 or 4 people. Our waitress was also excited for us that we ordered it.

41.description: I have NEVER encountered a front door staff that was more rude. We went here during the Old Town Art Fair, so it was busy - I completely get that. I know Chicago also has crazy regulations for businesses during these festivals, but that doesn't give you the right to treat people like garbage. We had a table on the patio and when my friend went to change and come back, the bouncer kept telling him he had not been on the patio because he "was right here." I had two friends walk past the patio to say hi and another bouncer tried to take their beers (THAT THEY PURCHASED AT THE FESTIVAL) and say they couldn't be in front of the patio with them (it might have helped if he you know, asked them where the beers were from instead of assuming they took them from the bar). One bouncer eavesdropped and then barged in on a conversation I was having when a friend asked if she could join our table (he inserted himself in between us and said, "NO, no one else is allowed in").We had a spot for the Hawks game and had a decent server, but nothing will ever make me forget the treatment of people at Woodie's. And we were not the only ones. What a terrible staff. Never again.

52.description: Tried this place out tonight for the first time. Went around 6ish for dinner and had an amazing experience. Shared the Mac attack burger with a friend. Absolutely delicious. Not too much Mac but enough to add a really special flavor. The sweet potato fries were sweet and crunchy. They were so tasty and they came as a side for our burger with no extra charge. My fiancé got a southwest salad and loved it. The chipotle mayo was a perfect dressing. Sweet and spicy. The waitress was very sweet and kept our water full the entire night. She even brought jalapeños out for my fiancés salad just because she thought they tasted good with it. Very good service. Definitely would come back! They're doing it right!

50.description: I've always had a good time at Woodie's for drinks and dinner; the food is good and it's a fun scene, especially on the weekends. I recently hosted a surprise party there and I have never been so impressed with quality of service and attention to detail. Blanca helped me coordinate and answered my long list of questions and was so patient, friendly and helpful. The party went off without a hitch and my guests raved about the staff (especially Amy our server). If you're looking for a great place to host an event or get together I cannot say more about Woodie's! Exceptional quality of service that put the night over the edge!!

4.description: Yelp led us straight to this place. It is an Ohio State Buckeyes bar, but if you aren't a fan of OSU, it is still worth the trip. The servers got our large party in within 5 mins on a Saturday night. When we sat down our server recommended the root beer...beer.  I was hesitant, but it was much better than I expected and it was 10% alcohol!  After about half a glass, it started getting a little bit too sweet, but it was definitely worth a try. The food was also great. We ordered the pretzels, mac & cheese and tacos. The pretzels were enormous so we had to share them with the entire table. The Asian tacos were unreal. They are small, but delicious. They come with a ton of chips, but I couldn't even look at them after the rest of the great food. We definitely had fun at Woodie's and enjoyed some great food and drink. This would be a great spot to enjoy a sporting event. Definitely stop in if you are in Old Town.

6.description: To be honest, I don't remember much of this place since we came here around 11pm after we started drinking at noon.  Seemed like a cool place from what I remember.  Darker atmosphere and had a decent crowd on a Thursday.

22.description: Great OSU alumni bar!!! Must get the chicken waffle bites. They were really good. Bloody Mary's were really good!!! The bar is three levels which is really cool. Awesome service too. Our server was great and the people working out front were really nice.

15.description: Stopped by with a friend around dinner time. Thursday specials include 1/2 off sangria pitchers, wine, salads, and wraps.We sat outside and ordered the sangria and I ordered the Foghorn Leghorn chicken sandwich and my friend ordered the cobb salad. The sangria was really good and refreshing even though it was getting cooler out. The chicken sandwich comes fried or grilled, I opted for fried. The sandwich is topped with crispy onions, lettuce, tomato and a house sauce. It's a fairly large sandwich and was quite  tasty. The fries were great too! Only thing is the plate was too small, so the food was falling off the edges onto the table. The cobb salad looked great and the ratio of lettuce to toppings, favored toppings. The salad came with diced grilled chicken, fresh avocado, hardboiled egg, choice of cheese, tomato and bacon. Seemed like a popular place as the inside was pretty busy and outdoor seating was occupied. Friendly service and good food. I'll be back.

57.description: Great service and food that's affordable and taste good....what more could you ask for?!Came to Woodie's on a Sunday night with friends and received a warm greeting as soon as we came through the doors. The place was packed for a Sunday night which was a little surprising, but made the environment that much more exciting.For dinner I got the Mac Attack Burger which was so good my mouth is still watering. I ordered a side of sweet potato fries which were just OK.Dessert was the Skillet Cookie and we ate that faster than you could say, "the Bears traded who?!"I'll definitely be back go Woodie's Flat.

20.description: Yelp led us straight to this place. It is an Ohio State Buckeyes bar, but if you aren't a fan of OSU, it is still worth the trip. The servers got our large party in within 5 mins on a Saturday night. When we sat down our server recommended the root beer...beer.  I was hesitant, but it was much better than I expected and it was 10% alcohol!  After about half a glass, it started getting a little bit too sweet, but it was definitely worth a try. The food was also great. We ordered the pretzels, mac & cheese and tacos. The pretzels were enormous so we had to share them with the entire table. The Asian tacos were unreal. They are small, but delicious. They come with a ton of chips, but I couldn't even look at them after the rest of the great food. We definitely had fun at Woodie's and enjoyed some great food and drink. This would be a great spot to enjoy a sporting event. Definitely stop in if you are in Old Town.

36.description: Whoever that upstairs, female bartender is on Wednesday nights is a BELLIGERENT jerk. I would never normally say that about anyone but this past Wednesday, she belligerently attacked us (verbally) for absolutely no reason that the entire situation can only be described as truly unbelievable. I'm still in awe of how she acted. Had the bar manager taken action with her I probably would've relented on this review a bit, but the fact that the manager just said, "Yeeaaahhh, that's how she is..!" was utterly ridiculous. (I won't go into specifics because that'll take too long.)Not sure why Woodie's would keep her on staff if they know all she serves is attitude. I know that I would sooner go to another bar than have her EVER serve me and me feel obliged to tip her. If I ever see her bartending there again, I'll be taking my team elsewhere to spend money.

14.description: We enjoyed the food so much that the table fell silent. There was no pretense of politeness amongst friends as we fought each other for the last bits.Those chicken and waffle bites! Those pretzel bites! That pork belly! Phenomenal food.

58.description: Just a little update, we are now a month out from when I write this originally, and I have even been contacted by the owner.  As I suspected, he even made false claims of any kind of reconciliation of my experience.  And still the voucher for a free hair cut has still yet to arrive, and it isn't even about the money.  Extremely frustrating when a business so blatantly lies about the service they do not provide.  And then to take laissez faire approach to dealing with people who actually make an effort to speak up.  GO TO HAIR CUTTERY DOWN THE STREET AND ASK FOR LIZA.  Best haircut to date.SAVE YOUR MONEY, THEY WONT BE HERE LONG.As a follow up, I still don't change my review on State Street and I am happy for Kyle N. and his post.  Remember, for the money you are paying you aren't getting the service.  Also Kyle, I would have loved a neck massage but I was rushed out of the shop and given a rush job haircut, and charged full price.  Just be aware people all I am saying.Please don't make the mistake I made by going to this sham of a business.  I called and made an appointment, and arrived a few minutes late.  I hate to do this, but if you go here, at least do not use the stylist named Sherri, it may just be her.  I believe another poster called it dead on, all she did was take two different clippers over my head and did absolutely no styling.  Then I was rushed out the door because apparently her next appointment was there, and she didn't want to keep him waiting.  This barber shop sells itself as an old school men's barber shop, when in reality it is just a better fashioned SuperCuts (in fact two of the stylists who work there I have had cut my hair previously, at a Supercuts).  Here is the best part, I called the next day after my terrible haircut, and spoke to the manager, who apologized and offered to send me a free haircut coupon to give the place one more chance.  Point blank the coupons never arrived, and she was just giving idle lip service.  Save your money and go down the street to the Hair Cuttery, you will pay half, and if you are fortunate to get a haircut from Lisa, you will be pleased.  I just hope noone makes the misstake I did and walkout disappointed and $30 less in your pocket.

56.description: I just have thin straight hair brushed back, no big style job.  I'm not stuck on anyone who "knows" my hair.  So whenever I go here I just take any stylist who is available.  Of the four who have cut my hair, three seemed like they really wanted to be somewhere else and barely spoke a word to me.  The fourth was incredibly conversational and made the experience alot of fun, more what I expected for a place that wants to be an upscale alternative for guys who'd prefer to bypass SuperCuts.  But in the end, each stylist gave me a haircut I liked.

29.description: I admit I never pay more than $20 for a hair cut, but this was was worth it and I'll probably be back. The hair cut included shampoo and I gotta tell you, these ladies can handle a straight razor. Did I mention most of the "barbers" were women? I needed a hair cut badly and since I was going to be in the North Loop and Old Town areas, I needed to find a place. I ended up calling for an appointment and was able to get one for the afternoon the same day. The people were nice and the atmosphere warm and rustic, and it was even fronted by a classic facade and a barber pole. Did they really have those in the old days? It definitely didn't scream "We just graduated from beauty school" like a lot of the cheaper places.

42.description: Kudos to State Street Barber shop!  I recently wrote a review suggesting they cool the place off on hot days.  Not only did I recieve a message back from management, but more importantly, when I recievd my haircut from Anna today, she made sure the temperature was nice and cool.  Thanks for implementing your customers feedback!  Now not only does Anna give a killer haircut, shampoo, shave and massage, but the temperature under the smock is very comfortable, which makes an extremely pleasurable experience.  Ill be back!

23.description: I came in because I moved to a new neighborhood and wanted to find an actual barbershop that was convenient to where I live.  I had been going to Belmont Barbershop, and loved it, always received great haircuts with little instruction needed.  I'm not a chatty guy at the barbershop, and I expect the barber to know what he's doing and have a good eye for it. So I decided to give this place a shot.On State Street Barbers' website, they say they're trying to be a man's barbershop, provide high quality haircuts without "checking one's masculinity at the door" like at a salon.  A little chauvinistic, sure, but I just want a regular barbershop and this seemed like the closest one to my apartment.  In my opinion, they have failed in their mission. It is an MBA's perception of what a barbershop should be in design, and a hair salon in execution.  I was honestly a little confused when I walked in and saw no men - not what I think of when I think, "men's barbershop."  But I went ahead with the cut.  I agree the earlier post by N.S. - a $12 cut for $27.  I asked for a little under 2 inches left on top, and ended up with 1-1/4".  Big difference.  It looks like a buzz cut.  She kept checking the length of an individual cut she'd take off, to see if it was the right amount she was removing.  I can't tell based on a single clip.  Make it look good overall, and I'll be happy. I'm not.  I'm going back to Belmont Barbershop even though it's harder with my schedule and farther from my new apartment.  They cut for under $20, but they actually earn the money.  Every cut I've had at Belmont is cut with minimal instruction from me, and looks great.  Later, State Street.

47.description: My experience with State Street Barbers on Wells has been very good. Anna is exceptional -- she cuts mean hair, is very personable, and understands customer service. I work in the area, and I can get my hair cut during my lunch hour without any fuss. I've never felt rushed out the door; on the contrary, Anna takes as much time as I need to get my hair cut, my beard trimmed and get a shave if/when I need one.I have to say I'm a bit mystified by the "go to XYZCuts - it's cheaper/better" thread here. State Street Barbers charges $18 for a haircut, and the Hair Cuttery in Wicker Park charges about the same. I've had good experiences with both, but I have to say that the State Street personnel have always been friendly, efficient and knowledgeable. I'm not sure you get the same attention you would at a chain, especially if you're male and just want to get a haircut.

8.description: Anna has given me my last 5 haircuts over 2 years, which says a bit too much about how long I go in between haircuts. But I won't go anywhere else. She knows my head, and I no longer suffer from "wait two weeks and it'll get better" syndrome after a fresh cut. I was a Floyd's customer for a long time before this, but State St. has that same old-school barbershop feeling (I'd say it's more authentic) and service without the annoying wait times and blaring music, and for the same price. And Floyd's doesn't have Anna, who in addition to being a great barber is also hilarious. I'll be back as soon as my boss comments on my hair again.

31.description: This place continues to be outstanding.Best shave in the city, no question.  I've tried a few other places just to get a comparison, and this place is in a class by itself.Definitely recommended

34.description: This place sux. The lady that cut my hair (brenda??--old foreign lady with heavy accent) was so the rudest bitch that ever cut my hair. She got mad that I asked her to make the back shorter. Then, halfway thru the cut, she asked if I had a coupon, which really shouldn't make a diff, but she instantly started cutting alot faster trying to rush me outta there. I was offered no beverage like the groupon said I should have been. I also was not offered a shampoo after the cut, nor was I offered a shoulder massage, not that I would have taken the latter from her.  She used clippers when I specifically said all-scissors. After I left, I wanted to go ask for my tip back!  Never going back again.

16.description: I just got the worst, mangled haircut in my life.  I told the stylist I like my sideburns kept long (I came in with long sideburns), and to not cut them because I would trim them while shaving.  She proceeded to cut off 2.5 inches while I was turned away from the mirror, until they were way shorter than most guys wear them.  Now to try to grow them out I'll have two different levels for the next month or more.  I have no idea how anyone could think that a guy that walks in with longer sideburns wants them completely shaved off.  She never even asked about the level, she just cut.  Never going back again.

13.description: Want the best haircut of your life? Make an appt with Jeri right away. She's a wonderful stylist and knows that everyones head of hair is different. After my first visit I told her that she gave me the best haircut ever and I meant it!

11.description: Late 40's and just grew my 1st beard..Juan cleaned it up, straight razored it, then that hot towel...the perfect shave. ..fully recommend this place..

39.description: I made an appt at least 2-3 years ago for an old fashioned shave for my significant other.  The shave by Maestro was so awesome that we have returned to the shop and to Maestro two times a week since that first shave.  Agnes wrote a review that leaves me totally baffled as we have never experienced any of what she says...the staff are most accommodating, the shave, the smoothest ever...never once was there any issue with the shaves or services at State Street Barbers on Wells and with a few hundred shaves by Maestro under our belt, we certainly can attest to his competence and "bedside manner."

37.description: This is the best place to get a haircut.  They take walkins (I'm an appointment guy though), have good reading material, and a great atmosphere.  I now live out in the west suburbs and try to plan a trip to the city to visit Maestro the Barber because he's that good.  They give an excellent cut and use nice products (Crew, Tea Tree, Art of Shaving, etc).  Price is worth it.  Always have good conversation there too.  I must give big kudos to Maestro though, great with a straight edge!

0.description: Read all the other reviews and chose to book with Bernadeta and have to say,  all the 5 star reviews were spot on.
