Being my first time here,  Bernadeta listened to my requests and provided the service I was really hoping for. Great job,  will for sure become a long standing regular client. In/Out 30 minutes with shampoo and nice warm face towel. Great job,  glad I took the advice of others this time.

38.description: I've tried 3 men's hair places in the area: Alfredos (about $20, no shampoo), Halo for Men ($45, shampoo + a few short, silly extras), and State Street Barbers ($27, shampoo).  The winner: State Street Barbers.  All 3 stylists were skilled enough and fine to interact with.  But my hair looked best after being cut at State Street Barbers by Alison.  More to the point, you have to consider both price and what you get for the price.  I just got tired of paying $55 (includes tip) for a hair cut when I could be paying much less.  In fairness, I should point out that Halo for Men offers a two week follow-up touch-up at no charge.  But after the additional tip and the sheer hassle of scheduling an appt, remembering it, and getting there, I skipped some of mine because it wasn't doing much to prevent me from having to go in for a haircut about every 5 or 6 weeks anyway. As for Alfredos vs. State Street Barbers, I simply liked the cut I got at State Street better; in fact, I would place Alfredos in last place among these three, though the cut was still fine.  The atmosphere at State Street is more salon than barber shop; the opposite is true at Alfredos.Hope you find this helpful.

51.description: First off, a qualifier.  I'm a guy, so all I really require of a hair cutting establishment is that I walk out with shorter, better looking hair than I walked in with.  I don't want a paraffin hand treatment or my eyebrows done.  I made my first appointment with State Street Barbers today and was seen exactly when I wanted to be.  The staff was courteous and at times even funny.  I got the cut I wanted and it didn't take an hour.  They were conversational, but not overly chatty.  I don't like the idea that your hairstylist is supposed to treat you like you're about to be best friends.  I'll be back in a few weeks as it's a decently priced cut from an experienced stylist.  What more can a guy ask for?Also, you probably shouldn't believe the review by the bald guy about the haircut he received.  Haircuts don't put hair back on the head, Leon.

27.description: Great place, friendly people.  I just moved to Chicago and needed a new barber, read some reviews online, called them and the got me in 25 mins later!  Great hair cut and a straight razor neck trim!  I would highly recommend this place for a great haircut at a great price!  $25 in the city is cheap!  Plus they validate parking right across the street.

32.description: So I have a mixed review on this place.  When you get a haircut, your experience is only as good as the individual that is cutting your hair.  Ever since this place opened I've gotten my hair cut by Bernadetta, roughly 7 or 8 years ago.  She is absolutely amazing.  I can honestly say that in the last 8 years I haven't gotten a bad haircut from her yet, and she is hilarious and cool.  i look forward to my visit with her come haircut time.  I go to State Street Barbers because of Bernadetta alone, and as long as she's working there, I'll never get my hair cut anywhere else.That said, I'm not a huge fan of this business.  I hated the fact that there was a Groupon for 50% off a haircut there but it was only extended to new customers.  So let me get this right...I've been getting my hair cut there every 3-4 weeks since they've opened, and through word of mouth I've referred a huge amount of business to this place, but I don't qualify for a groupon there?  I think that's downright offensive, and a horrible business practice...a true slap in the face to a loyal customer base.  I know other customers that shared my thoughts on this.In summary, because my stylist is great, I'll keep coming back here.  They used to offer a beer while you wait, which I rarely accepted because I would be there early on weekends, but they don't seem to do that any more.  The neck shave is quality.  I always get shampoo'd, and even though the price has steadily increased since I started going there, I think it's still a good value for the quality of haircut that I receive.  I would get a haircut here if you're looking for a good barber, but ask for Bernadetta.

54.description: My boyfriend was frustrated with trying to find someone to cut his hair at a decent price that he almost gave me the clippers.  That would have been ugly on so many different levels.  Instead he went to State Street Barbers and was very satisfied with his cut (he is super picky). Now he looks hot and has regained sanity.

48.description: I have to agree with previous reviewers who thought the customer service here was less than desired. I came to State Street Barbers on a recommendation from a friend, but I have to say that while the haircut itself was okay, it was the most rushed and self-congratulatory service I've experienced in a long time. I didn't get a wash, no "famous shoulder massage," and no shaving. They charged me the full $24.My barber didn't wet my hair, didn't really seem to care how I wanted my hair to be cut, and threw on my gown thing so carelessly that there were literally chunks of hair stuck to the inside of my shirt afterward. I can't imagine if I had been going back to work afterward. Honestly, I couldn't care less how my hair looks most of the time, so this should tell you something about how remarkably bad this service is. She spent the entire 10 minutes telling me how good she was at cutting hair, how bad everyone else is, and how much better off my hair would be "when I start coming to see her regularly." Sorry, lady. I think I might try Frank's next time.If you're deaf and loaded, you might have a good time here. For everyone else, I absolutely would not recommend this place. The only saving grace is that they clearly know how to cut guys' hair, but so does Supercuts, and at Supercuts, they won't tell you about it the whole time.

44.description: If you are a man, you haven't truly lived until you have had a hot later shave from Maestro at State Street Barbers.  Take an hour out of your day, go lay back in the chair and let him work his magic.  The mix of hot and cold towels, hot lather, and various tonics, along with a true straight razor shave will leave you feeling smooth, clean and refreshed.  If you have facial hair like me (I have a goatee), Maestro will trim it to perfection.  You will walk out looking like a new man.  They also offer other services as well.  This is a true old world experience that you will not regret...One other thing, I took my groomsmen there the day of my wedding, and they accommodated all of us.  Make sure you book something like this in advance.

24.description: I received a perfunctory haircut.The barber asked a few questions, did the haircut I requested and I was on my way.Nothing overly special.

7.description: It has been almost 2 years since I have been back to the old neighborhood and I was so happy to see that Marcie was still working there. She helped me to tune up the beard and try a new doo and the wife loved it, so kudos to my Chica for a job well done! Highly recommended her to anyone / everyone

49.description: The price is right, but proof that you get what you pay for.  It's in my area and cheaper than Truefitt and Hill, so I gave it a try, again.  The man at the desk told me the guy was good, and when I sat down I told the barber exactly what I wanted, and no clipper work--all scissor work.  So what does he start doing halfway through my hair cut--clipper-ing my hair.  What could I do?  One side of my head has hair longer than the other and after a month it's still too short to be corrected.  My barber just was not that skilled and I should have known better.The first time I went there the lady who cut my hair did an okay job but it still looked like she only knew one cut and that's what  I got.  If you think you're particular about your hair, don't go here.

40.description: It seems to me that most men's barbers are somewhat lost if you would rather have only scissors (no clippers) used on your hair.  It took me a good 5 years of living in Chicago and countless haircuts ranging from decent to so bad I had to shave my head but I finally found Katie (Webster location) who gives the perfect cut every single time.  She's professional (takes her time and gets it right), personable and gives the type of quality cut that is near impossible to find for a reasonable price.  But honestly for all of that I would really pay double.

53.description: I have been going to Jeri here for over 2 years --- she is incredible!!! Always is happy to see me, fun, personable, and gives a great haircut. I have recommended Jeri to all my friends and they have not been disappointed.

30.description: Best shaves in the world!  See Maestro the barber - he's it.

46.description: I'm writing this review based on my husband's experience because he goes here for his haircuts.  They do a very good job and use great products.  You receive a massage as part of your service but he has said they skip that sometimes (and he's not to happy about that).Overall, good stylists that know what they're doing.  Owner is very friendly and helpful with purchasing products.  Warm tea avail. before or during your appt. (nice touch).

1.description: I'm very picky about how my hair is cut, and although there are hundreds of salons in Chicago, there are very few barbershops like SSB. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. They take their time with you and make sure they get your haircut right. SSB also offers a number of other services including shaving, beard and mustache trims, etc. They price was a little high, especially for a short cut like mine, but you get what you pay for here.

55.description: If you are looking for a hair cut experience then this is the place to go.  My boyfriend has been going to State Street Barbers since they opened.  When he comes home his hair looks really nice.  Back in the day when he went elsewhere sometimes I was less than thrilled with the results.  He loves the hot towel on the face and hot lather shaves.  All and all I am very pleased with his hair cut and he loves the service he receives there.

9.description: Jeri has been the only person to cut my hair here for 8 years, she is "no longer there" and I have a 10 -cut gift card left to use.  I'm sure there are other great stylists there but now I need to find another match.  Overall I liked the place but it was really b/c of Jeri.  I think there was a recent ownership change that may be causing turnover of staff.

26.description: My hair is pretty hard to cut well (thick, curly, frizzy), and this place nails it every time, which is more than I can say about basically any other place I've ever had my hair cut... ever. They know more about hair than I knew there was to know about hair, and they always leave me with a neat and stylish cut that holds up longer than haircuts from other places. They finish up the process with warm foam and a straight razor, something I've never had elsewhere, and the prices are pretty reasonable, especially when compared with the "salons" that have proliferated in my neighborhood. One tip: you need to bring cash for a tip, they won't take it on a card.

25.description: $27 dollars for a $12 haircut  Hardly a step up from cost cutters in quality of cut or barber I had.Also, Sign that says in capital letters at front "BARBERS DO NOT ACCEPT CREDIT CARD TIPS".  I thought that was a little bit insulting especially if paying $27 for a $12 cut and kind of gives a depiction of the mentality of the people running it.

12.description: I've gotten my haircut for the past 2 years that I've lived in River North. I've had my hair cut by Richard, Remi, Bobby, and Ann. All of them are great, although I like Remi's precision and attention to detail the most. They are all friendly, but not pushy.At $27, the cut is a *little* expensive for my tastes (I have a very simple cut), but the shampoo, hot lather neck shave and brief shoulder/neck massage, keep me coming back. The best thing about this place is their consistency. They consistently give me *good* hair cuts. I'm moving to Lakeview next month and will be sad to leave this place. Hopefully the Southport location is as good as the River North one.

59.description: Blech. Sure, the place looks great, all old-world and such. I even remember when they were building the place out, I was excited at the prospect of a local barber that could give decent cuts and that wouldn't cost an arm an a leg. But you're not getting Truefit & Hill (900 North), you're getting Hair Cuttery.I made the mistake of walking in for a cut, thinking that at least, given the look of the place, they might at least deign to lift a razor or scissors. But of course they didn't, because where does it say that just because you look like a decent spot, you are? Electric clippers all around. Wham, bam, thank you, sir.Ten minutes later, I had paid and was on my way home, a few dollars poorer.

21.description: Great, friendly neighborhood place.  At $27 dollars, it's a good deal if you consider that you can always come in afterwards for a free clean-up (straight edge neck shave).  It's also one of the few places in the city where you can get a quality hot lather shave.  Try to get on Maestro's schedule if you can.  His station is the first chair and you will appreciate his dedication and attention to detail.

17.description: Dint like this place, went twice,

10.description: The stylists do a fine job of cutting hair, but it seems to be a bit overpriced for what you get. The $32 charge includes a shampoo and a back massage, but the majority of the shampoos last one minute and I've never actually gotten the massage. I get the feeling that the stylists just want to churn through customers and don't care about servicing the ones they are working on... at least that's my point of view. If you promise a shampoo and a massage, you need to make sure you're following through on both.

5.description: Went to state street barbers where juan antonio gave my buddy a perfect shave and haircut shampoo and a mini massage took his time did it right ...like he said to mark nothing fast is good....you get your moneys worth with juan antonio...Great service on marks wedding day...thank to juan!!!

3.description: I have been seeing Bernadetta at State Street Barbers on Wells for almost three years.  Wow, I can't believe it's been that long! Since I started going there, I won't go anywhere else or let anyone touch my hair.  I'm pretty picky and very specific about how I like my hair, and Bernadetta is patient with me and always makes sure that I leave happy and looking fresh!  To boot, she's fun and I always laugh and enjoy myself while she's cutting! The haircut is $32, which is a good price for the service they provide... especially in the area!  I also like that they take advanced appointments like a salon because a lot of shops don't, which makes it super difficult when you're busy and trying to plan your week!I'd definitely recommend making appointment with Bernadetta and checking out State Street -- super good find!!

35.description: Sherry is the best barber/stylist who has ever cut my hair. I've been going to her for 4 years now and don't think I'll ever switch.

19.description: Had a very bad experience with a diva named Anna.  She couldn't understand why I was so upset that she no-showed for my 8:00 a.m. appointment.  I unfortunately called the owner about her forgetting, in my wrath, her boasts about how she had the owner wrapped around her finger.  And true enough, there is now an indicator on my online account telling me "DO NOT BOOK WITH ANNA."  Great, so a chit gets drunk and no-shows for my appointment the following morning and she gets a reward for it?  A new low for even hairstylists at this location.    Don't believe the hype about this place.  I was paying Anna $34.00 and I found another place nearby for $25.00 that does a comparable cut.  Truth be told, Anna was indeed a better hairstylist than most other individuals at this location.  She gave me one or two bad haircuts, and admitted as such, but we all have our bad days (or so I thought).  Hence, her privileged diva airs.  Take a pass and find a more professional establishment.  I work too hard for my money to throw it at some immature schoolgirl.  A true professional doesn't allow his/her moods or personal enjoyment affect his/her work. Bad "corporate" culture - this behavior should not be tolerated.

28.description: I've been to State Street Barbershop twice now.  The first time at the Webster location and the second time at the Wells location.For my first haircut, I had an appointment with the first available person.  Overall, the haircut was not too bad; I was offered a wash after the cut, but no massage as everyone else here has mentioned.  Despite the uneven trimming of my sideburns, I would say that the experience was acceptable.  It was Thanksgiving eve, so I figured that my barberette just wanted to get out of there, and I guess I couldn't blame her.Now, the second time at the Wells location, the staff kindly accommodated my schedule.  However, I had received one of my worst haircuts ever.  My hair on top was longer than the bangs, so strands of hair would protrude forward from behind.  The hair on the sides stuck out to make it look as though I wore a helmet (or had an afro).  The sideburns were again uneven, but not as bad as the first time.  I was not offered a wash, massage, or style, disappointingly, and left the shop with hair looking worse than when I had arrived drenched from the rain.  On the drive home, I remember thinking that maybe it was just the lack of styling, not the haircut itself that made my hair look so crappy.  Unfortunately, that was not the case... Most annoying is how I spend ten minutes, at least, to style my hair in order to hide the problems of my recent haircut.  Mind you, I usually spend 1 minute at most to style my hair as I have that messy, bed head type of hair style.It is not my style to complain about service like how people send back food at restaurants.  For the first time ever, I feel like doing just that -- I would like to have this mess of a haircut fixed.I had such high hopes for this place, but now I am just not sure.  I still have to decide on whether to return to State Street Barbershop at all.  If I do, I am not sure if I should give the barber from my second experience (who was highly recommended) at the Wells location another chance.

45.description: The 4-star rating goes to Marcella.  Everyone is friendly there, but I've had a few not-so-great haircuts from stylists other than Marcella.  The only reason I kept going back after the bad cuts was a) it's in a convenient location relative to where I live; b) they have late hours and are even open on Sunday.  I'm sure there are other decent sylists, I just haven't had them so I stick with what I'm comfortable with.  If I hadn't found her, I'd be going somewhere else.

33.description: My husband is still going here and his hair always looks hot :) Amazing customer service!

43.description: I go to the barber Allison at State St. on Wells about every 3-4 weeks and she always does a great job.  I have a lot of cowlicks on my head and she knows how to cut my hair so they are unnoticeable and not sticking up. The straight razor neck shave at the end is a nice touch...she's also cleaned up my beard as well. Definitely the best haircut I've ever had. The location is nice, feels very old school. Parking isn't too bad, the lot across the street validates up to 45 minutes and it's easily accessible from the el.  I come up from the South Loop just to get my haircut here and will continue to do so!

2.description: I had to track Juan Antonio down to his newest location so he would give my boyfriend a hair cut and shave.  Totally worth it!  Juan takes his time with the service but is very precise.  I brought in a picture of a shaved in part which is very modern now, and he nailed it.  My boyfriend loved the nice, little touches like the neck shave and hot towel.  Thanks Juanny!!

18.description: This is hands down my favorite barber shop in the city! I've been to almost every neighborhood in search of a good shop and I found it in Old Town. The facility is very clean and the service is great. If you're in need of a cut, make sure to schedule an appointment with Enrique.

41.description: While it's not as cheap as the Hair Cuttery, it's also not nearly as expensive as some of the "men's salons". It's a pretty decent atmosphere and they have parking across the street.At the end of the day, it's not about where you get your haircut...it's about who cuts it. I've been going to Allison for a couple years and she always does a great job. She also does a very thorough job including a straight razor neck shave and cleaning up the eybrows.I'm not really sure about the other 'barbers', but most of them seem to have a good supply of regulars. Which is a very good sign.

52.description: I dig the barber shop atmosphere in here and Allison does a great job on my hair.  I am a hair stylist myself so i am very particular but she has never let me down.  And you can't beat the price for a top level haircut.

50.description: I'll be back. Let's start with that. I have short hair so not exactly a difficult cut if you know what I mean. But, it's really about the stylist. and Sheree was excellent. I'd almost rather say she was horrible so her appointment book won't get too full for me!  It's a nice price and in the right place for me.

4.description: So Overall I really like State Street for haircuts.  In addition, this location's staff seemed to be more my speed than some of the other locations I've visited.  It took me awhile to find the stylist I really liked, but when I did its been great.  Cedric didn't just give me the standard "how do you want it" but asked a lot of follow-up questions, which narrowed down the type of haircut I was getting.  The prices are higher than I remember, but hey, I'm at the point where I am more than willing to pay for a haircut I actually like.

6.description: Ethan gives the best fade on the north side! I recommended him to some my friends and they go back to him too. Check em out

22.description: This is the only place I will go.

15.description: I honestly believe that Marcie administered the best haircut that I have ever received. She is skillful beyond any other stylist I have trusted with my appearance. Not only are the results remarkable, her attitude throughout the procedure is first-class and perceptive of what YOU desire from a cosmetic professional. I am certain that State St. Barbers of Chicago takes the same approach in hiring their staff equally, and as a result my visits will be re occurring.My wife can not keep her hands off of me... Get your hair cut by Marcie at State St. Barbers of Chicago on Wells.

57.description: I have to disagree with the previous posting from Jim S about Sherri. I've been a loyal client of hers for the last several months. She is top-notch. Much better than any $12 Hair Cuttery or $50 doo at a fancy Lincoln Park salon. I've referred several other guys her way and they walked away very satisfied. Another great thing about this location is that they have 45 minutes of free parking right across the street, which is great b/c the area is pretty busy and parking is scarce. Give her another try! If you're lucky, you'll get a nice shoulder and neck massage before you leave.

20.description: This place is well worth the money.  After going through 5 places in a few years, I think I finally have found one I can stay mainly because the price stays the same versus jumping 5-10$ each year as the barber gains skill.

36.description: Allright here goes. I am a little biased here because Marcela, the girl that has been cutting my hair for almost 20 years, works here with her twin sister Bernadette, so I have been following them like a stalker:)But in fairness, the greatest thing about for me getting my hair cut here (and with Marcela) apart from her styling, is her crazy sense of humor, especially if you have a personality and can crack some jokes.So if you come here or make an appointment, ask for Marcela.  And when you come in and tell her I sent you, dont be surprised if she screams in laughter:)But the level of haircuts you get, and shampoo, and hot shaving cream and razor neck trim, and mini-massage. For $27 bucks, you cant beat that--Dont forget a tip--

14.description: I received a perfunctory haircut.The barber asked a few questions, did the haircut I requested and I was on my way.Nothing overly special.

58.description: This place is so weird and ghetto. They have hardware and lotto tickets and if you're lucky...food. When you order you'll wonder if the staff was prepared to receive food orders. The food is also terrible. You'd be better of going to Bacci down the street.

56.description: After searching high and low for thin crust pizza in Old Town, 5 Boroughs is the winner. There doesn't seem to be anywhere this far north than has thin crust pizza like the South Side, but I love this place! When you are in the mood for a pizza with crackley outer crust that for some reason tastes healthy, this is the place. Pizza is cut into slices rather than squares, because it's NY style, but that's part of what makes it unique.Extra bonus is the fresh spinach that tops the pizza rather than using frozen. Pick up orders are always ready in under ten minutes, and the prices are reasonable. My only compliant is that they close so early; 9 pm during the week and 10 pm on weekends.

29.description: I ordered a large cheese pizza and was so disappointed in it. The crust was like cardboard and the sauce flavor was just off. My quest to find a good pizza that's not deep dish in Chicago will continue. Also, delivery took 2 hours!!!!! Awful, would never order from them again!

42.description: Went here as a last minute stop before I headed home, called in an order and it was ready as soon as I walked in the door. We had a chi town special pizza. It had a lot of everything and was pretty good. I'm a fan of thin crust pizza and they gave us the option of square or pie slices. That was different. The folks there are very friendly and when my buddy spilt his drink the owner reached in the fridge and grabbed him another one. Great hospitality and great pizza!!

23.description: Stopped here when I was hungry and walking around town after a night with friends. The guy at the counter was lazy, did not seem to care about his job, and was arguably high at the time. I got the last two slices available - when a couple of other customers came in after me he and the cook did not seem eager to make more anytime soon.The place was pretty sketchy, some ratty gangsta-type guy who had wandered in and was chatting with the guy at the counter ended up coming up to me and asking if he could bum a cigarette off me on the way out. I don't smoke, so I said I had none and he was on his way, but what kind of a place has people just wandering up to you and asking for a cigarette while you're eating?The pizza was also overly greasy and not all that satisfying. For the price there are far better places to get food at night around the area.

47.description: New ownership is horrible. My boyfriend and I have ordered here for a year and a half almost every weekend during football season. Since the new ownership, pizza isn't the same, customer service is horrible!

8.description: Pizza was not good. Both me and female I wad with agreed. But for 1030 for dinner it was all we could di. Staff was great but the food was just not that good.

31.description: This may very well be the worst restaurant within a 3 mile radius.  The food is disgusting, cheap stuff they pull from a freezer and heat up.  It's the lowest quality pizza I've ever had in Chicago.   I was in a big group, and everything that each of us got was absolutely terrible.  To make matters worse, the service is completely horrible.  The only thing worse than getting shockingly bad food is getting it after being made to wait a shockingly long time.  Their system of just heating up frozen stuff (which you can easily see them doing) means that things take a while to get sufficiently warm.  They're also generally curt, and they intentionally misstate prep times.If you look at my reviews, you'll see that I'm not a particularly critical reviewer on Yelp; this is by far my worst ever review, and I doubt I'll ever write one this bad again.  But this horrible place deserves every word of it.STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!

34.description: Disappointed. I ordered an 18 inch Chicago classic pizza. It came on time but was obviously a Not fresh cheese pizza with cold ingredients thrown on top. 3x more sausage than I've ever seen and raw, cold vegetables. I had to put it under the broiler to try and cook it. I used to love 5B but from this and reading other reviews it seems like bad is the norm here. Super sad.

16.description: This may very well be the worst restaurant within a 3 mile radius.  The food is disgusting, cheap stuff they pull from a freezer and heat up.  It's the lowest quality pizza I've ever had in Chicago.   I was in a big group, and everything that each of us got was absolutely terrible.  To make matters worse, the service is completely horrible.  The only thing worse than getting shockingly bad food is getting it after being made to wait a shockingly long time.  Their system of just heating up frozen stuff (which you can easily see them doing) means that things take a while to get sufficiently warm.  They're also generally curt, and they intentionally misstate prep times.If you look at my reviews, you'll see that I'm not a particularly critical reviewer on Yelp; this is by far my worst ever review, and I doubt I'll ever write one this bad again.  But this horrible place deserves every word of it.STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!

13.description: Personally I like NYC pizza more than Chicago style even though I'm from here and this place was great. The owner, Mohammed, is an awesome guy, great in small talk to make you feel welcome and just all around made me feel good supporting local v big franchise places. The price did make me feel ehhh prior to seeing the slice, but the piece was huge, fresh and I think it was worth it. No probs recommending this place to people.

11.description: Bleah!  That is all you need to know.  Just go to the mini mart, buy a Tombstone and thank me later.

39.description: 0 stars should really be an option.I picked up a few slices after class thinking I'd give the place a shot.When I paid in cash, the guy at the register weirdly made my change with a wad of rolled up cash he had in his pocket - suspicious.When I got home to eat the slices they were dry and bland - but no matter, I wasn't expecting perfection. Then, as I ate my pizza from the point up to the crust, I took a bite of the crust and felt A HAIR IN MY MOUTH. I'm thinking, did I lose a hair on this pizza? Nope.- It wasn't my hair. IT was a 3 inch long black hair.- It wasn't just resting on top, which might have made me feel slightly better.- The hair was BAKED INTO THE MIDDLE OF THE CRUST.This hair had not only come off of someone, but had been BAKED INTO the crust of the pizza. Meaning the follicle got to implode into the dough while it baked in the oven, while it was reheated and served to me, AND when I microwaved it when I got home. This place is disgusting and unprofessional.Never. Again.UPDATE***I ate here last night. I had to leave work early because I have full-on food poisoning.THIS PLACE SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN.

37.description: Most of the reviews and many of the pictures on the page are a lie....well, not a lie but written for a different place.  This is a different place with different owners than when I used to go here before.  The only thing that seems to be the same is the sign and the address.  The food is absolutely terrible and it's a travesty that Yelp would leave it under the same page.  Was literally upsetting.

0.description: Best. Cheese. Fries. EVER. - Seasoned fries and meticulously placed melty cheese = what dreams are made of. Also perfect thin crust pepperoni. Not sure if it's comparable to NY style but its perfectly foldable and totally satisfying. This place is more than just a local pizza joint. It's a neighborhood staple. Go there a few times and they'll remember your favorites. I completely adore everything about this place: Late night spot with craveable food and great owners: This is one of those spots that is just so perfectly Chicago and impossible not to fall in love with.

38.description: I've been eyeballing this place for over a year now and finally got around to trying it.  As far as the pizza goes it was good, but not anything that I would go out of my way to buy.  What brought my review up from a 3 star rating to a 4 star review was the man working there.  He was very friendly and impressed me so much that in the future I'm sure I'll stop in for a slice of pizza a few times a year when I'm in the neighborhood.  The pizza here is pretty thin crusted so if you're looking for deep dish pizza this would not be the place for you.

51.description: Turkey sub and corned beef sub had a ridiculously small amount of meat. The meat was comparable to beef jerky. I hate giving bad reviews but this was a joke . I will remove this review when the subs improve.

27.description: Not the worst pizza, but probably won't be making a return. Reminds me of a lot of the places I went growing up, and it's a pretty cozy and old school place. For ~$5 you get a pretty decent-sized slice of pizza and a can of pop, which is a decent deal. Pizza was nothing special, but I'm sure if you're in the mood it could really hit the spot. Not upset I went, but probably not gonna be a place I come back to.

32.description: So 5 Boroughs used to awesome. As close as you could get to a NYC style pie in Old Town. Well now it is like a NYC bodega. You walk in and there are lottery machines to greet you, not the smell of fresh dough and tomato sauce. I should have known they had changed owners b/c when I called for a pick up the voice on the other end lost its NYC accent and personality. I had to repeat my order three times, which was a large with one half pepperoni  the other half spinach, onion, and mushroom. So when I got there 10 minutes I was asked again about my order. WTF. Lastly the spinach, mushroom, and onion was not baked onto my pie. What I mean is they cooked my pizza and then put raw veg on top. WTF! I'm not Italian nor have I ever been (Same can be said for every person working there. 2 east Indians and a brotha. Not that that should matter with pizza making skills , but it did.) but I know I could and have prepared better pizza at home. I will not be back and I hope for your cravings sake don't go to this pizza place.

54.description: I went here with my family on a Sunday night around 7pm. The place was empty.  I had a groupon and wanted to check them out. The place is small a few tables and chairs and counters with stools. The chairs were uncomfortable. The breadsticks were good. The pizza not so much. The cheese was rubbery and chewy had to take it off. If they used a better quality of cheese they could have great pizza. The crust and the sauce were good. Overall I don't think we will be going back.

48.description: This review is for the new 5 boroughs. The reason for 5 stars is simply its location to the city, variety, and great hours for good food. They also have halal meat (just let hte owner know you want it). This is not really new york style pizza, so dont let the name fool you. What this place is is good food (great fries), similar to a mix of jubranos and italian express, and its open late and close to downtown. New owner, new menu etc. I will definitely go back because its hard to find a late night halal burger/halal pepperoni in the middle of the night.

44.description: Very unhappy.I ordered a double cheeseburger and in the notes I wrote "only ketchup & mustard". What I got was a dry double cheeseburger with mayo, mustard, onion, pickle, tomato, and lettuce, none of which I wanted. The fries were gooey and soft, along with tasteless. I didn't even eat the burger; I tossed it. The food is sub par and they can't even follow directions.

24.description: This is really good New York pizza. I know you're looking up Chicago, but if you're there and want to try NY pizza, this is the only place we found in two trips. It's about 1 or 2 miles north of Hancock Tower (Chicago 360) in "Old Town". We walked there and cabbed back and it was worth it. They also deliver. Many reviews are negative about this place because Chicagoans aren't ever going to be happy with NY style pizza. It's kinda floppy at the end of the large slice (so you'll need to fold it). It's covered in real mozzarella cheese (not the part-skim junk) so it will drip. And the crust is authentic with a good sauce.

7.description: Worst customer service and delivery ever! Order was an hour late and never received my food! When I called to speak to restaurant, they said delivery driver was out and could not update me on the status! Restaurant could not give me an accurate Eta, they keep telling me 5 minutes for an hour.

49.description: Hear this, this is the closest you'll get to NYC pizza in Chicago. Period. I grew up in Chicago-style pizza, pan, but I worked for 2 years in New York, and fell in love with the "slice".  The current guys that run this place as of Nov. 2013 have it.

40.description: The 12 year old kid at the register could swipe a mean credit card.   Now for 4 dollars I guess a slice and coke can not be to harshly judged. That being said I think tombstone would win in a side by side.    That being said the kid gets it the 5 stars.   Very funny

53.description: I had heard about this place before and really wanted to try it.  I like to support restaurants that cater to the Zabiha/Halal-eating population, but my experience here was really, really bad.A friend and I get to the location at around 11:30 AM, to find the location closed despite the hours listed on the door saying that the place should indeed be open.  There was a man sitting inside who saw us standing there, but for the longest time he ignored our presence.  When we knocked on the door to get his attention, he started making weird gestures (and couldn't just open the door just to tell us how much longer till the place opens up or why they're still closed).  We came back 45 minutes later to find the restaurant STILL closed, with the man STILL sitting inside.  We tried to call the location to see if we could understand what indeed was going on, but no one picked up.As someone who tends to give the benefit of the doubt, I still do not understand why this happened and why we couldn't just be told kindly what the situation was.

30.description: This place used to be good a couple years ago and now seems to be under new ownership.  All I can say is it suuuuucks.

46.description: So I bought a Mediterranean pizza and cheese fries on Seamless on the coldest day of all winter on Seamless, because I did not want to venture outside. Given the conditions, this may have been a bad idea, but I picked it because all the other places had a much longer waiting time and we had been driving earlier and I figured the roads were practicable enough. The was was listed at 45-60 mins (as opposed to some that were 75-90). Unfortunately, I didn't think about checking Yelp and just wanted to get this done so I could satisfy my savage pizza craving.... Unfortunately, after waiting over an hour and a half, still nothing. We resorted to calling the place, keeping in mind the weather conditions. A lady picked up, and told us that they had a lot of customers given the weather conditions, and that the guy had left so we said that we would wait 20 minutes before cancelling. Half an hour later, we called back. I was hesitant to cancel because I REALLY wanted pizza and didn't want to order from another place and wait another hour. This time a guy picked up, and said the delivery guy left 12 minutes ago. Funny, because half an hour ago we were told he was already gone. But whatever, "20 more minutes, this is it", we were told, and so we waited....Another half hour later, this time THEY called us back. I was starting to freak out because the place was now listed as closed for the night on Seamless. Apparently the car got stuck in the snow, so it would be an additional 15 minutes. We hung up, starting to seriously doubt that we were going to eat pizza that night, and about 20 minutes later, as my boyfriend had lost all hope and was taking some food i had cooked out of the fridge, I FINALLY saw a car (by car, I mean a 20 year old beat up Chevy, or something of the kind, no wonder it got stuck in the snow) pull up in front of our residence. His phone rang, and I couldn't believe my ears when the delivery guy asked my boyfriend to come down to his car in the snow and cold to get the pizza!!!! Seriously dude, we ordered DELIVERY, not pick-up, for a reason! As my boyfriend was taking too long to layer up, the guy made it to the door of the building, and my boyfriend met him downstairs so I did not get to express my frustration to the delivery guy, who kept on making more and more excuses from what I heard. Again, I understand the weather conditions, but if you cannot deliver what you advertise, close down for the night. Many places closed for that day because of the conditions, but if you decide to stay open, do NOT lie to your customers repeatedly and make excuses. Notice that at no point their offered a refund or gave us a discount for the wait. I ordered at 7:50 pm, the pizza arrived at 10:35 pm!Now on to the quality of the food. Like I said, I was craving pizza and wanted it fast, so I missed the bad reviews here, but in the two hours I spent waiting, I checked out the latest reviews and was kind of praying that they were wrong...They weren't. The pizza we got after 2 and a half hour was cold, and pretty similar to the picture Lauren A. posted. The fries were lukewarm and soggy, and the cheesy tasted awful. My boyfriend said this was the worst pizza he's ever tasted, and he is pretty big on pizza. As of me, this was probably my worst food experience ever. It really feels like they were trying to use the fact that most people didn't want to go outside in the cold, and that many other places were closed to generate some quick cash while scamming the customers.I waited a few days to post here because I was so furious that night, I didn't want to write on impulse. This is now 3 days later, and I just want to warn everyone that this place has absolutely God awful food and service, and does not even deserve one star.  At this rate, I don't think they will remain open for a long time.

1.description: Come here for some good New York style pizza in Chicago.  Though I have never been to New York and actually had this kind of pizza I have seen plenty food shows to get the idea of what New York Style is.  Large thinly sliced pizza that you fold.  It was really good here and the service is friendly.  They have some seating and a TV.  It is conveniently located right off of the Brown Line stop at Sedgewick and is open late.  I'm not in this area often but I would suggest coming here for a good slice of pizza. $4.40 including tax for a slice of pepperoni

55.description: I stopped here to order a sub thinking this would be better than the Subway literally around the corner.  Boy was I wrong!!  The guy didn't know how much the item I ordered was, then he continued to come out of the the kitchen to ask me if I wanted things that were included on the sub I ordered.  The sub took FOR-EV-ER to make... I was in there well over 10 minutes which means they don't make a lot of subs and what I was given had been frozen.  The meat was pretty skimpy and the other toppings were almost non-existent.  I don't think I have ever seen a tomato cut as thin as the 2 I was given were.The signs say salads, but they were nowhere to be found on their menu and I highly doubt they could make one.Reading other posts I think this place used to be good, but these new people have misleading signs, barely speak English and have a less than mediocre product.  They were friendly, but I can get a smile a lot of places.  Will not return here.

9.description: This was quite possibly the worst food I have ever eaten.It took forever to make a gyro and fries.  I heard multiple microwave dings.The fries and the meat on the gyros were both way overcooked.  Like beyond anything I've ever attempted to eat before.  The gyro meat was harder than beef jerkey.  You could literally pick a piece up and snap it in half.Never again.

26.description: Finally some decent NY Style pizza in Chicago!

25.description: Since leaving Chi-town, and enjoying many other pizza establishments, just coming back onto Yelp and re-reading my review of this place literally makes me cringe again - that's how AWFUL this place truly is.   Go away you awful, awful place!

12.description: Pizza was pretty garbage and expensive. It's conveniently located by the brown line, but still not worth the location and convenience. Avoid. Place is always empty too.

59.description: Horrendous!  Loved it with the previous owners. .. the new ones are unable to speak English nor know how to make the food. It is scary when you walk in, dark and signs all over the place stating you can know pay your cell phone bill there. Wtf? The owners are not Italian immigrants either, in case you are wondering, but the new ones have now decided to sell gyros as well as crappy pizza. Do not go here!

21.description: I got a sub from here and it was one of the worst things I have ever eaten. I could only stomach half of it before I had to throw it away.  Maybe the pizza is better, but stay away from the subs.  Nothing was fresh and it definitely just came out of the freezer and was heated up.  Even by frozen food standards it was bad.

17.description: Just had a delivery. Soup was cold, no fries with my order. Sub was certainly sub-standard and to top it off no utensils at all. Basic restaurant delivery 101 if it is going to a hotel they need napkins and utensils (especially if you sold them soup).

10.description: Have you ever ordered a meal and when it was served, you actually expect to get sick? Well, that pretty much sums up my first (and last) visit to Five Buroughs.

5.description: Mediocre pizza and really greasy. The delivery guy was a dick too. Definitely not Chicago style pizza. The cheese doesn't even taste like cheese.

3.description: We ordered our usual extra large pizza with extra cheese and extra ground beef, and never disappointed.  Tonight we had the taste for grilled chicken wings,  and the owner made some for us, and OH MY GOD, they were DELICIOUS!  The meat fell off of the bone, and the seasoning was detectable!  I haven't tasted such amazing grilled wings in many years, and thank you!  They weren't on the menu,  but he seasoned them perfectly!  If you haven't tried 5 Boroughs, or haven't eaten here in a while,  please order and enjoy!  Great food!

35.description: Not a fan. The pizza was rubbery and didn't taste fresh at all. Definitely not NYC style either.

19.description: This place deserves negative stars. Quite possibly the worst pizza let alone restaurant I have ever carried out from.I am surprised every day I drive by to see that they are still open. It was immediate sickness after one bite of their NOT FRESH frozen sausage. We returned the pizza because it was so bad. First time I have ever done that.Will not go again and do not recommend anyone else does. How do they pass health inspections?!

28.description: I was on my way home after 12 midnight and hadn't eaten dinner. Nothing was open except Subway which I didn't want. As I looked on Sedwick I saw a sign below the Sedwick station, 5 Boroughs Pizza & Subs. They serve pizza by the slice, just what I wanted, not too much and not too little. When I walked in I saw two very nice man behind the counter, I ordered a piece of pepperoni pizza to go. The service was very fast and they were very courteous. It had been Nonna's Pizza before, but had become 5 Boroughs several years ago. When it was Nonna's the pizza had  a lot of cheese but no flavor. The pizza was a little salty when I got it home but had a great taste, after I warmed it up again. I read some of the comments on Yelp , complaining that the owner was not Italian. Who do makes the pizzas at all the other restaurants? Doesn't really matter as long as they do a good job? They are opened in until 2 AM on weekdays,  and Friday and Saturday nights until 4 AM.  In addition, they have subs,  salads, and desert items. While you are there you can even purchase lottery tickets,  too!

45.description: I really wish I liked this place, it's one of the few restaurants right by my work, but it's  awful. It's half convenience store, half completely average food. The wait time is outrageous. 30 minutes for breadsticks and a slice of pizza, 45-1 hour for cheese sticks and cheesy breadsticks. The owner once scolded me for ordering through grubhub for about 10 minutes. There was a child at the register. Overall, terrible quality food and customer service.

33.description: Called this place about 10 times last month to make an order for carry out on Friday nights we like it thin crust pizza but last night pizza i don't belive that's same place we order pizza burn all over the taste change oily i don't know the cook change or its a mistake that's only place close to my home but Perhaps we'll give it shot sometime in the future maybe we get the same again.

43.description: live down the street and was looking for nearby NY style pizza... food was ready in 15 minutes!!! pizza was good, breaded mushrooms good.... hit the spot and good for your local pizza craving place

2.description: This is really good new York style pizza,fantastic slice of pizza,best pizza delivery,it's right across the street from the brownline station.

18.description: I had heard about this place before and really wanted to try it.  I like to support restaurants that cater to the Zabiha/Halal-eating population, but my experience here was really, really bad.A friend and I get to the location at around 11:30 AM, to find the location closed despite the hours listed on the door saying that the place should indeed be open.  There was a man sitting inside who saw us standing there, but for the longest time he ignored our presence.  When we knocked on the door to get his attention, he started making weird gestures (and couldn't just open the door just to tell us how much longer till the place opens up or why they're still closed).  We came back 45 minutes later to find the restaurant STILL closed, with the man STILL sitting inside.  We tried to call the location to see if we could understand what indeed was going on, but no one picked up.As someone who tends to give the benefit of the doubt, I still do not understand why this happened and why we couldn't just be told kindly what the situation was.

41.description: Went there a couple weeks ago & ordered a philly steak sandwich. It was so burned, hard & dry. I could not eat it & had to throw it away. Big waste of money. Looks like they are a lottery place more than a restaurant. It should be shut down.  Disgusting food.

52.description: Pizza tasted like poorly cooked frozen pizza. They didn't half the slices they had listed on their menu. For some reason, they were selling lottery tickets and cellphone cables, presumably because their food is so terrible.

50.description: Do not go to this place. One star doesn't begin to express how I feel about this rat-hole of a "restaurant:.  The person in front of me ordered Mac N' Cheese Pizza.  The Mac wasn't cooked and the cheese wasn't melted.  She asked for her money back.  The restaurant was indifferent and returned the money because they wouldn't eat it either. I asked the cash register dude, what do you recommend?  he said... nothing.I asked the chef guy, what do you recommend.  he said... nothing.  When I asked if my food would be better than the Mac N' Cheese slice I just saw, he said, "maybe you should go to Subway."  I realized tonight that I will never buy food from a restaurant that sells lottery tickets.  This place is disgusting.  It should be shut down.

4.description: For being a sub place they sure don't have a great sub. Never tried the pizza but seeing how they did on the cookie I think I am all set there. The onion rings are below average. Wings are okay.

6.description: Ordered an extra large half cheese half giardinara. Ordered it pie cut... Like a typical NY style pizza. It was delivered party cut and about 30 minutes after it was promised, and cold. On top of that, prices listed were wrong as the delivery driver said. I expected to pay about $20 and I was over $30 after delivery charges ($5). If you're looking for good pizza, this is certainly not the place to go.

22.description: Wish I could review but they didn't open during their business hours. Hmm........kinda unprofessional.

15.description: I was on my way home after 12 midnight and hadn't eaten dinner. Nothing was open except Subway which I didn't want. As I looked on Sedwick I saw a sign below the Sedwick station, 5 Boroughs Pizza & Subs. They serve pizza by the slice, just what I wanted, not too much and not too little. When I walked in I saw two very nice man behind the counter, I ordered a piece of pepperoni pizza to go. The service was very fast and they were very courteous. It had been Nonna's Pizza before, but had become 5 Boroughs several years ago. When it was Nonna's the pizza had  a lot of cheese but no flavor. The pizza was a little salty when I got it home but had a great taste, after I warmed it up again. I read some of the comments on Yelp , complaining that the owner was not Italian. Who do makes the pizzas at all the other restaurants? Doesn't really matter as long as they do a good job? They are opened in until 2 AM on weekdays,  and Friday and Saturday nights until 4 AM.  In addition, they have subs,  salads, and desert items. While you are there you can even purchase lottery tickets,  too!

57.description: I don't want to be mean, but saying "I jut ate a 5 Boroughs Pizza" is worse than saying "I just ate a Hot Pocket." Wow. I literally had to put the pizza in my own oven for 10-minutes at 450 and it was STILL undercooked. WTF?! It is no questions why Chicago pizza joints rule over New York if this is the sheeeeet they consider pizza (I hope not!). If you like flavorless cardboard and store bought packages of marinara sauce (check out the picture, I'm not lying!), order from here. If you'd rather get diarrhea and order cheaper pizza, just get a $5 pizza from Little Caesars, at least its edible. BTW, the delivery driver was one of the nicest guys ever, that's why it deserves only 1-star, not negative 10.

20.description: DO NOT EAT HERE! The best part of the pizza was getting to the crust. The pizza had an overwhelming taste of garlic and it was so greasy. We didn't even finish the over priced pizza. I would rather eat at little caesars. I hope i don't get food poisoning. I should read these reviews first.

36.description: This is one of the worst pizzas I've ever ordered. Cheap cheese, the crust is dry and tastes like flour, and the tomato sauce is heavily salted. Further the order was wrong and eating this pizza gave me a "fast food" hangover.

14.description: Since leaving Chi-town, and enjoying many other pizza establishments, just coming back onto Yelp and re-reading my review of this place literally makes me cringe again - that's how AWFUL this place truly is.   Go away you awful, awful place!

3.description: It's a small boutique so don't expect the huge variety you see at dept stores. The prices are competitive. I've been to Saks and Nordstrom and prices are about the same, sometimes even lower in WildFlowers. I must admit that the fact you can bring your dog is a big plus. The owner is the nicest person. She is helpful but not pushy, and you can tell she enjoys selling and the art of lingerie. She said she does bachelorette parties too... I bought a beautiful bra that fits perfectly and my size is not too common: 32DD.

1.description: I'm writing this review now, however I admit that I haven't been in the store since February of this year.  This is a really cute store that carries higher end lingerie.  Think cheaper than La Perla but more expensive than Victoria's Secret.  The lady who runs/owns the store is very nice and personable.  My first visit to the store she helped me pick out my foundations to wear under my wedding dress.  The reason I'm giving the store 3 stars is because I am not a fan of high pressure sales.  If you go to this store you will be pressured to buy more.Update 11/23/07:  I was fitted for the wrong bra size at Wildflowers.  The salesperson merely guessed what size I should be, instead of measuring me.  I know that my size hasn't changed since I was last in the store, in February.  I was fitted a couple of weeks ago at a different store, where I found out I'd been wearing the wrong size.  So, now I have a few pricey and pretty bras that don't properly enhance my assets.  grrrr

2.description: I've walked by this store many times without noticing it since it's hidden in the Gaslight Courtyard of Old Town. However, ever since discovering it I just can't get enough. They carry some fun, sexy lingerie- the perfect gift to bring to any bachelorette party!

0.description: Wildflowers is a true "hidden gem" in Chicago.  The owner is the most personable and firendly person I have ever met!  We had a group meeting there recently and I admit, I am the last person to be in a lingerie store, prefering the anonymity of major stores with the same, plain offerings.  I assumed that everything here would either be too rique or out of my price range.  I was sooo wrong!The selections cover a wide range of racy to demure and the pricing is reasonable - even cheaper on some lines than Nordstrom's.  I walked away with a robe and nightgown - and the nightgown was a size smaller than I would have bought - but for the wonderful advice on how that line ran - and she was right - perfect fit!I would defnitely encourage everyone to seek this place out and ring the buzzer for an amazing experience.  They also offer private appointments where you can try on yoru selections for your special someone!  What place does that?

4.description: I would never go here again.  When I visited here looking for some items for my wedding/honeymoon, I was extremely disappointed. The place smelled like dirty feet and had a very small selection.  The piece I tried on came from a pile of stuff in the back.This place bills itself as a classy boutique selling high-end French lingerie. NOT SO. It's a dark, dingy place basically in a basement and just a couple notches above Lover's Lane.

3.description: I recently discovered Cityblue while shopping and brunching in Old Town with one of my friends and I'm so glad I did. Every time I've gone in, the staff is very friendly and helpful plus they have unique jewelry, tops by Ella Moss and Splendid that I love, and a lot of denim to choose from! I was also lucky enough to meet the owner and her dog, Max, and they were both completely fabulous. Definitely check out this dog friendly designer denim boutique. You won't be disappointed!

1.description: I was headed to one of my favorite boutiques in Old Town, Sara Jane, when I passed by this store that I had never noticed before. I went inside and the friendly gal who works there mentioned that they had just opened and would be having their grand opening in November.In my 5-10 minutes in this tiny boutique I discovered lots of denim (William Rast and Genetic to name a few brands), some casual t-shirts, and many splendid tops as well. Oh, and I can't forget to mention their collection of fingerless gloves- I may need to get myself a pair of those to get thru the winter!I saved my money for a shopping spree at Sara Jane since I'm not in the market for a new pair of jeans, don't really do the t-shirt thing and none of the splendid stuff was calling my name. However, when I do decided to invest in a pair of new jeans (or fingerless gloves) I may pay them another visit.

2.description: shopping for designer jeans has become unbearable in deparment stores and such as you only see the most generic items, brands, cuts, etc. I find that the individuality and overall experience was quite different here. i was able to find items for day-to-day wear as well as styles that could be dressed up on occasion. The staff was super friendly and had an open mind as to my budget and needs. very economical store with some unique brands/items that truly set it apart. i will be coming back for seasons to come!

5.description: I go to cityblue anytime I need my denim fix- they have a really great selection of my favorite denim brand Genetic and I have also gotten a lot of great tops here.  Including my favorite coat of all time, which I have worn almost every day straight since getting it  back in January :) The girls working here are really knowledgable and very honest when it comes to sizes, styles, washes etc. I never feel like they are only trying to sell me something.  Cityblue is a great place and I would suggest it to anyone looking for a great shopping experience.

6.description: I forgot to mention: The girls behind the counter took my number, said they'd let the owner know about the issue, and that the owner would call me if something could be done. She never called.

7.description: When I need to revive my closet (which I tend to look for reasons to do on a weekly basis), I do not head down to the Magnificent Mile to battle the crowds, wait in long lines, and be "assisted" by sales associates who seem to care more about their latest text messages than getting me another size.  I admit, I used to make this trek; only most of the time to come home empty handed and exhausted.  Thank God for Cityblue, a little slice of denimlover's heaven in Old Town.   Every time I walk into Cityblue, I am greeted with a smile from the helpful employees and faced with miles upon miles of denim.  Not your typical denim that any Joe-Schmo or Jill-Schmo can pick up off the rack at the nearest department store.  If I wanted that denim, I would head back down to Michigan ave or order it online.  Cityblue's denim includes an array of great washes, cuts, and styles for any body type and at a wide range of price points.  They have some styles that, at least from my shopping excursions, you can't find anywhere else in Chicago.  The staff is knowledgeable about how every style fits and always willing to grab me as many sizes as I need in order to find that perfect pair.  Aside from the just the denim, Cityblue has racks and racks of great tops by Splendid and Ella Moss.  Not trendy tops that you will just wear once and then never again. Tops that I find myself reaching for again and again in my closet because the styles are so versatile and, let's be honest, they look pretty dang good paired with my William Rast jeans from Cityblue!   They also have some great jewelry, scarves, and gloves that are great for everyday or a special night on the town.  If I got a dollar for every compliment I have gotten about my Brightly Twisted scarf from Cityblue I would... have more than enough money for the pair of Citizens of Humanity jeans that I saw there the other day.Bottom line, Cityblue is Chicago's denim, top, and accessory mecca.  A place I look forward to stopping into to see the latest styles.  A place that, more often than not, I find myself spending nearly an hour browsing, trying on, or hanging out on the comfortable couches playing with the owner's dog.  A place that throws wonderful events and offers amazing sales and specials that you simply cannot find anywhere else.  The next time you need to revive your closet, or simply want an amazing shopping experience, you should definitely check out Cityblue!

8.description: Not happy with their customer service!  I had a gift certificate for Cityblue and went to buy a pair of jeans there in Sept.  The staff was helpful while picking out the jeans especially considering that I had never bought skinny jeans and was very hesitant.  The jeans purchased were a pair of Rich and Skinny and after a handful of wears they ripped.  Now if I were buying a $20 pair of jeans I would expect and understand if this happens but I spend money on my jeans and expect them to last more than 3 months.  The Cityblue associates kept telling me that if this had happened in 7 days then they would be able to exchange the jeans.  It's not like I was trying to get my money back or a different pair of jeans.  I wanted the jeans that I bought without a hole in them.  Jeans are meant to last more than 7 days and I don't think that 3 months is a long time to have a pair of jeans.  I guess I'll stick to Nordstroms who believes in the product they sell and will exchange when there is an issue.  It's called customer service and as a boutique you are suppose to excel in this area to keep customers coming back.

0.description: Really cool store--industrial meets rock and roll! All of the girls in there are super friendly and will take time to work with you on finding the perfect styles that match (like having a personal shopper). There aren't a ton of options but I feel like it has that "we hand-picked these styles" feel rather than the usual "pack it all in there" feel. It leaves the store feeling airy and manageable. Further, I feel like the purchases made in there are one of a kind and you won't see every other girl walking down Wells in your top and necklace.I highly recommend checking it out--they do little open houses once in awhile as well so its a nice way to mingle and shop. Again..really feels like a personal shopping experience. I'm a fan for sure!

4.description: I have been very interested in a pair of Seven jeans.  I called ahead of time to make sure they had my size (32).  The woman on the phone was super nice and said she would put a pair aside for me.  When I went in, she had them waiting for me and there was another woman there (Andrea?).  Anyhow, they were both extremely helpful.  The jeans fit great and I have gotten a ton of compliments today.  They only had two pairs in my size, but that is because they sold out another style. They are pricey, but worth it.  Definitely going back to get another pair.

3.description: DO NOT go here for a massage!  I can see from other reviews that the chiropractic care is good, but this was the WORST massage I ever had - and I've had a lot.When I checked in, the massage therapist did not introduce herself (I later found out when she gave me her card when I left that her name is Leah).  I changed, and waited at least 10 minutes for her to come back in.  She proceeded to give me a very lame massage, didn't react when I said anything - for some reason (and I've never had this before) - I got the feeling she HATED what she was doing.  And to make matters worse, you can hear all conversatons going on elsewhere.To top it off, the 50 minute massage lasted at the most 40 minutes; apparently she counted the 10-15 minutes I was waiting for her as part of the treatment.  I brought it up at the end but she insisted it was a full 50 minutes.  I checked my watch both when she came in & when she left so I know I was accurate.Horrible experience, a waste of time and money (even with Living Social coupon).

1.description: I first gave this place 4-stars, and that was until I was dropped from treatment. However, before I go into that, I must say that Dr. O and his staff generally pretty kind.I decided to go with Gold Coast Wellness because I needed supplemental treatment; massage therapy  with the Physical therapy I was already receiving at another location.When I met with Dr. O, he was really good at assuring me that it would not be a problem. Fast-forward a few weeks and I'd only seen the massage therapist maybe twice (admittedly I had ran late for my appoints and missed one session).I started to get worried that I wasn't getting the supplemental care that I was seeking there. Eventually I was told that they can't just provide ONLY massage therapy. So I had extra PT, on top of my current regimen.  Eventually, I had asked about receiving trigger point injections since I was told by Dr. O that they had a pain specialist. Gloria, the office manager, followed up with me and mentioned that she had to check with insurance. This took almost 3 weeks. I called and spoke with her and she started talking about how inconsistent I was and how that makes my case look harder to prove. I REMINDED her that it was only suppose to be SUPPLEMENTAL care and I was already seeing another PT on a regular basis. To make a long story short, a few days later I got a call from Gloria saying that whomever she'd spoken with on their end stated they didn't want to treat me anymore because of the gaps in my attendance. Basically, they were afraid of not getting PAID.I was SHOCKED. I was honest from day 1 about what I needed, which was massage therapy. I got everything but that, with the exception of 2 or 3 sessions, then I was dropped like a HOT POTATO.Unfortunately, it made me feel like this practice didn't follow their motto about making sure their patients feel better or are cared for. I understand that its a business and they need to make money, but the way my case was handled, it was really only about $$$. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone with an accident or injury case because your treatment will be different! I.e. you can't get PT on the same day as you get a massage for "insurance purposes."Bah.

0.description: I've been under the care of all the staff at GCW for 7 years, and I couldn't live without them. Two herniated discs caused me serious problems until Dr. O and Elisha, a wonderful massage therapist/pain guru, helped me work out a plan to keep me mobile and as pain-free as possible. As with another reviewer, Dr. O called me at home when I was laid up with back spasms to see how I was doing. Elisha, though, is my star here. Weekly massages and deep tissue work keep me moving and grooving. I can't say enough about her, and I refer anyone complaining of pain to her, because her knowledge of body work and how one thing can cause another, are unparalleled. I adore her. Don't ever leave me, Elisha!!!

2.description: Sarge and his staff are the best that a chiropractic facility can offer. They listen and seek to understand your personal fitness/nutrition/health concerns, accommodate, are well trained, and offer a variety of services. Sarge is so helpful and accommodating and helped me train and prepare for the Chicago marathon and assist me with my overuse/knee injuries. Their scheduling online makes it a easy process for those with little time and have always been helpful to accommodate my busy schedule. On the side of my busy traveling consulting gig, I am an aerobics instructor so the demands of both my job causes non-typical stresses in my opinion. I have been to several chiros in the city, and I stop here because I found what I am looking for. case closed!

5.description: I've been to Dr. Odisho's Riverwest and Gold Coast location for both massage therapy and physical therapy and his staff is both friendly and top notch.  For my massage therapy I went with Elisha and she can really work out the knots I had built up over the years.  She made sure you were comfortable with the amount of pressure she applied and new exactly were the knots were.  Dr. O has assisted me with a variety of injuries I seem to get into from my knee to elbow and back.  Overall the service is great and I will continue to visit GCW for my needs and services.

6.description: I have been to my fair share of Chiropractic clinics, all offering different levels of therapy from strictly adjustments, to physical therapy, massage therapy, the list goes on and on.  After finding Gold Coast Wellness and River North Health & Wellness, I am confident that I have found the perfect place for me!I came across Dr. O's clinic randomly when a friend of mine posted something on his Facebook page about a clinic he was going to try out in the city.  I reached out to him since the clinic I had been going to was out in the suburbs, and frankly for the service I was receiving, was not worth the time spent to travel out there.So after getting some information from my friend, I reached out to the clinic and actually got Dr. O on the phone.  He was extremely friendly and quickly found out whether my insurance was accepted at his clinic.  Once I received the thumbs up, I quickly made an appointment for myself.Gold Coast Wellness and  River North Health & Wellness definitely stand out from the rest.  Their approach to overall wellness is outstanding.  Some key characteristics that distinguish these clinics...1) Dr. O (or Sarge as we have come to know him) takes a personal interest in his patient's overall wellness.  Unlike other clinics that I have been to in the past, Dr. O is very involved in the process.  Other clinics I have tried often had several techs that work with the patients, and the doctor would only see the patients for a few minutes at the end of the appointment.  Sarge gets to know his patients and is always very friendly as well as professional.  He checks in on his patients throughout their appointments and wants to make sure that they are always pleased with the clinic's service.2) Service Offerings: The clinics offer a vast array of services to their clients, from physical therapy, adjustments, massage therapy, orthotics...the list is very extensive.  I would recommend checking out their website for details.  And most importantly, a lot of insurance plans are accepted here, so more often than not, treatments are covered!  3) Location, Location, Location...for those living in the city or in the vicinity, Dr. O's clinic is fantastic.  He first opened up a clinic in the Gold Coast, and more recently opened another clinic in River North.  And even better, he offers COMPLIMENTARY VALET at both of the locations!!These are only a few of the things that make Gold Coast Wellness and River North Health & Wellness such great businesses.  I definitely recommend that people check out Dr. O's clinics.  The service is unparalleled, and I am a very satisfied & happy client.  I have referred many people to his clinics and they have all been extremely impressed as well.  It is also very simple to schedule appointments via Schedulicity (schedulicity.com).On a side note, Sarge is always shows his customer appreciation.  My husband and I have attended several events that he has hosted in the past as an appreciation to his customers.   I have never been to a clinic that does this for its patients.  Thanks, Dr. O, for the excellent service you provide!  We will certainly be back!

7.description: My massage therapist, Heather, was intuitive and thoughtful in her approach to my treatment. She described her technique as "fascial manipulation," referring to her focus on penetrating and loosening the connections between primary muscle groups. My experience of her technique is that it is quite different from "deep tissue massage" (as the service was advertised on Groupon). The overall effect was different, leaving me less like jello and more pleasurably "loose." I would recommend her to any client who is knowledgeable about massage techniques and can recognize the uniqueness of her work.

8.description: Fortunately I ended up not needing to see Dr. Odisho ... or maybe not? For a medical professional his service was unparalleled, especially considering I haven't been before & would've been a first time client. I called a little after 6 p.m. on a weekday and Dr. Odisho had left for the day, though the person who answered the phone was extremely friendly & helpful. Then, Dr. Odisho personally called me back on his cell phone at 7p.m.! *And* followed up the next morning! If only all doctors/clinicians were so attentive....

9.description: When my back, hips, piriformis, ankles, shins, or other joints are out of whack, this is the place I come to. Dr Sargon Odisho, (or just plain Sarge), and his team of docs work me over well and make me feel so much better. They offer a variety of care and services, including massages, however I've only used the chiropractic part. Great staff that is always friendly and helpful, always makes me feel at home. They always try and work with your insurance and plus they have free parking in their underground garage, which is always helpful in this area.

10.description: I joined on late this year with a group of friends for the Chicago Marathon. I can say with the up most confidence that I would have not made it had it not been for Dr. O. and his crew. Since I hadn't been training all that long I had a lot of catching up to do and a few minor injuries threatened to end this years run for me. But Dr. O. got me back on track and across the finish line. He made me custom made orthotics from a mold he made of my feet, not just a scan like in the stores, and that fixed a lot of problems I've been having from even before training. And they were only $150. My roommate has the same running orthotics from a podiatrist that are from the same manufacture but only 3/4 length that he paid over $300 dollars out of pocket. My roommate is pissed! Also, I think one of the only reasons I'm able to walk normally a day after the marathon while other people are still crawling in agony is cause of Dr. O. signature sports specific stretching technique. There are parts of my quads and hamstrings that Dr. O. worked on that I had never even felt before. Part of the muscle I've missed with my own stretches and I know those are the parts I've hurt in the past. Those are the parts that would likely have been killing me after the run but not an ache because of the stretching. Thanks for help on the 26.2 Dr. O.
