It was a Thursday night around 8:30 and very quiet. Still quality and service was good!I recommend this spot if you like the basics of sushi and really want fresh melt in your mouth fish. I plan to be back for some more.

38.description: My fiancé and I have made Shiso our regular weekend date-night spot. We have been coming to Shiso for months now and we have never been let down. The fish is always fresh and the sushi is rolled consistently. Service is always top-notch and amazing. We have been to some of the top sushi restaurants in Chicago and Shiso, while more casual, matches the quality and the service with a much more reasonable price tag.  Thus far, our favorites include calamari and edamame as an appetizer (best calamari in the city!), miso soup, spicy tuna, jala colar, negi hamachi, and the mochi ice cream for desert. Cannot beat the BYOB! Highly recommend, you will not disappointed!

51.description: This place hadn't been on my radar as far as sushi joints until I dined here last weekend with a girlfriend. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The sushi was very fresh, service was attentive but not overly so, and prices were very reasonable especially for the area. BYOB always helps my enjoyment level as well. We got two speciality rolls which were awesome, an eel and cucumber (my all time favorite thing) and it was one of the best I've had. The only dud was the Seattle roll. I would definitely come back here when in the area.

27.description: Lately, I've been hearing the term "comfort food" thrown around rather recklessly. I get it, we're trying to steer away from the fancy-edible-art-gastronomic types of meals and back to our familial roots. Believe me, if there's anyone that can appreciate using food as a coping mechanism, it's me. However, when you have the lethal combination of multiple panic attacks and a laundry list of favorite foods as I do... everything kind of turns into comfort food doesn't it? Professionally, I don't condone eating your feelings with clients...but personally, I say have at it. So what does comfort food have to do with Shiso? A little dish called katsu curry, my friends. Ah yes, nothing like having a big slab of lightly breaded pork on a bed of fluffy white rice topped with thick curry gravy. Shiso has a reasonably priced katsu curry with a pretty large portion, perfect for dinner and then lunch when you're frustrated at work the next day. "Oh, you screwed up my paperwork while I was gone for the weekend? I got katsu curry, no f__ks are given."

32.description: Sincerely my favorite sushi place in all Chicago. SO good!Tucked away on North Ave in Old Town, Shiso can comfortably hold about 30 guests. It's a BYOB restaurant, which is always fantastic. If you forgo bringing your own bottle of wine, you can order one for a reasonable price ($20) at the restaurant. Shiso makes super yummy and creative sushi rolls. My favorites, in order:1. Sears Tower-- OH MY WORD. I could eat like five of these in one sitting. The whole has cream cheese, crab, clinator, asparagus, and unagi. Then it's deep fried, stacked up to look like a tower, and then drizzled with sweet sauce. Seriously, heavenly. A MUST TRY.2. Mexican -- deep fried shrimp, avaocado, masago, jalapeno, and cilantro, covered with unagi sauce. I am not a fan of spicy food, but this is amazing. 3. Tiger -- deep fried soft shell crab, cucumber, avocado, cilantro, masago mayo, topped with tamago and unagi sauce. So yummy.The waitresses are always super friendly and nice. They don't mind if you're there for a long, just hanging out and catching up with friends. The bill is always pretty decent too! If you're going with a group, I'd recommend calling ahead for a reservation, as space is tight and it's usually pretty busy. BONUS -- they also deliver!!! Whenever I'm in Chicago, I always stop in at Shiso!

54.description: Nice little sushi place, skip the sashimi sets.We were looking for a good sushi place and we found one. We got their crispy shrimp rolls and a sashimi supreme. Each piece of sushi 2 - 2.75, which is pretty average. Miso soup- salty. Shrimp rolls- impressed by the one long piece of shrimp in each, but needed a little salt.Sashimi supreme had 15 pieces ($26)- These things are always grab bags. Some are good and some are meh. All the pieces were fresh, and the white tuna was the best. The shoestring radish that the sashimi lay on was a little too much, like a tumbleweed and a rather flavorless. Oddly, the fish on the sushi and sashimi were same size. Given that the set repeated fish. It might have been better to chose 10 individual pieces rather than the 15 piece supreme. Ambiance and Service 4/5Food 4/5Value 3/5

48.description: My friend and I got the Sears Tower Roll, Philadelphia Roll, and I think the Chicago roll? Anyway, it was all good! Kind if expensive though. The waitress was nice. The place was nice looking.

44.description: Good sushi.i listened to all the comments below about how great sears tower roll is and i tried it.for me it was overfried.i really liked the chicago roll and shiso special roll.service is nice and fast but be prepared to wait for at least 15 min even if you have reservation.

24.description: Hidden Jem of Chicago sushi! This is my absolute favorite place to go for sushi and its fairly close to me which is a huge plus. I'm not that adventurous with sushi but I still enjoy it none the less. I've tried various Maki rolls here and they are all wonderful! I recommend the dragon roll. The only sad part is that they have added a corkage fee- except for on Sundays.Shiso, I love you and I will be back again and again!

7.description: Visited Shiso on a Saturday night before a Second City show and was a perfect location for that. It was busy when we arrived without a reservation, but they took our number and gave us a call when the table was ready so we could grab a drink next door while we waited, which was nice. We were seated at the sushi bar, which ended up good bc there were some larger really loud parties doing saki bombs and whatnot, so glad we had seats away from them where we could hear each other. Food was overall pretty average, nothing bad, but just fairly standard decent sushi. Rolls were pretty small, which wasn't bad for the standard roll price points, but their speciality rolls were probably a bit pricey for the size. They also had a lot of rolls with cream cheese and smoked salmon, which are really the only two ingredients I'll never order in sushi. Perhaps would be back again if I needed an easy place before a show, but definitely wouldn't go out of my way if I wasn't in the area.

49.description: The food here is somewhat expensive. The quality is quite average. It is not BYOB anymore and they do charge a corkage fee. The maki rolls are tiny and they are quite stingy with the sashimi. It's just not worth the visit.But one plus is that we have made a reservation and they did have a table for us straightaway, despite being such a small restaurant.

40.description: Visiting from Miami and happened to walk by. Stopped in late on a Sunday and it was quiet but the staff was welcoming. Ordered several rolls and they came right out. Very fresh and delicious even at closing time. Looks like a spot I would eat at very often in Miami. Prices were good and I have no complaints on this trip. Great random dinner.

53.description: I was a big fan of this little BYOB sushi place.Things I loved: The Seaweed Salad By far one of the best seaweed salads I've had in the cityShiso signature roll: AmazingSpicy cruncy tuna was great too.Things I would improve1. The atmosphere was slightly bland.  Tone the slights down slightly and change the music to fit the restaurant a little better.  FOOD IS SOOOO GOOD.2. Benches were hardOther than that loved this place and I went on a weekday, so maybe on the weekends packed with people the atmosphere would be perfect, still felt the lights were a little high and CANDLES would have been a great improvement.  Why do candles make things so intimate?  Something esoteric about fire.

30.description: I'm confused by all the great reviews. Went here for dinner recently and was unimpressed. Freshness is important in a sushi restaurant, and nothing here was fresh. Wilted brown lettuce in the salads, dried-out California rolls that seemed to have been premade and refrigerated for a long time, so-so maki rolls. Our glassware was dirty and there were fruit flies buzzing around the table.Also if you're planning to BYOB there's now a $3 per person corkage fee.

46.description: Came in on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. The place was empty, but I saw good reviews and decided to give the place a chance. The Sears tower roll we ordered was good, but the sashimi was pretty horrid. The tuna was really, really dry. Salmon and hamachi texture was weird...it was as if they were recently thawed out. Yuck.

1.description: The food was pretty tasty, although I admit I wish there was a higher number of more basic rolls on the menu. We split 3 signature rolls between 2 people and it was just the right amount of food. BYOB is also nice, although if I'm being charged a corkage fee, it would have been nice to have the wine poured into our glasses and topped off for us. When I made my reservation, the hotels said I'd need to finish eating by a certain time - first time I've heard that, but thankfully they didn't hold us to it. They seem to run a tight ship with booking tables, which was pretty fascinating.

55.description: I love you Shiso.Had Mike's birthday celebration here, and we sure did celebrate!  BYOB, wonderful sushi, great friends and atmosphere. Success.We'll be back Shiso, hopefully sooner rather than later!

9.description: Visited shiso for the first time this evening for date night! The food and service was great. I ordered the Sears tower Miko, Miso soup, and a beer (didn't BYOB). The miso soup was great although I don't like tofu or spinach I ate around it. The Sears Tower Miko was stacked like a tower and beautifully plated! It was delicious especially with the sauce and was very fresh. Our waitress was very kind and helped with any questions we had regarding the menu. Very small restaurant but got a table right away! Definitely will be returning to try more!

26.description: A hidden gem in the North Avenue barren strip from Clark to Halsted.  The only sushi in the area.  Open for lunch on Sundays.I LIKE...BYOB on Sundays and NO corkage fee.Drinks List (less than $10) -- Red, White, Beer and Cocktails.Spring Summer Role ($12.95) -- all my favorite ingredients for nourishment and healthy eating.  Greens.  Avocado.  Fresh Fish.  Rice.  The sliver of mango is perfect for just citrus taste to maki.Wasabi Shumai ($6.95) -- wasabi adds a kick and dimension to the sometimes bland and boring Shumai.  Overpriced.SKIP...Sake ($7-21) -- it seems like retail pricing plus markup, not bulk rate.Soft Shell Crab ($6.50) -- the price is right but the single serving crab is itty bitty.  Overcooked.Banana Tempura + Green Tea Ice Cream ($6.95) -- wrong kind of banana for frying.  Overripe mushy banana.  Eek.  A baseball size serving of pre-molded green tea ice cream that was re-frozen.

25.description: So I'm a fan.  Maybe because it's an unassuming, out of the way little joint, or maybe because I first went based on Yelp reviews, so I was primed to think it was great.  After trying a few different rolls and the edamame every time, I can say I've been pleased with all of them.  While I don't remember which rolls I got, I picked basic ones that weren't overpowered with cream cheese and tempura (because those ones are good ANYWHERE).I'm not sure on the BYOB situation at this point because I've ordered wine each time I've gone, but I heard or read that it's BYOB, so they may still allow that.

12.description: Sushi is always on par. Cozy little atmosphere with very friendly servers. Love this place!

59.description: Went there for Sunday lunch and it was empty. Not a very good sign but it was too late to back out the door.Service was excellent, but when we were the only customers, I'd think that it's pretty hard to neglect our needs. Food:- Miso was very good. It was a good portion too.- takoyaki (octopus puff): delish!!! perfectly battered, perfectly juicy inside and perfectly flavored. - Shumai: Our Japanese native friend said this was authentic to what shumai tasted like in her memories. I prefer the Chinese version with yellow skin. - volcano: looks exactly what it sounds like and tastes pretty similar too when you picture ingredients exploding everywhere and mixing together. It was pretty meh for me but when we ordered we knew it was not going to be a roll that you could taste the different layers in.- shiso signature: i had high expectations for this since it was a signature dish. I ended up liking my friend's roll better. Note to self: whenever there are the words "deep fried" in a roll description, do not order, unless you are hungover.- sakura (i think): either sakura or whatever roll that has the least amount of condiments/sauces in the description. The fish was fresh and the amount of avacado was just enough to help the food slide into your esophagus.- sears tower: kudos to the restaurant for keeping it sears towers instead of Willis tower. Taste-wise, I could care less coz the presentation was just priceless. We came up with various interpretations of what they looked like. You'll have to see it for yourself. The 3-star rating is biased since I didn't try their sashimi or nigiri. But it likely won't bump it up.

21.description: Sears tower and volcano. They're a Pontiac game changing play.

17.description: Sincerely my favorite sushi place in all Chicago. SO good!Tucked away on North Ave in Old Town, Shiso can comfortably hold about 30 guests. It's a BYOB restaurant, which is always fantastic. If you forgo bringing your own bottle of wine, you can order one for a reasonable price ($20) at the restaurant. Shiso makes super yummy and creative sushi rolls. My favorites, in order:1. Sears Tower-- OH MY WORD. I could eat like five of these in one sitting. The whole has cream cheese, crab, clinator, asparagus, and unagi. Then it's deep fried, stacked up to look like a tower, and then drizzled with sweet sauce. Seriously, heavenly. A MUST TRY.2. Mexican -- deep fried shrimp, avaocado, masago, jalapeno, and cilantro, covered with unagi sauce. I am not a fan of spicy food, but this is amazing. 3. Tiger -- deep fried soft shell crab, cucumber, avocado, cilantro, masago mayo, topped with tamago and unagi sauce. So yummy.The waitresses are always super friendly and nice. They don't mind if you're there for a long, just hanging out and catching up with friends. The bill is always pretty decent too! If you're going with a group, I'd recommend calling ahead for a reservation, as space is tight and it's usually pretty busy. BONUS -- they also deliver!!! Whenever I'm in Chicago, I always stop in at Shiso!

10.description: Hidden Gem.  My favorite go-to sushi spot in Chicago.  I live across the street from RA but will still go slightly out of my way for Shiso.The spicy crunchy tuna and the fried soft shell crab are so delicious that I have cravings for them.  I can't say that about a lot of dishes.Best part is its BYOB!!!!  How can you possibly go wrong with that?

5.description: A hidden gem in the North Avenue barren strip from Clark to Halsted.  The only sushi in the area.  Open for lunch on Sundays.I LIKE...BYOB on Sundays and NO corkage fee.Drinks List (less than $10) -- Red, White, Beer and Cocktails.Spring Summer Role ($12.95) -- all my favorite ingredients for nourishment and healthy eating.  Greens.  Avocado.  Fresh Fish.  Rice.  The sliver of mango is perfect for just citrus taste to maki.Wasabi Shumai ($6.95) -- wasabi adds a kick and dimension to the sometimes bland and boring Shumai.  Overpriced.SKIP...Sake ($7-21) -- it seems like retail pricing plus markup, not bulk rate.Soft Shell Crab ($6.50) -- the price is right but the single serving crab is itty bitty.  Overcooked.Banana Tempura + Green Tea Ice Cream ($6.95) -- wrong kind of banana for frying.  Overripe mushy banana.  Eek.  A baseball size serving of pre-molded green tea ice cream that was re-frozen.

3.description: We order from Shiso all the time but last night was our first time eating in the restaurant. The staff were friendly and the service was fast. It's a nice, cozy atmosphere inside. Ordering in has its advantages since you get free edamame or house salad for orders of $30 or more. You get a free california roll or spicy tuna maki roll for orders of $50 or more. You also get 10% off all cash orders. Just check the website to confirm the offers are still valid. I would recommend the spicy miso soup, fried calamari (with a honey wasabi dipping sauce) the chicago roll, and the unakyo roll.While they serve alcohol in the restaurant, remember that you can bring your own for $3 per person.

35.description: I'm not sure why this place has 4 stars. Nothing I tasted here was worthy of that, including the Sashimi Set, the Spicy Udon with Chicken, and the Sunset Roll.Sashimi Set - Average, nothing special. Not especially fresh.Spicy Udon with Chicken - The spicy sauce, drenched all over the noodles, was too creamy for my taste. It made the consistency almost like an alfredo spaghetti, which was weird because I always expect (and prefer) Japanese udon to be much lighter.Sunset Roll - Meh, very average. Also, It took us forever to even find a roll amongst the Specialty Rolls that didn't have cream cheese in it... clearly indicating that this is not a traditional Japanese restaurant - cream cheese in sushi is one trend I've never understood.Definitely go elsewhere for Japanese food... Sunshine Cafe, Uni Sushi, Union Sushi, Arami, etc. There are a ton of better options!

19.description: Just stopped by as we were walking by very nice spot with good service...definitely try the Sears tower maki and the house saki!

28.description: I'm very loyal to my sushi place in NYC but this was incredible! The shumai is honestly the best I've ever had. And I'm crazy about a BYOB (they actually do sell alcohol, also!) The rolls were also amazing-- I had the Mexican and the spicy tuna, and they were so so good. It was really affordable and our server was so kind and attentive! That said: the special rolls can really add up fast, so be careful if you're on a budget! That said, it's totally worth it :)

45.description: Cute little sushi place in Old Town. Not sure if it's byob but they still serve alcohol there. We didn't have a reservation on a Friday night but they were able to squeeze us in a tiny corner table as long as we ate in less than an hour and a half. Worked for us, since we were in a time crunch. Service is friendly and the food is quick. The mexican roll was our favorite. Something about jalapeños in sushi is just genius. We also got the Sears tower roll and the shisu signature roll. Both are so tasty, smothered in all that unagi sauce and spicy mayo. Yum.

33.description: Definitely a must for girls night! Great for dine in and take out. The only thing I would not recommend as a to go item is the seaweed salad. The dressing weighs it down significantly by the time it arrives. Tons of vegetarian options as well! I recommend the Super Veggie Tempura roll.

43.description: Love this place! The food has been excellent over multiple visits. Wait-staff is always attentive and friendly. Prices are reasonable.

2.description: Nice quaint sushi restaurant on North Ave.  VERY small space, but was cozy instead of cramped.  Very friendly and attentive staff.The sushi was above average and better than what I was expecting.  We ordered the fried calamari, miso soup, seaweed salad, a few rolls and sashimi.  The fried calamari was great, crisp on the outside and tender on the inside.  It's very easy to overcook so was very impressed when it wasn't.  Miso soup was basic, not great, not bad.  The seaweed salad was good, but a bit too sweet for my preference.  The rolls were good, the crispy salmon skin was actually crispy!My personal gauge on how good a sushi place is is based on the freshness of the seafood.  I always get the Ikura (salmon roe) and the maguro (tuna).  The ikura was nearly tasteless, which to me is a sign that it isn't fresh.  The maguro was good, but still not the freshest I've had.Overall, it was better than I would have expected from a small neighborhood sushi place.  Can't be too hard on the place since this isn't the Bay Area or LA, but definitely good for the money and location.  Will be going back to check out the Katsu Curry!

18.description: I'm not sure why this place has 4 stars. Nothing I tasted here was worthy of that, including the Sashimi Set, the Spicy Udon with Chicken, and the Sunset Roll.Sashimi Set - Average, nothing special. Not especially fresh.Spicy Udon with Chicken - The spicy sauce, drenched all over the noodles, was too creamy for my taste. It made the consistency almost like an alfredo spaghetti, which was weird because I always expect (and prefer) Japanese udon to be much lighter.Sunset Roll - Meh, very average. Also, It took us forever to even find a roll amongst the Specialty Rolls that didn't have cream cheese in it... clearly indicating that this is not a traditional Japanese restaurant - cream cheese in sushi is one trend I've never understood.Definitely go elsewhere for Japanese food... Sunshine Cafe, Uni Sushi, Union Sushi, Arami, etc. There are a ton of better options!

41.description: Great little sushi gem.  The pieces have gotten smaller but the appetizers are pretty amazing.  Love the calamari, tempura tuna roll.  Sushi pieces are fresh.  This place could go from good to great if they served bigger pieces and cuts of fish!

52.description: Solid little sushi spot for a quick bite. Was in there last night, had the house salad, spicy tuna and the Golden Triangle Roll. Overall the food was very good. The house salad is the traditional greens with ginger dressing, their ginger dressing is more sweet than other places I have been to. Spicy tuna was great and the Golden Triangle was good and is promising, but there is just too many sauces on it, and too much of them. It makes the roll, which has tempura shrimp in it to start, very heavy in your stomach... Not exactly what I was going for. But I will be back, great that it is right around the corner!

50.description: Delicious sushi and great decor. Perfect for a date. Try the spicy miso for a new twist to an old standby. Noodles are average, but everything else makes up for it. And it helps that this consistent place is on my block.

4.description: Adorable BYOB ($3 flat fee for corkage per person) sushi place that takes reservations. Also, rolls are well-priced/ lean to the cheaper side.The food was good, service was quick and all of the staff was super friendly! I just wish the place had more seating- but definitely good for a date or a girls dinner out before hitting the bars, especially since it's right next to old town social.

6.description: We really enjoyed our meal at Shiso.Started with the Spicy Miso Soup and the Shiso house salad.  Both were pretty good.  My soup came out a few minutes before her salad which was a bit annoying but it wasn't too big of a deal.Next we had the Crispy Calamari appetizer and our first roll was a special Mango Roll topped with Himachi they had that evening.  The Crispy Calamari was a good size appetizer for sharing.We followed up with the Spicy Tuna Roll, Shiso Signature Roll, and the Sears Tower Roll.The Special Maki rolls were really good.Next time around I'll probably stick with the Calamari and Sears Tower and then explore the menu a bit and try some new things.

22.description: Food- 7Sushi was on point, even fish hating friend enjoyed the Chicago roll. Spicy miso soup very good, good gyoza and shumai.  Shrimp Tempura was crispy and fresh.Atmosphere- 6.5A little sterile, slightly standardized, and no effort towards authenticity.  Good lighting.Customer Experience- 7.5Great service, and BYOB is way to go here.

15.description: Great sushi in old town. Pretty average prices. Byob. Cute, trendy interior. My favorite is the Mexican roll but all their sushi is very fresh and top notch. I will return no doubt.

57.description: The service and ambiance was good, but the price (for dinner) did not match with the quality of the dishes. We got a few rolls of sushi and sashimi for dinner. The portions were smaller than my experience with other sushi restaurants, and their overall quality did not impress. One of my pet peeves is when miso soup isn't included for customers, and when restaurants serve sashimi with rice. While it isn't uncommon to see this, I can't help thinking that it's a business' way to make you pay for soup (which is cheap to make) or use less sashimi for an expensive dish.There are cheaper food (and sushi) options out there. That said, if you are someone big on service and environment, the noise level was low, the decor and furniture are slick and modern, and the waitress was extremely nice.

20.description: One of my favorite Sushi restaurants in Chicago. I have eaten here a dozen times and have never been disappointed. Fresh fish, beautiful presentation, and great service. The Golden Triangle is a must try along with any of their special Maki's.

36.description: Pretty decent sushi place for the price. We had the volcano, tiger, Chicago and spicy tuna rolls which were fresh, good blends and depth of flavors. The sashimi pieces I will skip next time. Polite and timely wait staff. Good cocktail selection (lychee martini is great!) Overall a good experience and we'll deforest return!

14.description: The absolute best sushi place in old town! BYOB is a plus! My faves:- hamachi app- spicy miso- mango tango roll- pumpkin roll - all the sashimi is amazing

58.description: Two words:     Must       TryIf you have/like/want TASTE then Spice House is for you. Excellent selection, delectable offerings and amazing staff will put their spices on the top shelf of your spice rack. They have every seasoning you'll need to zest up kitchen time. You can access their shop 24-hours a day via the web. If this is the only way you can connect with TSH then do it. Their Taylor Street Cheese Sprinkle is killer in your Italian dishes, salads and especially on popcorn.  They have realllly delish cinnamon, meat rubs, sugars and extracts.I am fortunate. I learned about TSH while on a Chicago Planet Food Tour. Our visit consisted of a spice class held on their back terrazzo. Oh Lordy! What a stunning venue! We sat on white iron chairs amidst bushes and trees in full autumn bloom. I don't know if my mind has done a Jimmy Hendrix but I swear there were butterflies dancing around us as our personable and knowledgeable host led his class. I've used their seasoning several times since returning to Hawaii. The biggest hit so far is a snack mix concocted with their Taylor Street Cheese Sprinkle, unsalted butter, bacon salt and truffle oil. I pour this serum of the gods over pretzels, Chex cereal, baby Keebler crackers, Bugles, peppered pecans & cranberries, freshly shredded Parmesan Reggiano cheese and other yummy snack items.  Everything is slowly roasted and tossed until they reach toasty-roasted yumminess. I heart Chicago and The Spice House is one very good reason why. Try them out and be ready to get creative in the kitchen!Service: 5 starsOrganization: 5 starsFresh goods: 5 starsVenue: 5 starsOverall: 5 stars!

56.description: Man this place is amazing. I was looking for some dried lavender - I'm a rather avid baker and was looking to try my hand at scenting sugar to use in my pies. They definitely had it as well as three other spices I picked up. They have multiple sizes and you can pretty much get as much as you want or as little. Their staff is amazing, helpful and explains everything quite thoroughly if you have any questions. FYI, the pullman rub mix is great. I tried it to dry rub my pulled pork the other day and it turned out amazing!

29.description: I recently moved from Chicago back to my home state.  Now that I'm back I find myself missing the city I love so much (that would be Chicago!).  At least thanks to the internet I can still have access to The Spice House.I received my order today and of course being TSH everything was perfect.  Later I was on my way to the store so I took the box and packing material with me to throw in the dumpster.  While walking to the dumpster I got a big smell of the box and the packing material and in my mind I was instantly transported back to my frequent visits to TSH when I used to live in Chicago.  If I weren't on my way to go shopping I would have returned to my apartment and placed the box in my bedroom so I could have that wonderful smell waiting for me when I went in to sleep tonight.  Now that it's almost bedtime I'm really regretting not doing that since I have no doubt I would have had some great dreams.  I just glanced to the right of where I'm typing this and it shows some reviews others have written on TSH and the opening line of Amy D's says it much better than I have written.  It says, "If heaven has a smell, it will smell like The Spice House."  I whole heartedly agree Amy!!!There just really is not enough good things that can be said about this store, the employees or the owners.  I also ordered a catalog with my order and spent a good hour going through it reading and highlighting items I like and items I want to try in the future.  I love the fact that for people like me they still offer a hard copy catalog and not just a downloadable one (they do have a free downloadable one if you check their website, it's on the main page on the lower left side).  My new Spice House catalog will take a place of honor right in my kitchen beside my favorite cookbooks.  Well, as usual this is starting to turn into another book length review so I'd better shut up.  I'll leave you with 2 of my favorite recommendations, oops make that 3 since I just thought of another must have in my home.  Here they are:  Gateway to the North which is a fabulous blend for pork chops, the Lakeshore Drive seasoning blend (as someone wrote in the past this LSD mix is as addictive as crack) which goes on every egg I cook for breakfast and lastly their Indonesian "Korintje" Cassia Cinnamon (it has the flavor that I love in cinnamon, but it doesn't give me heartburn like grocery store cinnamon, getting old is tough on a persons digestive system).  Stop in or order on the internet and I have no doubt you'll become as big of fan of The Spice House as I am.  Speaking of ordering on the internet in my opinion their shipping prices were just downright cheap for Priority Mail to my home state.  I expected to pay at least 50% more than what they charged for shipping.  Thank you TSH for not gouging your customers on shipping I hope you folks make millions of dollars off your labors since you certainly deserve to!!!!

42.description: This is a great place to buy my Indian Spices.  I just wish there was Fresh Curry and Kaffer leaves!

23.description: One of a kind place. This funky shop is like a spice bizarre out of a dream. They make most of the items themselves and have a totally unique selection. They are a little pricy, but totally worth it. I Personally recommend trying the smoked paprika, and the sriracha spice. Come here on a date to have some interesting experiences, and walk around. There are plenty of free samples to try.

47.description: They say he who controls the spice, controls everything... but spice house couldn't control my sneezing. I spent the rest of my day lying on the bathroom floor with a hot towel on my face after a visit last week to pick up some Lawrys Seasoned salt WHICH THEY DONT EVEN CARRY! never coming back. get it together spice house. your spice is not nice.

8.description: One of a kind place. This funky shop is like a spice bizarre out of a dream. They make most of the items themselves and have a totally unique selection. They are a little pricy, but totally worth it. I Personally recommend trying the smoked paprika, and the sriracha spice. Come here on a date to have some interesting experiences, and walk around. There are plenty of free samples to try.

31.description: I really love the selection and price points in the Spice House.  And the neighborhood is nice so I can always make a day of it.  But with just a few people inside it can be very cramped and hard to get around.  Once you have been in and know what you want it's easy to navigate.

34.description: This place is really great.  I came in to put a birthday gift together for my dad and the staff was incredibly helpful.  We put together a great box and she even put the spices in order that made sense - spicy to mild, meat to poultry to fish.  I love the Lakeshore Drive seasoning.  I put it on EVERYTHING.  My omelets, my potatoes, everything.  It's the perfect blend.

16.description: SPICE, SPICE BABY!There's an eschatological excitement to walking into The Spice House with a mural of spices and herbs from around the globe. The spices are beautifully displayed in canisters that look as if they are encased expensive international cosmetics, but in fact,contained spice blends that are ethereal parsimony to my eyes. Yo, VIP, let's kick it, Spice, Spice Baby, Spice, Spice Baby! The spices smelled nothing like the time-forgotten powdered spices in my kitchen pantry. The spices here were steroidally potent as I burrowed my nostrils like a tiny aromatic vole. After giving the Tellicherry black and green peppercorns a whiff, I felt as if someone had probed my sinuses with a tiny wire brush. It was then that I realized how ignorant I had been. Did you know that pink peppercorns are not peppers at all, but dried Brazilian berries that are mild and sweet to the palate? There was an Indian pepper which tasted of pine resin and citrus, and wild Tasmanian pepper that elevated my tongue to a sweetly state. Did you know that white pepper is not really white pepper? It is actually black pepper, but it is put through a process called retting. They soak the peppercorn until the skin decomposes and then the seeds are dried. The white pepper at The Spice House smells ethereal. The texture is somewhere between rich truffle to good chocolate and followed by a mild flavor. Spices definitely intensifies the flavors of your foods, from meats to vegetables to salads and fresh fish. On the other hand, spices can be complicated if you are not sure about which spices to use with what, and on what types of foods. Throughout the world, cumin is second in popularity only to black pepper, so I was glad I was able to find Spanish cumin here. I use cumin often for my Latin American home made cuisine. Then, there is the smoked Spanish paprika, which is rich, colorful and naturally smoked over traditional oak fires. I also enjoy cooking Indian dishes and I am still learning how to make specific Indian cuisine. Although, Latin American and Italian are my "specialties" when it comes to whipping up authentic, flavorful dishes. I purchased an Indian spice mixture of Tellicherry black and Mysore green peppercorns with white peppercorns from Sarawak. A little bit goes a long, long way so don't go crazy using this spice or you may end up cleaning out your entire system. You don't want to become a human fire torch and end up with a rear-end on fire!If you cannot find a specific spice here chances are you will not find it at your local grocery store. I like to grow my own herbs and spices during the warmer months in Chicago, but when I need the best of the best and it is the dead of Winter, I come to The Spice House. I've been coming for years, so my review is long overdue.The price-point is really dependent upon what kind of spice (spices) you end up purchasing. Some are a bit on the pricey side, but they are definitely high quality spices. For this alone, 5-stars. However, my final rating is 4-stars because parking is a pain in the ass in this area of the city -- just insane!!! Yo, man, let's get outta here! Word to your mother! Spice House, Baaaaby, Spice House, Baaaaby....

13.description: I have to agree with every yelper out there...the The Spice House is spectacular! I have been a frequent customer since I moved to the city three years ago. I regularly purchase their Vietnamese Saigon cinnamon and love it for its sweet, spicy flavor and freshness. I use it in my morning coffee daily. I am an avid exerciser and used to get cramps in my feet when swimming and running but noticed since I started the cinnamon in my coffee no more cramping...not sure if it is actually connected...just sayin. Anyhow I divert. I don't really cook much but I have bought countless gifts for friends and family (hoping they will cook for me...it worked once) as they have a great assortment of spice sets and you can mix your own set of Chicago neighborhood ethnic spices...such as Greektown "Billygoat" seasoning, Back of the Yards Rub and Bronzeville Rib Rub. They ship so great gift for exChicagoans to "rub" in their faces what they are missing here in this amazing city ya know?

11.description: Went in search for whole dried sage, not available in any major stores anymore.The Spice House came through with it! The sales person was super friendly and smart, she took care of my order in a jiff. My gf bought a gift set of spices from around the city and it was reasonably priced and the couple we gave it too loves it. Support small business and head on down to Old Town to this great place.Spice House is the tops!

39.description: The best blends of spices I can find anywhere! I love the Bicentennial Seasoning, My hubby and I are big fun of pan fried duck and this seasoning makes the best duck ever! English prime rib rub is also delicious and my friend cannot get enough of their truffle salt! We live in NYC so you think we'll get good stuff there too but nothing to compare. Love them!!

37.description: I bought the Hawaiian Black sea salt and its fantastic. Theres lots of selection of spices. I tend to by organic as non organic spices are radiated. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly.

0.description: This place is awesome. Never thought I could get so interested in spices, but the staff was so friendly and knowledgable that I couldn't stop asking questions. Also, it smells amazing. So even if you're not trying to buy something, just go in and take a wiff.

38.description: If Heaven has a smell, it will smell like The Spice House.My first visit to The Spice House on Wells Street was almost 4 years ago, and they have been my Sole Spice Source since that time. I am so loyal to Spice House products, that when I run out of a certain spice I will make a different recipe rather than having to buy non-Spice House spices. My first stop here was on a whim after I saw a positive review in a blog I used to read.  My husband & I were in Chicago on an extended weekend, and we happened to be eating at a nearby restaurant.  I loved that even on a drizzly day, you could smell the heavenly aroma of The Spice House from pretty far down the sidewalk.  That first visit we walked out with almost a 10# shopping bag filled with amazing spices (which was a pain in the arse to haul around for the rest of the day, but I digress).When I got home a couple of days later & began to experiment with my purchases, I realized that the spices I had purchased at The Spice House were the FRESHEST and best spices I had ever used in my life (I'm a pretty adventurous home-cook).  I have been a very loyal Spice House customer, since (although admittedly, mainly through their online store...due to the pains of heavy bags when playing tourist, as mentioned above :-) ).  A few years ago when we renovated our kitchen & designed our kitchen island from scratch, we had our island drawers specially-designed to be the correct height to accommodate the standard 4oz Spice House spice bottles.  I have always found the staff to be Incredibly friendly, bordering on highly-entertaining depending on the day.  I wish we lived closer so I could stop in regularly.  The gift boxes make great Wedding, Birthday, or Holiday gifts.  Tip: if you follow The Spice House on social networking (i.e. Facebook) or sign up for their e-newsletters, you will be notified about Free Shipping specials.  Since my sales tax rate at home is a bit friendlier than it is in the Chicago-area...this works out quite to my advantage :-).

51.description: Screw Jimmy John's, Spice House should steal the slogan "Free Smells." I mean JJ's smells like...nothing and Spice House smells amazing with scents and spices that evoke emotion and memory.In recent years I've taken a greater interest in cooking, but that's not what got me through Spice House's door the first time. What got me in the door was their lovely gift sets. If you're looking for a handpicked set, a set focusing on a type of food (like poultry), or a neighborhood-themed set - this is your place.Or, if you're simply looking for some fine spices for yourself, this place has got it going on. I recommend asking, if you're looking for something in particular, there are jars everywhere and it would be frustrating to hunt it down. Fortunately, there are plenty of staff with aprons ready and willing to help.If you think going to a place like Spice House is too fancy or pricey for you, it's not really. Since the spices are kept in bulk jars, you can buy amounts you actually need instead of buying a grocery store bottle you might never use again.TIP: If you have you own spice bottles, ask for them to bag your spices.

Some are a bit on the pricey side, but they are definitely high quality spices. For this alone, 5-stars. However, my final rating is 4-stars because parking is a pain in the ass in this area of the city -- just insane!!! Yo, man, let's get outta here! Word to your mother! Spice House, Baaaaby, Spice House, Baaaaby....

32.description: If you have ever cooked anything this is where tag want to be. From Chicago neighborhood specific blends to high quality fresh spices and herbs, this place makes everything taste better!

54.description: I don't cook often, but this store makes me want to try a few new recipes. I was a little overwhelmed in this store. Come with some ideas of spices you would want to buy, then prepare to be amazed at the numerous options available. The staff are incredibly helpful if you need advice. I suggest visiting their website to plan your purchases.

48.description: On the principle that every dog gets one bite, I am overriding my previous negative review of The Spice House. (if Yelp lets me delete it, I will, but I haven't figured that out yet!) I have had subsequent correspondence with the owner, and I believe that there was an initial misunderstanding that developed a life of its own. I am happy to say that I do stand by all the positive comments I made.

44.description: They always have everything I need or could possibly ever want to make a fantastic meal. Best Herbs de Provence. Excellent vanilla beans, multiple varieties. If you are a true home chef, this is a fantastic place.They even mail order your herbs & spices to you. I think they should expand and carry more herbs too. It only makes sense.

24.description: Great staff, great selection! They had exactly what I needed! Will definitely return when I have more time to browse. Thanks guys!

7.description: This is one of those amazing hidden gems in Chicago.  They have your typical spices, which I still need to buy, and they also have their own spice blends, all named after places in Chicago.  I've tried quite a few and they are all delicious.  I only have 2 complaints.  I wish they put the suggested food pairings on the actual bottle.  Not just on the description at the store.  Also, I've been here twice and have never been asked if I needed help.  This is one of those places where if you suggest a killer spice blend, I'm going to need to buy it and run home and try it.  Some direction and suggestions would have been appreciated.

49.description: I dont understand all the hype about this place. The spices are nothing special at all.Bay leaves ? Horrible.Fennel seed ? Tiny and dried out same with cumin,coriander and on and on. If you want great spices. Go to Penzeys !!

40.description: Popped in here after a trip to Old Town Oil down the street, and 100% can't wait to go back. Lots of yummy smells and flavors are in the air, and you can find all sorts of spices you wouldn't see at the grocery store: a barrel of Vietnamese cinnamon, dried Meyer Lemon peel, Strawberry Sugar, dried crunchy honey bits, and the list goes on! They even stock some molecular gastronomy chemicals, and told me how to recreate some of my own items that they were out of. Very helpful staff, great selection, good prices, no complaints here!

53.description: Oh, Spice House!  How I wish you were near me in Orlando!Terrific selection of spices, and the staff is not only friendly and helpful, but they have fantastic senses of humor!  I bustled in 20 minutes before closing (the only time I could get there!), and they never made me feel like I was an inconvenience--on the contrary, I felt like I had all the time in the world!Don't miss out on the Smokehouse Seasoning and the Greektown Seasoning!

30.description: I was excited to buy the Ethnic Chicago Neighborhoods Spice Blends Gift Box 2 to give as a hostess gift.  I called the Old Town location (1512 N Wells) to confirm they had this gift box in stock and explain that I planned to stop by the store to purchase the gift box that afternoon.  A couple hours later I walked into the store, asked where the Ethnic Chicago Neighborhoods Spice Blends Gift Box 2 was, and the three people packaging spices at the front table pointed me to the wall a foot behind them.  I looked closely at the wall and saw gift box 1 and gift box 3, but couldn't find gift box 2.  I asked the table of employees where I could find gift box 2 and someone said "we're sold out."  I explained that I had called earlier to confirm that they had the gift box and the employee shrugged and responded that they sold the last one recently.  The employees were dismissive and unhelpful so I left (and went down the street to Old Town Oil where I had a great experience and purchased a wonderful hostess gift).  Overall, my experience at the Old Town location of The Spice House was incredibly disappointing.

46.description: I wandered into the Spice House on a Monday after work, and I'm pretty sure I found my new favorite store. I was looking at getting either their Grilling or Chicago Neighborhoods gift sets for Father's Day. It was close to closing time, so the store was pretty quiet. I was greeted warmly by the two men who were working there and who were extremely helpful. After I picked out the gift sets (Which have been getting rave reviews from my parents) I was encouraged to walk around and smell everything in the store. It was fabulous. I'm at the point where I now regularly use spices in my own cooking, and I felt like I was in heaven. Every spice I could imagine, I found, including a number that I hadn't been able to find at multiple grocery stores (cardamom!) As a cinnamon addict, I asked about the differences in their cinnamon (4 kinds, not including sticks!!) and we had a wonderful discussion on the different types and flavors. And they allow you to smell anything you want! These guys definitely know their spices and took the time to teach me.What particularly impressed me were the prices. It's been killing me to go to the grocery store and pay heinous amounts of money for the seasonings my food needs. The Spice House's prices are, I'd say, either comparable or even better than what I've been seeing in my grocery store. And they have an option to let you buy it in small envelopes, so if all you need is a little bit, they can do that. My entire home smells like delicious cardamom right now, and I've got a list of things that I'm ready to go back for!

1.description: We would come here on occasion when visiting the city. The problem we always had was parking. When I lived in the city and took public transit, this would be an easy place to visit and in an area with lots of cool places to check out. But now that I live in the burbs, I don't get many chances to shop at a place like this.You will get a slight senses overload when you walk in. I loved the mixed spices they have with flavors like Chicago pizza and other unique mixtures. Those are great for gifts. I know we've bought garlic and roasted garlic here before and loved both.Great place to shop, but don't bring a car or you may be looking for quite a while to park and pay for a meter.

55.description: What a fabulous selection of spices!  I adore the old apothecary cabinets and jars used to house their gigantic assortment of spices.  I keep a running list on my phone of spices on which I'm running low, and they had every single one.  So I picked up those that I needed, and then some.  The staff were extremely knowledgeable, so much so that the girl was able to go into great detail about the differences between regular and Ceylon cinnamon.  I mean, who knows that?!?!  Only the best spice people ever!  Also, they have several varieties of powdered cheese.  This means so much to me and the quality and deliciousness of my popcorn has increased exponentially because of them.  LOVE IT.As a friend once told me, going to The Spice House is truly a spiritual experience.  You'll find anything and everything you can imagine at this great store!

9.description: Wonderful helpful people!  Amazing spices, amazing varitiety, this is so one of my favoriate places ever.

26.description: It's hard to find a space shop like this anymore. The spices from the store just don't compare. The store has amazing quality, great selection, and fabulous blends. Even after moving out of town, I still purchase my spices from the store. Even paying shipping is worth the quality.

25.description: Just adding some more praise on to a clearly awesome specialty shop. With over 300 reviews and a 5 Star rating it was pretty apparent to me that The Spice House was going to rule. It definitely did. Between the amazing smells when you walk in, the encyclopedic array of spices, the super friendly and hands on service, it's hard to imagine another place like this that even comes close in town. It's perfect for a present for grandma, a coworker, or someone you don't really want to give a gift to but have to. Heck, you may even leave wanting to season some of your own meat next meal. Stop in and see for yourself!

12.description: Just adding some more praise on to a clearly awesome specialty shop. With over 300 reviews and a 5 Star rating it was pretty apparent to me that The Spice House was going to rule. It definitely did. Between the amazing smells when you walk in, the encyclopedic array of spices, the super friendly and hands on service, it's hard to imagine another place like this that even comes close in town. It's perfect for a present for grandma, a coworker, or someone you don't really want to give a gift to but have to. Heck, you may even leave wanting to season some of your own meat next meal. Stop in and see for yourself!

59.description: It's simple: buy spices here, however you can get at them (in person, mail order, carrier pigeon, beg-a-buddy.... you get the point).GREAT selection of GREAT spices at GREAT prices.This place is so special. Years and years of shopping here, and it's pure love every time. Well done The Spice House (and special thanks to Loni for all your excellent suggestions! Delish!).

21.description: I usually go to the Evanston location but I picked up an online order from this location a few weeks ago since it's closer to my job. They mixed up one of the items I ordered which was a little annoying since this location is not the most convenient for my schedule...The person who corrected the order was very nice and apologetic. She even gave me a gift card for having to come back in. The staff is helpful and the variety and quality of the products is fantastic.

17.description: If Heaven has a smell, it will smell like The Spice House.My first visit to The Spice House on Wells Street was almost 4 years ago, and they have been my Sole Spice Source since that time. I am so loyal to Spice House products, that when I run out of a certain spice I will make a different recipe rather than having to buy non-Spice House spices. My first stop here was on a whim after I saw a positive review in a blog I used to read.  My husband & I were in Chicago on an extended weekend, and we happened to be eating at a nearby restaurant.  I loved that even on a drizzly day, you could smell the heavenly aroma of The Spice House from pretty far down the sidewalk.  That first visit we walked out with almost a 10# shopping bag filled with amazing spices (which was a pain in the arse to haul around for the rest of the day, but I digress).When I got home a couple of days later & began to experiment with my purchases, I realized that the spices I had purchased at The Spice House were the FRESHEST and best spices I had ever used in my life (I'm a pretty adventurous home-cook).  I have been a very loyal Spice House customer, since (although admittedly, mainly through their online store...due to the pains of heavy bags when playing tourist, as mentioned above :-) ).  A few years ago when we renovated our kitchen & designed our kitchen island from scratch, we had our island drawers specially-designed to be the correct height to accommodate the standard 4oz Spice House spice bottles.  I have always found the staff to be Incredibly friendly, bordering on highly-entertaining depending on the day.  I wish we lived closer so I could stop in regularly.  The gift boxes make great Wedding, Birthday, or Holiday gifts.  Tip: if you follow The Spice House on social networking (i.e. Facebook) or sign up for their e-newsletters, you will be notified about Free Shipping specials.  Since my sales tax rate at home is a bit friendlier than it is in the Chicago-area...this works out quite to my advantage :-).

10.description: This cozy place in Old Town literally has everything you could ever wish for in terms of herbs and spices ! Their selection borders on the absurd, all of it very fresh, and their staff are all super friendly and knowledgeable. From the moment you enter the place and take in the different smells to the time the staff is preparing your spice on their scale, it's a wonderful experience.

5.description: The Spice House is a great option for buying spices. Most spices have multiple options such as black, white and green cardamom. You can buy them in jars or bags. The bags are the best buy. You get more than enough to fill up the containers you already have and it's still less expensive than buying a jar.There aren't bags (or even jars) of all of the spices they have because The Spice House is a tiny place. For example, I might want green cardamom but only the black one is already packaged. An employee has to prepare it for me and they're very busy helping nearly everybody in the store. What happens is that I settle for the black cardamom because it's already packaged and more convenient.I'm always caught off guard that a spice store can be bustling. The check out person  explained it to me. Besides neighborhood customers, The Spice House is also a stop for a couple foodie tours and they host events.

3.description: Great little gem!!!!  The knowledge and selection is remarkable.  If they don't have it on hand they'll get it for you.  Items are fresh and packed on site.  Prices are more than fair and they don't try to upsell items for no reason.  Definitely my new spot for unique, fresh spices.

35.description: Great place and even though it has been a while since we have been there, it was well worth the trip to stop by. Only thing preventing 5 stars is the set up. Was a lot of people asking to help but was hard to follow the flow of the spices and blends... But may have been me. Would be a good idea to have a menu of offerings and services . But service was great and people were very nice.... As always. Will be back again in a few weeks.

19.description: Every single product I've had from The Spice House is amazing.

28.description: I'm never buying spices from the grocery store again.  The quality and prices are better than what you would find elsewhere. They have a huge variety of spices (because, duh) but the staff has always been super friendly if you need any help. Definitely my favorite gem in Old Town.

45.description: I stumbled upon this gem when walking by. I wish this was in CA! You could smell a variety of spices from outside the doorway. You are able to try the spices by sprinkling them on your hands. It's truly an experience even if you're visiting and can't bring back spices.

33.description: Want to have the best selection of fresh spices and knowledgeable assistance? Ask for Raynise at the Spice House. She rocks! I left with the spices I needed and all my holiday gifts; what an unexpected pleasure of a shopping experience.

43.description: This shop has any and every spice you could imagine. My roommate and I went in on a whim and left with a few new spices to add to our already growing spice rack. The staff is friendly, and always able to offer suggestions.

2.description: So, The Spice House is a pretty darn spectacular place. Once you get up the stairs in front, you enter a world of small plastic bags, glass jars, heavenly scents and helpful employees. Like to cook? Love to cook? Don't hate cooking? This store can make your dishes taste better. Seasonings and spices are key.  They seem to have most anything you were missing, things you had no idea you needed as well as a plethora of new to you spices. I love this store.The Spice House has AMAZING original blends of spices that can make you rethink your taste preferences. For example:I used to be fond of saying "I hate pepper." I repeated those words often!I can now be seen eating those words FREQUENTLY in the form of the Back of The Yards  Garlic Pepper seasoning. This stuff is  INCREDIBLE. I have to be honest here. I can bake. I can bake anything, but cooking, well... It's a whole different skill set. Back of The Yards adds a great flavor my meat and chicken dishes were missing. On my latest journey into the store, I happened to pick up a jar of the Sunny Paris, Salt-free seasoning. This has been a gift from the gods for my homemade soups! It also is a great flavoring on vegetables. The salt-free option rocks my world.  Why consume extra salt?I could go on and on and on but I think it's clear. This place spices my world- from the help, to the smells, to the products-it is all around wonderful! If you are not local  or can't easily make it to the store itself, the website is pretty great!* the stairs in front are not steep but can be a bit of a challenge to those using walking devices.

18.description: One of the most fragrant places in all the land. They have an abundance of choices ranging from the most commonly used spices to the completely exotic. Forget Penzey's and don't even think about using McCormick's.

41.description: Sometimes a small problem brings out the best in people/companies. The spice house screwed up on the shipping name and the package didn't get delivered in time (it was to my friend at a hotel who was flying back to Europe). Mistakes happen, and while it was bad for me, I understood. I talked with Tracy at the store and was blown away by the service. He immediately apologized and offered the refund (apology appreciated, refund expected). But then he went above and beyond the call of duty and offered to ship me the package to Europe at no extra charge. I obviously love the product at The Spice House (why else would I have gone through the trouble of ordering spices from the US if I'm now living in Europe), and can now say that the service easily matches the product. Thank you for keeping me as a loyal customer.

52.description: Amazing place!  Go here for spices and you'll never look back!

50.description: This place is the best for finding that interesting new spice to add to any recipe to make it "yours." The selection is overwhelming but in a great way! The associates are also very helpful in suggesting new recipes to try and explaining the differences/similarities between any couple spices.

4.description: This was our sixth stop on the Gold Coast & Old Town Food Tour so I got to visit The Spice House. It's a cozy place filled with all kinds of different spices. The place is supposed to smell amazing since you can try the spices and dust it on the floor if there are any remaining spices that are left over. However, the smell was a bit strong for me and I didn't enjoy the smell too much, but that is just me. But everyone else seemed to love it.Anyways, this is the place to go to get all your spices to cook a lovely meal. Personally, I think they make great gifts as well. I would recommend this place to anyone that loves cooking or just exploring and trying different kinds of spices that are out there. There were spices that I never even knew existed and I got to try it so that's pretty cool.

6.description: If you are a foodie, and if you are ever close to Old Town, you MUST make a pilgrimage into the Spice Shop! Highest quality world spices, arriving into Spice House in bulk wooden barrels and boxes, and broken down by knowledgeable staff into manageable bags and jars, and all the way down to electronic-scale measured grams for your saffron fix (2 or 3 diff kinds of saffron BTW), make this a unique and aromatic adventure. Marco Polo would be envious of all the spices gathered in one space.What can I say that numerous others haven't? Spice House is just an AMAZING icon of Old Town in Chicago and a true homage for cooks and foodies. 15 kinds of bar-b-q rub? Yes. 25 different salad spices and herb mixtures? Yes. Peppercorns? 8 different varieties.... This place is a foodie's dream.

22.description: Tangy.Zesty.Raunchy.Spicy.

15.description: My visit to the Spice House was... fine. I went specifically to buy a giftset and seasoning for my family members for Christmas. I found the giftset with no troubles, but the second spice was harder to find. I walked around the store for awhile looking generally confused before anyone offered to help me. The employees were fine: not particularly friendly or rude. I'd only go here to buy gifts or something really rare that I couldn't find elsewhere.

57.description: Very interesting store you can find many  new and unusual spices, which you can purchase in bulk. Customers can sample the spices before purchasing them. There are also recipes for using many different ingredients in the store. The store is staffed with enough informed sales people to help you if you have a questions. There are also gift sets throughout the store that they will send for you. The spice House has several locations throughout the Chicago area.On my most recent visit  to the Wells Street location , they were busy restocking the different spices, unfortunately they were out of stock of one of  the items I wanted. In addition, another item was only available in a giant size container and I only wanted a small portion.  The spices are reasonably priced if you compare them to more expensive ones in the grocery store. The difference between the grocery store and The Spice House is that the spices are fresher and in most cases you are not forced to get a large container when you only need a small amount, you can get what is need for a new recipe, and waste the rest.

20.description: One of my favorite places to go get spices! I went in there the other day to order my own personal spice box to give to a friend and they did it for me.  They are friendly and take time to take care of you.  If you like your spices this is the place to go.

36.description: I loved this place. I can't believe i didn't visit earlier. The staff were so helpful and really knew everything about spices. They gave me recommendations for products and were extremely knowledgable!

14.description: This the best spice store I have ever visited! Since I moved to the old town area in September, I am regular! Prices are great and the staff are knowledgable and friendly. Go and enjoy, you won't regret it!

58.description: fanastic cozy interior and great wifi and great coffee what more could you want

56.description: Its decor is a bit frilly and feels like it had a lot of stuff from world market or pier one. The coffee was fine but I didn't think of it as very special and don't have any reason to go back.

29.description: This place is great.  First off, the ambiance is  terrific as there are so many separate sitting areas that feel like private spaces.  This isn't a place where you're sitting on top of each with other conversations forced into your space.  There is also a wood burning fireplace, though it wasn't lit while I was here on a Sunday morning.  The menu is great and they have maybe 20+ selections of different types of tea if you don't want coffee.  They also have many packaged and prepared food options, though I didn't try anything on my visit.This is a real cafe where you can not only sit for a long period of time, but you'll *want* to sit for a long period of time.  The employees are friendly as well.  Great place!  I live in Streeterville, but plan to walk over here to visit more often.

42.description: Love Eva's. Been going here for about a year now. Staff is great. Ambiance is relaxing. Their coffee and espresso are stronger than most other coffee shops I've been to, so for anyone with a long night/day ahead of them - Eva's will keep you going!

23.description: Great local coffee shop in Old Town!Perfect for a quick cup or for hanging out and doing work for the whole afternoon.

47.description: This little place is a GEM; great Intelligentsia brand coffee, SUPER friendly staff... the only kicker is the location is a little dodgy at night, but totally fine in the morning/day. Love it... great small biz.

8.description: This is everything I'd ever want in a coffee shop!- Books- Fireplace- Reasonable prices-Strong but flavorful coffee- Comfy chairs- Large tables with plenty of work space- Unique mugs and plates- Good food (their caprese sandwich was on point!)- Great atmosphere paired with great decorHonestly, just everything you'd ever want in a coffee shop. Even WiFi.

31.description: So far, I've been to a few coffee shops in Chicago and the best experience I had was at Eva's.  The hot chocolate was good, the ambience was nice, and the WiFi was pretty good.  It's sort of out of the way but I definitely liked the vibe here so looking forward to visiting again in the near future.

34.description: Very cute (guys can say "cute" right?) coffee shop in Old Town - a true hidden gem. People who work there are awesome, coffee is fantastic, and it's a great place to get work done if you're too hungover to go into the office. Eat your heart out, world's biggest Starbucks on Wells/North.

16.description: Great quiet and cozy place to chill or do work. Not too crowded on a Friday afternoon. It feels like home! Sat at a table by the window for a while, then moved to one of the super comfortable leather chairs by the fireplace.

13.description: This place is huge! No problem finding seats - not just any seats but couches and comfortable arm chairs. There's dining-table-type seating in the back to get some serious desk work done. Pour overs are only $2 and coffee refills are $0.50! Great prices especially for well made intelligentsia coffee. True neighborhood gem.  Baristas are friendly and if you stay a while you'll end up talking to others there.

11.description: I was looking for a cute cafe around Old Town and found some good reviews online for Eva's Cafe. Comfy seating and interior make it cozy as soon as you step in. The chai latte was great and after reading a yelp review I tried the pesto sandwich and loved it. I would give it a 4-5 star rating except that halfway through my meal, someone entered the store and sat at my table, didn't order anything to eat/drink and proceeded to listen to loud music and watch TV shows right next to me as I was working -- there were plenty of other tables available too... Since I was trying to get work done this was pretty disturbing. I noticed other people around the store looked annoyed as well. I'd give the cafe another try but I probably won't be bringing my work with me.

39.description: Delicious chicken poblano soup, great ambiance.But call ahead to see if the fireplace is lit. It wasn't today, and the front room was cold.

37.description: This is a very cute coffee shop!  The staff is always exceptionally pleasant.  During the weekends, it does get fairly busy but you are able to reserve space if you are meeting with big groups.  I'm not sure if there is a cost for printing, but there is a printer available if needed (and of course free wifi).

0.description: The most Brooklyn-esq coffee shop in the neighborhood, and in a good way! Tons of seating inside, fireplace, cartoons, antiques, etc. Regular coffee was solid. Seems like a good spot to get some work done in a quite atmosphere.

38.description: New local favorite. Staff is friendly and relaxed, coffee and tea is quality. To stay drinks are served in eclectic, mis-matched mugs. And, as a tea drinker, I geeked out when they brought out a full teapot of my choice of tea. (Try the toasted/roasted almond tea!) Whether hunkering down to catch up on homework, curling up to read a book, or meeting up with a friend, the atmosphere at Eva's is cozy and comfortable. With exposed brick and decorative knick knacks, the place has a homey vibe. They've got big tables, small tables--and even leather chairs and a fireplace.  Yep. I like this place.

51.description: I absolutely love this place. I work in the neighborhood and there's tons of other coffee shops that are closer to me, but still always go here.The staff is incredible friendly, they know exactly what I order when I walk in, and it's CHEAP!Thanks, Eva's!

27.description: Cozy is definitely the word to describe Eva's. Throw in friendly staff, delicious and reasonably priced coffee and tasty zucchini-walnut bread and its definitely worth a visit. Great vibe for lingering and catching up with friends, or for getting work done.

32.description: This little cosy café in Old Town is perfect for a nice coffee break with friends or to work, as they have both great wifi and a printer! It's not as hectic as other coffee shops, it feels more like you are sitting in someones living room. Since I'm a writer I appreciate both feeling comfortable and being able to concentrate. The staff is really sweet and the food is priceworthy as well!If you are looking for a more hip spot with a lot of space and people just go to Filter Café but do you want to feel more like you are at home then Evas Café is the right place :)

54.description: HIDDEN GEM!  You would not know it's there unless you're looking for it because it's located on a deserted stretch past the brown line stop.  Food (soup, sandwich) is really good (haven't tried the baked goods, but they looked amazing).  It has such a nice, low-key atmosphere, and the staff was extremely friendly.  They have some big, high tables for working, etc and then couches and some teeny tables for chatting over a cup of coffee.  Definitely going back next chance I get.

48.description: I so want to like this place.  I am a huge supporter of local businesses and want them to succeed to help drive better neighborhoods.  However, its so hard to give Eva's more than 2 stars.Here is the deal.  They serve very good coffee (Intelligentsia) and its a nice cozy cafe.  The negative was the dude who was working the counter made an easy coffee purchase into a difficult transaction.  It was painful to just get my coffee and be on my way.  What made it even more difficult was the fact that I had to walk 3 extra blocks to avoid the big boys (Starbucks) to get something local.I will give this place another go next time I am in the neighborhood but I didn't walk away extremely satisfied.

44.description: This is what a cafe was meant to be. Tasty beverages, friendly service (they bring your drink out to you when they've finished making it!), properly-made cappuccinos (note to you fancy-pants baristas - if you make a cute flower in a cappuccino, that's NOT a frothy cappuccino, that's a latte), a mix of comfy club and upholstered chairs and tables for writing), it's like being at mom & dad's place when they've gone out for a little while. And a fireplace that burns REAL wood! Are you freakin' kidding me?!? I LOVE this place! I've been coming here for years, since around the time it opened, and it's been better each time I've come. I'm not bringing my friend the pyro here though--there's not a candle she hasn't tried to reshape or stick something burnable into. A restaurant embarrassment. Just look, don't touch.If they had a dishwasher here, I'd put my emptied mug into it. Like mom taught me to do in her house.

24.description: Great quiet and cozy place to chill or do work. Not too crowded on a Friday afternoon. It feels like home! Sat at a table by the window for a while, then moved to one of the super comfortable leather chairs by the fireplace.

7.description: Go for the atmosphere not the donuts (mine was stale).  Real wood burning fireplace and Sherlock Holmes vintage feel.  A Chicago old world gem once inside.  You could write a novel here.  I'm sure many have.

49.description: Truly great staff at Eva's! Such a great spot to sit with friends with a cup of coffee & enjoy the crackling fireplace! Can be full on the weekends with people & their laptops! Love grabbing coffee here & popping onto the brown line to head to work!

40.description: My neighborhood coffee cafe. Nice spot always a good scene of people.  They recently added a printer so you can get tickets printed.

53.description: Visited Eva's for the first time today after reading Yelp! reviews. It's even better than I hoped for. The atmosphere is welcoming and the service friendly, helpful and thoughtful. The cafe is deep with several large tables in the back. Near the front windows are smaller tables and a wall counter.  The sitting arrangement around the fireplace is lovely now....I can only imagine how magical it is during winter months when it's cold and snowy outside. Like others mentioned, the brick floor is just plain 'special.' This is a little treasure on Sedgewick.Today, I had an iced mint tea with a blueberry muffin.  Both were very good. Later, I had a latte that was 'just right' - and it came to me in a lovely mug with a heart shape in the foam.  Sigh......why didn't I start coming here a LONG time ago??Side note....when I arrived at Eva's, I stepped into a pleasant, quiet, studious atmosphere with numerous patrons scattered throughout, all with laptops and books, several with earphones. Music was playing at just the right volume. I happily ordered tea and a muffin and set up my own study-space at one of the small tables by the windows.  Soon, an etiquette-lacking buffoon came in, chose a chair in the middle of the front room and proceeded to make call after call on his cell phone with seemingly no recognition that his loud voice was the ONLY 'noise' in the place. After 20-30 minutes of this, I packed up my things and moved to an open space at one of the larger tables in the back.  My hope is that by adding this, maybe just one more person out there will be more considerate about making coffee houses their personal office. Stepping outside to make or take the call should be as routine as stepping outside to smoke.  Smoking and making phone calls are absolutely fine....just don't make the rest of us do it with you.

30.description: I thought the place was really cool and an awesome place to study.  They have a large tea selection and I was very satisfied.  Definitely will be coming back again.

46.description: Great place to work and/or study. Free review, plenty of outlets, great (but not too loud) music and tables with a lot of room. High quality coffee and tea at good prices and very friendly staff. This is my favorite cafe in the Gold Coast/Old Town region by far!

1.description: The chill hipsters come to and work at Eva's Cafe, and I am so glad that they exist. Your typical hipsters: Notoriously rude, condescending, and too cool for school.Eva's Cafe hipsters: Good sense of humor, laid back, and still too cool for school.My friend and I are in love with this cafe as a study space (the kind that won't give you the boot for studying for hours) and their breakfast sandwiches. THOSE POTATO COINS ARE EVERYTHING... although a bit oily. Still. Get the potato coins.Solid coffee, latte, ambiance. It's never been too loud (although there's always some ridiculous human being who thinks that loudly skyping or talking on the phone in a public space is totally ok) and the diverse mix (students, families, foreigners, lonely dogs waiting outside the door) make it feel like the real neighborhood joint it is. There are plenty of outlets and seating options if you get there at a reasonable time (aka morning).

55.description: They serve Intelligentsia coffee and the decor here is very cute. The wifi is free and just need to ask the barista for the wifi password. They take card with a small minimum purchase. We walked her from our hotel room. Overall, it was very good.

9.description: So to keep on with my coffee fix, I stopped in here before I went shopping. My latte was awesome, but the owner makes this fabulous zucchini bread - just like my mom. I don't know of many cafes and bakeries in general that make this, so I had to have this. I am pretty sure I was craving it the day before and it was meant to be. It's such a homey coffee shop too. I would love it if it were in my neighborhood as I'd feel like it would be my spot. The barista probably had a good laugh with my reaction to finding out that they had zucchini bread here, and she was really sweet. If I'm in this neighborhood or have another hankering for zucchini bread, you will definitely find me here.

26.description: Great food, great atmosphere, nice people! Cozy little spot perfect for kicking off your Sunday. Will definitely be going back!

25.description: I have been a fan of Eva's for the last two years--it's right near my apartment, it's cozy, and they serve intelligentsia coffee, what more could I want? But in the past month or so I have had multiple terrible and inconsistent drinks. I've had several that I don't even choke down. The man I thought was a manager or owner hasn't been around in the morning and the other baristas are not nearly as capable as he was. I may have to take a break from Eva's and hope they can improve.

12.description: Stopped in for a nice warm coffee with my boyfriend. This place was so nice, and cozy. Bought a large house coffee, it was reasonably priced, 2.50$ and 50 cents for a refill. House blend was tasty and strong. Sat and warmed up from the cold and watched people pass from the window. Loved it
