59.description: Eva's!  I was mostly in shock when I came here because WHY HAVE I NOT BEEN HERE BEFORE.Great space, first off.  Comfortable lighting with lots of hardwood and exposed brick.  Feels like being in someone's living room.  The barista was very friendly and our drinks were affordable and well made.  Also they have pastries from an excellent bakery, including a long-lost favorite of mine, Monkey Bread.  Have them pop it in the toaster oven for you, and you'll have a whole new addiction situation.  I really love this cafe, and will find a way to work it into some aspect of my life-commuting around the city.  It's right off the Sedgewick stop and tucked into a cute brick building.  Come here now and come frequently!

21.description: My absolute favorite coffee shop hidden in Chicago.  Victorian tea pots. REAL fireplace. Loose leaf tea. Cute sitting areas. Wifi. Dream come true.

17.description: Really good coffee :)It is hard to find great coffee away from San Fran but I especially came to this spot because they serve Intelligentsia coffee. I was NOT disappointed!  The baristas were entertaining as well, which is always nice.As for the ambiance, I went right when it opened and the place is super cute. It was empty as well, so if you want to get some work done and drink some delicious coffee, definitely stop by!  It is also right by the Redwood City Farmers' Market, so you can always swing by there right after :)It is the best coffee spot I have been to in Redwood City! :)

10.description: Eva's is a great place to stop in for a quick cup of coffee, or to spend the whole afternoon drinking out of one of the cute miss-matched mugs and working using the free wifi--they also offer a printing service which is great for freelancers who want to work outside of the home. The staff and regulars are all very friendly, sociable, and respectful of other clients and the space, which is incredibly comfortable and homey, especially on cold winter days.The coffee is great, the servings of tea are generous, and the option to make your own sandwich is a welcome alternative to typical coffee shop lunch options of cookies and muffins (though, their banana muffin is pretty great.) Highly highly recommend!

5.description: This little cosy café in Old Town is perfect for a nice coffee break with friends or to work, as they have both great wifi and a printer! It's not as hectic as other coffee shops, it feels more like you are sitting in someones living room. Since I'm a writer I appreciate both feeling comfortable and being able to concentrate. The staff is really sweet and the food is priceworthy as well!If you are looking for a more hip spot with a lot of space and people just go to Filter Café but do you want to feel more like you are at home then Evas Café is the right place :)

3.description: I always study in coffee shops (I a doctor), this is a lil hidden gem, tons of great tea flavors where you get a full pot. Good wifi, super comfortable seating, a lil dark but that's the atmosphere they set.Will definitely come back!

35.description: This is everything I'd ever want in a coffee shop!- Books- Fireplace- Reasonable prices-Strong but flavorful coffee- Comfy chairs- Large tables with plenty of work space- Unique mugs and plates- Good food (their caprese sandwich was on point!)- Great atmosphere paired with great decorHonestly, just everything you'd ever want in a coffee shop. Even WiFi.

19.description: Such  a cute cozy coffee shop. The area is not the prettiest around but it feels very comfortable in the café. They have a very fine selection of tea, this is a must try! I am a coffee person but next time I go, I will try tea (fig green tea sounds very delicious to me). I love sitting by the fire place and reading a book, very relaxing atmosphere in there

28.description: Such a cozy cafe! I came here after checking out Yelp reviews for a coffee place where I could hang out by myself and do some work for a few hours. I was not disappointed.The furniture is cozy and feels antique-like. There are plenty of 2-seater high and low tables with 3 large tables for 4-6 people towards the back of the cafe. It was hard for me to find the counter at first because it was further back in the cafe but as I strolled towards the back whilst checking the available tables out, I was greeted by a cheery girl? Lady? Woman? Miss? A cheery person. I ordered an iced vanilla latte in my own cup. I hadn't eaten lunch yet so I also got a build your own sandwich with turkey, cheddar cheese, tomato, lettuce, hot pepper, and - I think I ordered onion (I asked for all veggies except for basil) - with mayo and mustard on toasted (it was toasted without specification to toast it) focaccia bread. It was toasted just right. The bread tasted fresh. My sensitive teeth sank right into it with a pleasant, toasty-warm crunch. The sandwich was DELICIOUS although I don't remember if there was actually onion in it or not.There is a separate restroom for men and women but when the women stall was occupied, I went ahead and used the restroom for men because it's a single stall anyway. I really like how welcoming this place is. The noise level is low, the music they play is -- I don't really know what genre it was and I wasn't really listening to it because I had earphones on -- neutral? Not bothersome? Not distracting?It's a healthy walk (about 10-15 minutes) from the Clark/Division red line subway station and about a 2 minute walk from the Sedgwick brown line subway station. I like it! Thanks for being open!

45.description: My new favorite Chicago coffee shop! I usually go to the two story Starbucks on Rush and Oak, but decided to try Eva's for something more original and local. The rave reviews on here are legit. Here's what I like about the place:1. Great coffee. They serve Intelligentia, and their house blend is also very tasty.2. Reasonable prices. A medium coffee is $2 and refills are only 50 cents3. Good sized shop with plenty of work space. Good for meeting one-on-one, a small group, or working by yourself. Come here to read a book, work on your laptop, meet with a colleague or catch up with friends -- conducive space for it all. You can sit in the front in one of the comfy chairs or high chairs and watch the foot traffic. Or go to the back where there are large wooden tables.  4. Strong, free wifi. Huge. 5. Nice selection of music played at a reasonable level. This is so key! Loud enough to enjoy if you like what's playing, yet soft enough to not distract conversations or those looking to tune out. Bonus #6: the staff is chill, helpful, and friendly. Note: I've been to Ipsento, Filter, Big Shoulders, La Colombe (West Loop and Wicker), Dollop, Bow Truss, etc -- all great places and Eva's can hang with the best of them. I will be back here soon, they deserve the business!

33.description: Great intimate cafe. Awesome alternative to the commercial Starbucks. Location could be a little better, but the cozy feeling inside makes up for it.

43.description: It is freezing outside! I got a hazelnut latte with whole milk from the recommendation of a regular. It was excellent. This place is really laid back. It has heavy furniture and a stack of books and board games way in the back past the counter. I also got one of their packaged oatmeals which was pretty good compared to other store brands I've had.

2.description: Such a cozy cafe! I came here after checking out Yelp reviews for a coffee place where I could hang out by myself and do some work for a few hours. I was not disappointed.The furniture is cozy and feels antique-like. There are plenty of 2-seater high and low tables with 3 large tables for 4-6 people towards the back of the cafe. It was hard for me to find the counter at first because it was further back in the cafe but as I strolled towards the back whilst checking the available tables out, I was greeted by a cheery girl? Lady? Woman? Miss? A cheery person. I ordered an iced vanilla latte in my own cup. I hadn't eaten lunch yet so I also got a build your own sandwich with turkey, cheddar cheese, tomato, lettuce, hot pepper, and - I think I ordered onion (I asked for all veggies except for basil) - with mayo and mustard on toasted (it was toasted without specification to toast it) focaccia bread. It was toasted just right. The bread tasted fresh. My sensitive teeth sank right into it with a pleasant, toasty-warm crunch. The sandwich was DELICIOUS although I don't remember if there was actually onion in it or not.There is a separate restroom for men and women but when the women stall was occupied, I went ahead and used the restroom for men because it's a single stall anyway. I really like how welcoming this place is. The noise level is low, the music they play is -- I don't really know what genre it was and I wasn't really listening to it because I had earphones on -- neutral? Not bothersome? Not distracting?It's a healthy walk (about 10-15 minutes) from the Clark/Division red line subway station and about a 2 minute walk from the Sedgwick brown line subway station. I like it! Thanks for being open!

18.description: Absolutely love this place. The staff is incredibly nice at this family-run classy coffee shop in Old Town. I first came here in 2014 on a friend's recommendation, and have been coming back here monthly ever since. Great place to get work done, and cozy up with great coffee. They also have great breakfast sandwiches on the weekend. They even have a printer to print documents.

41.description: Home style cafe will remind you of your mom or grams. Comfy cozy and full of home style cheer.  Serving under great Intelligensia coffee too.  I refreshing departure from strollers at Starbucks and hipsters at Intelligensia.

52.description: 5 stars all the way! I love Eva's and I would return every weekend if I lived in the neighborhood. They nailed every detail that matters most, and more. First, the coffee is fantastic and the pastries all looked amazing and fresh-not dry. I had a morning cookie that was to DIE for. They also have a printer! When I got bored doing the work I brought, I picked up one of their awesome coffee table books from the shelf and spent a few hours relaxedly learning some history from the last 1000 years. Plus, it was a rainy day and it could not have been more cozy inside! I only wish we could have gotten one of the few comfy chairs. One guy hogged the comfy leather chair area the entire afternoon!

50.description: Great service. Great sandwiches. Great coffee. It's a little bit off the beaten path, but still in the heart of Old Town. Always love coming here.

4.description: Generous amounts of quality tea.  Courteous staff.  Top notch in terms of value/quality.However, I kindly ask that you do not go here.  This is because every time I come there is no room to sit due to this cafe's increasing popularity.  Please go to Starbucks and let me have a table here.

6.description: This is what a cafe was meant to be. Tasty beverages, friendly service (they bring your drink out to you when they've finished making it!), properly-made cappuccinos (note to you fancy-pants baristas - if you make a cute flower in a cappuccino, that's NOT a frothy cappuccino, that's a latte), a mix of comfy club and upholstered chairs and tables for writing), it's like being at mom & dad's place when they've gone out for a little while. And a fireplace that burns REAL wood! Are you freakin' kidding me?!? I LOVE this place! I've been coming here for years, since around the time it opened, and it's been better each time I've come. I'm not bringing my friend the pyro here though--there's not a candle she hasn't tried to reshape or stick something burnable into. A restaurant embarrassment. Just look, don't touch.If they had a dishwasher here, I'd put my emptied mug into it. Like mom taught me to do in her house.

22.description: Just a nice cozy neighborhood coffee spot. Great atmosphere, cozy warm comforting. A touch dark, but you wont be stumbling around blind. A nice spot to wind down after a long day, or to meet a date, friend for a chat. The drinks are top notch amd and reasonable, pastries are fresh and tasty.

15.description: Cozy little coffee shop tucked away from the normal hustle/bustle of old town. Great coffee and treats and a super friendly staff.

57.description: ADORABLE. Is what this place is!I needed wifi for work, and stopped in for sustenance as well. This place reminded me of the coffee house on every other tv show. There are a lot of tables, sofa chairs, and the setting was very inviting. The guys behind the counter were very nice. Sandwiches are simple, yet tasty. And parking was free. I would definitely be back if I'm in the area!

20.description: This is the best little coffee shop in Old Town! It has a cozy atmosphere, friendly staff, great coffee and fresh made to order breakfast sandwiches that are delicious! There's hardly ever a line and there are plenty of places to sit and hang out. They also have free wifi. You must go!

36.description: this is my favorite neighborhood coffee place.--- the coffee is superb--- the coffee is also reasonably priced--- ceramic mugs if you dine in --- free wifi (password goodcoffee)--- spacious with several tables for work, as well as a few large leather armchairs near a working fireplace gives it a really cozy feel.--- similarly there are power outlets near every table--- incredibly friendly staff that brings you your drink after it's madeI don't like to give 5/5 but this place is a no brainer.

14.description: My new favorite Chicago coffee shop! I usually go to the two story Starbucks on Rush and Oak, but decided to try Eva's for something more original and local. The rave reviews on here are legit. Here's what I like about the place:1. Great coffee. They serve Intelligentia, and their house blend is also very tasty.2. Reasonable prices. A medium coffee is $2 and refills are only 50 cents3. Good sized shop with plenty of work space. Good for meeting one-on-one, a small group, or working by yourself. Come here to read a book, work on your laptop, meet with a colleague or catch up with friends -- conducive space for it all. You can sit in the front in one of the comfy chairs or high chairs and watch the foot traffic. Or go to the back where there are large wooden tables.  4. Strong, free wifi. Huge. 5. Nice selection of music played at a reasonable level. This is so key! Loud enough to enjoy if you like what's playing, yet soft enough to not distract conversations or those looking to tune out. Bonus #6: the staff is chill, helpful, and friendly. Note: I've been to Ipsento, Filter, Big Shoulders, La Colombe (West Loop and Wicker), Dollop, Bow Truss, etc -- all great places and Eva's can hang with the best of them. I will be back here soon, they deserve the business!

0.description: Frank Landon has done makeovers on our tv show and done a fabulous job on both men and women. He is talented and creative. His services also include microdermabrasion that does not hurt, peels, hair syles and colors etc etc.

1.description: I really hate to give this place such a low rating because the staff were super welcoming and friendly.  However, since this review is mainly about my haircut, I would have to say I am extremely disappointed with the way it turned out; especially for $100. My hair stylist was a middle aged Asian lady, Haruki, I believe. First off, it took her forever to cut my hair, as if she was cutting it for the first time. She would cut a little and then analyze it, and go back to correct it, and then step back to analyze it some more.  This went on for about 2 hours. You figured after that many hours it would be a masterpiece--NOT!  The end result?  Blunt/choppy ends, crown of head lacked volume, and there's absolutely no style whatsoever.  Throughout the entire experience, she only used one pair of scissors.  Not that I'm an expert, but because the bottom on my hair is so thick, she should have used sheers to thin it out to create these wispy long layers.  Instead, she cut everything straight across with a few uneven strands in the front to supposedly "frame" the face.  Even that she didn't do it right.  To create layers, it has to be gradual.  Right now, it looks like a mullet. I don't have time to deal with the blunt ends on the bottom every morning, so I've been tying it up in a ponytail until I find another stylist who can correct this problem. Her skills and styling techniques are very outdated.  After dropping a $100 at this place, I was expecting a more modern and stylish haircut. Big disappointment.

9.description: Had highlights done with Scott and he's terrific! My hair looks very natural- well done!  Scott couldn't have been nicer. Will definitely go back!

12.description: This is the only place to go for japanese straightening in Chicago.  Suzuki straightens my hair and also highlights it, and it is silky smooth, healthy and straight.  The stylists at Sho don't just know cuts and products -- they really understand hair.  They can give you beautiful hair no matter what nature gave you.

21.description: This place is by far the best salon I've ever been to.  Esther did my hair cut and she knew exactly what I wanted.  Last time when I was Rachel K the girl (can't remember her name) actually cut two inches of my hair while I only asked for a trim!  Esther trimmed my hair and it looked great, I walked out pretty happily, will definitely go back for my next hair cut.

16.description: I have been going to this salon since it's grand opening day.  I love my stylist, Miwa, and my colorist, Jill.  They are both fantastic at what they do.  I always walk out with a huge smile on my face because I love what they have done to my hair.  Miwa always give me a fantastic cut and more importanly she knows me as a person.  Jill is great with color and she always has great suggestions without ever being pushy.  Ultimately it is your decision and thats how it should be.  She has a great personality and is absolutely adorable!  On my wedding day last year there was no contest on who would do my hair.....hands down Miwa and Jill!!!

17.description: Blondes may always have more fun, but it can be a real pain to get the perfect platinum.  It's not a matter of life or death, but a good dye job can make or break the next 6-8 weeks of your life.  Having been spoiled by the ole pros in SoCal for several years, I was pretty nervous about finding the right stylist here in Chi-town.  Literally, I stopped "good blondes" on the street to find out where they got their color.  I was definitely taking a risk- is it a faux pas to ask?  After all, we want to look like naturals not Christina Aguilera.  A friend of a friend held the key to my lock of gorgeous hair.  Jill at Sho Studio is not only the cutest stylist around but the very very very best.  The best I have ever had, in fact, and that's saying a lot.   $105 for highlights and it's worth every penny. She listens and doesn't push products on you.It's no frills (i.e. I blowdry my own hair after its over), but I don't expect much after having my hair pulled through a cap with a teasing comb and frosted with bleach sometime in the distant past.  She is tops, and it makes me sad to think of life without her.

10.description: I moved to chicago four years ago and for the most part still went back to my old stylists whenever i visited Taipei or LA and would only get a cut in chicago when I was desperate.  I just hadn't been able to find a stylist who is very good with asian hair and pleasant to work with, not until i went to Sho.i went to sho studio in November with the living social promotion.  my friend had suzuki and i had esther.  both of us were very pleased with our cuts.  at first i was a little disappointed that i couldn't get an appointment with suzuki (he only had one opening on that day), but after reading the excellent reviews of esther here on yelp, i went with her.  it was proved a great decision!!   esther is friendly, very personable, and listens attentively  to what i wanted.  i was a bit indecisive about what exactly i wanted (whether to keep growing or cut it short), so she stepped in and offered her professional opinions.  unlike other stylists who usually criticized my previous cut by a different stylist, esther actually praised that it was a very good cut, just not fitting anymore after a few months because of the fact that i have a lot of hair in the back of my head.  she also advised against chemical treatment (coloring, straight perm...etc.) that i was kind of thinking of.  i would imagine most stylists would go with the customer's requests (especially the ones that will involve more $$), but not esther, which made me feel that she was really thinking for the customer but not just her business.  all in all, a very good experience.  although a bit pricey ($100 first visit, $85 thereafter), i will most definitely go back to sho studio in the future.

5.description: I still cannot find anyone who can cut my hair  the way they do it in Japan. I have really thick long hair and it gets hot and difficult to deal with in the summer so I like it when the hairstylist is able to cut away and layer my hair so that it feels much lighter yet  the length is still there.  If I'm going to spend 80 dollars plus tip then I want to feel different and look different when I leave. Frankie did seem like a very nice person but she was also afraid to cut my hair as if I was going to freak out about loosing the length.  I didn't really bother to look at the prices on their website because I read that the prices were reasonable and there were only 2  money signs on the yelp website so I figured it wouldn't be that expensive, but shoot, 80 dollars for a trim is pricy for me.   When I asked the receptionist dude to charge the tip on my credit card, he gave me an attitude about how next time I need to bring cash for the tip.  Seriouslly, I just paid for an 80 dollar haircut and you're scolding me for not having cash for tips? Ugh...

11.description: Lost but then... found!  I had no idea that I was in jeopardy of losing (or for that matter, I had no idea that I had even lost) my stylist, Angel Marquez (formerly of Salon Buzz and now at Sho Studio)!  I went through this once before (and unfortunately, suffered the indignity of having to go to another stylist for a period of time)... and trust me, I don't ever want to go through that again.  In any event, Angel has found me!  I love the new digs - very modern, very hip (reminds me of NYC salons), very clean and most importantly, it's Angel's new home.  Everyone at the salon is friendly and upbeat... and truthfully, I'm inclined to try a few other services upon my return visit.  So, if any others out there are missing their Angel, do not fret - he's at Sho Studio; if you need contact information for Angel, feel free to drop a line!

22.description: One of the people I miss most in Chicago is Miwa, my stylist. She is a great stylist and a sweet person. She is in demand so you have to make an appointment well in advance, but it's definitely worth it. I always leave the salon feeling beautiful and with a smile on my face.

0.description: I have lived in Chicago for 15 years and pretty much traveled out of state and even out of the country for haircuts until I met Frankie in 2008. She is absolutely spectacular in her skill. She is able to understand what you want, and more importantly, she will tailor the look to suit your face. I haven't had a bad cut once. I also get compliments on my hair frequently on a weekly basis. ALL THANKS TO FRANKIE!! Try her at least once. The prices are reasonable and best of all, you will NOT be disappointed.

20.description: Blondes may always have more fun, but it can be a real pain to get the perfect platinum.  It's not a matter of life or death, but a good dye job can make or break the next 6-8 weeks of your life.  Having been spoiled by the ole pros in SoCal for several years, I was pretty nervous about finding the right stylist here in Chi-town.  Literally, I stopped "good blondes" on the street to find out where they got their color.  I was definitely taking a risk- is it a faux pas to ask?  After all, we want to look like naturals not Christina Aguilera.  A friend of a friend held the key to my lock of gorgeous hair.  Jill at Sho Studio is not only the cutest stylist around but the very very very best.  The best I have ever had, in fact, and that's saying a lot.   $105 for highlights and it's worth every penny. She listens and doesn't push products on you.It's no frills (i.e. I blowdry my own hair after its over), but I don't expect much after having my hair pulled through a cap with a teasing comb and frosted with bleach sometime in the distant past.  She is tops, and it makes me sad to think of life without her.

19.description: This place is by far the best salon I've ever been to.  Esther did my hair cut and she knew exactly what I wanted.  Last time when I was Rachel K the girl (can't remember her name) actually cut two inches of my hair while I only asked for a trim!  Esther trimmed my hair and it looked great, I walked out pretty happily, will definitely go back for my next hair cut.

2.description: BAD!I am Japanese and I was expecting that someone could cut hair like they would in Japan. WRONG.This lady (middle age) was a hair stylist in Japan...but I guess she stopped learning new techniques and such.Who cuts hair wet unless you cut your hair really short....Nobody does that in Japan now. And she cannot do lyers. Just HORRIBLE. But yes she can speak Japanese if that is all you want.I now know I have to fly back to new york.

18.description: Miwa is a lifesaver! I've been going there for the Japanese relaxing process for 6 years now and would not go anywhere else for this procedure. She's so adorable that the 8 hours I'm sitting in the chair just flies. I've heard horror stories of people trying to get this process done for cheaper and having their hair fall out as a result. Although Sho is a tad on the expensive side, I'd say it's completely worth it. Highly recommended!

13.description: I miss Esther.  She's awesome and I highly recommend her as a stylist.  I like going to salons and saying "do whatever you think looks good as long as I can still put my hair in a ponytail I don't care".  she totally got it and ran with it and I always had good cuts.  Once she even recommend red under layered blocky highlights which were bad ass and perfect for work because i could hide them or show them off.  It's expensive (about $90 a cut) but you get what you pay for :)

4.description: Love this salon. Suzuki is the best colorist and stylist I have ever used.

6.description: How can there be no mention of Scott Patrick in the reviews of this place so far?  He is a color genius and also cuts hair amazingly as it turns out.  Pricey but you get what you pay for, and he is completely forthcoming and candid about what will look good on a person and what will definitely not.  Make an appointment well in advance to ensure you can get in when you need to.  For the record, I do miss my previously reviewed hair genius, Dennis from Gro, and I would still recommend him without reservation, but being able to go to the same person for cut and color is where it's at for me right now.  What truly sets SP apart is his ability to create a color story that a) is totally complimented by the haircut and vice-versa, and b) is utterly sophisticated without being too over-the-top or avant-garde unless that's what you happen to be looking for.  Plus, he's very sensitive to someone's maintenance tolerability scale.  My main goals are to cover any grays, look good on both wash-and-go and blowout days, and only have to come back every three months or so without looking totally grown out.  Done, done, and done!

15.description: Very impressed with this place. Clean, hip studio. Everyone that works there is very professional and nice. If you have the chance get your haircut by Angel, he is the best!

7.description: Suzuki gives it to you straight. I brought in pictures of hair cuts I like and he said, "I can do that, but with your hair type, it won't look good". We talked about what I wanted my hair to do and he came up with a game plan to meet my wants that would work with my hair. Michelle washed my hair and it was SO relaxing! It was like a massage. Then Suzuki cut my hair and was very careful to show me how to style it and a few different options. He was charming and pleasant to talk to while he worked. He mentioned how much he loved his job and it shows! I thought it was going to be MUCH more expensive than it was. I LOVE my new hair, I LOVED the experience and I'd pay half again as much as he charged. I'll making him the only one that cuts my hair from now on!

8.description: ANGEL (FORMERLY SALON BUZZ) IS AMAZING!I have been seeing Angel since he was at Salon Buzz and he recently has moved to SHO STUDIO!I am very particular with my hair and Angel always does an amazing job! I have thick, coarse, asian hair. and he does an AMAZING JOB! I give him a general idea of what I want, and he gives me some suggestions and after i have FABULOUS Hair!He is great with modern and creative cuts!~

3.description: Love the layout of the salon, decor is tasteful however that all gets tossed out the door when you hear Suzuki (one of owners) open his nasty mouth and speak poorly about his staff and assistants.  It's one thing to be entertained by that sort of childish small minded behavior while watching reality shows on TV, however seeing it in real life and wondering how someone could treat their employees in such a manner in front of clients (there were 3 guest there at the same time as me) gave me a deep feeling of sorrow for that poor misguided man.I loved my cut and would consider going back for that but the poor attitude of the owner will keep me away for good.

14.description: I found Sho Studio on Yelp.  Specifically Miwa, an amazing woman, not only as a cutter but as a person.  Then after the colorist I was using moved, I inherited Ingrid, who it turned out, was even better.  Over the past year or so, I've felt a bad vibe at Sho.  Some employees complained to me about Management, I noticed that many of the younger help were leaving regularly, you could tell that the staff were not happy.  Today I received a letter that Miwa and Ingrid have moved.  I'll be following them to the new salon.

3.description: Love this bar ! Been coming here for 8 years. Had dinner here for super bowl last night. We ordered the chicken lemon and it was delicious. The food here is always good. Grace is the best bartender she's been here a long time and really knows her job.

1.description: This place is basic, but not in a cool dive bar way, more like a not living up to its potential way. The menu is so out of line with what one expects at a nicer sports bar, especially in Old Town. I mean the throwback layouts with cheap pictures and the actual food selection of food is stuck in the 80s-90s. They desperately need some help. And how about some vegetarian options besides a salad? It is 2015.Service is okay - came for Beats game with my mom and was served my check before the first quarter was even over. Ummm I'm clearly in a Bears hat and my eyes are peeled to the TV - why are you trying to kick me out already?! It's so close to my mom's place so I'll give it another try but I cannot recommend.

2.description: Descriptive phrase: a standard, no-pretense bar.We stopped into Tavern on Wells late one Saturday for a nightcap. It's your standard-issue sports/locals bar. They've got TVs and beer and shots. It's the bar you go to if you're in the mood for a domestic beer but not in the mood for mixologists and dropping bass.

5.description: Came here with my Boyfriend who had bought a Groupon for the Tavern On Wells. We came not expecting much but actually we had a good time. Our waitress was extremely attentive and knowledgeable of the menu. I wish I could remember her name. But,she gave us a run down on everything to the Beer Selection to the Entrees.Which we appreciated since it was our first time there. I ended up ordering a stuffed burger which was AMAZING and my boyfriend got a pizza with like Four toppings which was YUMMY too. The Groupon included two beers/wine we opted for Beers. I wanted something kind of sweet so she suggested Not Your Fathers Root Beer which was surprisingly good.Overall I would definitely come back with or without Groupon !

6.description: Had a groupon so we tried it. So good!! Burgers are amazing salad was great and super friendly! We will be back for sure

7.description: Great staff.  The bartender was very attentive and friendly.  The owner was just as friendly.  I recommend you stop by and try the sliders with a blue moon and a side of a shot of FireBall... Cheers

8.description: Great burgers really attentive wait staff and good beer selection, what else could you ask for? Oh and there are also plenty of monitors to catch a game if you want.

9.description: I was previously apprehensive to try Old Town Burger Saloon (their name prior to changing it), because of the sub par Yelp ratings. Right around the corner from my condo, I was starving and needed a burger after a long day at work. Best decision I've made in a while, because this is hands down the greatest burger I've had in Old Town. I try to stop in every week for a grass fed cheeseburger (try it with a fried egg and bacon)! The sweet potato fries are just on point. Atmosphere is nice; a small town feel in the big city. Never too busy, and the service is nice. Highly recommended!

0.description: 5 stars!  I stopped in this place while in the area and was amazed with the food & service.  This is a smallish bar style restaurant with about 7 to 10 tables / booths.  They also have a billiard table.  Most bars don't have great food,  but this place served up some fresh and tasty items.  We tried 5 items:1. Wings - pretty much your standard wings but fresh and tasty.2. Nachos - my girlfriend said the homemade salsas were very good.3. Pizza - sausage & green pepper.  Awesome!  I've been to some little bars that serve frozen pizza.  This place homemakes their pizza and the crust is super good along with the fresh ingredients!  Highly recomend the pizza!4.  Beef tacos - filled with plenty of beef and very yummy!5. Margaritta - better than mostOverall I would give the food 4 stars for this type of restaurant / bar.  I raised the whole review to 5 stars due to the amazing service!  Very welcoming and friendly service!Pictures included of all the items I tried.

4.description: This place has changed names a few times in a fairly short period of time. Formerly the Old Town Burger Saloon, this place has updated the sign and menu. There are some more food options and it has pictures. The interior is the exact same. I came by out of convenience as usual and ordered the Old Town Beef Burger with grass fed beef. I don't usually spend the extra money for the grass fed beef. I'm not sure if it was that or a new cook or something else, but this was easily the best burger I've had at this place. It is enough to convince me that they've updated more than the menu by adding pictures.Heads up though, the mugs for draft beers are probably 12oz mugs, not pints. This is not new, but I only discovered it when pouring my can into it.

1.description: I purchased a Groupon-esque deal on the streets of the gold coast from some overly-pushy and kind of annoying guys.  I desperately needed a haircut, so I was willing to give this place a try. So glad I did! My stylist, Gianna, was super nice and easy to talk to, unlike the usual awkward conversation that can be had during a haircut.  The salon itself was clean and well-kept, and in a nice area. The girl at the front desk was very helpful and sweet.  I felt a little demanding going in, because I did not want to lose much length in my hair but needed a cut and a new style. Gianna delivered perfectly!  I look forward to going back again in the future.

9.description: Compagnia della Bellezza is amazing! You will not be disappointed. Just go! :)

23.description: My friend and I decided to take advantage of the promotion advertized by a marketing firm downtown Chicago.I'm usually very skeptical about such offers, but this time I decided to give it a try since I've heard of this salon before from a coworker. My colleague recommended the services of the salon owner Maria, so when I called in to make an appointment I asked for an appointment with her. I was told that she was rarely at the salon these days and the offer did not include her services, since the salon was trying to promote their other hairstylists. The receptionist assured me that the other stylists were very qualified as well.  I was excited, and looked forward to getting a hair cut from "one of the best voted salons" in the Chicago land area as the  advertisement read, not realizing that I was about the face an ultimate haircut nightmare. See, we all had this one time when the haircut was just not right- too short, too long, just not what you had in mind. I had no idea that it was my turn to experience just exactly that.When I came in, the stylist asked me what I had in mind and I told her right away that I definitely wanted to keep the length. Then she showed me a magazine and I picked out a LONG haircut, and asked her what she thought. She said that it would work well for me.  During the course of the conversation I repeated to her several times that I definitely wanted to keep the length. It seemed like she understood, at least she was not asking any more questions. To make the long story short, what I got was a chin level version of a bob cut (I guess I lucked out it wasn't a buzz cut after all).  The haircut looked nothing like the picture I showed to her. When I pointed it out she showed that if I were to use a flat iron it was a little longer. I was letting my hair grow for 2 years!!!! Needless to say I was very disappointed.She kept assuring me that it looked good.  I'm glad she thought so because I clearly didn't!!!.Then I got my makeover, which was a part of the package as well. The lady seemed rushed and, I felt bad keeping her there. The makeup looked o.k., just o.k.  What I really didn't like was that she was using the same brush she probably used on other clients before - it did not look clean.Afterwards, I was meeting a friend for dinner. When she saw me she exclaimed-"I thought you were letting your hair grow". I thought so too I said grimly.  I will not be going back there!

5.description: I (usually) try to avoid cliches in my reviews but I've just left my first appointment at Compagnia Della Bellezza and I'm still so in shock over my new look that all I'm really able to come up with right now is:  OMGOMGOMG... LOOK AT ME!  I LOOK AMAZING!I walked in with my signature humongous, bushy mane and no make up.  Background:  I've never thought of myself as very pretty.  Maybe "cute" on my best day but I've often. Thought, "good thing I've got a great personality cause I was in the wrong line when they were passing out beauty."  Not being falsely modest - that's just what I thought.  Well, let me tell YOU something.  By the time my new hair BFF/stylist, Mallory, and my new make-up guru/consultant, Bobbie, got done with me...just.... holy cow!  I look HOT!  I honestly had no idea I could look like this!  My hair is sleek, polished and most important, versatile.  My make up is somehow both subtle AND dynamic.  I cried when. I saw myself.  I know this sounds silly but I look like the "after" scene in one of those makeover television shows.  I'm stunned.I'd say these guys get my coveted BTS (better than sex) rating but the thing is, I think the fiance isn't going to be able to keep his hands off of me when he sees me so, 5 Stars/BTS.... the point is moot.  I LOVE this place and I can hardly wait to go back; true story. :-))

25.description: Maria Paonessa, the owner, is a very special person. Her salon which is hard to spell Compagnia della Bellezza (is pronounced Compe Aneea Day La Bell Eat Za) is a labor of love that she has developed over the last 20 years moving from several locations on Wells Street until she finally bought the old Ripley's Believe It or Not Museum Building. The decor is lovely and artistic.The approach to hair is as "cutting edge" --no pun-- from Europe down to daily "lady-up-dos." The community energy in the salon is friendly and caring. There are no snobby elitists bossing your hair around. You will get advice - but they listen to you first.Maria Paonessa is a great colorist. Go to her if you accidentally use ASH Blonde and your hair turns light purple like mine did one time.

12.description: Got a great haircut - I'll definitely be back! I've tried to do layers before and I normally end up looking like Jennifer Aniston circa 1995, which is all well and good if you want to look like you want to go to a Hootie & the Blowfish concert, but... anyway, this time, I decided to try again and it actually worked! Great job, Mallory, you rock! Thanks for the great hair!

21.description: I, too like other reviewers came to this salon after uncharacteristically buying a "best salon search" coupon from a marketing guy on the street. I'm not an impulse buyer so let me tell you that that guy was really good at his job.Just went to this salon this past week to have my hair colored by Lily. I was a little wary of using the coupon so I asked her about why the salon uses the marketing technique. She explained that the salon doesn't get a lot of foot traffic since they are on the second level of the building so they use the marketing guys for referrals to get people into the salon, which helped me feel less suspicious about the coupon.I came in to get my hair colored a week before my wedding. Lily was very good. She understood what I wanted and recommended small additional things that would make the color look better (and it did). Also I came in a little on the fence about getting a cut as well. Rather then encouraging me to do it, Lily told me that I should probably wait until after the wedding so I can get more for my money with the cut. For that reason I will be going back and requesting her specifically!I will be going back for the make-up application part of the coupon this week and will check back in!Another plus-fairly easy to get appts. Salon is busy but not too busy that you feel as though it's a factory.

16.description: The first time I went here Maria did my hair. I pretty much get the same thing done every time...blonde highlights and layers put throughout. Maria was amazing and even took the time to curl my hair!Fast forward 1 year.I return to the same salon to get my hair done after purchasing a livingsocial deal. I came in and they didn't have a scheduled appointment even though i made one so i rescheduled with Paolo for 4 days later. I asked to lose no length and lost at least 2.5inches!!! He decided to do painted highlights.....awful they pretty much washed out after a couple days and although my hair looked fine leaving the salon it wasn't what I asked for and over $100 later I'm not so thrilled, before it was full of volume and after it was flat and the color looked horrible.....sadly I will not return to this salon. When I asked specifically for bright blonde highlights I didn't want dark blonde/brown highlights that make me look washed out.

17.description: I, too like other reviewers came to this salon after uncharacteristically buying a "best salon search" coupon from a marketing guy on the street. I'm not an impulse buyer so let me tell you that that guy was really good at his job.Just went to this salon this past week to have my hair colored by Lily. I was a little wary of using the coupon so I asked her about why the salon uses the marketing technique. She explained that the salon doesn't get a lot of foot traffic since they are on the second level of the building so they use the marketing guys for referrals to get people into the salon, which helped me feel less suspicious about the coupon.I came in to get my hair colored a week before my wedding. Lily was very good. She understood what I wanted and recommended small additional things that would make the color look better (and it did). Also I came in a little on the fence about getting a cut as well. Rather then encouraging me to do it, Lily told me that I should probably wait until after the wedding so I can get more for my money with the cut. For that reason I will be going back and requesting her specifically!I will be going back for the make-up application part of the coupon this week and will check back in!Another plus-fairly easy to get appts. Salon is busy but not too busy that you feel as though it's a factory.

10.description: Worst haircut of my LIFE. They used zip ties to cut my hair...really? No wonder they were using street PR people to get business...never going back. Found a nicer salon to fix the mess they made.

11.description: I purchased  keratin treatment tthrough living social. I went to the salon in July 2011. Writing the review now bc My hair never have been so bad in my life.  My hair was dry and frizzy from the first week of the treatment and few months later, now, I still suffer from the results. FYI I have done keratin treatment in January 2011, it called global keratin and had only positive results.

26.description: I went in with brittle, pink/purple hair and came out with a super sleek cut.  The owner did my hair, so it cost more than usual, but holy shit was it expensive.  $250 for a cut and color.  I loved loved my hair but I really wasn't treated very well.  The owner was a bit snooty and my procedure took hours, making me their last customer a bit after closing time, but it was definitely not necessary to make me feel rushed and semi kicked out....  The red chunks in my hair faded very very quickly too.

22.description: A little while back I walked into the salon with a photo of a hair cut i had to have. I wanted the cut, the color, the style, everything. Maria not only discussed the possibility of doing it for me but gave me exactly what I wanted. Of course we had to talk about how the celebrity in the photo and I did not have the same hair texture and we would have to work with my cow licks. She gave me one of, if not the best haircut I've ever had. I love the color, it looks fantastic and I've gotten a slew of compliments on it since my appointment. I will be back for sure.

0.description: Front desk person ELenore was extremely helpful and friendly. She tried so gard to find the time tgat can fit to my schedule and get right person for me, I prepered the owner of the salon for highlight.. She had to call me couple times for confirmation.Paulo examined my hair and listen my concern. I had really comfortable time whole entire time.My skin is really senstive .HE was really carefull entire time. After my 3 hour apllication they kind enough and offered another visit complimentary if I have any problem with color. Paulo was really friendly and profesional.I will definetly come back.I already purchase package deal for.my sister and friends. I want them to experience .

20.description: I (usually) try to avoid cliches in my reviews but I've just left my first appointment at Compagnia Della Bellezza and I'm still so in shock over my new look that all I'm really able to come up with right now is:  OMGOMGOMG... LOOK AT ME!  I LOOK AMAZING!I walked in with my signature humongous, bushy mane and no make up.  Background:  I've never thought of myself as very pretty.  Maybe "cute" on my best day but I've often. Thought, "good thing I've got a great personality cause I was in the wrong line when they were passing out beauty."  Not being falsely modest - that's just what I thought.  Well, let me tell YOU something.  By the time my new hair BFF/stylist, Mallory, and my new make-up guru/consultant, Bobbie, got done with me...just.... holy cow!  I look HOT!  I honestly had no idea I could look like this!  My hair is sleek, polished and most important, versatile.  My make up is somehow both subtle AND dynamic.  I cried when. I saw myself.  I know this sounds silly but I look like the "after" scene in one of those makeover television shows.  I'm stunned.I'd say these guys get my coveted BTS (better than sex) rating but the thing is, I think the fiance isn't going to be able to keep his hands off of me when he sees me so, 5 Stars/BTS.... the point is moot.  I LOVE this place and I can hardly wait to go back; true story. :-))

19.description: I had a hair cut and color done by Paolo. I was a little nervous to try someone new but he did an amazing job, and I would highly recommend him. The color looks great and it was exactly what i asked for. Paolo was very friendly and easy to talk to. I will definitely go back to see him again:)

2.description: Mediocre to bad hairstyling. I made the mistake of taking a coupon that I got from school. The last hairstylist I had left me looking like a portobello mushroom, and I walked out with the regret that I paid $120 for a botched job.

18.description: I have been going to Compagnia della Bellezza for a couple of years and i love it.  After seeing Paolo i have been receiving a lot of compliments on my hair.  I would definitely recommend this salon to anyone.

13.description: I bought a deal on the street to go to this place. Not sure how the guys, cigarette in hand, got me to buy a deal on the street BUT I'm a total sucker for deals and this one was worth it! I got a cut and some future discounts as well as extra conditioning, etc. I'm not here to write about the deal though. I'm here to recommend Mallory! She is fabulous. I have curly hair and it's easy to end up with weird layers or a shelf cut. She used some crazy zip tie method on me that works like none other (just got back from my second cut). She both asked me what I wanted AND had notes from the last time I was in so that when I said "just do what you did last time" she actually could :) I'd give this place 5 stars but the atmosphere is a bit off. You shampoo in one place and then walk up the stairs for a cut. However, the receptionist is lovely and brought me my tea when I forgot it down stairs. She also called to ensure I knew where to park and that they validated. Go see Mallory!

4.description: It took three hours for all over color, she charged double what was originally quoted to me and my hair was yellow when I left.  My neck was so sore (from having my head in the bowl for over an hour) and my scalp hurt for days.  I'm giving two stars because the owner was nice (and actually talked to me waaaaay more than my stylist) and the cut was good, although it was just a basic trim. Not worth it.

24.description: I have talked to several hairstylists and colorists over the past 5 years to ask them if I could go from the blonde that I was to a red-head. All and I do mean ALL of them prior to Maria, told me no, not really and that it would take several appointments. Maria and her team are GENIUSES! Not only were they able to make me into a gorgeous red-head, they did it in one day and did NOT fry my hair or make it look unhealthy. Maria did research and took the time to figure out chemically how best to match a wig that was similar to the color I wanted. And the cut she gave without my direction is really good for my face. From the receptionist to the other stylists to the shampoo girl, everyone made me feel at ease about the process when I was a complete hot mess! Don't listen to that crazy other review about "perm" smell and her incessant dribble about not getting the "right" cut. It's her fault for not stopping the cut and helping the stylist understand what she wanted instead of letting her do it and then complain about it afterwards.

6.description: This review charts the torrid journey of my sad, poor hair.I was sitting outside school with my friend, when a cool guy came up to ask for a lighter, then proceeded to solicit a coupon for an array of hair services. My friend declined, but I haven't gotten my hair cut in an embarrassingly long time, and didn't feel like going to the suburbs to get my hair cuit by my normal lady, so I got it. It seemed like a good deal for $50, and it was close to my apartment, so why not? WHY NOT I SAID. The deal offers a number of services, but I am a simple girl of simple tastes and have had the same haircut for like 7 years. How hard can it be to trim side bangs and cut/layer 2-3 inches of hair?The girl at reception was great, and when I was a few minutes late, she was super nice about it. An assistant washed my hair, and then I was sitting and waiting for my hair cutter to come. Everything seemed normal.My hair person was extremely friendly, and I felt good about having her cut my hair. She didn't cut it in the same way that I was used to, so I couldn't really see how much she was cutting or where she was cutting, but we had a nice conversation and she seemed to have a lot of experience, so I wasn't too worried. BUT, after she dried my hair, I looked at the mirror and started experiencing an anxiety attack.Okay, my hair is extremely fine (fine as in thin, not fine as in beautiful, because it is certainly not beautiful right now). It does weird ugly-wavy things when you dry it because it's so thin, so it's imperative that I straighten it every day. I understand that, and I think anyone who touches my hair understands that. It was looking strange, so my hair person suggested she flat iron it first, and then we could go from there. I nervously agreed.However, after flat ironing it, I told her to cut about half an inch from my bangs (because she had barely touched them and they had been growing for SIX MONTHS), which is a normal length for me to get cut, but it looked horrible. After cutting a little, she "layered" the bangs, which then became choppier. I don't even know how it came to be this way. It was a terrible force of nature. She then tried putting pomade into my bangs to style it the way I usually do, but it just looked worse and worse with too much pomade, and by the time I left, my bangs looked like a bad rendition of Danny Zuko's hair, Grease-style. Except maybe Grease 2.I know she felt bad, but my bangs were too short to try to cut more/fix. And I felt bad for her feeling bad. But actually, my bad is worse than her bad because I have to live with this. So I thanked her, tipped her, then rushed home to wash, dry, and try to fix my hair. I came home and did everything I could but what's done has been done and I cannot undo it, and all I can do now is sadly write this long yelp entry, and grow my hair out until I can return to my regular lady in the suburbs. Maybe this was my fault because I didn't specify (but I thought everyone who cuts hair does this?), but she didn't thin the ends of my hair at all, and now it looks like someone just took a pair of scissors and cut straight across my hair, except that there are uneven ends so maybe a someone with shaky hands. I had to cut random strands when I got home, not that it did much to salvage it. The bangs are choppy and so short that I begin to hyperventilate when thinking about them.To answer my original question, apparently it is extremely hard to trim side bangs and cut/layer 2-3 inches of hair. I don't know much about hair, but I do know that what I ask for is not much. It usually takes people less than 30 minutes to cut my hair, but somehow, it took over an hour here. I hate to give such a terrible review because everyone was so friendly, which is why I am giving more than 1 star. However, I just got the worst haircut of all the haircuts in my life, and that includes the weird perm I got in 7th grade, so this cannot go unnoticed.

15.description: I got a great haircut and highlights here!! It was fairly expensive, but very worth it. The shape of the cut and color of the highlights were perfect for my face and skin tone. I got tons of compliments for months! No joke. My only complaint is that the stylists stations were pretty dirty. I saw a wad of chewed gum stuck on top of one and color just sitting all over another...

7.description: I now see Lily and Mallory at the salon because Marilena moved back to Italy.....but----They are even more awesome. Better highlights and better cuts!Lily has helped me grow my hair so much! Thank you Lily!!!Mallory is excellent too!

8.description: I purchased a LivingSocial deal for a cut/highlight/blowout and so glad I tried this place out for the first time!  I'll get the only major negative out of the way first: it was extremely difficult and a hassle to make an appointment.  Often the phone was not answered during business hours, and the voicemail box was full so could not leave a message.  I had to call several days/times (taking time out of my work day) to try to book my appointment before I was finally able to do so.  I understand the salon likely received a significant increase in phone traffic due to the LivingSocial deal, but should have planned to accomodate for that as this is an important first impression for new customers.That being said, I was very happy with my experience at my appointment. Friendly greeting, no wait for my hairdresser (Sunday), and friendly service.  She and Paulo did a great job of listening to what I wanted and determining a custom highlight and cut plan.  I am brunette and wanted dramatic blonde highlights, and was a bit nervous as it had been some time since I had done this and would always entrust the job to my sister.  They assured me that it would turn out great, and they were right - it was gorgeous and perfect!!  Colors and layers turned out just how I wanted even though I didn't know exactly what I wanted ;)  Sunday has a great personality that made it a joy to have her do my hair.I thought it was nice that Paulo "floated" around, helping the hairdressers when needed, chatting with customers, and chatting with the receptionist.  I could tell that details were important to him, and this also lent a true boutique and comfortable feel to the salon.  My appointment took about 1/2 hour longer than I had been quoted, and I had to have a quick vs. full blowout as I had a commitment following the appt., but I understand these do take time especially on a first visit and will remember to allow extra time.Sunday and Paulo were excellent and I would definitely recommend the salon to any friend!  Thank you!

3.description: I'm typically the kind of person that unless it's involving me, I don't say a word. That being said, I have to mention my experience while at the salon waiting for my sister. I am not certain as to what kind of rules pertain to off duty employees having a hair service, but I certainly did not see anything wrong with the lovely woman who shampooed so many clients that day. With the amount of work she does, it was the least she deserved. This assistant is ALWAYS friendly, and possesses a lovely demeanor each time I am in the salon. I cannot understand why she was completely berated in front of all of us in the salon by some loud-mouthed, "truck driver" of a stylist!Completely inappropriate for a public display, whether the assistant was in the right or not. In my opinion, the assistant deserves an apology and the stylist ought to be reprimanded.

14.description: Maria Paonessa, the owner, is a very special person. Her salon which is hard to spell Compagnia della Bellezza (is pronounced Compe Aneea Day La Bell Eat Za) is a labor of love that she has developed over the last 20 years moving from several locations on Wells Street until she finally bought the old Ripley's Believe It or Not Museum Building. The decor is lovely and artistic.The approach to hair is as "cutting edge" --no pun-- from Europe down to daily "lady-up-dos." The community energy in the salon is friendly and caring. There are no snobby elitists bossing your hair around. You will get advice - but they listen to you first.Maria Paonessa is a great colorist. Go to her if you accidentally use ASH Blonde and your hair turns light purple like mine did one time.

3.description: Okay, I never thought I'd say this about a chain QSR -but this Potbelly is the perfect addition to the Old Town/Wells Street district.Before Potbelly opened its doors, there were few places where you can get a quick bite to eat in this area (aside from Chipotle in Piper's Alley, a tiny Subway, and an even tinier mini-McDonalds). Most places on Wells are more of an "ordeal" in the sense that it's a formal sit down, and minimum 45 minute commitment. Potbelly adds an easy option to get a quick Turkey sandwich, and carry on with your day in Old Town.This location is a great size (and has tall ceilings and a very airy feel), plenty of seats, very clean, and even a small outdoor picnic table in front. Food is the same as you can expect from any Potbelly (nothing terribly creative... But well perfected sandwiches, epic cookies, Zapp's chips and yummy shakes). The staff so far has been very friendly and service was efficient. Ambiance is nice...They even had a guy singing/playing guitar in the front - so probably safe to say management is taking this opening seriously. My first experience was very pleasant - and I look forward to many more! I live just a few blocks over, so have a feeling this will be my new regular spot.

1.description: I am obsessed with potbelly. And I'm sure this location is great most of the time...but I just ordered delivery of three sandwiches and two of the three were wrong!! I think our sandwiches got switched with someone else's. Luckily my family is easygoing, but the people that receive two TKY's with nothing but extra extra hot peppers is going to be maaaaaad. Just be careful with your delivery orders Potbellys

2.description: Went here for lunch on a weekday. Got a biggie wreck and it tasted exactly what I was craving! There was no line and the staff was very quick (the place is also pretty large and can sit 20-30 pretty comfortably). I was most impressed by how friendly the people were.

5.description: I have not tried potbelly in years and was not certain which sand which to choose because they all looked so good. A very nice  gentleman behind the counter sold me on a California turkey with avocado and cucumber. Yummy:) It was nice to see the staff restocking and picking up the place. It really felt clean.

6.description: Last week we had a mishap with our order and we received a call today from the General Manager Matt . He was very professional and went above and beyond. He sent the office lunch on behalf of PB. This was not expected but a very nice gesture. Thank you Matt!

7.description: Potbelly is always good, but live music at lunch was horrible and loud. It could have been ok but it was too loud to allow conversation.

0.description: After a long afternoon of work and working or at the local xsport, I limped in tired and malnourished. I faintly overheard an order for "wrecking ball" and discovered the secrets that lie beneath the Potbelly menu. I couldn't fight the temptation and ordered one. The Wrecking Ball is exactly what you'd think, a wreck with meatballs.  It was rich and full of local flavor. My first bite marinated in my mouth and filled me with passion... Or was it happiness? The sandwich artist told erotic stories about his encounter with an older woman to his coworker the cashier, referring to her as a "MILF" (serious). I left feeling reborn. Limited parking. 4 stars.

4.description: Terrible delivery. I know potbelly sandwiches are the best,  But never get delivery from this place.  Just go to jimmy john for delivery.

28.description: Seriously awful. Dumplings were ok - probably 2 stars. Then the crab rangoon. I was on my 2nd one and bit into a hair. Dark, curly, rough....leave it up to the imagination. Even my fiance couldn't finish his food - and he'll eat anything.

1.description: Fast delivery, fresh ingredients. Glad I found this neighborhood place. Ordered pork Lo mein and my sister got steamed vegetables. Tasty. Oh and the egg roll was delish

39.description: Don't expect any miracles. It dependable, and fairly flavorful, if you order any of the fried and then apply sauce dishes like General Tsao, Orange, or Kung Pao. If you like saucy dishes, you'll probably like this place. Its definitely not bad. A touch on the greasy . They are the only Chinese restaurant I know that does not offer Asian vegetables.  Its convenient for me, but overpriced like everything else in the neighborhood. It would get 3 stars if it were cheaper.

9.description: Our nearby highrise orders nightly from this place, the doorpeople know the delivery folks by face. We have been eating from this restaurant since it opened. Without a doubt this is the best "old school," which is appropriate for "Old Town" I suppose, Chinese restaurant in Chicago bar none. Portions are huge, ingredients are uber fresh, and they stand behind their product - we once ordered vegetarian egg rolls, received what my girlfriend claimed was meaty egg rolls, and PCF sent over replacement egg rolls promptly without question. A favorite.

29.description: Place is disgusting recently license suspended by health dept eat here at your own peril

23.description: If I could rate -0- stars, I would.  I placed an order for food at 5:30 pm and was told by GrubHub it would be one hour and then 1.5 hours by email.  After over 2 hours I placed a call to the restaurant.  They said my order hadn't gone out yet but it would soon.  An hour later I called the restaurant and was told "the driver was right around the corner and would be there soon."  I gave them twenty minutes, and, fed up, called GrubHub.  GrubHub contacted them, and they told GrubHub I'd have my order in a half hour... It never came.  Almost an hour later, I called back to the restaurant and was told the same thing that the driver was nearby and would be here in 15 minutes.  After waiting a half hour more, and at this point over 4 hours, I called GrubHub to cancel the order and ask for a refund, which GrubHub gladly did and gave me credits to my GrubHub account.  I understand if a restaurant is busy, but it should not take under any circumstances over 4 hours to deliver food (and if I hadn't cancelled my order, would it have been over 5?).  Moreover, I was never called by the restaurant or contacted by them and they consistently blew me off.  I have ordered from Peking before without incident, but I for sure will not order from them again.

5.description: Best Chinese Food In Chicago!Hands down - some of the best Chinese food you will ever eat! The taste is fresh, the meats are tender, and it's made right before your very eyes!I've eaten here for several year and remain impressed by Peking Chinese Food's consistency of quality, preparation, and overall deliciousness.There's nothing here in terms of atmosphere, so don't plan on dining in unless you're very hungry, and are okay with glaring fluorescent lighting. It's only a storefront housing a big open kitchen, a counter, and a small dine-in area. Best to order your meal for take out, or have it delivered.

31.description: What are people talking about?!  I checked this place out because it is around the corner.  Great food, fast delivery, good prices, and varied menu!!  I was sick so I was craving soup.  The egg drop/wonton combo soup was delicious and I had never had a mixed soup like this.  Like others said, the hot and sour soup was good too.  I got general tso's chicken for tomorrow when I feel better.  I tasted it and it was great also.  The chicken was tender and the sauce was tasty.  Also, contrary to a previous review there are multiple steamed vegetable dishes with your choice of protein add-ons.  The steamed veggies were not really special but definitely healthy.  The rice is the sticky white rice which is my favorite and it was cooked to perfection.  I also got 4 fortune cookies to myself so I guess I ordered enough food for 4 people haha!  All of that with delivery came out to $25 with tip and delivery so i feel like it was very affordable.  You can check out grubhub to order.Amending my review because i have ordered several times and the food has been good.  However, one time i waited 2 hours for my food and no one bothered to call..

25.description: After the Women's Book Club at Moody Church last Sunday,  several of us who just met decided to go out for lunch.  On our way to Top Grill, which one of the ladies suggested, Pecking Chinese Food was in our sites and we seemed to be drawn there instead.   I really didn't feel like Chinese Food, and I'm especially weary about Chinese Fast Food places.  Four Stars for:  Our impromtu lunch gathering turned out to be a blessed, devine appointment of encouragement when we met one other sister having lunch there.  Not to mention I found the BEST Crispy Sesame Chicken I ever had here!  My first mouthful was a pleasant surprise.   I love how their lunch specials are EVERYDAY 10-3pm, and not limited to duirng the week like most places.  Lunch specials includes fried rice and a soda.  L23 Crispy Sesame Chicken was pefectly crisp and a sweet flavor that was just right, all for $6.  I look forward to trying other dishes there in the future but I'm thinking I'm going to have to keep getting the Crispy Sesame Chicken.  I'm glad the Spirit drew us there otherwise I'd have never set foot in this fast food place!

12.description: I'm pretty picky about my Chinese food, but this place nailed it! For my first visit, I ordered the shrimp lo-mein and egg-rolls; I couldn't be more pleased with everything. The ingredients were fresh and seasoned well. The cooking time was fast, which I appreciated on my lunch break! I will definitely be returning to Peking as the service was very friendly and efficient.

37.description: Non-sketchiest looking establishment on the inside? No.Flavorful and dependable?  Yes! These are good things, people!It's the best and most consistent Chinese food I've found in Chicago (granted I've never been to Chinatown) since Far East on Diversey was put out of business (by Miss Asia).Minus one for price though.  Boo, expensive Old Town.

21.description: While delivery was fast, the food was the absolute worst I've ever had! The Shrimp Fried Rice had no seasoning with pieces of raw celery and onion, and the Shrimp Toast was soggy, greasy and tasteless!  First and last time I will patronize business at this restaurant!

16.description: After the Women's Book Club at Moody Church last Sunday,  several of us who just met decided to go out for lunch.  On our way to Top Grill, which one of the ladies suggested, Pecking Chinese Food was in our sites and we seemed to be drawn there instead.   I really didn't feel like Chinese Food, and I'm especially weary about Chinese Fast Food places.  Four Stars for:  Our impromtu lunch gathering turned out to be a blessed, devine appointment of encouragement when we met one other sister having lunch there.  Not to mention I found the BEST Crispy Sesame Chicken I ever had here!  My first mouthful was a pleasant surprise.   I love how their lunch specials are EVERYDAY 10-3pm, and not limited to duirng the week like most places.  Lunch specials includes fried rice and a soda.  L23 Crispy Sesame Chicken was pefectly crisp and a sweet flavor that was just right, all for $6.  I look forward to trying other dishes there in the future but I'm thinking I'm going to have to keep getting the Crispy Sesame Chicken.  I'm glad the Spirit drew us there otherwise I'd have never set foot in this fast food place!

17.description: I have ordered take out from here several times and stopped by to pick up to go food a few times as well.  It's pretty typical, reasonably priced chinese food. I have always been happy with how it tastes, timeliness, and size of the portions. Overall, no complaints.

10.description: I think the average rating is justified; but there are a few jewels on the menu worth trying - Singapore Mai Fun, Broccoli Shrimp, and Sesame Chicken. Delivery is cheap and quick - on average. I have dined in, but it's not up my alley. Others in my family like doing lunch there.

11.description: Delivery is so fast even though I order all white meat chicken and they have to make it fresh. I think the veggie fried rice is bomb and honestly haven't had anything from here that I don't like. It isn't anything fancy but it is my go to for take out!

26.description: My complaint is not an indictment of their food, but rather the terrible service. I ordered dinner through my Seamless app, in which I'd filtered my location and all restaurants that were available for delivery. After an hour had passed, I called the restaurant, asking when I might expect the meal (fully aware that +/- 10 min. from the estimated delivery time is the norm on a Saturday night), and the woman on the phone informed me that the driver was on his way. Forty minutes later (making the total wait now 1:40), the delivery person finally arrived and, rather than attempting to explain such a long wait, I was berated by the man, who threw the food in my arms, and exclaimed the restaurant was "too far" to deliver to my home. Not only was this an incredibly rude way to deal with a hungry customer,  who has been forced to wait almost 2 hours for food, but something that, had it been a problem, could have been addressed immediately after my ordering. Moreover, upon searching the location (as provided by Seamless) of the restaurant, I saw it is literally 3.3 miles down one avenue from my apartment (not the "15 miles" the delivery person yelled to me at my doorstep). Despite the fallacy behind the exaggerated delivery distance, screaming at a customer is neither appropriate nor effective. I will never again order delivery from this restaurant, and I encourage others caution in doing so.

27.description: I got carryout yesterday and I ordered the General Tso Chicken Combo with Fried Rice and an egg roll for $8.50.  I thought the portion was a good size for the price, but I think it was lacking a little flavor.  I asked for it spicy and actually had to put some Tabasco in it for more spice.  Overall, not a bad value, but won't be returning anytime soon.

35.description: Love their rice. Then again I am arabian and we are made of rice pretty much.....I do not trust their "meats" got their beef fried rice once and will never do it again, the beef was NOT beef.....the chicken is okay but you have to turn a blind eye....

8.description: I have lived in this city for 7 years now, and after discovering Peking about 4 years ago I haven't gotten Chinese food anywhere else since. Their dumplings are DOPE (the dipping sauce is what really makes it). I love their vegetable egg rolls, amazing Wonton Soup and General Tso's Chicken.Oh and I crave their Lo Mein on a daily basis.Also, their delivery guy Ko is super friendly!

0.description: Little hole in the wall family owned Chinese restaurant. The mother and father cook while the young son takes phone orders and the little girl kind of runs around. It gave it a strange yet homey feel to see the family working together for this little restaurant. I found it endearing.On to the food!I ordered the Moo Shoo Pork, Egg Rolls, and Crab Rangoon. First off, the egg rolls are huge, not some dinky crappy little fried things. They had some interesting spices in them I'm not familiar with, but they weren't too bad. The cream cheese crab Rangoon were huge and tasted very good. They came with a sort of sweet and sour sauce. Moo Shoo is sort of like crepes where there are these paper thin square almost tortilla thingies, but you get a heaping plate of some of the most delicious pork I've ever had. My wife and I took turns mostly failing at trying to make moo shoo burritos filled with the incredible pork veggie bits and sealed with some of the dark sauce provided with it. Both of us are stuffed and didn't even manage to finish it even though we put a pretty serious hurting on it. Also, if we had known the egg rolls were so huge we would not have ordered them and only would have got the crab Rangoon. We weren't able to finish it all. The entire meal with a soda was $20Good food, cute place, but when another Asian lady came in and they started arguing (in Mandarin) it was almost obnoxiously loud. Other than that, I'm a big fan. If I'm in the area again no doubt I'll try it out a second time.

38.description: I agree w/ the two prior ratings. Average could be good with a few minor improvements, but with the number of small concerns plaguing this place, a two is fitting. The flavor is actually done pretty well but their chicken definitely scares me, dark in appearance and not great in terms of texture. Let's face it, your going to this place for convinience.

20.description: First time in the area, thought I will try it. I order shrimp with lobster combination platter. The lady ask me white or brown. I never heard like that before. I told her white.I proceed to sit as I informed that I was planning to eat in. Got the food and to my surprised looks different. Green been raw in it. Who does that? The dish is okay. Not the best.  I wouldn't recommend to anyone to fine there.

19.description: Tonight I was craving greasy Chinese food. since I've had a long week I decided, dammit I deserve it! I have not really ordered Chinese food too much since moving to Chicago so I picked Peking since it's close to where I live and didn't look like an expensive sit down Chinese place since that's not what I wanted I just wanted to good unhealthy take out & that's exactly what I got! I ordered off of grub hub and had a 10% discount so my partner and I got dumplings, chicken lo mein, general tso chicken and chicken fried rice. We ordered at 6pm and had our food in about 30 minutes which is unheard of for delivery in the city on a Friday! I opened up those little cartons and could already tell this was going to be a hit! Oh boy was this food perfection for what I was craving! The lo mein was the thin noodles and had plenty of veggies and chicken! The dumplings were okay not my favorite and the general Taos was a little too fried but the sauce tasted great. My partner liked his fried rice but I'm not a fan of that dish so I had a bite it was okay. This place is perfect for when you're craving that deliciously bad for you Chinese food! I will be getting delivery again in the future!

33.description: excellent Peking duck, just small quantity of hoison sauce but great duck!!!! i also ordered orange chicken and it was very very good, pretty spicy but great!

2.description: This review is for delivery only. The food we ordered was all very good and as expected for Chinese delivery. The chicken fried rice, crab rangoons, egg roll and general tso's all had good flavor and we're still hot when it arrived. Delivery took about 25 minutes once I placed the order and that's faster than I expected. This isn't upscale Chinese food by any means but it was exactly what we were craving. We'll be ordering from here again.

34.description: The food is great, consistent, and the best in the Old Town, Gold Coast.  Have been ordering from them two to three times a month for the past five years.  The only thing I could ask for to be better is the telephone ordering process.  This is a family business and sometimes they have a relative take the phone orders for pickup / delivery whose English is worse then my Chinese.  And I don't speak Chinese.  We normally get the vegatable mai-fun for my vegetarian wife and I get the General Tso Chicken.  I cannot find better in ChinaTown or when I travel.
