32.description: the fantastic food makes up for the poor decor. i recomend the egg rolls. i have only been eating there for....mm 12 years or so :)there is never any parking around there

18.description: This place is staffed by people who think a person can not tell the difference between cabbage and white onions!  As I asked for NO ONIONS and STILL had onions in my food.  I DO NOT suggest this restaurant to ANYBODY!

13.description: We weren't sure where to order take out from in the area until our door man recommended Peking. We checked out their website, which was easy to use and they even have online ordering. We were skeptical at first because we saw several negative reviews on here, but we gave it a shot and were very pleasantly surprised. We ordered the Orange Beef and Sesame Chicken, which come with white rice, and also ordered two Pork Egg Rolls. The prices were reasonable, the delivery was very quick and the food was hot when we received it. Everything was delicious and the portions were a good size. You could taste that it was freshly made, which is a big deal to me. We will certainly add Peking to our list of regular restaurants to order from. Using the coupons that come with the order, we're looking forward to trying more dishes they have to offer.

4.description: Please add or attach this to my review.How did I forget the fried rice from last month's shrimp and garlic sauce?  One reviewer said the rice was wet.  I love fried rice.  It was "wet", from   oil, and the rancid oil in the pan.  I didn't think wet fried rice was possible, but they do it.

24.description: Ordered delivery was told it would be 1.5 hours it now 2.5+ hours, I live 1.8 miles away. Unless the food is mind blowing this is the first and last time for me.

6.description: I ordered online for delivery. Delivery was very fast - I think less than 30 minutes. Prices were typical, though with a delivery charge and tip, it was $28 for basically 1 entree and 1 appetizer, which was steep.The kuoh tay or potstickers were fine - not amazing, but decent.  However, I ordered one of my favorite dishes, which also happens to be a supposed specialty of the house, sesame chicken.  Not good.  Not like food poisoning awful or anything, just very not good.  This is supposed to be a spicy dish; this had none.  It was mildly sweet, with tons of gloppy sauce (I would guess gluten is used to thicken).  The rice was also very wet and distracting.I wouldn't order from here again, just because the risk based on this dish is too expensive.

22.description: In my 57 years on this planet, this was the worst I ever ate, and I've had Chinese all over this country, both take out and world-class.  Most places are your average take-out, but they must have had a busboy cooking that day at Peking.  First the egg roll.  I couldn't identify what it was, but there was something sweet in it.  It tasted funny--not like most take-out egg rolls taste.   Then there was fried rice.  It was totally tasteless.  Most Chinese places overseason and add MSG, but this had NOTHING!  I added some soy sauce, but I didn't want to use too much, otherwise it would just taste like soy sauce.  Then I had the seafood combo at $15.95.  I ordered it because the combination of seafood and Chinese veggies sounded good.  BLEAH!!!!!!  The fake crabmeat wasn't the better stuff that most places use.  They used some kind of chunk style that didn't look appealing, and worse yet, it was also disgusting.  I felt like I was biting into a big chunk of paste.  (Kind of like a giant flour lump in homemade gravy.)   There were also no Chinese veggies as described in the menu.  Instead there was a lot of broccoli and a whole mess of green pepper.  My husband said his orange chicken wasn't that great either.  All of this after a very long wait (we should have gotten carry-out instead of delivery.)  This meal was not only disappointing, but flat out disgusting.  We just moved here and this place was recommended by a neighbor in our condo building, so I pretty much expected your typical Chinese take-out---nothing to write home about, but a decent, satisfying meal.  Peking was off the radar, so we will look for another place to satisfy our craving without having to venture to Chinatown.

15.description: The only two dishes I eat here are the veggie lo mein and the crag Rangoon so I can't really vouch for anything else...BUT that said, this is by far the BEST lo mein and Rangoon I've had in the city of Chicago. The woman who works the counter is awesome and remembered my order after only going twice. Definitely my favorite Chinese place around.

40.description: This seems to be your typical hole-in-the-wall Chinese food restaurant. You know what to expect and you know how it should taste. I've had bad luck here with the quality of chicken where things look uncooked and have large bits of fat attached. I order from here every few months, thinking it will be better but I have yet to learn my lesson. It is never better, it is always the same...

7.description: I liked this place.... but every time I order I ask for extra soy sauce and I rarely get it.

36.description: Always wondered about this place.  Passed it many times but never in the mood.  Being that I was partying at North beach and taking excursions to feed the meter, I was walking passed it often.  On the last trip back, I stopped in for an order of egg rolls.  It was a dead Saturday afternoon and most of their employees were in a daze.  They left the door wide open due to the immense heat.  An older gentleman sat reading a paper enjoying a coca cola.  They made the egg rolls fresh and it took about ten minutes before I was back on the road walking back to the beach.  I stopped and sat on a park bench under the trees.  It took some time to eat and enjoy one roll.  The contents were still piping hot and I added a bit of sweet and sour sauce with every bite. It was delicious for what it was.  When I got back to the beach my cousin inquired "forty minutes to feed a meter?" I revealed an egg roll with sauce.  Once he finished, "good thinking"

30.description: Had some sweet and sour chicken for about 5 bucks. Went pretty late at night so couldn't get the lunch specials but overall pretty god. The people were nice and the food was warm and average. oh and free tea!

3.description: I try twisted in like 6 yearsFood is bland no flavor at allI order crab Rangoon and sm vegetable   fried rice heard they eat dog meat rat or cat I Don't get a riskSo I Took My Food To THE Beach I Was Ready To Eat ButHooo hooooo no utensilsNo spoonNo forkNo napkinsNo soy sauce grrrtttttNever come back againThe lady that took my order look upsetLady that's way your place is empty

14.description: First time in the area, thought I will try it. I order shrimp with lobster combination platter. The lady ask me white or brown. I never heard like that before. I told her white.I proceed to sit as I informed that I was planning to eat in. Got the food and to my surprised looks different. Green been raw in it. Who does that? The dish is okay. Not the best.  I wouldn't recommend to anyone to fine there.

58.description: It was a Monday and I was having a bad hair day. A REALLY bad hair day. That night, I was attending a special dinner and wanted to look my best. My hair desperately needed some professional help. But I'd forgotten that many salons are closed on Mondays, including the one that I usually visit. As I walked down Wells Street and glanced in shuttered windows, I was beginning to panic. And then (cue the angels singing) I saw the Swerve sign. The salon door was open (Hooray!) and up a flight of stairs was Corrie, a pleasant receptionist, who told me that there was a stylist available.  Corrie offered me a fresh, hot cup of coffee and introduced me to Jennifer, my stylist. Jennifer has thick, wavy hair, like mine. She had no problem transforming my wild do into a beautiful, silky straight look that made me feel like a million bucks.   The salon is in a clean, contemporary loft space and the atmosphere is warm and friendly. My appointment took less than an hour and was $45. A cut and style is $67. I liked the results of the blow-out so much that I returned for a cut and style the next week. Jennifer gave my hair a new, better shape and I think she's converted me into a new regular Swerve client.  Thanks Swerve!

56.description: I was looking for a last minute blow out before a game with my professional dance team and mandi did a great job! She was quick and to the point and put some toner on my dull locks to brighten them up for the performance! Thanks Mandi!

29.description: I see Stephanie for cut and color, Gio for shaving/adding graphics the back of my head. I've always been really happy with the color and service.

42.description: This is a generous, round up, 4 stars as opposed to 3. Based solely on the artistic talents of Megan, whom is a 5 star stylist. Megan knows color. I have been getting my hair done since I was 12.  I tell her what I want to see and it's done to perfection. Very few stylists can take a vision and bring it to life.  Also perfect- every haircut. I have been to salons where you wait 2 hours for those Hollywood Red Carpet dos. Megan makes you look like walking on the red carpet in a fraction of the time. And my locks look fantastic for weeks to come! Love my hair, love my stylist.The bad 1.5 stars- front desk staff. I have consistently NOT been offered a beverage on every visit. (I do eventually get one, by the wonderful Megan). The purpose of  offering a water, coffee, is to make me feel welcome upon first point of contact. I'm lucky I get a "hello" half the time! On my most recent visit, I received my confirmation call, to be told I would be seeing a different stylist, same day and time. Want to make a girl lose her shiznit?! Tell her the appointment booked MONTHS in advance for her precious hair is now with someone different. (I eventually got my right, booked in advanced appointment with Megan). But not after a mini panic attack.Go to Swerve for Megan. You may want to bring your own water though.

23.description: I went to Swerve because it was on Gilt and close to my house... my previous stylist had upped her prices and was in a tough to get to location, so I was looking to find a new salon, and the deal was enough to make me try this place. I had read some reviews that said they treated gilt/groupon customers poorly, and that is definitely not the case. I went to Danielle who gave me  a great cut, was super sweet, and there was a redken treatment included that i thought would just be like a deep conditioning but I think did a lot more for my hair than that.... would definitely go back!

47.description: I was in town for a wedding and needed a last-minute style.  I asked a friend for a nearby salon, and he contacted a friend of his.  She immediately recommended Swerve.  On this recommendation, I called and asked if they could take me for an appointment.  They not only found a way to get me an appointment, they made sure that it gave me plenty of time to get ready for the wedding. Melissa was my stylist; she was incredible.  She gave me exactly what I wanted in a style.  I would return to this salon any day.Small warning--they prefer tips to be in cash.  They will accept credit cards for payment, though.

8.description: About two years ago I booked a last minute hair cut appointment in a bind at Swerve... years later I am still going to swerve and the same stylist. Danielle is absolutely amazing. She has cut and colored my hair several times now and I have always left so happy. The atmosphere at the salon is inviting and friendly. I have not only recommended so many of my friends to go check it out but have now decided to get my hair and makeup done at Swerve for my wedding. It started as my neighborhood salon that was a quick step away, to now being my favorite place to visit!

31.description: I have been seeing Emma here for about a year. She is the Queen of blonde. Her highlighting work is amazing as is her positive energy and upbeat personality. She always takes her time to give me exactly what I want and if anything needs to be tweeked, she is more than happy to accommodate it. Great service!

34.description: I got a terrible haircut here last week, after being one of Amy's clients for over a year. Too short, too blunt, longer on one side, and oddly chopped side bangs. I knew it was MUCH shorter than what I asked for (I wanted below-the-collar-bone and got barely-grazing-the-shoulders) and unfortunately there is nothing that can be done about as soon as it happens, but I also couldn't tell how bad it was until I went on vacation the next day, washed out all the product, tried to style it myself and realized the terrible quality of a cut.  I wanted long hair with more layers. Not a shoulder-length blunt bob.No point in going back to Swerve and having Amy not take the time to listen to what I wanted....again.So I hid my hair in a scarf for a week, then went to Red 7 Salon for a correctional cut (two haircuts in one week  - :-( - there goes my long hair!) and highly recommend Laura.  While it's incredible depressing to think about how it will take me another year+ to grow my hair back, at least I won't look like an idiot in the process.  Really sad about the whole experience, but glad I found new stylist who takes the time to really listen to what their clients want.

16.description: I've gone back and forth about whether to write a review on Swerve since I stopped going there about two years ago, but when I saw that it was on Gilt I felt compelled to warn people not to spend their money here. It is such an unprofessional environment and for the cost and final product, there are better places in Chicago.STYLING:At first, I loved Swerve. My stylist, who I won't name for reasons that will become obvious below, was awesome and I even let her highlight my hair for the first time in my life which I had always said I would never do. But over time, the way she cut my hair really thinned it out, and oddly made it triangular around my face. Two years later, I'm starting to get the fullness back, but it's not fully recovered yet. I should also mention that of the 4-5 people I referred there during the time I was a client, no one ever went back for a second trip, so they must have had a  negative or lackluster experience as well. Also, the first time my stylist did my highlights, they were great, but the price was more than twice the price that the website listed for highlights at the time because they were "custom". This is my bad for not asking first, but seriously, over twice the top price quoted? Come on. For reference, I just looked at the current price for "custom" on the site, and mine were about 60% more expensive than that. Then, the second time, she pretty much just slapped on some dye so that I had obvious, rectangular chunks of color strewn about my head. Not cool. Had to get it fixed elsewhere.RAGING UNPROFESSIONALISM:My stylist once laughed while telling me about how she'd run out of the right color of red dye while doing a full color on the customer before me, so she'd just mixed a different color to finish the back of the person's head. Isn't step one of any process in life "Figure out if I have the requisite tools to complete this project?" And then, if you're going to flake out on doing something the right way, you're going to TELL ANOTHER CUSTOMER ABOUT HOW YOU LITERALLY JUST JACKED UP ANOTHER CUSTOMER'S HAIR AND DON'T EVEN CARE?!?!? It gets better though! My stylist also put me in the middle of a conflict between Swerve and a friend of mine that I'd referred to Swerve. As background, the front desk staff at Swerve are horrible. They've tried to call me to schedule something and then won't call me back when they drop the call mid-conversation, they've lost appointments, failed to call to confirm appointments, etc. In keeping with this trend, Swerve attempted to charge a friend of mine a no-show fee for an appointment that she'd never made and that, when they called her to confirm, she affirmatively canceled. It escalated to the point where she had to cancel her credit card because of multiple charge attempts by Swerve. But instead of calling my friend directly to apologize for the misunderstanding and try to make it right (which probably would have worked), my stylist put me in the middle of it by asking me to talk to my friend to urge her to come back to my stylist despite the poor front desk experience! How awkward is that?!?! She pretty much laid out a script for me of what to say to my friend on her behalf. It was so bizarre. This is your business, not mine.FALSE ADVERTISING:At one point, Swerve ran a promotion giving you $100 to the salon for any friend you referred. The fine print said that the credit had to be used towards services, which I was fine with. I ended up referring three friends during the promotion period, who all confirmed to me that they'd visited with my stylist after they'd done so. When I tried to cash in on the credit, though, my stylist told me that only two of them had visited. I decided not to push the issue. Then, when I received the credits, they were in $25 increments, could only be used one per visit, and all 8 expired within 3 months of issuance. In other words, I basically only got a $25 credit. When I called, Swerve did at least extend one coupon for me so that I could take advantage of $50 of the $200 I should have gotten. So beware, their promotions probably aren't as good as they say.So that's Swerve. I found a new place that I'm super happy at and will never go back.

13.description: Gio was awesome! Love my haircut, and he was really nice and friendly.  Took his time to do it correctly.  Definitely going back! Thanks Gio!

11.description: Two coworkers of mine have been seeing Dana at Swerve for a while, so I decided to give her a try. Turns out, she is the stylist I've been searching for after living in Chicago for 3 years! The thing I really love about Dana is that she truly listens to what you ask for and genuinely wants to be sure you love your hair before you leave the salon. Overall, I had a great experience. The salon is very clean and the staff are all very nice and attentive. You get a complimentary glass of beer or wine (or coffee/tea/water) while you get your hair done, which I love. It's the little things! As a first time client, I also received a little goody bag that included a 25% off coupon for all products I purchased that day, so I loaded up on makeup (they just launched their own line)--the products are great and VERY reasonably priced. I can't wait to come back for my next appointment!

39.description: I love coming here. I found my stylist for Chicago! I came in for a basic cute back in the day and interviewed Jennifer Romano. She listened to what I wanted and what I needed.I came back for another cut, but a style cut. Went with the bang route and loved while it lasted. I had spoke about going extreme and she explained that with my face I can pull off a lot of styles. When I came in to cut off 9 inches, Jennifer took care of me. explained what was going to happen reassured me that I will look great and saw that I was starting to freaked-out. She had a glass of wine brought over to me ASAP. I felt better just after and made my time even better.If you want a great cut, a glass of wine and an amazing person to chat with, go and Jennifer!!

37.description: I have to be honest, it has been several years since I have been here.  I only stopped going since I moved to the suburbs and stopped working in the city.BUT, this salon is wonderful.  They really know what they are doing.  I used to go to Laura (one of the owners).  She is phenomenal with color.  I started going to Laura when I lived in Missouri.  I was coming to visit my boyfriend and had dyed my hair from a box for the first time.  My mom took one look at me and told me I had to get my hair fixed in Chicago.  My sister had been coming to Swerve and got me an appointment.  I was so impressed, for about a year I scheduled my appointments for when I was in town.  I continued coming here when I moved to the city.  Laura always took great care of me and did a fantastic job.  Once I was there when they received new makeup.   She had someone give me a free makeover while my color was setting.  Great customer service and extremely talented staff.  I hope they are still doing well.This salon is pricey, but consistent with other upscale salons in the area.

0.description: This review is for Lindsay as she is the only one I have gone to at this salon for brows and brazillian. I love her!The salon is also super clean and chic and I would go there for any other services as well!

38.description: Laura's the best!

51.description: I love Swerve and I love Amy.  I moved to NYC for 2.5 years and never found anyone who could make me feel great about my hair, and I was going to high end salons and paying high end prices.  Walking out of Swerve, I feel like a million bucks, without spending a million bucks.  I am so happy to have my hair back in Amy's hands.

27.description: Hi, I'm B and I have serious anxiety about cutting my hair. Now that we got that out of the way I can tell you about my most recent experience at Swerve; it was fabulous. When you walk into this place, you're immediately greeted by smiling faces--I'm a huge fan of great customer service. Then asked if I would like anything to drink. So awesome! Promptly am asked who I am and who I am there to see and asked to wait for Dana. Now a little back story here, I'm in to have something drastic done. I have finally told myself long enough that I can donate my hair, this means at least 8 inches is coming off. This is a huge thing, I am losing a part of me. My hair, it goes everywhere with me, it's not like a purse I can switch out when I'm bored with it. Dana is super patient with me, immediately I am at ease and letting her do what she thinks is going to be perfect. I've had the pleasure of having Dana cut my hair before but never anything this drastic. Every step, every suggestion and any comments about my preference were taken into consideration and she worked some serious magic. 9 inches later and one fried out blow dryer (I have a lot of hair) I walked out feeling absolutely fantastic. I have hair that moves and still has length to it so I can still do fun things with it! I truly loved every minute of my appointment from the second I walked in to the moment I walked out that door I had a smile on my face. Finding someone to trust to cut this  hair is a huge issue for me. Luckily I found someone amazing!

32.description: Elle is the best! And great customer service from the receptionists. My color is always perfect whether I get highlights, all over color, or a combo of both. And Elle has helped me grow my hair out from a weird layered cut with her recommendations to make my hair healthier. The salon is clean and friendly. Great quality for surprisingly low prices for the area.

54.description: I moved to Chicago a year and a half ago, and have been coming to Swerve since then even though it's a bit out of the way for me. I've been seeing Mallory more recently, and she is a really gifted stylist as well as a pleasure to be around. She's managed to do really fun things with my hair color and cut even though I have relatively boring "straight and long" requirements.The front desk staff is very nice, and every single person that works there dresses adorably - which is obviously super important. Ha.

48.description: I moved back to Chicago 3 years ago and it took me a year and a half to find a colorist to get my perfect shade of blonde.  Finally I was recommended Emma at Swerve salon and she was able to give me the perfect color I was looking for. Emma is truly fantatic and so is everybody else as Swerve.  Extremely nice, stylish, and professional.  The Salon is clean, organized, and ready to do anything to make you feel comfortable.

44.description: I used to go to Louis Licari in NYC. When I moved to Chicago, I read that Swerve was one of the best salons, so I tried it . I'm picky about my hair, but show me a woman who isn't. We want it done right. I have long, thick, naturally wavy hair that I have highlighted blonde. And it takes forever to style! Emma is a wiz with the highlights. She is super fast and does a fantastic job. Her cuts are also spot-on. Plus, if you tell her a "trim", she never goes scissor-happy. She is speedy with the blowout too. I've never had a problem with customer service either. I only have two minor complaints: 1) I can't get an appointment before noon , 2) it's a bit pricey for Chicago. Emma is a doll. She's nice, always on time  and professional. I haven't tried facials there yet, but have done the waxing.  Danielle does a great job waxing . She nice, pleasantly chatty, thorough  and it's easy to book her at the same time as your hair appointment.  Overall, it's a pretty nice place.

24.description: I love getting my hair done with Stephanie! She really listens to what I am looking for, and the salon is always clean and professional. Plus the location is great!

7.description: I was referred to Caitlyn by my roommate who has been urging me to go and give her a try. I'm very particular about who I let color my hair, but after getting a HORRIBLE bleach job from my usual stylist at a different salon, I took my roommates advice- and I couldn't be more pleased. I texted Caitlyn in a panic & she immediately responded and was able to get me in the next day. Her level of professionalism and care was outstanding. She made me feel so comfortable & talked through every step of the way through the correction. I will note that she is still training at the salon, which is even more impressive for how great of a job she did. I went from this awful platinum white bleach job to a warm, natural bright blonde. Honestly the best consult/service I have received by a stylist. The salon itself is beautiful! Everything is so clean, it makes you feel really good knowing that you are being taken care of by people who respect their workplace. I highly recommend this salon, & Caitlyn! Thanks again for fixing me!!

49.description: I decided to try Swerve because the location is convenient. The haircut seemed to go well, but after I washed my hair myself, my hair become unmanageable. It was obvious that the hair stylist did not know how to cut curly hair. In fact, he straightened my hair at the end and cut some more off to see if he did everything right. When I got my hair cut at another salon a couple of months later, the hair stylist asked who cut my hair because it was not cut well. On top of that, they try to push products on you and push you into scheduling appointment for months in advance and claim they will remind you a week before. I never got a reminder a week before about an appointment I was forced to book and frankly did not want to book. When I got a reminder the day off (the only reminder) and tried to cancel, I was told I would have to pay a $24 cancellation fee.  Avoid this place at all costs. The only star it gets is for its convenient location.

40.description: I just needed to share the wonderful experience I had at Swerve Salon in Old Town. What a great salon! Joe cut and colored my hair and it turned out perfect! I love what he did. To try out a new stylist with a cut and color - it can be very unpredictable! But I must say, Joe really impressed me. Not to mention, he is the funniest guy and really, really detailed and particular when dealing with my hair. These two qualities are something I need in someone who is doing my hair. I love great personalities and this salon is filled with them! Brie, the manager, is the funniest gal this side of the Mississippi and she always immediately takes care of you. The receptionist, Ally, is such a sweetheart, too. Everyone there is pretty cool and that helps the experience. The bonus is that they are EXCELLENT with hair! I love them! I already booked my next appt.

53.description: I wish I'd had a great experience at Swerve. It is so convenient for me, just up the street from my apartment. After reading all the yelp reviews, I was excited to give it a try. I made an appointment and was randomly assigned to Mandi. I was there for a deep conditioning treatment and a haircut. The other salons I've been to do the deep conditioning treatment differently - they add the conditioner after shampooing, then they covered the hair with a cap or wrap or something and you sit under the dryer to heat up the conditioner and let it work it's magic. At Swerve, I think I just paid an extra $18 for them to use a different brand of conditioner, that was in my hair for 3.5 seconds before being rinsed out. For the cut, I wanted a trim and bangs, and to be specific I brought several pictures of a well-known celebrity to clarify exactly how I wanted it to look. Mandi started the cut by having me stand, and trimming my hair when it was wet. Then, she had me sit in the chair and dried my hair before continuing to cut it AFTER it was dry. She said something about internal layers to give it more shape. She also didn't want to give me the bangs like the celebrity pics, since she said my hair was too curly, so I just ended up with a really awkward short layer toward the front, about the length of my chin.This fell short of the mark, and I've never had split ends so quickly after a haircut. Bummer, since I had high hopes for this place, but I will not be back.

30.description: Well, well. A couple of weeks before I leave the city after 4 years and I find Mallory. She blew away the cuts my long-time stylist was giving me at a high end salon on Hubbard. I went in with overgrown long layers and side swept bangs. My standard styling is to hot roll and go for big time volume in a Bardot spin on bed head . The length was well past my shoulder blades. I requested to keep as much length as possible, shaping of the layers and special attention to volume at the crown. Insane. Mallory did a phenomenal job. Great price for a cut at $60ish. I thought I was committing highway robbery. On top of that she is smart, stylish and a great conversationalist. I'll be visiting her each time I come to the city.

46.description: GIO (hair stylist) is awesome at highlights. 116 for full high-lights that are AMAZING!  Love this place and the service. Complimentary wine as well!

1.description: I hate to write this review.... just really hate to write this but my recent experiences with Swerve Salon have been so bad it deserves an update.I started with this salon many many years ago and have seen the business build.  I have been an evangelist telling everyone that compliments me on my hair color or cut to go see Jenn at Swerve.  Boy do I have egg on my face!!!This place started out great.  Great talent, great service, no complaints.  But as this salon grew there were changes.The stylist I regularly go to (Jenn) is top notch, very talented.  The problem is that she isn't the one always working on me.  She has an assistant.  The assistant is always early in their training (maybe still in school or right out of school I'm not sure).  And my stylist is basically training the assistant on the job... using me as the teaching tool.This just started a couple years ago and the assistant regularly changes.  If her assistant is good, it is usually fine.  But the assistant does things like checks to see if my hair is fully lightened, tones my hair color, and other things that I would feel way more comfortable having my very talented and very expensive stylist do.  Sometimes it hasn't come out well.Maybe this isn't the case if you go to a stylist that isn't as busy.  But Jenn is always super booked and is usually taking two clients at one time.  So I guess she needs the assistant.I have been very patient with this whole situation and really haven't cared if it takes longer or if they don't get my color exactly right.  I'm pretty low key about these things and take it in stride.But the thing that really irks me is that I'm still paying full price as if I were getting the full attention of my stylist!!I don't even get a say in it!!  I have never once been asked if am comfortable letting the assistant do parts of my service.  Which frankly sometimes I am not.On top of that, I have recently had problems with the management and admin process.The salon keeps your credit card on file and charges you 1/2 of the cost of services if you don't show up for a confirmed appointment.  I understand why this is done and it makes sense.My problem is that they don't really confirm the appointment.  They call ONCE and leave you a message if you get voicemail.After many years of reliably showing up for appointments I missed one.  I didn't even realized I had missed it until way after the fact.  And when I showed up for my next appointment they charged me an extra $75.  I was not a happy camper, but whatever... I understand the policy.At that first missed appointment I asked that they actually confirm the appointment.  Like, talk to me.  Or email with me, or text me.  The answer was No.I spoke with the manager and owner and their software doesn't support email or text and they don't think it it practical to actually talk to someone before considering an appointment confirmed.  Okay, noted... I will need to be more vigilant about checking voicemails left by the salon.  Besides it was anomaly that would probably never happen again.Skip to a couple months later and I started sharing my calendar with my co-workers and removed my salon appointments.  I thought I moved it to another calendar, but apparently I screwed it up.  Doah!!  So I missed another appointment and they charged me another $75.  Okay, ouch but I knew better that is my fault.The kicker is that after year and years of religiously reliable appointments now they tell me they won't book my appointments in advance any longer.  Are you kidding me!?!?!I guess this salon has grown so much and so big that they don't need the reliable long-term customers that helped them build their business or to actually provide the high-quality level of service that they certainly charge for. $$$$$Bummer

55.description: I had a brazilian wax here weeks ago when I was visiting with family, so it was my first time at Swerve, and in that neighborhood in general.To begin, the salon was one of the cleanest I have visited EVER. They had beer, wine, water, soda(s), juice and snacks to offer as I waited for my appointment to begin which was extremely pleasant. The ladies at the desk were friendly and happy to get me checked in. It is always so nice to be greeted by happy, fun employees... it makes all the difference.My appointment was quick and as painless as it could have been. I was satisfied with the turnout and would very highly recommend this salon for wax services. They use quality skin-care lines that we can trust (at all ages).

9.description: THIS PLACE IS THE BESTI have been coming here for about a year now and I love it. They are ALWAYS on time for appointments and they always finish on time!The salon is clean, professional and friendly. I go to Gio for everything and I cannot say enough good things about him!He is always willing to give advice about products and whats the best option for your hair. I have my hair cut and dyed by him and he is WORTH every penny. Not to mention he is super easy to get an appointment with -even if its super last minute!In conclusion, if you are getting your hair done anywhere else, you're wasting your money!

26.description: I am writing this review just to be honest, I dont like to really leave negative reviews of hair salons just because things happen with hair that sometimes do not go as planned. However I was going to the same girl for almost a year so she knew my hair very well and what I wanted to have done (since ive been doing the same things for 10-12 years) and she kept making my hair too dark, each time it would end up more carmel than the last from not letting the color lift enough. I went for a touch up a few days before my wedding photos and asked her to lift the color longer like she used to. The color did not lift and ended up being way too dark so I called the next day and explained the issue to the receptionist about my color being wrong and that id like to come in and have it redone because I am having my wedding photos done, and that I would PAY and would be happy to take an appointment with whomever would be available, I did not ask for a free service what so ever, I just wanted my hair to be correct for my wedding photos. She took all of my information down and said someone would call me back.I ended up hearing nothing by the next day and the next day it was too late as I was leaving town.I ended up having my hair redone at the hotel the morning of my photos. I do like the hair care product selection and the prices of this salon and the lady who does the waxes is very helpful with picking out products and fake lashes, the salon is also very clean and has very bright lighting so you can see your haircut or make up well, but other than that I dont appreciate or care for the level of customer service I received, as well as being ignored after offering to pay to have my hair fixed.

25.description: I've went to Swerve because my friend's hair looks absolutely amazing when she has it colored by Jackie--I mean cover girl-amazing, so I thought I'd take a break from my usual place and see what happens. I was astounded by the absolute rudeness of the woman at the reception desk, and in fact, have been to Swerve several times, and am in repeat awe of how devoid of basic manners the reception women are. Each time I come in, I give serious thought to just turning around and leaving--but then I realize I won't have my hair colored by Jackie, so I stay.So in short, go for Jackie(my hair never looked better...or felt softer!), but be prepared to be rudely greeted, not be offered a beverage as some customers are, and to watch the the receptionist stuff her face with food as she makes the most unpleasant noises and states the appointment cancellation policy over the phone with a clear dearth of etiquette.It's really unfortunate that the arrival is so unpleasant, and the demand for payment(not even a "please" makes visiting the salon such an unfriendly experience...but as long as I can endure it, having Jackie make me gorgeous justifies my suspension of customer service expectations.Swerve gets zero stars, my colorist gets five stars....so I'm averaging it out, and rounding up just because I'm glad someone at Swerve used the small amount of good judgement they had and hired a great colorist!

12.description: I decided to try this salon after hearing several raves about this place and I am glad that I did! I went in for a conditioning treatment and haircut with a blow dry. Dana was my stylist and I'm so happy that she was. She listened to what I wanted out of my haircut and gave me her honest opinions on what would work best for me. She also didn't try to sell me too much on products (which I bought anyway) or additional services. I already booked my next appointment! Also I love that they use Pureology and Redken products. Although Pureology is a bit pricey they have great products that actually work and are worth the splurge every once in a while and you can't go wrong with Redken.

59.description: For the past 8 years I've been going to the same hair stylist. Sadly she is located in the burbs and I haven't been able to make it out there so I decided to try Swerve. (previously I had only gone here for waxing). First of all, this place is way overpriced! And as friendly as the stylist was, when I got home and took a close look at my hair, I was not pleased. She did a partial highlight so the top of my head was super blonde and she didn't get close enough to my roots since they were still very visible! I now have to part my hair differently to hide the nasty job she did with my original part. I won't be coming back.

21.description: Made a reservation for 3:30 and after all the trouble it took to get me there the receptionist told me it was never booked. Really needed the cut for an event tonight. Very upset. Never going back.

17.description: Absolutely love! I get my hair cut and colored by Amy and I have never been disappointed.  No matter what color I want, Amy somehow always perfects it, even while working around my hair dye allergy.  I've gone from brown, to blonde, to auburn, and every time, my hair comes out exactly how I wanted it.  They also give you a nice scalp massage when they wash your hair which is a nice little bonus.  Amy's always great when recommending products for me, and instead of blindly trying to make a sale, she tailors the products to my particular hair so it stays healthy and vibrant between cuts/colors.  It can be a bit pricy, but in my opinion it is 100% worth it.  I'd rather my cut/color be a little more expensive and look amazing than it be cheap and look mediocre.  Everyone that works at Swerve Salon is extremely friendly and helpful and I have always had a positive experience.The only downside is that you can only tip in cash.  There is a Chase bank a couple blocks down, and if I forgot cash, they've always been nice and let me run down to the ATM after my appointment.  Plus, they said they're working on getting their own ATM machine in the salon, so fingers crossed!

10.description: I went to Dana for a haircut and I couldn't be happier. It was my first time at this salon and many of my friends recommended Dana too me! She cut my hair exactly as I asked her, and it was perfect! Thank you for a great haircut!

5.description: I had a wonderful experience at Swerve this week. I am always a little apprehensive about going to a new stylist, but Nicole was AWESOME!  We talked through how I wanted my hair colored and cut and she had great ideas on how to tailor my ideas to what would look best with my natural color and hair type. As she used different hair products in my hair she talked through the purpose of the product, but was not pushy about getting me to purchase anything. I LOVE how my hair turned out. The cut & color were exactly what I was looking for. Thanks, Nicole!! I will definitely be back!!

3.description: I absolutely love Swerve Salon! Joe was recommended to me by a close friend and he is awesome! You walk in and you're greeted with a glass of wine and a beautiful salon. I have shorter hair and have been trying to grow out my bob (due to my wedding in October)- Joe has been so helpful with making me comfortable with growing my hair out! He gives a great cut! I have also never dyed my hair and I've entrusted him with that as well, go to Swerve and go see Joe!

35.description: The place is so trendy. Love the loft-like feel. Cute little Dana did my color and what a great job she did. She took her time and made sure SHE was satisfied as well as me.

19.description: Just used my Gilt coupon for a cut and conditioning with Danielle. She did such an amazing job! Definitely understood what I wanted and checked with me throughout the whole appt to make sure I was happy and knew what she was doing. I'm so pleased with the cut and will definitely be coming back to Danielle

28.description: I love this place--Joe has only been doing my hair for a little less than a year, but I can't imagine going anywhere else! Cute salon, friendly stylists, and fun evironment!

45.description: Swerve is a great salon with an amazing location, great prices and products! I've been going to Mallory for my cut/color/highlights for 3 yrs now and I love her! She really pays attention to detail and goes the extra mile to make sure I leave happy! I have REALLY long straight hair and she does a great job cutting in layers and making sure everything blends in how it should. Highly recommended!

33.description: I had a horrendous highlighting experience and desperately needed a new salon and stylist who knew exactly what I needed corrected and what I wanted done. Emma, who is the recent award winner for 'blondes' in particular, changed my hair life. Being blonde is a lot of maintenance and since I'm an actor it is important that I always look my best. She knew exactly how to correct the previous mistake done by someone else and also knew exactly what to do to my hair. My hair cut was also amazing. My next appointment is soon and even my out growth looks wonderful. It's so natural, I won't ever go to anyone else. The salon staff is also a joy and they are constantly catering to you. This is a great place that I would highly recommend to anyone I'm close with!

43.description: UPDATE: 09/2013Spent $200 (not inc. "tip" for a terrible haircut and experience)!Went back to the salon for a full weave (highlights) and a cut. The color came out ok BUT the cut was TERRIBLE! Worse haircut I have ever had in my life. I am always cautious when getting my hair cut from a stylist I have never used before. But being new to the city I really didn't have a choice. Upon speaking with the stylist (Stephanie) she mentioned that she had been at that salon for three years. Figuring that it is a REDKIN salon, I would take a chance on a cut from her because I didn't think they would hire anyone that would be THAT horrible. WRONG! I asked to cut off about 5 inches and then cut the other layers to frame my face and trim all the layers to match so that basically i would keep the same layering, just a little trimmed off. Instead, she cut the length, layered a little around my face and cut chunks through the back to make my hair style look fat instead of thinned out through layering. WORSE HAIRCUT EVER and I was only getting this done for a wedding. I had to wear my hair in a pony tail in order for save face for family photos. So embarrassing!CUSTOMER SERVICE - HORRIBLE from Stephanie. I warned her before we started that my hair is really dried and damaged right now. I have been processing it with highlights for years and I use a lot of heat on it through blow drying and flat ironing. Not only did I watch her make faces in the mirror but she jokingly talked about it being like a "bristle pad" with another stylist as she was washing out the product. RUDE! I WILL NEVER recommend this salon or this stylist to anyone in the future.TERRIBLE!

2.description: Great people and awesome atmosphere. Greeted with a glass of wine and amazing service throughout. I had Giavanni as my hair stylist for the evening and he was wonderful. So polite and was showing me lots of products that could help my hair. I ended up purchasing a $16 hair spray and brought my total to $96.  Only complaint is that that is very pricey for a haircut!

18.description: I see Stephanie for cut and color, Gio for shaving/adding graphics the back of my head. I've always been really happy with the color and service.

41.description: I finally found the stylist of my dreams...in Massachusetts, where we used to live. We moved to Chicago and I despaired of finding someone else who can make my hair look so great, AND be a nice person that I don't mind hanging out with for a couple of hours while my hair is done. My former stylist was at a Redken salon as well, and she gave me my color formula to give my new Chicago stylist something to work from. Joe made my hair look AMAZING. Just, amazing. The cut was perfect, I didn't need much but he thinned it out and made it look like I had an actual "style" again. And the color? Oh, the color. He suggested a few strategic caramel highlights, just to try (no charge!), to which I said (after two glasses of wine), "Sure, why not!" Well, I'm happy I did, and the last time I went back I was glad to pay for more, in addition to my single-process. The conditioning treatment also made a clear difference in the health of my hair (at least for a week or so), and I continue to do that as well.Joe is fun, sweet, and knows a LOT about color and cut. He is both a great listener and not afraid to suggest new ideas to his customers that will make them look FABULOUS. I have found my Chicago stylist! Which surprisingly was easier than finding a good local falafel place...

52.description: Easily located in Old Town (next to Pour House). Staff is super nice and the place is very clean. Mandi is the best! Great blonde hi-lights and I am super picky (as most blondes are)

50.description: if you are a blonde, go to  emma at swerve! she is the best of the best. I  am super finicky and picky about my blonde highlights, and emma knows exactly what to do. Love her!

4.description: First of all I want to say that this salon is absolutely adorable! It is so organized, clean, and a very warm friendly atmosphere. You're greeted right as you arrive which is always a great sign! This salon was recommended to me by my boss as she knew I was very nervous about cutting my hair short since it has always been on the longer side. She recommended Elle to me and I now will also be spreading her name about! She even fit me in on a day she was booked! Elle was very friendly, personable, and very understanding of what kind of look I was going for. She didn't try to pressure me into something I didn't want. She knew I was nervous and she walked me through the whole thing which ultimately made it way easier to start cutting it! I love the cut and I may even be on team short hair now thanks to Elle! Long review short.... My experience was 10/10! So, go to Swerve & go to Elle! You won't be disappointed! And did I also mention they will serve you wine?! Very reasonable prices for Old Town & everyone is very friendly! I will definitely be returning in the future!! Thanks again Elle! You rock! :D

6.description: Huge Review for Stephanie Pearson:  She is the best hairstylist so Im writing this review for her!  This salon is listed as a great salon for Redkin if you go to Redkins website.. that is how I started to initially go to Swerve after moving here to Chicago a little over a year ago.  My hair is pretty high maintenance and I had to go to the best ha.  So after the Redkin site recommended this salon, I was paired with Stephanie and she has been my girl ever since.  I love her.  She gets my style, and I think I went from Dark brown to Blonde.. back to brown (bc I always like to change my look!) and she has taken such good care of my hair.  And Ive always loved the color.  She is truly the best.  If you are in downtown and are looking for a salon, go to swerve.. and ask for Stephanie!! Love you girl!! Sincerely, Jessica Ramsey

22.description: Clean and well-decoratedI did not wait and was offered a beverage instantlygood products and they can deal with a variety of hair typesquick and efficient serviceHonestly the friendliest/cutest staff and very affordable

15.description: Clean and well-decoratedI did not wait and was offered a beverage instantlygood products and they can deal with a variety of hair typesquick and efficient serviceHonestly the friendliest/cutest staff and very affordable

57.description: This review is for Emma. I saw her for the first time yesterday, after moving to Chicago from out of state, and couldn't have been happier with the experience! I was extremely nervous seeing a new colorist, especially since I am in the final stages of transitioning from red back to my natural blonde hair. However, after only a few minutes of talking, Emma knew exactly what I wanted with my color. She discussed price options ahead of time when I asked, and was very forthright about what was included. She worked SUPER fast and was easy to talk to.  I'm in love with the color she gave me.Everyone I interacted with at the salon was friendly, my appointment started on time, and I found the color prices to be comparable to other salons I've visited.

20.description: I've gone back and forth about whether to write a review on Swerve since I stopped going there about two years ago, but when I saw that it was on Gilt I felt compelled to warn people not to spend their money here. It is such an unprofessional environment and for the cost and final product, there are better places in Chicago.STYLING:At first, I loved Swerve. My stylist, who I won't name for reasons that will become obvious below, was awesome and I even let her highlight my hair for the first time in my life which I had always said I would never do. But over time, the way she cut my hair really thinned it out, and oddly made it triangular around my face. Two years later, I'm starting to get the fullness back, but it's not fully recovered yet. I should also mention that of the 4-5 people I referred there during the time I was a client, no one ever went back for a second trip, so they must have had a  negative or lackluster experience as well. Also, the first time my stylist did my highlights, they were great, but the price was more than twice the price that the website listed for highlights at the time because they were "custom". This is my bad for not asking first, but seriously, over twice the top price quoted? Come on. For reference, I just looked at the current price for "custom" on the site, and mine were about 60% more expensive than that. Then, the second time, she pretty much just slapped on some dye so that I had obvious, rectangular chunks of color strewn about my head. Not cool. Had to get it fixed elsewhere.RAGING UNPROFESSIONALISM:My stylist once laughed while telling me about how she'd run out of the right color of red dye while doing a full color on the customer before me, so she'd just mixed a different color to finish the back of the person's head. Isn't step one of any process in life "Figure out if I have the requisite tools to complete this project?" And then, if you're going to flake out on doing something the right way, you're going to TELL ANOTHER CUSTOMER ABOUT HOW YOU LITERALLY JUST JACKED UP ANOTHER CUSTOMER'S HAIR AND DON'T EVEN CARE?!?!? It gets better though! My stylist also put me in the middle of a conflict between Swerve and a friend of mine that I'd referred to Swerve. As background, the front desk staff at Swerve are horrible. They've tried to call me to schedule something and then won't call me back when they drop the call mid-conversation, they've lost appointments, failed to call to confirm appointments, etc. In keeping with this trend, Swerve attempted to charge a friend of mine a no-show fee for an appointment that she'd never made and that, when they called her to confirm, she affirmatively canceled. It escalated to the point where she had to cancel her credit card because of multiple charge attempts by Swerve. But instead of calling my friend directly to apologize for the misunderstanding and try to make it right (which probably would have worked), my stylist put me in the middle of it by asking me to talk to my friend to urge her to come back to my stylist despite the poor front desk experience! How awkward is that?!?! She pretty much laid out a script for me of what to say to my friend on her behalf. It was so bizarre. This is your business, not mine.FALSE ADVERTISING:At one point, Swerve ran a promotion giving you $100 to the salon for any friend you referred. The fine print said that the credit had to be used towards services, which I was fine with. I ended up referring three friends during the promotion period, who all confirmed to me that they'd visited with my stylist after they'd done so. When I tried to cash in on the credit, though, my stylist told me that only two of them had visited. I decided not to push the issue. Then, when I received the credits, they were in $25 increments, could only be used one per visit, and all 8 expired within 3 months of issuance. In other words, I basically only got a $25 credit. When I called, Swerve did at least extend one coupon for me so that I could take advantage of $50 of the $200 I should have gotten. So beware, their promotions probably aren't as good as they say.So that's Swerve. I found a new place that I'm super happy at and will never go back.

36.description: This review is for Brooke who gave me a facial last night.Brooke was AMAZING!  She not only have me an amazing facial, but she also gave me a foot massage and wrapped them in hot towels.  She also gave me a shoulder / decolletage massage while I had a mask on my face and I was in heaven.  I would highly suggest Brooke!My only complaint is that the facial room is located where everyone checks in and buys product, so you could hear quite a bit of noise.  However, the darkness of the room and the music that was on, seemed to drown out the noise quite a bit.

14.description: I would be lost without Jenn! I am VERY particular about who I let cut/color my hair and Jenn always does an amazing job! I started going to Jenn about 6 years ago after I moved to the city and it was the best decision I have made. She is great at giving advice about color and cut and talks me thought things when I get in my "I want a change" moods. I constantly get compliments on my hair and I have her to thank! The salon and all of the employees are stand up and I always look forward to my appointments!

1.description: This place is amazing. I was stopping in and I never had really used anything this high tech to vape before. I only used ego twists or something on that level of vaping. I wanted something a little better and with more of a kick. I wanted to quit smoking, and so far, vape pens did not work.The guy working there actually taught me about so many things. He taught me about different devices, different tanks, taught me how to use, build, drip, use cotton... I can go on and on.We spent about two hours talking and he answered all my questions. Great place

9.description: I bought two vaporizers and both the chargers broke within 2 weeks. One broke the day I bought it. The threading one on the the vaporizers was bad and my boyfriend had to take it to work to get tools to fix it. The store has next to no options. The staff woman did not know what she was talking about. Not very happy with my experience. I will shop elsewhere.

12.description: Hands down the best vape shop in the area. Great atmosphere, great gear, amazing juice, great prices, and a fantastic staff. If you're in the area, you have to stop by.

21.description: I had a great time at this store! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Even though they are in a small shop right now, the staff makes the space so inviting that customers are willing and excited to chat with each other about the product VapeMonkeys is selling. Also the Hilo Heisenberg eliquid is wonderful, thanks for the suggestion!

16.description: Nice small vape shop! Feeling is very welcoming and the staff is always helpful. They have a lot of different and quality flavors to choose from anything from simple fruity flavors to more complex dessert type flavors.Whether you're new to vaping or have been doing it for a while they are very helpful!

17.description: I had a great time at this store! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Even though they are in a small shop right now, the staff makes the space so inviting that customers are willing and excited to chat with each other about the product VapeMonkeys is selling. Also the Hilo Heisenberg eliquid is wonderful, thanks for the suggestion!

10.description: Hands down by far the best vape shop in Chicago land area. They have a great selection of juices (PREMIUM JUICES!!!), mods (clones and authentics) even starter kits. The people here are nice and easy going unlike other shops that ive been to (not going to mention and names) these guys do no try to upsell you. They help you with what you need and what works for you. As far as their juices 24 Interstate is CRACK! I go through a bottle every week. I recommend it to everyone that likes sweets!. good people, great atmosphere, great products, great price. If you're new to vaping or veteran this is MOS DEF the place to be. Follow them on Instagram so you can be up to date on the new mods and juices.SUPPORT YOUR LOCAL VAPE SHOP!!!!!!!

5.description: I stopped in Vape Monkeys new location on Dempster. Love the vibrant color inside representing their logo. Real comfy atmosphere with a juice bar to attend to your sample needs. Great place to just kick back in their lounge area to watch tv and vape with the juices on the table. They have a great selection of mods, juices, starter kits..etc. The reason i came in today was because i wasnt' happy with my mechanical set-up after trying out my friends. I talked to Kris about my situation and it seemed that i just have an outdated set-up and i needed to upgrade from my previous set-up.I got a new RBA and Kris built it to my specific needs. It was exactly what i was looking for. Not only that but he gave me a crash course on how to build it along with some extra coils and cotton to play with at home and practice. I highly recommend this vape store. Great environment, knowledgeable staff , and amazing customer service. I follow them on facebook and instagram so i can be updated with the new mods and juices they get in.

11.description: Went to the shop and was not really impressed.  The salesperson, although very pretty wasn't knowledgeable and was steering a total newbie, someone who never vaped b4, to get a mech mod when obviously he should have gotten a starter kit which they don't sell..and it sounded like she was talking out of her butt.  If the vape community wants to nurture new people into vaping, this is not the way to go.  They had some good juices, but not alot of hardware, mainly mechs and drippers, but not alot.  Thank goodness I've been doing this so I have a little knowledge.  I wouldn't recommend it to someone just starting out

3.description: This place is awesome! Super friendly staff that gave me attention as soon as I walked in, knowledgeable, explained everything very well and even helped my fix my tank. They also cleaned it for me for free and very very nice.

0.description: These guys are great helped my boyfriend and I get all set up with a good priced quality starter sets and juices.  First place we tried in the area and no need to go anywhere else as far as I'm concerned.  They were very helpful setting everything up for us so we were set to go out the door with knowledge and great quality products for very reasonable prices.  The guy helped us set everything up and we were good to go leaving feelin happy.  Bye bye Newport 100s!!!

20.description: Little shop with just enough gear n juice to be great. Kris, the owner, was SUPER helpful in letting me taste almost ALL their juice from his personal atomizer! Wow that's what I call service folks! He explained they will be moving next door and will be getting more goodies very soon. I'll be back to have him throw a dual nano coil build in my Trident which he does for a mere $5. DONE DEAL! Noobs and Vape vets alike should check this place out!

19.description: The staff was beyond knowledgeable, friendly, and really took their time to explain and show me how to use their products.  When I got home, I looked up what I bought online and it turned out I saved a lot of money by buying from them.  Also, they have a large selection of premium juices, as well as a "bar" where you can sit and try them.

2.description: Best Vape shop around. The entire staff is knowledgable and down to earth. Selection of juice is fire.

18.description: Great service and the juice selection is awesome. It's a great place to find the ruthless ejuice and other top shelf ejuice. I have shopped around and the deals are great. I always get what I'm looking for. It's definitely worth the trip to get a great vape. It's a friendly environment.

13.description: Cheap products bad warranty

4.description: Great little vape shop. Great juice, great service, great prices but..... Twice now I've been offered new wicks after dripping some wick wrecking juices and the guy who did my wicks, I won't mention his name cause he's good otherwise, had filthy hands!  I watched my new cotton turn a nasty brown as he rolled it.  Needless to say as soon as I left I ripped that stuff out and re-wicked in the lot.  Cleanliness is a pretty big deal for me so I'll be refusing the wick service in the future. Only other gripe would be start stocking more Rda's!!! Fill up a case with clones and keep a few top notch authentics for the guys who need em.

6.description: Great shop! All employees are super friendly and super helpful. Even when the shop is packed, someone always asks you how you're doing and helps you find what you're looking for. These guys all know their stuff and are always looking to help out! Great environment, great staff, great experiences there. Thanks guys!

15.description: I signed up for yelp specifically to review these guys. They're that good. I have been vaping for abt 18 months, and wanted to "graduate" to using an RDA & building my own coils. These guys answered every dumb question I had, educated me on batteries, resistance calculators, wire, etc. They even built me a coil to get me going. The shop itself is pretty chill - a couch, tons of liquids to try, and a sense of community for vapers. I've since called a few times as other questions have popped up & I've gotten them answered. Chris, the owner, was great to me, and Chase had answered every question I've thrown at him. They regularly check online prices to make sure their stuff is competitively priced. They have truly won a customer for life with me. Thanks guys.

7.description: Customer service, customer service, customer service! I went in yesterday to get my first dripper and the guys there were so incredibly helpful it was mind boggling. The entire group that works here is amazing and helpful with getting into RBAs amongst other things. Some vape shops have rude staff or people who don't have time or want to give time to you but when I walked in yesterday, these guys were on point!I'll definitely be back again to buy more juices for my RBA!

8.description: VAPE MONKEYS. Great place, great guys behind the counter. always coming up with new juices to try. Can't go wrong. Willing to help with builds and recommendations.

14.description: Little shop with just enough gear n juice to be great. Kris, the owner, was SUPER helpful in letting me taste almost ALL their juice from his personal atomizer! Wow that's what I call service folks! He explained they will be moving next door and will be getting more goodies very soon. I'll be back to have him throw a dual nano coil build in my Trident which he does for a mere $5. DONE DEAL! Noobs and Vape vets alike should check this place out!

3.description: I like it because it's close, but frankly the Pizza isn't that great. Good to get off the Sedgwick brown-line for a slice, but I rarely order pizza here despite being a block away. Thin crust is always soggy and their deep dish us better, but still something is missing...

1.description: I eat here more than I should, but I love it. Either for a party with friends, or dinner for one. I've always enjoyed it. I can't comment on their delivery, though they usually ring my buzzer when my pizza's done since I live right upstairs.I recommend the calzones, the sauce, seasonings and crust are great.

2.description: Horrible, nasty pizza....not worth it.  Overpriced too.  Friendly staff though.

5.description: so I thought tonight I would try this pizza again.  After  all I did like it in the beginning.  My last review was pretty bad since the pizza was cold.  Not only was it cold it was overpriced.  When I confronted the server with the "online" special price, she told me she would have to contact the owner.  Low and behold, I get the "on line" special price.  Tonight we ordered the same as usual and it was again not as it was when the place first opened.  Unfortunately, we will not try it again.  At their prices there are so many more better places!  We really loved the place when it first opened.  Bring back the same quality and maybe we will return

0.description: nonnas is closed--now operated as cleaner, more new yawkie 5 boroughs PizzaQuite good--give it a shot!!!

4.description: Okay so the pizza is tasty, but not worth the awful service.  The first time I got delivery  it took over two hours and was cold.  We called and complained about the lateness and they mailed us a $10 gift card.  2nd time only went there to use the gift card and order a slice of pizza to go.  The employees are the dumbest individuals I have ever encountered in my life.  They just move slow and it looks like nothing is going on in there.  So the other day on my way home from work I stopped in and while I was waiting for my slice of pie I heard them messing up this woman's sandwich in there, who was there before me.  And as I was walking out a third employee gave her the wrong order again, man she looked steamed.  I was just happy to see it's not just me, these people are dumber than rocks.

3.description: Don't go here.  Amy, the assistant manager, was very inflexible with me.  They'll try to charge you prices that are non-competitive.  I was going to give them a try here at this new location but when I found out how inflexible, inconsiderate, and negative they were, it made it easy.  Instead, try Heavenly Massage on State street (just south of Division).  Fair prices and a good attitude.

1.description: A place that offers you the ability to get a massage at a low price and keep that price, there isn't any other place like it. With this new location that is now WAYYYY closer to me I can come and and see friendly people and get the massage I want. The friendly faces at the front desk who help me with anything that I may need! My therapist meets my need and give me way to keep up with this at home. They were also giving away free facials if you signed up for their program! I didn't want to pay the non-member pricing and I travel a lot so I joined, now I can be a member anywhere! I love this place and would defiantly tell everyone to come here!

2.description: This place is outstanding!  Tangi was absolutely amazing.   The massage therapists here seem to really seem supportive which is new to me as I have seen them typically be very competitive about clients.   They all recommend one another for different types of massages.  The experience got better and better.  I love Amy, Jordan,  Lauren,  Eric and Manny.  Oh and Robert is great too.  They are all so nice and accommodating.  So glad that this place is my neighborhood spot.   They are always able to fit me in and I love it cause I know by fall they will be booked as this is a very talented team of individuals!

0.description: I love this massage envy, I come here monthly for a massage.  The package they offer is great, and the staff is so friendly!  I usually have Janet, who is so good, she makes the experience relaxing and delightful!

58.description: Full disclosure: I'm not a coffee drinker, so I've never really frequented Intelligentsia. But since the new Old Town location just opened in the fabulous Plum Market around the corner from our place, I accompanied my partner, who wanted to get a dirty chai. While we were waiting for his drink, I think they must have been filming an episode of Portlandia because we watched mouths agape as one of the guys behind the bar pulled, tasted, and discarded five or six espressos before arriving at one he felt comfortable serving the increasingly thirsty customer ahead of us. Meanwhile, other employees were brushing what I assumed were invisible coffee grounds and tea leaf particles off of futuristic looking beverage implements.Funnily enough, once it arrived the dirty chai was described as lacking the "bite" the espresso normally contributes, a problem apparently not encountered at other Intelligentsia outlets. I should confess that a previous visit I enjoyed an iced tea and I imagine that I will be back to sample other beverages and foodstuffs. The room itself is gorgeous, with tall ceilings, glass walls, contemporary furniture, and stylish lighting. The espresso machine is sexier than and perhaps just as costly as the Italian sports cars that dot the Gold Coast. I cannot wait for the early dark nights of Chicago winter, when passersby will surely be treated to a stunning urban tableaux fit for the 21st century--the ennui of well-heeled espresso connoisseurs longing anxiously for the perfect cup of what we used to call joe.

56.description: I was so happy that intelligentsia was opening near my house.  The place is beautiful and comfortable.  The cups,spoons,decor,supplies etc are all beautiful.  Everything is perfect.  Except they have no clue on how to prepare a cup of espresso

29.description: Love the coffee that is served here. The atmosphere is trendy & clean. The customer service is wonderful.

42.description: Cute coffee shop adjacent to Plum Market. They have a lot of seating with good sized tables (one of my gripes with Starbucks). They do not have skim milk or sugar free syrups, but maybe that means they are more authentic?I got a chocolate ganache latte. It was lovely. The finish on the top with the foam was a nice touch.

23.description: I love Intelligentsia coffee, especially the mocha! Love their minimal decor! The pastries are delicious! However, never had I encountered good service here. There is always this one manager/ cashier that looks grumpy. The first time I came in, it was 30 mins before closing, I guess he didn't expect customers to come in at that time so he was grumpy. I get it.  Then I came back again for the second time, earlier, he was still grumpy so I have no idea what his deal is. Another thing with this location is their WiFi sucks! So disappointed! :(After all, if you want to grab a coffee to-go, this place would be good but if you plan to sit down and work/study, I suggest going somewhere else.

47.description: This place looks more like a chemistry lab that a coffee bar. After having their coffee a few times elsewhere I loved that they are open in the Plum Market so I can have a cup directly from them.   Walking into this location it is very clean and modern.  The bulk coffee and accessories are on shelves off to the right.  The drink menu is minimalist and to the point.  After you order you see them weighing the beans and the water to make sure that your coffee is up to their standards.  Great place to stop by when you're in the area for the best cup of coffee you can get.

8.description: Stop by for a cup of coffee since I didn't really want breakfast that day. The decor was so cute and everyone seemed so relaxed. I wish nyc was like that haha.  Got my coffee, forgot the name, it was originated from Columbia. It was a bitter sweet type of coffee. Definitely made it on my top coffee list.

31.description: WiFi was quite non-intelligent...sia. It's connected to a high-end grocery next door, so you can hop onto that WiFi, but it'll drop you consistently too.There's a point where Intelligentsia got too cool for itself. You can't escape them if you're in Chicago, which can be a good thing, but at this location it hurts them. Here, there's no sense of the local-coffee roaster feel, which I will shamelessly admit, kinda makes a difference on a purely aesthetic level.It felt cold here, even though the temperature was just right. No soul, no character to it. The douchebag in me is on full throttle right now.

34.description: Great coffee. Tasty roast espresso based drinks made in front of you at a reasonable cost. Great service. You won't find the million fruity blends and snacks you find in coffee chains. This is high quality coffee done right.  This is the philosophy of "do one thing but do it right." Ample seating. Can bring your laptop.

16.description: This place is awesome. Super delicious coffee beverages. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. I've had most drinks on their menu, they are delicious. Also, they're willing to change the music to whatever you want if you ask politely.

13.description: BLUF:  Definitely a very pretentious feel to the place but amazing coffee.High end hipster coffee joint.  Very modern atmosphere with a hoity-toity whole foods' crowd.  The baristas are all lumbersexuals/hipsters with beards and skinny jeans.  They were very nice though so i am jerk for judging.  I got the Ethiopian coffee and it was great.  they pour you a cup and give you a side jar too for a little more.  nice touch.  you wait a little but cuz the coffee is worth it and fresh.  the coffee was really really good.  i personally like dive bars and interesting atmosphere.  the atmosphere here was very pretentious and sterile in my opinion.  Cant beat the coffee though which was why i was really there.

11.description: Before I flew from Houston, my coffee-savvy friends insisted me to try out Intelligentsia. Although I had a great coffee experience at Boston's North End, I was still not a huge coffee fan. However, my prospective on coffee has definitely changed after my first trip to Intelligentsia. I was in Chicago for a business weekend retreat and had few afternoon hours of free time to kill. Curiosity encouraged to me take up my friends' suggestion and motivated me to walk to Intelligentsia. The moment I walked in, I was greeted by a friendly barista. He was kind enough to explain to this coffee novice the difference among the espresso types. Eventually, I chose the espresso cappuccino.The cup of coffee was arrived with a cool milk froth design on top, but it is not nearly impressive as the coffee itself. There is only one word I can use to describe the coffee: remarkable.In fact, the coffee was so remarkable that I went there again for breakfast the next day, and I was happy that Intelligensia served a small pastry selection. I chose a small pastry piece and it was so good especially as a complement to my second cup of Intelligentsia espresso!The next day again, I finally have to leave Chicago on a noon flight, but I went to Intelligentsia for another breakfast before I head to O'Hare. I don't know when I will be returning to Chicago, so I was taking as many opportunities as I can to experience Intelligentsia.Three days in Chicago, three trips to Intelligentsia. I was convinced why my friends were raving about this place, because after my first trip there, I was raving about it to my co-workers when I returned to the hotel. Not only was the coffee stellar, the price was also extremely affordable despite the coffee's phenomenal quality. I never caught the name of the barista who has served me three times, but I would like to thank this friend for showing me the best coffee I have ever had.

39.description: Legit coffee.Big cuppa latte. Milk froth is naturally sweet, espresso is bold but not bitter. No extra sugar needed.Great space. I wanna drink freshly brewed coffee from a chemex next time!

37.description: Before I flew from Houston, my coffee-savvy friends insisted me to try out Intelligentsia. Although I had a great coffee experience at Boston's North End, I was still not a huge coffee fan. However, my prospective on coffee has definitely changed after my first trip to Intelligentsia. I was in Chicago for a business weekend retreat and had few afternoon hours of free time to kill. Curiosity encouraged to me take up my friends' suggestion and motivated me to walk to Intelligentsia. The moment I walked in, I was greeted by a friendly barista. He was kind enough to explain to this coffee novice the difference among the espresso types. Eventually, I chose the espresso cappuccino.The cup of coffee was arrived with a cool milk froth design on top, but it is not nearly impressive as the coffee itself.
