There is only one word I can use to describe the coffee: remarkable.In fact, the coffee was so remarkable that I went there again for breakfast the next day, and I was happy that Intelligensia served a small pastry selection. I chose a small pastry piece and it was so good especially as a complement to my second cup of Intelligentsia espresso!The next day again, I finally have to leave Chicago on a noon flight, but I went to Intelligentsia for another breakfast before I head to O'Hare. I don't know when I will be returning to Chicago, so I was taking as many opportunities as I can to experience Intelligentsia.Three days in Chicago, three trips to Intelligentsia. I was convinced why my friends were raving about this place, because after my first trip there, I was raving about it to my co-workers when I returned to the hotel. Not only was the coffee stellar, the price was also extremely affordable despite the coffee's phenomenal quality. I never caught the name of the barista who has served me three times, but I would like to thank this friend for showing me the best coffee I have ever had.

0.description: First stop on Chicago caffeine crawl.Some people apparently don't like Intelligentsia. I guess because they have experienced snobbery, or maybe because they don't like how big the company has gotten to be. Then there are people who have never heard of such a company, like a lady I know that lived in Chicago for a few years. And still others adore Intelligentsia. I personally like them quite well. The few times that I've been to an Intelli, I've never been snobbed, so I can't complain about that. And I love them for what they've done in the coffee world. Ah, yes. And it seems like I always enjoy the coffee they make for me. Now for this particular experience. Intelligentsia seemed like an appropriate start for my Chicago coffee tour, since Chicago is where Intelligentsia originated. Also it was the most convenient place to obtain caffeine at the moment. I walked in and was greeted by the fresh vibe that is Intelligentsia. A jolly, bill-capped barista with a nice beard brewed me up an exprexxo. (There is no X in espresso but there are three Xs in exprexxo.) I sat down on a nearby construction avocado green chair and tried it out. It was the best espresso I'd had that day. Of course. What else would I expect out of these people? Never mind that it was the first espresso for the day too.

38.description: The Russian intelligentsia, the social stratum of publicly active educated people, is a taxonomic label created in the mid-19th century describing a social group whose professions didn't fit anywhere in the existing Russian customary social hierarchy. The story of Intelligentsia Coffee and Tea, the coffee roasting company that runs this Old Town and a handful of other coffee bars in Chicago, LA, and NY, is essentially akin to that of the 19th century social stratum as the coffee roasting company experimented with buying, roasting, and brewing techniques and adopted a business philosophy that bore little relationship to the received categories in coffee business--the then two-tier system constituted of gas station store's coffee and Starbucks coffee. They therefore, like their namesake social category, added a new class to the two-tier system and with some other roasting companies started the Third Wave Coffee movement. Their efforts have been well paid off as they turned into one of the "Big Three of Third Wave Coffee."Much digital and real ink has been spilled lauding the awesomeness of Intelligentsia coffee's taste and aroma. I agree with them all. I am by no means a coffee expert; but when I go to a third-wave coffee place for the first time, I usually get an espresso to try and see if I can tell any difference. What I drank at Old Town Intelligentsia was for sure different, in a good way, from what I had in other places. I even had Intelligentsia coffee before at Angry Catfish Bicycle and Coffee Bar in Minneapolis. It's maybe a delusion; but I think this original Intelligentsia Coffee Bar's espresso was better than that of Angry Catfish which brews the same beans. Add to their exceptionally good coffee some nice baristas, a modern yet comfortable interior design, high-speed wifi connection, a gorgeous espresso machine--which itself is an amazing piece of industrial design--and delicious pastries and you will get a first-rate third wave coffee bar.Although Lenin and his Bolshevik Party were perhaps the most famous representatives of intelligentsia, he famously criticized the social stratum of which he was a member for being lackeys of capitalism. In fact, in a letter to Gorky, he once wrote that the intelligentsia is not the nation's brain; it's the nation's feces. The Intelligentsia coffee bar too, although an amazing place serving excellent coffee, doesn't assist the "cause of working class!" (After all, shouldn't third wave coffee be served in independently owned coffee shops--and not chains?) So if you are a fellow working class 'tavarish', like me, be aware that you will pay way more than what you usually pay at your ordinary coffee place.

51.description: Great coffee and very friendly staff. I'll definitely be back. Parking wasn't bad either for a Sunday afternoon.

27.description: OK, not great.  Good coffee, decent selection of local pastry-ish fare.  The music is actually a great combo of 50s-70s classic rock/classic punk.  The issue I have with the place is it's way to "cold" of a space.  Not only is it freezing in here, but there just isn't that warm, coffee shop feel here.Ultimately, wifi seems to work well, coffee is good, and music is good. But, atmosphere and temp just don't do it for me.

32.description: After spending 2 and a half days waiting to trek to this place when it came up for our plans, the wait was worth it. Great service from the crew, welcoming us in, answering any and every question, being polite and patient while we chose our coffee, and offering up a killer suggestion. The cold press was fantastic and a perfect refreshment from the summer heat, while giving us the kick in the ass we needed for another two plus miles of city exploring. Bought a bag of the dark roast Intelligentsia, brewed a cup yesterday after grinding, and it was amazing. No cream needed, great little flavors of molasses and dark cocoa on the tail end of the flavor.Good stuff all around.

54.description: Staff here is unbelievably rude.

48.description: A long time, deeply loyal Starbucks aficionado, I entered intelligentsia coffee with an air of veiled hostility.  One might even say I was pitching for a fight. I was committed to the powerful, nearly over roasted and occasionally satisfyingly bitter Starbucks double cappuccino (dry side). I decided to try the intelligentsia version of same.  Their standard cappuccino contains two shots of espresso and what I now realize is an exquisite topping of steamed milk and crema. This is a magnificent cappuccino made with observable precision and care. The results are nothing short of outstanding. Their standard "black cat" beans produce a rich, gold, nutty, cappuccino.  They use a 5% milk fat Kemps milk to produce the foam. This, with the crema, is again, magnifique!

44.description: I like it for the convenience because I live in in Old Town. The cafe is inside Plum market.  They don't have a huge menu but it's a good spot for a quick cup of coffee! Will be back to try out some pastries!

24.description: Great, hand-crafted coffees with friendly employees and lots of seating with natural lighting. It is connected to plum market (the grocery store) so the vibe isn't quite as "coffee-shoppish" as the typical cafe, but doesn't take away from the quality at all! A little pricey ($4 for a latte) but it's so delicious and one of the few places in Chicago that I've found that does latte art that I'm okay with it as a treat now and then. Also have soy as their non-dairy option (no almond milk, etc.).

7.description: Iintelli is obviously delicious but what puts this store over the top is the excellent customer service. The baristas are kind, helpful and friendly. I like doing homework here. Usually, I can  find a place to sit. I also get a small discount for being a Moody Bible Institute student, so that's a plus. Cool story: Once I had an intelligentsia gift card from another store. Unfortunately, at the time, this location could not accept the gift card (I don't remember why) but they apologized and graciously awarded me a token for a free drink voucher. Be sure to tip this fine establishment.

49.description: I love this place! I'm here almost every day. It's a great place to meet w people 1 on 1. The coffee/tea is always on point. They have a very precise way of making each drink.  Check the menu for new specialty items. Everything is on point and made w care. I'm a fan of the low fat 12oz cappuccino. :)What's also cool about this location is you can also grab some food at the plumb market. Plumb has free parking w validation. If not there's plenty of pay the park on the street. The staff here is friendly and they go above and beyond to serve. Leave a tip + show the love these guys work hard and deserve it! PS. There are at least 3 solid areas that will give you access to an outlet. I would bring laptops fully charged just in case

40.description: This place is awesome, it is such a great place to meet new friends and spend time with old friends. The employees at intelligentsia are very friendly and make each of your drinks with care. Whenever you order you are assured that you will always get the same thing. They have great recommendations on all of their different drinks as well. They have a small variety of pastries that you can choose from but Intelligentsia is conveniently located inside Plum Market, so if you are hungry Plum Market has a great food bar and pre-made foods to choose from. Intelligentsia has a craft to making their coffee and it is perfect! They have suitable seating for lots of people and it is also children friendly. They also offer free wifi which is helpful :)

53.description: This place is for the true coffee snob.  If that's you, this place is it and say goodbye to your days at Starbucks.  I had the greatest iced mocha the other day and it really put to shame all the other crap that's out there, Starbucks included.Cute cafe connected to Plum Market where you can sit and talk and feel like you're sitting in Milan. Okay, a bit exaggerated but none the less, a great place for a good cup of coffee.

30.description: Best americano and good music made my day :)People are nice and outside view is awesome!Love the green and white match up interiors.Good to know this place!Thanks!

46.description: Oh, Sweet Jesus. I almost forgot what good coffee tastes like. Having majorly conflicted feelings about this new location that opened up dangerously close to my place/work/way to school. Intelligentsia shops used to be out of the way and solely reserved as treats for very special occasions. Thus, it's been quite a long while since I've had their coffee and I definitely, definitely did not tear up at the first sip of my latte. I didn't even realize I had ordered a hot beverage and was walking around in 94 degree weather until I got home. Still, at $5 for a small latte (incl tip), I'm going to have to start a fund for luxurious splurges.*This review was written in the summer; thought it was posted but it was only saved

1.description: They are very slow and coffee is very expensive. The coffee is great however.  But also the staff all dress like communists. So. I don't really love this place.

55.description: So happy to see an Itelligentsia open up in Old Town. Coffee snobs unite at the new convenient location within the new Plum Market.This probably isn't a post up and boogie on down on your laptop or w/ friends type spot but still has space for tables & chairs. I feel like this place is meant to serve as a grab & go or fuel up before grocery shopping type of digs. I do love that they always incorporate local pastries/food from surrounding spots, in this case they have pastries from Friole one of my FAV bakeries in Lincoln Park, so major brownie points were earned here.Logistics wise there is a lot confusion on where to order which I'm sure is just growing pains of a new location but otherwise this place is a gem.

9.description: Always look forward to relaxing with a great cup of coffee when we visit from Memphis, TN!  Love this place!

26.description: First thing's first: the coffee is excellent. I guess that's all that should matter...however, as a non-coffee snob myself, I found the menu and service a bit off-putting and high-brow. In addition, this fairly sterile location, though bright and airy, does not feel like some place you could sit with a cup for an hour.

25.description: This is a place you come to when you have a leisurely day and plenty if time. It takes quite a bit if time to get your coffee. However, if you have time I strongly suggest coming here. As soon as you walk in you feel that you are in a artistry coffee shop. There are small tables but mostly large communal tables which I appreciate. There is also a wine and beer bar. They serve brewed coffee to taste too. I really love that they pride te selves on fair trade coffee. They have beans from different countries and each bag tells a story. In the end I had a soy chocolate ganache latte. They have it a beautiful design with the steamed soy milk. The latte was delicious. It tasted much more like hot chocolate than a mocha latte. Overall I like this place. I just won't go when I'm in a hurry.

12.description: Stopped in earlier this week for the first time.  Regular coffee was OK - not as good as I would expect for the $4 price tag. Space is cool - open and bright with tons of white decor and natural light.  Would stop in again for a cappuccino or to spend some time working

59.description: I am far from a coffee connoisseur, but Intelligentsia coffee has been a long time favorite of mine. Everyone has their own favorites, so I won't try to convince you otherwise, but if you haven't tried an Intelligentsia cafe, I urge you to try one as they're wonderful.This Intelligentsia is connected to the brand new Plum Market in Old Town. The space itself is quite minimal but beautifully appointed. Large windows occupy the west wall, and the color scheme is grey, green and bright orange. Free wifi is fast enough to get some work done, and the tables are big enough for you spread out comfortably. However, I feel that the front counter area is a bit...busy. First time patrons seem to be confused about how to line up to order, and where to go to start an order. There are a lot of workers behind the counter, each with their respective tasks, but many looked at me but didn't give me direction on where I needed to go to order my drinks. Perhaps growing pains, and hopefully not something more...judgmental. And they give you sparkling water when you ask for water...a plus or negative, depending on your taste.Overall, highly recommended.

21.description: Didn't get the signature design for my cup, but very tasty; I think I would still give a slight edge to the Pasadena location.

17.description: WiFi was quite non-intelligent...sia. It's connected to a high-end grocery next door, so you can hop onto that WiFi, but it'll drop you consistently too.There's a point where Intelligentsia got too cool for itself. You can't escape them if you're in Chicago, which can be a good thing, but at this location it hurts them. Here, there's no sense of the local-coffee roaster feel, which I will shamelessly admit, kinda makes a difference on a purely aesthetic level.It felt cold here, even though the temperature was just right. No soul, no character to it. The douchebag in me is on full throttle right now.

10.description: Connected to Plum, this is in a great location near Division. Baristas are very sweet and make a killer latte. I liked this place so much I had to return during my vacation.

5.description: So I'm a fan of Intelligentsia mainly, because no one gets an absolutely balanced pour over better than them.Located between the PNC bank and Plum Market, there's a parking garage just south of PNC bank, where you can get parking validation. Wahoo for free parking. Otherwise there are metered spots in front, and lots of random tow zones that you have to watch out for.Pricing here is pricy. A pour over is $5, as are most of their teas ($4-5) per cup. You get plenty of coffee and tea.They have a DELICIOUS vanilla bean donut for about $2. OMG. This one melted in my mouth, and I still think about it.Plus free wifi, it's attached to Plum Market, and relatively spacious/plentiful seating with tables throughout, indoor and out.Whenever I have out-of-towners, I will almost always take them to an Intelligentsia or a Metropolis cafe like Dollop if they can appreciate high quality coffee.

3.description: we went to their Old Town location and this was as close to 9th bar in dunedin as i could get. They poured a mean cup of cap! My first Cap was better then i ordered it the next day but they were still great! i noticed there are multiple locations in Chicago and hope it catches on here in Orlando. Super clean place, and friendly staff.

35.description: I visit this intelli whenever I have the chance, and since it's walking distance from my apt I try to make it at least once a week. For coffee snobs that have been spoiled in the goodness of fresh light roast coffee this place is awesome. Incredible consistency. Each barista takes ownership of the beverage served which is refreshing ;)

19.description: Inelligentsia Coffee is great but this location is incredibly average. It is inside of a grocery store and feels industrial, not authentic.

28.description: Beautiful new location, but they are still training baristas. I got a med Americano that was weaker than cheap diner coffee. Be sure to sip before you leave. I sure wish I had, especially after driving well out of my way to get the Intelligentsia quality and richness I craved.

45.description: This place is so amazing - I stop in at least once a week to grab a cappuccino and a pastry, and am constantly impressed by how high quality the coffee and food is, and how much attention to detail is put into every cup (the latte art alone is incredible). Plus the attached Plum Market is absolutely amazing - if I had a million dollars, you better believe that would be my first stop (I'm slightly food obsessed).And the added bonus: all the baristas are well-dressed, sexy, and nice. Makes that coffee taste even better.

33.description: My favorite iced mocha in the entire world. So flavorful and creamy-- it isn't very sweet and doesn't even need to be sweetened. The staff here is always quick and kind, and I enjoy being able to get a couple of groceries and then sit down with a coffee.

43.description: I have always loved Inteligenstia coffee, but have never written a review. This place is so nice and peaceful! And the coffee is the BEST!! It's a little on the pricey side, but my theory has always been: you pay for what you get! The girl that helped me was super nice and knowledgable as well! Whoever does the decorating is pretty genius too! Love the decor!!

2.description: Very spacious, modern, stylistic decor. I ordered a vanilla iced coffee, which was average. House coffee was great though.In addition to the drinks, I got a chocolate croissant and an almond scone. They were really good. Food and drinks are a bit more pricy compared to those in Starbucks. The baristas were very friendly and helpful.I'll come again for the nice atmosphere and decor if I happen to be in this area again.

18.description: The coffee is great. They put the cutest little hearts in the cappuccinos. A little overpriced. The pastries are passable but nothing to write home about. Good wifi!

41.description: I work at the bike shop up the street so I frequently come in here. Staff is super rad and always good to chat with.

52.description: Same great coffee and pastries, new location.  Outstanding!  nb  don't expect italian coffee bar speed ... for that reason, only four stars

50.description: A much needed addition to the area as most of the coffee shops around here are so full there is not a seat left in the house.  Plenty of seating with 20+ tables including a community table. This location is connected to the Plum market and is next to the market's wine bar.  Free wifi, and intellligentsia never disappoints with their coffee.  I did not notice parking besides street parking, so I would recommend walking to this location.

4.description: While I don't venture in this area much I'm glad to find a new and the space is lovely. I really enjoyed my first visit. I enjoyed a ICED LATTE and will be back for more :)

6.description: This is a place you come to when you have a leisurely day and plenty if time. It takes quite a bit if time to get your coffee. However, if you have time I strongly suggest coming here. As soon as you walk in you feel that you are in a artistry coffee shop. There are small tables but mostly large communal tables which I appreciate. There is also a wine and beer bar. They serve brewed coffee to taste too. I really love that they pride te selves on fair trade coffee. They have beans from different countries and each bag tells a story. In the end I had a soy chocolate ganache latte. They have it a beautiful design with the steamed soy milk. The latte was delicious. It tasted much more like hot chocolate than a mocha latte. Overall I like this place. I just won't go when I'm in a hurry.

22.description: BLUF:  Definitely a very pretentious feel to the place but amazing coffee.High end hipster coffee joint.  Very modern atmosphere with a hoity-toity whole foods' crowd.  The baristas are all lumbersexuals/hipsters with beards and skinny jeans.  They were very nice though so i am jerk for judging.  I got the Ethiopian coffee and it was great.  they pour you a cup and give you a side jar too for a little more.  nice touch.  you wait a little but cuz the coffee is worth it and fresh.  the coffee was really really good.  i personally like dive bars and interesting atmosphere.  the atmosphere here was very pretentious and sterile in my opinion.  Cant beat the coffee though which was why i was really there.

15.description: great coffee in a light, comfortable space.  Friendly baristas.I purchased a 12oz. bag of one of their roasts and it was excellent.

57.description: the presentation is here is the best around....not to mention the coffee.  I would have to say the best cappucino in Chicago.  You are given a small glass of water and a small proper espresso spoon - this is exactly how coffeehouses in europe serve their customers.  it is a classy, attention to details and very non-disposable feeling.  finally music playing and no TVs!!! I love it - well done intelligentsia

20.description: great coffee in a light, comfortable space.  Friendly baristas.I purchased a 12oz. bag of one of their roasts and it was excellent.

36.description: After working from here for several days, I made the decision that I need to move to Chicago. Great coffee, fresh flowers, natural light, free wifi...have i died and gone to heaven?

14.description: The coffee was burned and the place is not cozy at all. The girl who made my latte for me don't seem friendly.

12.description: I wish I knew the name of the wax "specialist" that I had. All I can tell you was that she was medium height, brunette, on the heavier side, and had dramatically drawn on eyebrows.First of all, let me tell you that I'm a loyal EWC customer. I have a wax pass, and always go to their locations for my waxing. I should also tell you that I have awesome eyebrows. They have a gentle arch, really full, very similar to Camilla Belle. Today, I was late for my appointment. Totally my fault, and they were nice enough to fit me in. I should have known better, and just taken a later appointment. The wax specialist was in a huge rush to try and get me in and out and it was TERRIBLE. She asked me how my day was going THREE TIMES in a row. I told her my eyes always water when I get waxed, and not to worry about it. She responded with, "you better not be f**king crying on my table." And when she showed me the mirror afterwards, one of my brows was completely thinned out and re-shaped! Suddenly I had this skinny little shred of an eyebrow with this crazy forced arch. She fully acknowledged that one of them was thinner than the other, but just said- "yea, one came out thinner. But your eyebrows are hot." I had no time to do anything about it, because I was already late in their schedule. So I just had to leave and I figured it was probably not that noticeable. It was totally noticeable. I've now just spent 20 minutes in the bathroom plucking the other eyebrow to match this one and it breaks my heart to see my beautiful, full, eyebrows destroyed like this! I'm hoping they grow back quickly and I don't have to wait too long.

3.description: I normally go to the other EWC on Clark & Belden, but due to issues with the EWC's call center (I couldn't get an appointment for FOUR MONTHS!! Also, they're extremely unhelpful and rude), I had to come here. This place actually turned out to be much better than the other EWC and I will no longer return to the Clark & Belden location. The staff was very friendly and my waxer was awesome. She made me feel extremely comfortable, even though I was nervous since I hadn't been waxed in four months. I ended up getting my eyebrows done and some other things that I won't mention (heh) and she made it as painless as humanly possible, which was much appreciated.I told my waxer and the front desk staff about the issues with the call center and they ended up giving me their direct number so I wouldn't have to deal with the call center anymore. Don't even both dealing with the call center and just come here directly. Much easier to work with for sure!

1.description: Beth is fantastic! She has the best attitude and makes getting a wax a breeze. I actually enjoy our fifteen minutes together chatting and making small talk, which for some people at some establishments can be awkward.. but not here. This plays is truly great and has hard working girls at the front desk too! They are genuine and kind and can turn your day around with a cheerful smile. I find it to be a great experience and won't go elsewhere as long as I am in Chicago!

2.description: I come here every four weeks for a wax, the place is conveniently located to my house.  The staff is friendly, gets you in and out, and you forget for a quick minute you are even getting a wax.  I highly recommend it.

9.description: I saw Brandy for lip, eyebrow, and Brazilian.  She was fantastic!  She had great attention to detail and was very attentive to how hot/cold the wax was. I was in and out in an hour, too! It was my first time seeing her and I'll definitely be going back to her in the future.

10.description: I went here for my first wax yesterday and although I was terrified to go, I left buying a package for more waxes.Lots of metered street parking and right by the brown line Sedgwick stop, this location is clean bright.As I said, I was scared to be going for my first wax, but when I walked in I was welcomed and calmed down by the woman at the front desk (Katie I think?). She quickly got me checked in and handed me off to Betty. Betty is great. She did a great job of explaining things to me, keeping my calm, and distracting me all while she was putting hot wax on my lady bits. I was done in less than 30 minutes.While getting a Brazilian is a humbling and painful experience, the people at EWC made my first experience as easy as possible.

4.description: I absolutely love European Wax Center. I have visited the North Avenue location a couple dozen times, and also gone to the Streeterville location as well. The facility is always clean, and the wax they use is great and makes the waxes much less painful! I go in generally for brazilian and brows. I cannot say enough good things about ALEXA. She is amazing! She is the fastest, most painless waxer I have ever had. And on top of that, she's easy to talk to, makes you feel comfortable, and distracts you from the little pain you may be experiencing from your wax. Generally I am in and out in less than 15 minutes with her! On top of all of that- the prices for Brazilian cannot be beat.

6.description: Its a solid 3.5 star place.Cheers to a free eyebrow wax!  What's not to love about being beautified for free!!!??Easy online scheduling.  They offer a free wax for new customers.  I went and had my brows done.The space is new, clean, nice.  The wax was OK for free.  I have fine blond hairs and felt that they really didnt get all of them.  I would have expected more if I would have paid $16 for it...alas, it just cost me $5 for tip.I also really liked how they offer yearly services or packages to decrease the cost per wax.  I just think this place is really OK.

15.description: This was by far the worst waxing experience I ever have had! I went in for a bikini Brazilian. When I was brought back to the room (which was cold), the waxing specialist stayed in there and said to remove my bottoms and get on the table. Typically when I have gotten waxed in the past, the specialist leaves the room and allows me to get on the table and place a towel over myself. I am used to hard wax with strips, so I was not used to wax that is used by European Wax Center. Apparently it is called, "comfort wax" though. I beg to differ. When she began taking huge strips off, I actually yelled out because it felt as though she ripped part of lady bit off. The whole thing took about a half hour. Which is longer than I would have liked to endure. She went over each section probably about 3 times.. maybe four. She didn't even talk to me, which made it worse! The only time she did talk was to say how I need to buy their lotion for my ingrown hairs. When it was finally over, she didn't even offer a mirror for me to see the work (frankly I was so ready to get out of there I didn't care). When I got home, there was wax still all over me. I woke up the next morning and was still in pain. The only plus was it cost $23 for new client. However, I would not go back even for $23.

0.description: So I've never been waxed before and had my first experience today at the European wax center. I really didn't know what to expect because it is sort of an uncomfortable situation for me. That was until this experience! The front desk ladies were so welcoming! Made me feel comfortable right off the bat while I waited for my specialist. The place and atmosphere was clean and positive.My specialist was Alexa... And let me tell you. Alexa was the epitome of professional. She was fast and knew exactly what to do. She totally knocked out any negative preconceived notions I had about getting waxed! I could not be more pleased by my experience and I already have my next appointment booked! 5 stars from me all the way!

5.description: I received great service here for a Brazilian Wax. The esthetician Beth was nice and professional. European Wax Center does offer some cool products and waxing packages plus for my first visit I received half off!

13.description: Went in for the Men's back wax. First time waxer.  Tiffany was my groomer and did a splendid job answering all my questions and getting me out quickly and pretty much pain free.  The salon is very stylish and clean.  I would have given 5 stars if it weren't for the counter attendant (Isabella ??) who was pretty unhelpful on the phone and while I waited.   Also I was not offered the "first time" free wax or a discount.   If you can get past the front counter, it's worth it!

11.description: Love EWC and Brandy. Was just in for B&B (brow and bikini) and can't say enough positive things about Brandy. And, Raquel the Manager is awesome and accommodating. Don't hesitate to visit.

8.description: I can't say enough good things about EWC Old Town! I recently moved to Old Town from Lakeview and was planning on going to my old waxing spot that I had been going to for years. I ended up in a time crunch on a Sunday morning and only had a few hours before I had to be somewhere that day - I had a boat day planned on Labor Day Monday so needed a brazilian ASAP.I called and because it was Sunday morning, they had availability to squeeze me in. When I got there, the woman at the front desk let me know of a membership - if you're new, you can buy 9 waxes and get 3 free for a total of 12. It was a little over $400, but they offered PAYMENT PLANS which is awesome - so your credit card only gets charged $140ish over 3 months. Easier pill to swallow than upfront. I told her I would get my wax and then consider.Nicole did my brazilian and it was hands down the best and most painless brazilian I have ever had done! I thought that I was never going to leave my old waxing place but she had me sold. I was in and out of the room in about 10 minutes and she walked me through all the products she was using on me (cooling gel, etc) and told me about the signature blue wax that isn't supposed to grab onto the skin and is painless. I didn't believe her at first but it truly was painless...I ended up buying the wax package so now I have 12 more brazilians to use - and they don't expire! Some places you have to go monthly but my hair doesn't grow quite as fast so I go once every 5-6 weeks.They do push their products a little bit - I bought some of the ingrown hair serum because Nicole was talking it up - but so far it's been great and I don't regret buying it at all.If you live in the area and need a place to get a wax done, you should absolutely check this place out!

14.description: Becca is excellent at her job and puts you at ease. She also educated me as to what I could do daily/weekly to make my wax experience more tolerable - cause let's face it, it's never gonna be a party.Wax is far better than any other that I've used - much less pain.Totally clean and the manager was on site, active and very pleasant and informative. She also seemed to work well/was respectful with her staff which is always a bonus.Would definitely recommend.

7.description: Great concept, but too corporate and inconsistent customer service. I am a loyal EWC client. I have multiple wax passes, but I am not a fan. I think their customer service is poor, but mostly because the online appointment scheduler and call center are unreliable. I have had many appointments lost, but I didn't find out until I showed up. They are constantly running late due to their 9-min late policy. I actually live closer to another EWC, so trekking to this one only to find I no longer have a previously confirmed appointment or they are 15+ min behind is extremely frustrating (as was the case today). If only they would let us know! I do love my aesthetician, Beth. She's fabulous and the only reason I keep coming back.

3.description: This place has horrible customer service and they never have what you need ! And then will get mad at you when they mess up your order ! I will never go here again and I don't advise anyone else to go here either ! Go down the street to star bucks ! The only reason I'm giving them one star is because I don't have a choice they deserve negative stars

1.description: By far the slowest and most unorganized Dunkin Donuts I have been to. My girlfriend and I ordered two sandwiches, a bagel and a coffee. It took about 25 minutes to get our order as well as the staff asking us several times what our order was and asking did we receive it yet.I wouldn't go back here for breakfast.

2.description: Omg. I can not believe this place. For the last couple of years, I have ordered the same thing. I order one large, unsweeted iced coffee with a pump of sugar free vanilla, one order of hash browns, and a chicken bacon ranch wrap. I'm always left waiting, I receive about 6-7 hashbrowns, and my coffee is either hot, or plain, or sweetened. HOW?? I'm not asking for the Holy grail! Yet, I always forget about the terrible customer service, and screwball service. I've recently switched to Starbucks. A little out of the way, less of a menu, but I receive what I order and pay for. = )

9.description: They had the elusive "creme" donut. Though only in vanilla. I wanted to recapture my youth with a chocolate creme doughnut, but alas none were to be found. There is a facebook page dedicated to bringing it back. It does exist, but only in select locations. Still, after 6 or 7 DD checks, I finally found this one with the vanilla. Not as good but better than that custard crap. Well, I walk in and find the woman behind counter yelling at some other employees. I don't know what was going on, but it appeared to be a family dispute. She was speaking an East Indian language, so can only imagine what was being said. Problem was that I had to get back to the house to get to airport and this woman was holding my donut, turned to someone else yelling very loudly. She did not take my money, she did not give me doughnut, just held it out of reach as she yelled and yelled. Others came in and waited behind me. I went to use restroom, she yelled as she buzzed me in. It got louder as I was in restroom. I come out to even LOUDER yelling. I considered calling the police, but why? I'm going home to San Francisco. I will not return to this DD. If they had the CHOCOLATE creme doughnut, I would consider a return to the doughnut domestic dispute. But they didn't so I will not.And I only ate half that doughut. It was not as good as I remembered. But the taste lingered in my mouth all afternoon. Not in a good way.

10.description: I stop here on many mornings on my way to work.  It's nice to get a friendly "Hi honey, how are you?' in the morning, and to have them remember your order to boot.  They are fast, and friendly, and just what I need when I'm half asleep in the morning.

4.description: The employees at this location should really go through some sort of customer service training. The last thing a customer wants to deal with first thing ini the morning are the rude and unthoughtful workers of the local dunkin

6.description: This DD gets the job done, just barely, and without any class.  You know the drill, you get coffee and donuts here.  And it's all of pretty good quality.But the jackasses behind the counter at this location are just unbearable.  The cashiers are so involved in their own private conversations that they always ask you to repeat your order, and then you have to repeat it again to the person pouring the coffee.  It's the type of situation where the cashier tells you the total and then holds out her hand in your general direction as she turns her head to talk with her coworkers (who are all family?  friends?).If you're in the vicinity of North and Wells, I recommend going somewhere else, but since this location is right next to the Sedgwick L stop, they will continue to do land office business despite their dreadful customer service.

11.description: Think all Dunkin' Donuts are the same?  Then you are so wrong!!!!   This isn't just any Dunkin' Donuts; it's MY Dunkin' Donuts.  I've been going to this one for years, as I've lived in Old Town since 2001.  This particular location is a family affair, and you can feel the love from the moment you step in the door.  Plus -- and this is huge -- they're FAST.  And courteous.  You won't get greeted by name, but if you're a regular like I am, you will always receive a cheerful and familiar "Hi Honey!  How are you?"  And they remember how you order your coffee, which, as everyone knows, is the BEST coffee.  Bottom line -- if you haven't been to this Dunkin' Donuts, you're missing out.  I'd eat breakfast there every day if I could.

5.description: This has to be the most frustrating DD around. Yet again, I order 3 coffees with cream only and they screw it up by adding sugar! Unfortunately these are for co-workers so I can't taste them before leaving the establishment. So irritating!

7.description: Ok... I had a review pending since the Yelp iPhone Appl wont let you actually submit a review... and I've visited this Dunkin Donuts every weekend and often weekdays depending on my schedule...As of this morning I will never go back; there were many people in the store and one of the owners chastized this female customer for supposedly leaving a paper there, which was already on the table when she sat down. I'm sorry, but you simply dont yell at customers, especially for something as stupid as a Red Eye paper!I voted with my feet and told the owners "That is not the way you talk to customers!"  I can't support any business which doesn't respect that the customer is not only WHY you are in business but HOW you stay in business.I wont be back.

8.description: Every doughnut hole known to man is here.  The owners are fantastic.  My husband and I go in at least once a week for breakfast before work and they are so friendly and I absolutely refuse to believe that it is a common occurrence that there is any sort of yelling there.  They seem to be a very tight knit family, and, lets face it, if I worked with my family, you would certainly hear some yelling more than once in a while.

0.description: Just a run-of-the-mill Dunkin' Donuts in the city, very small parking lot with a lot of different shops in it. Don't try and park here with a large vehicle especially during peak times. Not a very large sitting area, more of a grab and go place. Can't go wrong with Dunkin' Donuts coffee though, always good always hot

58.description: A hidden gem for sure. They're really nice here and it's super low key. I always get what I always order from Thai restaurants--pad see ew. Although tonight, I had the Singapore noodles to try and ail my hangover and it was also pretty good. One absolute must try is the coconut ice cream. They make it themselves and it is to die for!

56.description: One and done!  Waited 105 minutes for delivery that is literally 3 blocks away. Walked to the restaurant to get a progress check. "The car broke down". Really?  The food was delivered in a Benz. Who gives a shit what the food tastes like.

29.description: Really good and a little bit lighter and not as greasy. Only bad thing is it costs an extra dollar to substitute out carrots and green onion.

42.description: 3 and a half stars! Better than A-Ok.We found this place when we were walking around Old Town. It is a very small space, but clean. It probably mostly caters to take out and delivery than sit down. We walked in around 9:40pm on Saturday night. Their closing time is 10:00pm, and they did not seem too pleased to see customers walk in at 9:40pm. Anyway, we put in our orders right away. We ordered thai basil with tofu, panang curry with vegetables and chicken fried rice. The food was good, the curry better than the other dishes. It was fresh and flavorful, but the portion sizes were smaller than you are used to getting at other Thai places.

23.description: Their Penang Curry is one of the best one I have eaten in Chicago. The portions are small, but the taste is great. I'd also had the pad see ew and pad Thai and the flavor was good. Small place but great tasting food.

47.description: Decent Thai lunch. I'm always skeptical of anything below 4 stars, but this place was acceptable. Small dining room, quick lunch service.

8.description: The food itself was 5-star. We were a group of 4 and ordered different appetizers (soup, satay, and wontons) which were all super tasty. For our main course we focused on the Thai curries that they had (green and red mostly) which were super tasty. Their Thai iced tea was also good. So, for the food itself we would give 5 stars.What annoyed us and made us remove 2 stars was that they added the tip to the bill (on top of final price including tax) and when they processed our credit cards they even added the tip line again. This is a bad business practice and they should not do this!

31.description: This place is delicious! Had a rough day at work and wanted to indulge in curry. I randomly chose this place on Grubhub since it was close by.....and boy am I so happy!!!!! Perfectly spiced Panang Curry with chicken! Not the super peanut butter tasting kind that I hate!  I see this becoming a dangerous habit !! YUM

34.description: Place is great for take out. The spicy basil chicken is really good ( extra spicy , extra chicken ). Delivery time kind of takes awhile 45 to a hour .

16.description: This is my go-to spot for Thai food in Old Town/Gold Coast. Pickup is super quick as food is done within 5/10 min of ordering. Same applies of ordering to go in the restaurant. Top picks are the panang curry and pad see ew. Drunken noodle is alright too.

13.description: READ THIS  !We are regular customers at the Tai restaurant.  Present once or twice a week for lunch special.  Yesterday, we ordered entree and soup as usual, but were told there was no regular cabbage & tofu soup available to accompany the lunch.  We were asked to select a "crispy fried whatever' that we don't eat.  We asked to be served a cup of another soup which the server refused.  The lady co-owner was present and was totally disrespectful of our dietary requirements.  She did say she could make a special bowl of cabbage soup for us, but implied it would be quite awhile.  No thanks !  We left and ate elsewhere.  Too bad.  While the man-owner and most servers are quite nice, the lady-owner is a real B.  Lack of concern for customer satisfaction TAKES YOUR APPETITE AWAY does it not?

11.description: So I have ordered from here many times - and we really like the food.   For the food I would rate them 4 stars.   Three reasons they are lower:1 - Website is VERY bad - in this day and age you can really improve this and should2 - Last delivery was wrong - missed one entire dish on the order and I had to call to get them to bring it.   Very basic thing.3 - Today I placed an order on their website and after 30 minutes they called to tell me they are closed!!   Really?  First, closure on a Tuesday makes no sense.  Second, why do you have a website that lets people order when you are closed (see point #1)I am looking for another more reliable and easier Thai place to deliver.   Too bad - my business was yours to lose - and you did.

39.description: Went here last night and was pleasantly surprised. It's a small no thrills restaurant but the food is AMAZING! I highly recommend the chicken pad Thai, tom yum soup, and the beef and broccoli. Completely packed with flavor and not loaded with grease! The staff was super personable and went out of their way make sure everything was perfect. I will for sure be back for my next Thai craving with the passion cooking from this kitchen!!

37.description: Convenient and quick earned this place two stars, the third star comes from the tofu pad thai and green curry chicken -- both were adequate but nothing great. They made a mistake on the spring rolls ordered and they were really skimpy on the rice.

0.description: I was in the area and had a craving for some thai.  Stopped by this hole in the wall (seats about 20 I'm guessing) and was pleasantly surprised by what I got.  Ordered the chicken and vegetable dish, which was very good.  Chicken was good and vegetables were nicely cooked.  Good flavor in the sauce and overall good bang for your buck.  Also ordered fried egg rolls, which were decent.  I'd say a 70%.  Warm and flaky outter with good amount filling.  Not a ton of flavor, but the sauce was good.  The service here was great though.  Girl who takes orders and waits on the tables is super friendly and her mom who runs the kitchen is great too.  I will definitely be back to this gem.

38.description: A tiny hole-in-the-wall but I went there for lunch and had some tasty red curry.  Most people were doing takeout.

51.description: Hidden gem as said before by others. Just make sure you ask for chopsticks because they don't give them otherwise. Not sure about anyone else but I can't eat Asian food without them...somehow tastes weird to me otherwise.

27.description: Nice food , clean and tidy shop and person who served us was lovely but we felt  the food was not very authentic.

32.description: Never order online with this place it will multiply your order. I saw my total and then it shot me a confirmation email that I did not check with multiple quantities of each. I replied with the email telling them this and they called me thinking to fix it and they were denying it had anything to do with their website. They did nothing to help me except argue with me.

54.description: I love this place!  The service is amazing and the food is so delicious!  My favorite Thai restaurant. You'll leave feeling very pleased and healthy :)

48.description: I got the crispy thai rolls and the singapore noodles....yummy! It came 15 mins earlier to my office. :)

44.description: This is my favorite Thai place for delivery in the city.  I order here at least once every 2 weeks.  Prices are reasonable, they are consistently within an hour for delivery, and the food is tasty with good portions. I'm not adventurous about trying new things on their menu, as I have my tried and true dishes.  I literally crave the Drunken Fried Rice, and their Pad Thai is pretty delicious too.  And when I request spicy, they take me seriously. Yay!

24.description: Decent green curry with medium spiceThai iced coffee about rightBut nothing memorable

7.description: Nice takeout spot. 'Healthy Thai Food' they say. I don't know how healthy it is but it sure is good! Portions are sizable, enough for dinner and leftovers for lunch. Everything tastes fresh and was ready within 10 minutes of ordering online. Will be returning in the future.

49.description: Great panang curry. Quick. Large portion and very fresh. I also liked their crispy spring rolls. I will definitely go back. And also no other Thai restaurant nearby has very good food or service!

40.description: If you love SPICY food, this is the place for you. They don't mess around with the hotness of their foods. They even have their own caliper with a wall of fame to back it up! My friend & I have been trying to get on their wall but we couldn't even stand their regular spicy menu and in order to get on their wall, you have order & consume (by yourself) a dish ordered at least FIVE EXTRA HOT. We only ordered the regular spicy and we were already suffering. And surprisingly, even ordered spicy, their dishes were still pretty good and had flavor (besides hot). The papaya salad though was kind of a let-down, too much carrots and not enough papaya. Anyhow, kudos to those who got on the wall of fame, seriously..your stomach must have given you trouble for a whole week after that.

53.description: I agree with other reviews that this is absolutely a hidden gem! We always order the sweet & sour shrimp with brown rice. The shrimp is not fried and is just in the sauce, the flavor has some undertone I cannot identify but I love it! I've always been happy with other side orders but I cannot say enough about  the sweet & sour shrimp!

30.description: Really tasty and inexpensive. Portions are enough for two to split. I'm a fan!

46.description: This is my go-to spot for Thai food in Old Town/Gold Coast. Pickup is super quick as food is done within 5/10 min of ordering. Same applies of ordering to go in the restaurant. Top picks are the panang curry and pad see ew. Drunken noodle is alright too.

1.description: Saw the strong reviews and decided to give it a shot for some Thai delivery. My girlfriend and I both had the pad Thai with chicken, and we were both surprised at the low quality of the meat. The chicken just flat out did not taste good. We picked through the dishes to try to get some noodles, but even removing the chicken the dishes overall did not have any good flavor.We have ordered Thai from several places, but this is the first we both unanimously disliked - as well as the first time we both stopped eating and threw away the food.Looks like tums for dessert. Stay away, we certainly will never order again.

55.description: The food comes quickly and it's absolutely delicious. I'm going back next time I'm in Chicago.

9.description: Great food, don't see what any negative reviews would have to say. We are Thai food snobs, I only like places that use fresh (not frozen) ingredients with liberal use of Thai basil, and this place hit every mark. Each place is a little different of course, there is no one way to make any Thai dish... But everything we had was good.

26.description: I ordered the Tom Yum soup, Pad Thai, and Thai Iced Tea late one night to go and my order was done in only 10 mins. The food was very tasty, pretty authentic, and reasonably priced. The Thai Iced Tea was very refreshing and a good mix between sweet and tea-tasting. Perfect meal for a late evening.

25.description: Best little find after a long art show. The food was excellent, the service was fantastic, I highly recommend this little gem. I ordered the fresh spring rolls and they had an amazing little kick. I also has the Hot Basil with vegetables. I haven't been this excited to review a place in a long time!

12.description: This place seems desperate for business. The website was poorly laid out and misleading seemingly allowing a coupon to go through when I ordered more food than I needed to get a free app but was greeted by a reprimanding staff that not only denied my coupon and also didn't care about my poor experience online and were rude to me during my visit. The staff does not know the definition of customer service. Good food, but it does not overcome the poorly managed take out experience. Leaves something to be desired.

59.description: We love Thai food and this is the best! We are in Chicago for a few days and were looking for dinner close to our hotel. We hit the jackpot with this little place.  Walking up to it, it didn't look like much, small but clean, not many guests.  They had a very active "to go" business and I see why,  I had Chicken in Curry sauce with Coconut milk.  Awesome.  My husband had Drunken Noodles with Pork.  it was great.  I wish i could take it back home to KC with me,

21.description: The closest Eastern food takeout around me. Both the Pad Thai and the Drunken Noodles were excellent! There was very little wait for my food to be ready. My only complaint was the pricing, which I felt was just a little high for two dishes on a takeout order.

17.description: The food was just average. Not spiced or flavored for my taste. Dining area very small and clean. Waiter was courteous. Just did not compare well with other Thai food establishments we've enjoyed in the past.

10.description: Quick lunch and a good find.Fresh and true

5.description: The chicken panang curry is out of this world. Flavors are on point.. One of the best panangs in town. I've tried to find another dish as good but haven't yet.. Everything else is fairly mediocre. Also they charge extra for brown rice which is annoying.. Recommend it for takeout rather than dine in.. The ambiance isn't the best. Moral of the story: get the chicken panang and order it to go... Solid 4 stars for that.

3.description: Pretty good Thai food out of the way of main pedestrian traffic. We were kind of just in the area. It's solid food, but nothing amazing. The inside is small and intimate. If I'm in the area and hungry, I'll go back.

35.description: Best thai food in the city! Not a good dinner or date night scene but if you're solely focused on quality rice (great brown sauce) and noodle dishes (amazing pad see ew), this is the place! Prices are very reasonable as well.

19.description: Garlic & Chili Thai Cuisine is a good, convenient neighborhood spot in Old Town. The food is consistently good, the takeout is incredibly fast, the service is always friendly, and you can't beat the prices.The Pad Thai and Thai Fried Rice dishes are both good, but they are just a little on the bland side. I always order extra chili sauce on the side to give them a little more flavor. The Crab & Cheese Rangoon is very light on both the crab and the cheese, but it's also only $4.95 so I'm not complaining.There are a few cafeteria tables in the small space inside, but it's best for takeout. There are better places for Thai in the city if you're willing to go a couple miles further in any direction, but Garlic & Chili Thai is a satisfying option for a quick, inexpensive meal in Old Town.

28.description: Delicious noodles, rice, veggies, shrimp...all of it! Really good and not as greasy as most. My fav thai place

45.description: Garlic & Chili Thai Cuisine is a good, convenient neighborhood spot in Old Town. The food is consistently good, the takeout is incredibly fast, the service is always friendly, and you can't beat the prices.The Pad Thai and Thai Fried Rice dishes are both good, but they are just a little on the bland side. I always order extra chili sauce on the side to give them a little more flavor. The Crab & Cheese Rangoon is very light on both the crab and the cheese, but it's also only $4.95 so I'm not complaining.There are a few cafeteria tables in the small space inside, but it's best for takeout. There are better places for Thai in the city if you're willing to go a couple miles further in any direction, but Garlic & Chili Thai is a satisfying option for a quick, inexpensive meal in Old Town.

33.description: The place is small , but the food is great .  The soups are delicious , I'll definitely recommended for anybody that loves Thai food

43.description: We picked this place because it was near my nephew in Old Town and had good reviews. We were a party of 9 and when we saw the place, we were a bit skeptical about them seating us because it's so small. The waitress/host/takeout order taker was very accommodating and set us right up.There was hardly anyone there when we arrived around 7:00 on a Wednesday evening, but that quickly changed! The three or four other tables that we didn't take up for our party filled up and the takeout business was brisk. How our waitress did it all (seating, taking orders, taking phone orders, delivering food, etc.) and did it well and with a friendly smile was quite remarkable. All of our food arrived accurately and was hot.We had thai iced tea and coffee for drinks, which was pretty typical for a Thai restaurant. And we tried their strawberry smoothie, which was a little on the watery side but tasty. It looks like a BYOB place, as another table had brought in some wine. The restaurant provides wine glasses.The food was delicious! We had spring rolls, fried Thai rolls, and crab rangoon for appetizers, which were all hot and very tasty. My young niece and nephew had appetizers for their meals (shrimp rolls and chicken satay). As another reader noted, the sweet and spicy sauce for the shrimp rolls was great! For entrees we had a variety of dishes, from red and panang curries with chicken and shrimp to drunken noodles with shrimp, pad see yoo with chicken, garlic basil with tofu, and one of the daily noodle specials (with a yellow curry sauce). Everyone really liked their dishes. Even my boyfriend who had never eaten Thai enjoyed the entire meal (outside of the curries, which is a taste he does not like). I had the panang curry, and it stood up with some of the best I've had. The sauce was delicate but spicy and nutty. My only comment on the food is that the spicy dishes could definitely be made more spicy. Overall, this is a great place for takeout or a casual Thai meal at reasonable prices. We really enjoyed our experience here. And my nephew now has it on his list of good places to get takeout from!

2.description: Glad to have found a Thai restaurant in the area.  It is a small restaurant, but there's usually a spot to sit.  Most people tend to order for carry out.Thai ice tea $2.50 - tastes delicious & perfect on a hot day, but they do load it with ice.. :(Pad see-ew $8.50 - a-ok, wouldn't call it amazing..Crab cheese wonton - uniquely different and tasty.Customer Service - friendlyI would come here again for Thai tea and a-ok priced Thai food..not too pricey..

18.description: Cute little place on the corner. 14 seats- nothing fancy BUT the food is very good! You cannot go wrong here. I had a green curry dish and it was delicious. My friend had a pad see pork dish and it was delicious. Before dinner we had the sampler appetizer platter and ate everything. The price is just right considering this being in Chicago. A great neighborhood Thai eatery and near many local hotels.  Highly recommended.

41.description: This place is a hidden gem located 2 blocks from me. I always get take out and order the Shrimp Dumplings and Chicken Pad Thai which are both delicious!

52.description: I am so lucky that this place is so close to me. Such a hidden gem! I always order the crab rangoon with this sweet & spicy sauce that they make in-house. I'm obsessed with this sauce. I could probably drink it, honestly. Chicken satay with peanut sauce is pretty good. Pad Thai is good too. Shrimp sticks are yummy (served with that amazing sauce). The actual restaurant is very small, so I usually just get delivery. They also have a coupon if you order delivery of $15!

50.description: You could take a photo of this place and put it next to "hole in the wall" in the dictionary.  Tucked away in the half-basement of what looks like a residential hotel, and catering mostly to take-out, it does have a few tables if you want to eat in.Ordering lunch was a little hazardous; the very inexperienced-looking waitress had to rush off and make a phone call to some higher authority than the chef before confirming that they were out of what the menu said was the lunch special.  So I tried again with a basic shrimp stir-fry, tasty (not very spicy) and filling.Sure I'd come back here if I lived in the neighborhood.

4.description: Ordered delivery for the first time. The Panang curry with shrimp was delicious over white rice. After reading other Yelp reviews, I ordered the curry "spicy" and found that it was the perfect amount for my taste. Not too spicy, but just a little kick. I also had the basil chicken, which I didn't not enjoy as much. Personally, I prefer ground chicken in Thai basil chicken. Overall, I was happy with the curry and I will definitely be ordering more food in the future. Looking forward to trying some of their other dishes.

6.description: My fiance ended up ordering here Friday night, I guess not having checked my previous Yelp review. Which turned out to be a good thing! We had some friends over and the most painful part was the 2+ hours it took delivery. But in good news, their panang curry was quite decent. Their tofu drunken noodles was good too but the other two curries we ordered - massaman and green - were watery. The appetizers were okay - we tried the wontons, curry puffs and egg rolls. The egg rolls were way too oily and we ended up throwing most of them out. Be prepared for a really long wait once you order! After 1 hour, we called the restaurant and they kept saying the food was out for delivery but it was another 1 hour before we actually received it.

22.description: The food was just average. Not spiced or flavored for my taste. Dining area very small and clean. Waiter was courteous. Just did not compare well with other Thai food establishments we've enjoyed in the past.

15.description: Their Penang Curry is one of the best one I have eaten in Chicago. The portions are small, but the taste is great. I'd also had the pad see ew and pad Thai and the flavor was good. Small place but great tasting food.

57.description: This place is evening you could want on a budget living in the Gold Coast / Old town part of Chicago. Great food and amazing friendly staff. This place is a wonderful staple to the neighborhood.

20.description: Cute little place on the corner. 14 seats- nothing fancy BUT the food is very good! You cannot go wrong here. I had a green curry dish and it was delicious. My friend had a pad see pork dish and it was delicious. Before dinner we had the sampler appetizer platter and ate everything. The price is just right considering this being in Chicago. A great neighborhood Thai eatery and near many local hotels.  Highly recommended.

36.description: This place was not bad but not great, either. I frequently eat Thai food and have dined at several different Thai places around Chicago. This place was not particularly memorable. Even on a Friday evening, there were hardly any patrons. The food was bland and the portion sizes were too small given the price charged. It was meh. If you're starving and have no other options for Thai, this is your spot.

14.description: I'm a regular here I get delivery at least once every two weeks. I love their drunk fried rice and pad thai. Once I ordered a dish to be made super extremely spicy and I couldn't even finish it as my whole mouth was burning so beware. I think just asking for 'spicy' instead of 'super spicy' is a good plan for next time

3.description: My first visit to a Great Clips = a great experience. Myra cut my baby fine hair and texturized me, giving me some volume & a very nice style that I love. No wait, great price. I will be back...Thank you Myra!

1.description: I have been going here a few years now. It is clean and professional. The stylist all seem to have quite a bit of experience. All in all a good value.

2.description: Someday I will learn that paying $14 for a haircut is soooo not worth it. This weekend I went to Great Clips to get my hair and bangs "trimmed". My previous experience at this location was equally as bad as this time, so sadly I'm not surprised. When I walked in, I saw the same man who had previously cut my hair and totally botched my bangs waiting at the counter, and I cringed in fear. How can someone mess up two times in a row, right? Typically I cut my own bangs in between haircuts because they grow so stinking fast, so as he called my name, I figured I would give him a chance for redemption as they were getting pretty long. It really isn't difficult. If I can do it, a paid professional should be able to. WRONG. So as I sat down in the chair, I pulled off my winter hat (it's freezing out) and he began cutting my hair... Did not brush it out, did not fix my part, nothing... Just began chopping away. I knew I was screwed. Then a women came up to him as he was cutting my hair and asked if he would be able to fix her daughter's hair because he did not cut her bangs as she wanted. This should have been my sign to run immediately, but I did not. He agreed to fix them after he was done with mine. Once he had finished cutting my hair, which is about an inch longer on the right side, he moved towards my bangs. He asked how long I wanted them, and I told him they are usually touching the lowest point of my eyebrows. The finished product? The right side of my bangs were bluntly chopped above my right eyebrow. The left side of my bangs actually looked pretty decent, but a little long, below my eyebrow. Looking in the mirror, I told him they looked fine, as there was no way that man would be coming near my head with scissors ever again. I paid for my haircut and immediately put on my hat to leave. Then I looked over to see the girl crying about her hair as she got in his chair to get her own bangs "fixed". I went home and immediately fixed my bangs. They're still extremely short, but he is lucky they grow fast. Someone seriously needs to give this man a lesson in cutting bangs. Not only has he messed up mine, but I'm sure that poor little girl's bangs looked equally as bad when he was done with her.All-in-all, my bangs were way shorter on the right side than the left, and the rest of my hair was an inch longer on the right side than on the left, making for one awesome haircut. I've gone to some of the women working there before, and they are pretty good, but NEVER AGAIN will I trust that man with my hair. The one and only star is for those women...

9.description: One of the worst haircuts I've had in a while. I went here b/c I had a Groupon, but now I regret trying to save money. My stylist didn't listen to a word I said when I explained how I wanted it cut. Definitely not going back to this one.

10.description: i didnt have a satisfying experience at great clips on division and clybourne. my stylist (juan  - the only dude stylist there) worked w extended hands so that his lines were crooked and assymetrical. he wouldn't listen to directions much - instead of leaving hair wide in the back, made it super narrow. his tapered back is basically a line with barely any taper. When he was done I had to ask him to finish cutting hair on top - apparently he thought it was short enouph and didn't touch it at all. who cuts hair without touching top of the head. i specifically told him that my hair was cut the usual finger length a month ago, when he asked in barely audible voice if i cut it shorter than usual during last visit. Would've been one star if not for the fact that the wait is minimal and I've had some luck with this place before (different stylist).

4.description: I came here because I got a coupon for a free haircut in my welcome-to-the-neighborhood welcome packet a few months back.  If I were in need of a real styled cut, I'd go elsewhere, but I just needed to get my split ends trimmed. I walked in at 5:52pm and they close at 6.  I didn't have a problem.  I've been at places that lock the door around that time.  The place was well staffed with three stylists.  I was so thankful that I got the stylist I did, because the other ones were loudly smacking and popping their gum and that would have driven me nuts while getting my hair cut.  I find it obnoxious. I did not have a problem using my coupon.  I didn't even look to see what the cost was for the standard haircut anyway.  I may come back to get the same trim.  The gals there didn't seem to be the most personable.  They looked like they had the longest day ever and weren't happy to see customers. They talked to each other in Spanish when more people entered after me just before closing (thinking the customers couldn't understand them) and I quickly joined in the conversation to magnify how rude that was.  My stylist Teresa was nice though and joked around with me later. I didn't have high expectation of this place, therefore I was not disappointed.  The previous yelper's review was about the particular stylist and not this particular Great Clips.  It's hit or miss when it comes to the stylists at these kinds of places.  Getting a good hair cut requires good communication.

6.description: It is what it is - a cheap place to get a cut. If you're looking for high style, this place wont be for you. But if you are a guy & want to spend $15 + tip for a clipper cut, this place is fine.

11.description: I came in for a basic haircut Saturday morning. Service was surprisingly quick (in and out under 15mins), but the quality certainly leaves lots of room for improvements. Great Clips offers lots of coupons year-round, I see it as the least expensive option after cutting my own hair.

5.description: They were awesome!!!! =) friendly ladies, NO WAIT, WASH AND CUT FOR $20 BUCKS YOU CANT BEAT THAT!!!! I cant complain with the service, i just wanted a trim and told her what my CRAZY CURLY hair does and she knew exactly what I was talking about and even suggested some new products! cant ask for anything else... all good in a lunch break!!! FOR THE AREA you cant beat 20 bucks!

7.description: Are you kidding me? I went to this location instead of the s. halsted one b/c my office is right next door. I normally stick with a good thing, but figured, you can't screw a dude's hair up too much right? WRONG. My hair used to be a 2 on the side and finger length on the top. Easy, wham, bam thank you mam, 7 minute hair cut. I was in the chair for 20 minutes. I think it was her first time with the scissors. OH MY..........My face was turning red b/c I was so angry and just wanted to get the hell out of there. She totally butchered my hair.  The only good thing to come out of it....I went home and used my clippers and shaved my head. Ever since, I have been cutting my own hair, shaving it down with no guard. So, thanks Great Clips for letting me cut my own hair:)

8.description: went here because of groupon.  They gave my little boy an awful haircut.   Different lengths everywhere.  will take some time for his hair to grow back to normalcy.  I cannot believe how bad it was.   Have these folks had any training?  Guess you get what you pay for.  Yikes!!!!

0.description: I hate going to fancy salons where you get judged for not having a haircut in oooh maybe 6 or 8 months, so I go to Great Clips. Seriously, I hate the judgement. And the confusion about who to tip, and feeling uncomfortable saying you don't like the cut/color/style because that person's the professional so maybe they know what looks good?? It all gives me anxiety, and the one glass of complimentary wine isn't enough to cure it!Great Clips has online check-in available, but I've just walked in both times at this location and not had to wait longer than maybe 10 minutes. My last cut was with a sweet woman named Maria. She asked what I wanted, did it meticulously yet still efficiently, then double-checked with me that it looked fine. I asked for a bit more off the bangs, and she happily complied. Easy peasy! And only $16 without tip!I do wish she'd asked if I wanted a wash, too, but since I hadn't checked-in and there were a few waiting who had, she might have just been trying to streamline things. Next time!

3.description: If I give all McDonald's one star, will they go away? Wish I could give them all quarter-stars. Popped in here for coffee once, and even that . . . yuk.Good for kids?! No! The worst food on the planet - fat laden and unhealthy.

1.description: I moved away from Chicago several years ago but occasionally visit home for family reasons - and sometimes get the craving for McDonalds to which this is the closest location for me. I'm writing this review because for the past several years I've ventured in one of the employee's, named Terry (of 6 years), has usually been the one taking my order. I've been extremely impressed by her demeanor and her professional attitude is probably the best I've ever seen in the food industry. She moves quickly and efficiently, and I always feel reassured that she's going to get my order right. This is refreshing because, well, it's McDonalds and you don't always have that kind of commitment from a global fast food chain. And she's been doing this for years (3-4 that I've noticed)! that is why I'm writing this review.

2.description: The worst McDonalds I have ever been too. I'm 31, I have visited McDonalds for the past 25 years. For being the "Largest Word Wide American Corporation," it's a shame what it's coming to. I stopped into this location, store # 14173, order #135 on my way home from work to grab a late night burger.(10:12 pm) I was approached by two homeless men while I was fillings own soda waiting for my order. When I felt threatened and told them I "do not have any change." I turned to look into the dining room and see this photo I took... Seemingly a refuge for harassment, robbery, rape, and other such negative situations seemingly accepted by McDonalds. Otherwise, why else would they allow such people to harass their life long customers? SHAME ON YOU MCDONALD'S, WHAT IF MY KIDS WERE WITH ME?

5.description: Why is this in a $$$ neighborhood and the owners can't even afford Air Conditioning ? The staff said it has been hot like this for over a decade since they have been working there. They dont' care that the customers are feeling like HELL Landed  on the building. They just take your order and give you the food all while appearing to be getting ready to faint from the heat..  why bother? I wish that everyone would boycott this place and perhaps the owners will invest in cooling!

6.description: Location closes at 12pm, but was locked 5 mins early, and had only one customer inside in line. We had to go elsewhere for ice cream cones. Too sad, One Star, 'Nough said!P.S. This Mickeys is located on the corner of North & Wells. I'm personally shocked that I could not find this location in any of the review directories. I'm listing it after an exhaustive search.

0.description: I chose this one because currently its the closest Ronald's to my apt, but ones with drive-thrus are usually better.  McDonald's burgers and sandwiches aren't good at all, let's be honest.  There are many fast food chains with a better burger.  But McDonald's has something that none other can copy to their level:  BREAKFAST.Judge me all you want, but the sausage biscuit, breakfast burrito and hashbrowns are sometimes the only reason I get out of bed in the morning.  Yes, I know I have a problem, but still... it's YUMMERZ.  Get off your high healthy horse and slum it at McD's with me.  The McNuggets and perfect fries can't be beat either, don't hate.

4.description: all of the local crackheads eat here.

28.description: I'm so happy I was referred here. These dudes are more than helpful. They are knowledgeable on all of their products and make sure you leave with what you need. They get all the dang stars.

1.description: Great place! Although the city is cheating us with taxes, they give a great discount, 15% off 3 or more bottle of juice!

9.description: They have this line called chaos that I don't see at many other shops at the moment , that stuff is great. Especially the Black Flag Waffle. If you are looking for some quality juice that is made in Chicago give them a visit. Not looking for some juice sent from the gods? No worries, they have a awesome selection of mods and other accessories ( and many other lines of juice) The workers truly enjoy their job and are very helpful .From beginner to expert vape enthusiasts , this shop is a must see. They have everything you need at a great price.And that Matty guy is pretty cool too.

29.description: I stopped by the new location with my cousin this past weekend, and OMG! I love it! I've been vamping for almost a year now, and pretty much have frequented every vape spot in the Chicago area, but Vape is my new favorite! The set up is cool, the decor is nice, and now they have plenty of space to chill and get your vape on.  If you went to their other location, you are in for a real treat when you see this one. I always have a fun time when I stop in, the guys are super knowledgeable about all they're products and they have any and everything you need as a beginner or a seasoned veteran. Plus, they carry a wide variety of premium e-juice like Mr. Goodvape and some others that are the bomb! Oh, and they're prices can't be beat!Thumbs up guys on the upgrade, you now have a customer for life!

23.description: This is as good as it gets for Vape shops! They are super knowledgeable and extremely helpful. If you're just starting or advance, they treat everyone with respect. They have earned my business as a customer! The quality of juices they carry is epic and they have a great tasting bar. Plenty of room to relax and vape for a while too. Anyone looking to get into Vapes or wanting to try something new, check this place out!

5.description: These guys are the best!! I'm trying to quit smoking and they are so helpful in doing so. Friendly staff and great customer service.
