I've recommended this spot to a few people and everyone is completely satisfied with the products. Numerous flavors and the juice bottles are affordable and last long. Definitely coming back.

31.description: I'm new to the vaping world, so my buddy suggested going to vape, so once we got there it was a really cool experience... The guys were very knowledgeable about the products and the juices that they carry, and they were very personable.. And I must say that the easydoesit juice is great!!! I'll be back...

25.description: THE premiere vape shop in Chicago. Yes, I started this out with a bang. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. They have a very wide variety of everything. Very nice e-juice bar where they welcome you to sit and sift through a vast menu and try each succulent flavor for a premiere vaping experience. As a Detroiter visiting Chicago I can recommend this shop to anyone. Thanks guys

12.description: Great selection. Knowledgeable, friendly staff. This is why I'm a return customer that travels from the suburbs. Highly recommended.

21.description: Go here when you are ready to get something more than the easily breakable and disposable vaporizers you can get at a headshop. Wide variety of liquid flavored and they let you try them!

16.description: JoJo was super helpful. The space is welcoming with a contemporary feel. Lots of great flavors. Prices are good. Lots of different styles of vapes available. JoJo offered me solutions to the problems I'm having with my current vape before he tried to sell me a whole new device. That's integrity right there. I'll definitely go back for refills on my flavors. Highly recommend if you're looking for knowledgable staff.

17.description: My mom gave me one of her vape pens which she used to kick a 30+ years smoking habit. I was skeptical because I had tried vaping before, but didn't know what I was doing and would go back to cigarettes. I ran out of cigarettes yesterday and decided to go cold turkey. 24 hours in, I was feeling super crazy and everything in my body was like GO TO THE STORE AND BUY A PACK OF CIGARETTES. I went up to Vape and Matt helped me enormously and showed me what to do properly. He let me try so many wonderful tasty satisfying flavors. I left feeling so much better and with the true hope that I can quit this time!

10.description: So I was looking for my first mod. I've been reading about them online and I was ready to take the plunge. I was greeted right away by Eric who was fully knowledgeable and broke it down super simple. I didn't feel rushed or any thing. I got a basic mod with a Kay fun tank. It's super simple and easy to use. Even got a ruthless ez duz it on Ice. I absolutely love it. Thank you. Love the atmosphere inside. They have a pretty decent juice bar with a tablet full of flavors to choose.

11.description: THE premiere vape shop in Chicago. Yes, I started this out with a bang. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. They have a very wide variety of everything. Very nice e-juice bar where they welcome you to sit and sift through a vast menu and try each succulent flavor for a premiere vaping experience. As a Detroiter visiting Chicago I can recommend this shop to anyone. Thanks guys

26.description: Ok, I don't normally leave reviews for every place I visit, but I couldn't pass on this one.  When I went into Vape I was 100% new to vaping.  After reading the excellent reviews I decided to check it out and what an experience!! The staff was extremely helpful, and the guy that helped me out went to lengths explaining the differences between devices and the pros and cons of each. As you can see in the pictures they also have a juice bar where you can test any and every flavor you would like.  This was a fantastic experience and I would recommend anyone looking for a great Vape store to give this place a try!

27.description: I stopped in yesterday for a mod, while they didn't have the exact mod I was looking for, they did everything in their power to hook me up, and I left with something even better than what I came for. Their selection is bar-none the best I've seen in the Chicago-land area and the prices rival even online Chinese vendors. I was able to taste every juice I could handle, and they would not settle until I was 110% satisfied. I can't say enough good things about this shop, the staff, and the products. If you're shopping anywhere else, you're missing out.

35.description: Nice selection... Hope to see more products on my next visit. I only bought a spacer thing for between my Vivi Nova and Vision Spinner. Nice juice selection... Will ask to sample next time. Didn't bring my vape. Nice friendly peeps, nice overall feel to the shop. A/C works, *phew* :) There is street parking and a Dunkin just a couple steps away, you can get your happy hour on.  thanks!!

0.description: If you haven't switched from smoking to vaporizing you really, really should! This place is tiny, attached to a car wash. But it had the product I needed, and at half the price. I was so excited I did a dance. Quick service, good location. Friendly staff who were explaining to the customer before me how to use an E-cigarette. Now its moved to a larger location with even greater selection. Do hit this one up!

20.description: JoJo was super helpful. The space is welcoming with a contemporary feel. Lots of great flavors. Prices are good. Lots of different styles of vapes available. JoJo offered me solutions to the problems I'm having with my current vape before he tried to sell me a whole new device. That's integrity right there. I'll definitely go back for refills on my flavors. Highly recommend if you're looking for knowledgable staff.

19.description: My boyfriend Ho-Train and are town from Seattle and stopped by this random Vape Shop! Great selection of juices and mods! They are super knowledgeable about mechanical and variable voltage mods and answered all of our questions! Hands down a great place to stop by and have a Vape session! We will be back!

33.description: Vape is an amazing vapor shop with high end mods, tanks, atomizers and a great selection of premium juice. The prices are more than reasonable and the service is five star. Every Chicagoland vaper should stop in.

2.description: Great place. Grabed the ipv3 from vapegut. .....And didn't see bearded clam..place is one of the best in city. Owners are cool and carry the best authentic mods

34.description: My boyfriend Ho-Train and are town from Seattle and stopped by this random Vape Shop! Great selection of juices and mods! They are super knowledgeable about mechanical and variable voltage mods and answered all of our questions! Hands down a great place to stop by and have a Vape session! We will be back!

32.description: So glad I discovered Vape today which is walking distance from my home. They just opened up two months ago so this was the first time I found out they were there. Bought a bottle of a berry / mint / watermelon concoction just to try something out since I was there anyway and I like it a lot. Going to head back in when I have more time and get a battery and sample some juices. Been ordering online so-far but you know, the cost of postage and the waiting . . . so glad something opened up nearby.

18.description: Vape is the ONLY vape shop anyone should patronize and I'll tell you why. These guys give a shit and it shows. Everything about the place is solid. Staff, helpfulness, selection, shop appearance. These guys are true vape enthusiasts and they have a genuine love for spreading knowledge of all things vape related. I went in to this shop over the summer as a beginner with my lady. Neither of us knew dick about vaping. Paul, one of the employees started us off on our vaping journey with care, compassion and mature guidance. He explained everything we wanted to know and didn't talk down to us or make us feel dumb for not being seasoned vapers. I have been to other vape shops in the area and no one compares to the level of service that is provided at Vape. The juice bar is my favorite part of the shop. All their flavors are on Ipads and it makes selecting and discovering new flavors fun. The staff are experts on their products. Often I ask for a recommendation and am rarely disappointed with their suggestions. It's shops like this that keep me from shopping on the internet. I know I could save a few bucks but I like giving my business to Vape. They have actually talked us out of spending money when myself or my fiance got overzealous in our spending. Only hiccup was one time a short Filipino dude shorted us like 200 points on our frequent shopper rewards card but we got it sorted out the next time we came in. Don't even bother with other vape shops. Vape is the only place you need to go. You will not be disappointed!

13.description: I stopped by the new location with my cousin this past weekend, and OMG! I love it! I've been vamping for almost a year now, and pretty much have frequented every vape spot in the Chicago area, but Vape is my new favorite! The set up is cool, the decor is nice, and now they have plenty of space to chill and get your vape on.  If you went to their other location, you are in for a real treat when you see this one. I always have a fun time when I stop in, the guys are super knowledgeable about all they're products and they have any and everything you need as a beginner or a seasoned veteran. Plus, they carry a wide variety of premium e-juice like Mr. Goodvape and some others that are the bomb! Oh, and they're prices can't be beat!Thumbs up guys on the upgrade, you now have a customer for life!

4.description: My friend went here and bought 2 mods from them and got a $250 mod that shocks her finger whenever she presses the firing button, she went back to exchange for the $150 Petri mod, which was better. But the next day, Mattie charged her $10 for a new build?!?! (Who charges for builds???). Plus, when she wanted to use her fivestar points, same guy Mattie had excuses why she couldn't use her points for juices. But other than that, other employees are nice! But those experiences really turned us off from going back.

24.description: Best vape shop in the city hands down!!! Has a wide variety of vaporizers AND juices. Not to mention the staff is great, very knowledgable and patient! Me being new at vaping, Eric helped me tremendously to guide me in the right direction with my purchase. Definitely recommend this shop to everyone!

6.description: I couldn't have had a better, easier experience at Vape.I'm a pack-a-day smoker, and I'd planned on moving to vaping for some time, if only so I could start running again. I went into Vape after reading the Yelp reviews, and I'm glad I did. They gave me a great walkthrough on the basics of vaping, and didn't try to hard sell me on any piece of equipment. They gave me exactly what I wanted -- something simple, something good for newbies.I spent probably too much time trying out different juice flavors. After asking how much I smoked, we found a nicotine amount that would work for me, and went through several flavors. Never once did I feel rushed, and never once did I feel like they were pulling me towards specific products.All in all, it was a perfect experience for a beginner, and I can't wait to go back once my juice is finished. I'd recommend this place to anybody.

22.description: I love this place....High quality juices, tanks, mods, etc. Great customer service and very knowledgeable and patient staff.  Special shout out to Joe who hooked me up with a great kit and great juices.  Very comfortable atmosphere.  If your in the area. ..make sure you stop by for a visit. .. You will not be disappointed! !!

15.description: I'm very new to the vape scene and have juggled between having some friends build ones for me or to just by a quality one from a quality store. After a quick bite in the city I hit Google for the nearest vape stores by me. There aren't many by where I live, so I figured here's my chance. It's a bit hard to spot driving down western, and I missed it once. Walked in waited for the people before me to finish their order and was quickly shown everything there is to know. Before you know it I was buying a vape and couldn't be more pleased. Hopefully this helps me quit smoking cigarettes. But on to the shop, product was good, service was very patient and helpful and answered all of my silly questions. I'm telling you I have completely no knowledge of vapes and these guys guided me from A to Z. If your new to the scene this is the place. And if you're a seasoned pro they have a good amount of mods, nice setting, chilled atmosphere, and a ton of juices to TRY before you buy!

7.description: Is there a 6 star option Because these guys go the extra mile to make sure you had a good experience in their vape shop. Even though there are a lot of vape shops in the Chicago area I think Vape beats them all. I drive 25 miles to get product from these guys and will continue to. keep up the good work!

8.description: Walked in to buy a 150 watt mod and a couple batteries. Had gotten a quote for a whopping 10% off for black friday. One guy wouldn't even get off the couch, and the other guy tried to sell me a $10 Ego kit for $60 or something. What I mean to say, is that he talked down to me. Then I was told that the quote I got on the phone "was not real". I walked out. Save your time, money, and breath, do not shop at Vape.

30.description: Just got into vaping and was pleased to find Vape around the corner from my house about a week ago and I think I have already been in 3 times. I have been to tons of tobacco stores that sell limited amounts of e-cigs and vaporizers but none of them seemed to know anything about what they were selling. Vape is the complete opposite. Joe and Daryl answered every questions I had and their prices are really reasonable even when compared to the online stores. If you're in the area, stop purchasing online...support a local business and stop in to Vape.

3.description: Excellent place. I was just there (by recommendation from St Lucia's Smoke Shop) with intent to take the step from entry level ecigs to a proper 'intermediate' vape setup. The staff members helps me do this with ease, especially Royal (I think that was his name).Thanks. Will definitely be back soon for some more juices.

14.description: Honestly the best customer service I have had in a while. I always come in with problems and they maintain a positive attitude and set me up. They do great builds and are the experts of the Chicago vape scene. Matty knows what he is doing and he gave a great customer experience. I work in the service industry, and I am pretty stern about good service, and Matty is awesome!!!!! Thanks Vape!!!!

28.description: This is an old building with old business in selling wine and spirits run by an old family.  My brother and I bought a bottle of scotch here for my Dad a while ago.  They helped us select a rare and delectable bottle.Also, I took the gf here for a wine tasting.  It was quite memorable - we enjoyed unique pairings, got great instruction, shared our table with interesting people.

1.description: I actually had the same issue as Emily F.  (no relation) below. Called to inquire about a product. Person I spoke with cut me off before I even said what I was looking for. Told me they had a bottle that was worth a few thousand and probably not what I was looking for. Had a fairly condescending tone. Then asked if I was on their mailing list. I said no, and asked how I could get on the mailing list. They told me to go to where I usually shop and get on their's! So rude.Let me say this: A) I live a few blocks from this location, and had intended on making this a new "go-to" based on what I've heard of their selection and expertise - not any more; B) presuming in a condescending manner that potential customers aren't well enough off to afford your selection is bad business (I actually can afford what they had, if it had actually been what I wanted.....it wasn't); and C) telling someone to go to where they usually shop and get on their mailing list instead...... I don't even think I have to say anything about this. This individual seemed to "know their stuff", but perhaps they should reconsider having them answering the phones. We all have our strengths....customer service clearly isn't their's.

9.description: Fantastic customer service is a lost art.Except at House of Glunz. We moseyed in because we saw it was the only place in Chicago to pick up Pappy Van Winkle (if you're lucky!), and we left an hour later with more knowledge about bourbon and related spirits than I even knew existed. Mind. Blown. House of Glunz is the exact opposite of a volume seller like Binny's. Staffed by a single person, you have to buzz yourself in. But that single person will take you on a tour of what they have to offer, based on your preferences and price points. And just maybe you'll get a history lesson while you're at it. But they do their business based on customer service and building a base of regulars who they know by first name. For example, a guy who came in while we were there and asked for a bottle of "30 year old something," for a special occasion: the employee thought through the request, said he'd research it and be in touch (I imagine 30 year aged ___ is difficult to come by...)So don't come in expecting limitless choices. Don't come in expecting to buy a $9 plastic handle of vodka. Come in to learn, to taste, and to appreciate good booze. (the old space, dating back to 1888, is worth seeing in and of itself)

29.description: Regardless of whether or not they only have one ice wine, the selection and care of all the other wines in there is apparent.  Not to mention their beer selection of Euro beers, which I appreciate.  The sales person was very helpful in distinguishing tastes and explaining with patience what the differences in wines were.  I like the old classic feel of the architecture and you really can't beat the range of prices they have there.  I feel like all walks of life and budgets can appreciate the fine wines here for sale and if you don't drink wine regularly, this place may change your mind.

23.description: My favorite place to purchase wine in the city.  They have an excellent reputation, are extremely knowledgeable, and have no crazy high-end-wine-shop-ego.

5.description: I called with a product inquiry and the sales associate I spoke to could NOT have been more rude.  I politely asked as to when they were expecting their next shipment and she cut me off mid-sentence.  Wow, for an Old Town small business operation, I really expected better customer service, or at least to be treated in a civil manner.

31.description: I hate to throw cold water on all of the glowing reviews, but i hate this place.  I lived next door for a while and was super excited to live next door to this famous store.  There are a few wines available for less money, but the majority of the store is on the pricier side.  Not a big deal.  That is not why i hate this place. I came looking for an ice wine to send to my friend's mom for a present and asked the salespeople for help.  The woman there said they only had one ice wine down in storage.  It was $250 and she was sure I wasn't interested in that.  WTF?  How dare you judge what i can and can't afford, snobby wine be-atch.  I never went back and never will.

25.description: This place is sweet. Especially since it's been there for over 100 years and they still kept everything in tact. The wine selection is unique and interesting and the staff is very knowledgeable and helpful. Bonus that they have some nice beers as well at decent prices, and offer wine tastings on Saturdays...

12.description: Incredible! I was a little worried at first because it was not very crowded (completely empty compared to Yolk).  I stumbled in here for Brunch with some friends on a Sunday and ordered the corned beef sandwich.  That sandwich blew my mind, and the other food on the table was great as well.  Get the yogurt with one of your dishes - it's out of control good.  The service was excellent.  And best of all, that place is like walking into history.  It was opened in the late 1800's and then closed for almost 100 years after prohibition. It just reopened in 2012 but it has a bunch of original stuff (floors, tables, ornamental ceilings).  Prices were very reasonable.  I can't recommend this place enough!

37.description: This place has a great selection of wines (and some incredibely old liquors!).  It's kinda pricey, but the staff is very knowledgable, and they have free wine tastings frequently.  Make sure to go into the second room and look at all their antiques...it's pretty amazing.  All in all, if you're looking for a nice bottle of wine, go here.  You'll be happy you did.  Plus, they've been around forever (try 1888), so you gotta support the local businesses!

21.description: This is an outstanding wine shop--it's been around for 100 years and looks it, and it has a feel to it that's just completely different from warehouse places like Sam's or Binny's (though they also have their place). The staff has never been anything but polite to me the numerous times I've been in there, unfailingly helpful--their wine selection stands out, but they also have loads of interesting whisk(e)ys, among other things. They hold regular tastings, too, generally with a member of the staff there to give you the complete rundown. I suggest stopping by on a Saturday afternoon--you'll probably emerge with more knowledge (and likely more wine) than you came in with, ready to start a lifelong love affair with the rustic, earthy reds of Basque Country (or something).Anyway, if you live in the area, consider yourself lucky, and check it out.

16.description: This is exactly what one would call an old school wine store. Somewhat rustic and older on the inside adds to the charm here. House of Glunz is a chicago wine store staple and has been around forever and has been run by the glunz family over that time as wellThe selection is very eclectic and its a guarantee that you will find something interesting here. The prices aren't always the best, in fact there is some gross overcharging on some wines, but, its the nooks and crannies in the selection is where this shines. They do a great job of getting off beat wines and interesting burgs that won't damage your wallet too badlyTheir wine tastings are always very interesting and they do a great job of getting a quality cross section of wines for their tastings. I don't get here too often, but I'm always glad that I stop by when I do get the chance to drop in

17.description: OK, this is by far my favorite spot to buy champagne in the city...they've got a very solid selection and hold down bottles for seriously every price range (again, MD 50/50 crowd excluded)...not to mention they've got some of the rarest vintages and vineyards in the city...i've been in the store before and asked about a bottle i'd bought the week prior, whether there were any other types from that winery they recommend, etc...and was seriously told "sorry, they're a small vineyard and only brought the one kind up to the midwest this season...but at least you won't have to look hard to find it, we bought every bottle for 8 states."cocky.

10.description: Really helpful salespeople here.  They helped me pick out a 10 yr bulleitt and a single cask buffalo trace.  I could not be happier with the experience.  Plus, this place has a long history so a definite visit for people looking to support local businesses.  5 stars in my book!

11.description: Great local drink shop with a decent albeit small craft beer selection.Came here when staying in the area looking for rare craft beers.  Nice staff, with beer held in what might as well be a closet in the back.  Irrelevant as they had a good selection of quality 3 Floyds, Bell's, and other good offerings.Helpful staff that sold me the last KBS (oh yes) and helped me find a lot of good things. While they don't have the widest selection, they definitely have a few good offerings and are worth a stop if in the area.

26.description: The fact that they're the oldest wine shop in the Midwest should say a lot about this place...I don't end up here often, but it's a real gem of a store...  There are lots of rare goodies here...  Not everything is rare, they have a sampling of just about everything.They occasionally have wine tastings of more rare stuff, stuff you otherwise might not be able to afford.  I went to a Pinot Noir tasting here that was just fantastic...  Probably the best tasting I've ever been to.  We sampled selections from all across the world, including several French wines that were decades older than myself...  Even if you can't afford some of the bottles you're drinking this is a good way to get your hands in through the door.  I think the tasting fee was $25, but it was well worth it.The same family that operates this wine shop also operates the Glunz Family Winery in Grayslake... They produce one of the most popular Gloggs that is sold all around Chicago, so many people have probably had their wine without even realizing it...

27.description: Every time I come here, these guys recommend an awesome, inexpensive bottle that goes perfectly with my food. Great selection, really helpful staff. One of my favorite wine stores.

35.description: This is so much better than those warehouse wine stores! Because the store is smaller, they are more selective and only sell great wines. It is not more expensive either! There are many fantastic finds under $20, alot under $10 even!!! Sign up for their email list and they will send you wine tasting and sale notices.

8.description: Stopped in for wine and a cheese plate. Nice wine selection. The deviled eggs were very good. However, the cheese plate left a lot to be desired. The cheese itself was not very good and the portion was minuscule. It was served with burnt bread and a little bit of beets and almonds with honey. Normally I need to ask for more bread with a cheese plate. If the cheese has been better I would have asked for more to fill the bread. Huge fail for a wine bar.

0.description: What a great afternoon!  Fun staff, Rare whiskey, great bratwurst, fries with mayo truffle sauce - not to mention that this was a old restaurant from the 1880s the clothes during Prohibition although the attached wine store remained open. A few years ago one the descendants of the original owners rehabbed the restaurant retaining all the cool architectural details - what a fun place to spend a few hours! And the rhubarb Margarita is not to be missed!

20.description: I love the staff here!  They are very knowledgeable and helpful, and I have never been disappointed by a bottle they have helped me to find.  It's the perfect place to stop on your way to a BYOB or before a night in.  Also, be sure to check out the free tastings on Saturdays!

19.description: I really enjoy shopping for wine here.  I have always found the staff very helpful and informative and never snooty.  I have also taken some of the courses taught by Barbara Glunz (and others) and attended wine tastings and have found them very informative and helpful.  They have a great selection and are willing to help you pick out the best wine for your taste, needs and budget.  And I love the room the classes & tastings are in - the store's long history is clearly evident!

33.description: There is a good reason why everyone so far has given this place 5 stars - it's the perfect little wine shop.  Basically it's owned by a family which mainly makes their money off of selling to restaurants, but loves keeping the storefront open and so has been maintaining it for years regardless of that fact that it doesn't make them loads of money.  In this small area you'll find all sorts of glorious wines with the help of the fantastic staff who work here.  Also, they have monthly wine tastings for a reasonable price ($25-$40) which have all sorts of themes such as the upcoming "Winter Reds" theme.I greatly appreciate this family's attempt to maintain a storefront which is available for all Chicagoans.  If you want to get into a great wine discussion or just learn a bit more, talk up the people who work here.  Always a fantastic experience.Also - for beer lovers - they sell high quality beer which is also delicious! :)

2.description: I love this place. Family owned, and a great wine list. Nice decor with historical interest on the walls of this place. Worth a visit, very nice.

34.description: Do you love Wine? This is THE place to come.  They been around since 1888.. wowza!  They know their stuff 110% I would love to work here and learn everything about wine.  I'm satisfied every single time I  visit to pick up bottle or two wine for my guests.  This place makes me look like a genious when it comes to wine.  Oh  how I wish I had big wine celler in the basement one day with no spiders of course.  I hate spiders!! Don't worry about expensiveness!!!  I usually pick up a bottle around $10-$15.  It's about your taste, not about how much it costs.  I bought many expensive wines in the past and no one liked it including myself.  So I did some research, asking around, been to few wine tastings, learning much as I can.  Everytime I go to a nice restaurant, I asked them for recommendation, where they get their wine, where is the best place to get wine in Chicago.  They have recommended me to this place..  oh and waitress at Bella Lounge said they get special wine from this place as well so there you go.  I highly recommend visiting here if you ever need a nice bottle of wine. Make sure to invite me :)  I'll bring one of my favorite wine for sure!

32.description: I used to live two blocks from the place and would go often to get wine.  They have an incredible selection and a staff told me the oldest wine store in the city.You can find wine at any price, so don't think it's an $$$ place.  I would always buy riesling for ~$10 and always tasted great.  The staff is very knowledgeable and gave great suggestions.  They are not pushy and if you tell them how much you want to spend, they will stick to that.They have a wine tasting area and a cellar in the back which is really neat.  If you're around Division/Wells, check it out!

18.description: This has to be one of the most attractive and interesting-bars, decor-wise in Chicago.  The menu is interesting and the food is delicious.

13.description: Love this place for buying high quality booze and they have a good brunch, but I'd love it if they posted a menu for the tavern on the website...kinda want to go there tonight.

4.description: Totally our go-to wine shop. Yes, yes. I was not completely all warm and fuzzy about House of Glunz when I first reviewed it; however, it's grown on me. I also have a soft spot for independently owned businesses.I'm a very lazy shopper. That's why I cannot stand resale shops. Too much work. It doesn't matter what it is and wine is no exception. I like to find a knowledgeable employee and have them select items for me.What I love about House of Glunz is that the family (the Glunz family employees) who are always there KNOW things. I tell them my price range and a few other morsels to steer them toward a recommendation. For example, I might show them a picture on my phone of our dinner for that evening or I might say, "M is a California wine snob who prefers red over white." The Glunz family walks me around the tiny shop and pulls wine off of the racks.Most recently, I gave the Glunz mom less direction than usual. I said, "I have $75 to spend and I want to spend it here." We picked out six bottles for just over my price mark (I encouraged this splurge). She recommended that I keep the receipt and jot a few notes about each wine so that they can make even better suggestions next time. M and I have been diligently making our notes and look forward to our next visit to House of Glunz!

24.description: OK, this is by far my favorite spot to buy champagne in the city...they've got a very solid selection and hold down bottles for seriously every price range (again, MD 50/50 crowd excluded)...not to mention they've got some of the rarest vintages and vineyards in the city...i've been in the store before and asked about a bottle i'd bought the week prior, whether there were any other types from that winery they recommend, etc...and was seriously told "sorry, they're a small vineyard and only brought the one kind up to the midwest this season...but at least you won't have to look hard to find it, we bought every bottle for 8 states."cocky.

6.description: I've been to Glunz before for drinks and the setting was low key and what to expect from a tavern, but nothing special. I had decided to host a party there and chose Glunz because my boyfriend likes whiskey and Glunz does offer a pretty big selection of higher end bourbons. For this I give the 2 stars. I could not have been more disappointed and let down with the quality of service. I setup the party 2 months before the surprise date and had confirmed details through phone. The coordinator assured me that I would be sent an email immediately after our conversation to verify party details, but I did not hear back. I emailed and still did not hear back until less than 2 weeks before the party date. I was then notified that my party specs had been changed. I tried talking to the manager of the tavern only to be rushed off of the phone and instructed that he would talk to me by email only. I sent an email and NEVER heard back. I was forced to setup the party at another venue and thankfully Old Town has so much more to choose from than Glunz. If you want mediocre food and poor and unfriendly service this is your place. And I caution anyone from thinking of having more than a quick bite to eat and a drink here!

22.description: Although this place has a pretentious and expensive feel to it, the workers are knowledgeable and helpful.  My fave thing is that they carry all the flavors of Lambic refrigerated...yay!  This helps if I'm on my way to a BYOB, but don't have time to get the liquor cold...To get to the refrigerated section (which also carries cheese), you have to walk to a back dark room, but once there, they have a nice selection.Also, there's some story about the extra room to the side which one of the employee's told me about; unfortunately I already forgot...darn it!

15.description: great unique spot.  family owned, nice people.  okay selection.

7.description: So, I know that this spot just re-opened as a bar after being closed forever (the bar part anyway), and I visited with friends yesterday.While I thought the space was cute, I was actually a bit surprised because it was written up as more of a wine bar, but it's really more of a restaurant.  It was bright and there were families in there which led to the restaurant feel.It got quite crowded and seems to have some loyal friends.The wine selection was ok, but quite pricey.  The food selection was decent, but also pricey (aside from the pretzels...which were $3 and a good value).Overall, I had fun, but wasn't blown away.  I wouldn't make a special trip here, though I might stop in to the wine shop!

36.description: great building, great location, abd good wine. you can find all the wine that your great great great grand mother was alive to see bottled. The place is amazing and alot of my gold coast friends go here.

30.description: Unique and very special family owned wine shop.  If you love wine - you must go here.  Very memorable, I highly recommend!

3.description: I'm a Trader Joe's wineho (see what I did there? Instead of a wino, I'm a wineHO?) and shop there regularly for my run-of-the-mill necessities. But sometimes I want out -of-the-box. Sometimes I want a surprise. Sometimes, I want a little sparkle. Figuratively and literally. That's where House of Glunz comes in. For (higher end of the spectrum) TJ's prices, I can find new and thrilling wines I did not know exist from vineyards that next to no one has heard of. Talk of the dinner party, much? The staff at HG are patient, thorough, and recommend great wines based on your tastes, budget, and experience. I am not experienced. Yes, I'm an experienced drinker, however my knowledge of wine is slim-pickins'. But they don't judge you on that. Instead, they get excited and teach you about what you enjoy. Apparently, I don't like tannins, which are typically not found in South American wines. And now I sound like an educated wine connoisseur. Boo-yah! Ahem... until I say "Boo-yah" and then I sound like myself again...  HG also has wine tastings with affordable bottles featured. I cannot recommend wine tastings enough to people who don't know much about wine. The pourer is going to be describing these wines in depth to you, and based on whether or not you like it and why, they are going to be able to describe to you what you like, without you feeling like a total boob.Get buzzed into House of Glunz and then get your wineho buzz on.

14.description: Although this place has a pretentious and expensive feel to it, the workers are knowledgeable and helpful.  My fave thing is that they carry all the flavors of Lambic refrigerated...yay!  This helps if I'm on my way to a BYOB, but don't have time to get the liquor cold...To get to the refrigerated section (which also carries cheese), you have to walk to a back dark room, but once there, they have a nice selection.Also, there's some story about the extra room to the side which one of the employee's told me about; unfortunately I already forgot...darn it!

12.description: Absolute emphasis on customer service at this sparkling new VapeCity Chicago location. Always friendly and approachable, the staff here is really helpful whether you are rebuilding mechanical mods or just looking into vaping for the first time as a smoking alternative. Great juice selection - I will be back again -and again...

3.description: Return customerBeen coming to the shop a couple times. Always friendly staff (clafton & bentoy) Had them do some builds for me and my girlfriend. Had one issue with my kayfun the next day, but got it easily fixed at the skokie location (only went there because i was in the area and the staff that did the build were off today). Either way, good folks at all the locations I've been to so far. All really informative and welcoming. Definitely recommended!

1.description: The staff is incredibly helpful and knowledgeable; I called them about my vape not working properly, and the gentleman who answered my call was able to determine the possible problem and how to fix it immediately. I followed his advice and it worked perfectly! Their selection of flavors is extensive and extremely impressive, and the staff gives excellent advice based on the preferences of the customer. Great people, great store, couldn't be better! If you want to quit smoking cigarettes, by all means, this is the best of the best!

2.description: This place is absolute amazing. Great selection of juice & vapes. The customer service is just great as well. Will return here again & would definitely recommend this place to a friend.

9.description: Very knowledgeable group of guys.   We told them the flavor profiles my wife and I liked and they had us testing many different juice brands until we found a few we liked.  No pressure and they did not try to hard sell us.   We've been vaping for 3 years.  They have excellent assortment of juice lines to try and buy.

10.description: I was a pack and a half smoker and looking for a change. The customer service was outstanding!  I've been to all three stores searching for various juices that were sold out at one location and I can't say enough of the high quality employees.  My wife and I must of spent a few hours getting educated and never once did I feel like I was a burden at any of the stores. Mike and Mike (One of the owner's cousin) were working that night and he took back a vaporizer I bought at the Oakton store the day before so I could trade it in for a better model that worked for me.  Again, I can't speak highly enough of the staff and the education they give new customers.

13.description: This is a very good vape shop with tons of flavor available. The owner or worker I should've asked his name is really cool. Thinner taller guy, real nice. Gave me 3 flavors for 30$ and asked if I had the fivestar rewards, he checked and I had enough for an extra flavor for free! Nice! Will be coming back here. Much cleaner much friendlier than the one in Skokie.

16.description: Really positive and knowledgable staff. Im an newbie and I was extremely impressed with the product selection. Great Place !!!!!!!!!

6.description: Great shop, great staff, great selection! I've been a few times, usually to pick up some vapor. This time I went to get a new, upgraded device. They were super helpful and informative. I left very happy and with the prefect vaporizer. Couldn't be happier! They also have a reward program. I'll definitely keep coming back!

15.description: Was recommended this store from a friend and I wasn't disappointed. The workers know everything about the electronic cigarette. Whether you're smoking an ego twist or a Sir Lancelot (I got mine from here). They can help you with every question you need!Not enough? They have tons, yes tons, of great fluids for you to try or drip onto your ecig. Wouldn't bother wasting your time trying to find another vape store to go to. Vape City Chicago has it all!

0.description: Cliff was very helpful and knowledgeable. This place has a good selection of juice and merchandise. I'll be coming back !

5.description: chill ppl.. good prices..big selections.. what more can you ask for

11.description: This place is great. Cliff is nice. Love tha juice.

8.description: Friendly, knowledgeable people with a big selection of brands. Perfect combo. Went in there to pick up some swirly pop juice  but came out with much more lol.  Allen was helping me out and mentioned the new kangertech subtank mini and aspire Atlantis. He went over the pros and cons of both  and I was able to make an informed decision. I picked up the subtank and really like it over my igo w5. Stocked up on cereal killer, okvmi lychee, berry McQueen, and dolce guava. Definitely will be back

4.description: This is my first review on yelp I have ever done because this place deserves to be jam packed with business, and I had one of the single best customer service experiences in my life.I think I left there about an hour ago. I thought the gentleman that helped me out was named Cliff but after reading the other reviews maybe his name was Claf, not sure. He told me he was the manager of this location and understandably so. I am currently in Pharmacy School and take non-stop flack for being a 10 year smoker, not only from my classmates but also my professors and worst of all my girlfriend. So I told her I would switch to vaping in order to quit. I had tried a few other products from a few other locations but due to lack of knowledge, or poor products none have really stuck. The manager walked me through the entire process explaining in detail information that even the internet didn't provide me. After helping me pick a product, some flavors, and a plan to suit my needs (extremely well I might add). He gave me an entire run down of how to use my new purchase and how to maintain it.I don't believe I have EVER seen such amazing customer service from anyone besides me and this experience honestly might be better than anything I have done.Thank you so much VapeCity for helping me with my smoking cessation!

14.description: Got my eGo-V v2 for a great price, along with trying multiple flavors until finding one that satisfy my taste buds. If you do go, look for Kevin, he hooked me up with a great deal on my first vape kit along with lots of goodies for a much lower price than the other stores within the area.

7.description: Awesome customer service! I think this store is great and definitely worth a visit. It has a good selection of vaporizers and flavors.

58.description: Enjoyed a lazy Sunday here for lunch (and unfortunately for my liver, I was still there for dinner). Among my entree choices were the portabella sandwich with fries and then Buffalo wings, which are $.50 on Sundays. Everything was good and the place never got too busy. The service was quick and chatty. I have to agree with Angela S though; the place did occasionally smell like a toilet, but not frequently enough for me to not spend 6 hours there.

56.description: Came here for a friend's fundraising event....well I guess the bar had 'forgotten' that they were coming...YIKES.  Or they didnt know they were coming or something...miscommunication for sure.  They accomodated so I guess we cant complain too much.Other than that...it was an ok spot to grab a couple of cocktails.  There was nothing that was saying that I should come back.  It was pretty standard bar....TVs, two different bars...one downstairs, on upstairs.The staff was was...kind of unattentive...however, like I said, no one knew we were coming so maybe they were understaffed.Its a little dark and dingy in there so not the ideal place for a happy hour in the spring, but it'll do.

29.description: The chicken sandwich is my absolute favorite menu item. The beer selections are great and the pricing is very reasonable. If at all possible, attend Wednesday night trivia. It's one of the most fun pub trivia I've ever been lucky to participate in. Questions are challenging but not impossible and the competition is fun and funny. Shots for round winners! The crowd are young professionals. Lots of fun people, great service and fun atmosphere!

42.description: OK so went here two times now and second time we walked out. The servers are incompetent from the moment you walk in. They look at you and then look away, no hello can I help you nothing. A guy at the bar I believe the manager was eating food and the same, nothing. We went to a high top table and sat down. No one helped us for 5 min. We were all of 10 people in the place. We looked at each other and decided to scat. We decided that we wanted to not drive ourselves nuts by taking this treatment any longer. Go else where or plan on being treated like an imposition to the workers. :(

23.description: This is a great spot to have a drink. It has a pub like feel to it, but the food is a lot better than normal pub food. I highly recommend the chili when it is available during the fall and winter.

47.description: Declan's is very hit-or-miss.  I've had great experiences and poor ones (issues with weak drinks and slow service).  But they have pretty good specials.  I enjoy their chicken fingers and I love the fish n' chips.  The burgers are decent and the prices are within reason.My friends and I really enjoy trivia night on Wednesday.  The playlist is stellar, but not so loud that you can't hear the person next to you.  The waitress has come to recognize us, and the staff is really nice.  They are always willing to take requests to put a specific game on one of the many televisions near you.I've never been to Declan's during the more crowded times, like when the OU games are on.  It's just not my scene.  But if you're in the neighborhood and need a place to chill and have some drinks and food for a reasonable price, you should stop by.

8.description: I met up with my boyfriend and some friends at Declan's after the Wells Street Art Fair.  All of them were already inside when I got there, and there was a brocade (bro-baracade) at the entrance that I tried to make my way through when I heard the bouncers shouting about how they were too crowded and couldn't let anyone else in.  I hate waiting to get into places and especially places that shouldn't even require a wait.  My boyfriend came out to get me, and they vary graciously let me in after a few people made their way out.  We went inside through that back side door, and the place wasn't even that crowded.  I ordered a drink and was told they didn't have that particular juice mixer, just one of the 6-7 that were on the menu.  Ok, fine.  When I went to order a beer, once again, they didn't have the beers listed on their menu, just your crappy domestic beers like Coors Light, Miller LIte, and Bud Light.  Once again annoyed.So, another came up to meet us about an hour and a half later.  By that time, they were letting people in--the place became unbearably crowded--and charging a $10 cover.  Seriously, a $10 cover, give. me. a. break.If we hadn't been in the neighborhood for the art festivals, we would never, ever have gone there.  I was not a fan at all.

31.description: I've been here a few times over the past year and have always had a great time. Weds night trivia was a blast. Dave took care of us and made sure we had a great time. I'm a big fan of the French onion soup, wings, and chicken pot pie.

34.description: My husband and I came here for a quick drink.  We had a nice, friendly waitress who knew the menu well.  I had a glass of wine and my hubby had a great, delicious beer.  I woukd definitely go back to this bar.  We didn't get to stay long, but I would come back for drinks.

16.description: Your average Irish bar, but with some shockingly good food items, and a nice outdoor seating area. +1 for great food, -1 for pretty slow service.I like to hit up Declan's on a quiet weekday night, sit outside, and grab some chicken wings or fish tacos (both of these are 5 star level for an Irish bar - the fish tacos are great regardless of venue). The service can be terribly slow, but I've learned to accept that and be pleasantly surprised with the occasional quick service.On weekends, it morphs into a pretty unfortunate scene along with the rest of Wells. If you like Wells on weekends, I'd imagine you'd like Declan's. If you don't, steer clear.

13.description: The chicken sandwich is my absolute favorite menu item. The beer selections are great and the pricing is very reasonable. If at all possible, attend Wednesday night trivia. It's one of the most fun pub trivia I've ever been lucky to participate in. Questions are challenging but not impossible and the competition is fun and funny. Shots for round winners! The crowd are young professionals. Lots of fun people, great service and fun atmosphere!

11.description: NO LONGER A SOONER BARSorry Sooners, but this place is now a Notre Dame bar. I went in with my boyfriend to watch Bedlam and they were so sad to tell me that the Sooner club left. I have no idea what the new bar is but it's not here. Just a heads up. If you do happen to stop in though, it's a nice little bar. When you walk in there are several high-top tables in the entrance, a long bar, and then more tables in the back. The bar has really beautifully carved wood right over exposed brick. It really is a pretty bar. The bar top is really nice too. It's none of that dinky stuff. It's wrapped in a big wooden lip that's really pretty. If you go around Christmas time they have really nice decorations too. Pretty much made my day to see how well they decorated. The bathrooms are clean too which was great because it was busy in there on a Saturday. I really liked the staff. There were a group of exceedingly rowdy drunk guys and I feel like the bartender handled them really well. She was polite but also made it really clear they were bothering people and she would be happy to tab them out if they couldn't cool it. It was really nice that they were looking after the rest of their guests. We never had to wait on beer, our food came out super quickly, and our waitress was an absolutely sweet heart. We got the doughnuts...because when your team loses a game they should have easily breezed through you need doughnuts. They are absolutely delicious. I mean it. I was a little skeptical, but they were awesome. You should really get them if you're with a group. It's a nice little bar. Definitely worth stopping in if you're in the neighborhood. Even though the Sooner club wasn't there we stayed and I'm glad we did.

39.description: Oklahoma Sooners - flock to this place!!!  Declan's is without a doubt the OU mecca in Chicago.  On a recent trip to Chicago, I was desperate to find a place to watch the season opener that was available on Pay-Per-View only.  My on-line search led me to a location that turned out to be the headquarters of the past.  The manager was kind enough to point me in the right direction.  I'll say!  There was a blowup OU player on the sidewalk, they had grilled burgers and a beer coupon specials, the game was on every channel except one (poor TN fan in the corner), OU decorations every where you looked, super excited fans and sponsors, fight song after scoring, you name it, they did it, and all in support of the Oklahoma Sooners.  It was really great and the people were very nice - of course they were! - they were OU supporters.  The OU club was very excited for football and the staff was extremely supportive and very cool.  The burger was delicious, the house made chips too, and the beer was cold and refreshing.  I was so glad to be there.Anyway - if I am ever in Chicago and needing to catch the OU game, I will most definitely get to Declan's.  Get there early and stay late!!!

37.description: Great, great place. Way above average pub food and great service. And, try the donuts. I'm serious.

0.description: After moving down the street from Declan's in August, we've visited a few times.  Pros:  The patio is great in the summer - it's a great people watching spot on Wells; Sunday Football - being a transplant to Chicago, they are willing to play other games during Bears games on some TVs.  General bar food is pretty good - tops are the wings, quesadillas, and fried pickles.  I like my fried pickles with regular breadcrumbs and Declan's seems to be one of the only places that does that vs. beer battered.  Decent beer list with reasonable prices.Cons:  Other food has been sub-par - would not recommend the fish and chips.  The inside bar can be a little dark for Sat/Sunday afternoons

38.description: This is the sponsor bar for my flag football team. Drink prices are pretty on par for the area. The food is solid and priced very reasonably. They have a nice outdoor seating area in the warmer months. The staff are always friendly and attentive. This is an OU bar, so when the Sooners are playing, this place gets packed and rowdy.

51.description: Declan seems like a nice guy, but the food here? Not so much.  I'd rather eat cardboard.  My mother always said that if you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything at all.  So I'm going to stop here.

27.description: Nice bar!

32.description: Good place to stop in for a drink when you are trying to get our of the snow! The bartenders are fast and the drinks are strong!

54.description: You get what you get!It's a pub.  With pub food. And loud-mouthed rude regulars who think they own the joint. Drinks were a-ok! Food was great! Staff, while pleasant, needs some training in how to deal with unruly customers. Clientele left much to be desired. Some boozer at the bar - who was obviously a regular - got all sexist-y bent out of shape because the bartenders (male) allowed a server (female) to carry a large bucket of ice. No lie. Seems ridiculous right? Not to this guy. He started cussing about how f-ing ignorant the male employees were, and f-this and f-that.  This could have been laughable - but - this guy was not satisfied just bitching. He started harassing other customers - trying to get them to agree with him - and if they didn't - he berated them. Sadly, the spineless staff did nothing to try to shut the guy up.  He was also not asked to leave. Which is the real issue here. The staff allowed this guy to bully them.If I'm at a pub and some guy starts acting like an a-hole and harassing other patrons - I want to see his ass bounced out. Period!OF NOTE:The female servers sport a modified Hooter's look.  If you're into that - then this is the place for you! Declan's Irish Pub could easily be renamed Hot Shorts and Racks.

48.description: I will try to keep this as short as possible, but I was there late Saturday night... one of the regulars was calling me out wanting to fight...acting like a complete jerk as it was unprovoked.  I kept my cool, because I could tell he knew the bartender and owner and it would have been a bad idea to go there.  No biggie, guys get drunk and act like asses.   HERE'S WHERE THE REAL PROBLEM STARTED!!! I go outside to grab a cab as it was raining.  I left my female friend inside (BIG MISTAKE).  She comes out a minute later, crying and hysterical.  She said someone (not sure if he worked there or not) stopped her on the way out, locked the door, and proceed to grope her.  We were both very upset and wanted to go back in, but you could sense everyone in there was playing by different rules.  I don't mind a neighborhood bar with regulars, but this was something out of a movie.  I'm writing this review in hopes that any girl whoever reads it will not visit this bar (I use the word loosely).  PLEASE DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE.

44.description: I went to Declan's to watch a Blackhawks game this week and had a fantastic time! They had just revamped the food menu and everything from the flatbreads to the burgers were excellent. The blue haven burger was especially delicious. Service was great too even though the bar was busy. I will definitely be coming back here again!

24.description: Relatively terrible for an Irish pub. I've sent back about 16 beers in my extensive drinking life for being flat and 5 were here. Something is wrong.

7.description: Great bar. Every bad review on this has to do with people who complain about it being too busy during events! Come on people, don't complain that an Irish pub is crowded on St. Paddy's day!If you want a good Guinness this is a good bar to go to. Great service and friendly people.

49.description: Place has potential.  Needs better cleaning.  Lots of bar flies and a stale beer smell.   Had what they called the "Worlds best fish and chips".   Good quality fish, unfortunately cooked very poorly leaving the coating more doughy than crisp.   Fries were limp too.  Not sure their fryer is set hot enough.   My friend loved her Salmon and couscous  though.  It looked delicious and perfectly cooked.

40.description: We came here with a group of about ten people. I was sadly, quite disappointed with the trip.  We ordered three buckets of beer and it took almost 20 minutes for the beer to arrive. Although the place was busy, it wasn't swamped. It seemed like they were purposely ignoring us for some reason. At the end of our night we also only ordered 4 buckets, but were charged for 5 buckets despite calling this out to the waitress. She insisted we ordered five buckets despite an entire table of people insisting the opposite.The waitress of course took our entire order by memory. Because of this she forgot one person's order. Smart move when you have a large table. Use your memory for 10 people.Can't imagine how we got charged for an extra bucket of beer...The food was fine, a lot of wings and standard bar fare. Nothing special.Given the huge hassle with waiting for drinks and the botched order I'd skip returning here.

53.description: I remember board games that the waitress had to give us paper clips and other office tools to use as player pieces (there's have gone missing).Friendly service.And a tower of beer.All-in-all, one darn fine afternoon I'd say!

30.description: I had a craving so we came back for those juicy burgers.It was Sunday evening the middle of St. Paddy's weekend, however the place wasn't crowded. Just like before, about half the tables were occupied. The burgers weren't as juicy this time, but were still above par. There was a good deal on Guinness that night which the bf took part in. We got dessert to go last time, but abstained this time because we were too full. Overall a good meal out. Would still recommend to those in the area.

46.description: I was here with a bunch of friends for the big Packers-Bears game.  it was packed obviously so we couldn't really get great seats, however, the bartenders kept the beers coming at a decent clip.  The most important factor in a situation like that.  Standard pub grub was on the menu.  Middle of the road.

1.description: We came here to grab a bite on a weeknight. the food was fairly lackluster but great sports bar atmosphere.The good:- good place to watch a game and grab a beer. they have a lot of TVs- pretzel bun on burgers!- great tater tots (you can go wrong with tots!)- decent (not great) beer selectionthe meh or bad:- the wings! Not good...these are not too breaded which is fine. however, the food was a bit cold when it arrived and didn't taste fresh. the mango habanero flavor was not at all spicy given it was considered high on the heat scale per the menu. not a fan of the up charge to get sauce on the side. - we weren't crazy about the carne asada burger....there was nothing to talk about.  - generally the food service was slower

55.description: Awesome times here. Great back room for private gatherings. Juke Box isn't bad either.

9.description: Food came out wrong, ended up waiting 40 mins for nachos... Our waitress, Veronica said out next drink was on her, and then charged us. First and last time here. Also she never came to our table I had to flag our waitress down each time.

26.description: I love this place. I'm from OU Alum and moved here in the fall from Oklahoma. This is definitely the place to go to watch the game. Or, sports games in general. plenty of TVs. I have been here when it's PACKED and also when it's nearly empty. Either way, I have always had great service. No one forgets to check on you. Definitely reflects a lot on a business when their service doesn't shake even if it's busy. I always enjoy my experience here. Also, their grilled cheese is awesome. and get the pub fries.

25.description: I met up with my boyfriend and some friends at Declan's after the Wells Street Art Fair.  All of them were already inside when I got there, and there was a brocade (bro-baracade) at the entrance that I tried to make my way through when I heard the bouncers shouting about how they were too crowded and couldn't let anyone else in.  I hate waiting to get into places and especially places that shouldn't even require a wait.  My boyfriend came out to get me, and they vary graciously let me in after a few people made their way out.  We went inside through that back side door, and the place wasn't even that crowded.  I ordered a drink and was told they didn't have that particular juice mixer, just one of the 6-7 that were on the menu.  Ok, fine.  When I went to order a beer, once again, they didn't have the beers listed on their menu, just your crappy domestic beers like Coors Light, Miller LIte, and Bud Light.  Once again annoyed.So, another came up to meet us about an hour and a half later.  By that time, they were letting people in--the place became unbearably crowded--and charging a $10 cover.  Seriously, a $10 cover, give. me. a. break.If we hadn't been in the neighborhood for the art festivals, we would never, ever have gone there.  I was not a fan at all.

12.description: We loved the appetizers! Fried pickles were the best we've ever had and the nachos were a large portion...perfect for sharing. We went there to watch the Notre Dame football game. We loved being in an Irish environment to watch an exciting game. Downside...you can't watch the game from every seat at every table. They need to add miller lite to the draft list. Overall- great pub! Make sure to call ahead if you would like a seat during the game.

59.description: The bff and I have always talked about going to the city for NYE, staying at a hotel, and hitting up a pub with a  package deal for the night.  We couldn't decide on what offer to take up this year, so I suggested that we go to the city and use our hotel rewards points this year!She did a simple search for NYE and Irish Pub.  See we're allergic to beer, so all we really drink when we're in it for the long haul is cider (we think it's the hops and cider isn't made with hops).  Declans was the first and best looking option that came up on the search and, of course, they have cider since they're an Irish Pub!  The deal was $60 for 5 hours of drinks and heavy appetizers.  So we showed up to the hotel right at check in time to start drinking early and get ready for the night.  We head over to the pub at 7pm to have dinner since the site and tickets stated that the package went from 8pm - 1am.  Everyone agreed the food was great.  We had a couple of their burgers, the sliders, and the portabella sandwhich.  We sat at the bar and TJ was our bar keep.  Great guy!  Apparently the package was posted at the bar waas to begin at 9pm, but TJ started us at 8pm since we had the tickets.  We were glad that we sat at the bar for the night.  We had great service from TJ and Nicole (the other bar keep)!  They indeed added a ton of fun to the night!  Though we don't get a waitress at the bar Elizabeth kept stopping by and checking in on us.  She was a lot of fun too!The only real complaint that I have would be that the "heavy" appetizers that they promised were only out for a short while at the beginning of the evening (and was only one tray of each offered).  If you're going to have people drinking all night there really should be another round offered up later when everyone is half drunk!All in all it was the best night!  The staff was really great!  We'll be sure to stop in again some time when we're in the city next time!

21.description: Your average Irish bar, but with some shockingly good food items, and a nice outdoor seating area. +1 for great food, -1 for pretty slow service.I like to hit up Declan's on a quiet weekday night, sit outside, and grab some chicken wings or fish tacos (both of these are 5 star level for an Irish bar - the fish tacos are great regardless of venue). The service can be terribly slow, but I've learned to accept that and be pleasantly surprised with the occasional quick service.On weekends, it morphs into a pretty unfortunate scene along with the rest of Wells. If you like Wells on weekends, I'd imagine you'd like Declan's. If you don't, steer clear.

17.description: Trivia on Tuesdays is a lot of fun. Had an awesome burger with huge stake fries as we waited for free trivia to begin. The place filled up fast and many people had reserved tables, so be sure to think ahead if you want to check it out. The service was not that great, but I will try and let it go because it was busy. She just wasn't really designed to be a server I don't think. Didn't have any urgency and always brought the drinks to the wrong people...even the one drinking pop. Not a deal breaker, but not very attentive. Trivia was fun and food was good. I'll be back!

10.description: One of my favorite bars in Old Town. Pretty relaxed atmosphere during the weekdays but can get pretty douchey on the weekends. The food is typical bar fare but pretty good and the beer selection is fairly decent.Just a really nice Irish Pub to hang out at and watch a ballgame.

5.description: Awesome Chicago Irish Pub!  If you're looking for an unpretentious yet classy place to unwind with friends, watch a game (it's an official Nortre Dame bar Chicago) or enjoy a cocktail on a huge patio- this is one of my top suggestions. The namesake is one of the owners who is actually from Ireland and the pub sports decor and art directly imported by him and his Irish family. Adorned with rich mahogany woods (much of which was re-purposed from historic Chicago buildings such as the pillars behind the bar from Chicago's well known Como Inn) plenty of nice high top tables, and a stunning mahogany main bar- this is a truly visually pleasing Irish pub atmosphere.Old Town is a hot neighborhood with a healthy event, bar & nighlife scene so the place (and every-other even half-way decent place in Old Town) can get a bit too crowded for the personal taste of some... but you can't really hold thriving business or being crowded during an event or holiday against a place.There is a second bar and private party room on the second floor, a full kitchen (although a limited menu for the late-night crowd) frequent drink specials, clean bathrooms, and trivia nights.  TIP:  Try the fried pickles & the burgers are one of the best in Chicago.

3.description: Went in for a martini, told the woman at the bar what I wanted and she ordered me outside to a table and said someone would be right out. The place was not hopping by any means, just a few people sitting at the bar and a couple at tables outside. Three servers were congregated at the end of the bar chatting. I waited outside for about 5 minute and when no one showed up I left. Its a Monday night for crying out loud and you clearly were busy chatting and not paying attention to customers (which one of those things are you geting paid to do?)I wasn't about to keep waiting because if one of those servers had showed up 10 minutes later how long would I have been sitting there like a lemon waiting for my martini after I placed the order? Sorry but your lazy behavior cost you a good tip on a slow night. I wallked down the street, had a great martini and nice chat with another bartender (who didn't order me outside), paid $10 and left a $5 tip on top. Its not that hard to do a good job serving food or drinks -- you just have to be serious about your work. I know, I used to do it. Of course I'm not 100% sure what the problem was. Perhaps the whole deal was a communication issue, or maybe something went wrong the minute I stepped out the door and they were all called somewhere else to respond to a huge emergency. Like I said though, I know restaurant work and I suspect I encountered a group of lazy gossipy servers. I don't need to know the details and you won't get to make that mistake with me again. I've got cash and two good feet. Buh bye.

35.description: Trivia on Tuesdays is a lot of fun. Had an awesome burger with huge stake fries as we waited for free trivia to begin. The place filled up fast and many people had reserved tables, so be sure to think ahead if you want to check it out. The service was not that great, but I will try and let it go because it was busy. She just wasn't really designed to be a server I don't think. Didn't have any urgency and always brought the drinks to the wrong people...even the one drinking pop. Not a deal breaker, but not very attentive. Trivia was fun and food was good. I'll be back!

19.description: I just was here for the bears game with a few friends.I really had no idea I was going to end up here. But my friend who lives in Old Town said he preferred this place over the pour house because it was not as crowded.The service was good and attentive.It should be noted that they have a rather limited menu...something I did not know.I had just eaten breakfast 2 hours before so I was not interested in having a large meal...The Mozzarella Sticks are awesome but there is not much room to mess up there.I shared someone's Hummus platter. I think they make their own hummus. Kudos to them for being able to pull this off at an Irish Pub in Old Town.The guac was sub par.I found the chicken strips to be dried out. For those of you who like to have mamosa's during games or any other sunday you should make not of the $5 mamosa special during this time.For an irish pub to be devoid of a corned beef sandwich is kind of interesting...Call me crazy for thinking that.I think Dublin is way better especially for its variety and service and they are an irish bar. I'm just sayin'They have an interesting patio area that looks like a junior beach area of some sort is the best way I would describe it.

28.description: We have been going to Declan's for about three years now. I can't say more great things about this place! We really love the food especially the burgers. Dave and his staff are absolutely great. I'm sad that we are going to be leaving the city in the next year, but Declan's will definitely be on our list to come back to when we visit the city.

45.description: I had a lot of fun here on Saturday night for a friend's birthday party.  We got a wristband deal and the bar had set aside a few tables for our party on the second floor.  The first floor was packed but the second floor had more room to dance and socialize and such.  The bartender was very nice as was the DJ. The music was very danceable and everyone was having fun. I would definitely recommend this venue for a party - it was very hassle-free and they had a good space!

33.description: I usually like the atmosphere and beers at Declan's.  For the most part the staff is very friendly.  Tonight we walked in and there was a doorman there that was on an ego trip.  He harassed our entire group, I think someone forgot to tell him that we are the customer.  With that said we had to take the abuse as we were there for a birthday party. I will not be back and suggest the same for everyone else.

43.description: Went during the Wells Street Art Festival... won't be returning.The menu, probably meant for the festival weekend, was marginal. It wasn't too busy - as there were still empty tables - yet it took over 20 minutes to get our  chips and guacamole appetizer... and our glasses sat empty for 15 minutes before our waiter meandered by. The table next to us had 4 people the last of whom waited 30 minutes for her veggies and humus. Regarding the food... Chips and guac was good.The meat on the Chicken sandwich was dry and sparse. The Portabella  sandwich had one half with 80% of the mushroom on it. The amount of mushroom resembled the amount used to garnish other sandwiches.The staff was friendly. It was obvious there is a large local crowd because waitstaff and managers all seemed engaged in extended visits while the tables around us sat without food and drinks.

2.description: I came here for the first time time a few months ago. I heard they show Notre Dame football games. I thought this would be a great Irish pub to watch an Irish football game. I called ahead and reserved a table. I had no problem reserving the table over the phone. My group arrived a little early and we were seated right away. We order plenty of drinks and appetizers. Overall I was very happy with the speed of service and the food. The fried pickles were awesome!!! I loved that they showed the Notre Dame on every tv. After a great experience we thought it would be a great place during St Patricks Day weekend. We wanted to get away from the crowd so we decided to head up to Declan's in Old Town. I was surprised that it didn't seem to busy. I found my way to the bar. They had two bartenders working. They were busy but I had to wave down one of them to place an order. He didn't listen to what I wanted. I had to stop him and request draft beers. They moved all of the chairs and tables...not sure if you could order food over the weekend. We wanted to but didn't know if that was possible. I did not see any servers/bartenders besides the two behind the bad. The atmosphere did not seem upbeat and Irish like it did on my last visit. Overall- I loved it the first time and wanted to watch all Notre Dame games at Declan's but I am hesitant to return after my last visit.

18.description: We came here with a group of about ten people. I was sadly, quite disappointed with the trip.  We ordered three buckets of beer and it took almost 20 minutes for the beer to arrive. Although the place was busy, it wasn't swamped. It seemed like they were purposely ignoring us for some reason. At the end of our night we also only ordered 4 buckets, but were charged for 5 buckets despite calling this out to the waitress. She insisted we ordered five buckets despite an entire table of people insisting the opposite.The waitress of course took our entire order by memory. Because of this she forgot one person's order. Smart move when you have a large table. Use your memory for 10 people.Can't imagine how we got charged for an extra bucket of beer...The food was fine, a lot of wings and standard bar fare. Nothing special.Given the huge hassle with waiting for drinks and the botched order I'd skip returning here.

41.description: I just was here for the bears game with a few friends.I really had no idea I was going to end up here. But my friend who lives in Old Town said he preferred this place over the pour house because it was not as crowded.The service was good and attentive.It should be noted that they have a rather limited menu...something I did not know.I had just eaten breakfast 2 hours before so I was not interested in having a large meal...The Mozzarella Sticks are awesome but there is not much room to mess up there.I shared someone's Hummus platter. I think they make their own hummus. Kudos to them for being able to pull this off at an Irish Pub in Old Town.The guac was sub par.I found the chicken strips to be dried out. For those of you who like to have mamosa's during games or any other sunday you should make not of the $5 mamosa special during this time.For an irish pub to be devoid of a corned beef sandwich is kind of interesting...Call me crazy for thinking that.I think Dublin is way better especially for its variety and service and they are an irish bar. I'm just sayin'They have an interesting patio area that looks like a junior beach area of some sort is the best way I would describe it.

52.description: We've been to this place only once, but it felt very nice, especially seating outside. The waitress was super nice!

50.description: If you like chill irish pubs with good beers, good chill crowds, great wings, and very nice staff then check it out. Only reason it's 3 stars is bc its a small irish pub what ya looking for can't give Em all 5s! And it's much better than a 3. Go check out a game, have a beer, and chill.

4.description: Awful place to go.  Disrespectful and very rude staff.  My boyfriend was kicked out due to not drinking since he was on antibiotics from just recently  getting stitches.  He was "too drunk" to be in the bar.  I recommend to not go to the bar.  If you want to have a good time do not go here!!!

6.description: So not an amazing experience.   The guy running the bar tonight felt very empowered to let us know that we had closed our tab one too many times.  (We don't keep our tab open because we have jerk friends that take advantage of us.)  This had caused him an apparent over excising of his powers which limited his abilities.   It was all way too much and he decided to cut us off because that was in his power to do so...(just so you know).   What a douche...we probably will never be back which seems unfortunate considering the remainder of the employees seemed totally normal and non douchey and the food seemed awesome.

22.description: One word: wings. The regular buffalo wings here are my weakness. I've been here on many occasions and it's rare that I don't order wings AND an entree. The salads are all delicious and the Rueben and the pulled pork sliders are two of my favorite sandwiches. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. They have a great beer selection and awesome specials. So if you're looking for a bar that's not filled with D Bags like Benchmark down the street then go to Declan's! Great service, food and drinks.

15.description: Waiting to get a beer. and it's been like an hour ffff this place. plus it's 4 dollars for a beer. I'm pissed and mad
