57.description: My birthday party was awesome!!!So I wanted to have my 25th b-day party at a bar in a central location in the city, so that all my friends could easily get to it.  I called around (I did kind of do this party planning last minute) and most bars I tried were not available for the night or the package didn't sound like that good of a deal.   Then (luckily!) I called up Declan's Pub and I was able to speak to the person in charge right away (some of the other places I gave up on because I couldn't even get a hold of a manager) and he was super friendly and helpful and totally helped me organize the details.  Long story short, I was able to reserve the entire upstairs area (for a few hours, but it was still cool)  with its own bar.  We had our own bartender up there, who was really nice, and the drink package was a good deal.  Basically, we had open bar for a few hours and appetizers for our party.  The only thing I might have wanted was more vegetarian/health food options but it was delicious anyway.  It was  a fun night and I've been back on several weekends since then.  It's always a good time!

20.description: I came in for the ND game and found a seat " upstairs" it took about 5 mins to get a drink which was just a lemonade cause I had to work after the game and only got one no refills on soft drinks and got the pub fries which were ok but the so called aolli was just hot sauce and mayo I asked for cheese and never got it needless to say I will never go back

36.description: I'm a sucker for an Irish place with available parking....especially in the city. Went to watch the Blackhawks. Nobody was really interested in the game =\ that's okay. Tons of TV screens. Great crowd. There was a DJ upstairs. Good vibes. The manager was nice enough to alert us the air was gonna be turned on since it was getting too hot and if we got too cold to just let him know. He also thanked our group for coming as we left for the night.  It's the small things that people can do to make you come back to their bar. And write good reviews! Also beer was cheap considering.

14.description: Been here a few times & the food is really delicious.  And, today, when they made a mistake with our order, the waitress & manager were kind enough to comp the entire bill.  That was above & beyond good service.  We'll definitely be back.  And, happy to pay full price :-). The food is that delicious.

12.description: I had an okay experience at Creative Claythings.  Here's why....Pros:  -Very affordable-Small class size -Natalie is great wheel instructorCons:  -Primarily use recycled clay (which is sometimes difficult to work with)-Very limited glaze selection-Older tools and equipment -Given small amounts of clay per class -Studio wreaks of cigarette smoke (because owner smokes in studio)   -Instructors tend to want to fix your pieces for you vs. teaching you how to fix them yourself    I'm going to give Lillstreet a try next.

3.description: I'm a huge fan of the studio! I've been taking classes for a couple of months and am now a studio member. Here's what I like about it:1. it's affordable.2. my instructor and Mary, the owner, are really knowledgeable and helpful3. lots of the people who work in the studio make cool pottery, so we can all learn form and be inspired by each other. 4. As a member I can use the studio any time I want, whether I want to drop by for 15 minutes or 6 hours - it's always available for me.5. there is always parking available

1.description: Great classes, helpful instructors that teach the basics. I enrolled in the beginners class during the winter and it was a great way to get out the house

2.description: I've been taking classes at this studio on and off for a few years now and I can't say enough good things about this place. Taking classes here is something I always look forward to. There was never a time where it felt like an obligation to go to class. Even after the longest day at work, I would leave Creative Claythings feeling energizing and relaxed.The instructors at this studio are patient and knowledgeable and the people in the classes have always been fun. Life gets busy, so sometimes you can't make it to your scheduled class in the evenings. Creative Claythings understands that and offers a flexible "make-up" class option, where you can come into the studios on Saturday.Mary, the studio owner is fantastic. She has a dry sense of humor that always cracked me up.  That woman is talented and tough and funny as hell.If you have ever considered taking a pottery class, this is the place to go!

9.description: Creative Claythings is GREAT- I looked forward to my beginning pottery class every week.  The instructors are so attentive, funny and qualified... all materials are included and you cannot beat the price- $160 for 8 weeks of classes.  They are super flexible if you have to miss a class and come in some other time during the week.  Plus I'm pretty sure that if I could make something decent out of clay, anyone could.  Very therapeutic and a great creative outlet.

10.description: My girlfriend and I have been going here for almost 2 months and we love it. Mary, her instructors and our class mates are great. The instruction and help they give is fantastic...especially for me as I need it.Its a very comfortable atmosphere. I am very happy we signed up for this.

13.description: I love this place. I had been wanting to take ceramics classes for a long time, but there were two big things stopping me: studios were far north with difficult parking and the cost was beyond what I could spend. Creative Claythings is great because it's close to my neighborhood (near Ukrainian Village) and it's by far the least expensive classes around. The class size is small so I got excellent personal attention. The teachers are friendly and the environment is casual. I especially liked that you got to try both hand building and wheel throwing. There is even a make up class on Saturday mornings if you miss a session.I liked my experience so much I went on to rent studio space as a studio member, which is wonderful since it's difficult to continue with ceramics in your apartment :) If you are looking to try ceramics for the first time without investing a month's rent, this is the place.

16.description: The beginner's class has been fantastic at this studio. Anna our instructor is fun and very experienced. Pretty hands off but always there with patience if you have questions. It's true what some of the other reviews have said about the clay and the tools, but for the price this place can't be beat. Besides, it had helped me discover a deep abiding love of clay.

6.description: When you take classes here, you really feel like you're a part of a small and slightly dysfunctional family. In a good way. After reviewing a bunch of options, this was definitely the best bang for my buck - 8 weeks for $165 vs lillstreet's $135 for 4 weeks. The studio does smell like cigarette smoke, but you get over it quickly (trust me, I HATE cigarette smoke). There's tons of character in the place including the resident caged pigeon that the owner Mary saved some years ago after an accident of some sort (I forget the actual tale behind the bird). The classes were great and Anna is an awesome instructor. Sometimes Natalie's wheel class would occur at the same time which is a downer for me since I found her to be obnoxiously loud, but from the other reviews here I guess I'm in the minority on that. Midway through my classes, I changed jobs which had me out of town during the week, but the great thing about Creative Claythings is that Mary teaches a complimentary make up classes every Saturday. Granted it was like taking a class from your lovable yet slightly verbally abusive aunt, but I really really appreciated how I accommodating the classes were to my schedule. I can't wait until my schedule frees up again, because I would love to take the intermediate class there.

15.description: I have taken pottery classes at four other studios in Chicago, and have landed at Creative Claythings for several reasons:. You can't beat the price. The staff are all easy to get along with and very helpful.  I have learned a lot.. There is the option to rent studio space, which is also very reasonably priced.  Studio members are given a key to the studio, which I haven't found anywhere else.  Most studios have limited "open studio" time.  You also get a lot more space than at most studios...a whole shelving unit vs. part of a single shelf.. As far as glazes go, you are free to purchase your own, as long as they are for the right kiln temperature.  You are also free to bring your own tools.. Lots of wheels!  There has never been a time when I couldn't just sit down at a wheel and throw.  There are also plenty of tables for hand building.. The neighborhood is not difficult to get around in.  There is always parking out front, and little traffic (this is a smaller reason, but sometimes the little things make a big difference).I would recommend this studio and plan on staying for some time.

0.description: Winters in Chicago give me cabin fever, so I enrolled in the intro to pottery class to get me out of the house during the week nights-- I was not disappointed! The instructors were great, and honestly, the price is much more reasonable than a lot of the other studios. I ended up signing up for another two months-- highly recommend if you're looking for a creative outlet!

5.description: Joint the beginners class in May. Our instructor Tyler was very helpful and patient. Even if I would get frustrated with my pieces and he would patiently explain and help correct my work. Great job, Tyler!

11.description: Due to a rare creative urge (and an ad in the Chicago Journal), I signed up for pottery classes here w/ a friend last year.The beginner's class was 8 weeks long - 4 weeks making things by hand and 4 on the wheel.  The price was pretty reasonable (around $160, if my memory serves me correctly).  I like the 8 week setup - it's a good amount of time to get acclimated and figure out whether or not you have enough talent (and patience) to move on to the next class.I netted out at 3 stars because the first 4 weeks weren't very exciting.  Nor was there very much direction from the instructor.However, the last 4 weeks on the wheel were much better - Natalie, the instructor, was fabulous.  Despite the fact that I completely sucked at making the actual pottery on the wheel, she was helpful, funny & encouraging.The studio is set up conveniently, with a retail-type area in front (some of the pieces are for sale, others serve as "inspiration" for non-creative students like me :).  In the next room is the actual studio - split into tables and wheels.While I was a bit disappointed with the overall experience, I feel like I broadened my horizons.  And I have a few interesting bowls & flower pots to show for it.

8.description: I LOVE the classes here.  The instructors I've had, Mary (the owner) and Natalie have been great.  They've been patient with me being all thumbs and they know their stuff-- never make me feel like I'm asking a dumb question.Their small gallery next door is pretty nice too when they hold an opening.Bottom line: I'd recommend this place for classes and if you're shopping for ceramic art.

4.description: I've started the beginner class here back in April 2010 and love the studio, the teachers, the owner, the location and everything in between! I am now a studio member, which has incredible benefits - not only do you get a spot to store all your tools and creations, you get a key to the studio and 24-hr access during non-class time. For extra $20 per month, you can come over during class time as well. Both the classes and the membership are the cheapest in town and the quality of instruction is great! The location is also very convenient with plenty of free street parking, and close to the Metra and the Grand bus.I just love this place and will remain a member as long as I live in Chicago!

14.description: I am currently taking the beginner class at Creative Claythings. I love it. When I started the class was small, so most people chose to start on the wheel, as we had had previous experience, and hand building isn't necessary. But if you like to hand build, you always have that option. Mary, the owner, is great. She teaches the advanced class and also the make-up classes on Saturdays. She is very helpful. The teachers are really good too. They  have helped me a lot, and now I'm actually making real bowls that you could actually eat out of. Also, if you take the classes for the 8 weeks and want to stay on, you can keep going for $60 for 4 weeks I think. (don't quote me on the price) I really like it here and I plan on staying on for more classes. I think the studio member program is awesome too. This is really an artist community and I really like that.

7.description: I love this place! I've taken classes with Natalie, Ana, and make-up classes with Mary and every is so helpful. I've made pieces that I thought I ruined- Natalie and Ana both are pretty incredible at fixing "ruined" pieces. Honestly, don't think I've met a nicer bunch of people. The wheel throwing part of the class seems a bit short because you actually only throw for 2 weeks ( trim third, glaze fourth week), so just enough time to get frustrated and think you suck at it. I'd recommend signing up for another round of classes if possible before you give up/get frustrated with the wheel- it definitely gets easier. Another huge plus about coming here is how flexible they are. If you miss a class, they offer a makeup class on Saturdays... but if you honestly can't make that they help you find a time that you can make it up. So so appreciated that they are flexible.

3.description: I have been a dedicated client to Brit and Justin for the past 6 years. I love Salon Rouge & the owners there, but am so proud of Brit and Justin for opening Pink Beard Hair Studio! I wouldn't trust anyone else with my hair! Amazing color, best extensions, blow outs and styling. Perfect location in Old Town right off the brown line on Sedgwick and North Ave!

1.description: Pink Beard is the place to be. I'm extremely picky about my hair and never once in the eight years that Brittney has been doing my hair has she let me down. Her color work is incredible and cuts are meticulous. Both Brittney and Justin are constantly growing and evolving to keep up with the latest trends and products. The space is clean, welcoming, and cozy and they even have cold High Life Ponies in the fridge. You can't go wrong. Get to Pink Beard!

2.description: Lots of salons to choose from in the city. Make this one your new home base. Brittney is a real expert, and makes the right choice for your hair--plus she's connected to some of the most talented makeup artists in Chicago so it's the perfect spot for weddings. I haven't felt this great walking out of a salon in years. Big fan.

5.description: Full disclosure:  I have never been to Pink Beard... but I HAVE had Brittney color/cut/style my hair on NUMEROUS occasions... and she is fantastic.  Her "chair-side manner" is wonderful.  She has the best sense of humor in the world.  If I still lived in Chicago (which I don't), I would be one of those regulars you would probably know by name because I would be there so much.  Brit is wonderful.  You will never, ever second-guess your decision to sit in her chair or visit her salon.

6.description: I have known Brittney for 11 years and she has been the only one to do my hair cuts/coloring for most of that time. She gets to know her clients and gives great hair advice accordingly. She does a fantastic job and I have never been disappointed. I get a lot of compliments on my hair after she has finished with it. She's amazing!

7.description: Obsessed with the highlights I just had done by Brittany! It's not easy to find hair stylists that have mastered the perfect blonde, she has! She has awesome technique and is fabulous to spend time with! Highly recommended!

8.description: Love this place!!!! Very professional and friendly people!!! And their work is excellent!!! If you haven't been make it your business to go!!! You would not be disappointed at all.

9.description: Best best best. These guys are amazing. Color, cut they do it all! Wouldn't go anywhere else.

0.description: I absolutely love the way Justin does my color! Blonde isn't easy and he nails it every time. I've been going to him for years at Salon Rouge so there wasn't a minute of hesitation to follow him to his new shop! Check it out, you wont be disappointed!Congrats on the new digs guys!!! See you soon :)

4.description: I was looking in the Old Town neighborhood for a convenient location for a haircut.  Justin at Salon Rouge was recommended. I happily followed him to his own shop this year. He does an excellent job each and every time.  Competent, friendly, professional and reliably good each time I see him. I am pleased to recommend him to friends.

28.description: This place does an amazing job with nails and Sue, the owner, always makes you feel at home!!  The location is very clean, and believe me, they have more colors then any nails salon I have ever seen!!

1.description: I would give this nail salon zero stars if I could. Before they even opened this morning, I called to see if I could get my artificial gel nails removed. They told me no problem and to come in at 10:30. I get there about 10 minutes early and I am looked at with confusion when I tell them what I'm there for. They then ask me if I can come back later as she already has an appointment. Keep in mind, I was told to come in for 10:30. At this point, they have wasted my time and money (transportation) and didn't offer a coupon or discount for future use. Very unprofessional business. Do not go here.

39.description: This place is a neighborhood gem. They do an amazing Pink and White manicure and fabulous pedicures. Great prices and friendly service!!

9.description: This was the worst mani pedi ever. Went in for their special for $28 but my lady was very rude talking to others and just being rude she offered me a foot massage for 1 dollar and I checked three times with her 1 dollar she said yes. When I got my bill it was an extra 8 dollars I flipped. I will never recommend this place to others nor should anyone ever go there. Piss poor experience!!!!

29.description: I've been here twice.  The first time the owner was present and everyone seemed to be on their best behavior.  I got a deal mani pedi and while it wasn't the best one I've ever had, it wasn't the worst.  My Mom was visiting so I took her with me (having been only to one other salon, Magnifique on North, which was WAY worse than Elegant).  The owner was not in and the experience was TOTALLY different.  I asked if they could take the two of us immediately and they said yes.  They filled my Mom's tub with cold water and she had to ask for hot- the very rude lady didn't believe her 'I put hot in!' and thankfully a nicer person came over and put hot in for her.  After waiting almost 30 minutes!!! they finally started.  They were really busy, but it felt rushed.  They all seemed to be annoyed about the Tuesday special and kept asking if we wanted upgrades, which I just find so annoying.  My Mom's was super rushed and at the end we could tell why- her lady wanted to go home!  She stuck my Mom under the dryer and left the salon!  She had a smudged nail she tried to fix herself.  I feel embarrassed for bringing her with me.  I would suggest making sure the owner is there if you go, think her name is Sue.  Otherwise it's all rushed chaos and rudeness!

23.description: HORRIFYING EXPERIENCEThe woman who did my gel nails was impatient and did not want to wait for them to soak for removal. Instead, she tried to pry the gel off with a drill (the kind you use for acrylics). I asked her not to use the drill as I did not want my nail beds damaged. She pretended not to hear me and gripped my hand as I pulled it away and drilled down into my nail bed. I told her again that I did not want her to damage my nails. She proceeded to YELL AT ME IN VIETNAMESE and stormed around the salon while everyone looked at her like she was crazy. Eventually, another woman took over to finish my nails. The job was sloppy and hurried. Everyone in the salon is more concerned about leaving early for the day than doing a good job. AVOID THIS SALON AT ALL COSTS. IT IS OVERPRICED AND THE EMPLOYEES ARE EXTREMELY RUDE!!!

5.description: I give this  three stars for the service and experience not for the quality of the job.I made an appointment for 9AM on a Saturday which I figured would be the best time to get in. I arrived early and was seated quickly. Lots of color choices which is great! My pedicure started and I was excited because I hadn't gotten one in a long time. The technician asked if I wanted the 'spa pedicure' and I said sure why not because it supposively added more to the service. In fact it did not. What also was frustrating was my pedicure and no-chip manicure were at the same time. It was very rushed and not a relaxing experience like I feel these services should be. They rushed me out of there in under 45 minutes. I was then asked to tip only in cash, so I had to go next door to the ATM to get cash out and being charged a fee. The actual manicure lasted over two weeks which is awesome considering I seem to have problems after week one usually.I would consider returning because of the job done but I am hesitant because of the service.

31.description: I went here a few weeks ago for acrylic nails and was VERY dissapointed. Lasted less than 4 days and paint chipped off. They look like I did them myself. Sue was very rude to me and did not clip my cuticles. Mani was $10 more than advertised

25.description: I give this  three stars for the service and experience not for the quality of the job.I made an appointment for 9AM on a Saturday which I figured would be the best time to get in. I arrived early and was seated quickly. Lots of color choices which is great! My pedicure started and I was excited because I hadn't gotten one in a long time. The technician asked if I wanted the 'spa pedicure' and I said sure why not because it supposively added more to the service. In fact it did not. What also was frustrating was my pedicure and no-chip manicure were at the same time. It was very rushed and not a relaxing experience like I feel these services should be. They rushed me out of there in under 45 minutes. I was then asked to tip only in cash, so I had to go next door to the ATM to get cash out and being charged a fee. The actual manicure lasted over two weeks which is awesome considering I seem to have problems after week one usually.I would consider returning because of the job done but I am hesitant because of the service.

12.description: HORRIFYING EXPERIENCEThe woman who did my gel nails was impatient and did not want to wait for them to soak for removal. Instead, she tried to pry the gel off with a drill (the kind you use for acrylics). I asked her not to use the drill as I did not want my nail beds damaged. She pretended not to hear me and gripped my hand as I pulled it away and drilled down into my nail bed. I told her again that I did not want her to damage my nails. She proceeded to YELL AT ME IN VIETNAMESE and stormed around the salon while everyone looked at her like she was crazy. Eventually, another woman took over to finish my nails. The job was sloppy and hurried. Everyone in the salon is more concerned about leaving early for the day than doing a good job. AVOID THIS SALON AT ALL COSTS. IT IS OVERPRICED AND THE EMPLOYEES ARE EXTREMELY RUDE!!!

37.description: Sue always does a fantastic job. I followed her from the shop on Clark. Place is clean and reasonably priced. Always accommodating.

21.description: I have been to this salon several times. I have made an appointment each time but never have been seen on time.  The last time I was told by the technician that due to the rain they had many cancellations.  When she was doing my pedicure she asked if she could use an instrument to remove a callus and I consented.  Then when I went to pay my bill she charged me additional $8!  She never informed me there would be an additional charge for this and the entire mani-pedi was rushed and average.  I also heard that other clients were being charged for a "spa pedicure" and were complaining about the additional fee.  I will never go back there...they are not trustworthy.

16.description: This place was cheap (hence the two stars instead of one), but it was the worst mani/pedi I've ever had.  There was nail polish all over the skin around my nails (hands and feet), and after I asked my manicurist to clean it up, she only cleaned up the colored polish on my skin (that I had to point out to her) and left clear polish all over my hands (even after I pointed it out).  The edges are not clean and you can see through the polish to my nail in some places.  Definitely do not recommend.

17.description: This place did a great job.  They are reasonable, took me as a walk in appointment during the Old Town Art Fair, when they were very busy, and they were also extremely polite and friendly.  They did a great job, and their prices are some of the best around for the quality.  I will definitely be back!

10.description: Coming from NY it was scary leaving my hair and nail ladies. Let's be honest girls, they're like family. Then I found Sue. I have been going to her for years and it's always a home run. Always. From regular shape, to pointy and my new obsession coffin. Just got these done tonight, 8/7. It's pink and white powder with sparkles and done to perfection. I love Sue and all the ladies at Elegant nails. They always make me feel welcome and very decent price. I got this difficult design and a pedicure for $80.00. Gladly pay it every time! Don't think twice, just go and ask for Sue or Chris. Really any of them!

11.description: Very polite and efficient. It's a small space that gets busy quickly. The women greet you once you enter and helpful to give suggestions on color. This is my go-to pedi spot and well priced for the area.

26.description: I highly recommend Elegant Nails to anyone looking for a high quality, reasonably priced nail salon. I have been going to Sue since I moved to Chicago five years ago and it has been a great experience. She is extremely kind, talented, and accommodating. Her staff is very friendly, as well. The salon itself is spacious and clean. The prices are definitely affordable, including a $28 mani/pedi special Monday thru Wednesday. There are a ton of color choices for both regular polish and no-chip. Walk-ins are always accepted and they offer many other services like waxing and massages. I am so happy to have found this salon and will continue going back for many years to come.

27.description: Even better than the old location on Clark. this location has more space, allowing for more waiting space, manicure and pedicure stations.  The staff are all so friendly and were excited when they saw I had come to their new location. The prices are great! I get my eyebrows done there all the time for $10 and they do gel manicures for $30. You really cannot find similar prices anywhere in town. They always do a great job and I have never either this location or their old one (with the same employees) without being completely satisfied.

35.description: Love this place! I have bit my nails for the past 30 or so years, I came in here for a no chip...it lasted 2 whole weeks! And I didn't bite my nails! I have gone back 3 times and love Kim's no chip services!

8.description: I like this place because of the specials and customer service. Sue is amazing and can do almost anything. It's best to make appts. But they try their best to accommodate all walk-ins. Sally, maybe Sandy (forgive me if I'm wrong) and another tall gentleman are really good with pedicures and no chip manicures. Another plus is that they have so many no-chip colors to choose from! The shop is not out of date but it isn't the most modern compared to other Gold Coast locations. When it comes to getting the job done for a reasonable price in the near north / downtown area this is a great spot to consider!

0.description: This is the best nail salon I HAVE EVER BEEN TO.  I have used Sue and Chris for years and the no chip is out of this world!!!! It lasts for 2-3 weeks, it's a clean nail salon, tge people are all friendly and nice and I will go nowhere else.  I followed them from Clark street.  Very competitively priced with outstanding products!  The pedicures and acrylic nails are great as well.  I have been to several nail salons in my life and I will go nowhere else!   You can't ask for a better salon.  Don't waste your time or money elsewhere! Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.

38.description: Really good prices. $28 gets you a mani and pedi. If you do acrylic, I would recommend Sue. I always get no chip done, and they have a lot of colors to choose from.

20.description: Went in for a full acrylic set and when my nail tech told me I could get gel for $2 more, I was wary but agreed because I was curious. All she did was use acrylic powder, didn't even put a no-chip topcoat on to pretend like it was "gel." When I politely asked her why she was giving me acrylic even though I agreed to gel, she told me with a smile that it was gel powder...Gel powder doesn't exist. The "gel" nails that they offer are NOT gel nails. True gel nails are built up and sculpted from an actual gel that is cured between coats, either built up on itself or over an artificial nail tip. It can come in pots and tubes, but it is NEVER a liquid and powder (like acrylic).This salon is just providing traditional acrylic manicures and charging more for it. Although $2 isn't an extravagant amount to overcharge, it's still wrong and false advertisement. I'd rather that $2 go towards a tip for an honest and well done manicure.The set that they gave me was average. The shaping is crooked on some nails and the polish around the cuticle wasn't cleaned well and looks sloppy. I didn't feel like going back and forth with the tech about it since I already knew I wouldn't be returning.

19.description: HORRIBLE experience. They were so rushed, and painted on the skin of all three of the girls I was with. They were rude, and seemed completely uninterested in giving us good manicures or pedicures; their goal seemed to be to rush is out. The only reason they get two stars is because they were cheapish.

33.description: Sue is fantastic. She cares a lot about her work and how her customers feel. She wants you to walk out of there with exactly what you want and makes that happen. I recommend her to everyone!!!

2.description: I was a weekly customer at the old location on Clark, and was a little sad when they moved to wells street since it's a few blocks farther. But, the continued awesome service and impeccable manicures (that last forever!) keep me coming back every week. This is Chicagos best kept beauty secret. $10 manicures every day and $28 mani/pedi Monday through Wednesday's. The only reason I don't tell more people about it is because I'm too worried the secret will be discovered and it will be even more packed!You won't regret a manicure by Sue, Holly, or Kris!

34.description: Went here on my lunch break and was out within 30 min. Regular manis are $10 and they are great quality and eyebrows are $10 I had aminah (not sure of spelling) she is awesome. Super friendly, Did wonderful job on my nails and my eyebrows are awesome. Bring cash for tips, credit cards are accepted for payment. There is a lot of metered street parking outside. I will definitely be using this as lunch break getaway.

32.description: Looks like your average nail place. Got mani & spa pedi for $38. Asked for simple mani to shape, file and do clear polish. Horrible shape and file job. Would have been better off doing myself (and I'm not good at nails). Go somewhere else. Not worth the $.

18.description: I highly recommend Elegant Nails to anyone looking for a high quality, reasonably priced nail salon. I have been going to Sue since I moved to Chicago five years ago and it has been a great experience. She is extremely kind, talented, and accommodating. Her staff is very friendly, as well. The salon itself is spacious and clean. The prices are definitely affordable, including a $28 mani/pedi special Monday thru Wednesday. There are a ton of color choices for both regular polish and no-chip. Walk-ins are always accepted and they offer many other services like waxing and massages. I am so happy to have found this salon and will continue going back for many years to come.

13.description: One of the worst nail experiences I have had!I live across the street and decided to try Elegant Nails since my favorite technician had left my usual place. Big disappointment!It may have just been who I had, but it was the laziest, worst mani pedi I have gotten in a very long time. The pedicure was probably 20 minutes long because she hardly did anything but file haphazardly and do a sloppy paint job. The manicure was even worse. She didn't use cuticle softener before pushing back my cuticles and I had to ask her to fix them twice. Even then they came out completely torn up. I used a very sheer polish and the polish job still had flaws. When there was a hair from the brush stuck to the polish on one of my nails, rather than take it out and re-do the nail, she just kept painting over more coats.This place is cheap, but you get even less than you pay for. Save your money and go somewhere else.

4.description: I have been a client of Sue's since 2006 and followed her through 2 locations.  I get compliments on her work all the time,  since people see my hands all day at work.  Her gel nails are the only ones that will stay on,  and she's the only professional who's ever been able to tame my ingrown toenails. They do take walk-ins but do yourself a favor and make an appointment!  They're busy because they're good!

24.description: This place did a great job.  They are reasonable, took me as a walk in appointment during the Old Town Art Fair, when they were very busy, and they were also extremely polite and friendly.  They did a great job, and their prices are some of the best around for the quality.  I will definitely be back!

6.description: Even better than the old location on Clark. this location has more space, allowing for more waiting space, manicure and pedicure stations.  The staff are all so friendly and were excited when they saw I had come to their new location. The prices are great! I get my eyebrows done there all the time for $10 and they do gel manicures for $30. You really cannot find similar prices anywhere in town. They always do a great job and I have never either this location or their old one (with the same employees) without being completely satisfied.

22.description: Very polite and efficient. It's a small space that gets busy quickly. The women greet you once you enter and helpful to give suggestions on color. This is my go-to pedi spot and well priced for the area.

15.description: Always love getting my no-chip mani and pedi here.  Sue and staff are great!   I never need an appointment, they are always so kind, and even have fixed a few nail breaks to make my nails look perfect!   I may be partial because I live a block away, but I will spend my lunch hour getting here and back to just squeeze in a manicure.   LOVE the no-chip,  It's worth the money and I can go weeks in between manicures.

40.description: What a wonderful place.   I have been to many nail salons in the neighborhood over the years and now have two favorites, and this is one of them.  Very nice shop, clean, and decorated very nicely.   The staff is very kind and professional.  I really like how the customers are treated.  The service was one of the top manicures I have had, and excellent prices.  The new owners provide an excellent experience, and I will be back for sure.

7.description: I used to be a Gold Coast nail salon jumper, but when it came time to book appointments for myself, my 4 bridesmaids and my mom, Elegant Nails on Wells was the only salon in the area that seemed welcoming to us and didn't fret one bit about booking the appointments for a Friday afternoon like..2 weeks in advance.And everything worked out perfectly! The salon wasn't too crowded so we could all talk during our services, and Sue made my nails look wedding ready :) I go back often now for no chip manicures (they typically last 2 full weeks! And I wash my hands a Lot and am far from dainty haha) and also pedicures as they're a great deal at $20! $10 manicures too if you just want some primping without the commitment of no chip, but I totally recommend the no chip ;)I usually call and ask how the wait is maybe 30-60 minutes before I want to come in (unless I'm bringing 5 people with me!) and she always tells me that's fine. I've had to wait a couple minutes here and there, but usually it's spot on accurate and I get seated right away.What more could a girl want?! Thanks, Elegant Nails! See you in a few weeks :)

36.description: Mani/Pedi for $28 Monday-Wednesday! I was sold right there!There were TONS of colors to choose from, and they even had a special selection of summer colors. The nail tech did a great job, and the nail polish  stayed on for a week chip free. Pretty good for regular polish. The shop itself looks kind of dated, but it still seemed clean. I highly recommend this place if you want a cheap, yet quality mani or pedi.

30.description: Great service for the price! Got the spa pedicure (would definitely recommend- the extra $8 is worth it!) and manicure for 36

3.description: I used to be a big fan but today pretty much made me realize I'll never be going back. I was in and out the door in 20 minutes, that was with an eyebrow wax, a trip to the bathroom, no chip manicure and payment. For some people maybe that's a plus but there were zero frills and my nails look like I did them myself.

14.description: Mani/Pedi for $28 Monday-Wednesday! I was sold right there!There were TONS of colors to choose from, and they even had a special selection of summer colors. The nail tech did a great job, and the nail polish  stayed on for a week chip free. Pretty good for regular polish. The shop itself looks kind of dated, but it still seemed clean. I highly recommend this place if you want a cheap, yet quality mani or pedi.

58.description: I have gone to this place for 10 years and read the reviews online about the hostess and owner and couldn't believe it until I experienced it myself.  My friend and I went to have dinner - we were on the patio which is self seating.  A table got up that was by the heater and we moved - the hostess comes over and says we have to move that we can't sit there she has someone who is a party of 5.   We had already been sitting there - I looked up at her - and she put her face and hand in my face and said "don't even" I said excuse me? and she screamed "you heard me - I said Don't even!" I said I'm a customer who the hell are you talking to like that?  She started screaming and throwing her hands around like she was on the street in the south side.  I asked for the owner - the owner was 100 times worse - came out screaming and cursing and calling me a fat bitch and that I should leave.  I will never give another dime to such a degenerate group of people that have no respect for their customers.  There are too many great Italian places in Chicago - whom have class and respect - if you want to be treated like you live in the Ghetto.  Please make a reservation.

56.description: Found this restaurant on Yelp before going to see a Second City show only a few blocks away. What a fantastic choice! Everyone at our table got something different, and everyone was extremely satisfied. Even as an Italian myself, I have had a wide sampling, and the Eggplant Parmesan was, I think, the best I've ever had! Even as a resident of the suburbs, we will make sure we end up back here in the future. Highly recommended!

29.description: I can say enough good things about this place.  I used to come here by myself to get the squid ink pasta (I don't actually know the real name of the dish but they always know what I'm talking about).  Since I started eating healthier (squid ink pasta, besides the noodles, is a heavenly, heavy cream sauce), my new favorite dish I always get is a grill squid salad (again, don't know the actual name.  There are two seafood salads last I checked.  The one I love has grilled squid, blanched green beans and other veggies.  Not too heavy on the dressing.  All so perfect.  Next time I get it, I'm also going to get a grilled squid appetizer, tell them to bring it out all at once and ENJOY.  I recommend going during off peak times or call a days in advance for a reservation.  Yes, they are that good.

42.description: We had a very large part in the outdoor garden last Thursday. Service was impeccable (as well as patient)! Wonderful food.

23.description: Great place, friendly staff and great food. If you want to experience real Italian food this is the place...

47.description: One of my favorite places to eat. Black linguini is the best. I could do without the calamari which is too crispy and dry.

8.description: If you haven't been, you're missing a lot! The service is outstanding... A water server saw me start to raise my hand, he instantly directed my waiter to my direction. They thought that my finished meal, was to be tossed, rather than packed, they made me a full order! The food was awesomely fresh. The smell of the various entrees were overwhelmingly seductive. This place rocks!

31.description: The pasta is where it's at here. This has been an old staple for many years. Everything here though is very very delicious. I've had many of their pasta dishes and many appetizers and each one is better than the next. Beware though, this place is a total madhouse on the weekends so i would go during the week or at an off hour for a more relaxing dinner.

34.description: This place has amazing pasta! The seafood frutti di Mari is the gem here along with the lamb. We keep coming back here every time. So glad we have this spot in our Neighborhood!!

16.description: I'm one of the many Yelpers who dream of doing half-stars.  Topo Gigio is a little better than a 3, but not quite a 4.  I love the venetian plaster walls, and the classic Italian restaurant decor.  And who wouldn't love a theme restaurant that pays homage to an early 60's Italian mouse puppet.  I was the first one who arrived from my party of 5.  When I told the hostess I had a reservation she was surly, and can I say bitchy because the rest of my party hadn't arrived yet. Hostess lady, you're supposed to be welcoming, not like the freakin' troll who controls passage over the bridge.  Be nice!  Anyway, I loved the house Chianti and was pleased with the generous pour.  The bread came to the table piping hot and there was also a hot whole grain bread in the  basket.  I love that because then I can justify eating more carbs because it's "healthier".  I had grilled portobello with polenta which was really pretty delicious.  The peach sorbet was peachy and refreshing with nice chunks of peaches in it.  My pals got a variety of dishes from black pasta to soup with clam shells floating around in it.  Everyone seemed to like what they ordered.  I seriously wasn't paying attention because I was busy tending to the Chianti.  I also have to say that the service was excellent.  We let our server know that we had a play to catch across the street at the Red Orchid.  The service was perfectly executed to accommodate our schedule.  Overall the experience here was really pretty good.  I think I just got a bit jaded because of the snarly, snarky attitude of the hostess.  Sometimes those first impressions are hard to shake.

13.description: I thought the food here was great! Homemade pasta, fresh seafood, real bufala mozzarella, great wine. Even better were the people. I sat at the inside bar and made more friends in my first 30 minutes than I have in a my life (well, that's an exaggeration but you get the picture). Rudy at the bar was incredible--I swear he knew every person that walked in! There were a ton of regulars who could not stop gabbing about how they love this placeI ordered the Caprese salad to start, then finished with the special Black Squid Ink Pasta with Scallops & Shrimp. Wow! The sauce was rich yet still light. The seafood was cooked perfectly. And pasta was so flavorful! Even their complimentary bread is worth mentioning. Hot & homemade. Yum!This was a great spot--good for a solo dinner at the bar, with a group of friends, or on a date. Definitely coming back to visit!

11.description: I generally avoid Italian restaurants due to higher carb foods and fatty sauces. This restaurant is entirely different. Topo doesn't need use cheap tricks to make flavorful food. Great atmosphere and a neighborhood gem in Old Town!

39.description: I came to the restaurant for different occasions in the past . The last time I was here was about a week ago because my sister and her family were visiting me from Poland. We were seated promptly by a very friendly host when we got there. We ordered grilled calamari and mussels with marinara sauce for appetizers, and we ordered a few pasta dishes, risotto with grilled beef steak, eggplant parmesan, white fish dish for our main dishes. Even though the portion of each dish was huge but we finished almost all the food on our table. Everything was so good. A friend of mine and I ordered a glass of house Cabernet for each of us, and it tasted much better than I expected. It was smooth and fruity but it still has body. They were also very generous with the amount served in the glass. I can't wait to go back! Maybe I will sit at a table either at the back patio or at their outdoor seats in the front if weather permits.

37.description: Not impressed at all.  First time here (visiting from San Francisco) and I ordered the eggplant parmesan and it tasted like it had come out of a frozen box.  Not fresh at all, and I literally took two bites and couldn't stomach it anymore.  My husband had some sort of ink pasta with seafood and it was the saltiest dish we had ever tasted.  Fresher ingredients in your food would be helpful for starters.

0.description: So you think your stomach is full of carb bomb pasta and cant take it in anymore. You are wrong! You order dessert. Chocolate mousse cake is ORGASMIC. And all of a sudden you have room to fill. Tiramisu is out of this worldService is incredible Food is the awesomethentic Italian Go here if you're visiting Chicago

38.description: A beautiful, relaxing lunch!I ordered the seashell pasta with cream sauce and it was as close to perfect as you can get. Seasoned expertly, depth of flavor, yet still light! Get this if you can.Fiancé ordered the whitefish and it looked beautiful. It tasted great too. They saute it first and then finish it in the oven. Crispy skin and a crunchy crust on the flaky flesh. Again, expertly seasoned that went well with the lemon butter sauce.Can't wait to go back!

51.description: My partner and I went here during the Old Town arts festival, so it was extremely packed!  The hostess was really friendly and energetic about getting us a table.  We were sat on the patio and seen by our waiter promptly and he was quite professional and knowledgeable; attentive without being annoying.  We were enjoying our bread and olive oil and wine when it began to rain on us.  The entire waitstaff began to mobilize to find us an umbrella so that we could continue our meal! The food was excellent, I had the tortellini with a crème sauce and ham chunks, and my lady had the some beef with a red sauce and risotto.  The beef was tender and the sauce was a bit sweet and a bit tangy, a perfect dish!  The wine we had was a perfect pairing for our meal and was suggested by our waiter.  There was a bit of a dust up with a neighboring table and the hostess resulting in some threatening words being exchanged and those patrons being ejected.  We the thought it was amusing to me and my partner but the owner and the host apologized to us and offered us a free dessert, which we happily accepted!  Great food and a friendly family like atmosphere and professional staff!

27.description: I have no complaints about the restaurant, but also nothing to get excited about (except maybe the bread). Food was exceptionally fresh. Service was intermittent and abrupt. Few options for vegetarians but carnivores would go crazy for the variety of choices.

32.description: We had the swordfish special (served with potatoes, spinach) and rigatoni (with a pomodoro pancetta basil sauce) followed by the decadent and delicious homemade tiramisu - all this accompanied by the reasonable Sangiovese and an Italian Cab

54.description: Let me start by saying I am not a big fan of going out to eat Italian food. It is just not that exciting to me and I tend to leave feeling like I could have made the dish better at home. That said, I actually loved Topo Gigio! I went with a group of 8 people and made a last minute reservation. The waiter was a really pleasant and humorous Italian gentleman who was very attentiveness. We ordered a wide variety of items including the pesto pasta with  shrimp, the seafood pasta in marinara, spaghetti and meatballs, caprese salad, grilled scallops, and a few other items as well. I did not hear any complaints about the food. They were very generous with the seafood and the dishes were overall quite flavorful. The pasta portions were definitely large as well. However, like most Italian restaurants, the dishes were very heavy and caloric. I definitely needed a nap afterwards. Nonetheless, I would come back here again if I was ever in the mood for some Italian.

48.description: I went there with a group of 12 people for a friend's birthday. The place was perfect for the event: nice atmosphere, friendly waiter and my sea food pasta was excellent.

44.description: The food is prepared pretty well overall but this place is as pretentious as it gets. And the inside manager is one of the biggest dickheads I've ever come across in the service industry period. Shocked by his poor attitude and rudeness. Not spending my money there because of his poor treatment of us-I've literally never been so insulted. This guy ushered me outside and dropped some major "rules" on me like I was some brat trying to skip the line. He kept saying "you should know the rules since you've been coming here before"???? Sorry I didn't read my topo Gigio manual before I left my apt. It's also sweltering hot outside so I went inside to get the scoop-obvious hoping for a table inside but more than willing to be out. All he had to do was be a little nicer about it, like use basic customer service skills and people skills, and we'd been spending some loot there right now.

24.description: Great Italian restaurant in the heart of Old Town.  We sat outside in the small courtyard behind the building.  It was a cool day, the enclosed area blocked the wind and there were several heaters which kept the area warm and comfortable.We had the chicken fiorentina and the grilled chicken salad.  Both were very flavorful and the chicken fiorentina was not too salty and had a great sauce.The waiter was very attentive and quickly fixed an issue when my gf unrolled the silverware and found out her napkin was damp.  Maybe it was left outside?  Not a huge deal.Total was just under $60 for 2 entrees and four alcoholic drinks.  Great place, atmosphere and most importantly, great food!

7.description: Had the Veal Chop special (sauteed in a wine, mushroom, and artichoke sauce) tonight with a side of Roasted Potatoes and Spinach chased by a glass of Chianti.  The chop was 2" thick, tender, moist, delicious, and satisfying.  Our group also shared a Carpaccio alla Piemontese appetizer that was quite good too.  The place was packed with some of Chi-towns most beautiful women.  Topo Gigio represents.

49.description: Exceptional Italian restaurant, the flavors are delicately balanced, rich and full of flavor. This is a must have. Conchiglie Mediterranea is terrific, the scallops are perfectly cooked and there's the perfect amount of spice, not overpowering but enough to notice. The eggplant parmesan is one of the best around. Perfectly breaded so you can still taste the eggplant, the right amount of sauce and cheese. Not too much that you're overpowered but enough that you get all the flavors and enjoyment necessary. We had another linguine pasta, I don't see it on the menu listed here, jumbo prawns and capers, red sauce, it's simply to die for! One of the best made pasta dishes I've had. Perfect flavors! Finally, Joe's Salad is a must have! What a treat!! Avocado, potato, tomato, red onion, buffalo mozzarella and aged parmesan, artichoke, capers and just enough vinaigrette . Highly recommended!

40.description: This place is one of those places that you must stop by and grab a bite to eat. Have lunch, dinner whatever you choose.   We stopped at topo's after spending the after noon enjoying some recreational activities at the beach.   I'd have to say that I am very pleased with this restaurant, as well for their food.   There was a 30min wait. Which I'd have to say is worth it once you try their food.

53.description: No need to look for better Italian cuisine in Chicago after finding this gem. Romantic for a first or last date. Literally everything on the menu is delicious and the service compliments the food with intelligent servers who know about the dishes and add to the appeal. I know this is a short review but you have to experience this place to truly have good Italian in Chicago.

30.description: Had the Veal Chop special (sauteed in a wine, mushroom, and artichoke sauce) tonight with a side of Roasted Potatoes and Spinach chased by a glass of Chianti.  The chop was 2" thick, tender, moist, delicious, and satisfying.  Our group also shared a Carpaccio alla Piemontese appetizer that was quite good too.  The place was packed with some of Chi-towns most beautiful women.  Topo Gigio represents.

46.description: This is not about my second time here because I never went back. But someone we knew also went to this place few weeks ago and said similar things about the hostess. We found this funny.

1.description: Great italian place. The lighting is kind of dim making it harder to navigate their traditional menu. Traditional in the sense of having complex food names and descriptions. The waiters were super nice and when we told him we were concerned about making our show in time they gave us accurate times on the dishes we were considering and brought the check out in a timely manner. The atmosphere felt very family owned/home style. I could very easily see hosting a party here with family style sharing.The food was great. People plesant. The tables a bit too close but not too close ;).

55.description: Best Italian food in all the city. Best waiters around- Alex and Ceasar are our favorite!Favorite dishes include the petti de pollo, pasta arrabiata, and eggplant parm. Really can't go wrong with any of the pasta dishes though. Fresh sea food as well.BEST. CAPRESE SALAD. EVER. Real buffalo mozzarella. Over all amazing. Family place. In love with it.

9.description: I am so disgusted with what I have just witnessed. I was here for lunch and watched a manager treat a customer rudely. Then the owner was called out to talk to the customer. I was sure the owner would try to smooth things over with this kind customer. Apparently they were charging her for a dinner price when she had called in to pick up a lunch order. The owner came over and berated this nice woman and told her, "now you're not going to get it" and slammed the bag of food on the table. Just as a child would. I couldn't believe his behavior. This restaurant will not survive another year under this kind of ownership. Truly disappointing.

26.description: The ambiance here was so lovely.  It's a seemingly small restaurant till you walk in.  As you move from the front to the middle you realize you are actually outdoors!  This ristorante tucked in an alley with ivy-covered brick walls on either side & warm mood lighting would be the perfect place for a first date, anniversary or marriage proposal. Oh....and the food....lets just say, anything made from scratch, in my eyes, is divine! And this food is!

25.description: The Fettuccine san Remo is to-die-for.  Probably the best pasta dish in town.  Salad selections are a weak spot.  Great patio and wonderful staff.

12.description: This place is one of those places that you must stop by and grab a bite to eat. Have lunch, dinner whatever you choose.   We stopped at topo's after spending the after noon enjoying some recreational activities at the beach.   I'd have to say that I am very pleased with this restaurant, as well for their food.   There was a 30min wait. Which I'd have to say is worth it once you try their food.

59.description: Great red sauce Italian restaurant! The prices for the value and quantity of the food is great. The 2 times I have been there, I had the waiter make dishes which weren't on the menu. Fairly descent priced wine menu too.

21.description: Like many restaurants, this one is a dichotomy.  First, the food here is 5 stars.  It's absolutely delicious especially if you go in on a Friday and get the Squid Ink Pasta.  The simple caprese is also quite good...top quality, simple ingredients.  However, the people here have much to be desired.  I live a block away and go in quite often. There have frequently been some sort of issue with the staff (e.g. being reluctant to move us inside to one of several empty tables after it had started to rain...seriously?) but nothing that I couldn't swallow.  The exception being that the bartenders have always been very friendly and fun and should be given their due.  My most recent experience has finally pushed Topo to be the second entrant on to my list of places that I will not be going back.  In short, the manager is passive-aggressive and the owner is arrogant and unconcerned with a customer's feedback about his employees.  Here's the latest incident that was the last straw.  Read on for the drama or just go across the street to Orso or to Bistro Voltaire for French fare.We made a reservation several months ago for a celebratory dinner for a group of us.  Three days before the reservation, we were left a polite voicemail from someone asking to confirm the reservation.  The week was a busy one (and hence the need for a celebratory dinner at the end) and the following day we received a very passive aggressive voicemail from a different woman.  I was taken aback.  The following morning we were finally getting some breathing room and the phone rang.  My wife picked up and it was the passive-aggressive woman who more than lived up to her previous voicemail.  This did not sit well with me and 30 minutes later, I called the restaurant to speak to a manager.  The same woman picked up and told me that she was the manager, the owner was not there and inquired as to the issue.  After attempting to punt a few times, I finally acquiesced and told her "actually, the issue is with you.  I don't appreciate how rude you were over the past three days and would like to speak to someone about it."  I was regrettably curt but certainly never called her names despite her later claims to her boss, presumably to save her own hide.  She took my number and my first name which has no connection to the reservation.  I received a call later in the afternoon from a blocked number.   After explaining the situation, he first scolded me for not returning the voicemails more promptly, told me that he was present at the time of the call and disagreed with my assessment of the woman's rudeness, and that seeing how I was unhappy and wouldn't want me to be unhappy in his restaurant, told me he was cancelling my reservation.  The icing on the cake was when the manager accused me of calling the woman on the phone a b!tch - which I absolutely never did (nor would ever do to any service industry employee). I was stunned but it now makes my choice for Italian fare easier. Go across the street to any other fine restaurant in Old Town.

17.description: Topo Gigio is a hidden gem in Old Town! They're very old school Italian, authentic and reasonably priced. The pastas are one of my favorites in the city, and they have a penchant for making incredible sauces. Here are some of my highlights:Garganelli - handmade pasta with very tasty sausageConchiglie - simple but far from plain; never knew shrimps and scallops in tomato basil sauce could taste so goodSpaghetti Ai Frutti Di Mare - marinara sauce is rich with seafood flavor, almost like the calamari, mussels, clams and sea scallops melted into it! Portions are generous for one person, but I usually enjoy my meal so much, I have to resist stuffing myself.  Excellent service and food during the many times I've visited. I would not hesitate to recommend Topo Gigio.

10.description: I'm not a yelper like the rest of these people lol.. but I just had to say this place is outstanding! The food, the staff, the atmosphere, it's beyond spectacular. Thanks Topo!

5.description: The ambiance here was so lovely.  It's a seemingly small restaurant till you walk in.  As you move from the front to the middle you realize you are actually outdoors!  This ristorante tucked in an alley with ivy-covered brick walls on either side & warm mood lighting would be the perfect place for a first date, anniversary or marriage proposal. Oh....and the food....lets just say, anything made from scratch, in my eyes, is divine! And this food is!

3.description: I have been to this restaurant twice now with my husband and the food and service was great both times. I read other reviews about servers being too busy but honestly when the food is sooo good I can see why! For a romantic date night request the tables that are for two right by the window inside that way you're away from the noise and crowd of the restaurant. The calamari fritti is the best fried calamari I've had in Chicago thus far.

35.description: Delicious food consistently. The service can be great or mediocre depending on how crowded it gets. It is never bad service however, and the employees are always polite and friendly, maybe even too friendly sometimes.

19.description: Great Italian restaurant in the heart of Old Town.  We sat outside in the small courtyard behind the building.  It was a cool day, the enclosed area blocked the wind and there were several heaters which kept the area warm and comfortable.We had the chicken fiorentina and the grilled chicken salad.  Both were very flavorful and the chicken fiorentina was not too salty and had a great sauce.The waiter was very attentive and quickly fixed an issue when my gf unrolled the silverware and found out her napkin was damp.  Maybe it was left outside?  Not a huge deal.Total was just under $60 for 2 entrees and four alcoholic drinks.  Great place, atmosphere and most importantly, great food!

28.description: 1st class all the way my waiter cesar is hands down the best server here the appetizers until the main course is phenomenal i will be a repeat customer for sure

45.description: Went once and had great calamari and some light pasta.  Went again a handful of months later and had quite possibly the worst chicken parm I've ever had.  This leaves me somewhat undecided and if an Italian place can't get chicken parm right...hmmm

33.description: They were able to seat all 7 of us quickly, and took great care of us even as the night got busier. the bruschetta and calamari di fritti were as good as I've had. Everyone was happy with the appetizers. All nicely bookended by the prosecco and sambuca.

43.description: What an excellent restaurant! The atmosphere is warm and fun and the food is absolutely fantastic. I was so happy with how eager they were to accommodate their pasta dishes to fit my vegetarian diet.

2.description: Amongst the shops and boutiques on Wells St, Topo Gogio doesn't not make a bold standing as far as store fronts are concerned. However once you're inside you feel the quaint atmosphere which makes you feel as though you're within a unique Italian dining establishment. The servers are well versed in Italian offering detailed suggestions off the menu. All the seating is great, despite the hostess queuing us into a seemingly desolate and lonely dining area. It definitely was the opposite as it was very heated and more guests filled up the area quickly. The wine menu is plentiful leaving no one unaccommodated. The food menu is in Italian however the descriptions are in English. I advise you learn a bit of Italian pronunciation before coming if you want to appear well versed. The food portions are surprisingly filling given my preconceived notions that most pasta dishes leave you hungry. The prices fluctuate between $15 and $26, a good price range. Not a great place to bring the kids. Overall this is definitely a 5 star place to get your Italian fix.

18.description: We had the swordfish special (served with potatoes, spinach) and rigatoni (with a pomodoro pancetta basil sauce) followed by the decadent and delicious homemade tiramisu - all this accompanied by the reasonable Sangiovese and an Italian Cab

41.description: the only word I can think of is "basic" very bland dishes we had. Then I thought, maybe it's the gold coast clientele and their older people that are use to these non-flavored dishes they've been use to for years.  very disappointed I wasted a lot of money here. we should have known when we noticed all the nick knacks on the walls, especially the mice statues all over the place, very bazaar, like some little child decorated the place.. seem dirty too. strange place..

52.description: One of my favorite Italian places in Chicago! Have never been disappointed with a meal here. Even my dad, who is really hard to please, was impressed with his chicken dish. Highly recommend!

50.description: I took my family here before a Second City show and we all had a great time. I can't think of anything that I'd like for them to improve. I had the conchiglie alla sarda and it was plate-licking good.

4.description: The owner here is an assh***... He is a racist towards Asians and he called me a chink. The food was not that great, we waited over 1 hour before we even got some kind of service. Worst experience ever!

6.description: Well over a decade of our patronage ended tonight by the owner himself. We ordered our weekly "Joe's salad" with mozzarella substituted for fontina cheese, which we don't care for, as we have for nearly every week "since forever" given we live up the block in the Old Town Triangle. The owner told us the substition would cost additional 2.50 and we accepted this although it marked the first time in our lengthy experience a surcharge was demanded. Since we already were paying overage, we requested a few slices extra mozzarella with another surcharge. The owner went ballistic, telling us that 2-3 slices of mozzarella would cost us 12.80 per salad because it amounts to an appetizer. (I believe he contemplated the caprese salad.)We declined the second surcharge, told the owner to put the original mozzarella substitution on our salads and I would walk to the nearby Treasure Island and buy a tub of fresh, large buffalo mozzarella balls imported from Italy there. (These sell for less than 1.00 for a very large and authentic ball, so for a dollar or two plus ten minutes time it made sense.)At this notification, the owner terminated our relationship. Please know that at no time did we display poor manners, loud tone or any other behavior a reasonable person would construe as rudeness towards the owner or anybody else at the restaurant. Among other things, here is what the owner cost his business tonight:* $500 to 1,000 each and every month - no exaggeration - just for the two of us monthly dine-in and carry out* thousands more each year for the group dinners, cocktail sessions and other events we formerly led there* the business of our contacts, who will be informed* the owner's dignity and respect, and confidence in his business judgment, for treating polite and loyal customers so terriblyWe're done here.

22.description: There are many choices to eat in Old Town after a long  day at work. And, my experience is that Topo provides an inviting atmosphere, along with great food. It's easy to eat here solo.  Rudy, the bartender, sets a place setting, complete with a napkin, for a placemat...at the bar! Other diners are friendly, and, it's clear they return here for the above reasons.  Oh, I had the Eggplant Parmesan ..hot, and delicious!One recommendation I would make would be to install a purse hook under the counter..so, a purse doesn't take up space on a chair.  Maybe there is one..I couldn't find it.. Thanks!

15.description: What an experience....romantic dinner setting candlelit, food was too die for, service friendly!  Recommend to any!

57.description: During the art fair yesterday, we were enjoying a Starbucks coffee on the sidewalk, considering places to have dinner. Due to the coffee being overly full, we poured a bit out on the sidewalk so it would not spill. Immediately, a bouncer grabs the full cup and tosses it in the garbage. No words, nothing. No apology. We were appalled that this happened. When we asked to enter to talk to a manager they wouldn't let us enter. Will never be entering again nor will anybody we know. Horrible customer service.

20.description: Let me start by saying, the food here was really good. Came here with my family from overseas, they had just arrived and I had booked this place due to the fact some of them were staying locally and this restaurant was relatively close by for the first night. Me and my wife had been here some time ago, it wasn't particularly memorable the first time, but I didn't have any negative memories. Now I do.After we had finished our delicious meal, the bill came, we paid up in cash. Our waiter asked me if I'd like change. Now not knowing exactly how much I was going to tip I said "yes please". I could tell he was disappointed, so I made sure to look over the amount again upon its return and tip accordingly.I put in 15%. There were 6 people and I didn't think he really deserved 20%, I think 15% is more than adequate for lets just say, "adequate" service. I'm more than happy to take care of a waiter/waitress who goes above and beyond, this guy did not. He wasn't bad (not yet), but he wasn't 20%.Whilst we were all still seated, he took away the tip. After that, I could see him pacing around our area looking at the tip we'd given. This struck me as odd and I almost thought he was going to come over to complain about it. Well, my gut was right, he approached me and proceeded to say that this was far to low a tip amount and that he usually receives no less that 18-20%! I was stunned. I said "what is the problem exactly? i don't think it's less than you deserve and I certainly think it's more than enough". He protested once again that it wasn't enough and that he can't even pay the bus boys with this. He threw the tip back on the table and stormed off. At this point I was totally offended. I explained what had happened to my wife and to my family, said that we should leave but not before I speak to the manager. I got to the host and asked to speak to the manager, he brought him over. I explained the situation and what had happened, he apologized, I said "I'm going to give you two options; I can give him the tip or I can leave and give him nothing, I don't believe that we deserved to be spoken to like that and I'm frankly very insulted in the way he basically threw the tip back at me". Right at this moment our waiter came over and started to repeat that the tip wasn't enough and basically get into an argument with us right at the host stand in the middle of the restaurant. The manager was waaay out of his depth here and literally couldn't handle the situation, he basically stood there not able to do or say anything. In fairness, he looked about 18 years old and very green. So, we simply ended the discussion right there, took his tip and left. I've never experienced anything like this dining out before. But this one guy ruined the first night with my family. I feel bad for the bus boys, this guy cost them their tip just because he'd rather throw a 15% tip back as opposed to accepting it. I gave him the opportunity to take it back, even after he threw it back at me. His pride was obviously more important.Will never go here again. Outrageous considering the money we spent.

36.description: We were a large group and without a reservation gor a comfortable seating. Loved the veggie risotto (not on the menu). Service was fabulous.

14.description: Food and service is still excellent .  Our recent experiences here with reservations and host staff have improved drastically.  This is our favorite restaurant in the area.

1.description: This is a Papa Johns. It tastes like Papa Johns. It has no parking. It is there.

9.description: Showed up almost 2 hours late claiming that the order from Grubhub didn't reach them. REALLY?! Yea sorry not sorry, never ordering from here again! So happy Grubhub gave me credit and sorted out everything for me

12.description: This is a horrible restaurant I went there and I wasn't satisfied by the pizza it was a terrible pizza I was terrible service it was dirty the tables were messy when I called the woman on the phone she was mean I found some like hair in my food. Everything you could think of a good restaurant this isn't this is trash this is bad this is rubbish bitch garbage this restaurant is a steaming fart

21.description: Two words:   food poisoning. As in down for two days and hoping to die.

16.description: I called and placed an order for delivery, and the girl on the phone told me it would be 30 to 40 minutes, and it's a snowstorm outside... I was sure my pizza and breadsticks would take at least an hour.  But 30 minutes later I heard a knock at my apartment door, and my dinner is here!  So efficient.  I really appreciate that! I  have ordered at this Papa John's location before and no matter what, the food is always great. Parmesan garlic breadsticks are amazing, perfectly salty and delicious, and the mushroom pizza I always get is again divine. And the guy who delivered my goods was so polite, my cat happened to escape while we were exchanging food for cash, and he was very helpful and pleasant while I made a fool of myself chasing her down the hall and trying to get her to come back in to my apartment. Overall, thanks to Papa John's, I am having a great night!You will not regret ordering food from this location.

17.description: The place was very, very clean compared to the one I have worked at in Conshohoken, Pa. Another thing I love about this place is the fact is that you can dine in and when it comes to delivery, there always on time according to the estimated time I get in my email.

10.description: This location has lost several of my orders and most others are delivered much later than the estimated time given. Customer service isn't great at all. Communication is terrible, whenever I call no one seems to know what's going on. Despite all the issues I've experienced, I've never been reached out to by the manager nor has anyone ever offered a discount or refund.

5.description: My fiancé and I order here about once a week. We started ordering from them about a year ago, and we have had very few bad experiences over that time. And if there's something wrong, they try to make it right or credit you for the next time. The worst (which became the best) time was the most recent. When our pizza hadn't arrived after 1 hour and 15 minutes, I called to see where it was. I spoke to Janice and she informed me that there had basically been a major kitchen/delivery mix up and they were about 8 pizzas behind. I was very aggravated because I had taken my digestive enzyme pills (I'm lactose intolerant) to counteract the time when I would've been eating the pizza. Not only was I was starving out of my mind, but now I would have to take a double amount of pills because the pizza still wouldn't be there for another 45 minutes!  She was profusely apologetic, and told me she'd give me a credit for a pizza next time, and I told her "No thank you, because I will almost certainly not reorder from you guys again because of this." She told me that she refused to lose me as a customer for Papa John's and that she would like to comp the pizza that would soon be on its way AND keep the credit for next time. She also told me she had just called in different delivery drivers from all over the city to try to come help and speed up the process. Obviously, it was very nice for her to offer those things, but the real reason I will return is because she clearly cared about me as a customer and DID NOT just pass it off as an "oh well! Who cares? It isn't my company." And she was a problem solver: attempting to correct the issue trying to speed it up as much as possible by calling all available drivers! She treated my business as if it were her own. She is an asset to that location. I have a feeling if they keep her and only other employees like her around: customers will be more satisfied, yelp reviews will increase, employee morale will go up and they'll want to continue to see their work praised, service quality all around goes up, and their sales will increase. Everyone wins!! AND the pizza is always good, but it was particularly  delicious that night. The night went from zero to hero pretty quickly. Keep Janice (and those like her) at that place as long as you can, Papa John's! She (and the very nice delivery man from the Michigan and Cermak location that helped out that evening) are the only reasons I will definitely come back.

11.description: Used to be a regular customer- I will not be ordering from this place again. I placed an order about 30 minutes before it started to rain. A full hour after I ordered (set time was 20-40 min), Papa Johns Division gives me a call to let me know the order is running a little late. Mid-call, their driver says he is not going out anymore tonight. The man who called did not understand the concept of a refund nor did he understand customer service. The entire debacle was inconvenient, the management does not know how to handle delivering in weather (this is Chicago, people), and they lacked a clear business strategy for dealing with orders they need to cancel. I am disappointed. I will not order from here again. Next time I want cheap cardboard pizza I will order from Sarpinos or Dominos. It's cheaper anyways.

22.description: Oh. My. Stars.  FINALLY my prayers have been answered and we have PAPA JOHN'S in the CITY.  I couldn't be happier.  It's just as delicious and mushy as I remember.  Remember my name, Papa.  Because I'm about to become your #1 customer.  In your face, Domino's!!!!

0.description: Papa John's pizza is what it is. Nothing to write home about but it was good. More to this review is for the customer service.
