I called in an order well and requested a specific delivery time - say it was 7pm, I asked for a 9pm delivery knowing that I wouldn't be home before then. The lady who took my order said okay and we proceeded to figure out the best price combination for what I wanted based on the current specials. Make sure to call out a specific deal you may have heard on TV, radio, etc. They don't just volunteer giving you discounts. Closed mouths don't get fed! So ask.The delivery driver called me at 8:45 saying he was outside. Ugh. But I was actually only 5 minutes away, which I told him and asked him to wait. He sounded totally agreeable and didn't fuss. I arrived within 5 minutes and there he was, still pleasant and not annoyed. Good thing too because I mean... it wasn't 9pm yet so he was just early. I gave him a pretty good tip for his time and that was that.

20.description: I do enjoy Papa John's quite a bit for a chain pizza joint. Plus, it is so nice having something other than Domino's which always seems to be the default

19.description: Oh. My. Stars.  FINALLY my prayers have been answered and we have PAPA JOHN'S in the CITY.  I couldn't be happier.  It's just as delicious and mushy as I remember.  Remember my name, Papa.  Because I'm about to become your #1 customer.  In your face, Domino's!!!!

2.description: They typically deliver my pizza nice and hot! One time they delivered it cold and not what I ordered.... But the manager had them deliver one on the house and it was nice and hot.I've always loved Papa Johns...

18.description: I do enjoy Papa John's quite a bit for a chain pizza joint. Plus, it is so nice having something other than Domino's which always seems to be the default

13.description: This is the worst location to order from.  I ordered a pizza online at 8 p.m..  Called at 9:15 p.m. and the person on the phone says they see the order but did not receive it so they did not process it.  Basically, they found it in their system but did not see it.  Never order from this place.  They can't fulfill a simple order.  I hope Papa Johns vet's the franchise owners going forward.  Bottom line, I never received the order and after calling the location on Division St., I told them to make sure to cancel it!  Never again!

4.description: Dem fat hoes took ~80 minutes to get me my goddam pizza. I was with 3 friends and we were all wondering what the hell are they doing jerking each other off?

6.description: Extremely poor service. They told me my order would arrive in 45 minutes to an hour. An hour later I call and I tell the lady that it's been an hour and she just tells me to hold "for a second". After ten minutes on hold I hang up and call again and she tells me she is "the only one there" and asked me to hold again. Eventually I was given a discount, which is the only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1.

15.description: After my initial review, management was nice enough to contact me and offer me a complimentary pizza for my experience. They were incredibly generous, and I thought it was very nice of them.This time everything was great! Pizza came quickly and was exactly what I wanted. Thank you Papa John's!

7.description: Terrible experience. I ordered online at 6:45pm and just called at 8pm to know where my pizza was. Turns out they made "a mistake" and had to remake the pizza. When I asked where the driver is... the pizza wasn't even out for delivery after 1hr and 15 minutes. There wasn't a driver at the store to deliver the pizza. Unbelievable. No phone call. I cancelled my order and won't be using this location in the future.

8.description: Ordered a pizza online...estimated time for delivery 30-40 mins.63 minutes later no pizza.  We cancelled the order.  If I wanted to wait for over an hour for pizza...I would not have ordered from PJ's. Disappointing show.  I won't order from here again.  The hunt for fast delivery in the area continues.

3.description: So I made an online order. After more than an hour and a half of waiting, I call the place, and they tell me that my order has not been started yet, that I would have to wait 35 to 45 more minutes. Great. The man who took my order, apart from not being nice at all made me repeat the same things 3 to 4 times. In the end I ended up cancelling my order, cause why would I wait another hour for it? No point. So I cancelled it but still I haven´t got any refund......

14.description: First and last time I order from there. I place an order over the phone, and it arrives 45 minutes later. I open the top, and the order was wrong. I ordered a 3 topping pizza: cheese, Canadian bacon, and pineapple. What I got: onions, chicken, BBQ sauce, and some other unidentifiable objects. Uh, those toppings are really my thing, and I had waited 45 minutes. I was very disappointed.Mistakes happen, but this last part really ticked me off...I call, they argue with me, told me they would give me a refund, and then HUNG UP on me!

58.description: I am terrible at writing reviews for salons and restaurants I go to but I really felt the need to write one for this place....they are so wonderful!! I just had my engagement pictures done today; my blow out was done by Amy and my make up was done by Emma, I loved them both. They did such a great job and made everything so easy for me on a very stressful day!  I love the decor in the store, its very very cute and trendy. I would highly recommend this place to all of my friends!! I plan on taking my g/f's there for some bachelorette fun :)

56.description: I had never had a blowout or been to a blowout bar before, but I'm pretty sure this one is particularly exceptional. The moment you walk in, you are greeted very enthusiastically by the woman to mans the impressive beauty counter.  The thing that really struck me was the decor. It's strikingly beautiful in it's simplicity and unique features, and I was told the owner hand picked every piece. Bravo. Will you decorate my apartment, please?As for my blowout, I was very impressed with the time, care, and detail that went into it. It involved a lot more styling that I expect, but in the end, my hair looked like it had never looked before. It was polished, had amazing curls (which is difficult to achieve with my stick straight asian hair), and it held up in the Chicago wind! Amazing! I might have to incorporate blowouts into my monthly indulgences.  AND... they do blowout/make up parties where they'll give you some bubbly or you can make it byob. Next girls' night out, for sure!I highly recommend Arch!

29.description: I've been getting my brows done here once a month for the better part of a year. The employees are careful, meticulous, and friendly. I originally balked at the $20 price-- in my old neighborhood, brow waxes were $10 a pop-- but it's worth it, since the Arch service is so consistently good. After a decade of fretting each time I let a stranger groom my brows, I'm now absolutely delighted to have found a salon where every single employee does a consistently great job. I come in, I sit down, they show me what they plan to do, they do it well, and I walk out feeling oh-so-polished.

42.description: I literally JUST got home from Arch Apothecary and I'm so thrilled to be able to write a glowing review about Emma and her brow shaping skills. Before even dipping a stick into wax, she first drew out where my brows should be and where she'd like to see them grown in (they're pretty short and flat). I was astounded with her level of skill and knowledge, especially since she's so young (and adorable, of course). She even said that if I came back the next day she would fill them in for my date that I was telling her about.The brow waxes are $20 which are comparable to other brow bars in the city, but I definitely would say that this is much better value. Plus, the shop is just so damn cute and they have some amazing (albeit expensive) products to browse.

23.description: The bad...I tried to walk in because I have a gc & they had no availability. Waaawaaawaaa....bummer.I will have to call to make an appointment.The space is super cute. Lots of candles, perfumes, & makeup. I'll be happy when I can actually check out the services.

47.description: I've been here for a blowout four times, and loved it every time.  The store is super clean and the staff is beyond friendly.  Ask for Amy for a blowout, you won't be disappointed.  Arch Apothecary is awesome!

8.description: I seriously cannot say enough good things about Arch Apothecary. Emma does my eyebrows every month - she is absolutely amazing. She shapes them perfectly, they last for a long time and she'll fill them in for me after. She is so sweet and professional. Arch Apothecary also provided the makeup service for my wedding. Another great experience. The trial went so smoothly, the girls were on time and professional and they did an amazing job. Everyone got an airbrush and it looked so, so natural. They did such an amazing job getting the look that each person wanted. I've never seen an airbrush look so natural in my life. AND it lasted all night. Check this place out. Totally worth your time.

31.description: I kid you not, friends, I could spend entire paychecks here if I allowed myself!My mom introduced me to this beautiful treasure in pursuit of a unique eyeliner pencil. It is called Royal Navy by Terry. It's this rich, lush, brilliant blue that makes ones eyes POP and stand out like a gemstone. Gorgeous! It cost around $40 which couldn't have made me happier. I felt so great about my purchase and this eye pencil will last a LONG time.Please treat yourself to some Arch Apothecary.

34.description: Is Old Town adorable or what?Stumbled across Arch when I was research places to get make-up done on Yelp. Coupled with the fact that this place also does blow-outs and up-dos, it was the perfect fit for what I needed. Jessica R did my make-up. She's fantastic and would always check to see how I was liking things and whether I wanted to change anything (e.g. lighter or darker eye shadow? thicker or thinner eyeliner? etc). She is an absolute pro at all things make-up, and applying falsies in particular. Make-up application is $50, but if you buy $50 of product at Arch, they waive the application fee - super nifty, and I left with 2 lip glosses. They have a lovely selection of high-end (but not mainstream) make-up brands in-store.Another Jessica did my blow-out (and I completely forgot her last name - forgive me!). Hair was washed to a squeaky clean, and she managed to magically put soft curls in my hair that held all night. Such an impressive feat!Can't wait to come back here again. A lot of ladies were visiting on Saturday and getting their brows done, so I suspect this is a great place to go to get those tamed.

16.description: Emma is an eyebrow shaping goddess!! A couple of friends recommended her a year ago and I haven't looked back. Be sure to download the Belly app on your phone to earn points there.

13.description: I kid you not, friends, I could spend entire paychecks here if I allowed myself!My mom introduced me to this beautiful treasure in pursuit of a unique eyeliner pencil. It is called Royal Navy by Terry. It's this rich, lush, brilliant blue that makes ones eyes POP and stand out like a gemstone. Gorgeous! It cost around $40 which couldn't have made me happier. I felt so great about my purchase and this eye pencil will last a LONG time.Please treat yourself to some Arch Apothecary.

11.description: I love this place.  I just moved to Madison from Chicago and am so glad they opened up here!!  The brow waxes are excellent and I am going in to have my make up done next week!

39.description: Wow!  This place is great!  I came for an updo and eyebrow wax and could not have been more pleased.  Everyone in the shop was super friendly, the space is gorgeous, and I LOVED my services!  My hair and brows looked beautiful (if I may say so....). The updo was gorgeous but not stuffy, looked great from every angle and lasted all night.  My Day Two hair is awesome too, I am currently rocking a very fancy pony!  And my brows look great; I never knew I needed a better brow shape until I got one.  I can't wait to return for a blowout and makeup app when the time is right.  Highly recommend!

37.description: Amazing. Would go as far as say it is the best brow wax I've ever had in my life. I have seen Jessica twice now, and am so impressed by Arch....they really listen to what type of brows you are looking for and do not give you the "one size fits all" brow wax. The store is very cute and clean, and has a great selection of products (which they are not overly pushy about whatsoever). Highly recommend!

0.description: I have loved this place for a long time!  Everyone there is so talented and very nice. Emma does my brows usually and I get tons of compliments although sometimes Lauren does them as well!  Branden does the best makeup in the city!  And whenever I get a blowout Abby is my girl although they are all great.I am the Venue Manager for Room 1520 in the West Loop and our brides book Arch Apothecary to come to our bridal suite for day of Hair and Makeup services.  The girls always look gorgeous and are super happy!

38.description: This spot is really charming. They carry a unique selection of products and I love the decor. I'd highly recommend Emma. She's very friendly and excellent at what she does.  One thing to note is that they take cards but only accept tips in cash, so remember to bring some cash.

51.description: Love Emma & her brow shaping skills!  So happy my once over-plucked brows are getting the TLC they finally need & deserve.

27.description: Today was my second time at this place for brow waxing...my first experience was great and so tried second time and I'm sorry to say very upset with the service. The actual waxing session took around 30mins and i was continuously feeling that something is not rite because whenever she was applying wax, it was so hard and cold ;not easy to spread , I could feel it..After 30mins when I checked my brow, it looked almost the same as before, in spite of telling her please make it thinner...The worst part is after coming home I could see red rashes on my skin...I am not coming back...very miffed!

32.description: I love coming here! The ladies do a great job on my brows. But why is it so #@^$*# expensive?!?!Otherwise, I love it. They're awesome. It's $30 for brow/lip waxing. They also offer to use makeup to fill-in afterwards if you're a bit red.

54.description: Awesome for brows. I have seem both Emma and Lauren... They both rock. They keep broad natural and point out what they want to see grow for a better brow! It really makes a difference on my whole face! Worth the money! It's a really awesome space too think anthro meets a salon. Great candles, soaps, gifts etc. too!

48.description: Great blow out! Just wish they had an online booking system. Very cute place and location. The staff didn't know much about gluten in the cosmetics so be aware of that if you are going there for make up. I loved my hair and the girl who did it did a great job.

44.description: This little Old Town spot is absolutely to die for. It's bright, airy, and filled with pretty little products.I came here for a blow out with Christina, who was really sweet and gabbed with me about Andy Cohen and the Real Housewives throughout my service. I'd definitely come back for the great service and lovely ambiance.

24.description: Arch Apothecary has very talented staff at the brow bar.  My experience with both Emma and Lauren was wonderful.  They were attentive to detail, and I like how they showed me how they were going to shape my brows in a way that was flattering and executed that perfectly.  Please note that their website is not updated with the latest prices as it has gone up to $23 plus gratuity for a brow wax, which is much pricier than threading. However, I feel that you get what you pay for and peace of mine as they offer a quality service and the wax used is nonirritating.

7.description: Arch Apothecary has very talented staff at the brow bar.  My experience with both Emma and Lauren was wonderful.  They were attentive to detail, and I like how they showed me how they were going to shape my brows in a way that was flattering and executed that perfectly.  Please note that their website is not updated with the latest prices as it has gone up to $23 plus gratuity for a brow wax, which is much pricier than threading. However, I feel that you get what you pay for and peace of mine as they offer a quality service and the wax used is nonirritating.

49.description: Not only is Arch Apothecary located in one of the best neighborhoods in Chicago, its staff, beautiful decor and service is top notch! From the moment you walk into the store, you are greeted by friendly staff who are very knowledgeable when it comes to specialty beauty products (they have almost 30 different high-end brands!), fabulous blow outs and perfect brows-just to name a few reasons why Arch is amazing.I have been to Emma, Jeannelle, and Lauren for my brows and eye lash tints. All girls are pros and super sweet. They start out by looking at the natural shape of your brow and face structure before taking the time to explain the "game plan". I am always so pleased with how my brows look when I leave.I have also been to Arch for a private party...girls' night out with champagne and wine of course! Emily (in charge of event planning and PR) coordinated a fabulous party for make-up and eyelash applications & blow outs. Ask for Emily for information on private parties and wedding services! Arch is the best brow and beauty/style bar in the city hands down. Be sure to follow them on Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest and Twitter for beauty ideas and products!

40.description: I went to Arch for a blowout, and I was really excited about it. When I walked in I was greeted by a group of great women and seated right away. The decor was great and the lighting was impeccable. With that said, I sat down and had my hair shampooed and I felt like my hair wasn't really washed the way I like it to be. I have a lot of hair and it's important to spend a little time making sure you get all the soap out and I didn't feel like that was the case. The blowout was just ok. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't worth the $35+tip either. I would rather spend a little more and get an awesome blowout somewhere else.

53.description: Really loved it here and although it is $35 vs. the $15 cheap salons it was a totally different experience. The lighting is great so they can really make the best arch possible and the ambiance is very nice as well. Clean and the end result was a better shaped brow.Worth spending the extra money!

30.description: This review is primarily for the express braid I received this weekend. While Arch does have a good selection of high-end hair products and make-up, I would not return for the service I received again. I got a fishtail braid done for the express braid/bun service. I was in the chair for less than ten minutes and my braid did not last much longer than that. After five/ten minutes walking around outside most of my hair was falling out. I spent a half hour at home putting countless bobby pins in to save it. My efforts were useless as I felt like I couldn't move the rest of the day for fear of what was left of my braid falling out. While I only paid $10 for this, I was very disappointed that it barely lasted long enough for me to walk home. Save your money and do your hair yourself.

46.description: I recently stopped by here for a blowout after they were able to squeeze me in at the last minute on a Friday afternoon.This is a beautiful salon in the heart of Old Town- it reminded me of Anthropologie-style décor - excellent taste! Rustic wood floors, high dramatic ceilings, beautiful chandeliers, mirrors and overall decor. It is always a good sign of things to come when there is great attention to detail paid to the salon itself.My stylist washed my hair, offered me something to drink and we went over the type of blowout I wanted - just a simple curled in bob. I was impressed that they use Oribe hair products which I love and liked that unlike some hair places, the sinks, floor, etc. wasn't filthy & covered in hair.The blowout was never painful - no painful tugs or burns which I've experienced in the past. Before I knew it - she was done! My hair stayed polished and with the perfect amount of volume for the rest of the night. They also offer make-up and brow-shaping services along with a great selection of makeup, scented candles and fragrances for purchase.For $35 you can't really go wrong at Arch Apothecary given the great atmosphere, high quality of products, and great styling. I'll be back!

1.description: Lucy was excellent. She did my brows, super quick, painless. No watery eyes. Lovely space, great products. Highly recommended.

55.description: Great, laid back and friendly staff.  I felt welcome and comfortable, exactly what a salon should make a patron feel. They use fabulous products, Oribe etc., and give a very natural blow out with attention to your hair type.  I appreciate being listened to when I request "not too much" product!  I am used to blow-dry bars in NYC who have the art down, but haven't found a spot here in Chi that focuses on blow-outs and doing them correctly.  Arch's got it.  The glass of wine doesn't t hurt either.  Great product selection from makeup to facial products and nail polishes as well.

9.description: Thanks to Lauren, I now have fabulous eyebrows that keep me feeling confident and sexy.I never thought eyebrows were a big deal and I never took the time to take care of them. I would just go to whatever salon had the best deal. Then I  randomly stumbled into Arch. Lauren did my eyebrows and I was instantly impressed at all the knowledge she had about my brows and shape. This girl knows what she is doing. She helped me to grow them out after multiple bad brow jobs at the previous places I had been. Apparently I was getting bad work done on my brows and had no idea. So glad I found Lauren at Arch! I have been going to Lauren for almost a year now.   It feels awesome to walk out of Arch after Lauren finishes my eyebrows. Don't pass up a great opportunity to have your brow game on fleek. Lauren is the way to go. Trust me!

26.description: Walked in here because I was desperate for a brow wax. They were able to accommodate me and the girl was very nice and friendly. She asked how I wanted my brows and did a diligent job of shaping and trimming them. I would have given 4 stars, but a star gets deducted because she didn't remove all the wax. When I got home, there were little sticky bits that I had to wash off.

25.description: Emma is an eyebrow shaping goddess!! A couple of friends recommended her a year ago and I haven't looked back. Be sure to download the Belly app on your phone to earn points there.

12.description: I love Arch and will only go there for my brows! Emma is amazing at what she does and has helped me achieve brows I've always wanted. I highly recommend Arch for waxing, blowouts + braids, they even have cute little gift ideas like candles, makeup, hair products, etc.

59.description: Lauren really is the best! My over-plucked brows are now in her professional hands.  My only regret is that I didn't see her sooner.

21.description: Stopped in today because I was looking to pick out a few items from the Jouer makeup collection. Ended up getting an eyebrow wax and tint. Will definitely be back! Old Town definitely has many gems and Arch is one of them.

17.description: Lauren is amazing!  Love my brows!

10.description: Emma is the best. I have large eyebrows that grow quickly and Emma has been shaping them perfectly for two years now. I get compliments on them often. She doesn't measure - she just sees and creates the perfect arch. And she's really sweet, so it's nice to catch up on each others' lives every few weeks.I've also been for a few blowouts and loved my hair too. Just need to try the makeup sometime soon.The space is adorable and everyone is friendly. You should definitely go, but make an appointment because they are popular -- and rightly so!

5.description: Emma is the best!  Will never go to another place again!

3.description: Great selection. Really nice staff. Braids are awesome and so affordable!! Blow-outs good. Product selection is amazing- lots of fun things to look at.Again: go for the braids!!!!!!

35.description: I don't know what I would do without Arch Apothecary in my life.  It's like the show cheers - everyone knows your name and I feel like I get to spend the afternoon with friends when I stop in (which is frequently).Jess, Lauren, and Emma are all extremely talented at brow shaping and make up application and they couldn't be more friendly! But mostly, I don't know what i would do without Abbey in my life - she makes my hair always look impeccable.  Her blow outs last for days and I get so many compliments on my hair.  It's very long and she keeps it so healthy so that I can keep it long and minimize hair cuts.  She's also amazing at styles creating fun styles with braids and waives and buns.  I walk in and she'll do a quick fix and I leave looking like a different person.  She's simply the best!Also, Kelly can do some seriously amazing celebrity like beach waves!And, I can bring my dog with me which makes it a really fun activity, especially in this cold winter we're having

19.description: Got an awesome blowout and eyelash tint. I have huge curly hair and the stylist, whose name I can't remember, finished in under 30 minutes, which is miraculous. If I lived in Chicago, I'd go weekly.

28.description: So happy to have found this place.In the last week I've been to Arch twice, first to have my eyebrows waxed & tinted and yesterday I had a blow out.I was really impressed with how my eyebrows turned out. In fact they looked so good my husband even noticed & commented on them. I was put at ease straight away when Lauren took the time to draw out how they would look & told me where she'd be waxing. After Lauren had finished she offered some cream or concealer to help with the redness incase I was off out or back to work.My "Old Town Classic" blowout yesterday with Abby was big & bouncy & held up wonderfully against the wind & the humidity. My hair still looked pretty this morning.Tip:Bring cash tips.Revised Review: Went for a Third visit on Christmas Eve for another Brow Arch Wax & Brow tint. My previous visit the total was $35 plus tip, I think I paid $41 all in. This last visit it was $43 BEFORE tip. That's $50 to get my eyebrows tidied up. It was annoying as I had with me the exact amount as last time & left my card at home (as you can not tip with cash). I ended up having to stick it on my UK credit card that I found floating around the bottom of my purse. Can you say Overseas service charge! I'm not sure if I was mistakenly overcharged or if they've put their prices up, if so they are now certainly on the pricier side of beauty. I'll certainly be looking for something more appropriately priced.Additionally there was no drawing the line like last time, and the colour was not quite the same. Aside from all that they still looked great & the chat was friendly as usual.

45.description: I had stopped getting my brows waxed after a traumatizing incident a few years back at another salon. This place is SO cute, I couldn't resist and finally scheduled an appointment with Emma. I've been going to her regularly for a few months now and she does an AMAZING job. I've gotten so many compliments on my brows and I swear, I feel like they are growing in better than ever before. She also took a lot of time in the beginning helping to teach me how to fill in my brows. Love her and love this place!

33.description: I just went to Arch as part of my sister's bachelorette weekend.  I made appointments for 5 girls for blow-outs and everyone loved the experience.  The shop is adorable and as other reviewers have mentioned, they have a great selection of make-up and other products.  I walked out with a lip balm and lip gloss (also, they don't push the products on you, which I really appreciate).  The blow-out was great and very relaxing and the staff were all very attentive, sweet and knowledgeable.  They even offer you champagne or wine while you are getting your hair done.  All in all, great experience, I just wish they had a location in San Diego!

43.description: This place is ADDICTING!The price is a steal for getting a amazing look that lasts several days, and I always get compliments on my hair afterwards, sometimes 3 days after still.These ladies listen and have a great eye!So recommended.  Abby is particularly talented!

2.description: Had to stop by here to add to my review. I have been going to Arch for like 3 years now but it's incredible that they can continue to impress me more and more with each visit. I won a free blowout at another blow dry bar and it ended up being a three hour disaster. I called Arch in a panic and without question they just said "come here, we don't have a lot of time but we will make it work" with literally 15 minutes - Valerie was able to turn my absolutely nasty ratty previous do into exactly what I had pictured. It was truly amazing. I am trying to figure out how to post pictures on this review now so you can see before and after. Also - as always, Emma is absolute FIRE with make up. No filters - just chantecaille.

18.description: Lauren was an absolute pleasure from start to finish - my brows look better than they ever have before (this is, for what it's worth, absurdly high praise in my book) and Lauren couldn't have been friendlier or more fun to talk to. They also carry pretty much exclusively awesome brands in-store, so I know where I'll be going to stock up on Jouer and Oribe from now on.

41.description: I went to Arch Apothecary for a blowout recently. 1 star for the actual blowout service.4 stars for the ambience and decor of the salon.I am VERY disappointed with the blowout.  The outcome was something I could have easily achieved at home (and do), without the $35 price tag.  If the experience was the very least relaxing, I would have enjoyed it.. but I felt uneasy the entire time feeling I am wasting my money.  When the stylist washed my hair, she missed getting the bottom section of my hair wet.  She dried my hair at such a slow pace, not even attempting to achieve volume in the blowout process.  Isn't that the point of a BLOW OUT?I then got a few waves with the curling iron (again something I can easily do myself).. and when she was finished I needed to point out sections she missed.The conversation with the stylist was her negative self talk.  I left her chair feeling down and in a bad mood.I will NEVER return for a blowout, and feel this was a complete waste of my money.**Final update, my waves fell out before I even left for my event that evening.  I had to add in waves myself at home with my curling iron.  I considered just jumping in the shower and re-doing it myself.

52.description: This review is so overdue. I've been coming to Arch for the past 5 months for my brows. I admit I have done pretty much everything to my brows in the past - threading, plucking, over plucking - but no more! The girls at Arch are fabulous and know exactly what they are doing. My brows have never looked better and fit my face so much better with their expert help!I also got an express facial this week and WOW! I didn't expect much for half an hour and $40 but it was relaxing (minus the blowdryer that started up in the last 5 minutes of my relaxation) and made my face absolutely glow. I will definitely be adding an express facial on to my regular eyebrow wax on a more regular basis now. The only thing I wasn't super impressed by was my blow-out a few weeks back. Don't get me wrong, I wasn't disappointed, I just wasn't super impressed. I felt like I left the salon looking like I had blowdryed my own hair which is fine but not worth the $$. I might give a blow out another try and maybe next time I'll go for a different "look."

50.description: After a couple of less-than-remarkable eyebrow waxings at another salon combined with my unruly and faded out eyebrows, I was resigned to have crummy looking brows. But after coming to Arch Apothecary the past few months I am so very pleased with Emma's magical skills. My brows look fabulous! Thank you, Emma!

4.description: I went in for my first service last week and loved it!! Had my eyebrow wax done by Meghan and they look fantastic! She was super sweet and gave my brows life again.  She also filled them in which is a nice bonus. Plus I purchased the eyebrow pencil I liked it so much. I am an esthetician myself so I can definitely appreciate good work when I see it. The space is also super cute and well maintained. This is definitely my new go to brow place

6.description: The bad...I tried to walk in because I have a gc & they had no availability. Waaawaaawaaa....bummer.I will have to call to make an appointment.The space is super cute. Lots of candles, perfumes, & makeup. I'll be happy when I can actually check out the services.

22.description: LOVE this place!  Kelly usually wrangles my hair for blow-outs.  She is amazing and just a cool chick. I have a lot of hair and she knows exactly what to do to tame my mane.  She is my go-to especially on special occasions.  OK, let's talk lashes for a moment. LASHES!!   Jessica, Lauren, Branden, Emma,and Betsy...you are my lash masters!  Individual lashes are the way to go and I look for any excuse to do so. Me:  "Oh, we need to go to the supermarket?...Sure, no problem...Let me just pop over to Arch for some lashes before we leave."   They look amazing and I feel like my eyes look big, more awake, and I barely have to wear make-up for the next few days after which is fantastic. Nice, cool people that give excellent service.    Run, don't walk to Arch!!!  .....Ok, walking is fine too, I guess.

15.description: Stopped in today because I was looking to pick out a few items from the Jouer makeup collection. Ended up getting an eyebrow wax and tint. Will definitely be back! Old Town definitely has many gems and Arch is one of them.

57.description: Lauren is hands down the best for brows/waxing. I wouldn't trust anyone else!

20.description: FINALLY! A brow place that understands how to keep your brows looking natural! Awesome vibe inside and helpful & friendly staff. The owner, Emma, is in most days and cares about her customers and their experience. Great spot for brow shaping.

36.description: LOVE my eyebrow wax, it is the best I have EVER had. That being said, it is a little pricey since I can get mine done at my nail salon for half the price. The makeup and products are amazing but also very high end so beware if you are on a budget!

14.description: I was torn between writing this review or not, because half of me wants to selfishly keep this place a secret! I was debating going here for a blowout or DryBar, but picked this since it was a local business and slightly cheaper than DryBar. I called an hour ahead and they took me without any issue. I walked into a clean, amazingly cute space that felt airy and comfortable. The two stylists were so friendly and chatty- and offered me a complimentary glass of wine which was much needed after a stressful day. The products used were top of the line & smelt great! I was in & out within ~40 minutes, but didn't feel rushed at all. $35 for the best blowout and style I've had + a glass of wine? I'll be back in no time : )

58.description: I love this little place. My parents used to take me here when I was a little kid and The Fudge Pot is just how I remembered it.I love the various chocolate "things" like the key to the city, the gun, the ninja turtles and much much MORE!I got the Tootsie which was delicious.A little treat from the Fudge Pot is a great way to add some chocolatey goodness to the end of any night.

56.description: This place is not just an Old-Town favorite, ppl come from all over for its sweetness mmgood!!!

29.description: Believe me this is the best English Toffee. The best !!!!

42.description: I wanted to like the chocolate here but the chocolate was not good. Cute store in a quaint neighborhood. The staff wasn't friendly. We bought an entire box of assorted candies and ended up throwing them away. The chocolate was too thick on the covered strawberries. They have a huge assortment of unique fun molded chocolates. But I can't imagine eating one.

23.description: Great place, had Paul make my girlfriend something special.  She loves smores and Paul made us smores on a stick.  It was amazing and it made our night.

47.description: I wish I liked this place. Sure, they may specialize in custom orders and chocolate-shaped bats, but they're missing the foundation of a chocolate shop: delicious chocolate. Did I get the same chocolate that everyone else is reviewing? Their chocolate is too sugary and not chocolate-y at all. I had the dark chocolate almond bark and a chocolate-covered salted caramel and couldn't even finish them. As my friend and I were tasting the chocolate, I said that it was about on-par with Hershey's. He said he thought Hershey's was better. So, yeah... that about sums up The Fudge Pot. :(

8.description: What I would say stands out about The Fudge Pot is the ability to custom mold ANYTHING into chocolate. If they don't have it, they will make it (for a fee, of course). The display case on the back wall showcases chocolate tools, sporting goods, professional tools, animals, toys, letters, people - seriously, they have it all, and all in chocolate. They also have good candies; I bought two "toodles," (pecan caramel turtles), a passion fruit truffle, a Grand Marnier truffle, some peanut butter fudge, and one of my hard-to-find favorites, seafoam aka sponge candy! A little pricey, but most specialty candy/fudge shops do cost a little more. Worth a peek if you're in Old Town.

31.description: I have been going here for years, especially around Christmas for myself and family. I am very disappointed in the low quality chocolate that they changed to. I spent $100 on candies for gifts and for Christmas Eve and I was embarrassed at the chalky and fake flavor that they now have. I won't be going back.

34.description: I stopped in to see if the had sugar free chocolates and they had both dark and milk chocolate! The gentleman that helped me was helpful and had a great sense of humor. I will be back to stock up for Christmas!

16.description: Amazing chocolate... Why else go here right?!!My wife and I left second city with a sweet tooth, walked by the fudge pot at 9:45 on a Sunday night.Still open walked in and bought $35 worth of different fancy chocolate, all amazing.Here comes the worst part........!The lady was a total...yep very mean. Basically the worst part of our 4day vacation in Chicago! Absolutely awful! Obviously they were closing at 10pm but seriously... Not like you could leave early!So upset with the experience! Will I go back? Absolutely! If I see her a again..... I'll write the place off forever!

13.description: Yes Yes Yes I know... the chocolate is good, Very good in fact... however This review is going to focus on the service aspect of this establishment.  Me and Smalls went there today 02/02/2015. This is the third time we have encountered Paul the chocolatier.  he is a man who doesn't seem to like being a chocolatier, as he is very grumpy, and he has been very grumpy every time we go and spend $26 on a small bag of chocolates.Hey Paul, you are not doing us a favor, stop acting like it. I can easily get good tasting premium chocolate for less money at places other than your establishment.if you don't like slinging chocolates... quit.

11.description: The bf started bringing home chocolate covered strawberries for special occasions and I fell in love with them on first bite. The strawberries are always big and sweet and the chocolate is super thick and absolutely delicious. The butter toffee is also really tasty.It's a bit pricey but you get your moneys worth.

39.description: The name says it all - well ok maybe not since they have so much more than just fudge!This is the only place in Chicago that I know of that makes candy apples and I grew up getting them at the fair in the southwest and I was looking for nostalgia. They have cherry and cinnamon and they are wonderful!they have peanut brittle, chocolate covered strawberries, turtles, sea salt caramels, chocolate covered pretzels, white chocolate and so much more!I love to get the sampler box for gifts to chocolate/candy lovers. you cannot go wrong with it and I always get asked WOW where is that from? Enough said!

37.description: I love this place so much. It's such a great place for chocolate.

0.description: During my few days stay in chicago; I frequented The Fudge Pot almost everyday. Christine was ever so diligent and helped me select the Creme de la Creme of the crops in the store. I purchased for my families, friends and colleagues. My favourites are the toffee bark, chocolate strawberries, frozen bananas and of course fudge. Mike helped me on my last day to choose for a special friend. They really offer excellent services and deserve a pay raise. If I know of anyone visiting Chicago, I would highly recommend The Fudge Pot!

38.description: Went there last night with my family...holly sh@t this place rocks. Great selection of chocolate candies....and the milk chocolate raisin cluster was awesome. If you are in their hood, stop in you will not be disappointed

51.description: I wish they had more dark-chocolate delights...   I'm very Interacial when it comes to candy.   What I did have was delicious and the staff was great.

27.description: Great little place for a sweet treat. They don't have a huge variety, but every offering is delicious. I recommend the chocolate-covered pretzels and the vanilla cremes.

32.description: Great little spot for fudge.

54.description: GET BUTTER TOFFEE.  I don't care about anything else.

48.description: Who doesn't love a chocolate shop? They have all the standards you could ask for as well as plenty of chocolate poured into fun little molds. Well priced, good flavor, and a nice spot in Old Town.

44.description: White chocolate with almonds and dark chocolate were so yummy! They have an amazing selection of sweets and I wish I had tried more. It was getting late and they were ready to close, but the staff was so patient answering my questions and letting me wander around undecidely. And now I'm in love with homemade chocolate shops!

24.description: Yummy yum yummy!! Came here last night and spent $15 and got some great dessert for my boyfriend and myself. Great chocolate strawberries. I also bought a "toodle", chocolate covered banana, and a taffy apple. Really cool set up , it's at a basement level, and the fudge station or whatever (where the make all the candy) is right in front for all to see. I also grabbed brochure that lists all the custom chocolate shapes they do for any occasion! Really creative. I told my guy that he best to buy all my holiday and bday chocolate treats from here on out!

7.description: The Fudge Pot has been around forever, and I have been in and out of Old Town a thousand times, but not once did I have the urge to ever go inside. They say it's a Chicago institution. I finally made the jump a few weeks back. And a jump it was, as the store is a few feet below street level. They have a nice little selection, from barks, truffles, toffees. I have to give five stars to to the chocolate covered strawberries. I was a little drunk, but I could still tell they were quality. The place is like a museum, with a display case full of chocolate sculptures. I admit I'm not a huge chocolate person, but I like it on occasions, and the aroma made me want to crash through the glass and chomp away, Pac Man style.

49.description: Came here as part of the Chicago Food Tour. What a find! Great fudge. Great candy. Great chocolate. Nice people. What more can you ask for?Actually, ask for the chocolate covered strawberry. Better yet, ask for 2. It's SOO good.

40.description: I love The Fudge Pot. It's ironic that my favorite item they sell isn't even chocolate. They are one of the few if any places i have found that makes taffy apples that are covered in walnuts and not peanuts. They are awesome! I get one every time i am in that neighborhood. The Toodles are good too, they are pecan clusters with chocolate on top. yum yum yum. :)

53.description: The Fudge Pot is a Chicago institution, and I have been going here for over 40 years since my parents would bring me.  they have all kinds of delicious candy made fresh daily.  My favorites are the chocolate covered strawberries, toffee, and of course the fudge,  They specialize in customized chocolate shapes for any occasion, and the store is lined with cases of chocolate in every conceivable shape.  They also have lollipops in in all sizes and shapes that they will personalize by writing any name or message in frosting on it.  I never go near the Old Town neighborhood without stopping by.

30.description: Great chocolate Oreos, nutter butters, Peanut butter and everything you can cover in chocolate!

46.description: Service was not spectacular-outstanding-oh-my-god, but was very good. Far more importantly, their chocolate covered strawberries are to die for. Even in the middle of winter when all you can find at the groceries store are bitter little thimble-sized strawberries, theirs are gigantic, fresh, and delicious. Wish I knew how they did it.

1.description: This was our fourth stop on the Gold Coast & Old Town Food Tour so I got to try the butter toffee at the the Fudge Pot. I'm not exactly a big fan of chocolate so this review is simply on my experience. This is such a cute little shop that's filled with fudge and different kinds of sweets. They have so many things such as cars, tools, animals, etc that that are all made of chocolate. I love that there are just so many cute things to look at here. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone especially Chocolate Lovers! It's such a cute little shop to just look at regardless if you like chocolate or not. They also have other sweets like caramel apples that looked really good. I will definitely have to come back and try that next time. Anyways, I really enjoyed his place and can't wait to come back to try their caramel apple since it looks really good as well!

55.description: Cute little chocolate shop in the basement of a building right off of wells.  I had a couple of their chocolate covered cherries and was in heaven.  Worth a stop and great to support a local small business.

9.description: My husband brought home two of the world's largest frozen bananas tonight. Full disclosure: we probably eat frozen bananas 4-5 times a week. This was our first experience with the Fudge Pot's. Verdict? Very good. Loved that they were dark chocolate. The bananas were fresh. A true delight in my mouth. The only downside is that they were a little difficult to eat. That said, I expect we'll be back at the Fudge Pot.

26.description: Walking around old town after getting some dinner, we stumbled into this quaint chocolate shop, the window display is a good hook for guests to come in.There's really cool chocolate items in different shapes, just about any shape you could think of actually; chocolate cell phones, chocolate squares with "best dad" written on it, etc.We tried a chocolate covered strawberry and it was insanely fresh like they just dipped it and 2 milk chocolate turtles. I believe we got those 3 items for $8, so the prices are pretty reasonable.  This definitely satisfied our sweet tooth before going into second city for a comedy show.  Cute atmosphere and interesting shapes of chocolate that I hadn't seen anywhere else. I live in lakeview and there aren't many chocolate shops up here, they should definitely build a location! :)

25.description: All of the chocolate makers were super friendly, especially the man I think was the owner. They had many different selections, all of which could be sold individually. I bought 8 or 9 different items and they were all really delicious. Thanks, Fudge Pot!

12.description: Walking around Old Town, BFF & I spotted The Fudge Pot & thought a bit of chocolate would be the perfect nibble on such a brisk autumn dayLots of cute Halloween chocolates, cookies & what I think were cake-pops.....but we went right for the candy casesThe Salted Caramel Chocolate caught my eye & it was heavenly.  Nice thick square of buttery & chewy caramel, covered w/ a perfect layer of dark chocolate.  Not too thick, not too thin.  The salt was more of a hint & just complimented the flavor w/out being overpoweringWould stop by again to pick up a few more nibbles - and when I say few, think dozens

59.description: My husband surprised me with two boxes of chocolates from The Fudge Pot - one with assorted chocolates and one with chocolate covered strawberries. They were both delicious, but I have to give lots of praise to the chocolate covered strawberries: they were covered with just the right amount of chocolate and the strawberries were super fresh - not an easy balance to achieve. I'm a fan!

21.description: The bf started bringing home chocolate covered strawberries for special occasions and I fell in love with them on first bite. The strawberries are always big and sweet and the chocolate is super thick and absolutely delicious. The butter toffee is also really tasty.It's a bit pricey but you get your moneys worth.

17.description: I AM OFFICIALLY A FUDGE POT ADDICT!!!I knew that this review was my second update of the Fudge Pot. I also acknowledged that I went to the Fudge Pot every three days, and the owner recognized me by now. I am so glad that I do not live next to the Fudge Pot. Otherwise, I will not be able to wear my current pants. SO WHAT'S GOOD IN THE FUDGE POT? I highly recommend the FRZOEN CHOCOLATE BANANA! Initially, I was highly skeptical of the banana. Like most of you, I assumed that it would be no different from bananas dipped into chocolate, which I could easily make myself. However, surprisingly, the chocolate was thin and crispy. More importantly, the BANANA tasted like ICE CREAM. I felt like I were in heaven every time I ate this dessert. I would suggest you buying dark chocolate banana. Otherwise, it would be too sweet. I hope that my mum does not read this review. Otherwise, she will start yelling at me for either not sharing the food of the Fudge Pot with her or forcing me to run in the gym.Food: 5Service: 3Decor: 4

10.description: Sometimes the best finds are those that are just..unplanned. A couple friends and I were in Chicago for a wedding and decided to do some exploring on the way to dinner and ended up across from the Fudge Pot. Me, being the ADD sweet tooth I am, pointed my finger across the road and yelled "Let us go to there!" And so that's where our Fudge Pot story began.Walked in and we were drawn to all the chocolates in various forms on display: cars, chocolate boxes, sports memorabilia... ALL made from milk chocolate!Ok ok, so part of me was hating on the chocolate on display because I'm a dark chocolate girl (dark like my heart) and wasn't feelin' the milk chocolate, but I WAS feeling the other chocolates on display! There were "toodles" -- walnut/caramel/chocolate chewies, as well as various chocolate covered items. Put together a little sample box and went on my way, but boy were those toodles delicious!My friend Nicole got the peanut butter white chocolate fudge, which was divine. Knocking off a star due to service -- the ladies behind the counter seemed impatient and not very friendly. Might be due to the fact that they probably get a lot of people coming in not purchasing anything. Not sure of the reason, but would have loved a little more help and a more positive 'tude.

5.description: I went here last week to buy some chocolate for my boyfriend, who is allergic to nuts. I specifically asked the man behind the counter whether or not there were tree nuts in the chocolates I purchased and made it clear I was asking for allergy reasons. As part of my order I purchased three peanut butter fudge chocolates. With these I double checked again with the man behind the counter to ensure there were no tree nuts in the chocolate. He told me there were only peanuts. This morning I gave the chocolates to my boyfriend, who proceeded to have a severe allergy attack. One of the 'peanut butter' chocolates was in fact filled with a tree nut filling. I had a bite and I think it was hazelnut. Do not go here if you have allergies: they don't care enough about their customers to make sure they aren't poisoning them.

3.description: The Fudge Pot has been around since 1963, offering a variety of fudge as well as other sweets, such as caramel apples, chocolate-dipped strawberries, lollipops, toffee, and truffles.  I stopped by to check out their selection, and I was a fan of their 'special order' of the animal-shaped chocolate bars :D  You can see the different assortment behind their 'collection' glass case :D  The staff here are pretty friendly, and if you're in the mood for a sweet treat, check the Fudge Pot out.  They also do great custom orders, such as giant chocolate 'engagement' rings and personal lollipops!+animal-shaped chocolate bars :D

35.description: Great fudge, great toffee, and amazing almonds covered with white chocolate...  Prices are cheap and quality is amazing.

19.description: I love the Fudge Pot products and went there today for my fudge fix.  All three salespersons were on their phones when I walked in.  Two appeared to be texting, tweeting or emailing and the third was talking on her phone.  I bought my fudge and commented on how cute the Halloween chocolates were.  The sales person's response was less than a smile with a "humph."  I was not impressed with the customer service today and the manager or owner should know that his/her employees are not being friendly or attentive, or even giving the appearance of working.

28.description: The fudge pot is a awesome little sweets spot to check out if you are in the old town neigborhood. I've tried the truffles here, the peanut brittle and the fudge as well. All of their fudge is made fresh and when you order you just tell them how much you want and they cut you a slice from one of the many selections they have behind the counter. they also have a cool display case that showcases all of the neat creations they either have made or can make. I'm not sure if any of that stuff is for sale but I'm guessing it's just for show. Also, another thing that is a plus about this place is that it's fairly reasonably priced for what you get. Great value in my opinion.

45.description: I found cinnamon and cherry candy apples here! And for only $3 a pop! Aside from finally finding a place that sells one of my favorite treats here in Chicago... I recommend visiting to peruse the chocolate display cases. From handcuffs to cars to trinkets and boxes everything is made of milk chocolate. The workers are very friendly and I would recommend seeing this place at least once....just don't go buying all of my candy apples.

33.description: Walking around Old Town, BFF & I spotted The Fudge Pot & thought a bit of chocolate would be the perfect nibble on such a brisk autumn dayLots of cute Halloween chocolates, cookies & what I think were cake-pops.....but we went right for the candy casesThe Salted Caramel Chocolate caught my eye & it was heavenly.  Nice thick square of buttery & chewy caramel, covered w/ a perfect layer of dark chocolate.  Not too thick, not too thin.  The salt was more of a hint & just complimented the flavor w/out being overpoweringWould stop by again to pick up a few more nibbles - and when I say few, think dozens

43.description: The Fudge Pot has been in Old Town since 1963... Lots of changes to the neighborhood but this is still a family run business going into its 3rd generation. Best Bets: Walnut Caramel Apple, English Toffee, Turtles. Great prices. Ask to see the XXX novelty book (if you are over 21).

2.description: Shopped here a few moons ago and the chocolate was on point. Glad I reencountered the opportunity to be able to go again.

18.description: The fudge pot is a awesome little sweets spot to check out if you are in the old town neigborhood. I've tried the truffles here, the peanut brittle and the fudge as well. All of their fudge is made fresh and when you order you just tell them how much you want and they cut you a slice from one of the many selections they have behind the counter. they also have a cool display case that showcases all of the neat creations they either have made or can make. I'm not sure if any of that stuff is for sale but I'm guessing it's just for show. Also, another thing that is a plus about this place is that it's fairly reasonably priced for what you get. Great value in my opinion.

41.description: This place packs so much fudge. A big variety to select from.

52.description: BEFORE YOU DO ANYTHING: look in the white binder! They have really fun gag gifts or things for bachelor/bachelorette parties. Otherwise, the caramel/chocolate apples are amazing! The caramel you can buy is also great! Whenever I go there I always buy some extra chocolate-covered marshmallows and orange peels for the way back!

50.description: I AM OFFICIALLY A FUDGE POT ADDICT!!!I knew that this review was my second update of the Fudge Pot. I also acknowledged that I went to the Fudge Pot every three days, and the owner recognized me by now. I am so glad that I do not live next to the Fudge Pot. Otherwise, I will not be able to wear my current pants. SO WHAT'S GOOD IN THE FUDGE POT? I highly recommend the FRZOEN CHOCOLATE BANANA! Initially, I was highly skeptical of the banana. Like most of you, I assumed that it would be no different from bananas dipped into chocolate, which I could easily make myself. However, surprisingly, the chocolate was thin and crispy. More importantly, the BANANA tasted like ICE CREAM. I felt like I were in heaven every time I ate this dessert. I would suggest you buying dark chocolate banana. Otherwise, it would be too sweet. I hope that my mum does not read this review. Otherwise, she will start yelling at me for either not sharing the food of the Fudge Pot with her or forcing me to run in the gym.Food: 5Service: 3Decor: 4

4.description: Would you look at that! My 400th review and i didn't even realize it! :)Butter toffee! I didn't even like toffee before I tried this at The Fudge Pot. I fell in love with this delicious treat when I went on a Chicago Food Planet Tour to explore the Gold Coast/Old Town. The day we tried some, I went back to buy and was excited to have a coupon to use. The toffee was gone within 1 day of being home..Delicious chocolate covering the best part - the buttery crunchy toffee.. I'm salivating as I'm writing this review.. They also have it in dark chocolate for those fans.I spent some time looking for something close, but sadly, nothing compares..So I went back again recently and made a deliberate stop to come here and get their toffee! Mike helped me out and, as it turns out, was the same guy who helped me the year (or 2) before :)I wish I had pictures of the foods, but eating it was more important :) If you can get here, go! Try the toffee, it is delicious! :)

6.description: Spoiler Alert: Best milk chocolate covered marshmallows EVER. This family owned establishment has been making chocolate in Old Town over 50 years since 1963, it's the real deal. Chocolate, toffee, fudge, truffles, toffee apples covered in many yummy things they make it all right there. The inside is plastered with kitschy decor including signed celebrity pics, sports memorabilia, and paraphenalia related to famous fudge devotees. I have brought out of town guests and friends and often send this chocolate as gifts in the mail and gotten rave reviews all around. One of my favorite spots in Chicago!

22.description: Every possible shape and flavor of chocolate you can imagine. Great food gifts and party favors.

15.description: Hard-working chocolate shop. Easily popped in for a couple Toodles to go...they were perfect.

57.description: Fudge Pot is BOMB!!  If you like chocolate and other assorted sweet treats you will love this place!  I love getting the peanut butter and chocolate cups but I would probably eat just about anything in there.  Their candy apples look amazing and they have the best assortment of decorative chocolates that would be perfect to give away as gifts.  I love this place!

20.description: Sometimes the best finds are those that are just..unplanned. A couple friends and I were in Chicago for a wedding and decided to do some exploring on the way to dinner and ended up across from the Fudge Pot. Me, being the ADD sweet tooth I am, pointed my finger across the road and yelled "Let us go to there!" And so that's where our Fudge Pot story began.Walked in and we were drawn to all the chocolates in various forms on display: cars, chocolate boxes, sports memorabilia... ALL made from milk chocolate!Ok ok, so part of me was hating on the chocolate on display because I'm a dark chocolate girl (dark like my heart) and wasn't feelin' the milk chocolate, but I WAS feeling the other chocolates on display! There were "toodles" -- walnut/caramel/chocolate chewies, as well as various chocolate covered items. Put together a little sample box and went on my way, but boy were those toodles delicious!My friend Nicole got the peanut butter white chocolate fudge, which was divine. Knocking off a star due to service -- the ladies behind the counter seemed impatient and not very friendly. Might be due to the fact that they probably get a lot of people coming in not purchasing anything. Not sure of the reason, but would have loved a little more help and a more positive 'tude.

36.description: The workers here are so rude and kind of intimidating. They rush you by constantly asking you "are you ready or what?" When there is NO ONE else in the store, while the other employees laugh. Only reason they are getting 2 stars is because the chocolate is awesome. Will probly be back for it, but I'm not excited about the service..... At all.

14.description: Always the best quality candy. I've been going to The Fudge Pot for decades. Never varies, its just the finest candy you can get! Great quality and value.

3.description: Amazing tan that stays really long time. I look really like after being on Hawaii. Love the Eva, she is very nice and makes you to feel comfortable. Defenetly will be back :)

1.description: I highly recommend EcoTan. I needed to get a quick spray tan before a trip to Miami last month (so I could have some semblance of color prior to arriving in the sun-drenched beaches) and the staff at EcoTan was very quick to accommodate (it was a last minute booking and they shifted their schedule around to make sure they could take me in). Beyond being a great alternative to getting burned by the sun or getting microwaved in a tanning booth, the spray tan results looked way better than I expected (it was my first time!). The staff there are super friendly and work with exact precision to not only match you up with the right level of tan you're looking to obtain, but to also spend a good amount of time making sure they hit every spot. Overall it was a great experience. I was kind of nervous coming in as it was my first time getting a direct spray tan, but that quickly changed as I met the staff and they put me at ease. Again, I definitely recommend EcoTan to everyone out there seeking to get some color as we are now hitting the summer season!

2.description: Great service! My tan looked so natural . My place for healthy sun !

0.description: I have been going to EcoTan for about 4 months now.  Since I am slightly allergic to the sun a organic spray tan is just what I need to perfect that tan complexion that I want.  Eva is great! She knows what she is doing and the results have always been the best.  I tried Ortanic and the results did not even compare to EcoTan.  I could totally tell the difference between the two as Ortanic's looked orange and burnt, while EcoTan looked more tan and natural.I recommend EcoTan to anyone looking to get a nice summer glow w/o the appearance of looking like a Oompa Loompa!

4.description: Eva was great- the first time.  I initially went in for a spray tan a couple of months ago.  it was a great experience- she was on time, professional and my tan looked great.  I made a second appointment last week.  Although there is a contact phone # listed on her website, they will not actually make her appointments for her and I was told to make my appointment online.  I followed the directions, received a comfirmation email and showed up for my appointment.  I waited over 20 minutes before the owner of the salon- who just happened to be there- contacted Eva to find out where she was (she was not physically in the building).  She told the owner that the appointment had been cancelled.  I then spoke with her directly and told her that I did not cancel my appointment and she proceeded to tell me that they only way it could have been cancelled was by me.  I reiterated that I hadn't touched the system since I made the initial appointment.  She then apologized and offered me a free tan the very next day.  Again, I showed up and guess who wasn't there AGAIN?!?!?!?  I waited 20 minutes and left. The salon offers no assistance as I was told repeatedly "she doesn't work for the salon, she just rents space."   I'm not sure what the problem was, but this is no way to run a business.  I will be going elsewhere from now on.

58.description: To me, a restaurant having good food is not enough.  It has to be a full experience and Orso's certainly is.  When you walk in you are greeted with lots of dark wood and old world charm complimented by Big Band music or The Rat Pack's greatest hits. The menu is very old school Italian with no surprises but in it's own way that sets Orso's apart.  So many places try to re-invent the wheel but much like the overall image they convey... Orso's likes to keep it traditional.So far I've tried three entrees and they were all lovely but the stand out dish is the Tortellaci Al Prosciutto.  Wonderfully flavorful and filling and when paired with the Santa Margarita Pinto Grigio, a fantastic meal.  The Veal Saltimbocca is also a good bet.The only gripe I have with Orso's is the hit and miss service.  A friend of mine and I have gone here numerous times and we're never quite sure which kind of service we are going to get.  It could be either excellent or quite spotty.In short, if you are looking for a time capsule or intimate date setting, give this Chicago institution a shot!

56.description: I've been coming to Orso's for about 20 years now. Even had a graduation dinner there. Great service, love the ambiance, and the garden in the back is great in the summer. That said, I no longer eat here because, well, I can think of a number of better Italian restaurants whose prices accurately reflect the quality of the food. While the food is good, it's just not special in any way. The chefs should be mildly ashamed of themselves for not doing more. It's like they simply don't recognize that competition exists. Honestly, anyone with average cooking capabilities can make many of their menu items at home. IT TASTES STORE BOUGHT, and that's not good for a restaurant that presents itself as upscale. When I eat somewhere, the last thing I want running through my mind is how easily I could make the dish at home, let alone improve upon it. I'm sorry Orso's, but your cuisine is quickly becoming irrelevant, and as a long time patron, this makes me sad.

29.description: Vegetarians! Jalopeno Gnocchi is to die for!

42.description: Stopped in for quick lunch while in town from AZ. Great ambiance and charm best describes this jewel. Lunch was amazing and came out of the kitchen fast. I have been here for dinner on my last visit and it was wonderful as well. I will be back!

23.description: We came here for dinner due to the close proximity to the UP Comedy Club for the 8pm show. Plus this time I had the chance to check out the back patio.  This was a small birthday event too so I brought in a mini cake to the restaurant. The host and waitress were nice and accommodating to hide the cake and bring it out later with a candle. On Mondays, wine bottles are half off (that was a pleasant surprise). the 4 of us decided to share the fried calamari and 2 pasta entrees. Tortellini with prosciutto in cream sauce was so good that it's so bad for you because it was rich and yummy. The Fumigato, penne with chicken and mushrooms, didn't disappoint either and it was good contrast to the previous dish. I was slightly nervous that the service may be slow (based on previous reviews) in order to catch the 8pm show. For this reason, I kept the waitress informed when we ordered and flagged her down when we needed something. This worked well for all of us.

47.description: I love their pizza! my favorite! People there are very friendly. Best pizza i have ever had!

8.description: Orso's isn't great. I came to a bridal shower and the service was awesome and so was the food. The cheese pizza was so good, the pasta and meatballs melted in my mouth, and the cake from portillos topped it off. I came here a second time and shared a plate of fumigato with a friend. It hit the spot! My new fav Italian place in the city.

31.description: We have dined with friend's and family here on many various week nights.  The service, food quality, and house wines are always spot on excellent!  The vodka sauce is the best ever.  Spinach ravioli and meat ravioli dishes are among our favorites. You have to try this and you will surely become an Orso's fan.  Atmosphere is the real thing.  Just like going back in time to the old Chicago days too.

34.description: When I get served overcooked pasta - to the point where several pieces of pasta have fallen apart, I get sad. I get disappointed because an Italian restaurant should know better and that's just one of the basic rules to cooking pasta. All of our pasta dishes (four to be exact) were served with over cooked pasta. I ordered the Fumigato - which incorporated grilled chicken and a tomato cream sauce. The sauce was quite tasty - definitely Americanized, but tasty. The chicken, however, reminded me of the stuff you can buy frozen at the grocery store. It was very tough. I can see the appeal though, the portions were huge and the ambience and service was quite nice. I'm just not sure I fell in love with the mushy pasta.

16.description: Stopped in for quick lunch while in town from AZ. Great ambiance and charm best describes this jewel. Lunch was amazing and came out of the kitchen fast. I have been here for dinner on my last visit and it was wonderful as well. I will be back!

13.description: Orso's has long been my family's go-to restaurant. Having spent countless evenings at our usual circular table by the piano, I can assure you that this establishment is one of Chicago's finest. Any good Italian will tell you that Orso's has the most authentic cuisine in the city. This family owned and family operated gem of Oldtown will knock your socks off. I recommend the following:Between six or seven of us...we typically begin with two bottles of wine, two orders of fried calamari, and two orders of mussels (we're Italian...hold the judgement). My standard order is the fumigato - rigatoni pasta with mushrooms and grilled chicken bathed in a cream tomato sauce. Its perfection prohibits me from enjoying most other pastas. My brother usually orders the veal marsala with a cup of minestrone. My parents rotate between the jalapeno gnocchi and the lasagna bolognese. Additionally, I would like to note that the portions at Orso's are, by definition, enormous. Everything on the menu, and I do mean everything, is mouthwatering. I have to conclude this review because I'm still five days away from returning to my beloved Orso's again. I live in Washington, D.C. now and every Italian restaurant pales in comparison.

11.description: Was able to try this place during Chicago Restaurant Week so my husband and I, along with another couple, could sample a variety of appetizers and pastas. I love me some legit Italian pasta and this place is it! Topo Gigio right down the street is my go-to suggestion for people coming into the city for Italian but this is going to be my runner-up suggestion.Started with the fried Calamari which was not only fried perfectly but were good pieces of calamari and almost melted in your mouth. The table also tried steamed mussles (which I didn't) and demolished them almost instantly. The Caesar salad is made with their homemade dressing which I actually didn't care for. It wasn't creamy enough for me and was almost too tart. For entrees we tried the jalapeno gnocchi which definitely had a kick to it (and also not as rave-able as some other reviews here make it seem), the fumigato of rigatoni pasta with fresh mushrooms (normally comes with chicken but I did without) and THIS entrée was amazing beyond amazing - such a great mix of mushrooms to pasta and creamed sauce. The great thing is you can always mix and match sauces with the entrees, so if you want alfredo sauce instead of tomato sauce, they can do that for you.Our waitress was great and just attentive enough without being overbearing.

39.description: I came here with my boyfriend on Valentine's day after trying their pasta at my work's Fooda setup. We made reservations for 6pm, but at the time it wasn't very busy. When we got to our table, our candle wasn't lit, but that was no big deal. I got the Fumigato and he got the chicken parm. The food took a decent amount of time to come out, but we had bread and olive oil to tide us over. The food wasn't the best I've had, but it was still really good.

37.description: One of my favorite places to go for Lasagna. Its a nice cozy neighborhood joint with friendly service. The outdoor patio is nice in the summer.

0.description: Lovely ambiance and delicious food make this one of my new favorite Italian restaurants in THE city for Italian restaurants.  Orso's has a beautifully lit and very large patio that just feels like you're on the streets of Florence ducking in for a romantic meal.  This venue is probably pretty awesome for hosting private parties and events in the summer time, with such a spacious patio area and beautiful decor.  Also great for a date night - loud enough that it's not too silently awkward and yet still intimate and beautiful to create a romantic atmosphere.They graciously accommodated our baby and our friends' baby with the accompanying strollers and helped us get set up on a Saturday evening.  We were immediately served warm bread with olive oil and parmesan to get started.  We were just going for a quick dinner with our newborns so we didn't dabble into the drink menu but I would love to go back for a leisurely glass of wine from which I assume is a pretty good selection.My husband ordered the jalapeno gnocci with the vodka sauce and arrabiata sauce on the side.  It was delicious!  I could have gone for a bit more jalapeno kick, but both sauces were absolutely divine.  I ordered the capellini melissa and it was also excellent.  Plump and larger shrimp that tasted fresh and a delicious garlicky sauce.  Both dishes were perfection, just depends on what texture and taste you're in the mood for.Orso's definitely takes pride in what they do and they do it very well.  Service was very prompt and friendly.  They were very accommodating with our babies and during the ordering process.  And the food was absolutely fantastic.  I'll happily come back, just wish I lived closer to the Old town neighborhood for it.  Or maybe they can move to Logan Square?

38.description: It's worth mentioning that I've only been here once, but their tortellaci al prosciutto was probably one of the most delicious pasta dishes I've ever had. It was rich and savory, but the sauce did not drown out the veal. I can't remember what my girlfriend had but she said hers was incredible too. We had the calamari as an appetizer which was great as well, crispy, tender and hot. The only thing I did not like was the pretty cramped interior, but the decor was inviting and the food was good enough that I'll definitely be wanting to come back.

51.description: Checked out Orso's the other night for the first time. I honestly didn't know it existed as it is unassuming from the outside.My one complaint is that we were seated in the basement which seemed a little outdated and stuffy. But other than that, loved both the food and the service! Our waitress was awesome and even comped is one of our wine carafes. Who is NOT into that? She also had great suggestions as to what we should order.Food:-complimentary bread/foccacia: so good. Put some oil and Parmesan cheese in front of me and who really needs a main course-Rigatoni Paisano: perfection. Rigatoni with plentiful sausage, peas, and thinly slice mushrooms (important because I don't love huge mushroom chunks) in a red sauce. Yum!Would definitely recommend to others!

27.description: Yawn! That should sum up my experience here. Service is very slow and the food is barely average. The ambience of the place is fantastic but the other elements just bring it down. We ordered the sausage and peppers for our appetizer and it was average. Dinner included the caesar salad and the veal stuffed tortellini which was again very average. Did I mention the service is suuuuper slow?A Debbie downer in old town so stay away I say!

32.description: I wanted to give this place a positive review based on all the hype, but this was a mediocre experience at best. The waitstaff is attentive and seemingly on top of it, but the kitchen is unbelievably slow. It took approximately 40 minutes to get our appetizer and an hour to get our salad. I decided to cut our losses and leave before waiting even longer for our entree.

54.description: Had the gluten free pasta option (since I'm gluten free)... It was delicious. They have outdoor seating in the front and back. Nice and quiet on a weeknight. Great wine. Very romantic with lights outside and heaters.

48.description: I had pizza here a couple of weeks ago. It was terrible. It was 85% cheese with a crust like a microwavable pizza from the corner bodega.  We both ate one piece and took the rest to take home. We then decided it wasn't even worth the trouble and tried to find a homeless person to donate to. We couldn't find one so just threw it in the garbage. Also, they sat us at the first table when you walk in the front door so it seemed like everyone who walked in was sitting at our table.Not going back for pizza.

44.description: Never again.  Ordered delivery of 4 meals + salads/soup. I had the order taker repeat the order back to me...just to be sure.  Delivery took 1.5 hours which is understandable as it's a Saturday night and Valentines day. They delivered in the time frame quoted.   good start. Unfortunately, the order was missing 1 meal (fyi: that's a 25% failure rate).
