The missing meal is not even on the receipt (so much for having someone confirm my order).  Still, not an issue until I call to let them know and I get an unapologetic "we didn't charge you for it, right?".  No, no you didn't charge me but I also just waited 1.5 hours and have no meal but I guess that's acceptable.  He offered to send it ...it might take another 40 minutes.  I turned him down but quickly decided to call back since I'm at work anyway, might as well just wait.  I called back within 5 minutes to be told it would now take another 1.5 hours to get 1 PASTA DISH that THEY jacked up the order on. Really? Messing up a delivery order is not that big of a deal, acting like you couldn't give a damn when your customer calls is enough to lose my business. see ya.

24.description: They took our last minute reservation on Father's Day and we were able to sit outside, which was exactly what my father wanted on his day! The food was good, fresh warm bread and had the stuffed peppers - which could have used a side of broccoli or something else with it. My brother gnocchi was sharp and spicy - just like it should be since it was jalapeño and my mother loved the fish dish she ordered. There were a lot of younger families there so it is a perfect place to take the parents or the little kids, to enjoy some al fresco dining.

7.description: Nope, nope, nope, nope. I selected Orso's for a group dinner before a show at Second City ONLY because of its location. It's a hop, skip, and a jump away from the comedy venue. I'd read the reviews and saw people mention slow service a couple times, but...I recognize that every restaurant has an off night from time to time. But I think "off night" is how this restaurant rolls. We arrived a couple minutes for our 6:00 pm reservation and were told we could sit on the gorgeous patio. (it's really beautiful - like an urban oasis filled with grape vines) We got water and some fresh, crusty bread quickly...but then everything fell apart. I'll spare you my sob story, but just know that our one appetizer - a bianco pizza - didn't arrive for nearly an hour after we ordered. An hour! Our server seemed to be intentionally dodging us, too. He must have known we would be kind of ticked off about sitting and waiting for an entire hour to get something I could make in my kitchen in 10 minutes.After the appetizer arrived, and it was approaching 7:30, I had to tell our waiter that we needed our food ASAP if we were going to make it to our 8:00 show. Nearly an hour and a half after we ordered, our food arrived, leaving us about 10 minutes to wolf everything down. That's no way to enjoy a meal. While we were eating, our server dropped off our check but didn't come back to take our credit cards and we had to hunt him down. Half of our party went ahead to Second City while the other half stayed behind to make sure our bill got squared away.I eat out. Often. And I've never had such service. Or such slow service. Please DO NOT eat here if you expect to get in and out in 2 hours and/or need to be somewhere at a specific time. It will ruin your night.

49.description: Good Italian food in Old Town. They have a large menu to choose from and they also have seasonal and holiday specials.What's probably the best feature of this restaurant though, is their patio. In the summer, there is very little that beats their open air dinner experience.I always come here for a meal that I know will make me happy!

40.description: Was able to try this place during Chicago Restaurant Week so my husband and I, along with another couple, could sample a variety of appetizers and pastas. I love me some legit Italian pasta and this place is it! Topo Gigio right down the street is my go-to suggestion for people coming into the city for Italian but this is going to be my runner-up suggestion.Started with the fried Calamari which was not only fried perfectly but were good pieces of calamari and almost melted in your mouth. The table also tried steamed mussles (which I didn't) and demolished them almost instantly. The Caesar salad is made with their homemade dressing which I actually didn't care for. It wasn't creamy enough for me and was almost too tart. For entrees we tried the jalapeno gnocchi which definitely had a kick to it (and also not as rave-able as some other reviews here make it seem), the fumigato of rigatoni pasta with fresh mushrooms (normally comes with chicken but I did without) and THIS entrée was amazing beyond amazing - such a great mix of mushrooms to pasta and creamed sauce. The great thing is you can always mix and match sauces with the entrees, so if you want alfredo sauce instead of tomato sauce, they can do that for you.Our waitress was great and just attentive enough without being overbearing.

53.description: I ordered take out from here so can't comment on the atmosphere. The eggplant parmagiana dinner was huge! For the first time, there was actually more eggplant than pasta! The slices of eggplant were thin but very big pieces. Lots of cheese and lots of sauce. Sauce was pretty good - not too sweet which is how I like it. It came with some penne which I wish there was more of and some nice sliced toasted Italian bread. Very affordable for a quick nothing fancy dinner.

30.description: Nope, nope, nope, nope. I selected Orso's for a group dinner before a show at Second City ONLY because of its location. It's a hop, skip, and a jump away from the comedy venue. I'd read the reviews and saw people mention slow service a couple times, but...I recognize that every restaurant has an off night from time to time. But I think "off night" is how this restaurant rolls. We arrived a couple minutes for our 6:00 pm reservation and were told we could sit on the gorgeous patio. (it's really beautiful - like an urban oasis filled with grape vines) We got water and some fresh, crusty bread quickly...but then everything fell apart. I'll spare you my sob story, but just know that our one appetizer - a bianco pizza - didn't arrive for nearly an hour after we ordered. An hour! Our server seemed to be intentionally dodging us, too. He must have known we would be kind of ticked off about sitting and waiting for an entire hour to get something I could make in my kitchen in 10 minutes.After the appetizer arrived, and it was approaching 7:30, I had to tell our waiter that we needed our food ASAP if we were going to make it to our 8:00 show. While we were eating, our server dropped off our check but didn't come back to take our credit cards and we had to hunt him down. Half of our party went ahead to Second City while the other half stayed behind to make sure our bill got squared away.I eat out. Often. And I've never had such service. Or such slow service. Please DO NOT eat here if you expect to get in and out in 2 hours and/or need to be somewhere at a specific time. It will ruin your night.

46.description: Quaint & unassuming restaurant tucked away on N Wells St. Romantic interiors - try and get a table by the window or the 1st floorMy favorite: Chicken Marsala

1.description: Orso's is a visually beautiful restaurant with average food.  We were in a section of the restaurant with a trio of gold chandliers, and I saw a gorgeous piano in the main section.  These accents were very pretty!For my main course, I ordered capellini melissa served with sun dried tomatoes, peas, and small shrimps in a tomato sauce.  I had to use salt and cheese to give it some flavor.  After sampling the eggplant parmigiana and jalapeño gnocchi from my friends, I thought everything tasted very one-note and plain.  The highlight of the evening was tiramitsu for dessert.  It was very light, airy and delicious!  With such great Italian food just across the street, I expected a little more.  However, if ambiance is what you're after, this is the place.

55.description: Amazing food and great customer service. The waiter was great about recommending wine.

9.description: I can understand how people who feel the service was slow. I think that maybe the kitchen's fault as our waiter was attentive. But then again it did take a long time to get a glass of wine.I had a voucher to use and we had a hard time getting to $60. I had just one glass of wine and my boyfriend only had water. That was part of the reason. I got the special pasta with crab even. It was ok. A little heavy. Nothing offensive, and nothing memorable either. My boyfriend got the chicken which was huge. We got tiramisu to-go which was the best part of the meal. I think they make it there. It was delicious but not worth the drive and parking hassle for just that. It wasn't bad. Just another Italian place in Chicago. The lady playing the piano was nice.

26.description: Orso's isn't great. I came to a bridal shower and the service was awesome and so was the food. The cheese pizza was so good, the pasta and meatballs melted in my mouth, and the cake from portillos topped it off. I came here a second time and shared a plate of fumigato with a friend. It hit the spot! My new fav Italian place in the city.

25.description: We had our wedding here and reception! Everything about it was amazing! Staff went above and beyond! Food was so delicious and the venue was so romantic and quant!

12.description: Hate to slam the place--FANTASTIC BAR with a real piano player--pizza sucks

59.description: First off, major, major, MAJOR props for their outdoor space.  I've lived in the neighborhood for ten years and I've seen the ground-level dining area.  I didn't know that up the stairs, there's a peaceful little oasis with flowers and strings of lights.  It was an absolutely perfect spot for a meal.The problem with being in a secluded area of a restaurant?  You're not going to see the waiters that often.  Our water glasses fell dangerously low multiple times.I tried the jalapeno gnocchi and I'm still not sure what I thought of it.  The heat from the jalepeno doesn't kick in until after you swallow it.  It was an interesting flavor, but not really my cup of tea for an Italian joint.My girlfriend ordered the fumigato (rigatoni pasta with fresh mushrooms and grilled chicken in a rich tomato cream sauce).  It just tasted bland.We also split the pizza bianco (Italian style thin crust pizza drizzled with garlic-herb oil, topped with a blend of fontina, mozzarella and goat cheese, topped with fresh arugula tossed in a lemon vinaigrette).  Also bland.  And the crust was a flavorless cracker.Also wasn't a huge fan of my wine - the Stemmari pinot noir.  I almost always go with pinot or merlot, but this glass gave me a headache.For my money, Viaggio at the Park is the best Italian I've had in Chicago.  Orso's is, you know, fine.  But considering the ambiance, it's a shame it's not better.

21.description: Just finished dinner here. The ambiance was great! The food was excellent. Paul was our server and made our night!

17.description: Stumbled across this restaurant and it is definitely a wow! The patio on the outside has a great atmosphere and reminds me of New Orleans. The wine list is incredible and both dishes I ordered with my mom were so delicious (the filet and the capellini Melissa). Will definitely be going back!

10.description: First off, major, major, MAJOR props for their outdoor space.  I've lived in the neighborhood for ten years and I've seen the ground-level dining area.  I didn't know that up the stairs, there's a peaceful little oasis with flowers and strings of lights.  It was an absolutely perfect spot for a meal.The problem with being in a secluded area of a restaurant?  You're not going to see the waiters that often.  Our water glasses fell dangerously low multiple times.I tried the jalapeno gnocchi and I'm still not sure what I thought of it.  The heat from the jalepeno doesn't kick in until after you swallow it.  It was an interesting flavor, but not really my cup of tea for an Italian joint.My girlfriend ordered the fumigato (rigatoni pasta with fresh mushrooms and grilled chicken in a rich tomato cream sauce).  It just tasted bland.We also split the pizza bianco (Italian style thin crust pizza drizzled with garlic-herb oil, topped with a blend of fontina, mozzarella and goat cheese, topped with fresh arugula tossed in a lemon vinaigrette).  Also bland.  And the crust was a flavorless cracker.Also wasn't a huge fan of my wine - the Stemmari pinot noir.  I almost always go with pinot or merlot, but this glass gave me a headache.For my money, Viaggio at the Park is the best Italian I've had in Chicago.  Orso's is, you know, fine.  But considering the ambiance, it's a shame it's not better.

5.description: We came here for dinner due to the close proximity to the UP Comedy Club for the 8pm show. Plus this time I had the chance to check out the back patio.  This was a small birthday event too so I brought in a mini cake to the restaurant. The host and waitress were nice and accommodating to hide the cake and bring it out later with a candle. On Mondays, wine bottles are half off (that was a pleasant surprise). the 4 of us decided to share the fried calamari and 2 pasta entrees. Tortellini with prosciutto in cream sauce was so good that it's so bad for you because it was rich and yummy. The Fumigato, penne with chicken and mushrooms, didn't disappoint either and it was good contrast to the previous dish. I was slightly nervous that the service may be slow (based on previous reviews) in order to catch the 8pm show. For this reason, I kept the waitress informed when we ordered and flagged her down when we needed something. This worked well for all of us.

3.description: Jalapeño gnocchi was overcooked but the chicken parm and steak were very delicious. for four people and two bottles of wine the total bill was around $170. Not bad.

35.description: Went for a business meeting.  Food and service were great.

19.description: Never again.  Ordered delivery of 4 meals + salads/soup. I had the order taker repeat the order back to me...just to be sure.  Delivery took 1.5 hours which is understandable as it's a Saturday night and Valentines day. They delivered in the time frame quoted.   good start. Unfortunately, the order was missing 1 meal (fyi: that's a 25% failure rate). Really? Messing up a delivery order is not that big of a deal, acting like you couldn't give a damn when your customer calls is enough to lose my business. see ya.

But then again it did take a long time to get a glass of wine.I had a voucher to use and we had a hard time getting to $60. I had just one glass of wine and my boyfriend only had water. That was part of the reason. I got the special pasta with crab even. It was ok. A little heavy. Nothing offensive, and nothing memorable either. My boyfriend got the chicken which was huge. We got tiramisu to-go which was the best part of the meal. I think they make it there. It was delicious but not worth the drive and parking hassle for just that. It wasn't bad. Just another Italian place in Chicago. The lady playing the piano was nice.

45.description: Orso's is fabulous!!! My husband and I have eaten at this restaurant many times and it never disappoints!I decided I finally had to write this review after they catered an event for me this weekend. I had 50 people at my home for a party and they were wonderful every step of the way. From walking me through the order process and helping me gauge how much food to order (I would have ordered way more than I needed to!) to adding a last minute menu change the morning of the party. They were pleasant and helpful when I was stressed to the max. Their delivery staff not only delivered the food, but helped me set-up my entire food station and stayed a little longer to make sure it was just the way I wanted it from a presentation stand-point.Everyone at my party raved about the food! Please consider them for catering your next event; they will not disappoint!

33.description: We're at Orso's now. No idea if the food is good. We were seated 55 minutes ago and have yet to be served.

43.description: It was ok. I was disappointed that they stuck us down in the basement when there were tons of open tables upstairs by the piano player. The basement isn't a nice atmosphere.

2.description: 3 stars really encapsulates this place well. The food was decently priced (not too pricey, not too cheap) and the service was there, but it wasn't stellar. My girlfriend and I went on a great Saturday afternoon. We split the Italian Grinder sandwich which was about $7 if I recall correctly. It came with your choice of sides; we got the potato wedges. The sandwich was really, really oily (which some people like) and overall just kinda disappointing. It was over-fried, floppy, and looked and tasted like something I could have made at home. In essence it was nothing more than a glorified grilled cheese with meat that I paid $7 for. The potato wedges were similar. They were cooked the right amount but they were drowned in oil and garlic. As for the service, it really let me down. The restaurant provides endless warm bread, which was really tasty, but for some reason the server brought out grated cheese with it. I asked for olive oil the next time he came by but he never brought it out, even though he acknowledged that he understood my request. In my opinion, an Italian restaurant should be stocked with olive oil, and the killer thing is that I saw a bottle of it right through the window (since we were sitting outside). But alas, my olive oil never came. Our "main server," who actually took our order and got our bill, was too casual and acted as if he could have done without our business. He wasn't mean but he wasn't friendly either. He was just there. I would give this place one more chance, but if my second time there is anything like the first I won't be going back.

18.description: Yawn! That should sum up my experience here. Service is very slow and the food is barely average. The ambience of the place is fantastic but the other elements just bring it down. We ordered the sausage and peppers for our appetizer and it was average. Dinner included the caesar salad and the veal stuffed tortellini which was again very average. Did I mention the service is suuuuper slow?A Debbie downer in old town so stay away I say!

41.description: Nice, casual, Italian fare.  Reasonable to high end prices.  Nice outdoor area during the nicer months.  Nice location.  Sausage appetizer was good with a beer.

52.description: We ate in the back room and it was so cute. Loved the lighting, and the bartender was chatty enough with us that it was nice without being weird. My friend was a half hour late, so I ended up talking with the bartender and a regular for awhile on my own, very welcoming. I loved that in the back they had the heaters kick on once it cooled off. Service was well-timed, food was amazing, I got a penne dish that was supposed to have mushrooms, but I subbed them for peas instead, and it was great. My friend and I split a salad with goat cheese that was super good.

50.description: Nice restaurant with good Italian food.  They have a really nice courtyard out back for the summer.

4.description: This place was only okay. I must say the service was great; the hostesses were welcoming and the waitress we had was helpful. But the food did not live up to the rest of the environment. We walked in and it looked super fancy. There was a lady on the piano, the lighting was dim, and the tables were candle-lit and had nice table cloths; very elegant all around. But then the food came. Subpar. We had the grilled calamari for an appetizer and it was hard to finish. Then we got a pizza (12 in for the two of us). Def had enough for leftover, but probably more than we expected. The pizza was pretty salty, but the crust and sauce were good. Don't know if I'll be going again.

6.description: Orso's is like an old girlfriend that you, for some reason, keep going back to.  You know that there are better ones out there for you, but something keeps pulling you back.  With Orso's, it's the pizza (good thin crust), the jalapeno gnocchi (with meat sauce- it's darn good), the location (close to me- in the heart of Old Town), and the gorgeous outdoor dining/bar area in the warmer months.  The staff is always welcoming, the food is certainly decent, but I always look back on the experience and know that something was missing.  I can never quite pinpoint it, but know it's not quite the one Italian joint that I'm staying with- Kinda' like that old girlfriend!

22.description: Great brunch menu  - I had the Green eggs and ham and husband had the omelette special. We enjoyed $6 Bloody Marys (with Zing Zang, the best bloody mary mixer) and loved the outdoor courtyard. Very relaxing. We will be back.

15.description: I went here with my wife for restaurant week, so we got a good deal. For my first course, I had an arugula salad with baby spinach, shaved Parmesan cheese, and cherry tomatoes with lemon vinaigrette dressing. It was fine...nothing special. My wife enjoyed her Caesar salad...I found it ordinary. We both had the rigatoni pasta with chicken and mushrooms in a tomato cram sauce. DELISH! Finally, we ended our meal with cherry gelato. This was great. I didn't find the restaurant to be very romantic; there was a TV playing over the bar where we sat next to and the dining area was not dimly lit. Service was good, though. I'm not sure I would go back here given the amount of Italian restaurants in the city. But I would encourage people to try it if they're in Old Town. The food was very good as a whole.

57.description: What a great little place!!  We just happened upon it today while in the neighborhood.  Loved the back patio, sunlight filtering through grapevines heavy with grapes!  Service was prompt and friendly, food was good, house Pinot Grigio was very tasty.  Just a cozy, authentic neighborhood Italian place.

20.description: Here for a bachelorette party, had an awesome time. Not sure why the wait staff got bad reviews in the past, they were fantastic! Meghan from Dublin was our waitress and she was so great! Very attentive. We were on the patio and my water was filled ar least 15 times! More than attentive. Food was out fast for 12 people. And tasted amazing. Great place for an old town celebration!

36.description: Always great food whenever we eat there!

14.description: They took our last minute reservation on Father's Day and we were able to sit outside, which was exactly what my father wanted on his day! The food was good, fresh warm bread and had the stuffed peppers - which could have used a side of broccoli or something else with it. My brother gnocchi was sharp and spicy - just like it should be since it was jalapeño and my mother loved the fish dish she ordered. There were a lot of younger families there so it is a perfect place to take the parents or the little kids, to enjoy some al fresco dining.

3.description: I saw this restaurant appear on GrubHub a few days ago, so I figured I'd give it a try.It appears as though "Original Tsang" closes then re-opens as a Pizza/Thai/Mexican place between 4PM and 3AM now.I tried their "famous" thin-crust pizza, which was basically over-priced cardboard. Their sauce isn't bad, but the crust is awful. Perhaps their deep dish or pan pizzas are better. The meat on the pizza also had me feeling awful all throughout the next day.I also tried their "hand breaded cheese curds." They were mozzarella sticks. I expected actual cheese curds.This place isn't going to win any awards. If I had done a bit of research before I ordered, I probably wouldn't have.

1.description: My husband and I were after a quick and cheap meal so decided to give this place a try.  We live only a few doors down the road so convenience was key.  We called our order in on the way home.  We were first disappointed in the price for 2 small pizzas.  $27 for two small pizzas at a dodgy pizza joint seemed like too much but we were hungry.  My husband went to pick it up.  It was ready and he returned in only a few minutes with two very small and light boxes.  Unfortunately, he hadn't checked the contents.  So when it was time to plate up we found the wrong pies.  He was already in his pyjamas so back I went to "Downtown."  I had to explain the situation to the lady, showing her the two pizzas. She then went to the back to yell at what I assume was her husband.  He came out and said he would make Medium pizza.  That sounded reasonable to me.  15 minutes later, I came back to pick up my pizzas.  They boxed up one freshly made pizza and grabbed the pizza that was now cold from the back.  I asked if both pizzas were hot.  I just got "hot?" "Hot!" As a response.  I gave up and went home. The hot pizza was pretty good.  It had a very generous amount of mozzarella on it.  The cold one was, well cold and pretty crappy.

2.description: My fiance and I ordered from them and I wish I would have read these reviews before doing so. I ordered a cheeseburger after being told there was no Mexican food, despite the menu Clearly having mexican. The cheeseburger was ordered with ketchup and onion only and when delivery came, the cheeseburger was smothered in thousand island dressing. We also didn't receive the 2 cokes we ordered. I called to complain and they said they would drop the coke off "in a little while". Mind you this was around 2am. So I asked to just be refunded the $4 for the pop. Never got it back. We paid just shy of $40 for a cheeseburger, an Asian dish and 2 cokes we never got. If I would have known that, I would have walked to the dunkin donuts down the street.

9.description: Delicious deep dish pizza delivered fresh to your door seemingly anytime - day, night or early morning.  Terrific owners with a heart for creating wonderful dishes!

10.description: If I could give this place a zero, I would. I created a yelp account just to review this place.First, let me preface this by saying this review is on the customer service provided. I work at a hotel downtown at the front desk and frequently have guests ask me where to order from. I gave him a menu from Downtown pizza and helped him place the order as he had a speech impediment. I called and ordered the two Pizzas for the guest and while I was on the phone I asked the woman for an estimate on how long it would take and she said 45 minutes.About an hour, hour 15 goes by and the food still has not arrived. I called back and asked for an update and was told that the food has been made but that they are just waiting on the driver. 45 minutes later the driver shows up at the hotel. I called back and spoke with the woman again and told her that I did not think that it was acceptable that it took an hour and 45 minutes to have the pizzas delivered. When I reminded her that she told me it would only take 45 minutes she said "that was just for the pizza's being cooked, but since he ordered two pizzas (one small and one large) it would take longer" I then started to explain to her that I understand if it gets busy, but it would have been nice if they had called the guest to inform him that they would be running late. In the middle of me explaining this to her she abruptly hands the phone to who I assume was the manager. While I was re-explaining the situation to him and said that the guest should be given a discount for the inconvenience of having to wait almost two hours for the pizza. He then replied that the price that was given was a fair price and that he would not change it. In the middle of me explaining to him why I do not think that it is fair, he puts the phone down and I hear him answer another phone. He never once asks me to hold on; he just abruptly puts the phone down. I felt really bad for the delivery guy because he was just standing there while this was all going on. At this point the guest is upset because he is hungry and it is two in the morning he just wants to tell the delivery guy to take the pizza back. I hung up the phone and call him back. I told him that I do not appreciate being placed on hold without giving any warning. He then goes on to say "well, I'm sorry I don't know what you want me to say, we do the best we can we will do better next time" I then explain that it is still not fair that this guest had to wait two hours when we were only told 45 minutes. Again, while I am in the middle of explaining he hangs up on me. I call back, irate at this point and start to tell him that this is not okay to hang up on a customer and that it is really bad customer service. While I am saying that I hear the woman in the background say "she called back again?". I continue explaining what I am saying when he again just hangs up on me. We finally just have the delivery driver call and say that the guest is only going to give him 50% of the total, exasperated the owner must have agreed. The guest gave the deliveryman a tip and he left after apologizing for the entire ordeal.As this was for a guest, I do not know how the food was, from the customer service alone however, I will not be recommending this place to any guest again. I really was not looking for the guest to have a free meal. I was just maybe hoping that they would understand the issue and give the guest a 10% discount and apologize. Instead they were so rude and continued to hang up on me, only escalating the issue farther.

4.description: Cold cheese sticks pizza is like lees baron not worth 15$at all. Very very disappointing

6.description: One of my favorite late night places. Small, very friendly staff, and they have a huge variety of really good food. I usually get the Chinese but I've tried a few other things. Definitely worth going!

11.description: we were staying at the holiday inn mart plaza and needed a late night bite that delivered. this was the only menu in the place and we were starving. we didnt do the smartest and got a little of everything and im glad we tried. The Red curry was really good, spicy, just the way we like it. we will definitely be ordering that again. The Hot and Sour soup was not my favorite, I think it had bits of sausage in it...it was weird.  My husband liked it though =) We also got a small thin crust cheese, Habenero Chicken, and Jalepeno pizza, it was ok, not the best but ok. Having an Order above 30$ entitles you to free chicken wings, they are the breaded and.fried kind, you apply your own sauce. Overall I would have scored higher if we had more things like the red curry. We will be back for that though. =)

5.description: I am so happy i found this place. Its open late. Delivers late and delivers a new found love.Ok the bad part is the extra large is not so.... extra large .But the rest is awesome. The variety fits my family because we dont always want the same thing.Ellen on the phone is great and even the delivery guy with long grey hair is cool.I hope they will be around for a loooong timeI think the owners name is Ti... he funny guy

7.description: I order it from grub hub and I didn't eat it, i won't order from this restaurant any more ;(((((((

8.description: Worst buffalo chicken wings EVERRR! The wings were fried really hard & they didn't even use buffalo sauce. Instead they put a few drops of hot sauce on like 3 wings. Wtf? The only thing that was good was the chesse sticks. I rather starve then order from this place again.

0.description: I work a lot of late nights and sometimes dont get a chance to eat until I'm done. Choices are pretty slim at 3 or 4 o'clock in the morning but these guys are always open AND THEY DELIVER!  When they first opened their pizza was just ok but now its really good. I get both deep dish and thin crust depending on my mood. They also have a good Italian beef and even  Asian food. Its pretty awesome to have a place like this too deliver so late at night. The drivers are cool too.

58.description: fucking worst hot dog i have had in my life. who fucking delivers cold hot dogs and cold fries and frozen tamales?!?!?! geez!!! totally wish portillos delivered. this place can blow me. never eat here. or order from grubhub. NO STARS.

56.description: This place is total garbage.....an absolute joke & the management are total hacks.  I ordered food and it was delivered over two hours later.....missing items, other sh*t I didn't order and they couldn't comprehend what plain means.  Upon arriving the driver tried to make me come downstairs and get the food and told me the delay was my own fault because I ordered too late-----after 1 AM.  Only problem is that I didn't.....I ordered it around 12:25.  Then the next day, when I called to complain----I was told that if I wanted to get a refund, I needed to produce the food.  Yeah I am going to go digging thru my garbage for day old food for these jago*fs?  Don't go here unless you want the worst restaurant experience of your life.

29.description: If you want to be proud of your drunk food choices, order from here.  I've never actually been to the restaurant because I've only craved this sort of oily junk food drunk, but everything they send is quality--including the chili cheese fries, which can be hard after a trip in the carMust try: chili cheese gyro fries, loaded fries (pretty much they are cheese fries with bacon on them), pizza puffs (yum!!!!!  I eat these sober, too), and Chicago dogs--you're in Chicago, don't be a fool.  Keep in mind all sandwiches, dogs, etc. you order come with a side of fries as well.  They're not soggy, oily little potato weaklings, either.  These are decent fries.  However, a word of caution for your drunken choices: the chili cheese gyro fries are fantastic, but they are best suited for those nights you are feeling especially vindictive towards your sphincter.  You're welcome.

42.description: DONT EAT HEREthe food is trashthe bacon is not realall of it is over fried and tastes like sh*trealy dont waste your time id rather go to home depo and get a hotdog from there

23.description: Absolutely atrocious!  I have been going here intermittently for a year, and it has been mediocre at best. However,  after tonight, I will not be returning. I waited over half an hour for a gyros dinner meal, and I wanted my money back after 20 minutes,  because how hard can it be to shave the meat off of the spit and put it in a pita? I was the only one there! I watched them wash dishes before they got to my order, and all they wanted to offer me was a soft drink!  All I requested was extra sauce, but by the time I received my order, I only received enough meat for 1 gyro and not two as the platter supplies. I threw the empty pita away in disgust. I showed the manager on my way out of the door, but by that time, I had enough BS and I informed him I would never frequent this establishment again. He actually seemed to prefer yelling at his employees as opposed to handing my complaints! This place is a dump; go home and make a burnt grilled cheese!

47.description: sammys  is a place I would order from again and again because I love their food..delivered it to me on new years day when I was ill and I enjoyed it -love their catfish tails and have no problem getting food from a greasy spoon as sometimes some of the best food comes from those types of restaurants as long as it is up to standard which it has been for many years ..the grub hub delivery charge is huge if you live on the other end of the city like I do but this summer I will be making a road trip to sammys

8.description: I thought I'd give this place a shot through Grubhub just to see how it is.  I should've read the reviews first because the short and sweet summary is, it's terrible.  I ordered the double chicken sandwich which came with fries and my girlfriend had a cheeseburger and fries.  We also ordered a can of pop and a side of onion rings.  Grubhub stated that the restaurant was done making the food and was out on delivery.  Over an hour after the estimated delivery time, two unanswered phone calls to the business, and one answered phone call to Grubhub themselves, we finally had our food.  It's a good thing Grubhub knows how to service consumers because this business does not.  Neglecting your phone is not good business, especially considering that's potential business they're turning away.  I'm not sure if the delivery driver works for Grubhub or the restaurant but no apology or explanation was given for why the food was so late.The food was just plain bad.  When the driver handed me the bag of food, the bag felt as if it was going to cave any second.  Why you ask?  Because the pop had been out of the fridge for so long, it sweated through the bag and completely soaked along with all the food inside.  A simple plastic bag to keep the pop separate from the food would've avoided this.  Not only that but the food was all cold, every bit of it.  The fries were completely soggy and looked like soaked weeping willow trees.  Had the sandwiches been warm, that still wouldn't have salvaged the blandness of the food.  The chicken itself was hard, almost as if it hadn't cooked long enough.  I asked my girlfriend if I could try her cheeseburger and she recommended I didn't out of concern it might make us both sick if I did.  I learn from my mistakes and will never order from this shithole again.  Be advised, it's bad.

31.description: In a moment of desperation, I tried Sammy's again.This time the food was only 30 minutes late and was actually edible... As a bonus, it was all there too!Delivery driver was rude and basically tried to lob the bag of food over the gate rather than wait the 3 seconds it took me to open it.Not a fan, but they get an extra star in the review update for delivering edible food this time.

34.description: Been 2 hours. Food hasn't shown. Too bad I didn't read the reviews on here first.Update: The food finally came at 11:06 PM while the order was placed at 8:56 pm.As I got my order, the conversation went down like this.Driver: "This is Sammy. ( Is he the owner?) I have your order.Me: "Ok. I'll be right down."Driver hands me my food.Driver: "Now do you know where you're ordering from?"Me: "Yeah."Driver: "And you live all the way over here?"Me: "Yeah."Driver: "Now why would you go and do something like that?"Me: "Why not?"Driver walks away.Note to owner: If you cannot control the quality and delivery time of your food, there's a thing called "delivery area." Don't want to deliver to a place 15 minutes away. DON'T.

16.description: Ordered through grub hub and was quoted 30 minutes. The food took an hour and 20 to show up, and the order was wrong. Very disappointed.

13.description: You completely ripped off my daughter and her friend. We are visiting and they ordered Milk Shakes and fresh cookies. The cookies were complete BS. PREPACKAGED CRAP. $20 dollars. You guys suck. I will be coming by tomorrow to return your cookies. Way to take advantage of kids. Hope you feel good about yourselves. Scumbags.

11.description: Well, I'm glad that I read the reviews before I ordered. DO order from this establishment! Here's why.. We ordered food for myself and some friends at 10:21, they said the order would be delivered at approximately 11:00.  Guess what?  They were here in 35 minutes!  Yay!  So all in all, kudos to you GrubHub for letting a business like this one partner with you.  If you know what's good for you - YOU WILL order from here regardless of what that other reviewer said. What a great business, you should be very proud of yourself.

39.description: The sammy's slander has to stop! Sammy's got me through college 4 wings fries mild sauce coleslaw for 4$ come on man what were you expecting with food that cheap. Anyway the wings are huge and good mildsauce all over the fries is excellent can't forget the two slices of white bread, and for all the grub hub haters quit being lazy and pick it up and i always got a Mr. pure fruit punch from the store inside to finish the meal out. Delicious.

37.description: I've ordered from here through Grubhub.com, and unfortunately they do not accept reviews through their website so here I go.Food was disgusting...they forgot my ranch, and then gave me BBQ when I specifically asked for ranch for my cheese sticks.  I was quoted 30 min delivery time, food didn't arrive until almost 2 hours later.  being very upset I called Grubhub they did make it better by giving me a 10 dollar credit but the food was so disgusting that I am going to call this morning to get my full reimbursement back.  it was a joke.They need to get a better handle on time and redo their delivery radius.  I live 7 miles away but this was near downtown, and in chicago 7 miles could be a 30-45 min drive depending on traffic especially in Chicago.  All the food was moist and disgusting, they need to get better containers so that the heat does not stay in the package, that there is ventilation since the fries are very nasty when they get wet from their own condensation, tried a couple and didn't finish it.Wings were cooked through, but the lack of ranch and wings being soggy made me not eat them.The cheese sticks were the only good thing, after reheating them in the small oven they were crispy once again otherwise same thing, don't keep them in a container that can absorb their own condensation, but even then I could only eat one.Lesson learned, check where the location of the place is prior to placing an order and read the reviews on yelp.  If i would have done those two things prior to ordering I would have never ordered from them since everyone seems to have the same issues I did.

0.description: It was alright.. I got the Italian beef w/ sweet peppers for $7. Wasn't really in the mood for fries but it's nice when it comes with, even though it's worked into the price..  I was kicking myself in the butt when I walked out and saw the special was Philly steak sandwich, fries and a can for $5.79 because I love a great deal and any excuse when I can bust out the bottle of A1.  The beef was good.. Bread was soft.. Got it dry bc I wanted the save the other half for breakfast. I had 4-5 fries on my drive back home and they were salty.. Greasy.. And it hit the spot.. But I did get a couple crouton moments.. If you read the other reviews you'll know what this means.. I actually saw that they had grilled chicken wings and legs on the menu. I am definitely going to come back to try those on for size.  I would've gave this place 4 stars if the menu was just a bit more cheaper for what it is.My advice for people that had a bad experience here.. Get off your lazy ass and DUI it here like a true Chicagoan.

38.description: No. Never again. Grubhub. Ordered at 11:30 pm for a late bite. An hour and a half later and the food was not just unwarm, it was cold as in slightly thawed. Soggy. Wet. Uncooked. Delivery guy's comment? I don't know i just bring it.  soooo bad. DON'T DO IT!!!

51.description: Never ordering from here again! Super disappointed. I wanted to try out a Gyro burger, and not only did it come extremely late, but my fries are saturated with oil, half of them aren't cooked and the other half tastes like it was a batch from 3 days ago. My burger was COLD, and fell apart the moment I picked it up. I got half way through and gave up. To top it all off, the Milkshake tastes like crap... Don't waste your time or money with this place. Check out my picture. It's the one that says: "This was my dinner?? Disgusting"

27.description: You completely ripped off my daughter and her friend. We are visiting and they ordered Milk Shakes and fresh cookies. The cookies were complete BS. PREPACKAGED CRAP. $20 dollars. You guys suck. I will be coming by tomorrow to return your cookies. Way to take advantage of kids. Hope you feel good about yourselves. Scumbags.

32.description: Ordered on grub hub, almost 1.5 hours late on my order, food was freezing cold. Items missing in my order and order was not properly made (asked for sweet peppers and got hot peppers) delivery driver was sooooooo rude. He jumped back into the elevator and completely ignored me when I told him items were missing in my order. Overall, terrible service and so unhappy. They should have their grubhub services revoked. It gives a great company a bad representation. Never order from here.

54.description: Wow.... Really wish we would have checked yelp before ordering here. Similar to other reviews. Ordered online, didn't receive a confirmation so we called within 10 minutes to confirm it was received. Employee stated yes they just received it and was in work. Stated a 30 to 40 minute wait. No problem. However, after an hour we were still waiting.  Called again and they said another 20 minutes with no acknowledgement whatsoever of it being late already. 2 hours later still nothing. Finally as we are dialing the number to call them again the delivery driver calls saying he is having trouble finding a place to park (presidential towers... Delivery drivers park here all the time with no problem). We finally get our food and ask the driver if he knows why it took so long. With a smirk he was surprised it took hours and told us that when orders come in online it can take a while to get faxed over to them. What? Like I said we called to confirm they got the order within 10 minutes. Anyways, food was received cold and milkshakes were melted. I ordered a chili dog with no onion and with cheese. They took that as meaning lots of onions and no cheese. Well worth the wait..... Do not even give this place the time of day.

48.description: --Dry, cold gyros came with tiny bits of dirty foil spread throughout the meal  (none of our food was wrapped in foil so I'm not even sure where that came from. -- Chicago Style hot dogs were discolored and cold (possibly raw, had to spit it out).--Onion Rings were hard and fries were so soggy they were  translucent.  Spent almost 40 dollars and threw out ever last bit of it. This food wasn't just bad, it was INEDIBLE. When we called to complain about the foil in the gyros, they offered to remake the food and have it delivered in 20 minutes. Yeah right. Steer clear...this place is a hazard.

44.description: I feel bad even saying this, but this place seriously stinks. I called after waiting 45 minutes after ordering to see what the status was on my food. The guy on the phone told me it was on the way and then hung up on me before i could say thank you. I ignored that because i was working and don't have the time to fix peoples manners, that's his moms job not mine. And then when the food got here the delivery guy was on the phone and he gave me the food and then walked away, when i went after him and said "wait i didn't pay you", he was to into his phone call to do his job. This place sucks. Food was cold, my order was far from correct, and everything was soggy. This place stinks

24.description: Don't aggravate yourself when its 11:30PM and you're dying for a fry or two... Absolutely horrible. I ordered off of GrubHub on a Saturday night around 11:30. After an hour of waiting, I decided maybe it was time to call and see what the deal was... "Oh itll be there soon". What is soon? And why do you not realize than an hour is already too long? My boyfriend and I got so tired over the course of waiting for our food that we ended up falling asleep around 1:45. Low and behold, my phone starts blaring at 2:30 in the morning. "I'm here with your food""Well, its been three hours since I ordered, I expect at this point its going to be free"*hangs up* Screw you, Sammy's, for getting us excited for food that never actually came, and stripping us of precious sleep time that we could've had if our hopes weren't up waiting for our food. Absolutely do not spend your hard earned cash here- they dont deserve a penny.

7.description: Good thing is that this place open late. We were craving for food but nowhere was open late after 2. So we decided to order food here through Yelps Eat24. We should have read the reviews. We ordered the spicy steak dinner and got an extremely soggy cheeseburger and for the chopped steak we ordered it looked like an dried beef thrown between two slices of bread (It was not chopped steak!!) and it was dry as hell! Fries were sad and soggy as well. The cheesecake we ordered was gross and wasnt even cold they didnt even give us napkins or forks for us to "enjoy" our terrible order. We had to eat it with our bare hands but looking back at the food we ordered we decided not to eat it. We tried a few bites and my friends ate a good amount but now he fears he will suffer from that. Worst $37 ever spent! I DO NOT recommend this place and i pray that my friend and i do not die from diarrhea or food poisoning.

49.description: 2 reasons to come here: you are drunk or you are cheap. Don't expect much, it's a dirty cheap stand. To all you online complainers: you are idiots. This is a place you stumble into, not have delivered. Do you really want your food transported from this place. Most likely on the passenger seat of a1987 ford tempo where the red pleather seats are torn and the horrific foam touches your food? Really? Really?Update:I still love this joint. But people have read my review - mentioned it by my name - and still got burned by online orders. Please be smart and listen. Your hunger depends on it.

40.description: Garbage!I ordered off of seamless and it said my food would be about 30-45 minutes an hour passes no food. hour and 15 minutes pass i call and find out whats going on and the DUMBASS night manager answers i ask where my food is and hes like "oh its on its way to you. do u want the drivers phone number?" i tell em no its cool i figured my food was really on its way. 45 more minutes pass i call back and im put on hold for an hour i gave up called seamless to get a refund! i call the next day and the night manager threatened me. im not gonna go into detail but this was my one and only time ordering from herethis place should be shut down!

53.description: I live close to Sammy's, so I stop in from time to time.  I've never had them deliver, so I can't respond to some of the other reviewers' bad experiences with that.  I can tell you, however, that even if you order in the shop they often make mistakes and confuse your order with someone else's.  Stick to the hot dogs.  That's your best bet, and they're cheap.  And they actually taste pretty good.  Most of the rest of the food is mediocre or worse, but the prices are pretty reasonable.  The service is fairly quick when you order in the store.Sammy's is good for a quick, cheap bite if you actually walk into the restaurant, but lower your expectations.

30.description: I tried this place twice, and the delivery was an epic failure both times.  First time was an hour late, second was two hours late.  No apology.  When I spoke with the delivery driver, she tells me that it takes a while to get to where I am from their location.  I had to head out and deliver supplies to two jobsites downtown while I waited, and I passed them TWICE in the time it took them to deliver.  To top it off, the food I got was cold (and this was over the summer, mind you) and had been left a bit too close to the fire for too long.  This is the kind of thing that makes people want to reach out and touch someone with a hammer.

46.description: Never again!! Might as well have thrown $25 in the trash.  Waited 2 HOURS of my food to be delivered. Called after an hour and a half and was told the driver was 5 mins away. 30 mins after that We got ice cold soggy fries , a "grilled" cheese that was never even cooked , and 2 melted milkshakes that like nothing but liquid sugar. Everything went in the trash.

1.description: 1 star is way more than this place deserves. I placed an order at 12:40 and my food showed up almost 3 hours later. When it had already been 2 hours I called the restaurant and asked where my food was. The non too polite man on the phone said they didn't have drivers until just now, and that my food should be there in 15 minutes. 40 minutes later the driver called and said he was outside. I opened the door and he wasn't there. I looked around for a minute and he was no where to be seen. Finally I tired calling his phone and it went to voicemail. When I was shutting the door to my house he finally decided to leave his car and bring me my "food". I told him he was almost 3 hours late and he shrugged while he said sorry. All of this would have been somewhat forgivable if the food hadn't been so bad it was inedible. Forget cold and soggy, those things can be fixed by a microwave. 1st the food wasn't even what I ordered and 2nd I've seen better buglers at homeless cookouts. I tried to feed some to my dog and even he wouldn't eat it. Save your self time and money and eat elsewhere.

55.description: I've ordered food from Sammy's twice via GrubHub, and both times the food has arrived after the estimated arrival time. The first time it was TWO HOURS LATE, which is completely ridiculous. Also, both times the food arrived soggy and cold. GROSS. I'm not even sure why I ordered from them a second time after having such a horrible experience the first time around. I blame the five glasses of wine I had. Yuck yuck yuck.Honestly, if I could give it NO stars I would...but unfortunately that's not an option.

9.description: This is the type of place where they spit in your food, pick it up off the floor and serve you. Where the delivery guys are high, eat your food and say the order was canceled. Spend Money elsewhere.

26.description: Worst burger in Chicago and the fries suck.  However the pizza puff was good.  The burger was clearly a cheap frozen patty, and the bacon was some rubbery piece of crap.  The fries are sooooo greasy and soggy, I couldn't pick them up with my hands.  The only thing that didn't suck was the one thing that you can't screw up, and that was the pizza puff.

25.description: Takes for ever for delivery food always cold forgets food all the time i hate this place

12.description: Worst Hot Dog I've ever had in Chicago. Oh by the way, I'm a Chicagoan. This is definitely a pass.

59.description: Rarely order from Sammy's but when I do never disappointed. Ordered two Gyro plates Friday evening, delivered Jimmy Johns fast by a smiling pleasant delivery person. Enough food for four, very good, lettuce, tomato and onion were very fresh. Fries were great, gyro meat moist and tasty. Needed a little more pita and sauce but still enough also get Red Gold ketchup not that cheap stuff.

21.description: Unfortunately Sammy's Red Hots burned down. I really miss them. They've been around since I was a kid. The cheesy Italian beef was my favorite. I hope they rebuild but it's been a month now I haven't heard anything about them.

17.description: This restaurant is an abomination to all fast food restaurants out there.  I just ordered from them on Grubhub and not only did they show up an hour an a half later, but they gave me a milkshake riddled with styrofoam, mixed in, just how I like it, charred gyro meat, cheese dogs, hold the cheese even though I paid for it, and failed to bring the 6 pack of sprite I ordered.  The cashier also called before they started my order to alert me that they were missing the cheesecake that I asked for.  He should've just told me they were missing edible food in general.  We'll see if that charge stays on my credit card.  Also the speedy delivery service that I mentioned earlier cost me $8.50!!  I will never order from here again and I will definitely be calling them in the morning.

10.description: I'd give them 0 if I could.I ordered from here through grubhub on Saturday night . . . Placed my order at 11.37pm.  The original estimate said it would be there in 45-55 minutes.  About 5 minutes later, I got an updated that said they would be there at 1.10am . . . over an hour seems a little crazy but whatever.At 12.53am I got a call from the driver saying he had a flat tire but would be there in 10 minutes . . . I actually clarified with him that he would be there in 10 minutes even though he had a flat and he said yes. I waited up until 2.00am for him to arrive and he never did . . . but I still got charged.I can't rate the food (but judging by what everyone else says, it sucks) but I can rate the service and that did suck.  You've been warned!

5.description: I ordered through Grubhub without reading any reviews on Yelp. Just as I was starting to get worried I'd be waiting for hours for my food to get here, I got a call that it had arrived - 5-10 minutes EARLY! Delivery guy was niceFood was on time - even a bit early and I got everything I orderedFood was good (fries were a bit limp but still warm and I ate them all) I would order from here again.

3.description: NO!!! Horrible to say the least. I ordered my food to have delivered to my work. First of all I put in the delivery notes not to deliver my food till 12:30....well they delivered my food at 11:40, thank God my employer is flexible with eating at your desk. The bag was soaking wet....start of a bad sign! I ordered the fried chicken with fries, the chicken itself was dark brown, a sign that the fryers have not been cleaned in some time. The fries were just as bad. They were cold and really hard. This is not a place that I will order from again, there are too many options out there to choose from.

35.description: Ordered from GrubHub one night because we didn't feel like going out and wanted a quick easy meal.  Got an absolutely awful meal instead.When it was delivered all of the food was soggy and wet.  The hotdogs I ordered were cold, the BBQ burger didn't have real bacon on it, and they forgot the cheese fries included in the order.  We paid almost 20 bucks for it, and it was completely awful.  Couldn't even finish the meal, absolutely awful.  Never again.  20 bucks wasted.

19.description: In a moment of desperation, I tried Sammy's again.This time the food was only 30 minutes late and was actually edible... As a bonus, it was all there too!Delivery driver was rude and basically tried to lob the bag of food over the gate rather than wait the 3 seconds it took me to open it.Not a fan, but they get an extra star in the review update for delivering edible food this time.

28.description: Mediocre sandwiches and fries (with no ketchup) and a 15 dollar delivery fee on top of whatever you order! Maybe the pizza is good. I don't think I'll try to find out.

45.description: I shudder thinking about it. Dirty, soggy, cold, just disgusting. do yourself a favor and just eat your money. Its probably cleaner, less soggy, and not as cold.

33.description: Ordered food and two hours later NOTHING! No wonder they don't take reviews on GrubHub, the delivery sucks. After two hours we called the restaurant and he quoted us ten more minutes until the food arrived. We were starving so we waited, after another 20 minutes passed we decided to cancel the order. About 2 minutes after we cancelled the driver called and said he was still 15 minutes away. Really? No communication, no regard for time, no respect for customers. If you really want to try Sammy's pick it up cause if you get delivery you will never get the food. Oh and I forgot to mention I was called "honey and sweetheart" several times over the phone, I can't speak for all women but that's not endearing to me coming from a stranger.

43.description: wow - what a slice of life.  Nice place, the owner was present and friendly.  Got hotdogs with cheese and a chicken sandwich.  Some guys were in there spending all the grocery money on lottery tickets.  Also the pacman machine rarely sits vacant in this little spot.

2.description: I ordered delivery through GrubHub. It was late night, 11:30pm.Just...awful. Seriously, everything about it is just awful. I really thought there were some exaggerations here but everything is spot on. 3 hours for delivery on GrubHub and multiple calls I was told they were "minutes away". Food was inedible but after sitting for 3 hours, I don't know anything that would be edible after that long. Soggy. Cold. If it's consistently this bad, just don't offer delivery. I think I'm actually more mad that they followed through and delivered the food that had been sitting.I did like their oyster crackers.

18.description: NEVER AGAIN. Food came more than an hour and half late , catfish was nasty , fries were soggy , messed up my hotdogs by giving me two French fries INSTEAD......HOW DO YOU F THAT UP. Only thing that was good was the chocolate cake. It's disgusting on how much they lied about the time and causing the guy to get yelled at by me and my friends and then they admitted to not putting my order in until 10 min before the hour mark ...... & than 30 min to drive to 12 min away destination . I didn't pay for the catfish and kept it and tried to find an oven to make it taste somewhat good ..... (Only positive was that the double chocolate cake was delicious but it was prepackaged anyways) NEVER AGAIN . Thanks for redefining AWFUL UNTRUTHFUL RUDE NASTY SERVICE & FOOD....

41.description: Had a bad delivery experience.  Food showed up 40 minutes after the estimated delivery time and was lukewarm and soggy on arrival.  The chili cheese dog I ordered came with zero chili, and was just a puny sized dog with a Kraft single thrown on top.  The spicy chicken tenders were solid, as was the strawberry shake.  Of the two milkshakes I ordered, one came in the wrong flavor.

52.description: Ordered off GrubHub and everything was disgusting, I am not sure where to begin, so I will just go down the list of items we ordered.Gyro Sandwich: brown/wilted lettuce on the bottom that was so caked on I could not remove it.  The gyro meat was grainy and had hard bits in it that I was not sure what they were (guessing bits of bone, I feel disgusted as well, and stopped eating for that reason).  Lastly the cucumber sauce was congealed and not a sauce so much as the consistency of feta cheese.Tamale in a Blanket: Served like a hotdog, this was the saving grace, I would not order it again, but it was the best thing served.Coconut Cake: This pissed me off the most, it cost $5 on GrubHub.com, but clearly only costs $1.99 in the restaurant, as it came with the price tag on it.  On top of that, it is yellow cake box mix with cheap frosting and coconut flakes on top, not worth the $5, not worth the $1.99Fries: They come with everything, and so I did not pay extra for it.  That said, they were all oil, I asked to have them crispy, and I think they made it undercooked instead.  Overall, disgusting.Finally, the delivery service.  I live in a condo building that has a buzzer at the front door.  I have lost faith in humanity based on how lazy the driver(s) are for restaurants, specifically since they charge $6, yes SIX dollars to deliver.  They called me from his car asking me to come down, I said no, I paid $6 to have it delivered, you should be opening it up, putting it on a plate and cleaning up afterwards, so I am sure as hell not coming down.  He then tried to act like he did not speak English, so as I dialed GrubHub to cancel (and let him know I was doing so), he suddenly learned English and was able to use the buzzer.  He was extremely rude upon the hand-off. Don't do it, save yourself the money and save your body the garbage this place serves.

50.description: I'm going to go with 1 star, I ordered delivery double cheese burger fries, and double chocolate cake. The fries were okay, the burger was not good, The beef was not good (very low quality beef) entirely to many grilled onions soggy bun with entirely too many  toppings. So many the burger fell apart when picked up. I ended up throwing away half the burger which was a mistake because I should have tossed it after one bite because several hours later I had to stay near the toilet for about 1 day as this awful food ran it's course through my system, both ways if you understand what I'm saying. So in summary I will never consume anything from here ever again, not even a bottle of water. Just so you know I'm no stranger to fast food at all, I probably have fast food two times a week due to my busy two job lifestyle and I never write reviews but I had to put it here because grubhub would not let me review it there... Stay away, you've been warned.

4.description: Try to order food from here the people that work there were so rude. They hung up on me yelled at me and all I asked for was the price of my order and how long will be. I'll never ever order food from there again. There are way too many places in the city of Chicago for restaurant to act that way towards their customers absolutely ridiculous

6.description: Well, I wish I would have read the reviews before I ordered. DO NOT order from this establishment! Here's why.. Ordered food for myself and some friends at 12:21, they said the order would be delivered at approximately 12:50-1:00.. Little to say, it's 2:09 right now, it never came, and now when I call no reply. I did even call and reached someone at 1:32 and they said it was on it's way and should be 10 minutes. Still no show. Still charged $37.xx for some food that I never got. I'll update this if I get a refund but I would definitely not suggest this place and I plan to report them to GrubHub and the BBB. You at least call someone and tell them you can't make it and refund their money, but no, absolutely no communication. UPDATE FROM ORIGINAL:My food finally showed up at 2:37am, after I went to bed. I opened it up once I got inside before I put it in the fridge to maybe hopefully eat the next day.. they had placed a soda on top of the order inside and everything in the bag was soaked along with being cold from a poor delivery. Here's where it gets better though!... I called to get a refund four times and was told to call GrubHub to get it taken care of. GrubHub had to call them to approve it and they called them and they REFUSED MY REFUND!So all in all, screw GrubHub for letting a business take advantage of you and if you know what's good for you - DO NOT order from here. What an awful business, you all should be ashamed of yourselves.

22.description: They really dont deserve any stars. I normally read reviews 1st but my boyfriend was using the eat24 app. We stumbled upon sammys and decided to go with it because the food sounded pretty good and the prices weren't bad. We ordered a combo beef sandwich, mozzarella sticks, personal pizza, and loaded fries. Our total was a little over $21. My boyfriend went to pick up the food and he checked the bad when he got in the car....He called me hysterical lol. The personal pizza was suppose to have gyro meat, steak, bacon chicken, cheese, the works. The "pizza" was literally some submarine bread with sauce and cheese on it lol. They gave me the wrong sandwich and it was suppose to include fries but they didnt include them. The loaded fries looked horrible and they were cold. The only thing that was right was the mozzarella sticks lol.We basically had to contact eat24 for a full refund because sammys didn't want to correct our whole order. Will never order from them again.

15.description: Not bad. I ordered a polish sausage with everything and it was large and good. It came with fries that were greasy and limp. I ate all the sausage and half the fries.

57.description: Ok... Start at 5 stars...I ordered on Grubhub because I really wanted an italian sausage sandwich and they were the only restaurant open late that delivered to me...Est. delivery time 35-45min, actual 1hour exactly.  Delivery driver was nice though and they aren't exactly just down the block (about 17 min drive in traffic)I will however, take off for every single thing being cold because they aren't THAT far, and I've ordered from further places and had no problems.  If they don't have a way to keep their food warm (warming bag) then they should make their delivery area smaller. - 1 star.Italian sausage was disgusting- it actually kind of tasted like a polish sausage AND an italian sausage but... wrong.  I really have no idea what that taste was.  I'm guessing it's just cheap.  It was also on the soggiest bun I've ever seen, so it made me kind of curious what that juice was even from.  I had grilled onions on the sandwich, but the juice was brown... like when you get an italian beef?  I could only take 2 bites of the sandwich (spit the second one out) so I didn't really figure it out.  -2 stars because that's how bad this was.We're at 2 stars now.Onion rings also had a weird taste and were dry, in keeping with the theme of the place they tasted cheap.  Actually, they tasted way worse than onion rings I've gotten at Aldi's and fried myself and that's why they lose a star too, and down to one.They forgot my orange soda :( ... .75 cents down the drain, and it sure would have helped rinse those nasty tastes out of my mouth. -1 star.Strawberry "slushie" was actually a weird milk shake/slushie hybrid- but suprisingly this is pretty tasty.  The fries are delicious.  So plus one star for that. Yeah... it's just not very good.  BUT it's extremely cheap.

20.description: This restaurant is an abomination to all fast food restaurants out there.  I just ordered from them on Grubhub and not only did they show up an hour an a half later, but they gave me a milkshake riddled with styrofoam, mixed in, just how I like it, charred gyro meat, cheese dogs, hold the cheese even though I paid for it, and failed to bring the 6 pack of sprite I ordered.  The cashier also called before they started my order to alert me that they were missing the cheesecake that I asked for.  He should've just told me they were missing edible food in general.  We'll see if that charge stays on my credit card.  Also the speedy delivery service that I mentioned earlier cost me $8.50!!  I will never order from here again and I will definitely be calling them in the morning.

36.description: So gross. Soggy fries. Watery cucumber sauce. Super fatty greasy meat. Run.

14.description: God awful food, wasn't cooked at all and the service was not good either. Stay away better to give your money to an homeless person then spend it at this place.

58.description: So after posting my original review, I received a call from Mama's with a challenge - give them another chance and they'll provide a free pizza.I decided to go in with them, one pizza for free and one on my dime. Delivery was fast, pizzas were hot and tasty and my pie had ample anchovies! I'm a happy, fat dude...

56.description: This place was such a delight! Cute and hidden, but cozy with great food and wineHouse Salad - delicious! Loved the black olives and roasted red peppersVeggie pizza - also tasty. Loved the eggplant. And don't be shy in adding the table giardiniera to spice this upMeatball sub - Tasty pork meatball. Ask for a side of sauce because you'll definitely need/want itJust moved to Old Town and I'll know we'll be back!

29.description: We stopped in to split a pizza and beer while meandering through old town. The place is crazy small, 5 tables & a long bar, but super cute and fun. Pizza was good!

42.description: Yummy salad, spinach bread, lasagna, and dessert. Great place to go and share so that you try everything.

23.description: Came here on a Friday night after drinking WAAAYYY too much wine, but I'm reasonably sure I can still remember it well enough to give a good review.  Of course, two days later my husband said something about pizza, and I said "when did I last have pizza??" - "two days ago dear."  Ah yes.So if you still trust this review, trust that you should get the arugula pizza and the pepperoni.  All the crusts were very good - oven fired, very slightly charred in a good way.  Thin but chewy.   The arugula was my favorite topping, the pepperoni was very cheesy and the pepperoni itself was great.We also ordered the antipasto salad and the house salad - they tasted virtually the same to me except one had egg.  They were NOT light, veggie heavy salads - more like chopped salads.Service was friendly and helpful.  It is tiny.  I'd go back sober :)

47.description: Amazing food. Amazing service. Mama Milano has been absolutely great with us. The lasagna and the lemon gelato were to die for. As NY and LA natives, we'll definitely comeback here to eat when we are in Chi-town!

8.description: Overpriced & very mediocre quality. Size for your money isn't a good value either. We got 2 pizzas & a salad for $50. I honestly can say that Little Caesars beats what I had. (Pepperoni). Crust was like dry cardboard. Pepperoni had ok flavor. Cheese was decent. My wife had the pizza Blanco. It was much better, but still had the cardboard crust though. The reason why the get the second star is because at 12:30pm on Saturday night they do deliver. I'd try other places first if you have the option.

31.description: I do not even know where to begin with how lovely my whole experience was at Mama Milano's. The ambiance, the food, the service, impeccable. I would highly suggest it to anyone!! It is nice, but not too fancy, you can dress up or dress down. The kitchen is so neat. The food, so good. The prices, so worth it. Just go there!

34.description: Great service and food.Lasagna to die for.Sausage and peppers, shrimp risotto. Chicken parm, and pizza were all delicious.Janice is a doll.Can't wait till summer to sit outside.

16.description: Mama Milano's was recommended by a friend, and I couldn't be more pleased with the recommendation. The service here is impeccable. Definitely try the sausage and pepper bread or the spinach bread, as well as the house salad. Pizzas are also a must! We also ordered a side of meatballs, which were some of the best I've had in quite some time. Everything here is authentic and made with love. The restaurant is just off of the main path of the sidewalk, providing it with a cozy, almost secret-like atmosphere. It is very small, so I'd recommend against coming here with a large group.

13.description: I really want to like this place, but every visit leaves us feeling a little off. Just blocks from where we live, we find ourselves at Mama Milano's semi-regularly. The food is pretty good, prices are reasonable.However, the service is just awkward. Saturday night we walked in at 5:15. We were the only customers there. The server asked us where we wanted to sit and we asked if we could sit on the booth side. He said no, and put us at one of the small two people tables by the door. About 10 minutes later, another couple walks in and sits in the booth. They are later asked to move to the table right behind us leaving us cramped. Eventually two other parties of two walked in and were apparently allowed to sit in the booths. I know Mama Milano's is small, but you should make your current customers happy and comfortable whenever possible. We'll be trying Dinotto's next time we want Italian food.

11.description: Very nice place to go w/a couple of friends or solo. The seating area @ the bar has woven placemats cute Lil home touch and you can sit and watch your meal being prepared by the owner, they give you homemade garlic brushed bread. I ordered a side house salad very, very good to be a salad. And the lobster ravioli topped with alfredo sauce and breadcrumbs and then baked I enjoyed this also. A lot of Alfredo sauces are bland or just plain nasty but this was good no complaints.

39.description: My husband and I stopped here for a late lunch while running errands last weekend. Our server, George, was very helpful when suggesting appetizers and menu items. And the food was delicious! We had the sausage and roasted pepper appetizer and a margarita pizza along with a couple of glasses of wine. We were even more impressed when towards the end of our stay a *very* large group came through the door taking nearly every empty table in the establishment. It was a slower afternoon so I'm sure that this could not have been expected. However, George handled it with style and ease. We will definitely be back!

37.description: While the place is small, that only adds to the ambiance. Service is great because the lone waiter has so few tables to tend to or you're at the bar watching the magic happen. The food was the best italian I've had in chicago and mama herself even came to our table at one point, true to an italian cook, to shovel pasta onto our plates and ask if we needed more sauce. I can't say enough great things about this place. This is my second time here, once sat at the bar and once at a table. This will be my go to place in Oldtown!

0.description: Excellent food, service and atmosphere. Found this place by accident while bar hopping in the area. Had the meatballs and a pizza. Both were delicious. They gave us some of their Holiday Risotto.  It was a little sweet and rich. Maybe best risotto I have ever tasted. We sat at the bar. There are some tables in the small, cozy spot, but we enjoyed the conversations with the staff at the bar. Kitchen is right behind the bar so you can watch your food being prepared. Staff was friendly and helpful. I will be back.

38.description: Was referred by a friend who lives in the neighborhood and it is a very friendly little place. The service was very nice and I ordered an eggplant sandwich and my friend ordered the thin crusted pizza which I think looked better. My sandwich was good but had only 2 patties of eggplant and had more breading than sauce...just a tad more sauce would have been helpful. It had lots of good gooey mozzarella though. I didn't drink but there was a full bar that I noted. I ordered some dessert but that was just average fare so I wouldn't order desserts the next time.

51.description: confusing spot...like one of the other reviewers mentioned, this is sort of a "strange place".  i wondered why they were bouncers standing outside a pizza joint and then realized they were manning the sports bar next door.  when you walk in, the restaurant has a weird lay-out.  the bar itself takes up half of the room with 2 tops lining the right side and a 2 larger tables by the door...perhaps why it's called a pizza "bar"?  who knows but if i were a server there, i'd be very claustrophobic.  speaking of servers, they receive 5 stars - everyone from the bar staff to the bussers pitched in and were accountable.  so nice and rare to find these days :)  as noted by another reviewer, i received my wine in a nice wine glass but pop was served in its plastic bottle along with a plastic cup.  do they not trust us with glasses?the spinach bread is yum yum yum and so is their pizza crust - it is golden and flaky without being too chewy with almost a parmesan taste to it.  i enjoyed my arugula pizza but husband's egg and prosciutto pizza was too runny and the crust was undercooked (he sent it back and the happily sent out an entirely different pizza).i wished there were more vegi options...

27.description: Stumbled upon this gem and was  in for a total treat. Mama Milano's has a small Old Town footprint, but a big personality. The owner cooks Italian staples right in front of you at the bar. The pizza is superb and the Italian sausage and peppers here are the best I've had in the city. Do yourself a favor and finish it off with the lemoncello Italian ice. To die for.

32.description: Very small but cozy italian restaurant on Wells street that not a lot of people know about. Very good italian pizzas and great salads. The staff is all wonderful and you almost feel like you are at your italian friends house eating dinner.

54.description: The pizza looked fantastic.. Until we took a bite. We had three different kinds of pizza and weren't satisfied with any. Everything was very bland.Nice atmosphere, friendly owner.

48.description: Great food!  Limited menu.  Spinach bread is a must.
