44.description: Incredible homemade Italian with excellent service.   Have been here 3 times and it is some of the best Italian in the city and is such a great secret.  The meatball salad is a huge house salad with a separate side of 2 of the best meatballs ever.  All pizzas are great (hot hot hot and margarita) and service is friendly and makes you feel at home.  Plus mama herself makes me feel like ive know her for years.

24.description: The staff was super! Best pizza we have had. The owner helped us choose a great wine and  we were able to watch them make our pizza! Wonderful place to eat!

7.description: Came here bc of Yelp reviews and they were spot on. I do have to admit that upon walking in, I was a little unimpressed. The restaurant seemed small and not a lot of patrons compared to the booming number of people at Old Town Pour House (we walked in to the PourHouse on accident at first thinking it was one whole restaurant). Staff was incredibly friendly and the pizza is SO good here. I love the crunchy thin crust. The pizza wasn't too salty or greasy as other places are. We ordered the pancetta and egg pizza and spinach bread appetizer which was recommended by a lot of yelpers. The spinach bread appetizer is definitely not appetizer portioned. It's so big and we ended up having to take home leftovers.I will have to come back to try other items on the menu.

49.description: Don't waste your time. Went there for the pizza but received horrible service instead. The appetizers came out after the entrees. Attempted to tell the waiter, who became defensive and told us "it is what it is". Attempted to talk to the manager who refused to correct the problem. Overall, nothing special about the food, horrible service. And not worth the price.

40.description: Amazing pizza!! Cracker kind of crust. Delicious dessert! Don't miss the cannoli or the tiramisu!!!

53.description: Mama Milano's was a bit of a strange place, but I really enjoyed my meal there and would definitely recommend the food to anyone.  Why was it strange?1)  The restaurant is set WAY back from the street.  We walked right past it before realizing it was there.  It's also next to a bar that was pretty rowdy when we were there (it was St Pat's weekend, so it may have been anomaly).  We were entertained by the drunks running amok, but you may not be if its a first date/dinner with in laws/etc.2)  The space inside is WAY too small.  Like uncomfortably small.  Maybe they have outdoor seating in warmer weather?  This is not a good place for groups- a table of 4 was almost too much.3)  They served soda in bottles without a glass or cup of ice.  Strange.4)  Service was a bit... off?  Not bad, just strange.  Despite these things, the food was absolutely excellent and that's why I have to give it 4 stars.  I ordered the "Calamata" pasta (or something like that), not knowing what to expect.  It was pasta, shaped like calamari rings!  Same thickness and everything!  I've probably eaten at hundreds of Italian places in my life and this is the first time I've seen that.  Some of my companions ordered the pizzas, which also looked amazing.  For the price, the portions were really excellent as well.I really loved this part of Chicago, so I have a feeling that I will be back here at some point in my life.  I'll definitely keep Mama Milano's in mind for a great Italian meal.

30.description: We stumbled upon this place by chance and were beyond pleasantly surprised. Great family atmosphere, authentic cuisine and just wonderful experience. The owner was a lovely woman who took our order and kept us entertained the entire time. I even got a hug on the way out! Definitely recommend this hidden gem. The pancetta egg pizza was incredible. Bellissimo!

46.description: We had a fabulous afternoon enjoying Mama Milano's wonderful pizza.  We got in right before a rush hit - I believe they were busier than expected b/c the bar next door was closed for maintenance.  Service was a tad bit slow due to this but we were not in much of a hurry and the waiter definitely was on his toes working his butt off.  We really appreciate that despite the rush of tables he was still able to give us 100% attentive service.  The pizza was was fabulous fantastic dough, great sauce, wonderful fresh ingredients!! We each got our own pizza but one pizza with an appetizer would have fed the two of us.  I would definitely recommend this place and come again!

1.description: My fiancee and I live near by and just wanted to grab dinner in the neighborhood on a Friday night. We were recommended by a friend to try Mama Milano's, and since it was a nice night we tried eating on the patio.I'm from an Italian family, and while I understand that most restaurants can't beat the old family recipes that are handmade pasta and sauces, if you're going to charge $20 for an entree it better be pretty good.  I ordered the lobster ravioli, and my fiancee ordered pizza. The lobster ravioli came out and looked (and tasted) more like melted cheese soup with some dough in it.  My fiancee's pizza was better than the ravioli, but there are far better options on Wells for pizza for the amount that Milano's is charging.We wanted to like this place, we really did, but the service was poor on top of the subpar food.  Our appetizer was really late, and instead of saying "the kitchen and/or I forgot to place the order" (which it was clear that was the case), the server tried to blame it on "being busy".  However, there was a group of 4 that sat down 10 minutes after us that got their full entrees before we got our appetizer.Sorry Mama Milano's, but I think you're a subpar Italian restaurant that is charging far too much money for your subpar food.  Better luck next time.

55.description: Mama welcomes you at the door and ensures that you are taken care of by one of the friendly servers.  The pizza is very good and the crisp crust is divine!  George, our waiter, was outstanding!

9.description: The service and food were outstanding! I sat at the bar looking over all the fresh food and thought I would order pizza. But lasagna was recommended to me and it was perfect! Everything is made in front of you and it smells delicious! Definitely worth your visit - 5 stars!

26.description: I came here on a Saturday with a friend for a late lunch/early dinner (3pm ish).  We were able to choose a place to sit right away.Pancetta and Egg ($15.95) - pizza with mozzarella, Italian ham, and eggs. Tasty and flavorful.  I especially enjoyed the crunchyness of the crust. nomnomnom.. The portion is big so one pizza can be shared amongst 2-4 ppl (varies depending on whether or not you are a big eater).Mama Milano's Famous Spinach Bread Appetizer (~$11) - spinach and mozarella cheese baked in light dough served with marinara sauce.  I loved how the bread was soo cheesy!!  This comes with 4 huge pieces and probably can be ordered for an meal because it is soo filling.*Recommended**Atmosphere - casualCustomer Service - okI would come here again to get some Spinach Bread or just to carb load prior to a race!Parking - street parking, Red Line (Clark & Lasalle stop, north exit)..you'll need to walk a little...

25.description: Came here bc of Yelp reviews and they were spot on. I do have to admit that upon walking in, I was a little unimpressed. The restaurant seemed small and not a lot of patrons compared to the booming number of people at Old Town Pour House (we walked in to the PourHouse on accident at first thinking it was one whole restaurant). Staff was incredibly friendly and the pizza is SO good here. I love the crunchy thin crust. The pizza wasn't too salty or greasy as other places are. We ordered the pancetta and egg pizza and spinach bread appetizer which was recommended by a lot of yelpers. The spinach bread appetizer is definitely not appetizer portioned. It's so big and we ended up having to take home leftovers.I will have to come back to try other items on the menu.

12.description: I will say this - I am not a lasagna guy and never have been, but Mama Milano converted me for the night. We got a pizza and lasagna and it was great, but next time I come I will only be getting the lasagna. Maybe two orders...

59.description: Great local spot in Old Town! I decided to check this place out on a Friday night while in the mood for authentic pizza. The restaurant itself has limited seating, but we did not have a problem at 8pm. However, more and more people trickled in and sat at the bar. It is a quaint restaurant with great service. The pizza had a brick oven taste and was delicious. I highly recommend the spinach bread as well! I will definitely be going back when I am looking to have a relaxing, great meal with a casual date night ambiance.

21.description: I really want to like this place, but every visit leaves us feeling a little off. Just blocks from where we live, we find ourselves at Mama Milano's semi-regularly. The food is pretty good, prices are reasonable.However, the service is just awkward. Saturday night we walked in at 5:15. We were the only customers there. The server asked us where we wanted to sit and we asked if we could sit on the booth side. He said no, and put us at one of the small two people tables by the door. About 10 minutes later, another couple walks in and sits in the booth. They are later asked to move to the table right behind us leaving us cramped. Eventually two other parties of two walked in and were apparently allowed to sit in the booths. I know Mama Milano's is small, but you should make your current customers happy and comfortable whenever possible. We'll be trying Dinotto's next time we want Italian food.

17.description: My husband and I stopped here for a late lunch while running errands last weekend. Our server, George, was very helpful when suggesting appetizers and menu items. And the food was delicious! We had the sausage and roasted pepper appetizer and a margarita pizza along with a couple of glasses of wine. We were even more impressed when towards the end of our stay a *very* large group came through the door taking nearly every empty table in the establishment. It was a slower afternoon so I'm sure that this could not have been expected. However, George handled it with style and ease. We will definitely be back!

10.description: Was referred by a friend who lives in the neighborhood and it is a very friendly little place. The service was very nice and I ordered an eggplant sandwich and my friend ordered the thin crusted pizza which I think looked better. My sandwich was good but had only 2 patties of eggplant and had more breading than sauce...just a tad more sauce would have been helpful. It had lots of good gooey mozzarella though. I didn't drink but there was a full bar that I noted. I ordered some dessert but that was just average fare so I wouldn't order desserts the next time.

5.description: Level setting:  1 we were regulars at Papa Milanos  2  i live in the neighborhood  3  place is cool and service is goodWe each had a 10" pizza, (which is more than two people need)  The 1 1/2 thick pepperoni was good but per YELP-MEH IVE EXPERIENCED BETTER.  The other pie was a Blanco--pesto/pepper--per YELP-MEH IVE EXPERIENCED BETTER.  Had hoped it would be good--two stars.  With the incredible number of alternatives in this town, I rarely retry less than perfect experiences. Sorry the place was just not that good

3.description: I came here on a Saturday with a friend for a late lunch/early dinner (3pm ish).  We were able to choose a place to sit right away.Pancetta and Egg ($15.95) - pizza with mozzarella, Italian ham, and eggs. Tasty and flavorful.  I especially enjoyed the crunchyness of the crust. nomnomnom.. The portion is big so one pizza can be shared amongst 2-4 ppl (varies depending on whether or not you are a big eater).Mama Milano's Famous Spinach Bread Appetizer (~$11) - spinach and mozarella cheese baked in light dough served with marinara sauce.  I loved how the bread was soo cheesy!!  This comes with 4 huge pieces and probably can be ordered for an meal because it is soo filling.*Recommended**Atmosphere - casualCustomer Service - okI would come here again to get some Spinach Bread or just to carb load prior to a race!Parking - street parking, Red Line (Clark & Lasalle stop, north exit)..you'll need to walk a little...

35.description: After reading the reviews, I don't understand how someone would give this less than at least 3 stars. My boyfriend did not make Valentine's Day dinner plans after I reminded him several times. So...we ended up driving down Clark while he searched the internets for somewhere with Italian food and vodka (after 7 years, I'm pretty easy to please). We ended up here. Because we're in our late 20's and have thus reached old age, we went at 5pm for dinner. The restaurant was empty so we sat at the end of the bar closest to the oven (because it's currently 0°f) and wanted to be far as hell away from the door. We got our drinks immediately, prompt water refills, and suggestions from Mama Milano herself. We split the Chicken Parmigiana and the Linguine Alfredo along with our freshly baked bread. Ketel One vodka on the rocks plus carbs = FOOD COMA. Let's just say I didn't get the D when we got home because I passed out, but I was delightfully satisfied. Go here, because the food is just as good as gettin the D on V-Day.

19.description: This place was such a delight! Cute and hidden, but cozy with great food and wineHouse Salad - delicious! Loved the black olives and roasted red peppersVeggie pizza - also tasty. Loved the eggplant. And don't be shy in adding the table giardiniera to spice this upMeatball sub - Tasty pork meatball. Ask for a side of sauce because you'll definitely need/want itJust moved to Old Town and I'll know we'll be back!

28.description: Mama Milano's was recommended by a friend, and I couldn't be more pleased with the recommendation. The service here is impeccable. Definitely try the sausage and pepper bread or the spinach bread, as well as the house salad. Pizzas are also a must! We also ordered a side of meatballs, which were some of the best I've had in quite some time. Everything here is authentic and made with love. The restaurant is just off of the main path of the sidewalk, providing it with a cozy, almost secret-like atmosphere. It is very small, so I'd recommend against coming here with a large group.

45.description: The only really good meal I had in Chicago the week I was there. Cool little place, get the arugula pizza on dough and a half.

33.description: Great food, great people. Definitely a neighborhood gem.

43.description: I had the most amazing service from Janice she is not only the owner but when I come there she is like  a 2nd mother/grandmother all her recommendations are always the best. Her staff is always friendly and welcoming. I've never felt more at home outside of home than I do whenever I come to Mama Milanos the spinach bread is not like anything you ever had nor is her vegetable risotto is out of the world. Ruben Juan and Alfredo together are the best in the business. I highly recommend if you want to taste amazing food come here.

2.description: The meatballs were amazing! With excellent sauce.The pizza was disappointing, tasted like a better Tombstone frozen pizza-which isn't saying much. I had to throw on the remaining sauce from the meatballs to make it taste a fifth better.

18.description: I had dinner with an old friend who just moved to Old Town and was looking for an intimate place for dinner on a Tuesday night. We stumbled upon this place and could not have been more pleased! The pizza was Amazing! As well as the service. Will definitely be back soon!

41.description: Great thin but not too thin pizza for me & the hubs.  Went w a basic cheese and a house salad.   Both items were prepared perfectly.  Pizza sauce flavor was not too sweet or over seasoned.  It was quite perfect! The salad was also delish.  The ranch is homemade and u can taste it! Can't wait to return & try their other menu items. As pizza snobs, this place has definitely caught our attention! They seem to deliver too :)

52.description: I had arugula thin crust pizza. It was great. Very crispy and bursting with flavor. Cannoli (made In-house) for dessert was one of the best I've ever had!

50.description: Great food, for portion size, decent prices, small, tucked away location. They waitress was friendly and attentive. Would eat there again!

4.description: Came here on a Friday night after drinking WAAAYYY too much wine, but I'm reasonably sure I can still remember it well enough to give a good review.  Of course, two days later my husband said something about pizza, and I said "when did I last have pizza??" - "two days ago dear."  Ah yes.So if you still trust this review, trust that you should get the arugula pizza and the pepperoni.  All the crusts were very good - oven fired, very slightly charred in a good way.  Thin but chewy.   The arugula was my favorite topping, the pepperoni was very cheesy and the pepperoni itself was great.We also ordered the antipasto salad and the house salad - they tasted virtually the same to me except one had egg.  They were NOT light, veggie heavy salads - more like chopped salads.Service was friendly and helpful.  It is tiny.  I'd go back sober :)

6.description: Im from the east coast and this place is terrific for their pizzas and especially their meatballs if you want a change from a deep dish.  Small intimate and Mama M takes great care of her patrons!

22.description: Like many others, we were persuaded by Yelp reviews to check out Mama Milano's on a Saturday night. We were seated right away in the outside area, where we had plenty of people watching opportunity since Pour House was right next door. We started off with the house salad and the spinach bread. House salad was delicious and very flavorful - it seemed like something you could reasonably make at home, except inevitably yours would not taste nearly as good. The spinach bread can more accurately be described as "delicious hot cheese wrapped in bread that's garnished in spinach and dipped in marinara" - not as healthy as the name implies, but extremely tasty nevertheless.We shared a margherita pizza as our entree. The pizza was satisfyingly crispy (you could hear and audible "crunch" with every bite...mmm). The crust was also very thin, which I personally don't like as much (I feel like I'm just eating cardboard by the end), so next time I'll check out the options for a thicker crust.Service was good and prices fair. Dinner for two without drinks cost about $40 with plenty to take leftover. I'm looking forward to coming back and indulging in the lobster ravioli next time.

15.description: Like many others, we were persuaded by Yelp reviews to check out Mama Milano's on a Saturday night. We were seated right away in the outside area, where we had plenty of people watching opportunity since Pour House was right next door. We started off with the house salad and the spinach bread. House salad was delicious and very flavorful - it seemed like something you could reasonably make at home, except inevitably yours would not taste nearly as good. The spinach bread can more accurately be described as "delicious hot cheese wrapped in bread that's garnished in spinach and dipped in marinara" - not as healthy as the name implies, but extremely tasty nevertheless.We shared a margherita pizza as our entree. The pizza was satisfyingly crispy (you could hear and audible "crunch" with every bite...mmm). The crust was also very thin, which I personally don't like as much (I feel like I'm just eating cardboard by the end), so next time I'll check out the options for a thicker crust.Service was good and prices fair. Dinner for two without drinks cost about $40 with plenty to take leftover. I'm looking forward to coming back and indulging in the lobster ravioli next time.

57.description: I went there with a female a few months ago and we really liked it. It was quiet that night so it wasn't too busy and we had a wonderful experience. The salad was one of the better ones I've had-right about of dress/fresh lettuce. Everything else was just great. It's a very comfortable feel which isn't usually the case at date restaurants. Don't be deterred by the bro-stablishment next door.  The service was nice-which is not always the case at nicer dinner  places. I will go back.

20.description: Level setting:  1 we were regulars at Papa Milanos  2  i live in the neighborhood  3  place is cool and service is goodWe each had a 10" pizza, (which is more than two people need)  The 1 1/2 thick pepperoni was good but per YELP-MEH IVE EXPERIENCED BETTER.  The other pie was a Blanco--pesto/pepper--per YELP-MEH IVE EXPERIENCED BETTER.  Had hoped it would be good--two stars.  With the incredible number of alternatives in this town, I rarely retry less than perfect experiences. Sorry the place was just not that good

36.description: What a great place to have a nice dinner. Small, quaint, warm and clean. We felt like Mama made you feel as if you were at her own table. When she came over to make sure we had enough sauce and pasta while filling our plates, it felt like the warmth of your own mother. The food was incredible! The best Italian we have had in Chicago.

14.description: Wow. I love pizza so coming here was a no brainier but the pizza was just so delicious. Every flavour was pronounced. Everything was just perfect. I miss having good pizza with a reasonable price! It taste sooooo perfect. I was more surprised that there weren't as many people. It was just me and a friend and the waiter. This place is a perfect on the go and in the perfect spot!

3.description: It's clean, which I really appreciate in a consignment store. Good price on the items.

1.description: Soo glad I found this boutique! I've been here a handful of times now, and I always left with a few goodies from Mercy Beaucoup. Once I found a Burberry scarf for $50! The people who work here are always very sweet and helpful. Make sure you come towards the end of the week as they get new shipments on Tuesday and slowly unpacked them. But the manager lady told me to check in weekly because you never know what goodies you would find here. I am a little disappointed with their xs and small selections here though. They seem to get taken quickly. I guess you just have to come at the right time to score them. Join their email list to find out sales event. I attended the holiday sales party and they have delicious cookies, coffee, and san pellegrino while you shopped. I also love their frequent shopper program.

0.description: Went shopping here yesterday with the family and everyone found a little something! I got a cute skirt for work- the best part about this place is that it's for a good cause. Will definitely go again.

2.description: Excellent, immaculately managed charity shop. Whether you score a bargain or not, always a pleasure to visit.

5.description: When I can both find a deal on a quality item and give to charity at the same time, I'm a happy lady.  I stumbled upon this resale shop and was pleased with the quality of items, the prices, and the cleanliness and presentation of the store. Also, this place sorts items by size (not a common theme in thrift stores), so I'm not wasting my time. They had a lot of mid to higher end brands as well.

6.description: I scored some beautiful Dries Van Noten shoes here for $50 (30% off sale) and a women's suit for $11 (75% off sale) and saw lots of other nice, reasonably priced items.There is a great winter clothing sale going on right now, so I highly recommend stopping in. It's pleasant and not at all overwhelming.

7.description: I was so happy to find a place to donate some of my nicer things that I just wasn't wearing anymore since I quit work.   And I LOVE shopping there.  I found a really cute winter coat (wool)  last fall in perfect condition for $35!  Talbots is the low-end here and the prices are dirt cheap.  Plus, what better cause to support than Mercy Home?

8.description: Cuuuuu-uuuuuuute!  I was pretty excited to get a resale shop in the neighborhood because a) seriously there is no place to buy shoes nearby, and b) you can often times find a lot of cute one-of-a-kind vintage finds at retail shops.Mercy Beaucoup is a clean, well-appointed, adorable shop on Wells Street.  Just make sure you look for the stairs for the "garden level" shops on the east side of the street.I was delighted to see that they carried shoes by Salvatore Ferragamo, Tory Burch, and Kate Spade.  Their prices are reasonable (very reasonable).  Best part of all is that it supports Mercy Home for Boys & Girls and is staffed by friendly young men and women from Mercy Home.Great organization.  Super-cute store.  And, did I mention that they're having a sale for the summer?  20-30% off.  Heeeey-o!

9.description: My favorite shop in Old Town.Great VERY GENTLY used designer clothing.I've found many deals here including AG and 7 For All Mankind jeans for under $40.My mom also scored a brand new J. Crew cashmere cardigan for $20!  They are always getting new merchandise, I try to stop in weekly!

10.description: What a great shop.  I discovered this last spring (2012) while running an errand and have been in frequently ever since.  I've found many wonderful things and the best deal probably was a pair of Trina Turk pants that fit me like a glove and with the extra sale going on that day cost me $18!!!  Amazing...I live in the neighborhood so I stop in at least once a month just to see if there's anything else for me - more often than not there has been!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! (oh, and for the guys I saw great Tommy Bahama shirts for only $25!)

4.description: This is my best friends neighborhood and I found it via YELP for a recent girls weekend. Right near La Fournette and a slight step down from the sidewalk. The clothes were beautiful and well priced. I found many great deals. this has become a real go-to. The prices are well in-line for a consignment shop, but not rock bottom prices as appropriate for the quality of clothing. Highly recommend. It's a small shop, but we could have spent quite a bit of time here looking through the treasures.

3.description: I often use deals with LevelUp and Belly to grab a free/discounted lunch. I was in no hurry and this location wasn't too far out of my way. Suffice to say, I won't be going back. I was adamant that there be no tomatoes on my sandwich. That was the only instruction I have to the sandwich maker. The one thing I said maybe 6 times to not out on, she put on. Ugh. And then they refused to take my payment with LevelUp. I had to grab my sandwich and nearly walk out the door before she went to get the manager. And then the attitude. I'm not a fan of Quizno's to begin with. Avoid this location.

1.description: I love Quiznos & have always had good experiences at this location. The staff is quick & efficient & has always gotten my order right.On top of that, the place has always looked & felt very clean & well maintained.

2.description: I didn't make it here in time to use my 2 small sub sandwich groupon, so I used the expired amount to purchase a regular sub and I quite enjoyed it. The service was quick and smooth, even with the expired groupon transaction, and I was pleasantly surprised by this toasty and flavorful Chicken Pesto Caesar sandwich. I did have more bread than filling, but because the bread was warm and seasoned, it didn't really bother me.

5.description: This place never gets old.  I love it

6.description: For a sub franchise Quizno's food is pretty delectable. Toasty subs and crisp, fresh chopped salads served with warm pita slices are a safe bet for lunch. Sure, the dining ambiance seems to lack any sort of spark but for those seeking the comfort and familiarity of a chain, the ambiance is perfectly acceptable. I am guilty of submitting my information into their little in-store dropbox and receiving the Quizno's e-newsletter, which drops some pretty sweet Quizno's coupons into my inbox a few times a month. Whenever I take my coupons inside and surrender them I often get quizzical stares from the manager. Once my coupon was denied because they claimed it was fake. Aside from a few coupon frustrations at this store, the food is predictable, but good. Big plus for delivery and friendly tattooed employee who often makes my sammies!

7.description: As someone who used to be a manager of a Quiznos this place is a disgrace to the company. I've always thought that Quizno's had the best "chopped" salads ever but after ordering I was extremely disappointed. The "chopped" salad was made with regular greens. The tomatoes were just standard tomotoes chopped up and so there was tomato guts everywhere rather than the simple and mess free tomato ends that Quizno's trains their employees on for QUALITY control. After watching her scoop the tomato sludge onto my salad I told myself that at least I had the flatbread --BUT WAIT-- they charge for it (meaning you get an unchopped salad WITHOUT flatbread for only 6 Dollars WHAT A STEAL!). I've been to other quiznos in the city in the past week so unless this change happened in the past 5 days I think its pretty obvious that their customers are getting the runaround. I love Quizno's. I even had a short stint at Quizno's College. But this place does not even remotely live up to the standard and should not don the name. I understand that times are tough, but I'm fairly certain that to save money you ensure that your employees are trained well and not over serving rather than taking it out on the customer. If you'd like a crappy salad, without any bread, go to this "quiznos". If you'd like an awesome chopped salad with some of the most amazing flatbread you've ever tasted, go to another Quizno's in the city. The one in the DePaul center is amazing!

8.description: quizno's are quizno's nothing special about this location. they do deliver which is a plus in the food desert that i temp in and it really pissed me off that they would not deliver to me because i was using a groupon now deal. but i like them better than subway so i will probably go back

9.description: Careful, cause this place definitely starts to shut down early (they close at 9, but get pretty pissy if you show up after 8:15).  Overall, pretty stingy with the ingredients, but still good sandwichs.  Pretty busy during the lunch hour with walter payton kids.  They also play a pretty bad selection of music (think early to mid 90's and the like).

0.description: Very clean. Fast service. Staff was super nice. It's hard to find any Quiznos shop in Chicago so this was a great find when I drove by. Meter parking was easy to find. Staff let my wife and I stay and eat in the dining area a bit past closing without trying to get us out. Oh yea-one of the best sandwiches I've had. Love it

4.description: I really hate to complain about a $3 sandwich, but I must say that the bullet subs, made to compete with similar ones at Subway, leave a lot to be desired. Like actual fixin's on the sandwich. I get that you may need to cut back on the meat, but the veggies? Sorely lacking. I tried the turkey pesto and while it tasted good, it was mostly bread.I decided to try a different one the other day and it still lacked any substance. I like the selection, but they really need to put more stuff on those bullets. Perhaps the other sandwiches are better, but I am reluctant to try.I'm probably gonna stick to Subway - at least I can get mucho veggies on the $2.99 daily specials. And I get 2 meals out of those as it is. Not so with the bullets. I threw out much of it because it had so much bread.

1.description: DISGUSTING. MSG to the max and I found a price sticker still attached to a chunk of chicken in the dish I ordered... Awesome job, idiots..

9.description: Note upfront that I ordered delivery off Grub Hub so this might affect things?First off, "Spicy" Pad Thai was not spicy and was a little dry. It was not a spicy red peanut sauce or anything like that and I could barely taste any sauce on it at all. It was basically noodles with sprouts on top with a slight hint of a peanut sauce near the bottom.  Not terrible, but far from the best I've had. The General Tsao Chicken had potential but they left it in the deep frier for about 5 minutes too long. I literally could not chew half of the pieces and had to spit them out. I didn't even eat half of it. Not saying yours will be cooked the same way, but it reflects on the product they are willing to serve.

23.description: Note upfront that I ordered delivery off Grub Hub so this might affect things?First off, "Spicy" Pad Thai was not spicy and was a little dry. It was not a spicy red peanut sauce or anything like that and I could barely taste any sauce on it at all. It was basically noodles with sprouts on top with a slight hint of a peanut sauce near the bottom.  Not terrible, but far from the best I've had. The General Tsao Chicken had potential but they left it in the deep frier for about 5 minutes too long. I literally could not chew half of the pieces and had to spit them out. I didn't even eat half of it. Not saying yours will be cooked the same way, but it reflects on the product they are willing to serve.

12.description: The only reason I order from this place is because of the free delivery.  I've ordered 3 times, probably going to start paying delivery fees somewhere else.Dumplings- 3/10.  Edible, will never order them again though.Chicken Wings- 4/10.  Only reason I ordered them is because I needed to pad my order over $15 and didn't want the dumplings or to pay $4.49 for 2 egg rolls.  Probably should have gone with the egg rolls.  Tasted as if they were fried yesterday and reheated.General Tso Crisp Chicken- 7/10.  Chicken is all white meat, fresh, decent meal option.Shrimp with Lobster Sauce- 2/10.  Sounds delicious, doesn't it?  Sounds fancy even.  It's gotta be good if it's $1 more than all other entrees, right?  Wrong.  Shrimp was decent size but it came absolutely swimming in this thick, brown sauce loaded with mushrooms (its more like Mushrooms and Shrimp in gross brown sauce than Shrimp with Lobster Sauce).  There were several other unidentifiable meats/vegetables (I'm not even sure) swimming in this thick muck.  Put it this way, I picked out the shrimp one by one, dumped the rest, and didn't even finish the shrimp.Rice (standard that comes w/ entrees)- 6/10.  If you mess up rice your restaurant shouldn't be in business.  The rice was just ok.  I have yet to discover a decent Chinese food place in Chicago.  Coming from the east coast I guess I'm spoiled, the Chinese in New York is usually good no matter where you get it.  Out here?  Not so much.

21.description: I ordered from here one night with a couple of friends. I wasn't expecting fine Chinese fare at such cheap prices, but I can appreciate good cheap food especially when someone brings it to my door. I won't be ordering from Beijing and Bangkok again. We split several things. The dumplings were edible, but there was a strange flavor I can't place. Almost like a spicy sausage inside the dough instead of pork. Plus the sauce was runny and too mild for my liking. The sesame chicken was over cooked and the sauce was too gloppy. Perhaps because I ordered delivery and perhaps it'd been sitting for too long, but I've never experienced that in my vast history of ordering Chinese delivery. The Pad Thai was really bland. It's fine if it's not spicy, but it should be sweet. It was plain noodles w/ chicken and egg and some sprouts on top. Even the lime didn't liven it up. Because our order was now over a certain price we got a free order of beef fried rice. It was the color of fried rice but it tasted like white rice covered in soy sauce, which would also explain the color...Nothing is so gross that I would throw it out or complain to the restaurant, just enough that my leftovers will probably get moldy and I'll never order from here again.

16.description: Ordered via Seamless (which has always been fabulous prior to this particular order). I left a bad review there as well - hopefully it will get published, but I'm putting it here again so that no one ever has to go hungry again.NEVER order from this place if you value time and money. Didn't get a refund , didn't get food, only got bad service.I made a pre-order about 4-5 hours prior to the delivery time and it still arrived 20 minutes late. People pre-order for a reason. When I called the person at the restaurant aggressively said "I'm Sorry, ok? I'm sorry, ok? I'm sorry, ok?" - literally 3 times. Sorry people usually don't talk like that. Again, since I had pre-ordered for a reason and had to leave, I was walking out to the streets right when the driver called. I explained that I had already waited 20 minutes and that I was standing right around the corner. He didn't understand English. Then, 45 minutes from the original delivery time, the aggressive person from the restaurant calls again and explains to me how hard it is to find a driver who can speak English. Told him that the driver needn't speak English if the food arrives on time. The person goes "I'm sorry, ok? I'm sorry, ok? Next time next time." I was gonna say "no next time" when he just hung up. (main reason of leaving this review). Btw, I'm a third-language English speaker so I'm not at all sorry for that driver guy.

17.description: Terrible food. Everything I ordered was awful. I took one bite of each dish and had to throw everything out. Don't waste your time or money on this dump.

10.description: Better than average Chinese delivery.  The wonton soup had plenty of wontons filled with sausage, spiced somewhat differently than I am used to but not bad; the broth was uninspired but not that different from what most take-out places serve.  The combo fried rice had generous portions of beef, chicken, and large tasty shrimp.  The beef and chicken were a little dry.  General Tso's chicken was crisp and tasty but overcooked and therefore overly chewy.  I liked the sauce, which was mildly spicy, not overwhelming.  Delivery time to my Gold Coast location was about 75 minutes, but I was prepared for that based on info from Grub Hub.  Nevertheless the food did not need to be reheated.  A small order of the fried rice, the entree and the soup came to $20 and it easily serves two.

5.description: One star is more than enough for this place. I ordered from here through GrubHub a couple of weeks ago and was more than disappointed. I had ordered a eggroll and Chicken Pad Thai.. well, the eggroll was soggy and mushy.. took about 3 bites and threw the rest out; and the Pad Thai, they didn't put the sauce, the noodles were rather cold, wet and soggy- tasted awful, I took about 5 bites and that was enough for me. The delivery was on time; the food was definitely, by far, one of the WORST places I have ever tried.

11.description: - Called for delivery of two orders of pad thai and one order of yellow curry at 10:30 pm.- After waiting for quite a while, the food didn't come. No phone calls giving me updates. I had to call the restaurant a couple more times just to ask/remind them about my order.- I finally received one order of pad thai and one order of red curry after midnight. The food was nothing specially, just average greasy stuff. Definitely not good enough to risk ordering from them again and waiting until next year to eat.

22.description: I am definitely a fan of this place. I get it all the time! I've tried a lot of the menu and so far my favorite is the walnut shrimp, so goooooood! One of my favorite Chinese places in the city!

0.description: B&B delivers.  Yea in the traditional to-your-door service, but B&B also delivers in the idiomatic sense that their goods are quality.  I like my Chinese food, and am therefore picky about it.  I'm happy to report that B&B offers some of the best Chinese delivery I've ever had, and that's a fair accomplishment.  In addition, their delivery time was well within the estimated range.  If you perchance to walk past the storefront, B&B does look shuttered, but I assure you that as of this writing they still deliver as well as "deliver."

20.description: Better than average Chinese delivery.  The wonton soup had plenty of wontons filled with sausage, spiced somewhat differently than I am used to but not bad; the broth was uninspired but not that different from what most take-out places serve.  The combo fried rice had generous portions of beef, chicken, and large tasty shrimp.  The beef and chicken were a little dry.  General Tso's chicken was crisp and tasty but overcooked and therefore overly chewy.  I liked the sauce, which was mildly spicy, not overwhelming.  Delivery time to my Gold Coast location was about 75 minutes, but I was prepared for that based on info from Grub Hub.  Nevertheless the food did not need to be reheated.  A small order of the fried rice, the entree and the soup came to $20 and it easily serves two.

19.description: Best delivery in the old town area.  The only problem is the rice.  It tastes good but it upsets my stomach.  I have tried the kung pao chicken, sesame chicken, cashew chicken, and pad thai.  They are better than your typical Chinese/Thai delivery options and the price reflects as such.  You can order online and the food is delivered fairly efficiently.

2.description: I hate giving 1 and 2-star reviews, but if I'm keeping it  honest, I absolutely cannot rate my experience above 2 stars.  Sadly, the only reason I am giving a second star is to give this restaurant the benefit of the doubt that dining in or other things on their menu might taste better.I placed an order through Grubhub for the following hoping to share some food with my co-workers and have the rest over the next couple days:-Wonton Soup-Chicken Wings-Cucumber Salad-Dumplings-Vegetable Fried Rice-Free Crab Rangoon (since there was a $20 delivery minimum, I figured I would spend another $5 and get the free crab rangoon)I was so turned off by the things I tried first that I haven't tasted the wonton soup or cucumber salad yet.  As for what I did taste:Crab Rangoon - It was just not good.  Not exactly sure why, but I've noticed that crab rangoon folded into a triangle is never as good as crab rangoon folded into a pouch.  Obviously the taste is not directly related to the shape of the crab rangoon, but it's just something I noticed.  Basically, it seems that restaurants who are lazy when it comes to folding their crab rangoon are also careless when making the filling.  This crab rangoon was folded into a triangle, it was overcooked, and it had a weird taste to it, definitely too salty =(Chicken Wings - It was as if the wings were simply fried and then Sriracha sauce was thrown on top.  The taste was nothing special and with how much hot sauce was added, they were almost too spicy for me to eat them at all...not to mention the fact that the menu only said "Chicken Wings" and did not mention anything about them being spicy.Dumplings - The menu had no description as to whether or not the dumplings were friend or steamed and did not mention if the filling was chicken, pork, veggies, shrimp, etc.  They turned out to be pork (I believe), and they were very salty.Vegetable Fried Rice - Not terrible but nothing specialI seriously do not enjoy writing bad reviews, but I was very disappointed with the food I received from this restaurant.  Like I said I haven't tasted the wonton soup or cucumber salad yet, but even if they're amazing, it won't change my experience with the other four things I tasted.Lessons Learned:1) Be wary of restaurants with no delivery fee.  They're not all bad,  but it is a little bit of a red flag.2) Unless I am just not that hungry or I have money to throw down the drain, check Yelp reviews before ordering at a new restaurant.

18.description: I am definitely a fan of this place. I get it all the time! I've tried a lot of the menu and so far my favorite is the walnut shrimp, so goooooood! One of my favorite Chinese places in the city!

13.description: The delivery service was very quick and the food was delicious.i ordered spring rolls,crab ragoon and fried rice with shrimps.Very recommended.

4.description: The absolute WORST service I have ever had. I never write reviews but I felt this was a must. The lady who answered the phone initially kept cutting me off and yelling at me then she gave the phone to the manager and he instantly started screaming at me because their driver apparently called me and left me a voice mail when I never got a call and they never delivered my food. He yelled at me until I told him he was the worst manager I've ever dealt with. I will never come here again and I suggest that no one else goes there either.

24.description: Best delivery in the old town area.  The only problem is the rice.  It tastes good but it upsets my stomach.  I have tried the kung pao chicken, sesame chicken, cashew chicken, and pad thai.  They are better than your typical Chinese/Thai delivery options and the price reflects as such.  You can order online and the food is delivered fairly efficiently.

6.description: Awful service ruined the evening.Ordered a full dinner at 7pm through Seamless.com, and paid over $40.00 for everything to be delivered.  At 8:40, after calling in several times to check on the delivery, a woman informed me that the food was still at the restaurant, and that the driver had already left for the day.  When asked why the order which was placed for delivery was left to be picked up with no notification whatsoever, she rudely replied that I should "come get the food if you want it."Businesses on Seamless are usually organized and efficient, however, Bejiing and Bangkok failed miserably to live up to simple standards.  If you like to gamble on whether or you will get food you have paid for, feel free to order from this shoddy business.  Otherwise, avoid B&B altogether.

15.description: Not sure about the delivery service, but the restaurant service was fast and attentive.  (I don't think my water glass was ever the least bit empty.)  While our non-traditional appetizer (sushi) came out with our meal, the sushi was fresh and quite tasty.  I would give the Summer Roll a "thumbs up."  The noodles were OK--a little bit too much sweet sauce for the Golden Noodles.  I would go back and try more sushi (but skip the thai).

7.description: Took two bites of the dumplings and had to throw them out. They were burnt on the bottom and had a disgusting fish taste. The rest of my food was also horrible.

8.description: I've ordered here twice off of GrubHub for two reasons: 1) It's only 2.1 miles away and 2) free delivery.  Had I gave this place a review the first time around I would have said 3 stars.  It was average and borderline recommendable.  The Kung Pao Chicken was spicy and fresh and the Crab Rangoon was pretty solid.  I waited 45 minutes, but it seemed worth it.Tonight, it was a different story.  Not sure why this Monday was any different, but service and quality of food was just miserable.  I waited 2 hours for delivery (called in at 7p, arrived at 9p) and the food was cold and unpleasant.  The Kung Pao was bland and soggy and the Crab Rangoon was burnt.  Just a disaster.  The only thing worth eating was the rice.If you're up for a 50/50 gamble, give it a shot.  I'd say there are better bets in this area, so look elsewhere for Chinese takeout/delivery.  The service and quality is not worth the price.

3.description: I write reviews about as much as I write thank you notes to high school geometry teachers (zero).   Fact is, I'd give these guys 5 stars but I run a small restaurant of my own and figure if I drop a 5-er up there the yelp filter will pull them down.  General Chix, PFR, Crab Rangoon all winners.  Dumplings still worth it but I'm an East Coast Chinese food snob so prefer the bigger, more fried pork ones.  Delivery was as expected, all items were correct, price was right.  Worst part- they packed in some Siracha/chilli sauce.  Seriously, that was/is the worst part.  If you're on the fence, hopefully you pull the trigger like I did and find your new COMMA reasonably priced COMMA Chinese food delivery spot.  Be warned, if you're looking for tofu, tempura fried, more vegetables in the food than protein, look elsewhere.  Take the plunge.

14.description: Two stars is generous. I just ordered from Seamless and decided to take their reviewers recommendation, which had 4 stars from a handful of people. I should have looked to yelp. It would have saved me $20.The food was bland. I'm not pretending to be an expert on Asian cuisine, but it just didn't taste like anything. (chicken fried rice) I threw it out. The chicken teriyaki was equally as bad. I tossed that as well.Delivery was on time and it was warm, so I didn't go all the way down to 1 star. I wouldn't order from here again.

29.description: The service here has gone steadily downhill in the last couple of years. I don't go often, but I will occasionally stop in before work for a delicious cinnamon sugar bagel to power me through the morning. I've lately been treated with indifference which I almost didn't notice. It's usually around 730 AM, you get a pass. The last few times have been enough to keep me from returning. Today was the worst. There was literally no one else in the shop. There were two people behind the bakery counter when I walked in, talking to each other. They didn't look at me when I walked in. They were talking about their break and what they had to get done before they could take it. I probably stood there 30-45 seconds, which is an insanely long time when you're standing in an empty bagel  shop with three employees behind the counter waiting to get your breakfast. I finally got my bagel which was sliced, even though I said "NOT SLICED" three times. Fine, whatever. I'm a wimp and just took it. I paid and the woman at the counter who is usually the saving grace starts getting really involved in the discussion about what needs to get done before breaks. There is no one else in there still besides me. If they had hustled me in and out, I'd have been gone in under a minute, now I'm approaching 5. I had paid and she was holding my change in her hands. I could see it. She wouldn't make eye contact with  me but was instead engaged in more discussion about breaks! Goodness gracious but they are strict. You have to wipe down counters before you take your break, FYI. I wanted to just walk out, but I had paid for my $3 bagel with a $20 so I waited. I could have reached and grabbed my money out of her hand but my mother raised me better than that. So I stood and waited another 15 seconds (again, it sounds short, but when the standard amount of time it takes a vendor to hand you your change is .5 seconds, this was entirely unnecessary) to get my changed. I turned on my heel and huffed out of there, never to return. That'll show 'em.

42.description: Parking sucks, but I live close enough that it's walking distance. The place is always busy during the weekends. There are usually long lines, but the servers move quickly. Sometimes they move too quickly though - I've had bagels that have been sliced awkwardly and unevenly slathered with cream cheese. However, I'm a sucker for bagels and can't really complain about this place. I love that they have low-fat cream cheese. My favorite is the honey walnut on a cinnamon raisin bagel. It's toasted deliciousness! The only downside is that they close early. I've had bagel cravings in the late afternoon/early evening and I've been forced to head to Dominick's to buy some second-class bagels.

23.description: The food here is good. That's not the problem.Like everyone else who has given this place a negative review, it's all because of the service. This location has the WORST service -- for no understandable reason.  I don't understand why the people working there are so slow - it happens consistently - regardless of whether the place is busy.  They forget food in the toaster, they only hear one food order, they take 30+ minutes to make ONE bagel.  I really don't understand, and I wish there was something other than writing a Yelp review to change this issue.  I want to keep eating the food, but do I really need to allot myself a half hour just to pick up lunch?If the people who own this place read this, please fix this problem. Soon.

47.description: I may be lucky, but I have found this Einstein to be far superior to the one in the Gold Coast that I also frequent. Service is always fast, and the line seems to move much faster here. I do love the patio here too.. a great place to pass the morning.

8.description: Overpriced for a mediocre breakfast sandwich. I ordered a egg and ham on a cinnamon raisin toasted. The bagel wasn't bad (and I'm a New Yorker) but having fake eggs is inexcusable. It looked like egg beaters and really ruined the sandwich. Service wasn't friendly either.

31.description: I've had a fair share of bagels in my days, including New York bagels which are supposed to be best in the land, but Einstein Bros (regardless of location) always ranks among the best.  The coffee is also very top notch. I see many people who complain about the efficiency of the service in this place, but hey, that's life -- sometimes there's a long line, sometimes not. I'd sooner complain about people who can't make up their mind when placing an order. The problem is seldom the traffic lights; it is almost always the drivers.Anyway, thumbs up to Einstein's. They should be everywhere.

34.description: I truly feel that the bagel is a forgotten food wonder of the world. Its the perfect excuse to over dose on mountains of cream cheese. I am truly jealous that this chain doesn't exist where I live, I have to seek out an actual bakery if I want a fresh bagel. We came in after a cold day of shopping just needing a coffee. My boyfriend got an americano and I got an orange juice.Now, I cant rate the bagels because we didn't have one, but the store was clean, well stocked with bottled juices and such, and the americano was surprisingly not bad. The staff wasn't exactly friendly though, seems like they don't focus on quality when they do their hiring.

16.description: I'm a regular around 11 am on weekdays, so stop here if you want to know about service during earlier hours. I have a few favorite employees and overall appreciate their consistent friendliness, although if you don't want to tell anyone how your day is going, go someplace else... "Bring your own traveler for $1 coffee is an amazing deal!" Asiago bagel with salmon cream cheese and a Vanilla Hazelnut coffee with splenda and cream is a wonderful midday pick-me-up. I love their unflavored coffee as well. If you're a stickler for piping hot fresh coffee, you may occasionally be disappointed. But overall they're fine. My only complaint is that, by lunch time, they replace their dairy carafes. I often have to ask for half and half, and they refill the same one, which is not very sanitary (former Starbucks employee).

13.description: Disappointing. I gave this location another try because I live close and get a bagel craving sometimes, but I'll never give my money here again. They are constantly out of bagels and getting orders wrong. Today I ordered 3 bagels toasted, and none of them were toasted and the cream cheese was wrong.  Their credit card machine was broken so it was also cash only. Employees have a bad attitude and the slow service reflects that.

11.description: Don't get me wrong, I love bagels and usually einsteins. But this is by far the worst one I have any been too. Even if there is only  2 or 3 people in line I wait upwards of 15 minutes, the staff is extremely rude and slow, and they do not open when they are scheduled to open. This morning I went when they opened and they would not open the door for me and the man in front of me, and locked the door. This place needs new employees.

39.description: I'm so glad I'm not the first to review the service at this location.Say what you want about the food. It does it for me in a pinch. But when I get only 1/2 hour for lunch and it takes me 15 minutes to get a damn bagel I get grouchy. I'm consistently horrified by the attitude I get from these people - and I work in retail, so I know how easy it is to smile. Freakin' smile, people. I'd even take that. Mostly I get an annoyed look, as though I'm interrupting some pressing appointment. You don't have to look like I'm making your day by ordering a bagel, but at least don't look like I'm ruining it.Sigh. I hate leaving negative reviews of places, but if you can go anywhere else in this neighborhood, do it.

37.description: I'm reviewing this place... because I liked it about 110% better than the Lincoln Park Einsteins. Granted, that's not saying much... but the staff here is much better.Still took me about 15 minutes (in a line) to order a turkey sandwich on a bagel, but at least everyone was friendly and helpful. The LP einsteins usually makes me want to cry. Haha.I got the turkey cheddar melt by the way, and I don't recommend it. It was too hot, seriously. I was in a hurry and didn't have that much time to eat, and I wasn't even sure if I was going to have time to eat it because it was so hot. I know they probably have better sandwich options, but it was pretty bland. Still not 5 star service by any means, but in comparison, I'll take it.

0.description: Good: Soft, warm, delicious every seed bagels made fresh every day.Bad: Bagels run out pretty quick, especially the good varieties (every seed, poppy)Worse: Clean your ice machine! There is consistently black/brown particles in the ice cubes. It's pretty disgusting and a shame because their fountain coke mix game is on point.

38.description: Of course a chain will never measure up to a great deli bagel - but with its convenient location only a block away from my place, Einstein Bros has quickly become a weekend tradition for me.Don't worry about stumbling over in your PJs - most other people in line with be sporting some sort of sweat pants. Or, they will be in their running clothes fresh off the lake where they've been training with those obnoxiously oversized runner groups that feel as though they can block the entire path. OK, sorry for the digression. Anyways, don't let the long line scare you, they are ready for the rush at this location and everything moves pretty quick- and never have they made a misstep with my order. I go with the good grains bagel (double toasted) with light cream cheese, tomato and lox pretty much everytime. I went for months not ordering my favorite breakfast smoked fish thinking it wouldn't measure up- so glad I took a chance because something about Sunday mornings makes me crave a bagel and lox and now I don't have to do much more then roll out of bed to get it. Everyone seems to love the assorted breakfast sandwiches too...me personally, I can't get myself to eat those pre-formed egg circles, but that's just me. They certainly smell good!Probably 2 of these stars are for the AMAZING Einstein coffee, which is aptly named "darn good coffee". Now you can even buy one of their cute travel mugs for $2.50 and refills are only 99 cents when you bring the cup in. Saving the environment and money- I'm all about it. If you are lucky enough to live near an Einstein, it really does the trick for a filling weekend breakfast without the mandatory primping and 45 minute wait of many Chicago Brunch spots.

51.description: I'm not sure why I continue to come here. Their bagels aren't even good, but because of the few delis in this area I do grab a sandwich at Einsteins every once in a while. There were only about 3 people ahead of me in line today and they were moving so slow- it took them about 20 minutes per person. And these people were getting cream cheese on a bagel- nothing complicated! Finally it was my turn to be helped, but then I had to wait another 10 min at the cash register because the guy working it was busy on his cell phone. I don't know if the other Einstein locations are better, but the service at this one is awful.

27.description: woke up in the mood for NY bagels ... happen to drive by Einstein in the afternoon - great!store looks nice, it actually ... smells like NY bagel shop! great.order one "thin" bagel (another "great" ... many times, i wished in NY that someone'd come up w/ thinner bagels) w/ flavored cream cheese. i also add regular one & a strudel to the order."ricky" (i think) - the cashers bangs out $10.85 ... what? (wasn't expecting NY prices :). now, i hate to sound winy, but it was either the lack of training of the new casher or ... her carelessness. but it took another 10 min & few interactions from the manager for her to correct the order, to the correct $6.07ohh yeah, the bagels are delicious & authentic NY bagels :)

32.description: We tried the the new egg white bagel panini and I am happy to say I'd have it again. Beyond sesame seed bagels, I don't care for them too much. So it says a lot that I actually like the sandwich! Oh... less than 400 calories in this bad boy, too. Bonus.

54.description: There aren't many good places to get a bagel in Chicago so I often end up grabbing brunch at Einsteins. It does the trick if I'm craving deli food, but it doesn't compare to any of the deli's in NY.  I do really enjoy the tasty turkey sandwich though so try that.

48.description: Not only they have great bagles and sandwiches, I always order ahead of times and they are ready.  It is really convenient that way.  Otherwise the wait could be long.I truly LOVE their bagles.....

44.description: We go to Einstein's a lot. Especially because the only other breakfast place we really like in the neighborhood is Nookie's, and sometimes we just don't feel like waiting in line, ya know? So Einstein's is always the backup. And I've always been relatively satisfied with my honey whole wheat bagel with light cream cheese. I mean, sometimes I'd specify not toasted, and it would come out toasted, but eh, whatever. And then Sunday happened. Mike M.'s egg sausage cheese on a potato bagel came out fine, and then we pulled mine out of the bag. No cream cheese on it. So we had to go back and the very cranky lady working gave us cream cheese. Then I look closely at the bagel and smell it, and it's not honey wheat, it's PUMPKIN. Now, I know I'm in the minority here, but I *HATE* pumpkin - pumpkin pie, pumpkin ice cream, pumpkin muffins, and pumpkin bagels. So at this point, I was pretty annoyed. I finally got my correct order, and not two minutes later, a different woman was up at the counter complaining that she had gotten the wrong order also. So I know you're busy, Einstein's, but maybe you need a new system - like maybe the one that Starbucks and every fast food place in the world has - where you order first, and then your food gets made. At any rate, something needs to change to keep the customers happy here.

24.description: First the chain:  Einstein's has a wide variety of bagels and "schmears" which are fun, tasty and delicious.  This location:  I love Eintein's bagels, but find that there is a large variety in the quality and cleanliness of locations, more so than other franchises.  This Einstein's is well run, clean, and the staff is super friendly.  Every bagel I've had here has been fresh--often times they're running out of different types of bagels on a Saturday morning around 11, which is usually when I go.  *Sometimes* the coffee is not so well-made, but never terrible.  Overall, good bagels!

7.description: Store not very clean. I come here weekly and it's never open on time. Unfortunately my kids like these bagels. Today the reason was their systems were acting up. Acting up? That didn't make sense. They will open 6:45am. I wonder what the reasons were previously?

49.description: These sandwiches are pretty good, but the hours here are terrible.

40.description: I don't really have anything to add that hasn't been said by other reviewers, but I'm bored and procrastinating and wanted to write a review of something. I happened to have lunch at this Einstein's today, so it's the big winner! Or loser.I'm not a huge fan of Einstein's- I have high bagel standards and these don't quite cut the mustard.  But in a pinch, if I'm really craving one, I'll suck it up and go. I do like the coffee- I never ever get sweet flavored coffee, but whenever I'm at Einstein's I'll get 3/4 regular and 1/4 vanilla hazelnut. And you know what? It's tasty.As others have mentioned, the service at this location blows. Pretty hardcore.  The guy behind the counter today didn't seem to know where anything was, and told us that he doesn't normally work in that store. Okay, understandable. The manager (I'm assuming based on the lack of a yellow and black polo) was extremely un-interested in making our experience a good one. And I guess if I was the manager of a mediocre chain bagel place, I'd be pretty blase too. However, they have pizza bagels. And if there's one thing this girl loves, it's a pizza bagel. And I'm not just saying that because I have wicked PMS and would eat anything that's covered in cheese and pepperoni. Oh wait. . .So basically, 3 stars for the decent coffee and rockin' pizza bagels.

53.description: Just not a fan of these bagels....unfortunately there aren't many other places to get a good bagel in Chicago, but Einsteins is worse than most.

30.description: I have not been to this Einstein in a couple of years. Now I tend to go to the one located on Diversey which I recently reviewed and can say it is my favorite Einstein so far. That is based on the service, food, and the layout of the store itself. However I was in the area and grabbed lunch with a friend at this location. We ordered Paninis but the bread that was made with them was out so they made it on a bagel instead which I imagine tasted better as it was very good. The lolita with the accent made the sandwhiches, she was nice. There was also a big gal with big ol bagels if you know what I mean and a scarf around her head. She must have been the manager because everytime the lolita wanted to do something on the register she would need to call her. At first the manager was intimidating but she turned out to be jolly. It was a nice lunch, I am just giving it three stars because I can't say it is as nice as the Diversey location.

46.description: Open at 5.30 am? Nice!!This alone makes this place so awesome for me. I had passed it so many times when I was going biking on Lake Shore Drive.Finally, after much internal debate and justifying ("there is really no breakfast in the house") I went in. The bagel was perfectly toasted with low fat cream cheese. What I really liked was the different types of low fat cream cheese, took me a few minutes to actually decide what I wanted. BTW it tastes just as good cold.

1.description: The most lackluster customer service I have ever experienced. The staff was unfriendly and unhelpful. Woman at the counter blatantly ignored the fourth member of our party and did not take her order. Reconsider your staffing processes.

55.description: For a quick lunch or breakfast on the go, Einstein's is the perfect place.  They have great sandwiches and of course- great bagels.  The people who work there are friendly and even on weekends the line moves along at a good pace so you don't have to wait too long.  If you are in the mood for a sandwich the Einstein Club is my favorite, and the soups are great as well.  And if you are ordering breakfast they have great egg and cheese sandwiches!

9.description: I come here all the time to get the lox & bagel and with every visit, I get less and less lox. Service is sub par and the menu states that a sandwich will include a pickle and a choice of chips, potato salad or fresh fruit. I have been denied multiple times for a choice of any of these items. Not sure if the menu is misleading or if my experience at this Einstein Bros location has been a disaster since day 1, but I am very angered with my experiences here. I will not be coming back until I see some significant improvements in service, portions (there is no set standard for how much lox should be on the bagel), and a clear explanation of why I did not receive pickles or any of the side choices for my past purchases.

26.description: A lot of fast food style places with distinct breakfast and lunch menus discontinue offering the breakfast items after breakfast time. I went in at 1pm yesterday and expected to not be able to get an egg sandwich but I was delightfully surprised! I moved up to Chicago from orlando where my love for Einstein initiated and I'm glad it's here and that breakfast can extend well past 10:30AM

25.description: The bagels are consistently good at the location, however this post is about their service.  Parked the car in a street paid spot, put enough quarters to be clear for 25 min., ordered a plain bagel with veggie cream cheese, with a line of 2 people, and I took it to go, and I came back to a ticket, be Ashe it took about 30 minutes to get my bagel. Slowest service ever!!!  If you are not in a rush and want a good bagel then ok,but if you are like the rest of the busy paced world, you could probably skip this place.

12.description: I love the bagels and cream cheese  but the staff here is so slow and never know what they're doing. Always looking up recipes etc

21.description: A long time ago (at least 12 years), an Einstein's came to Batavia (I think it was that town) and I fell in LOVE with their Veggie Delight bagel sandwich! I liked the sesame seed bagel, the cream cheese shmear (cute name, right?!), the spouts, cucumbers, and whatever else was on that delicious creation!Fast Forward to current day when I realized that THIS Einstein's is around the corner from one of my haunts. Then I swiped two Einstein coupons from M (I knew she wasn't going to use them for herself). I treated myself on two separate days. Each time I got the same thing: a Veggie Delight bagel sandwich, and apple, and a pickle. The pickle was tasty, but wilted.This location is fairly clean and the employees are courteous. Once I ate my sandwich there and the other time I took it to go. I can't say that the dining experience was that incredible or anything. I was by myself and had nothing to look at. No TV and nothing to read. I looked at the menu and noticed that my sandwich isn't on the menu but appreciated that the employees had no problems making it for me or charging me for it.Although I once was in love with Einstein's, I can't say that flame burns strong anymore. The sandwich was good, but I doubt that I will ever be a regular.

17.description: I went here to grab a bagel and a smoothie. They didn't toast my bagel because it had "just gotten out of the oven" but it wasn't very warm and it was actually chewy and underdone. When I got to the register, the employee walked away and mumbled that someone else would help me, I waited 10 minutes while the other employees ignored me and made food for a group of 4 people behind me. When someone finally came to ring me up, I opted against the smoothie because I had no clue how long it would take. Overall the quality of service and food was sub-par, something you don't expect from a well established chain. I would suggest going to one of the many other restaurants on Wells St., I won't make this mistake again.

10.description: A long time ago (at least 12 years), an Einstein's came to Batavia (I think it was that town) and I fell in LOVE with their Veggie Delight bagel sandwich! I liked the sesame seed bagel, the cream cheese shmear (cute name, right?!), the spouts, cucumbers, and whatever else was on that delicious creation!Fast Forward to current day when I realized that THIS Einstein's is around the corner from one of my haunts. Then I swiped two Einstein coupons from M (I knew she wasn't going to use them for herself). I treated myself on two separate days. Each time I got the same thing: a Veggie Delight bagel sandwich, and apple, and a pickle. The pickle was tasty, but wilted.This location is fairly clean and the employees are courteous. Once I ate my sandwich there and the other time I took it to go. I can't say that the dining experience was that incredible or anything. I was by myself and had nothing to look at. No TV and nothing to read. I looked at the menu and noticed that my sandwich isn't on the menu but appreciated that the employees had no problems making it for me or charging me for it.Although I once was in love with Einstein's, I can't say that flame burns strong anymore. The sandwich was good, but I doubt that I will ever be a regular.

5.description: Love their bagels but this morning I had a breakfast sandwich and the egg tasted fake.  Very fake and also not fresh.I guess I will just stick to bagels from now on and skip the egg sandwiches.My favorite is the chili bagel.  Just wish I could have a real egg on it.Service was ok.

3.description: Terrible service the people working are barely doing their jobs and they mumble. Very unfriendly no wonder all the Einstein's have shut down in Chicago. This one needs to go!

35.description: I lived on this block almost 4years. And DESPERATELY tried to avoid eating here. HORRENDOUS service. WTF are the obnoxious, rowdy, borderline braindead staff doing!?!? They carry on their own inappropriate, LOUD conversations while you are standing right in front of them, waiting ridiculous amounts of time for a toasted bagel.Incessant complaints have been made to the manager. NOTHING changes. These schmucks should be working cash registers at Subway or Dominicks. A GED should be a requirementWhat a fucking disgraceRIPOFF. $10 for a turkey sandwich & coffee?!?!?!

19.description: I missed lunch today, so I decided to get a quick bite here since it was nearby. I ordered an Onion bagel with cream cheese and a strawberry banana shake for just over 5$. Onion bagel was alright and the shake tasted a little like concentrated fruit syrups blended together... so overall just a 3/5. Decent but I've had better.

28.description: After a day when HSBC epically screwed me and I've spent all day dealing with incompetence, Einstein's was a pleasant experience. Not perfect, I'll admit: the guy forgot to ask me if I wanted my bagel toasted. But they were friendly and engaging, and when I asked to borrow a phone because my own had died, the lady behind the counter got me her own personal phone. Would definitely visit here again.There are clearly contrasting experiences based on other reviews - but this is one more data point to add to the mix. The bagels are undeniably tasty and I had a positive experience.

45.description: I used to really like this place.  Been here probably 6 times and never had a problem.  Quick service and good bagels.  However, don't go very early when they open (supposed to at 5:30 am).  They actually opened late, the manager wasn't interested in selling anything yet, coffee wasn't ready, and they didn't have any honey butter.  Now, being that it's the butt-crack of dawn, and typically the only thing I'm interested in that early is punching someone in the neck for waking me up (unless it's a girl, you can't hit girls, in which case my responsed are just grunts and I move slower), I can totally relate to the unfriendliness of the manager.  But how the hell do you not have any fucking honey butter?!  I mean, really.  That's just ridiculous.  Personally, I think he was just too lazy to go get it, or he was pissed that I came in to buy something.  Seriously, fuck that guy.  Still, I would go back.  Just not in the early morning.  Apologies for the language, but I really love honey butter.  Ruined my bagel without it.

33.description: I have yet to visit an Einstein's in the city or suburbs that isn't terribly managed.  They have the worst, most inefficient system for ordering, food prep, check out and coffee station maintenance.  The line here gets crazy despite 9 people working because of this system.  Even when I'm the only one there it is painfully slow.  I just don't get it, Einstein's.Unfortunately, there isn't an alternative within a few blocks so I continue to come here and then get mad at myself for giving in again...

43.description: This Einstein Bagel has to be the worst location I've ever been to. The staff was extremely slow not to mention VERY rude. The manager was talking back to the customer and telling them off (this happened more than once). I gave this place a second try (after a horrible first experience) and I was let down a second time! I would definately not go to this place. There are much better local breakfast places!!!!

2.description: I always liked the convenience of this location in the neighborhood. It is always busy, but was worth the wait. Unfortunately, after my experience today, I will not be going back. I should have known the experience would be anything but normal the moment I stepped in the door. Upon entering I had to step over a pile of garbage and broom sitting on the floor in the middle of the store. Not a big deal, these things happen, places get busy. But then I get to the counter, the customer in front of me leaves in a huff without placing an order after dealing with one of the rudest servers I've ever encountered. Although a red flag, I'm hungry...so I stick around. I order a Ham and Swiss breakfast bagel and a side of potato salad. The server yells that that sandwich isn't a combo and doesn't come with potato salad?!?! Her rant was so out of nowhere, her co-worker jumped in to tell her to calm down. I told her I understood it did not come with potato salad and that I would pay additional money for it. Can you believe the nerve of me...to want to purchase an additional item from a business that in fact offers that particular item. I really owe that woman an apology.I wish I could say my bad experience ended there. Upon receiving my food, I tried to put the encounter behind me and sit down to eat. I placed my food on the table and went to grab a fork for the potato salad. When I returned to sit down, my now favorite employee has picked up the broom everyone coming in the store had to step over and told me she was sweeping the area  (which included the table I had my opened food on). I quickly packed up my food and got outta there. I am not sure what time they close (was there at 12:30), but I definitely got  the impression that I was holding them up from leaving.So I will do them a favor and never inconvenience them again. There are plenty of other options in the neighborhood that actually enjoy when you spend money in their establishments. Good luck with employees like that Einstein's, you are going to need it.
