18.description: DISGUSTING!!!!  I've been passing by this chain's stores for 2 years now and today I finally got around to trying this store.  I paid $3.88 for 2 bagels and both of them were very raw on the inside even though they looked normal on the outside.  Unfortunately I was home, an hour away, before I discovered I'd been sold raw dough so they don't have to worry about me coming back for a well deserved refund.  By raw I'm not meaning a little undercooked I'm talking about COMPLETELY RAW dough inside (not like very moist and chewy, but as raw as it was in the mixer before it was shaped into bagels) like the interior had never had even the slightest bit of heat reach it.  I guess the only thing that keeps me from totally getting irate about it is that I've never heard of anybody getting food poisoning from completely raw bread dough so I guess these people won't kill anybody with uncooked products.I'll never step inside another one of their stores after this experience.  I hate McDonalds restaurants (which there is one only about a half block away right on Wells, go there instead), but to be truthfull I'd stop at McDonalds and get one of their rubbery and tasteless bagels they use in breakfast sandwiches before I'd ever return here.  At least McDonalds uses cooked bagels.  You'd think if a fast food chain can sell cooked bagels then a bagel shop should certainly be able to.  If this is how they do business they really need to shut down their chain and stop embarassing themselves and ripping off paying customers!  They don't even deserve the one star I've given them, but unfortunately here on Yelp everybody gets at least one star no matter how disgusting they are.I have contacted the company at their corporate website and have reported this store and I hope others who are also experiencing problems at this or other of their stores will go to their website and use the Contact Us link at the bottom of the webpage to report this place.  Maybe if enough of us complain they will fix the problems.

41.description: Why waste my time on yelping a chain like Einstein (which is generally consistently good), you say? Because this location is the worst in the world!!!  Yes, that is quite a bold statement but a true one at that.The employees here are incompetent, for lack of a better word.  I live next door and due to pure laziness always find myself trekking in because I don't want to walk any further when the wind chill is below zero.  I can't tell you how many times I've been in there and NO ONE HELPS ME.  One time I found myself going to the cashier to order and she responds "did you order with them first?" (them being the people behind the counter who make your bagel) "No" I respond..(because they won't even LOOK at me I want to yell).  "Well you have to order with them first"  Ok.  So I go to the people behind the counter (side note:  I am the only person looking to order , mind you, they are not even remotely busy and there are 3 people behind the counter and one person at the register).  "Hi, can I place my order here?"  I ask quietly."Yeah when none of us are busy doing something else." one employee responds.Ok, I officially hate you, Einstein employee.TWO SECONDS later, the same employee looks at me, and says, "ok, what do you want?"It was like the scene from "Meet the Parents" where the flight attendant won't let Ben Stiller on the plane even though no one else is there.One star because I like the spicy jalepeno cream cheese.

52.description: I wish they would open up more bagel places around the city.  If you go out to the suburbs you'll find Einstein's or Great American Bagel on every block but not in the city.  This location on Wells has great sandwiches and the people who work there are super nice.  I just don't get there too often because I'm not in that area.  Please open up more Einstein locations!

50.description: I don't typically review chains like Einsteins because I figure if I don't like reading about chain restaurants other yelpers won't as well. However, this Einsteins, which I frequent often since it is right in my neighborhood, has the worst service ever! I stopped in this morning for a bagel and my experience was typical for what I'm used to from this Einsteins. There was only one woman in front of me and a bunch of employees standing there doing nothing. It took at least 15 minutes until I was able to place my order and by that time 2 customers behind me had decided to walk out due to slow service.  It's understandable if you have to wait because a restaurant is super busy, but when there is hardly a line there is no excuse. I continue to go back because there aren't many places for bagels/sandwiches in my neighborhood, but I definitely visit Einsteins a less often than I used to.

4.description: Great place for quick bagels. Also teas,  coffees and fountain drinks. Had a delicious egg bacon cheese bagel and a cream cheese bagel for about $5

6.description: Be sure to check your bag before you leave. 1.  Girl said she put potato salad in bag. Negative. 2 bagel was supposed to be toasted. Negative 3. Had to wait for more ice to be put in drink dispenser. 4. Strong roast coffee tasted weaker than medium roast. Neither was good. There are many good food choices on Wells. Skip this one!

22.description: DISGUSTING!!!!  I've been passing by this chain's stores for 2 years now and today I finally got around to trying this store.  I paid $3.88 for 2 bagels and both of them were very raw on the inside even though they looked normal on the outside.  Unfortunately I was home, an hour away, before I discovered I'd been sold raw dough so they don't have to worry about me coming back for a well deserved refund.  By raw I'm not meaning a little undercooked I'm talking about COMPLETELY RAW dough inside (not like very moist and chewy, but as raw as it was in the mixer before it was shaped into bagels) like the interior had never had even the slightest bit of heat reach it.  I guess the only thing that keeps me from totally getting irate about it is that I've never heard of anybody getting food poisoning from completely raw bread dough so I guess these people won't kill anybody with uncooked products.I'll never step inside another one of their stores after this experience.  I hate McDonalds restaurants (which there is one only about a half block away right on Wells, go there instead), but to be truthfull I'd stop at McDonalds and get one of their rubbery and tasteless bagels they use in breakfast sandwiches before I'd ever return here.  At least McDonalds uses cooked bagels.  You'd think if a fast food chain can sell cooked bagels then a bagel shop should certainly be able to.  If this is how they do business they really need to shut down their chain and stop embarassing themselves and ripping off paying customers!  They don't even deserve the one star I've given them, but unfortunately here on Yelp everybody gets at least one star no matter how disgusting they are.I have contacted the company at their corporate website and have reported this store and I hope others who are also experiencing problems at this or other of their stores will go to their website and use the Contact Us link at the bottom of the webpage to report this place.  Maybe if enough of us complain they will fix the problems.

15.description: the staff behind the counter will greet you and make eye contact. I did not see if they wore name tags. They have free WiFi, but they expect you to buy something. There is a small eating area. It is not very busy for its location. There are no public bathrooms. I don't want to spend a lot for a bagel, so that place would be better for someone willing to spend more than .99 for bread. The menu items were more expensive than starbucks and dunkin donuts. If you plan on eating there, bring coupons.

20.description: I have been stopping here on my way to the office practically every morning lately. Delicious bagels and awesome specialty coffee! Way better and more affordable than Starbucks. For the price of a large coffee at Starbucks, at Einsteins I can get with it a bagel and schmear. The service is friendly and fast. I wish there was one closer to my office to also try their lunch stuff.

36.description: I love Einstein's coffee, I do! I like to mix 'n' match a little of their dark Euro Blend with whatever seasonal or flavored coffee they might have. Fall is great for a little Cinnamon or Hazelnut topper to my dark roast. Of course the only real reason to review a Chain is for service, speed, selection.The line was long the morning I went, which is fine..but it was also SLOW. There were plenty of worker bees but no Queen to keep them from buzzing aimlessly back and forth behind the counter. My breakfast sandwich was good...but it's a chain, it shouldn't be any different anywhere in the country!This location had the weirdest mix of clientele I've ever seen. Not quite Lincoln Park baby buggy set, but there were parents that let their kids touch every bottle of water and juice in the cooler while they talked on their cell phone...Not cool. Also, as a Public Service, please DO put on something other than your PJs, sweats or scrubs people. Please. This isn't the campus library anymore. But that's just my own etiquette pet peeve. Don't make me come in with my velour bathrobe and flip flops!! Because I will!

14.description: I live directly above and steal the wifi regularly and it is pretty slow. Also when I shower for over 20 min the pipes leak and it goes right on the bagels! I assume they throw them out after that happens but I don't leave things like that to chance.. Einstein's coffee is pretty terrible too, there's a Starbucks across the street so why bother?

12.description: My prediction- this place won't make it. The food just isn't that good. Case in point- I ordered a polish with raw onion and mustard. They served it on a french roll. Not a hot dog bun. Seems kind of dumb to me. Also. Fries were just sort of, eh.  Just overall an forgettable experience. My advice- don't bother.

7.description: This place is great. Super nice people, very clean, has anything you want for a quick meal, late night snack, or drunk food after the bar.

3.description: The only not bourgeois restaurant round here lolDankI see nothing wrong with this place ... fast, fresh, cheap ... V grateful to have a walkable passable hot dog joint yo

1.description: I ordered the hot dog special. The girl taking the order asked what I wanted on the dogs. While making the dogs, she asked again what I wanted on the dogs. When I sat down to eat the dogs i discovered that she go the order WRONG. Really? Also, it took 15 minutes to fill the order. I was the only customer in the place. I asked for the order to be "here". She brought it in a bag to go. Finally, she had a snotty attitude. Portillos is the only place I will go from now on. The owner of this place needs to properly train the staff here.

2.description: Stopped in yesterday at 11:30 for 4 Chicago Dogs, a Polish Sausage and a FF/ grand total $20, no big deal price wise.  Problem was that none of the hot dogs were even cooked? Literally cold-lukewarm/ we were hungry so we ate em anyway.. this is a hot dog joint on Wells St in Chicago! Really? Can't steam a hot dog properly.. OK// +1 star for the great condiments

9.description: Just a few blocks down from The Second City, this is an ideal after show stop to complete your Chicago experience. Nothing fancy here. Oh no. But the food is tasty, fast and affordable. We had the classic Italian beef sandwich "wet"... A generous portion of tender meat on a fresh, soft roll. You can get a classic Chicago hot dog here too, which seemed to be the favorite among the late night revelers who wandered in to cure their munchies!! The place is clean, safe and the service is friendly.

18.description: Cheese fries are amazing here. Great place to get food after the bars. I tried the Italian beef during the day and it was very average. I'll stop back to try a hot dog and give it another chance.

10.description: The Food I have gotten has always been made to order so hot and fresh and good.The pricing is way too high. It is a low rent fry stand and if you order cheese sticks and a small fry it is $9   Seems expensive to me when their portions are not large.

13.description: This place was basically built to feed drunk people at 2 am.  Unfortunately I'm sober and it's 2pm.  First off the employees all look like they get naked and smother themselves in mustard and then lick it off of each other when it's slow. There is a chalkboard menu with no prices which I didn't like. I ordered a hot dog and cheese fries.  That is all.  AND they messed up my order.  I sent it back for the cheese and then I was happy.  The hot dog sucked way too bread even though I had them drag it thru the garden.  But the cheese fries were goodI guess to put a positive spin I would have to say that at least the employees don't have important jobs that could cause real damage.  They don't build spaceships or perform open heart surgery or anything like that where their incompetence could get people killed.

16.description: Awesome hot dog stand. Old school. Very clean with great service and selection.  The menu has everything  you'd expect, from a polish to an Italian beef and delicious hand cut fries. This is what a great Chicago hot dog should be. Great for kids too. A great spot in old town.

17.description: The best hot dog in Chicago and I highly recommend A Maxwell st Polish Sausage Best in Town

15.description: Came in around 11pm and ordered chicken fingers, a polish and cheese fries. After 30 minutes asked what was going on and they had clearly forgotten our order. We still waited another 20 minutes and finally got our food and were given "free" mozzarella sticks only to get home and discover they forgot our cheese fries.

0.description: Some of the best onion rings in town! Other food is great too, open late! They also offer merkts cheddar on their menu, which is great addition to the burgers or the fries.

5.description: Just what the neighborhood needs!  Friendly staff and super fresh ingredients.  A little pricey but not outlandish.Maybe the best onion rings in the city.

11.description: Was taking a walk around, didn't want to spend much money today so we stopped in at this little hot dog place. The ladies there were very nice. It was a very clean cozy place to grab a bite!

8.description: i went in to order a polish , to be informed "all we have is hotdogs" thats all they wrote , if you have nothing available except hotdogs on a wednesday at lunch time thats just incompetence. i doubt it is worth returning

4.description: Currently Dog House Grill is the best hot dog stand in Old Town and a welcome addition at that. It offers hot dogs, Polish, Italian beef, pizza puffs and a few other classic Chicago quick bites. The food looks and tastes fresh and non-greasy. Service is pleasant and fast enough. The seating area is modest but relatively clean and not sticky or smelly.Dog House Grill is located in the space formerly occupied by Fresh Start, which was a health-conscious fast food takeout joint. I miss Fresh Start, however, Dog House Grill is appreciated, particularly given it keeps late night hours.I have eaten two Chicago dogs, one Polish and one Italian beef here. All appeared fresh, and the toppings and condiments were abundant. However, the dogs were missing celery salt and that's a sin in Chicago; otherwise they were authentic. The Italian beef was placed on Turano bread, and it was juicy and peppery, but the deep beefy flavor you get at famous beef stands was lacking. It was good though.I give Dog House Grill four stars because for what it is, essentially a Vienna factory outlet, this stand is the best in the area. On good weather days, I might leave Old Town for superior versions of the same genre food.[Edited 2-28-15:  Ordered a double cheeseburger and fries today. My usual burger - salt, pepper, pickles and ungrilled onions. The bun appeared to be a floured Turano potato one and it was moist as well as non-fake tasting; the meat was 5/8 lb and better tasting than Five Guys and local pub beef; the pickles contributed and did not distract; the onions were fresh sliced reds; the American cheese was your basic American, but the cook placed an extra slice on top and it was not completely melted in the center. Not a Butcher and The Burger burger experience but delicious and filling nevertheless.The fries stood out. These had some skin on them and were the puffy non-heavy higher end variety. Notably better than you typically would find at Butcher and The Burger or in Old Town. Quite potato-ey yet light and non-greasy. The fries were perfectly golden, snappy on the outside and, as stated, puffy on the inside. They were not heavily salted and didn't need it, I used very little ketchup because the fries themselves tasted good on their own and I ate majority plain.The food here is non-greasy or heavy for what it is. The ingredients are quality.Once word travels, and the summer Old Town bar and festival scene kicks in, this place and its location are going to make not just bank but a killing. Mark this.Now if only they will add wi-fi.]

14.description: Really refreshing and I loved it.Had a couple of the burgers and the polish. Meat was really really well cooked and grilled in a good way. Also enjoyed that they give you a hoagie roll for the polish so you don't get stuck with a drippy hot dog bun.Well worth it and quite rare for a hot dog place, it's extremely clean inside and good for sitting.

6.description: Good burger ( got the double ) and cheese fries. Cheese fries are a huge portion. It's good hangover food. This street and area lacks this type of food, so it's a convenient addition for those drunken munchies or just a greasy meal. I went during the day for lunch and was the only person in there so it was fast.

3.description: Joan Cusack sold me a jar of honeyBFF & I were walking around Old Town when we see this fun window display w/ all kinds of neat bric-a-bracJudy Maxwell Home - a fun curio shop owned by Joan Cusack - had a very eclectic collection w/ a wonderfully random bit of everything like Barnum & Bailey's Animal Cracker boxes, some fun costume jewelry, there was the pay phone in the window, a football helmet, some antique furniture, the gift baskets, some china pattern type dishes displayed on antique type table. Also, some funny cards............and lots of jars of what I think I see as "Local Raw Honey".  This immediately caught my eye as I am a big believer of the benefits of raw honey & I like to grab honeys from my travelsSure enough, it is confirmed that this is indeed raw honey, locally sourced - that's all I needed to hear!Thick & very mild flavor - this honey would be great w/ sweet & savory dishes alike.  I could see using it in coffee or drizzled over cheese (just to name a couple uses)Joan happened to be in the shop on the day we visited & she explained how they use the honey w/ other things from their Tisane setup to have drinkys on cold fall / wintry days.....such a fantastic ideaThe shop was getting ready for the holiday season & starting to put together "themes" of gifts on their shelves - which would make it very easy to grab a unique & fun holiday gift.....they already did all the thinking & put it all together for youDefinitely worth a stop if in the Old Town area - lots to discover & enjoy!

1.description: Walked in on a whim after an afternoon at the Chicago History Museum and exploring Old Town. Fun and eclectic shop full of great items. Found a card for my dad's birthday and a great souvenir for my step-daughter.My wife had a headache and purchased some aspirin. As the clerk rang us up, she asked if they had bottles of water so she could take one. The woman replied, "no, but let me get you a glass of water. I'll be right back". As she walked away my wife said, "she's an actress". I replied, "you mean Joan Cusack"? "Yes!" "No way..."We paid and left, very happy with our purchases and kindness of the lady who couldn't possibly have been Joan Cusack.Later over dinner, my wife again brought it up and we began doing a little research... Holy CRAP!!! It was Joan Cusack!!!Joan, thank you so much for taking the extra time to get a glass of water for my wife. It helped her headache immensely!We loved the store and truly appreciate your kindness :-)Kurt & Sloane

2.description: It is such an amazing store. Great for fun gifts, gifts for birthdays, anniversaries and I have yet to leave without buying myself something too! Staff is fun , knowledgeable & not at all pushy!

5.description: Delightful surprises, items you did not know you needed, and perfect gifts for the hardest-to-buy for -- that is the enticing assortment you will find in this adorable little island of whimsy and wit curated by one of Hollywood's most delightful performers, Joan Cusack.  The store is named for one of her favorite movie characters, the madcap Barbra Streisand role in "What's Up Doc?" The staff is friendly and encouraging, but never pushy, and they are happy to have your items autographed by Ms. Cusack, if you like.  From delightfully goofy to oh-no-they-didn't outrageous, there is something here for everyone.

6.description: Judy Maxwell is such a fun, inspiring, cute little shop. When I recently visited my mama in Chicago, we came by here a few times just to find cute little gifts for my nieces and brother. I bought a few treasures here, but could have bought much much more. The ladies working here were so sweet and struck up friendly conversation while we browsed around. I thought it was neat that Joan owned the shop. I'm a fan of hers in a huge way especially because of her role in Shameless. I hope people are mindful of her privacy, though, and don't smother her in her own shop.

7.description: LOVE this store!  When they first opened, the fantastical window display immediately grabbed my attention.  I wasn't even sure of what it was but I knew I liked it!  Once they officially opened my feelings were confirmed.  I dig it!!!Super cool vintage wares, cool art, cards, jewelry, locally sourced natural products, home decor of all kinds and...just treasures everywhere.  What's more is that if you are a fan of anything I just listed, the staff will happily geek out with you whilst on your journey through the store.  I love this addition to the neighborhood. Yay!!!

0.description: This place is fantastic, and thankfully so close to my work!  It has saved me multiple times when I am in "last-minute gift" situations.  The staff is fun and friendly, and there are always new items to look at.  Sometimes I stop in on my lunch break just to look around, because something usually makes me smile or laugh.  My friends and family are always pleasantly surprised with the gifts I get from Judy Maxwell Home, because they are unique items that can't be found just anywhere.  It's great to have shopping options like this in Old Town.

4.description: Always find random things here...like  this baby outfit which they wrapped up like a Chicago style hot dog!!

29.description: This nail place was amazing:)  Just used my group on for the no chip mani and basic pedi!  Vince did an awesome job.  Was totally relax through the whole time!  His foot massage was great!  And people were all very friendly!  Will be seeing them again soon!  My nails never look better!

42.description: I had my first no-chip manicure in mid-June during a hectic string of destination weddings and a long weekend visiting friends in NYC.  And damned if the polish didn't stand up to everything I could throw at it in the three weeks that I had it on.  The manicurist was sweet and really helpful in picking out a color when I told her I wanted a shade of the sexiest red.  It was an absolutely stunning color.  And as soon as I walked out of the salon and down to Starbucks, I had already gotten two compliments on my nails.  I was sad at how quickly my nails started to grow.  I had never had a manicure before that allowed me to actually observe nail growth!  So, why the three-star review?  Well, I stopped in on a Saturday morning after going to the Green City Market to have the polish removed.  I have never seen anything destroy my fingernails so quickly!  First, she soaked my nails in a special acetone solution (apprently different from regular nail polish remover, although it smelled very similar).  Next, I sat for at least 15, if not 20 minutes with my hands inside glorified heating pads to loosen the polish.  Finally, the woman started scraping away at my nails with a metal tool that felt like it might take my fingernails with the polish. Over the next few hours my nails became very brittle and began to break off and peel away.  Needless to say, my poor little fingernails have been traumatized ever since.  Some are still peeling; others have dents and ridges from the intial scraping.  I've sworn off any manicures for awhile just trying to get my nails back to a normal, healthy state.  Anyway, your nails will look awesome for a couple weeks.  But if it's a process you're not willing (or cannot afford) to keep up for many months at a time, I wouldn't recommend it.

23.description: This place was SOOOOOO not worth it.  I went for a no chp manicure and a pedicure, and they did not have many reds to choose from.  Even worse, they can't match any of the red polishes they have to the ones offered in the no chip. That was what I specifically asked for. They were not apologetic, and they told me I was going to have to wait in order to do  the polish change.  The reds I ended up with still didn't match. They were actually VERY rude.  This was not a pleasant experience at all.  I will definately NOT go back.  There are so many other places in the city that have a much better selection of colors with a lot less attitude.

47.description: The owner wrote me after reading my initial review on yelp and had invited me to coming in for a complimentry service of my choice. My second experience was a complete 180 from my first. My appointment was on time, and I had nail tech that was absolutely amazing. She was a true perfectionist in making my nails look fabulous. Overal I'm very happy with my mani this time around and will definately go back again.

8.description: All in all, I was disappointed.Yes, I was a Groupon customer, but no, I don't think I should be given poor service. I actually live in the area and was really excited to learn that there was a nail salon nearby. I won't be going back for several reasons.I made an appointment a week in advance, and received 2 phone calls in-between. One was to request a schedule change b/c a nail technician quit (TMI) and the second was to confirm. I agreed to push my appointment back by 1 hour. I showed up 20 minutes early and planned on reading a magazine. When I announced my name the technician goes, what did I tell you? Ok. That was rude. I knew I was early, but I wanted to relax and read a magazine. That was a bit of a problem, because there wasn't a waiting room. Fortunately, I was able to jump in early. I went to pick out my mail polish color and all of them were practically empty. In fact, there wasn't much to choose from. Is this salon doing so poorly that they can't make sure their colors are in stock? That was a bit strange.I was told to go sit on a bench (yes, a bench) for my Pedi. There was no massage chair. FYI - the reason I like getting Pedi's is for the massage chair. That was disappointing. However, the technician did an excellent job! She really took her time and my feet felt brand new when she was done.I had to pick out a new color for my hands, because the color for my feet ran out. I thought was strange as well. Definitely the first time that ever happened before at nail salon. I picked out a new color and she began the Mani. However, another customer was getting a touch up on her no-chip Mani and needed to head out the door. My technician asked if it was ok to stop mine and help her. I felt rude saying no, so of course, I said sure. She was working on both of us at the same time. Again, very strange. I also noticed that the towel the technician was using is the exact towel I bought at Wal-Mart for my kitchen. Pretty low budget, but normally a very expensive place. The decor wasn't anything to speak of, and there was hip-hop music in the background. The other technicians were actually signing to it while working...again, strange.My technician did do an excellent job on my Mani. It's only the 2nd day, but it's holding up well. Obviously, this tech is the best asset this studio has.Another strange thing, there weren't any fans or lights to help with drying. Isn't that a fundamental in a nail salon?All in all, disappointing but great technician. I don't plan on going back.

31.description: I'm obsessed with Groupon, so when they ran a special for a no-chip mani and pedi here I decided it was time to try this much touted manicure. My nails are PERFECT!! The pedicure looks awesome too. I was the only client in the spa during my appointment because there was only one technician working. I'm not sure if this is how it normally is, but it made for a quick and easy visit. I did not have anything to take off my nails when I got there so I was in and out in an hour, but I have heard that having a previous no-chip to take off can add a few minutes. Final bonus: they have at least 40 no-chip colors to choose from!

34.description: I'm OK with blue nails if I pick a blue nail polish, but besides that I find blue nails to be pretty icky.  And after almost 2 years of no-chip manis at Sanctuary Nail Spa my nails turned blue. Yikes!! When Christina does my nails they are awesome. They last for weeks, which is afterall the whole point of the no chip manicure, and they certainly don't turn blue! And she's fun to chat with!However, when Christina is booked or traveling I've often tried other nail technicians here and it's just not the same. My nails chip within a week and the last few times they've turned an icky blue under my pink nail polish.I've decided to give up on Sanctuary Nail Spa, but haven't given up on the no chip manicure. Most recently I tried another brand of no-chip at the East Bank Club spa. It's the same price as Sanctuary Nail Spa ($40 for a no-chip). It's been 2 weeks of no chips and they are still pale pink, which is what I was going for. If I wanted blue nails I"d pick out a blue nail polish!

16.description: I can't believe I have not heard of this amazing thing called the "No-Chip Manicure" until now. Where in the world have I been??Let me start out by saying that I AM the chick that chips her manicure immediately, I mean like in the time it takes to get from the nail salon to my car...yep, I am really rough on my nails. I had stopped getting manicures because it was starting to become a waste of money.So as soon as I found out about the No-Chip, I looked up nail salons that specialize in it on Yelp, and thought I'd check out Sanctuary. I took my mom along because she was having the same chipping problems as I was. The process is really interesting. They put some type of gel on your nails and let it dry under a UV light, then apply the polish (with a paintbrush type tool) and put your hands back under the UV light. The end result is fantastic. I am so happy with my manicure (my mom is too)! It looks great. I think the most awesome thing is that you walk out of the shop and your nails are completely dry. There is no having to be delicate with your hands for a couple of hours just to make sure your manicure doesn't chip. And the whole process only took about an hour. It's been three days since my manicure and not a chip in sight!I also noticed that some people docked stars because they said the inside of Sanctuary doesn't look very spa-like. It's small, but very comfortable. And no, it doesn't look like one of those big, expensive downtown/loop spas where you're most likely paying for the ambience. Maybe it's just the type of person I am, but as long as a place is clean and neat, the service is the most important thing to me. And my No-Chip manicure turned out great! I'll be back!

13.description: This is a no frills place. They did an adequate job.I would've chosen 3 stars if it meant 'ok' but 'a ok' implies that it was a better than average experience.If you're looking for a basic place to get a mani/pedi give them a try. 2 stars doesn't mean bad it just means it was nothing special.

11.description: I had purchased on of the deals for a $35 no chip mani and regular pedi.After trying no chip at a few other salons and many times at each, I figured why not?  I could not be happier!!    They were able to squeeze me in the day I called even with their busy schedule.  I had Brigitte and she was fantastic.  Super nice and attentive.  I had to rush her a bit (my meter was going to be up) and she was still nice about it and still did a high quality job.      It has now been two weeks today and my nails still have no chips!!  Everywhere else I have been I have gotten chips in a week and a half or less.  I'm sure I could even go another week.      Parking is super hard and expensive (it'd old town after all). I initially thought that this was going to deter me from coming back, but after seeing how amazing my nails STILL look I will drive around and pay extra for parking!

39.description: Overall feeling of the "spa" is not a spa. It was recommended by a friend and we went and it just wasn't up to par. I may be being prissy but I like my nails done in a better non-mainstream environment. I know Mojo spa is overpriced or priced high depending how you look at it, but this place is just nothing special really.They give out coupons and run specials but I wouldn't go unless I was desperate and they were the last available. The pedicure stations look SO uncomfortable. Been once and will most likely keep it at that.

37.description: I can't believe I have not heard of this amazing thing called the "No-Chip Manicure" until now. Where in the world have I been??Let me start out by saying that I AM the chick that chips her manicure immediately, I mean like in the time it takes to get from the nail salon to my car...yep, I am really rough on my nails. I had stopped getting manicures because it was starting to become a waste of money.So as soon as I found out about the No-Chip, I looked up nail salons that specialize in it on Yelp, and thought I'd check out Sanctuary. I took my mom along because she was having the same chipping problems as I was. The process is really interesting. They put some type of gel on your nails and let it dry under a UV light, then apply the polish (with a paintbrush type tool) and put your hands back under the UV light. The end result is fantastic. I am so happy with my manicure (my mom is too)! It looks great. I think the most awesome thing is that you walk out of the shop and your nails are completely dry. There is no having to be delicate with your hands for a couple of hours just to make sure your manicure doesn't chip. And the whole process only took about an hour. It's been three days since my manicure and not a chip in sight!I also noticed that some people docked stars because they said the inside of Sanctuary doesn't look very spa-like. It's small, but very comfortable. And no, it doesn't look like one of those big, expensive downtown/loop spas where you're most likely paying for the ambience. Maybe it's just the type of person I am, but as long as a place is clean and neat, the service is the most important thing to me. And my No-Chip manicure turned out great! I'll be back!

0.description: 1.I was a groupon customer and they extended my appointment to fit me at my convenience beyond the deadline.2.They were ready for me and I didnt have to wait at all.3.I think her name was Bridgette and she did a fantastic job on my hands and legs. She was extremely meticulous and really seemed like she wanted my nails to look pretty !! 4.the best part is this is the first salon where the "no chip" manicure really comes true !! I didnt have to wait more than 3 mins after the last coat to leave the place and didnt have to fumble with driving and wearing my coat to make sure it does not get ruined !! I waited for 2.5 weeks to write this review and my nails still havent chipped !! they still look shiny and glossy as ever and the only problem is that my nails have grown  !!5.I will definitely be going back to this place !!and yes they only do have a long padded bench to sit on during the pedicure but I thought that not having a massage chair was worth it when I see my nails still looking good after almost three weeks !!

38.description: Sanctuary is a nail salon, not a spa. There is nothing comforting about the salon even from having to ring a bell to get in to the small room with long tables. I have gotten no chip manicures several time with good results, but not worth the drive or parking expense. Also, don't be the first appointment for any of techs as they open at 1:00 but don't arrive until 1:00-1:15. My last tech didn't arrive for 1:00 appt until 1:30 due to traffic. If you live in Chicago, you expect traffic, so be on time.

51.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE the "no chip" manicure.  They're UV gel nails that last for weeks.  Mine were still looking great after three weeks, but of course I had some unsightly outgrowth.  If it weren't for that, I probably could have gone for another week.HATE HATE HATE the decor and the music.  I swear, this place makes me feel like I'm in Miami in the late 80s...it's all pastels and HORRIBLE "smooth jazz" that makes me want to take a cuticle scraper and poke myself in the eye.  Coming here is not a pleasant experience, unfortunately.  I guess I can ignore the decor, but the awful elevator music drills into my brain and stays there for the duration of my appointment.  If I can find another nail place in the city that does gel nails, I'm there.

27.description: Never going back. My mani/pedi are fine BUT everyone there was so rude. I went with a Groupon so maybe that's why I was treated so poorly. The staff just talked amongst themselves as if I wasn't there. My nail tech would actually stop doing my nails so he could tell the others a story or check his phone. And then when he told me my nails were finished, I said thanks & handed him his tip (on the full price, not just the groupon price) & he said nothing in return...not a thanks, not a hope to see you again. He put the money away & said nothing. Im never going back & I'm going to make sure all my friends never experience this place either.

32.description: I had purchased on of the deals for a $35 no chip mani and regular pedi.After trying no chip at a few other salons and many times at each, I figured why not?  I could not be happier!!    They were able to squeeze me in the day I called even with their busy schedule.  I had Brigitte and she was fantastic.  Super nice and attentive.  I had to rush her a bit (my meter was going to be up) and she was still nice about it and still did a high quality job.      It has now been two weeks today and my nails still have no chips!!  Everywhere else I have been I have gotten chips in a week and a half or less.  I'm sure I could even go another week.      Parking is super hard and expensive (it'd old town after all). I initially thought that this was going to deter me from coming back, but after seeing how amazing my nails STILL look I will drive around and pay extra for parking!

48.description: Just an update on how well the no chip manicure holds up. I waited 2.5 weeks until my next mani. I had the deep red and it did not chip or fade. I was also in Florida during that time and I was in the sun and salt water. If anything, the warm weather and water made my nails grow faster. By the last couple days, my outgrowth was driving me crazy.I went back this past weekend and tried the French manicure. Layla did such a good job that I will be getting another French with her in the future. She did each nail perfectly!

44.description: I have gone to every nail salon in the Loop and near north, and my manicures never last more than 3-4 days.  With swimming, typing, and bubble baths, the polish just never stayed on.  Now with the "No Chip Manicures" offered by Sanctuary, I now have beautiful nails all of the time. Ala did my nails, and she's actually from Russia, I was just thinking before entering the salon "what has happened to all of the wonderful Russian manicurists?" and I had the wonderful opportunity to have Ala work on my nails, and now they are beautiful.  Thank you Ala.  If you make an appointment on your way out, you receive a 5% discount next time you go.  I will never return to the "old" way of putting on nail polish by those awful Loop nail salons, they are so yesterday.

24.description: I'm really torn about this place.  I went in with a KGB deal which was UBER cheap, $15 for a mani & pedi, so I wasn't really expecting the best service.  Turns out I was wrong, the tech that did my mani/pedi did a great job, really took her time and was a perfectionist about the whole thing.  My problem is, it chipped that very next morning, less than 12 hours! I was so frustrated because I hadn't even gotten out of bed yet and noticed it, when could that have possibly happened?!  Within 2 days, almost all my nails had chipped, badly, so sad.  I think they use a super cheap topcoat and that was the problem with it.  I would probably go back to try a no-chip, seems like the other women in the salon were really happy with their nails who were getting that. Nice service, and good work, but little lasting power.

7.description: This place is hard to find, but it was an excellent experience. Pros:-No Chip Manicure: they have lots of color options and use the good kind of "polish" that strengthens your nails and doesn't ruin them. I can't remember the name of it at the moment.-Staff: they were really friendly and attentive. Bridget was my technician, and she spent lots of time on my nails making sure that they were perfect. -Space: it's small, but it's peaceful and quiet and you don't have people walking down the street looking in and staring at you. Cons:-Chairs: for pedicures, there are no massage chairs. It's just a long bench that is padded. It's definitely not uncomfortable, but I like having the massage chair. -No razor: I know that the razor is technically not good for your feet, but for those of us that wait a while between pedicures and want all those calluses gone, this was a bit disappointing. However, they do a good job filing the bottoms of your feet, so if your calluses aren't too bad, this is an excellent option. Note: This place is hard to find. It's at 1500 Wells, and it's basically in the building with the Northern Trust ATM. You enter, buzz for Sanctuary Nail Spa, and then go up the stairs and to your left. There's also a hair salon in that same building, and if you haven't been there before and say that Sanctuary Nails recommended you, the hair salon will give you 20% off of your first service! I haven't been yet, so I can't comment on how good they are. Overall: I would definitely go back for the no-chip manicure.

49.description: Rarely have Yelp reviews let me down.  Sadly, this is one of those few and far between times.This nail salon is tiny--the waiting area is cramped.  Good selection of magazines, though.I went in for a mani/pedi, and they insisted on doing the pedi second--more on that later.  The actual nail shaping and painting was good--the tech I had was efficient.  However, I saw other techs not paying attention to what they were doing and being very aggressive with their client's nails.   Also, I question the cleanliness of this place--the tools were soaking in some liquid but it was hard to tell as they were in a storage basket and I didn't get a good look.  The stations themselves could have used a good hose-down.The pedi was slightly better--different tech this time, but still efficient.  And I was able to see them clean down one of the stainless steel basins--they followed all the steps there.  The bench for the pedi station seats three, and is a bit uncomfortable/stiff--no massage chairs here.  Unfortunately, because the pedi was done second, I had very little time to let my nails dry (Friday night, places to go, people to see).  So, of course, the polish on my big toes smudged.  On top of all that, Pretty City lists a basic mani/pedi combo at $40--and I had a $5 off coupon.  But the woman at the counter insisted the cost of the two services was $45.  I don't know which is right/wrong, but don't take it out on the customer!The basic manicure lasted almost a week, and the pedicure has been good for a week and half (polish problem notwithstanding)--and may be ok for longer, but I got tired of the color.  These are probably the only positives, and I can get nail polish longevity elsewhere--places with massage chairs for example.

40.description: Just call me "Chippy."Why? Because my seemingly beautiful red holiday manicure chipped within hours of getting it, and after 3 days...3 solider digits down. Oh, sadness. Overall: A nice-ish place in Old Town, specializing in no-chip manicures. (I just got a regular one, perhaps my biggest blunder?). Good color selection, pretty clean, crazy 80's music and some super pastel decor. All fine and good, I'd have my nails done in a barn if they looked perfectionx10, so...it's all good. Timing: Made an appointment for 1pm, didn't leave til 205. Got a late start, my girl was running behind. Then a pretty laborious (and unenthused!) manicure ensued. It was all fine, but probably chipped because it was put on a bit thick.Would I go back? Sure. Would I get the no-chip instead? Yes. $15 manicures. I've had better!

53.description: I love Sanctuary for pedicures. Working in a lab all day, playing with solvents like methanol and acetone, I don't do manicures (what's the point?), but when spring and summer roll around, I am addicted to my monthly pedicures at Sanctuary. I have unbelievably ticklish feet, but they always manage to hold my feet and make it as comfortable for me as possible. Plus, I have kind of gross feet (years of figure skating will do that to a person), and the Sanctuary people help me pick out the best color, exfoliate the heck out of my heels, and even fill in my big toe nails with acrylic so they look better in flip flops. I can't afford to get pedicures all year long, but if I could, I'd be at Sanctuary nonstop! :)

30.description: This place is hard to find, but it was an excellent experience. Pros:-No Chip Manicure: they have lots of color options and use the good kind of "polish" that strengthens your nails and doesn't ruin them. I can't remember the name of it at the moment.-Staff: they were really friendly and attentive. Bridget was my technician, and she spent lots of time on my nails making sure that they were perfect. -Space: it's small, but it's peaceful and quiet and you don't have people walking down the street looking in and staring at you. Cons:-Chairs: for pedicures, there are no massage chairs. It's just a long bench that is padded. It's definitely not uncomfortable, but I like having the massage chair. -No razor: I know that the razor is technically not good for your feet, but for those of us that wait a while between pedicures and want all those calluses gone, this was a bit disappointing. However, they do a good job filing the bottoms of your feet, so if your calluses aren't too bad, this is an excellent option. Note: This place is hard to find. It's at 1500 Wells, and it's basically in the building with the Northern Trust ATM. You enter, buzz for Sanctuary Nail Spa, and then go up the stairs and to your left. There's also a hair salon in that same building, and if you haven't been there before and say that Sanctuary Nails recommended you, the hair salon will give you 20% off of your first service! I haven't been yet, so I can't comment on how good they are. Overall: I would definitely go back for the no-chip manicure.

46.description: I've been a customer for a couple of years. What can I say, No - chip manicure is the best. I can't remember how I survived on manicures alone or understand why I allowed  other to use power equipment on my fingers. All of the technicians are courteous and talented.

1.description: I'm OK with blue nails if I pick a blue nail polish, but besides that I find blue nails to be pretty icky.  And after almost 2 years of no-chip manis at Sanctuary Nail Spa my nails turned blue. Yikes!! When Christina does my nails they are awesome. They last for weeks, which is afterall the whole point of the no chip manicure, and they certainly don't turn blue! And she's fun to chat with!However, when Christina is booked or traveling I've often tried other nail technicians here and it's just not the same. My nails chip within a week and the last few times they've turned an icky blue under my pink nail polish.I've decided to give up on Sanctuary Nail Spa, but haven't given up on the no chip manicure. Most recently I tried another brand of no-chip at the East Bank Club spa. It's the same price as Sanctuary Nail Spa ($40 for a no-chip). It's been 2 weeks of no chips and they are still pale pink, which is what I was going for. If I wanted blue nails I"d pick out a blue nail polish!

9.description: As far as this salon being convenient, it is not!  I've been waiting for three weeks to get in (thanks Groupon) for my no chip and pedicure.  And this place is not open on Sunday or Monday??!!!  WTF!   They did not return my phone call to confirm my appointment.  Overall, I'm super annoyed and a little pissed that I bought TWO of these Groupons.  I really wish that they would get that since they sold over a 1000 groupons that maybe it's a good idea to open on days like Sunday and Monday!

26.description: As far as this salon being convenient, it is not!  I've been waiting for three weeks to get in (thanks Groupon) for my no chip and pedicure.  And this place is not open on Sunday or Monday??!!!  WTF!   They did not return my phone call to confirm my appointment.  Overall, I'm super annoyed and a little pissed that I bought TWO of these Groupons.  I really wish that they would get that since they sold over a 1000 groupons that maybe it's a good idea to open on days like Sunday and Monday!

25.description: As soon as I left, I was planning on giving this place no more than a two star review.They had a good selection of colors. As people have mentioned, no salon chairs for the pedi, but the bench wasn't uncomfortable. They didn't offer me any magazines like they did the girl who walked in minutes after me... That was unfortunate. The guy who did my nails was good enough, but he chatted with the other nail tech the whole time which was a little awkward.  He also repeatedly picked up his phone to text his friend while giving me my manicure and pedicure... Seriously? I noticed he scrimped a bit as well. Maybe it was because I had a groupon, or because it was the end of the day, but he only massaged one leg! Lame! I should have said something.The Pedi looked good by the end. The manicure was also a little too short for my taste - definitely a little more scrimping. But it looked good when I left, and it was only $20, so whatever. I tipped him well anyways. He was friendly enough.Now the reason I'm giving this place three stars instead of two is because the manicure lasted amazingly! Seriously, it took almost a week before chipping! And this was just a plain mani, not the no-chip one. My pedi still looks fantastic! I don't know how they did it. It's expensive, so I probably won't go back without another Groupon, but anywhere I get a regular mani that lasts a week before chipping deserves at least three stars.

12.description: There are plenty of nail shops in Old Town - go somewhere else!  I don't mind a budget nail shop, but this one is too much.  No dryers, sloppy polish application, no cuticle cutting, unprofessional banter.  Pretty sure I'd rather do my nails myself....or go down the street to Magnifique ;)

21.description: I purchased their Groupon for a No-Chip Manicure and Basic Pedicure in August and am still hanging on to it because of the difficulty in making an appointment. This place must be amazing because I can't name one other nail salon in the city that isn't able to squeeze you in when you call at least a day before. I called in September a week before my wedding to set up an appointment, but they couldn't find a single time to fit me in. I would think that for such a special event, they might make some accommodation, but that wasn't the case. I called again today to make an appointment for tomorrow and again was told that they were fully booked. This was the worst waste of money. I can't believe how much trouble they make it for a simple mani/pedi. I'd much rather go to the nail place right around my corner. They do a fantastic job and take walk-in's gladly. Thanks for being so accommodating Sanctuary!

17.description: I came here to get a full set of Brisa gel tips. I have a severe acrylic allergy, and my nails are terribly short and flimsy making no-chip a non-starter for me. Brisa gel are touted as hypo-allergenic and acrylic free, and happily, I did not develop a blistering rash like I did with my last acrylic set 7 years ago!  My nail tech (Shauna?) did a great job. She was very methodical but efficient, and the nails look great one week later. No chips, no allergic reaction. My friend came for the no-chip mani and a pedi, and had an equally good service experience.I left off one star because it is a pretty average looking salon with distractingly bad music.

10.description: I'm obsessed with Groupon, so when they ran a special for a no-chip mani and pedi here I decided it was time to try this much touted manicure. My nails are PERFECT!! The pedicure looks awesome too. I was the only client in the spa during my appointment because there was only one technician working. I'm not sure if this is how it normally is, but it made for a quick and easy visit. I did not have anything to take off my nails when I got there so I was in and out in an hour, but I have heard that having a previous no-chip to take off can add a few minutes. Final bonus: they have at least 40 no-chip colors to choose from!

5.description: I have the worst nails in the world.  Bridget makes them look fantastic!  She is a miracle worker.  This small, friendly and intimate salon is so refreshing, not the 20 station nail factories where no one speaks to you and you can't  even ask a question.Simply the best, I travel in from the suburbs to see Bridget.  I have tried many in my area but none compare.

3.description: I purchased a groupon for a mani/pedi and tried multiple times to schedule an appointment but time after time was told that they had no availability and that their next appointment was in 2 weeks or something ridiculous.  Let's be real, when you want a mani/pedi you want it now not in 2 weeks!  My groupon expired and I finally went in this weekend to redeem the credit and decided on a no chip manicure.Upon walking into this place I quickly realized why they were always booked - NOT because it's a super cool posh nail spa but because they only have 3 pedicure stations, 4 manicure stations, and only 3 people working,  It's a very bare bones nail spa that has likely not had any renovations for the past 10 years.  The pedicure area is essentially a bench with a small cushion for lumbar support (or to sit on?) and a basin to put your feet in.  No spa chair and it looks very uncomfortable.  The pedicure stations are pretty standard but the service and quality of my no chip manicure was sub par compared to other nail salons in the area.  The nail technician was very focused and seemed to be paying attention to detail but when I left the salon I realized I had no chip polish on my cuticles not to mention she didn't even polish all the way to my cuticles so on day 1 it already looks grown out. There are atleast 3 other nail salons within 1 block of this place that are much better and cheaper ($45 for a no chip mani).  I will definitely not be returning.

35.description: Meh, Meh & more Meh.I do have to give the place credit that the no-chip manicure lasted & looked nice for two weeks as guaranteed, but (big but):1)   When I was in the "spa" getting my nails done, there were kids in the spa that were noisy in their own right but the moms who were yelling at them to stay still & be quiet were worse. This is no "spa" it is a manicure factory.2)   The lady who did my nails filed the skin around my nails to the point where my lovely new nails were surrounded by scabs by the next day. For the price, I expect a pain free experience. I will not be going back... ever.

19.description: I tried it because of Groupon. I will not go again. There are too many salons nearer to me that actually do good work. I had to wait 30 minutes and I felt like it was a rushed job. No cuticle work was done at all. I am giving it one star because there was electricity.

28.description: I have had better but they are now offering a $15 mani/pedi im having a really hard time not hitting that buy button, im currently not really hanging with my awesome cousin so maybe never is today im a sucker for deals

45.description: I went to Sanctuary Nails to try my first no chip manicure. I called to see if they had appointments available when I had a free hour. Initially they told me no, then when I said I would have to come back they said they would squeeze me in. From the moment I got entered the salon I felt rushed. To make matters worse, 15 minutes before the no-chip was complete the appointment for the woman doing my nails had already arrived. I must say the woman who did my nails did a wonderful job. They were beautiful. However, I was not given any instructions on how to care for them and they felt very thick. Two days after I had the no-chip done, I had gray marks under three of my nails. Turns out, you are not supposed to stay away from citric acid for 24 hours - I had an orange! It cost me $60 and my nails looked bad after 3 days. By the end of the first week my real nail was pulling away from the gel. All in all, it was not a great experience. I have had the no-chip at another salon since this experience and I love the process. I love that my nails look nice for weeks, but I don't think I could go back to Sanctuary again.

33.description: I have patiently waited 2 weeks since my first trip to Sanctuary Nail Spa to write my review because I have had bad experiences with no chip before, and I wanted to make sure it'd last before I gave a positive OR negative review. I've gone to three other salons to have the no chip applied and within 5 days I had chips. When no chip chips, it's worse than when regular polish chips because you can't buy the stuff to correct it yourself, and it's a process to take it off so you can't just rush home and remove it. I had read good reviews on Yelp of Khrystina's service at Sanctuary and when I went as a walk in and took the first person available, who happened to be Khrystina! I'll say that all the technicians there seemed to be favorites with many regulars, so I assume they are all very good. I got my no chip 2 weeks ago today, and just returned from my second visit. I had zero chips, and could have definitely gone longer before a touch up except for the grow out. Khrystina is incredibly efficient. I had an appointment at 11, her previous client got up and left the chair at 10:59 AM and I slid right in. The process to remove the polish is quick, much less of a hassle than I had expected. With removing the previous color and another manicure it was exactly an hour. It is definitely worth the extra few minutes and extra couple of bucks it costs to have beautiful, flawless nails for 2 weeks. No chip has far fewer color options than other polish brands, but Khrystina is very skilled at mixing colors and can make almost anything you envision.It really isn't much to look at inside. The door is hard to find, and the salon is tight. There aren't individual stations, but 3 long tables with 3 stations each. You walk in and the pedicure stations are perched just to your left, and there isn't much room to wait. The lighting is terrible, and the chairs are just typical office chairs. But who cares!? If my nails looked like crap and the no chip didn't last, maybe I'd care about the decor, but I don't. Plus they always offer me coffee, tea, or a mimosa! Can't go wrong. I highly recommend you make a trip to Sanctuary Nail to try out the no chip.

43.description: I loved my experience at this salon. I went in for a full set of the Brisa Gel Nails yesterday and was taken care of by Megan. She was very thorough and did my nails just the way I like them. They are beautiful, shiny, and durable. I had my infant daughter with me and the staff made me feel so welcome to have her there. I would recommend this place to anyone. Very clean utensils and friendly staff!

2.description: Have been to Sanctuary before for no chip mani/pedi and service was meh the first time around. Figured I'd give them another try with groupon, but when I called to make an appt today, they wanted a credit card # to hold my appt. The guy I spoke with said I could make a non-groupon appt without leaving credit card, but not if I want to use a groupon.Really? Unfortunate to treat groupon customers this way. If it were standard practice for all, ok. There are too many other fabulous nail salons in this city to waste time with this place. Won't be going back.

18.description: I have patiently waited 2 weeks since my first trip to Sanctuary Nail Spa to write my review because I have had bad experiences with no chip before, and I wanted to make sure it'd last before I gave a positive OR negative review. I've gone to three other salons to have the no chip applied and within 5 days I had chips. When no chip chips, it's worse than when regular polish chips because you can't buy the stuff to correct it yourself, and it's a process to take it off so you can't just rush home and remove it. I had read good reviews on Yelp of Khrystina's service at Sanctuary and when I went as a walk in and took the first person available, who happened to be Khrystina! I'll say that all the technicians there seemed to be favorites with many regulars, so I assume they are all very good. I got my no chip 2 weeks ago today, and just returned from my second visit. If my nails looked like crap and the no chip didn't last, maybe I'd care about the decor, but I don't. Plus they always offer me coffee, tea, or a mimosa! Can't go wrong. I highly recommend you make a trip to Sanctuary Nail to try out the no chip.

41.description: I came here to get a full set of Brisa gel tips. I have a severe acrylic allergy, and my nails are terribly short and flimsy making no-chip a non-starter for me. Brisa gel are touted as hypo-allergenic and acrylic free, and happily, I did not develop a blistering rash like I did with my last acrylic set 7 years ago!  My nail tech (Shauna?) did a great job. She was very methodical but efficient, and the nails look great one week later. No chips, no allergic reaction. My friend came for the no-chip mani and a pedi, and had an equally good service experience.I left off one star because it is a pretty average looking salon with distractingly bad music.

52.description: First of all, I have to express utter shock and dismay that NO ONE has yet to mention the amazing, life changing NO CHIP MANI & PEDI!This has literally changed my life and my nails and there really is NO going back.  This wonderous process is exactly what it sounds like:  a mani/pedi that DOES NOT CHIP.  No joke yelpers, no joke.It doesn't damage your nails the way a full set does, and they never use power tools a la Tim the Tool Man Taylor to buff imperfections.  It's a gel based nail polish that dries pretty much instantly and lasts for about 2-3 weeks.  The pedi can last for 1-2 months.  This is also wonderous if you have weak nails and need a little boost to help them grow!I go to Azmira, but everyone is absolutely wonderful.  Megan, the owner is very hands on, and everyone is very welcoming.  And there's an abundance of tea on hand!They're excellent at helping you pick the right colors and shades, as well as identify the right service for your specific needs.  And it's one of those places where you can even feel comfortable bringing a little dog!  No, seriously.  One of the other clients was in there with her puppy and it was totally okay!It almost reminds me of a Steel Magnolia's type environment.  Minus the Shirley McClains getting bikini waxes.

50.description: No chip manicure if fabulous. I love looking like I have a perfect French manicure all the time! For those not familiar with the no-chip manicure offered at Sanctuary it's a wonderful thing so check it out! Gel polishes are applied to your nail with a paint brush and after each layer of polish your nails are dried under a UV light. You're able to miraculously walk out of the salon with no chips, dents or mess-ups. Amazing. Really. The colors are limited but the staff is able to mix and match colors to imitate your fave OPI or Essie polishes.You're not able to take off the old polish yourself, so plan on coming a bit early for the removal process. Start to finish everything takes about 1 hour.This is not a relaxing spa location though. I agree the music sucks  (smooth jazz is so blah) and the decor is ho-hum. The staff is all very friendly though, the prices are right and the no-chip mani rocks!

4.description: Just call me "Chippy."Why? Because my seemingly beautiful red holiday manicure chipped within hours of getting it, and after 3 days...3 solider digits down. Oh, sadness. Overall: A nice-ish place in Old Town, specializing in no-chip manicures. (I just got a regular one, perhaps my biggest blunder?). Good color selection, pretty clean, crazy 80's music and some super pastel decor. All fine and good, I'd have my nails done in a barn if they looked perfectionx10, so...it's all good. Timing: Made an appointment for 1pm, didn't leave til 205. Got a late start, my girl was running behind. Then a pretty laborious (and unenthused!) manicure ensued. It was all fine, but probably chipped because it was put on a bit thick.Would I go back? Sure. Would I get the no-chip instead? Yes. $15 manicures. I've had better!

6.description: As soon as I left, I was planning on giving this place no more than a two star review.They had a good selection of colors. As people have mentioned, no salon chairs for the pedi, but the bench wasn't uncomfortable. They didn't offer me any magazines like they did the girl who walked in minutes after me... That was unfortunate. The guy who did my nails was good enough, but he chatted with the other nail tech the whole time which was a little awkward.  He also repeatedly picked up his phone to text his friend while giving me my manicure and pedicure... Seriously? I noticed he scrimped a bit as well. Maybe it was because I had a groupon, or because it was the end of the day, but he only massaged one leg! Lame! I should have said something.The Pedi looked good by the end. The manicure was also a little too short for my taste - definitely a little more scrimping. But it looked good when I left, and it was only $20, so whatever. I tipped him well anyways. He was friendly enough.Now the reason I'm giving this place three stars instead of two is because the manicure lasted amazingly! Seriously, it took almost a week before chipping! And this was just a plain mani, not the no-chip one. My pedi still looks fantastic! I don't know how they did it. It's expensive, so I probably won't go back without another Groupon, but anywhere I get a regular mani that lasts a week before chipping deserves at least three stars.

22.description: LAME! Bought a Groupon to treat a friend. With a regular price of $75 for a no-chip mani and regular pedi - I was thinking this was going to be a nice salon. brought my friend here for a treat - and was embarrassed. Ladies, this shop is retro - and not in a good way. Looks like it was opened in the 80's and never updated. There was only a bench for the pedicures. I am short, so I had to scrunch forward so that my feet were in the water. The UV lights were single hand only and were filthy.I asked for square nails (repeatedly) which she kept saying that she was doing. But when I checked them they were as oval as an 80 year old's and they were all crooked. To rectify this, she kept filing them down. They are still round and a couple are still crooked. But she would have been at this all day and down to the quick if I kept asking her to fix them. It was all I could do to not grab the nail file from her. I don't relish in leaving bad reviews, but i just looked down at my feet and noticed (past the super thick layer of polish that she put on) that the polish on my big toe is already chipping at the top - after just three days!!!! So not only am I out the money -- but more importantly the time.I am heading back to my "no frills" shop where I can get the same service for $50... with a lux vibrating chair (that I can lean back in - with my feet still being in the water), that has two hand UV lights that don't look like they are 5 years old, and is CLEAN.

15.description: The resin why I gave two is the nail tech hurt my nails and cut it into a weird shape. She realized that also. Lol it's kinda funny. The guy do my meni and maybe is a goupon, they r not offering a good service? I cannot expect a good service? I mean the reason why u open a goupon is to bring more business, you can't just treat customer bad only bc they hold the groupon but paying regularly. Ppl won't be happy and won't go back then u lose businessThey charge total as 45 for a meni+pedi which is pricey in a vintage salonBut to be honest, the service is OKOk, except the pedi lady mess up my nail shape. lol

20.description: I totally enjoyed Sanctuary Nail Spa very cute place,  I must admit the place is hidden, very cozy, clean, and a friendly environment.  You are well greeted, they have free fresh coffee, they offer you magazine while you wait, which the wait was not very long.  I really like it for it's no chip and plenty of beautiful colors...Price is perfect for all the accommodation and special offers they have...They also specialize in making there own scrubs.  If they are overbooked they do all means possible to squeeze you in there busy schedule..(now that is hard to find). I highly recommend to call in advance so you have plenty of room to your day....As a first time customer I like to find out more of the business and what I found out is when you bring in a person for the first time you get $5 off....I like special...that extra 5 dollar is a lot nowadays:)  Go Sanctuary...!!!

36.description: I used to go to this nail spa years ago to get no chip manicures from Azmira, which was great. So I'm back in town and wanting a no chip, made an appointment. Azmira isn't there anymore so I told the receptionist that I needed a quality no chip french manicure for a wedding I was standing up in. I was slotted for 10am on a friday. I got there at 9:55am and was surprised that the office was closed - ten minutes later (after i'm waiting outside), they show up. My manicurist ended up being 15 minutes late - I never got an apology. The office seemed haphazard and sloppy. In the end, the no chip was fine - lasted through the wedding.  The place is certainly popular, very busy by 10:30 but I was a bit uncomfortable with what I thought was the snobby clientele.

14.description: I have been going to Sanctuary for almost 4 years now. I swear by their no-chip manicures. I could not imagine having my nails any other way. Over the past year or so I know any other salons in the city offer this service but I have heard so many stories about other no-chips coming off and not lasting. NOT Sanctuary. My nails stay on 2-3 weeks and Jessica always does an amazing job. Prices are reasonable and they are always accommodating with schedules too.

58.description: i love this place because they are always nice,they are friendly and they know my name as soon as i walk in.their philadelphia roll is the best.also very good ice tea with cream.my husband loves the tempura apetizers and he is crazy about their soups.delivery is very fast.

56.description: I really do not understand the poor reviews! I can also be a picky reviewer, but after visiting many BYOB Thai restaurants, this is one of my favorites after one long visit with 6 of my girlfriends. Service: First, it has a lovely ambiance, with festive delight during this time of year, along with clean tables, with silverware on them, plenty of move-around space, and when I walked in at 8 p.m. on a cold Friday evening, I saw lots of costumers of all ages, enjoying their dinner. I came in alone being first, and they seated me right away. When all the girls came, our friendly waiter asked if we wanted any appetizers and she was so patient with us as we were so chit-chatty and didn't look at our menus. She brought wine glasses and a cork for all of us as well as we all brought our bottles of wine. Food: 4/5- You get what you pay for! So if you want more authentic, with more flavor, this isn't your place. I'll agree with that. They don't play music in the background of this restaurant or delight you like that, but the presentation is great and it is, what it is. One of my friends got a tofu noodle dish, and another a large soup. My hot and sour soup was all right with  large pieces of chicken and mushrooms. We shared different rolls of Sushi and they have many. I loved the warmness of all the sushi and all of it tasted good. I would chose Tiparos again for a large group of people. Best part- 16 dollars when we all split the bill.

29.description: Worst tom yum soup I have ever had.  Didn't send chopsticks with the delivery.  Overpriced for the quality of food.  Panang beef was ok.  Really wasn't impressed with this place.

42.description: I'll admit that I've on,y gotten this restaurant for takeout.I do enjoy how their sushi samplers have a better variety of interesting rolls, and not just the standard california/spicy tuna/salmon that I seem to see at so many other sushi restaurants. It's also great since when you order through grubhub, it's pretty easy to buy enough to get those extra potstickers for free.My main complaint is how long it takes their takeout to arrive- it's normally at least an hour and a half, and that's on a good day. I can only order from them well in advance, and never when I want a quick sushi fix!

23.description: We live 3 blocks away. Ordered delivery 1.5 hours ago (one order of pad thai) and it still has not arrived! Will not be ordering from there again, regardless of the quality of food.

47.description: Online ordering for delivery through their website is easy. Reasonable prices and a large selection. Our order arrived on time, however it was lukewarm at best. The food was average and the canned mushrooms they use permeated, in a bad way, each dish. Likely won't order from here again as there are plenty of other places to get Thai food.

8.description: Interesting combo of a thai restaurant up front and a sushi bar in the back. Food isn't horrible but wasn't the best I've ever had. I came here more out of convenience than anything else since it was within walking distance of where I was staying in the city, open late for a Friday, and I could order for take out.I ordered the spicy basil leaves with chicken and a side of white rice. Caution this is a pretty spicy dish! I accidentally mistaken the green peppers which I thought were bell peppers were actually sliced jalepenos! Ooo weeee! The seasoning and flavors were on point compared to other basil chicken dishes I've have but I was a bit disappointed they seemed to use ground chicken rather than larger pieces of chicken.If I came back, I'd probably go for their curry dish instead. 'Til next time, cheers!

31.description: Really enjoy the crystal noodles!And some of the fastest delivery on top of that.

34.description: Interesting combo of a thai restaurant up front and a sushi bar in the back. Food isn't horrible but wasn't the best I've ever had. I came here more out of convenience than anything else since it was within walking distance of where I was staying in the city, open late for a Friday, and I could order for take out.I ordered the spicy basil leaves with chicken and a side of white rice. Caution this is a pretty spicy dish! I accidentally mistaken the green peppers which I thought were bell peppers were actually sliced jalepenos! Ooo weeee! The seasoning and flavors were on point compared to other basil chicken dishes I've have but I was a bit disappointed they seemed to use ground chicken rather than larger pieces of chicken.If I came back, I'd probably go for their curry dish instead. 'Til next time, cheers!

16.description: 2 star for the atmosphere. 1 for the food. I'd got the Penang curry, which wasn't curry. It's pretty much just beef in peanut butter sauce. There's no other flavor. It also don't come with rice. That's additional charge. The Pad Kee Mao was a little better but not by much. The flavor was lacking. The presentation doesn't look appetizing. However, it was more edible than the Penang Curry. I should stick with Garlic & Chili Thai for Thai food.

13.description: How I managed to NOT write a review months ago when I ate here is a mystery?... Oh wait, no its not. I suffered from gastro-intestinal distress for several days. It took a solid week or so before my gut biome returned to normal. I tried to block out the trauma afterwards. Despite my girlfriend's prior dire warnings of this place, I did not think it could be that bad. It was. We ordered two entrees (sorry, I don't recall what they were). One was at best so-so. The other looked/tasted like someone tossed a can of dog food and brown gravy into a sautee pan for 10 minutes. As I mentioned, I didn't feel right for a good week. I don't understand how this place stays open unless its a front for some seedy mob types. It is not an average nearby take out joint which I could see benefitting from all the residences and high-rises nearby. It is simply disgusting. A truly wretched place. Please save your taste-buds, stomach, and gastrointestinal system from this torture (unless your a culinary masochist). If this is a mob front, please take pity on me as you have already tortured me.

11.description: i like the place and its a good thai food.

39.description: Fresh and tasty. Brown rice was unusually good. Went there before Second City show just 2 blocks away. Veggies were great, spicy basil beef was delicious. It's cheap too, the place is nice and clean.

37.description: Good food and service. Friendly staff. Sushi is a nice compliment to the Thai menu! Good neighborhood spot. Outdoor seating is nice during the warm weather. Also, their location is a short walk/bike ride to the lake (during the warmer months) to order take out and have a Thai picnic by the water.

0.description: We went here on three different occasions and had both Thai and sushi.I am taking one star away overall for the Pad Thai which was pedestrian and nothing special.On the other hand, the sushi was very good, the service was cheerful, and the sushi chefs accommodating.
