38.description: Great place for soup, especially the BBQ or Tom Yum. Sushi is slightly overpriced for what you get. The interior is nice and cozy, and the wait staff is quite good. I have never been treated strangely when I come in to eat alone and write my papers. Additionally, they have excellent drink specials, I can't recommend the Mai Tai enough!

51.description: I live right around the corner form this hidden gem and ever since moving into the neighborhood  It has been a staple in my house hold! I like the typical thai food; pad thai, fried rice, masaman curry, nothing too fancy but it is always delicious! When eating inside the place is wonderful with great service and a lovely atmosphere. Getting take out is always good too except that delivery takes way too long so I usually just run to pick it up! Recently I have discovered sushi and have not gotten a chance to try anything more than a California roll from here but that itself was very good!  Highly recommend!

27.description: I've only had once dish here (and lightly tasted a few others) but I LOVE their curry. It's so good and I haven't found many places to beat it yet. With that said, I haven't tried many of their other dishes yet. I typically taste whatever my boyfriend orders and in general they seem pretty good.I don't come often but when I do it's always for their curry, so obviously I highly recommend it!

32.description: Had no clue this place was right up the street from me. Surprised me.Nothing too fancy - no bells and whistles. Isn't the best sushi in the world but the combo of thai, soup, noodles, sushi is hard to beat in the area.

54.description: We have ordered delivery from here at work a few times and the delivery service is quick and professional.  The food is good and always arrives still hot.  Sushi delivery is tough to do but it always comes fresh!

48.description: This is my go to delivery Thai food. The food is always consistently good, the delivery folks are wonderful and it's inexpensive. Two entrees last me 4-5 meals which is perfect since I don't cook :)I strongly recommend the curries! They are all wonderful.

44.description: I ordered a large take-out order for a meeting I was hosting. Tiparos was able to make many adjustments for me and accomodate everything I needed. Their food was also excellent.

24.description: Placed an order online and chose to "pay with credit card upon delivery in person". Called Tiparos 30 mins later wondering where my food was and the employee said she held my order because I had not given a credit card with my order. She then said that it would take another hour to get my food. Terrible delivery and customer service.

7.description: Tiparos is good for take out or dining in. It is clean and the staff are friendly.  The portions are usually pretty hefty, so when I get food to go, it lasts me 2 meals! Even though I am not a vegetarian I enjoy the pad thai with tofu. The menu is pretty vast and includes Chinese and Thai options.  They also have bubble tea, which I love and you can get it to go!

49.description: Super good and i need gluten free so when i said no soy sauce/gluten they were so easy about it.

40.description: Food was okay I was told no sushi for the day which was disappointing. The service wasnt all that.

53.description: First off, who doesn't love BYOB!  Tiparos provides both a cheap and delicious meal.    The service is fast and efficient, but not necessarily the most friendly.  I have been there a few times and have never needed to wait for a seat, no matter how big the group.  The Pad Thai is amazing, so is the Tiparos noodle delight.  I have actually never had anything there I did not enjoy.  Absolutely worth going for lunch or dinner.  If I remember correctly they have a deal on sushi rolls from 3-6!

30.description: love this place for thai and sushi rolls!!

46.description: Great place for Thai food. They also have sushi but i never tried it there. Highly recommended!!

1.description: Wish I had checked yelp first. Delivery ordered at 8pm on a Tuesday.One hour forty minutes later sushi was... just fine.

55.description: I ordered Tiparos through Seemless (delivery service)Needless to say, the experience left a terrible taste in my mouth.-2 hour wait time (supposed to be 45-60 minutes)-Terrible customer service everytime I'd call to check in-Mediocre food-High prices relative to other thai places in the areaNet-net, I'd discourage anyone from ordering from them or bothering with their food.

9.description: Went to Tiparos for dinner with a music colleague following a quartet gig at the Chicago History Museum. Parking had already been paid for and we still had an hour on the meter- why not, we thought, both really liking Thai food. Service was a little abrupt but everything made it out hot and in a timely fashion. Although dinner tasted good (I had a small bowl of the Tom Kha coconut soup with chicken as an appetizer; my colleague, fried vegetable spring rolls with dipping sauce. For dinner, we each ordered Pad Thai; she had tofu and I chose beef) the ill-effects began making me queasy as we carpooled back our sides of town. I was feeling terrible upon returning home and went to bed early. Luckily for me, that was the worst of it. Came to find out via text the next day that my colleague did not fare so well; she was quite ill that night following this particular meal. So, when one person at the table falls sick, maybe it's a stomach bug. When both parties end up feeling terrible, well, I, for one, won't be dining at Tiparos again anytime soon.

26.description: super casualtheir Pad Woon Sen is awesome

25.description: Tiparos is good for take out or dining in. It is clean and the staff are friendly.  The portions are usually pretty hefty, so when I get food to go, it lasts me 2 meals! Even though I am not a vegetarian I enjoy the pad thai with tofu. The menu is pretty vast and includes Chinese and Thai options.  They also have bubble tea, which I love and you can get it to go!

12.description: Seriously this is the worst Thai food I have ever had in my entire life and I have eaten a A LOT of Thai food over the years. I love Thai food. It is one my favorite go-to cuisines. I want so desperately to like this place - even to tolerate this place. I have tried it 3 times in hopes that it has become better or hoping if I try a different dish, that it will be better. It is less than a block away from me and at this point, I would not eat there even if my entire meal and drinks were free. My last (and final) visit: It was a cold night. My bf and I were lazy, and he wanted to try this place since it was so close by.  I warned him about how awful it was but he insisted that no place could be that bad....He ate his words. Based of our last visit: We got 2 dishes and both were terrible. We had some sort of beef dish - the 'meat' was rubbery and after one bite, I could not stomach another. The noodle dish was edible but not the least bit satisfactory. It was not cooked right and was flavorless. I'd much rather warm up any frozen dish from any grocery store. My bf and I did not finish even 1/2 of our food. We talked about how we would even not give the leftovers to a dog because that would be cruel. Please - save yourself. While I have not tried all of the Thai restaurants in Chicago, I would bet good money that if you went to ANY other Thai place - the food would be significantly better. I seriously can't understand how this place is still open or how people manage to give it 3 stars or higher?! Do the people of Old Town lack tastebuds?  I understand there aren't a lot of decent  choices in the area but that is still no excuse.

59.description: always greasy pad thai.. -must stop going here. must stop going here. must stop going here..

21.description: How I managed to NOT write a review months ago when I ate here is a mystery?... Oh wait, no its not. I suffered from gastro-intestinal distress for several days. It took a solid week or so before my gut biome returned to normal. I tried to block out the trauma afterwards. Despite my girlfriend's prior dire warnings of this place, I did not think it could be that bad. It was. We ordered two entrees (sorry, I don't recall what they were). One was at best so-so. The other looked/tasted like someone tossed a can of dog food and brown gravy into a sautee pan for 10 minutes. As I mentioned, I didn't feel right for a good week. I don't understand how this place stays open unless its a front for some seedy mob types. It is not an average nearby take out joint which I could see benefitting from all the residences and high-rises nearby. It is simply disgusting. A truly wretched place. Please save your taste-buds, stomach, and gastrointestinal system from this torture (unless your a culinary masochist). If this is a mob front, please take pity on me as you have already tortured me.

17.description: Love this place. Cheap and good. Always have the Panang Chicken - it's delicious. Nice staff and food cokes out quick. For quick, cheap Thai this is the place to go.

10.description: Pretty good spot for Thai takeout, but skip the sushi. The restaurant itself is nothing exciting, so if you're looking for a good atmosphere, this isn't the place. But they do have a great Thai menu, and everything I've tried has been great! Recommend for takeout.

5.description: We were the ones dining in on a weeknight. Most of their business seemed to be take out.  Quality has gone down.... We got the spicy seafood dish where the shrimp and scallops tasted fine but the vegetables tasted old. The pad kee mao was not at all spicy and the noodles were mushy and bland. Only good thing was that all the food came out fast.

3.description: Avoid this placeYou really want thai food go to thai uptown noodle or bamme This place the staff is rude I get here not hello not can I help you.......They don't speak English or what real bad food call thai tiparos I orders papaya salad so salty, I order tempura and they serve breaded fry tick shrimps and veggies ewwwww

35.description: I ordered delivery from here. Food was fine, but the driver told me that they won't deliver to my place anymore because it's out of area. I live close to the Sheridan line, so about 3 miles... Maybe it's just me, but if that's out of area--how do they make money?

19.description: I love Tiparos! After trying a few places, I keep coming back here. It's got my favorite Pad Thai, and I really enjoy the Mussaman Curry too!

28.description: good Quality Thai food.  I have not tried their sushi.  They have liquor but also BYOB.

45.description: Gross!!! Tasteless, bad delivery, rude order takers, not worth it. Go to Penny's, Garlic and Chilli, Butterfly anywhere else but here.

33.description: We recently moved to the old town neighborhood and was happy to find a Thai place so close by.  Five of us visited the place. The food was okay however the service was not great......  Portion was relatively small and when we asked for slight modification on a stir fry vegetable dish to have more broccoli and less other veggies, they up charged by $2 and dish had no taste...  Same thing on my son's iced tea.  My son asked for refills twice and they charged for the ice tea each time also.  When I pointed it out to the waitress, she just pretended not to understand English.  I also mentioned it was our first time here and with attitude and services we received we would not come back.  The response was "ok".   Well, we HAVE NOT even back since...

43.description: I want to give 2 stars for delivery but 4 stars for eating in - so i guess I'll just go with 3 stars.Their dining experience is great - great attentive service, reasonably priced food. They apparently also have a full bar with decently priced imported beers.  I ordered Thai food here and everything was great.  Food came out fast, and the check for two came out to under $20. I had the Pad See-Ew and my friend had the Pad-Thai. Both were satisfactory, but nothing special.On one very cold winter day, I decided to not walk the two minutes for takeout but order delivery from downstairs - well, the food was fast, I'll give you that. But that was probably the easiest $7 delivery + tip that restaurant's ever made. haha, they literally just popped next door and upstairs.  I had osme kind of wonton soup and Pad -See Ew. The Pad See-Ew was very small portioned and the soup was very bland.  Blah.

2.description: Definitely skip the sushi ( think grocery store quality) and go for the excellent traditional Thai dishes. Very reasonably priced and the food ( for the most part) is full of flavor. Love the pad see ew, pad soon sen and cashew chicken. Skip the spring rolls and card- boardy Thai spring rolls. Great delivery. Restaurant has a nice atmosphere as well.

18.description: I want to give 2 stars for delivery but 4 stars for eating in - so i guess I'll just go with 3 stars.Their dining experience is great - great attentive service, reasonably priced food. They apparently also have a full bar with decently priced imported beers.  I ordered Thai food here and everything was great.  Food came out fast, and the check for two came out to under $20. I had the Pad See-Ew and my friend had the Pad-Thai. Both were satisfactory, but nothing special.On one very cold winter day, I decided to not walk the two minutes for takeout but order delivery from downstairs - well, the food was fast, I'll give you that. But that was probably the easiest $7 delivery + tip that restaurant's ever made. haha, they literally just popped next door and upstairs.  I had osme kind of wonton soup and Pad -See Ew. The Pad See-Ew was very small portioned and the soup was very bland.  Blah.

41.description: Wednesday night I ordered online and did not have to wait long. Walked over and the restaurant was nicely tucked away and decorated just right- not kitschy or anything. Clean, quiet atmosphere. The staff was attentive and it was refreshing to see that they actually checked my ID before handing over my order. A man, who I think is the owner, was very polite- asked my name and actually remembered it as he said goodbye. The food was hot and tasty. The hot sauce is a good thing to use (if you like spicy). Eggrolls were crunchy and stuffed full of goodness, the pot stickers too (I like mine a little crunchier though),  the sushi roll I had was nicely formed and good for the price, the the pad thai was good- what it lacks it makes up for in serving size. I still have some massuman curry to eat (dinner tonight!) and cannot wait. I will be going back for sure.

52.description: My friends and I had visitors in town and we chose this place because it was close, the type of food we wanted, and, of course, BYOB.  A quick breakdown:The atmosphere: The restaurant is spacious, which is appreciated as most restaurants in this area are cramped with a lack of seating.  We made a reservation for 8 and were seated right away on a Saturday night.  We went around 9.The food: I had the rice stick noodle - no soup, with chicken and it was good.  It wasn't what I was expecting and was just okay -- I'm not a huge fan of chicken, which is why I ordered beef (see below) and the noodles were overcooked.  I would probably order it with the soup next time.  We shared 2 orders of edamame and crab rangoon and everyone enjoyed the appetizers.  Everything came out hot and quickly.  I've been hear previously and enjoyed the pad thai, which is always a simple choice.The service: This is my main complaint.  The waitress took my order and I specifically said I would like beef.  She even repeated my order and said beef.  She brought out my dish with chicken and when I told her that I requested beef, she went back to her ticket and she showed me that she had written down chicken.  Now, that's great that that's what you wrote down, but that's still NOT what I ordered.  I told her that I ordered beef though and she did NOTHING --- She stared at me, extremely rude.  She looked at me and did not offer to replace my food, but insisted that I was the one who was incorrect.  Next time:  Just replace the food with what the customer ordered.  Especially when the entire table heard me.

50.description: I have been ordering from and eating at Tiparos for a long time. The food has always been great, the service friendly and the delivery relatively quick. Tonight (one of the very cold and snowy nights we have been suffering from winter 2013) I ate at Tiparos. I must have dropped my Iphone in front of the restaurant when I went to put money in the parking meter.I did not realize this until I got home and could not find my phone. The find my Iphone app said it was in front of Tiparos.I rushed back to the restaurant and asked them to call my phone while I looked outside for it. Not only did they call my phone but PAUL the owner helped me find it under the snow that had fallen (and the single digit temperatures). I am so grateful. Now I will not only be going back for the food but for the helpful owner!

4.description: Loved their summer roll! They have a large variety of foods and some great flavors. Perfect for a chill night out or take out!

6.description: We order takeout from here every once in a while, food is consistently solid. Staff has always been very nice and helpful.

22.description: Okay, Tiparos and I are over.  Food poisoning last night, I suspect from the Tom Kha soup, which was the only thing my husband and I didn't share.  He THEN told me he suspected having gotten food poisoning there a few weeks earlier - which says more about my husband than it does about Tiparos, even.

15.description: The worst...The food is not up to par and is too salty.  I had the fried rice ( last item on the menu under Rice) and the most strangest and awkward tasting spring rolls in my life! I thought most spring rolls have a crispy, hot texture to them.  These were prepared cold with a soft wrapping.  Customer service is not anything to rave about either.

57.description: I ordered sushi from here and it was alright. Nothing too fancy - I ordered a tuna roll and a yellowtail roll with some dumplings. Pretty average - I would say this is a good spot for a quick lunch.

20.description: I have been a patron of Tiparos for several years and it is my go to place. I think they have the best Pad Thai around but I too avoid the adventurous sushi and stick with the fish that moves such as  tuna, salmon, crab stick and hamachi.   Paul, the owner, is truly a great guy and always goes out of his way to ensure the restaurant is running right.The portions are generous and the food is quality is top notch. I do agree with some of the other reviews and find that dining in is the best option. Sorry for those who got poisoned however! Never a good experience.

36.description: Their pad see ew is fantastic compared to the other thai places in the area. Its not heavy on the vegetables and focuses on the noodles and sauce being good. The sushi is also good. I really enjoyed the shrimp tempura roll, the pieces were big and the sweet sauce on top wasnt overpowering.

14.description: WORST sushi and thai I have ever been to. I had one bite of the sushi and it was inedible. Because so many of the other dishes were built incredibly wrong for thai - and yes, I mean authentic thai, and I was so hungry and wanted to avoid another let down, after the sushi, I went with the crab rangoons. AWFUL. They were beyond BLAND, and what oozed out looked like a white version of "pink sludge". No crab or krab in sight. It's hard to mess up crab rangoons! My friend who wasn't with me concurred my thoughts on the place- "Yep, worst crab rangoons I have ever had". They wanted to charge $1 to get Siracha with my sushi. That's like charging for ketchup at McDonalds. They were also out of the wine I ordered. I still paid for it all. $25 for two bites of crappy food. I will never go back to Tiparos.

58.description: 2nd mortgage time! However, the feta and sundried tomato turkey burgers are the only turkey burgers I have ever liked!The staff is also very helpful, especially the lady in the floral department and their overall selection is great.

56.description: What a cute grocery store!  I had no idea this was even a Michigan chain until i looked at my bag.  I first walked in at the Old Town location when there was a bunch of chocolate and wine tastings! I was impressed!  Love how they sell Sees and Zingermans items too!  Love how there is a wine and coffee bar with an outdoor patio!  Can't wait to try the Michigan locations!Btw...$4for a glass of wine on a patio with free wifi!  Not too shabby!

29.description: Love this place! An organic and non-gmo buyers haven.

42.description: I agree with every reviewer here, the cashier service is atrocious. Absolutely despicable. To have a fancy supermarket and great service in the store is now starting to ruin it at checkout. The lack of happiness, the have a good one and the complete insanity of their coupon marketing leaves you very unsatisfied. I literally just left the store after never being asked if I had my rewards card, paying cash and getting 98 cents change (she couldn't spare a penny) and then handing myself my groceries because she was on to the next customer.

23.description: Hidden gem for craft beer, they get an unbelievable supply and it seems that very few people go there looking for it because I've found some hard-to-get-your-hands-on bombers there several times.  Beer prices are as good as you will find them for craft selection.Hot bar has some really good food for somewhat reasonable prices.Intelligentsia coffee is expensive bu it's easily the best coffee I've ever had.No clue about the groceries, I've tried shipping for groceries a few times but wasn't sure what I was looking at.

47.description: As a recent transplant from Michigan, it was comforting to see a Plum Market in Chicago! It offers the same selection of fresh produce, meat, deli, and bakery items. The emphasis is still on Michigan produce and other food items, including Zingerman's breads and pies, but they also have a See's Candies section (California!). If I had to make an analogy for non-Michigan natives, I'd say this store is the same category as Whole Foods (national), PCC (Washington), and Natural Pantry (Alaska).I come to Plum Market every week for their selection of Zingerman's breads and Boar's Head deli meats and cheeses. They often have samples of their newest items, and my most recent visit occurred during their Organic Harvest Festival. There were samples of "smart chicken," chocolate-covered candied ginger, protein drink, watermelon-lime-mint juice from their juice bar, and of course, Zingerman's breads.The bread loaves are often on sale for half price, a rare sight and find in Ann Arbor. The staff are often hard to find in the produce section, but they are easier to find in the meat department, deli, bakery (very easy to find in the bakery), and skincare sections. My checkout experience is hit-or-miss, but I usually get asked if I found everything all right and wished a good day/great weekend. Like Whole Foods, there is a prepared foods and salad bar, and a coffee bar (but better, this is more like a coffee lab) using Intelligentsia coffee. There is also a juice bar, which is more like a juice splurge because the juices can run you upwards of ten dollars each. If you check-in on Yelp, you'll receive an offer for a dollar off your juice bar purchase.   I encourage shoppers to sign up for Plum Rewards. I haven't received any offers yet, but shoppers ahead of me in line have used e-coupons and saved 25% or greater on their purchases!

8.description: This store sells Trader Joe's kind of food at Whole Foods prices ($7.99 for Driscoll's non organic strawberries, are you kidding me?). I'd never go if I didn't live next door, but sometimes I need something last minute, so I have no choice but to go to Plum. The quality of their produce is ok, I've bought some spoiled produce before there, but aside from everything being overpriced, their cashiers are terrible. Not once I was asked if I found everything ok, most of the time they don't say a single word to me.

31.description: This place is great for vegans. So many vegan goodies in here! Plum Market carries vegan products (and non-vegan) products that Whole Foods doesn't, and I think that is what lures me to come back every single week. I discovered this place on accident almost a year ago and I'm so glad I did.I came out with a bag of Beanfields nacho flavored bean & rice chips. Came back every week to get these and tons of other things! However... it appears that they don't have my favorite nacho flavored bean & rice chips and my heart breaks every time I go down the chip aisle. They were the only store in Chicago that carried the delicious nacho flavored bean & rice chips!Besides the heartbreak of not being able to buy my favorite snacks in the whole wide world... this store is still the best!

34.description: This is a great place to grab a hot lunch on the go or pick up a delicious hot dinner on your way home from work. The food quality is amazing here, everything is locally sourced and natural. I always eat lunch here. They have patio and indoor seating. There is a huge selection of food. I also like to pick up dinner here for me and the family after a long day at the office. They have so many selections and they change their menu everyday. Free 2 hour indoor parking with purchase. Great wine and beer selection. You have to check this place out!

16.description: What a cute grocery store!  I had no idea this was even a Michigan chain until i looked at my bag.  I first walked in at the Old Town location when there was a bunch of chocolate and wine tastings! I was impressed!  Love how they sell Sees and Zingermans items too!  Love how there is a wine and coffee bar with an outdoor patio!  Can't wait to try the Michigan locations!Btw...$4for a glass of wine on a patio with free wifi!  Not too shabby!

13.description: I've NEVER been as excited to go grocery shopping than when I go to the Plum Market! I'm always excited at the fact that I know I'll be finding something interesting, new, and healthy to try out... EACH TIME I go. The best part about the Plum is the overwhelming amount of choices of HEALTHY and DIFFERENT varieties of: organic food, wine/alcohol, produce, flowers/plants, beer, meat, cheese, pastries, essential oils, vitamins, chocolate, soaps, ice creams, coffee, teas, etc. etc. etc. there are, ranging from organic, to gluten/sugar/dairy free, GMO free, and to cruelty free products! They have pre-made terrariums, a hot bar with Instagram-ready looking food, wine tastings, and star fruit, people... STAR FRUIT! Ever try it?If you're tired of the same old bland tasting food, or brands, or you're in a rut with your usual grocery story, I highly recommend trying the Plum. Even if you live in the burbs or out of state, I'd literally recommend people to pop in, even for a quick peek. I cannot express enough how good it feels to shop here knowing that I've left with exotic, tasty gems. The only draw back to this place is that it's a bit expensive, but WELL worth it. The staff is also super friendly, helpful, and actually knowledgeable in what they're talking about, too. This is thee best alternative "EVERYTHING" grocery store that I hope to see popping up in more places soon. I wish every grocery store was like the Plum! :)

11.description: KART O' FUNWhen did grocery stores become a party? There is no reason to even go home anymore. I literally could hang out in this store all night.  Luckily they do not have a DJ spinning records or I may never leave but I will drop that suggestion in the box. Now I know why Dominick's closed because they couldn't keep up with all this grocery fun. This store is located in Old Town and is the first Chicago location but rumors are in the air that a second one is on the way. They have 2 hour free parking but you need to buy something in order to get it validated. Does a pack of gum count? I am not sure but I hope so.There are three ways to enter and depending on which door you choose your experience could be different. The south door has the coffee shop & wine bar right as you walk in. Grabbing a wine will help you relax prior to going shopping. There is free wifi if you can get it to work. I had some issues connecting, so I really did not use it. If you enter from the North end you will get a treat. Make sure you look up at the facade  because it is historic. I do not know all of the facts but I do know when they built this new location they took every stone down piece by piece, restored it and then reassembled it prior to the store opening. I love it when we preserve Chicago history. The third way is less exciting because it is basically an escalator ride down from the parking lot.The neighbors have really embraced this store and I see a lot of people who walk here. The selection of organic food is fantastic and all of the produce looks amazing. Now I will say it is a little more expensive then other stores but you do get what you pay for and you will be paying for quality items when you come here to shop.I am not quite sure why but there is a See's Candy location inside. This is great for me because I no longer have to fly to California to pick up a box for my wife. It was one of those things I always brought home from a business trip. Near the candy shop is a beautiful florist with an incredible selection of flowers. I think they are trying to give me a hint by putting candy and flowers together.They have a selection of pre-made food. I did try the Sicilian pizza bread and it was very tasty and full of flavor. You can self serve yourself from the hot and cold salad section. I enjoy the olive bar and spied some spicy olives that I will be returning for in the near future.I need to get back to the wine bar because this is where I spent most of my time. That seems surprising doesn't it. The staff working here is amazing. They have a great knowledge of all the wines they sell and pour here. If you also like wine tastings and events they have them every Thursday night. There is a small fee of $10 to $20 depending on the event but you get two hours of education and tastings. You can sign up for the email list, so you can stay up to date of when those different events are happening. I like to think of it as the best extra credit class you can sign up for. So if you haven't been to this store I recommend a trip. It is good to see how a new store does it and does it differently. The staff is really friendly and will engage you while you are in the aisles to make sure you are doing good.  I hate stores where staff will run away from you because you might have a question about where chickpeas are at. I always am looking for the most random stuff and that is why I need help. So congrats on making it one year and here is to many more years of delivering great service and delicious food to the community.

39.description: My mom and sister found the Plum Market while visiting me and were amazed by the wine selection and quality of food. The man at the seafood and meat counter was extremely helpful. We asked for some chicken legs and he told us he had just packaged some that were cheaper in the ice box behind us. The guys in the wine section and cheese counter also made great recommendations. We ended up grabbing some food for lunch and it was on par with Whole Foods, maybe better! It's definitely more expensive than your average grocery store, but the quality and knowledgeable staff make up for it.

37.description: Plum Market...how I love thee...let me count the ways...Let's get one thing straight: this place is EXPENSIVE. BUT...if you sign up for the Plum Rewards card, you always can get a discount of some sort. And there is free parking.This is how awesome this place is: No matter where I am, I go out of my way to go to go to the salad bar. It's always fresh, tons of choices and that Crab salad is out of this world! The hot bar is always delicious, as well as the soup.They have a great bakery and carry Glazed and Infused donuts these Zingleman's? pies which are as good as mine, and that's saying a LOT. The coffee bar is great, so is the wine and beer section. Produce fresh and plentiful. Meats, seafood are super!Employees are knowledgeable and friendly. I could go on and on...but you get the picture. It's great!

0.description: Wonderful addition to the neighborhood!!  The wine selection is fantastic and priced reasonably.  But do not expect the store to be inexpensive - think comparable pricing to Whole Foods.  Regardless, it has everything we need.  The meat and sea food selection is top notch.  The prepared food and salad bar makes for easy dinner pickup.  We have also enjoyed the wine bar and the Intelligentsia coffee bar.  However, do not expect the speediest service at the Intelligentsia coffee bar.  It is not the "fast food" cafe approach.  The tea is lose leafed and brewed on a timer.  The coffee drink preparation uses a methodology.  There is seating in the store where we have met friends and grabbed something for dinner in the store or have enjoyed sitting outside with a coffee and a muffin.  I have also gone there for a coffee and brought work as there is free wifi.  Plum has a loyalty rewards card and you do receive coupons for $10 off depending on what you spend plus coupons in the mail.  There is free two hour parking in the garage.Overall it has been a win-win for the neighborhood from selection, service and convenience.

38.description: My boyfriend and I were visiting Chicago from Denver, CO and happened to wonder upon Plum Market one evening following a comedy show. The produce section caught our eye from the sidewalk as everything was colorful and perfectly placed. Upon entering we were greeted by a gentleman who was doing a wine tasting and aside from the great wine we got to sample he spent quality time with us selecting the perfect bottle to take back to the hotel. We then continued to wonder throughout the market and were able to sample a number of delicious treats! The entire staff was gracious and welcoming and we met the manager who surprised us upon checkout with a bag of cashew brittle to take home, his treat! We left and commented on the experience as it was over-the-top from start to finish. It is rare to experience this kind of customer service and for that reason is was memorable. The only question is...when do you come to Denver??

51.description: Their food selection is impressive, however, the price is steep. What I did find to be a bargain was the wine! Beats Binnys by a lot. As far as their customer service goes, it is a huge issue for me. The employees who stock, and the people behind the counters are great. They go out of their way to help me find something. What I hate the most is their cashiers. I hardly get a smile, hello, or even did you find everything okay from them. They always seem to ruin my experience at Plum, and this is has been every time that I've been there, roughly 15 times. Also beware: there have been 2 occasions where the cashier has double rung an item or entered a mistaken sku, each mistake being about $20 in difference. When the cashier tried to fight me like I was wrong without even reviewing the items, I have a problem with that. That's not cool. I personally think the managers should focus on retraining their cashiers, or maybe they need to quit their jobs and go elsewhere.

27.description: Plum market is such a great, classy place, with some of the most delicious foods.  I am quickly finding this place as one of my favorites.  I highly recommend it!!!

32.description: I love having Plum Market at my discretion for my hunger needs!  It's a nice alternative to Whole Foods, and pretty comparable in price.  So don't expect to find bargains here, although they do offer some pretty good specials that run every week.   Plum Market offers great products from local artisan producers, as well as those from their home state of Michigan, including lots of goodies from Zingerman's!  Some of their biggest attributes are their butcher counter and their pre-made food area.  They have a nice hot food case where you can get a nice meal that may include roast turkey, ribs, steak and copious sides.  As well, they offer a self serve area where you can purchase food by the pound.  Their bakery is also very reliable.  You can never go wrong with a grocery store where you can get your favorite Glazed and Infused donut!One knock that happens on occasion is I've found milk and other dairy products at or very near expiration date.  I've found the employees to be super friendly and very service oriented.  Another cool thing is that there's an Intelligentsia attached, so you can grab a nice single origin coffee and do your shopping!

54.description: This place is awesome! Their hot food bar outshines whole foods for sure. It's cheaper, there are more selections, and interesting combos of ingredients. I made a pretty amazing salad topped with a creamy tomato chicken.This shop also has a coffee, wine, and juice bar. It's an all around win win.

48.description: Skip the cupcakes - took home several and they were not good. Frosting looked like chocolate but had no flavor and no butter other than the no flavor chocolate cake which had a way to dense consistency and just was not what i expected for $2.50

44.description: Many items are pricey, but others are competitively priced. Unlike Mrs Greens, this is a FUN place to shop! great selection of just about everything from peppers to jelly belly's. I wish they carried Dannon yogurt, but they can't carry everything! I see myself coming here for years to come.

24.description: This is by far the best grocery store in the city of Chicago. Their grocery product selection is unmatched by its competitors and the quality of their fresh food (produce, seafood, meat, cheese) is extraordinary. I would go for the Niman Ranch meat alone. Add to this the baked good, with assists from the bakers of Zingerman's of Ann Arbor and other talented local bakers, and you have the makings of great food shopping. I have only lightly purchased from their abundant selection of prepared foods, but I was happy with my selections.They reward regular customers with great coupons, better than I have ever seen offered by any grocery store. The prices are comparable to their competitors, but if you shop the sales, you will be rewarded with high quality food at good prices.The staff is extremely helpful and pleasant. How often have you seen happy people working in grocery stores? I don't think I have visited once without at least one staff member asking me if I was finding what I needed.Interconnected to the store is a wine bar and an Intelligentsia Coffeebar, with good seating inside and outside. This area is a great place to take a minute after shopping to relax and enjoy life.

7.description: I stop here often on my forays through Old Town. Not the place for basics, but they have great selections on unusual items, a great beer/wine selection. The staff are always friendly. The deli is well stocked. I like it!

49.description: I ordered a vegetable tray for  entertaining out of  town guests and it was spectacular.  I cannot thank the produce department enough for putting together the vegetables on the tray so lovely, so beautifully, and being so accommodating as to which vegetables I wanted.  They even had some good suggestions when I called them.  The man I talked to on the phone was super  nice and really took the time to talk with me with good ideas. I think their customer service is great.  My guests were very impressed with the beautiful tray, and ...the vegetables stayed fresh for days.  I will definitely call them again for future trays.  It looked awesome on our table.  Also when I went to pick it up, the workers took great care to make sure it was packaged perfectly.  Thank you plum market.

40.description: This is by far the coolest grocery store I have ever been to. My brother tried to prepare me for how hard I would freak out, and I'm glad he did, or I would have just been walking around slack-jawed the whole time. The produce is phenomenal, the alcohol selection was fantastic, and they had a wine professional (not sure if she was a sommelier or not, but she certainly knew her wine). We went a little crazy at the cheese counter, and we also got a bunch of delicious prepared sauces and starters so the guys can have some homecooked meals without having to do too much actual cooking. Overall, I was floored by the selection, the quality and the experience of shopping here. We also agreed we had never spent as much at the grocery store (with the exception of hosting Thanksgiving). But it truly is one of the best shopping experiences ever, and if you know me, you know I'd much rather spend my money at the grocery than the department store!

53.description: It blows my mind that everyone doesn't rate plum market as a 5 star.The grocery portion of the store is perfect; it carries unique items, but you can count on it for your staples. I come through every morning for a raw protein drink that I've never seen anywhere else. I also hit up the butcher a few times a week for items such as jalapeno cheddar stuffed brats. This type of stuff is typically only available at dedicated butcheries. Plum market supplies it all.Aside from groceries, plum has a hot food bar with healthy snacks and beautifully delicious fried foods. The best of both worlds! It also has a wine bar, which hosts frequent tastings and unique exhibits.Plum carries hard to find items such as Zingerman's baked goods, Rainier cherries, and salt cooking blocks. Its attached to an Intelligentsia. It has free wifi. It has great beer, wine, and traditional grocery selection. What more do you need?

30.description: I love the Plum!!! I have been shopping there since the day it opened.  it has completely replaced Whole Foods for me. It is so service oriented, other stores could learn a lot from them. They manage to be helpful but not intrusive. I have celiac disease and they have the widest variety of gluten-free foods but I would shop there anyway. The meat and fish counters are really a cut above. The zingermans baked goods are incredible, especially the pecan pie!  I buy it for my guy. They have food you can't find anywhere else.While everyone seems to think they are higher than whole foods I don't. Aside from having a lot of specials, their frequent shopping card is great. It gives you 10 or 20% off frequently, which ends up being less expensive than their competitors. I am hooked!

46.description: Best juice and yogurt bar.  Erik is our favorite baristo, a task master with just the right touch.  They make their own smoothie base with very healthy coconut water and almond milk and agave.  Wow!  Yummy and healthy.

1.description: My favorite place to stop for food on my walk home from the gym.  I love the salad bar here, its a mixture of the awesome already premade salads, along with all of the different salad toppings.  I especially love the edamame and argula salad as well as the chickpea with chunks of cheese!!!!!The hot bar and soup bar always has great options as well, my family loves the mashed potatoes and mac & cheese.The Veuve champagne (my favorite) is shockingly priced decently well here compared to Binny's and other grocery stores in the neighborhood.

55.description: KART O' FUNWhen did grocery stores become a party? There is no reason to even go home anymore. I literally could hang out in this store all night.  Luckily they do not have a DJ spinning records or I may never leave but I will drop that suggestion in the box. Now I know why Dominick's closed because they couldn't keep up with all this grocery fun. This store is located in Old Town and is the first Chicago location but rumors are in the air that a second one is on the way. They have 2 hour free parking but you need to buy something in order to get it validated. Does a pack of gum count? I am not sure but I hope so.There are three ways to enter and depending on which door you choose your experience could be different. The south door has the coffee shop & wine bar right as you walk in. Grabbing a wine will help you relax prior to going shopping. There is free wifi if you can get it to work. I had some issues connecting, so I really did not use it. If you enter from the North end you will get a treat. Make sure you look up at the facade  because it is historic. I do not know all of the facts but I do know when they built this new location they took every stone down piece by piece, restored it and then reassembled it prior to the store opening. I love it when we preserve Chicago history. The third way is less exciting because it is basically an escalator ride down from the parking lot.The neighbors have really embraced this store and I see a lot of people who walk here. The selection of organic food is fantastic and all of the produce looks amazing. Now I will say it is a little more expensive then other stores but you do get what you pay for and you will be paying for quality items when you come here to shop.I am not quite sure why but there is a See's Candy location inside. This is great for me because I no longer have to fly to California to pick up a box for my wife. It was one of those things I always brought home from a business trip. Near the candy shop is a beautiful florist with an incredible selection of flowers. I think they are trying to give me a hint by putting candy and flowers together.They have a selection of pre-made food. I did try the Sicilian pizza bread and it was very tasty and full of flavor. You can self serve yourself from the hot and cold salad section. I enjoy the olive bar and spied some spicy olives that I will be returning for in the near future.I need to get back to the wine bar because this is where I spent most of my time. That seems surprising doesn't it. The staff working here is amazing. They have a great knowledge of all the wines they sell and pour here. If you also like wine tastings and events they have them every Thursday night. There is a small fee of $10 to $20 depending on the event but you get two hours of education and tastings. You can sign up for the email list, so you can stay up to date of when those different events are happening. I like to think of it as the best extra credit class you can sign up for. So if you haven't been to this store I recommend a trip. It is good to see how a new store does it and does it differently. The staff is really friendly and will engage you while you are in the aisles to make sure you are doing good.  I hate stores where staff will run away from you because you might have a question about where chickpeas are at. I always am looking for the most random stuff and that is why I need help. So congrats on making it one year and here is to many more years of delivering great service and delicious food to the community.

9.description: I have such a love-hate relationship with Plum Market.  I love it because the food is amazing and I hate it because they are robbing me blind! I first ventured to Plum on its opening day and I immediately fell in love. The produce are a,amazing and fresh, the meat department is really nice, clean and large. The prepared foods are superior to any other supermarket I have been to. They have pre made burgers that you can buy individually, and I strongly recommend the signature chicken and the Mediterranean turkey burgers. They also have a huge selection of fruits and vegetables, including some more exotic ones that you may not find everywhere. I believe I have only had one negative costumer service experience in probably 100 visits. I took away 1 star for 2 different reasons. 1.  It can be so pricy! You have to watch everything you buy to make sure you aren't buying a $4 orange. 2. The prepared foods section has stayed the same for a year, and I would appreciate some variety. As a frequent costumer, it has gotten boring and I rarely buy as much as I used to from this section.Regardless, the quality of the food at plum continues to bring me back time and time again.

26.description: I was so happy with this place for so long but recently things began to change. It is  still the best store in the area, but it is nonetheless lacking. Talk about a lack of variety, they seem to always have the same tired looking soups, desserts, salads, meal options, produce, juice and meat. I'd give this place 5 stars if they changed up their offering from time to time and had less deceptive coupons and  a better loyalty program.  Sill the customer service is good most go above and beyond. They have a large organic section and a natural medicine section both of which are good.  It is on the expensive side but about this I can't complain, it is in the Gold Cost, they have high quality all be it never changing products and it's my choice to shop there so. Also they should have Hagen Dasz, Garofalo pasta,  and Bone Sukin sauce. Bottom line : It is the best in the area with a good enough selection, they need more changing choices  and less deceptive coupons

25.description: Pros:-Clean-Solid hot bar-Intelligentsia cafe-Nice employees Cons-Sells expired food by putting it on sale. Thought this was an accident the first time but I've seen it happen like three times now. I even brought an expired item up to them and it was back on sale the next day.

12.description: Obsessed with this place. I unashamedly buy single serving bags of kale chips for $9. Just because they're different and delicious. Plum has the lesser-known brands that I swear by, like Arctic Zero and Chia Pop. Tip: Get a Plum card. Coupons!

59.description: I knew Plum from living in Michigan and am so glad it's in Chicago! It's a great store with a ton of options and helpful, friendly staff. Plum Market also gives back to the community - they work with my non-profit to hire the youth we serve and have been such a great partner. And they have Zingerman's...what more is there to say?

21.description: It's a fabulous market for the rich and the people who think like to spend their hard earn money. I can't even afford corn at this beautifully organized grocery store. The food looks fabulously laid out and the hot foods and ready made foods looks and smells wonderful. People are very friendly there and everything is clean.I got to sample some lovely Sees Candies and buy a bottle of Poland Spring water, my favorite brand of water. I would return here if I was really craving for more Poland Spring water. That i can afford to buy there. This place make Whole Foods look affordable.

17.description: If Wholefoods is aka... "whole-paycheck" than Plum is "Whole Monthly Salary."The place seemed pretentious & many of the products one can purchase at Wholefoods & Mrs. Greens Organic market,  located in Lincoln Park, for a lot less. It is a nice market but it's  abusively overpriced. For all the nice reviews, Plum thanks you for making them rich & allowing yourselves to be ripped-off.

10.description: Love this place! It's like a fusion of Whole Foods and Mariano's, but with a better gluten-free selection. There's a parking garage next door that allows you to park for up to 2 hours with purchase. Now all Plum Market needs to do is expand in Chicago. There are 2 or 3 other locations, all of which are in Michigan.

5.description: THIS MARKET IS AMAZING.I popped in here after a workout class this week and was super impressed. Yes, it is a high-end grocery store as other Yelpers have mentioned, but I was really excited about the quality of everything and the amount of good brands they sell: they've got Honest products, a wealth of Sir Kensington's mayos, mustards and ketchups, BUTTER London nail polishes, Hampton Creek eggless mayo, Chameleon Cold Brew (all the way from my hometown of Austin), Califia Farms Cold Brew, and more.There's a hot bar and (I think) some prepared foods for you to take home as well. I also managed to find Mina Harissa here, which I couldn't even find at Whole Foods even though I thought it was a generally well-known product. When I was slowly walking through the aisles - and taking a few photos of the awesomeness - I had at least 3 employees greet me and ask me if I needed help with anything.Yes, it's pricey, but so is good food and quality products that aren't chock full of chemicals. I'm impressed with you, Plum Market. I'll be back.

3.description: Dare I say this place is BETTER than Whole Foods?!After walking 35 minutes only to realize the Shawarma restaurant I wanted to go to was CLOSED, I was too hungry to think so I just stopped at Plum thinking they'd have some half-assed salad bar I could TRY and navigate, but to my SURPRISE... That was NOT THE CASE AT ALL! I was completely BLOWN AWAY by the options, so much so, I may very well hit up Plum Market again today for LUNCH!! I grabbed a olive oil based salmon salad, along with some chicken at the salad bar and it was so friggin' good. My mouth is watering just thinking about it!! That's it. Decision made. I'm going back there for lunch today! PS: my lunch cost $15- which is the equivalent of how much I would have purchased at the Shawarma place! Boo ya!

35.description: How I wish this market was in my West Loop neighborhood!  We are sorely lacking a place like this.  The produce section is superb as is the meat and seafood.  I was blown away by the wine, craft beer, spirits selection and the pricing which I found to be comparable if not a tad bit lower than the giant Chicago liquor store we all know and love.  The staff is super helpful and knowledgeable.  I haven't had a chance to try any of the prepared foods but fully intend to do so in the very near future.  They have a wine bar as well as an Intelligentsia Coffee bar.  Having parking is a major bonus.

19.description: Eh, this store is a mess!  Small crammed aisles, rude people and a Michigan based store?  I grew up in Michigan and never heard of them, nor would I ever claim them.Why bother, this place is a mess!

28.description: BEWARE of their SEAFOOD !!!!!Purchased shrimp, crab claws, and cod for a soup. All three products were spoiled, reeked of ammonia and squishy. Left me without ingredients for my dinner party soup. What a disappointment!! They did refund my money after I lugged that skanky fish that stunk up my freezer:( yes, it was that pungent, it stunk even frozen.  Also have to agree with everyone saying that most of their sale items ring up as regular price.

45.description: Didn't like that the manger messages me correcting me on the price of his soup and yes it's over $10 with tax TODD! Your messages made you seem like a jerk and a bit of a smart ass!

33.description: I really like it here. I go here primarily because they're the only one that carries my Goodbelly juice that's of the gluten free variety. I'd much rather eat my gluten then drink it. The thought of chugging gluten makes me want to gag. I've searched whole foods everywhere in Chicago and they don't carry the green cap version. Boooo.. ! Yes. This is first world yuppie problems. Since I'm here I do my grocery shopping here too sometimes. They carry everything that whole foods has, sometimes even better stuff actually. Their prices are a little higher than whole foods with some stuff, like for instance my usual flax milk here is more expensive than the same one at whole foods - son of gun!- but oh well.. Saves me a trip so I turn a blind eye sometimes to it. Cuz let's get real here, it'll take me forever to restock the fridge when it's freezing outside. Since I'm here anyway why not just grab it. They have really good prices on wine too I find. And their frozen section is a bit better than the selection at whole foods. You can find all the flavors of Jeni's ice cream here. They're just a little lacking on the frozen veggie section. Same with the produce section. It suffices. Another plus: see's candies is here inside the store. I miss see's candies being a west coast transplant! Soo.. When I'm not at whole foods grocery shopping, I'm here. Or eating out. The employees here are super friendly. The guys working the booze department are kinda hot. Like Portland hot. And that's the younger ones.. Not the old men. I'm not like that. Great store.

43.description: really quite good and i love that whole foods has a competitor.  their hot bar is wonderful and seems to be fresher than whole foods.  i was there once and they practically had a buffet set up, starting in the booze section and wrapping around to the cheese area.  mmmm.  they also have a great candy and chocolate selection.  i also had a salad to go that was great.

2.description: Basically a more expensive Whole Foods.My main problem is the checkout. The second there are more than three customers nearing numerous (though often unmanned) it's chaos. No one knows which line they're in. The process can be painfully slow as the cashier gingerly places one item over the scanner, comments on it to the customer, then sets out down near the bagging area. If there happens to be a bagger, it can be slightly more efficient, unless the bagger also comments on each item as well.I mean I'm not going to stop coming. It's near my work and has food I actually want. I just hope they figure out a way to be more efficient.

18.description: I love having Plum Market at my discretion for my hunger needs!  It's a nice alternative to Whole Foods, and pretty comparable in price.  So don't expect to find bargains here, although they do offer some pretty good specials that run every week.   Plum Market offers great products from local artisan producers, as well as those from their home state of Michigan, including lots of goodies from Zingerman's!  Some of their biggest attributes are their butcher counter and their pre-made food area.  They have a nice hot food case where you can get a nice meal that may include roast turkey, ribs, steak and copious sides.  As well, they offer a self serve area where you can purchase food by the pound.  Their bakery is also very reliable.  You can never go wrong with a grocery store where you can get your favorite Glazed and Infused donut!One knock that happens on occasion is I've found milk and other dairy products at or very near expiration date.  I've found the employees to be super friendly and very service oriented.  Another cool thing is that there's an Intelligentsia attached, so you can grab a nice single origin coffee and do your shopping!

41.description: I was so excited when I heard that Plum was coming to Chicago, but my excitement was short lived.  The poor staff that have to work for, what looks like an egotistical and fickle set of owners who rove around snacking behind the hot bar and randomly screaming at what looks like overworked hourly workers, its a wonder there hasn't been a walk out.  The two stars I did give were for the incredible food coming out of their kitchen and the insanely helpful and dedicated wine staff.  Aside from an unstable and outrageous upper management team, as apparent to even an occasional shopper like myself, the backbone of this store, the hourly workers, all deserve metals and a raise.  I also find it amusing/irritating that the one PR person assigned to responding to these reviews only chooses the positive ones to comment on, leaving the rest of us hanging.  Im torn between shopping there again to support the staff, and going back to Whole Foods in protest of the Upper Management circus.

52.description: I have such a love-hate relationship with Plum Market.  I love it because the food is amazing and I hate it because they are robbing me blind! I first ventured to Plum on its opening day and I immediately fell in love. The produce are a,amazing and fresh, the meat department is really nice, clean and large. The prepared foods are superior to any other supermarket I have been to. They have pre made burgers that you can buy individually, and I strongly recommend the signature chicken and the Mediterranean turkey burgers. They also have a huge selection of fruits and vegetables, including some more exotic ones that you may not find everywhere. I believe I have only had one negative costumer service experience in probably 100 visits. I took away 1 star for 2 different reasons. 1.  It can be so pricy! You have to watch everything you buy to make sure you aren't buying a $4 orange. 2. The prepared foods section has stayed the same for a year, and I would appreciate some variety. As a frequent costumer, it has gotten boring and I rarely buy as much as I used to from this section.Regardless, the quality of the food at plum continues to bring me back time and time again.

50.description: Catering came in and provided a tasting menu at my company. Everything was gourmet and freshly made. There was just the right amount everything flavorful that you can imagine! Everything was definitely delish! :) I will revisit for sure!

4.description: It's a fabulous market for the rich and the people who think like to spend their hard earn money. I can't even afford corn at this beautifully organized grocery store. The food looks fabulously laid out and the hot foods and ready made foods looks and smells wonderful. People are very friendly there and everything is clean.I got to sample some lovely Sees Candies and buy a bottle of Poland Spring water, my favorite brand of water. I would return here if I was really craving for more Poland Spring water. That i can afford to buy there. This place make Whole Foods look affordable.

6.description: This is very close to my house. I started going here after the Jewel closed. I always felt it was way more expensive but not so much with the coupons I get in my email. At times they don't have some of the things I wish for....Pure Leaf Unsweetened Tea...but I LOVE their self-serve salad and dinner bar near the deli. I am obsessed with their ground turkey, the plantains, and the spicy corn salad....thats my dinner at least once a week! I also have enjoyed their meatloaf from the deli and their chicken breasts which they also use in their chicken salad. I am starting to get so used to Plum Market that I am wishing that Jewel won't come back!

22.description: Did you just finish your workout at Soul Cycle, or Shred 415, or perhaps a short jog down Wells street and need a place to show off your new lululemon yoga pants? Look no farther, Plum Market is your place.Plum is a high end grocery store on Wells, it's just about as pricey as Whole Paycheck... I mean Whole Foods. But after your workout, you need a place to browse, look at all the nice organic foods, and try and decide which type of granola to buy, Plum can satisfy all those needs for you, it's perfect!But really... this place has high quality meats and fish. A pretty good hot/cold buffet bar, and pretty good pre-prepared foods. The staff is very friendly as well.5/5 would come back in my yoga pants any day of the week to hang out with the other yoga pants people staring at the different wines and granolas.

15.description: Did you just finish your workout at Soul Cycle, or Shred 415, or perhaps a short jog down Wells street and need a place to show off your new lululemon yoga pants? Look no farther, Plum Market is your place.Plum is a high end grocery store on Wells, it's just about as pricey as Whole Paycheck... I mean Whole Foods. But after your workout, you need a place to browse, look at all the nice organic foods, and try and decide which type of granola to buy, Plum can satisfy all those needs for you, it's perfect!But really... this place has high quality meats and fish. A pretty good hot/cold buffet bar, and pretty good pre-prepared foods. The staff is very friendly as well.5/5 would come back in my yoga pants any day of the week to hang out with the other yoga pants people staring at the different wines and granolas.

57.description: I was always a huge fan of Plum. The store is beautiful and everyone is so helpful and friendly. My love for Plum has now ended due to getting food poisoning from one of their prepared salads in the deli case on 6/11/14. Never again.

20.description: Plum market is great for what it is, an upscaleGrocery in an upscale neighborhood. They always have fresh juices, produce, the hot bar is solid. Although the hot bar can fall off after 2ish in the afternoon. But that's to be expected.The beer, wine, and liquors selection is great. Marcel (manager of the dept) is a great resource if you have questions on what to pair with what. However he is not the only one, everyone is very helpful and seemingly willing to go beyond what you might expect.I am giving Plum 4 stars, due to price, prices went up recently. Before it was a upscale grocery with not so upscale prices. Now its very close if not a touch more than Whole foods.

36.description: Absolutely love this market. It is such a great place to have in the middle of the city. I can get organic veggies & meats. I also have a lot of food allergies & they have a lot of allergy friendly foods.

14.description: Open until 10, even Xmas eve, is wonderful for those of us who need last-minute supplies. I may now relax as I was worried about working and shopping on the 24th. Many thanks.

58.description: Gross. I can get behind a dive bar for a late night every once in a while, but this place is just nasty. I shudder thinking about its bathrooms. I can't even believe people would order food here..i'm shocked because judging from the reviews it happens and more than rarely.I suppose since it bills itself as a dive bar and seems fine w/that status, it deserves one star. Also, I can't give zero stars.

56.description: Damn, there is a lot of hate in Chicago for this great dive bar.  Burton Place was a nice respite from all the trendy spots we hit up while in Chicago.  It gave me flashbacks to my college days, which always make me warm and fuzzy inside.   Brooklyn Brown on draft made me happy considering the lack of dark beer options (not counting Guinness) at many of the bars we went to.  I liked the mix of patrons.. a little diversity never hurt anyone.. and I absolutely loved the percentage of men to women here... come on Atlanta, kick some ladies out of the city.  Burton Place is an unpretentious, slightly gritty bar with multiple floors of fun and festivities.

29.description: If I could give this place a zero, I would.  The bar smelled like a dirty public bathroom and once we got the bartenders attention and showed our licenses she sneezed all over them.  We proceeded to order a couple beers which the bartender then sneezed all over and did not wash her hands.  There are plenty of other bars in that area that are nice, clean and have similar prices.

42.description: This is our favorite Sunday bar.  A dive bar with a nice friendly laid back atmosphere and a very cool and funny bartender!  They have a good BLT and their beer specials on Sunday rock ($6 pitchers of anything).  Burton Place is a no frills bar when you're looking for no frills.  Good jukebox too!!  Great little neighborhood place to get rid of a Saturday night hangover.  This bar is always good to our crazy drunken running club so extra brownie points for that.  I know the bartender reads these reviews and sometimes he isn't happy about them.  So here you go...hope this five star review made you smile!

23.description: Say what you want about this place, but I have never not had a great time here. The multiple floors allow for ample space to explore while also ignoring people you may not want to run into. The staff is very friendly, especially Shelly (?) who works on the first floor. She really took care of us. While the bottom looks like a dive, the upper two floors are not bad. If you are looking for a late night bar (or anytime bar where you want several strong drinks), I'd recommend it. Many thanks to them keeping my credit card for me at the front register for a week for me to pick it up.

47.description: 2.5 stars I guess.  This place has really gone down-hill.  I'm all for a good dive bar and all but the staff at this place just doesn't seem to care anymore and not in a "cool, divey" way.  More just like they seem to have more important things to do than take care of the people that pay their bills.  Boo.

8.description: Great night out, great music, bartenders, food and late night environment. Will defiantly be coming back again!

31.description: I love a good dive, so my review has nothing to do with the actual establishment but rather my overall experience. We were at the Wells St. Art Festival this weekend, and since I was about to explode from drinking beer, i stopped by with two friends to grab a cocktail.  I ordered a vodka soda with a lemon, and watched him pour me a weak cocktail (I tended bar for years....) and squeeze two limes in it.  I wasn't even that disappointed until he told me that it was $9.00.  For crappy well vodka!?  The icing on the cake was after I had asked one of the guys behind the bar VERY politely if I could please have a water.  He was counting through tickets to see how much money he had made thus far.  It was 90+ degrees that day so I didn't think it was a huge deal.  His response?  "This is a BAR.  You should have brought a bottle of water from somewhere else."  I thought he was joking around with me at first, but after he ignored me and went back to checking out his takings for the day, I realized he wasn't.  I asked him if he was serious, and he said if I really wanted some to grab the pitcher sitting behind the bar and get some myself.I wasn't expecting five star restaurant service, but that was just plain and simple RUDE and could never imagine treating one of my own bar patrons that way.  Needless to say, I will never come back to pay $9.00 for a crappy drink and to be treated with such disrespect!

34.description: Walked in and walked right back out. Had a certificate to eat here and gave it to our cab driver. The place smells like BLEACH! and it's one giant bar. Not my kind of place to eat or hang out. I love a good dive bar like everyone else, but this place stunk! Literally.

16.description: Bare bones and basic, but at least they can pour a Guinness. It's a pretty simple space -- bar in the middle of the room, ~20 seats around it, plus a Touch Tunes jukebox that was the focal point of our evening. Lots of guys hanging around, several red bulls & vodkas being poured, and maybe a shot or two of jager... just to give you an idea of the crowd, bros. No major complaints. A solid spot to stop for a drink if you're in the area, hopping from place to place.

13.description: Went in this past Friday during the happy hour time. The bartender was great and the service was quick! It has a very chill atmosphere and was not too crowded. I will be back again.

11.description: If Burton's were only open on weeknights, I could give it 4 stars. Easily. It's a chill dive with lots of beer on tap, great bartenders and friendly patrons. But problems begin when people see the long line to get into nearby Benchmark and decide to detour to Burton's. This crowd of bros and clique-ish chicks all dressed up look (and act) quite out of place. Things take a turn for the worst when Benchmark closes and, to borrow Castro's phrase, flushes its toilets onto Burton's. The whole place gets even more crowded with people who should've gone home. For example, some asshat kicked my stool out from under me because he think I stole it from him.The 2nd floor opens during street fests, but service is atrocious. I don't even want to type about it. Just be prepared to be ignored.

39.description: The waitress forgot about our table, multiple times. Forgot to ring in our orders, and then before our food came said she had a family emergency, closed our tab and bailed. Then we got to watch her smoke a cig with the other patrons and leave with her boyfriend on a motorcycle. When the food still didn't come, we went inside (we were on the patio) and asked the bartender who said there had never been any food rang in. He rang it in and offered to buy us both a beer, then forgot to do that.I went in another day because I figured a whole bar shouldn't be blamed for a waitress' mistake. The bartender blew us off though and was only social with the regular at the corner.Just seems like the type of place you could have a blast at only if you are already friends with the employees.

37.description: where else can you find good peeps and good music. Newly renovated 2nd and 3rd floors make the late night spot a place to see and be.  Love it here..

0.description: Stopped for a drink around 11pm on saturday. It was a tiny bit busy but we were still able to grab seats by the oval bar. Drinks were strong (almost too strong) The bartender and staff were friendly. The place is such a dive especially in comparing a lot of the bigger bars like benchmark. The area between the wall and bar is narrow so be preparred for drunk idiots to hit you or to rub up on someone (maybe that's what youd like ;) ) Not a bad spot to grab a drink and the food looked (and smelled) pretty good too.

38.description: I was here for a Vegan Meetup.  Absolute worst place to have a meetup.Last time we hung out at Coopers.  That's a great place for a meetup.  There is no seating here at Burtons Place.If you're here to watch a game, that's fine.  Their nachos were fantastic though.......probably because I was starving.

51.description: I came here for lunch with my dad. We were barely greeted and given menus. There were more fruit flies at the bar than patrons. Our sandwiches took 1/2 hour and were only delivered because we asked the server to stop reading her RedEye and check on them. The food was mediocre but not bad. If all of this wasn't enough, the server turned on a TV over her head with an open liquor bottle and replace it without cleaning it. I would only ever stumble in here if I were already drunk. Very disappointed that my lunch date was ruined.

27.description: Pub style bar. Smelled stale. We walked in during the early afternoon for a couple of beers. They were replacing the taps so we got some bottles. No fault of theirs, just crappy timing. Some writing on the wall said "I snort coke to suck dick". I applaud the honesty, but it sounds like it's not a place I'd like to hang out at night. Bartender was friendly though. She liked the fact that I finished my friend's beer before we left. Can't let it go to waste, ya' know?

32.description: My dad always told me that nothing good happens after 2am. It depends how you feel about meeting all sorts of random people from bums to hot babes, public make outs amongst strangers, shots of stuff you're not sure what it was, and tone def karaoke with buddies, but if you consider these features as negatives then you'd probably side with my pops. Sorry dad...I'm gonna have to disagree and say that Burton Place has some bright sides. Plus it's pretty cheap.

54.description: You should almost always appreciate a two-story dive bar. Whether the "second" story is a "basement" or an "attic", you just gotta love it. Anyways, ended up making a pit stop here during a trolley party on a Saturday. The bottom level was pretty crowded, but upstairs wasn't bad at all. There was a lot of space, an extra bar, and a pool table. Sure enough, another trolley party  meandered their way in with us up there, laaaame :)The service was great and the bartender was nice and not a bitch--how refreshing! (No, I'm not saying all female bartending are bitches, but some are, we all know that). My sprite and vodka came in a big tall glass and she was liberal with the V. Weeee!I'd come here again.

48.description: My friends and I decided to use Burton Place as a check-in/meeting place on St. Patty's parade day and were not very impressed. We were in desperate need of some food to sustain our binge drinking and found that their pizza is not even good when you are wasted, to be honest I'm not even sure if you could call it pizza. The drinks are overpriced and the place is understaffed, which makes service rather slow at times. Needless to say, we won't be back.

44.description: Nothing screams "Danger Will Robinson" to me like a 3-story bar with steep stairs and a $20 minimum credit card tab.  Yep, sounds like a fun party/safety hazard/massive hangover-in-the-making to me.

24.description: Not super familiar with Chicago nightlife (I'm a New Yorker) but had a good time here on a recent visit  Three-floor dive bar definitely became more appealing as the night went on, with good music and some dancing on the upper floors. Drinks were strong and reasonably priced. Very casual but seemingly cool crowd.

7.description: Shitty. Bar tenders don't recall your drinks in spite of the limited patrons. Also, They claim to serve food until 3 but they don't.

49.description: I am most certainly not a Burton Place regular but I live in the neighborhood and I've wandered into Burton Place on rare occasion per the request of a friend. Overall, it isn't bad, a late night place to get drunkeER and find various types of mischief - if that's what you're in the market for. My last visit was really bad. I tried that new upstairs area after a black tie event. The bartender was the person who claimed to "own" that space. My guess is the owners give him a piece of the profits if he can bring people in, or maybe he was just full of sh**. For the most part, he was an OK guy, friendly and accommodating at first. As the night went on, the "usual suspects" (regulars, likely other bartenders and waitresses, hangers-on in for a free drink) started to show up and they were not too fond of the seemingly fancy-types in their cocktail dresses and tuxedos that were occupying their space. Sure, we were a little loaded, but that should have been par for the course for the Burton Place people.In short, the "usual suspects" mocked and made others feel uncomfortable while the bartender willingly allowed this behavior to take place, if not instigate it. The black-tie people were intoxicated, but the proper way to handle a situation (where you think one might be over-served and inappropriate) is to ask them to leave - not have your friends shout obscenities and shine a flash light on people - as the bartender did. It was a big fail on the part of the Burton Place staff and it embarrassed and enraged the black-tie people nearly causing an odd battle between the hangers-on people and the black-tie people (paying customers).My overall impression, the bartender gives away free drinks to his friends and those are the only people that frequent that top floor. This is bad business because these "usual suspects" go out of their way to make others feel unwelcome. It is that typical, 20-something year old, I'm a bartender and "I hate the man," and this is MY place behavior. My advice to the bartender (if he's even still employed by the establishment) -- keep your obnoxious friends in check, you'll likely make more money and attract more paying customers and less hangers-on. Otherwise, you will likely be out of a job soon enough.

40.description: I think this is my favorite "go to" bar in Chicago.  I love how you could dress up or down... and I love their cheese fries.  I wish they had them in CA bars!

53.description: Burtons was the only place in the area that didn't have a line at 11:30pm on Saturday, so our group wandered inside for some quick relief from the cold night. Aside from the toasty temperature, Burtons provided little more. The drinks were weak, the bathrooms were gross, the bar was inaccessible (mosh-pit style line upstairs), and the music could've been better.
