There's a pool table upstairs to keep you entertained...but other than that it's a completely no frills bar. There's almost no seating, so plan on standing the whole night and getting bumped by drunk people around you when it gets crowded. Do yourself a favor and go out early enough to get into the nicer bars  across the street.

30.description: I love a good dive bar.  Unfortunately Burton Place is not a good one.  And that is unfortunate, because it used to be a great one that my friends and i would patronize often 20 years ago.  So I was looking forward to reliving many of those happy memories when I decided to stop in recently.  The place has not changed at all -and by that I mean it not only looked the same, but it did not seem like it had been cleaned since I was last in there.  Everything including the bar felt greasy.  And despite the fact it was not busy the bartender was extremely slow and not friendly at all.  Unbelievably, they still serve food there but I would never take the chance of eating anything in there.  It is always a sad day when a once-great place finally hits bottom.  It is doubly surprising given that the old town neighborhood around has gone the opposite way and improved tremendously in terms of the other establishments along Wells and people being more willing to go there.

46.description: I'm so sad.I just left this place and was headed there for my friends and my 7th annual old town good Friday pub crawl. In past years this place has been our permanent stop on our crawl - the one place we could count on to be awesome. We walked in here with minds blazing ready to let ourselves loose at Burton Place - where we generally do every year. Unfortunately something had changed since we were here last year. There was an bartendress who we didn't recognize and had never seen. She was curt, which was fine, until she told us to knock it off...(thanks for the spelling edit Joghn Z!)We were simply enjoying ourselves and really excited to be in our favorite bar of our pub crawl, and she - after a friend of mine was acting ridiculous - said "you think you should be acting like this - you're 28".The BARTENDER. SAID THAT! First of all - it's Burton Place at 1 PM on a Friday. WHO GIVES A FUCK!? Second of all, of all the places that you would think would welcome fun behavior from grown ups wouldn't you think Burton would be that place? It has in the past. We have previously fallen in love with bartenders because they laugh with us, not scoff at us. It's not anymore. Unfortunately, it's not.They were supremely rude and judgemental all so their "regular" patrons could smoke cigarettes and watch Stargate SG-1...so sad.I hope future bartenders can take a page from the past and not let this blip on the radar affect Burtons overall awesomeness.Tear.

1.description: Great place.  Can be somewhat quiet early in the night, but if you are looking for a great place to go after 2 am, this is the bar to go to.  The Jalepeno Poppers are also a great late-night snack.  This place is 3 floors of classic Americana for 20-30 somethings.

55.description: When I first walked in here, I was thinking, how depressing. One of the diviest bars that I've been to in Chicago so far. Not that I don't like dive bars, but it was dead inside which made it sad.My friends and I sat outside to enjoy the weather. Our waitress was amazing! 5 stars for her. Very friendly, quick and intuitive. Nice rack also! Yes, I write it as I sees it.The bar food is not bad either - good value. As the day went on the place got more crowded and became a happier place.

9.description: The older I get, the more I love (and prefer) dive bars. I'm not sure if you can call Burton's a dive bar but you can definitely call it intimate with no frills.Let me paint you a picture:-jukebox-80% male clientele-fairly mellow on a weeknight yet, not dull-circular bar that pretty much takes up the entire space-located in Old Town -A ginger and Jameson that is mixed just right-last, and most importantly, the jukebox has Missy Elliott's "Work It" (all is right in the world)Feel like you're there?

26.description: A dive bar without the drink prices to justify. Our group went here on a Saturday night after hitting several other bars. There are 3 floors at Burton Place. The main floor was pretty standard and very crowded. The second floor was a creepy wanna be dance floor with no one on it. The third floor, where we finally ended up felt like a house party we weren't invited to.With a large group of friends, this bar might be a good time, but it was just alright. Not too high on my list of favorite places.

25.description: I really dont like this bar.  I dont know what it is but Im just not crazy about it.  I kinda dont like that its really cramped in there for one and the fact that the bouncers were tryna cattle us in there to make more room for folks!  Come on now yall tryna pack us into that small space should be a fire hazard.  The only thing that I like is that its a late night bar but really....no thanks!

12.description: Nice little dive on Wells. Seems to cater to the older locals in the area but is always a pretty friendly place to hang out when you're playing it low key for the night.

59.description: Burton Place is a niche bar.  Its niche is late-night.  We've never gone over to Old Town to go specifically to Burton Place.  It's solely a follow-up place once Fireplace closes.  It generally starts to get packed after 1:30 a.m. when all the 2 a.m. bars have closed.  There tends to be an influx of younger people in their 20s once you get closer to 2 a.m.  Burton Place is sometimes an okay place for a drink or two late night, but it is essentially a dump.  I've been in the place on occasions when they had buckets (plural) on stools catching water raining down from the floors above that was splattering all over the downstairs floor.  When you have a plumbing situation as such you know what the bathroom will be like.  Right.  It kind of makes me cringe that they serve food here.It's an okay place for a late night beer or two.  It's 2 1/2 stars, but I'll round up to three stars.

21.description: If Burton's were only open on weeknights, I could give it 4 stars. Easily. It's a chill dive with lots of beer on tap, great bartenders and friendly patrons. But problems begin when people see the long line to get into nearby Benchmark and decide to detour to Burton's. This crowd of bros and clique-ish chicks all dressed up look (and act) quite out of place. Things take a turn for the worst when Benchmark closes and, to borrow Castro's phrase, flushes its toilets onto Burton's. The whole place gets even more crowded with people who should've gone home. For example, some asshat kicked my stool out from under me because he think I stole it from him.The 2nd floor opens during street fests, but service is atrocious. I don't even want to type about it. Just be prepared to be ignored.

17.description: My dad always told me that nothing good happens after 2am. It depends how you feel about meeting all sorts of random people from bums to hot babes, public make outs amongst strangers, shots of stuff you're not sure what it was, and tone def karaoke with buddies, but if you consider these features as negatives then you'd probably side with my pops. Sorry dad...I'm gonna have to disagree and say that Burton Place has some bright sides. Plus it's pretty cheap.

10.description: Had such a great time there with the bartenders shelly and Margo. Super friendly, but pretty sure I got super sick from the tatertotschoes

5.description: Definitely a cool dive bar with very cool bartenders.I came on a Thursday night and it was a nice crowd. Good music was playing as it was a mix of 90's and 2000s tunes.Nice to see there is a civilized bar in this area...good stuff

3.description: Another great dive bar! Great for trashy day drinking, or sordid late night imbibing. Friendly staff, good prices and just a whole lotta booze.

35.description: This place is an absolute dump, but is exactly what I was looking for in a neighborhood full of pretentious bars vying for the title of top-douche (reigning champ: Benchmark, with Pour House expected to challenge for the belt soon).What you'll find, from my experience: friendly bartenders, cheap drinks, and an overall vibe that feels like college.What you won't: lines out the door, $10 beers, and pretension.If you want to get dressed up with your girlfriends and go dancing, suffice it to say this isn't your spot. But if you're looking for a laid-back spot for a cheap drink and good music, I'd definitely recommend Burton.

19.description: Burton's Place, the Manolo Blahnik of Chicago bars!  If Beethoven would have composed his 10th Symphony, it would have looked and sounded exactly like Burton's Place except in dark lit corner bar form.   I mean this place has it ALL, absolutely EVERYTHING can be found here folks.   I haven't visited this fine drinking and dining establishment in quite some time and coming back last night made me realize what I have been missing.  Immediately upon entering you can't help but feel warm and cozy like a fireplace in a cabin during winter solstice.  Everyone here has a cracked iPhone screen, so this must be some sort of express entry into the place. I immediately headed up to the third floor.  Let me tell you, this place looked just like the ballroom in the Disney movie Beauty and the Beast.  From slightly stained velvet curtains, to linoleum floors to Formica countertops, I was in complete awe!  I was just waiting for Lumière and Cogsworth to show up. LOL....  You can't help but notice the aroma emanating from here.  It's if heaven's angels were playfully fighting and spilling Drakkar, Cool Water and Abercrombie Woods all over the place.   Maybe it was a special Friday night but the patrons were all dressed to the 9's.  The crème de la crème of Chicago were here. I saw cowboy hats, pleather jackets, mom jeans, fupa accentuating pants, "Hoof-Arted" t-shirts.  See and be seen! Tonight must have been a zombie themed night because everyone was stumbling into permanent walls, puking on the floor, and falling down the stairs while trying to go to "third base".... Millennial's and their themes I tell ya!  I didn't mind the song "Face down ass up" too much but my only recommendation would be to have a few more Barry Manilow songs besides Copacabana and Mandy in the jukebox.....obviously! You must also try the food.  I showed up late so they were out of the prime rib.  Instead, I tried the pommes frites, tots frites and deep fried battered chicken cutlets.  The perfect compliment to a 2011 Bigfoot merlot or a pint of their finest Miller High Life.  Food and Wine magazine, eat your heart out!  My only major gripe about this place is that they didn't have any tempeh.  I definitely recommend this establishment to locals and out of town folks!.

28.description: We went to Burton's Place on a Saturday night.  I don't know what the bartenders name was upstairs, but she was rude beyond belief.  She denied my entire group water and told us that she had the right.  This was on Saturday, September 15, 2012.  I know she was busy and I can appreciate that, but she was so rude that it made us leave early.  Her attitude was unacceptable and I know it is a late night bar but there still needs to be a level of service to paying customers.  I know she has to deal with drunk people all the time and it could get frustrating but you have to help people that are just trying to get water.  That is a common request and when you are shoved away for water that is a reason not to go back.

45.description: Gone here twice after shows at night, and its a pretty basic bar.  The big plusses though are karaoke on Tuesday nights, late night food, and the service, which, for a bar filled with drunks, is pretty good.  And, regarding that late night food, it's pretty tasty for this sort of thing.  My favorite chicken tenders in the area by far--a good crispy batter on 'em, with all that sweet succulent meat inside.  COPA on Clybourn used to satisfy my karaoke jones, but I think they're closed.  In any case, they didn't serve food anyway, and this place does-with a smile.  Haven't gone upstairs--in fact, until I read other reviews, I didn't even know it had one--but it's a-ok to me at this point.

33.description: The only reason I came here was for some food. I was starving and needed to eat a little something before I started drinking. It was Saturday night and we sat at the bar. There was only 1 bartender! Service was horrible. Not because she was unfriendly, but because she was busy. After about 10 minutes of sitting down we were finally able to order. We ordered the appetizer sampler and a round of drinks. We saw our food come out, but nobody grabbed it and gave it to us. I took matter into my own hands and took my own food. The food was just a bunch of basic fried foods. This would be an okay dive bar if the service was better.

43.description: RIPPED US OFF; TWICE - When my friend and I went to and pay the tab via our separate credit cards, the bartender overcharged us for a drink apiece.  When my friend called him on it, he said that they bought us a round.  My friend said we never got the drinks and that if you did buy us a round, you wouldn't charge us for it, right?  So, the bartender fixed the tabs.  Guess what?  I check my bank this morning and they still added $2 to my credit card.  Now, I checked my receipt and I wrote very clearly, so there's no mistaking the amount.  I know why they did such a small amount - so no one would complain.  Well, I am.  If you go here, beware.

2.description: Horriable customer service, the food is ok seeing it's just bar food. A skinny white woman, with raspy voice who claims to be the manager is just plain RUDE.. Smh. Work on treating customers better.

18.description: Nothing screams "Danger Will Robinson" to me like a 3-story bar with steep stairs and a $20 minimum credit card tab.  Yep, sounds like a fun party/safety hazard/massive hangover-in-the-making to me.

41.description: Want to recall or relive your college days by crashing a frat house party at 3am? Then come to Burton's. Else, avoid it.

52.description: A dive bar indeed. Very much so. And that's what made it appealing to me. If i lived nearby, this would probably be my fall back place. And they got a lot of TVs for sports, which is nice. One TV was actually playing an episode of "Will and Grace." I have seen it all in life.

50.description: Great late night bar (after 2AM) with good bar food and cold drinks.  My friends and I arrived here around 2AM and the bar was pretty empty; and by 2:30AM the place was packed, so get there early.  Staff was great, very friendly and quick service.

4.description: Walk in, can't immediately get upstairs but once you do they play decent music. HOWEVER if the doorman "Donni" gives you his card and you decline he will treat you like SHIT. He can't take take rejection, so be prepared to be kicked out for no good reason, just pure bitterness of rejection. Also they close the kitchen at 2:50 not 3am. Last resort bar if you're in chicago.

6.description: The bartender is TERRIBLE she is crabby and is very short with you. They say they have 3 floors been there multiple times and the upstairs is always closed. When I asked the bartender why, she looked and me and walked away. Would never go back or recommend to anyone

22.description: Great late night dive-ish bar. Nice neighborhood feel. Gets a little crowded but its fun. The only negative (and its a pretty huge one) is the smug female bartender on the second floor. She's terrible. Avoid her altogether and you'll have a nice time.

15.description: Burton Place is a dive bar.  The downstairs bar seems like it takes up half the room so it is very crowded  The upstairs feels like a Frat party.  A good place to go if you either want to drink a lot or your 21.

57.description: After getting my hair done at RJ, I met up with Shannon and TT at Burton. We were avoiding Wrigley-ville due to the Cubs game and drunks on the street. Plus I was starving so a place with food was a must. The place was HOT and not like sexy it was warm inside. There was a softball team taking up the front of the bar so we took our seats at the bar. Our bartender had a drawn picture on the wall, so Shannon messed with him. I got the chicken sandwich with BBQ and a shiner boch. The sandwich was good but the fries were not salty fried goodness. fail on fries. The beer was good but I downed that quick.. at 5.50 a pint.. I moved to Miller lite quick (4.50). Not a huge drop in price but better than 5.50. TT and Shannon drank Burton place out of Blue moons. The keg was spent after 4 drinks. Because it took so long for them to change kegs .. we got free lemon drop shots.. more sweet not as vodkaie as expected. I was ok with this place but for the price and the atmosphere was not worth the hype. We ended up going to Trinity after!

20.description: Smells like bum piss

36.description: I was in here on Friday Night around 10:45pm and not only was the place virtually empty (about 20 people), but the smell of urine and stale beer was enough to wake the dead.  What a s&*thole.

14.description: This is one of my favorite kinds of bar, dark, a little dirty and open practically till the sun comes up! The first time I went here was on a Thursday night. It was pretty chill until 2am when the bar got packed! That's when my friend informed me that this was "a late night bar." The crowd was super fun and the jukebox was hot. Fast forward to Saturday night, where I was suggesting the spot to a friend. That's when I discovered the other two floors!  Still gotta stick with the ground floor and boy was I surprised when they turned on the lights at 5am! Can't wait to head back for another late night session soon!

58.description: Mark Malnaiti thanked me at the door for visiting.  I really didn't dig it.  I dream of Rubio's and love fish tacos. These have way too much going on--too many sauces, too many tastes  It is $15 for a pair of tacos and a side.  Place was crowded--I live around the corner and wanted to love it.  Gave 3 stars rather than 2 because of professional execution.  It's me, not you.

56.description: Good, fresh fish and excellent toppings. Because I ordered all batter fried fish, it was really large, maybe too large to fit on the tortilla. Best bet is to eat a piece of fish, then finish the taco. I needed Kramer's caddie to tell me that, but he wasn't around. I was alone so I couldn't try a lot of different stuff, but the cod and the shrimp were excellent. I would bring a couple people so you could get a bigger variety of items. Saw Marc Malnati as I was leaving. Good that for someone who doesn't NEED to be at his restaurants that he still makes the effort and wants to try new ideas.  We'll be back.

29.description: I really enjoyed this place. The food was fresh, delicious, and my order was filled promptly and accurately. I had 1 crispy shrimp taco, one ahi tuna poke taco, and a side of the coconut rice. Everything was delicious! I wish I had room for more food, but the 2 tacos were plenty. Also, I don't understand when Yelpers review a restaurant and give them an awesome food review, but only give 3 stars because they think the food was "too expensive." I'm sorry, but didn't you see a menu with prices BEFORE you ordered? I knew I was going to spend at least $15 on my meal because I actually read the menu. And why would you suggest that the restaurant make smaller portions just so they can charge less? You do understand that there are many other taquerias in Chicago? In Old Town? Find a cheaper place to eat and leave Buzz Bait alone to continue in its awesomeness!

42.description: I love when a place has a very limited menu, because it's usually a sign that they do only a few things but they do them well. That is totally true for Buzz Bait! The tacos ROCK. They're big, too. When they say two tacos per order, that is enough for one person...especially if you have any guac or sides. The margs are okay (a little too sweet without enough liquor), and while the salsa/guac selections are amazing, the chips are too oily to enjoy. Will be back all the time for the tacos and sides, but I'd hold on the chips and drinks.

23.description: What a great addition to bustling Wells Street in Old Town. I went to Buzz Bait last night. Loved everything; chips and avocado salsa, bbq glazed salmon taco, Sapporo battered cod taco, and my yummy margarita! The flavors were plentiful and delicious!! The staff was very friendly and the restaurant was warm and inviting. I will definitely come back and try other menu items. Thank you Mark Malnati for bringing southern Cal, my 2nd fav area to my #1 city!!

47.description: Underwhelmed. There is nothing redeeming about this place. We waited 45 minutes for our chips because they were backed up. Then they tell us they were out of two tacos. When our food finally came, it was super greasy. It's one thing if it's an off day but no one seemed terribly concerned about our crappy experience. There are better fish tacos elsewhere! Skip buzz bait!

8.description: Buzz Bait is a great addition to Wells St./Old Town. The service was great each time I've been there; they were efficient and friendly. The prices are a little high ($9-10 for two tacos), but it's worth it because: a) the tacos are both pretty big/full of the main protein; and b) the ingredients all seem very fresh (and they have a stated commitment to using sustainably-caught fish). For tacos, check out the sweet and spicy ahi tuna poke and the bbq glazed salmon. The Santa Monica salmon bowl is also pretty good (and a bit more filling than just ordering two tacos). As far as sides, get the smoked beans. 5 stars--will return and recommend to friends

31.description: Another day, another delicious meal at Buzz Bait.  I went to Buzz Bait again and it was just as delicious as the last visit.  It was a warm November day (60 degrees!) and we managed to snatch an outdoor table (jackpot!)  The bus boy immediately spotted us and came out to clean off our table.  We had the ahi tuna, mahi mahi and avocado tacos.  The avocado tacos weren't for me but the others were just as delicious as I remembered.  The mahi mahi tacos were so delicious I would happily eat them every day and, at those prices, maybe I will.  :-)

34.description: I live in the area and stopped in for dinner last night.  Ordered the cod taco, blackened chicken taco, chips/corn salsa, glass of wine and a margarita.  The food was 4 star good, with the light battered cod and corn salsa being our favorite.  Service and décor were also good.  But the reason for the 3 star rating, at this price point ($42 total) I guessed I am comparing Buzz Bait to Big Star or Mercadito...which include table service and non-plastic utensils.  I will return but probably for a quick lunch as opposed to dinner.

16.description: Buzz Bait is a great addition to the Old Town dining scene where there is already a good assortment of nice sit down joints and sports bars but few fast casual eateries.Went with a group of friends and we tried the salmon, ahi tuna, and shrimp tacos. Each was great but my favorite was the salmon. It had a really nice salty sweet flavor profile from the teriyaki glaze combined with the bourbon bacon crumbles. Each order comes with two fairly large tacos and the fish tasted super fresh. Will definitely be back for more soon.

13.description: Where does one hear about restaurants, and how does one trust those sources? My trip to Buzz Bait was to answer an angle of that question, "how should one react to restaurants they see on the TV in the back of a taxicab at 2am, coming home from one of Chicago's, shall we say, 'bearier' establishments?".Fast-forward to lunch the next...er...same day. I stopped into Buzz Bait, ordered at the counter, and claimed a seat on the patio. A delivery truck outside seemed to be keeping people away, but I enjoyed the fresh air and good view of the edge of Old Town immensely. Less enjoyable was the lack of any napkins outside. Chips and salsa arrived first - the chips were clearly homemade and well-seasoned, and I thought the dish was a good deal for $3. Several minutes later, my two cod tacos arrived. The rest of the taco was good, but I was disappointed by the cod itself. While each taco had generous pieces (to the point where they were difficult to fold and eat), they were thickly-breaded and greasy. I'd reconsider breading the cod altogether, as they significantly detracted from what was an otherwise good taco. Portion size was good for the price, but I will definitely try other proteins if I make a return trip.All things considered, I don't think taking food advice from a taxicab TV at 2am was that bad of a choice.

11.description: Get the salmon tacos they're incredible. Same with the guac and chips, both a must try!

39.description: Casual taco place-- fish tacos are really good and fairly priced. Sometimes finding a place to sit can be a bit of a challenge. There are a lot of great taco places in Chicago, but I can say with confidence that this place has the freshest fish in their tacos. I have never been disappointed!

37.description: Went here for the first time last weekend with my mother and brother, both of whom enjoy fish tacos. I was pleasantly surprised that they had non-fish options and got the chicken tacos and avocado salsa. You have the option to mix and match your tacos and the tacos are stuffed to overflowing, which makes them somewhat troublesome to eat but means you get a good value for your money which I appreciate. My dinner mates enjoyed their tacos even despite the jet lag.Not too many places to sit, but they do to take out.

0.description: I've been looking for an awesome fish taco place in Chicago and finally found it! With how fresh tasting the tacos are, this is as close as I'm going to get to a solid west coast fish taco stand.I tried the mahi mahi, and ahi tuna tacos with a side of the chips and avocado salsa. All were incredibly good. The mahi mahi taco has a lot of different flavors going on that really impressed me. The ahi tuna was really fresh and tasted fantastic.Cannot wait for the summer to come sit on the patio, enjoying the sun and some fish tacos!

38.description: Where does one hear about restaurants, and how does one trust those sources? My trip to Buzz Bait was to answer an angle of that question, "how should one react to restaurants they see on the TV in the back of a taxicab at 2am, coming home from one of Chicago's, shall we say, 'bearier' establishments?".Fast-forward to lunch the next...er...same day. I stopped into Buzz Bait, ordered at the counter, and claimed a seat on the patio. A delivery truck outside seemed to be keeping people away, but I enjoyed the fresh air and good view of the edge of Old Town immensely. Less enjoyable was the lack of any napkins outside. Chips and salsa arrived first - the chips were clearly homemade and well-seasoned, and I thought the dish was a good deal for $3. Several minutes later, my two cod tacos arrived. The rest of the taco was good, but I was disappointed by the cod itself. While each taco had generous pieces (to the point where they were difficult to fold and eat), they were thickly-breaded and greasy. I'd reconsider breading the cod altogether, as they significantly detracted from what was an otherwise good taco. Portion size was good for the price, but I will definitely try other proteins if I make a return trip.All things considered, I don't think taking food advice from a taxicab TV at 2am was that bad of a choice.

51.description: Split the Chicken and Ahi tuna tacos. I really liked the tuna. Overall, great food, excellent service and fun atmosphere. Perfect fit for the Old Town neighborhood!

27.description: The tacos were very large, overflowing with filling, which was definitely not expected--they were a great value as priced. The ability to mix and match tacos was also nice. Unfortunately the chips and salsa size did not have the same amount to coat ratio, as there were not many chips, though delicious, and even less of the salsa. I also ordered the jefe milkshake which didn't have much tequila, mostly salted caramel gelato, which was good but not as strong of a tequila flavor as I would have liked.

32.description: Good quick-service taco shop near the second city theatre. We were looking for someplace to eat quick before a show, and stumbled across Buzz Bait. While they appeared to be short handed the night that we visited, we were still mostly impressed. Both the battered fish and the ahi tuna poke tacos were great. The selection of craft beer was also not bad. They have clean seating areas and restrooms, and even some outdoor seating. All they really need is a little quicker service (ie more people working on busy evenings) and this place will be MONEY!

54.description: Super cute Mexican joint in the Old Town area. I love the super simple menu. We got the salmon salad and the ahi tuna coconut rice bowl -- both were delicious. The salads definitely could use more greens and larger portions. I understand that this is a fairly new restaurant, but the staff should nonetheless be familiar with their software ordering system and the menu choices. The girl taking our order literally too foreverrrr to get our orders in right, after us repeating it 5 times over. Practice makes perfect, so hopefully they have that operations bump smoothed out soon. Other than slow service, the price and food are awesome here. The recipes and pairings of different ingredients is really unique and clever. It has a great ambience of trendy causal. I'm a fan of the high ceilings, large open front windows, and spacious feel. The presentation of the dishes is beautiful too. Definitely check this place out if you're looking for a quick and yummy meal. It's becoming a local's favorite hot spot for sure!

48.description: This place gave me taco amnesia! I loved Velvet when they opened up, yelp.com/biz/velvet-taco… but Buzz Bait made me forget that name after a visit last night. Half way through my first taco I was all "Mmmmm this place is way better than uuhhh Flash Taco errr Flannel Taco errr whatever the f*** that place in the Viagra Triangle is called." Verbatim what I said. They don't have the variety of other spots. Almost everything on the menu swims except for the chicken, but if you're solid on seafood their food is better, cheaper, and you get more of it. Along with a bomb-ass blueberry margarita and it's a fantastic fast-casual at a fair price. It should also be noted that the seating is slim to none, but that definitely doesn't factor into this overall experience. Their sign DOES read "Taqueria" which for those who don't speak restaurant common sense translates to "take your complaints about the lack of tables and shove 'em where the sun don't shine."Overall I loved this place and think Mark Malnati needs to send Trevor Noah one of those poke tacos. New host...new Malnati concept...you see what I'm getting at. Make it happen!

44.description: I was so excited to try this place when it opened! I love all the different taco joints in Chicago and to have this one on my doorstep would've been such a great regular option.I've now been to Buzz Bait a couple of times. Both times I left wishing I'd gone elsewhere. The first try was during their opening week - it was very busy and I was pleased to see them off to a good start! I ordered the tuna, the salmon and the battered cod tacos. The battered cod were ok but a little greasy. The tuna was tasteless and chewy, the salmon was far too sweet, almost sickly. I gave it a pass simply because it seems unfair to judge a place so soon after it opened. And this restaurant is the brainchild of Chicago (pizza) restaurant veteran Lou Malnati, so I was expecting better - possibly the culmination of Mr Malnati's decades of success, both front and back of house. Sadly the second time I visited Buzz Bait, several weeks later, it was even worse. The tacos hasn't improved (I couldn't even bring myself to finish them), and the service had taken a nose dive. We had to clean our own table, the staff behind the counter were rushing/panicking and for a fast-serve restaurant our order took over 15 minutes to come up. During that time we noticed that the layout of the small restaurant was making things worse. Customers didn't know where to stand, too much of the small restaurant is taken up by three large booths (usually only sitting a couple of slow eaters), leaving the other 15-20 customers to fight over a handful of bar stools.Sorry - but if I'm going to eat standing up in a taco joint, it had better be worth it. So I'm heading back to any one of many fine and authentically cool taco joints this town has to offer, and I'll pretend this never happened.Lou Malnati should stick to happily making huge pizza for tourists and leave the taquerias to the taco-hipsters like Antique or Velvet Taco.

24.description: Ordered a mahi mahi rice bowl with the yogurt sauce and it was SO GOOD!! I'll definitely be back again and again to order this delicious dish amongst other things. Great addition to Wells St.

7.description: So I totally want another one of these taco's right now. On my first visit I went with the Sweet & Spicy Ahi Tuna Poke. I was curious the size of the taco's since it's 2/$10. I've grown accustom to high price taco's now, but they better taste good and these did!! Totally gourmet style taco's from the taste to the way it was served. The portion on of the tuna was good and the flavor was awesome. I actually was full off the taco's but I had to try the dessert. I got the Chocolate Cherry Tamale. It's basically a warm cake/brownie with vanilla bean gelato on top. It was soooo good! I would say should be more like $4 versus $5 for the portion size, but at least it was good! I plan to go back to try more items on the limited menu.

49.description: When the word gets out, this place will be packed. Not your typical taco joint. Great food, versatile options, location, atmosphere, music, and margaritas. Who wouldn't want a blueberry mint margarita with ahi tuna rice bowl. Great for on the go too!

40.description: Amazing tacos !!!! OMG !!! I will definitely come back !!!! Ahi tuna tacos were insane !!!

53.description: It only took a single look at the menu to coax my boyfriend to join me in this adventure. I'm not a huge proponent of love at first site, but this menu definitely had me feeling some type of way (watch out boyfriend).Avocado heaven! I had the avocado taco which did not skimp on the avocado! Do I really have to take out one of these slightly fried and lightly coated in breadcrumbs, delicious avocados to make space for myself to fold the taco? Yes, and how glorious it was to try that succulent single and lonely avocado all on its own. I think I'm salivating as I type. If this taco's name was Nemo, you might as well call me Marlin, because two lost souls looking for one other were just reunited. Drinking my blueberry mint margarita, I think I heard the Beatles playing for the first time.Yes, I DO have a second taco. It's an equally satisfying looking temptress that I am trying to patiently save for lunch or dinner tomorrow. I'm sure it will be the best part of my day.

30.description: So I totally want another one of these taco's right now. On my first visit I went with the Sweet & Spicy Ahi Tuna Poke. I was curious the size of the taco's since it's 2/$10. I've grown accustom to high price taco's now, but they better taste good and these did!! Totally gourmet style taco's from the taste to the way it was served. The portion on of the tuna was good and the flavor was awesome. I actually was full off the taco's but I had to try the dessert. I got the Chocolate Cherry Tamale. It's basically a warm cake/brownie with vanilla bean gelato on top. It was soooo good! I would say should be more like $4 versus $5 for the portion size, but at least it was good! I plan to go back to try more items on the limited menu.

46.description: We started with the guacamole salsa and the blueberry mint margaritas - all very tasty. Chips tasted homemade.  I ordered the tuna poke tacos and they were very, very tasty. My friend ordered the salmon tacos and liked them as well. Great new spot in Old Town!

1.description: A friend and I stumped upon Buzz Bait when looking for a place to eat dinner after a Second City show. After realizing our original dinner choice was a 15 minute walk on a 10 degree night, Buzz Bait came to the rescue. Such a great surprise!My friends know I am a huge fan of tacos and Buzz Bait delivered. I love the idea of a strictly seafood taqueria. Fish tacos are some of my favorites. We asked for some reccos and the lady behind the counter recommended the mahi and ahi tuna. I ordered both with a blueberry maragarita. Can you ever get tacos without tequila?! My friend ordered the mahi and crispy shrimp with a mango margarita. Two tacos was definitely enough. They are fully stuffed with fish and toppings. I loved the mani and ahi tuna. My friend particularly loved the crispy shrimp. I'm looking forward to trying the bbq salmon on my next visit. The margaritas were great as well, I completely recommend the blueberry or mango if you're feeling like trying something different than the classic.The restaurant is small with a few booths and table, very casual. You order from the counter and then they bring your items out to your table. If you're in Old Town and looking for a quick bite, Buzz Bait is the way to go!

55.description: All throughout our meal, my friend and I mentioned several times to each other (and once to the owner) that we were both going to write 5-star Yelp reviews as soon as we got home. The food is THAT good (highly recommend the salmon and tuna poke tacos).However, this is NOT a place to come if you want to catch-up and have a conversation with your dining companions. While we ate quickly, we felt very rushed throughout the meal, and the manager even cleared my margarita when there was still a quarter left in the glass.The food is outstanding, but next time I'll try takeout so I don't feel as though I'm eating on a shot clock!

9.description: I've walked by this place and normally it's closed because they have such a late opening, which makes no sense to me why they aren't open for lunch? Anyhow, I ordered the Cod and and the Avocado Tacos. I wasn't paying attention and didn't realize I ordered a vegetarian dish, the guy who was working noticed I look confused and offered to replace the mistake I made (super sweet of him) I normally have no problem returning something if I didn't like it, but damn, that Avocado Taco was delish! After I scarfed the first taco down I was pretty stuffed, only took small bite out of the Cod. It was good, but I liked the vegetarian one better! In addition to my 2 tacos, I ordered the Avocado Salsa. Wasn't a huge fan, the dish was mostly whole petite tomatoes, I told the guy working, and he replaced it with more guacamole. My bill was $14, in which I find to be fairly expensive for 2 tacos and salsa, but the food was good. I would definitely return just for the Tacos and next time try a Margarita. It's a cute lil restaurant with a nice patio. And kudos on customer service. Need to give a heads up to the management of this place, on a Friday late afternoon, you should staff more than one person to be making tacos, or have the girl taking orders help with the food! Not happy! Waited over 10 minutes for 2 tacos and they still weren't being made! Had to get a refund bc it took too long!!

26.description: It's fresh and different! First, love the decor! The food is great, perfect portion sizes, great drinks! The Tuna Poke Taco is delish and so is the coconut rice! I've taken several groups of friends here and everyone enjoys it!

25.description: Something new to try on Wells street, great! Wells now has it's own fish / taqueria, similar places have popped up all over Chicago. We were a bit confused on how to order. We figured it out, enter, walk to the register, order and take your number. They will bring it out. Also, not clearly specified on the menu is that you get two tacos per order, but you can also mix and match. So go for it! Seating is limited. You might need to get cozy with others at the bar or just carry out. We ordered four tacos between the two of us, it was enough to satisfy. The tacos are full, which is great but also makes for some messy fingers so grab some paper towel and a fork to get the leftovers. We went with the Battered Alaskan Cod, Blackened Mahi Mahi and Tuna Poke. I wanted the Salmon but it was not ready or sold out.. Of our choices, we had favorites but there was not a bad one in the bunch.  In order of liking: Tune Poke, Cod, Mahi Mahi. Gotta go back and try the Salmon!We also tried to order the Elotes, but it is out of season. So we went with the Cheese Quesadilla. Absolutely nothing special about it. Maybe order it for a really picky  kid or something. It is a half tortilla with bland cheese. Also for a side we had the Salsa and Chips. Way better value for your $3 and yummy, both the chips with the oil and seasoning and the salsa. We will be back to try some other options, for a quick low-key dinner.

12.description: This place gave me taco amnesia! I loved Velvet when they opened up, yelp.com/biz/velvet-taco… but Buzz Bait made me forget that name after a visit last night. Half way through my first taco I was all "Mmmmm this place is way better than uuhhh Flash Taco errr Flannel Taco errr whatever the f*** that place in the Viagra Triangle is called." Verbatim what I said. They don't have the variety of other spots. Almost everything on the menu swims except for the chicken, but if you're solid on seafood their food is better, cheaper, and you get more of it. Along with a bomb-ass blueberry margarita and it's a fantastic fast-casual at a fair price. It should also be noted that the seating is slim to none, but that definitely doesn't factor into this overall experience. Their sign DOES read "Taqueria" which for those who don't speak restaurant common sense translates to "take your complaints about the lack of tables and shove 'em where the sun don't shine."Overall I loved this place and think Mark Malnati needs to send Trevor Noah one of those poke tacos. New host...new Malnati concept...you see what I'm getting at. Make it happen!

59.description: Buzz Bait is a great addition to the Old Town neighborhood. It offers a variety of flavorful tacos and the blueberry margarita is unique and delicious! We had the blackened mahi mahi and the blackened chicken both of which I suggest getting.  We also had the corn salsa and chips and their chips - all I can say is YUM! They were delicious! The service was quick and attentive. It's more of a fast casual restaurant, has a chipotle feel to it almost. I definitely suggest this to anyone in the area looking for a good taco and a quick meal! The only reason why I did not give it 5 stars is because I did not leave thinking this is one of the best things I have ever had and would I crave it over and over again maybe, maybe not. Overall, great restaurant for friends! Highly suggest it!

21.description: Wow! A gem. Why didn't I discover this place sooner? We tried the crispy shrimp and spicy ahi tuna tacos. Exceptional! Try the blueberry mint margarita. Loved it!

17.description: Buzz Bait Taqueria can Buzz off! Sorry guys, subpar tacos that try hard to deliver but it's just not there. The shrimp in the taco was cold. The mahi taco had some flavor but the flour tortilla overpowers the little bit of meat. The mayo based sauce was decent and so was the cabbage. The winner was the Seafood Chowdah. Overall, I wouldn't come back here again.

10.description: Something new to try on Wells street, great! Wells now has it's own fish / taqueria, similar places have popped up all over Chicago. We were a bit confused on how to order. We figured it out, enter, walk to the register, order and take your number. They will bring it out. Also, not clearly specified on the menu is that you get two tacos per order, but you can also mix and match. So go for it! Seating is limited. You might need to get cozy with others at the bar or just carry out. We ordered four tacos between the two of us, it was enough to satisfy. The tacos are full, which is great but also makes for some messy fingers so grab some paper towel and a fork to get the leftovers. We went with the Battered Alaskan Cod, Blackened Mahi Mahi and Tuna Poke. I wanted the Salmon but it was not ready or sold out.. Of our choices, we had favorites but there was not a bad one in the bunch.  In order of liking: Tune Poke, Cod, Mahi Mahi. Gotta go back and try the Salmon!We also tried to order the Elotes, but it is out of season. So we went with the Cheese Quesadilla. Absolutely nothing special about it. Maybe order it for a really picky  kid or something. It is a half tortilla with bland cheese. Also for a side we had the Salsa and Chips. Way better value for your $3 and yummy, both the chips with the oil and seasoning and the salsa. We will be back to try some other options, for a quick low-key dinner.

5.description: Super cute Mexican joint in the Old Town area. I love the super simple menu. We got the salmon salad and the ahi tuna coconut rice bowl -- both were delicious. The salads definitely could use more greens and larger portions. I understand that this is a fairly new restaurant, but the staff should nonetheless be familiar with their software ordering system and the menu choices. The girl taking our order literally too foreverrrr to get our orders in right, after us repeating it 5 times over. Practice makes perfect, so hopefully they have that operations bump smoothed out soon. Other than slow service, the price and food are awesome here. The recipes and pairings of different ingredients is really unique and clever. It has a great ambience of trendy causal. I'm a fan of the high ceilings, large open front windows, and spacious feel. The presentation of the dishes is beautiful too. Definitely check this place out if you're looking for a quick and yummy meal. It's becoming a local's favorite hot spot for sure!

3.description: The reason my friend and I came here was to test the ahi tuna taco. We were walking lazily through the city and went to get a refreshing ahi tuna taco at Velvet taco with a lettuce wrap. Once we were done, we walked further and I remembered Buzz Bait. So we decided to try their ahi tuna taco too. The taco did not come with a lettuce wrap at Buzz Bait unfortunately. the flavor profile was initially overpowering with the teriyaki. it's a filling taco and needs the flour tortilla to carry all the toppings. It was still enjoyable in a different way. It is a great casual addition to old town with seafood options. I still stand by Velvet taco for a refreshing ahi tuna bite.

35.description: Really happy to see this place open for lunch on weekends now.  We (me, my wife and daughter) stopped as we were headed to a different restaurant since we noticed it was open now for lunch.  It sounded so promising from the menu and right up our alley for type of foods we like.  I tried the bbq salmon taco, and avocado taco.  Both are fantastic.  Each order comes with two tacos and you can mix your selection.  Nice way to try different tacos.   We also tried the avocado salsa and we all couldn't get enough.  The chips are fantastic.  Had to go back and get a second order of it ($3).  My wife and daughter also tried different types of fish with their taco choices and we all really liked our choices.  Decent quantity of food, maybe a tad bit pricey, but not too bad.  Music was too loud for sitting inside, so it was a bit hard to hear each other talk, but the food was great.  We'll be back for sure.Second visit... Food just as good as the first... excellent service.  Had the Cod taco and Salmon, wife had the Ahi tuna, daughter had a rice bowl with Salmon.  We all shared and everything was wonderful.  We noticed the music wasn't as loud this time too :)  Did they read my review and respond, not sure, but it was great and we'll be back often.

19.description: Tried this place with two buddies and we all agreed it was great and we'd come back. It's a step above fast casual as you order in the front but are served at your table. The tacos are pretty large, and everything tastes very fresh. The tuna was phenomenal, as was the cod. We ordered a couple sides of chips which were pretty greasy but awesome nonetheless.The only knock on the place is that you can't order individual tacos -- all orders come in pairs. I would still definitely recommend Buzz Bait to all the fish and taco lovers out there.

28.description: I have told many of my friends about this relatively new fast-casual spot since trying it myself. They were sold out of the BBQ glazed salmon that I had read about so I opted for the sweet and spicy ahi tuna poke tacos. I'm glad I did as they were the freshest and tastiest fish tacos that I've ever had in Chicago.There were two tacos in an order (allowed to mix-and-match!) which left me quite satisfied which is hard to generally say given my appetite. As a side, I ordered the avocado salsa and chips; the chips had a great zesty seasoning to them. Beer selection was in a custom cooler shaped like a deflated fishing bobber; not a huge variety but some good crafts including rotating Ballast Point selection. The cocktails looked unique and good as well.

45.description: Meh is all I can say. The tacos aren't great. Forget the vegetarian one- two tiny slices of avocado and a pound of aggressively bland cabbage. I'll pass, especially for how much it costs. The most irritating part was trying to get two orders of tacos to go. We stood around waiting 25 minutes and then finally asked about our order. There was serious scrambling, someone yelled at someone else, and it was clear they'd skipped/lost our order. They bagged it and handed it to us and said nothing. Just, "here you go." Also, try to keep the back kitchen stuff out of the front. We don't need to hear the manager complaining about the staff or about how stressed everyone is.

33.description: Coming from California, it's hard to find good tacos. Buzz Bait's burrito bowls were quite good, the slaw was the real show stopper. The meat was a little dry, but generally speaking, it was a good eat!

43.description: It's one of those places where you walk in and look up at the menu while the person behind the cash register stands there and stares at you. We ordered the shrimp and salmon tacos and shared between the two of us. For drinks, ordered a margarita and a beer. The tacos were very delicious and really filling, I wouldn't have wanted more than two. In the end, spent $50 on 2 tacos & a drink, for each of us. Seems a bit pricey for some tacos. They could just make them a little smaller, charge less, and I'd eat one of each!Especially because of the informal ordering process, it doesn't seem like a typical nice night time restaurant in this neighborhood. I think they should consider a lunch time operation.

2.description: While a bit overpriced for fish tacos, this place is a definite spot to try.Atmosphere: Relaxed while still maintaining a trendy vibe, this is a perfect combo for anyone that loves a good beach taco shack without the sunburn and screaming children. I love the bar stool counter tops where you can watch them preparing the food - it makes for a more intimate setting.Food:Crispy shrimp tacos. I don't even like shrimp and I would probably order this one ten thousand times again. Really flavorful, fresh and filling. Two of these is enough to fuel your night as you lower your standards at the bars nearby.  The avo tacos are also a great option if you're vegetarian! Side note: don't be a fool and just order the blueberry mint margarita. If you don't you will regret your evening.Would absolutely go back, and am slightly petrified of what damage I could do to my wallet if I came here with a buzz on. They knew exactly what they were doing when they named this place.

18.description: Wow. This place is incredible. Starting from the moment you enter the music and decor is calm yet energizing. We ordered the chowder, ahi poke taco and shrimp taco. I LOVED the shrimp and my boyfriend LOVED the ahi. The restaurant and bathrooms are clean. The manager took out order, made our margaritas (get the mango!), and came by asking us if we needed anything. If you are looking for a light flavorful meal this is your spot. I want to come back when it's warmer and sit outside. Five big stars!

41.description: The tacos are mediocre. The combinations don't work together very well and there could be more flavor. Not sure if the quality is very good.

52.description: Note to Meghan R. of Buzz Bait Taqueria ,I came to YELP to see the comments you're getting.  We live close by and want to stop in for dinner. But what I noticed most in the YELP reviews you only reply to very POSITIVE reviews in the most gushing terms possible but ignore the NEGATIVE reviews.  Your approach makes me question whether whether you care 2 cents about pleasing your customers.  Very odd indeed.

50.description: I am a fish taco fan and seek them out whenever I am at restaurants and/or traveling. Was at Buzz Bait this past Saturday night. Food was great. Menu was simple, reasonably priced and executed pretty darn well. The tuna taco was my favorite so far. For those of you that don't actually go fishing... those things on the wall are actually buzz baits. Talked with Mr. Malnati for a bit as well, thanked him for both the years of pizza tradition and the tacos. I will absolutely be back to try the rest of the menu. Thanks for opening this spot up.

4.description: Here is the deal. I was blown away. Amazing fish tacos. Hands down one of the best in the area. Very affordable prices. I also recommend the avacado dip with chips. It's really good guacamole. To top it all of the let's talk about the service. Fast friendly and very informative on the menu chocies. The General manager Alex, came out and talked to us as well. Let's us know the background of the restaurant. We will be back soon and will tell many friends. It's really hard to find a fish taco place in the city that is this good. Thank you.

6.description: Had the ahi tuna poke taco and the glazed salmon taco. The tuna had way more sauces than it needed. Simplify and it will be better. Glazed salmon was just about right. You can mix and match your tacos - good option. Strip back the ahi taco and I'll give it 4 stars!

22.description: The reason my friend and I came here was to test the ahi tuna taco. We were walking lazily through the city and went to get a refreshing ahi tuna taco at Velvet taco with a lettuce wrap. Once we were done, we walked further and I remembered Buzz Bait. So we decided to try their ahi tuna taco too. The taco did not come with a lettuce wrap at Buzz Bait unfortunately. the flavor profile was initially overpowering with the teriyaki. it's a filling taco and needs the flour tortilla to carry all the toppings. It was still enjoyable in a different way. It is a great casual addition to old town with seafood options. I still stand by Velvet taco for a refreshing ahi tuna bite.

15.description: So, I was really looking forward to trying this place as it was started by the Malnati family and the owners of Kamehachi. I came in on tonight with my friend for dinner and I was a little disappointed. We noticed they had Elote as a side and we were so excited. But, of course they were out of it. My friend is a vegetarian, so she ordered the Avocado tacos and chips with Avocado Salsa for us to share. I had a hard time ordering because I'm trying to watch my carb intake. The cashier seemed confused when I asked if I could substitute something for the rice in one of the fish "bowls." This was not allowed apparently. So, I ordered the Mahi Mahi bowl and the Blueberry Margarita. The Marg and the fish bowl were excellent, although there wasn't much fish to be seen. Also, the bowl costs $11 and is probably half the size of a Chipotle burrito bowl. I was really disappointed that I couldn't substitute the rice in the fish bowl. Having been a customer of Lou Malnati's for years, I know they offer all kinds of substitutions and gluten free options. When I asked the cashier at Buzz Bait, what they do for people who are gluten free, she said "I don't know, I guess they don't come here." What the hell? I will probably not be back here any time soon. I prefer Velvet Taco as a better value for the money, anyways.

57.description: Went on a busy Friday night, the cod tacos were the best of what we tried (also had the salmon, avocado and chicken). It's a fast casual kind of vibe. With all of the great taco options in the city I can't say I would go back anytime soon.

20.description: Came here at noon on  a Sunday and we were the only ones. I had been wanting to try this place since it opened and saw the menu looked great! It's a pretty cute and cool establishment. I would say a beachy feel until you hear the random country music...lol The gentleman that took our order was very nice and helpful so it was great service. We got the ahi tuna, the cod, the shrimp and the avocado tacos. Let's just say this place has a lot of potential. The tortilla to these tacos really killed any of the filling. They are too thick and doughy for tortillas. It overpowers the filling in all of them. They were all good exempt the avocado. I would not recommend fried avocado at all. Overall they've got great potential just change the tortilla to corn or even much smaller ones without so much dough in them. 2 tacos dor $10 seems a bit steep too  (Perhaps...Check out oscars tacos in San Diego for references  ;)

36.description: The food is good --- fresh and well made.  I think that the order size should be three tacos instead of two.  For most guys, two won't be enough, and since you can't order a-la carte, that sort of leaves you stuck in the middle between not enough and too much food.  The shrimp taco was really, really good, and the guacamole was delicious.  I hope they do well and are able to stick around.  It's a good addition to Old Town.

14.description: Came here at noon on  a Sunday and we were the only ones. I had been wanting to try this place since it opened and saw the menu looked great! It's a pretty cute and cool establishment. I would say a beachy feel until you hear the random country music...lol The gentleman that took our order was very nice and helpful so it was great service. We got the ahi tuna, the cod, the shrimp and the avocado tacos. Let's just say this place has a lot of potential. The tortilla to these tacos really killed any of the filling. They are too thick and doughy for tortillas. It overpowers the filling in all of them. They were all good exempt the avocado. I would not recommend fried avocado at all. Overall they've got great potential just change the tortilla to corn or even much smaller ones without so much dough in them. 2 tacos dor $10 seems a bit steep too  (Perhaps...Check out oscars tacos in San Diego for references  ;)

29.description: These guys and girls are great!  Up Down has been a staple in Old Town and smoking tradition for years.  There is always a friendly face there to greet you and chat with while enjoying a "stick" from their vast cigar caves.I am still holing out hope that they make this a 5-Star place by investing in a smoking lounge that can hold more than the front of the store.  Keep your fingers crossed!Main Line: If you are in Old Town, you need to stop, even if its only to look around

42.description: You'd think being an early twenties woman walking into a swanky little cigar shop on Wells in Old Town would be an uncomfortable experience.  But see, you'd be thinking wrong.For the last few years, I've come to Old Town to look for all my boyfriend's cigar fixes and in the interm, have learned a lot about cigars, the accoutrements, and even found myself dabbling in swanky cigarettes and cigarillos.With its small and open floorplan, with cigars in see-through cases that line the walls, its like walking into a library of cigars, which would be wholy approporiate since the selection is encyclopedic.  The staff are SO courteous, helpful,  engaging and knowledgeable.  Think of them as librarians who don't shush you for talking.Tell one of those cigar librarians you need help, and they follow you around and make recommendation based on some random questions they ask.  There will be some hits or misses (as they're not mind readers) but they always make you feel like Ms. Moneybags, even if you're not spending the big bucks.

23.description: I've been smoking cigars for about two years now, and I really began my cigar education at UpDown. Walking in made me feel like a little kid walking into the Lego Store many years ago. Aside from a great atmosphere and a varied selection, the only iffy thing about UpDown is the lack of seating and the inconsistent staff service. I've walked in and someone has helped me right away, but I've spent 15 minutes waiting for a worker to help me out and open up a case. If you're there with a friend, it can be an interesting time delving into the world of cigars, but it can be disappointing if you purchase some cigars to have right there and then and you're forced to stand up and have your cigar. I don't need a La-Z-Boy chair, but space is definitely a concern at UpDown. Aside from technical aspects, the cigars there are kept in good condition, and you can get a great cigar at a reasonable price. Go for anything in the full-flavor corner (the corner with the Tatuaje, Padron, Alec Bradley, and O.S.O.K. cigars). The O.S.O.K. room 101 is a personal favorite. The buzz puts you on your ass, but you barely notice because of the comfortable draw and the consistency of spice and strength. Stop by and see what UpDown has for you.

47.description: They have real quality cigars here and it's worth the price you eyes see when they pop out. I don't smoke but for anyone who loves cigars you should try this place out..

8.description: Came here with a friend who is a regular customer. Up Down is an awesome place with an endless selection. The cigars selection is top notch and the employees know their cigars. The back patio is a nice touch if you want to smoke on a nice day. It's a friendly place and I'll be returning when I'm in the area.

31.description: I never got into smoking in my life nor will I ever try that. But if I had visited this place ten years ago, things could be completely different now. For cigar or tobacco lovers this place must be wonderland. Extensive cigar selection and they can make stuff for you as you wish. Their pipes are works of art. I didn't see anyone tacky at all. They also have lighters and smoking accessories that are worth seeing. I got a lighter for an important person in my life and they offered gift wrapping for free. Really courteous staff. Recommend!!

34.description: Where else in Chitown can you rub elbows with former NBA players (Dennis Rodman was here recently), actors (John Cusack is said to frequent this place), and down-to-earth locals in search of a nice tobacco buzz.  My random trip to this place was one of the highlights from my weekend trip back to the ol' hometown.   Prices were decent, fun atmosphere, nice helpful service.  5 stars.

16.description: Upscale tobacco shop with a very knowledgeable staff.  Definitely not to be confused with other smoke shops that cater primarily to hippies.  You won't find vaporizers or cigarettes, however, you will find quality cigars and accessories.  They have a great selection of loose tobacco.  Impressed with extensive inventory of Porsche products.  They have both, classical and modern, smoking accessories.  Definitely worthy of a stop if you are a tobacco connoisseur.

13.description: Been going to this place for nearly a year, as it's about the only place I'm aware of on the North Side where you can actually smoke a cigar inside. Great selection of products and in the last few months they've done the wise thing and added a flat screen making it a great place to relax and watch a ballgame. The clientele are mainly professional people from several walks of life. Chicago police regularly stop in to buy cigars and the conversation is frequently free flowing and enjoyable. Sports, politics, etc. I've even had my picture taken with Jimmy Jackson (ex-NBAer) and Al Sharpton (of Tawana Brawley fame). Phil the owner is a solid guy and a big Blackhawks fan who remembers his customers' names and makes you feel welcome. My only gripes here - and I noticed this has been mentioned by other reviewers, so I'm apparently not crazy - is that there is an "inner circle" feel re: the people who work there. They treat the regulars - and each other - with a high degree of familiarity and friendliness, but for those who were only semi-regulars (like me), there's a decidedly cooler feel. There are often 2-3 of them on duty clustered behind the counter, smoking, chatting and laughing among themselves. I don't mean to over play this, and I never had a hint of an issue with any of them. But they could use some training I believe on making everyone feel welcome. The other gripe is that they shouldn't let people smoke cigarettes inside. One of the employees regularly smokes cigarettes, and occasionally a customer will as well. Cigarette smoke is infinitely more irritating to eyes, nose and palate, unlike cigar smoke which is fine, especially in a cigar shop. I wish they'd put an end to this.

11.description: I was pretty underwhelmed by this place. Its good selection and convenient hours are definite pluses. But, the rest was a poor experience.I walked in on a Friday night and there were several groups of people standing around having conversations. As none of them were behind the counter, I couldn't figure out who worked there. I started looking around and found what I was after fairly quickly. So, I just stood there and tried making eye contact with anyone, to no avail. Finally a different customer broke off to buy something and I was able to pin down a guy to get my smokes. Come on guys. If you have all of your stuff behind locked glass and a customer is just standing there with his arms crossed looking hopeful, at least take a cue and help him out.I purchased three smokes and asked if they sell any bottled water. Nope. Literally every single person in the store had an "Up Down Cigar Shop" coffee mug in front of them, so I was hoping maybe I'd be directed to wherever these are obtained. Nope. So, I just sat down at the counter and lit up one of my cigars. I started to get a sense of who was an employee since a few of the guys would periodically walk behind the counter, but none of them even made eye contact with me. I tried striking up a conversation with one guy by mentioning I was from Phoenix and that his shop had been recommended to me, but that elicited an "Oh." before he went back to his more important customers.It's unfortunate that it really is possible to sustain a cigar shop on a small circle of regulars who buy lots of cigars, because owners get complacent about reaching out and being friendly to new customers. Too bad, guys. You lost out on my repeat business while I was in town, and back in Phoenix I'll definitely be telling people NOT to go to your shop when they travel to Chicago.

39.description: I'm no cigar aficionado but I do enjoy a cigar now and then...Up Down is great, the people are friendly and no matter your cigar skill level they are happy to help you...after a few visits they helped me find my new smoke of choice...Romeo Y Julieta Numero Dos ...

37.description: Prices are a bit inflated but the smokes are superb, so no big deal.

0.description: A wonderful experience shopping for the perfect gift!  Very patient and helpful.......... A definite add for any aficionado

38.description: I feel like they are very knowledgeable and have a vast understanding of things that smoke. I really thought the (who I pressume is the owner) man with the beard was a very nice touch to this establishment. I thought that the prices were high, but they are in Old Town, so I can understand charging that much. I don't know if paying $30 bucks for a lighter was worth it, but it was a gift so we'll see. If I had an option to give it a three and a half I would, but I chose to give it a three. I'm not a huge cigar smoker, but if i was I would give it a 4 star rating. I highly suggest checking this place out even if you don't smoke.

27.description: Love it, have for years. Great selection, knowledgable staff. Their prices are reasonable at the store or on their website. Up Down certainly should be in your circuit of cigar shops. By the way, one of the coolest spaces. You can even enjoy one while your there!

32.description: As there seems to be to entries on Yelp for this shop I'm posting this under both.  I've been smoking cigars for the better part of two decades now over three continents and 30 countries.  Smoking their products and smoking their products on their soils.  So of course now that I'm living in Chicago again I'm out to find a nice shop I can go sit at, read, and smoke a VSG (one of my favorites).I took a friend of mine here from out of town as my first visit.  I'm not sure what the picture on this website is of the big pipe above the store because I never saw it.  However, well done on the picture of Betsy from Mad Men; she could make smoking a turd look sexy!They certainly have a superior selection.  My buddy found a few sticks he's been searching high and low for.  Their lay out and décor is classy too.  This is Chicago though so you're going to pay Chicago prices.  Buying single sticks online would be cheaper, and that is even before Chicago taxes.  Binnys is a great humidor with good prices if you're just looking to pick up some sticks quick.My only other dig is the seating.  I appreciate a shop I can smoke in, especially since Illinois and Chicago decided to override civil liberty but the seating here is almost nil.  There was room for about 4 people, max, to sit at non-backed bar stools at the counter.  Not a place you can really sit back and read with a smoke.All in all I can't say I'll be back.  Or at least I won't specifically head out that way, I'm not mad at them or anything.  It's a classy shop and the staff was perfectly friendly but the prices aren't worth it if I can't hang out in a comfortable chair with a smoke.  They also had a great selection of pipes and paraphernalia, but again, the prices were higher than other places readily available.Prost, Cheers, Salud, Bon Appetit, and all those great wishes!

48.description: They do have a great selection of cigars, fine cigarettes and smoking accessories.  However, the prices are insane and not just because of the city tax.  I paid more than $3 more for a pack of cigarettes (Nat Sherman Hint of Mint) than I do at Blue Havana.  Granted I needed some as I was stumbling to another bar so they had me at convenience.

44.description: Stopped in here after the Yelp event.  Was looking for a new Zippo.  They not only have every Zippo known to man, but any other kind of lighter, cigar cutter, cigarette case and anything else imaginable.  The hand carved ivory pipes they had displayed looked like they belong in a museum.  They also have the biggest selection of cigars I have ever seen in one store.  The staff here was very nice, and all dressed in Santa suit jackets.  I also noted the fact that they have a cigarette here named Black Death Filters.  You gotta love that one.  I did not make a purchase, due to the fact the prices are astronomically high.

24.description: I was pretty underwhelmed by this place. Its good selection and convenient hours are definite pluses. But, the rest was a poor experience.I walked in on a Friday night and there were several groups of people standing around having conversations. As none of them were behind the counter, I couldn't figure out who worked there. I started looking around and found what I was after fairly quickly. So, I just stood there and tried making eye contact with anyone, to no avail. Finally a different customer broke off to buy something and I was able to pin down a guy to get my smokes. Come on guys. If you have all of your stuff behind locked glass and a customer is just standing there with his arms crossed looking hopeful, at least take a cue and help him out.I purchased three smokes and asked if they sell any bottled water. Nope. Literally every single person in the store had an "Up Down Cigar Shop" coffee mug in front of them, so I was hoping maybe I'd be directed to wherever these are obtained. Nope. So, I just sat down at the counter and lit up one of my cigars. I started to get a sense of who was an employee since a few of the guys would periodically walk behind the counter, but none of them even made eye contact with me. I tried striking up a conversation with one guy by mentioning I was from Phoenix and that his shop had been recommended to me, but that elicited an "Oh." before he went back to his more important customers.It's unfortunate that it really is possible to sustain a cigar shop on a small circle of regulars who buy lots of cigars, because owners get complacent about reaching out and being friendly to new customers. Too bad, guys. You lost out on my repeat business while I was in town, and back in Phoenix I'll definitely be telling people NOT to go to your shop when they travel to Chicago.

7.description: This is a really cool store. The guys who work here are friendly and knowledgable and they keep a record of what cigars you like. I buy pipes for my dad from here for every holiday and he always loves them.

49.description: they gave away free cigars during an old town festival!  the staff here is super nice and will let you browse around without harrasing you but is eager to help and offer suggestions if you need them!

40.description: I have visited the Up Down Cigar shop three or four times, and every visit has a different vibe. The employee's are quite helpful and the selection is good. There are always top notch cigars on sale at a decent price. I highly recommend the humidor on the side where they have their cut rate cigars. I have found some brand name cigars at a good price in there. It has something for everyone. If you need a gift for a cigar or pipe smoker, it's a must that you visit this place.

30.description: Went in a few weeks ago with two friends of mine who had never tried a cigar before, and the staff could not have been nicer. The guy behind the counter took my friends around, asked them what kind of flavors they preferred, and help make great choices for the both of them. Great selection, cool location.

46.description: Nice selection.  Good yearly party too.  Staff is very knowledgeable and helpful without being pushy.

1.description: I have been coming here for years, since I used to live in Chicago just a few blocks away. I visited again while in town, and I felt it's time for a review.It's a nice size shop, with lots of glass displays, and well stocked. The "counter" is a circular area in the middle of the shop, where customers conduct the business of paying for their purchases, or sit at high stool to light up their cigars, and engage in conversation.The staff is always helpful, and in more than one occasions steered me or my companion in a good direction with selections. This time I asked for a specific cigar, and the gentleman behind the counter - who had attentively approached me to ask if he could help with anything - checked on their computer system and they did not, but they had similar cigars from the same producer, and I made my purchase.When needing a cigar in Old Town, or Lincoln Park, go here.

9.description: Great selection. Hip, upscale, modern shop.  Friendly service. Pricey, but open super late.

26.description: Been coming here for a couple of years now, and I really like the people who work there and the selection of cigars/tobacco/pipes.  The events there are nice as well.  Perfect place to get a cigar if you are in Chicago.

25.description: I'm writing from total begginer standpoint; no expert on cigars here.  That said, I smoke about once every week or two and this is my go to place.  There is a great selection of cigars here. Oh, are you in the market for a pipe, or a nice lighter? They've got that here aplenty. I've never used this service, but I always overhear them speaking about the lighters they repair, so hey -- they've got that too. My favorite thing about this place, though, is coming in for a smoke.  As much as I'm in favor of every place in my life not smelling like smoke, there is nothing like being able to light up a cigar, indoors, with a good buddy and a cup of hot chocolate (my prefernce if I'm not drinking). The Saturday night crew here is not to be missed.  The Sunday morning crew are generally complaining about working about being hungover, but hey, who the heck isn't.

12.description: Been coming in here for a few years now and continue to love it. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  I tend to be picky with the style/type of cigars and the staff have offered great recommendations. Ive also bought a quality humidor here and happy with the purchase.

21.description: Cigars are both noble cultural traditions and symbols of brutish white male culture.  The staff where cigars are procured are barometers, to which culture the establishment caters to. Wether it's TESA Cigars which sullies to the lowest guttural denominator or to Burning Leaf Tobacco and Blue Havana, exemplars of the noble tradition that I partake once or twice monthly, while striving to keep my humidor at plum producing levels on the aged and oily cigars I favor, especially the  La Flor Dominicana Double Ligero  Maduro, (LD).  Burning Leaf only sells the LD as a smaller corona. Because I only smoke once or twice a month, I prefer the double Corona, which Blue Havana sells. But they're located too far from Logan Square for winter trips. Last week I was in Old Town for a Chicago Teacher's Union Fundraiser . It was near a Starbucks so I grabbed a pound of fragrant yet bold French Expresso, which is a grand accompaniment to a strong cigar and was the start of Fidel Castro's day before he gave up cigars.Then I ventured  into Up Down and  as Fortuna had it, the first thing I saw was the  LD double  croronas!  I reached for a few and discovered the cabinet locked. Generally most shops keep their cabinet's open as a statement of trust to  the customer. I turned and there stood an old rag weed with a ZZ Top beard going for a Willie Nelson look.  " We keep our cases, looked", said he,  actuating the word "locked" with hostility.As if I was behind the need for the locked cases and he was sending a message to the rest of my pick-pock and shelf/counter swiping crew that I lead as the Black Fagin updated from Oliver Twist. And instead of living in an "abandoned house on a stranded street by a marketplace" like Fagin and his crew, my crew squats in the Cabrini Green Housing Project, (formally down the street from them), now closed  by Chicago's Transformation 20/20 Plan that ethnically cleansed the neighborhood, creating the gun violence on the south and westside.          I wasn't surprised. I've seen relics like this  before.
