He pictures himself as some wizened and organically erudite box car scholar, worthy of a place under the Henley Street bridge in Cormac McCarthy's novel Suttree.The reality is he's a throw back to an era when the "old rugged white man" were iconic of American strength, grit, and determination, that extended American armies across seas in wars of John Wayne masculinity, while promoting hollowed American Optimism and parochialism here . The same "white men"  who made politicians like Nixon and Reagan. Clearly he is the southern sheriff of Up Down. But out of civility and as a student of cigar culture. I let it slide and expressed my pleasure. Not just about securing cigars  I've been hoping for since fall, (they will have to be aged to get their maximum potential) but also not having to hunt for them because I always forget their name, as I was running late as usual.  So while I'm making small talk about how great the LD's are and how this was the first place I was able to find the proper size, he just stairs at me. I'm sure picturing me selling stolen cigars on the blue line train."Do you want one cigar" as if I'm not truly interested in buying.  No I say and select three. I'm still upbeat because they're moderately priced excluding the various  heavy taxes, which should only be levied on cigarettes because they do far more damage to our fragile healthcare system.  Then I ask if he freezes his cigars before transforming them to his personal humidor?  It's an ongoing debate due to the scourge of any humidor,tobacco beetles. I still have nightmares about them after they came this close(- ) to destroying my aging Cubans. He replies "no". Leaving me to wonder if he understood what I was talking about. So I rephrased explaining it in context" And again he just said "No" At this point I'm getting pissed and I'm about to say something. When a fellow steps in and gives me a lengthy scholarly lecture on beetle infestation. All of which I know from reading several cyber sights, some of dubious nautre So it's still good to hear it from a professional, who really knows his cigars, which even in the better shops, is still rare. Those who sale cigars should not just be both informational steward and Cigar "physicians"   It's  because of this fellow that I didn't feel the urge to freeze these newest additions now  aging in my humidor.   I just wish I had encountered him because the two starts would have been three starts. But because of him, it's not a one star review.Indeed this gentlemen's intervention and his knowledge of those wretched beetles and their cursed breeding habits and conditions,reminded me of those rare cigar masters at The Tobacco Exchange Located off some twists and turns of  what was Pirate's Alley were many a sad case found themselves waylaid and set upon before ending up as fair to some savage crime bygones ago in the french Quarter of New Orleans

17.description: Best selection of cigars in the city, that I know. Staff is very helpful, and the location lets you enjoy the neighborhood after you leave. No TV's, but I like that you can come and focus on the conversation with people. They throw monthly events in the spring/summer months that are pretty fun too. The seating is kinda tough sometimes, especially when it's a lot of people.All in all a pretty fun place.

10.description: Amazing selection and an actual private garden in back to enjoy your picks. This place is recommended by tobacconists.

5.description: Looking for a good smoke in Old Town?  Look no further, welcome to Up Down Cigar Shop!Selection wise this shop carries most major brands cigars and a large variety of pipes and pipe tobacco.  Walking into their showroom you'll see Ashton, My Father, Altadis which includes Montecristo, Dominican Cohiba, Opus X, Arturo Fuente, Liga Privada, Palina, Padron, and of course Tatuaje.As a brick and mortar the shop carries a solid selection and has many store exclusives produced by Jaime Garcia, Davidoff and Tatuaje to commemorate the shop's 50th anniversary.  I was able to have them dig through the back room and find me some vintage God of Fire 2004 and I was happy to buy them all.  Overall the staff is helpful and knowledge as well as hospital.  I found their recommendations to be thoughtful and they were definitely down to shoot the breeze and talk tobacco.  It's a great business however its smoking area definitely needs much work. You won't find big comfy leather couches in the shop and will have to settle smoking at the counter or one small room in the front.  They've recently opened a beer garden for the summer where you can go in the outdoor patio.Updown Lounge is a great venue and hosts many cigar events with some of the biggest names in the cigar industry.  It is a Chicago foundation but be prepared to pay your 30% cigar tax!

3.description: Awful service look at you like you can't afford a thing . You buy a $13 stick and no thank you

35.description: Good place. Nice Peeps. Always helpful. Open Late. I also like their matches. Sure, tis a bit spendy but heck, I just really like the place....

19.description: Great cigar and tobacco place.  Love the American Indian outside.  Inside they have just about everything that is quality.

28.description: My husband and I went into this shop to look at the pipes and hookas. The employees there never said hello, offered help, or even looked up from their computer. Just because I'm not a rich looking older man does not mean that I would not have purchased something. Trust me, avoiding a customer in this place is VERY hard because its a small shop. I felt uncomfortable and ended up walking out after about ten minutes (being in sight of employees the entire time). I'm giving them two stars instead of one because they do have very good taste and the shop was really cool looking. They did have a selection of beautiful hookas but I will not support a place that does not have reasonable customer service. I don't expect to be ass-kissed, in fact I hate that, but what I hate even more is to be obviously ignored.

45.description: Like most high end tobacco shops, you have to put up with obnoxious, cigar smoking frat boys of all ages, but this gorgeous store is worth it for the blending bar, one of the marvels of the city's smoking scene. Rather than smoking that Drum or Bali Shag, come over here and get educated on how to blend different sorts of fresh tobacco together for a taste that will hit you exactly the way you want, and spend about a quarter what you would on prepackaged smokes in the process.

33.description: Nice shop with fair prices.  Diana, the owner, has been in the game for quite a while and knows her stuff.  She has her own cigars rolled exclusively for her in the Dominican.  BYOB for a different night with some friends.

43.description: An excellent selection of cigars!  if they have run out of your brand, the staff will be happy to work with you to find something similar.  They area a reliable source of the ins and outs of cigar flavors, history, etc and will not push you into buying something too expensive.

2.description: A beautiful store on a charming stretch, Up Down Cigar was the second stop on my semi-intentional survey of Chicago cigar shops. I'm not sure any place in Chicago can rival Iwan Ries & Co. for sheer selection, but Up Down seemed well-curated and staffed by the patient and knowledgeable Riley, who not only made reasonable recommendations to me but also kindly answered my greenhorn questions about cigars. I haven't had a chance to check out their smoking patio yet, but I look forward to returning and learning more.

18.description: I've been smoking cigars for about two years now, and I really began my cigar education at UpDown. Walking in made me feel like a little kid walking into the Lego Store many years ago. Aside from a great atmosphere and a varied selection, the only iffy thing about UpDown is the lack of seating and the inconsistent staff service. I've walked in and someone has helped me right away, but I've spent 15 minutes waiting for a worker to help me out and open up a case. If you're there with a friend, it can be an interesting time delving into the world of cigars, but it can be disappointing if you purchase some cigars to have right there and then and you're forced to stand up and have your cigar. I don't need a La-Z-Boy chair, but space is definitely a concern at UpDown. Aside from technical aspects, the cigars there are kept in good condition, and you can get a great cigar at a reasonable price. Go for anything in the full-flavor corner (the corner with the Tatuaje, Padron, Alec Bradley, and O.S.O.K. cigars). The O.S.O.K. room 101 is a personal favorite. The buzz puts you on your ass, but you barely notice because of the comfortable draw and the consistency of spice and strength. Stop by and see what UpDown has for you.

41.description: The employees are super nice and well informed. I walked in not knowing very much about pipes or pipe tobacco and the employees took the time to explain the different types of pipes, how they are made, and which types of pipes produce different results when smoking. They have a large stock of cigars, pipes, and tobaccos.

50.description: Great selection of cigars and accesories, and its located so temptingly in the middle of old town. The owner Diana Silvius presides over the most well known tobacco shop in Chicago.  If you are going to smoke a cigar in chicago, and you can only go one place, this is it.

4.description: Had good service to find a nice, light cigar. Went with the suggested Dominican ($9), which was good and light! Staff and service were great!

6.description: Stopped in here after dinner while on a recent business trip to Chicago.Great selection and had a great time talking with the gentleman behind the desk as I enjoyed my cigar.A lot of great history about the business and its owner, so definitely take the time to talk shop with the employees about both.Going to be a regular stop for me when in Chicago from now on.

22.description: By far my favorite Cigar shop! I just got in to cigars and go here about 3-4 times a week. Great place to let loose and smoke a few! Great company, great folks. Prices are decent if you know what you're looking for. Great array of pipes, fairly expensive selection of Humidors, but definitely shows in quality. I have purchased many many things from UpDown and will continue to. Love it here. PLEASE GO! :)

15.description: Cigars are both noble cultural traditions and symbols of brutish white male culture.  The staff where cigars are procured are barometers, to which culture the establishment caters to. Wether it's TESA Cigars which sullies to the lowest guttural denominator or to Burning Leaf Tobacco and Blue Havana, exemplars of the noble tradition that I partake once or twice monthly, while striving to keep my humidor at plum producing levels on the aged and oily cigars I favor, especially the  La Flor Dominicana Double Ligero  Maduro, (LD).  Burning Leaf only sells the LD as a smaller corona. Because I only smoke once or twice a month, I prefer the double Corona, which Blue Havana sells. But they're located too far from Logan Square for winter trips. Last week I was in Old Town for a Chicago Teacher's Union Fundraiser . It was near a Starbucks so I grabbed a pound of fragrant yet bold French Expresso, which is a grand accompaniment to a strong cigar and was the start of Fidel Castro's day before he gave up cigars.Then I ventured  into Up Down and  as Fortuna had it, the first thing I saw was the  LD double  croronas!  I reached for a few and discovered the cabinet locked. Generally most shops keep their cabinet's open as a statement of trust to  the customer. I turned and there stood an old rag weed with a ZZ Top beard going for a Willie Nelson look.  " We keep our cases, looked", said he,  actuating the word "locked" with hostility.As if I was behind the need for the locked cases and he was sending a message to the rest of my pick-pock and shelf/counter swiping crew that I lead as the Black Fagin updated from Oliver Twist. And instead of living in an "abandoned house on a stranded street by a marketplace" like Fagin and his crew, my crew squats in the Cabrini Green Housing Project, (formally down the street from them), now closed  by Chicago's Transformation 20/20 Plan that ethnically cleansed the neighborhood, creating the gun violence on the south and westside.          I wasn't surprised. I've seen relics like this  before. He pictures himself as some wizened and organically erudite box car scholar, worthy of a place under the Henley Street bridge in Cormac McCarthy's novel Suttree.The reality is he's a throw back to an era when the "old rugged white man" were iconic of American strength, grit, and determination, that extended American armies across seas in wars of John Wayne masculinity, while promoting hollowed American Optimism and parochialism here . The same "white men"  who made politicians like Nixon and Reagan. Clearly he is the southern sheriff of Up Down. But out of civility and as a student of cigar culture. I let it slide and expressed my pleasure. Not just about securing cigars  I've been hoping for since fall, (they will have to be aged to get their maximum potential) but also not having to hunt for them because I always forget their name, as I was running late as usual.  So while I'm making small talk about how great the LD's are and how this was the first place I was able to find the proper size, he just stairs at me. I'm sure picturing me selling stolen cigars on the blue line train."Do you want one cigar" as if I'm not truly interested in buying.  No I say and select three. I'm still upbeat because they're moderately priced excluding the various  heavy taxes, which should only be levied on cigarettes because they do far more damage to our fragile healthcare system.  Then I ask if he freezes his cigars before transforming them to his personal humidor?  It's an ongoing debate due to the scourge of any humidor,tobacco beetles. I still have nightmares about them after they came this close(- ) to destroying my aging Cubans. He replies "no". Leaving me to wonder if he understood what I was talking about. So I rephrased explaining it in context" And again he just said "No" At this point I'm getting pissed and I'm about to say something. When a fellow steps in and gives me a lengthy scholarly lecture on beetle infestation. All of which I know from reading several cyber sights, some of dubious nautre So it's still good to hear it from a professional, who really knows his cigars, which even in the better shops, is still rare. Those who sale cigars should not just be both informational steward and Cigar "physicians"   It's  because of this fellow that I didn't feel the urge to freeze these newest additions now  aging in my humidor.   I just wish I had encountered him because the two starts would have been three starts. But because of him, it's not a one star review.Indeed this gentlemen's intervention and his knowledge of those wretched beetles and their cursed breeding habits and conditions,reminded me of those rare cigar masters at The Tobacco Exchange Located off some twists and turns of  what was Pirate's Alley were many a sad case found themselves waylaid and set upon before ending up as fair to some savage crime bygones ago in the french Quarter of New Orleans

20.description: Best selection of cigars in the city, that I know. Staff is very helpful, and the location lets you enjoy the neighborhood after you leave. No TV's, but I like that you can come and focus on the conversation with people. They throw monthly events in the spring/summer months that are pretty fun too. The seating is kinda tough sometimes, especially when it's a lot of people.All in all a pretty fun place.

36.description: when you add in the convenience factor of late hours(open til 11), free parking(in the lot next door), solid selection of AF products(opus anyone) and a staff that actually knows the difference between maduro and double maduro, then you can see why the prices are so much more than other well respected places like Iwan Reis or Jack Schwartz.so if you don't have the time to run into the loop(during office hours) or order online, its nice to know you don't have to settle for a SS from walgreens or gas station and can get a good smoke when you need it.for those shopping for others, there is a great selection of accessories, lighters, humidors and other knick knacks...and its still open until 11pm for those last minute gifts.just be prepared to pay for it.

14.description: Very friendly service. Patient and knowledgeable. Even gift wrapped a present for me!

58.description: Some of the best food comes from these 'hole in the wall 'joints such as with this spot where taxi cab drivers frequent.  My cousin goes here several times a week and is obsessed with the biryani and I am a huge fan of the butter chicken and the minced meat, usually chicken beef or lamb.  The people who run this place are very friendly, though you might have to remind them of exactly what you want but if you treat them nice, they hook you up with bigger portions or give you things for free to try it out such as when I was asking about their halvva, a colorful sweet, kind of bright orange in color.  The place is clean, full of random taxi cab drivers or a group of them that met to eat and chat.  Late at night you will find random people like me walk in because they know the secret about how cool this place is for feasting.  I love the naan here, it is very close to the Peshawari naan which is the absolute best.  This place is open all night so its a great late night spot and I alway seem to find parking rather close to the front entrance.  Hearing all these different languages and watching the Urdu news stations is always interesting.  This place is highly recommended and they also make food for parties or special events.

56.description: Friendly Pakistani guy behind the counter (FPGBTC): Hello boss, what can I get you?NP: I'll take my usual: biryani to go, please.FPGBTC serves heaping spoons of aromatic biryani into a Styrofoam box, enough to last me for at least two, maybe even three meals.FPGBTC: You are a doctor, right?NP: No, I am not a doctor.FPGBTC: Oh! You look like a doctor. You should have been a doctor.NP: ...  Thank you?Hear that, mom? I may not have become a doctor like you wanted, but at least I look like one!Note: Chicken biryani is served Sunday through Wednesday, mutton pilaw is available on Thursday and Saturday, and mutton biryani, my favorite, is the special on Friday. Also, it's not really mutton; it's goat.

29.description: They cater, too. Went to a party and they had catered for 130 people. Every dish was fabulous. You can ask for a selection of Bangladeshi dishes and you won't go wrong as the owner-chef is from Bangladesh.

42.description: Good value. Naan, lentils, chicken & fish were tasty. We wouldn't get the beef again. We were the only female customers and the atmosphere is nothing special. But all in all a good find thanks to yelp.

23.description: Mutton Biriyani was awesome! One of the best biriyani I had after cmg to US... I did not like the gravy much as it was very very oily...

47.description: Good place to try if you're looking for a good Indian/Pakistani restaurant.Food is served cafeteria style.Place is open 24/7 EXCEPT during Ramadan.I know this because I was here and THEY WERE CLOSED.sigh.Prices are reasonable and I can always count on a huge meal for under $15.Its a cabbie hangout.So dont walk in expecting linen tablecloths.Lmao.Us cab drivers know all the good spots sooooo.......YEP!!!! Definetely  worth trying.

8.description: Delicious! I didn't even realize I was a fan of this type of food until I ate here. I got the chicken biryani and beef curry. Both were delicious. Very good sized portions but the one downfall is the chicken had bones in it and if you get it take out then it cost $3 more dollars. Other then that, this place is definitely gonna be my go to

31.description: Writing a review because the young man working behind the counter yesterday on Labor Day was incredibly nice. Like any other Pakistani person, my all time favorite food is Nihari, so I went into this place craving it after not having it in a while.  I just moved to the Gold Coast area and Devon is a hike for me.  To my disappointment they were all out of Nihari and just had the gravy left.  I was starving so I still asked it I could buy just the gravy, and a few minutes later I received piping hot Nihari, naan, raitha sauce and toppings for FREE.  I mean I know there was no meat left in the gravy but still awfully nice of them to pack it up so nicely for me and not charge me.  Needless to say I have found my new go-to spot in the area.

34.description: Good food, but I was overcharged like Ray C below, same experience.  Would have been a 4-star review, but Ray C's review confirmed my suspicions.  If you go, I would definitely confirm the order total right after you order, either eating in or ordering over the phone.  Do not get the total price after-the-fact.  I suspect different rates are being charged to different customers.

16.description: My wife and I have often driven past this restaurant in a non-descript area of Clybourn. We had always noticed a lot of cabdrivers frequented Tabaq (always a good sign!) and my wife, who's Pakistani, and I thought we'd give it a try. There are very few truly authentic Pakistani restaurants off of Devon and the few that we've found were either overpriced (compared to Devon) or  unsanitary. We've finally found our go-to place! The food is fantastic, authentic, spicy and reasonably priced. It's also only 3/4 mile from our home when we're craving Paki cuisine. We had the Frontier chicken, Biryani, Nihari, and samosas. It was outstanding across the board. The one complaint was the temperature of the food but it's not a place where you want to dine in anyway and we just warmed it up at home. Highly recommended!

13.description: Ever wonder where cab drivers go when they're not working? Well...here is a popular spot. I was the only person eating inside that hadn't rolled up in a yellow and black and I think that's a pretty good sign if you're looking for authentic Pakistani food. I was a first timer, but this cuisine is really cheap, served in huge portions, and incredibly flavorful. Served cafeteria style at Tabaq there were options of chicken, lamb, veggie, and talapia. You will RARELY hear me say this, but after my meal here I'd recommend going vegetarian with your order. Not that the meat wasn't any good, but the squash dish was awesome and the lamb was a bit boney.  Overall the service was friendly, the food was very affordable, and they'll even let you sample stuff if you've a new to Pakistani food so it's totally worth a stop in.

11.description: Mind blown!!! 24/7 cabbie Pakistani food. The most authentic Pakistani food I have tasted in the United States hitherto. Everything I tasted from the daal, squash, lamb (which I think was goat), chicken, naan, chappati, mint chutney to the gulab jaman and doodh pati tasted amazing and transported me back to Pakistan. It wasn't just good it was something I'd rate a 5/5 on yelp if I was back home in Pakistan! Food like my grandma made it. I admit I haven't tried the other Pakistani food spots in Chicago yet and I am a little desi food deprived living in Rochester NY but I have tried them in other big cities. No comparison. Just a delicious bliss. Oh and it's as cheap as it gets. Probably cheaper than ordering pizza. Excellent helpful friendly staff. Prayer area in the basement. Seating and restroom like what you'd expect from a cabbie place but very clean (seating not the restroom). I think I might have to move to Chicago. Thank you Tabaq for making me miss home a little bit less.... or maybe more?

39.description: I've never had Pakistani food before but this really hit the spot. The restaurant is open 24 hours and is usually filled with cab drivers. Parking is hard to find! We felt a little out of place when we walked in (I was the only girl out of 20 or so patrons!) but there was a guy who was very welcoming and friendly. They don't have any signs up about how the process works, but basically you have two options: small for 7.99 or large for 10.99. You can pick one entree, and then you have the choice or rice or naan. They have lots of options, including vegetarian dishes. Everything is already cooked and out for you to see, kind of like a cafeteria. We went with the lamb briyani and the goat. I would highly recommend the naan- it was fresh and toasty and delicious. You get four giant pieces. The goat was okay- there wasn't a whole lot of it, but I enjoyed dipping my naan in the sauce. The briyani was decent too. It tastes better when you mix in other sauces. You also get a small side salad. So you order your food, sit down, and they call you up to get your food when it is ready. Then, you enjoy your meal, go up to pay, and leave your dishes on the table.5 stars for amazing prices and really large portions. The two of us ate until we were stuffed and still had a ton of leftovers, which were still good the next day! Also, customer service was great. If you are reallt hungry, you should check this place out!

37.description: Take-out is $10.99 for your choice of entree that comes with rice or naan and salad.Dine-in is the same with the additional option of a $7.99 "small" portion of an entree with the same rice or naan and salad.Choose from deliciously seasoned and spiced goat nihari, beef nihari, lentils, chicken korma, chicken makhani, tandoor fish, biryani, etc. etc. Selections change daily and if only I hit the gym more often, I'd come every day to try all of them.Don't be intimidated by the 15 cabs parked outside.  The counter service is friendly and helpful too.Authentic, fast, cheap. PERFECT. go now.

0.description: My very first experience with Pakistani food and oh my, what a treat. I made our friends order for me, so I had a chicken boti, which was delicious. Perfect amount of spice. The naan that comes with the food is seriously amazing and perfectly toasted. We also shared HUGE orders of lamb biryani (the rice) and that was delicious. For dessert, I grabbed one of the rice puddings and how fresh it was! I liked that the gentleman helping us order explained everything to us at first and was so welcoming since my fiancé and I had no idea what we were ordering. Hidden gem, definitely go to get the most authentic food possible. Great, friendly guys working. Would go back at any hour of the day!

38.description: Tabaq  is an authentic Indo / Pak mughlai dhaba (cafe) style food where what you see is what you get. There is nothing made to order, you get what has been made fresh that day. There are pros and cons of this approachI had the green daal - good, not spicy, goat korma - great and spciy, chicken biryani - great and spciy, naan, mango lassi and chai. Food was flavorful = fair amount of oil. Leaves you full for the entire day, and you can skip dinner or double up on the cholestrol meds. Meal was shared with my little 5 year old who pretty much ate the naan with yogurt because everything was spicy for her, she's 5 after all !Cash register is manned by a young fellow by the name of Javaad who is a co-owner  and he really took care of us. When I complained that my goat curry was mostly bones, he brought some pieces with meat. Food was decent and the service was good, it was a late sunday afternoon so not many peopleHaving lived in and around downtown Manhattan and San Fran where arguably the best Indo or Pak restaurants are to be found, I have been disappointed in not having anywhere near the same in downtown Chicago. Why is that I wonder??

51.description: We found this place on Google map which has a lot of excellent reviews. We drove by and it's much more crowded than other restaurants near by. Walked in without knowing much about Pakistani food and we were the only non middle eastern group in the restaurant. But the staffs were so friendly. They explained all the dishes in details so we could make our choices in a breeze. They even made a special chicken dish for my 7 yr old who doesn't like spicy food. That chicken dish (see photo) was outstanding. We also ordered the tilapia and a chicken rice dish that they're both very good. We'll be back! Just wish their restroom is a bit cleaner.

27.description: I've always heard great things about this restaurant but was a little leery of actually going in. This would be the day!!! I came in with my husband and walked up to the display case to see the offerings. They had lamb, beef, chicken, fish, naan, lentils, rice and on and on. We settled on the chicken biryani and beef haleem. Both were delicious and came with a side salad and naan.  The owner is super nice and incredibly hospitable. Ladies, you WILL be the only female in the place, unless of course you bring a friend. I didn't feel uncomfortable at all until I looked down to see that I was wearing my leather knee high boots. (whoopsy...this is my own fault) I think I will be dressing a little different the next time around! Can't wait to come back!!!

32.description: Food is cheap and good.  You see a lot of taxis outside. I generally believe taxi drivers know one of the best places to eat in town. The only drawback is it's buffet so it's all lukewarm but not made to order hot food

54.description: Like stepping into Islamabad. This place is the hole-in-the-wall I had been looking for! Great desi food. Everything I tried was full of taste and authenticity. Owner is a nice guy and I encourage you to try all of it. Yes, all the cab drivers go here, but it is for good reason--they know where the best Indo-Pak food is.

48.description: Going to Tabaq is like being magically transported to the Middle East....but ignore the fact that it's located in a questionable area on Clybourn next to the shadyass Dominick's. I had always wanted to try Tabaq out ever since my Indian cabbie recommended their biryani. Went on an early Friday evening and noted how busy it was and filled with all male cabbies! (I was the only girl.....felt kinda awkward)The food is cafeteria style and we chose a large lamb biryani, side of lamb stew, veggies, and naan. Each order also comes with a small salad and spicy or non spicy yogurt sauce. All of our food tasted GREAT and was seasoned so well, like if i I had a Pakistani mom. The lamb was really tender and the biryani was super flavorful. I would definitely come back to Tabaq, I highly recommend it as not only a great food adventure, but a cultural experience as well!!

44.description: I love Tabaq! Really good Middle Eastern/Pakistani/Indian food. Very spicy, very tasty. The predominantly Middle Eastern clientele demonstrates the food's authenticity in my view, and everyone is welcome. The owner is really cool.The restaurant is not exactly fancy, but it is very reasonably priced, and you get a lot from what you pay for (you can get a full meal with two entrées, a salad and a giant naan for only $8).They are open 24/7, which is great for late night snacks.Overall, down-to-earth, well priced and great food.

24.description: I'm a happy camper here.  No airs at all.  Non-existent decor with killer food at great prices.  Very friendly staff ready to suggest other dishes.  Frontier chicken was the best I've had in Chicago.  A+++

7.description: This place is really good. The food was outstanding - had chicken biryani and the guy in front of me asked to have some mutton stew juice drizzled over his so I did the same. Wow! Tasty! The entrees come with either nan or chipatis or pakoras. I got the pakoras and picked up a mango lassi too. I saw other people with nan and asked for that as well. The total came to just over 15.00. I paid with a 20 and he gave me 5 even back. It was too much food for one person.Like I said, the biryani w/ mutton juice was sublime. It came with a small salad of lettuce, white onions and sliced jalapenos. I like! There was some greenish yoghurt sauce that might have been for the salad -- not sure -- but I dipped the pakoras into it and poured the rest on my biryani. The nan was really good and hot. The mango lassi was absolutely amazing!I kept seeing men (some in traditional dress) come in and go downstairs. A few minutes later they would come up and get food. I assume they were going downstairs for prayers because I noticed a review here last night mentioning a sign detailing prayer times. I didn't see the sign but I would like to think I was eating above a room where a lot of people were praying. I'm an atheist myself but I appreciate the hearts of people who pray and I like to be around them as long as they are people of love. I sensed no ill will there and didn't feel out of place. Hopefully I'll get a chance to go back before I leave town. I only wish I could sample a little of each option. Maybe I'll have the daal next time.

49.description: We landed in Chicago on a Sunday night and knew we would venture to Devon street for an authentic Pakistani/Indian meal...but we broke down the first night decided to give Tabq a shot as it was in the city and naturally the cabbie knew where to go.So, its a cafeteria style spot where the cabbis go--hence it must be GOOD!!The young guy who was taking orders let us taste a few different dishes and we ended up getting the pillao, goat curry and a naan. First off the portions are huge but that does not equate to lack of taste as the food was delish.The pillao was great and so was the goat curry.The only downside was that I wish they could deliver to our hotel.But overall, if in the city this is a solid spot for Indian/Pakistani food.

40.description: Subhan Allah , I didn't expect to find this Musjed , mosque underneath Tabaq Restaurant,  its nice place , cozy , may Allah put Baraka on the people who made it easy for us to pray at this place

53.description: Kickass food! 6-7 curry dishes, tandori style bone-in and boneless, tilapia dishes, lamb, beef all with blasting flavor and almost all with a hefty kick.  Dishes rotate for the element of surprise. I've been here 6 times and am never disappointed and always excited.  Its clean interior is a reassuring element of the whole experience.

30.description: When I was in college, a friend of mine would bring me home cooked Pakistani food -lamb or chicken biryani as well as lamb curry.   It was my introduction to Pakistani food and when ever I go to restaurants, I would compare the food to the home cooking.  The food here reminded me of that!  I think I am addicted to this place.  The portions are large and the prices are right on!

46.description: Ever wonder where cab drivers go when they're not working? Well...here is a popular spot. I was the only person eating inside that hadn't rolled up in a yellow and black and I think that's a pretty good sign if you're looking for authentic Pakistani food. I was a first timer, but this cuisine is really cheap, served in huge portions, and incredibly flavorful. Served cafeteria style at Tabaq there were options of chicken, lamb, veggie, and talapia. You will RARELY hear me say this, but after my meal here I'd recommend going vegetarian with your order. Not that the meat wasn't any good, but the squash dish was awesome and the lamb was a bit boney.  Overall the service was friendly, the food was very affordable, and they'll even let you sample stuff if you've a new to Pakistani food so it's totally worth a stop in.

1.description: This is the Cab Hotspot in Uptown Chicago. The street looked like a fruit basket filled with different colored Cabs. Which means, you probably don't want to come here with your significant other or family. If you're coming with a bunch of guy friends you'll be just fine... or you can take it for carry out. This restaurant is different then the norm. All the food is ready-made and presented right in front of you. Whatever is on display are your only options. If for some reason the food you want is not there or it ran out, then they would be able to make it on the spot. The man behind the counter doesn't have the best english. It may seem like he is getting inpatient or angry, but really he's not. It's just the way he talks/stands. Trust me, I'm desi. Anyways, you tell him what you want and he will make you plate and warm it up for you. Also on the menu, it says $8 or $11 options. Just disregard that, everything is $8 no matter what you get. I guess it makes it easy. Chicken Biryani and Haleem is what you have to get from here. For the first time, I came here in the winter and my experience could have been better (I usually go during Ramadan). They didn't have haleem or chicken biryani that day. So we had settle for whatever they had on display. I forgot the names of some of the dishes but some were super delicious and some were okay. The BBQ chicken was not that great though, I thought it was too dry and not enough flavor. Overall, I'd rather drive out here to get Chicken Biryani or Haleem. From now on, I'm going to call ahead to see if they have it.

55.description: There are a bunch of Pakistani cafeteria places on the near north side that primarily cater to cabbies. I've tried several, and this is the one to choose if you're not part of this culture and you just like ethnic foods. They are very welcoming and friendly to randoms like me.We enjoyed the spicy biryani and a vegetarian combination (dal and mixed veggie curry) with naan. Despite the steam table, everything tasted fresh, and the portions were gigantic. I had plenty to take home for lunch the next day.Don't come here expecting a gracious dining experience. It's just a clean, home-style, no-frills place to try new foods and eat with some Chicagoans from around the world.

9.description: Decent food.  Place seems good.  I ordered the chicken briyani and some meat and potatoes. The quantity was low for the price.  One thing I cannot understand is why do they charge $3 more for takeaway.  That's a huge margin.

26.description: My wife and I have often driven past this restaurant in a non-descript area of Clybourn. We had always noticed a lot of cabdrivers frequented Tabaq (always a good sign!) and my wife, who's Pakistani, and I thought we'd give it a try. There are very few truly authentic Pakistani restaurants off of Devon and the few that we've found were either overpriced (compared to Devon) or  unsanitary. We've finally found our go-to place! The food is fantastic, authentic, spicy and reasonably priced. It's also only 3/4 mile from our home when we're craving Paki cuisine. We had the Frontier chicken, Biryani, Nihari, and samosas. It was outstanding across the board. The one complaint was the temperature of the food but it's not a place where you want to dine in anyway and we just warmed it up at home. Highly recommended!

25.description: We were in Chicago for a short winter break and arrived late to our downtown hotel by taxi. After finding out that our taxi driver was from India, we started to quiz him on the best places to eat Indian non-veg food. Lo and behold, he said he would be happy to take us to Tabaq as that was the only restaurant open that late into the night (24 hours open) Tabaq was a fantastic experience...the place is a bit shady but never did we feel unsafe. We had two kids with us who could not stop raving about the food. Their best dishes and in order was Chicken Biryani, Goat curry, Goat Biryani and their morning paratha and Indian omelette! Their quantities are large and prices are very reasonable. No fancy place to eat but entirely hearty meals that satisfies the soul! Oh, don't miss their chai and kheer!

12.description: I've always heard great things about this restaurant but was a little leery of actually going in. This would be the day!!! I came in with my husband and walked up to the display case to see the offerings. They had lamb, beef, chicken, fish, naan, lentils, rice and on and on. We settled on the chicken biryani and beef haleem. Both were delicious and came with a side salad and naan.  The owner is super nice and incredibly hospitable. Ladies, you WILL be the only female in the place, unless of course you bring a friend. I didn't feel uncomfortable at all until I looked down to see that I was wearing my leather knee high boots. (whoopsy...this is my own fault) I think I will be dressing a little different the next time around! Can't wait to come back!!!

59.description: ok I can't write essay's like other user have.  But this is place is good.  I was told to try their Charga, which I have to agree was really delicious.  My 2 yr old is a picky eater, but he loved the chicken to.  I tried other stuff, like Murgh Cholay, daal, while I liked the daal, hubby like Murgh Cholay, and kids loved the Charga, everyone was happy. Naan were decent size, and tasted good.  They would have been better eaten fresh,  but we did a take out, so they got soft.  Our First night in chicago, and they made it feel like home.  I am told this is a taxi driver type place, you never see women, and i'll have to agree I waited out side of the restaurant while hubby went and got the stuff, and didn't see one female pass by.  Great prices as well!!

21.description: Decent food...not great...being an Indian I have high expectations I guess...tried this place based on yelp reviews...the other place..."fl*m*ng w*k" have better food...have tried it few times over the years!!!

17.description: Going to Tabaq is like being magically transported to the Middle East....but ignore the fact that it's located in a questionable area on Clybourn next to the shadyass Dominick's. I had always wanted to try Tabaq out ever since my Indian cabbie recommended their biryani. Went on an early Friday evening and noted how busy it was and filled with all male cabbies! (I was the only girl.....felt kinda awkward)The food is cafeteria style and we chose a large lamb biryani, side of lamb stew, veggies, and naan. Each order also comes with a small salad and spicy or non spicy yogurt sauce. All of our food tasted GREAT and was seasoned so well, like if i I had a Pakistani mom. The lamb was really tender and the biryani was super flavorful. I would definitely come back to Tabaq, I highly recommend it as not only a great food adventure, but a cultural experience as well!!

10.description: My boyfriend and I went this afternoon for lunch. We'd been looking for a great Indian place in Chicago and based on the reviews here decided to give it a go. I recall one person saying it's in a shady neighborhood, which is not the case. It's in Old Town right next to a Starbucks, Jewel Osco and Panera...and I mean RIGHT AROUND THE CORNER. There is also limited parking on the off streets (we parked for free on Mohawk, but you can probably get away with parking at Jewel and walking 50 ft). We got the mutton biryani, frontier chicken and the shish kabob (2/order). We also got a side of white rice and naan. The naan is HUGE and the rice is heaping. The gentleman behind the counter, Juad (spelling?), was also so nice and recommended the naan-rice split. He also gave us yellow rice and curry on the house. The atmosphere is great, I only saw groups and individual men inside, but you could tell they all knew each other and enjoyed being there. If you dine in, most entrees are $7.99 compared to $10.99 if you take out, but the portions are very filling. HIGHLY recommend the mutton biryani. The sauce is like a gravy and the lamb is juicy. We will be back again!

5.description: ALWAYS OPENI have been dying to eat here for years. I always drive by & there is not a single parking spot outside on the street. All of those spots are always occupied by taxis. I even got an incredible recommendation from Dr. Nishan, a fellow Yelper, whose review about Tabaq is quite humorous. Nishan calls it his favorite and now I know why.  We were driving down the street when I saw a cab pulling out of a parking spot. We were hungry & decided today was the day we try Tabaq. We walked in & were greeted by the owner. He was so friendly and we loved talking to him. He went through all of the dishes and pointed out his favorites. We were so excited and couldn't decide. He even gave us a sample. After our sample we were sold & placed our order. We ordered a Haleem which is ground dal (lentil) with shredded beef. It came with a salad, fresh baked naan & a mint-cilantro sauce called raita. The haleem was so good and spicy. It was perfect food for a cold chilly day in Chicago. The spice warmed up every inch of my body. The dish would not win any awards for looks but it is a perfect 5 stars based on taste. If you don't believe me then go & check my photo but it's an ugly dish. Ha! I can hardly wait to come back & have this again. We read several reviews about the Chicken Biriyani being the best item on the menu. We couldn't deny all of those comments & we went for it. The plate was huge. It was stacked so high it almost touched the ceiling & I must admit it was everything everyone was is it would be. I would definitely order this item again on a return trip. It came with a side salad &!three chunks of chicken on the bone. I really had to work the chicken because it was not the user friendly chicken we all get at an American restaurant. This was meat chunks with tiny little bones everywhere. If you're looking for easy then this place is not for you. I love authentic and in my heart I feel like this place delivered. Our two dishes were a ton of food and we had a feast on our table. The owner came over to check on us & we were so excited about the food. He even brought over a ground chicken kabob patty with grilled onions & jalapeños. The patty was dry but full of fantastic flavors. It was the best chicken burger I've ever had. I'm so glad the owner brought this over because I was curious about how it tasted. It was a new way of serving chicken kabobs and much more easier to eat.  The owner even brought over Kheer which is a rice pudding with hints of cinnamon. He told us to eat it after we finished our food. It was really cute. He didn't want us to eat dessert before we cleaned our plates off. This was a perfect way to end our late lunch. It wasn't too sweet but had the right amount of flavor. We made our way back to the counter to pay for our meal. Yes they are very trusting here and you pay after you are done eating. All dishes are $8 except for the grilled fish which is $10. It makes it totally easy to order and pay.Of course we started talking to the owner and he talked about the special Halal meat. He also informed us that it was much more expensive the normal meat from Jewel. I knew most of this but it's great to hear a restaurant owner talk with pride about the quality of his food. He also told me to come back any time because he never closes. I wish I was still in my younger years because this place would be my new 3am burrito joint. It's funny how time changes and lifestyles change. The owner asked me to come back this Friday after 2pm because he is making chicken kabobs that will impress me. I told him I couldn't make this Friday but I would defiantly come back on an upcoming Friday. I just thought he was such a nice person and is everything you want in a restaurant owner. His friendliness & kindness towards us makes us want to come back again & again. If you do decide to come here then don't be afraid. There is a good chance you will be the only person here who doesn't drive for a living. Not once will you feel out of place. Eating here reminds me of my culinary adventures around the world but I'm in my own backyard of Chicago. This is why I love this city. You can drive from neighborhood to neighborhood to get the most authentic traditional food ever. This makes Chicago a culinary treat for me.We also met a doctor who comes in here every day for a green tea chai with milk. He recommended we get one, while we were talking to the owner. Next thing we knew the owner had poured two for us to take. This place rocks. I had never had this drink but it was unique and good. Honestly this place is the best. In closing, thanks to the owner for caring about newbie customers. You invited us in & treated us to a grand experience. We can not wait to come back & eat here again. We also learned that the food changes daily at the back counter, so we could have a different food adventure every day of the week and at any hour. We're ready for that challenge.

3.description: My farts have never been smellier! Usually this means that my chrohn's is acting up, but today's meal was so special that none of the unbearably crippling pain came with the ungodly gas! This only happens with grade A+ cuisine! Thanks a lot guys!

35.description: Review is for carryout - hubby brought home some frontier chicken, chicken chargha i think and naans. We wanted biryani/some sort of rice.. but they didn't have any on a Sunday night. Frontier chicken was yummy...but nothing out of this world. Same with the chargha. I felt like the food was flavorful without being spicy. Tandoori/chargha or whatever...that was kind of disappointing in the spice department cos i like my tandoori to be really spicy and smokey.The naan were delicious and warm. Erm...we got two free 'sides' - vegetable dish and lentils. They were ok. I want to try their biryani to really see how good their food is. So, hopefully next time.

19.description: You should probably know what you are getting into before going here... Not for the uninitiated, but if you are looking for a place with great Pakistani food at anytime this is hard to beat. Great food and really a fix for biryani when you need it. I wish I lived in Chicago to order more take out from here.

I even got an incredible recommendation from Dr. Nishan, a fellow Yelper, whose review about Tabaq is quite humorous. You can drive from neighborhood to neighborhood to get the most authentic traditional food ever. This makes Chicago a culinary treat for me.We also met a doctor who comes in here every day for a green tea chai with milk. He recommended we get one, while we were talking to the owner. Next thing we knew the owner had poured two for us to take. This place rocks. I had never had this drink but it was unique and good. Honestly this place is the best. In closing, thanks to the owner for caring about newbie customers. You invited us in & treated us to a grand experience. We can not wait to come back & eat here again. We also learned that the food changes daily at the back counter, so we could have a different food adventure every day of the week and at any hour. We're ready for that challenge.

45.description: Been coming here for years.  Great food all around.We've come here for late night dining and at proper dinner time.  The food and quality is always good.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Very consistent place.

33.description: Perfect for what it is!Might wanna bring a translator though...A bit confusing...

43.description: I typically want to eat at restaurants that are authentic and it doesnt get better than this. I just started exploring this cuisine around town and stumbled upon this place on my way to work. Freindly serivce, tasty food, and very welcoming to a new comer!

2.description: Totally unexpected delicious food! Area is sketchy (to put it mildly) and I truly did not expect much coming in. Yelp reeled me in and I am thankful for it. The interiors are plain, clean and completely fuss free. Seems like a close knit community that gathers here to drink tea, eat biryani and discuss current affairs. The food is the REAL deal. They were out of chicken biryani so I got the goat biryani instead. Perfectly spiced, but I do wish there was more meat to match the proportions of rice. My husband got the frontier chicken and it was delicious too. Definitely great fix for Indian/Pakistani food in the old town area if you don't feel like driving all the way to Devon.

18.description: Just excellent. I went here with a buddy late one night and we both got a spicy lamb dish for around $12 after tax. The food was delicious! Also, the serving size was so large that I got three small meals out of it, and I eat quite a bit. This place is awesome.

41.description: Mind blown!!! 24/7 cabbie Pakistani food. The most authentic Pakistani food I have tasted in the United States hitherto. Everything I tasted from the daal, squash, lamb (which I think was goat), chicken, naan, chappati, mint chutney to the gulab jaman and doodh pati tasted amazing and transported me back to Pakistan. It wasn't just good it was something I'd rate a 5/5 on yelp if I was back home in Pakistan! Food like my grandma made it. I admit I haven't tried the other Pakistani food spots in Chicago yet and I am a little desi food deprived living in Rochester NY but I have tried them in other big cities. No comparison. Just a delicious bliss. Oh and it's as cheap as it gets. Probably cheaper than ordering pizza. Excellent helpful friendly staff. Prayer area in the basement. Seating and restroom like what you'd expect from a cabbie place but very clean (seating not the restroom). I think I might have to move to Chicago. Thank you Tabaq for making me miss home a little bit less.... or maybe more?

52.description: Wow.  I have a new favorite food.  Who would have ever guessed it would be called biryani.  I'm not even sure I'm spelling or pronouncing it correctly.But I love this place.  Super staff, clean place, food is fast and delicious.  Small space but that's okay.  I'm not here for the atmosphere.  I'm here for the biryani.

50.description: So after a long day of spending way too much on furniture for our new apartment, my boyfriend and I had built up quite the appetite. This place was right around the corner and had good ratings, so we tried it. Man, am I glad we did!  We've never tried Pakistani cuisine before so it was an intriguing place to try out. Based on some of the other yelp reviews I tried the chicken biryani. So good!  I'm not real familiar with my Pakistani cuisine so I'm not real sure what my boyfriend had. He had something the guy behind the counter suggested bc it was spicy. I wish I remembered what it was because it was really good too. We had naan with a dipping sauce of some kind that was awesome as well. Good food, good service, try it!

4.description: It is one of the best places to eat fresh Pakistani food in Chicago. Friendly service and verity of food is very good. 5 Stars

6.description: Where should I start for this place...1. Open 24/7....2. Nice Warm food everytime3. Better than all the overly priced so-called Indian restaurants in downtown chicago.4. No fuss place. 5. The meats are very authentic and very nice.6. Super cheap.

22.description: This place is soo freaking good. The lentils are amazing. All of the curries are outstanding. The owners are welcoming and greets you like family. A perfect grubby hole in the wall restaurant.

15.description: Food was good but I think the other reviewers exaggerated a bit. The naan is fresh and made to order. The chicken curry was so so. The biryani was good. If you're looking for authentic, I'd say this is a good bet. One problem was that there was no butter chicken, which is my favorite.

57.description: The food here was really *really good.  The staff was very friendly and explained to us all the dishes available.  Chicken was so moist and well flavored.  I am definitely going back and would recommend to others.

20.description: Decent food.  Place seems good.  I ordered the chicken briyani and some meat and potatoes. The quantity was low for the price.  One thing I cannot understand is why do they charge $3 more for takeaway.  That's a huge margin.

36.description: Eh. Really wasn't impressed.Our portions were pitifully small, the food had a very pungent flavor (which I normally really like Pakistani food, but this was different), the water glasses actually disgusting, and the salads consisted of only onions and brown carrots. It was definitely very disappointing. Also avoid the sweet rice.The naan was good, and the lassi was delicious, but overall, unless its 3:00 and you're hungry with a friend like us, I'd probs head for another place.I really really wanted to like this place, but alas. Maybe I'll give it another whirl.

14.description: Worst place . Not worth spending time and Money. Food was awful. They were heating up the food in the oven. We just took the food and had leave as it is. I didn't not find single item worth eating. Avoid this place.

58.description: Stopped by on Saturday night with some friends to grab drinks.  The atmosphere and ambiance of this place are great. On top of that, service here is amazing!  Our bartender, Ryan, was the BEST!!  He was really friendly and took care of us even though we were sitting in a booth behind the bar.  He recommended some drinks and they were all fantastic.  It sounded like they have additional seating on the back patio and upstairs, but we didn't venture to check these areas out. They also have a few TVs in the main bar area if you want to catch a game. If you're in the Old Town area, I highly recommend you stop by!

56.description: Went there for a quick dinner with a friend. It was empty inside but the back area is cute, still empty though. We both ordered burgers which were good, but I asked for a couple of things off the burger and it came with them on. The waitress also asked if we wanted to sub out chips for fries, but didn't tell us they would be extra until the food came. Could be a bad waitress-good restaurant type thing, but for me it's the little things that count.

29.description: Came here last night to try this new place out. I had the pork chop and my friend had a burger and the hot fudge brownie dessert. My pork chop come without a bone and cut into pieces and was a little too fatty but I ate it all because it was good with the fries. My friend said her food was good too. The place was packed by 8pm but it is a smaller venue. The temperature also fluctuated from being warm to cold. Overall pleasant experience and affordable. Will come again to try the drink menu.

42.description: A little torn about this place, a solid 3.5 but deciding to round up or down is challenging, here's what happened:Arrived with friends for girls night and met up at the upstairs bar...which smelled fishy and musty so I was thrilled to hear that we would be sitting downstairs instead.  We were taken to the back patio which was now covered and had heat lamps, so cozy and would have been warm enough if the cute metal patio furniture had seat cushions.  Instead the metal chairs were so cold we were all sitting on our coats even though we were right next to the heat lamp... Also the patio had extremely bad acoustics, not helped by the loud music, which meant chatting with anyone not directly next to you was pretty difficult.  Unfortunate since the point of the dinner was to catch up... Moving on to the service... Nice but flaky, from spilling drinks to messing up the bill, not the best but apologetic and attentive enough.  On to the main event- the food was good, with a couple highlights:  started by sharing the beet salad, good but nothing special.  Next was the butternut squash farro, omg give the chef a raise, this one had me scrapping the bowl.  Toothsome farro in a light yet divinely creamy sauce made risotto style.  Chunks of butternut squash and well seasoned, this was the definite winner of the night.  For an entree I split the ribeye, it was a sizeable potion, slightly overcooked but flavorful.  Served with a side of scalloped potatoes and sautéed mushrooms, former were good but latter were too heavily soaked in butter... Is there such a thing as too much butter you ask?!? Up until I had the mushrooms I would have adamantly said no, I stand corrected though.  Also ordered a side of roasted brussel sprouts that were pretty good.  Overall I'd come back again, maybe in the summer when the patio is meant to be used...

23.description: Walked in and loved the vibe and music.We had a great time last night with Sean and Chris behind the bar. Their knowledge of the cocktail menu, as well as being awesome conversationalist made my time enjoyable. Sean suggested a cocktail called, when the smoke clears and it was amazing.When we asked about food, they suggested the bacon wrap dates and the cheeseburger. Honestly both were tasty, and the burger was one of the best i have had in quite sometime. Overall we had a great night. I strongly recommend checking out this one of a kind place. I know we will be back to see our two new favorite bartenders soon. Thanks guys!!!

47.description: Great addition to Old Town!   Pomp & Circumstance has a great retro vibe, good music, and great drinks.   The best highlight is the friendly, welcoming staff.  This spot has cozy nooks for a date, or ample space to chill with friends.  A welcoming neighborhood spot for sure!  Looking forward to trying their patio and their food next.

8.description: I can't speak to the bar or what this place is like in the evenings, but I can easily say that our brunch experience was the worst we have ever had in Chicago. Showed up at about 12:30 on a Saturday - waited about an hour for a table when we had originally been quoted a 15 minute wait. Had a bloody mary while we waited - fine.Once we were seated it took another 15-20 minutes for the server to come. We eventually placed our order. Had to remind the server about out coffee - we got it about 30 minutes after we ordered. Food came an hour later - kind of. They forgot about half the items, dishes were different than stated on the menu and when we asked why we didn't get them, the manager (who at this point was bringing out all the food for the whole restaurant), acted like we were crazy. We ate as fast as we could and got out of there. We were in there for over THREE hours. Insanity. All I can say is don't go for brunch - it was a nightmare. It was clear they were extremely understaffed and that the kitchen staff didn't know the menu. It was also FREEZING cold.

31.description: I've been here twice already and have enjoyed both experiences thus far. I've had the pomp burger and the grilled chicken club - both were very delicious and I highly recommend them, especially the pomp burger. The atmosphere is very relaxing and I love the decorations. The outside has a cute little patio area. A very cool and cozy vibe overall. The service is above average but both times the food took a bit long. Otherwise, I definitely recommend this place and will continue coming back!

34.description: New, trendy place in the Old Town neighborhood. The ambiance is nice but I'm not sure I'd go back. The food is nothing special. I tried the lobster roll. I've had better at other places in the city. Everyone else I was with like their food but it was nothing they've rave about.

16.description: Stopped by on Saturday night with some friends to grab drinks.  The atmosphere and ambiance of this place are great. On top of that, service here is amazing!  Our bartender, Ryan, was the BEST!!  He was really friendly and took care of us even though we were sitting in a booth behind the bar.  He recommended some drinks and they were all fantastic.  It sounded like they have additional seating on the back patio and upstairs, but we didn't venture to check these areas out. They also have a few TVs in the main bar area if you want to catch a game. If you're in the Old Town area, I highly recommend you stop by!

13.description: Overly disappointed in our visit here.  We wanted to stop by for drinks.  It was pretty crowded when we got there.  The first thing we noticed was how awkward everything was arranged.  There seemed to be no order to anything.  Service was slow.  We ordered our drinks and asked for water as well.  It took awhile to get our drinks, but they were busy so it was expected.  We never got our waters.  The drinks were not $13 quality.  There was too much ice and they didn't taste like anything special.  I'd been wanting to try this place for a few weeks, but now I'm wishing we hadn't even gone.  It looks to have so much potential, but it was a fail for us.

11.description: They painted a turd gold.-Service was slow. -It's absolutely freezing up front. - food was mediocre and expensive - Poor attempt to lure Old Town crowds into thinking they are getting a quality dining experience.

39.description: Amazing service by the bartenders. Very attentive and one bartender gave us an extra drink on the house. Great experience!!

37.description: Just had lunch here with a friend.  Service and the food was all great.  I'm so thrilled to have a restaurant like this in the area that's reasonably priced AND has good food.  The service was maybe a little too good.  There was one guy who kept stopping by our table to refill our waters and make conversation.  He was incredibly kind but he was really interrupting our experience.  I also wish they had chosen a different setup.  The booths are awkward (long... the way a date would have to sit side by side which is such an incredibly strange setup to me) and the smaller table tops have stools - this place is nice enough where the chairs around all of the high top should have back support and a place to put a purse.  But these are just a small matter of preference and not anything to deter me from returning.My friend nearly licked her plate clean of the french toast.  They were playing an old western on one of the TV's and sports on the other.  The cappuccino is delicious.  Our waiter couldn't have been more helpful or prompt.  I'll definitely go back.

0.description: 40 ft from my house with great cocktailsAviation / last word were both fantasticThe Hemingway was that every day kinda goodAll cocktails $13... A little steep but they pour accurately ..

38.description: My friend and I went here for dinner the other night. We both ordered drinks, which were delicious. I ordered the pot roast which was very tasty and tender.The problem was with my friend who ordered the pork chops. When it came out we both noticed it looked pretty pink. We thought, "there is no way they would give us undercooked pork." Wrong. My friend got nasty FOOD POISONING. He was sick all night. Be very careful when eating here!!! If you meat looks undercooked, it probably is!

51.description: They are trying to be a good restaurant, but need to tidy up some of the loose ends.  I arrived just a few minutes early before my reservation and was seated right away, however, I wasn't approached again for 10 minutes -- I went and got my own menu but I really wanted a drink.  And no one approached me to take any order.  I finally got water, but still wasn't able to order a drink.  Then everyone arrived and the server finally showed up. The menu is very confusing -- there is like a little bit of a food menu and then pages and pages and alcohol.  The food was good -- I had a wonderful beet salad with burrata cheese (seems like the new popular cheese these days) and some nondescript cauliflower side dish.  The salad was great, but the cauliflower had no taste.  I asked for pepper but didn't get it until all of the food was consumed.  The restaurant has potential but will need to work out a few of these challenges.

27.description: We made a reservation for 7 at an appropriate time for dinner or ordering food. But we were seated at a lounge area without table room for food. When I asked to be moved, they told me that when we make an open table reservation, they assume we won't be eating. Strange. They put us into a booth which was fine, then wanted us to move to a different table, and we were there 20 minutes and were never asked if we wanted a drink. Every person said something different to us, so we left and had a wonderful experience across the street. Would not recommend this place unless you want a cocktail at the bar OR wait until they get the kinks worked out.

32.description: Overall just an okay experience from ambiance to service to desserts to cocktails. The only highlight was the apple cobbler - everything else was just blah.They have a cute patio in the back which they've tried to convert to a winter-proof spot but it's still really cold. The cocktails took so long and weren't even mixed well.

54.description: A welcomed addition to the neighborhood.  Have been dying to try it out and really came away impressed.  The cocktails were creative and a great balance between booze and overall taste.  I tried 3 different ones and they were all delicious, no shock I can't remember the name of any of them.  The food was as equally impressive.  I got the NY strip steak, which for $24 was better than almost any places that charges at least double, if not more.  You literally would pay that much if you went out and bought it yourself, I don't know how they do it, but I'm not complaining.  Seriously one of the best steaks I've had in a while and yes that's including all the major spots in River North.  My dining companion got the chicken, which was also really good.  The mussels had chorizo mixed in, which was a nice departure from the standard fare and the charcuterie plate had a top notch array of really high quality cured meats, comparable to what I've had in Spain.  With a great atmosphere and patio and the drinks and food to match, this is definitely my new go to in the area.

48.description: Came here pretty hungry for drinks and a late dinner around 10pm back in September.  Thought this would be a good pick since it seemed more cocktail-focused than the other options on Wells but I was disappointed and probably won't be back.Drinks:  The 2 cocktails we ordered - Watermelon Cooler and an Old Fashioned - seemed watered down and off balance.  Definitely not worth the $13 price tag because I probably could've got the same taste at one of the sports bars down the street for $4-5 less... or gotten a better tasting cocktail at Old Town Social for the same price. :XFood: Mussels, NY strip and side of brussels sprouts. Overall, it was all OK but again, not worth the $$$ because the quality and flavors just weren't up to par.  Mussels were fine but more than a handful of them didn't open and they were a bit dry because there wasn't enough broth/juice in the pot it was served in.  Steak we ordered was cooked correctly but the sauce they served it with was salty. I did enjoy the garlicky mashed potatoes that came with the steak and the side of brussels sprouts we ordered were good too.We were sat in the back patio area which looked really cute and quaint.  Loved the patio furniture they selected and the twinkling lights overhead.  Our waitress was nice and service was fine so the 2-star review is basically for the meh drinks/food.

44.description: Great location, great decor, good service, good food.  Our only complaint (an expensive one) was the "24oz" specialty cocktail which wasn't anywhere close close to 24oz for $30.  We split one just to check it out and were ok with it looking a little light in the pour as we did ask to split it and trying to not complain.  We then ordered a second for my husband alone and it wasn't even close to a 24oz cocktail.  We had to look down in the mug to find where the cocktail started.   The server had more club soda added to make sure it was filled up - thanks????   We paid $60 for maybe a total of 1 24oz cocktail and the only liquor in it was a higher end vodka.  It puts a customer in a bad position to have to say something to the Manager so we didn't - we didn't want to be "those people" but hindsight we should have as we left feeling ripped off due to that full charge on the bill.  We just assumed that if a nice place like that promotes a $30 24oz cocktail on the front of their drink list they would be honorable about it. I would try it again but would stick with the basics.

24.description: Shawn was an awesome bartender! Super friendly, easy going and definitely made me want to return. First time at the bar and had a great experience. Great hidden spot in Old Town.

7.description: Stopped by for Saturday breakfast with the husband. We walked here from uptown so it was a hike and we were starving by the time we got in. I love the decor and the small booths in the back but we ended up at the bar since we didn't have reservations. The French press coffee was delicious. The lobster omelette and lobster benedict very very delicious. Also enjoyed the parfait and French toast side. Guess we were hungry!! However service was very slow and that takes away a star when one is hungry.

49.description: Overall experience was above average. Drinks were good. We got the cheese board that was insulting; for $18 you get 4 thinly sliced pieces of cheese and a small scoop of blue cheese. I wouldn't call that a cheese board. Beet salad was awesome, very delicious. Burger was great. However, we were told they would substitute chips for fries and when we got the bill they had applied a surcharge.  It's not a lot of money added to the bill, but it's the principal of it all (the waitress told us it is their policy not to inform of that stuff because it is assumed we know). I should note that the manager was very accommodating when we brought some issues up. He deducted for more than the the issues we brought up which was very appreciated. Honestly would not return in the future.

40.description: I thought the food was good but a bit overpriced. It also took a long time for our food to come and the service was a bit slow. With a newer place, I expect service to be a bit slower. The atmosphere was cool and the drink list was great.

53.description: Awesome place! Great cocktails and really unique, charming atmosphere. Highly recommended!

30.description: the food is just ok~ the outdoor patio is great!

46.description: Such friendly staff and we loved the Lobster Benedict. The French toast was amazing!

1.description: Excellent service all around, from the bartender to our server.  Top notch, pleasant, kept all the orders straight, very fast and nimble.Started with the bison tartare (tasty and meaty), bacon wrapped dates (can't ever go wrong), and the charcuterie (a bit more bite needed in the selections, and could jack up the portion just a smidge).I had the lobster roll which was pretty standard, but had decent chunks of crustacean.  The Manhattans are fantastic, smoky, sweet, and nicely balanced.

55.description: Just had another great meal at Pomp & Circumstance in Old Town.  Vibe is old school and hip, drinks are done right and the food is delicious!  Gotta try the bison tartare, salmon, and lobster roll.  Can't wait to come back and try more next time.

9.description: The boyfriend and I decided to give Pomp & Circumstance a try on a Friday night. We were able to get a reservation last minute which was great, albeit I was a tad skeptical because let's be real, it's not easy getting a last minute reservation in Chicago on a FRIDAY night. But we made it!Initial thought upon entering: Awesome vibe, unique vintage decor, and real candles that were lit with real fire! I loved it! And the photos following you up the staircase to the lounge were right up my alley.Play-by-play: Once we were seated, we had to wait quite some time for our waitress to notice we were even there. Granted it was a busy night and we were in a corner, but I was still a little surprised that it took 15 minutes to be noticed. Finally! She does! First, we order our drinks. An Old Fashioned for me and a PBR for the boyfriend. This took about another 10-15 minutes to receive. They weren't the craziest of drink orders so once again, we were surprised at the wait. Now by no means do we want to be rushed through our date, but it would be nice to have our drinks early so we can peruse the menu whilst sipping. Then we ordered our food which consisted of a Chicken Caesar Salad and Scallops. And yet another long wait for a surprisingly light meal. Last, but not least, we order the cheesecake for dessert. AND OH MY GOSH, it was amazing! This was, by far, the highlight of the meal for the both of us. It was surprisingly big and only $7 so that was a nice.Final synopsis: Even though our waitress was very, very nice, she could have been a little more attentive. The table next to us told us that they had been having the same issue with waiting a long time for drinks and food so we weren't alone in our feelings. All in all, we will go back again for that cheesecake! And to give the menu another try. Hopefully this time around, the service will be a little quicker!

26.description: Giant booths (for two people!), yummy cocktails, and good eats.  (The pot roast is AMAZING.)  I've also always found the service to be really friendly and enthusiastic, which is why we keep coming back.

25.description: Love this new spot! Great music, great atmosphere and amazing drinks!  The bar downstairs is cool and the food is great.  On the weekends, go upstairs! Sean is awesome... he makes amazing cocktails (who knew an OF was an old fashioned??!) and good conversation all night to boot.  Love this addition to the neighborhood!

12.description: My friends and I were super excited to try this place for brunch last Saturday morning. When we walked in, we didn't see the host stand since no one was there, so we were kind of lost and started to walk towards the back. We saw a guy who kind of looked like he worked there, so we asked him if he did, and he said yes. There were about 8 empty tables, so we asked if we could sit or if he needed to seat us, and he rudely said he needed to seat us, and that we had walked past the host stand, so we went back to the front. After he saw there were four of us, he said he'd seat us in a few minutes, seeming annoyed.We sat in some vacant chairs up front, looked a the menu, and were getting excited about the Lobster and Truffle omelet. Yum!The host disappeared for 10 min. When he came back, he didn't even acknowledge that we were still there, and there were still at least 8 empty tables. He left again.He came back about 5 min later. Still ignored us. We then asked him if we could just sit where we were already sitting up front, and he said no. Then left again.He came back a few minutes later, and we asked again about getting seated seeing as the place was half empty and we were afraid if he left again, we wouldn't see him for a while. He rudely said he'd seat us in a few minutes, did not apologize, and rudely said they were understaffed, and walked away again.Despite being super excited to try that omelet, he was so rude and it was so annoying to be standing around for no reason, so we left.Having working in hospitality myself, if he was truly understaffed, that is unfortunate, but there are much better ways to handle the situation. His tone and attitude were so unnecessary, and did not make us feel welcome in the least bit. If I owned this place, I certainly wouldn't want him to be the face of my establishment.When we left, we went to The Vig instead, spent a lot of money, and had a much more positive experience.

59.description: Hmmm I'm really debating between the 4 and 5 stars, but I think this place is worthy of 5 stars. I stopped by for a preview last night and was very pleasantly surprised. Old Town usually isn't my hood of choice, but I think I can make an exception for Pomp & Circumstance. I didn't care much for the watermelon cooler--- a lot of watermelon cocktails seem to disappoint me though, so I guess I have high standards for that. I really liked the Pink Lady though-- had a few of those last night.
