I tried a sip of the North Park Ave, and as much as I love me a stiff drink, this is definitely a man's drink---- there is no frou frou in any of that shit. The bacon wrapped dates were done superbly here, but what blew me away were the burgers here.... omg the sides of the burger bun were crisp, and the burger was so juicy that the juice squirted out the other end when I bit into it. Soooo good. Will definitely have to hit up this place again.

21.description: Jon and I were in town to celebrate the New Year and what better way to kick off 2016 than with a little Pomp & Circumstance (pun intended!!).AMBIANCE:* This review pertains to the second floor only. I was told that the manager was a former Manhattanite, which may be why the restaurant has that underground-hipster, but shabby-chic vibe. Depending on where you sat, you could envision yourself in a speakeasy or in someone's parlor. We reserved the best seats in the house, the booth next to the DJ and in front of the bar. If you're coming with a group of friends (seating approximately 4-6), get that booth! Who knows, karaoke night might be in your cards since you're so close in proximity to alcohol and music.COCKTAILS:* Sean was the best bartender, and he whipped up some fun drinks through the night. I loved "When the Smoke Clears," it tasted like a mix between a mojito, a julep, with bubbly champagne. And many thanks to the restaurant for the additional champagne throughout the night! FOOD:The New Year menu was drool-worthy, I'm still dreaming about that medium-rare steak and mushroom ravioli. I noticed that the New Year menu is not offered on the regular menu, so I won't bore you with the delicious, delicious details. However, if steak and or ravioli are ever offered on the menu, GET IT! Or if you're hosting a private event there, ask about that steak and ravioli you read about on some random yelper's review.

17.description: Just visited Pomp and Circumstance and the only thing that topped the food was our amazing bartender John. Not only was he super friendly, he was very knowledgable about the cocktails and beer that matched our style.  I recommend the Pink Lady and the North Park Ave.  Both were very tasty and I enjoyed watching John work his magic!  If you go for dinner try starting with the bacon dates.  The bacon was perfectly crisp and the dates were big and plump.  The Pomp Burger was also delicious.  It's a double patty topped with butterkase cheese, house pickles, pomp sauce, shredded lettuce, tomato and red onion.  The burger was perfectly cooked and perfectly juicy.Pomp and Circumstance is a great addition to Old Town.  For amazing drinks and great food go check this place out!

10.description: Overall just an okay experience from ambiance to service to desserts to cocktails. The only highlight was the apple cobbler - everything else was just blah.They have a cute patio in the back which they've tried to convert to a winter-proof spot but it's still really cold. The cocktails took so long and weren't even mixed well.

5.description: Cool bar! The first floor is the restaurant and also has a small bar but the second floor is where it's at! Good vibes and has a classy but fun feel to it. The bartenders were nice. My friend described to one of them the taste and level of alcohol she wanted and the suggestions were helpful.

3.description: A play on words?  For "Pomp and circumstance" is all about grandeur and this place is about as down to earth as they come.  But the name did give us something to talk about during our dinner here the other night.Pomp and Circumstance (P&C) surely has one of the longest bar names in Chicago!  But a bar with all of these little nooks and crannies to tuck away into, it worthy of such a moniker.  As you enter the first floor bar and dining area, there is a fireplace and hightop and booths tucked away on one side with the bar lining the other.  The bar is showing vintage movies from the 40's and 50's and on the day I was there they were offering a "Beatnik special "( Malort anyone?  I had to order some just for the uninitiated in our group).  Crist (sp?) at the bar was great, mixing up our drinks and quick with suggestions.  He even stuffed some bleu cheese into olives for my martini.  Sweet!We were a group of 8 so we had a couple of tables pushed together on the back patio.  The roof looks to be retractable so this will be a great place to sit outside in the summer and have some cocktails.  And during the cooler moths, they also have heaters out there so you are never cold.  The only downside?  It's loud out there.Upstairs there is a more loungey type space, with softer chairs, another bar and a corner banquette that looks perfect for gathering with friends.For dinner we had a wide range of the menu.  Our favs?  The bacon wrapped dates, the Cheeseburger and the mussels.  We ordered the cheese plate but felt it was a little colloquial, offering up some pretty basic cheeses and in need of more bread.The chicken came in a close second to the burger, though.  Service was just okay as there were long gaps between seeing the server and we had to flag someone down to get us more water.The decor is comfortable ad not fancy.  And the music ranged from the 50's to the 80's with the 60's being the sweet spot.All in all, P&C is off to a great start.  Hopefully with a name like that, they are going to have a whole "parade" of great reviews!

35.description: True to their words, the drinks were stiff. However, the lack of attention to details in cocktails leaves room for improvement. There was a significant piece of ice in my martini and I think for a $13 cocktail, that kind of blunder is simply not going to cut it. This could have been easily avoided by using a fine mesh strainer.

19.description: Came here last night to try this new place out. I had the pork chop and my friend had a burger and the hot fudge brownie dessert. My pork chop come without a bone and cut into pieces and was a little too fatty but I ate it all because it was good with the fries. My friend said her food was good too. The place was packed by 8pm but it is a smaller venue. The temperature also fluctuated from being warm to cold. Overall pleasant experience and affordable. Will come again to try the drink menu.

28.description: Great service.  Bruce keep the drinks coming and the support staff left no glass empty. We ordered the chicken and pot roast. They were prepared perfect. The pot roast was nicely proportioned. Although I wished there were more potatoes it was delicious. The chicken was great, cooked perfectly juicy and flavorful.  BF paired the chicken with a delicious Chardonay.  We had The Blinker. It was Soo amazing. We loved them so much we had 3. I'm sure we will be back to have them again. The music was great and the ambiance was perfect for our celebration.

45.description: Came on a Friday night with a friend in town visiting - despite there being several open tables, the hostess sat us smack dab in between two tables in the long shared booth - usually a cozy spot but not sure the logic when there were plenty of other seating options.My friend asked for a Bud Light (I know, I know) but was told they didn't carry it. After getting a blank stare from the waitress as we asked for the beer menu, we finally received a cocktail and beer list. And shocker, Bud Light WAS on the menu. I ordered a Ketel Dirty Martini which didn't taste quite right - and saw later on the bill that it was Grey Goose. Minor detail but give people what they ask for.The worst part was that we ordered the Crab Rangoon and bit into it only to discover that the center was still slightly frozen with ice chips throughout. So nothing like ordering at a restaurant and then realizing they serve frozen food.The odds of me coming back here are slim to none although the rooftop patio is enticing. Hoping that this was just newbie restaurant bad luck and I hear better things to bring me back.

33.description: I have mix feelings about this place. The food was good. I enjoyed the atmosphere. The drinks could have been stiffer but they were lovely nonetheless. However the service was lacking. Although the bartender was nice, after he confirmed what my friend and I wanted for our next round he forgot to make me mine drink after finishing hers. It was strange...I've never had that happen before. How do you forget half the order? We went there on a Tuesday so it wasn't jammed packed or anything. I ended up asking the other bartender (who we decided was probably the manager) to make me my drink. The service was just slower than expected. We sat around with nothing to drink for ten minutes before the bartender noticed. There was a group of three or four people who stood beside us for five minutes before yelling out as they were leaving that this was the third time they've tried to drink at Pomp & Circumstances but they could never get service. No one seemed bothered by this outburst. It was a Tuesday! I can imagine it taking awhile to get to someone if the place was super busy but it wasn't. Overall I had a good time and may go back.

43.description: Welcome to Old Town, Pomp & Circumstance!  Check out the statement-making 10 foot entrance door. Think speak easy interior decor, fresh farm to table food, and crowd pleasing hits from the 60s and 70s playing ("Thriller", "Hit the Road Jack", and a few token Stevie Wonder jams).  It makes for a fun environment!  I can't wait to come back!  The extensive drink list is calling my name. Though the food is incredibly tasty, you won't have to graduate into your fat pants because the portions are appropriately sized.  I enjoyed a lobster roll (mayo based), though it wasn't my favorite, as it could have used more lobster (like always!) and less greens.  Highly recommend the roasted cauliflower or brussel sprouts as healthy and flavorful sides ($8 each)!  The brussel sprouts were extra crispy on the outside and dressed perfectly.  My husband inhaled the scallop entree, which is served on top of onions and a butternut squash puree.My only gripe is that the price point is a bit high.  Our dinner for 2 was about $85 after tax and tip.

2.description: I went here last weekend for brunch, and had a pretty good experience. We were with two couples and a couple of young kids, and we all found plenty that we liked on the menu (not every brunch spot would have worked for us). The booths were especially nice for the kids, as it kept them stationary for (most of) the meal. Ambiance and music was great - definitely noticed it.The food we all ordered was really good. Special plug for the chilaquiles - they're delicious! Had the right ratio of meat to tortilla chips, which is not always the case at every restaurant. Everyone else's food seemed great too, and there was a nice selection of drinks available too. Service was solid, and the waiter had some helpful tips on the menu as well.Overall, nice addition to the neighborhood, and will return here soon.

18.description: Hmmm I'm really debating between the 4 and 5 stars, but I think this place is worthy of 5 stars. I stopped by for a preview last night and was very pleasantly surprised. Old Town usually isn't my hood of choice, but I think I can make an exception for Pomp & Circumstance. I didn't care much for the watermelon cooler--- a lot of watermelon cocktails seem to disappoint me though, so I guess I have high standards for that. I really liked the Pink Lady though-- had a few of those last night. I tried a sip of the North Park Ave, and as much as I love me a stiff drink, this is definitely a man's drink---- there is no frou frou in any of that shit. The bacon wrapped dates were done superbly here, but what blew me away were the burgers here.... omg the sides of the burger bun were crisp, and the burger was so juicy that the juice squirted out the other end when I bit into it. Soooo good. Will definitely have to hit up this place again.

41.description: Stopped in for a drink after dining in the neighborhood.  We sat upstairs at the bar and later on at a sofa overlooking Wells.  I can't speak to the food or cocktails since I only had a glass of wine but I can say the interior decor and overall atmosphere was very cool.  The place had a retro, swanky lounge meets rustic industrial vibe.  It was nice to go somewhere other than a sports bar.  Curved sofas and high back booths invite you to get comfortable and stay for awhile.  The two downsides were the funky fish/mildew/bathroom (?) smell on the 2nd floor and the price of our bill.  Even though we were only there for drinks, I still thought our bill was high.

52.description: My husband and I had an absolutely lovely time at Pomp & Circumstance's back patio. The menu is just right -- some creativity without being crazy and some variety without trying to be everything. Even though it wasn't on the cocktail menu, the bartender made me a perfect classic Sazerac (not a common skill out there). And my husband had a great beer selection. The server told us that the patio will be open year-round, which is SO nice since it's a bit of magic with pretty wrought iron furniture, TVs that are not the center of attention but make it inviting for my sports-guy spouse, and a great playlist in the background. At this time of year, there's a wall of red geraniums....hope they find a way to keep some visual interest when the weather turns. It's a place where conversation is possible while still catering to the TV/music interests of their guests.  I really hope it stays that way, as so many spots on Wells play TVs and music so loud, it's impossible to talk at the table. In summary, we think Pomp & Circumstance is an A+ addition to the Wells corridor....it offers an unmet need for those of us who enjoy a bit of nuance and consideration.

50.description: Restaurant has a funny smell. We sat on the patio outback (it is heated), it is cute. Three of us girls shared the 240z Shakedown drink, which comes in a super cute pineapple glass.  Drink was tasty.

4.description: Jon and I were in town to celebrate the New Year and what better way to kick off 2016 than with a little Pomp & Circumstance (pun intended!!).AMBIANCE:* This review pertains to the second floor only. I was told that the manager was a former Manhattanite, which may be why the restaurant has that underground-hipster, but shabby-chic vibe. Depending on where you sat, you could envision yourself in a speakeasy or in someone's parlor. We reserved the best seats in the house, the booth next to the DJ and in front of the bar. If you're coming with a group of friends (seating approximately 4-6), get that booth! Who knows, karaoke night might be in your cards since you're so close in proximity to alcohol and music.COCKTAILS:* Sean was the best bartender, and he whipped up some fun drinks through the night. I loved "When the Smoke Clears," it tasted like a mix between a mojito, a julep, with bubbly champagne. And many thanks to the restaurant for the additional champagne throughout the night! FOOD:The New Year menu was drool-worthy, I'm still dreaming about that medium-rare steak and mushroom ravioli. I noticed that the New Year menu is not offered on the regular menu, so I won't bore you with the delicious, delicious details. However, if steak and or ravioli are ever offered on the menu, GET IT! Or if you're hosting a private event there, ask about that steak and ravioli you read about on some random yelper's review.

6.description: Welcome to Old Town, Pomp & Circumstance!  Check out the statement-making 10 foot entrance door. Think speak easy interior decor, fresh farm to table food, and crowd pleasing hits from the 60s and 70s playing ("Thriller", "Hit the Road Jack", and a few token Stevie Wonder jams).  It makes for a fun environment!  I can't wait to come back!  The extensive drink list is calling my name. Though the food is incredibly tasty, you won't have to graduate into your fat pants because the portions are appropriately sized.  I enjoyed a lobster roll (mayo based), though it wasn't my favorite, as it could have used more lobster (like always!) and less greens.  Highly recommend the roasted cauliflower or brussel sprouts as healthy and flavorful sides ($8 each)!  The brussel sprouts were extra crispy on the outside and dressed perfectly.  My husband inhaled the scallop entree, which is served on top of onions and a butternut squash puree.My only gripe is that the price point is a bit high.  Our dinner for 2 was about $85 after tax and tip.

22.description: Spence and Sean were phenomenal! The food was delicious and the service was great! Will definitely be coming back!

15.description: Enjoyed experience here the waiter was new but they tried to sell him as one of their best when we were seated. A few probing questions from my girlfriend proved that. Food was very good we had the ousters and the burger. Drink selection was God and interesting.

57.description: New place in Old Town that we hope will thrive. We had a quick dinner after getting seated immediately with no reservation. Food was excellent, particularly the pork belly. A nice experience.

20.description: A play on words?  For "Pomp and circumstance" is all about grandeur and this place is about as down to earth as they come.  But the name did give us something to talk about during our dinner here the other night.Pomp and Circumstance (P&C) surely has one of the longest bar names in Chicago!  But a bar with all of these little nooks and crannies to tuck away into, it worthy of such a moniker.  As you enter the first floor bar and dining area, there is a fireplace and hightop and booths tucked away on one side with the bar lining the other.  The bar is showing vintage movies from the 40's and 50's and on the day I was there they were offering a "Beatnik special "( Malort anyone?  I had to order some just for the uninitiated in our group).  Crist (sp?) at the bar was great, mixing up our drinks and quick with suggestions.  He even stuffed some bleu cheese into olives for my martini.  Sweet!We were a group of 8 so we had a couple of tables pushed together on the back patio.  The roof looks to be retractable so this will be a great place to sit outside in the summer and have some cocktails.  And during the cooler moths, they also have heaters out there so you are never cold.  The only downside?  It's loud out there.Upstairs there is a more loungey type space, with softer chairs, another bar and a corner banquette that looks perfect for gathering with friends.For dinner we had a wide range of the menu.  Our favs?  The bacon wrapped dates, the Cheeseburger and the mussels.  We ordered the cheese plate but felt it was a little colloquial, offering up some pretty basic cheeses and in need of more bread.The chicken came in a close second to the burger, though.  Service was just okay as there were long gaps between seeing the server and we had to flag someone down to get us more water.The decor is comfortable ad not fancy.  And the music ranged from the 50's to the 80's with the 60's being the sweet spot.All in all, P&C is off to a great start.  Hopefully with a name like that, they are going to have a whole "parade" of great reviews!

36.description: Very cute place! Outstanding food, anything you order is a winner! I was very impressed with their oysters, crab rangoon, their gourmet burger and a side of brussel sprouts... A+ on food and presentation! With this said, I still gave them only 3 stars, here is why: Terrible diner-style dessert. The brownie felt old, and was presented barely warm with a scoop of very average ice cream and a canned cherry on top... Sad.The place is tiny and has two entrances near each other, with no double-doors (a must for Chicago!) so it gets really drafty and cold with every person walking in or out, you have to sit with your coat on. Another strike against them was the service. Although the rest of their staff were very nice and willing to step in to help us, our waitress (also polite) was unfortunately not capable of waiting tables. She mixed up our orders and was MIA most of the time. Wine list needs improvement. The only non-California red was a Malbec and they were out of it. All the other reds were California cabs. If the management is reading this, please feel free to reach out, it would be my pleasure to help you with your wine list!

14.description: Love this new spot! Great music, great atmosphere and amazing drinks!  The bar downstairs is cool and the food is great.  On the weekends, go upstairs! Sean is awesome... he makes amazing cocktails (who knew an OF was an old fashioned??!) and good conversation all night to boot.  Love this addition to the neighborhood!

Chris is great!  He was really patient and a great teacher.  I would highly recommend taking classes.  It really is a great way to relieve stress and have fun!Chris also has the personality that would be good with children.

3.description: The owner Rocks!! What an awesome place to come learn a new skill or to wake up that winter-induced dormant brain's Creative Center. The 3 hour Happy Hour Class was the best!! Can't wait to pick up my creations!!

1.description: My boyfriend and I did the byob pottery class on a Friday night and we had so much fun! Our instructor Chris was very nice and provided all the right instructions. We played around with clay and ended up making some awesome stuff. We are definitely going back for a beginners class.

2.description: Before coming to this place I was really skeptical. Went for a happy hour class. The experience was really great. The instructor was very helpful, the equipments were user friendly even for first timers. Everything was perfect about this place, great music, great experience and lots of fun.. Didn't realize how 3 hrs flew by.. Definitely planning for a beginners class. A great way to spend an evening, away from work life pressure. Highly recommended, must try!!

9.description: Took a group of 10 to PPP. We didnt know if they would enjoy it but it was part of a surprise weekend, where we planned the agenda.Chris did a great job of getting us all up to speed with our clay projects. Everyone had a Ton of fun and created some really great masterpieces.We are all anxious to to get our glazed finished products back. Thanks chris!

18.description: Wife and I went for happy hour class.  Learned the basics and were both able to make something in the first session.  Really a good break from the winter cabin fever. Chris was great and very helpful!

10.description: A group of 5 of us girls attended the happy hour class last night. Such a great night! We learned a lot and I know I'll be looking into taking some classes and another happy hour session ASAP!

4.description: On a dreary May night with no plans, we set out to find a date night that differed from the norm.  We stumbled upon Penguin Foot's BYOB pottery class and had the best time! The class had the perfect amount of structure.  Chris would give words of wisdom and help out when necessary but also provided space if you would prefer to just drink and socialize and figure things out for yourself.  Two weeks later he followed up to come in and glaze which was quick, easy, and fun.  We will definitely come back.  It was a great deal and a fun activity.  And if you follow it up with a reservation at 90 miles across the street for dinner you've got a perfect date night!

16.description: Great hand-made ceramic goods and art. If you want something unique for your kitchen, or decorative for your home, you should check it out.

6.description: We hosted a networking evening at Penguin Foot Pottery and it was a BLAST!  I haven't done anything pottery-related since I was in elementary school but managed to make a couple of cute little containers that I can't wait to see once they've been fired.  I loved the laid back environment and that there was no pressure to make something quickly and be done.  I must have destroyed 10 pots before I made one I wanted to keep.  It was an AMAZING evening and Elizabeth C. was absolutely right, Chris has great taste in music!  Thanks Chris and Paige!

11.description: Visited with my wife without an appointment.  Great studio setup and conveniently located.  We had a great time, Chris gave us a quick intro on the setup and we dove in hands on.  Lots of fun, and will definitely be returning often.

12.description: I went to penguin foot pottery while visiting a friend who lives in Chicago and must say I had a wonderful time! I didn't have any experience with pottery, or crafts for that matter, but I would still recommend this place to everyone. The instructor was great and it all made for a very fun class, also BYOB. Check it out.

17.description: Initially found this through a Groupon last winter, and then didn't stop. I took 4 sessions on Tuesday nights. It's such a low key studio and non intimidating place to try a new creative outlet! I had never tried pottery before and was so happy I did.Chris is a cool, laid back, friendly and approachable dude with a good sense of humor who is great with adults and kids. He is a former CPS teacher who decided to open up his own studio. Side note: He also has good taste in music (a mix of Beastie Boys, Modest Mouse, Bob Dylan, and the White Stripes while I muck around in clay? Don't mind if I do.)  He encourages you to play around, mess up, get messy, and figure it out on your own in a no pressure atmosphere, and provides as much or as little instruction as you want.)It's a small business that warms your heart to support, and prices are a DEAL for what you get. As much clay as pieces you can make, glazing, and open studio time on Saturdays. If you miss a class, they're super flexible and let you make it up.   I haven't been back in about 6 months but I'm looking forward to my schedule opening up to do another session.

5.description: LOVE Penguin Foot Pottery! My best friend and I took the introductory class in the spring. Our instructor Chris was great at teaching us how to get started and as the classes progressed so did our lessons. Chris is great at answering questions and always offers one on one help. The atmosphere is fun and creative. We always meet super creative people and have a blast. We decided to go back tonight (Saturday) for the happy hour (byob) pottery. Since we had been before we didn't need much instruction but Chris took the time to give several lessons to the entire group. We got to keep two of our pieces and are going next weekend to glaze them once they have been fired! I can't wait to go back and bring more friends!

13.description: My significant other and I went to the happy hour class, it was a great time. I misunderstood how the pot glaze/pick-up went and was waiting for a call. Turns out, you just show up a few weeks later.

7.description: I just started a 4-week beginning pottery class and I am totally in love! I had no idea how rewarding it would be to create something that I can actually use from a blob of clay. The space is really open and bright and you can tell that a lot of planning went into laying out the different areas. Everything just flows really well. Chris, the owner, is super knowledgeable and talented and has a very easy way about his teaching. I'm half way through the course, but I know that I will be continuing. If you've ever had any interest in pottery, I highly recommend checking out Penguin Foot.

8.description: Parking is free and close to El train and the building is an artsy, loft setting. The 4 week intro pottery throwing class is great (so far) and I am having lots of fun. As enrolled students we are invited to come use a wheel any time one is open, and we can practice to our heart's delight (and our entire body if covered in clay). So much fun, a great deal and great environment for being creative.

19.description: My daughter and I just finished up a "Happy Hour Class". Simply awesome. Chris was great, taught us the essentials and let us have a ball!

0.description: I went to Penguin Foot for my girlfriend's birthday party and we had a great time! It was so fun to find something out of the ordinary to do to celebrate with her friends, and I think everyone had a good time (albeit with some bouts of frustration) on the pottery wheel. The instructor, Chris, was incredibly patient with our crew's very limited pottery skills, and was super nice about everything, even helping us find a delicious local pizza place to order dinner from. I would recommend Penguin Foot to anyone looking for a unique social and/or artistic experience, beginner or expert.

15.description: I started my first pottery class at Penguin Foot in January 2011 as a total beginner. The class size was perfect and Chris was an excellent teacher, providing simple yet detailed instructions for each stage of throwing, trimming and glazing. I've now completed my third class and can't wait to continue!

58.description: All around worst brunch I've had in the city.We had friends visiting from out of town and thought the Kanela in Old Town would be a great spot.  We have eaten at the Bucktown and Lakeview locations and have had a very nice meal, even on a busy Saturday or Sunday morning.Unfortunately the old town location was pretty miserable all around.  Here are the facts from our brunch:-Were quoted a 30 minute wait for 4.  It ultimately turned out to be an hour.  The extra half hour was to wait for two tables to flip, which should have been an indicator for what was to come.-When we were finally notified of our table, there appeared to be a mix up and had to wait an additional 5 minutes.-The hostess did apologize for the excess wait, and told us we would get a free monkeybread appetizer.  More on that below.-Our server came over to introduce himself and take our drink order.  About 30 seconds late he cames over and told us that he was leaving to go to the Sox game and hoped the weather held out for him.  We just kind of sit there...-The monkey bread showed up 5 minutes later and appeared to be a goopy mess in a cast iron skillet.  It appeared undercooked on top and burnt on the bottom, as it neither resembled nor tasted like monkeybread or any sort of bread.  Our coffee and drinks had not yet arrived, and no plates were provided. -We order our food and wait...and wait... and wait for our four meals for about 30 minute. The server tells us our food will "be out in a just a moment" and we proceed to wait an additional 15 minutes for our food.-The food arrives and is completely underwhelming.  The omelet is colored bright yellow and looks like it had been sitting in a vat of melted butter.  My breakfast sandwich is served with an egg with the yolk already broken (and slightly undercooked) on top.  The biscuits and gravy have a strange terribly overcooked sausage patty/hamburger in them.  While this sort of place would likely do fine in a small town competing with the likes of applebees and chilis, I simply can't see this place continuing in the city with these issues.  You'll notice that there are other recent reviews citing these same issues. The other locations of Kanela are actually quite good.... this place in no way resembed the food and service of either the Lakeview or Bucktown restaurants.

56.description: I ordered the Lorraine scramble, which was a combination of eggs, bacon, Gruyere, carmelized onions, and scallions. The omelette was pretty delicious, but the potatoes served on the side were just okay. I prefer my hash browns to be, well, brown. These potatoes were very lightly done. The honey butter served with the toast was a nice surprise though. Would have given 4 stars, but the hostess told us it would be a 20 minute wait, but clearly put down 30 in her booking app. We were in a rush to get to the airport, so we might not have stayed had we known how long it would take.

29.description: This was the first place I ate while visiting Chicago and it was amazing to say the least! It is now on my list of best breakfast I have ever had. My husband also enjoyed his breakfast and we both left stuffed. For the area it comes at a really great prize.We ate outside on the patio on a Friday morning. There was no wait and we were seated right away even though the place was pretty full. I had biscuits and gravy. I have had a lot of biscuits and gravy living in the south but these were the best I have ever eaten! The plate was enough to feed two people. It came with several super delicious biscuits, southern style house pork sausage, smothered in sage gravy, 2 sunny side eggs, and a side of potatoes. You get all that for $12. My husband had a breakfast sandwich which he loved. It had house made pork sausage, cheddar, sunny side egg, arugula, a spicy pepper jam, and was served on a english muffin. It came with a few options for a side and he decided on fresh fruit.

42.description: After trying out both breakfast and lunch options at Kanela, I must say that I think they do both quite well.  This last time I tried their goat cheese & beet salad with smoked salmon and it was a very refreshing choice for the warm summer weather.  Sundays there is always a wait when I have been, but nothing more than 30 minutes usually.  Their portion sizes are generous and reasonably priced.

23.description: STOP SEARCHING. EAT HERE ALREADY!!! :) Pitcher of bloody Mary's was delish, food was AWESOME, and the service was exceptional! Shout out to Drew... Super fun, definitely made the experience all the more memorable.Without a doubt this place deserves a visit. Warm, inviting, classy without being pretentious, and reasonably priced. So once again...STOP SEARCHING. EAT HERE ALREADY! :)

47.description: Delicious food and yummy latte's plus they have almond milk, any alternative milk besides soy always earns them an extra star in my book! The food was good tho and service was great!

8.description: We've stopped her numerous times for brunch as it is right down the street from us.  They have their menu broken into separate tastes, sweet, savory etc.I don't eat a lot of eggs so I tend to peruse the sweet section of the menu, and I really do enjoy some good processed sugar. Given this I've tried several of the items and they are all quite delicious, though I'm not so sure how much your waist line appreciates them.  The S'mores pancakes are really tasty specifically.They make one hell of a bloody mary for folks who like them, it even comes with a grilled cheese square on the skewer.  They also make a killer mint flavored hot chocolate for those cold winter days.I recommend sitting at the breakfast bar for fun banter with the staff and quick service.

31.description: Easily one of my favorite brunch places in the neighborhood. I live nearby and stop in all the time! Even if I don't have time for a full brunch and just need a coffee, it's definitely worth going in instead of Starbucks, because it is STRONG and will give you the boost you need to get through the day! Also, the kanela/cinnamon pancakes are to die for. So good.

34.description: The egg white omelette is really good. Thy have good coffee and nice fresh juices. Beware of a wait for Sunday brunch. But definitely a good spot that I will return to!

16.description: Great breakfast/brunch execution here.  Had the vegetarian sausage with eggs.  Loved that the potatoes were cooked soft and perfectly browned without being greasy or burned.  Wife had the stuffed french toast which was really good as well. Will hopefully see the french toast flight on special during my next visit.  Free validated parking in the lot next door.

13.description: The food here was absolutely amazing. I had eggs benedict, many of the sides, and red velvet French toast. The honey butter for the toast was so so delicious. It was so good, I went back the same day. During that visit, there was a problem with my order, and the manager took that dish off my ticket! They were so kind!

11.description: For a Sunday brunch, it was packed, as any breakfast club should be. Luckily, my friend had an in, so we didn't have to wait as long, but even if you do, stay. The food is worth it. The menu has a lot of really tempting offerings and I could eat brunch food for every single meal for the rest of my life, so it was a tough choice. I eventually opted for the chicken and waffles, because it provides the perfect combination of sweet and savory, and I never know which one I want more for brunch. It was a good choice, as I enjoyed it immensely. Two large pieces of fried chicken breast over a thick Belgian waffle, sunny side up eggs and some honey butter to melt all over it. What's not to love? Plus, it came with really friendly service, even though the poor guy had a lot of tables to look after.I didn't try the bloody mary- but I wish I had. It has a mini grilled cheese sandwich on it! If I wasn't already packing the calories in that day, I would have tried to order a side of mini grilled cheese sandwiches. I'll definitely be back to try more off of their amazing menu!

39.description: Rob returns.  Yes Rob, the vibrant, dryly comedic waiter who ran the Old Town Kanela like a well-oiled machine of yummy goodness and relaxing ambiance with such a cool demeanor, while he doubled as the server who provided the unparalleled sense that you were not only welcomed at Kanela, but were essentially his honored guest.  indeed, Rob became an entirely separate reason to go to Kanela, so much so that during his hiatus, we could not help but reminisce about the good ole' days when Rob was there, his witty conversation and his no-nonsense responsiveness to every customers' requests, no matter how absurd. So often was the case that an adjacent customer would say to us 'you know Rob too, isn't he great?' So this is a broadcast to all Rob-missers, he has resurfaced more "Rob" than ever, actually tossing in a restrained smile once in a while, and clearly proud to be at Kanela's new Streeterville location where we made a bee-line when we heard of his return.  It not only took us back to the good ole' days of Kanela Old Town, but to the new flagship location which was outstanding.  Designed from a blank canvas it brings wood accents, modern pendant lighting, high ceilings and floor to ceiling windows facing onto 2 corners, still with the chalkboard of featured items and alcoholic concoctions, and all the usual Kanela appointments for warmth and familiarity, plus outdoor seating on both frontages, you will never have to wait to dine alfresco.  The ever evolving menu continues to be fresh, creative and fun.  A vegan menu to come and a special dog menu with the clear message dogs are welcome to boot.  Rob proudly introduced us to the new team one by one and with so much new underway, the owners were on-site and he introduced us to them too, each very welcoming and a pleasure to talk to.  While we live in Old Town, Streeterville is now in the rotation just for the Rob experience all over again.

37.description: I've loved this place since i first discovered it last year, but somewhere along the line this spring something changed. Food is never consistent anymore.  I love the specialized benedicts offered but, every time i get them, its not the same as the last time.  Usually, on my typical friday morning visit with a small child, Shannon takes fantastic care of us. 3yo Alex calls her Elsa, and enjoys conversating with her. She keeps my coffee filled and makes sure everything is good. Today, we were helped by Audrey.  After sitting for 5 minutes with not even a hello, she finally came over and simply asked if we were ready to order.   I have a decade service experience, even if you're in the weeds, introduce yourself..  one mistake was fixed by our food runner.  But alas, my coffee cup sat empty until we were done eating.  Maybe it was a bad day for her, or whatever.  Next time, unless Shannon is working we will opt for bagels across the street instead.

0.description: Really 3.5/5, but I rounded up. First off, finding the host is kind of confusing. There's no stand or anything so if the host is gone taking someone to their table, you're just awkwardly standing there trying to find someone to ask for a table. When we did find him (not long at all), we didn't have to wait which was great, probably bc we got there a little before 10 on a Sunday. Just beat the rush basically, though they did already look packed in the front. The table arrangement is kind of crowded in the back where we were seated. Our table was really close to a booth table next to us, but their backs were to us so it wasn't like we felt like we were in each other's conversations.The more important stuff:I got the Lorraine scrambler and my friend got the California Benedict with veggie bacon. For drinks, I got the peppermint mocha and she got the pumpkin spice latte (I know, basic =P). Overall, food was good and the drinks were delicious/better. I tried her veggie bacon, looked like dog food but surprisingly tasted pretty decent! My scrambler was yummy, definitely would recommend getting it. The potatoes were just okay. I think I'd go for a different side next time. Service was good, initially kind of slow but it actually got better as our area got more full, so we appreciated that.

38.description: Food is amazing and Rob is awesome. He took great care of us and helped cure my hangover with bloody Mary's and monkey bread. I'll be back each and every time I'm in Chicago.

51.description: What happened to Kanela? This is one of our favorite weekend breakfast stops in our neighborhood. Food, service are consistently good. Saturday, both were consistently bad. Signature pastry is a Kanela (cinnamon) roll - Always a highlight. Saturday my Kanela roll was ensconced in a small skillet; it was dry as dust, with a cream cheese frosting that just tasted like a mound of cream cheese on the top. We didn't - Couldn't - Eat it. Service was lousy but we had a new guy and he had too many tables but he was nice and tried real hard. Nevertheless, both our orders were massively screwed up.I hope this was just a bad day, but I don't understand how a cinnamon roll that is always so good could be SO bad.

27.description: Delicious food. Great service. We tried the Lorraine scramble and crab cake eggs Benedict and we not disappointed. Also had the regular and strawberry mimosas.....yummy!

32.description: For a Sunday brunch, it was packed, as any breakfast club should be. Luckily, my friend had an in, so we didn't have to wait as long, but even if you do, stay. The food is worth it. The menu has a lot of really tempting offerings and I could eat brunch food for every single meal for the rest of my life, so it was a tough choice. I eventually opted for the chicken and waffles, because it provides the perfect combination of sweet and savory, and I never know which one I want more for brunch. It was a good choice, as I enjoyed it immensely. Two large pieces of fried chicken breast over a thick Belgian waffle, sunny side up eggs and some honey butter to melt all over it. What's not to love? Plus, it came with really friendly service, even though the poor guy had a lot of tables to look after.I didn't try the bloody mary- but I wish I had. It has a mini grilled cheese sandwich on it! If I wasn't already packing the calories in that day, I would have tried to order a side of mini grilled cheese sandwiches. I'll definitely be back to try more off of their amazing menu!

54.description: Me and my friend got a monkey bread appetizer, and I got myself a bloody mary and the lorraine scramble with a side of pork belly. The monkey bread was tasty. The bloody was tasty. The pork belly was a bit underwhelming and dry. The lorraine scramble was a 5. I don't like leaving a place feeling like I could have made what I ordered, but better. That's how I felt with that. Maybe I ordered wrong. This is definitely a place I'd go if I lived nearby and could walk there...but not a place I'd go out of my way to drive to and wait in line for.

48.description: Mediocre preparation. A sad strip of cheese on a grilled cheese sandwich is a serious crime! Especially when the bread is two inches thick. My friends banana pancakes were undercooked. Nice airy location, but really needs to do revision on their food preps. ;-)

44.description: I recently was in and did not have the same amazing experience I always used to have.  My best friend I would loved coming here after our workouts since I live down the street and always had the best service and time whenever Rob was there, whether he was our server or not he always made sure we were taken care of. Unfortunately he's no longer there and it's just not the same, the food is mediocre and now that Rob is gone the vibe isn't the same. Don't think I'll be returning anytime soon.

24.description: Quite impressed by the bloody mary. We got it spicy but if it is too much for some people, you could water it down a tad. The cool factor: it has a piece of grilled cheese in it.Service was very helpful and attentive. I got the spicy feta omelet and my cousin got the crab cake benedict. Both were great. I liked that it was easy to make substitutions. Be prepared to wait for a table even if it's at 10am on Sunday.

7.description: We were seated promptly on a Saturday morning. Once we ordered, we had to wait about 45 minutes for the food. During this time, there was no indication of when any dish would come out. Luckily, we were seated outside, and this was back when it was still pleasant to be outside, so at least we got some fresh air over a good conversation while we waited. We had the Loukoumades to start, which were tasty, and I would recommend them if you do go. My main dish, the Lorraine scramble, was very average; I would have expected much more from a combination of gruyere and bacon. My friend didn't like her sandwich too much either (I think the chicken avocado BLT but I'm not 100% sure anymore). Overall, I liked the outdoor seating and the starter, but can't recommend it for service and brunch entrees.

49.description: I want to start off by saying I REALLY wanted to like this place. We came on a Sunday during the Wells Street Art festival. I knew there would be a wait, and that wasn't bad at all. We were able to walk around and look at the booths until our table was ready. Since we'd already looked at the menu we knew what we wanted to order as soon as we sat down.We ordered the Kanela roll for the table and it came to us overcooked and slightly brunt. It was a little disappointing because I've only been hearing how amazing it was, only to be left with a dry and hard pastry.Then it took 40 minutes before the first round of food came out. I say first round because at our table of 5 only 3 people got their meals, and the food was cold. My pancakes and my husband's eggs came out 15 minutes later.Bottom line, the servers were nice, but the wait time for COLD food left a bad taste in my mouth. A manager never came by to check to see how things were going either.Again, I know it was on a festival day, but if you're going to be open, shouldn't you be better more prepared?

40.description: I loved this place so much. I'm on vacation so I've been eating like crazy in Chicago lol. Kanela has definitely been one of my favorite spots. We went on a Tuesday morning so there was no wait time at all. We just went in there and picked the table we liked. The food was amazing!! I'm like Ron Swanson when it comes to breakfast food so I destroyed my plate  I had the eggs/bacon/sausage/toast and potatoes and my girlfriend ordered the chocolate chip with Cocoa krispies pancakes. Those pancakes seriously changed my life. I never order pancakes, I always get French toast but I'm seriously glad I got the pancakes this time. Whenever a friend of mine goes to Chicago I'm definitely going to recommend them to go here.

53.description: Not worth the 45 minute wait.Cocktails were fabulous!They screwed up our order, so brought us the doughnuts, monkey bread and kanela roll. IDK how you make a cinnamon roll taste like nothing, but it did. The doughnuts were good, but more like funnel cake.Crabcake benedict was delicous! My friend had the chorizo wrap and enjoyed it.Overall, I will not be back. Just so blah. Service was good, but VERY LOUD!

30.description: Kanela's is one of my favorite brunch spots, although it's pretty small so you often have to wait. The staff has always been friendly and the food is good. The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because they took the Raspberry Cheesecake Stuffed French Toast off the menu and it was easily the best item (the other french toasts just don't compare!).

46.description: Definitely one of the best breakfasts we've had in a long time!! Came here on the Fourth of July and it was pretty packed. The chicken and waffles were amazing - the chicken was so tender and had a great breaking on it. It also came with this awesome sweet and spicy sauce that really made the whole dish over the top good. We got an order of Kanela french toast too - challah bread with a lemon cream and apricot jam. The perfect summery breakfast dish. Service was neither great nor horrible but the food really stood out so we didn't care!

1.description: Here for Sunday brunch, the latter part of the afternoon.  Came upon it randomly.  No wait, but with only about 20 min to spare in the serious decision making process of "what do I want" when everything looks enticing.  Trying to breathe in and out and put the pressure of the Great Amazing Race out of my head, we were sat by the very lovely Grayson, very friendly, and our drinks came quickly.  Because I ruined my stomach from a bad decision two nights prior, I ipted for something tasty and healthy.  Wild mushroom arugula Benedict, and subbed regular hollandaise over the Sriacha (no hot stuff for this sensitive tummy today).  Nice presentation, a lot of height with the side salad.  Visually pleasing.  Perfectly poached eggs.  Tasty warm.  Meaty mushrooms (though I can't get over the fact that some of the shrooms were rehydrated and they did not properly drain them well as some bites were filled with squishy water.  Needs a little salt.  Hearty and thick English muffin.  "How are your first few bites tasting?" , asks Grayson politely.  She is a fantastic server, kudos to her for making us feel welcome in her domain.  Side salad is situated ontop a halved napkin to keep it from sliding, but the sauce from the Benedict gets into the napkin and then you have a little piece of mush napkin in your mouth.  Maybe an alternative solution to keep it from sliding?  Partner in crime had the banana walnut multigrain pancakes.  #healthynothealthy lol. If I'm going for pancakes, I go all in.  It is what it is.  Whatever some people need to do to make themselves feel better.  Hahaha. They were appealing, but lacking that overall fluff from the AP flour.  Plus served with a creme anglaise and whipped cream.  F the multigrain in my opinion.  Heehee. A very big portion, took half of it home.  Grayson gave us great personalized service, as she hands the bill and addresses him by name.  I like that!  Everyone loves hearing their own name.  A+ job sister.  We'll be back and I'm calling ahead to make sure you're our server!FYI, the Wifi is kanela1552 - great for helping while eating (my friends hate me)

55.description: This review is well overdue.  I used to live in the neighborhood when Kanela first opened and was a little bit of a regular.  I love their coffee and have never had a single thing on the menu I didn't like.  Their summer cocktails have been great this year so far and major shout out to Rob for always being so personable and entertaining.  He really brightens up your day.  He also introduced me to Spring and I'm earning points all over the city.Thank you Rob and thank you Kanela for also being a great go to brunch spot!

9.description: Kanela is almost to the top of my favorite brunch list. I live for brunch so I like places that have innovative dishes outside of the traditional pancakes and seasonal fruit.My usual go-to meal is a benedict. So naturally, I had to try the crab cake benedict. I've never been to the coasts for seafood but from what I've had, this is one of the tastiest seafood breakfasts I've had. The crab cake was crunchy but still moist and their sauce has just the right amount of tang. Definitely worth the wait!

26.description: Kanela is almost to the top of my favorite brunch list. I live for brunch so I like places that have innovative dishes outside of the traditional pancakes and seasonal fruit.My usual go-to meal is a benedict. So naturally, I had to try the crab cake benedict. I've never been to the coasts for seafood but from what I've had, this is one of the tastiest seafood breakfasts I've had. The crab cake was crunchy but still moist and their sauce has just the right amount of tang. Definitely worth the wait!

25.description: We ate here on a birthday trip to Chicago, and I loved it! I wanted everything on the menu...it all sounded so good. The food was delicious (monkey bread is a must try) and the mimosas were a perfect addition. My only gripe was the bee situation on the front patio, but I would definitely eat here again.

12.description: I loved this place so much. I'm on vacation so I've been eating like crazy in Chicago lol. Kanela has definitely been one of my favorite spots. We went on a Tuesday morning so there was no wait time at all. We just went in there and picked the table we liked. The food was amazing!! I'm like Ron Swanson when it comes to breakfast food so I destroyed my plate  I had the eggs/bacon/sausage/toast and potatoes and my girlfriend ordered the chocolate chip with Cocoa krispies pancakes. Those pancakes seriously changed my life. I never order pancakes, I always get French toast but I'm seriously glad I got the pancakes this time. Whenever a friend of mine goes to Chicago I'm definitely going to recommend them to go here.

59.description: This place is amazing! I have been multiple times so I brought my friends from Canada, and they loved it! The service is great and the food is even better. Anything you order will be fantastic! I would recommend the strawberry mimosas :)

21.description: We've stopped her numerous times for brunch as it is right down the street from us.  They have their menu broken into separate tastes, sweet, savory etc.I don't eat a lot of eggs so I tend to peruse the sweet section of the menu, and I really do enjoy some good processed sugar. Given this I've tried several of the items and they are all quite delicious, though I'm not so sure how much your waist line appreciates them.  The S'mores pancakes are really tasty specifically.They make one hell of a bloody mary for folks who like them, it even comes with a grilled cheese square on the skewer.  They also make a killer mint flavored hot chocolate for those cold winter days.I recommend sitting at the breakfast bar for fun banter with the staff and quick service.

17.description: Great service and amazing Bloody Mary with a mini grilled cheese! We ordered the fried egg sandwich, the California Benedict and the scramble and everything was delicious! Will definitely be going back :)

10.description: This was the first place I ate while visiting Chicago and it was amazing to say the least! It is now on my list of best breakfast I have ever had. My husband also enjoyed his breakfast and we both left stuffed. For the area it comes at a really great prize.We ate outside on the patio on a Friday morning. There was no wait and we were seated right away even though the place was pretty full. I had biscuits and gravy. I have had a lot of biscuits and gravy living in the south but these were the best I have ever eaten! The plate was enough to feed two people. It came with several super delicious biscuits, southern style house pork sausage, smothered in sage gravy, 2 sunny side eggs, and a side of potatoes. You get all that for $12. My husband had a breakfast sandwich which he loved. It had house made pork sausage, cheddar, sunny side egg, arugula, a spicy pepper jam, and was served on a english muffin. It came with a few options for a side and he decided on fresh fruit.

5.description: Quite impressed by the bloody mary. We got it spicy but if it is too much for some people, you could water it down a tad. The cool factor: it has a piece of grilled cheese in it.Service was very helpful and attentive. I got the spicy feta omelet and my cousin got the crab cake benedict. Both were great. I liked that it was easy to make substitutions. Be prepared to wait for a table even if it's at 10am on Sunday.

3.description: Horrible service! We came here on a Saturday afternoon and it was very packed. Waited about twenty minutes and then received a text message that our table was ready. When we go to our table it was just very crowded and we knew it would be uncomfortable to eat there so we asked the hostess if she would mind moving us to the OPEN table that was closer to the side of the restaurants entry way. She said we would have to wait ( we thought no worries maybe they're just adding the finishing touches to the already ready to eat at table) we wait for about 10 minutes before I ask her how long will it be until we're able to sit down. She says VERY rudely "what is it you wanted , wait what did you ask" I said we asked if possible can we please move to the empty table she then goes on to catch an attitude and says I guess. The whole time we tried to enjoy our food she just kept looking at us and rolling her eyes being rude. We're brining money to this business, have some respect. Food wise - it's okay, nothing spectacular. You get what you pay for. Wouldn't come again.

35.description: It used to be so much better. Good luck getting service if you sit outside. Potatoes make me sad. Lorraine scramble is ok, try making it at home instead. Coffee is exceptional. $4.25 for orange juice.

19.description: I took my grand daughter here on a Monday for brunch. She didn't eat anything except the hot cocoa. I couldn't understand why until I tasted her food. The French toast was hard as a rock.  The monkey bread was inedible...dry, hard, had no taste at all! It says it all when an 8 year old won't even eat your sugary sweet entrees! My coffee tasted old and was barely lukewarm. Our bill was $60 not including tip, but our meal wasn't even worth $10!!! I will not be back even though we live right in Old Town!

28.description: Definitely one of my top picks for brunch any day, especially on the weekends! This location has a very chill vibe; its small in size but cozy-which sometimes sucks when you have to wait 20-25 minutes for a table, but if you get there around 1 that can be avoided.Kellie, I hope I'm remembering her name correctly, was our server and she totally made us feel welcomed and explained some menu items for us. However I've had a server there before that really didn't care to check back. I've had there omelettes before which are good but their benedicts are where it's at, super delicious! I always feel food is under seasoned at breakfast places, which I get, but Kanela seasons their food to a T!  The smores waffle is so delicious as "dessert" whichI like sharing with whoever I'm with. Their sandwiches are also yummy.

45.description: I have been a few times and gotten the Fried egg Sandwich, and Lemon blueberry pancakes.  Both were delicious, and the potatoes that come with the savory meals are fantastic.  The fresh squeezed OJ is a plus also.  Definitely worth trying for brunch/lunch!

33.description: Eh, not sold. The service was rather slow, we needed to ask for everything (including water, more coffee, silverware, and ketchup). Every meal that came out LOOKED amazing- ascetically pleasing.  I had the biscuits and gravy.. Which was kinda weird. It was a biscuit sitting on top of what looked like a hamburger patty then topped with two sunny side up eggs; all smothered in gravy. The gravy flavor was bland. The sausage patty was bland. The eggs (although done perfectly) were not "disclosed" on the menu so they were an unwanted surprise. The ambience is cute, great area, but overall unimpressed with the food. Hand me the s & p!

43.description: Went there for breakfast, and was told there was a 30 minute wait time (understandable for a Sunday morning). However, 50 minutes later, it appeared that they skipped over us in the line. After addressing this with the host, and being seated immediately, we ordered the Spicy Feta Omelet and the skillet of the day (a western/Mexican skillet). Both were good, and had a very pleasant server. A solid 3 star experience.

2.description: Found this place on Yelp and it was half a mile from where I was staying so I figured it was perfect. The pics posted looked pretty good and that was definitely a driver.So you go in and the host station is kind of in an awkward place.  We decided to just seat ourselves.  The waiter came from the kitchen area and happily greeted us with menus and told us he'd get us waters. The arrangement of the space is decent but even just being hours ago I can't remember anything f that stands out.  The kitchen is kind of open and towards the back so you can see what in transpiring. Nothing too exciting going on back there. Just your normal kitchen. The menu is pretty salivating and I preferred the pork belly Benedict and my colleagues got the lemon blueberry pancakes.  The coffee came first and was average at best. Plenty of refills at least.The Benedict looked fantastic but overall it wasn't that amazing. Part of the problem,which is not the restaurant's fault I guess, is that you couldn't cut it without it falling apart. It was messy per se but just annoying. The pork belly was long abundantly flavorful and eggs.. Are eggs.The good news.. My buddies loved the pancakes. Probably wouldn't want to go back. Our server I will say was energetic and quick.

18.description: I don't like leaving anything less than fantastic reviews, but this was easily my most disappointing meal while visiting Chicago. The monkey bread was extremely dry. Had good flavor but was hard to get over the dryness. I ordered the "homemade" chorizo wrap, which turned out to be about 3 eggs, wrapped in a tortilla with taco meat. I had a better breakfast burrito at Mickey D's yesterday to be honest. My gf had their burger and while it wasn't awful, it wasn't cooked to order and was doused in mustard. The chips were good at least. Not somewhere I would visit again.

41.description: I loved everything about this place! The location, the friendly waiters, THE AMAZING FOOD! I had the fried egg sandwich w/ the red potatoes & the chocolate chip cocoa Krispies pancakes. My friends & I agreed it was one of the best breakfasts we've ever had.

52.description: My Friends and I have been trying to eat here for the past few months. They always have a wait list for more than 30 minutes. I believe that's not a bad thing for business and that's a good sign that they serve good food. Finally we were able to get a table after a 20 minutes wait. I ordered the Pork belly benedict and Bloody Mary! I usually hate bloody mary but since my friend suggested it, I tried it from them! Surprisingly it was really good! Finally understood why the place is always packed.

50.description: Used to be a 2-3 time/week regular and even bring clients regularly as I work in the neighborhood. Never again. After a couple of underwhelming experiences and waiting forty five plus minutes for food I am throwing in the towel in this joint. It's a shame as the menu has always been solid and the location so convenient. Like so many others in here I'm just wondering what the heck happened to this place.

4.description: The food and our waitress was subpar, so I can only give 3 stars. She was young, barely attentive, and before asking if we wanted anything else, she just dropped our check off and then picked it up without any acknowledgment. As someone that has been in the service industry for 20+years, you come to expect a particular kind of service and they are lacking for sure here. Now, on to the food; I wanted the crab benedict, but our waitress told me that she would not recommend it and I am not sure if I should have considered the source. Next time, I will just scroll through my fellow Yelpers for suggestions. I decided on the mushroom arugula benedict and it was good, although the mushrooms were a tad slimy and seemingly not cooked through. The chai tea was extremely awful, but hey, the potatoes were great!

6.description: Seems a little rookie to run out of chorizo during prime time Sunday brunch, but okay, my second entree choice was the crab cake benedict.  The english muffin was a little mushy and could have been better toasted.  Crab cake portion of the meal wasn't a pure lump crab cake like I was expecting, but more of a fried patty with a lot of filler, and potato cubes were basic.  Overall, the dish gave me the caloric energy I needed, but it was oh so ordinary.

22.description: I would love to eat one of their sweet breakfast items from here but I would literally gain 30 pounds in one seating. Everything on the menu is unique, fresh, and well put together. I ordered the California Benedict sandwich the last time I came in and while they brought out my order wrong at first, they were quick to fix it with no problem. Their mimosas are great along with their spiked coffee drinks.

15.description: I ordered the monkey bread and the flavor was good but it was so dry and kind of hard that it wasn't that enjoyable to eat. I ordered a burger and it had way too much mustard on it to the point that's all I can taste with the patty and they cooked the patty more than I ordered but the chips that came with it were delicious.

57.description: Mediocre ... Lorraine scramble was so/so and the crab cake Benedict looked far from fresh. Service lacked attention.

20.description: Definitely one of my favorite brunch places downtown!  They have a great atmosphere, awesome bloody marys, and fantastic lattes. Then menu is broken down into sweet and savory, and they switch up the menu from time to time with great new dishes. Some stand outs are for me are the lemon blueberry pancakes, the biscuits and gravy, and the chicken and waffles.

36.description: This place sucks in every way. I ordered carry out through Grubhub and got there right when Grubhub said the order was ready. I still had to wait 15 minutes for the zombies working there to bring out my order. The place was totally disorganized. Then my food was under cooked and totally bland. The cinamon roll was a complete joke.  You can't just slap some icing onto the cardboard box and think that will taste good.

14.description: Definitely one of my top picks for brunch any day, especially on the weekends! This location has a very chill vibe; its small in size but cozy-which sometimes sucks when you have to wait 20-25 minutes for a table, but if you get there around 1 that can be avoided.Kellie, I hope I'm remembering her name correctly, was our server and she totally made us feel welcomed and explained some menu items for us. However I've had a server there before that really didn't care to check back. I've had there omelettes before which are good but their benedicts are where it's at, super delicious! I always feel food is under seasoned at breakfast places, which I get, but Kanela seasons their food to a T!  The smores waffle is so delicious as "dessert" whichI like sharing with whoever I'm with. Their sandwiches are also yummy.

1.description: Owner shut down business without any notice and cancelled my followup appointment.

9.description: I can not say enough about Isabell and her services! I went in for eyelash tinting (something I'd never done before) and she did an amazing job!! I was nervous at first about having dye so close to my eyeballs, but she made me feel comfortable by explaining the process and promising to never leave me alone. She was thoughtful and took her time working out any concerns I had. I absolutely believe her true calling in life is to help make women beautiful. Her prices are fair, and her work is quality.Although I only went in for a tint, I am confident that her other services would be well worth it. She is flexible with appointment times, and for a fee she is also willing to bring her services to you! I only wish I had a picture to attach to this review. My upper eyelashes were always long, but now you can SEE how long they are. Also, I don't have to put mascara on those tricky bottom lashes. I will definitely be back in a month!!

12.description: Isabell Daniel is an outstanding artist that takes time understand what you are interested in and is very helpful in making sure you are satisfied with your lashes.  It was the first time I had lash work done and I was extremely excited when I saw her finished work. My lashes looked so real and natural with the fill in lashes. Wow!!! Wow!!! Wow!!! I would totally do it again and would recommend anyone who is thinking about doing lash work to see Isabell and visit her place that is very cozy. Her patience and charisma shows through her work of art! I cannot tell you how many people commented on my lashes and not once did anyone question if they were fill in's. They looked so natural and real.  If you read this review, then you are ready to give the lashes a try and recommend to reach out to Isabell right away. You will be happy you tried it out!!!

21.description: Isabell from Soul Beauty is amazing and so talented! The past two years, I have been going to her for a variety of treatments ranging from skincare (peels and enzyme treatments) and beauty (lashes, eyelash and brow tinting and shaping). I host events and I am in the public eye and Isabell always keeps me looking and feeling beautiful.Soul Beauty is about more than outer beauty...what makes Isabell so special is that she really helps her clients focus on inner beauty as well and with each treatment I feel even more beautiful. When you are working with people on their outer appearance it can be a very personal and sometimes invasive experience. Isabell handles this process with so much love and care. She is great about customizing the experience for each client to make them feel special. I send many referrals her way and get so many compliments on my glowing skin, long and lustrous lashes and well arched and defined brows. Her services have really helped with my confidence level and I feel excited when I tell my friends about my special beauty secret...Soul Beauty!Isabell has a wide range of talent and is even going to do all my makeup and styling for a photo shoot I have coming up for professional pictures for my business. Isabell is also very upbeat with a positive attitude...she makes the entire process fun and enjoyable.I highly recommend Isabell from Soul Beauty! She will truly reveal your inner and outer beauty!Sarah Vargo - Founder of Maven and Partner at Social Gravity, Author of upcoming book "Life Is Your Party"

16.description: Best lashes in Chicago! Isabell is not only incredibly talented at eyelash extensions, tinting and all things eyebrow related, she is completely genuine and honest. She did a fill on a set of eyelash extensions I'd had done out of state. She gave me suggestions on how to keep my natural lashes heathy, since I prefer a more dramatic look with my lashes. She used a lighter weight mink lash and I immediately noticed a difference upon opening my eyes.  Isabell loves what she does and does an amazing job, what more could you ask for! I'm receiving compliments constantly on my lashes, even my male friends have noticed how great they look.

17.description: Isabell is amazing!  Her eyelash extensions are so natural looking and she makes the process a breeze.  I have always wanted extensions but I have extremely sensitive eyes  and couldn't imagine someone messing with them for an hour ++.  She has such a calm relaxing way I was completely at ease and actually enjoyed it! I call her my "Beauty Therapist"  Isabell is a beautiful person inside and out and a true Master of Her  Trade"  Highly Recommended!

10.description: I came to redeem my Gilt City voucher and got an eyebrow tint. Isabel was patiently waiting for me, and we had a nice chat as I filled out my form. She offered lots of advice and suggestions and really seems to work with you as a client of hers to really make you feel comfortable and pretty. She also works with your budget and ensures that she does the best job no matter how long it takes. She is certainly one that will go the extra mile and genuinely loves what she does. I was curious about this eyebrow tinting procedure as I have light eyebrows and am pretty lazy about doing anything that requires daily maintenance. She went through and combed and trimmed them down along with waxing some extra hairs around the eyebrows to make them stand out and then applied the stuff to make them darker. I am not sure how long it's supposed to last, but it lasted a few days for me. I was hoping for something more long term outside of getting them tatooed, but I think it's nice for maybe a special occasion.

5.description: Isabel is an eyelash extension artist! I got one of the Yelp deals and got my eyelashes done by her a week before my wedding. They looked AMAZING and natural. So many people commented on them during the wedding asking me what mascara the makeup artist used, because they didn't think they were fake at all.I also have to say that Isabel made the hour+ experience really enjoyable. She's a people person and a fellow yogini. So we had lots to talk about. Admittedly, it felt a little odd to carry a conversation with someone with my eyes closed, especially since I like to talk with my hands. But Isabel made the no eye-contact conversation really fun. She even inspired me to get back to being more committed to my yoga practice. Thanks Isabel!

11.description: Isabell from Soul Beauty is amazing and so talented! The past two years, I have been going to her for a variety of treatments ranging from skincare (peels and enzyme treatments) and beauty (lashes, eyelash and brow tinting and shaping). I host events and I am in the public eye and Isabell always keeps me looking and feeling beautiful.Soul Beauty is about more than outer beauty...what makes Isabell so special is that she really helps her clients focus on inner beauty as well and with each treatment I feel even more beautiful. When you are working with people on their outer appearance it can be a very personal and sometimes invasive experience. Isabell handles this process with so much love and care. She is great about customizing the experience for each client to make them feel special. I send many referrals her way and get so many compliments on my glowing skin, long and lustrous lashes and well arched and defined brows. Her services have really helped with my confidence level and I feel excited when I tell my friends about my special beauty secret...Soul Beauty!Isabell has a wide range of talent and is even going to do all my makeup and styling for a photo shoot I have coming up for professional pictures for my business. Isabell is also very upbeat with a positive attitude...she makes the entire process fun and enjoyable.I highly recommend Isabell from Soul Beauty! She will truly reveal your inner and outer beauty!Sarah Vargo - Founder of Maven and Partner at Social Gravity, Author of upcoming book "Life Is Your Party"

3.description: Great brow shaping. A little pricey though.

0.description: Whether it is lashes or skin care Isabelle knows how to take care of you.  I went to Isabel once to take care of a skin issue two years ago and I still see her because she finds joy in making her clients look their best.  Don't go anywhere else.

20.description: In my line of work, most women don't wear make-up ever. I was thinking of doing lashes because I wanted to look beautiful, but not fake. Isabell did such a great job listening to my needs and now I feel so gorgeous at work or even first thing in the morning - even without the YSL mascara I used to be addicted to.Isabell is just the most warm and caring person and it makes the process of applying and touching up a pleasure. I would whole-heartedley recommend her. Oh and bonus... she will come to your home and do the process for a nominal fee.

19.description: Isabel, thank you, thank you, THANK YOU for making me a gorgeous bride!!  The mink lashes were totally amazing and I think I might be addicted.Since I have very blonde, very fine, very short lashes, I did tons of research to find out what would be the best option for my wedding.  I knew I wanted REAL mink lashes and I heard great things about Isabel...SHE IS AMAZING.  I loved coming to her home spa because it felt super authentic and not like...cheesy.  She's such a genuine person and the whole process is totally relaxing.  Isabel is professional, gentle, and precise.  She listens to exactly what you want and does what needs to happen for you to look and feel your best.  She did an unbelievable job on my lashes and then told me to come back for a fill-in after they'd settled for a day.   Isabel has such a positive energy and you leave feeling totally confidant and energized...I felt SO GORGEOUS in the weeks leading up to my wedding.  That's right WEEKS.  I got them done about 3 weeks before my wedding and they still looked amazing on the day-of!  It was so nice to have luxurious lashes during those 3 weeks, because I ended up doing so many dinners, parties, etc. with friends and family.  I loved my lashes so much that I visited Isabel before we went on our honeymoon...I felt so confidant the entire time we were traveling and it was SO easy not to have to worry about putting on makeup every day.  I have had my current set for over a month and while they've started to shed, my eyes still look great!YOU WILL BE SO HAPPY YOU GAVE YOURSELF THIS GIFT!

2.description: The first time I had eyelash extensions done was 15 years ago and throughout the years, have tried dozens of places. I always had synthetic lashes applied until Isabel used mink lashes on me. I know many places use synthetic mink and swear they are real so do your homework. Isabel uses the real deal and they felt so light and natural the first time, I had to have fills every two to three weeks. I feel so amazing each time I leave a fill session. I would recommend her services to Anyone who wants beautiful, full, lashes. I'm really impressed; the quality of glue, lashes and her work are seriously A-1. Super..... Simply Super.

18.description: I really cannot say enough about Isabell.  I have been in search of a great set of lashes since moving back to Chicago from New York and I finally I found them!  Isabell is a perfectionist and could not have been more welcoming and generous with her time.  She is also a highly ethical businesswoman and those are hard to find!  So glad to have found her and thankful for the other reviewers who led me to Isabell.

13.description: Such a fabulous time! I haven't felt or looked this good in years! Thank you Isabelle!! You guys are great and I'll definitely see you soon!
