4.description: I just moved to Chicago from NYC and was worried I would never find a place as good as the my girl in New York to get my lashes done but thank god for Isabell.  She not only exceeded my expectations but she brought new life back to my badly damaged lashes.  I never thought I would see them this long again, but one session with her and they already started to look like new again.  When I entered her office she took one look at me and it's like she read my mind and new exactly what I wanted.  She was able to give me full long natural looking lashes that feel weightless and require little to no maintenance, I'm so happy I found her and will definitely be returning.  She is an artist in the truest form of the word, and she's awesome to talk to

6.description: Isabel is awesome.  She really listened to understand the look I wanted and that is what I get.  She's always improving techniques and products, she's such a perfectionist she wants your lashes to look perfect every time you leave.  BTW, we have the best conversations, she's so funny.  I always say I'm going to relax when I get there, she has headphones with different types of things for you from music to mantras.  We always end up talking!  LOL.

15.description: Isabell is just amazing. Not only is she fantastic at what she does but she really cares about her clients and making them happy.Bottom line, her work is flawless!

7.description: Overall, service was great and I'd go back if I needed lashes for a special occasion (not everyday wear for me). Very nice, friendly staff. My only issue was the AC didn't appear to be working the day that I went and it seemed as if the glue didn't dry correctly - in the end, not a big deal, just made for a longer, slightly uncomfortable appointment.

8.description: I have gotten mink eyelash extensions twice from Isabell and cannot be happier with the results. She customizes the lashes for each person on each session, whether you want more curl, more volume or more length. The first time I wanted long fringed lashes on the corners for a "cat-eye look" which she did and the second session I wanted to go for a totally natural look which also looked amazing.Isabell is very sweet and takes the time to hear what your preferences are. She really cares about making you feel beautiful! She also makes a point to get to know her clients personally. I was shocked to hear that she still remember some of our conversations after not seeing each other in a few months! Highly recommended!

14.description: In my line of work, most women don't wear make-up ever. I was thinking of doing lashes because I wanted to look beautiful, but not fake. Isabell did such a great job listening to my needs and now I feel so gorgeous at work or even first thing in the morning - even without the YSL mascara I used to be addicted to.Isabell is just the most warm and caring person and it makes the process of applying and touching up a pleasure. I would whole-heartedley recommend her. Oh and bonus... she will come to your home and do the process for a nominal fee.

3.description: Found Maura through a Gilt deal and was blown away by the facial I was given. I have fairly sensitive skin and she did a wonderful job being thorough without irritating at all. I have been back for massages and more facials and she is great at it all! Her massages are really great. The perfect balance of working out stiff problem areas and still feeling blissfully relaxed. t stiff problem areas and still feeling blissfully relaxed.

1.description: I was so pleasantly surprised!Given the neighborhood small business spa, I was expecting to have a nice experience, but this was one of the best massages I've ever had. I've been to all kinds of spas in Chicago and on vacations, and I would say Maura at Go Spa ranks up there with the best of them.The spa itself is still small and no frills, but for the price and the location and the hospitality and the kick ass massage, I will definitely be back!

2.description: Maura is amazing. Won't go anywhere else for massages. Go Spa is awesome, I highly recommend.

9.description: I found Go Spa through a Gilt deal and am SO glad I did! So far I've had a PCA chemical peel and custom facial with microdermabrasion as well as multiple brow waxes, all with Maura. She is so sweet and welcoming and each service has been fantastic. It's clear to see she is well educated in her craft and has a passion for great customer service. She also runs monthly specials which are great if you're trying to beautify on a budget like I am. Highly recommend, you won't regret it!!

10.description: My mom and I paid a visit to Go Spa in July 2014. We got massages for my mom's birthday and Maura was fabulous!!! We have gone to many spas and have gotten plenty of massages. However, my mom and I agreed that Maura was by far one of the best massage therapists we've ever had! She even uses warm towels during the massage! We had never experienced that before and it was such a pleasant surprise and a very nice touch! Now we are ready to take my dad to go spa for a facial and massage! Actually, that's our Christmas gift to him! :-)

4.description: Is this what Shania Twain meant when she said "I feel like a woman"? GoSpa is a great spot to get your pamper on. The salon is right next to it's sister business Go Cycle spin studio (just look for purple and you'll find them), very accessible from either Sedgewick or even North/Clybourn.I've gone in for both a massage and a facial treatment and have left each time feeling like a million bucks. Maura runs the spa and does a great job of explaining what she's doing and qualifying you for the right treatments. I was very nervous to experiment with micro derm or face peels and she was able to walk me through both options very patiently. I left the spa and my face looked slightly dewy if anything and am noticing just slight peeling that you would experience after a sun burn. Definitely not as scary as they make it out to be  (cue Sex & The City example of Samantha before Carrie's book singing) Yes you should do your research on what strength is best for you, but if you are using Yelp clearly you get this already ;)With all the massive chains it's refreshing to be able to go somewhere local where you don't feel rushed and questioning where you just spent your money. Plus I am always a huge supporter of a female run business.Tip: Keep your eyes peeled on her Facebook page as she runs some good deals every month or so

6.description: I saw Maura for a facial and brow wax and she was amazing. I felt so pampered and my skin was positively radiant afterwards. Everything was very professional and the atmosphere was very relaxing. I definitely recommend Go Spa for anyone who wants to treat themselves.

12.description: This review is very belated - I've been to Maura many times for massages and she is the absolute best.  As a chronic sloucher and cyclist, my back needs attention at least once a month and I have tried nearly every masseuse in the city.  Maura is the perfect mix of pressure and relaxation.  It is difficult to find someone who can give a great massage that is pain-free and calming but also has a positive long-term impact on your muscles.  Maura is it.  Can't say enough positive things.  Plus, scheduling is incredibly easy, payment is easy, and she is just a really cool person.  So go there.

5.description: I love Go Spa!!!Maura  gives wonderful facials and love the chemical peels:)))After many years of sitting in the sun, Maura has made my skin glow and I love her for taking such good care of my skin.This is a spa is worth a visit, trust me!!!

11.description: If you are looking for quality services that are done right I would highly recommend getting them done at Go Spa. I have been there twice now to get a Brazilian wax and I would not go anywhere else. Previously, I got one done at another spa in the city and it totally ruined my trip where I was planning on spending most of the time in a bathing suit. I was red for 5 days with bumps and discomfort. After Maura did mine, I didn't have any of those symptoms. There was barely even any redness. She takes her time doing things and she is meticulous about her work. I have also gotten my lashes done by Maura so they would look fuller in my wedding pictures. The results were beyond what I expected. I didn't want them to look fake but rather full and natural and that's exactly how they turned out. I am so excited to see how they will look on my wedding day. You will not be disappointed if you visit Maura at Go Spa, I guarantee it!

8.description: Just went in for my facial, went in with a headache, went out a new person.Maura pays close attention to what she is doing and does it great. Perfectionist in the best way. Thank you, and I will be back again and again.

0.description: I absolutely love Maura! I have had numerous massages, facials, and a chemical peel at Go Spa. I love how quiet, small, and relaxing the space is. I forget I am in the middle of the city and just zone out and relax. I usually visit Maura for a massage when I am having some strange ache or pain and she ALWAYS helps me feel better. She isn't afraid to make it hurt (in a good way!) I would go to Maura for any of the services she offers and I know I will be happy with the service and results. Book your appointment with Maura TODAY!!

7.description: This place is great and Maura is awesome! I have had both a massage and facial.  Maura really takes time to understand your pain points and your skin type before completing any service.I love how comfortable she made me feel and how warm and welcome the spa was.  I will definitely be back for more.Highly recommend checking this place out.

29.description: This place is great. The vanilla latte I ordered is right on point! The lady even behind the counter offered to make it sweater if I needed. While I waited I even played a game of Sets with a stranger also waiting. The environment and atmosphere of this place is relaxing. The colors aren't to bright not to dull, but has the vibrant feel when looking at the walls. There are plenty of seats but still a ton of room to walk around still. The best part, is the games. Every game from when I was a kid to games I never heard of, all at your convenience. I will definitely be returning! Thank you!

42.description: So happy that we found this little joint in Old Town! I loved the service; the lady at the counter was very helpful in choosing our drinks. The menu had a great variety-- consisting of coconut water, bubble teas, hot teas, sweets, and coffees. The pricing was reasonable and since its open late, there was reason to stick around. The best thing about Cassava was that they had games, a foosball table, magazines, and puzzles! So it makes for a perfect, chill hang out spot for date night or with a group of friends.

23.description: This adorable cafe is a really great place to read, work, or spend a lazy Sunday afternoon with friends, which is what I did. But I think another great occasion to suggest this cafe would be for those "I'm not sure if I like you and I want to make a smart decision" dates. Here's why:1. The decor is friendly and charming, but the IKEA furniture keeps it from seeming like you're trying too hard2. It's well lit with soft jazz tunes filling the air. You won't have to worry about not hearing or seeing them properly.3. It's possible that this only applies to me, but if your person doesn't like smoothies and pastries, it's probably not meant to be.4. There are games to play and puzzles to do so you don't have to worry about awkwardness or running out of conversation topics while you slurp on your boba.Anyway, this spot is super cute and it's nice to not have to schelp all the way to chinatown for bubble tea, especially bubble tea with fresh ingredients!PS: the princess puzzle was missing a piece when we did it

47.description: This place is such a gem. Great addition to the area and super friendly owners. Had the Vietnamese coffee and it was delicious and the chocolate scone was so fresh. Will definitely be coming back. The best part about this place is the board games and foosball table. Someone ordered the shaved ice while we were eating and it looked to die for. Can't wait to try it next.

8.description: It's a bubble tea joint wedged between Old Town and the Gold Coast on LaSalle. Already, that's an anomaly because those neighborhoods mostly have Starbucks. You'll be hard-pressed to find bubble tea outside of Chinatown.Next, Cassava Café has strict quality standards. They use no syrups or powders. In fact, they make their own bubbles! You ask for an avocado slush (yum!)? They are made with real avocados. That means that Vung (pronounced Vaughn) sometimes has to tell me "no" because the avocados aren't ripe enough. Think about that. I think it's a reflection of her commitment to delivering consistently good products. She won't give you a subpar product and hope that you won't notice.Vung and Jason really put their hearts into Cassava Café. They literally made some of the tables! They have free wifi, a foosball table, games (Cards Against Humanity, Battleship, Connect Four, Monopoly, Clue, etc.), puzzles, and novels to keep customers entertained. There are a variety of seating options including two-person tables, communal tables, and a couch.I like to stop by for a Vietnamese Coffee before work or date night in the evenings. We love the sandwiches and salads that Vung creates for us. Somehow she sears cheese on the bread making a delicious crunch! It's incredible and I highly recommend you try any sandwich involving cheese. Besides that, they have some pre-packages Asian foods: ramen, Meji Pandas, Yan Yan, and Shrimp Crackers. They carry two different kinds of coffees: 1) Metropolis and 2) Café du Monde. I've never seen Café du Monde outside of New Orleans so that's a special treat.

31.description: Love this place! Board games, cute environment. It's in a hidden location on corner of Lasalle and Division. If you like those fruit smoothies that Asian restaurants normally carry, check this place out!

34.description: Living in Gold Coast, the only places I have consistently been to study have been Barnes and Starbucks. What a treat to discover the new Cassava Café right by where I live which offers free Wi-Fi and stays open later....AND BUBBLE TEA? What a treat to find a gem like this here. I came to Cassava around 7pm to study on a Friday night, and it got really packed and loud with people playing foosball and games (Which is also a PRO that they have games). People left and it became quiet again so I'm sure that there will be moments where it may be very quiet or loud so keep an open-mind if you come to do work. I got the Jasmine Green Tea, received it promptly, and it was steeped with a cute floating infuser. The owner also offered me a lemon cookie that was absolutely delicious and completely devoured. I definitely felt the quality of service and care for customers!! I will be back regularly to try the bubble tea, play some games, and study with friends. :)

16.description: This place is the best for milk tea, bubble tea, and everything in between.  All of the teas and boba,  and everything else are fresh and organic..no mixes or anything of the sort.  Very, very good spot and a relaxing atmosphere with great service.

13.description: Great place for boba.  Awful location with lack of parking. The girl working the register was really helpful and kind.  I ended up ordering a hot red bean milk tea.  It was more milliner than usual and contained red bean flavor instead of real red beans. It's a great place to study, there's an assortment of books, magazines, board games and foosball as well.  Cool place, but it's a pricey for boba.

11.description: I had a great time at Cassava but there's plenty of room for improvementPROS: service is nicegreat games to play with great books to read location is decent cafe is clean and cute CONS:food items were not up to par: - tapioca pearls were undercooked (chewy outside, hard inside) -honey green milk tea was bland (I'm assuming hot tea with ice melts the ice right away & honey ratio was overwhelming)- the snow was too icy (I think it's shaved ice and not fluff) - for the snow, they ran out of strawberries the day we came :( I really appreciated the library of books and the load of games that were offered. The location was not hard to find but parking was. The only thing I would say is maybe keep the teas chilled that way the drink is not luke-warm by the time it's served? Hopefully management will take this review into consideration and change some things around because in Chicago there are a lot of competition and there's no room for mediocre if you want to keep your cafe alive and running! Good luck Cassava, hope to see you soon... With love, a concerned boba drinker

39.description: Best place ever! Owners are super personable and attentive to customers!Highly recommend as a study spot!

37.description: Slush bubble tea was mediocre. Milk based bubble teas are better.

0.description: Great place for, as they say, work and play. Studying or computing is nice with fast internet and plenty o' outlets too. The game selection is way above the average mishmash of checkers and connect 4. Try not to look at all the art and decor. Could use more couches. Thanks for your friendly and fast service. Drinks were good and not hella sugared up like the Bobas I'm used to. The owners are a cute couple!Best in the Clark/Division area.

38.description: Great study spot. Open until midnight. And good coffee. Free WiFi makes this the best place to buckle down and get your work done. I haven't used the board games or got the snacks yet but I like that the place provides a place where you can study or play

51.description: A cute little cafe that just opened up. Workers are nice but could move a little bit faster. Hopefully will improve with time. But one of the only places in the area that has BOARD GAMES to play! And foosball too!

27.description: I came here on a Saturday with a couple friends.  I was excited because it seemed like a "coffee haus" type of place in the city! woohoo..unfortunately, it wasn't a 5 star experience this time around.Drinks (milk teas, boba etc) - all made from natural fruit etc.Taro smoothie ($5.09, total with tax) - one size, made with actual taro so the drink is white, not purple.  I honestly prefer the purple powdered taro drinks, maybe I don't like the original taro taste.Taro milk tea - one size, you can get it either hot or iced.  My friends got one hot and one cold so figure out which one tasted better.  They liked the hot taro milk tea better.  BUT both of the taro drinks tasted wayyy too milky...might as well just buy a gallon of milk for the cost of this drink.  Not recommended.Shaved ice - the bowl was too small for it, the toppings/ice etc kept on falling out while we were trying to grab a bite..It wasn't the delicious ppatbingsoo/shaved ice taste... wouldn't recommend..Costs - ~$5+ for the items here..Customer Service: Atmosphere - it seems like the to-go place to come to if you want to just chat with friends..not too small, but also not too big so depends on the day (you may or may not find seating).  I like the idea of the board games though.Customer Service - they are nice, but not too organized..My friends and I were confused on who's drink was who's when it came out one by one ...apparently a lot of ppl ordered different types of taro drinks that day... Location - very conveniently located near the Clark & Division Red Line and free parking on LaSalle street (on weekends/during specific hours).Heard the Jasmine Milk tea is good here so maybe I'll stop by to try that next time..

32.description: Cute spot they make everything in house! Prices make this a treat rather than daily coffee stop, but well worth a visit!!

48.description: This is the best place ever! The food is delicious, the customer service is excellent, the pricing is fair, and the atmosphere is lovely.  The bubble tea is amazing! You MUST try it! If you need a respite from the crazy world, pop into the Cassava Cafe for a moment of bliss!  The interior is decorated in such a way that combines beauty with relaxation and fun. The cafe has all of these fun games that you can play to de-stress, and the walls are painted in the most artful way. Plus, the customer service here is excellent and the owners really care about the customers, you can tell!This places seriously rocks!

44.description: Great little spot. A little hidden although it's on a pretty busy street. A nice, friendly atmosphere, not too crowded. Great spot to get some work done. Haven't tried the bubble tea yet but they have all sorts of coffee drinks and some food too!

24.description: What a great find through my Yelp search for nearby restaurants! I think this place actually used to be a nail salon I'd go to once in awhile.Anyway's it's such a cute spot! I was greeted with a warm welcome. Along the wall were board games and there were quite a few customers reading books. Sort of reminded me of a classier Starbucks vibe.The menu is really small, but they have a huge variety of bubble teas. I went with the grilled cheese. It was delicious and huge! For .75 extra J had her add turkey. The bread was delicious the sandwich was served on. I also got a Bundt cake, which was just okay. Great place to come to read, play games, and grab a bite to eat.

7.description: Finally a bubble tea place that not too far south in chinatown or too far north. This location is just right in Old Town! The set up is pretty cool with board games, card games and a Foosball table. Once it gets more busy it would be nice to see more sofas maybe. They specialize in all natural ingredients in their drinks...which could be why they are bit pricy (even without bubbles). I tried the Jasmine milk tea with lychee which was pretty good. 2/11 update: I like that many of their bubbles teas can be made hot (great for the cold weather). Try the royal milk tea hot!

49.description: I really love the concept of this place and it executes extremely well.  I was recommended to visit this place so I went to check it out.  This store makes me wish I lived in Chicago.  As far as the atmosphere, the wall painting on the side reminds me of a certain Japanese Blossom lotion decoration from a popular bath and body products store, but I was told it was hand-painted by one of the owners. Very well done! As I walked in, one of the first things I noticed was a group of people playing Catan.  I really love board games so they've got me hooked there.  Also, there's a Foosball table in the middle of the room so overall, it looked like a fun place to hang out during the weekend.  Tbh, the selection of board games was a little sparse, but the wall space is large and they just opened, so I'll give them some slack on that ;). (Also, I didn't have time to enjoy their games this time since I was kind of in a rush.)For the drinks, I shared with some buddies.  We shared a strawberry slushy, a jasmine milk tea with lychee jelly, an avocado slushy, and fresh coconut milk.  The drinks were all wonderful and I was very surprised to learn that the drinks were all made from scratch.  No powder, even for taro milk tea.  I'm planning on trying that next time since you really don't see taro milk tea in an unpowdered form - ever. The coconut milk was also true to its name (on the blackboard).  It was very fresh and you could taste it in how sweet the coconut milk was.  Keep in mind, this is a freshly opened coconut.  They even give you a spoon to help eat the inside.  My friend chopped it open when we got back to his apartment (he was kind of excited to do it) and we got much better access to the coconut flesh then.  As expected, the coconut flesh was very soft and sweet, and I'd definitely recommend chopping it open to get at all the flesh if you do buy one.  Just be careful cutting it though since it takes a bit of force to chop it open. Finally, I got a lemon ricotta cookie which, while a little pricey for the size, was delicious  It was exactly that softness of a freshly baked cookie and was just the right amount of lemony goodness.  That said, I would probably save my money and try one of the Vietnamese coffees instead.  It seemed like other people were really enjoying those.  Overall, I highly recommend this place.

40.description: This place is awesome! I come here to study and hang out and the atmosphere feels great. When Im in the area I bring all my friends here. This place has great coffee and they're always switching up the menu. This place even has a free to play foosball table! The owners are super nice.Great atmosphere, great food, friendly environment. I highly recommend.

30.description: This place is the best for milk tea, bubble tea, and everything in between.  All of the teas and boba,  and everything else are fresh and organic..no mixes or anything of the sort.  Very, very good spot and a relaxing atmosphere with great service.

46.description: I'm a big fan of bubble/milk tea, but it's not the easiest thing to get out of Chinatown and Argyle here (there's only one other place I know of, in the Loop, that outright does it and another in Wicker Park). When I read about this place opening not too far from where I live, I was really glad to say the least, especially with taro.The space is pretty nice, clean, and open. I think it could use a few more tables, but not much. Another good and smart touch is that they have board games there which is great along with a few communal tables so you can easily play the games.This seems like a great place you'd come to work kind of quietly or just play your friends at some board/card game.The girl working today, who I have a feeling is one of the owners, was really nice, helpful, and cool. Easy to talk to and really had some great suggestions. I started out with the Taro milk tea (w/boba). I'm used to seeing it purple and in this case it wasn't. It quickly became apparent to me that they actually use real taro to make this as I sipped up little bits of it - a lot of other places use powder mix so I appreciate them actually making it the right way. The boba were also really good - not too hard but not too soft. High quality.After that I had a grilled cheese sandwich with tomato which was pretty good. The tomato on it was roma tomatoes and on the outside was melted cheese (tasted like Asiago). Nice touch - not your typical grilled cheese but good. After that, I ordered some more. Some Jasmine milk tea with lychee, a lemon ricotta cookie, and banana bundt cake. All were really good and I ended up liking the Jasmine milk tea more than the Taro. The girl suggested the lychee in it which was an expert recommendation. The lemon ricotta cookie was really good too. Kind of sweet, but really lemony. The banana bundt cake was pretty damn good too.I'll definitely be back and this place is good. I really appreciate how they use fresh ingredients instead of powder mixes for their milk tea. I'm hoping they're in business for a long time. There's no shortage of pedestrian traffic near there. People just need to come in. Some people may be apprehensive since they don't know what bubble/milk tea is. They should give out some samples for free on the sidewalk to get people more interested and informed. I'll be back next time to try some coffee. This would be a great place to just relax and play a board game too.

1.description: Girlfriend and I were looking for a spot to do some work one evening and found this gem. Below are some of the things I really enjoyed about the place..- All of their drinks are made from scratch; we had the Jasmine Milk Tea (iced) and the Taro Milk Latte.. both drinks were really delicious. I ordered a second Taro Milk Latte during my stay -- it was THAT good. I especially love the chunks of fresh taro at the end of my drink, and the drinks are served lightly sweetened allowing you to add more sweetener to your liking- Prices are comparable to the teas/drinks at Kung Fu, Saint Alp's, etc. that you see in Chinatown / Argyle- Plenty of outlets and space (we were both working on our laptops)- The lady at the counter (who I'm guessing owns/runs this place) was very personable; we had questions about some menu items -- specifically the Masala Tea --which became a friendly exchange of travel experiences, inspiration for their menu items, etc.- WiFi is LEGIT. I'm a web developer and I typically work from home. Definitely suits my needs and will likely be including this cafe into my options for places to work other than my apartment- A wide assortment of board games / books, and foosball- *Bonus: the water they serve has fresh slices of strawberry.. nice move

9.description: Can't say enough good things about this place. Brand new, clean, friendly people. A coffee shop with food and bubble tea, fast and free wi-fi, good tables to work or study at.I didn't love the grilled cheese that I got but it was good enough and the coffee was good. I have a hard time finding coffee places open late in this area, so it's a great option when nothing else is open too. Highly recommend checking this place out!

26.description: Great spot. Polite staff. Open space. Lots of board games to play. A fussball table. And space. And more space.As a coffee shop aficionado...I likey.

25.description: The Vietnamese hot coffee is delicious! And the chill atmosphere makes it a nice place to work.

12.description: I seriously love tea and love boba tea so I like to try different tea spots when I visit a new place. Since I was in town for a few days, I had to try Chicago milk tea and this was one of the highest rated tea places around the hotel that I was staying at. Cassava Cafe is definitely a cute cafe with such beautiful wall decors. It's a very clean and nice place. It's a great place for a group of friends to hang out thanks to all the cards, puzzle and board games that they have there. They even have a Foosball table, which is pretty awesome in my opinion.The only girl working there that night was really friendly and sweet.Anyways, they serve, food, tea and dessert here, but I only got to try the tea. It's pretty cool that they use completely fresh ingredients to make their drinks. Like usually in milk tea, most places would normally use powder or syrup, but this place actually uses real fruits. For example, in a strawberry milk tea, they normally use strawberry powder or syrup, but Cassava Cafe actually uses fresh strawberries to make their drinks. I wonder if that's good, but I actually ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea instead since the worker said that it was their best drink and it was also the most popular drink. Unfortunately, I did not like it. It tasted way to plain and just didn't taste like jasmine milk tea. I also tried the Taro drink as well. I definitely tasted the fresh Taro in that drink. And the real flavor for Taro isn't really that good...Even though it is definitely better to use real and fresh ingredients, Taro has a really strong flavor to it. Like when tea places uses Taro powder, it takes away a lot of the actual flavor and leaves a sweet taste to it. I only know a few places that use real taro to make it and this place tastes similar to the other places as well... So it's definitely a good drink for real Taro lovers, and I guess I am not a real Taro lover. Overall, I didn't like the tea I got. The Jasmine Tea was just too plain and didn't taste like Jasmine. The Taro drink is okay. But overall, I think I would only come back to try their food and dessert. I've been to too many tea places and I know what I like. Jasmine milk tea is the easiest milk tea to make and hard to mess up on. So new places that I try, I'll always try either the regular milk tea or jasmine milk tea first and if I don't like that, there's a great chance I won't like any of the other drinks.

21.description: Fresh, Inviting, Simple, Art-of-craft, Inspired.I stepped into this fresh, clean, inspired oasis and was immediately struck by the modest library of books and games. Some shelves request I return the book when I finish; some shelves invite me to bring the book on an adventure with me in life. The games are a great variety: settlers of catan, apples to apples, connect 4, clue, life, jenga, cards against humanity, etc... a FOOSEBALL table! Glancing around the shop, partially bisected by a wall to create a better defined space, I found a small couch, a few tables of 5+ seating, and a couple more intimate tables--this place is clearly an invitation for community. Their late hours and wifi add some nice versatility to my options, as well.The real magic happened when I stepped up to engage the lovely lady who was championing the castle. She was cooking up some red beans, giving them periodic, careful attention as they went through some kind of dry heating in a skillet. The beans, like the taro and all other ingredients they use in their assortment of bubble tea and smoothies, are prepped from scratch (raw state). I was sold when I saw the avacado smoothie on the menu, one of my personal favorites, which I haven't found for many years during my meanderings. The ingredients? Ice, avacado, condensed milk, cane sugar, and the in-house tapioca bobo.It was incredible. Fresh, simple, delicious. I shall return.-Gabriel

17.description: So happy a bubble tea place opened outside of chinatown. I discovered this hidden gem located right by the clark/division red line stop. I had the Taro bubble tea which was probably the best I've ever had. It was fresh taro rather than powders and super sugary syrups. My boyfriend ordered the red bean milk tea which was also great. There were a few other people in this cozy cafe, but it was relatively quiet on a Friday night. There are a lot of board games (catan, pokemon monopoly, apples-to-apples to name a few), and Foosball table. It would be a great place to bring a few friends and play games. There were also a good amount of outlets and free Wi-Fi if you're looking for somewhere to work/study.While it took a little more time to get our bubble tea than joy yees or Kung fu tea, I really didn't mind because of the top-notch quality. They're also pretty new so this will probably improve with time.Before we left we decided to order the shaved ice which came with ice cream, red bean, strawberries, apples, mango, lychee jelly, and popping boba. It was good but didn't knock my socks off. But after that bubble tea, my socks were already long gone.As a nearby resident, I'm already planning on returning and trying everything else they have to offer.

10.description: I love their fresh taro smoothie. The lady is always so friendly and welcoming! I always get my smoothie with lychee jelly and it tastes amazing!

5.description: What a great find through my Yelp search for nearby restaurants! I think this place actually used to be a nail salon I'd go to once in awhile.Anyway's it's such a cute spot! I was greeted with a warm welcome. Along the wall were board games and there were quite a few customers reading books. Sort of reminded me of a classier Starbucks vibe.The menu is really small, but they have a huge variety of bubble teas. I went with the grilled cheese. It was delicious and huge! For .75 extra J had her add turkey. The bread was delicious the sandwich was served on. I also got a Bundt cake, which was just okay. Great place to come to read, play games, and grab a bite to eat.

3.description: I came here on a Thursday morning only because I was in the area and love exploring. I loved the interior decor at this place, it's quiet enough to study and get work done, and there's free wifi! There are books on the shelf as well. I got the fresh young coconut water and loved it! I love coconut water and there aren't that many places in the city that serves fresh coconut water. I love eating the white fruit part of the coconut too and my waitress had given me a spoon to scoop that out so appreciated that as well! I would definitely come back again.

35.description: Fresh ingredients  for every drink on the menu !!! What??? no boba place that I have ever been to have done that before. This place is a place where i highly recommend :) everyone here are all so nice and they make sure that you are happy when you leave. Come check out the place and I'm sure you won't be disappointed!!

19.description: I really love the concept of this place and it executes extremely well.  I was recommended to visit this place so I went to check it out.  This store makes me wish I lived in Chicago.  As far as the atmosphere, the wall painting on the side reminds me of a certain Japanese Blossom lotion decoration from a popular bath and body products store, but I was told it was hand-painted by one of the owners. Very well done! As I walked in, one of the first things I noticed was a group of people playing Catan.  I really love board games so they've got me hooked there.  Also, there's a Foosball table in the middle of the room so overall, it looked like a fun place to hang out during the weekend.  Tbh, the selection of board games was a little sparse, but the wall space is large and they just opened, so I'll give them some slack on that ;). (Also, I didn't have time to enjoy their games this time since I was kind of in a rush.)For the drinks, I shared with some buddies.  We shared a strawberry slushy, a jasmine milk tea with lychee jelly, an avocado slushy, and fresh coconut milk.  The drinks were all wonderful and I was very surprised to learn that the drinks were all made from scratch.  No powder, even for taro milk tea.  I'm planning on trying that next time since you really don't see taro milk tea in an unpowdered form - ever. The coconut milk was also true to its name (on the blackboard).  It was very fresh and you could taste it in how sweet the coconut milk was.  Keep in mind, this is a freshly opened coconut.  They even give you a spoon to help eat the inside.  My friend chopped it open when we got back to his apartment (he was kind of excited to do it) and we got much better access to the coconut flesh then.  As expected, the coconut flesh was very soft and sweet, and I'd definitely recommend chopping it open to get at all the flesh if you do buy one.  Just be careful cutting it though since it takes a bit of force to chop it open. Finally, I got a lemon ricotta cookie which, while a little pricey for the size, was delicious  It was exactly that softness of a freshly baked cookie and was just the right amount of lemony goodness.  That said, I would probably save my money and try one of the Vietnamese coffees instead.  It seemed like other people were really enjoying those.  Overall, I highly recommend this place.

28.description: I am incredibly lazy and never take time to do Yelp reviews, but I had to write about this place! First off, their service is great and the owner is very personable and I had a great experience just from that.  Their boba tea is on another level of delicious. They don't use powders and the difference in taste is huge. She also let me try a savory scone snack they're experimenting with, which was also delicious. I will absolutely be back!

45.description: So happy a bubble tea place opened outside of chinatown. I discovered this hidden gem located right by the clark/division red line stop. I had the Taro bubble tea which was probably the best I've ever had. It was fresh taro rather than powders and super sugary syrups. My boyfriend ordered the red bean milk tea which was also great. There were a few other people in this cozy cafe, but it was relatively quiet on a Friday night. There are a lot of board games (catan, pokemon monopoly, apples-to-apples to name a few), and Foosball table. It would be a great place to bring a few friends and play games. There were also a good amount of outlets and free Wi-Fi if you're looking for somewhere to work/study.While it took a little more time to get our bubble tea than joy yees or Kung fu tea, I really didn't mind because of the top-notch quality. They're also pretty new so this will probably improve with time.Before we left we decided to order the shaved ice which came with ice cream, red bean, strawberries, apples, mango, lychee jelly, and popping boba. It was good but didn't knock my socks off. But after that bubble tea, my socks were already long gone.As a nearby resident, I'm already planning on returning and trying everything else they have to offer.

33.description: WE LOVE IT!!! The lady that owns it is soo cute and amazing ! She's so nice and caring. She kept checking in on us to see if he liked what we got. And she put in extra effort in making our order. She made it look fancy and it tasted delicious ! If you don't know what to get ask her and she'll direct you in the right way. The lichee drink is one of my favorites. Definitely will recommend this place to all my friend !

43.description: It's a bubble tea joint wedged between Old Town and the Gold Coast on LaSalle. Already, that's an anomaly because those neighborhoods mostly have Starbucks. You'll be hard-pressed to find bubble tea outside of Chinatown.Next, Cassava Café has strict quality standards. They use no syrups or powders. In fact, they make their own bubbles! You ask for an avocado slush (yum!)? They are made with real avocados. That means that Vung (pronounced Vaughn) sometimes has to tell me "no" because the avocados aren't ripe enough. Think about that. I think it's a reflection of her commitment to delivering consistently good products. She won't give you a subpar product and hope that you won't notice.Vung and Jason really put their hearts into Cassava Café. They literally made some of the tables! They have free wifi, a foosball table, games (Cards Against Humanity, Battleship, Connect Four, Monopoly, Clue, etc.), puzzles, and novels to keep customers entertained. There are a variety of seating options including two-person tables, communal tables, and a couch.I like to stop by for a Vietnamese Coffee before work or date night in the evenings. We love the sandwiches and salads that Vung creates for us. Somehow she sears cheese on the bread making a delicious crunch! It's incredible and I highly recommend you try any sandwich involving cheese. Besides that, they have some pre-packages Asian foods: ramen, Meji Pandas, Yan Yan, and Shrimp Crackers. They carry two different kinds of coffees: 1) Metropolis and 2) Café du Monde. I've never seen Café du Monde outside of New Orleans so that's a special treat.

2.description: I was so excited to try this place and left disappointed. Pros:West coast boba shop feel.Although I didn't order a sandwich, I watched a waitress make one and it looked amazing.Cons:Boba was hardened and not as fresh as I'd prefer for the prices they were charging :/

18.description: I'm a big fan of bubble/milk tea, but it's not the easiest thing to get out of Chinatown and Argyle here (there's only one other place I know of, in the Loop, that outright does it and another in Wicker Park). When I read about this place opening not too far from where I live, I was really glad to say the least, especially with taro.The space is pretty nice, clean, and open. I think it could use a few more tables, but not much. Another good and smart touch is that they have board games there which is great along with a few communal tables so you can easily play the games.This seems like a great place you'd come to work kind of quietly or just play your friends at some board/card game.The girl working today, who I have a feeling is one of the owners, was really nice, helpful, and cool. Easy to talk to and really had some great suggestions. I started out with the Taro milk tea (w/boba). I'm used to seeing it purple and in this case it wasn't. It quickly became apparent to me that they actually use real taro to make this as I sipped up little bits of it - a lot of other places use powder mix so I appreciate them actually making it the right way. The boba were also really good - not too hard but not too soft. High quality.After that I had a grilled cheese sandwich with tomato which was pretty good. The tomato on it was roma tomatoes and on the outside was melted cheese (tasted like Asiago). Nice touch - not your typical grilled cheese but good. After that, I ordered some more. Some Jasmine milk tea with lychee, a lemon ricotta cookie, and banana bundt cake. All were really good and I ended up liking the Jasmine milk tea more than the Taro. The girl suggested the lychee in it which was an expert recommendation. The lemon ricotta cookie was really good too. Kind of sweet, but really lemony. The banana bundt cake was pretty damn good too.I'll definitely be back and this place is good. I really appreciate how they use fresh ingredients instead of powder mixes for their milk tea. I'm hoping they're in business for a long time. There's no shortage of pedestrian traffic near there. People just need to come in. Some people may be apprehensive since they don't know what bubble/milk tea is. They should give out some samples for free on the sidewalk to get people more interested and informed. I'll be back next time to try some coffee. This would be a great place to just relax and play a board game too.

41.description: I would say this place is 'fine.' They didn't have coconut milk tea which... is basically the only reason I get bubble tea. But the barista was very apologetic etc. The seating in this place is weird. it doesn't seem like they're utilizing the space well, but I've never seen it running out of space.Overall, if I'm dying for bubble tea I'll go here, but otherwise I'd rather trek down to Chinatown to get it.

52.description: Top notch toasted cheese and Vietnamese coffee. WARNING: though the coffee tastes good enough to shoot back, don't. It'll hit you when you least expect it and you'll be super shakey. The place is clean and has an interesting menu and convientely located off the red line.

50.description: Awesome, cozy place with the most personalized service I've ever seen. The food is delicious, the bubble tea is authentic, the pastries are mouth-watering, and the location is a great hangout spot. If you go in and catch Vung working there, definitely ask for her suggestions. She won't let you down and she'll even remember your favorites!

4.description: Great independent neighborhood hang out cafe serving coffees, teas, bubble tea, Boba and snacks. Lovely, charming young couple owners Vung and Jason, who have both a sense of community and fun, inviting spirits. The Bubble Teas we had were all authentic and delicious, which is their mission, to be true and respectful to not deviating or compromising the high standards of authentic boba. In addition to tables and communal tables for hanging out with friends or your best friends, the computer, there is a large wall shelf with both books and classic and New games including, Cards Against Humanity to enjoy while chilling in the oven bright space. There is even as foosball table, Cafe Du Monde coffee for sale and other fun snacks.Opened only four months, this a a great independent neighborhood spot and we need to support them and keep them close to us. Please visit them and show your support to these budding entrepreneurs. Oh and BTW, if you are from Taiwan, it is NOT your perverted meaning of boba their tagline! You can ask for yourself what it means.

6.description: I came here on a Saturday with a couple friends.  I was excited because it seemed like a "coffee haus" type of place in the city! woohoo..unfortunately, it wasn't a 5 star experience this time around.Drinks (milk teas, boba etc) - all made from natural fruit etc.Taro smoothie ($5.09, total with tax) - one size, made with actual taro so the drink is white, not purple.  I honestly prefer the purple powdered taro drinks, maybe I don't like the original taro taste.Taro milk tea - one size, you can get it either hot or iced.  My friends got one hot and one cold so figure out which one tasted better.  They liked the hot taro milk tea better.  BUT both of the taro drinks tasted wayyy too milky...might as well just buy a gallon of milk for the cost of this drink.  Not recommended.Shaved ice - the bowl was too small for it, the toppings/ice etc kept on falling out while we were trying to grab a bite..It wasn't the delicious ppatbingsoo/shaved ice taste... wouldn't recommend..Costs - ~$5+ for the items here..Customer Service: Atmosphere - it seems like the to-go place to come to if you want to just chat with friends..not too small, but also not too big so depends on the day (you may or may not find seating).  I like the idea of the board games though.Customer Service - they are nice, but not too organized..My friends and I were confused on who's drink was who's when it came out one by one ...apparently a lot of ppl ordered different types of taro drinks that day... Location - very conveniently located near the Clark & Division Red Line and free parking on LaSalle street (on weekends/during specific hours).Heard the Jasmine Milk tea is good here so maybe I'll stop by to try that next time..

22.description: Can't say enough good things about this place. Brand new, clean, friendly people. A coffee shop with food and bubble tea, fast and free wi-fi, good tables to work or study at.I didn't love the grilled cheese that I got but it was good enough and the coffee was good. I have a hard time finding coffee places open late in this area, so it's a great option when nothing else is open too. Highly recommend checking this place out!

15.description: This adorable cafe is a really great place to read, work, or spend a lazy Sunday afternoon with friends, which is what I did. But I think another great occasion to suggest this cafe would be for those "I'm not sure if I like you and I want to make a smart decision" dates. Here's why:1. The decor is friendly and charming, but the IKEA furniture keeps it from seeming like you're trying too hard2. It's well lit with soft jazz tunes filling the air. You won't have to worry about not hearing or seeing them properly.3. It's possible that this only applies to me, but if your person doesn't like smoothies and pastries, it's probably not meant to be.4. There are games to play and puzzles to do so you don't have to worry about awkwardness or running out of conversation topics while you slurp on your boba.Anyway, this spot is super cute and it's nice to not have to schelp all the way to chinatown for bubble tea, especially bubble tea with fresh ingredients!PS: the princess puzzle was missing a piece when we did it

20.description: Favorite new cafe in Chicago! Delicious boba teas (all local ingredients/homemade) and tasty other caffeinated drinks (sometimes even decorated with panda lattes)! We've also had the grilled cheese and shaved ice which were great. Fun place to catch up with friends over games (we've played Set and bridge) as well as for hours-long studying sessions (free wi-fi, ample seating, great lighting). Friendly service. Right off the Clark/Division stop.

36.description: Finally a bubble tea place that not too far south in chinatown or too far north. This location is just right in Old Town! The set up is pretty cool with board games, card games and a Foosball table. Once it gets more busy it would be nice to see more sofas maybe. They specialize in all natural ingredients in their drinks...which could be why they are bit pricy (even without bubbles). I tried the Jasmine milk tea with lychee which was pretty good. 2/11 update: I like that many of their bubbles teas can be made hot (great for the cold weather). Try the royal milk tea hot!

14.description: It's such an unassuming spot, and it was found through the Yelp app. It's a pretty decent sized coffee and drink spot. My boyfriend and I truly enjoyed the fooz ball table while waiting for my Vietnamese coffee drink to be finished dripping. It was very tasty, and the prices were reasonable. The barista was also very nice. I would love to come back and try the bubble tea.

12.description: My new favorite nail salon!  Great atmosphere and friendly staff.  Their manicures last a long time and always look great.  Pedicures are super relaxing and you get to choose what kind of scrub you would like.  It's a great idea to join their membership club- I joined for free when they first opened and I get discounts on every mani and pedi.  You won't be disappointed!!

3.description: Every time I go to this salon I am rushed in picking a color. I don't know about you, but I can't decide on what I want in 30 seconds when it comes to my nail care. Give me a proper minute to look at the colors to decide. Also they just let you sit there at the nail dryers forever because they don't turn off. No joke I just sat there for a good 30 minutes waiting for it to go off and no one told me when my nails will be dry. I use to go to Sapphire Salon in Lakeview and I prefer that place way more than Spa Dabin. Not only is the price point great, but they let me take my time in picking my color and tip on my credit card.

1.description: Two hours and $50 for a mani and pedi; not only did I have to go home and immediately remove the nail polish I also had to file my nails so they'd be even. What a waste of time and money.

2.description: I used to go here pretty regularly for manicures. I found their nail estheticians to be hit or miss. The last time I was here a customer brought in their dog and then the dog was roaming around the shop the entire time. I found this pretty odd and unsanitary. The dog kept barking at customers in the shop. The staff didn't say anything to this customer. The customer did nothing to control her dog. This was my last straw with this place. I'll go to a different nail salon where I don't need to worry about a dog running around and barking the whole time.

9.description: Wow, I can't say enough good things about this spa. It's adorable, clean and comfortable. The staff makes you feel like they want you to stay all day to relax there.  I had a mani/pedi and the woman who did my nails paid such close attention to detail. I highly recommend this spa!

10.description: Came here with a Gilt City deal before NYE and this place is AWESOME!  They put little half socks on my feet to keep my bare feet toasty in the chilly weather and the Vinylux polish was the best- no chips for a week and it was easy to take off!

13.description: Cozy atmosphere!

16.description: I can truly say that I received the absolute worst manicure ever at this place. The bell should've gone off when I got there on a weekday during lunch hour and not one customer other than myself was in there!   Literally a twenty minute manicure! And believe me it shows!  The girl barely trimmed my cuticles, so basically the so called manicure ended up being a polish change.  And what a joke that was!  The girl did not do a thorough polish job at all...She didn't put any polish on the extreme tips of my nails, I believe the technical term is called "wrapping," essentially swiping the nail polish brush up and over the extreme tips of the nails so that the color is uniformly placed on each nail (Please note, I had a traditional manicure, not a no chip).  So because the girl did not adequately apply the nail polish pretty much the next day the white un-polished tips of my nails stood out like a sore thumb in comparison to my deep magenta pink nail polish.  And just two days after the manicure, the un-polished tips are just hideous!  And then let's talk about the fact that the so called nail tech didn't even polish evenly down to the base/cuticle of the nail, so there's noticeable, un-polished gaps in the area where the cuticle meets the base/extreme bottom portion.  The same thing is true as to the sides of my nails in that the nail polish wasn't applied evenly down the far sides of the nails so just a day and a half after the manicure the gaps down the sides of the nails and at the base of the nails is ridiculously noticeable.  Above and beyond the horrific manicure, (again, if that's what you call it), the vibe in the place was really weird.  There was a huge disconnect between some of the non-Asian employees, including the American/Non-Asian receptionist, and the Eastern European nail tech, and the other Asian/Korean employees, in particular the owner.  Upon my arrival, even though I was the only customer in there, the older Korean lady, presumably the owner/manager, was fumbling around trying to figure out basically which girl's turn it was to do a manicure, and in a rather crude voice summons the Eastern European girl over to do my nails.  There were absolutely no niceties directed to me whatsoever from this older Korean lady, who I believe was the owner, even though I was the only customer patronizing her so called nail salon.  And the other Korean nail techs were eating some garlicky, smelly food while I'm trying to get my nails done.  Horrible lighting in there, so in a way I'm not surprised at how my nails turned out.  Finally, the icing on the cake...I contacted them via e-mail, an extremely detailed e-mail re the issues w/my nails.  I left my contact info, and asked them to give me a refund of the $15.00 I paid for this shoddy manicure...Ask me if they ever called me back/contacted me....Not!!!!  I took pics of my nails a day and a half later.  If I can figure out how to post them to my review I will...Believe me, you all will be shocked by what my nails look like!!!  Word to the wise, avoid this place like the plague!!!  A child could've done a better job painting my nails!!!

6.description: Super clean and great work! They do not chat in other languages with each other like other places I have been to. They are quiet and very professional. Joanna is the best! I always ask for her.

15.description: What a lovely experience. The staff is friendly, the space is clean and bright and the massage with the mani-pedi is worth the trip! I will definitely be a repeat customer here.

0.description: I've been going here for over a year and love it!  I don't even need to specify a certain person because everyone is so good (& I'm picky).  It's a nice atmosphere, clean, and reasonable prices.  They give a mini-massage + hot towels.  Highly recommend.

5.description: Giving 3 stars because so far my experience has been a hit or miss at this nail salon. While I really liked one of the girls' regular mani work, I simply hated the  French no chip I got there once with one of the guys. He just didn't do a good job cleaning up the nail at all, but also used a very bad nail polish and after doing it in one of my hands, I asked him if that was normal and he said yes, I'm not exaggerating, it looked gross, and he ignored the fact the nail polish was bad and kept doing it. Of course after a while, when I saw that the huge spots in the nails wasn't going away, I told him to take it off. Now imagine how convenient, after all the long wait for the no chip application, we had to remove it, and redo it. However, even after using a "better" nail polish, it still looked bad. I left the salon pretty unhappy, and it wasn't cheap. But again, the last 2 times I went there I got a regular mani with one of the girls and she was good. Now I'm anxious to try French no chip again, as I love that and my fave salon in Lincoln Park shut down :( I'll keep trying this place until I get super annoyed and find another salon...its just so convenient for me to go there.

11.description: Very disappointed! I like to use my own polish when getting my mani-pedi. They charge you for using your own! $10-$15 extra! How crazy is that!

8.description: Not enjoyable.  Pedicure: They don't have traditional massaging chairs... which would be totally fine if the seats provided weren't shallow bench-type things you can't relax in (isn't that half the point of a pedicure?!).  They do an ok job polishing but on both of my visits left way too much dead skin; I'm a runner and one of the nasty side effects is big ugly callouses that I'd prefer to have scrubbed off.Manicure:Terrible.  I was talked into "upgrading" to some vinyl polish that lasts at least a week.  The same young man did my manicure both times and both times I left looking like I slapped dollar store nail stickers on.  The bubbling in the polish was so severe I returned the next day and a great older woman fixed them; if I didn't have such a bad taste in my mouth from the other issues I would recommend her.  Overall, hard pass.  I've since moved out of the area but regardless would not return.

4.description: So many reasons I'd pass on this salon, but my most recent experience included my pedicure being done by a kid who wasn't a day over 18. He first reprimanded me for having to prop myself up repeatedly, as I slid down their lousy seating - mind you, I was 7 months pregnant trying my best to keep still. He completely failed to pumice or exfoliate my feet. Isn't that a core aspect of the service? For their absurd pedicure pricing, I would think so. Then when it got to the actual nail work, let's just say there was bleeding involved. As far as painting goes, I would have preferred he use a stencil per nail, because he essentially slathered paint across each toe, and scraped it off with his nail when done. I was having my nails and toes done at the same time, and the girl doing my nails, after seeing me inspect my shoddily done pedicure, said she'd redo his work. This was a kind gesture, only it was a the expense of an extra 30 minutes of my time. I recognize this is just one technician, however previous experiences had been filled with rude and overpriced service. This was just the final straw. I won't be going back, and would recommend anyone walk a few blocks up the street to one of the other salons - cheaper, friendlier and FAR more efficient.

14.description: Spa Dabin is my new go-to nail salon. The salon is super cute and they do a great job! Some of the women put an extra layer of base coat between the two coats of polish and my mani/pedis usually last a week and a half to two weeks! They go out of their way to make you comfortable and everyone is super friendly. Great location and the rewards program is also definitely worth it.

7.description: No kidding, the manager called me the same afternoon that I had a confusing phone experience with the receptionist and asked me to come in so they could re-do the manicure for free.  They treated me like their most valuable VIP that afternoon!  I'm incredibly impressed with their customer service and loved the product already.  Tip for folks trying Vinylux for the first time:  don't do spa manicure; I think that's what had it chipping so much the first time.  too many oils for the Vinylux to adhere.  But please go to Spa Dabin; they're wonderful.

58.description: I have had food from here delivered twice while at work and both times the experience was completely awesome.The portions are really generous for how cheap it is, and it still tastes really good and hits the spot. Both times I ordered the chicken and broccoli and both times it was delicious.Also, everyone I've interacted with there was really friendly and the delivery time was AMAZING for being delivered downtown.Both times I have been completely impressed by this place.

56.description: Kind of a 'fast-food' Chinese joint in southern Old Town. I used to order from here before I lived in the area, and now that I can see it from my balcony, I'm obviously there a little more. The food is great. Crab Rangoon is one of the best I've ever had. Not bad on the price either. And the portions are pretty big-- I'm not one to eat a great deal in a single sitting, so I've always got leftovers no matter what I get.Why only 3 stars? Well, this place is great as a delivery or carry-out joint; but I wouldn't necessarily recommend dining in. Not very clean looking inside; definitely has the 'fast-food' esque vibe.

29.description: Food didn't look at all what we ordered. They didn't ask use what size we wanted and since we never ordered, we got charged for more than we could eat. Not to say I had an appetite after seeing the food.

42.description: China Doll is one of my favorite spots for Chinese cuisine..I've known the owner for years...Pepper steak is real nice!!

23.description: I just ordered Sesame Chicken last weekend and the "chicken" had a soggy covering and pieces of fat and whatnot on it. Also, the sauce was bland and vegetables were soggy. It was absolutely disgusting. I threw it away and would never order from here again!!

47.description: The food wasn't bad, it kinda stunk bad when I was in there but besides that there were no other complaints

8.description: yelp's chicago.eat24hours.com/c… is soooo stupid.  It just claimed China Doll is "CLOSED" -- it's 6:58pm on a Saturday.  So...we placed our order on Grub Hub.  We love China Doll...food is awesome.  Delivery is quick.

31.description: For the money.large portions.. fast delivery hot when you get it...for guys who want to eat. Not the most delicious ....very acceptable taste. Guys like this place more than women because of this. As long as we eat.. we happy.

34.description: I order pepper steak from this place all the time, atleast 3 times a week, and its always SLAMMIN!!! No one in Chicago can make pepper steak like China Doll it always smells and tastes sooo Damn Good......The other Food is good too but the Pepper steak can't be topped LoLO and since its located on Wells Street you know how that goes No Parking gotta pay the paybox..

16.description: I've eaten here a few times and the food is just so-so. Nothing special. The prices are cheap and you get your food fast. Very oily and greasy. Worth a try but there are definitely much better chinese places in the neighborhood.

13.description: If you like this restaurant, you don't know Chinese food from shoe leather.  I'm serious.  I ordered twice cooked pork and it was by far the worst twice cooked pork I have ever had.  Actually the only thing in it that is in traditional twice cooked pork was the pork.  But even that was stretching it, as they used a completely wrong cut of pork.Every other ingredient in the dish is not an ingredient that is supposed to be in twice cooked pork.  Needless to say, it was missing all the crucial ingredients.  It tasted nothing like twice cooked pork.  And when I say nothing, I mean nothing as in the way steak tastes nothing like cream of broccoli soup.Even if I give them the benefit of the doubt and assume they were making a different dish, I honestly don't know what that dish would be.  A moo goo gai pan ripoff with pork instead of chicken?  And preserved bamboo instead of fresh vegetables?  Possibly.  Except that dish doesn't exist in Chinese cooking.Whatever it was they thought they were making, I can vividly describe what it tasted like:  decayed meat covered by a weak white wine based (as in mostly starch instead of wine) sauce.

11.description: Straight up, the Hot and Sour soup is inedible. Smells rancid and gross. And tasted weird. I want my money back but it's raining. Other than that, yeah it's Chinese food. Taste like mall food sure whatever.Reasonable portion size for the prize I guess so that's why 2 stars. I won't be coming back. Sorry if you're reading this and you're hungry - keep looking!

39.description: This place has great food- I've been coming here for over 10 years.  I'm not sure why there are so many bad reviews, sounds like too many yuppies w/their noses in the air.  Their stir-fried shrimp, kung pao chicken and mangolian beef are awesome.  I absolutely LOVE this place.  I eat here at least once a week and have never had something I didn't like.  As for all the negative reviews, these people are mistaken.  Chinadoll is my favorite place to get Chinese from and a great place to stop in and have a quick lunch.  I've had great service from Chinadoll for over a decade.... LOVE LOVE LOVE IT.  Best stir-fried shrimp in the city.

37.description: I order from this place a lot and the reason I order from here a lot is because it's fast, never have they messed up an order, it's inexpensive, and I know what to expect from the price. It's your average Amerinese food. Not gonna wins any awards except from the only source that matters - my stomach. There's no pandering, no showboating, no surprises. It's standard fare. So if you consider yourself a self-proclaimed foodie, or food guru, or Professor of Foodonomics with a PHD in Savorlinguistics, or General Chewface of the USS Tasty - stay away. And also get off your pretentious high horse.

0.description: It was 10:30 and I wanted Chinese food for breakfast. China Doll was the only place open on GrubHub and it was exactly what I needed. Food arrived hot in about 45 minutes. Shrimp fried rice and egg rolls were pretty good, nothing exciting or fancy, but still good. PS Egg rolls are really underrated as a breakfast food.

38.description: The food is absolutely sub par, let's be honest. I used grub hub to have them deliver it to my job, and they interrupted customers to try and get someone's attention. If it's paid for- tip included, I'd prefer you to just abandon it then to disrupt other people- clearly there are no standards for customer service- awesome. Now I know they can't handle delivery unless it's to the privacy of my home.

51.description: I'm not sure why people gave this place such bad reviews. Obviously this is not high-class or authentic Chinese food, but since I moved downtown this has been my go-to place for fast, cheap Chinese. Being Chinese myself, I do get a little embarrassed ordering Americanized Chinese food, but I have to admit that it usually tastes pretty good!  China Doll fits this niche pretty well.This place is always fast, and the delivery guys have always been nice and courteous. I have ordered crab rangoon, sesame chicken, chicken chop suey, and chicken chow fun from here. I think that the crab rangoon and sesame chicken are both delicious. I like how the sesame chicken is not your typical greasy, syrupy sweet sauce used by most Chinese restaurants. It's a unique sauce that is actually a little spicy, which was a pleasant surprise.Skip chow fun and chop suey--they are both horrible.

27.description: One word to describe our meal .....BLAND! I had veggie fried rice & veggie egg rolls. My bf had the combination lo mein and crab rangoons. Everything was edible but lack any flavor. I seriously think frozen Chinese would have had more flavor. Plus, no fortune cookies. You can't order Chinese & not get fortune cookies!

32.description: We have been ordering from China Doll for the past several months. Typically we request Mongolian beef, shrimp sub gum chow mien with pan fried noodles and vegetable egg foo young. All are excellent, but the beef might be a bit too mild for some. We have also tried the egg rolls, but they were a disappointment. Service is really great. Food comes at designated time and arrives hot. Delivery people and order takers are very courteous. As some have mentioned, this is not high end, but prices are very reasonable and portions are generous.

54.description: ... was that chicken...?Grub Hub, Sunday night, who's delivering and doesn't have a $15 minimum? Ok China Doll, it's go time.40 minutes, a confused delivery driver and $14 later, I opened my half order of orange chicken, small rice and egg roll to find orange chicken and small rice. Phone call to China Doll and rather than have the driver come back for a measly egg roll, I asked for a refund to my card. I was told that was Grub Hub's duty so I decided to have them bring it (because something told me that would be a bigger hassle and I probably wouldn't be ordering from them again anyway, just a hunch). Hunch turns to fact. Three bites of "spicy" orange chicken yielded whatever the chicken equivalent is to gristle, some grease and not much orange. 20 minutes later, the buzzer rang and after some more confusion, the egg rolls arrived. They were tasty, the guy brought them back without any attitude and for that, they get another star. No way I'm ordering from there again though, sorry.

48.description: I've lived in Chicago for 3 years and have yet to find a kung pao chicken similar to what I consider to be the best in this country (in another city).  I've eaten at likely 12-15 different Chinese restaurants in Chicago and have not found one I like (in chinatown, downtown, lincoln park, lakeview, edgewater, etc).  It is often greasy, lacking flavor (and very often not spicy), mystery chicken, gross vegetables, etc.My point is:  The Kung Pao chicken I had from this place last week is the best I've found here so far (not my favorite ever, but the best out of 12-15 chinese restaurants in Chicago.  The chicken was good (no fatty, weird parts), it was nicely spicey (and not just loaded with peppers where the sauce has no flavor), and good vegetables.  A solid kung pao - and I'm no amateur when it comes to kung pao haha.Delivery was also quick - but that's just about any chinese restaurant I've tried.

44.description: Nice place to get quick lunch very nice staff

24.description: I've ordered from China Doll four times because it seemed like one of the cleaner albeit slightly bland options for Chinese in the neighborhood.  The first few times I ordered Kung Pao Chicken it was slightly bland but the meat seemed fresh.  I just ordered Orange Chicken today, however, and it was truly appalling, the chicken itself had rock hard deposits of fat or something inside, a soggy thinly breaded exterior, and the sauce was a bland modified barbecue sauce.  It was absolutely disgusting.  I threw it away.

7.description: Full disclosure: most of this review had to do with the utterly poor delivery driver that I just experienced. I've had a lot of food delivered to my office downtown, since I can't leave my office for more than 5 minutes. As I work in radio, I can't just up and run downstairs at a moment's notice. I ordered through Grubhub, and included specific instructions for the delivery: "Call [phone number], and I'll be down in a few minutes." When he called, I told him I'd be down in about 5 minutes, since I had to go on air for a report. He said, "Five minutes?!" with such a tone in his voice that it was outrageous that I tell him that. I immediate responded with, "Is that okay, or should I call and ask for a refund?" I told him that I work for a radio station and I had a report coming up.After a too-long pause, he sighed loudly, he said, "Five minutes." When I saw him downstairs, I told him that I didn't appreciate the tone he took on the phone. I said he was lucky that I prepaid the tip, otherwise I would've given him nothing. He rolled his eyes, shook his head, and got back in his car.Unbelievable. The food is decent, but the service left a bad taste in my mouth. Debatable if I'll order from here again.

49.description: All I can say is AWFUL.  Just kidding - that isn't all I can say.  I'm in Chicago, on business, staying downtown.  It's Sunday night and nothing within walking distance is even open.  Found this place on GrubHub, not a huge minimum for delivery and they are open!  Everything after that is down hill.  No napkins, utensils or anything with it despite that they asked me how many place settings I wanted on the phone.  Egg rolls were edible but not longer crispy.  I ordered sesame chicken, but it came in beef w/ broccoli sauce (including the broccoli).  The beef lo-mein I got came with noodles from a 25 cent ramen package - oh except the ramen has more flavor.  I REGRET that i chose this place over McDonalds.  I didn't starve between the pseudo-edible egg rolls and the tiny box of white rice they included.Please stay away from this place.  If it were my money and I wasn't expensing it, I'd seriously dispute the charges.

40.description: Yeah the chicken dishes are hit or miss but the moo shu pork and the beef dishes seem pretty consistently acceptable. Ordered from there 3-4 times since finding them about 2 months ago. Personally I think it's better than Empire Kitchen as they over soy sauce everything to make it more tasty.

53.description: A long time ago, This was a great Chinese restaurant. But the one on N.Milwaukee was far from pleasing. I had an Egg Foo Young dinner sans the classic gravy. WHAT???????, No Egg Foo Young without gravy??????????????. Gee whiz.......

30.description: I ordered the orange chicken, pretty sure it wasn't chicken. The fries rice & egg rolls were also gross. Easily the worst Chinese food I've ever had. BLAH

46.description: I so wanted to like this place. I'd passed by it several times. Stopped in to pick up some chop suey and fried rice to go. Mistake. I've never had such bad fried rice in my life. Any Chinese fast food chain rice would have been better. It was very dark looking, but I was open minded. Awful, Just awful. The veggie chop suey wasn't so bad, but if you're a Chinese restaurant and you can't even have decent fried rice -- why bother? That's a staple. Shameful.Now I know why it's empty a lot of the time. It's convenient and the only Chinese in the area, so maybe people have gotten used to the mediocrity. I will not be back. I'm moving anyway, so it will not be a loss!

1.description: This was hands down the worst Chinese food I have ever had in my life. Sesame Chicken-Horrible and tasteless Lo Mein-Completely inedible Broccoli Beef-Tasted like burnt pot bottomVisiting from NY and this was an awful first meal. Gross!!! I wish I could give it less than a star

55.description: I'm kind of, what you'd call a "moo shu guru" because that's usually my favorite thing to have when I'm choosing my Chinese food... However, China Doll probably had the worst moo shu chicken I've had in a long time. There was barely any chicken and it was super saucy...BEFORE the plum sauce.I'm sure other things on their menu are great, but moo shu is not their forte.

9.description: Some of the worst Chinese food I've ever had.The Vegetable Lo Mein was unlike any Vegetable Lo Mein I've ever had.  The noodles for the lo mein were curly vermicelli noodles.  There were just as many mung bean sprouts as there were noodles and they were soggy and grey and tasted soggy and grey.  There was also a strange mixed of vegetables that didn't work well together - disintegrated tomato slices, soggy snow peas, cabbage, bell peppers, three different types of mushrooms.  The dish smelled rancid and I didn't bother finishing it.  The Orange Chicken sauce was watery and flavorless.  Burnt egg rolls and bland wonton soup finished off the order.  Never again.

26.description: First, I'd like to thank the man that called me for asking me if I wanted Shrimp in my vegetable egg rolls or just vegetables, because if he hadn't made that call I would be dead right now. On the other hand, is shrimp a vegetable I guess I need to be more firm in stating that I do not want shellfish. Egg Rolls - outstanding darn I couldn't help myself only two per order! :) Vegetable fried Rice - ExcellentEgg Foo Young - hmmm...not seasoned too good, but still good.I don't know who the cook was tonight, but they made my night. Thanks... China Doll, I fell like an American Doll after eating your take out. :) ha

25.description: Quick delivery! Tasty meal. A must every week!

12.description: First and last time ordering here.Got General Tso's chicken which tastes nothing at all the way GT is supposed to be.  Flavorless and tasteless.They use breaded chicken which is ridiculous.I also got the combination fried rice ( shrimp, chicken and beef) It tasted good until I bit into the beef.
