It's disgusting and tastes like pieces of flavorless bits of flank steak.  Ruins the taste of the rest of the rice.  There is literally no flavor in these dishes.Ordered using grub hub and the lady up front sat there oblivious to me waiting on a pick up.  Asked a chef in the back after signaling him down that I was here for a pick up.I never write reviews, especially bad ones unless I must.I never throw out food and the only thing that saved me from throwing this away was the homeless guy downstairs who was sitting there and seemed like he hasn't had a meal in a long time.  Even then I thought twice about giving him this.

59.description: Hey!  The food here is pretty decent.  I have ordered from her 3-4 times this year and it is consistently good.  Not as great as some of the gourmet Chinese places, but worthy of my repeated business.

21.description: Do not trust google reviews, that is how I got a very bad meal. Never again! I read the other reviews and thought I would enjoy a nice dinner. I didn't hardly eat any of it and still feel sick. It was nasty. I don't know if it was a bad batch of fried rice, egg drop soup, and shrimp lo mein. Not good at all.

17.description: Just had the sweet n sour chicken lunch with fried rice from this place: worst sweet and sour ever.

10.description: I ordered from China Doll on a Tuesday night using Grubhub. The order came in about 40 minutes, which isn't too bad considering the time of the delivery. I ordered the Sesame Chicken and Pork Lo Mein, and used a coupon to receive a free beef fried rice. The order was quite big and I thought I had ordered a bit too much for myself to finish. Nope.The Sesame Chicken, as another reviewer has noted, was flavorless. I have never dipped chicken in so much sauce for it to taste like nothing. Not salty, not saucy, nothing. I don't even know what I was eating. I guess it may have been healthier because it certainly tasted like nothing. The dish it came in was large, but 30% of it was broccoli and a weird vegetable that I didn't quite like. I actually don't even know what it was.The Pork Lo Mein was, well, not really a lo mein. The noodles used was a vermicelli sized curly noodle, which you know if you eat Chinese food as much as I do, is often used for chow mein. Maybe they ran out or maybe Chicago uses these for lo mein, but it was not what I was expecting. Very little flavor, and way too many odd vegetables for me to enjoy.I'm glad I ordered the above two orders, however, because the free beef fried rice that came with the +$20 order was quite good. Other reviewers have said they didn't like the beef that was in the rice, which I definitely agree with, but you can't really have pieces of filet mignon in fried rice, and after the first two dishes, I was relieved to find something rather edible. The order also came with a side of white rice, which was, to my surprise, bad. How do you mess up white rice? I don't even know.0.5 stars for beef fried rice, 0.5 stars for quick service, 0 stars for all other foods. 1 star for ample utensils and napkins and sturdy packaging. (I really don't like leaving 1 star reviews). I hate bashing on restaurants because I'm sure it's difficult to run a successful restaurant, but China Doll should really look into revising its recipe. It has potential to be good, but just needs a new way of doing things.

5.description: So far everything I order has been pretty good.  Delivery is fast too.

3.description: By far the worst Chinese restaurant I have ever had. The beef fried rice tasted expired and the rice was mushy. I paid for an order  of egg rolls that I didn't receive and they charged me for.  I would never order from here again.

35.description: This was the worst Chinese food I've ever had. The Kung Pao Chicken and Beef Pepper Steak were INCREDIBLY bland. My husband typically eats anything, but he wouldn't eat all of his serving of Kung Pao Chicken. What a disappointment!

19.description: I've ordered from China Doll four times because it seemed like one of the cleaner albeit slightly bland options for Chinese in the neighborhood.  The first few times I ordered Kung Pao Chicken it was slightly bland but the meat seemed fresh.  I just ordered Orange Chicken today, however, and it was truly appalling, the chicken itself had rock hard deposits of fat or something inside, a soggy thinly breaded exterior, and the sauce was a bland modified barbecue sauce.  It was absolutely disgusting.  I threw it away.

28.description: Not great but good Chinese. The Veggie Egg Roll was great!  The orange chicken had more flavor then the sesame chicken.  Chicken fried rice is good.  Delivery was prompt.  I think we will order again.  They need to take it easy with the staples and the bag.  I think there was well over a bakers dozen of staples tattooed to the delivery bag.

45.description: Hands down, one of the worst fast food establishments on the planet...that's right, I've been all around the planet (ok not really, however this is Bad with a CAPITAL B).They try to be a jack of all trades (greasy fast food American and Chinese) but a master of none.Skip it and grab a snickers bar from the Walgreens down on North and Wells instead.

33.description: so....i just finished my really gross food.   I came to this site to see if there were any posts that agreed with my experience and what do I find....THE CHICKEN TASTES LIKE SOAP/CHLORINE/PETROLEUM PRODUCTS. I think its from the plastic tupperware containers they use.  As I sit here and type this, i have a taste of heavy metal in my mouth.  Its really gross.  I feel like I will have an arm growing out of my forehead in 5 years. I ordered once, smelled like a chlorinated bleached oil rig.  Just finished my second order and am now convinced that this was not a fluke.  This place sucks.  Dont bother ordering anything with chicken in it because you are simply poisoning your self

43.description: I just moved into the area and went there with my boy friend.  The lady at the counter was very friendly (That's why I gave it 2 stars instead of one).  The food tasted like crappy chinese food.  Made both my boyfriend and I sick within 20 minutes of leaving.  Will not go back!

2.description: They charged a $2.50 delivery fee. I got the spicy garlic chicken and it tasted like nothing. There's no taste like no flavors to the chicken :-( The hot and sour soup wasn't bad though. I would not order from here again. It did arrived after 45 mins.

18.description: One word to describe our meal .....BLAND! I had veggie fried rice & veggie egg rolls. My bf had the combination lo mein and crab rangoons. Everything was edible but lack any flavor. I seriously think frozen Chinese would have had more flavor. Plus, no fortune cookies. You can't order Chinese & not get fortune cookies!

41.description: I've ordered from this place twice. The first order was gross.....shame on them. I ordered again and the second order was absolutely revolting....shame on me for giving this place a second chance. I ordered the crab rangoon (arrived cold) and the orange chicken.....ugh, I cannot put into words how disgusting this was. I'm pretty sure it wasn't actually chicken and it was soggy and the sauce tasted like body odor. I've never tasted body odor but if I had I am sure it would taste like their orange chicken sauce. Never, ever, ever order from this place.

52.description: To be fair, I have only had delivery menu items, but China Doll was quite good.  Of the items I tried -- Pork Fried Rice, General Tsao's Chicken, and Crab Rangoon -- all were above average.In particular, the Crab Rangoon had a large amount of crab, which is a phenomenal deal and exceedingly rare among "cheap" Chinese places.  Most places simply stuff Crab Rangoon with cream cheese, so I was quite surprised.  A+ for value on this aspect...Of note -- the delivery service was particularly slow (over 1.5 hours), but this may have been an isolated incident.In sum -- don't expect fireworks, but if you're looking for a good value for very tasty chinese, then China Doll is a great pick.  I will certainly be back for more!

50.description: horrifying. to echo yelper penny s: WAS THAT CHICKEN!?!?!i write this review after just receiving my delivery order. it arrived prompty. within 50 minutes. i'm just so seriously disappointed with the quality of chinese food available through grubhub. i always check yelp ratings before a grubhub order and they are always between 1 - 3 stars for restaurants that grubhub lists as 4's or 5's. regardless, i decided to try china doll for the first time. ordered a half order of sesame chicken, half order of kung pao chicken and crab rangoon. cheap enough. where do i start? maybe with the fact that the entire order smelled like soap. yelper yoie l. writes "the crab rangoon and sesame chicken are both delicious." did we order from the same place? the sesame chicken had nothing to do with sesame or chicken. rubbery, so so so dry (i chewed for minutes) and a vague, bland brown sauce. threw that away immediately.crab rangoon was edible but no sauce? and kung pao chicken tastes like how a tire smells. i'm still starving.

4.description: What every Thai Place charges $9.00 for this place charges $13.25 and is crap. DO NOT EVER buy here. Overpriced and not good quality

6.description: Inedible Chinese delivery. We smelled it and couldn't eat it. Tried it, couldn't eat it.

22.description: I've eaten here a few times and the food is just so-so. Nothing special. The prices are cheap and you get your food fast. Very oily and greasy. Worth a try but there are definitely much better chinese places in the neighborhood.

15.description: First, I'd like to thank the man that called me for asking me if I wanted Shrimp in my vegetable egg rolls or just vegetables, because if he hadn't made that call I would be dead right now. On the other hand, is shrimp a vegetable I guess I need to be more firm in stating that I do not want shellfish. Egg Rolls - outstanding darn I couldn't help myself only two per order! :) Vegetable fried Rice - ExcellentEgg Foo Young - hmmm...not seasoned too good, but still good.I don't know who the cook was tonight, but they made my night. Thanks... China Doll, I fell like an American Doll after eating your take out. :) ha

57.description: Run-o-the-mill Chinese food. Hot, cheap, and on-time. I'll keep looking til I find THE place for Chinese takeout in my new neighborhood. TIP: Order from Grub Hub for coupons!

20.description: I was little unsure about ordering Chinese food from up north, but I gave it a shot while secretly praying my food was how I like it. I received my food in a timely fashion and boy the food was delicious. I have no complaints.

36.description: not the best. probably the worst Chinese food i've ever had. how is that even possible? Chinese food is supposed to be a safe bet, even the worst isn't "that bad." you know, standard good-bad. this was bad. the order was wrong (placed online, how do you mess that up?) and the taste was flat. so flat and dull that the chicken kow tasted like chlorine. the beef chowmein, well it was too beefy and saucy. how? ugh, so sad to write a negative review, especially when this place was highly recommended.

14.description: I am not sure why there are these bad reviews. We seem to order from a new chinese place each time we are in the mood, as we have yet to find a decent option in Chicago. Last night we rolled the dice with China Doll and had some of the best delivery in the city!We ordered a crab rangoon app, egg drop soup, hot and sour soup, beef fried rice, and kung pao chicken. The crab rangoons were perfectly crispy and hot (never like this when delivered!), the soups both rich in flavor and piping hot. The beef fried rice was good (not great). The kung pao chicken was again good, not great. The sauce was light and not too "gloppy", which is welcomed. We ordered via GrubHub and had hot food in ~45 mins (compared to the GH 1.25 hour estimate). With the amount of awful chinese delivery I have had here, China Doll was great. This will be our go-to for some time!

3.description: Snap Kitchen is a company that is based out of Austin Texas, I am so glad they now have an Old Town location . This is a healthy alternative to the usual convenience food you pick up at the store. The meals are quick and easy, just heat in the microwave! It's amazing for prepared food, the items I tasted were very  good, I didn't have to doctor them up with mass quantities of different seasonings,  I would actually purchase these entrees again. In addition, to making food that tastes good, they are healthy and  low in calories, that's amazing! There is only one downfall Snap Kitchen can be pretty pricey, but that could be because all containers are BPA-free and each is color coordinated per size, along with fresh, local, healthy ingredients. There are options for people who are gluten-free, non-dairy, Vegan, etc... The items I have had and enjoyed were: Turkey Bolognese, Chicken and Butternut Squash, Snap Caesar Salad with Chicken, and Banana Nut Pancakes which were great! Snap Kitchen has a meal program were customers commit to daily healthy eating program for as little as 3 days, or 21 days. Customers plan out and pre-order their meals and snacks and pick up their meals every three days. The other element that Snap Kitchen has going for them is their staff, they are extremely outgoing individuals. They warmly greet customers as they enter the store and are very knowledgeable about all the foods sold. Always patient and polite to every customer, the staff patiently answers question, after question. In addition, the sales staff has kept the store immaculate. There is a wall of microwaves so customers may choose to eat at Snap Kitchen, the staff cleans up immediately, it is spotless.Since, this store has just opened, I am giving Snap Kitchen  4.5 - 5  stars. The Service and food is greet and is 5 stars, but the price is high for the portions. I will by all means be return and recommend it to other if they are in the market for freshly prepared food.

1.description: If Whole Foods and Weight Watchers had a baby, it would be named Snap Kitchen.They have healthy meals in BPA free containers that allow you to throw them right in the microwave. Their nutrition labels tell you exactly what ingredients they used, how many calories are in it and how long it needs to be microwaved. We tried the chimichurri chicken and the sausage spiral pasta. The chimichurri chicken was packed with 44g of protein and 10g of carbs. Pretty good nutritional ratio. Only reason I took off a star is because of the price. Snap portions are properly measured to prevent overeating.  But the food to price ratio doesn't quite balance out.

2.description: We've seen the sign and knew that Snap was coming soon but we didn't know what it was. It's  bright green sign somehow triggered the association that it would be fresh and health conscious.Today we forgot our protein drink for after our Sunday work-out and, on a whim, we decided to detour to Snap Kitchen on our way to the grocery store.Inside were about four cheerful and eager employees. One of them excitedly told us how this particular Snap Kitchen has been in the works for five years. They needed time to find local sources that were as GMO free as possible. WOW. We were sold.I picked out four items: Curried Chicken Salad, Chia & Date Pudding, Snap War Bar, Devily Eggs for $13 (the bar was given to us for free). The wall of food was divided by size and color coded: snacks and meals of various portions.I paid with my credit card at the register and signed up for their rewards program. Next, we got spoons and napkins from a station that also housed condiments and microwaves and then we sat down at the front window.All of our food was scrumptious! The Curried Chicken Salad was our favorite. It had the savory and sweet mix that is customary in curry and the chicken was cut up extra small.We were surprised that we liked the Chia & Date Pudding as much as we did. It had delicious flavor and a lumpy, slimy texture.The Devily Eggs were made with a hummus middle instead of the typical yellow/mayo stuff. It was a good change that I understood and accepted.Lastly, the Snap War Bar was good. It smelled kind of like carrot cake or banana bread. The texture was a lot like a soft, dense bread. It had all of these healthy ingredients in it.We were a little disappointed that there wasn't tap water available (only bottled for sale) and that they don't recycle. We look forward to the freshly pressed juices that are coming soon. We are so excited about this food option that we plan to grab a quick dinner to-go on our way home from work later this week!

5.description: I stopped in to check it out.  Person from the counter came over and started to explain the sizes and color coding of containers (which are microwaveable, reusable and BPA-free).  Above the area where the food is, there are signs for breakfast, lunch dinner, etc.   Their take home menu says that their salmon "is free of antibiotics and preservatives" and their "ground beef is 100% grass-fed, pasture raised, and free of hormones and antibiotics." They also offer gluten-free and vegan choices.I tired the Naked Chicken with Snap Pea and Roasted Cauliflower, and Silken Chocolate "Mousse" (with orange zest).  I liked both and look forward to going back and trying something different.  Hopefully they will open a store on the northside of Chicago.

6.description: I just finished eating my afternoon snack the "blueberry chia pecan parfait" and it was so good. I need to compliment this place because every time I've purchased a pre-made meal or snack from here, I've enjoyed it! I feel good after eating these meals as well- never too full and always satisfied. They do a good job at packaging up unique things. Worth a shot for anyone who cares about what they put in their mouth : )

7.description: I only got Kale crackers here (which were pretty good, healthy tasting) so I feel like I can't be a good judge of Snap Kitchen yet. Like many people have mentioned here though, this is a really cool concept! I'm huge on eating healthy and seeing what this place has to offer was already exciting in itself. My only complaint is that this place is super pricey and I feel like that just discourages healthy eating altogether.

8.description: This place is an interesting concept - prepackaged meals that are "healthy."  I've eaten here a few times and I've enjoyed my food each time.  There are a few negatives, however.The first time I ate here I got a salad which - once I later read the nutrition facts - wasn't actually healthy at all.  They also have a pretty small selection, so I have walked in and walked out because nothing there looked good.  Lastly, you're going to pay a premium for the amount of food you get.  Yeah, it's pretty good, but spending $12 and still being hungry isn't ideal.The food is solid and this is extremely convenient though, so I'll be back.

0.description: I'd go back in a snap. But seriously, I've gone back every other day since I discovered snap kitchen just a few short weeks ago. After seeing the little green balls pop up seemingly all over the city, I wasn't sure what to expect. 4 weeks ago I would've said "prepared pre-packaged foods aren't my thing." Because that sounds lazy, and not fresh, and maybe even gross. But, snap kitchen totally proves that wrong. After a friend tried it out and sold me on testing it, I'm so hooked. Here's why:- the food is GOOD. Whoever is designing the recipes creates such a wide variety of flavors, ensuring the consumers don't get bored with the options - the portions are big! I was shocked to experience just how much food makes up a full day of eating, even when you pick size small meals- the employees are so friendly and helpful. My first time in, a person walked me through the whole process of creating two days worth of meals, and reviewed my picks to ensure I got well balanced choices. - it's really not that expensive! I was terrified of how much it would cost, but when I consider how much I spend on a daily or weekly basis with all of my purchased lunches, whole foods salad bar trips, etc, this is no more expensive than my average days worth of food. If you want to be eating real food, with ingredients you can pronounce, AND you don't want to cook or portion it out yourself, you should probably stop reading Yelp reviews and head to snap kitchen. Now.

4.description: Stopped by today to hopefully pick up a meal but the only thing vegetarian was a cheese & spinach enchilada, which I didn't even ask was gluten-free or not. They did have some nice drinks and a small selection of snacks - but hope they add more variety soon!

0.description: I recently moved to Old Town and since my glasses were crooked I thought I would stop in. Vinnie not only straightened them out but he also tightened the hinges, replaced my old yellow nose parts with fresh ones, and talked to me about the peeling off anti-glare I have going on. I wasn't sure if anyone would even touch them but he actually went above and beyond. We discussed my insurance and he showed me some new frames. In the words of Arnold Schwarzenegger, "I will be back".

58.description: salespeople always cool and knowledgeable, never pushy

56.description: Staff was very friendly on the phone and in the store, however the sales person (though very nice) was not as informed as I would have liked about the Electra bikes.  I think he was new there. According to another sales person, they have only recently begun carrying Electras but they are selling a lot of them.  If that is the case, I would hope they will soon carry more Electra accessories in the store.  All in all, a very good experience!

29.description: I bought my bike here several years ago for a great price. I've been coming back ever since for everything from accessories to services for my bike. The staff is always extremely helpful and friendly.

42.description: Great Service, I have bought 3 bikes from there.  Easy sales process, and really helped me find the right bikes for me at the time.  I think its the best place to go to buy a bike in the city, especially if your just getting into riding.  Follow their recommendations on security and safety.

23.description: Great customer service the place was clean and the staff great you as you enter

47.description: Got a flat and needed the tire replaced today. Walked in, the shop was busy but I was waited on within a few minutes, and the bike was fixed and ready 40 minutes later.

8.description: Superb customer service, coupled with a great selection and knowledgeable team makes for an all-around great experience.I bought a bike here back in winter 2012.  The staff fitted me for a bike, and then walked me through all the important customization decisions (important for a potential racing bike).  Throughout the process I was explained each decision, and not talked down to for not having extensive bike knowledge (not naming specific names, but other bike shops give off a judgy vibe).  The bike came with a care/maintenance package, and I have been coming back for over 3 years to have all my issues taken care of professionally.  The staff is extremely knowledgeable, and are apologetic if they don't get your bike fixed in 48 hours (really that's a quick turnaround).They also have a tent at the annual Bike-The-Drive event, and they saved my ass this year when a crash broke my real derailer.  They had the piece, and I was able to get the bike up to their shop on N Wells later that day.

31.description: I was in the market for a decent road bike and tried out bikes at various shops from Felt, Giant, Specialized and Cannondale.  I thought I should try out a Trek as well so I stopped by Village.  I was surprised when they said that they do not allow test rides.  I left there and picked up a bike from another shop that allowed me to try it out.

34.description: Bought a $700 Trek + 300 in extras. Service was friendly & helpful but they failed to assemble the bike properly and I fell off the bike right after I purchased it because the handlebars weren't secure. I almost got hit by a cab on Wells St. Prices are good but this is too much of a factory. They didn't offer a credit or anything. Luckily I was wearing my helmut.

16.description: Just bought a Trek Madone here, and absolutely love the bike, was thrilled with the price, and really had a great experience service-wise with Tyler.  Seriously, Village is a cool place with people that genuinely know their stuff, aren't too pushy, and love the sport - everything you want in a LBS (local bike shop).So why the 3 stars?  The only reason I post this is so they change (please!) their no-test-ride policy.  I'll change the review to a 5-star review if this changes.I understand test rides are a liability and as a business, I expect them to hedge risk.  However, as someone spending $1000+ on a bike I really need to know how it rides before making the investment.  I decided to pull the trigger because I had done a lot of research and I knew what I was looking for, but for the average customer I think this would be a detriment.   To slightly make up for this, they did a great job fitting me on a trainer and the bike is very comfortable.That said, thank you Village Cycles and especially Tyler!  I'm really happy with the bike and I will be back...But probably after test-riding any potential purchases at another shop.EDIT: they reached out to me after posting this review and reminded me of the stellar return policy. I love my new ride so no returns here- but it's nice to know.

13.description: I recently purchased my Trek Chelsea 8 from here. I love this place! I was a bit nervous about coming to a large bike store on my own, but Jake was patient. Explained the different types and styles of bicycles to me and let me try several on the bike stand. Though it would have been better if I could do a road test (but I understand for theft reasons why they wouldn't) I could not have been happier with my choice!I have been riding it for three days in a row, on the '606', to run errands, to work and just for fun. I am so glad I went here and didn't overspend (as much as I thought I would, but I am so glad I got what I purchased!! Well worth it!)The only draw back is when I went back to get my bike the next day for pick up the pedals didn't match and one of the gears were off-- but no biggie. Just inspect your purchase before you leave.

11.description: I came in today to buy my first beach cruiser and the guy who helped me was great! He recommended different things for me and answered any questions that I had. Very fast checkout and my bike was ready in an hour. I am now loving my city cruiser and I will definitely recommend this place to anyone! I love my bike!!

39.description: Village Cycle Center is not only the best Trek source in Chicago, they also have the best service team for any bike.  The staff is very knowledgeable, helpful, courteous, and always smiling.  From the novice to the pro, everyone who walks through the door is treated with respect, and never upsold.My first experience with Village Cycle Center was when my rear tire kept going flat and I even broke a spoke on a ride, stranding me at the north end of the North Branch Trail.  When I called on a weekend because my usual shop was too busy to help, they told me to bring the wheel right in and they'd check it out.When the service team called and told me that not only was the broken spoke the wrong spoke for the wheel, but also there was another mismatched spoke and the spoke tension was all wrong, it gave me serious concerns about the shop I had previously been frequenting.  They had me out the door quickly and the rim was back to normal.The next year, having commuted nearly year-round in Chicago for years, and using the same bike to commute and do longer pleasure and charity rides, I decided that I wanted to get a good road bike and dedicate the commuter to commuting.  Once I narrowed the field down to getting a Trek model of some kind, I began shopping around, and Village Cycle Center was on the short list of places to visit.When I began discussing my options with Tim, we got right down to business.  His intimate knowledge of the variations between models and levels of bikes was outstanding.  With an eye to balancing component choices with pricing, Tim knows where it's worth it to spend a little more for something better and where the gain won't justify the cost increase.Over a few days, Tim helped me choose a 2013 Madone 5.2, which was right in the sweet spot of components vs. price, and worked with me to get the bike fit to my body before sending me home. Since then, I have been in with both of my bikes for service and advice.  I cannot say enough about how professionally and skillfully the entire team goes about their work.  If a repair is something I can do on my own, I'm not pressured to have the work done for me.  When something bigger needs attention, they always work diligently to get me back out the door in a timely fashion.  In the very rare event something was missed or a mistake was made, they always make it right.So, when I needed a new commuter after laying mine down in traffic, I knew exactly where I was going to make my selection.  Again, Tim helped me choose the right bike and got me out the door with a spectacular bike for a really great price.  My new commuter is a 2014 Crossrip LTD, which was not only an upgrade for my commute, but also will serve me well as I do longer touring rides and begin to dabble in the cyclocross world.If you're a new customer, you're going to be treated really well, regardless of your skill level.  If you're a regular, walking in feels like hanging out with friends, and you know you're going to be well served by an outstanding staff.Get over here and see what they can do for you.  You won't be disappointed.

37.description: I bought a Trek bike from Village Cycle in 2005. After moving with me to Arizona and returning back to Chicago, it was in major need of some TLC. I picked it up yesterday and it's as good as new not to mention the awesome Yelp deal and tune-up promo they honored.

0.description: Great customer service. The staff is always friendly and knowledgeable. The store is a neighborhood stable.They had a hard to find bike rack in stock. Ken made sure I had all the right accessories for installation and installed the rack on my vehicle. I accidentally damaged a part for the rack, which Ken reordered.They also have a nice selection of accessories.

38.description: I saw an ad on Facebook that trek bicycles were on sale. I wandered in only with the intention to look around. I was approached by Fred who is extremely knowledgeable. He walked me through the different models and spent time explaining the features that would be most important to the type of rider I am. We looked at inventory and finally found the one. It was reasonably priced and I even got a pair of riding shoes and new pedals. He politely upsold me without being pushy. He made great recommendations on seats and helmets too. Fred was kind enough to switch over all my accessories from my old bike and taught me how to clip in and out of my new pedals. They also give three free tuneups with all bike purchases. I will definitely be back for all my biking needs. Thanks Fred for all your help!

51.description: Overall great bike shop! I've had a Trek for 15 years and it still is in great shape. Since we now live near the lake and go camping, my boyfriend was in dire need to get a new bike.I had originally searched online for Trek retailers in the area where I stumbled on Village Cycle. After hearing that they had a sale going on, we definitely headed there!The staff was super knowledgable and found us exactly what we wanted! I didn't feel pressured at all to make a bigger purchase. Their repair shop has great deals, too! I will definitely go back whenever I finally replace my own Trek.

27.description: Wonderful trek shop with awesome prices. The staff was more than helpful to fit me to a trek 1.2 I had been researching online. The bike was assembled fast and correctly and the staff was more than willing to show me a few things on the 1.2 that were different from my 7.2. I'll definitely make the long drive from Naperville again for the best prices and service around.

32.description: I bought my first road bike here and the service was amazing. I worked with Tim who spent ample time with me - sizing me for a bike, explaining the difference between the different models (and price points), helping me pick the right shoes, pedals and bike computer.  I visited several other cycle shops in Chicago and visited Village 3x before purchasing since it was a big purchase for me ($2k). Overall, the experience was very positive and I would recommend the shop to anyone looking for their next bike. I love my bike and can't wait for the weather to improve so I can get out and put some miles on it!

54.description: Lots of friendly staff members always willing to help.

48.description: very helpful people, especially with accessories(I already have a bike) and of course the deal coupon couldn't be beaten!  Easy bike park in front and they have air  right there to fill tires

44.description: My husband and I decided to invest in new bikes as a hobby and to get fit.I went to Yelp to search bike shops and was impressed with this place - PLUS they were having a summer sale!We went in completely clueless. I admitted that we were clueless and our salesperson (trying to find his name) was incredibly helpful and did not pressure us.He fitted us both for new bikes and helped educate us on the proper size and fit for our needs. We were looking at some of the bikes on the lower price range and he had nothing but great things to say about those bikes and did not try to pressure us into spending more (this is already an expensive enough hobby, right?)We purchased a bike for my husband, I was not ready to commit yet. Full disclosure - they do try to up-sell you on a ton of accessories, but I did not see it as "up-selling" but as truly trying to be helpful! We did not buy a bike lock or water bottle cage from them, but later bought elsewhere and wished we had just bought from them because they make it easy and install everything and show you how to use it.We came back the next day and purchased a bike for me too. This place has a huge variety of bikes and the customer service is top notch!

24.description: The best bike shop ever! I got a tune up for my bike and got new tires for my bike. I also bought the voucher too. All for $75! So technically i paid $100. But hey my bike feels brand new and I was having the time of my life riding it today. The employees were really nice and one of them gave me an adaptor for my new tires. will be going back again for any services. I do wish they had more parts for single speed bikes.

7.description: They tuned up my girl Penelope (yes I named my road bike)  just in time for my century ride. This place is always busy. I've been here early morning as soon as they open, afternoon and right before they close and there's always a pack of avid cycle enthusiasts here. Guess that what happens when you live in a active city like Chicago.They do tune ups, repairs, bike fittings and  will adjust your bike as needed. All this for very reasonable prices. For instance, after using my indoor trainer all winter I needed new tires, retape my handlebars and lube my bike chain.  They also fixed my bike computer. All for just under $100. I also had a groupon and the grand total was just $20 out the door! Woohoo!!! Ready for another summer of biking. They also have numerous accessories for purchase. Free parking down the street in a garage, but there's also a loading zone directly in front of the store too. Happy riding!

49.description: A true bike shop on steroids. Great selection, from entry level to pro. It was well worth the drive from Aurora  and was not disappointed . Easy parking in downtown Chicago, just don't forget to feed the meter. Awesome sales/service staff that is very knowledgable  and they don't try to up sell. They will ask what you are looking for and budget then give you all options for you to choose from. The only con is they did not mention the accessory items that are on sale and no test rides which is why only 4 stars. Don't forget the yelp 25/50 coupon deal which makes this shop all the sweeter. Do your homework and take the ride! I will be a customer for years to come.......

40.description: New to the bike scene -Like, since I was a kid -...shopped around quite a bit - sorting through bikes, prices, feel, etc. After some good experiences and some not so good ones (see certain bike store in Boys Town...blah) this place was the bomb.Big, friendly, bright -Staff was really cool, professional and helpful -....From Day One had a better experience than most the others but it was in Day Two when I went back to buy that these folks sealed the deal -...they had a really helpful sales guy come and help me (1) talked me through my choices (2) and explained their really useful return policy (3) which really left me feeling like confident in what I was doing -Products come and go but businesses that get it like these guys they are institutions -Check 'em out!

53.description: Fantastic Bike Fitting!!!Stopped into Village Cycle and talked to Tim about a some cycling knee pain. He quickly eyed the problem and we set up a bike fitting for later in the week. The process was amazing. Tim spend a solid 3 hours with me making a million minute adjustments to the bike and the end result is nothing short of perfection. Village cycle is a great place to purchase a bike, have it serviced or get a fitting. If you are reading this review and thinking of a fitting, call and set up an appointment today.

30.description: Just bought a Trek Madone here, and absolutely love the bike, was thrilled with the price, and really had a great experience service-wise with Tyler.  Seriously, Village is a cool place with people that genuinely know their stuff, aren't too pushy, and love the sport - everything you want in a LBS (local bike shop).So why the 3 stars?  The only reason I post this is so they change (please!) their no-test-ride policy.  I'll change the review to a 5-star review if this changes.I understand test rides are a liability and as a business, I expect them to hedge risk.  However, as someone spending $1000+ on a bike I really need to know how it rides before making the investment.  I decided to pull the trigger because I had done a lot of research and I knew what I was looking for, but for the average customer I think this would be a detriment.   To slightly make up for this, they did a great job fitting me on a trainer and the bike is very comfortable.That said, thank you Village Cycles and especially Tyler!  I'm really happy with the bike and I will be back...But probably after test-riding any potential purchases at another shop.EDIT: they reached out to me after posting this review and reminded me of the stellar return policy. I love my new ride so no returns here- but it's nice to know.

46.description: Great place to go if you are looking for a bike. Knowing what you want or having no idea they were very helpful. Every body was very helpful and knowledgable answerd any question I could have. The prices were better then a few of the bike shops I looked at def worth the drive. The only down fall is they mostly only sell trek which was fine because that's what I wanted but hard when trying to compair to other bike brands.

1.description: I don't often give 5 Star reviews, however the efforts of David, Tim and Bill truly deserve It! It's been almost twenty years since I have purchased my last bicycle a Trek 730 Multitrack that still is in perfect shape and has served me well. Searching for a new bike had me visiting several dealerships that will not be named (actually they don't deserve a mention for their poor customer service). Visits to several local bike shops ranged from being totally ignored, given misinformation, prices changing depending who you spoke with on a second visit (that cost one shop out of a sale) This led me to a Google search and discovering Village Cycle. I was totally impressed with their website! Not only was I able to research a huge variety of brands and types of bikes, I was able to do the same with the accessories too. I was impressed with a brand called Electra and their model called the Verse Equipe, that was even on sale too. I then telephoned the shop and spoke with a very knowledgeable gentleman named David who was most helpful. He even did something that most salespeople neglect to do, he asked for the sale by saying "Could I build one for you?". I replied yes, but I had two conditions, I wanted to pay cash (around the holidays, I really don't make purchases by credit card, it's too easy to go overboard), and I wouldn't be able to pick it up until the following weekend.  David said that wouldn't be a problem and he had the bicycle built for me. **There should be at least some type of warning attached to their website, because it is very addictive! I went back to the site and found several accessories that I wanted added to the bike. I phoned the shop and this time I spoke with Tim who answered all my questions and made sure the accessories were added to my bike and it would be ready for pickup. With such excellent attention to customer satisfaction, I even signed up for their newsletter on their website. It was a pleasant surprise when they sent me a Christmas present, a $10.00 gift certificate! I was even more pleasantly surprised by Yelp with an offer of $50.00 for $25.00, and an additional $10.00 off with $25.00 in accessories as a checkin offer!  Today I picked the bike up and they were just as incredible in person as they were on the telephone. I even found a couple more toys too add to the bike. Bill added the new toys to the bike, spent more time going of the features and accessories than the Mercedes dealer did when I got my new car.  Mercedes didn't even come close to the free services Village includes with your new bike purchase. He didn't even grumble when a noticed a scratch of the front fender that was swapped out very quickly. Heck, he even helped me load it into my car. I'm going to stop now, not only because I could go on much longer singing their praises; but I just got the bike home and I'm dying to take it for a ride! If you need a new bicycle, don't be put off by Village perhaps not being your local bike shop (it was over a 40 mile trek for me); it's worth it to find an honest and helpful shop that isn't going to "take you for a ride". Give Village a try! - Bill

55.description: Village cycle was great.  After calling to get some info on purchasing a new bike Tim did a great job. He helped me choose the right bike for my needs (trek cobia) and it's awesome.  So great that I had to go back the next day and get a new bike for my wife.  Highly recommend!

9.description: Great spot for beginning bikers or those who take it a little more seriously. I was in the market for a couple accessories. One of the sales people walked me through all the options, explained everything to me and helped make a good decision. Didn't feel pushy or like they were trying to sell the more expensive stuff. Would definitely return for any of my biking needs!

26.description: They tuned up my girl Penelope (yes I named my road bike)  just in time for my century ride. This place is always busy. I've been here early morning as soon as they open, afternoon and right before they close and there's always a pack of avid cycle enthusiasts here. Guess that what happens when you live in a active city like Chicago.They do tune ups, repairs, bike fittings and  will adjust your bike as needed. All this for very reasonable prices. For instance, after using my indoor trainer all winter I needed new tires, retape my handlebars and lube my bike chain.  They also fixed my bike computer. All for just under $100. I also had a groupon and the grand total was just $20 out the door! Woohoo!!! Ready for another summer of biking. They also have numerous accessories for purchase. Free parking down the street in a garage, but there's also a loading zone directly in front of the store too. Happy riding!

25.description: I don't normally give positive reviews as I feel there are only two kinds of feedback - dollars and negative reviews.   I give dollars and that is where I stop.   HOWEVER, I was compelled to give a positive review here due to the exceptional service (above and beyond) provided by RUS at Village Bike.   I had an accident a few weeks ago that I suspected to be due to loose brakes that I got fixed at Village and even pointed out while checking out.  Obviously other things were involved such as nature, the breaking speed, speed I was riding etc - however RUS asked no questions.  Fixed the bike, replaced the brake cable, made the brake impeccable and added a couple of frills - all for NO CHARGE.  I walked in with perhaps regretting giving them business but their service and great attitude made me walk out happy giving them business.  I give them five stars without any hesitation for being a great neighborhood bike shop that knows how to treat its customers.

12.description: Village cycle didn't let me down. I bought a carbon frame road bike from them in 2009 when I lived in Chicago. I now live in El Paso, TX. I have a small frame issue that may be covered by the manufacturer's lifetime warranty. I need to present the receipt to the manufacturer. Small problem, the thermal printed receipt has faded into oblivion. I called Village Cycle on a busy Saturday and expected to get no attention from them since I am no longer a customer due to my move. I thought it would take multiple follow up calls and weeks to get my receipt. To my surprise, an hour after my call, I received the needed receipt by email. Character is how you treat people that can do nothing for you. Ken Frigo at Village Cycle demonstrated outstanding character and service. Thank you!

59.description: I went in to get a flat fixed and ended up buying a bike. These guys were amazing, they fixed my bike and gave me a new bike seat because mine was broken. They were very friendly and not only got my old bike up and running but gave me a great deal on a new bike! they  got a return customer here!  I did not think i would be able to find such a great bike under $350.

21.description: I came in today to buy my first beach cruiser and the guy who helped me was great! He recommended different things for me and answered any questions that I had. Very fast checkout and my bike was ready in an hour. I am now loving my city cruiser and I will definitely recommend this place to anyone! I love my bike!!

17.description: I had a flat tire and walked my bike to their store at about 8:40 PM, they close at 9, and a guy who was closing up shop stopped what he doing and fixed my tire and adjusted my spokes in about 15 minutes. He could have easily said, "come back tomorrow" but he made the choice to put a customer first and stay a bit later.Also, they charged less than other shops in Chicago to fix a tire.I will definitely be going back because of their price, customer service, and attitude.Thank you.

10.description: They have very nice friendly staff who know everything about bicycles especially the Trek brand of bikes. I didn't buy a bicycle however my husband did. He loves his bicycle I'm sure this won't be the last time I see this Cycle center.

5.description: The service here is exceptional. I got my first bike here and I'm enjoying every bit of her! Thank you Matt for being so informative and having so much patience for this newbie! I got the Trek Chelsea 8. She's the perfect fit for a petite person like myself.

3.description: These guys are a class act and best in class at what they do.  Friendly,  helpful,  knowledgable, attentive staff. Excellent service.  Good selection of bikes and accessories.  Not the cheapest place in town but as I understand it, the staff are on salary,  not commission do you're not pressured to buy and they will take as much time as you need to get comfortable with your purchase decisions.  Glad to have them in the hood.BTW, they have a Yelp deal that hot can buy which can save you some $$$.

35.description: Russ in the service center has done a great job with all of our work. It's a hike for us to get there as we live in the burbs, but is well worth it.

19.description: The best bike shop ever! I got a tune up for my bike and got new tires for my bike. I also bought the voucher too. All for $75! So technically i paid $100. But hey my bike feels brand new and I was having the time of my life riding it today. The employees were really nice and one of them gave me an adaptor for my new tires. will be going back again for any services. I do wish they had more parts for single speed bikes.

28.description: Great bike shop very knowledgeable staff and extremely friendly .Great selection of bikes.

45.description: I am not someone who knows anything about bikes, nor do I claim to.  I went to a bike shop closer to my home, but it was closed because they were moving.  A friendly passerby told me about Village Cycle Center.  Right after speaking with him I took the L up there and walked in.  Friendly and knowledgeable staff with a lot of merchandise.  The prices are much better than other places (I compared).  The staff member I worked with found me a bike, within my price range, that fit my height, weight, etc.  I will be going back and I have been telling my friends about this place!

33.description: Place is awesome. Staff is great and the technical help was top notch. They are very knowledgeable and have the largest selection of Treks in the city. Highly recommend.

43.description: I bought a bike here a few months ago and found the staff helpful but the bare minimum.  Spending 1k means I want to do my research and understand what I'm buying, and the sales person seemed annoyed.  There was an accessories promotion going on which I didn't get or was offered, also a letdown.   When you go in for service the pompous sales people standing around don't even greet you or move out of the aisle so you can get by.  There are a lot of great bike shops in Chicago, go elsewhere.

2.description: I have to update my review- I dropped in to pick up a new bike,but did not realize they do NOT allow test rides here! I was ready to pick up a bike, and actually walked out because I wasn't able to ride the bike around the block! I know it is a small gripe, but what was frustrating because I really like this shop! As I mentioned before, I bought two bikes here previously, and have used them for service before and the staff is great! I'll be back, but just know you can only take the bike on a trainer- but you CAN return within 7 days. So if you are dead set on a model they have, you do have some options just in case it is not what you wanted. And I cannot emphasize enough, the service I have received at this shop is really top notch. Pricing is great too.

18.description: I have had many interactions with Village Cycle Center all of them good.  Once I went in to get replacement cleats, I thought I knew the model but when I showed the clerk the cleats he recognized right away the where an older model and he happened to have those in stock as well.  If I had done that via mail order would have taken weeks not minutes and would have involved a lot of shipping costs. Another time I had a grinding noise coming from my freewheel, took it to another closer bike shop and they said it would take a few days to fix and cost $60.  Came to Village Cycle and they fixed it on the spot in 15 min and it was only $20.I even bought an expensive Trek from them and we tried like 3 frame sizes before settling on one, seems I have been riding frames that were a little too big for me for a long time.

41.description: When I was considering buying a bike, a friend of mine recommended Village Cycle Center. Past experience has shown me that despite him being a lifelong suburbanite who makes rare trips to the city, his recommendations for stuff in Chicago have always been spot-on.I went on a very busy summer Saturday and explained to these guys that I hadn't been on a bike in 25 years and needed one to 1) run quick errands that wouldn't require me to drive or use CTA, and 2) lose about 800 pounds that I desperately need to shed. Never once was I pressured into anything that was terribly costly, and these guys made sure that before I made a final selection that the bike and the frame were appropriate for my height. (Wait...actually, I take back the thing about being pressured...I was almost not allowed to think of leaving unless I bought a helmet! Which was okay because I was planning to do that anyway.)They set me up with a nice Trek Shift 2, which I took home and named Syd. So far the rides have been pretty darn nice, weather permitting. (You know how hard it is for a fat guy to pedal against huge gusts of wind?)A few things worth mentioning that I like about Village Cycle Center:- Huge selection -- not just for bikes but accessories as well.- Free compressed air outside in case you need to inflate your tires. I know that some other stores do that as well, but that's still a nice touch.- Unlike with, say, Johnny Sprockets (another store that I have had great experiences with), you don't have to try to balance a door and your bike when entering -- the entrance is wide open, you just walk the bike right in, no hassling with the door trying to close on you.- Free checkup after 30 hours/30 rides. Again, I know some places offer this, but it's still nice to know I can get that done. Just two days ago from this writing I had my service taken care of, and there was a noticeable positive difference on the ride home.- Prices are reasonable, and they seemingly always have some kind of a sale going on.If you were to ask me what I DON'T like about Village Cycle Center, hmmm....I'd have to say....1) They don't stock "Bort" license plates.2) And this is NOT their fault, but...if you have to have any service done that requires a wait, you'll find that the neighborhood is...pretty useless unless you're hungry, thirsty, or a woman looking for kitschy crap. (If you're a MAN looking for kitschy crap, sorry; it's for women only in this neighborhood; you're better off in Andersonville, which does have very good kitschy crap for both men and women.) Really, there's NOTHING TO DO while you're waiting! Lotsa stuff in the store itself to read, but you'll be done well before your hour is up.

52.description: I was looking for a bike for my 9 year old son. After checking several other bike shops that didn't have anything in stock and would take 1-2 weeks for delivery or local sports stores that didn't have what we were looking for we went to Village Cycle which had a great selection. We worked with Larry who was great!  He was attentive and remembered what I was looking for when I called in ... My son mostly does family rides around the city and he also started to do Kid triathlons so a hybrid makes most sense but he also wants to start doing more off road so a mountain bike is more ideal for that ... We compromised and bought a Trek MT 200 which is a mountain bike and he had it outfitted with hybrid tires for his race. After the race we can swap out for the mountain treads for only $10 in labor. The bike was ready in 1 hour and we were amazed at how quick it was ready given our other experiences. They took the time with him to over best practices as this is his first 7-speed Bike.  We also used the yelp coupon to save $25 on our purchase which was easy. Great experience, great service, great selection, great value.

50.description: Wonderful neighborhood shop.  The entire staff is very knowledgable and always willing to help explain things.  Highly recommended.

4.description: These guys tuned up my 8-year-old road bike and put on a top-notch new chain. Beautiful work. On time. Looks and rides like new. Friendly helpful staff, especially the mechanics crew. Will keep coming back.

6.description: I have bought a bike here, had another one assembled and many upgrades/maintenance. Everytime has been a treat. The staff always gives great advice, they want you to get the right product not just the most expensive. Just took my road bike in for a fitting, Larry was awesome and gave great options. He was helpful, knowledgeable and friendly.

22.description: The guys at Village Cycle are total pros!  I just purchased my first road bike. Tim taught me everything I needed to know. He was honest, forthright, & insightful. No pressure to buy, & helped to find the least expensive option that fit my needs.

15.description: Awesome service and great deals all around! Went in search of a new road bike, completely new to the sport but have heard great things so wanted to give it a shot. Tyler, the sales associate, couldn't have been more helpful. No up-selling, just honest recommendations based on my feedback to his questions. If you are looking for unparalleled customer service and if you're in the market for a new bike, you should go here. Just a small knock, I was there on a pretty busy Saturday and the guys in the back actually servicing the bikes were slammed. One of them came out, saw a long line of customers and gave us all a solid five-second menacing glare before turning around and walking away. Not a huge deal, just a little uncomfortable.

57.description: Biked before our 90 day tuneup expired. Place was busy but there were a lot of employes working with customer. Steven took care of us and checked out gears and breaks. Also lifted our seats and gave us info about our gears. Really great people and cool bikes.

20.description: I had a flat tire and walked my bike to their store at about 8:40 PM, they close at 9, and a guy who was closing up shop stopped what he doing and fixed my tire and adjusted my spokes in about 15 minutes. He could have easily said, "come back tomorrow" but he made the choice to put a customer first and stay a bit later.Also, they charged less than other shops in Chicago to fix a tire.I will definitely be going back because of their price, customer service, and attitude.Thank you.

36.description: Shop seems to have a decent selection and a pretty good stock of the basics. That being said, I worked at a Trek bike shop in STL before moving to Chicago. I went in because I needed a specific product produced only by Trek to specifically fit their wheels. When I showed up, the staff (a couple of 16 year old kids) had absolutely no clue what I was talking about, told me that what I was looking for did not exist, and then tried to sell me a different product that would cost far more. Mind you, this wasn't something obscure, it had been a featured product the entire summer as part of the weekly Trek product training. It absolutely blew my mind they wouldn't even know what it was. If you need the basics, you can probably pick them up here. But for any service, or high end components, I'd suggest finding a shop with a more knowledgeable staff.

14.description: Great customer service experience.  Initially I was not completely satisfied with the condition of my bike when I picked it up but I spoke to the manager, Catherine, and she went out of her way to ensure that I was taken care of.  I also need to thank one of your expert mechanics, Russ, for his work. He not only tuned my bike to perfection he remembered a conversation we had about a month earlier regarding the slope of my bars and my grips, he changed out the grips and I couldn't be happier.  That is definitely going above and beyond for your customers and I truly appreciate the effort. Thanks again and I'll see you guys next summer!

58.description: BEST THING TO DO ON A SATURDAY MORNING HANDS DOWN!!!New summer Saturday routine...1. Green City Market2. Lie at my pool all day working on my tan, enjoying a cocktail or two.....I LOVE this farmer's market. You cannot go wrong. There are so many awesome things to see and sample and smell.... sigh... I wish it was more than just twice a week (Wednesday and Saturday). I want it everyday! I've run out of tomatoes and I now refuse to buy them at the grocery store. They MUST come to me from Green City Market! MUST! There are gorgeous fresh flowers (I'm bringing home fresh peonies this weekend) and local honey, fresh baked bread, meat, veggies (MUST get the tomatoes!), fruit, jams and jellies and pie! There is nothing not to love. I've been to my fair share of farmers markets, but I must admit this one takes the cake. It doesn't hurt that it's practically in my front yard, either.

56.description: I finally checked out GCM this past Saturday. What a great market and it's HUGE (twss). There was a nice variety of produce and eats...which we all know I appreciate as by evidence of my waistline. I snagged some beautiful looking red leaf lettuce, beets, red carrots (!!!), peaches, red onions and micro greens. If I did not have errands to run after my trip to the market, I would have snagged a bunch of flowers as well but in the sub tropical temps we are experiencing right now...I knew they'd never survive. Next time! I arrived around 10AM and parking was crazy. It was hot and I did not feel like circling around nor did I feel like walking a great distance in the heat so I parked my ride in the paid lot....which is $9 for 2 hours or less. Kinda spendy...kinda like GCM. That is my issue with this market. I felt it was kinda on the expensive side and while I appreciate local organic produce...I really don't want to pay $5 dollars for blueberries. I think the veggies I snagged were right around what you'd pay for at a market. The micro greens were by far the best deal the GCM had to offer. I almost breezed past this stand but thankfully my friends had me stop for a moment and try some samplings. Who knew that micro greens could be so damn delicious? Not me, that's for sure! I really wanted to hit up the tamale stand but SIX DOLLARS for ONE tamale? No bueno. The burger stand smelled pretty delicious as well. Next time I'd like to hit up the Becker Lane tent and grab myself some pork....next time as in when it's not 100+ degrees outside.GCM, I am impressed with you but I had to knock off a star b/c...where the hell were all the tomatoes?? I hope you make this up to me upon my next visit. Please & thank you.

29.description: Wow.Completely worth it - I am a little loathe to share this place with anyone for fear that it shall not live up to my previous experience the next time I visit Chi town.Came here with my brother and sister in law, and totally loved the organic, delicious, gonna make you love it foodfest. Grilled cheese sandwiches here will make your knees tremble. Elk jerky will make you become a voracious velociraptor, wanting more; pea tendrils will then make you want to commit to extreme veganism - can I say more?Kudos to all the purveyors here - you are all heroes in your own communities, and certainly serve your patrons well. I can only hope to strive to offer the same excellence in my own microcosm.Will most certainly be back!!!

42.description: I love absolutely everything about Green City Market.  You can find me here almost every single Saturday morning.  There is great variety and dependable organic produce. My blog has a review of the market and what I purchased recently . . .  youngfoodies.com/green-c…

23.description: The produce looked great, if a bit pricey. Not enough eat there choices and the ones there ARE pricey for what they deliver. Parking is a hassle. Still, it's a pleasant environment. I'm glad we went.

47.description: For that guy or gal who went over to one of the couple cheese stands looking to get their fix of jack Cheese with morels and onion... and was told that a trio of utter douchebags cleaned them out...Fuck you.  You probably live in the area.  Get some next week.  It's utterly refreshing to run through a list in your head and find practically everything that you're looking for at a Farmer's market.  This place is one of them.

8.description: It's a lot fun coming here on Saturday noon.

31.description: I like farmers' markets, and this one is particularly excellent.  Today, as I was wandering along through the tables covered with beautiful and aromatic veggies, fruits, herbs, cheeses, breads and jams I could almost imagine that I was back in my village market in France.  That is, until the guy with dreadlocks sat down in a folding chair and began drumming.  It suddenly went from being a lovely market day to feeling like an Occupy Wall Street event.  Hence the four stars.

34.description: On June 7 of this year, TimeOut Chicago published a small item extolling the Becker Lane porchetta sandwich at Green City Market (timeoutchicago.com/resta…).  They painted a hell of a picture and really revved up my taste buds.  I cut it out of the magazine and kept that little nugget in my top dresser drawer.  I wasn't going to go several miles out of my way to spend $12 on a pork sandwich, but in case I found myself at the market at any point this summer, I wanted to keep a reminder of this supposed marvel.Well, it took nearly three months, but I finally got the sandwich.  And it was worth the wait.  And the twelve bucks.  This was one of the best sandwiches that I have eaten in recent memory.  And the guys slinging them are pretty cool too.It was worth the trip by itself, but the rest of the market seemed pretty anemic.  Was it the Labor Day weekend?  The recent drought?  There were noticeably fewer vendors and patrons than I remember from the last few times.Shrug.  I'll be back next spring for another porchetta.

16.description: I guess I'm alone in my opinion here. I find the market to be somewhat of a disappointment. Mostly people go on about the food, which can be gotten at the vendor's brick & mortar establishments. Not to mention, you would pay less. They seem to up their prices at The Market. Also, as many times as I have gone, the local chefs get the first dibs on all the stuff. Especially the heirloom tomatoes, when they become available in the late summer. More times than not, the fruit I have purchased has mold on the bottoms of the baskets. The veggies seem to wilt before I get them home. I try to get there right when they open, so I can't figure out why this happens most times. Wish I would love it because I appreciate the concept but for the prices you pay, I find the quality lacks. This is just one women's opinion.

13.description: I could possibly give this 4 stars one day, but I think 3 is fair for now. I went with a friend on a gorgeous morning and we took a lovely stroll on our way there. It is a bit unpleasant to get to, you are better off taking the bus. Don't count on parking. We got there and tried some food. We started at Zullo's and my egg/lamb/foccacia sandwich was fine, the apple cider donuts were good (read: they will make you fat). Then we moved down the aisles and I got some more food. Brings lots of cash, you will spend it all. I then got a smoothie and then ended the day with a crepe (~$12). All of the food I ate while I was there was fine, but it didn't blow me away and I'm not sure it was worth the cash outlay.I do want to comment that this farmer's market isn't that big. I understand this is a city, but I didn't think it was anything to write home about. Especially when every day it's open is 'strap your kid in a stroller and bring your dog(s)' day. Fortuantely I didn't see anyone (human or dog) drop a deuce anywhere. The selection is ok. The day I went it was cucumbers and peaches galore. I bought some berries and eggplant, but again, I wasn't blown away.When the weather is beautiful you could definitely make a day of it here, so bring a blanket and/or chairs (lots of other people do!) and try to get some flowers... they were gorgeous.

11.description: My favorite farmer market in town! The people, the dogs, the croissants, the fresh peonies in the spring... The experience is just wonderful!

39.description: OK, lets just call it what it is:  A big farmer's market.  If you're looking for Fruits, Veggies, Cheese, Meat, and a handful of other specialty items, this place is great.  Also, if you like to cook, this place bestows great inspiration.  Finally, it's a perfect place to try something new.To be clear, I've never eaten at any of the food stands, so I have no review of them yet.The downside:  Green City Market is not a secret.  after 9am, when you combine all the strollers, people with their dogs, and oblivious cell users (I know, all three groups exist everywhere, but they all LOVE farmers markets, and flock to them like Larry "The Cable Guy" sprints towards terrible movie roles).  If you have a car, it'll be difficult to park, or you'll be paying 9 bucks.  I suggest riding your bike over if you have the option, or using pub trans.  Also, simply moving around the market after 9am is like walking barefoot on a carpet covered in legos:  it's going to take you a while, and someone's foot might hurt.  Outside of my gripes, it's a perfectly good experience.  Just remember: unless you just plan to go and hang out, plan to hit the market early.  It is certainly worth a visit.

37.description: I am so happy I finally made it to this place. I love that everything is fresh and locally grown from the area. The market sells everything from fresh fruits and vegetables to breads, cheeses, meats, flowers, even homemade ice cream, sandwiches, and other lunch things. Everything looked and smelled delicious. The only things I wish were different were:1. The prices are expensive here. And I am a poor college student. So that is not fun.2. Most of the vendors are cash only.For about $20 I bought 6 peaches, a pint of blueberries, an onion, and an ice cream cone. See, told you it was pricey. Worth it? You bet! Not for weekly shopping but for the occasional extra special ingredients for summer cooking or on a fun lunch date, I think it's a wonderful local option.

0.description: Green City Market is a must do for those living in Chicago and for those coming into the city and want to do something a little less touristy.The market is just south of Lincoln Park Zoo - walking distance to Old Town and easily accessible to public transit, Divvy Bikes, Bike Paths and Bus Routes.  Lots of great local produce, flowers and local products.  A great Saturday morning stroll.  Highly recommended.

38.description: BEST FARMER'S MARKET IN CHICAGO EVER!Thank you so much for the hard-core recommendations of Yelpers! I loved eating the colorful grapes, ranging from pink to purple, of Green Acres that is based in Indiana. They were juicy, sweet and easy to eat, since the skins were thin. They were so good that I bought 4 bags of grapes. I highly recommend you stopping by Green Acres! I also saw booths that sold crepes, jams and honey. I am definitely interested in stopping by sometime this week again to check them out. DON'T MISS OUT THE GREEN CITY MARKET!

51.description: So they do have many items but I feel that you can get similar fresh veggies and breads at other farmers markets throughout the city. After fighting for parking we had to step over so many strollers and dogs that we were more frustrated with our experience there. We do love going to the farmers market but are going to stick to the ones that are closer to home.

27.description: Love love love this place!! We usually go to get brunch and have never been disappointed. Had the brat with several kinds of mustard, had a floren-trio crepe, had blueberry smoothies, the grilled cheese, pies from Hoosier mama's.  Everything is delicious!

32.description: I was here 2 weeks ago. came on Wednesday.was not crowded because it rain hard on Tuesday night and early Wednesday morning.the grasses were stll soaking wet.there were only a few stands.did not find the Amish stand(I found them the next day in the loop).brought some nice honey crisp apples and sweet juicy peaches from a Michigan farm.--2 apples for $3 a pound.--5 peaches for $6.yes, more expensive than the supermarket but everything was really fresh.

54.description: I am in LOVE with the flowers at this market.  Such an interesting and gorgeous variety--more than just sunflowers and hydrangea. 3 bouquets for $15!

48.description: The start of Farmer's market is the signal that summer is here!! Now that I have a shorty, I need to find places that are family friendly and interesting for my baby.  Lots of vendors from Wisconsin and Michigan with quality offers, we picked up flowers and veggies on this trip.  Best part about this is the location right next to LP Nature Boardwalk...mommy gets to socialize with the GF on a lazy saturday and baby gets to see the animals and natural habtat.  A win-win situation!

44.description: After my first experience, I knew I would be back again and again. I can't get over how phenomenal this place is! All of the vendors are amazing, and even when it's busy there is no shortage of places to sit in the shade and enjoy a purchase or two. You should get here super early though because the good stuff does go fast! Everything is situated in rows with no real organization but that's half the fun! There are booths offering produce as well as booths for smoothies, ice creams, burgers, sodas, pork sandwiches, I could go on and on and on. This place is super accessible by multiple forms and manners of transportation, I chose to walk from my apartment down Fullerton on a beautiful Chicago summer day. Bring reusable bags too, the farmers/staff like that as do the rest of us environmentally conscious people! I will never be able to get enough!

24.description: This farmer's market is HUGE. Come early as I made the mistake of arriving around 11am. It was packed.   I bought some gorgeous multicolored carrots and berries.  I did not get a chance to buy any meat, they have several vendors for poultry and pork products.  The prepared foods are great. They have a crepe station, a place cooking just mushrooms, Italian and I ended the day with a buttermilk fed pork sausage from one of the vendors.  It was served on an brioche-like roll. The sausage was phenomenal--clean flavors, not too salty.  Can't wait to go back again.

7.description: This place is great!! This open market in the summer is so amazing. Fresh fruit, veggies and prepared food galore. Please bring your kids, BRING your dogs enjoy the day with the creatures you love. See you all there!!

49.description: We went on Saturday and came away with a very nice variety of quality items (beef brisket, four different cheeses and some artisinal honey.There was about 12-16 vendors (about what I was expecting because it is still winter), with quite a bit of overlap, which is to be expected at a farmer's market.  We will be making additional trips to this during the summer months to get the full experience.

40.description: If you can fight through weekend traffic and actually find a spot to park (if you don't want to pay the fee to park in the Norbert museum lot...9 bucks I think) then this is a great market. The variety is the most I have seen at any midwestern market.. keeping in mind that only seasonal produce is available. Everything is uber fresh and delicious. Standouts: Bushel & Pecks strawberry jam. Only thing we put on our pb&j's at home. fresh made shakes - seasonal flavors (cantaloupe & strawberry are out of this world)mushrooms in a paper bag - I can't remember the name of this vendor, but they have the freshest mushrooms you can probably buy in illinois. They have a great variety, and the price is actually not that much more than what you pay at the grocery store. My daughter devours these! Nichols Farm - any produce from here is exceptional. I bought an heirloom tomato plant for 6 bucks and proud to say it is thriving! Delicious produce. Stephanie Izzard gets produce from these guys for Girl & the Goat, although she probably gets first dibs. If you've eaten there you can attest.  River Valley Kitchens - they sell a mouth watering assortment of hand crafted jarred products from salsas, to cheese spreads, to tomato sauces. Everything is amazing and there are usually samples to taste. The berries are delicious and the taste is incomparable to anything we can get our hands on at the grocery store. Any place that sells garlic scapes and cheese curds has my seal of approval. The only bad part is waiting for things to be in season. Eat it Fresh!

53.description: I've been to farmer's markets in Italy and other places so I won't compare apples to oranges, but for Chicago, the Green City Market does pretty good and I'm glad to see this idea catching on. I like this market better than the one at Daley Plaza, somehow it seems more natural to buy fresh fruits and vegetables in a park setting than in the middle of the Loop.At Green City, you can find an assortment of fruits, vegetables, fresh herbs, honey, flowers, even pies (and I'm bummed that they were all sold out by the time we got there). We sampled some peaches and had to get them. Too bad I couldn't buy anything else because we were heading to Perennial across the street for brunch. It was hard to look but not buy. Saturday morning crowd was not too bad. I'll have to plan better next time and pickup ingredients for my own brunch.

30.description: Loved the autumn colors here on an October morning last month. Despite the rain & nasty weather, my friends and I had a really nice breakfast at Abby's Crepes!* Butternut squash, rapini, roasted apples ($10) - 4 starsyelp.com/biz_photos/q9oz…yelp.com/biz_photos/q9oz…The crepe was really soft, yet held the butternut squash well. Which, by the way, made a really nice savory crepe. I just thought the rapini was a little too sour - a little less of that and it would have been perfect!Full menu: yelp.com/biz_photos/gree…

46.description: It deserves a million stars if I could give it. This is hands down the best farmers market in the city. Organic, fresh, bountiful produce - it just makes me happy. You can also get food from the vendors like grilled cheese sammies, tamales etc so you can munch while you shop.Of course it is expensive than usual stores, but the quality of the food is absolutely incomparable. Apples, strawberries and asparagus are bountiful right now. I know i will be making a lot more trips here.

1.description: Running from 7 AM to 1 on Saturdays from roughly May 2nd through October 31st, this is one of the best local organic markets in the city. The GPS address is 1800 North Clark Street and more information can be found at: chicagofarmersmarkets.us but I can tell you that it is a wonderful source of clean, unadulterated food that is reasonably priced. My wife and I are raw vegan and we leave with bushel loads every time we shop here. Not only is it one of the longest running markets on the calendar, but it is one of the oldest and most respected in the Chicago area.Unique items about such as zucchini flowers, beet ketchup, artisan cheeses, organic non-gmo tofu, and on and on. Breakfast crepes are amazing, Gayle's cheese sandwiches are to die for, and there is a portable wood burning oven that turns out authentic italian-style pizzas nonstop (a good portion of the crowd was carrying pizza boxes while they shopped).
