Parking is a premium but the market opens at 7 and paid parking doesn't start until 8, so we try to get there at 7 and get our shopping done in an hour so we don't have to pay. An hour for us is plenty of time and we dally.Of all the markets we have frequented in Chicagoland, we like this one the most.

55.description: veggies and cheeses and flowers, oh my! green city market is a feast for the senses. just don't buy everything that tempts you in one visit or you'll go broke. the fun part of that is that you never run out of new things to explore.for organic fruits and veggies go to green acres farm! my favorites (though hard to choose) are the kale and eggplant. my girlfriend can't get enough of the beets and shallots. try the ground cherries- not only delicious, but cute. something i look for in a fruit. :)love the empanada thingies and the cider donuts at zullo's. we may have gone a just a tad overboard with our last order, which added up to $24. see what i mean about indulging in all your temptations?seedling has the best apples i've ever tasted. i exaggerate not.and ya'll know i'm a cheese girl. plenty to choose from here! when i want to treat myself i get a baked cheese from brunkow. just heat it up and it gets all crisp and buttery. it is what i'll call skies-opening-up-revealing-rays-of-sunlight-and-the-sound-of-angels-singing good.

9.description: Oops! Looks like we're back indoors. This market is year round. As of this week, it's only on Saturdays in the Peggy Notebaert Museum.So hands down this is the best market in the city. From Spring to Fall a great variety of fruits and veggies.  This time of year crunchy apples, acorn squash, broccoli, greens, brussel sprouts, root vegetables, tomatoes, onions, garlic, potatoes, sweet potatoes, just to name a few.  Everything is fresh and you get to know your farmers.  There are also cooked foods(eg. Grilled sandwiches, apple cider fritters, crepes, soups, chili), cooking demonstrations, meats, baked goods, salsas, etc. In the summer you can take the little ones to the zoo and in the winter enjoy the museum.

26.description: Loved it!  My first visit to the Green City Market was yesterday - and I couldn't believe I hadn't stopped in yet.  While there were plenty of market stalls, there were also plenty of food stalls as well, so you can definitely make this a destination for dining.  I didn't buy much on this trip (the bike made it somewhat difficult), but I did pick up some flowers and fruit and both were high quality and priced right.A great farmer's market in the city and I highly recommend it!  The salad greens looked amazing as did basically everything else there.  I did notice that even though I was there around 11am, things were already beginning to sell out, so don't delay if you're going to visit!

25.description: Really loved this Farmer's Market.  If you find yourself in the area, you will have to make a trip out!  I wish they had more variety of venders, however, I enjoyed walking around and bought some amazing fruit at a decent price.

12.description: I love this place. A Saturday morning stroll combined with a stop by the green city market makes for a perfect start to the weekend.From fresh flowers, to organic produce, to made-on-the-spot food...the market is a wonderful place to stop-by for that single ingredient you need, your week's groceries or a fun outing.Some of my favorites: Nichols Farm, Abby's crepes, Mint Creek.

59.description: The Green City Market is one of those brilliant places where community, culture and food meet to create something quite special. I can't speak highly enough of the dense, veggie-filled Floriole quiches or Zullo's fresh (warm, unbelievable) donuts.The market is unlike others in Chicago because it offers familiar faces and open spaces; sitting and enjoying a fresh crepe from Abby's filled with Prarie Pure cheese and Klug Farms greens, listening to a guitarist down the way or taking in one of the market's many demonstrations can be one of the season's greatest treats.The GCM combines a remarkable level of hometown warmth with a unique sense of place, with local growers and vendors like Burton's (maple syrup, maple water and other outstanding treats) who remember your name and your preferences week after week.The produce is fantastic, as should be expected. Every farm, from Seedling to Heritage Prairie, shows the utmost care for their product and their customers. I highly suggest coming right as the sun bursts through the trees in Lincoln Park - Wednesdays are a wonderful, leisurely time, and Saturdays can get a bit crowded - to grab the best of the vendors' offerings.

21.description: I could possibly give this 4 stars one day, but I think 3 is fair for now. I went with a friend on a gorgeous morning and we took a lovely stroll on our way there. It is a bit unpleasant to get to, you are better off taking the bus. Don't count on parking. We got there and tried some food. We started at Zullo's and my egg/lamb/foccacia sandwich was fine, the apple cider donuts were good (read: they will make you fat). Then we moved down the aisles and I got some more food. Brings lots of cash, you will spend it all. I then got a smoothie and then ended the day with a crepe (~$12). All of the food I ate while I was there was fine, but it didn't blow me away and I'm not sure it was worth the cash outlay.I do want to comment that this farmer's market isn't that big. I understand this is a city, but I didn't think it was anything to write home about. Especially when every day it's open is 'strap your kid in a stroller and bring your dog(s)' day. Fortuantely I didn't see anyone (human or dog) drop a deuce anywhere. The selection is ok. The day I went it was cucumbers and peaches galore. I bought some berries and eggplant, but again, I wasn't blown away.When the weather is beautiful you could definitely make a day of it here, so bring a blanket and/or chairs (lots of other people do!) and try to get some flowers... they were gorgeous.

17.description: Loved the autumn colors here on an October morning last month. Despite the rain & nasty weather, my friends and I had a really nice breakfast at Abby's Crepes!* Butternut squash, rapini, roasted apples ($10) - 4 starsyelp.com/biz_photos/q9oz…yelp.com/biz_photos/q9oz…The crepe was really soft, yet held the butternut squash well. Which, by the way, made a really nice savory crepe. I just thought the rapini was a little too sour - a little less of that and it would have been perfect!Full menu: yelp.com/biz_photos/gree…

10.description: There's a knife sharpener! Tons of tomatos! Snacks! Bread! BUT-was there coffee somewhere? I missed the coffee. That is why only 4 stars.

5.description: This is a fantastic farmer's market. I've been told to get here super early, as early as 7 am, to get good produce, but that was not my experience at all. I arrived later morning and there was still plenty of good produce to go around. In the fall, you can find apple ciders, lots of different kinds of apples, mushrooms, gourds and peppers. I will definitely come again during the summer, and empty out my pockets because the prices can sometimes be twice as much as in the grocery store.

3.description: Always get great quality stuff here. My favorite is the tofu stand- so yummy! Also can get some good honey, flowers and of course produce. They even have a portable brick oven pizza stand in the summer! So good

35.description: Best farmer's market in the city! Am I biased because it's across the street from my house? Probably but deal with it! I also love that it's year round though I'll admit, I frequent it much more in the summer when it's outside, but it's nice to have the option. I have never encountered an unfriendly farmer or vendor, and though the prices might be higher and the produce doesn't last as long as that bought in a grocery store - there is a reason! Everything is organic and pesticide free even if it's not "certified organic" (a very expensive process to just get a stamp on your food), and I love that all the farmers are local (I think I read within a 2 hour drive?). It gives me great pleasure to support these local farmers, get fresh, pesticide free veggies, and maybe indulge in a crepe, pastry or grilled cheese while I'm wandering around

19.description: Wow.Completely worth it - I am a little loathe to share this place with anyone for fear that it shall not live up to my previous experience the next time I visit Chi town.Came here with my brother and sister in law, and totally loved the organic, delicious, gonna make you love it foodfest. Grilled cheese sandwiches here will make your knees tremble. Elk jerky will make you become a voracious velociraptor, wanting more; pea tendrils will then make you want to commit to extreme veganism - can I say more?Kudos to all the purveyors here - you are all heroes in your own communities, and certainly serve your patrons well. I can only hope to strive to offer the same excellence in my own microcosm.Will most certainly be back!!!

28.description: Walking around the Green City Market is my FAVORITE Saturday morning activity! Nothing beats the atmosphere. Some of my favorite things to enjoy a the market are the crepes, the Seedlings smoothies (in the summer), the Seedlings cider (in the fall), and the grilled cheese. I can't leave without a bag full of fresh in-season fruits & vegetables, and some meat and cheese. I also love buying some of the fresh fruit jams, salsas, or honey as gifts!

45.description: This place is awesome and can get busy starting around 830 am or 9.   Great choices on things you can eat there for breakfast as well as many selections from farms, bakers, and more to take home and enjoy.  Love the ambiance, the music, and more.   Not all stands are created equal...some of the staff is friendlier than others.  I try to stick to the friendly ones.  An A+ and not to be missed place during spring/summer/fall hours.

33.description: By far my favorite farmers market.The good: Go here if you want a lot of options. They have everything and stuff you have never seen before too. I didn't know purple green beans and white asparagus existed. I mainly go for the fruits, greens, cheeses, and honey. A lot of it is organic too. The farmers are really nice and the quality is very high.Get there early, like 8 if you wanna get first dibs esp if you're into tomatoes. They sell out fast. Def get the apple cider donuts from zullos too!The bad: You will not have anymore money FFFFFFFFF dfakdshfafheri. Seriously you will be paying out the ass and unless you're into that kind of thing, it's hard to justify coming here for all your groceries every week (exception - you make enough money......anyone?). If you don't like strollers, babies, and dogs I highly suggest you stay away as well.Even though I can't afford a lot, I like to go anyway. It's a great Sat morning thing you know? If you go early, you should be able to find parking but after 10:30, you're basically SOL on that front. CTA that shit and save yourself a headache.

43.description: New to Chicago and was very excited about the Green City Market.. it's kind of small but I guess I'm used to the huge Californian ones. There's a handful of prepped foods (burgers, ice cream, tamales..), a few cheese, and maybe a dozen produce stands. Is it just the season... or do the farmers only do strawberries? It is in a great location though, with plenty of space to hang out on the grass and munch on your new purchases.

2.description: I think it's great to support local farmers, buy fresh food etc.  But, it's a 2 way street.  Plenty of times I have seen farmers bringing substandard produce and charging high prices for it.  Example, yesterday (Sept 5) we went to GCM.  We bought some cherry tomatoes from a farmer.  We came home and found rotten cherry tomatoes in the bottom of the package.  The package cost $4 and seemed like a good deal, but we got taken.  At the same time, we were buying mushrooms and the mushroom farmer saw us put a substandard mushroom in our bag.  He pulled it out, and put in a good one and said, "I don't want to sell a bad mushroom".   Farmers need to accept the responsibility for bad produce.  Also, people like me need to call out the bad ones, and call out the good ones.  Not everything here is 5 star, and not everything is 1 star either.

18.description: Loved it!  My first visit to the Green City Market was yesterday - and I couldn't believe I hadn't stopped in yet.  While there were plenty of market stalls, there were also plenty of food stalls as well, so you can definitely make this a destination for dining.  I didn't buy much on this trip (the bike made it somewhat difficult), but I did pick up some flowers and fruit and both were high quality and priced right.A great farmer's market in the city and I highly recommend it!  The salad greens looked amazing as did basically everything else there.  I did notice that even though I was there around 11am, things were already beginning to sell out, so don't delay if you're going to visit!

41.description: Green City Market is easily one of North America's best markets. I missed the wonderful midwestern produce, honey from Indiana, fresh flowers, food samples, live music and cooking demonstrations from some of Chicago's best chefs. I have gotten zucchini flowers and they make the best fritters. I used to live 15 minutes away and I would always go here to check out what they have here. Not that I can afford to shop here all the time but they have some pretty wonderful stuff here. I only wish the market would be a lot bigger. It just seems many of the vendors sell very similar products.The market is easily accessible via buses. It could get crowded later in the day; so come as early as possible.

52.description: Huge fan. This farmers market gets better and better every year!You name it, they have it. Plus, they hold the market all year (at the Nature Museum in the off season). For a $5 purchase, you get parking in the lot at the Chicago History Museum for $9. Pricey, yes, and you can take some public transportation or walk if you're lucky enough to live right by.They have everything here. The Nordic Butter is awesome. Cheese, meats, breads, milk, fruits and vegetables, gorgeous flowers. They have such diversity that I found tuberose here (grown less than 100 miles away) in the middle of August!I love, absolutely love and appreciate, that they have little signs on all the booths to show where the seller/farm is located and how far they are from Chicago. They have dinners and chef demonstrations. It's a great community.I encourage everyone to become a member - such a worthy, wonderful cause. I cannot wait one day to bring my family here and have the kids enjoy it too!

50.description: Dear Green City Farmer's Market, Was your father a thief? 'Cause someone stole the stars from the sky and put them into my review. I'd give you a bajillion stars if I could. Just let me taste you.Oooh, yeah, nom nom nom, give it to me. I relish those mountain rose potatoes of yours. I desire your creamy milk more than words can express. How I want to manhandle your naturally raised chicken thighs. I beg you... slather me in your summer butter. Oooh, ahh, let's pork 24-7. This market is incredible. Definitely one of the best in the city. I go back-and-forth between this one and the Logan Square Farmer's Market. I can't really choose a winner though. That would be like asking: Who would you rather bone: Marisa Tomei or Naomi Watts? Silly question. I want to bone both of them. At the same time. Not only is the Green City Farmer's Market year-round, but the quality of vendors is magnificent. While not all of the farmers are organic (which is kind of a joke of a label thanks to the FDA), the majority practice sustainable farming. That means they actually care about the land they use, as well as the animals they raise. If that matters to you, too, then you should really come to this market. Yes, it can get crowded, but honestly, it's not unmanageable. It's not like you're walking into a Wal-Mart on Black Friday, and it beats the heck out of Whole Foods or any other generic grocery store, which is likely to be even more packed on a Saturday.Big-ups to some of my favorite farms here: Meadow Haven Farm, Heartland Meats, Hawk's Hill Ranch, Ellis Farms, Green Acres Farms, Genesis Growers, River Valley Ranch, and Nordic Creamery. (I'm sure I'm forgetting some, and I imagine there are many other great farms that I haven't tried yet.)

4.description: I went today for the first time. It was smaller than expected. But maybe it was because it was cold. I bought a grilled cheese that was really good. It's in walking distance to the free zoo and conservatory. Parking is tough but I found a free spot!

6.description: Definitely one of the best farmer's markets I've ever been to. Prices are a little high but you're paying for high quality food made by people who actually care AND you're in Chicago...so it really should be expected. They have fruits, vegetables, grass-fed meats, dairy, eggs, pickled vegetables, flowers, honey, and several other fun local finds. They also have food vendors and I really think my husband only agrees to accompany me because he loves the bacon glazed cookie that the lovely chefs over at Cookies and Carnitas make! (They also have really great pork rinds!)Bottom line is Green City Market is an outstanding place to find local, seasonal food and support your local farmers. I recommend going pretty early as it can get a bit crowded, especially if you're trying to find somewhere to park.

22.description: There's a knife sharpener! Tons of tomatos! Snacks! Bread! BUT-was there coffee somewhere? I missed the coffee. That is why only 4 stars.

15.description: I enjoy this place occasionally on Saturdays during the summer. It has a nice people watching scenes and many singles and families with kids.I love their crepes. Tried mushroom and cheese crepes and caramel crepes. I wanted more even after finishing those... this place has also nice smoothies, donuts, sausage. Fresh produces are nice but more expensive than wholefoods. Flower markets are not a bad deal. They have nice sunflowers during this time of the season.

57.description: Green City Market is a perfect example of just how amazing Chicago can be.  You walk into lower Lincoln Park and you see children playing, dogs taking naps, musicians banging away on drums and other instruments, and local growers selling their delicious wares.Everything I've gotten from GCM has been delicious, especially the grilling cheese that....I'm sorry to say I forget to sells it.  If anyone remembers, can you please respond with the dairy's name?  I need more of it or I'm going to die.Basically, go.  If you go early it's cooler out and there is more selection, but it's also more crowded, so it's up to you.  Do not miss it, even if you don't buy anything.  It's still an invigorating experience.  It really makes you feel like you're part of a community!

20.description: I have gone to farmer's markets for nearly 30 years, in all the different cities I've lived in, and the places I've visited (if I could find one).  I had heard a lot about Green City so it was on my to-see list.Considering it is the biggest in the city, I was surprised by the size; it's not a heck of a lot bigger than the Temescal or Grand Lake farmer's markets in Oakland. and smaller than the KCC market in Honolulu. At this time of the year there was a nice selection of produce.  More expensive than CA, which is and isn't surprising.Where Green City really whups CA is in dairy and meats.  If I were flying and not driving back, I would seriously consider a freezer full of meat, cheese and cream.  Seriously, organic grass-fed cream for $5/quart?  In CA markets you are lucky if you get one or two meat vendors.  Here there were at least 6.

36.description: This is one of the best Farmers Markets I've ever been to. It's big and has plenty of offerings. I always find a large variety of fruits, vegetables, canned goods, breads,  and cheeses.I went to the market on Wednesday and Saturday of this week and both days are equally awesome, although the set-up is a little different each day. A few of my favorite purchases from this week: peaches, garlic, purple carrots, and pickles.  I'm also in love with the freshly squeezed fruit soda from Seasons Soda. I had apple mint flavored soda on Wednesday and cantaloupe flavored on Saturday. If you are traveling to this market, I plan you get started early. I only live 3 miles away but the commute to the market can be tricky after 10AM. I like to get up around 8AM and get there first thing. If you are driving, there is metered parking on Clark, I've never had a challenge with finding a spot. (especially early in the AM)

14.description: BEST FARMER'S MARKET IN CHICAGO EVER!Thank you so much for the hard-core recommendations of Yelpers! I loved eating the colorful grapes, ranging from pink to purple, of Green Acres that is based in Indiana. They were juicy, sweet and easy to eat, since the skins were thin. They were so good that I bought 4 bags of grapes. I highly recommend you stopping by Green Acres! I also saw booths that sold crepes, jams and honey. I am definitely interested in stopping by sometime this week again to check them out. DON'T MISS OUT THE GREEN CITY MARKET!

58.description: I have been here about 5 times before- it's near my gym.  I used to go up to Magic Nails on Clark (since about 2004).  My experiences here have been 50/50.  But this most recent time is the last time I will go.  This place is clean, has a ton of magazines and usually have appointments available- but let's face it, so do 70% of the other nail salons in Chicago.After my pedicure I went over to the drier and waited for about 20 minutes.  Then I inspected my nails- and found that there was nail polish ON my cuticles and my toes, there were dry patches around my toe nails- how is this possible immediately after a pedicure?!  It didn't even look like my cuticles were pushed back.  I was too annoyed to even deal with it so I left.  The next day I realized how much worse the pedicure was than I had even first realized... my feet were still rough,- I'm a runner, so I totally understand if my feet aren't soft like a newborns- that's normal.  But I was really p.o.'ed that I literally felt like a) I could have done a MUCH better job myself and b) I felt like I hadn't even gotten a pedicure the day after my pedicure!  Two days later the paint started bubbling and not even a week later the paint is chipping from the tip of the nail and also from the bottom where they had painted ON my cuticles.So, I would like to say I have officially received the worst pedicure of my life (yes, I think I'm not exaggerating), at Magnifique nails.  There are too many options in Chicago to deal with this.

56.description: I went to magnifique for the first time yesterday (6/29/10) for a manicure ad pedicure. The nail technician, Amy, did a great job cutting my nails, cleaning my feet and the massage was pretty good. She polished my nails beautifully with the colored polish, but when it came to the top coat I was upset. It only cover 3/4 of my nail bed on my hands and feet. When I asked her to fix it she couldn't understand me due to the language barrier. Besides that I'm not sure if I'd go back. I shouldn't have to go home to reapply the top coat and when I did the polish is bubbly due to several layers of polish being applied in a short time frame.

29.description: Just got one of the best manicures I've had in a while. My technician took her time and did a fabulous job. I will definitely come back.

42.description: My review is only on the no-chip manicure.DON'T DO IT!  Under no circumstances should you get a no-chip manicure here.  I came in on a Saturday.  I asked for a french no-chip mani.  I had called prior to my visit to confirm that they in fact knew how to do them.  I was told they did.  Everything was going well until the girl started painting on the white tip.  HORRIBLE.  It looked like I was getting a manicure from a two year old.  It was like she was putting blobs of polish on the tips of my nails.  I'm used to french no-chip manicures.   That's all I ever get.  I'm used to the line of the white tip being very defined.  It was not.  I should have taken a picture.  I kept telling her they didn't look right and he solution was to add more white polish, which as you know for a no-chip manicure it's a bad idea.  It gets lumpy and uneven.  I finally gave up on her trying to fix it and told her I didn't want a french mani anymore.  I know it was gel but she needed to take it off and just give me a plain color no-chip manicure.  She was apologetic and even though no-chip manis' polish is a pain to take off, she did it.I figured that taking away the stress of trying to paint perfect white tips on my nails would make the job easier, it didn't.  My nails looked a lot better than if I would have let her finish the french mani, but I could still feel that some were uneven were she applied more polish.  Never again will I be back.  I will say they were very nice about the whole ordeal, but don't tell people you do no-chip manis when you have no idea what you are doing.

23.description: Got an appointment on Saturday for Sunday morning, they did an excellent job on my hands and feet. Quick too - I was out in a little over an hour, plus drying time. Will definitely be returning!

47.description: I have been going to Manifique for years. The salon is pleasant and has a relaxing atmosphere. I generally have gone on the off days, but even when I came on a Saturday or Sunday, I could get in if I was willing to wait or come back later in the day. You will need to book in advance on $26 Tuesdays, but its worth it. They have a good selection of nail polishes and all of the women are good at french manicures. The atmosphere is relaxing unless there are annoying cell phone users, which I've seen the ladies politely request that they lower their voice. My friend Melissa SWEARS by this place and I can't blame her. Its the only nail salon that I've ever felt that they really paid attention to me and appreciated when I bring them new clients.

8.description: This is one of the worst salons where you can get your nails done.  If the tech smudges your nail; they don't fix it. Several different techs didn't paint all the way down the sides of the nail and I felt like I had a strip just down the middle and for some unknown reason their polish chips and comes off in less than 24 hours; not sure if it is the brand of "top" coat they use; but I have been unsatifsied each and every time I've gone and I kept thinking " it is just this 1 time " and nope - EVERY TIME! Qaulity - nope, not there.

31.description: I love this place!  They remember everyone's name and are so friendly.  It's very relaxing.  They play great music and the magazine collection is awesome :)

34.description: This place is excellent and I wouldn't have found it without Yelp, so thanks, Yelp!My nails have never looked prettier. It's been a few days and nothing has chipped or smudged. I think it might be the best mani-pedi I've ever received. I was able to walk in without an appointment on a Friday afternoon and pay $35 for the combo, which is pretty standard. Linda did a great job on both my hands and feet and she was pretty fast -- not rushed, but I was in and out pretty quickly. The space is clean and they were playing good music when I was there -- Etta James. Excellent magazine collection, too. Highly recommend!

16.description: I made an appointment at 5pm on a Tuesday to take advantage of their mani/pedi special. I mixed up my reservation time, so I arrived about 10 minutes late, but they weren't very busy and were able to accommodate me. The shop is clean, the furniture is well maintained and the chairs are comfortable. I chose my shellac color for my nails and the owner took the time to help me find the matching color. My nails were done very well by Julie. I hate when they go fast and don't get paint on the edges. She took her time and made sure I was happy with the color, shape, length, everything. I already made my next appt!

13.description: Very nice, clean, regular manicures last about 10 days. Great selection of OPI, Essie colors.  I Like their ticket raffle idea too!

11.description: Chose this salon since it was nearby my apt and it has better reviews than the other nail salon one block west of it. Not impressed in the slightest. I was a walk in on a Saturday around 5pm for mani/pedi. No wait so that was nice. But the experience was probably at the near bottom of my list. No price listings anywhere. Nail polish displays scattered across store, so I chose one color and on my way to the chair I saw a whole other wall of colors - annoying. No table to but my polish while getting my toes prepped. I held the nail polish in my hand the whole time. Was not offered any beverage. The tool used to push my cuticles back was square and hurt. The whole pedicure was rushed: weak massage, lukewarm water, and quick file job.  Points for 3 coats on the toes because I chose a light color.The manicure also had cons: poor file job - some fingers are square with round edges (how I like it) others are just round! Only did two coats of color this time. Didn't tell me the total when I was asked to pay! I hand my card over and when she returned there was no line for tip. I believe that customers should be told/asked if tipping on the card because I rarely carry cash and credit/debit transactions are so common! Two stars be cause there was no wait and the color selection is large although unorganized.

39.description: love this place. no frills, no wait time, and my manicures always last perfectly for a week+.inexpensive and convenient.

37.description: This place is great! It's not a spa type atmosphere but they do just as good of work for 1/2 the price! Only negatives they reuse their tools after each person and waxing (eye, lip, etc) is done in front of everyone.

0.description: I saw Julie and she did an excellent job on my nails! I'm from Las Vegas and I needed to get my acrylics off and a fresh manicure while in Chicago. I called 10 nail salons and no one provided this service, except for this salon. Not only was I thankful for someone to finally grant my request, but I left completely thrilled about my fab manicure. I will definitely be visiting again. This is my go to nail salon in chi city.

38.description: Went here with my bridesmaids today to get our nails done - and the woman who did my nail totally scrapped layers of skin that were not even fully formed off my feet and it's been miserable to walk all day. Really stings. Would NOT recommend.

51.description: This is as good as it gets for CHEAP mani/pedis in the city. They are attentive and friendly. I highly recommend T.T., one of the lovely stylists there. She is so incredibly kind and does an excellent job. I have very high standards for mani/pedis and she never fails me. I have never had to wait more than 10 minutes, but I do recommend that you make an appointment if you're going after 4 or so. It's quiet and conducive to a girlfriend meet up. They work to keep things peaceful - no TV just (majorly cheesy) background music. I wish they carried more Essie polish, since OPI can't seem to get over the metallics of 2 years ago. All and all I highly recommend it! Stop by Fresh Choice for the Waller's Winner smoothie before you go!OH, one last thing! You can't write in a tip if you're paying with credit, so bring a lil cash for those hard working ladies.

27.description: I came into Magnifique after going to my usual place around the corner and seeing like 15 people all crammed into the tiny space. So I kept walking and was pleasantly greeted by a busy, but much less chaotic (and more spaced out( environment at Magnifique. Even without an appointment I got right in for a no-chip manicure. The woman who helped me was SO meticulous and seemed to genuinely Want to do a good job on my nails. I'm glad she did, too, as a couple days later I got engaged and could proudly show off the new ring right away as my no chip was spot on :)  My no chip mani went on to last THREE weeks! And even then, it only started to grow out but still didn't really chip. For $30! I was so impressed!I just went back today for another no-chip mani and the staff seemed to remember me, and again were just great! A different woman helped me, but she too took her time and did a great job. There's tons of colors to choose from, a nice arm/hand massage at the end of the manicure, and a peaceful atmosphere. What's not to love?!  I'll be back again soon, but probably not too soon since the manicures last so long! :)

32.description: Just had the most uncomfortable manicure experience of my life! I walked in and was able to get get a spot right away, as I expected. The lady, not sure of her name, doing my nails was efficient and neat, but as she was working she asks if I want to get my eyebrows done.  I tell her no, then she replies, they need it. To quote Stephanie from Full House, "how rude!"  I felt so uncomfortable that I left before my nails were fully dry. Ended up smudging my nails my nails. I immediately went to my normal nail salon and had a wonderful experience. The paint job was decent (before the smudging) but the atmoshphere SUCKED!

54.description: For a $28 mani/pedi, you get what you pay for.  Now that I'm not a new customer and can't get the deal again, I probably won't be back to pay extra.  However. they're way better than the salon around the block at Clark and Burton-- so if you're in the area and in a bind, they'll do.

48.description: My mom was coming into town from California & the plan was to get mani/pedis!  Yay!  So based on the reviews on Yelp, we went here.We walked in on a Tuesday at like 11AM, they had us pick our colors and we were attended to right away.  Expected to wait for a few minutes seeing as it was they're $26 day but I suppose we were early enough to not wait.  Both of our ladies were super nice- not uber chatty and not stone silent.  My mom especially bonded with her lady who's son had moved away to Philadelphia... you know, standard mom-talk.My lady did and excellent job on my mani and pedi... she even corrected around my nail with a little brush dipped in acetone to make it clean (I have fair skin and got cherry red polish so you can totally see if she messed up).  My cuticles were a DISASTER, and she did her best but it was still kind of like putting a band-aid on a severed foot.  She was cute in the way she would yell at me every time I went to touch something & then did whatever it was herself so I didn't make a mess of her hard work.All in all, definitely worth it.  It would be worth it even if we hadn't come on a day with a special.  I'm excited to see how long my manicure will last before it starts chipping.... if its longer than 3 days I'm totally addicted.

44.description: I am having a hard time rating this place for a few reasons....(Background--3 ladies enjoying an afternoon of mani/pedis)Pros:1.  I had made appointments for us and they even called the day of to remind me--not that I would forget but a great touch  2.  My manicure lasted a whole week with no chipping---absolutely amazing!!!3.  The manicurist chased down North Avenue to give my friend back the extra tip that she left after the manucirist said she did not want it.Cons:1.  Even though we were first time customers, we did not recieve the $28 promo.  (and yes, we did tell them)2.  My other friend had to leave early because her car was parked in a lot and she didn't want to pay for another hour..so she told her manicurist that she needed to leave in 15 minutes and did not have time for a manicure anymore.  The manicurist insisted that there was enough time for a polish change.  My  friend paid for the pedicure and polish change...but iin the end did not have time to actually get her nails painted.  (the polish change costed $7).  My friend then told them to add that amount to my services since she couldn't get the service done...they ladies spoke to each other but said nothing.  In the end, the manicurist gave my friend back $2, not $7.  I think this is a very bad practice on their part.  And to make matters worse because of this whole thing, my friend had to pay an extra $13 for parking!!!Make a judgment call...my nails did turn out great, but......I probably would not go back again based on what happened

24.description: I got no chip nail polish which chipped in two days.I went back to get it fixed and the guy(owner) was unhappy about it. While I was there waiting in line to get the chip fixed, another person came in for manicure and I was told that I would have to wait for 2 more ppl that came after me. Fortunately there are plenty of nail shops around here too choose from and will not need those service again.

7.description: Clean environment. The color selection is dated and they do not carry Essie. I got a regular manicure ($12) which was messy and bubbled up after drying. I will mostly likely not go back to this nail salon.

49.description: I'm not sure what type of voodoo they use on their nail polish, but I am amazed!  It's been one week since my mani/pedi at Magnifique and my fingernails are just starting to show some chips.  Typically, a regular manicure will start to chip within days on me but this polish has lasted through a week of typing and washing dishes, along with normal wear and tear.  My stop at Magnifique wasn't a planned one and at first I was not impressed.  My pedi chair didn't massage and the overall feel of the salon was kind of dusty and old fashioned.  Looking at my digits today I can say that this was one of the best mani/pedi's I have ever received.

40.description: Fantastic mani-pedi! No frils, as other reviewers have noted, but who needs frills when you walk out with super-fierce fingers and toes?When I walked in to Magnifique Nail Salon for a mani-pedi with a fellow self-employed friend on a lovely fall Friday, the owner told us he'd only be able to get one of us in --the other (who hadn't even arrived yet) would have to come back an hour and a half later.When my face fell, he looked back at the schedule and found a way to work us in. Great selection of OPI and Essie nail colors. I picked a brand-new navy shade for my toes and a shimmery, sheer taupe for my fingernails. And though the time constraints were tight for us between scheduled appointments -- make one, by the way! -- I never felt rushed through my services.The massage chairs are nothing to write home about, but the attention my piggies got was enough to forgive that. I loved the motorized buffer they used on my toenails; it made a huge difference in how smoothly the polish went on. Also had a really lovely foot and calf massage in place of the usual "hot towel and fist thumping" treatment. Mani was pretty standard, but knowing that I usually chip my nails within hours of getting one and they still look flawless 24 hours later...that's worth noting.By the way...$35 for the whole she-bang --anytime? That does not suck. Go here. (Oh. And bring cash for your tip!)

53.description: I went to Magnifique Nails  for the 1st time for a mani/pedi last weekend. I went based on the location and pretty good reviews on here. I have to disagree with the reviews. This may be the worst mani/pedi I've ever had. On the short end my manicure will last for 3 days before they start chipping/peeling. With the mani at M.N., My nails started chipping the next day! Literally not even 24 hours later. My pedicures can last 3 weeks and I already need to get another one. There was no $28 new customer special on the day I went (Saturday). Also note, if you are diriving there is no parking specifically for the nail salon. There is meteted parking on the main streets which is always packed and permit parking in the neighborhood. I ended up finding a spot in the hood about 8 blocks away.  This made me super late to my appointment. The only good thing about this place is that they still took me even thought I was late. I'm starting to think they did a bad job b/c I was late. I don't know, but either way I won't be going back.

30.description: I was standing on North Ave and had some time to kill and since I was seriously overdue for a mani/pedi, did a quick look up on Yelp to see if there was anything near. Based on the Yelp reviews I went to Magnifique, and couldn't be happier with the results. After the manicure was finished, as I sat down at the nail dryer, I smudged a couple of my nails on my right hand. Oops. The nail stylist fixed them immediately. Great experience, great find.

46.description: I like nail specials! :)The pedicure was good, it's been a week and a half and still going solid.  The manicure by a different employee, not so much... wasn't the best paint job and two nails chipped the second day.It was decent for the price. Can't beat $26 for a mani- pedi new customer special on Tuesdays.

1.description: In my experience, this is the best salon in Old Town to get a full acrylic set done!  Nice shaping, the nail tech was attentive but still quick, and best of all my nails are NOT thick and plastic looking like how other salons have done in the past. Great results for a reasonable price!PS: Please don't forget to bring cash to tip your nail tech! They do accept credit cards for services, but not for gratuities (as far as I can tell).

55.description: I'm happy to say that I've been coming here for a year now. My mani/pedis from here have always lasted a long time. My mani can last a good week to a week and a half, and my pedi lasts a good 3 weeks to a month. And this is with real nail polish, not some over-priced, over-hyped gel or acrylic nails!I usually do my nails at home now because the economy isn't so great. I use the same products they do (Seche Vite top coat, CND Sticky base coat, Essie, OPI, the best out there that you can get). But I like to come here to treat myself when there is a special occasion like a birthday or wedding, or when I actually have money!I also still need help keeping my eyebrows tidy, and I know I will screw them up if I try to wax them at home all by myself, so Magnifique is the only place that I trust with my eyebrows. They make them nice, neat, and natural looking and you don't have to worry about them making you look like a Chola with sharpie drawn-on brows. The price may be steep for some at $10 but I think its more than worth it for perfect eyebrows.They always have specials, which makes it even easier for new people to come along and give this place a chance.

9.description: Great massage chairs and high quality service. I would recommend it to my friends. Bring your own reading material though

26.description: This place does a great job! Its quiet, clean, calm and again most importantly they do a great job! Very nice nail techs! Great spot to go.

25.description: My fave spot in Old Town for nails! Although this place is rarely empty, I've always been able to walk in for a quick manicure. I do call ahead for no-chips since they require more time. The prices are great -- $12 for a regular manicure and $30 for a no-chip! The atmosphere is quiet & clean, the nail technicians are meticulous and my nails look perfect for weeks. The only thing I would like is a wider variety of colors for no-chips. To be fair, the (I'm guessing) owner will pull a few colors to test on my nails if I give him an idea of what I'm looking for that day. But a few more options would be nice :) Also, you can pay with a card but tip only in cash!

12.description: Great service for the price.  They do a good job, and the people were friendly.  My only issue is that they didn't seem to use freshly sanitized tools for each client.  I am always wary when I go to a nail salon and they don't pull the mani/pedi tools out of a package, proving sanitation.  Otherwise, great value.

59.description: I went here with my roomie and got the $28 first timer mani-pedi.  Great deal! My pedicure was great.  It has been over a week and it's still lookin' good.  And I wear heels everyday.  The manicure, however, was only ok.  There was no hand massage, there were no hot towels like with the pedicure and my nails got messed up before I'd even left the building b/c she rushed me out before they were dry.  I didn't have time for her to redo them. I MIGHT come here again, but only if it is on Tuesday when it's cheaper.They did have a good selection of colors though, I should mention that.

21.description: I chose this place because it was cheap and was located near me in the Gold Coast. I don't know what the deal is but are there anyyyy good nail places in the GC? This place sadly is categorized with the rest as "okay".I was impressed by the polish selection (rainbows of OPI and Essie polish) but disappointed with the results. My nails are all bubbly because my technician clearly used way too much nail polish per coat. She was very sloppy and skipped out on massaging my legs and arms. I wouldn't come here again unless I was in a true time crunch or something. Save your $30 and go somewhere else!

17.description: I came into Magnifique after going to my usual place around the corner and seeing like 15 people all crammed into the tiny space. So I kept walking and was pleasantly greeted by a busy, but much less chaotic (and more spaced out( environment at Magnifique. Even without an appointment I got right in for a no-chip manicure. The woman who helped me was SO meticulous and seemed to genuinely Want to do a good job on my nails. I'm glad she did, too, as a couple days later I got engaged and could proudly show off the new ring right away as my no chip was spot on :)  My no chip mani went on to last THREE weeks! And even then, it only started to grow out but still didn't really chip. For $30! I was so impressed!I just went back today for another no-chip mani and the staff seemed to remember me, and again were just great! A different woman helped me, but she too took her time and did a great job. There's tons of colors to choose from, a nice arm/hand massage at the end of the manicure, and a peaceful atmosphere. What's not to love?!  I'll be back again soon, but probably not too soon since the manicures last so long! :)

10.description: Magnifique has great specials on weekdays, and will do whatever they can to fit you into their appointment book.  Lots of color choices, and quick service for those on the go!

5.description: My go-to place for the past 5 years. I've since moved to West Loop and I still drive back to Old Town just to get my nails done when they need it. My manicures always last at least a week (which says a lot coming from a busy mom who doesn't take great care of her hands), and I never need to take off my toe polish in-between pedis. I have the world's worst feet and no other place can get them so clean and remove so much dead skin. Usually it's a little pumice and I still walk out with callouses, but that's never the case at Magnifique. Additionally, there is very little turnover here, so it's nice visiting all familiar faces! Magnifique is in pretty high demand so they're largely appointment based. They take walk-ins when they can accommodate them, but I'd recommend calling at least several days in advance if you need your nails done at a specific time. Also remember to bring a tip in cash!

3.description: I chose this place because it was cheap and was located near me in the Gold Coast. I don't know what the deal is but are there anyyyy good nail places in the GC? This place sadly is categorized with the rest as "okay".I was impressed by the polish selection (rainbows of OPI and Essie polish) but disappointed with the results. My nails are all bubbly because my technician clearly used way too much nail polish per coat. She was very sloppy and skipped out on massaging my legs and arms. I wouldn't come here again unless I was in a true time crunch or something. Save your $30 and go somewhere else!

35.description: Went here yesterday for a pedicure. They had a huge selection of nail polish colors and it turned out great for a very reasonable price (only $25). Its right in my neighborhood, so I will definitely plan to go back again.The only thing I found strange is that I called ahead for an appointment at 4:00pm on a Saturday, but they told me I could only come at 4:30pm. When I got there around 4:20, there were only 2 other people there...Either way, there was no wait and they did a good job.

19.description: I called ahead on a Sunday afternoon and got in for a no-chip manicure in an hour. Deal.The place is cute and quiet- there's several massage chairs and then smaller tables for manicures. My favorite thing about my experience was my interaction with the man who seemed to run the place. When he asked what color I wanted and I told him "something dark", he grabbed three bottles of dark nail polish and tested all three options on his fingernails for me to choose from. What a sweetie. Also, several different woman walked in when I was getting my nails done and he waved and greeted them all by name. They must be regulars, which shows the salon must be doing something right. My manicurist was sweet too- not too chatty, but tried to engage me in conversation a couple of times. It took about 30 minutes from start to finish and my nails look awesome. Great job, lady!Great deal for $30. I'll definitely be back.

28.description: Have tried to come here many times. Once I even called and made reservations for 2 ahead of time. Once we got there they said I had only made reservations for one and they couldn't work us in. I give up on this place, they are rude and very defensive from the second you walk through the door. Oh and don't bother trying to walk in without an appointment.

45.description: I went here with a few months ago when I was a bridesmaid for my best friend's wedding, and I think they did a great job with my nails. I mean, really great (probably one of the best manicures I've ever had!). However, the price tag seemed unusually high to me. I got a set of gel nails, which although beautifully sculpted, cost me more than $60 once you calculate for the tip. Maybe if I was a little wealthier, I could afford this kind of luxury. But until that day comes, I have to rank this place only three stars because of the price factor.

33.description: I called ahead on a Sunday afternoon and got in for a no-chip manicure in an hour. Deal.The place is cute and quiet- there's several massage chairs and then smaller tables for manicures. My favorite thing about my experience was my interaction with the man who seemed to run the place. When he asked what color I wanted and I told him "something dark", he grabbed three bottles of dark nail polish and tested all three options on his fingernails for me to choose from. What a sweetie. Also, several different woman walked in when I was getting my nails done and he waved and greeted them all by name. They must be regulars, which shows the salon must be doing something right. My manicurist was sweet too- not too chatty, but tried to engage me in conversation a couple of times. It took about 30 minutes from start to finish and my nails look awesome. Great job, lady!Great deal for $30. I'll definitely be back.

43.description: cheap nail salons aren't difficult to come by in chicago, but only a few stand out. magnifique is one of them.the $28 mani // pedi special is an absolute steal, and having the former last almost two weeks and the latter almost four weeks makes it even better.the staff is extremely professional and works fast and efficiently. they go over everything twice and make sure it's smooth and the color looks perfect. on occasion, i've had a few tiny pieces of cuticle missed by the little clippers, or i've noticed days later that my color didn't *quite* hit the very edge of a nail, but that's something i don't have a problem dealing with.i've been known to change up my polish before the next appointment, so what i'm really looking for is a place that helps my nails stay clean and maintained until the next trip to a salon, and the women here help me reach that goal.even without the specials, i find a $12 manicure to be extremely reasonable. for those interested, they also do acrylic and gel nail applications here.c'est magnifique, indeed.

2.description: Traveling for business and needed mani-pedi. Salon looked disheveled, unkempt, and dirty. Technician acted as if she was extremely bored and just going through the motions. Not thorough in terms of treatment of the cuticle. Manicure chipped the next day.

18.description: I have been coming to this fabulous salon for at least 8 years. Spotlessly clean, wonderful music with a relaxing  environment. The owner and his wife are some of the finest people I have ever met. All customers are treated with respect and caring.   The manicure and pedicure are always perfect in every way. Regular manicure lasts at least 2 weeks and a pedicure 3 to 4 weeks.  I have had manicures in many places which are at least twice the price and last half the time.

41.description: I'm not sure what happened here.  All of the reviews are so great!  I found this mani/pedi place on Yelp while I was standing on North Ave. wondering why the place I had originally planned to go had closed...I wanted a full set of gel nails applied and a pedicure.  Not that difficult, right?  They started the pedi and the manicure at the same time.  I was really happy we were killing two birds with one stone.  After the pedi, I was transferred over to a table to finish the manicure.  Quick, no pain, the nails looked great.  The gels were shiny, dried immediately (since there's nothing to dry, really) and I actually left the place thinking "Wow, this is one of the best sets I've ever had" - I was really happy the night-of.Fast forward FOUR days.  My nails looked like trash.  Like disgusting trash.  There was a ton of space forming between my skin and the gel nail, even though I can normally go two weeks without a fill (my nails grow pretty slowly).  The luster of the gel was already gone and the edges of the nail even started turning yellow-ish and cracking off.  I have a lot of past experience will gels and acrylics (I used to have them for years) and this is the worst set I've ever had applied.  Period.  My nails were ready to peel off after four or five days and I had to get a fill almost immediately after I got the nails applied because the edges looked gross.  I'm definitely never coming back here again.  I wish I had better things to say about the place, it seems like everyone else is very happy with their experiences here.The pedicure was nice but yeesh... those gel nails were horrid.

52.description: Okay, no frills place. Mani-pedi was only $28 as a first timer. Good job, except one of the nails was filed kind of crooked (I didn't notice until I got home). Technicians were kind of matter of fact creating a not very warm atmosphere, but maybe that was in part due to the language barrier. The massage chairs also were kind of outdated and not very strong, and the water in the tub was not very warm.I would go back for one of the specials or if I need to go in the hood, but this place would not be my first choice destination.

50.description: Mani/pedis are rare treat for me. I usually don't do manicures since I abuse my nails a little too much thanks to hauling boxes around. I readily accepted a girls time at the nail salon when mani/pedi is $28. Magnifique is your typical nail salon with a number of pedi chairs and mani stations. My pedicure was pretty good. They didn't charge extra for pumice as I've experienced in other salons. Thankfully, she buffed out months worth of sandal wearing and applied a pretty polish. Likewise, my maincure also met my expectations. I got a nice, light pink applied to my digits which is just enough to feel pampered while possibly assembling and moving boxes from one location to the next. All in all, I like Magnifique. I got a solid mani/pedi for a great price. They handled the influx of four mani/pedis really well. They also let us relax and be chatty on a serious sugar rush and eventual crash. Though not in my neighborhood, Magnifique's a good nail salon.

4.description: If I could, I would give this place a 0 rating!Walk in on a sunday, The man receptionist, is really the nice guy but my nail tech was horrible! Not only did she cut my cuticle till it bleeds but she also did a nasty job of hand polish! She polished all over my skins! Yikes! Not only that but she did my pedicure and no-chip manicure too fast! And there were no other customer in the salon at all! This would be my first and last visit to this shop as the service provided and the bad polish isn't worth the money at all! Stay away from this place if you must!

6.description: These guys are amazing!  They take their time and make your nails look fabulous.  They play soothing music that you won't hate.  They are very nice ladies and I can't say enough good things about them!  Highly recommend.

22.description: Always so happy to come to this nail salon! Things I love:-Lasting pedicure-Meticulous and thorough but doesn't take too long (option of razor only if you want it)-Relaxing and spacey atmosphere-Very kind ladies working here-Clientele is generally very polite and no one is yapping on cell phone -Inexpensive! $25 pedicure-They have oil and plastic bags so you won't mess up your pedicure when you need to walk home in boots!

15.description: Always so happy to come to this nail salon! Things I love:-Lasting pedicure-Meticulous and thorough but doesn't take too long (option of razor only if you want it)-Relaxing and spacey atmosphere-Very kind ladies working here-Clientele is generally very polite and no one is yapping on cell phone -Inexpensive! $25 pedicure-They have oil and plastic bags so you won't mess up your pedicure when you need to walk home in boots!

57.description: Magnifique only offers the $26 mani/pedi special the first Tuesday of every month, but they will also give it to first time customers which is why I made an appointment. My pedicure was fine, my manicure was rushed and chipped a few days later. Whatever. My problem with this place is the shocking rudeness and unprofessionalism of my nail technician. I was the last customer in the salon and was drying my nails under the fan. The technician wanted to leave so she came up to me and said "you pay me now." Um, of course I'm going to pay, but can I let my nails dry first? She barely spoke English and instead of waiting as any normal employee would do, the woman goes into my purse, takes out my wallet, counts the cash, and takes the money. She then left the salon leaving me wondering if that really just happened. I get that it was late and they wanted to close, but do they really expect to keep customers when they pull stunts like that?

20.description: Mui & Yui are not only good to their customers, they are good to their staff. i know that everyone at this nail salon works so hard to make sure each customer is happy. i have always left comfortable and satisfied.

36.description: I have been coming here for years and really appreciate the excellent quality.   One time someone else helped me out....someone newer and they didn't have the same level of interest or expertise as their more senior technicians.   This really is the only place I go.  I really don't want to go any place else because of the excellent service, positive attitudes, and they recently remodeled and have the most comfortable massage chairs for when you get your pedi.

14.description: I came in for a manicure this past Friday and was thoroughly disappointed. I had come to them previously and had a decent experience getting a no chip manicure and a pedicure. When I came in on Friday, I was very rushed, they told me they could take me now and to pick out my color, I had barely gotten down to where the polish is, and the nail tech was next to me asking me what color I wanted, so I scrambled to pick one and went to her seat. She then started to scratch the top layer of my no chip off with a file, standard procedure, but she was doing it so quickly and roughly that it was snagging my cuticles in the process. She didn't allow the acetone to sit on them long enough to take the polish off properly, and scraped off the top layer of my nails. She broke one of my nails from scraping them so hard with the metal tool and had to patch it with acrylic.  It has been 4 days, and already my cuticles look like I need a manicure, she did not clean them up at all. The polish is uneven and thick in most spots, and I'm very disappointed. I won't be coming back to this nail salon, despite the close proximity to my home.

58.description: Had brunch here on Sunday. Unfortunately, along with my coffee being poured luke warm at best, my egg skillet was def not close to being fresh. On my coffee refill, it was still not hot. We all waited 45 minutes for food to come out, won't return.

56.description: Great outdoor seating a beautiful bar with a retractable roof. It tends to get crowded quickly and can become a little rowdy on weekends/game days- so if you are looking to have a fun fraternity-esque time (though you may be 5+ years out of college) this is probably for you. Then again, it is in Old Town, so everyone is put together and quite fit. Always have fun and they have a a good morning cocktail selection on the weekends, so you cannot beat that. Wait staff is very very nice and the food is decent.

29.description: I stopped in at Benchmark to watch the game and have some dinner. I pulled up a stool at the bar. It was pretty empty but people were trickling in slowly for the game since it was just after happy hour. The cobb salad was very good and they had a decent selection of craft beers. The staff was courteous..... at least in the beginning. As the game went along it ended up being a good active vibe for mid week. Then the shaved headed bartender started talking sports with us like guys always do and we exchanged game tactics on why we should've won the game. Of course we didn't agree but it was all in fun. Until he took a personal shot at me stating, " woohoo well how many beers have you had during this whole time?" Uh ok, I had 5 and a shot. What was the point in that? Sorry i might not want to get obliterated drunk like some of your regular douchey customers if that's what you're getting at. I came to watch the game, eat, drink beer and talk sports. If you want to take shots of some sort at your customers which is very unprofessional to make you feel better then there's no reason to return or recommend this bar at all. Congratulations, for ruining a good experience.

42.description: The staff here are sexist douche bags. I will never go here again. I am a woman and I've never felt so sexually harassed by anyone let alone someone who is supposed to be acting like a professional.

23.description: Favorite bar in Old Town. Love the upstairs with open air seating. They have some good food too- def recommend their nachos!

47.description: Oh, benchmark... How I love thee. I've had many first dates here, took my out of town guest here to have some cocktails, and explored the area with its entirety while visiting Old Town. This is my favorite OT bar. I've come to the consensus and have finally admitted to myself that I'm attracted to the fraternity, "bro" looking type of guys & benchmark provides for an endless array of these type options! Lol. I swear there's a hidden beer funnel and free natty ice somewhere in this bar that I do not know about. They all congregate here and it's perfect for my girl friends and I who are sharking it up for Mr. Pretty ;) The cocktails are solid, the beer list is A-Okay, the servers are pretty (shout out to Ms. Selena Gomez herself - identical, I swear), the bar is pretty clean, big, and welcoming, and when it's summer, they have the roof open. The sun beams in and it makes for a great daydrinking type of Sunday  FunDay. They also show a lot of sports on their TVs which are huge, btw.I haven't tried the food here as I'm more a fan of booze but hey, I wouldn't turn it down. Why not?! Try it out, peeps. Love, Sorority girl at heart.

8.description: Benchmark sets the benchmark for Old Town.  Take this with a grain of salt as I haven't spent any nightlife time in Old Town other than the two times I've been here.  Benchmark is versatile providing a sports bar feel with good drinks and a high class atmosphere.  BM is modern and the open floor plan is conducive to an inviting party going crowd.  Bar space is located down the middle of the venue with booths on the walls.  The upstairs has high tables as well as booth/couch seating areas in the front.  The upstairs is also open to the downstairs in some parts with balcony style viewing down to the main floor.  The upstairs has a retractable roof for the warmer months that provides a nice outside dining/drinking experience. BM has a highfalutin aura about it.  Nightlife will bring some people that are really dressed for a night on the town as well as some casual bar goers.  Perhaps this is more of the norm in this area, again I can't really say.  Most of my experience goes from strictly clubs to bars in Wicker Park.  There is not much in-between for me but I feel like BM is more of the usual for mid to late 20's people that are bringing in that flow.You will have to pay for this as drinks are a marked up because BM sets the benchmark.  Fireball shots here were $7 and I usually never pay more then $5.  Not huge but this is probably the standard pricing in this area.  The music seems to be hit or miss as the first night the DJ was amazing and the second not so much.  The DJ booth is open on the second floor overlooking the bar.  Live spinning music is always a good way to get the party started.  Coat check in the basement as well as washrooms.  There is a washroom on the second floor for men but this is more of a turn style.  Nearly impossible to get in and out.Finally, let the doorman know what it is as he was cheering for the Ducks and I am clearly a Buckeye.  O-H!

31.description: This place puts me in a moral quandary - the food is shockingly good, but the bar itself just oozes douche. That being said, Yelp is primarily a food site, so let's stick with that. Go with the burger - you can't go wrong.

34.description: First review here. It is Super Bowl Sunday and it's also a blizzard. Personally, I'm a browns fan but my group is decked out in Patriots hear (just won Super Bowl).We were seated at a table in back. After about ten minutes no one waited on us (around 1030). A member of my group stopped a server and asked for drinks. She told him that servers stopped serving tables shortly before.While it may sound snobby, our group opted to leave. The bar was empty, it didn't seem right.We took no more than five steps towards the door before we were met by the then very nice bouncer. He told us that he had our first round to stay. He ended up buying our group of 5 a round of beers and shots and hung around and befriended us.He truly cared about our service. It ended up being the GM, his names was JT Thomas.Great management. Great people. Great place.

16.description: Can I give zero stars please? This is the absolute worst bar that I've ever been to. I spent $80 here on drinks that I didn't even order, before I finally closed out my tab. After I closed it out and started to leave, one of my friends asked me to stay. I agreed, and bought another drink in cash. An hour later, I dod so again, and was accused of stealing beer. When I mentioned my tab, and the two drinks that I bought in cash, the bouncer still forced me out of the bar. I am an administrator at a downtown hospital. I'm pretty sure I don't need a free Bud Light. This is hands down the worst bar that I have been to in Chicago.

13.description: Food and service were both average.  I'm usually a fan but the server kept forgetting our sauces.  I'm usually a fan of 4 corners need to check this place out again and update my review.

11.description: Nice ambiance, yummy drinks and good bar food. The retractable roof is awesome and great for weekend brunch. I've also gotten dinner there and the buffalo rolls are really good!! They also have good mixed drinks, I'd recommend the mojito. As far as the bar scene, it can get really crowded with long lines so go early and get a table!They sometimes host events such as trivia nights, so be on the lookout for those because they are fun!!

39.description: Food and service were both average.  I'm usually a fan but the server kept forgetting our sauces.  I'm usually a fan of 4 corners need to check this place out again and update my review.

37.description: I love coming here! The service and food are out of this world. It's a great bar to watch games, enjoy a fun evening out, or even a casual dinner during the week. The only reason why I give 4 stars and not 5 is because my lamb is usually always over cooked. Otherwise, this place is fantastic!

0.description: Great Spot in Old Town!Great atmosphere and good peops.

38.description: Been here plenty of times food has always been great. Their menu has something for everything and isn't just the normal bar food. The service has been always pretty fast and attentive as well. Haven't had any complaints. Food is great.

51.description: Oh my. This place is filled with every frat bro you can think of. I'm talking polo shirts, collar popped of course, and aviator sunglasses. It's a people watching heaven!I had a blast here. They have an upstairs patio with a retractable roof. You can really observe all the party people from up there. Every drink you can imagine is served and the food is pretty tasty as well. Their bison burger  pretty much rocked my world. Tender, juicy with cheddar cheese. Yum! The roasted red pepper hummus was delicious. I highly recommend it. We hung out here for a few hours people watching and checking out the games on the TVs. Loads of fun.

27.description: I've been here a few times now and most recently, for brunch, using a Groupon. Although the bloody mary bar wasn't ideal, my celery stalk was dirty and the mix wasn't my favorite, the overall brunch experience was quite good. I really enjoyed the chilaquiles, a dish that was both plentiful and flavorful, as well as the beers that followed. The place was really loud, because of the games playing on the multiple TV screens, but that's to be expected in Chicago. Service was friendly and attentive and the meal was well worth the Groupon.The other times that I have been here, I've enjoyed the food, service, and drinks. Definitely a good spot to get a quick meal and drinks in Old Town, if you can handle the "bro"-crowd.

32.description: Benchmark sets the benchmark for Old Town.  Take this with a grain of salt as I haven't spent any nightlife time in Old Town other than the two times I've been here.  Benchmark is versatile providing a sports bar feel with good drinks and a high class atmosphere.  BM is modern and the open floor plan is conducive to an inviting party going crowd.  Bar space is located down the middle of the venue with booths on the walls.  The upstairs has high tables as well as booth/couch seating areas in the front.  The upstairs is also open to the downstairs in some parts with balcony style viewing down to the main floor.  The upstairs has a retractable roof for the warmer months that provides a nice outside dining/drinking experience. BM has a highfalutin aura about it.  Nightlife will bring some people that are really dressed for a night on the town as well as some casual bar goers.  Perhaps this is more of the norm in this area, again I can't really say.  Most of my experience goes from strictly clubs to bars in Wicker Park.  There is not much in-between for me but I feel like BM is more of the usual for mid to late 20's people that are bringing in that flow.You will have to pay for this as drinks are a marked up because BM sets the benchmark.  Fireball shots here were $7 and I usually never pay more then $5.  Not huge but this is probably the standard pricing in this area.  The music seems to be hit or miss as the first night the DJ was amazing and the second not so much.  The DJ booth is open on the second floor overlooking the bar.  Live spinning music is always a good way to get the party started.  Coat check in the basement as well as washrooms.  There is a washroom on the second floor for men but this is more of a turn style.  Nearly impossible to get in and out.Finally, let the doorman know what it is as he was cheering for the Ducks and I am clearly a Buckeye.  O-H!

54.description: I struggle with deciding how to rate Benchmark because I feel like each time I go, I have a completely different experience.Benchmark is a GREAT bar for gameday. The food is good, the beer is cold, and they have a ton of TVs. The drink specials aren't great, but they have some solid food specials and they'll show pretty much anything you ask for. Benchmark on gameday gets 4 stars.Benchmark is a fun bar for weeknight trivia and casual nights out. I came here with some girlfriends for Friends trivia and we had a great time! Our waitress was very attentive for how crowded her section was, drinks were decently priced, and the atmosphere was really fun.Benchmark is a "meh" bar for nightlife. The space itself is great - there's a lot of room, I love the retractable roof, etc. However, I don't like the people who come here. It's like the Lincoln Park college kids graduated, got some money, and now come into Old Town thinking they're hot stuff. It's just a bit too much for me.

48.description: ROOFTOP. That's all. It's awesome. Also, the food and drinks are great, too :) It can get crowded during games, but even so we can usually find a nice table somewhere at this place right away. Also, I've been here for their brunch, too, which is legit. They have a good diy Bloody Mary bar.

44.description: Benchmark is great for a weekend brunch, especially on game day.  They have a solid bloody mary bar with all the fixings.  The tacos are delicious, and super random but try the lollipop lambchops.However fun Benchmark is during the day, I can't stand it at night.  The retractable rooftop is great but it feels just like a college bar in Lincoln Park.  I went to a Big Ten college and Benchmark has more loud and obnoxious drunks than a frat party.  People will fall all over you and it's far too tight a fit.  Save Benchmark for the daytime.

24.description: A+ food and service. Looking for a good place with an outdoor setting and good food this is your place.

7.description: I've been here a few times now and most recently, for brunch, using a Groupon. Although the bloody mary bar wasn't ideal, my celery stalk was dirty and the mix wasn't my favorite, the overall brunch experience was quite good. I really enjoyed the chilaquiles, a dish that was both plentiful and flavorful, as well as the beers that followed. The place was really loud, because of the games playing on the multiple TV screens, but that's to be expected in Chicago. Service was friendly and attentive and the meal was well worth the Groupon.The other times that I have been here, I've enjoyed the food, service, and drinks. Definitely a good spot to get a quick meal and drinks in Old Town, if you can handle the "bro"-crowd.

49.description: Benchmark is one of my favorite sports bar in the city - south of Division street.  There are two different Benchmark's - Friday/Saturday night and then football days.  This is my go to for anything Hawks/Bears related as the crowd is great, above average bar food, and a lot of sunlight for those rare sunny game days :) An extra kuddos to the bartenders - they always remember your name and are pretty darn helpful.

40.description: Awesome ambiance...gets crowded. 20s and 30s crowd mainly. Nice bar.

53.description: The friendliness of the staff here is the difference.  The sliding roof doesn't hurt either.

30.description: The best thing about this place is the retractable roof that they open up during the summer, and their TV situation isn't terrible either for watching some games. However, I have never had good service when I have gone here, either at the bar or at a table. I feel like they hire girls who look pretty, but they don't really have any other skills that qualify them to work in the environment (not knowing the specials, forgetting what I ordered, bringing me the wrong thing, etc). Also, anytime I have been there during a shift change, there seems to be confusion with what I ordered with the previous person. I have had drinks I didn't order put on my tab, and also not been charged for things I ordered. I just don't feel like the employees are trained adequately. That retractable roof, though...

46.description: There is no denying that Benchmark is your typical hangout for all sports jersey wearing bros, but that is why we like it, right?!  Located in the heart of Old Town, it is one of the best bars in the city to view sporting events, grab some classic bar food, or sit on the second level enjoying a draft beer alfresco.  There is typically plenty of meter street parking and price point is pretty standard for a sports bar.  I highly recommend the Buffalo Rolls and the Hot Soft Pretzels.  See you all there!

1.description: Only giving Benchmark 3 stars due to the poor service. Came here for CCC 2015 because this was the registration pickup spot. We decided to stay and the bartender was not very helpful or attentive. We ordered a food and a drink item off their specials menu, and we were expecting 2 stickers for our CCC chart. However, she said that they are not giving stickers for the food items (even though the rules in the CCC handout said, stickers would be given for all food and drink specials). The drinks and ambiance were good. But the staff was rude!

55.description: Great place to watch a game. Busy, lively, and decent service. Had a few beers here recently while watching a world cup game. This is a definitely a 'scene' and is full of young professionals dressed to impress. The bar is nice though, great menu, and of course the roof deck is wonderful.

9.description: By far my favorite bar in Old Town/Lincoln Park! Love the patio- you can bring your dogs!+ It has a nice casual feeling for after-work or first-date drinks during the week. Unlike other bars I've been to in the area, the food is actually really good. They have nightly specials like lamb and salmon- not your general bar food.+ Weekend nights are busy and filled with beautiful people. There is a DJ upstairs too,+ Sundays there is a really good Bloody Mary bar- if you like spicy Bloodys, you'll like one of their mixes (I forgot what the spicy one is called)Great service, great atmosphere.

26.description: I've been about 5 times for their burgers, which are good.  They pad the bill - I brought it to the managers attention twice but now I just reduce the tip.  They over salt the fries and have had to send them back repeatedly.

25.description: Can I give zero stars please? This is the absolute worst bar that I've ever been to. I spent $80 here on drinks that I didn't even order, before I finally closed out my tab. After I closed it out and started to leave, one of my friends asked me to stay. I agreed, and bought another drink in cash. An hour later, I dod so again, and was accused of stealing beer.
