When I mentioned my tab, and the two drinks that I bought in cash, the bouncer still forced me out of the bar. I am an administrator at a downtown hospital. I'm pretty sure I don't need a free Bud Light. This is hands down the worst bar that I have been to in Chicago.

12.description: Came in on Thursday and sat at the bar and Anna was bartending. She was very helpful and mindful when when drinks needed to be filled. Ordered nachos and pizza. Everything was really good.  Only thing I'd recommend is having shredded cheese on the nachos rather than liquid cheese. Other than that,  everything was great. Cool atmosphere and DJ was playing good music.

59.description: Fish tacos and tater tots a must.  Gets very crowded and very loud!

21.description: Best desert I've ever had! And Gus is the best, most attentive bartender I've had in a while. Thanks for the recommendation.

17.description: Oh, benchmark... How I love thee. I've had many first dates here, took my out of town guest here to have some cocktails, and explored the area with its entirety while visiting Old Town. This is my favorite OT bar. I've come to the consensus and have finally admitted to myself that I'm attracted to the fraternity, "bro" looking type of guys & benchmark provides for an endless array of these type options! Lol. I swear there's a hidden beer funnel and free natty ice somewhere in this bar that I do not know about. They all congregate here and it's perfect for my girl friends and I who are sharking it up for Mr. Pretty ;) The cocktails are solid, the beer list is A-Okay, the servers are pretty (shout out to Ms. Selena Gomez herself - identical, I swear), the bar is pretty clean, big, and welcoming, and when it's summer, they have the roof open. The sun beams in and it makes for a great daydrinking type of Sunday  FunDay. They also show a lot of sports on their TVs which are huge, btw.I haven't tried the food here as I'm more a fan of booze but hey, I wouldn't turn it down. Why not?! Try it out, peeps. Love, Sorority girl at heart.

10.description: The food was great (definitely recommend the fish tacos- even as a California native). The Bloody Mary bar was also a must! Great Old Town spot.

5.description: I'm always impressed with the food. And I'm really enjoying the extra activities the bar puts on such as wine tastings etc. definitely check out their webpage for various events. Definitely a great place for a variety of folks.

3.description: This was a beautiful casual, yet upscale joint. It's schnazzy and hip. A great place to take friends for some pretty food and cocktails. It's the kind of spot you want to dress up a little to get noticed. Whether downstairs, or upstairs, it's a happening vibe. Downstairs is a little cooler, and suave of a feel. Upstairs feels a bit more lively, with its cool lights and opened rooftop in the summertime. There's some TV's around, too, for guys. I think it's ideal spot for the social person who might want to invite the next table over for a drink and get friendly. Service is on point. The food is pretty good. I had the ahi tuna tostadas, which were too easy to gobble up. Refreshing perfect balance of tuna with a crunch and a kick and a dab of cool sour cream. I had friends who ordered pizza, which comes on a flatter, crispy crust. Also easy to share. My friends ordered a skillet cookie. HEAVEN!! it was heated, chocolate-chipped sweetness, part savory, and part ice-creamy. Perfect to share with a table.Good music, pretty, clean... parking might be a little difficult. I was loving the weekday deal, including $5 glasses of nearly all wines on their wine list. I had the sexual chocolate, and that sure did make me happy ^_^.I'd love to come back and try more of what they have to offer. There were definitely no negatives, but I can't give a 5 without experiencing a full dinner here. It's on my list of recommends, though!

35.description: Patriots win the Super Bowl, awesome. At benchmark after for a drink and wait 20 minutes to be told by the waiter that she's done working. Bartender gets waved over about 10 feet and tells us we can come to the bar for a drink. We are about to leave but General Manager, JT Thomas, stops us and offers us a round. After being ignored for awhile it was a polite way of making up for it. It was the reason we stayed and the reason we will come back.

19.description: Favorite bar in Old Town. The food is great and they have a very nice atmosphere. I highly suggest their fish tacos. I also like the people that come here!Overall, I recommend checking this place out if you're in the area.

28.description: I can't believe I haven't written a review on this place yet since I've been several times. The crowd is a bit younger then I would like, but overall the service and food have always been great. Downstairs they have a little patio sidewalk area and on the main floor they have the huge windows that open up to the side walk. Upstairs the rooftop gets pretty lively (especially during sports games).I went here this pass Sunday. We got there about an hour before the Hawks game started and they were doing open seating. We were lucky enough to get a table on the rooftop and it got packed!!! 3 drinks down and a Turkey Burger later we were ready to give up our beloved table. I like that the waitress wasn't pushy with us to leave even though we were drinking ridiculously slow (1 drink an hour since we were there for 3 hours). Cocktail wise I would say my favorite of the 3 was the Kentucky Buck (Makers Mark, Strawberry, Ginger Beer). So refreshing!! The Turkey burger was excellent and overall I have never had a bad experience here.

45.description: Never going back. The waitress tipped herself an extra six dollars when I was out drinking with friends on a Friday. She probably did this with a ton of people that night hoping they wouldn't realize it the next morning. Also I asked the manager to solve the problem and he took my info down, but I never got the problem solved and he never called back.

33.description: Is there a "normal" bar on Wells Street? All with crowds I am not a fan of. Super loud, super preppy, just not my style. Space is cool but prices are simply ridiculous. Sorry, if you're OKAY with paying $6/7 for a MILLER LITE DRAFT, you're insane and we are probably not friends. We got there early and it wasn't too bad but it just got worse and worse as the night went on. They turned off many TVs too, which I didn't get. Games were still going on, come on now.

43.description: Oh how to rate benchmark is tricky.. If I can do half stars that would make it easier! I would say a total rating of 3 and half stars is perfect for benchmark.First... It's a pretty cool bar for old town! I love going here in the summer however it gets packed on weekends and even weekdays! They have a retractable roof which is sweet! You can sit upstairs and enjoy a cocktail! The bar alone has many tv's to watch a game! As for food.. I absolutely love their fish tacos and the arugula/ prosciutto pizza!! It's amazing! I haven't tried anything else but those items, however I'm sure everything else on the menu is good.As for drinks...they have a decent selection! Lastly.. They sponsor sports teams! They sponsored my volleyball league which was cool since we received a discount on game nights!

2.description: Went there last Sunday to watch football. Games were on but no sound. Just bad music. Bartender was indifferently rude (and unattractive). The place was empty too.I was sent a survey to fill out about my experience. I like to help businesses so I filled it out and they sent me what they thought was a "gift" which was: Complimentary Appetizer with purchase of any 2 appetizers or sandwiches.Why would I go back after a bad experience to spend even more money? Is that really a gift?Well one thing is for sure, they don't think of their customers as being too bright.

18.description: Oh how to rate benchmark is tricky.. If I can do half stars that would make it easier! I would say a total rating of 3 and half stars is perfect for benchmark.First... It's a pretty cool bar for old town! I love going here in the summer however it gets packed on weekends and even weekdays! They have a retractable roof which is sweet! You can sit upstairs and enjoy a cocktail! The bar alone has many tv's to watch a game! As for food.. I absolutely love their fish tacos and the arugula/ prosciutto pizza!! It's amazing! I haven't tried anything else but those items, however I'm sure everything else on the menu is good.As for drinks...they have a decent selection! Lastly.. They sponsor sports teams! They sponsored my volleyball league which was cool since we received a discount on game nights!

41.description: Great local place.  Really like the Tuna tostadas, Shrimp tacos and lamb chops.  Never had anything I didn't like here.  Good social scene and nice outdoor area in summer.

52.description: Where do I begin with this horrible establishment? The food was mediocre, the wait staff lack customer service, the bouncers are wannabes and douchebags and did I mention their menu is a disaster?! Game days are typical as with 500 other Chicago bars for any games on and the only distinct factor here is their retractable rooftop but do people actually come here for this so-called roof? It didn't seem too amazing to me. Advice to Benchmark, get your service in order for your waitstaff and hire some professional bouncers for your weekends.

50.description: Can we talk about service? Jenna went above and beyond time and time again! She was engaging and always fun! Grapefruit Radler and gin?! Who would have guessed?! Amazing service amazing fun! And might I add not bad on the eyes ;)

4.description: I can't believe I haven't written a review on this place yet since I've been several times. The crowd is a bit younger then I would like, but overall the service and food have always been great. Downstairs they have a little patio sidewalk area and on the main floor they have the huge windows that open up to the side walk. Upstairs the rooftop gets pretty lively (especially during sports games).I went here this pass Sunday. We got there about an hour before the Hawks game started and they were doing open seating. We were lucky enough to get a table on the rooftop and it got packed!!! 3 drinks down and a Turkey Burger later we were ready to give up our beloved table. I like that the waitress wasn't pushy with us to leave even though we were drinking ridiculously slow (1 drink an hour since we were there for 3 hours). Cocktail wise I would say my favorite of the 3 was the Kentucky Buck (Makers Mark, Strawberry, Ginger Beer). So refreshing!! The Turkey burger was excellent and overall I have never had a bad experience here.

6.description: This is a decent sports bar; a few big TVs and a few small TVs with games on. They play music. The drinks are a little pricey. I paid $6 for a blue moon draft; I have never paid more than $4 for a blue moon...ever! We also ordered the First Lady; it was too tart. Can't speak personally on the food. It was typical pub/bar food; my friends said it was good.

22.description: Andy was soooo helpful in organizing my reservation for my birthday. The only thing keeping this from being 5 stars is the table was right in the hallway so the servers and bus boys kept asking us to move out of the way. Kind of got annoying. Really fun bar though!

15.description: Egg sandwich was great , fries a and potatoes were really good. Pizza was good! Bloody Mary bar, nice sidewalk dining. All in all a good experience!

57.description: Great bar. Not the usual trashy pub filled with college kids. The crowd is a bit older and sophisticated. The food and drinks are great and tons of TVs for catch all your games. The steak tacos are the best!!!

20.description: My boyfriend and I came in not to long ago for lunch and our food was delicious! they had outdoor seating so we sat outside. It gets really crowded at night so i definitely would want to come back at night!

36.description: I like the design of this place, and the food is pretty decent.  If it was slow I would come back here often.  The only thing I really really can not stand is how you have to scavenge for a table and then pray and hope that a server comes to you.  If they had hosts like a normal restaurant, you didn't have to bus your own tables, and servers seemed to care about you, then this place would be awesome.

14.description: Favorite bar in Old Town. Love the upstairs with open air seating. They have some good food too- def recommend their nachos!

3.description: They have specials every day! Clean location, never too crowded. The beds are great!

1.description: Ha, what a joke...! Just got a mystic spray tan. Im glad Im not going anywhere warm where Id wear more revealing clothes. First of all, the machine doesn't tell you to turn around, so don't wait for that. Secondly, you wont be able to breath while getting spray tanned. You'll feel a little suffocated. Apparently I inhaled the solution and still feel a little bit in my throat. I just blew my nose, it was all brown. Other than that, it doesn't spray below your calves and when I got out, the solution was literally dripping down my legs. The girl did tell me I have to dab myself dry because the machine won't do it. But the dripping needed more than just a little bit of dabbing. Also I wasn't prepared to still feel sticky hours after the spray tan. The girl who works there was friendly, not very knowledgeable, but that's alright. Also she didn't really know what to do with my feedback. Im sorry, Im not coming back for the mystic spray tan.

2.description: I'm a fan of LA Tan but for some reason this location is awful.  The customer service here is awful. There needs to be a manger here, I've had problems every single time I've come to this location. The girls always have to call management or the owner and still even then the situation doesn't get resolved where someone has to come in.  If you don't mind the rudeness and having to wait an extra 20 mins on your tan time then come on in. The only perk is the Tuesday $5 tans

5.description: I go here on tuesdays for the $5 tans. I'm trying to cut back on tanning, so I don't need a monthly package. This place is nothing special but it gets the job done. If you go after 6 on tuesday there can be a bit of a wait.

6.description: I was drawn in by the large sign out front that says new clients get $50 worth of free tanning. I have a wedding coming up and I've been staring at this sign, while waiting for the North Avenue bus, for the past couple of weeks. I was a little apprehensive walking in. I tried spray tanning at a couple of places and some of the workers can be a bit snobby. Not here though! I explained to the wonderful counter girl that I wanted information on the promotion and that I had never been tanning in a bed before. She was very helpful and even assisted me in picking out a lotion. She suggested the stand-up bed for me and showed me how everything works. I couldn't have asked for a better first time experience. My only regret is that I didn't catch her name. But I plan on going back again this week so hopefully I'll get it.

7.description: Nice and clean location!!  New equipment!

0.description: I am not sure why people are complaining about this place. It's as good as the other LA tans, and nobody is unfriendly.  The only problem with it is that the stand-up rooms are very small & there's not much space to get ready.  Also, the Soltron XL Chill (one of the best beds) doesn't give me the same tan it used to because I think they have different bulbs in there now.  Also, i was reading on TanTalk that the acryllic is NOT supposed to look like that on the bottom (like cracked ice).  It's also not cold like it used to be.  The ergoline 600 at Xsport is colder, and it doesn't even have real AC...just strong fans.  The level 2 stand ups in LA tan salons (with LA tan bulbs) are pretty much the best beds anywhere if you have skin like mine (from the normal sun I typically turn red then tan later...and I will burn...I have no olive tones) - I get kind of orange & fake looking in the higher powered UVA beds (the ergoline at xsport) & I never burned in a Level 2 as long as I did a few Level 1 sessions first and built up to it.  I haven't needed to try a level 3.Also, the maximum times here are shorter than other LA Tans even though the beds are the same...and nobody seems to know why.  It's strange.Oh, parking is $4 an hour on the street in front (typical for old town)...so add that if you drive.Update:  Ok - as much as I love LA tan - I have to be honest, the bed at xsport gave me a way better than than the soltron & it was almost half the price.  It's the ergoline 650 I think...or 600 (not the one with facial tanners only).  The tan from the stand ups here is still really good, but it fades faster than the xpsort bed.  I built a base here mostly & then continued at xsport.  When I'd use the soltron, I wouldn't notice anything - even after 2 days.  This used to be my favorite bed - not sure what happened.

4.description: Eww, this place is so dirty, hair flying everywhere in tanning booth, dust filled vents/fans! And the rudest employees, I tried to bring my concers to little girl at the desk, and she shrugged and replied, "yea they're hard to clean" umm no, considering I have been to many different salons, this was by far the worst!!!  I did let corporate know, but I wanted to alert any walk ins to walk away!!!

3.description: I was charged $8.00 for a plate of plain rice. It used to be 4-5 dollars.  I hate to say this but I believe that because I was not ethnic they overcharged me.  Will not go back.

1.description: After reading Yelp reviews I was skeptical to try this place but I'm glad I decided to form my own opinion.  To be honest I'm not 100% sure what I got but it was chicken and rice and chick peas and flavored pretty well.  I was offered a small plate with different options to sample and asked if I was going to dine in...I didn't feel uncomfortable at all, their English was fine. My platter was $11, no menus are posted and it felt like he just grabbed a number out of thin air. I did get a lot of food but it was mainly rice. $7-$8 would've been fair.  I still tipped a $1 and I'll probably go back. Ask what's good today and try it.

2.description: Only ate the food because I was famished! No real menu and the prices seemed made up. Paid $10 for food that all tasted the same. Don't use the restroom, you will be scared for life.

5.description: Great lunch spot!I work right down the sidewalk from this establishment, and eat there a couple of times a month.The Business Lunch Special is perfect!It comes with two types of meat, awesome rice, great hummus and a small salad.I would recommend  ordering some pita's to make a nice little pita with all the goodies inside.If ordering take out, be aware that it does take about 15 minutes, so calling ahead is a plus.I also recommend calling in your lunch earlier in the day so you can get more of a helping of meat.My only gripe is that the portions seem inconsistent.Some days you get more meat, some days you get more rice.Overall, I will be returning. The convenience and tastiness does it for me.

6.description: In summery: 1. if you are not Arab or Pakistani you will get ripped off if you eat here. 2. This store most likely evades taxes and should be reported to the IRS. 3. Other than the naan, the food is ok at best and the place is really dirty. I have been 3 times to this place, mainly because its near my house. First thing you will notice is that there is no menu nor any prices. Second, most people dont speak english. I order the same dish all 3 times with the same sides.The first time i ordered a plate, after finishing the meal  the guy told me that it's gonna be 10 dollars. I saw that some of the other customers paid less than that. The second time i was smart enough to ask the prices first and was told that its 7 dollars. when i finished the meal, they said that its 10.  Luckily the guy who told me 7 was still in the store. The third time i went, i again asked for prices in advance and was told its 7. This time after finishing the meal, the same guy told me that its 8. When i asked why, he said that they charge a dollar for the togo box. I told him to f himself and offered the box back to him. If you will notice, no prices listed anywhere in the store, no taxes calculated and no recites are ever given. Its all  cash business. It is obvious that these guys are evading taxes and i for one am planning to report them. The store itself and the utensils don't look sanitary either.

7.description: Just didn't do it for me.  The hummus was ok at best.  The entrees were just not very good.  Not planning on going back.

0.description: Firstly, I have no idea what's going on with all of the 'don't trust the Muslims' nonsense. Seriously people... take a moment to think before you post something so xenophobic. The menu is clearly posted with prices. Yes, the menu changes everyday, this is typical in most of the world. Furthermore, they really need to change their name, get new signage and start a new Yelp page. It's clear they've changed ownership as well as their focus since openingNow let's get to the actual review. Firstly, at night this restaurant is mostly Indo-Pakistani/Mughlai cuisine now. They may haved a Middle Eastern menu during the day but I've never stopped by for lunch. The prices are quite fair, and the portions quite large. The food is pretty consistent with the other two restaurants on the block that cater to the transportation worker crowd. New Zaika and Tabaq next store are pretty comparable. I'd say Pita Grill is generally slightly less expensive with quality really varying depending on what specials are available.

4.description: So, I received an email from the new owner yesterday. He said to come on in, give them another shot and he would give me 50% off. No harm in trying. Went in today and the owner wasn't there, so no big deal. I ordered the ground beef kabob sandwich on Naan with a small hummus. Took a little while to cook, but at least you know it is fresh. I watched the guy make the Naan, very cool. So, I got my bag to go and headed up to my office. I was nervous, ha. I really wanted to like this place the first time. I am happy to report that the meal was fantastic. Really hit the spot. The sandwich was perfect. I am relieved and glad that there is a new lunch spot around that I can go to. So, next time I will take him up on the 50% off...happy to pay full price this time!@

28.description: WORST FACIAL EVER! Went for the prettycity.com special for microderm.  Waited a half hour for my appointment (yea that's my problem) then only to have her NOT do microderm, but give me a massive by hand exfoliating treatment (scrubbing my face with sand) that cased my entire face to have tiny little scabs ALL over it. I asked her why she was not using the NORMAL micromderm machine, and she said," oh well this is what I decided would be best for this promotion", SCAM)!!!!!!!!! She used many products and did give advise, BUT I WOULD never take any of it!  I have VERY sensitive skin prone to break outs-  ALL OF WHICH I TOLD her.  What she did not only cased the tiny scabs from rubbing so hard, but because she did that, my skin went into OVER production of oil and broke out!

1.description: I've been following Amy around the city for more than 10 years.  She is amazing, hilarious and professional.  She makes getting a Brazilian seem like a coffee date with a great friend.  Her facials are excellent and she gives great skincare advice.  I wouldn't go anywhere else!

9.description: So my boyfriend and I went in for a microderm and peel treatment for each of us. Amy was very accommodating to get both of us in together in the morning. Her place of work is a one room studio and it was clean and relaxing. Amy did a very good job and she is very informative and knowledgeable on skin care. She answered our questions and gave us good suggestions on products and care. She gave me some samples to try and I saw an immediate difference. My skin had a nice glow.Thank you Amy, you certainly live up to your reviews!

29.description: I took advantage of the $31 Pretty in Pink special going on through October 31st (at PrettyCity.com), and got an amazing microdermabrasion/chemical peel facial from Amy at A+ Skincare.  Amy really took her time, gave me a relaxing and very thorough facial (even her extractions were tolerable, and I normally HATE that part of a facial).  She has a cute, spotless little studio in Old Town, very private.  Definitely worth a visit!

23.description: So my boyfriend and I went in for a microderm and peel treatment for each of us. Amy was very accommodating to get both of us in together in the morning. Her place of work is a one room studio and it was clean and relaxing. Amy did a very good job and she is very informative and knowledgeable on skin care. She answered our questions and gave us good suggestions on products and care. She gave me some samples to try and I saw an immediate difference. My skin had a nice glow.Thank you Amy, you certainly live up to your reviews!

5.description: I've recently visited A+Skin Care after a long day at work and I had the most relaxing facial treatment! Amy is a true professional and I've been recommending her services to almost all people I know ever since. Who would have thought you had to wear sunscreen everyday?! Now I know and I try to follow the regiment she suggested as regularly as possible. I love all the Sonya Dakar Skin Care products I was able to purchase at the end of the treatment and now my skin feels great and hydrated during this nasty winter.Great customer service, great products and the best facial in Chicago!!!

31.description: Amy is a true professional. Her experience is evident. When my husband told me how great my bare skin looked at dinner, I was shocked! I knew it was because of my last microdermabrasion session with Amy! Thank you!!!

25.description: Had a facial with Amy through the October Pretty City specials.  She was sweet and did a good, thorough deep-clean.  Once in the room, it was very peaceful and relaxing.  The waiting area could use some help (chair in busy hallway).  I doubt I would pay the regular prices for such a bare-bones overall experience, but it was fun to try!

12.description: I visited Amy about two weeks ago for a facial and microdermabrasion.  It was the most amazing experience.  Not only was I relaxed the entire time, but if I had questions she was completely knowledgeable and could answer on the spot.  She goes above and beyond what other spas provide for a much better price.  Other spas I've been to offer just microderm for $150.  Amy provides Microderm, a facial, and a short back massage for the exact same price.  I left feeling extremely refreshed and my face felt clean and clear. She is gracious and does not try to make you buy the products she uses.I can't wait for my next session with her!!

21.description: I discovered A+ Skin Care through Pretty in Pink's $31 deals in October. I went in for a facial, and have been going back ever since to get my eyebrows waxed. The facial was fantastic, relaxing, and left my skin feeling and looking great. Amy is very helpful and knowledgeable about products and natural oils that promote healthy skincare and hair growth, which is a huge plus. She is the only person I trust with my eyebrows, and although she is very thorough, she believes (as do I) in keeping them in their natural shape. I would recommend Amy to everyone!

16.description: Amy is amazing. I'm a 20 something guy, but I felt like my skin was clogged up for a few weeks so I wanted a facial. I've had a few facials before, but Amy was definitely the best. She first talked to me for a good 30 mins before setting up an appointment to find out what sort of products I am using and what kind of skin I have. I told her I have extremely sensitive skin so before even doing a facial, she had me come in for a skin assessment and took plenty of time with that. I was impressed enough to schedule a facial the next week, and she did a phenomenal job. She cleaned everything up very expertly and my skin has been noticeably improved ever since.So yeah, very nice, very professional and very good at what she does.

17.description: i originally found amy during the $31 deals over a year ago,  made an appointment for a micro derm and a peel, and havent even thought of going to anyone else since. amy is amazing.  shes other-worldly-caring, thoughtful, insanely knowledgeable, and perhaps most importantly, she has an incredible way of knowing exactly what my skin needs.  she takes her time during appointments, plays great relaxing music, and has the ability to make even painful extractions seem like a soothing, enjoyable spa experience.knowing that im on a budget, she never tries to over-sell, and goes out of her way to find natural and less expensive solutions for my skin issues.  amy never fails to impress me by going out of her way to make sure my skin is at its best.  the last time i was there, dealing with an unusually nasty breakout, amy pulled out her phone and called a nutritionist, to get some information for me about  foods that potentially could aggravate acne.  and on more than one occasion, she has emailed me to check in and see how my skin is doing post-treatment.  no matter how busy she is, or how jam-packed her schedule is, she always takes the time to ask me how im doing, how my job is, how things are with my boyfriend, etc.  i dont have enough fingers to count the number of times that i have called amy in a total panic, (disastrous breakout before big date!  peeling, flaky skin before important meeting! zit-the-size-of-texas, cant leave the house!) and every single time, she has not only fit me in for an appointment and made my skin look brand new, but she has made me feel less stressed and more relaxed.  try her manual microderms and fruit enzyme peels - they are amazing.  also, ask about the A.N.D Pumpkin Enzyme Masque - this stuff has changed my life.  it decongests pores, keeps acne at bay, and makes your skin the SOFTEST after just one use.as far as im concerned, amy is a goddess.  and a+ skin care is the best kept secret in chicago.

10.description: Amy is awesome. I was referred to her by a friend, and she has done great work. My first time I had never had a facial before and I was a little nervous because I have pretty sensitive skin and was worried it would freak out from all of the different products. But she did a wonderful job, I came out with soft, happy skin, and my blemishes went away quickly after. She also waxed my eyebrows for me and sent me home equipped with some samples and lots of information about how to take care of my skin. I am so happy to have her, because now I don't have to run to the dermatologist every time something goes wrong with my skin. She is great!

11.description: Amy is great for facials.  My skin has improved so much going to her for the past year about every 6-8 weeks for a facial.  She is great at helping you relax and even does a neck/shoulder, arm and leg massage at the end of the facial to keep you relaxed.  She also has a great line of products and I have been very happy with everything she has recommended to me for skincare in between facials.  I would also highly recommend her for waxing as well.  She has done the best and most thorough brazilian I have ever gotten.  She spends time removing ingrowns which no other estheticians bother with.  I also recently had her do my eyebrows-she is very conservative and does not over-pluck.

26.description: I made an appointment for a facial with Amy through the February Pretty City promotion.  Normally, my face is a little blotchy right after a facial, but when I left Amy, it looked dewy and even-toned and amazing.  She's a super-nice gal, very warm and engaging, and I got a great treatment from her.  She took the time to discuss my current skincare regime, telling me what I've been doing right and what I might want to try incorporating.  But she did this without pushing me to buy products, and I felt like she genuinely wanted my skin to look its best.  She also threw in a great upper-back and shoulder massage, leaving me feeling relaxed and knot-free.The only downside was the location.  A+ is a 1-room operation in a building which houses a number of suites, all of them hair or nail salons.  There is no reception or waiting area, so it was a little difficult for me to find.  A minor complaint though, because the studio itself was super clean and professional.  I would definitely recommend A+ to anyone looking for a thoroughly professional, yet personal, experience.

27.description: I visited Amy about two weeks ago for a facial and microdermabrasion.  It was the most amazing experience.  Not only was I relaxed the entire time, but if I had questions she was completely knowledgeable and could answer on the spot.  She goes above and beyond what other spas provide for a much better price.  Other spas I've been to offer just microderm for $150.  Amy provides Microderm, a facial, and a short back massage for the exact same price.  I left feeling extremely refreshed and my face felt clean and clear. She is gracious and does not try to make you buy the products she uses.I can't wait for my next session with her!!

0.description: I have been going to Amy for about 2 years now & this review is long overdue. I have tried many different Spas & facial boutiques but NONE of them can compare to the level of service/ care you receive from Amy. Last year I came to Amy with really bad acne in my cheek area, when I left I had the most glowing acne free skin, I just couldn't believe that my face was so smooth.  She gave me samples of the products that she used & others that she recommend I try. To this day I still use the Dermalogica Microfoliant & Sonya Dakar sunscreen. Amy really cares about her clients, you won't find another that can come close to the work she does. Her main focus is always you and making you look & feel your best. She doesn't push products on you, they speak for themselves. Some people pay for gym memberships and never go, I pay for facials.

20.description: i originally found amy during the $31 deals over a year ago,  made an appointment for a micro derm and a peel, and havent even thought of going to anyone else since. amy is amazing.  shes other-worldly-caring, thoughtful, insanely knowledgeable, and perhaps most importantly, she has an incredible way of knowing exactly what my skin needs.  she takes her time during appointments, plays great relaxing music, and has the ability to make even painful extractions seem like a soothing, enjoyable spa experience.knowing that im on a budget, she never tries to over-sell, and goes out of her way to find natural and less expensive solutions for my skin issues.  amy never fails to impress me by going out of her way to make sure my skin is at its best.  the last time i was there, dealing with an unusually nasty breakout, amy pulled out her phone and called a nutritionist, to get some information for me about  foods that potentially could aggravate acne.  and on more than one occasion, she has emailed me to check in and see how my skin is doing post-treatment.  no matter how busy she is, or how jam-packed her schedule is, she always takes the time to ask me how im doing, how my job is, how things are with my boyfriend, etc.  i dont have enough fingers to count the number of times that i have called amy in a total panic, (disastrous breakout before big date!  peeling, flaky skin before important meeting! zit-the-size-of-texas, cant leave the house!) and every single time, she has not only fit me in for an appointment and made my skin look brand new, but she has made me feel less stressed and more relaxed.  try her manual microderms and fruit enzyme peels - they are amazing.  also, ask about the A.N.D Pumpkin Enzyme Masque - this stuff has changed my life.  it decongests pores, keeps acne at bay, and makes your skin the SOFTEST after just one use.as far as im concerned, amy is a goddess.  and a+ skin care is the best kept secret in chicago.

19.description: I discovered A+ Skin Care through Pretty in Pink's $31 deals in October. I went in for a facial, and have been going back ever since to get my eyebrows waxed. The facial was fantastic, relaxing, and left my skin feeling and looking great. Amy is very helpful and knowledgeable about products and natural oils that promote healthy skincare and hair growth, which is a huge plus. She is the only person I trust with my eyebrows, and although she is very thorough, she believes (as do I) in keeping them in their natural shape. I would recommend Amy to everyone!

2.description: Amy is super nice and professional! She gives very great advices and she also help you to understand what is going on with your skin. Recommend her to everyone who had skin problems!

32.description: A+ Skin Care is the perfect name for this place.  With Amy you truly get the best skincare around and all within a  friendly, fun and extremely professional atmosphere.   Amy always keeps up with what's new in skin treatment and passes it along to her clients.  She educates you not only about your skin but what's the best products for you without being pushy or giving you the "big sell".   She makes you feel so comfortable from the moment you arrive and when you're having a waxing treatment that is of the utmost importance.  I  simply won't go to anyone else for waxing or facials!!

18.description: I initially saw Amy at A+ Skin Care for a Brazilian wax. She did a great job and was very easy going and welcoming. Awesome. BUT I also mentioned that I wanted to talk to her about my acne. I'm 26 and I've tried everything under the sun short of oral medications - which I try to avoid. After my wax we talked about my current skincare regime and diet. She offered to wash my face and try a couple products out to see how my skin reacted, free of charge. After my mini facial she suggested I try out two products, so I ended up buying some. After a month there was a very noticeable improvement in my acne I was obviously delighted and very impressed with the product, but more with of her knowledge and attention to individual needs and skin types. I recently ran out of my products - beauty disaster!!! I called Amy to see when I could come pick up more. INSTEAD she offered to come meet me at my work to drop off the goods. That's right people, products on demand! I mean how much better does it get? It's like an aesthetician on call. Amy met me at my office that same day. Talk about easy, breezy, beautiful! If you're looking for someone who is friendly, relaxed, knowledgeable, and personalizes their treatments, look no further. Amy is great and I highly recommend A+ Skin Care.

13.description: This has to probably be one of the best facials I have ever gotten.  And I got the pretty city promotion too - so I came with the expectation of being skimped on treatment and time for the price I paid.  But nope - she was on point and even did extractions b/c  I told her that's my fav part of the facial, but it wasn't included in the promotion price.  So sweet.  And get this - her facials come with a hand and shoulder and scalp massage.  That was such a nice treat - I didn't want her to stop!  Most places charge extra for that.She gave great advice, gave me some free samples and I left feeling relaxed and refreshed.  Oh, and I was glowing, of course! I hope she's back with prettycity come October!

4.description: A 90 Minute Facial that isn't an upgrade? Sign me up! Amy is spunky & uber sweet. She really cares about you & your skin. She didn't reprimand me for sitting in the sun the past weekend & over-tanning my face. Instead, Amy cheerfully mentioned to use a facial moisturizer with sunscreen daily. Made me feel comfy. Can't wait to go back as my face was glistening & radiant after her service!!!

24.description: This business has the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my lifetime.  Apparently Amy doesn't care about being professional or about new customers.  I have been leaving messages for an appointment for over a week now.  I am still waiting for a return call!  How rude!  The same thing happened last year when I was trying to make an appointment during the October Pretty City specials.  I couldn't believe that the she was doing the same thing this year--NOT RETURNING CALLS!   Is this how this place treats their customers?  I will take my business elsewhere since it is not welcome at A+1 Skincare on Wells.

6.description: Amy is Fabulous!  Her services are top notch and she has a great personality. I have always gone to Amy for my waxing needs.  I have followed Amy for years and would not think of seeing anyone else for a bikini wax. Her facials are amazing and her attention to detail always impresses me....When you find an aesthetician like Amy , you never go elsewhere!

22.description: I absolutely love Amy  she provides a calming and great experience every time I'm with her. Amy's suit is always clean. Last time i was getting a facial i almost fell asleep because i trust her completely with my skin. Her products are amazing and she never pushes to buy her products.I would defiantly recommended her! She keeps me coming back!

15.description: I was referred to Amy from a close friend who knows skin and knows me...I enjoy a facial or two every now and again, but am not regimented or as vigilant with my skin as I should be. So going to an esthetician that I am not very well acquainted with can be intimidating. Not so with Amy. It's incredibly rare that you can feel someone's love of their craft through their hands, but that's the kind of magic I felt when I was under her care. She took the time to assess my skin problems (overall dryness and congestion on my nose) and was very thorough answering all my questions. Sometimes you may not feel comfortable asking questions when someone uses terms like dermis and dermaplaning, but she explained everything in laymen's terms, without making me feel uncomfortable or uneducated.Then she went to work. I believe I got a lactic peel + facial. It was hard to concentrate I was so relaxed. I'm sure there were cleansers, exfoliates, chemical peels, salicylic acid on the nose, virtually painless extractions, and moisturizers but I won't pretend to know what they were. My favorite part was the massage on my scalp and temples. Also, to note, when I was finished and dared to take a gander in the mirror, I didn't even recognize my skin. I mean, I knew it was my skin but it was so soft and dewy. I didn't even want to touch it for fear or marring it with my fingers. The texture was the kicker, and I felt as if my skin was taking a long awaited sigh. Amy is a master of her craft, incredibly professional, and an absolute gem. Thanks!

7.description: Amy stepped in when my favorite waxing place mysteriously closed and didn't inform any of the customers. I wanted to keep my business in the 'hood and happily found Amy based on Yelp reviews. I am big into customer loyalty, but between moving and unexpected closings I've had to bounce around a bit in a waxing Army-brat style. Upon even scheduling my appointment with Amy, she sounded so enthusiastic and excited to introduce me to A+. As an added bonus, she texts so there seems to be no need to worry about stepping out of the office to make calls for unwanted hair. I can text next to my coworkers and no one has a clue! Once it was time for the big day, I made my way to her private shop at 1500 N. Wells. Amy is extremely inviting and professional, but she crosses into someone who feels like an old friend almost immediately. Her little room is super cozy, Brazilian music appropriately plays overhead, and the place smells amazing. I've never seen another aesthetician work with the ferocity that she does either. She is a machine and her system is full-proof. It was some of the fastest, most efficient service I've ever received. Hard wax and soft wax are used and before you know it, you're done. First time customers get 20% off too! A+!

8.description: I met Amy awhile ago and feel she gives the best facial in town. I felt like I found a gem, she is kind, nurturing and very empathetic. She is very skilled in her profession. I feel extremely confident with whatever she suggests with my skin. I would encourage everyone to try her services.

30.description: I am a huge fan of Amy Rojek and A+ Skin Care.  I visit Amy for my waxing needs and she is fantastic.  While waxing is not my favorite pastime, Amy's technique makes the process quick and as painless as possible.  She's patient with nervous nellys like myself, and is super friendly.  Oh, and she's very thorough... she's not done with you until she's satisfied her work is as perfect as can be.I've recommended her to all my girlfriends and they all love her as much as I do.

3.description: Although I appreciated Amy's attention to detail during extractions, I never felt quite comfortable there based on several conflicting observations:- She is ultra-friendly on the phone, but at times it's difficult to end the conversation, for example, when at work or driving. A couple of times I almost had to hang up because I felt my verbal cues were being ignored. So she seems to take a great interest in customized treatment, but when I made my second appointment, I said, "I'd like exactly the treatment you did last time - it was perfect!" Her response: "Well, I have a lot of clients so you'll have to tell me what you got." Gee, I don't know - I showed up, she took a look at my skin, and then went through about 7 - 8 steps. I don't know what the name was and the treatments are NOT listed on her site.- On my second visit, I was about 15 minutes early. While the salon clients were offered hot tea, I was brushed over since I was an Amy client. Amy popped out and sort of scolded me for being early - it was so awkward I could only assume she was joking, but then when she was 25 mins late (making that 40 mins of waiting for me), there was no apology. Then, during the facials, I just got wierded out. There was a funny energy coming from her that did not allow me to relax. I knew she would do a great job, but I just wanted it to be over with and get out - both times. My skin did not feel pampered, per se - she is all results, and the results are good. The woman is a perfectionist when it comes to the complexion. She's also efficient once she starts on you.So if you have no intuition and are easygoing about customer service, you might end up loving your facial, but to me, a sense of welcome and a sense of peace in such a place is important. I prefer a place, like Elina Organics with Nadia, where I get perfect, glowing skin and a sense of tranquility - an escape from stress.One more tip - there is no transparency into the pricing since treatments are not listed online, which made me a bit uneasy.

14.description: I am convinced that Amy is the saint of skin. This woman has a halo floating over head. I've been dealing with hormonal/cystic acne on and off for about 5 years, and its been nothing short of awful for 5 months up until a few weeks ago. I've been through the ringer with dermatologists putting me on topical after topical treatment that never yielded any permanent results and only made my already sensitive and fair skin more sensitive and red and peely. Finding the right treatment has been a frustrating battle, and the only regret that I have is not having gone to Amy sooner. I could go on and on about how much Amy has improved my skin (and life, pretty much) in only one phone call and two visits. Her knowledge of her profession is clear, and she not only makes the appointments personal to your specific needs, but she takes the time to listen, carefully examine, and explain everything. She is incredibly thorough and ACTUALLY CARES about the welfare of your skin, whatever the issue may be. She's also understanding of those on a budget and doesn't try to push every product. She only recommended that I buy products really worth investing money in and suggested a number of at-home all-natural remedies for all other issues. Basically, I'm recommending anybody that I talk to that mentions a skin issue to her. Since leaving her office, my skin has only gotten clearer and clearer and easier to manage (and look at, hello!). GO TO AMY. NOW.

3.description: I am amazed that anyone recommends this store. About an hour into my wait, the person in front of me left, saying loudly that she had been waiting for 90 minutes. At that point, I should have left. I am certain that she would have not rated this store very highly either.When I arrived, a guy at the door with an iPad took my name and I was placed on a list that was clearly visible on a monitor. All I needed was to add a line on my family plan for an existing device, basically a SIM card. He indicated that should be easy. So far so good. I'm OK with waiting as long as I know where I am in line.I then watched as my name crawled slowly from its fourth place position upwards, wondering why with 5 workers in the store, only 2 were involved with customers. About 70 minutes into my wait, a guy walked in with problems with his phone, and a manager, Melissa, immediately sprang into action without signing him in to troubleshoot his phone. Another customer appeared at the door, and another worker starting assisting him without an appointment or being placed on the waiting list. At that point I left.I called AT&T and explained that I've been a customer for 35 years, because the customer service is so good, but that my experience at 1234 N Sedgwick was really bad. I got a very nice customer service representative who explained that there's no way that they can improve the customer service inside a store. 10 points for honesty. So basically, AT&T is a large enough company to absorb poorly performing locations, which this one clearly is. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. No doubt, the workers at that site will be relieved. In fact, you may want to switch carriers as I am now seriously considering.

1.description: Nice people working here, but I've been here an hour and there were two people in front of me when I checked in. I'm still waiting.   This is brutal, inefficient and pathetic. There has to be a way of servicing customers more efficiently. Every time someone comes in with a "quick question" they are infringing on and wasting my time and the others who ate waiting.  People should check themselves in or take a number or something but not interrupt the service reps causing delay in them servicing waiting customers.  One guy has been with a service rep for over an hour.  That's absurd when people are patiently waiting.  The result of not being able to service me in a reasonable amount of time is lost business.  I will obtain my phone elsewhere.

2.description: Worst customer service ever. My friend needed her iPhone activated, and 1 consultant told her he basically couldn't help her because the store closes at 8 (it was 7:35 at the time). Told her they had 2 customers and didn't know if they get to her. And that she could activate her phone at home. Basically, he told her to use the phone in AT&T to call cust serv. neither consultant actually provided her any service.Then another man walked in and sat down, and they asked him how they could help him @ 7:55. They didn't respond to him as dismissively as they did her. Then after she successfully acted as her own consultant and registered the phone, we walked out. Typically the employees say "Hello can I help you or how are you doing today" as well as when customers leave "Have a good day/night". They said nothing to us when we came in or left out. Altogether, very rude experience. Would not recommend any to come here.Happened 6/3/15 7:35pm

9.description: This review is specifically for Eric, who I've now worked with 3 times over the last few months.The first time was right after a particularly horrible day dealing with both AT&T on the phone, and the hipster jerks at the Apple Store.  I'll spare you the details, but essentially my piece o' crap Nokia had broken, and AT&T wouldn't bump up my upgrade (by 5 weeks) so I could get an iPhone, nor would they send me any sort of temporary replacement phone. I stumbled into the AT&T store, at my wit's end and ready to just buy a Blackberry. After explaining my tale of woe, Eric went into the back room and re-emerged with an even crappier version of my crappy Nokia, just to get me through the next month until my upgrade would allow me to get the iPhone.  It wasn't as good as getting a brand new phone on the spot, but it did keep me from settling rather than get the phone I really wanted.5 weeks later, I went back to the store to return the Nokia to Eric and get my iPhone. He seemed a little surprised that I actually came back, but he was really nice so I wanted to make sure he got the commission. Since obviously the Apple Store droids don't care about such things, I wanted the money to go to someone who had at least extended some professional courtesy to me.  I left with my shiny new iPhone in it's pretty pink case, a happy girl.The third visit was just this past weekend. The fiance was due for his upgrade, and really needed it as he has been using the junky free phone for the last 2 years. We wound up with Eric again, and he helped the fiance pick out a phone that was a nice upgrade but not too flashy. Now the fiance has a new toy, and I can actually hear him when I call.What I really liked about Eric is despite the fact that he is, in fact, a salesman, he wasn't pushy at all. That first day I was ready to plunk down $200 for a fancy Blackberry, but he convinced me to wait for the iPhone, since that's what I really wanted. He didn't try to sell the fiance on a fancy pants phone, he was ready to sell him one for $70 (he wound up going for one around $100). I'm sure he works on commission, but he doesn't try to sell you something you don't need. And as I am a total sucker who can be talked in to just about anything, I appreciate that.

10.description: I love my iPhone.  If I could marry it in a civil ceremony downtown, I would.That said, I would love it more if, when in my apartment, my texts were actually sent when I sent them, and received when they actually arrived.  I would also love it more if it didn't take a half-dozen tries to make an outgoing call.How AT&T can have such appalling coverage in Chicago--I know, I know; it is a quaint, rural community--is beyond me.Unless you have an iPhone or you don't want your cell phone provider to actually, you know, provide cell phone service... stay far, far away from this AT&T location and all others.

4.description: Upon entering the store, there were two consultants, each with a customer. Someone else was waiting, but the attendant scheduling customers said that he had been taken care of. I was told I was next. When a consultant became available, they met with the other person who was waiting. Then another person came in the store and was talking directly to the consultant about a concern. The consultant proceeded to tell him "as soon as I'm done here I will take care of you." I chose not to wait and will likely go to a different AT&T store. Felt disgruntled that the wait was not properly communicated.

6.description: Came in expecting the worst, came out experiencing the best. Unlike everyone else in the world, I was actually switching from Verizon TO AT&T and getting an iphone (goodbye flip phone!). My situation was a bit unique because I also have a blackberry for work, so I was looking at combining both devices into the iphone. Worried that I would have to jump through hoops, I came ready for battle.But Brandon was fabulous. On a Sunday afternoon, I walked in, and right away was greeted--no wait. I explained what I needed, and he got to work. Even better, he recommended the lowest minute plan to save me money (because no one needs that many minutes now with unlimited mobile to mobile). Sales people who SAVE you money? Shut the front door! He recommended the best case, put on the screen protectors, transferred numbers, etc etc etc. And I was in and out within 45 minutes. Wow. A *teeny-tiny* ding, and solely because I'm a lawyer, but you sign the contract on a little screen that doesn't REALLY allow you to read it. But then again, I'm part of the 0.0001% of the population who actually reads those things. So far, I'm impressed. Hopefully I don't need to go back in for any problems, but if I do, I hope the great customer service continues. Also--free parking in the massive Dominicks lot. Always a plus.

12.description: and to top it off, the next day the girl at the loop loation was able to wrap up the transfer in about 5 minutes.  seriously this near north location needs to just go away

5.description: Do not go to this store unless you want someone to try to con you into things you do not want. I went in to upgrade my iPhone using the AT&T next plan and specifically said I only want the phone. A man named Javiann first tried getting me to sign up for some ridiculous plan. I told him that my friend was in the day before and only had to pay the taxes on the phone. After he got me the phone he then told me it would be 150+ dollars because it is a bundled plan with screen protectors and a phone case. I had to then ask him a third time what it would be for just the phone. I finally found out it was 69 dollars. You mean to tell me a screen protector and phone case is another 80 dollars? The problem I had was that he was trying to scam me by saying I had to get this bundled plan with the case and screen protectors. After that,  I then told him that I did not want the AT&T protection plan. He said it HAD to go on and I had 48 hours to go online and decline it myself. Another scam. Luckily I remembered to delete it from my package. After I finally got what I needed he then proceeded to look at my address on my account to start finding out what cable I used, how many TVs I had and how many roommates I had.  None of his business. If I wanted cable services through AT&T I would ask. I repeatedly told him that I was just interested in the phone. This place will try to sell you and scam you any way they can.The best part about this is when I went to look at the google reviews for this exact location, I found that Javiann wrote the store a glowing review. He works there! I am in sales myself and realize that you have to hit a quota, but scamming people and trying to be sneaky is not the way to do it.Stay far away from this place.

13.description: Well, I got a fancy iphone after dropping my old Sprint Treo in a beautiful mountain stream.I went to the AT&T store figuring I would get the hard sell and the bully treatment.  Nothing could be further from the truth.  I talked with a guy named Terrence.  He broke down the plans for me, and had a very real and accurate assessment after asking me a few questions of just what plan I should go for.Not only that, but Terrence told me exactly what I needed to do to "port" or transfer my existing cell phone number to my AT&T service.  15 minutes after I walked in the store, I was calling and receiving calls, all using my preexisting cell phone number.Terrence can't take credit for the iphone, which is something of a marvel itself, but he stands out as the most stand-up, straightforward and HELPFUL person I've ever dealt with in the cell phone biz.Nice work!  Now can you do something about AT&T's crappy text message plans?

11.description: Talk about PUSHY. What's that? You ride a bicycle and don't own a car? Well you should buy a car charger anyway! Give me a break, guys. I straight up said I wasn't going to buy anything that day and they still come at me ringing up phones and accessories as I'm saying no. Seeeee yaaaaaa.

8.description: I am certainly not a fan of aging myself but I have to disclose that I have been a moderately happy Spring customer for nearly 15 years. How dreadfully grownup am I?I did enjoy some stress levels due to being on the fence about switching over to the slightly annoying IPhone cult. I nearly nixed the idea completely when I was on the Apple website. As I was near the completion of purchasing my very own 4G version on-line, a pop-up message informed me that my current phone number may not be available to transfer over to AT+T due to it being out of the network. What exactly does that mean? After a failed trip to an AT+T location in Nashville, which included waiting for nearly 90 minutes for a consultation to no avail, we thought that we give it another go while we were on business in Chicago. My group was greeted immediately by an associate named Mark T. who outlined the benefits of the IPhone, offered advice on the various plans that are available, and explained the whole process of "breaking up" with Sprint. I felt comfortable throughout the whole process and felt as if he was offering guidance that truly benefits me and not just making a sales quota. I was delighted to find out that he would actually be able to transfer over all of my phone numbers from my Blackberry to my new Igadget.So.I signed the dotted line and officially drank the IPhone and AT+T Kool-Aid.Let's hope that I don't have to fly all the way out to Chicago to see Mark for good customer service, AT+T?

0.description: Best service I have ever experienced at a cell phone store. My rep, Justin, helped me port over from T-Mobile. I didn't get any reception in certain areas and this caused issues with my website I own when I'm running social media aspects of it. We had ported over two lines, purchased two gear s2 with number sync, and U-Verse. Justin followed up and made sure everything went ok for my install. Great customer service and friendly employees at this location. Short wait time. Enjoyed my time with my representative. :)

7.description: Big fan of this location. Quickest, friendliest and this is the most honest AT&T in the city. I went in for the new iPhone today and Will introduced himself right away.  Within fifteen minutes I had my new iPhone 5S in GOLD ordered.  He was super friendly and a pleasure to work with.  I highly recommend Will when you visit:)

28.description: Delicious Decaf coffee. I assume the regular is too. Food is great. Like the organic options.

1.description: Nah, fam.I didn't think the food was "all that," though my friends liked theirs.The space is trying so hard to be rustic and quirky, but the ceilings are too high and the decorations too sparse for it to look anything other than austere and unwelcoming. Our server was nice but, poor guy, he seemed to be the only one for the whole restaurant, so service was interminably slow. Entrees run $10+ but are often $13-14 for food that is surely of good quality, but perhaps not enough to justify such a price point. If that doesn't convince you, my pomegranate-flavored seltzer was...$4.50. Like, why? Why?But also, why?This place is lame and you should check out other cafes that might be highbrow, but perhaps are slightly less exploitative of the ol' pocketbook.

9.description: Definitely make Le Pain Quotidien a stop if you are in Old Town! The food is delicious and feels very healthy/natural. Servers are very friendly and attentive. LPQ is going to be my new spot!

29.description: Great space both indoor and outdoor. Could picture spending winter mornings at the large wooden tables in the sun drenched windows. Good selection of quality breads and pastries. I'll be back to try the coconut chia pudding and avocado toast. Service was slow. Possibly still working out the kinks.

23.description: $4.00 for a chocolate croissant?  $16.75 for a cobb salad?  Those prices would be high for the independently owned, non-chain, sit-down restaurants in the area.  But for a place with a slightly more stuffy look/feel of a Panera Bread?  No thanks. Disappointed that this is what moved into the old Boston Market space.

5.description: I probably pick up breakfast 3-4 times a week. I was mostly visiting Starbucks, however when Le Pain Quotidien opened up around the corner, my habits changed. Sometimes I eat there, sometimes I take home, but nonetheless, the food, ambiance and staff are second to none! I love the feeling of sitting in the morning, with my mini pot of coffee, listing to goregous classic music, reading my paper. I feel like I've been transcended into old Paris. I must say, while, I've tried the eggs, and the kale salad, it's the avacado toast that keeps me coming back, over, and over and over again. Crunchy toasted bread with a smear of avacado yumminess. It's the citrus cumin salt, the lime juice and the perfect avacados that make this simple breakfast, simply perfect. Go. Go now!

31.description: I know this place just opened but man is the service bad. They have a lot of kinks to work out. They took over 15 minutes to give us water and coffee and we only got it because I got up from the table to find the server. The server kept giving us excuses saying that "there are so many tickets". Just say sorry and don't make excuses. Especially when you don't need a ticket to grab one of the prefilled waters that are just sitting at the server station in water bottles. Food took awhile but it's their first week so they are still figuring out the kitchen. Server brought us a croissant because we had to wait which was nice. Food was very good- I had the smoked salmon platter. Will give it another try in a couple months after they fix the service issues.

25.description: Really fresh ingredients and dishes. You can always find something healthy here... As long as you stay away from the delicious looking bakery. The chairs are a bit uncomfortable...

12.description: I returned here twice since my last review.  Both times, service was generally good.  It seems like they may have ironed out the kinks with their new opening.

21.description: This location tries really hard not to seem like a global chain and instead offers the potential of a charming brunch location. However, the inexperience, price and serving size at Le Pain Quotidiene won't have me coming back.My bf ordered the belgian waffle and I ordered the shrimp, avocado and corn arugula salad off their seasonal menu. Apparently, the waitress thought I said shrimp open-faced toast and brought out the wrong order. After a short wait, my salad arrived and it was tasty! Nothing exceptional (which I was hoping for with the price), but thankfully the salad wasn't overdressed as most places tend to do. My boyfriend's waffle was comically miniature, but I guess that's why they have the $6 price tag on this menu item. My salad on the other hand was around $15... I personally could make this salad for less.When the bill was brought out, we were charged for the shrimp toast AND the shrimp salad. Not sure, how easily this mishap could have happened, but I felt like this error was a bit of an amateur mistake.All in all, food is good, but the price is quite steep for a chain that lacks the appeal of other brunch hot spots in Chicago and around the area in Old Town.

16.description: I usually prefer steak and potatoes, but once in a while I like to try something new.  I decided to try the quinoa taboule salad since I do like quinoa.  Must say this salad was absolutely delicious.  As a matter of fact, as I sit here digesting it, i am STILL enjoying it.  I feel like I can have a solid night of drinking and not feel bad about it because I ate this salad.  I am actually pondering the idea of grabbing one to go tomorrow before heading to the airport to go home.Also, the white chocolate spread was outstanding.  Put some of that stuff on the fresh made bread and you'll be satisfied.

17.description: I know this place just opened but man is the service bad. They have a lot of kinks to work out. They took over 15 minutes to give us water and coffee and we only got it because I got up from the table to find the server. The server kept giving us excuses saying that "there are so many tickets". Just say sorry and don't make excuses. Especially when you don't need a ticket to grab one of the prefilled waters that are just sitting at the server station in water bottles. Food took awhile but it's their first week so they are still figuring out the kitchen. Server brought us a croissant because we had to wait which was nice. Food was very good- I had the smoked salmon platter. Will give it another try in a couple months after they fix the service issues.

10.description: I wanted to like this place. It's very cute and cozy inside. There are plenty of tables. Not a ton to plug a computer in, but still a cozy spot. I ordered tea and did some work. Went back up to get a cup of soup and was told it would be 10.99. For a cup of soup. I was almost offended. How do you charge eleven bucks for a cup of soup. I said no and went to Potbellys and got a bowl of soup for 4.50. I really did want to like this place and come back for lunch, but it's a rip off. No thanks.

11.description: Gave this place a shot for lunch. Walked in and ordered at the counter (because I thought that was what I was supposed to do). I ordered the Bakers Lunch (3 bean chili, toast, kale salad). Cost me $18 (no drink)! So I sat down by the window and the woman who took my order brought the food out to me in a to-go bag. Ok, didn't realize I was taking it to go, but no problem, I thought I'd just eat at the table out of the bag. She then told me I had to move to a different section because i was sitting in the server section (the to-go section was in the front). For $18 I should have been able to sit in the kitchen if I wanted to, considering the portion and the contents of my meal. I left with my food. When I got back to the office, I opened my salad and it was bone dry, no dressing. I was supposed to grab the dressing from the front I guess. Long story short, I paid $18 for a small portion of dry greens, HALF FILLED cup of chili, and a piece of toast (I'm still hungry)...and I was asked to move to another table (restaurant was NOT busy).Very poor customer service experience with an astronomically overpriced meal.

26.description: Want a $50 breakfast with mediocre food, not including alcohol? Come here!But the food and prices aren't even the worst part. As noted in previous reviews, the service is beyond awful. We sat outside on the patio, which as an aside is very nice. After we received our food, our server never came to check on us. I received bread but no butter or anything to spread on it. After waiting 15 minutes I finally got up and went inside to get him myself. Additionally, I had finished my ($3.60) iced tea shortly after I sat down on this hot day. I really would have loved a refill, which I learned after the server finally came, that they were free. Of course, after asking for said refill, it took 10 minutes to get. If you want good French breakfast, I recommend spending your money across the street at la fournette. Better value, better food, better service.

27.description: I usually prefer steak and potatoes, but once in a while I like to try something new.  I decided to try the quinoa taboule salad since I do like quinoa.  Must say this salad was absolutely delicious.  As a matter of fact, as I sit here digesting it, i am STILL enjoying it.  I feel like I can have a solid night of drinking and not feel bad about it because I ate this salad.  I am actually pondering the idea of grabbing one to go tomorrow before heading to the airport to go home.Also, the white chocolate spread was outstanding.  Put some of that stuff on the fresh made bread and you'll be satisfied.

0.description: I. Love. This. Place. Everything on the menu is an extraordinary experience. My favorites are the coffee drinks, smoked salmon breakfast and avocado toast.

20.description: The food was amazing here.  The bread was so fresh and the spreads that come with it are delicious!  We came at brunch time and there was a slight wait but nothing our of the ordinary in Old Town.  The rest of the food was so fresh and good, I highly recommend it.  I also had the cold brew coffee and it was delicious.

19.description: Great space both indoor and outdoor. Could picture spending winter mornings at the large wooden tables in the sun drenched windows. Good selection of quality breads and pastries. I'll be back to try the coconut chia pudding and avocado toast. Service was slow. Possibly still working out the kinks.

2.description: This place is pretty mediocre. I want to love Le Pain Quotidien, but I feel like they've become very generic. I came to this location for a meeting at about 6PM, and they had a "seat yourself" setting going on. A few guests, but plenty of tables available. I ordered a tea, as well as a split pea soup. My main issue is that the tea served was very weak, and the soup was luke warm at best (definitely re-heated). Our service was spotty and quite slow -- after ordering tea it was about 15 minutes to receive, and same with the soup. My bill came out to $13 for the two items, which seemed like a pretty bad deal considering each item was sub par.I like the atmosphere here, its a shame the food/service doesn't match up.

18.description: Hoping for the quick demise of this pretentious shell of a concept that recently invaded Lincoln Park.We first encountered this chain in Irvine, CA, where ill-conceived but expensive cafes like this are popular with the rich, clueless crowd. It is a disaster: poor, overpriced menu choices of marginal quality. Ridiculously large plates on small tables (as if inconvenience defines a "style"). Coffee served in miso soup bowls with no handles (not kidding). Uncomfortable chairs. Noisy and stuffy. WiFi is the slowest I've seen in a while. The list goes on and on... If you are curious, try it once and then help spread the word to avoid this unwelcome concept on Wells. They should be confined to upscale malls where dropping $50 for nothing is "part of the scene."

13.description: Definitely check this place out for breakfast. The avocado toast was amazing-I added a side of prosciutto which rounded it out quite nicely. The ambiance is open, bright and modern. Our service was slightly slow however that simply made it feel more like we were in France.

4.description: This location tries really hard not to seem like a global chain and instead offers the potential of a charming brunch location. However, the inexperience, price and serving size at Le Pain Quotidiene won't have me coming back.My bf ordered the belgian waffle and I ordered the shrimp, avocado and corn arugula salad off their seasonal menu. Apparently, the waitress thought I said shrimp open-faced toast and brought out the wrong order. After a short wait, my salad arrived and it was tasty! Nothing exceptional (which I was hoping for with the price), but thankfully the salad wasn't overdressed as most places tend to do. My boyfriend's waffle was comically miniature, but I guess that's why they have the $6 price tag on this menu item. My salad on the other hand was around $15... I personally could make this salad for less.When the bill was brought out, we were charged for the shrimp toast AND the shrimp salad. Not sure, how easily this mishap could have happened, but I felt like this error was a bit of an amateur mistake.All in all, food is good, but the price is quite steep for a chain that lacks the appeal of other brunch hot spots in Chicago and around the area in Old Town.

24.description: Enjoyed breakfast at his new hotspot. Service was surprisingly attentive and fast. I enjoyed the vanilla bean latte which was smooth and creamy (not as bitter as SB). Entrees were the French ham and Gruyere cheese omelette and the tomato and goat cheese frittata.  Both were served with fresh greens as a side.  Definitely a great choice in this area!   Tons of outdoor space which is welcomed during the busy summer months.  Thank you Lucille!!  Amazing service!!

6.description: This is the second Chicago Le Pain I've been to where service is terrible. The food is always solid, hence the 3 stars. Our server was not knowledgable about the menu, and he was SUPER awkward and seemed uncomfortably overwhelmed in a near empty restaurant. I cannot even imagine what this place is like during a Sunday brunch rush, and I'll probably never find out.Note to corporate - please, please hire some competent staff to serve your delicious food!!

22.description: The price of menu items combined with the excruciatingly slow and forgetful service by Clayton was enough to turn me off of this new Old Town location. (Gave 2 stars because their version of Nutella was delicious!)I won't return to Le-whatever because there are hundreds of other welcoming and price friendly brunch locations in the area.

15.description: Yes they really need to work on their service. The fact that they're new could be an excuse, but not acceptable from what is now a worldwide franchise chain. They could have hired at least an experienced, hands-on supervisor. They seem to be all over the place - like, they bring the fork but they forget the knife... tsk, tsk, tsk.Also, they're overpriced. I presume it's because everything is 100% organic? mmmmmm... small portions. Food is OK. Coffee is good. Food quality and ambiance bring the third star.I stick to La Fournette across the street for now.

7.description: The price of menu items combined with the excruciatingly slow and forgetful service by Clayton was enough to turn me off of this new Old Town location. (Gave 2 stars because their version of Nutella was delicious!)I won't return to Le-whatever because there are hundreds of other welcoming and price friendly brunch locations in the area.

8.description: Right next to the Talbott, this little bakery/ eatery does does pretty well. Great selection of omelets and breakfast dishes. Solid service and prices. Comfortable outdoor seating.

30.description: Yes they really need to work on their service. The fact that they're new could be an excuse, but not acceptable from what is now a worldwide franchise chain. They could have hired at least an experienced, hands-on supervisor. They seem to be all over the place - like, they bring the fork but they forget the knife... tsk, tsk, tsk.Also, they're overpriced. I presume it's because everything is 100% organic? mmmmmm... small portions. Food is OK. Coffee is good. Food quality and ambiance bring the third star.I stick to La Fournette across the street for now.

3.description: Working in the area on a Saturday I decided I would try this place for breakfast. Not at all what I had expected. I am a traditional kinda breakfast person...bacon and eggs, pancakes, waffles, etc. so needless to say I was a bit disappointed by the selection. The waitress I had simple had no concept of coffee refills. Oh well, at least I can say I tried it.

14.description: Delicious Decaf coffee. I assume the regular is too. Food is great. Like the organic options.

58.description: The highlights include hummus and baba ganoush (both contain just the right mix of spics without having one overpower others), tabouleh (salad-like and not soggy like at many other joints). The entrees don't stand out as much, but most people will like the generous portions. If you like desserts, their kenafeh is da bomb.
