$13.00.  The price point is a little pricey but tolerable if the food was excellent.  Unfortunately, I cannot give a high score for either entree.  The Wes Country dinner had tastey cauliflower mash but the flax seed crusted chicken breast had been over cooked and was rubbery and hard to cut and eat.  The Ninja Tenderloin was supposed to contain a piece of lean tenderloin with a bed of fresh vegetables (red onions, carrots, mushrooms and spinach) but the tenderloin was overcooked, very difficult to cut and chew and only contained carrots and a small amount of spinach.  Granted, I only tried 2 of 13 dinner entrees and while I wasn't pleased, I might give them one last chance and try a different entree.I thought the food would be fresh in view of the kitchen being on the premises but noticed that the items I bought had almost reached their expiration date.  If you decide to try this store, make sure you take the products in the back of the display case which are the freshest.I believe if My Fit Foods wants to be successful in the Chicago market, it is going to have to try harder and improve quality control.  An attractive store with eye candy staff only goes so far.  If the food is not of good quality and is priced too high, then we know what the fate of this chain will be.  I try to eat healthy foods every day which takes some effort, work out 4 days a week and thought this chain might make it easier for me but on first blush they have failed.  Good effort but poorly executed.  Stores such as My Fit Foods are needed and I wish them success but hope they take customer comments into consideration and improve their product but keep their staff :)

17.description: I'd like to start by saying I prep all my own food for 2 people 5-6 days out of the week.  I even have those little black containers.  I never leave my house without a healthy meal with me. Every once in a while though you just want a break from the prep and My Fit Foods is perfect for that.  If you are busy and on the go, My Fit Foods has you covered. It is so nice to walk in there and just line up your meals for the week. With my bulk prep I usually do, it leaves me eating the same thing for days. I really liked the variety, the flavor, portions and the way they reheated. I will be using My Fit Foods again very soon. The staff was very helpful too.

10.description: This place is awesome. I love junk food but am quickly being won over to eating right. Being health-conscious can be challenging when we are inundated with junk. My Fit Foods is neat because it combines healthy with convenient. The person running the counter is a nutritionist which is dope. I've never spoken to a nutritionist at a restaurant before. She helped my friend and me pick out dinners, cooked it, brought it to us, and was really friendly but not pushy at all.Portion sizes look tiny for the price. Then, you realize us Americans gorge ourselves and smaller portions are just better. The point of eating isn't to feel like the Michelin Man afterwards. The price seemed like too much, $10. Then you realize you are buying the equivalent of premium fuel for YOUR BODY so then $10 doesn't sound so bad.I had the ground turkey with rice and asparagus. Seasoned just right! I grabbed a Sriracha packet but didn't even need it. Standing alone, it was very good!More importantly, walking out, you feel rejuvenated from having eaten. This is something that just won't happen walking out of McDonald's where I could easily spend the same amount of money and want to take a nap after eating processed who-knows-what.Definitely check this place out if you care about your body and what you feed it.Only detraction is parking which generally sucks everywhere in Chicago.

11.description: I started the 21 day challenge and I feel GREAT!  Rachel designed a gluten-free meal plan for me that is so delicious.  I am losing weight and am never hungry, something I have never experienced in the past.  I basically get to eat delicious food all day, the meals are fresh and there is tons of variety.  Very economical for the variety of foods you get to eat and the quality of the foods.  I love it and plan to continue to work with Rachel much past the 21 days.  Thank you, Denise

26.description: I decided to do the 21-day challenge (I am in day 17 as of today).  I met with a nutritionist who set me up with a meal plan that accommodated my life and schedule.  Food pick-ups were scheduled for Sundays and Wednesdays.  The first food pick-up raised the first red flag.  Two of the meals were substituted because they were unavailable.  The second red flag was raised when I got home and noticed that one of the snacks "Hummus Bowl" included spoiled cucumber wedges.  When I went to pick up food the following Wednesday I showed the staff a picture and he replaced that particular meal.  However, the food that was brought home from this pick-up had mold growing on the cheese included in the "Picnic Time" snack.  When I went back the following Sunday and reported this they apologetically explained they had some problems with expiration dates and discounted the order I was to pick-up.The following Wednesday, I arrived at the store shortly after noon and was told to come back later in the day because their was an lids supply issue; hence my food was not ready.  When I explained I was unable to come back later in the day the nutritionist claimed she told me pick-up was after 5PM; yet I explained before starting the program all my pick-ups would be between 11 AM and 2 PM, which did not seem to be a problem.  I picked up food during this window up until this point.  Nowhere on the website or in the materials does it state food is ready after 5 PM.  Because I was unable to comeback I veered off the 21-day Challenge because I had no food available at home (because of the challenge).  I contacted the My Fit Foods corporate offices in Texas and talked with George who profusely apologized and compensated my next two pick-ups.  I asked that my pick-ups be changed from the Lakeview Store to the Old Town store thinking since food is prepared at Old Town it would be fresh and not transported across town. Unfortunately, I ran into the same issue with mold on food.  This time my "Picnic Time" snack received from the Old Town store had mold growing on the grapes.  One of my dinners "Butternut Porkloin" was missing the pork.  I took pictures of both of these meals/snacks and emailed the manager and George from corporate - both apologized and said they would double check procedures to ensure things of this nature do not occur again.Simply stated - the 21-day Challenge is an enormous personal and financial commitment to health and wellness.  To  not have food prepared on-time or to dole out spoiled or food with mold on it is unacceptable.  I get that these foods are perishable; yet my experience has been persistent and shows there is a lack of checks and balances on food expiration and their is a broken link in their supply chain.  Furthermore, these persistent issues are disheartening and distract from the goal of the program - to promote healthy eating habits and fitness goals.  What I do appreciate is the responsiveness of the management and corporate offices; however, one should not have to resort to these means of communication if My Fit Foods delivered on what they promise.Given my experience with the 21-day Challenge I STRONGLY DO NOT recommend the program.  I caution one to think twice before making such a financial and personal commitment.

27.description: Love the concept.  Love the food.  Love the convenience.  Have to agree with other posters that the aggressive faux-friendliness is really irritating and off-putting.  I almost hate walking in because I know they will attack me with fake cheeriness and invasive personal questions as soon as I step in.  Personally, I think it's really weird when a perfect stranger asks you what your plans are for the night.  I just want to shop on my own in peace!

35.description: This is the working girls dream! While I love to cook I get tired of eating the same thing for days. After a long day at work the last thing I want to do is be in the kitchen but I also don't like the idea of eating out all the time. I love that I can come home post work and gym and have all ready prepared meals waiting for me in the refrigerator and just takes a short amount of microwaving to prepare.

0.description: I initially felt a little ashamed coming here. I know how to cook healthy foods! But with the holidays coming, I wanted to give myself a break on my diligent Sunday food prepping. I also wanted to make sure I am eating healthy at least most days of the week.I did a lot of reading before I came here and I liked what I saw-- My Fit Foods' philosophy is 40% protein, 40% carbs, 20% fat. It's amazing how a small portion can fill you up when it's packed with protein and good carbs. Sodium is pretty low too, but everything is nicely seasoned. Even with dressing (balsamic-- some of the best I've ever had), their mediterranean shrimp salad is 270 calories. And it's a really hearty salad!I work in the Loop, so at least from my vantage point, the prices are okay. I came here for healthy lunches and dinners. It's less expensive than restaurant food by my home and office, marginally more expensive than a home cooked meal with similar quality ingredients. Make sure to look for coupons; I found 20% off through the end of November.Couple things I wish for-- a location in the Loop and more salad offerings. Right now there are only two lunch salads available. My office is the size of a studio apartment, so we don't have a  microwave in here (that would get odorous really fast). I rely on cold foods at lunch. If there was a Loop location, I could warm up their delicious warm lunch offerings right there!

20.description: This is a good location - there is a parking lot and a loading zone right out front.I think they're still trying to figure out the correct numbers.  Either you go in and are attacked or you go in and wait while no one acknowledges you. Expensive to live the My Fit Foods life 24/7...but if you're stocking up on some lunches for work or grab a quick dinner- it's cheaper (and way healthier!) than dining out.  Is the food amazing- no...but it's not gross by any means.  Although they stick with the cayenne pepper in EVERYTHING to 'speed up the metabolism" mindset.I did do the 21 day challenge.  To read about that you can check out my review: myfitfoodsreview.blogspo…

19.description: This is a good location - there is a parking lot and a loading zone right out front.I think they're still trying to figure out the correct numbers.  Either you go in and are attacked or you go in and wait while no one acknowledges you. Expensive to live the My Fit Foods life 24/7...but if you're stocking up on some lunches for work or grab a quick dinner- it's cheaper (and way healthier!) than dining out.  Is the food amazing- no...but it's not gross by any means.  Although they stick with the cayenne pepper in EVERYTHING to 'speed up the metabolism" mindset.I did do the 21 day challenge.  To read about that you can check out my review: myfitfoodsreview.blogspo…

33.description: I wanted to update my previous My Fit Foods Review becauseI felt the need to send them some more glowing praise!I went back in on Tuesday.. took my Aunt Arlene in with me,wanted to show her why I loved this place so much!More things to Love here..Bradley, the Corporate Training Guy took us on a tour of thekitchen, food preparation areas, met some of the kitchen staff/cooks.You see.. they prepare all of their foods right here on premises, itis all being freshly made/prepared on a daily basis.There is absolutely nothing frozen or shipped into this store,Just pure quality!Okay.. so you may ask.. Just how good this food is.. Let metell you.. every single entrée I have brought home has been phenominal..And..this is all pre-portioned quality food, if you're thinking it's anythinglike Lean Cuisine or a Weight Watchers frozen meal you would be mistaken.Because this is all top of the line stuff!For the Record.. prices do vary depending on the portion size youare getting.. the recommended size for women is small and that's whatI have been getting and it's just perfect..But.. the difference here is that this is a lifestyle change and instead ofblowing money at McDonalds you could be getting healthier options here.And.. once again.. everything has tasted great!So.. Thanks to Bradley for the tour and for all your knowledge and help..And.. Thanks for the my My Fit Foods thermal bag to keep my food fresh/coldon the way home!Okay.. and yes.. I will be picking up my T-Shirt this weekend!I was so lucky to have found this place..A great concept and a class A operation!I couldn't be more impressed if I tried...P.S for anyone interested the Clark/Diversey store will be opening in 2 months..

2.description: I grabbed a salad here after getting a coupon for a free entree in the mail. Everything was fine except that I was waiting in the store for 2-3 minutes before anyone came out to ring me up. Also there was no dressing on the salad, probably because they are all about the nutrition facts and calorie counting.

34.description: The food is great-- healthy, portioned out, pretty affordable (for eating out), and very fresh. I am very impressed. What's terrible about this place is their over the top customer service and awkwardly designed shop. The workers swarm and attack you when you walk in. It's not even a joke, I may not return because it's really annoying and unnecessary. I know I sound like the grinch, but go there, and then let me know how awkward they are. There is no need to cling to the shoppers or stalk them while they look around. Concept is incredible, but let's not go over board with the friendliness and customer service when I really just want to run in, grab a few to-go meals, and leave.

32.description: My fiance and I just walked in to browse the food. However, the employee swarmed us immediately and pretty much pressured us to buy something even though we purely just wanted to browse. He was really nice, but just really over the top. It was nice of him to warm up our food too.My fiance got the Blazin Cajun Shrimp. He would give it a 4. He said it was really spicy and really good!Mine on the other hand, was not good at all. I got the Beef Fit Up and I would give it a 1. I really did not find any flavor in it and my fiance agreed it was very bland. I think the perfect comparison would have been airplane food. I was also starving afterwards. I just went home and had a Clif Bar, Fiber One Bar, and some candy. The portion of the meal was too small and too bland for me.I think the food was pretty overpriced too. Mine was $9.50 for a small which is ridiculous since it had no taste and my fiance's was $7.50 for a small. I know it's healthy food so it should be expensive, but it's microwaveable food and a tiny portion. Overall, because my fiance enjoyed his food, our final average rating is a 3.

18.description: This place is like a godsent! So many gluten free foods, more than you could ever imagine.I got two meals here. One was for dinner and one was for lunch. The portion sizes are great and the food tastes amazing.The 21 day plan is a great place to start if you need to get into a healthier lifestyle.

13.description: Wow they must have been reading their Yelp reviews because they put prices on the food now and they have little signs if something is spicy.  Also, the chicken doesn't have the texture of rubber anymore.  A lot of the food is still spicy, but at least you know now.  The prices are kind of high...and it would be nice to have more low-carb options...BUT it's much improved.

4.description: I really like the idea of this place.  It seems like they have a lot of healthful, prepackaged food options.  They make everything on site, and the meals look very delicious.  However, the main problem is that they don't offer any decent vegetarian options.  None of the salads or main courses are meat free.  The only vegetarian options that they have are snack and breakfast options.  Another problem is the price.  I didn't even realize it before I checked out, but I spent 4.50 on carrot and celery slices that came with about 1 ounce of almond butter.  That's crazy. If they had more vegetarian meal options I would be ok with spending a little extra money for a healthy, prepared meal.  But as of now, that isn't an option.

24.description: The convenience and healthiness of a mostly gluten-free diet has really made a difference in my life.  I lost 12LBS on the 21 day challenge and have kept most of the weight off.  I highly recommend this program.  To the reviews talking about problems, this is the exception, not the rule here and it's a part of real life.  The staff have always acted professionally and addressed ANY issues I have had.  I love this place!

6.description: Overall, I think its amazing to have a place like this around. I prefer to eat clean, whole foods but that can be hard to do consistently, especially for lunch. My Fit Foods solves that problem for me. The cost of a meal here is on par with or less than what I'd spend for lunch if I ate out somewhere with counter service but instead of getting mystery meat and hidden calories, you get a deliciously prepared, nourishing meal that you feel great about giving your body.I don't give it 5 stars because some of the food tastes like "health food" from the freezer.  A little bland, kind of funny textures on the veggies, etc. But for every meal that I've had that was "eh"  I've had 2 or 3 that were great, so it comes down to personal taste and preferences. Definitely give it a try!!  The portions may seem small, but I think they are a great reminder of what our bodies actually need versus what the food industry has taught us that we need. In reality, even the small portions leave me satisfied. I love stocking up with My Fit Foods meals for a week to kind of detox and reset my body when I feel myself eating out too much or falling into bad habits. Lastly, all the employees I've encountered are super friendly and helpful and not the least bit pushy. A great service!

22.description: This location on North Avenue just west of LaSalle in Chicago has been vacant for some time.  It is good to see a new business there.  As far as My Fit Foods goes, here are my impressions from my first visit:This is a chain that sells prepared entrees for breakfast, lunch and dinner for those who wish to watch their weight or eat healthy with various portion sizes available.  Each entree is further organized by small, medium and large sizes with different prices for each.  Nutritional information is on the bottom of each container.  Also, a nutritionist is available at the store.What brought me into the store was the gleaming colors and illuminated refrigerated cases that face North Avenue.  As some other reviewers have indicated, a sales person does approach you right away to explain the concept and answer any questions you may have but I did not initially view this as problemsome as I was curious to learn more about this concept.  The manager Preston, an attractive straight southern boy in very tight jeans and tight t-shirt is easy on the eyes and explained the concept to me and I decided to give it a try.  I can understand how people feel about being pressured by a sales person.  I am certain that Preston would back off if you told him you didn't need any assistance.I bought two small dinner entrees--Wes County dinner & Ninja Tenderloin which cost a total of almost $20 with tax...the large entrees would be from $11.50 - $13.00.  The price point is a little pricey but tolerable if the food was excellent.  Unfortunately, I cannot give a high score for either entree.  The Wes Country dinner had tastey cauliflower mash but the flax seed crusted chicken breast had been over cooked and was rubbery and hard to cut and eat.  The Ninja Tenderloin was supposed to contain a piece of lean tenderloin with a bed of fresh vegetables (red onions, carrots, mushrooms and spinach) but the tenderloin was overcooked, very difficult to cut and chew and only contained carrots and a small amount of spinach.  Granted, I only tried 2 of 13 dinner entrees and while I wasn't pleased, I might give them one last chance and try a different entree.I thought the food would be fresh in view of the kitchen being on the premises but noticed that the items I bought had almost reached their expiration date.  If you decide to try this store, make sure you take the products in the back of the display case which are the freshest.I believe if My Fit Foods wants to be successful in the Chicago market, it is going to have to try harder and improve quality control.  An attractive store with eye candy staff only goes so far.  If the food is not of good quality and is priced too high, then we know what the fate of this chain will be.  I try to eat healthy foods every day which takes some effort, work out 4 days a week and thought this chain might make it easier for me but on first blush they have failed.  Good effort but poorly executed.  Stores such as My Fit Foods are needed and I wish them success but hope they take customer comments into consideration and improve their product but keep their staff :)

15.description: The meals are great! They are fresh, there is a good variety, and the portions are perfect. I think that the Mexican meals are the best. The staff is helpful and doesn't bombard me with unsolicited sales pitches and advice, which makes for a pleasant shopping experience.

7.description: If you value your time and like to eat healthy this is the best place in Chicago.  I did research with other competitive services before going here and they were the only ones who understood the fundamentals to eating healthy. They go off the glycemic index and don't try to push any fad diets on you.  What they offer is a lifetyle of eating that is feasible and should work long term.The meals taste great and are much better reheated than any food you would bring home from a restaurant or make yourself.  Some meals are better than others but they have quite a large selection to choose from.Despite what some of the reviews on here say I would say they are priced very fair.  They are by no means cheap but if money is an issue you should be cooking for yourself.  It is still much more healthy than eating at a restaurant and also cheaper.They have a registered dietitian on staff that comes up with your meal plans and customizes it to your needs and preferences.  This alone adds quite a bit of value as if you wanted to hire someone to do this for you it would cost quite a bit.They also have excellent customer service.  I've had some mistakes made in the past on orders but they made it right every time.The only bad thing about this service is that they do not offer delivery.  Since they are the best service of their kind in town for now it's just something that I'm willing to deal with.

8.description: I stopped by when the store first opened on North Avenue.  The person that waited on me was extremely pushy.  As a result, I left the store.I'm in the middle of a kitchen remodel and looking for meal options.  Thought I'd give it another look.  Had a nice woman help me buy 3 meals.  Since then, I've returned multiple times.Wow...the food is excellent!  Breakfast omlet made with turkey chorizo, gumbo, herb roasted chicken, cast iron salmon are my favorites.I log my food intake on MyFitness Pal.  All of My Fit Foods are on their database and easy to log.  They  make it easy to eat well, control portions, and watch calories.

30.description: I find it disappointing that a place that prides itself on fit foods has almost no vegetarian items. Apart from yogurt and veggie sides there is practical nothing. If you read up on health issues you'll know that some of their claims are spurious- especially the liver cleanse supplements. No doubt it's better than any other fast food places but I wont be a fan until I can count on some vegetarian items. The sales folks can be a bit pushy even when i said I'm vegetarian. With that said, My Fit is certainly a welcome addition to Old Town and hope to see some menus changes.

3.description: Southwest Style Chicken Salad was good, but the dressing wasn't in the box so I didn't get any :-( Wish they would have reminded me when I checked out. We also bought Mix & Mash and Omega Me Crazy Salmon. I wasn't a fan of either, but my friend thought the salmon was ok. A little pricey for what you get.

14.description: When coming to My Fit Foods, you need to understand what you're getting into.  This is a way to improve your lifestyle, get you away from all the bad stuff we Americans have been gorging on, and make better decisions moving forward.I walked in late November and sat down w/ Patty (on-site nutritionist).  She was very helpful in going over the concept with me and talking about food in general.  I did the 21 day plan and loved it.  Was every meal the best tasting thing I've ever had?  No!  Absolutely not!  But most of them were pretty good!  Think about it, if healthy food tasted as good as the pork belly from Publican, Americans would all look like super models rather than Chris Farley.Will these be the best tasting foods you've ever tasted?  No, but for healthy, quick options that you feel better afterwards on - they are pretty good!Will there be times in the 21 day challenge when you feel hungry or want to go to Portillos?  Yes, deal with it :)Will this be the best you've felt health-wise in any time period you can remember?  For me, yes.I enjoyed the 21 day cleanse (I did a modified version due to my work schedule) where I basically ate 80% of my meals from My Fit.  In regards to a lot of people's notes that it is expensive... well, no kidding you can make your own 1/2 apple, celery, and almond butter for less than 5.25 - but who really as the time for it?  The convenience factor is so nice and it is still cheaper than buying a sub, chips and pop at Jimmy Johns (I learned that that's not healthy - hah).I imitated a few of the meals they have there and when all is said and done, you probably pay about 2x what you'd pay at the grocery store.  For me, this is a major steal to not have to spend an hour at the store, then make the dish, etc.  Plus the issue with buying your own is that most of the time you need to buy too much (and then throw it away).My Fit is a great option for people who are serious about being fit and live a quick lifestyle.  I still eat most of my breakfasts, some lunches, and some dinners from there.  I give it a high recommendation, and just know that they are flexible as well.  Don't be intimidated by a commitment - definitely willing to work with you.

58.description: Good macarons.  And good almond croissants.

56.description: Stop be here for some coffee during a weekend trip to Chicago. Good cappuccino and good macaroons. A little on the pricey side but not too over the top.

29.description: Great crepes, I'd highly recommend them and the earl gray macaroons they have are an unusual but delicious flavor. The service is good too.

42.description: A cute lil French cafe in a cute lil neighborhood. I randomly came across it, and I'm glad I did. I got the savory crepe, and although it was a little over-priced, it was fantastic. If you check in here, you get a free macaron, and if you don't grab one (or four) you're missing out... they are amazing.

23.description: If u are looking for lousy service ... cold mocha coffee ... and pretentious french accents this is the place. I now understand why so many Americans dislike the french.

47.description: Three girls walk into a bakery...and two of them have never had a macaroon before.Call me uncultured, but I had no idea what these things were other than super cute. And today I got to try them here, and they were great!The server was friendly, the place was really cute (minus the sticky tables) and the macaroons were great. I'll be back for them, but probably would shy away from their regular foods because of the prices.

8.description: I am over the moon for macaroons and I'm very picky when it comes to having a good one. This place makes the best macaroons, you can check in and get a free one, which is even better. A friend told me about this bakery saying how good their macaroons were, so I decided to give it a shot and go. So I checked in and got my free macaroon, and let me tell you I did NOT regret it. They were the BEST. Perfection! Everything a macaroon should be. I ended up getting a 12 pack of them because I couldn't leave without getting more. I haven't tried anything else from there, but I will be coming back.

31.description: For pastries, beignets, croissants, and macaroons this place won't disappoint! Savory crepes are a favorite. They also have wonderful fresh breads and classic French sandwiches like Ham and cheese.

34.description: Loved their macaroons! Absolutely delicious and I even got a free one for checking in!

16.description: La Fornette is a classic French bakery. What's not to like about that? I love places with classic style. This place has got it. It was relaxing and homey and I would have liked to have lingered for a time, eating pastry after pastry and sipping S Pellegrino while sleepily looking around at the beauty of this lovely cafe. But there was more to be done that day. This was the first stop on my Chicago coffee/food tour. I didn't get much because I was preparing my stomach for a lot more that day. Five assorted madeleines and the free macaron upon check-in. The madeleines were good, kind of like small muffins only in a different shape. Sadly the macaron, light rose, was dry and/or stale. I was expecting better from a place like this. My friend got three and some of them were a lot better, but surely they should all be perfect. And he said the ham and cheese croissant was Excellent. The people were friendly. The place was cool. Most of the food was good. It was an appropriate start to my day.

13.description: Stopped here before seeing The Secondy City show nearby. Received a complimentary macaroon with my check in and ordered a hot chocolate for myself. The hot chocolate was very watery and not sweet. I have to admit I like a sweeter hot chocolate (not too sweet, but enough to be hot chocolate rather than black coffee). So that was a bummer. But the chocolate macaroon was delicious and the service was very friendly. Definitely a nice local cafe to stop at if you're in the area.

11.description: Wonderful delightful people working there,  fabulous breads and pastries,  delicious coffee and a cozy Euro patisserie ambiance.  We need one in every neighborhood.

39.description: Really cute French bakery with great pastries and macaroons.  It's pleasant to be greeted by friendly employees saying "Bonjour!" There is a great selection in the morning, but it dwindles as the day goes on, so get there earlier for the best choices.  They also have free wifi!

37.description: This place is the best for baguettes, croissants, macaroons.... Seriously, it's like you're in France. I love it! I go often and I'm never disappointed. The staff is sweet and it's a winner every time.

0.description: It's so hard to find macaroons in Chicago, let alone good ones. Thank you fellow yelpers. First, let me start off by saying macaroons are my favourite cookie. Like I love love love macaroons. Every time I go to a place that sells macaroons, I absolutely have to buy some. I've tried Argo's macaroons, ones from the French market, and Mariano's, etc. It's really hard to find that perfect macaroon with the crunchy shell on the outside and the chewy centre.I was in desperate need to settle my macaroon craving and not with some average ones. Drove all the way from Bridgeport to check out this little joint. Was worth the trip. Their macaroons are the best. I bought three boxes. Saving some for tomorrow. (': I love how flavourful they are and they are the absolute perfect consistency.

38.description: Good keesh (no idea how to spell, too lazy to google) and good doughnuts.  It's very european, which is only frustrating because the portions are small.  If you want breakfast, you'll end up buying 2 of everything just to get full.  My gf loves it and rightfully so, but I'm a 25 year old guy and I need more than their servings provide my appetite at 10am.

51.description: This place is my secret hideaway. I absolutely love the service, the coffee, the pastries.

27.description: Wonderful delightful people working there,  fabulous breads and pastries,  delicious coffee and a cozy Euro patisserie ambiance.  We need one in every neighborhood.

32.description: La Fournette has wonderful products.  I have not been into the bakery, but when we get catered breakfasts, the pastries always include their fantastic croissants (plain, chocolate, almond).  Their danish are really wonderful too.  I am looking forward to getting to their brick and mortar locations to try all of the foods they offer!

54.description: Great french bakery that I will be back to.  The almond croissant was one of the best I ever had.  Will need to try the chocolate one next time.Wife seemed to like the hazelnut beignet a lot, but I thought it would be better if freshly out of the fryer.  Their macaroons seemed very legit and authentic as well from the one I tried.

48.description: La Fournette was a life saver for me while staying nearby. Thank god for WIFI! Iced lattes were fantastic. I wouldn't say this is the best coffee I've ever had, but this was fantastic nevertheless (La Fournette over Starbucks any day!). I would skip the almond croissant (they smear almond paste between the sliced croissant which is way too sweet for me!) and go for the apple danish. Entirely decadent, not too sweet, and totally worth it.

44.description: This place is a legit French bakery with a French owner from the D'Alsace region and it shows - the food is authentic and impressive. I'm a bit of a macaron snob, and their Lindor (If I recall the name correctly) flavor macaron was probably one of the best I've ever had (this includes ones from Paris). It's a chocolate hazelnut raspberry flavor with a perfectly crunchy outer layer and gooey sweet inside! Seriously take advantage of the free macaron with a yelp check in offer. We had the quinoa salad which was very flavorful and the veggie crepe which was incredible! It was filled with this fantastic French cheese I had never heard of but unlike anything I've ever tasted. Just as we were finishing the chocolate hazelnut cookies came out of the oven and filled the whole bakery with the most intoxicating smell so we couldn't leave without getting them. They have a handful of sandwiches and lunch items but their bread and pastries seem to be their real specialty. Staff was friendly, helpful and even wrote down the name of that delicious cheese for me! It has a casual cafe atmosphere that doesn't guilt you for lingering a while after your meal. I will be back!

24.description: I'm a macaroon girl 'cause I'm fancy. Pinky up when you eat one. Always pinky up.I work from home on Fridays and after some hours spent at the Starbucks nearby, the tummy started rumbling. Right down the street is this lovely bakery filled with very friendly staff. It's not overly complicated, not overly French, and perfectly delicious. I had myself a melty Turkey Panini. It didn't last long on that plate. To finish it off, a Hazelnut and a Raspberry macaroon. Raspberry was the winner.They don't have sodas so I had to try my best to not pronounce too many R's when ordering a "Perrier".I'll definitely be back.

7.description: One of the best cafes in town, My favorite item is the tuna sandwich, but everything about this cafe is amazing, from the great service, awesome friendly staff to the delicious and fresh food.If you want to surprise your partner with a box of tasty and beautiful macaroon box, La Founette is the place. Prices are affordable comparing to  competitors.It's a family business, you can see the owner at the cafe greeting and talking to customers. Finally if you want to feel Paris vibe you have to come and try this amazing cafe.

49.description: My new routine. Every morning after spin class I come here for an ice cafe latte, hazelnut macaroons and the French baguette (my favorite type of bread)! . Yum. Yum.

40.description: Had the free macaron with yelp checkin - being from Montreal, was a bit disappointed - very sweet rather than savory, outside not crunchy enough. Had the baguette - OK i guess, rather subpar for someone expecting French quality baguette. However, we had a piece of rye bread (quoted as beibg their specialty, sold by weight) - very happy with it, would return for it if in the neighborhood! Great for sandwiches and a good deal too. Tried the croissant too - nice and buttery but lackinf the crunch/crust/crumbliness of french croissants...Overall, for bread snobs, a few good options, but will keep looking for the perfect baguette and coissant in Chicago.

53.description: Stopped here before seeing The Secondy City show nearby. Received a complimentary macaroon with my check in and ordered a hot chocolate for myself. The hot chocolate was very watery and not sweet. I have to admit I like a sweeter hot chocolate (not too sweet, but enough to be hot chocolate rather than black coffee). So that was a bummer. But the chocolate macaroon was delicious and the service was very friendly. Definitely a nice local cafe to stop at if you're in the area.

30.description: I have had macaroons from all over the world and was incredibly excited to find a French cafe in Chicago, my hometown that I get to visit quite often. Bought the box of 12 and shared it with 2 other people. None of us liked the macaroons :( they were incredible dry and tasteless. Not sure if it was a bad batch, but we were all incredibly disappointed. We made a special trip to try these macaroons and ended up regretting it :/

46.description: Awesome and authentic French Food!! Amazing crepes (we tried veggie) and gazpacho - even macarons. Highly recommended.

1.description: This little café is an absolute gem. The chocolate croissants and their large cappuccinos are delicious!!! Don't forget to try their Cassie macaroons. My favorite part? The people that work here are very kind.

55.description: Delicious confectionary heaven. Very reasonably priced and extremely tasty. Don't miss this spot the next time you're in Chicago!

9.description: Best authentic French bakery in the downtown area!Awesome bread! Awesome pastry! Amazing macaron! Everything is perfect!

26.description: I've had their baguettes and they're amazing, so I came here for a late afternoon snack.  I had the turkey sandwich on a pretzel which was decent.  I was not expecting them to take it right from the display window and heat it up, I was expecting it to be made fresh, so I was a little leery about all the mayo slathered on it, but I'm still alive so far.  Good macarons, not the best I've had, but ok.  Intelligentsia coffee. I think I'll stick to just getting bread from them and get my meals elsewhere, though I'm glad I tried it!

25.description: This place is quiet but cute. Decided to stop by before starting our busy day. The waitress was really nice and the food is tasty. But my favorite is their plain coffee, it's not burned or watery like most cafes.

12.description: I'm a macaroon girl 'cause I'm fancy. Pinky up when you eat one. Always pinky up.I work from home on Fridays and after some hours spent at the Starbucks nearby, the tummy started rumbling. Right down the street is this lovely bakery filled with very friendly staff. It's not overly complicated, not overly French, and perfectly delicious. I had myself a melty Turkey Panini. It didn't last long on that plate. To finish it off, a Hazelnut and a Raspberry macaroon. Raspberry was the winner.They don't have sodas so I had to try my best to not pronounce too many R's when ordering a "Perrier".I'll definitely be back.

59.description: I just went back to review La Fournette and saw I already had. Not sure why I made it 4 stars before... maybe because I'd only been once or twice. But I go all the time now, and not only are their macarons to die for, but their coffee is delicious, they make amazing salads, and the french bread is killer. I have zero complaints and this adorable little cafe is my guilty pleasure!

21.description: It was such a pleasant experience. Got to enjoy some delicious macaroons with peppermint tea.Note: Check in to get a free macaroon!

17.description: Went here for lunch on a weekday. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I got the medium Classic Niçoise Salad Mixed greens (5.95, fresh vegetables, olives, tuna, and anchovies with hazelnut oil and red wine vinaigrette) which looked good but honestly didn't really know what was in it and was surprised by the combination of flavors - the tuna was nice though.I also got a medium french onion soup (4.70) which I thought was pretty excellent. Powerful flavors with bread that was just right and just as much melted cheese as I was looking for.Seems like an authentic nice french place. you can check in on yelp and get a free macaroon which I thought was alright.

10.description: Came in for my good friends birthday and fell in love!! It's like being in France. The workers were super welcoming and the macaroons were so addicting that I ended up buying an entire two boxes. Plus if you Yelp them they give you a deal! Their hot chocolate is the most flavorful I've ever had

5.description: Decent spot, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. The panini I ordered was burnt. I love macarons, but the macarons here are just okay. And the internet goes in and out.

3.description: I'm so happy that I found this store.  I am a big fan of Italian macarons.  I've tried to make it by my own, but it's not the same. A great choice here, really good taste. And friendly atmosphere which is very important for me. Keep it up. Thanks.

35.description: I had a cappuccino and a ham&cheese crepe. This place has a nice vibe and the French theme doesn't come off pretentious. However, it fails to live up to the expectations when it comes to food. While the crepe batter had a nice flavor, the stuffing was simply bad. There was maybe two teaspoons of cheese in that crepe and the ham was very salty. The employees seemed uninterested in helping the customers.

19.description: I had a cappuccino and a ham&cheese crepe. This place has a nice vibe and the French theme doesn't come off pretentious. However, it fails to live up to the expectations when it comes to food. While the crepe batter had a nice flavor, the stuffing was simply bad. There was maybe two teaspoons of cheese in that crepe and the ham was very salty. The employees seemed uninterested in helping the customers.

28.description: I very much enjoy the coffee and croissants here.  I would make it a regular habit, except I find the prices inflated. Probably for the best, to keep my figure and diet in check.

45.description: This place. Ohhhhhhh. Amazing. Eat the beignets. Do it. Only your waistline may regret it. The hazelnut one was incredible!! So. So. Incredible. The Croque Monsieur was also wonderful, as were the macarons. Very friendly staff and a very cute place. Do yourself a favour. Dooooo itttttt.

33.description: Excellent service and delicious macaroons! Be sure to make use of the free macaroon through the yelp check in. The bakery smelled amazing and everyone loved what they ordered. My personal favorite was the raspberry macaroon, so yummy!

43.description: Delicious everything! We had the quiche and were very delighted! Also had a cappuccino which we really loved too.  They brew intelligentsia and they brew it well :)If you go later in the day you will have slim pickins as this place is quite popular and the favorites are definitely gone by the late afternoon.  Great service & quality and quick!   Check in on yelp to get a free macaron!

2.description: If you're in Old Town Chicago, You have to stop by for The B E S T Cappuccino and the greatest homemade desert. (Cookies and cakes).They also make delicious crunchy Sandwiches.The only thing I didn't really like was the filling for their hazelnut Crapes..

18.description: Three girls walk into a bakery...and two of them have never had a macaroon before.Call me uncultured, but I had no idea what these things were other than super cute. And today I got to try them here, and they were great!The server was friendly, the place was really cute (minus the sticky tables) and the macaroons were great. I'll be back for them, but probably would shy away from their regular foods because of the prices.

41.description: I was very excited to have coffee here because I was from out of town and a friend said the coffee was amazing. The girl at the front was INCREDIBLY rude to me. I asked for a coffee then changed my mind to a cappuccino and she huffed and puffed, then proceeded to be rude throughout the entire transaction. I felt like I was a nuisance for ordering a coffee. Nothing against the pastries but the service should be reconsidered.

52.description: Cute place with fresh pastry and good coffee. We have especially blueberry tart with tons of blueberries and very thin crust. Good stop while walking around Old Town.

50.description: My first time here. It was good, but pricey.I had a tomato chicken sandwich. It is a big sandwich, that comes with grilled chicken,  red peppers, onions, and seasoning on a very tasty bread. It was a really good sandwich but not for $10.45. It would be a better deal if at least it came with a side. I also tried three macaroons, a chocolate, vanilla, and raspberry. They were all very good. My personal favorite was the vanilla. Which I was surprised since I am a chocolate lover and always prefer chocolates over vanilla. Overall, very nice clean cafe, however a little too pricey for what you get.

4.description: Very friendly service, fast, and food was fresh! I got the chocolate croissant and it was amazing, melted in my mouth. My friend got the croque monsieur and it was also very tasty. Iced coffee was good. Nice, cozy atmosphere--would definitely come back for coffee, snack, or meal. Prices were fair and the selection was good.The macarons were just okay--lacked some flavor.

6.description: You should come get coffee and a pastry here over Einstein's Bagels next door for you can get Einstein's ANYWHERE!

22.description: I've never tried their baked goods, which are probably excellent based on reviews, but I never will now. Last night after work I was almost run down by their truck. They should be more careful about who they let drive their vans.

15.description: First stop on a Divvy bike tour of the city...I had Crêpe "Suzette" and a cappuccino.....Fantastic!!!! I had a lot of questions in regards to the sweet treats and my server was very patient and helpful....loved how cheerful she was...i'll definitely be retuning....so happy I found this gem!

57.description: Try not to buy a lot of stuff here, if you must. It can run up quite a large bill! The problem isn't the cost though, it's the quality. You pay a lot of money for very little.When I went there, I ordered a Crepe Suzzete and a couple macaroons. The bill was ~$25, but you have to understand that you aren't getting much. It was a snack, not a meal. The Suzzete was just a Crepe in orange juice. Although it was edible, it certainly wasn't tasty. I've had much, much better at other creperies I nearly did not finish all the Macaroons. Way too sweet. Towards the end, they all tasted the same because they are just sugar, and food coloring. If you close your eyes and take a bite out of a random Macaroon 9/10 you will guess the flavor wrong. Maybe it's because I don't have much of a sweet tooth, but nothing should be that sweet.The next dish was... oh wait, there wasn't another dish. Yup. That was it, and it was quite disappointing! I l don't think I will be returning.The saving grace for this restaurant was the great atmosphere and friendly staff. A good working environment, but it feels like a coffee shop. They fail to excel at what you went there for: crepes.

20.description: I came here after seeing that their yelp reviews were so great, unfortunately their macaroon werent!Pistachio is my favorite flavor and usually the only flavor I get. The pistachio macaroons here were brown, unlike other places, green. It didn't look as appealing, so I decided to try other flavors. Lucky I did because after purchase a dozen of macaroons.I tired the pistachio and it was stale! I thought that maybe they all just taste like that, so I tired another flavor and the others were fine, but not great like the ones I've tired at other places.The macaroon are cheaper here, and if you check in you get one for free. But what is the point if they aren't even good.

36.description: This place is amazing. They really give you an authentic French experience. The people are nice, the coffee is good, and the ambiance is excellent.

14.description: Delicious everything! We had the quiche and were very delighted! Also had a cappuccino which we really loved too.  They brew intelligentsia and they brew it well :)If you go later in the day you will have slim pickins as this place is quite popular and the favorites are definitely gone by the late afternoon.  Great service & quality and quick!   Check in on yelp to get a free macaron!

1.description: Great location and good sushi!i love coming here in the summer and sitting outside! If you're in the area and don't want to spend a ton of dinner I would recommend Cafe Sushi which is BYOB!

0.description: Definitely an excellent sushi experience. I have been here multiple times, and will continue to go.  Service: Excellent. The servers who have waited on me have been attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and have been able to provide good suggestions.  Food: Fantastic.  I find the sushi to be delicous.  It's super-fresh, and it shows in the delicious flavor.  Ambiance:  Sheek and upscale.  The bar in front looks great and is a great place to grab a drink.  Overall: Excllent.  I highly recommend and will definitely go back.

58.description: Great music! When we were there they were playing a great mix of alternative rock music. The waitresses are super-friendly and the food is a great value. Pizza is surprisingly good and they have a variety of sliders.

56.description: Stopped in here for a casual dinner and ordered the veggie pizza.   It seems like they run a lot of specials.  The place had good ambiance, but it was  just really stuffy inside on a balmy August night,  so we left really quickly after dinner.  I would definitely come back to try more of their pizzas, maybe on a cold winter night.

29.description: Old Town Pub was busy this past Saturday night.  It seems like this is a place where sports fans, football fans Saturday night, can gather and watch a game.  There were several TV's in the space and you can watch the game from wherever you are seated. Our waitress was attentive and checked on us often.  She made sure our drinks were always full and gave us ample time to review the menu before ordering.  The menu is pretty diverse, they have anything from wraps and sandwiches to pasta or pizza.  I had the blackened chicken wrap with tater tots.... Yep that's right tater tots.  I mean who can dislike a place that serves crunchy tater tots, a childhood favorite of mine.  The wrap was good as well, it was generous in size and had a lot of chicken in it.  I was pleased.If I lived nearby, I think this place would become a regular hang out of mine...It's relaxed, casual, and has a good atmosphere.  I will definitely visit again when I'm in Old Town next.

42.description: I made it into this place for a scheduled social networking event. We had a lot of people, yet it was very comfortable. This is a cozy neighborhood bar with friendly, welcoming staff. What more could you ask for? I used to live in the neighborhood - but never made it in. Now this is just one more reason that I'm sad I don't live around there anymore. But I'll definitely stop in when I'm around there - because it is the kind of place where everybody knows your name. Or at least, they treat you like they do. And that is all that counts. Cheers!

23.description: If you had asked me the first day I visited the establishment what score would I have given it, it would have been at least a 4. But having just moved here from New York, I took a break a Saturday afternoon around oneish to have lunch. I walked in and it was empty. No biggie except the bartender sat at the bar busily doing something on her computer. She made a huff audibly annoyed that she had to stop and serve me. Friendly guy that I am, I tried to make quick banter. She couldn't get back to her computer fast enough. She is this short long curly hair euro chick with an accent so I figured, ok, its her detached euro way. Suddenly 3 people walked in and took a table and Mr Hyde turned into Dr. Jekyl and she was all banter and smiles and laughter and it was clear she had never met these people. I was like WTF? I mean I'm not expecting a soliloquy but at least an attempt at bartender banter in an empty bar might have been nice. Then someone took a seat at the bar and she was Jekyl with her also. I was like, what is it about me that makes this person want to treat my like garbage. I asked for my meal to go and tipped her a dollar of a 30 dollar check. Sorry peeps , just annoyed at this.

47.description: I was here during a bulls game & this bartender Lesley was so nice!! She was so nice and fun  and the food was amazing!!! I highly recommend this bar any night of the week.... They have comedy one night as well as karaoke another. Had a blast!

8.description: We came in here last night pretty much because it was the first place we saw and it was freezing. We ended up having a great experience and will definitely go back! Maria our server was awesome and the food (especially $0.50 wings & chicken dumpling soup) was delicious. Definitely going to come back to this place!

31.description: I worked here for a couple years and I loooove this bar. the kitchen is clean, the food is surprisingly great and the staff (at least the ones from when I was there) are fantastic (also attractive!) awesome crowd of regulars and neighborhood folks; karaoke on wednesday nights; couple of big screens for the games; and usually some decent specials. Plus they recently remodeled a little and it looks swell. OTP's the cats meow and I'm no longer being paid to say so! Check her out.

34.description: This place is sketchy! Bad food decent beers. Think there was drug dealing happening when we were there.

16.description: Randomly stopped in here one Saturday afternoon to escape the heat and glad we did.Sat at the bar and tossed back a few pints of Anti-Hero and chatted with some local regulars. It's the kind of place that you kinda miss from the old days where people went to a bar to socialize with strangers and not just stare a big screen TV's and ignore everyone (although they do have TV's as well).Staff was very friendly and we met some colorful characters who we could actually see spending more time with. Heck, they even bought us a round and we only knew each other for less than 2 hours.This block of Wells seems to be well on it's way to gentrification but amidst that is a neighborhood gem that I hope can fight back the coffee bars and upscale organic markets that are starting to invade. Stay strong Old Town Pub! We'll be back!

13.description: Went here last night and was completely insulted.When I walked in, it was a Sunday night at 10 PM. Not exactly a happening night, there were a small group of people at the bar.The bartender nodded at me, not really saying hello or smiling, walked away, came back with shots for the group. Went to the back. I was still waiting after just that half-greeting.I walked out. I know I'm just one guy. But I'm one guy that has Irish in him and would have spent a decent amount on drinks. If you have more than one person in your group, it might be ok. But if you're just out on town looking for a quick drink (s), forget this bar and it's phony bartender.

11.description: Took me awhile but finally came back here after a very bad experience a year ago.   Only revisited because owner reached out after last review.   Although he asked me to tell him when I came back, I did not want any "special" treatment.  Happy to say it was definitely a very different experience!1 - Service was fast and friendly - despite being fairly busy (at least in the area I was sitting), I did not have to wait long for service.   May have helped that they had more staff there and it was not as crowded as last time.   2 - Had a burger and it was done well and very tasty.  Coleslaw is different - but I really liked it.   Some people near me had the chicken tacos and raved about them.3 - Saw from my visit that there are quite a few regulars here - but I still felt welcome (not like an interloper at all).  A good basic pub with laid back crowd.4 - Prices were VERY reasonable.  My overall take - This is not a fancy place but the warm and welcoming atmosphere as well as good prices really made it a good experience.   Glad I gave it another try.

39.description: My boyfriend and I are from Milwaukee.  While visiting Chicago last spring we lost our car one evening (like good Milwaukeeans in Chicago).  We walked and walked and walked and finally found the lot we'd forgotten it in.  So when we later found ourselves hungry and cautiously idling near an open parking spot around the corner of North and Wells, we didn't need to write down the exact latitude and longitude of where we'd left the car this time.  Very conveniently, we were able to toddle into Old Town Pub and keep the car in sight.  SWEET.We almost didn't go inside, actually, because it was deserted and hardly seemed like a place we'd find dinner for just a few bucks.  I'm so glad we changed our minds.  We sat down right at the bar. They were running like three drink specials.  My boyfriend went to the men's room and I ordered him what I thought he wanted ... turns out I was wrong, which was just fine, 'cuz for the price we just ordered his correct drink on top of the wrong one.  Old Town's prices were revealing themselves as a delicious change of pace. Being that we were shameless tourists for the day, we tried their hand-mixed mojitos and bloody marys -- more drink specials.  The liquid gold in my bloody mary glass hardly tasted like I should be paying less than $5 for it, I'll tell you that.The bartender was as chill as her bar, and coolly remained that way when people literally started pouring through the front door as soon as we'd placed our order.  She suggested we try the hummus since they make it in house --YES.  THEY MAKE THEIR OWN HUMMUS.  Or at least they did on the day we were visiting.-- and it was delicate, complicated, and luscious.  With shock and awe frozen on our faces, we hungrily licked the plate clean.  That's perfectly acceptable behavior in  Milwaukee, by the way.  Calm down.Our pork chops arrived after our appetizer plates had been magicked away.  I don't know what we were expecting when we ordered "dinner special pork chops" at an unfamiliar bar, but we found thick, juicy slabs of pork perfection slammed down on a plate in a way that made it look more like Noah's Ark.  We also found bright, oven-roasted green beans, impossibly smooth mashed potatoes (did Jesus himself use a potato ricer on these things?!), and baked FIGS (!!!) as a garnish.Really.  Figs.  Everything we ordered unintentionally fell into one of their nightly specials, so when our bill arrived, we were MORE than happy passing along some of our savings to our bartender.  We were also convinced she was really a superhero bartender, here from the Bar Planet Krypton, to renew Hope and Goodness with good bar food, to still the bitterness and skepticism as such you'd find in our black, Milwaukeean hearts after having had too much bad cheese and rancid sausage.When we stepped outside for our cigarettes, we looked at each other in disbelief, wondering if we'd just dined in the Twilight Zone.  No, the car was still there.  But ... Homemade hummus?  Figs used as a garnish?  As bar food?  Only in Chicago.

37.description: THIS PLACE IS AWESOME, DONT GO IF YOU HAVE DINING ISSUES(waited on hand and foot like you are a king or queen or something)

0.description: They make their own spinach and artichoke dip that's awesome! Also the pizzas are wonderful. Have only been here during the week, and it's always low key and not crowded. Great place to unwind and have a couple drinks.

38.description: I wandered in here with two friends looking for a low-key Saturday night. We ordered drinks and two appetizers and everything seemed fine. However, the waitress later came and asked my friend if she was done and she said yes. She then proceeded to clear all of the plates from the table even though there was food on it and the rest of the table was not done. She came back moments later and cleared the entire table and gave us our check. I might be mistaken, but people generally go to a bar on a Saturday night to hangout for an extended period of time. We were planning on ordering more drinks, but eventually left at the waitress basically kicked us out. She seemed much more interested in talking to her boyfriend who came in to the bar then providing us with any level of service.We were disappointed as we though we had found a chill neighborhood hangout. We loved the atmosphere. Food and drinks were average.

51.description: Sarah the bartender is awseome  and makes the best freaken Bloody marys in the city!!!! thus far and I look for the best.The cornbeef and cabbage sandwich was so delicious! its a really cool spot everyone is friendly staff and the people that go there. I m the concierge across the street and we send people there all the time. The people who live here also know OTP as the neighborhood spot to hangout. LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!

27.description: Not to be confused with Old Town Pour House (chad/trixie) or Old Town Ale House (hippies/hipsters), Old Town Pub is a sleepy little space to go to kick back a few beers and eat some good pub food. I've never seen this place more than 3/4 full, and I prefer it that way. Plenty of TVs, decent beers on tap, and decent food make this the type of place you go to catch up with a friend while wearing sweatpants and no makeup. And no one will judge you for it.

32.description: Old Town Pub is located right on Wells street in Old Town, convenient for me since I live down the street.  I have been here a few times and its your typical no frills pub.  They have great daily specials and a nice al fresco spot to have some drinks/food outside during the warmer months.  I particularly like sitting inside and watching tv but both are good.  The spinach artichoke dip is unreal...... literally amazing.  I also tried the fire tots which were basically the smallest portion of tots topped with nacho cheese sauce and some salsa mixture.  It was a pretty small portion for $6 but what can you do.  We bought a restaurant.com gift cert while we were there and saved $15 off our total bill, not bad at all.I'll def be back here again.

54.description: This place is a crapshoot.  One night, the vibrations are just right, and everyone is on -- bartender is awesome, people at the bar are funny, music is good, and all seems right.  The next - bartender is forgetting about you, there's some drunk a$$hole from Jersey who keeps trying to talk loudly at your whole group, and all you want to do is get outta there with your crew.  Can't speak to the food, and while I'm sure there are lots of reviews here that confuse Old Town Pub with Old Town Ale House, I'd go so far as to guess that there are no "deep cuts" on the jukebox.  Unless it's an internet jukebox.  Then you can cut my wrists.  I kid, I kid.  Happy Monday, people.

48.description: If I had a go-to place for a pub that was 1.Near my apartment and 2. had my favorite food-pizza, this would be it. Old Town Pub is a friendly & comfortable place to meet with friends, have a beer, and some great pizza. I enjoyed meeting the staff and found them all to be a great group of people. Looking forward to try their patio :)

44.description: Hands down my fave bar in Chicago.We can almost always find a seat here for football games, their tots are amazing AND OTP is all about Twitter (and Twitter specials that involve tots).The food is really good - blackened chicken wrap and all the pizzas are our favorites.  Pretty decent selection of beers on tap and they make a great bloody.It's absolutely our go-to spot on Wells (beats the aggressive middle-aged men and ladies at Benchmark).

24.description: I moved to Old Town this year from Wicker Park this year. Culture Shock. Ummm....where can an aging indie-rocker by a normal that does not cost $7000? I like the vibe in the bar and they seem happy to have you there. I have not ordered any food, but the Pizza I saw looked awesome and it took all of my restraint to not order one. Thank you for being a neighborhood bar in the midst of all the high priced joints. Friendly atmosphere. They changed the channel, so we could watch the baseball game. Thank you for not charging me $25 for two beers and one little appetizer - as far as I know, we are still living in America. :)

7.description: Hubs and I are visiting Chicago - flew in last Wednesday and ended up napping after we got to our AirBNB place, so we needed a late night dinner option nearby. And thus we found OTP.The pub was pretty empty (not too surprising for a Wednesday night), so we got our drinks and food really fast. Yay! Wait staff was pleasant, too. The ambiance was decent - a tad divey, but clean and well-lit.We ordered a Greek salad and were pleased to see it came with kalamata olives instead of canned "black" olives. Nice. Also ordered one of the premium pizzas - only complaint was they put so much topping on, it kept falling off the pizza. But hey, that's better than having too few toppings! So even that was kind of a win.It ended up being karaoke night, too. Well played, Universe - that's one of our not-so-guilty pleasures. We sang a few songs with the locals before heading back to our AirBNB. Would come here again if we lived here.

49.description: Great bar all around!  In fact, my experiences there have been so...normal... that I can't really think of a ton else to say.  It's a bar that does exactly what it says it will and it does it well.Beer selection is good, though I wish they had more on tap (lots of interesting bottles though).  Decent food too (especially for a bar that's not a "gastropub").   And to echo what another reviewer (Veronica Z.) said - Sara the bartender is indeed awesome!Close to lots of bus lines and the El bust far enough from both the main Old Town "strip" and from the bars at State/Division that the vibe stays very neighborhood-y and relaxed.  And in this part of the city, it's hard to say that about many places.

40.description: This place is an awesome hang out. It Is laid back and never overly crowded.

53.description: Now, I know I've gotten a reputation lately as the guy that only reviews places he likes.....that's because I think Yelp should be an opportunity to spread love about places we like....and if the place sucks....then don't tell anyone they even exist!!!You know what does exist? Old Town MoFo Pub!!! This place has consistently been one of my favorite haunts here in Chicago over the last few years. I've made more friends at this establishment between the customers and staff than I have anywhere else in my life. Half of my cell phone contacts I've met here.It is a crapshoot as to whether it will be busy, but if it is slow, then it's still an awesome place to just chill out. How bout that men's room guys??? How about a window? A vent? Anything??? (this could be my only complaint,really....hardly worth mentioning)There's this dude behind the bar named Kolin who I spend waaaay too much time around....in a good way..... Salt of the Earth, this guy. He's super obnoxious to those who deserve it.....Pop your collar, ask how much pink kamikaze's are, and see where it gets you!! Not frickin far....he'd rather just call you a tool box than make you something you accidentally ordered at Old Town Pub. Go down to Old Town Social, ya weenie.....Tuesdays: Kinky Comedy Showcase with Chicago's best stand up comedians....9pm...free...super fun.Wednesdays: Karaoke Jammie Jam! (Do not wear Pajamas, I was just referencing House Party 2)Saturdays: 10pm to 3am.....ridiculously fun.....go!!Best,TB

30.description: Waitress was rude.Buffalo calamari was room temperature and soggy. Grilled cheese was dry and awful- how do you mess up a grilled cheese?Fries were bland.My friend's club sandwich was "bad".His Stella also came out flat.Other than that though, it was great!

46.description: Good low key place to grab a beer in the summer.  The pizza and food is fine, definitely nothing special.

1.description: Here is what I will say - I really enjoy the pizza, and they have Green Line beer, so that is always nice. In the end, though, it is really not a GREAT place. In the summer, they have some outdoor seating, which is nice.What really brings them down is their drinks and their service. I recommend you get the beer (a very small variety on draft) or wine (again, only two options) because they are super skimpy on their mixed drinks. A friend asked for wine to replace her mixed drink, and without prompting the waiter said he saw the bartender put a lot of liquor in it, and that she should just 'slam it.' Friend didn't bring up the weak pour, so it is clear they understand it is an issue, and instead of addressing it they are just encouraging people to chug their drinks so they don't need to comp them.

55.description: Food: 2Decor: 1Service: 1We booked the entire place for 70-80 people for dinner. Put simply, they didn't prepare for us, and most of us spent the majority of our time waiting for pizza to arrive. I had a couple slices, and the pizza was very mediocre.

9.description: I ordered the blackened chicken wrap.When ordering, I asked, "is there mayo on this?" I was told no. Great!The wrap comes out... and guess what? The sauce that is used on the chicken is MAYO-BASED. Umm, that would have been REALLY helpful to know. I was with work colleagues, and in a hurry, so I managed to eat it.. but really - if it's mayo-based, and I ask if there is mayo... please tell me!Thankfully, I really liked the tater tots, and was able to fill up on those.The Diet Coke, however, didn't taste like proper Diet Coke. Either flat or a non-branded version, not sure.What I did like is that there were ample TVs showing the World Cup matches.The service was super attentive - perhaps a little too attentive - but I'd rather have that than non-existent. I'm still annoyed about the mayo.

26.description: Rude bartender today around opening time. When asked, "what is Oberon?" he responded "It's a beer."  This came after a few other sarcastic remarks, so I finally questioned if that was the answer he intended to give. He blithely said "what do you want me to say?" and I explained that a bit of description would perhaps be in order. After more crustiness, we walked out. Too bad, as the place looked cool.

25.description: The service was so fantastic I had to rate this place 5 stars. This is a complete whole in the wall dive bar but the people and staff here make it 5 starts. Great Saturday specials! Didn't try the food but the pizza looked great. P.S. No one looked the same! No curly haired girls and no plaid shirt boys!

12.description: old town pub should be a great bar and an alternative to some of the fancier places in the area, unfortunately it's not.  the place is broken in, but it goes a little farther and becomes a bit old/tired.  please note i am not referencing the cleanliness, everything seemed okay as that goes.  the food was average, not bad, not great.  bartenders were cool, but the waitresses not as friendly.walk down a small flight of stairs and the bar is immediately on the left.  just a ledge opposite the bar.  beyond the bar is a mix of seating.  the bar top is a perfectly worn wooden surface with a classic wide rail.  perfect for forearms.  wooden stools with back support.  the bar back is a mix of shelves, bottles, & hdtvs.  nothing special or decorative.  stamped tile ceiling.  an outdoor patio that is good on the warm days & for smokers.  other patrons are a mix, but most likely you'll be drinking with someone that's spent some time in a bar.  easy conversation.atmosphere is usually more subdued.  can get louder for a short time if certain crowds come thru or if a chicago team is playing.

59.description: We will NEVER be going back to the old town pub (undeserving of capital letters). The bartender, Sara, really did us wrong.  We ordered a pizza, it took an hour to get back, was cold, AND HAD NO CHEESE ON IT.  She PUT HER HAND IN OUR PIZZA to try to show us that there was cheese on it, but it was just soggy dough.  Thank you for nothing, and we'll be going up the street to ANY of the other excellent pubs in old town next time.Also, she kept arguing with us (the customers) throughout this afternoon.  Ridiculous.

21.description: Wow, for a place that gets looked over too easily they have some surprisingly tasty pizza! Perfect crust and sauce balance with whatever chosen ingredients.Their beer list isn't the most extensive, but can easily satisfy all tastes as a whole. For all the douchefest bars down the street on Wells, this is a great place to enjoy a decent brew and cozy conversation on a weekend night!

17.description: I could easily see myself falling in love with this place. The food isn't great, but it isn't terrible. Haven't tried the pizza though. It's a breath of fresh air from all the snooty places in the neighborhood. Props to the bartender, she was the only person there and she was waiting on the entire place. I will be back!!!

10.description: Food was decent but the terrible service is what warrants this rating. Upon walking in the bartender and seemingly only person in there didn't greet us for about 2 minutes. Not even a hello. Our drinks were empty for the majority of our meal, never offered refills and spent 90% of her time talking to friends at the bar counter. My guess is this place is probably great for the bar atmosphere...but it is terrible for having a quick bite of lunch at a service table.

5.description: Not great. Atmosphere was ok. Beer was not bad except the two we had to send back because they were flat. Highlight was the bartender/waitress with a great personality. You can find a better place on this same block.

3.description: My friends and I came here after work and I'm so glad we did! The atmosphere is totally laid back,it was not crowded at all and our waiter was amazing! My friends and I ordered the Mac n cheese, burger and Greek salad. *Greek salad with chicken amazing! Give great portions and chicken is so tender *Burger. ..also amazing and huge! If you're not a fan of cheese ask for little cheese or no cheese because it is piled onDefinitely will come back!

35.description: I m trying to become more of a realist than a dreamer.  I heard from many people how great this place was so I gave it a whirl.  I got the thin crust sausage and pepperoni.  It is a nice to get a beer and pizza outside on a nice day in Old Town, but other than that not worth it.  Pizza is bland and boring, so many better places in Chicago.

19.description: Wow, for a place that gets looked over too easily they have some surprisingly tasty pizza! Perfect crust and sauce balance with whatever chosen ingredients.Their beer list isn't the most extensive, but can easily satisfy all tastes as a whole. For all the douchefest bars down the street on Wells, this is a great place to enjoy a decent brew and cozy conversation on a weekend night!

28.description: My girlfriend and I had our first date here, and we're still together.  I'm not saying that Old Town Pub made it all possible, but it certainly didn't hurt.  OTP has great appetizers and a decent beer list for fairly reasonable prices.  I highly recommend the mac and cheese, but you are unlikely to go wrong with any choice here.  The service is fairly quick and the staff is really nice.The atmosphere is a little dark.  But it's quiet and relaxed, except for the handful of guys who might show up to watch a sports game.  I haven't been during the more crowded hours, but I expect things don't get too crazy.Overall, great food and drinks for a good price.  Give it a try.

45.description: When you're from out of town it's hard to find a good bar.  As we were walking through old town we stumbled upon this small pub.  We walked in and ordered a drink at the bar.  The next thing we know we're engaged in a wonderful conversation with the other bar patrons and the bartender.This bar was super welcoming, and left a great taste in my mouth for the town.

33.description: What an awful experience for a Thur night, prime time Bears game. Twice, I waited for a beer for 20+ minutes. The goat cheese took 35 minutes and tasted like ketchup. Please staff yourselves properly, especially when every single bar on Wells is packed solid (most with lines).

43.description: The bar is not my favorite, but the stars are for the pizza. Did not expect this little pub to have such delicious bbq chicken pizza. It's a nice place to go with a friend for beer and a pie. :)

2.description: So I came to this place on a Wednesday night. We were 8 friends. It wasn't packed at all. All my friends got their pizza's at the same time, however, mine came out 30 minutes late. So instead of eating after everyone was finished I told him the server to cancel my order and void the charges cause I had a tab open. He said it had been voided.Today I look at my statement and the charges went from pending to official. They charged me for a pizza I never even got to eat. It came out 30 minutes late. I just don't understand how this could have happened on a night where it wasn't even busy. On top of that you charge me?!?!Now I have to call my credit card company and report a theft to the police.Never going back here again just out of principle.Thank youJustin

18.description: The service here was terrible.  My 75 year old mother and I waited an hour for a lukewarm pizza and never got the beer I ordered.   I get things happen and waitresses/waiters are people too, however, ours was standing in the corner with her boyfriend up until the people at the table next to us asked their waitress to come over and help us because they noticed how long we had been sitting there .  Matter of fact, they sat down after us, ate and paid before we were even served. When our tip reflected the service, our waitress stopped us to ask iwhy her tip was so small (I actually left her 7%).  When I explained, she got irritated and in my face. Needless to say that was about the worst thing she could have done.   I'll spare you the details.  Bottomline, terrible experience.

41.description: I hate giving this a bad review. I ate here once in the Fall and it was good. Nothing to write home about but great for a quick bite and a beer. However, the 1-star review is based off my experience this passed Sunday afternoon.Stopped in around noon. Place was pretty empty with one other table.
