We sat down in a booth and waited for about 10 mins. Server was in sight, but she didn't bother coming over. Starving, I went and grabbed menus from the POS stand. We looked at the menu, waited...waited...then decided to leave since we did not know how to enter our own order into the POS. After being ignored to that degree it's hard to forgive. Since we live a block away we will probably try it again, and hopefully leave a different rating.

52.description: After shopping in the neighborhood we ducked in to OTP for some lunch and brews. It was pretty dead when we got there, but people started rolling out of bed by the time we left and the bar had become a popular place. Food is standard pub fare. My wife had the veggie pizza and I passed on the tempting bbq, burger, slider options and went with the jerk chicken. They were both good. I wanted the jerk to have more heat, but it was fine. They also have some pretty decent tap selections here as well. Our beverage of choice was the Rogue Yellow Snow, which we had a few rounds of. I haven't seen this IPA since we were in Oregon. Sadly for Kris, her Irish got their butts kicked along with every other decent team this week. That was much to the liking of our Big Ten waitress.

50.description: My boyfriend and I were sitting in a booth in the back on a Friday night.  At the end of the night, the bar was closing and we were the last two customers to leave.  During our walk home, less than 10 minutes after we left, we realized that we left my boyfriend's iTouch on the table.  We turned around and went back and the iTouch was gone and apparently none of the staff saw it.  So we were the last customers to leave and the iTouch was gone within minutes.  You do the math.  I called the next day and was told that the manager would check the safe and call me back.  No phone call.Two days later I went in and talked to the manager, Steve.  He said that he would check with the staff and that they have cameras they can review to find out who took it.  He asked me to give him two days and promised to call me back.  I asked that he call me either way, as I just want a follow up from him.  It has now been a week; no phone call.  Their pizza is good but their business practice and employees suck.  Bottom line.

4.description: After a night of holiday activities we searched everywhere for a place to grab a bite and a drink with open tables. Old town pub had a table in the back near a large tv so it worked perfectly. We ordered a pitcher of draft beer (great taste and cold) and ordered dinner. I had the stromboli. It was very cheesy and filled with great ingredients. The outside was a bit plain but tasted really good when dipped in the sauce. My boyfriend ordered a buffalo chicken wrap and said it was pretty tasty. The other couple in our group had the pizza. They said it was pretty good but not far above what you'd expect anywhere else in chicago. The place itself was very pub-like  (obviously) but could have much better bathrooms. There was a wood slab missing from the bathroom door or what we called... a peephole. Not cool. Other than that it was alright, nothing too fancy by any means but a good place to pop in for a drink and food when no where else is open.

6.description: I went here on a Thursday, and the blackhawks were playing and the place was still empty. I swear the back of the bar was just me and the friend I was with. It made it kind of nice because we could hear each other and talk, but at the same time you didn't get that feeling you get when you're cheering for your team in a crowded bar with everyone else cheering for your team!So that's a matter of opinion, what isn't is that they didn't have Miller lite in a bottle. Only had it in a can. Not a fan of can Miller lite. Also the waiter came by like once to see if we needed anything. Which being that both our beers were empty we did. We probably would've drank at least one additional round in the time it took for the waiter to appear. Decent enough place. Id say it'd be a quick stop if you're bar hopping. Nothing overly exciting

22.description: If there was a NO STAR rating that is what I would give this place. Walked in last Saturday and their were two female waitresses that were beyond rude. This place is full of TRAILER trash it's always this way when I go in. Sad because I love across the street and it is easy to access. This place doesn't not fit in, in old town and needs to relocate to Logan square

15.description: Not to be confused with Old Town Pour House (chad/trixie) or Old Town Ale House (hippies/hipsters), Old Town Pub is a sleepy little space to go to kick back a few beers and eat some good pub food. I've never seen this place more than 3/4 full, and I prefer it that way. Plenty of TVs, decent beers on tap, and decent food make this the type of place you go to catch up with a friend while wearing sweatpants and no makeup. And no one will judge you for it.

57.description: Weird place that can be fun but can be weird

20.description: I'm a firm believer in setting the correct expectations before you step into a place.  This place is one of those neighborhood bars that just happens to serve food.  It's NOT a 5-star restaurant who just happens to serve alcohol.  Let's be clear about that right from the beginning.  While some have referred to this as a high-end sports bar - it's not.  It's a neighborhood bar.  NOW - the neighborhood just happens to be in the up-coming and mid-to-high pricey neighborhood of Old Town, so you shouldn't expect $1 draft night.  As long as you're good going in with spending a bit higher than an average price for "bar" experience (NOT club, but BAR), then I think you'll have the right attitude going in.Service?  Well, to give you some context, it was mid-day on a monday in the middle of winter when we walked in.  SURPRISE!  We were the only ones in there.  And the single person behind the bar looked busy stocking and prepping for the up-coming Monday Night Football impending rush.  No problem, we're just two people.  How bad could it be.  Well, although we were steps from the bar, getting attention and service was a constant chore.  To top it off, I unwrapped the silverware and there was chunks of nastiness on the knife.  I chased down the employee and he quickly corrected the situation by giving me another fresh wrap of silverware - WITH ANOTHER BIG CHUNK OF STUFF ON IT! (are you kidding me).  Okay, now this is starting to get concerning.  So again I chase mister enthusiasm down and he brings me another, but this time (properly) waits to see the drumroll process of wrapping this one.  ALL GOOD.  Phew, okay, maybe now we can eat!Now.  The food.  I took a picture of the pizza that I ordered.  As I normally do, I throw a bit of hybrid together of a couple of "stock" menu items so I can get a good idea of how things taste.  The pizza had sausage on it.  Stay away from that if you're not into liquidy/greasy stuff.  These honkin' chunks of sausage exploded with grease.  However, once removed, everything else was fantastic.  My wife had a sandwich that was similar - once her sausage was removed, all good.  So in all the food wasn't bad for bar food.  I'd definitely change the sausage supplier, but all in all, good grub.  Atmosphere is cool as it's kind of a brownstone basement kind of vibe.  There are some cool aspects to the decor and walls, plenty of TVs, small enough to hang with friends without having to scream, and bathrooms were clean.  The service was the real issue here and I chalk that up to no one being there and this one guy trying to use this time to do other things.  The food was overall very much as expected for this kind of establishment.  So that would have been 4 out 5 had it not been for the liquid sausage.  Have fun!

36.description: Went to Old Town Pub last night because it was near to where I was going afterwards.  Had the sausage pizza and it was ok.  The person that I was with had the sliders and said it was ok as well.  Our waitress was very attentive so that was good.  There was surprisingly a lot of guys that were hanging out at Old Town.  I don't know why this surprised me, but it did!  I'd go back and maybe try the chicken panini or the greek salad with chicken next time.  It was a short walk to Second City so Old Town was a decent choice.

14.description: I purchased a Groupon to use in on 3/14/2015. It didn't say anywhere that it won't be accepted Saturday afternoon. Sooo disappointed.

58.description: Elly's is my kids' favorite restaurant, due in large part to their very-chocolatey chocolate chip pancakes.  The food isn't fancy but it's a great neighborhood breakfast place.  Other than the coffee, which is terrible, we've never made a bad choice here.  They even make a surprisingly good veggie burger.

56.description: Great breakfast spot in Old Town. Service is a little slow but the food is so good!! Highly recommend.

29.description: This is a good standby as your local destination for hangover cure food. It isn't up to the typical yelper foodie standards but I think it was really good and the portions were huge (I don't mean that as a knock, it just doesn't try to be anything other than a tasty diner).

42.description: This place has a certain charm to it that makes me want to keep going here. The food doesn't particularly stand out, but the atmosphere makes up for it.

23.description: Pretty average diner- consistent food, okay service, no wow. Just as good at 2 AM as 1 PM- for better or for worse.

47.description: It's a very nice place and it's open 24 hour! The pancakes are really good and so are all the other dishes. The place it's well decorated and comfortable.

8.description: Outstanding brunch-- and on a weekday, to boot! I had a sausage cheddar omelette with pancakes and they were DELICIOUS. Good service, really cute restaurant, excellent food at a a great price= 5 stars. Oh! And they're open 24rs. Highly recommend.

31.description: I love 24 hour diners. I've never been to a bad one, and Ellys continued that trend. Do you know how few places near-ish to downtown serve breakfast a dinner times? It's just diners for the most part, and that's a shame. ANYWHO. Fluffy pancakes, perfect over easy egg, quality bacon and fresh apple juice for about $10 in an adorable space. I'll be back for sure!

34.description: Best skillet!! Fast service even though the place was crowded. Food portion are huge.

16.description: Whoever doesn't give ellys 5 stars, probably sucks as a person. 24 hour bomb ass diner with bomb service. Just go

13.description: My first experience at Elly's was just okay. It was pretty busy when we get in, but we were seated in less that 7 minutes which was cool. When we got to our table, we were immediately given glasses of water before our waiter took our orders. I kid you not, we sat for about 10-15 minutes before the waiter came to ask us if we needed anything. A couple seated AFTER us got their orders taken before we did. Big mistake Elly's. Once we got our order in and the food came out, I began to put seasonings on my meal. The waiter swooped in and grabbed my plate before I could even take a bite and said "Oops, wrong order". You don't just take a plate in front of a starving man, that's not the way to our heart. I got the #1 special which came with eggs, bacon, a sausage link, a cup of juice and pancakes. The eggs were okay. Bacon was ehh. The pancakes tasted like recycled paper. Ended up spending like $20. For half the price and more flavor I probably should have just went to iHop like I wanted to.

11.description: I love 24 hour diners. I've never been to a bad one, and Ellys continued that trend. Do you know how few places near-ish to downtown serve breakfast a dinner times? It's just diners for the most part, and that's a shame. ANYWHO. Fluffy pancakes, perfect over easy egg, quality bacon and fresh apple juice for about $10 in an adorable space. I'll be back for sure!

39.description: I had the eggs Benedict and really enjoyed it! My girlfriend ordered an omelet with onions, peppers, and cheese and it was huge! The unfortunate thing was her onions weren't cooked all the way which really made the dish unappetizing. Nice place though, we would return again.

37.description: I've past this place a zillion times in my life and finally decided to stop in.It was fairly empty, well really empty, yet the hostess? decided to seat me next to a table already occupied. I get restaurants and table logistics so I didn't make a big deal about it, but I was a party of one so it was awkward to look at all these empty tables but I'm placed under these people. Oh well, no biggie. Waitress comes, she's, nice and friendly. I place my order. Food came out pretty fast. Too fast. It was okay, pancakes could of been cooked longer.Just sucked it up. Didn't say anything. Waitress was too attentive though, every 5 mins asking me if I'm okay, but I rather that than not coming to my table at all. So, I deal with it. I didn't like how I was being included with the other table though. Annoying. Damn hostess.The waitress would ask US all if we needed something & such, girl, I'm not with them. The waitress gives US our bill without request, more so the same time as the other table. Again, it's obvious I'm not with them, why keep including me with them? Of course she gave us each other's bill. That wouldn't of happen if I wasn't being included with that damn table. My attentive waitress was then hard to track down. I could not get her! Lol. Place still empty. Was so over this place by then.Went to pay, then right as I'm signing the receipt, the man cashier just leaves. Literally, just peaced out. I'm stuck there with the signed receipt lost for words cause it's like, do I leave it here? Is he coming back? Looking back I should of just walked away, their lost! I know you need that signed copy, and if he waited 5 seconds, he could of took it. Ass.But no, I stayed and flagged down a nice women who took it.I'll never go back. IHOP is better than this place. Food quality & all.  Yes. I said IHOP.Hell, even Golden Nugget.I'm a fairly peaceful person. I eat, I pay, I leave. So this experience just says enough. I kinda want my tip back too. Yes I do.

0.description: More Like, Elly's Pancake HEAVEN!Seriously thank the Gods for Yelp otherwise I doubt I would have ever known to visit Elly's as it is in a neighborhood I know very little about. Location: Elly's is right in the heart of Oldtown and on the corner of a bustling street. We visited on a Saturday afternoon and there was no wait for a table for 3. I think we were lucky though because there was only one table open when we arrived. Decor: The first thing one immediately notices when entering the restaurant is the beautiful wall on the northern wall that is adorned with an assortment of beautiful plates which act as accent pieces. I was obsessed with it. The second thing one notices is the ton of natural light that floods the restaurant due to the massive floor to ceiling windows. It was a beautiful sunny day in Chicago so I felt like a rose...blossoming in the sunlight (ha)! I also noticed that the chairs were all mismatched. LOVE this aesthetic.Service: In addition to the restaurant being visually bright and sunny, the owner greeted me and my friends. She was also very bright and sunny in personality. What I LOVED was when she was escorting us to our table, she linked arms with me like we were bffs forever and complimented my eyes. Now, to some people this would be overstepping so many boundaries, but to me, It made me feel like I was at home. She is fierce!Food: THE OMELET WAS HUGE AND DELICIOUS! And so affordable! All the ingredients were fresh. The pancakes, unfortunately, were not very good to me. They were a bit too dense, and the lack of flavor, did not help. The red velvet cupcake I randomly ordered, because I devour ANYTHING red velvet when I see it, everytime I see it, was DELICIOUS! I can't wait to return!

38.description: Been there twice. Pecan pancakes are great! So fluffy and delicious. The Olé Skillet is amazingly tasty! Definitely recommend it! One of many great places to eat in Chicago!

51.description: Very good friendly, and fast service even though the place was crowded! Excellent pancakes!

27.description: Awful food.  Ordered migas and it has NO tortillas and way too many jalapeños.  Maple syrup for the pancakes was disappointing too.

32.description: This place was heavenly! Open 24-hours, great service & great food! The OJ was fresh & the best pecan pancakes I've ever had!

54.description: What a great late night pit stop. I stumbled in there with a group of friends and we ordered according to the 3AM slosh principle of "the greasier the better". I started playing a game with one of the ladies at the table. I told her to turn her hands upside down on the table, I placed a full cup of water on each of her hands, and told her to balance them. Everyone at the table pretended to walk away. She pretty quickly spilled the water all over the table. We then tried the prank several more times, which resulted in several more spills. Now the whole time we were being late-night idiots, the manager of the restaurant was secretly watching us. Instead of coming over and yelling at us or kicking us out, he walked over with a stone face called over two waiters, they removed the glasses from the table, and then gave each of us a dinosaur kiddy-cup with a straw.

48.description: Mediocre food and service, good sized portions, nice atmosphere.  Convenient location is only reason I'll go back. Service was spotty, took 3 requests to get cream for coffee, forgot a juice order, didn't bring syrup with our pancakes (in a pancake house...)Food was just ok.  My Mexican skillet had those pickled jalepenos they put on water park nachos instead of fresh ones.  Turkey sausages were over cooked.

44.description: Ellys is what you expect from a diner experience with a splash of charm and some pretty mean milkshakes. I went in expecting something typical and found a little something more. We ordered a wide range so we could compare it to our favorite breakfast place. They have great Belgium waffles and they make their hash browns shredded with a crispy top- yum! Overall, it's convenient, fast and delicious.

24.description: If you're looking for a classic, solid breakfast meal at any time of the day, this is a great option. The atmosphere itself is pretty boxy and stark, but they make quality omelettes and pancakes! I've never tried a non breakfast menu item, and probably won't...since the place is called a pancake house.

7.description: Came here at 5 o'clock in the morning on New Years Eve. It was packed but we were seated almost immediately. Fast service. The turkey sausage was awful and really dry but the pancakes were delicious. Sadly, that's all I remember.

49.description: I tried the Spartan omelette which had good flavor with the feta however it was a little over cooked but what can I expect this isn't gourmet breakfast. I asked for a side of croussant. All of this to go. I'm guessing take out isn't too common as they didn't ask my name, total or how long it would be. But when I swung by ten minutes later I was pleasantly surprised. Everything was neatly packaged in pie plates & the cherry on top was ketchup, syrup and butter were all there without me having to ask for once! What a relief and nice treat.

40.description: Always a consistent experience at Ellys. The food is nothing to write home about but it's affordable and decent. Ambience is very casual and a bit noisy. If you're there before 10am on the weekend it's easy to get a table-which is a rare find in old town.

53.description: Went here last night and the food was amazing. Unfortunately in any experience with a restaurant the service is half of the experience. When we arrived, we sat ourselves in the corner booth, we found it most comfortable and almost immediately I found myself with my feet up on the booth next to me because there was a total of 6 people in the entire (very large) restaurant. It was evident that I was not disturbing anyone, mainly because of the fact that there was no one I could've possibly disturb. When I leaned back in my seat I was approached by the night manager, who we later found out was named Kieth. He walked towards our booth and said "can you not lean back in the booth like that, this is not your bedroom..."As a person working in the restaurant business, if I said this to a customer I would be immediately fired. I found I incredibly offensive and did not see, nor do see, the reasoning behind saying that this restaurant is not your bedroom. Of course this place is not my bedroom, I came here to eat, but if I decide to place my feet on an object which is not disturbing other guests nor the quality of the seat, then there is no need for such a rude comment. I strongly urge Keith to be lectured or fired, besides the fact of the comment that was extremely unprofessional, he gave us rude glances the entire night multiple times.

30.description: Had the Spartan omelette that came with hash browns and pancakes (that I changed to chocolate chip pancakes) it was dericious! The menu has so many breakfast and lunch style options it's a good place that has options for everyone and it's open 24/7- so good for those "late nights socializing"

46.description: Great no-nonsense diner in Old Town. Food is good and there are a decent number of healthy, tasty options on the menu. The inside has lots of character and staff is very friendly.

1.description: Just found the "open now" tab on Yelp. It's 2am and we need a diner. Found this place was 24/7 and we immediately ordered an uber ride. Food is fantastic greasy spoon with tons of options. We ordered the chicken and waffles and (be warned) it takes about 30 minutes. It was very dry and not very flavorful. Pretty disappointing, but the waffle was tasty. We also got the philly cheese steak, and though it wasn't anything like the actual sandwich, the steak was decent and satisfying at 2am.

55.description: awesome place. open 24 hours. great to just pop in whenever to have carby food.

9.description: their hawaiian omelette and veggie benedict were amaze!

26.description: There are many items on the menu, so you can find almost anything that has to do with breakfast as well as some lunch items. The coffee was good and the portions are large. The ingredients are good quality but the dishes lack flavor. The service was not great. Our server forgot many items we ordered and asked for. The atmosphere was nice and the decor was simple but modern.

25.description: Beautiful decor & open, airy space. Low-key vibe - huge portion sizes that are perfect for leftovers! My friend and I only had the sweet pancakes (walnuts and raisins for me and nutella banana for my friend) and they were ~delicious~

12.description: What a great late night pit stop. I stumbled in there with a group of friends and we ordered according to the 3AM slosh principle of "the greasier the better". I started playing a game with one of the ladies at the table. I told her to turn her hands upside down on the table, I placed a full cup of water on each of her hands, and told her to balance them. Everyone at the table pretended to walk away. She pretty quickly spilled the water all over the table. We then tried the prank several more times, which resulted in several more spills. Now the whole time we were being late-night idiots, the manager of the restaurant was secretly watching us. Instead of coming over and yelling at us or kicking us out, he walked over with a stone face called over two waiters, they removed the glasses from the table, and then gave each of us a dinosaur kiddy-cup with a straw.

59.description: Excellent eggs Benedict!  Great coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice!  Super friendly wait staff!  I'm a regular and I often go in for a quick cup of coffee!

21.description: Great venue for conversation over a meal. Friendly service brought me in for breakfast and lunch... You do the math

17.description: Spacious, opens 24 hours and free Wifi.Great prices and decent portions!Got the Spartan Omelette (feta cheese, spinach, tomatoes and mushrooms) with the pancakes. Pancakes were fluffy- I like them here. Con: $4/hr meter parking.

10.description: I went here for breakfast one morning with two of my friends and was not impressed. I am vegan, and this never seems to be a problem when eating at restaurants in Chicago, a city that is normally relatively vegan friendly. Upon arrival, I informed our waiter that I was vegan and asked if there were any dishes that he would recommend for me. All he had to say (in a very rude manner) was, "what's vegan?" Now, I understand that vegans do not make up a very large percentage of the population, but there are quite a few of us in Chicago and I would expect someone who works in the food business to at least be aware of the meaning of the word vegan. After patiently explaining to the waiter that I do not consume any animal products, he said (while wearing a very puzzled expression) "Well uh...We have fruit." Going into any restaurant that isn't typically meant for vegans, I don't expect a menu as abundant as the non-vegans around me get to choose from. I do, however, expect at least one or two options more impressive than just fruit and/or vegetables. I don't think people realize how easy it is to whip up a batch of vegan pancakes, or throw together some oatmeal with soy milk and a handful of raisins and nuts!! I ended up ordering the fruit, which turned out to be an okay array of fruit, albeit pretty overpriced considering it was just that: fruit. The waiter also brought me a side of cottage cheese and a slice of date nut bread, neither of which I could eat. The cottage cheese for obvious reasons, and the bread I found out was made using eggs. My friends ordered pancakes, which they said were okay, although while eating we were disturbed by an argument that was taking place at the table next to us between the customers and their waitress. We also had to ask several times for water refills because apparently our waiter was too busy to notice our glasses were empty on several occasions. I would recommend that Elly's add at least a couple vegan friendly options to their menu, and I would also recommend that they teach their waiters and waitresses basic manners when interacting with customers. Overall, vegan or not, I would not recommend this restaurant.

5.description: This diner turns out some solid fare, all the basics you would expect at a diner.  Yeah, they have a few specialities, but none of them are really unique.  Don't get me wrong - the food is good, but just not wowing.  The staff was a little standoffish to start, but warmed up and turned out to be pretty friendly once you engaged them.  The coffee was also good, even the decaf.  And I love the fact this place is 24 hours!  I wouldn't hesitate to come back to Elly's!

3.description: In the category of 24-hour diners, this place is a clear 5 stars. I'm not sure what reference point the other reviews are using. Most reviews seem to criticize Elly's for not being a gourmet breakfast place--even though it's not, nor does it try to be. At Elly's you get what you hope for from a 24-hour diner: classic breakfast fare and pretty good service any time of day. Most of the dishes include a ton of food and will fill you up. The omelettes are enormous (5 eggs). The Corned Beef Hash platter is delicious and includes as sides 2 eggs, hash browns, and a short stack of two pancakes or toast. The skillets are also massive and tasty. They serve non-breakfast items, but I have no idea why anyone would order those. I've easily been there over a dozen times. Each time, the food was comparable to the previous time. The negative anecdotes about food quality (in other reviews) do not accurately represent the overall quality or consistency.5 stars--will return and recommend to friends.

35.description: I really don't enjoy leaving bad reviews and very rarely do so. That being said, I've been to Elly's a handful of times but my last two experiences, both around 8pm, were not very enjoyable. I will say I've never had any issues when there for brunch so if you want to try it, I'd recommend going then.My last visit I ordered eggs. The eggs were cold and looked like they had been reheated in the microwave. The plate was a little warm but that was about it. They were so gross. Then to make matters worse, the guy refilled my water and a fly came out of the jug into my glass. I told him I would like a new water and he grabbed another glass from a nearby table and filled the water from the same jug the fly came out of! A little sketched out by the food and the cleanliness of this place.

19.description: About 2pm on the Saturday before St. Patricks day, the city was crazy busy, and we were in the mood for brunch... so thankful we decided on Elly's! Even though it was a little busier, the service was still acceptably prompt and friendly.The ambiance of Elly's reminds me of my aunt's kitchen when I was younger. Mismatched chairs, casual conversations flitting through the air, families and couples and friends seem to fill the joint, and the servers give off the "I may be working here but I'd still love to sit and eat any of the items on the menu" vibe. (Hoping I'm not the only one who knows what I'm talking about.)And the food. YOU GUYS, the food! I had four pieces of the Thick French Toast, and since I ran a half marathon that morning, I just wanted there to be MORE! Fluffy, flavorful, and they provided just the right amount of syrup to compliment them. The food my friends got also looked delicious, but since I'm kind of a french toast snob in the post-race afternoon, I have to say that mine was the best.The only disappointment, and the reason I can't give Elly's five stars, is dessert. Overpriced, bad pie (according to my roommate) and a brownie that was FAR too sugary (especially compared with that fantastic french toast...) That being said, I definitely plan on returning to Elly's soon for more French Toast... I'm sorry, I just can't get over how great that stuff was.

28.description: I love eating at Elly's all over Chicagoland so much. I've eaten here for years and I was first introduced to Elly's at the Suburban location in Norridge, Il.  I'm pretty much addicted to the Chicken Fried Steak that comes with gravy, eggs, toast or pancakes and hash browns.My meal today was a disappointment because the eggs were terrible.  They were scrambled, but tasted old. Either the milk was expired or the eggs were expired or the fridge where they are stored is terribly dirty and the wet items are holding in a dirty odor/taste.To clarify, I didn't get sick, the taste was just bad and it wasn't due to poor cooking abilities. I'll still go back and give them another try because they know what they are doing when it comes to this meal. I recently ordered the same in Texas and it was terrible. They deserve another chance.

45.description: OK.. First most, I must say my party of five had a wonderful, wonderful, wonderful experience! Our server Daniel has one of the best customer service I have seen In a very long time.   He was friendly, knowledgeable, and professional the entire time from taking our order, answering our questions and even serving our tea and coffee.   I only wish all servers were as genuinely nice as Dan was us!   He has the right attitude and potential character that is always needed in this type of service and management.   Thank you Dan, if I could tip more then my 20% budget, then I would have loved to give you another 80‰.   People like you are the reason customers enjoy coming back. The food was great, we all were very happy with all our entrees.  The hostess(maybe shift manager?) was also very welcoming when he sat us down.   He had seated five of us, but only had four menus on the table.  And I did not even notice we were shorted, however his quick observation, he ran over and handed me a menu and apologized, and had me baffled to ask him why he was sorry, and he pointed out that I was missing my menu.  (thanks!).   Also, after finishing my meal, when I walked pass to the restroom to wash my hands he also had a friendly smile as I walked by.   I always appreciate a smiling gesture in any aisle when I see it! This was my first time in this restaurant, and see no reason why anyone shouldn't stop in by.  So be sure to stop by and enjoy the service and food!   I am sure many of you never came down this far to read the review.  But I hope even one person actually reads this.  It was well worth my time to say it.

33.description: Only 24 hour restaurant that I have never been disappointed by. Whether you're there at noon or 4am, there's a crowd (always a good sign). Their fries are amazing, as well as their pancakes and skillets *which are huge*. Will continue to go back as long as this place stays open.

43.description: 5 stars it is!  Cute diner opened 24 hours.  Fun atmosphere, love the plates and the mismatched chairs.  Place is clean too and that says alot for a 24 hour joint.  You must get their fresh squeezed OJ because it is freshly squeezed and you will love it.  Fruit plate in season is lovely.  Great entrees for breakfast or lunch or at 2:00 a.m.  Cheap too!  What's not to love?  Nothing I say.  Great place all around.

2.description: Ellys is pretty close to where I live so I figured why not check it out. When we walked in we were not greeted or seated.... Confused we just sat ourselves.... When menus were brought over they were basically just thrown on the table (still no greeting by any employee). We sat for about 10 minutes before even getting asked for a beverage order. Finally when an employee came over he immediately asked if we were ready to order (still no drinks).... When finally able to order beverages we were also ready to place a food order, but were only given time to order drinks. Another 10 minutes before we were able to order food. Regardless of the time, we finally got a good server- Omar was nice, polite, soft spoken, and attentive. There was one server whom we noticed on the floor who was not only rude to her current tables (whom we were sitting right next to) by mumbling comments and rolling her eyes when was asked for things by her tables (ex: they asked for a togo bag several times and from or server as well... When she finally came over with the bag she proceeded to yell across the floor "yah I know I know I had to go get it okay!?" To her table and other employees whom were reminding her. When her table waved her over she was half way across the room and said "what?" It took her about a min to actually walk up to her table to see what they needed... RUDE)! If we would have had her as a server we would have left. All that being said it was a bit over priced for the service provided... The food I received was cold upon arrival and was subpar at best. Maybe they were going through a shift change with employees at the time because others after us were being greeted and seated, but If it weren't for Omar being so kind unlike the other server on the floor at that time I don't think I would ever dine at Ellys again.

18.description: Had skirt steak, tasted good and cooked to order. Eggs ok, and hash browns tasty. Plenty of seating, close to Lincoln Park and zoo.

41.description: Disclaimer: I've never been to Elly's in person. I have, however, ordered it on Postmates countless times. Their chocolate chip pancakes are the best I've ever had and they have such a wide variety of food to pick from.

52.description: I took my daughter here and it was our first time and this place was great. The food was really good. My daughter didn't like the bicentennial but she loved pancakes, what I liked most was the customer service our waiter was Angelo and he was the best a really nice and funny person. He made suggestions and just made us feel welcome. The restaurant was clean and very inviting. Will be back.

50.description: Really poor service experience. The place was busy but not completely slammed and the service was poor. First the server never returned after delivering our food to check up on us and we couldn't find her for over 15 minutes to ask for the check. She forgot syrup, cholula that we requested. We had to ask for cutlery. One member of our table asked for a water to three different people and it was forgotten by all three. When we did get our check it was wrong as we asked the cash from one our members be taken off the bill and the remainder split between credit cards. The server brought the bill back completely wrong and had to get the manager involved. We were there for 2 hours mostly because of the poor service. The food was actually good but with many good brunch places in the city why waste your time on poor service.

4.description: They don't exactly call it the 4 deuces but they've got it! Great breakfast & good coffee!

6.description: I love eating at Elly's all over Chicagoland so much. I've eaten here for years and I was first introduced to Elly's at the Suburban location in Norridge, Il.  I'm pretty much addicted to the Chicken Fried Steak that comes with gravy, eggs, toast or pancakes and hash browns.My meal today was a disappointment because the eggs were terrible.  They were scrambled, but tasted old. Either the milk was expired or the eggs were expired or the fridge where they are stored is terribly dirty and the wet items are holding in a dirty odor/taste.To clarify, I didn't get sick, the taste was just bad and it wasn't due to poor cooking abilities. I'll still go back and give them another try because they know what they are doing when it comes to this meal. I recently ordered the same in Texas and it was terrible. They deserve another chance.

22.description: Tried Ellie's for the first time today --my Veggie Benedict was really delicious, and the servers were super nice. It's a no-frills place with tasty breakfast options --also good for groups (lots of seating). Would highly recommend and will be back!

15.description: Fantastic!  Always a crowd pleaser!  Lots of variety!  Lots of food!  Best diner anywhere!  Cool atmosphere!  Kid-friendly!

57.description: Elly's is fantastic 24 hours a day!Elly's is my favorite brunch spot in Chicago and that's saying something. A great spot for a leisurely brunch or a twilight milkshake, you really can't go wrong with Elly's.

20.description: Came at an odd time - 4 PM - and it was pretty empty. The service was super fast. Coffee and water were filled constantly. My chocolate chip pancakes were HUGE and delicious and reasonably priced.

36.description: The Mexican skillet with chorizo is very very good. Go during off hours though, this place gets packed and busy during peak days hours (sat and sun). I like that you also get pancakes too. Bonus.

14.description: They know how to poach eggs. That's an extremely high complement because it seems so simple and yet...so many places can't do it right. I ordered the potato benedict - hold the hollandaise - yes I'm THAT person. Just don't like hollandaise. I also got it with hash browns cuz - potatoes, people, potatoes. Needed to do a cross-check on delicious-nuss of potato pancakes vs. hash browns. The pancakes win..hands down. No question. So after removing the bacon from the benedict and handing it to hubby, ate my poached eggs on my potato pancakes and lived in heaven for the next hour.

58.description: My friends and I walked in on a weeknight for some appetizers and drinks.  The waiter took one look at us and decided he hated us.  I realize we're young, but we are willing to tip well with good service.  He asked us questions in a very snotty tone, and generally made us all uncomfortable.We were not provided with a beer list, which sucks because they don't carry some major beer brand names.  Also, it's embarrassing to order a beer and have a snotty waiter look at you like you're dirt for ordering Miller (which I ordered in the hopes that it would be on the cheap side, seeing as how the rest of the menu is way overpriced).The appetizers were good, but not worth the cost.  You can get food that's just as good for less money in several restaurants in the immediate area.The restaurant could have earned a passable 3 stars if it weren't for our waiter.  By the way, waiter, if you happen to read this, you immediately judged us as poor tippers when we walked in, so you gave us poor service.  You were right, we were poor tippers, but you made that happen with your bad attitude.You might enjoy this restaurant if you have a ton of money (maybe the wait staff will judge you as worthy of better service), but you are better off spending that money somewhere else.

56.description: Sort of underwhelming.  Service was kind of inattentive and distracted (although, in fairness, I think we came in around shift change).  Although it is difficult to pin down what makes the place so..."meh", I suppose...is that it feels like a chain restaurant, complete with uninspired menu choices and ambiance, and disinterested servers.  As for the food, it was a slight step up from, say, Applebee's (which I have nothing but contempt for).  We had the hummus and wings to start.  Wings were pretty standard (can't fault them for my particular taste in apps), the hummus was most likely from a very large, very rarely used container.  Not great. If we weren't famished, I'dve probably sent it back.  But, we persevered.  My wife had the shepard's pie, which was good, if unremarkable.  I ordered the fish and chips and a side of mac and cheese.  You can imagine my surprise when I got the fish...no chips...and a side of mac and cheese.  Perhaps a miscommunication, but it seems like an attentive server would have picked up on the inherent lunacy of ordering fish and chips and getting, in fact, no chips.  That said, the fish was on the greasy/dense from overcooking side, and the mac and cheese wasn't worth the loss of my beloved chips.  "Why didn't you just ask for chips?" You ask.  It took twenty minutes to get hummus and wings.  It was a judgment call.  Overall, I get it.  There was no wait, it was reasonably comfortable, and, to my complete lack of surprise, utterly average in about every way.  And the thing about "average" places is that I usually won't go back.  I'll give a restaurant where I've had a terrible experience another try if I think they've had an off night, but O'Brien's?  Just cannot fathom a reason to ever return.  Just too many other options in the city.

29.description: We went while on vacation in Chicago, after looking for a long time for a place to have dinner since we were starving. The food was good, and the price were not that bad. However, we felt uncomfortable since they gave us a table out in the terrace in the cold ( although they have a heater, a really bad one btw) and with holes dripping water on us, because according to them they didn't have table inside. The funny thing is that we saw how they gave people arriving after us tables inside, without any reservations! I'm only giving them one star since the food was good. But if I find myself again in Chicago I wouldn't go again to this place.

42.description: Service was extremely slow. We kept waving down someone to get our server, our drinks took over 10 mins to arrive at our table.  The grilled calamari was served cold, they apologized but, returned with microwaved calamari (rubbery).  The only thing I'd recommend would be the rack of lamb and bread pudding for dessert (hence the 2 stars).

23.description: I have to say the reviews comprising this 2.5 star average are outdated and wrong. My wife works in Gold Coast and her co-workers decided to have a group dinner here. Once I new the location I of course looked it up on Yelp and scoffed at the choice. What a moron was I. (I blame you guys) A co-worker offered us a ride and despite the signs that say valet parking is $12, The restaurant validates for up to 2.5 hours. Convenient for Old Town on a Friday. When you walk in there are small tables in front of the bar, tables outside when the weather is nice and other tables with tablecloths and paper on top (I find that tacky, either have tablecloths or not. Don't half-ass it). Our group was seated promptly but I don't know the reservation details and we met a member who had been there. What is important is they don't give you crap about incomplete parties. Service was excellent.  Just going to state that. Now food. Half of use ordered the prime rib special. I said it was a work meal right? Those dishes were perfectly cooked as ordered as it should be for that dish (it is cooked in advance). Horseradish sauce was the perfect compliment and my garlic mashed potatoes were very good, though quite light. No skins on these spuds!My wife ordered the shepherds pie. It was very tasty. great potatoes, meat, and vegetables. Desert was paid for so, yum. Priced around $7 they were all very tasty. We had people order the creme brule, chocolate Swiss cake, bread pudding, and apple fritters. I'd beat describe this place as a good place to bring your out of town parents before taking them to second city for a decent dinner that hopefully they pay for.

47.description: Grilled calamari is amazing.  Everything else....standard pub-type food.

8.description: Skip this place, Chicago has a lot more to offer than this.  Service terrible, food just as bad.

31.description: I went here with my husband since we didn't want to wait for 40 minutes at the other restaurant we plan to go to. So I pass by here many times and never tried it. The service wasn't that good and the food was alright. My husband said he had better burgers elsewhere. I had the salmon with quinoa and it was ok because I thought the dish lack a little in flavor. To me the restaurant is more for like fish and chips and ribs. I don't think I would recommend this place to others.

34.description: I had the mozzarella salad and Cobb salad.  Everything was pretty good. We sat outside, the service was pretty decent so no complaints.  I think this place is worthy of 4 stars.

16.description: Tried O'Brians even though it had 2 1/2 stars, 'cause it was close. It was good, had appetizer & beer. Give it a try.

13.description: The food was reasonable. Nothing too extraordinary, but I'd eat it again.  The service was great and patio is beautiful.  Very well priced.

11.description: No stars if I could. We sat outside, but from the brief glimpse on the inside the place looked ancient (not in the way that it was a newer place made to look ancient). Carpet has not been changed since the place opened, I am assuming. I stall in the bathrooms- why?1- I am pretty sure the busser was waiting our table. He had to keep running back to the restaurant to find out the answers to my questions regarding the beers they have. C'monnow.2-If I wanted over cooked, Jewel jumbo shrimp lathered with a hot sauce, I would go to Jewel, buy some jumbo shrimp, overcook them and lather in a hot sauce. Needless to say, we chugged our beer and headed out to get some food.The Positive:It is summer in Chicago. Hot day and being able to sit outside to enjoy the weather. I'll give em that- they have a good location.

39.description: Wow!  Can't believe it's been 5 years since I reviewed this place as we come here almost every week for brunch, lunch or just drinks on the patio.O'Brien's can be counted on for delivering on a huge menu of items in a very consistent way.  My favorite visit?  Out on the patio for weekend lunch or brunch.  There is this amazing server out there named Tommy- who clearly loves what he does and take pride in it.  I know, when he is in charge of our table, that things are going to go exactly right and we are going to have a great visit!Take for example- my most recent experience.  I was on a crazy food program that had me specially ordering like  a bad "Saturday Night Live" comedic piece.  Tommy took it all in stride and the food came out exactly as I had asked- many things weren't even on the menu in the format I needed but I was accommodated in every sense of the word!  Gotta love that!If you drive- know that there is free valet parking located just south of the restaurant (remember to get your ticket stamped as 2.5 hours are free with the stamp or it's $12)  That's a great deal!All in all- O'Briens has quickly become that "go to" place that we chose time and time again when simplicity, good food and better service is all that we want!

37.description: Painfully slow service. Place was empty and waitress spent the evening chatting at the busboy stand. Had to get up and approach her multiple times to get waited on throughout the evening. Took 30 minutes to pay our bill and had to search the waitress out to finalize the transaction after the check came.

0.description: I have to write this review before I forget about this place. It's about as unmemorable as it gets. I came in on a nice warm Sunday afternoon and it was completely empty. I mean, there were about 2 other tables and it was dead quiet inside. We got seated and served quickly enough, but our table of five was soon forgotten as we finished our drinks and began a long period of concern, wondering if our waiter was ok. In an effort to distract myself from my thirst, I glanced at the dozens of pictures on the wall of what I could only assume were local Chicago TV personalities. Black and white and decades old, they had short, cheesy quips about how great O'briens is. For a moment I thought I had been transported into a Hooters, except there were no hooters in sight, much less our waiter. When the waiter finally returned from the dead, our party was ready to depart. The next time I'm in the mood for a Guinness, I'll try to find a real Irish pub.

38.description: Great outdoor seating area, however the servers were not very attentive for it not being a very busy night and only a few tables in outdoor area had people there. Menu is of an average selection. I didn't see anything on the menu that I also couldn't find somewhere else. I got the BBQ Pork Sandwich ( $13). I had it with sweet potato fries. The sandwich was good but nothing special. The BBQ sauce seems very general and the sandwich was not very flavorful. Sweet potato fries were good.

51.description: Went for lunch, sat in patio area at the outdoor bar. Had great service, was greeted and welcomed by the general mgr and had a nice prune rib sandwich and some beers. Great ambiance in patio and would go again in a heartbeat.

27.description: My girlfriend and I went in with low expectations and were still disappointed.  The food looked bad so I went with a burger which was similar to what you'd get in a high school cafeteria.  Super greasy without the benefit of any flavor.  I forget what she had but she didn't even eat more than like 2 bites.  The people were fairly nice and I know this is an old town institution... so they get a bonus star.  Otherwise it'd be 1.

32.description: Really nice outdoor eating area spoiled by average food and below average service. Would come back to drink outside but not to eat.

54.description: we were looking for a casual drink after a second city show and their patio worked out well for us. service was slow and impatient but beer selection was good.

48.description: The good: Pretty good food, but the prices are iffy. Got seated immediately, decent menu options. Everything about the food overall was average. Not bad, not great.The bad: The service was pretty sub-par. Took us 25 minutes to get the check, another 20 to get our orders in. Luckily the bread held us over until our food arrived.Overall: There are better options in the area. Try something else, but if all else fails O'Brien's isn't terrible by any means.

44.description: Good food.  Nothing amazing but good.  Who ever said the Irish knows how to cook?    Great location.  Good casual lunch place.  Even better in summer.

24.description: Not sure why there are so many negative reviews about this place. Maybe I just had good luck on the day that I went. Came here for lunch at around 1 o'clock in the afternoon on a weekday. Server took a little while to come over to our table, and I'll admit that his attentiveness was a little less than stellar. However, our order was correct, the food was very good, and the atmosphere was great. I would definitely consider coming back again!

7.description: Poor service...we waited too long for our server to ask us what we wanted. Food was mediocre.

49.description: Incredible Mac and Cheese and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Great experience!

40.description: Great patio, and beautiful dining room. Lame menu....this place lacks soul and character and the food is very basic.

53.description: Hadn't been here in a while despite the fact that I live in the neighborhood, but was out with another couple that couldn't agree on where to go when our first choice for lunch (Topo Gigio) was not open.  Bottom line is the food here is incredibly average to below average, and a bit pricey for what you get.  While it is much nicer inside since they remodeled, it will be another 8-10 years before I give them another shot.

30.description: Service great, couldn't have asked for better. Food, on the other hand, simply dreadful. Really stale  bread rolls, salty soup, sandwich barely mediocre - almost in edible. The two stars is because the service was 5 but food -1

46.description: My husband and I ate lunch at O'Briens last week while in Chicago.  The food was very good.  I ordered a rueben; it was so large that I was only able to eat half of it and saved the other half for lunch the next day.  It came with a decent sized bowl of good coleslaw. My husband ordered the chicken pot pie and pronounced it very good; he polished off the whole thing.  I don't remember the waiter's name, but the service was good; he was attentive, kept my water glass full, and was very personable..  The highlight of this restaurant was the manager, Jim Thompson.  When we entered the restaurant, we had some snow on us; he offered to take our coats and put them under a heater to dry them;  I have never had this offered to me in any restaurant. He made several trips to our area of the restaurant to ask if people were warm enough...it was a cold, blustery day.  He stopped by our table to ask if everything was ok.  He asked us where we were from, and when we told him, he said he had gone to college in our town.  He used to work at a restaurant on the next block from my husband's business!!  We knew several of the same people, so it was an interesting conversation.  We told him we were on our way to our daughter's house in Omaha; he recommended a restaurant chain there where he used to be employed.  After leaving, we immediately forgot the name of the restaurant chain and sent him an email asking for it; he responded right away.  We thoroughly enjoyed talking to him and eating at this restaurant; we plan to stop there again on our next trip to Chicago.

1.description: Service was great. They don't know how to pour a Guinness.You gotta wait for it. Guinness is worth waiting for. I was embarrassed for you.

55.description: This is every chain place you've every been too minus that flair on the walls and waiters/waitress. The food is about 1-2 dollars over priced and standard. When you're hungry and want something familiar and plain this is your spot. When you want something flarorful and satisfying keep moving

9.description: A dumpy Irish pub that doesn't know how to pour guinness. It's just sad.

26.description: We ate here 12/24/2014 and we sat in front by the street/window. This was one of the few place open on Christmas Eve and it was the first time we have eaten here. We ordered a varity of lunch items. Crab cakes, chicken, old town burger, stuffed mushroom and all were very good. We would eat here again. Our receipt says our server was #1031 Ashley and she did a great job.

25.description: I've lived in the neighborhood for 18 months and thought that despite the dated and tacky decor (and accompanying low expectations), I would give O'Briens a chance as it's a local place and I like to support local business. I now wish that I hadn't. The turkey burger was the stuff of nightmares: muddy and grey, the weight, texture and color of a shot-puck. The bun was as stale as the decor. The sweet potato fries were soggy and straight out of the freezer. Given my expectations were low to begin with, I can't say I'm surprised. I forced myself to have a few bites and then I gave up. Suffice it to say, I shall not be returning. The bad food aside, I'm mostly appalled that places like O'Brien's continue to thrive on delivering plates of mediocrity, to a willing public. Just because something has been there for a million years doesn't give it the right to be complacent. If a place like O'Brien's can't be bothered to make food from scratch or get a turkey burger even half-right, it does not deserve the longevity and prized patio spot that it currently enjoys. Tonight, however, there was no sunshine to disguise the plate of inedible treachery that awaited. Just me, the questionable patty and the murky light of the sad interior. PS I will be burping those bites for a good few hours and therefore re-living that ghastly experience for the rest of the evening.

12.description: Last night a group of friends came here for drinks and dinner. After the waitress returned 20+ minutes later with our drinks with no explanation what took so long, we decided to get the check and leave. After went to a different restaurant to eat.Terrible service, there's a million better places in the area - there's a reason there's so many open seats in the restaurant.

59.description: I came with my cousin during restaurant week, $44 for the 3-course prix fixe menu.  Crab cakes where great, as was the salmon and bread pudding.  The house wine was also nice.  I'm happy I was finally able to try this place

21.description: We were hesitant on going with all of the bad reviews but ended up really enjoying this place. We had a great server, she knew we were on a time crunch and got us in and out pretty fast. Tuesday's are half price on bottles of wine  So that was a nice surprise. We opted to split the almond crusted whitefish with asparagus and it was delish. They even split it for us in the kitchen without charging us.

17.description: High hopes for this place, it was decorated nicely for the holidays. Should have taken a hint when all of the surrounding places had a wait time of 1.5hrs, and this place, we walked in and was sat immediately. The service is very, very slow, unfortunately. We waited for the bill for awhile after our plates were cleared. I only can vouch for the chicken noodle soup, which was okay; salty and overpriced, but good. The spinach and artichoke dip was chunky, and served with carrots, which I thought was a bit quirky. The presentation of the dishes was appalling; everything just slapped together on a plate and served. The busboy was very quick - the waitress was not attentive and slow. She sort of slapped the bill down without even a thank you. Not the best hospitality, very disappointed in this place, both service and food wise.

10.description: We were hesitant on going with all of the bad reviews but ended up really enjoying this place. We had a great server, she knew we were on a time crunch and got us in and out pretty fast. Tuesday's are half price on bottles of wine  So that was a nice surprise. We opted to split the almond crusted whitefish with asparagus and it was delish. They even split it for us in the kitchen without charging us.

5.description: Summertime chi in old town on Wells street brings me back to the crazy party college years I didn't experience. Lol...this street is such a party atmosphere and is always packed. We stopped here cause we needed outside seating to accommodate my friends dog and we were able to snag a table for four. The older gentlemen host that sat us was so sweet and helped us keep an eye out to get a table. Now there's nothing spectacular cause it's your normal bar food. I had the steak sandwich with fries and I thought it was pretty yummy and reasonable priced. My friends also enjoyed there meals (Cobb salad, crab cakes, calamari) Next time I will definitely try the spinach dip. Oh....this place is right next door to the fudge shop...only downfall. Lol...love that place!

3.description: Went on a nice weekend evening and sat outside near the sidewalk. I wasn't too hungry so I just got an appetizer and soup. The Buffalo shrimp was really good - I assumed they would be fried but they were grilled and just tossed with some buffalo sauce - pretty good but it came out room temperature and I had to ask for ranch even though it was listed on the menu. The French onion soup was excellent - big croutons, lots of cheese, good flavor. My only complaint here was that it was extremely salty. Prices were fair for a place right on Wells in Old Town.

35.description: Food and atmosphere ok, nothing special.

19.description: We went while on vacation in Chicago, after looking for a long time for a place to have dinner since we were starving. The food was good, and the price were not that bad. However, we felt uncomfortable since they gave us a table out in the terrace in the cold ( although they have a heater, a really bad one btw) and with holes dripping water on us, because according to them they didn't have table inside. The funny thing is that we saw how they gave people arriving after us tables inside, without any reservations! I'm only giving them one star since the food was good. But if I find myself again in Chicago I wouldn't go again to this place.

28.description: Came for a NYE dinner because of all of our favorite places were closed for private events. The service was good but I would equate my meal to a VERY expensive cafeteria meal. $20 for cold rubbery "lemon" chicken and $45 for three tiny nuggets of cold beef and two small scallops.

45.description: I visit O'Brien's about once or twice a month, for either lunch or dinner. I work just down the street and the menu is great for either occasion. The staff really is top notch, and the manager (maybe owner?) seems to always be around and stops by the table and thanks us for coming. My go-to is the Shepherd's Pie- so tasty, and always enough for leftovers. Most recently I had the French Onion Soup for lunch- loved it! I'm sad to see this place get so many crummy reviews, because I have always had a great experience, and love the food. Give it a try, you won't be sorry!

33.description: I went on Sunday noon with 2 other friends and we had great hamburgers....I loved the corn baked with butter....it's amazing....There is space out side as well as indoor tables.I really like this place! :)

43.description: Great food.  Exceptional service.  Perfect place for lunch or dinner.  It's a winner!

2.description: Just don't. Go anywhere else. Unmemorable everything. Except the service. Awful.

18.description: 2 steaks that should have been the cooked the same - were vastly different. Whitefish was super dry

41.description: General: cool looking place, lots of outdoor seating. Tough location since there are many bars and restaurants nearby.Angus burger: standard, nothing fancy or exceptional. Sweet potato fries were good.Fish and chips: very good, not too much batter. Fish was good quality.Lowdown: not too crowded for Old Town, which is nice. A tad more of a formal atmosphere.

52.description: O'Brien's is a reliable place for a traditional menu in a pleasant setting.  We came here with my Dad, who lives in the neighborhood.  With patrons seated both outside and inside, as well as at the bar, the restaurant seemed a bit short-staffed for the number of customers.  As a result, our server kept us waiting longer than was comfortable for us, but manager Jim Thompson gets kudos for spotting the situation, coming to our rescue and taking our order himself.

50.description: This place is huge and reminded me of a great big Bennigan's.  And there are limited bathrooms for the ladies - one stall only on the main level, one stall upstairs.  Yes, that's right. ONE STALL!  I asked about it and because it's such an old building, there isn't much that can be done. Lavatory situation aside,  my chopped salad was good but forgettable.  I had a crab cake that was okay - it wasn't very hot temperature wise but did appear to have nice size chunks of crab.    It was very, very dark where we were seated, in the back room.  There's seating outside which would be lovely on temperate days.  All in all, it was an average meal at an average restaurant.

4.description: I went to O'briens after Chicago's Air and Water show and found it to be a standard pub. Many of the past reviews picked on the dated interior but I mean, it is a part of Chicago's Old Town neighborhood right?? I was a fan of the wooden paneling, high ceiling top and cleanliness. The rustiness gave it a great 20s look and feel. The menu has your standard Irish pub offerings: burgers, seafood, steak, sandwiches and some favorites like Chicken Pot Pie and Shepherd's Pie. I went for a burger and was really impressed with the size of that thing. The fries were also PERFECT. When I eat a burger I have certain expectations with the fries and O'briens' steak fries hit the nail on the head for me. The prices also seemed reasonable. Sadly, the service was not great. Our waiter took way too long to take our order, get our food and drinks, and give us the check. It wasn't that busy either. He also did not greet our table of four and frankly, just didn't seem all that interested in helping us. You could probably get better service up the street.

6.description: I have to say the reviews comprising this 2.5 star average are outdated and wrong. My wife works in Gold Coast and her co-workers decided to have a group dinner here. Once I new the location I of course looked it up on Yelp and scoffed at the choice. What a moron was I. (I blame you guys) A co-worker offered us a ride and despite the signs that say valet parking is $12, The restaurant validates for up to 2.5 hours. Convenient for Old Town on a Friday. When you walk in there are small tables in front of the bar, tables outside when the weather is nice and other tables with tablecloths and paper on top (I find that tacky, either have tablecloths or not. Don't half-ass it). Our group was seated promptly but I don't know the reservation details and we met a member who had been there. What is important is they don't give you crap about incomplete parties. Service was excellent.  Just going to state that. Now food. Half of use ordered the prime rib special. I said it was a work meal right? Those dishes were perfectly cooked as ordered as it should be for that dish (it is cooked in advance). Horseradish sauce was the perfect compliment and my garlic mashed potatoes were very good, though quite light. No skins on these spuds!My wife ordered the shepherds pie. It was very tasty. great potatoes, meat, and vegetables. Desert was paid for so, yum. Priced around $7 they were all very tasty. We had people order the creme brule, chocolate Swiss cake, bread pudding, and apple fritters. I'd beat describe this place as a good place to bring your out of town parents before taking them to second city for a decent dinner that hopefully they pay for.

22.description: My date and I were early going to Second City.We decided to stop here. Turned out to be an excellent  choice. Very good service from start to end. We ordered a couple of appetizers, crab cakes, calmari, and some wine. Food was very good, prepared well.Wine selection was ample. I would recommend  anyone to stop and try this place.

15.description: Wow!  Can't believe it's been 5 years since I reviewed this place as we come here almost every week for brunch, lunch or just drinks on the patio.O'Brien's can be counted on for delivering on a huge menu of items in a very consistent way.  My favorite visit?  Out on the patio for weekend lunch or brunch.  There is this amazing server out there named Tommy- who clearly loves what he does and take pride in it.  I know, when he is in charge of our table, that things are going to go exactly right and we are going to have a great visit!Take for example- my most recent experience.  I was on a crazy food program that had me specially ordering like  a bad "Saturday Night Live" comedic piece.  Tommy took it all in stride and the food came out exactly as I had asked- many things weren't even on the menu in the format I needed but I was accommodated in every sense of the word!  Gotta love that!If you drive- know that there is free valet parking located just south of the restaurant (remember to get your ticket stamped as 2.5 hours are free with the stamp or it's $12)  That's a great deal!All in all- O'Briens has quickly become that "go to" place that we chose time and time again when simplicity, good food and better service is all that we want!

57.description: A quiet environment for brunch. The food was ok, I had the Bacon Wrapped Meatloaf, my only critique is it could have used a bit more salt.

20.description: Summertime chi in old town on Wells street brings me back to the crazy party college years I didn't experience. Lol...this street is such a party atmosphere and is always packed. We stopped here cause we needed outside seating to accommodate my friends dog and we were able to snag a table for four. The older gentlemen host that sat us was so sweet and helped us keep an eye out to get a table. Now there's nothing spectacular cause it's your normal bar food. I had the steak sandwich with fries and I thought it was pretty yummy and reasonable priced. My friends also enjoyed there meals (Cobb salad, crab cakes, calamari) Next time I will definitely try the spinach dip. Oh....this place is right next door to the fudge shop...only downfall. Lol...love that place!

36.description: It's pretty difficult to screw up a burger and fries, but O'Brien's unfortunately did just that. Got the blue cheese burger with crispy onions (that were soft and not crispy). Ordered it medium rare and had it served it well done. The menu promised steak seasoning which was nonexistent. Came with only a pinch of blue cheese that was so mild I could barely taste it. Pretzel bun was also off - not a good choice for a blue cheese burger. Didn't finish the burger and noticed my buddy only ate half of his. Sweet potato fries were decent. Place is wildly overpriced too. The only thing I would suggest going here for is a beer on the patio which is quite spacious and nice, especially for people watching.

14.description: Seated on the Riverwalk and NOTHING happened. I mean, got some chicken wings right away, but just because they were not mine. I spent 1 hour at the place, with 2 toddlers and not even the chicken tenders I ordered to them arrived! At that one hour I got one lemonade and 1 mojito (that took 30 min to get to the table). Nice location, BAD BAD BAD service!

58.description: It is truly great to be experiencing all the places in Old Town.  Loved this place and tasting all the oils and vinegars.  Now, typically I get to do this in Napa or Sonoma but, being in the neighborhood and tasting was great.Staff here are terribly friendly.  If you're in the neighborhood, you got to check this out.

56.description: LOVE this place.  Just moved into the neighborhood and can't imagine going anywhere else for olive oil and balsamic vinegar.  I got an 18 year aged balsamic and an extra virgin olive oil from Leccino.  Yum!  I'll definitely be back again and again to get my bottles refilled.

29.description: I want to highlight to everyone the impeccable customer service at Old Town Oil. Brian is not only passionate and knowledgeable, but stands by his product and service 100%. I had one very minor shipping issue and he completely blew me away with how he handled the situation. Brian is willing to go out of his way in insure customer satisfaction. I've been ordering from Old Town Oil for 2 years after visiting the shop in person. This product is unbeatable at the price and truly fantastic for anyone who enjoys cooking, making their own salad dressings, marinade's, or just completely carbing-out on an entire baguette dunked in amazing oil & vinegar combos. Long live Old Town Oil.

42.description: Open the door and you are hit with the fact that this place only sells oil and vinegar, no joke. I uneasy in a place that reeked elitist gastrological splendor. We discovered how very wrong this assumption was.The black apron clad staff were amazingly friendly - knowledgeable - and willing to pour mini nut cups packed full of flavor. After the first toss of oil into the back of my throat I was sold. The hardest part was not buying a bottle of each creation. We settled on the walnut oil, lemon oil and red apple balsamic vinegar.After it was all said and done we decided that this place would be a perfect date destination followed by the Spice house and then dinner at your place.WE WILL BE BACK.

23.description: Old Town Oil is an excellent place to find high quality olive oils and balsamic vinegars.  If you're ready to move on from the supermarket stuff or shopping for a unique gift for a foodie, this is the place to hit up.  The store is lined with kegs of imported oils and vinegars all of which you can sample for  yourself.   I was a little overwhelmed by the selection on my first visit but their knowledgeable staff helped guide me by explaining each unique flavor profiles and offering tastes.  I eventually settled on the smooth, buttery hojiblanca EVOO from Spain and the peach infused balsamic vinegar.  But I had a little buyers remorse later after tasting the 18 year aged balsamic...phenomenal!  Never tasted any balsamic this good, even at high end restaurants.  Easily the best item in the store.  The prices are reasonable considering the quality of the product and when compared to similar specialty shops.  Balsamic vinegars keep for a while and because theirs are so rich, a little goes a long way.  Their olive oils are meant for dipping in bread or finishing dishes where you'll be able to taste and appreciate the delicate flavor.  As an added bonus, they'll knock off a few dollars from your next purchase when you refill your empty bottles.

47.description: I completely agree with the awesome reviews of the 18 year balsamic vinegar.  It's so good and a little goes a long way so although it's not cheap, you don't need to use much.  I added the vinegar to a spinach salad on Christmas and everyone raved that the salad was five-star restaurant quality.  I wish I could take credit , but it was all the vinegar!I had a great time walking around the store tasting different oils and vinegars until I could find exactly what I was looking for.  The sales clerk was very helpful, asking after each taste whether I was looking for something lighter/fruitier so he could direct me to what I wanted.  In the end, it was the Spanish oil that won.Stop in here before or after The Spice House and you'll be set to cook an incredible meal!

8.description: As a self-proclaimed foodie, I love all sorts of bakeries and specialty food stores. Old Town Oil is a great spot to find gourmet quality oils and vinegars in all flavors. The staff when I entered greeted me pleasantly and immediately explained how to mix and sample any oil and vinegar flavors I wanted (lemon oil with pomegranate vinegar was a delicious combo!) before buying. I would have tried every one if I wasn't positive I'd get a tummy ache from chugging down vinaigrette. Once you select an oil or vinegar, the staff bottles and seals it right in front of you from the same drum you sampled, so you know the flavor is exactly what you tasted. I purchased a bottle of blackberry ginger balsamic vinegar for about $17, and have tried it already in a fish marinade - tasty! I would go back for a flavored oil too!

31.description: I think I have a new favorite birthday gift store. I wandered in here after being given an amazing oil and vinegar combo as a gift of my own. I loved the super friendly service and trying all the recommended combos of oil and vinegar was really interesting (and yummy, for the most part). They have a water cooler to cleanse your palate after each tasting, and if there's something that they don't necessarily recommend after hearing about your taste preferences, they'll tell you. Also, they do a bottle exchange, so after you purchase, remember to bring back those empty bottles for a discount on your next purchase (I think he mentioned $2 off?). If you have a foodie friend with a birthday, or someone you just like a lot, get thee to Old Town Oil! Stat.

34.description: Let me begin by stating I did not walk in here looking like a big spender. I was wearing errand running clothes, ran in, the woman working asked if she could help me, and I said, "I'm just looking for some truffle oil"."I'm so sorry but we are completely out. You see, we don't have a reliable supplier." Then another sales person there joined in from the side, they were both explaining the unreliability of their supplier. Then the first lady said, "here, here is the store manager, he will talk to you."Really summoning the store manager was not necessary. I was totally okay. The Spice House two doors away had white truffle oil and I knew it. Either these employees were very nice people, or someone had mistreated them the last time they ran out of truffle oil. I felt kinda famous when the manager offered his apologies and advice (btw, there might be some there this Tuesday or Wednesday. Get it, yelpers!)So, customer service is above and beyond. Because they were so darn nice, I stayed and browsed a little, and I know I will be back. The variety is unsurpassed as far as I've seen; and you can taste all of the oils and vinegars. They have flavored balsamic vinegars, too. I'm pretty excited to treat myself and my greens to some new flavor.The bottles are pretty enough to give as gifts, and if you are a regular, you can bring back your bottle and get a $2 discount off your next bottle. Then they recycle the bottle. Cool, but call first if you need truffle oil.

16.description: They have free samples of their oil.  And they will combine flavors for you to sample, as well.  So I pretty much leave the store with a full belly each time.The staff is friendly and helpful, and they will recommend which oils to pair with certain dishes if you ask.  I love cooking, and the oils I've purchased here are an excellent addition.  Lots of flavor.I haven't tried their other products, like the salsa.  So I'd like to possibly see some samples of that being offered.  Other than that, it's a fun little shop.

13.description: high quality oils and vinegars. If you love to cook and try new flavors this is it for you.these vinegars can go on so much more than just salad. I have tried a few of them on the suggestion of staff on ice cream or coffee cake and although skeptical at first I was amazed and how good it was!The staff is friendly and helpful and will show you what mixes work, as well as what they are good on. my favs for vinegars are pomegranate, blueberry. strawberry, blackberry ginger, and cinnamon pear.my fav oils are the blood orange, roasted walnut, and basil.mixing blood orange with most of my fav oils is like a flavor explosion. I also love to mix the basil oil and strawberry vinegar - great on salads. including with bruschetta or a drizzle over a caprese.
