11.description: Stopped in here the other day and ended up walking out with a gift for my mom and mother in law in addition to what I was getting for myself. The man behind the counter was very friendly and  he encouraged me to sample all of the oils and vinegar's. It is a great place to get authentic oil & vinegar and it makes for great gifts. I will definitely be going back to Old Town Oil as soon as I need more O&V.

39.description: Love Old Town's selection of oils and vinagrettes. Really remarkable pairings. They make great gifts for foodie friends and for people I want to give made-in-Chicago gifts (same for the Spice Shop a few doors south).  Would give a 5 rating but downgrading to a 4 due to service. Staff is knowledgeable and helpful but in all the times I've been there I've sensed that the salespeople are paid on commission or are at least in competition with each other, which makes for a little uneasy shopping experience. But alas I still go back, the products are so good.

37.description: 3rd stop on the food tour, we sampled many of the olive oils. Pricy but much better than expected for an oil based place.

0.description: Stopped in here yesterday to collect some presents for Christmas. The guy working (owner?) helpfully showed me around, suggested different combinations, and offered me some samples. Super helpful and friendly! They have a good selection of different oils and balsamic vinegars. Definitely check out if you like to cook (or eat!).Also this stuck out to me: a lady came in to drop off her bottles, but didn't buy anything. She almost walked out but he called her back to give her a coupon for her bottles. Really great customer service.

38.description: Great store!! The staff is great and remembers us every time we come in.  They really take the time to educate on where the oils come from and how to mix them, etc.  I highly recommend!

51.description: Last night was my first time in Old Town Oil. It was really fun trying all the different oils and vinegars (white peach vinegar was my favorite!)  and I actually purchased a Christmas gift for my mother there. I picked up a set of 5 different oils and vinegars and worked with an employee to cherry pick from various sets to create a balanced set of oils and vinegars that compliment the kinds of food my mom cooks.They were so helpful and it was a fun way to spend some time trying different flavors and learning about mixology of oil and vinegar!

27.description: Having paid a visit down the street to the spice house, friends of mine told me that I needed to go here as well. Granted, it wasn't like it was gonna take much as I do loves me some good olive oil and balsamic vinegar. So, I just needed to find out for myself.Its pretty bare in old town oil to an extent. But, what's cool is that they have a whole bunch of olive oil tanks in the middle of the store. You can taste a small bit from these to figure out what you want. The range of olive oils was awesome and I was having a hard time figuring out what exactly I wanted. The balsamic area is towards the back of the store and is just like the olive oils. What was great was that the guy who was there was showing me the different combos that you can do with the oils and vinegars.Old town oil isn't cheap. You aren't coming in here to get any old olive oil, you are coming in here to get really good olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The prices aren't excessive at all for what you are getting, but be prepared to spend around $18ish on a bottle of olive oil or vinegar. So, be sure to only use it when it counts. All I can say is count me as a customer that will come in whenever I need some more olive oil or vinegar.

32.description: Beware - you might get a stomach ache from tasting every oil and vinegar in the shop.  You will not be able to resist trying each one, and then trying each one again.  You are doing your salad an injustice by putting general dressing on it, if it is good, you'll treat it with Old Town Oil's 18 year aged Balsamic Vinegar.  It has an unbelievable taste, that you just need to try for yourself.  They will recommend tasty combinations of oil & vinegar, and do not be surprised if you walk out with a couple of bottles.  You will not be sorry.  Then go visit the Spice House next door to continue your culinary adventures...

54.description: Love this store! You won't understand until you actually experience it yourself. An absolutely fabulous selection of oils and vinegars. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. I'm buying all Aunts and Grandmas' holiday gifts here.

48.description: The products they sell here are fantastic, pure and simple.BUT.... Old Town Oil is pretty much the same store as The Olive Tap (in Downer's Grove and Long Grove).  If you're looking to save $20 on a gift and have some time to go to the 'burbs, I'd suggest going there for:- Lower prices (by $15 for prepacked basket gifts)- Reasonable sales taxThe Olive Tap gets the exact same flavors of oil and balsamics as Old Town Oil, and they're bottled identically and distributed from the same place in California.  I mentioned this to the sales woman at Old Town Oil and she said the stores are "like cousins" but different.  As far as I could see, the difference was only in cost and attitude.

44.description: I recently took a vacay to Chicago and did the Near North food tour (reviewed separately). One of the stops on the tour was Old Town Oil. We really did enough time spent here to try the many, many varieties of olive oil and balsamic vinegar. I would say they had approximately 9ish balsamic vinegars and about twice as many olive oils. I have to admit I do not know as much about either as other people, but I can say the store seemed very clean and was very cute. They had a lot of interesting flavors from blood orange to white peach to apple to toasted walnuts to fig to Meyer lemon and savory flavors like sage and garlic. I have already forgotten which were vinegar flavors and which were olive oil flavors, my head is swimming with all the amazing flavors. The 18 year aged balsamic vinegar was sweet enough to drink like a dessert (probably a bit too thick to hahaha). The apple balsamic vinegar with the toasted walnut olive oil is an especially tasty combo.

24.description: When not scouting for a new eatery to patronize, this narrator cooks at home. Olive oil is a staple just about every one of my dishes, so if I find a place that specializes in the craft, lets just say I've found a bit of heaven!Enter Old Town Oil.They have a charming collection of olive oils and vinegars. The staff will be most willing to help you mix varieties to see which ones suit your taste best. My two personal favorites are the Walnut Oil with Blueberry Balsamic. The only reason why I gave this place four stars instead of five is that two small bottles will set you back over $30. Even for a specialty store, that's pricey.Use sparingly to flavor your food!

7.description: I've been a customer of OTO since it first opened around 2007. It is such a great concept; a small store, with a well curated selection of quality products. I buy both the olive oil and the balsamic and use for cooking as well as dressing for my salads. There's really nothing better. In addition, the staff is very friendly. They are most helpful when preparing gifts and choosing pairings. The oils are well priced.

49.description: Stumbled in here on my way to The Spice House up the street. Am still both amazed and appalled that I let this gem escape my attention for so freaking long! After just a few weeks, Old Town Oil is quickly climbing the charts as one of my favorite chicago shops. Sample barrel after barrel of irresistibly delectable extra virgin olive oils, infused with everything from Tuscan Herbs and Garlic to the more exotic blood orange. Find an oil (or many) to suit your taste, and pair it with an equally amazing bottle of vinegar.The customer service is wonderful; very knowledgeable and more than willing to help you find the perfect olive oil for that certain dish, or to just regale you with endless facts about the amazing properties of olive oil. The prices are reasonable, considering the quality of the product. If you're ever in need of a place to find the perfect gift for that foodie friend or family member, Old Town Oil cannot be beat.

40.description: A friend brought me here and I was amazed! Wonderful selection and the employees are actually happy to help you. They even held the door open for us on the way out. I read a review that this place is a little expensive for what you get. I just want to know who is going to drive 50 miles to save $20 bucks. After all is said and done. You saved nothing. You will waste 3 hours of your day, gas and frustration.

53.description: I am a sucker for these kind of custom shops. Like a kid in a candy store I love me some vinegar and oil. I love the set up. Tastings everywhere! There was a food tour in the store when we went in so it was a bit crowded however when they left it left plenty of room to do some tastings! The person who helped me was great. He helped me mix up some different oils and vinegars (obviously) however ones I wouldn't think to combine. I settled on the fig vinegar and basil olive oil. So far, has been great on my salads. Can't wait to go back and try some other combinations!

30.description: I suppose if you have no idea what you are tasting place is amazing. It sure looks pretty until you realize your oil is being bought in bulk and exposed to air multiple times if it is being stored in those shiny dispensers.... I do know what I am tasting and I do know what I am looking for. To me this place was a terrible disappointment.The selection of oil was sub-par. They had mostly infused oils and the infusions were not very good. I asked the employees for something specific and they looked at me like I was from Mars. For a shop that claims to specialize in oil I should hope they have heard of oil made from "black" olives. The next comment I got was something along the lines of... "our oil comes from Italy."  Well, if the most impressive thing you can tell me is the country from which you oil originated I think I will walk right back out the door. I will continue to order online from ppp-olive.com where they can tell me about the age of each olive and the family who makes each oil.If you are ever in Paris treat yourself to a real oil shop where people have passion about the product.PS. Water to cleanse the palette? Seriously? Water and oil don't mix. Any self respecting oil shop used a mild bread of some sort...

46.description: I consider myself a balsamic vinegar aficionado. I may not know wine or caviar or even cheeses as well, but oil and vinegar I know. I am always pleased when I find shops anywhere that specialize in fine oils and vinegars for the ones the average grocery store sell are pretty much bastardized versions of what they should be. Personally, I don't buy any balsamic aged for less than 15 years, that is hard to find in even gourmet grocery stores. On my visit to Chicago I was hoping to find a balsamic that could top the heavenly one I found at Oliviers & Co. in San Francisco earlier this year. The shop has a cute store front and was very welcoming. The shop is stocked with all the typical things you find in an oil and vinegar shop- jars of olives, olive oil soap, and large vats of oils and vinegars to taste. Immediately I dove right it. First up, their 18-year aged balsamic- very good, but not great. I prefer the consistency to be more on the heavy side, theirs is a bit light, nonetheless I bought a bottle anyway. I sampled some of the flavored vinegars and found the acidity too high for my liking, but the strawberry balsamic was divine! I took a bottle of that as well! The staff was friendly and not pushy at all. Overall I was very pleased with my find, unfortunately, the vinegars don't quite beat out the ones I got in San Francisco, but I definitely recommend a stop in here.

1.description: This was our fifth stop on the Gold Coast & Old Town Food Tour so I got to visit the Old Town Oil and I am so glad I got a chance to visit. This place is amazing!! There have a good collection of olive oils and vinegar to choose from. There is a small description on the oil that gives suggestions on what the oil can be used for: cooking, dipping, etc. .They have small little cup samples so that you can try as many sample as you like until you find the right oil that is just for you since some oils are better than others. I was in love with their strawberry vinegar one and a few other ones as well.Overall, I would definitely recommend this to anyone that loves cooking or just want a good salad dressing or dipping for their bread. There are so many flavors to choose from and until you visit, you won't even know that certain flavors exist. The only thing is that this place can be a bit pricey compared to other places that I have been to.

55.description: Love this place.  All these different infused olive oils... and you can taste before you buy.  Great prices, considering how expensive olive oil at the Jewel is.  And the chipotle infused oil is great!  Also the basil infused is great on salads... yum.

9.description: Meh is correct. I prefer Oh Olive on Armitage but I'm not going to say they have the world's best olive oil there either.I take one star off for the food tour. I was walking up Wells and was thinking I would go in when I saw a crowd of people coming out and then going on their way to the Spice House. After they were gone I went in and blah...There isn't as much as flavor in these oils as in others I've had. I found them to be bland. I also was turned off by how big the bottles are for the olive oil. If you have olive oil in your pantry for more than a year then it has turned. It's not that you can't eat it but it won't be as good. As someone who doesn't use it a ton there is no way I could use one bottle's worth in 12 months, unless I wanted to get fat (it may be good fat but it's still fat and high in calories).There are better places than this for sure.

26.description: Old Town Oil, I love you.  I have been purchasing similar oil out of state and finally thought there's gotta be something like this in Chicago.  A week ago, I visited the store and was thrilled with the selection, quality and customer service.  I had a bit of a hiccup with one item and Matt went ABOVE and BEYOND to fix it.   (No need to share details, other than off the charts service.)  I'm totally hooked.  I have lived in Chicago for 12 years and never knew about this place.   See you soon OTO.(New favoirte.  Walnut EEOV with Strawbery Balsamic.  Outrageously fabulous!)

25.description: This establishment makes me really happy and I hope it never goes out of business. You can try the olive oil and vinegar combinations in the store and the very helpful sales person will mix them for you. I felt silly drinking EVOO out of a tiny cup, but it was delicious. COMBO #1I tried the Garlic EVOO & Old Town Oil Reserve Balsamic, which is the contents of the "Steak Lovers" tool kit which I bought for my brother-in-law's birthday. They come in really pretty bottles and I bought a little gift bag to go with it all for $41. Not bad for a gift. COMBO #2I tried the peach white vinegar mixed with the meyer lemon EVOO. That was Delish with a capital D. I also had the brilliant idea to have them partner with Purple Pig since they serve a rather not-tasty olive oil ice cream that would be made so much more awesome with this combo. But the sales lady just kind of laughed kindly at my suggestion. Ah, well :)

12.description: Old Town Oil is a great place for foodies and family of foodies alike. Stopped by on a lovely 70 degrees October day and got half my Christmas shopping done!The staff is very helpful and the free samples delicious thought make sure you are not sampling on an empty stomach or you may feel a little nauseous after ingesting a pint of vinegar!I purchased the Cherry and Blueberry Balsamic and the walnut oil, all fabulous! Though with 10-12 variates of both I suggest you tasted test them all and choose your own!

59.description: I've always walked by small niche stores and wondered...how can you possibly have a store that only sells oil and vinegar??  But you can!We bought the 18 year aged balsamic, and I have never tasted anything better.  It's great that you can taste the different oils and vinegars...who knew oil could be infused with blood orange?!?

21.description: let's start with my wife and i love to cook.  Let's toss in there I am not a salad eater.  Now let's state that this place has a great selection of balsamics and oils that are some of the best I have had.  Viscus and tasty is how I describe their oils.   Most are 17 years and they delivery a wallop of taste that I have not found with any other place.  The oils are tasty and ecelectic, you can try before you buy and the staff is helpful.  They generally have oils from Greece, Spain, Italy, and the US.  Some flavors some straight.  Balsamic is just sick... flavors gallor and they are just so good. Love using the stuff and can't say enough.  Try the white balsamics with lemon or the dark with fig.  I generally am not a salad eater but you put this on it and I eat it.  Favorite is arugula, frisee, with mandarin orange, goat cheese, candied walnuts, red onion, tomato and toss in some grilled chicken.  Between this balsamic and the white truffle salt i recently purchased salads have suddenly become interesting.

17.description: Listen: Lonely 18 year balsamic seeks virgin olive oil for freshly prepared vinaigrette menaige et trois! Search no further, this is your hot spot! Knowledgable staff, top notch oils and fabulously aged balsamics to add some serous artisan flourish at your next dinner party! Pinch of basil and et voila! If only they had travel size!

10.description: Take time to sample and combine all of the different options. A great place to pick up a gift.

5.description: I've been to olive oil stores around the country but none were as friendly and helpful as was Old Town oil!I was looking for some hostess gifts and in one quick stop I was able to get expert advice from Mike on a complementary oil and vinegar to include.  They even have a nice selection of gift bags so that I didn't need to make another stop!Plenty of flavors with small tasting cups so that you can pair your favorites together.  And I also liked that on each of the oils there were suggestions on how to use it be it for dipping, in a sauce or for cooking.I also liked that they bottled it right in front of me which was a nice freshness cue.Prices are also reasonable as well.  So if you are a foodie or know someone who is, don't hesitate to stop into Old Town Oil.  I'm betting you'll be as happy with your purchase as I was!

3.description: One of my favorite stores in Chicago.  Every December for past few years, I have ordered wonderful olive oil and exquisite vinegars for my work colleagues, family and friends, and they are always very well-received.  This year, I was running behind and ordered just a few days before Christmas.  Instead of shipping, they proactively offered to drop the order off at my home in the South Loop. I was so pleasantly surprised - they were there in less than an hour.  You don't find great service like that in a lot of places anymore.  Big fan of this place and highly recommend!

35.description: In my kitchen, the motto is maximize deliciousness, minimize effort.  And the secret weapon is flavored oil from Old Town Oil.This little gem of a shop is nestled in the heart of Old Town.  I walked in one Sunday to be greeted immediately by a friendly fellow who possessed not only an impressively extensive knowledge of all things oil and vinegar, but also an unexpectedly sharp sense of humor.Before I knew what was happening, he had me talked into taking mini-shots of his favorite EVOO and aged balsamic concoctions.  Basil with strawberry, blood orange with tangerine, Tuscan herb with pomegranate, each one better than the last.With everything under $20 a bottle, I had to exercise a good bit of self-control not to say, "I'll take one of each!"  I highly recommend this place.  Delicious EVOO with a side of witty banter.  Can't beat that.

19.description: I love visiting Old Town Oil and sampling different combinations of olive oil and vinegar.  Bottles of oil and vinegar from Old Town Oil make the perfect gift when a looking for an alternative to a bottle of wine.  Service is always helpful.  I highly recommend popping in here as well as the spice store a few doors down when in Old Town.

28.description: Old Town Oil is a great place for foodies and family of foodies alike. Stopped by on a lovely 70 degrees October day and got half my Christmas shopping done!The staff is very helpful and the free samples delicious thought make sure you are not sampling on an empty stomach or you may feel a little nauseous after ingesting a pint of vinegar!I purchased the Cherry and Blueberry Balsamic and the walnut oil, all fabulous! Though with 10-12 variates of both I suggest you tasted test them all and choose your own!

45.description: This place has a great variety of oils and balsamics. The staff is very helpful and they cork and bottle up your purchases after pouring it straight from the barrel. To me, that makes the experience that much better. I have used the balsamic on several things and it never dissappoints. Salads, apples, chicken marinade, it definitely has a zest that is hard to compare from average grocery stores. It is pricier than average bottles, but it definitely has a noticeable quality difference as well.My one suggestion is that they provide bread or something to help sample the oils and balsamics. Currently, you pour a little into a small paper thimble and take a shot of it. It just doesn't give the same effect and actually kind of grosses me out if I try too many.

33.description: Old Town Oil has quality product. Simple enough. One room filled with a dozen or so varieties of oil and vinegar. Around $18 per bottle and you can sample any flavor. I have tried almost all they have to offer and prefer the flavored vinegars to the oils. Also, the customer service is outstanding. Best OilsPicual Olive OilBlack Truffle OilWalnut OilBest VinegarsUnflavored Aged Balsamic Champagne VinegarWhite Peach Balsamic (unreal and a little goes a long way)

43.description: For hardcore gastronomers and salad dressers alike, this is the place for oil and vinegar."We do not sacrifice quality and authenticity for price" said the manager, something I completely and wholeheartedly agree with.We went to a tasting for our building, and tasted some fantastic oils and vinegars and ended up buying 4 bottles, at least $15 each.... STEEP, but worth it.Oils we bought:Mixed HerbMeyer LemonBalsamic Vinegars:BlueberryWhite PeachLemon-White Peach is gonna be a KICKASS salad dressing.....Mixed Herb Blueberry is gonna be a weird marinade.Blueberry tops ice cream real well.

2.description: This is a great little store that we visited on our Chicago Food Planet tour in Gold Coast/Old Town and I'm so glad that we did.I've only been to a couple other oil stores in my life but this one was by far the nicest/most diverse in terms of both balsamics and olive oils. The staff was really helpful when answering any questions as well.One thing I appreciate is that they have little teeny cups underneath each oil and balsamic so that you could pour a little out and have a sample. When we were on our food tour the staff put together some incredible combinations of oil and balsamic together for us to dip some baguette bread into so I'd definitely take the staff's opinions before making a purchase. I've also learned they do business online so I won't have to be in Chicago to get products from Old town oil!

18.description: Old Town Oil is an excellent place to find high quality olive oils and balsamic vinegars.  If you're ready to move on from the supermarket stuff or shopping for a unique gift for a foodie, this is the place to hit up.  The store is lined with kegs of imported oils and vinegars all of which you can sample for  yourself.   I was a little overwhelmed by the selection on my first visit but their knowledgeable staff helped guide me by explaining each unique flavor profiles and offering tastes.  I eventually settled on the smooth, buttery hojiblanca EVOO from Spain and the peach infused balsamic vinegar.  But I had a little buyers remorse later after tasting the 18 year aged balsamic...phenomenal!  Never tasted any balsamic this good, even at high end restaurants.  Easily the best item in the store.  The prices are reasonable considering the quality of the product and when compared to similar specialty shops.  Balsamic vinegars keep for a while and because theirs are so rich, a little goes a long way.  Their olive oils are meant for dipping in bread or finishing dishes where you'll be able to taste and appreciate the delicate flavor.  As an added bonus, they'll knock off a few dollars from your next purchase when you refill your empty bottles.

41.description: At first blush, the idea of a place that sells only oil and vinegar seems like over simplifying.  But, walk in to Old Town Oil and mix your Blood Orange Olive Oil with some Peach Balsamic vinegar.  And then you'll want to try the Meyer Lemon with the 18 year Balsamic.  And then you'll want to try the Basil oil and the Fig Balsamic.  And then you'll want to try Walnut Oil with the Apple Balsamic.  And eventually, you'll embarass whoever you came with and they'll be dragging you out the door and you'll be like "Wait, I didn't get to mix the straight ahead Greek with the Blueberry."  And they'll be all, "Come on, you're making us uncomfortable."  And you'll be all, "But guys..." And they'll be all, "Seriously, these nice people have had enough of you.  Let's go before they call the cops."  And you'll finally give in and go because you remember what happened when you wouldn't leave the Fudge Pot. You might have a problem.  I'm only saying that because I care.

52.description: Pricey, but that's the ONLY negative thing I have to say, and really the prices are pretty much what you'd expect. The staff is SO helpful and friendly, explaining everything and letting us try anything we so desired. I left with two bottles but I secretly covet more. Good thing I live in the area so I can return frequently!! Also, a great gift idea.

50.description: Turned onto Old Town Oil by a friend when I was stumped for a Christmas Gift for my brother... he is a bit of a Closet Foodie. Well it can be a little overwhelming on your first visit but the staff is more than willing to help you with the selection process. They offered me a few choices and samples to ensure I knew what I was getting. After all was said and done I went with the Organic Olive Oil and 18yo Balsamic Vingar for the first purchase. It seemed to be a hit with my brother, now if only he would invite me over for dinner...

4.description: Very friendly, helpful service. Unique selection of oils and balsamics you can sample. Makes a great gift!

6.description: What a fun stop!So many flavors to try! The staff is very friendly and are happy to give suggestions regarding what flavored vinegars and olive oils to mix. Many of the containers have pairing suggestions. Don't miss this stop or The Spice House when nearby!!

22.description: I love visiting Old Town Oil and sampling different combinations of olive oil and vinegar.  Bottles of oil and vinegar from Old Town Oil make the perfect gift when a looking for an alternative to a bottle of wine.  Service is always helpful.  I highly recommend popping in here as well as the spice store a few doors down when in Old Town.

15.description: let's start with my wife and i love to cook.  Let's toss in there I am not a salad eater.  Now let's state that this place has a great selection of balsamics and oils that are some of the best I have had.  Viscus and tasty is how I describe their oils.   Most are 17 years and they delivery a wallop of taste that I have not found with any other place.  The oils are tasty and ecelectic, you can try before you buy and the staff is helpful.  They generally have oils from Greece, Spain, Italy, and the US.  Some flavors some straight.  Balsamic is just sick... flavors gallor and they are just so good. Love using the stuff and can't say enough.  Try the white balsamics with lemon or the dark with fig.  I generally am not a salad eater but you put this on it and I eat it.  Favorite is arugula, frisee, with mandarin orange, goat cheese, candied walnuts, red onion, tomato and toss in some grilled chicken.  Between this balsamic and the white truffle salt i recently purchased salads have suddenly become interesting.

57.description: Ok, this is worth checking out.  I was told to take a small sipping cup, mix a few drops of olive oil and a few drops of balsamic vinegar in it, swirl till bubbly, then swallow.  Sounded disgusting.  It was GREAT!  I could have spent an hour in there mixing concoctions.  The staff is kind and knowledgeable and encourage you to experiment.  I fell in love with the sesame seed oil.   I have discovered amazing new salad dressings and bread dippings because of Old Town Oil.  As I was leaving, I had to smile at the sign, "Unattended children will be given candy and a free puppy."  :)

20.description: Listen: Lonely 18 year balsamic seeks virgin olive oil for freshly prepared vinaigrette menaige et trois! Search no further, this is your hot spot! Knowledgable staff, top notch oils and fabulously aged balsamics to add some serous artisan flourish at your next dinner party! Pinch of basil and et voila! If only they had travel size!

36.description: Sweet Baby Jesus! I am so PISSED... That I didn't discover Old Town Oil sooner!!  Especially since I am at Topo Gigio fairly regularly and it's right next door..If you're like me & enjoy supporting small businesses that specialize in doing one thing and doing it well & if you have taste buds that REALLY appreciate quality and deeeeeeliciousness. Get to this place NOW before you forget. Great service in a rustic boutique atmosphere. You can sample all the marvelous varieties -- I know it sounds odd to sample oil and vinegar but that just proves how good it is! They also bottle & seal the heavenly nectar right in front of you. This is going to be a new favorite closing gift for my foodie clients!

14.description: All of the balsamic vinegars are amazing. I had a hard time choosing!! I ended up getting the berry and ginger one and ohhhhhhh baby is it good. Theres so many great olive oils as well. My friend lives in Chicago and brought me here =)

1.description: Decent selection of posters and the owner's really willing to make a deal. I would definitely go back.

2.description: They've got really cool vintage posters here and you can have them framed on the spot!  Its a great place to get some neat decorations for your house.

0.description: Great place!I went in with two paintings that were just on cotton sheets and the woman there gave me the options which we decided to stretch the paintings and then frame them without glass so that the glass wouldn't stick to the paint.  She was patient with me while I looked through all the frame options and helped me pick some great options in the lower price range of her frames.  She finished them a day early and called to say they were done.  They look fabulous!

3.description: Got a cut last week, not horrible but had to clean it up at home. Liked the stylist andthe free card deal with massage chair, but it wasn't anything out of the ordinary.

1.description: Staff is great and can't complain with a few haircut. My only complaint is that my shirt got really wet while doing shampoo and the water was getting into my ears.

0.description: No appointment but was taken right away.  Had a free upgrade to the MVP package which is the haircut, shampoo (in a chair which gives you a short massage) warm towel on face for a couple minutes, and a shoulder massage. It was nice, but I wouldn't do it on a regular basis.  Too expensive, even with free upgrade.Stylist Jay was nice and had interesting stories.

2.description: Terrible, terrible service.  After receiving arguable the worst haircut of my life, I was forced to return due to their walk-in policy and every other establishment being booked for the weekend. After waiting for 45 minutes (understandable; it was a busy day) they managed to somehow delete my name from the que and put me at the bottom of the list to wait another 45 minutes.

5.description: Went in today to get my hair cut and was a very happy with the job they did. My hair stylist Gabrielle recommended a new style for my hair. I was a little nervous but it turned out great! They also will shampoo your hair in a massage chair with a hot towel over your face. Great stress relief after a long day of work!

6.description: Been going here since it opened and it has been getting worse and worse... New hair dressers every time and my last visit I got the WORST HAIR OF MY LIFE... At 29 years of age, I was shocked! Any event, I wont be going back ever again.. Now Im going to look like a goof ball tonight for my dinner meeting.

7.description: I was down that way with my son and they had a deal advertised in the window so we both got a cut.  Good experience - I give it 4 stars out of 5.  My son is very particular about his hair so it was a tough sell but his stylist, Gabrielle, did a nice job.  I had Jermarie cut my hair and I just ask that the stylist follow my instructions exactly and she did.  I wrote their names down on the instant replay card they gave me after we were done so I'll be back.

8.description: The other review nailed it on the head. This was easily the WORST haircut I have ever gotten. Even after telling her to fix it she just told me how I should style it. It was uneven to say the least. Could be because she was cutting hair off without measure, or how she spent 5min on one side of my head and 1 on the other. I get it buzzed on the sides, scissor on top, pretty standard. I think she knew that it looked bad, and I hope it was the worst haircut she has ever done because I know I was not her only customer that day. I did not make a scene while I was there because there were six people waiting but I went home and shaved my head. Seriously.

9.description: Be prepared to wait. Staff like to laugh and joke but they move sloooooow. They quoted me 20 mins. Took an hour.

10.description: I came in for a promotional free haircut. not the greatest haircut ive had but def not the worst. i came in during the middle of the day and there was no wait. the stylist was nice enough but not exactly personable. thats ok though bc i hate stylists who talk too much and the whole time im just thinking you're holding some sharp scissors and a razor, id feel safer if you cut the chit chat and paid a lil more attention to not slicing me. The huge tvs in front of each chair is nice but am i really going to be there long enough to catch a whole game? i hope not. They sell an MVP package that includes a shampoo and massage. Sure it was nice bc it was free but I can shampoo my hair at home and the massage was literally 10 seconds.  At any rate I may come back here since they are so close to me but probably only if theres another promotional discount.

4.description: Brand spanking new sports clips with lots of TV's in the heart of Old Town.  What guy can resist a place full of young, friendly women, designed to make guys feel comfortable, and a service designed to pamper us without any of the salon fluff.  At least that was my expectation after having been to a few of these places in the burbs.  My experience at the Wells street location was very different from expectation.When I walked in I was greeted with a frown and a mumbled "welcome to sports clips" and no eye contact.  It appeared that she was miserable, couldn't wait to go home, and couldn't care less about the sports clip brand.  After a short wait I was seated and I swear to whichever deity you prefer, my "stylist" started having a lip-synced conversation with the "manager" who was cutting someone's hair on the other side of the room.  Of course I could see this happening in the mirror.  What I couldn't tell was whether or not they were talking about me.  It made me feel REALLY uncomfortable and was probably the least professional thing I'd ever seen.  Then when she was done she mumbled something to me about a free upgrade offer for the MVP experience.  What struck me was her dismal job of pitching this premium service.  If it weren't free no one would buy the service from her and she did just as bad a job trying to sell me their hair care products following the haircut.  It was obvious to me that she had ZERO sales training and knew nothing about the hair care products.  During the haircut I tried a few times to have a conversation with her but her one-word answers made it impossible.  I felt like trying to have a conversation with my teenage daughter.I'm sure purchasing a franchise like this is expensive and I'm sure the owners intend on getting value from the brand.  From what I've seen they are not even close to hitting their mark.

58.description: Incredible food and great service! Highly recommend

56.description: One of the few Japanese restaurants open late near downtown! Great service and tasty fresh food! The assortment of appetizers and entrees are great! The warm sake is smooth and tasty! The atmosphere is romantic for the two of you to converse for a long time with a great meal! It is a little pricey for the small portions you get! Everything is fresh and full of flavor tasting great! It is hard to find parking unless you don't mind circling around a little or park in the parking garage. They have two floors, so the dining area can handle a lot! They have a big long bar fully stocked! No complaints here! Always a great place for late night sushi!

29.description: lesson to the atrocious girl and the goat about customer service.Kamehachi had an error with our order and immediately rushed to fix it.  polite, professional, no-nonsense.  so appreciated!  thank you

42.description: Great place to grab cocktails and sake with Japanese appetizers. Staff was busy but friendly and attentive. Food is just ok. - rock shrimp tempura was good but I feel there was a tad too much batter. - spider roll - worst roll of the night. Too much rice and not enough crab at all. Too bland. Not worth it- spicy salmon deluxe was tasty- the 1st one on the specialty rolls were was pretty good. Not sure if it was worth the price- summer roll - best roll of the night. I didn't like the migi-tini - had a soapy taste. The whiskey cocktail and the dragon martini was good. Hot sake was great to share throughout dinner.

23.description: This one star is for the store decoration ONLY.The service is horrible.  My friend and I just ordered two noodles, and we waited for AN HOUR! In the first 40min, they totally forget about us, we were trying to get the waitress' attention, but she never notice us, we had to drag the bus boy to get a waitress.  Then it took them only 20 min to prepare the Udon.And the FOOD IS NOT GOOD!!!  Normally when people starves everything would tasted better, but the tempura they made makes me want to puke.   And the noodles are just ok, nothing special about it, fast food level

47.description: Fun dining experience! We came here for a friend's birthday and sat upstairs. We had a few extra people show up and our waitress was very accommodating. I really enjoyed the Spicy Tuna ($7) and Kamehaci roll ($9), which is tuna, avocado, cucumber, and masago. The Dragon Lady drink is lovely. It's a delicious mix of vodka, pomegranate, orange, and pineapple juices, and lemon-lime pop. I also got the Migi-tiny, but didn't care for it. This was gin, lemon, cucumber and had peppercorn flakes sprinkled on the top.Old Town is a fun neighborhood, so be sure to check out some of the cool after dinner drink spots while you're there.

8.description: Excellent surroundings. Authentic Japanese food. Great, attentive staff....especially Nova. He's always great. Local awesome place. Beautiful interior

31.description: Good quality sushi but the prices need adjustment.  $8 for 1 piece (not a serving of 2 pieces but a single piece) of nigiri sushi?  When two people end up with a bill exceeding $220 (with only one extravagance of 4 pieces of toro at $12 a piece), this is not what I would call good value for the money.

34.description: To start, the atmosphere is really nice - outside seating, bar seating and sit down seating and they're all decorated nicely. I got the Nabeyaki udon soup which was incredible. The noodles were great, tempura shrimp was excellent, basically everything was awesome and my friends who got the soup also agreed.My friends who got the sushi ate it all but didn't think it was anything special - they said they wished they ordered the soup instead. I can't speak to the sushi, so I guess you'll have to go and try yourself. Definitely recommended.

16.description: I have been to Kamehachi a couple of times over the years and to their location in Northbrook. Our experience in Old Town was definitely "meh." Positives were the atmostphere - really lovely new location and a front section that opens to the sidewalk - and presentation. All the plates were beautiful. For the prices, I'd rather go elsewhere for good Japanese. The service was just okay. We wandered around the front of the restaurant for almost 5 minutes before someone approached us and told us it was fine to sit at one of the front tables. It was almost another 10 before the waitress came to even take drink orders. Service was intermittent throughout; however, the server did quickly change out my cold sake when I said I didn't care for her original recommendation. For appetizers we had beef asparagus rolls and chicken yakitori. The beef rolls were bland with too much sauce. The chicken yakitori was probably the best dish of the evening - great flavor and the cuts of chicken were good. The veggies on the skewers seemed fresh.  My boyfrind had the gyoza. He said they were as good as he could get at a Japanese grocery store.For dinner, I ordered the spicy salmon deluxe, the tasmanian salmon and a sushi toro trio special - over $40 in sushi. Literally every piece of fish I put in my mouth was sinewy and I had to pick the parts that I couldn't chew out of my mouth and leave them on my plate. This almost never happens with fresh salmon. I didn't find the quality of the fish great and the spicy salmon deluxe was bland. My boyfriend had the ton katsu - he said the panko crumbs were just like heavy breading...not light and crispy the way they are supposed to be, and the cutlet itself was not pounded thin enough.  Even though the presentation looked nice, we decided that overall, the ingredients did not seem particularly fresh - from my fish to the cabbage on the side of the his plate.All in all, there so many other restaurants in the neighborhood, this one won't be a destination for us.

13.description: Awesome sushi! I was still a little full from brunch earlier in the morning, but all was still well. I found my favorite beer in the entire world here, so I can not thank this place enough for existing.

11.description: I'm super shocked I havnt written this review yet. This is a review from about 2012!I love this place! I used to work just down the street and would come after work or even before (It was a wine bar.) the vibe was amazing, fast and informative service, and of course very fresh sushi!My sister tried her first sushi here! Now she loves it and eats it like a pro!! Thanks to the versatility of Kamahachis menu, she was able to try something she really liked and is a sushi convert!

39.description: I'm super shocked I havnt written this review yet. This is a review from about 2012!I love this place! I used to work just down the street and would come after work or even before (It was a wine bar.) the vibe was amazing, fast and informative service, and of course very fresh sushi!My sister tried her first sushi here! Now she loves it and eats it like a pro!! Thanks to the versatility of Kamahachis menu, she was able to try something she really liked and is a sushi convert!

37.description: Currently I am visiting Chicago and I was so excited to find a sushi place in my favorite part of town, Old Town. I came in by myself because my sister is at work. First, it took the waitress about 15 minutes to bring me my water, when she brought it she set it down and walked away. Second, after I got my food, she never once came back to ask me anything, I even had to flag her down and ask for more water. Third, I ordered the spicy tuna roll and the sunset roll. The spicy tuna roll had no flavor other than the soy sauce and was very chewy. The sunset roll had no flavor besides the cilantro. After all of this when I was finished I put my chopsticks across my soy sauce dish and set my napkin on the table, the waitress never brought me my check. It took me asking twice to get it. The only reason I gave it two stars is for the environment, but I won't be returning.

0.description: At 10 pm on a Sunday night there aren't many trendy places to choose from for dinner. Luckily we found this place for a last minute late night Valentine's Day celebration. The front looks like a bar but once you step inside you'll seating for dinner towards the back and additional seating upstairs on busy nights. My favorite was the tempura rock fish appetizer which comes as a lightly breaded shrimp with yummy sauce. I ate it with a side of steamed rice and barely had any interest in trying anything else. The blazing red dragon roll was also a hit.

38.description: food is OK but the service is so slow and bad. The waiter and waitress are so racist. They are treating the white customers are much nicer and faster than color ones. not recommended for Asian to go.

51.description: Just went here with my gf last weekend. Happily surprised to have really great fish, which I have felt isn't as common in Chicago as New York. This place is a 5/5 when it comes to Chicago Sushi, probably a 4/5 for you out of towners.  Also they have really great Yaki Udon for those who are a fan of noodles.

27.description: Had a great experience here after a show at Zanies. They had great vegetarian options and a nice beer selection at the bar. The atmosphere was really nice, service was great, and the decor in the bar/restaurant was on point. Can't wait to come back.

32.description: Kamehachi on Wells is simply fantastic. My wife and I eat at the bar most Friday nights when we are at home in Chicago and have yet to experience anything other than a great meal in the past two years. The sushi is always fresh, the staff is incredibly friendly, and the environment is both welcoming and designer friendly. I highly recommend the salmon nigiri, summer roll, and spicy tuna deluxe deluxe (not a misprint)--our go-to selections.

54.description: Food is delicious, some of the best sushi I have ever had.  Banana tempura was amazing.  However, service was very slow, our waitress was nowhere to be seen several times throughout the evening, leaving our glasses empty for too long.  We would have ordered more drinks if she had offered, but we had to flag her down.  Great place overall, cozy atmosphere and pleasant music.  Will visit again.

48.description: My favorite sushi spot in Old Town.  Unfortunately, they've discontinued the Maki 51 sushi boat which means we may stop going.  Come on Kamehachi!  Bring it back!  This was a staple in our household.

44.description: Heavens knows why we come here. I think it's because we tend to crave Japanese before we head over to see a Second City show.Both times we've been here we have been underwhelmed.The appetizers were "meh", but the fact that they charge $16 for 2 dry chicken breasts with some teriyaki sauce poured over it on top of a bed of undercooked broccoli is a joke. I find it ironic that one of the cover pictures for the restaurant is chicken teriyaki on a bed of bok choy. At least splurge a little on the bok choy, guys. Or maybe broccoli is easier to freeze?We will never be coming back

24.description: Great fresh ingredients, deliciously crafted food, nice service! Prices are very reasonable. My friend and I just randomly stoped by for a lunch and quite enjoyed it!

7.description: This is the most disgusting sushi I ever had in Chicago. Simply the fishes are not fresh at all(even though we got today's specials, too!), soft shell crab was  fried at least couple hours ago, instant seaweed on miso soupThe manager guy claimed that they import fish from Japan, but whatever. fish is very dry and doesn't taste as fresh as it should. Another fake sushi place

49.description: We were going to second city and decided for sushi.  Great location.  The  decor is elegant and romantic.  The service is outstanding.  Overall, it is a great value and I strongly recommend.

40.description: Delicious sushi. And a good drink. It has a nice atmosphere as well. My one criticism is that we came during karaoke night and it didn't really fit the ambience of the place. I could have done without that. Otherwise wonderful experience. Good food and good service

53.description: We had dinner last month on a Saturday night at 7:30 pm and the food and service were excellent. My only regret is the restaurant was so loud in the dining area that I could barely here my friends at our table for 4 people. I've been in busy restaurants before were it was loud, but this was exceptionally loud in my opinion. The food was truly worth trying again, so I would definitely go back.  I've been in the upstairs dining area before and we did not have this issue.  If you have a large group, the space upstairs is perfect!

30.description: This beautifully decorated restaurant has amazingly delicious food, and a favorite place of ours to bring others to lunch. We have had one experience of eating here for dinner and it was not good due to very noisy customers taking up a huge table on second floor. Restaurant staff did nothing to quiet them down. We won't return on the evenings but love it during the daytime. Great service, so very close to our workplace/church, and ALWAYS good food!

46.description: I enjoyed this place! Great atmosphere. No complaints. I just had some basic rolls so I will update the review next time I go once I have more to say about the food.

1.description: First, the beef kakiniku was impossible to chew on. I was surprised how chewy it was and really impossible to eat. I tried only one piece and ended up going to the restroom to get rid of it lol. Did not finish this appetizer needless to say. I made polite of mention to the waiter of my dissatisfaction but never heard back. Also, the sashimi platter while very good in terms of freshness, the pieces were definitely below average in terms of size. Not a horrible experience by an means but I won't be back.Thanks for your reply. The server never mentioned removing it from the bill. If he did I appreciate that. Someone else paid the bill and I did not review it.

55.description: Great place, atmosphere, and the service was amazing. You have to love a place that sells Sapporo beer. Definitely coming back. Our server was very friendly and food came out in a timely manner.

9.description: I`m going to start my review by being forthcoming and stating that I do not eat raw fish (feel free to skip on down to the next review if that makes this irrelevant to your sushi hunt). That being said, i LOVE Kamehachi. Very few places offer me choices as a vegetarian for sushi rolls, however there were multiple for me to choose from (my favorites being the Veggie Crunch Roll & the AAC). Additionally, all of my dining companions who eat real sushi always enjoy their meals as well so it's a best of both worlds scenario. The atmosphere is cute for either a date or a dinner with friends, the location is central old town, and they take reservations. Every time I have gone the service has been quick and the drinks have been delicious. I definitely recommend this place and will be back again and again!

26.description: great food but dont get the spring rolls. dont do it. it tastes like a noddley leaves

25.description: Had a great meal here a few weeks ago. The staff was helpful and the assorted sushi's my group ordered were all delicious. I'm partial to this restaurant because they have no peanuts in the entire restaurant so it's safe Asian food for people with allergies. Will definitely return.

12.description: After having been to all of the big name sushi joints in Chicago, this is clearly the standout. We ordered a bunch of nigiri and each piece was so fresh and melt-in-your-mouth delicious. We also had a few maki rolls including the Summer and Spicy Tuna Deluxe Deluxe rolls. Glad we found this gem hidden in Old Town

59.description: My friends & I done here once a month after serving dinner at a local soup kitchen. We always hope for Jessica to be serving us! She is the best in the house! Two words: Rock Shrimp!!! You won't regret it! Love this sushi spot! Especially in the summer & in it's side walk seating!

21.description: Impressive! I tried Kamehachi last night with a friend. We ordered a bottle of wine, tuna carpaccio appetizer, and 3 makis (rainbow, sunset, and dragon). The sunset was my favorite! I must say I was really impressed to have a delicious sushi place nearby. It is a bit on the pricier side, but is overlooked by the quality of the fish - all very fresh! Our waitress was a doll - very sweet, amicable, and attentive (we sat on their patio). Overall, it was a good experience.

17.description: Late reviews!! There was our first time to eat there,  food is fresh, a fancy restaurant , it's good for dating

10.description: Great place to grab cocktails and sake with Japanese appetizers. Staff was busy but friendly and attentive. Food is just ok. - rock shrimp tempura was good but I feel there was a tad too much batter. - spider roll - worst roll of the night. Too much rice and not enough crab at all. Too bland. Not worth it- spicy salmon deluxe was tasty- the 1st one on the specialty rolls were was pretty good. Not sure if it was worth the price- summer roll - best roll of the night. I didn't like the migi-tini - had a soapy taste. The whiskey cocktail and the dragon martini was good. Hot sake was great to share throughout dinner.

5.description: To start, the atmosphere is really nice - outside seating, bar seating and sit down seating and they're all decorated nicely. I got the Nabeyaki udon soup which was incredible. The noodles were great, tempura shrimp was excellent, basically everything was awesome and my friends who got the soup also agreed.My friends who got the sushi ate it all but didn't think it was anything special - they said they wished they ordered the soup instead. I can't speak to the sushi, so I guess you'll have to go and try yourself. Definitely recommended.

3.description: This was our third stop on the Gold Coast & Old Town Food Tour so I got to try sushi at Kamehachi. The inside of this sushi place is really nice and very well decorated. They have two floors that are quite different from one another. The first floor has a nice long bar that is more lively. The second floor is probably more quiet for those that don't like too much noise while they are having dinner. But this is just what i felt when I first stepped it. I got sat upstairs and it was really quiet, but this could be because it's early in the morning and part of a food tour.Anyways, since this is part of a food tour, I did not to experience dining in, the service, or a variety of food. So this review is solely based on the few pieces of sushi that I had which was one piece from the tuna roll and another piece i believe was called the Shiitake roll (mushroom and avocado inside). The two peieces weren't bad, but it wasn't good either. The sushi just tasted average, and nothing quite special. Overall, I feel that the sushi here is only decent and not as great compared to many other sushi places. I do not think I would ever come back for sushi here, but then again, I did not get to try other dishes. So this will be my review until then...

35.description: Okay...all I have to say is CRAB CAKES! Maybe the best I have had.....anywhere. Rest of the meal was....well....only delicious.

19.description: We had dinner last month on a Saturday night at 7:30 pm and the food and service were excellent. My only regret is the restaurant was so loud in the dining area that I could barely here my friends at our table for 4 people. I've been in busy restaurants before were it was loud, but this was exceptionally loud in my opinion. The food was truly worth trying again, so I would definitely go back.  I've been in the upstairs dining area before and we did not have this issue.  If you have a large group, the space upstairs is perfect!

28.description: My first impression upon walking in was that it smelled fishy in the restaurant. Not a good sign. Then we ordered a glass of wine, which was delicious. However, upon ordering our first two sushi picks, we were disappointed. The spicy tuna was pretty good, but the other (I think the spider roll?) was by varying bites super bland/dry, and then sometimes badly fishy.

45.description: I have never reviewed a restaurant, but I would strongly discourage anyone from coming to this restaurant. Service was fine, but the sushi tasted like it had sat out for hours. I thought it was just my experience, but after talking to several friends they have had similar experiences. Way too expensive for the nasty fishy sushi you receive.

33.description: Love this place! I get delivery once a week here and it's always fast and friendly! I love the spicy edamame, miso soup, Kamehachi roll, salmon deluxe and summer roll! The outdoor patio is nice too when it's warm out!

43.description: I was very pleased with my experience here.   First off,  I do not eat seafood of any sort and was pleased to find that they have a nice selection of veggie rolls.   I am a picky eater and they made substitutions to my rolls for me.   My dining partner had lots of questions and our server was very knowledgeable and gave great advice.   They had excellent drinks.  I can't wait to go here again.

2.description: Pretty sure I found my top sushi bar in Chicago! After trying quite a few different spots, this landed as my favorite, reasonably priced sushi.The best part was how you could taste the quality of the fish, everything tasted very fresh. Lots of flavor, great roll selection, funky looking restaurant. I highly recommend it!

18.description: One of the best Japanese restaurants you will find in Chicago! Food is incredibly fresh and authentic. The service is great and the atmosphere is very cool and vibrant. We love going there and everything that we have tried on the menu has been fantastic!

41.description: Young and energetic crowd. Great for Date night or a casual night with friends. Food was really good; they even have sushi making classes. We sat at the front bar & had female wait on us... Very attentive & down to earth.

52.description: i have read a few reviews on this restaurant (and other japanese restaurants in chicago). it's so aggravating that most people in chicago think japanese food is dragon rolls and such. my goodness, people, japanese food is so widely diverse, and sushi is no different. i finally decided on this one for a special 20th anniversary dinner.i talked that afternoon with the head sushi chef about what he did and what he could offer. when he heard my list of interests with sushi, he mentioned that he could do those things. i was still a little wary because of the kind sushi crowd that populates chicago.to be completely honest, if i were alone, when we got to the address, i would have just walked by and looked for a steak house. the front is a sports bar, for goodness sakes. ugh. *not* the impression i had from people that had recommended it. but with my wife in hand, i braved it out. it was my good fortune.we walked past the sports part of the pub and sat back at the sushi bar. the chef came over and we talked a bit about what he would be doing for omakase (google it). i started having hope. we started with a sashimi platter. it was decent and the fish was tasty, but i was not overly excited about the sashimi 'shooters'. tried two anyways, just for kicks. it was ok. i thought the platter was trying to be too 'cute' or trendy. but then he started the sushi portion of the meal, and i have to say it ranks as probably one of the top 5 sushi dinners i have ever had. simply outstanding fish, preparation and variety. they even had a few types of fish i had never had as sushi before. most notably, mahi mahi. awesome fish.turns out, after my call, he got his whole staff working on various different types of sushi that i had mentioned. one of them is 'dzuke' which has many varieties, some of which actually requires a few days to prepare, but the shorter varieties are also quite nice. the konbu was stellar. every one of the prep people were taking a special interest in our meal, indicating what they had worked on.i think the experience was enhanced by the fact that these people were normally used to preparing rolls for the normal customer, that they were excited to have the opportunity to do what they had been trained to do. and serving people with a wider taste in sushi.we thoroughly enjoyed our time there and would go back again any time. the bill was $300, but considering what we had just experienced, was in keeping with the quality and variety.this is a definite go-to place for us. next time we're in town, we'll be back at the sushi bar.

50.description: We ate here for my husband's birthday dinner last week before heading to a show at Second City. We were not disappointed! The sushi was fresh and tasted great, and the custom cocktails were delicious as well. If we lived in Chicago, we would definitely make this a favorite of ours!

4.description: We needed a dinner after a weary day of architecture touring for Open House, and this place appealed by name and appearance.  The front bar is nicely decorated with lamps, and turtles greet you on the way to the back room, which i more dim and moody.  The service was a touch on the slow side but we were not in a big rush, requiring a lot of sitting and rest.  The food was filling--the noodle dishes are quite large!   So much we didn't have room for the interesting desserts.   This is a standout in Old Town and hope to visit again.

6.description: Three of us stopped here for dinner on a Friday night around 7pm. We were seated immediately. The place is a far cry from the usual sterile Japanese restaurant; it is beautiful with its high ceilings, exposed brick walls, low flattering lightening and unobtrusive music. We sat at a high top table parallel to the front door and were able to people watch. The whole wall opens so it is like eating outside but we weren't. Which is good because it was raining. Service was good and the bathroom is co- love the copper tile detail. We started with the edamame which has an unusual preparation- rock salt, a little spicy and some butter. Very very good and addictive. We went through 3 bowls! We had rock shrimp, salmon sashimi, rainbow roll, California roll, mushroom roll, and eel nagiri. All was delicious! I would return and order the same things!

22.description: My husband and I love Kamehachi! It is a great restaurant with beautiful presentations. This is a great place to come whether you like sushi or not. There is something wonderful for everyone!

15.description: Bottle cork fees are $20 a bottle, food takes a long time to arrive, and service is spotty. Food is pretty good, but better elsewhere in the city.

57.description: My immediate reaction was being very pleased with the ambience. Very relaxing and chill. The sushi was also good. Not amazing but not terrible

20.description: Visited this place last Saturday. My friend took me here for my birthday and we arrived at 7:30 with no reservations. We were seated right away and place was about half full. Sushi was just mediocre, but service was so dreadfully slow. They seemed understaffed. They did not make my friends wine spritzer right. I wanted to order another beer before we left but our server was no where to be found. We tried to get another server to help us but were denied. Naturally, it took forever to get the bill too. This place should of had much better service, especially for it not being busy on a Saturday night. Too bad because it's very close to where I live and I love sushi.

36.description: Three of us stopped here for dinner on a Friday night around 7pm. We were seated immediately. The place is a far cry from the usual sterile Japanese restaurant; it is beautiful with its high ceilings, exposed brick walls, low flattering lightening and unobtrusive music. We sat at a high top table parallel to the front door and were able to people watch. The whole wall opens so it is like eating outside but we weren't. Which is good because it was raining. Service was good and the bathroom is co- love the copper tile detail. We started with the edamame which has an unusual preparation- rock salt, a little spicy and some butter. Very very good and addictive. We went through 3 bowls! We had rock shrimp, salmon sashimi, rainbow roll, California roll, mushroom roll, and eel nagiri. All was delicious! I would return and order the same things!

14.description: This was a horrid experience. The restaurant came up on my Grubhub delivery results list, so we placed an order. After 1 hour they called and demanded that we pay $3 extra because we are out of their zone (but wait, what about the delivery results list? Hmm..)  Since they said they were 5-10 minutes away from my house I agreed to the extra charge even though they admitted it was their mistake. They showed up more than an hour later (after we called again) and the food was cold, soggy, and disgusting. They forgot the sauce for one of the dishes, but we didn't bother calling for it because we didn't want to wait for another hour to eat. It was a disappointing and gross experience. Yuck.

28.description: My favorite store in Chicago!! Super cute dresses and unique jewelery and accessories at very reasonable prices. They always have a few new things in stock, which can be a tad dangerous (especially since the store is across the street from our apartment). I'm proud (I think) to admit that I've never left this store empty handed!! My latest Sara Jane find was a new brand of jeans (anoname) that fit great and are about half the price of typical premium denim.The owners are really sweet and very helpful - love that they clear off the couch for my husband whenever we walk through the door. They give you a warm welcome when you enter, but they don't push you to buy anything. I love that approach!!

1.description: I attended an after hours shopping event here last week that my friend bid on through a charity. Whenever I attend events like this, I always plan to purchase something in support of the store or business. I ended up finding a gray sweater with faux leather and had to have it, purchase price was $125, great!The thing that I didn't enjoy about this experience was the attitude and unpleasant comments made by the owner throughout the event. When several ladies that didn't purchase items went to retrieve their coats from behind the register, the owner said "You didn't find anything?" in a condescending tone and also told my friend checking out "Nobody shopped." There were roughly 20 ladies in attendance and about 8 purchased items large and small during the event (6:30-8:00 pm). I'd say that's pretty good for an after hours event that you donated to a charity, so I'm not sure what all the rude undertones and comments were about. We were just a group of women, celebrating our friend's birthday, and looking forward to checking out what appeared to be a great boutique. Overall, the tone of this place did not make for a fun or comfortable evening. I love my sweater, but will not be supporting someone that treats customers like this.

39.description: Very cute boutique!  They email me all the time about sales they are having and I try to go there a lot to see what they have in that's new and cute.  Very unique items and they have great bags, and cute belts.  I got this belt with a huge buckle with crushed flowers in the buckle- it sounds weird but I really like it.  This is a place you have to go often to though because sometimes when you find something you want they don't have your size.

9.description: Yet another encounter with the exceptionally rude staff.  Door was propped wide open so I went in. Since the lights we're off i asked one of the women who was moving boxes around if they were open. she literally scowled at me like i was the enemy and said "no". More often than not it's just super negative and unfriendly in there. I love their stuff but have to mentally prepare for the negative experience every time.

29.description: I just discovered this Old Town boutique. A friend told me about it, otherwise I never would have known about it.  I walked out with a dress, top & jewelry.  I know I'll get lots of wear from the items.  The clothes are mid priced and it was nice to see brands that you don't find in every other boutique on Southport or Armitage.  Lots of  jewelery  ina variety of styles that is very well priced. Super helpful employee made great suggestions as to what would look good on me.  I can't wait to go back & shop there again.

23.description: Amazing selection of dresses!  If you want to get ready for the warm weather by buying colorful and flattering spring/summer dresses, this is the place to go.  Lots of colors, fabrics and styles - and a good price point.  Generally on the casual side, although I did snag one great dress for work.  Owner is really nice, and I found more during an hour at the store than I did all day shopping at other places!  Can't wait to go back when they get their new shipments in.

5.description: I love this boutique! Great Old Town Staple! They always have new items coming in and there selection is always current and fashionable. The staff is always warm and welcoming and there to help with anything you need! Sara you're the best! Happy and healthy holidays!

31.description: I love shopping here! I will definitely be going here for a few of my spring items. She has the best price range and I can always find something great no matter what my budget is. The owner and employees are exceptionally helpful. Sara always runs the best promo's and also sends out great specials via email. If you are not on her mailing list, you should be!

25.description: I had a good shopping day today. After a friend told me about Sara Jane, I decided to stop by and see what she was raving about. They have some really unique pieces - trendy, but not too trendy where you can't wear it past one season. The sales people are very helpful - one of the ladies picked out a few things that she thought would look good on me and my body type. I would have never picked those pieces out myself because she was telling me that they look much different when you try it on vs. looking at it on the hanger. I came out with a couple of really interesting sweaters. One is really versatile, and I could dress it up or dress it down. The other one is a cool greyish-blue color that you don't usually see. I'm glad that I stopped by. The best part is that they are doing a promotion where if you spend more than $125 (I think that was the amount), you get a $25 gift card in the mail. I'm down for that! They also said that they are always getting different inventory, so there is new merchandise all the time. Sara Jane will now be on my boutique shopping rotation!

12.description: I love this boutique. I drive by it every day when I drive my daughter to school. The windows keep luring me in. The staff manages that wonderful balance of leaving me alone, and offering me suggestions. They are not pushy - yay!  Last time in I didn't even notice the dress that I ended up buying when I looked around. It was the sales woman who saw what I was trying on, and my style, who suggested it too me. I like stores that carry a variety of styles and product lines. At Sara Jane I can find clothes that work with my look and body type. Most items are typical boutique prices. I'd say $50-150. Of course a few items are more like the $200 dress that I'll wear to death.

37.description: This place has some nice pieces of jewelry at very reasonable prices!  Their necklaces are fabulous and you don't have to spend a fortune to get unique and chic design.  The clothes are also nice but you do need to pay a premium for.  The atmosphere is very friendly and I'm never pressured to buy anything.

21.description: My friend and I came here on a sunny Sunday morning. There was one person working who did not bother to even speak with us until we had something in our hands. She didn't check on us while we tried clothes on. The clothes are very expensive and to be honest, prefer my experience at Handle with Care versus this one. The lady working appeared bored and didn't even offer to take the clothes once we were done.Me thinks not Sara Jane - would not recommend as there are far better stores in Chicago y'all!

16.description: You know those days when you just hate everything in your closet? I've been having a lot of them lately.  As I was staring at all the clothes in my closet this morning that are "so last year" I remembered the $50 coupon (off a purchase of $200) that came from my favorite boutique, Sara Jane, just the other day.  I grabbed my husband, dog, credit card, and coupon...and we were on our way to do some shopping! As always Sara Jane did not let me down.  I found a cute sweater and dress within minutes and Sara was giving me recommendations on how to spice the adorable dress up with a belt.  My husband and dog made themselves at home on the patio of Old Town Pub just right next door with the bears game, a beer, and a plate of fries. I think my husband was surprised when I walked out with a bag so soon, but that's the beauty of Sara Jane....with fabulous merchandise and even better service they make shopping easy (and fun!).

17.description: All I can say is "Whoa"! Excellent selection of gorgeous clothing and accessories. Plus the owner is absolutely fantastic! The atmosphere in the store is warm and friendly. I can't wait to stop and shop again - SOON!

10.description: The boutique is beautiful on the outside, however if you want to deal with rude sales associates be my guest and go inside. I will not be going back.

11.description: This review is LONG overdue but I needed some time to cool off after the incident.  What began as a fun shopping experience months ago, QUICKLY changed to a VERY negative experience overall.  I expressed some discontentment with the quality of the dress that was purchased for me as the dress didn't hold up well after washing it ONE time.  The issue was resolved; HOWEVER, the lack of professionalism that was displayed during the encounter left a terrible taste in my mouth to the point that I will NEVER shop here again.  When there is an issue with a customer, don't make it personal; keep it between you and that customer.  Don't harass the customer's brother who walks his dog by your store or discuss the issue with your family member who also happens to be a friend of that customer.  This type of behavior does NOTHING for customer service.  Additionally, when that customer returns to the store to resolve the matter (AT YOUR ENCOURAGMENT/SUGGESTION), the absolute LAST thing that customer wants to see is you (as the owner of the establishment) roll your eyes when she walks in.  What happened to delivering service with a smile?  WOW, all the best to you in your future transactions and encounters.  I'm sure you'll be DELIGHTED to know that I won't come back to your store again.

26.description: Delicate, that is what Sara Jane is.Not delicate in the form of china plates that will shatter if you accidentally bump into it after you've told yourself to stay a good 3 feet away. Delicate in the form of fashion elegance.Word of mouth brought me into this shop that offers quite a bit of carefully selected items that are unique and effortless beauty bunched together in the form of an entire wardrobe. From silky and colorful dresses to flimsy crochet half sweaters that could dress up an off the shoulder dress and make the outfit flawless.Upon walking in I was immediately welcomed with a warm hello and smile, almost immediately followed by a passionate desire to figure out what exactly you are looking for. Loved this, loved it so much I went in with my budget in line and was seriously considering blowing it. The store is small but the layout is set up so that there are more deep colors off along the wall by the entrance. Think blacks, whites and grays. There was a gorgeous red jacket that could spice up a fall night out, not to mention the grey dress towards the back with a somewhat ribbed neck that is ribbed with wound ribbons.Now cruise over to the other side where there are items with a little more color like a muted purple, light browns and teal print dresses.  I happened to notice a darling purple and off white print dress that was silky smooth, but my body type is funny and it was a little snug unfortunately. This does not deter me from coming back to this shop though.The jewelry is equally as noteworthy of the clothing and the toned down gold and brushed over silver hoops and chandeliers were tempting but sadly I didn't walk out with a purchase. A store that in itself is perpetually lovely.

27.description: I cannot say enough good things about the staff at this store. I'm by no means tiny and get a little intimidated going into boutiques. The sales girl (wish I got her name!) was so sweet and helpful. I told her I was looking for something for my upcoming birthday and she walked through the store with me picking out outfits that she thought would work for my plans. My only complaint is that there wasn't a huge selection of larger sizes, but there were definitely options.  The tops I tried were all so cute & I can't wait to wear my purchase next weekend to celebrate my big day!

35.description: Great jewelry.  Range of prices, too.

8.description: I am writing an updated review after the owner of this store sent an email to the host of the party, sought me out and messaged me on facebook, and also responded to my original post on yelp. After re-evaluating my experience at Sara Jane, I still have the following things to say. We went to this store for a private shopping event that my friend bid on at a charity event. The owner made several rude comments about how no one was shopping, how no one bought anything, and the females present at the party can confirm these statements were made (since the owner questioned the validity of these statements in my original post). Several of the girls bought things, including 2 scarves, a sweater, 2 shirts, and a tank (which we all have receipts for in case the owner wants to question the validity of that as well). It is my opinion that the the store owner was rude, and acted annoyed that we were in there and not every individual spent money on her clothes.
