It came to a point that we all grabbed our stuff and walked out because it was so uncomfortable being in there. I think this woman needs to re-evaluate how she treats her customers, and also how she handles criticism. Yelp is a site that can be utilized for good experiences and bad, and I had a bad one. I'd like to conclude this by stating I am writing about my honest and unfortunate experience with this boutique and this overly aggressive and extremely unprofessional woman who owns it. I have never had someone try to contact me outside of this website for reviewing their business, be it good or bad, and I find that behavior on her end to be very troubling.

0.description: Sara Jane's is my absolute favorite place to shop in Chicago, not only because of the unique and stylish clothes but also because of the experience. Sara and the entire staff are so helpful and make you feel great every time you're there. I would highly rate Sara Jane's!

38.description: I'm in full agreement with all of the reviews- this store is the bomb! They carry the cutest clothing at very expensive prices, but I have gotten some great deals here. The owner also sends out coupons all the time to people on her mailing list so that helps a lot. Even if you do pay full price for the clothing here it's worth it!

20.description: So we made our annual pilgrimage to Chicago for Cards-Cub series and now that trip always has to also include a trip to Sara Jane!  Great clothes, great service ~ fun atmosphere...and LOVING the new dress today that I just bought on Friday!

19.description: Last week, one of our super fashionable Yelp execs rocked a jacket that I knew I had to own. I'm not usually one to copy a look, but you don't understand... this jacket is edgy, chic and so flattering. Andrea said she didn't mind if I purchased the same one (hey, she travels 24/7 anyway so we're usually not in the same place at the same time) so off I was.Upon walking in, I was greeted by a helpful staffer who offered to show me all the jackets. She led me to the coveted jacket, but it was a size small in a form-fitting cut. She did find a medium, but in the cream color and I wanted black! And then, she showed me the sale rack and grabbed a cropped black motorcycle jacket. Zippers! Grommets! The body-conscious feminine cut is exactly what I had in mind. And don't forget the key word: sale. PLUS an extra 20% off!Lots of cute dresses and tops caught my eye after a quick scan of the boutique. Though, my one-track mind couldn't focus on any of the other clothes today. But I'll be returning soon, now that I know how quickly their stuff moves!

33.description: You know those days when you just hate everything in your closet? I've been having a lot of them lately.  As I was staring at all the clothes in my closet this morning that are "so last year" I remembered the $50 coupon (off a purchase of $200) that came from my favorite boutique, Sara Jane, just the other day.  I grabbed my husband, dog, credit card, and coupon...and we were on our way to do some shopping! As always Sara Jane did not let me down.  I found a cute sweater and dress within minutes and Sara was giving me recommendations on how to spice the adorable dress up with a belt.  My husband and dog made themselves at home on the patio of Old Town Pub just right next door with the bears game, a beer, and a plate of fries. I think my husband was surprised when I walked out with a bag so soon, but that's the beauty of Sara Jane....with fabulous merchandise and even better service they make shopping easy (and fun!).

2.description: Have walked by often but decided to go in yesterday, very happy I did so! Sales friend was fun and knowledgable, walked out with a Xmas present and a thanksgiving outfit for me and a very timely pair of warm gloves!Thank you, I'll be back

34.description: I REALLY like the merchandise in this store.  What I don't like is the owner.  I've shopped here on and off for the past couple years and every single time I've gone in, I've experienced nothing but rude, brassy and quite frankly obnoxious behavior from the owner.  I've always overlooked it because they do have a great selection of unique clothes, but I decided to write this review because I just called to get the name of a designer for a dress I liked there, as my husband offered to get it for my birthday.  She answered the phone, told me she "doesn't know who makes the dress" and I asked her to please check - to which she replied "why do you need to know the designer of the dress??" - rudely.  I was shocked that she wouldn't answer me.  She's the owner.  She knows who makes the f*ing dress.  Secondly, when I asked her to check, why the hell should she care why I wanted to know?  Then I told her my husband was coming in and I wanted him to get the right dress blah blah blah - way more than I cared to go into - to which she replied - again, rudely "I'll put it on hold for you - what's your name"?  I woud like to say that most of the sales girls I have encountered there have been great.  Wish I could say the same for the owner.  I will not be shopping here again.

32.description: I was visiting, & looked in the window, & walked in.  Cool Store.... Loved it, & they were so helpful in helping me find a dress for a special event I was in town for.  I cant wait to go back to Chicago so I can shop there again.

18.description: By far my favorite boutique in the Gold Coast/Old Town neighborhoods!  The women who work there are fantastic, and their clothes/jewelry/handbags are all at fair price points.  They're always updating their stock, and you can't go there without being offered a glass of wine, coffee, or something else fantastic.  Their sales are amazing, and it's just an overall fun place to shop.  Love supporting Sara Jane!

41.description: If you're looking to find one of a kind women's clothing items that you won't see anywhere else in the city, head to Old Town and visit Sara Jane.  The styles are unique and if you are ready to spend money on looking good, then this is the place to be.  You'll find stylish trends anywhere from 80's off the shoulder sweaters to evening attire perfect for a night out.  And stop in this Saturday and view the hottest trend- Cowboy Boots.  They are having a Cowboy Boot trunk show so side step it on in!

13.description: I have been shopping at this store for years and they always have the greatest merchandise and it's always new. The women that work there are always so sweet,  outgoing and helpful. I recommend this place to everyone!!

4.description: Walking down on Wells the other day with the bf and spotted this adorable boutique. I popped in and the friendly ladies informed me that they are having their summer sale. This store is well-organized, but unfortunately there were not many extra smalls left on the sales rack. No worries, I still managed to score 2 dresses and some super cute jeans all for $200! You can tell the quality of the clothes here is superb; this is not your forever 21, wear it one time and everything falls apart kind of deal. The sales ladies were very laid back yet attentive. Most of the items here are reasonably priced. I was able to find casual weekend dresses as well as work outfit here. I will be stopping by frequently as they seem to update their inventory quite often. It would be nice if they carry more dresses for petite people like me.

24.description: I absolutely love this store time and time again. They are always getting great new seasonal pieces and the jewelry is fun and affordable. The staff is friendly and helpful but never pushy (which is a big deal to me). I happen to work down the street and love stopping in when I have time. The owner is particularly helpful and knowledgeable about the products, and always makes me feel welcome. I will keep going back and suggest you do too! (also a great place to pick up a gift for a friend!)

6.description: This is an amazing store that I have been shopping at for almost 9 years. Sara stocks unique items that you won't find at others places. I find whenever I clean out my closet I always keep my Sara Jane clothes because they never go out of style.  The owner is super helpful and sweet!

22.description: I bought a GREAT hat here the other day.  Sparkly, gray and cute!  I've gotten SO many compliments on it already from friends and strangers alike.  It was on the pricy side (to me) for what it was, but I am wearing it a lot and it was definitely worth it in the end. I also got a great pair of skinny cords on sale!  Great fit and great deal. Owner was very nice and we chatted quite a bit.  Loved the service.  I will be back!

15.description: My friend and I came here on a sunny Sunday morning. There was one person working who did not bother to even speak with us until we had something in our hands. She didn't check on us while we tried clothes on. The clothes are very expensive and to be honest, prefer my experience at Handle with Care versus this one. The lady working appeared bored and didn't even offer to take the clothes once we were done.Me thinks not Sara Jane - would not recommend as there are far better stores in Chicago y'all!

40.description: I recently stopped by this store and loved the merchandise.  I actually got a great dress on sale that I will get alot of use out of. The owner was also extremely friendly and helpful. I could see myself going back here for unique items and for any parties that might come up.  Its a little expensive like most boutiques in Chicago, but I found great stuff on sale.

7.description: This was my first Well's Street Art Fair and my first time in Sara Jane's.  Sara Jane's was a saving grace this past weekend and a great find.  What a godsend.  The weather warmed up much more than expected!  Sara was offering complimentary air conditioning :-) and 20% off the entire store.  I was able to grab a cami at a great price and get a wee respite from the heat.The woman that helped me was hysterical and gave me a great laugh.  I loved the service and the offer of something cold to drink.  Considering how crowded the store was I thought the offer was a nice attention to detail (namely my needs at the moment).  Clearly, I was a little too hot (i.e. too gross) to try on outfits however, I liked what I saw.  I'll definitely be back, not only because I liked the merchandise but because I also enjoyed the banter with the staff.

36.description: Thank you to the yelp fashion show, I found Sara Jane!I went to the "Snooze, you Lose sale" this past Saturday, at 9AM sharp.We woke up super early (for a Saturday) to take advantage of the 40% off the entire store!  That is just an amazing deal!I got a super cute bold printed silk dress, a pair of jeans, and 2 pairs of hanky pankys, all for just above $200!!!My friends got a very sleek and sexy black top, a necklace, and a pair of jeans!  The jeans were absolutely the best deal, already on sale and an additional 40% off!  The hanky pankys were also on sale for 40% off!!!  You can't beat just over $10 for hanky pankys!Make sure you double check your receipt though; I realized that I got overcharged and had to get it corrected.  Good thing I caught it!  Sara also gave us a recommendation on where to get our jeans hemmed with "original hems".  We'll see how that turns out!I'll be visiting Sara Jane every time they have a sale - unfortunately I can't afford things at full price :(

30.description: Last week, one of our super fashionable Yelp execs rocked a jacket that I knew I had to own. I'm not usually one to copy a look, but you don't understand... this jacket is edgy, chic and so flattering. Andrea said she didn't mind if I purchased the same one (hey, she travels 24/7 anyway so we're usually not in the same place at the same time) so off I was.Upon walking in, I was greeted by a helpful staffer who offered to show me all the jackets. She led me to the coveted jacket, but it was a size small in a form-fitting cut. She did find a medium, but in the cream color and I wanted black! And then, she showed me the sale rack and grabbed a cropped black motorcycle jacket. Zippers! Grommets! The body-conscious feminine cut is exactly what I had in mind. And don't forget the key word: sale. PLUS an extra 20% off!Lots of cute dresses and tops caught my eye after a quick scan of the boutique. Though, my one-track mind couldn't focus on any of the other clothes today. But I'll be returning soon, now that I know how quickly their stuff moves!

3.description: I love that Sara Jane is a small boutique where personal shopping attention is common. I've visited twice and have been laden with outfits to try and cajoled, which is exactly my shopping style. The folks working there seem to be casual and fun.If there's something I dislike about shopping (in general) it's going through racks. Sara Jane has walls lined with racks (in case that IS your style). I am extremely appreciative that the employees at Sara Jane coddle me and put me into a fitting room and hand me outfits so that I can curtail the racks.Speaking of the fitting rooms, they are curtained off from the rest of the store. The curtains are hard to close and there is a gap along the mirrored wall where you can see clearly into the neighboring fitting room.The clothes are pretty unique. It's nice to know that you won't see any other person wearing the same thing as you when you purchased it from Sara Jane. It's easy to tell that the person (or people) who do the merchandising at Sara Jane has a distinctive style. There are funky patterns, colors, and flowy/stretchy fabrics. I noticed a few items with leather-like accents during my last visit. There are large pieces of jewelry such as bangles, cuffs, and bold necklaces and a few daintier accessories.Although I'm not  au courant, I have a vague sense of what works on me. I am short, slender, and have an athletic build. I have nothing to camouflage with pleats and drapery. I need structured clothing to help create curves where there are none. That said, I need to be careful about fitted clothing that is aimed to showcase a tiny waist or length (both of which I don't have). Most of the clothing at Sara Jane is probably intended for women with curves.The first time I went to Sara Jane I tried several pieces and came away empty handed. The next time I tried on at least eight outfits and came away with a dress, two pairs of earrings, and a bandeau (a one-size-fits-all strapless bra) for $150. If it weren't so time consuming, I would like the shopping experience even more. I am a fan of the prices at Sara Jane. I wish that there were more selections that worked for me.

14.description: I bought a GREAT hat here the other day.  Sparkly, gray and cute!  I've gotten SO many compliments on it already from friends and strangers alike.  It was on the pricy side (to me) for what it was, but I am wearing it a lot and it was definitely worth it in the end. I also got a great pair of skinny cords on sale!  Great fit and great deal. Owner was very nice and we chatted quite a bit.  Loved the service.  I will be back!

29.description: My fiance Eric and I came here with a Groupon. I really had no expectations for our visit after reading lots of mixed reviews. We walked in on a Monday at 4pm. We had been downtown running errands and we were starved. I remembered I had this Groupon so we decided to cash in. There's nothing really spectacular or special about this bar. You walk in and it's got that standard u-shape bar in the middle of the space. Lots of TVs around to catch sports which is cool. There was a pool table and a jukebox as well. There were half booth half tables along the edge of the bar so we sat there. There were some gentleman scattered at the bar that I guessed were regulars. They were all just shooting the shit. So our Groupon was either 2 burger or entrees and 4 beers. My main drawn to this special was the fact that it had alcohol included. Eric ordered a beef burger and I ordered a turkey burger. Both great and tasty. I ordered chipotle mayo on the side to put on my burger. It was really runny. It did not resemble mayo at all. I still put it on my burger and kinda used it as a dipping sauce. Service was decent. Everything over all was pleasant. We got our food and our drinks so it was well worth it. There wasn't anything spectacular about the place. Since this isn't an area that we frequent I'm not sure that we will be back. If it wasn't for the Groupon we wouldn't have stop by in the first place. If we're in the neighborhood it would be a place we would consider.

42.description: WOOF.Came here with the groupon for 2 burgers and 4 beers for 18 bucks. What a steal, right? Couldn't believe that the Burger Saloon, only had 2 types of burgers. Odd, right?Maybe it is because they don't even know how to cook a burger. It was more of a hockey puck that got burned in a fire place for 24 hours. I would never even feed these burgers to animal.The beer selection wasn't bad, but the beer wasn't too cold, and the glass was warm. So it had to be chugged within 2.5 minutes to be enjoyable.Will not be back. Ick.

23.description: This place is an odd cowboy and yuppie hangout. We came with the groupon, and as soon as we sat down we were asked if we came with a groupon. Not sure where to start with this place.We ordered two beers a Guinness and a greenline. Which both oddly tasted like bud light. Then we waited...Eventually our server came back to us and we ordered an appetizer which arrived 30 minutes later. Eleven tortilla chips with a small amount of onions and peppers were passed off as a $9 order of nachos. The burgers themselves were tasty, really overboard on the meat and cooked perfectly. Both of our orders were wrong but it was like watching paint dry so we didn't say anything.Reason for two starz-What is this place trying to be? Get a bar manager and a kitchen manager and run a successful business. I feel like I was ripped off by getting A groupon. If you're reading this review and still chose to come here prepare to be let down. This place sucks.

47.description: I would definitely recommend this place to my friends.  The staff is very attentive and down to earth.  The food is amazing.  Anyone that goes there MUST try the stuffed cheeseburger...YUM.  Definitely worth gaining weight for...:) I would have given it 5 stars, but it's too far from my house....I'm a suburbanite.

8.description: Great dive bar to have a drink and a bite. "It's more fun to eat at a bar than drink at a . . .

31.description: Here for a Groupon. Smelled bad. Terrible stale draft beer. Slow service. Terrible hamburger. Never again.

34.description: I came here on a Friday night for dinner and a few drinks.  Overall, the service was pretty terrible.  They screwed up both our meals and we had to ask multiple times for our second round of drinks.  The burger and chicken fingers were excessively dry and overall pretty bland.  Not worth going!

16.description: This place was awful. Terrible service, even worse food. The bartender was slow and the burger I got tasted awful - the meat was flavorless and they hadn't bothered to ask how we wanted them cooked. I will never go here again!

13.description: Like everyone else, we came here with a groupon. We had just finished a pub crawl so we were craving some greasy, loaded food and this place seemed perfect. It was quite empty on a Saturday evening, with some sketchy sorts seated at the bar. My Guinness was slopped down in front of me after a single pour and I got to watch it settle in front of me before I could sip my metallic-tasting beverage. I might have been spoiled though considering the pub crawl was an Irish one and I had been drinking well-poured Guinnesses all afternoon ... nah, it would have been shit either way.I ordered my stuffed burger medium-rare and received it medium well. It was pretty gray looking and waaaay too big considering the meat was unflavorful and dry. Quite a let down. The fries were just alright as well. We got what we needed out of it in terms of greasy food to recharge for the rest of the night, but it wasn't tasty and left us feeling heavy and too full to stay out much longer.

11.description: My fiance Eric and I came here with a Groupon. I really had no expectations for our visit after reading lots of mixed reviews. We walked in on a Monday at 4pm. We had been downtown running errands and we were starved. I remembered I had this Groupon so we decided to cash in. There's nothing really spectacular or special about this bar. You walk in and it's got that standard u-shape bar in the middle of the space. Lots of TVs around to catch sports which is cool. There was a pool table and a jukebox as well. There were half booth half tables along the edge of the bar so we sat there. There were some gentleman scattered at the bar that I guessed were regulars. They were all just shooting the shit. So our Groupon was either 2 burger or entrees and 4 beers. My main drawn to this special was the fact that it had alcohol included. Eric ordered a beef burger and I ordered a turkey burger. Both great and tasty. I ordered chipotle mayo on the side to put on my burger. It was really runny. It did not resemble mayo at all. I still put it on my burger and kinda used it as a dipping sauce. Service was decent. Everything over all was pleasant. We got our food and our drinks so it was well worth it. There wasn't anything spectacular about the place. Since this isn't an area that we frequent I'm not sure that we will be back. If it wasn't for the Groupon we wouldn't have stop by in the first place. If we're in the neighborhood it would be a place we would consider.

39.description: Not sure what all the bad reviews are about.  I went with my sister tonight to use our Groupon.  We were allowed to order a salad instead of a burger.  The Cobb salad was really delcious with yum grilled chicken.  The burger was huge and tasty.  My sister ordered it well done (not my choice) but I still really liked it.   Great beers on tap.   We did smell cigarette smoke but I think that may have been from an employee.  Otherwise great experience.  Would definitely go back!

37.description: Ehhh I really wasn't too impressed.For a Burger Saloon they really didn't have too many Burger options on their menu. I came here with friends to use a Groupon and the deal itself was very good but I felt my stuffed burger was overcooked. I came back a second time (again with a groupon) and ordered my stuffed burger, this time Medium Rare and again my burger was overcooked.There are too many other better options out there for burgers to keep coming back and giving them another opportunity to get it right.

0.description: When it comes to hanging out in old Town, I was sure I had been to every place in town.  But when friends of mine kept saying we had to go to "Salukis", who was I to say something to the contrary.  The funny part?  They go here so often they didn't even know there had been a name change somewhere along the way and Saluki's is now the Old Town Burger Saloon.But no matter what you call it, I call it a pretty decent bar that doesn't give into the pretense that all the other places on this stretch of Wells street succumb to.  I'm talking about a real bar, with a decent jukebox, pool table and some pretty decent bar food.  We were warmly welcomed and quickly shown to a table.  The server was over in a flash and she put up with a large group ordering a range of things including some of their parmesan garlic fries.  I was surprised that they were out of some of the standard name brand liquors which seemed odd although it was the weekend of the art festival so they may have been more busy than normal.And if you want to play the jukebox, just know that there is a good chance that there are a ton of people before you and you may never hear ANY of your music so keep your fingers crossed that there are people who have the same music taste as you or you may be listening to rap all night!For this simple bar loving gal?  You can bet I'll be back.  The service was good, the prices right and the staff was warm and welcoming from the bouncer to the bartender to the busser and server, everyone engaged with us.  And isn't that just what a neighborhood bar is supposed to do?

38.description: Like many of the other reviews on here I have to agree that the small selection of burgers is kind of pitiful when it's a part of the establishment's name.  I came here with an $18 Groupon for 2 entrees and 4 beers. The place has a hole in the wall kind of vibe.  A large bar in the center with some small cocktail tables around, a modern jukebox, and an arcade game.  We sat at the bar & presented the Groupon.  The bartender kind of made a face which is annoying because I always tip well on whatever the original bill would be without the Groupon.  Anyway...The wait for our food was a bit longer than expected.  Waffle fries always bring a smile to my face, but let's face it..this isn't a super upgrade or anything. I got a stuffed burger with cheddar and bacon - it was just okay.  There was much flavor in the actual meat. Overall, I'd probably come back for drinks, but not likely for the food.

27.description: Come for the groupon deal. Stay for as long as it takes to finish your meal.First off, I'm utterly shocked that this place is still open. Like several other reviewers of OTBS, I was bamboozled into purchasing the groupon. Also, similar to other reviewers I had a horrible experience. This establishment really does suck you in with a amazing deal. Instead of writing a long scathing review I'll do two lightning rounds.First visit: slow service, one bartender/waitress, bad beer selection, bright tv with weird dating profiles on it, horrible beer pours, incompetent staff, ok food not worth the price, bartender yelling at us because of a mistake she made with the groupon, bartender failing to cut a guy off who was nearly passing out.Second visit (bought two groupons at once): Stella was really budlight, exploding kegs, two bad bartenders, a giant chicken finger platter (only good thing), staff awkwardly hanging up christmas lights in an unsafe three stooges-like manner, more odd things on that bright tv, crappy service, mixed up our food with another couple and tried to give them their plates after we ate some fries.Aside from all those things I was really annoyed by three other things. 1) How dare you call yourself a "burger saloon" when you only have two beef burgers on the menu. The options are a stuffed burger or a regular burger. Also, a turkey burger is thrown in there. 2) They push the saloon look with a cheesy decor peppered with John Wayne photos. It's about as authentic as the Weihenstephaner mugs that all the beer are poured in. 3) The nerve of these people to post lazy, fake reviews. It's absurd that they would actually think that shit would fly. Booooo to this place.

32.description: Went there on a Groupon and was presently surprised. Definite improvement from the old Saluk days. I got the grass feed burger. So good.  You can select to add many onion options to your burger (red, grilled, fried) and numerous other toppings to individualize your meal. There is a bit of a dive bar atmosphere which may not be great for dinner but nice for catching some beers. Definitely coming back.

48.description: Cool place!! Great drink specials and awesome food. I would recommend this place

44.description: Went to this place to obviously grab a burger....makes sense right?  First they only have 2 burgers on the menu.  A standard burger and then a stuffed  burger.  Got the stuffed burger, thought it would be good.  And I was wrong!  It was oozing grease and tasted absolutely awful.  Bartender asked me why I wasn't eating my burger, told him I found it repulsive and asked him to take it away.  He still charged me for my burger when I only had 2 bites.....whatever still paid the bill but I will never visit this place EVER again!One main question: how can you call yourself a 'Burger Saloon' when all you have is 2 burgers?

24.description: Has anyone been here without the groupon?? (We had one as well).We came last Friday night and it was completely fine. "A-ok" is basically it. The burgers were tasty... We each ordered medium and they came our medium well, pushing well which was annoying but not a felony. The beer was cold and the bartender, Grace, was a pleasure. Based on other reviews it seems like this place is pretty hit or miss. Give them the benefit of the doubt for now.

7.description: I went here early in the evening to grab dinner. I liked the ambiance when I walked in - seemed like a cool place. but that's the only nice thing I can say. the food was terrible and the service was appalling. my advice - skip this place, but if you must go, steer clear of the food and check your bill at the end of the night. when I got there, the bartender was basically having a panic attack because his colleagues were late. it was 7:10, so assuming they were supposed to get in at 7. he was complaining to anyone who would listen about that - and really preoccupied to the point where he was apologizing to customers for being so frazzled. when I asked, "how's the turkey burger?", he replied, "regular or sweet potato fries?" shortly after I ordered, his two late colleagues rolled in - one of the women took her coat off behind the bar and proceeded to serve up two waters to customers without even washing her hands. I soon got my turkey burger only to discover it was pretty awful. I couldn't get over the funky smell - and the taste was something akin to cardboard. the fries (sweet potato) weren't bad, though. Although I only took two bites of my burger, no one asked me how I was doing or if it was ok, or even pretended that they noticed I wasn't eating my food. I didn't say anything because at this point I had come to the realization that this place was hopeless. when I asked for my check still no one asked about the uneaten burger. I guess it must be a regular occurrence here. the bill came to $21 for one burger and one draft beer. when I suggested it might be wrong (the burger was only $8), the woman spent some minutes futzing about to determine I was given the "wrong" tab. she dropped a $5 bill down on the bar in front of me and walked away. no apology, nada. I wouldn't believe it if it didn't happen to me! it was unreal. It is unbelievable that a place like this stays in business, if this is par for the course.

49.description: I think this place is so cool, I had the taco in a bun which was different and really good!   the horse in the Window reminded me of something from Texas! Cool place over all!

40.description: Went here on a Groupon and for Monday Night Football.  The service was good but the food was horrible!  For being a "Burger" bar/restaurant there wasn't much to choose from.  I ordered the stuffed burger cooked Medium.  It took forever to come out and was cooked beyond well done!  One of my friends ordered his medium rare and had the same problem.   The TVs are hung extremely high and is hard to watch sporting games.  Would not recommend....not even worth the Groupon price.....

30.description: I always feel hopeful when I see a new restaurant open in Old Town. This neighborhood seems to be the mecca for sub-par food in Chicago (Orso's, O'Brien's, etc.). I was really hoping for Old Town Burger Saloon to be an exception. Unfortunately it is not. I would expect a burger saloon to offer some darn good hamburgers, since the restaurant name implies that burgers are their specialty. I felt there were enough burger choices and they were reasonably priced. But my burger was overcooked and dry. And this may sound strange, but there was just too much meat! I opted for the 3/4 pound burger since the 1 pound burger just seemed ridiculous. But the 3/4 pound burger was still pretty ridiculous. I ordered a number of additional ingredients with the burger, but I could barely taste any of them. All I tasted was dried meat in every bite. In this city, a burger joint can't compete if it delivers anything less than a spectacular burger. Old Town Burger Saloon doesn't even come close. Old Town has let me dow once again.

46.description: This was my first time at this place and will be my last. I also hope the owner(s) read this review regarding the service on Wednesday nights because it is really disappointing.I remember there was one server/bartender with brunette hair serving drinks and food for the entire place and I can understand that she can be overwhelmed but I just think that those feelings could be held back when it comes to serving customers. I met a friend there and when I sat down I had to FLAG her down for her to notice that I just arrived there. Finally, I got a beer but she never cme back to check up on us or ask if we would like to look at the menu or anything. My friend and I finished our beers and again we HAD to get her attention for her to get us another round and a menu. Was not a fan of the food. My friend and I did not think it was amazing. We both didn't finish our food so I asked for a box while my friend was deciding whether he was going to take his home. I asked the bartender to get me one box and then my friend decides he does want to take his home so I got the bartender's attention and asked her for another box. She rolled her eyes because she HAD to get another to go box! I couldn't believe it. Rude server, ok food, bad experience! Come on now!

1.description: This place has an odd hold on me.  At the south end of Old Town it doesn't really fit in with what you would expect in the area.  It's a small bar, nothing seems new or shiny, lots of regulars, great bar staff, and excellent burgers.  Very non-assuming which I guess I like.  The waffle fries aren't my favorite, but the garlic Parmesan ones that weren't on the menu were quite good.  If you are looking for a good time and to not break the bank in Old Town give this place a try.

9.description: Amazing Burgers and great atmosphere.I tried the "chefs special burger" and it was awesome. If I wasn't so full I'd try another burger off the menu. Even better is the friendly and comfortable atmosphere. I can see coming back here again and again. Great for casual dining or a night out with friends.

26.description: Dropped in last month for a burger. The place smelled like a urnial cake. My wife and I both ordered the stuffed burger, medium. They tasted horrible and were cooked beyond well done, like hockey pucks. We wont be back.

25.description: Not as bad as everyone says, but still loses major points.We arrived shortly after 6 p.m. on a Tuesday.  There was one woman behind the bar.  She alone served 14 customers throughout the restaurant.  That's a major staffing problem.As you might expect with an overwhelmed server, the service was pretty slow.  Yes, we had the Groupon.  I ordered a burger, stuffed with provolone and bacon.  I also ordered a side of buffalo sauce.  It was tasty.  Not the best burger in the city (by far), but I enjoyed it.I also had parmesean waffle fries.  Again, nothing special.  But fine.My girlfriend asked for the truffle fries they had listed on the menu.  The server said they didn't have those... that it was a "typo."  Huh?What's even weirder is that the sole waitress/bartender was pretty scarce until we finally grabbed her to ask for our check.  She appeared with the bill and I started pulling out money.  As soon as the money hit the table, she grabbed it and was gone.  And she took my beer glass, which was still a quarter full.  I didn't have a chance to tell her I was still drinking.If this place hired more than one person to handle the customer load, I'm sure the experience would have been better.  The food isn't great... but understaffing is an easily-remedied problem.  And the owner of this joint is just throwing money down the drain.

12.description: So I made the mistake of buying two groupons and having a hunch this place won't last until the groupon expiration date, I decided to hurry and go back. I changed my game plan this time and skipped the burgers. I had pasta and the mister had chicken fingers. Now the pasta was fine- nothing to write home about. The chicken finger were good and come on huge platter. Despite being better than the burgers they are maybe worth 7 bucks, not the 10.00 menu listing.  After an uneventful eating experience I was ready to bump this up to two stars UNTIL:1. I order stella and it was warm bud light2. I was sitting at the bar and the keg "exploded" and beer sprayed in my eye. Yes you read that right! How is the even possbile? The bartender apologized and quickly moved on while I am sitting at the bar in tears. Yeah to hell with this place. Even with the groupon its not worth it!

21.description: The Yelp reviews almost made me not use my Groupon here, but thankfully, I had a decent experience when we went last Thursday.  Most people had issue with the service, but our service was fast and friendly (the place was mostly empty when we got there).  It sounds like a lot of people didn't love their burger; we didn't love it, but I have to say, it was very serviceable and were it not for living in Burgertown, USA, I think I would have liked it even more.  This is definitely true when you consider the Groupon gets you four beers and two 8 oz. cheeseburgers and fries for $18!!I probably won't go back without a Groupon, but I'm just thankful that this meal didn't suck.

17.description: Come for the groupon deal. Stay for as long as it takes to finish your meal.First off, I'm utterly shocked that this place is still open. Like several other reviewers of OTBS, I was bamboozled into purchasing the groupon. Also, similar to other reviewers I had a horrible experience. This establishment really does suck you in with a amazing deal. Instead of writing a long scathing review I'll do two lightning rounds.First visit: slow service, one bartender/waitress, bad beer selection, bright tv with weird dating profiles on it, horrible beer pours, incompetent staff, ok food not worth the price, bartender yelling at us because of a mistake she made with the groupon, bartender failing to cut a guy off who was nearly passing out.Second visit (bought two groupons at once): Stella was really budlight, exploding kegs, two bad bartenders, a giant chicken finger platter (only good thing), staff awkwardly hanging up christmas lights in an unsafe three stooges-like manner, more odd things on that bright tv, crappy service, mixed up our food with another couple and tried to give them their plates after we ate some fries.Aside from all those things I was really annoyed by three other things. 1) How dare you call yourself a "burger saloon" when you only have two beef burgers on the menu. The options are a stuffed burger or a regular burger. Also, a turkey burger is thrown in there. 2) They push the saloon look with a cheesy decor peppered with John Wayne photos. It's about as authentic as the Weihenstephaner mugs that all the beer are poured in. 3) The nerve of these people to post lazy, fake reviews. It's absurd that they would actually think that shit would fly. Booooo to this place.

10.description: The Yelp reviews almost made me not use my Groupon here, but thankfully, I had a decent experience when we went last Thursday.  Most people had issue with the service, but our service was fast and friendly (the place was mostly empty when we got there).  It sounds like a lot of people didn't love their burger; we didn't love it, but I have to say, it was very serviceable and were it not for living in Burgertown, USA, I think I would have liked it even more.  This is definitely true when you consider the Groupon gets you four beers and two 8 oz. cheeseburgers and fries for $18!!I probably won't go back without a Groupon, but I'm just thankful that this meal didn't suck.

5.description: I'm not sure why they changed the name from Salukis but as far as I can tell it's the same owners, staff, and customers.  I really like most of their food and especially the Nachos.  If you miss bars like Sterch's and Hotsie Totsie then this is the place for you.  Just to echo a statement posted by a previous poster, there always seems to be at least one drunken loudmouth in there every time I go in (maybe it's the same guy) so I wouldn't really recommend this place for families unless you're trying to raise the next Babe Ruth.

3.description: Not as bad as everyone says, but still loses major points.We arrived shortly after 6 p.m. on a Tuesday.  There was one woman behind the bar.  She alone served 14 customers throughout the restaurant.  That's a major staffing problem.As you might expect with an overwhelmed server, the service was pretty slow.  Yes, we had the Groupon.  I ordered a burger, stuffed with provolone and bacon.  I also ordered a side of buffalo sauce.  It was tasty.  Not the best burger in the city (by far), but I enjoyed it.I also had parmesean waffle fries.  Again, nothing special.  But fine.My girlfriend asked for the truffle fries they had listed on the menu.  The server said they didn't have those... that it was a "typo."  Huh?What's even weirder is that the sole waitress/bartender was pretty scarce until we finally grabbed her to ask for our check.  She appeared with the bill and I started pulling out money.  As soon as the money hit the table, she grabbed it and was gone.  And she took my beer glass, which was still a quarter full.  I didn't have a chance to tell her I was still drinking.If this place hired more than one person to handle the customer load, I'm sure the experience would have been better.  The food isn't great... but understaffing is an easily-remedied problem.  And the owner of this joint is just throwing money down the drain.

35.description: Went today for the third time.  I live about 3 blocks away, so it is convenient.  After reading the latest reviews, I thought I would leave one to offset the latest Grouponers.  You spent $18 for 2 burgers and 4 beers (which includes 312, Green Line, and Stella.  How many places can you even get 4 16 oz beers for $18 dollars in the city?  The person who complained about 2 types of burgers.........they have a 3/4 pound, then a stuffed burger.  Then you get to choose the cheese and toppings.  People complaining about the temperature of beer.  Beer isn't supposed to be served in a frosty mug.  When it is, it flattens the beer immediately.  It isn't high end dining or world changing, but have some perspective about the price you are paying and what you are getting in return.

19.description: Full disclosure: I went into this place expecting the worst.  The reviews weren't very good...the menu (like many noted) isn't very extensive, especially in terms of burgers...and the location isn't quite as nice and "trendy" as, say, Old Town Social further north on Wells.  BUT with an $18 Groupon for 2 entrees (doesn't have to be burgers!) and 4 beers (good size beers, I should add) my boyfriend and I decided to buy and try...and we ended up having a good time!I tried a stuffed burger stuffed with just cheddar cheese (I'm boring) and my boyfriend tried the grilled chicken sandwich, served with waffle fries or sweet potato fries (sweet potato were better, we concluded) and 4 beers -- we went with blue moon and 312 but there were other options, too.  Everything was good.  Award winning? No...but did they claim it would be? Nah, not really. It's just a small bar/restaurant. I think people need to remember what they're getting/where they're going.  Especially those with the Groupon! It's a steal -- go get it!Oh, there's a pool table and one of those shooting games, and a little outdoor seating area.  Give it a try, it's not so bad afterall :)

28.description: I also had a Groupon. We live in the neighborhood so I bought it before reading the reviews. I have suggested it many times and my hubby always declines. Today we finally went.So, it was really dark and had a strange smell and was totally empty at noon. We choose one of the little booths. Our waitress was also the bartender. She was very, very nice and knew exactly how the Groupon worked. We had our daughter with us which we probably wouldn't have done if we realized it was essentially a bar. My hubby ordered a burger stuffed with blue cheese and bacon which was fantastic (I had a bite) and I ordered a chicken sandwich. My sandwich was on of the best I ever had, it had cheddar and bacon and I got the aioli on the side. My husband ended up dipping his fries in it. It was so big I had half for lunch and half for dinner, it literally fed me all day.The beer selection was pretty weak, very basic bottle and 6 beers on tap. Greenline, 312, Stella, Guiness, Bud and Bud lite.I subtracted a star for atmosphere but really the food was super and the service very prompt and attentive.

45.description: I don't know why there are so many terrible reviews here.  I came here last night with my brother and boyfriend because we had the groupon.  Two entrees and 4 beers for $18... can't beat that deal.  I was nervous coming because of the terrible reviews about the service and food lacking but honestly I didn't notice.  The place is not new, let's set the record straight.  It used to be Saluki bar and just is now under new management and a new theme... which I prefer better.  I don't agree with the very bland menu and can't agree with the name because they only have 3 burger options on the menu but maybe they might change the menu... let's wait and see.We all ordered the stuffed burger, I had mine with mushrooms and Swiss cheese.  We all loved the burgers, they were big and stuffed well.  I'd prefer mine a lil less cooked but the waitress didn't ask us how we preferred ours to be cooked so we just went with it.  The waffle fries were good too.  I was also impressed with the draft beer options using the groupon, I had Stella and the boys each had 312.  can't go wrong there.We have a couple of more groupons left to use and this place is literally next door to my apartment so i know i will be back for sure.

33.description: I've walked in for drinks with my friends a few times.  I enjoy the atmosphere and the quotes on the wall from famous people.  It's all pretty much what you would expect from a local bar.  There are plenty of regulars (which we aren't) that are familiar with the staff and are there to wind down at the end of the day.The staff is friendly and the service is good.  Nothing about this place really exceeds expectations, but it doesn't fall short either.  I haven't been here when it gets crowded, and I've never tried the food.  Those factors could influence my opinion one way or the other.  But for some reasonably priced drinks on a week night, it is what it is.

43.description: Full disclosure: I went into this place expecting the worst.  The reviews weren't very good...the menu (like many noted) isn't very extensive, especially in terms of burgers...and the location isn't quite as nice and "trendy" as, say, Old Town Social further north on Wells.  BUT with an $18 Groupon for 2 entrees (doesn't have to be burgers!) and 4 beers (good size beers, I should add) my boyfriend and I decided to buy and try...and we ended up having a good time!I tried a stuffed burger stuffed with just cheddar cheese (I'm boring) and my boyfriend tried the grilled chicken sandwich, served with waffle fries or sweet potato fries (sweet potato were better, we concluded) and 4 beers -- we went with blue moon and 312 but there were other options, too.  Everything was good.  Award winning? No...but did they claim it would be? Nah, not really. It's just a small bar/restaurant. I think people need to remember what they're getting/where they're going.  Especially those with the Groupon! It's a steal -- go get it!Oh, there's a pool table and one of those shooting games, and a little outdoor seating area.  Give it a try, it's not so bad afterall :)

2.description: I'm a fan of dive bars. Most of the time they're fun. This evening was awful.The food took very long, although it tasted fine, it wasn't very impressive.I would return again if it wasn't for a drunk douche-bag at the bar screaming nonsense and talking about what women's proper proportions should be and that he would serve dog if he owned a Chinese restaurant. The worst thing is the employees didn't do much about this ornery fellow other than shush him a few times. Over served idiot.

18.description: Been coming here since summer. You know chili is good when you have a bowl in middle of July. Come enjoy a beer, buyer n a shot. I believe you'll enjoy it.

41.description: So I made the mistake of buying two groupons and having a hunch this place won't last until the groupon expiration date, I decided to hurry and go back. I changed my game plan this time and skipped the burgers. I had pasta and the mister had chicken fingers. Now the pasta was fine- nothing to write home about. The chicken finger were good and come on huge platter. Despite being better than the burgers they are maybe worth 7 bucks, not the 10.00 menu listing.  After an uneventful eating experience I was ready to bump this up to two stars UNTIL:1. I order stella and it was warm bud light2. I was sitting at the bar and the keg "exploded" and beer sprayed in my eye. Yes you read that right! How is the even possbile? The bartender apologized and quickly moved on while I am sitting at the bar in tears. Yeah to hell with this place. Even with the groupon its not worth it!

4.description: Gotta say right place right time. After a loooooong day helping the sister move this was exactly what was in order! Cold beer and burgers what more can you ask for on an awesome summer night? The food was pretty good, standard pub grub. We ordered the left side of the menu. Pretty stand up burger. I had the saloon burger with gouda and bacon. I'd have it again but not go out of my probably. Old Town prices so be ready for that I've had better for $10, this'll run you about $13. When she ordered calamari from a pub I was shocked but it was surprisingly pretty good, the sauce was great a little spicier than your average. All in all pop in and grab a bite and a brew if you're in the area. Not bad.

6.description: ::Take out review::We were not at all impressed.I love burgers. And it was a rough day at work for both of us.I stopped at four other restaurants to try to get some dinner that Monday and all of them were closed. I stumbled upon this place because a) it was open, and b) it was close to home.We got two different burgers and fries: the Mexican Burger and the Old Town Saloon Burger; the sweet potato fries and the parmesan garlic waffle fries.The prices and creativity of the burgers were great. The major disappointment was in the imbalance of quality to shoddy ingredients. Unfortunately for Old Town Burger Saloon, they picked the meat to skimp on at a time when we've been honing our taste for high quality ground beef. There were pieces of hard gristle in the burgers that were so large that we picked them out of our mouths. They also got low quality bacon that was thin and under-cooked. The other ingredients were spot on delicious.Another disappointment (and this could be because I did take-out) was that the buns and fries were soggy. The bottom bun of the burger was wet (and not with hamburger juices). The fries weren't at all crispy. I have created better fries from a frozen bag and my own oils and seasonings at home.Service was okay. They took my order, helped to validate my decisions, and told me an accurate ETA. Besides that, they didn't have much interaction with me. That's okay and I'm not holding it against them.I can't convince M to give them another shot and I don't want to! We've decided that if we have another bad work day on a Monday that we will just make our own burgers at home. Sure, our burgers won't have cool toppings on them but they will have better quality meat and we won't have to pick pieces of it out of our mouths.

22.description: Like everyone else, we came here with a groupon. We had just finished a pub crawl so we were craving some greasy, loaded food and this place seemed perfect. It was quite empty on a Saturday evening, with some sketchy sorts seated at the bar. My Guinness was slopped down in front of me after a single pour and I got to watch it settle in front of me before I could sip my metallic-tasting beverage. I might have been spoiled though considering the pub crawl was an Irish one and I had been drinking well-poured Guinnesses all afternoon ... nah, it would have been shit either way.I ordered my stuffed burger medium-rare and received it medium well. It was pretty gray looking and waaaay too big considering the meat was unflavorful and dry. Quite a let down. The fries were just alright as well. We got what we needed out of it in terms of greasy food to recharge for the rest of the night, but it wasn't tasty and left us feeling heavy and too full to stay out much longer.

15.description: Ehhh I really wasn't too impressed.For a Burger Saloon they really didn't have too many Burger options on their menu. I came here with friends to use a Groupon and the deal itself was very good but I felt my stuffed burger was overcooked. I came back a second time (again with a groupon) and ordered my stuffed burger, this time Medium Rare and again my burger was overcooked.There are too many other better options out there for burgers to keep coming back and giving them another opportunity to get it right.

20.description: Very low quality food and very slow service. I had to walk up to the waitress and ask for refills, to ask for a straw, to ask for a box, and to ask for a check. She never came to our table to check up on us and I was watching her like a hawk the whole time.. she was at the bar chatting it up with her co-workers. Will not be back ever.

36.description: The decor is hideous, grape lights tacked to the ceiling? I didn't have anything to eat, but my friends had a buger. They said it was decent at best, they were simply using their Groupon. I had two beers and both times my cup was fresh out of the dishwasher so it made the beer very warm. I wouldn't go back here because there are many other options available in Old Town.

14.description: I don't know why there are so many terrible reviews here.  I came here last night with my brother and boyfriend because we had the groupon.  Two entrees and 4 beers for $18... can't beat that deal.  I was nervous coming because of the terrible reviews about the service and food lacking but honestly I didn't notice.  The place is not new, let's set the record straight.  It used to be Saluki bar and just is now under new management and a new theme... which I prefer better.  I don't agree with the very bland menu and can't agree with the name because they only have 3 burger options on the menu but maybe they might change the menu... let's wait and see.We all ordered the stuffed burger, I had mine with mushrooms and Swiss cheese.  We all loved the burgers, they were big and stuffed well.  I'd prefer mine a lil less cooked but the waitress didn't ask us how we preferred ours to be cooked so we just went with it.  The waffle fries were good too.  I was also impressed with the draft beer options using the groupon, I had Stella and the boys each had 312.  can't go wrong there.We have a couple of more groupons left to use and this place is literally next door to my apartment so i know i will be back for sure.

58.description: Just kind of "eh".  I don't like giving low stars but this pizza is really just like Pizza Hut with a different name.  It's not terrible or anything, and it's great they're open till 4 but beyond that ....Bleh.  I feel like it was a lot cheaper when they first opened which made it more appealing.  I'm sure I'll order again at some point late night so it can't be "that" bad but I will say I wouldn't order if the better shops were open.The dough just tastes like it was frozen which I assume it was and the cheese and toppings are sparse and mediocre.  Again, not "terrible" but not really good either and why would you spend the money if it's not real good?  Also a big no to the rawish wings.  Gross.

56.description: Fast, late-night, free delivery.  The sandwiches make a good late night snack but the pizzas taste no different than the pizza from the other chain pizza joints.The service is always friendly and quick.

29.description: 2.5 stars True this definitely isn't the best pizza. I compare it to pizza you use to order in the school cafeteria. However, what this place has going for it is: delivering fast, delivering late, and delivering individual slices of pizza (not many places even have individual personal size pizzas).Plus the taste isn't extremely horrible. I normally order the individual size Classico Italiano or the individual size margarita pizza. The crust, sauce, and cheese are nothing to write home about, but the meat taste pretty decent at least. I consider this place a classier dominos. Most people I'm assuming order this pizza late (as do I) so I'm assuming it's more about getting something in your tummy than taste anyway. Enjoy! :)

42.description: Gross.We had two pizzas delivered - one eggplant, one with spinach - and they were equally terrible. The eggplant did not resemble eggplant in any way, shape, or form (neither visually or by taste), and the spinach was not spinach but bay leaves! Seriously? What the....Maybe they ran out and figured they could get away with it? I cannot even begin to wrap my head around this.The dough was extremely soggy and chewy, and several slices had sauce explode through the bottom. Yikes.Never, ever, ever again.

23.description: This place is awful, the employee looked at me before ignoring me and walking away. Don't even bother coming to place your order, it's not welcome and it's better off without your business.

47.description: You will like this place if...1. Your philosophy on pizza is that it can never be that bad. 2. You love delivery, but not if you have to pay for itYou're not going to be wowed by their options - and per item #1 above, if all you require is pizza in any way, shape or form, Sarpino's has you covered. In a city where delivery charges are upwards of $5, the word "free" is certainly a welcome option. Though you have to be willing to sacrifice taste to enjoy it.

8.description: 2.5 stars True this definitely isn't the best pizza. I compare it to pizza you use to order in the school cafeteria. However, what this place has going for it is: delivering fast, delivering late, and delivering individual slices of pizza (not many places even have individual personal size pizzas).Plus the taste isn't extremely horrible. I normally order the individual size Classico Italiano or the individual size margarita pizza. The crust, sauce, and cheese are nothing to write home about, but the meat taste pretty decent at least. I consider this place a classier dominos. Most people I'm assuming order this pizza late (as do I) so I'm assuming it's more about getting something in your tummy than taste anyway. Enjoy! :)

31.description: This is so far one of the worse pizzerias I been to, the food is practically garbage and the customer service the worse so far. My first experience actually it was a walk in and order a large pepperoni for almost 20 dollars, trust me the frozen pizzas from ALDI or little Ceasers taste better, my second time I order because one of my friends want to try it and told me that I was exaggerating, so we order from there and this what happened.I order a pizza from Sarpinos's Pizzeria on Damen but they told me that they don't deliver to my house, that there was another Sarpino's close by so I asked for the number and they refuse to give it to me because they told me that they have different owners, so I told them so what it is the same franchise. So long story short. I found out the other one on Division and wells which it was the same amount of distance from the other one.I call in to place my order and the manager told me that I will take about 1:30 to be deliver because they were busy so I told them that it was fine, well my pizza didn't arrive until 2:30 later I call them back at 1:40 hours later to check on the status of my order, they put me on hold for almost 20 min, so I hang up and call them back so they put me on hold once again, so I decide to order from some where else, so by the time the pizza driver arrived it was like like 2:30 hrs later I told them that I been waiting for too long and I didn't want it any longer, he got so mad and told me that I have to pay for the pizza and than he call the manager and I told the manager the story and I said that I been waiting for almost 3 hours for my pizza that I had call them  to check on the status and that I was on hold for almost 20 mins, the manager told me that he will give me 20% off next time I order and I told him that I don't want it any more that I have order from somewhere else already.So by the time I was talking to this guy my other pizza arrived on time and fresh and I check the pizza from Sarpinos it was cold as a rock and I told the driver, do u expect me to pay for this, he got all mad and he left speaking in a different language, I am guessing bad words.So people pls don't other from these Sarpinos restaurants, these are the worse place..

34.description: Seriously worst food I've eaten in chicago. Ordered appetizers, and sandwhiches. Food was cold, & Yes I understand that it is cold outside, but seriously? No delivery bag?

16.description: Probably the fastest pizza delivery in Chicago and the pizza is always full of flavor and still Ridiculous hot!!!    I love their Santa Fe Chicken Pizza from their Gourmet Pizza :-) Whenever my friends want late night or just good delivery pizza I raise my hand and shout out Sarpino's

13.description: One star is too generous. This is, by far, the worst pizza I've had in a long time. It truly is not good. Usually my reviews are more lengthy but there really isn't anything left to say. Go somewhere else, or go grab a frozen pizza from Jewel and save the money.

11.description: If you want to order late night food (when you're especially starving) and not receive it, this is place for you. I placed an order through GrubHub for me and three other friends after a night out. It said it would take 45 min. originally - which is typical. Then, the time changed to 1.5 hours, which is just nuts when the place is a half mile away from me. I called and spoke to a Sarpino's employee. I told him I wasn't sure I wanted to wait that long and was thinking about canceling the order. He told me he couldn't guarantee a delivery time and that I would have to cancel through GrubHub. After talking with my friends, we decided to just wait. Fast forward to 1.5 hours later and there's still no pizza. I called and he said "I cancelled it for you" - umm, what? He told me I had to cancel through GrubHub which I did NOT do. He argued with me, definitely didn't treat me with respect and offered nothing to make up for HIS mistake. Not to mention, GrubHub was still "tracking" the delivery which made me think it would arrive AND they charged me for it (after all, I never cancelled the order!). Get your act together Sarpino's, you're no Pequods and you lost my business for late night fixes.

39.description: Ordering delivery from them is atrocious! How in earth's name did it take them to deliver ONE pizza 2.5 hours to my place which is a quarter mile away???Upon delivery... no explanation, no apology, no nothing!I will never try these Sarpino schmo's again that's for sure!

37.description: Do not order from Sarpino's.  Ever.  They lie, they deliver late, and any grocery store freezer section brand makes a better pizza for cheaper.We ordered Sarpino's on Christmas Day night, hoping to relax with a movie after a great day with family.  We ordered through GrubHub, which allowed us a free 2-liter of soda with our order of $17 or more, and were also assured the food would arrive within 1 hour and 15 minutes.  Well, close to 2 HOURS later, our delivery guy arrives.  (I had to call the store to figure out where he was, and then he spent 5 minutes with me on the phone because he was at the wrong building.)  When it finally arrived, the pizza was barely warm.  I've had better DiGiorno's pizzas.  Also, that free 2-liter?  Those ass-hats actually marked off the discount on our tab and charged us for the 2-liter. I'll never order from Sarpino's again.  Oh yea.  And their pizza sucks.

0.description: Sarpino's food is consistently unbelievable. I love it so much. Quick delivery and no minimum. They're my go-to when I wanna be sure I'm gonna get something I like

38.description: Don't be fooled by the pictures on their website! The preparation and taste was disgusting. Overcooked pasta swimming in sauce that tasted like mayo. Wings were mediocre. The one time I allowed myself to eat junk food and utterly disappointed. I should've gone to Domino's.

51.description: If the only thing I had ever tried at Sarpino's was pizza, this would be a 4-star review.  With all due respect to other reviewers calling the pizza greasy, the cheese rubbery, etc., I have to wonder what they think they are ordering.  I find the cheese and the sausage quite tasty.  It's nice to get plenty of cheese without having to ask for extra.  The regular crust is just fine, and thin crust is available for those who prefer it.  I like being able to order "light sauce" because  otherwise it seems like too much to me.  Delivery in under half an hour, and around $15 for a large pizza when you apply the online discount. (various specialty and gourmet pizzas run a bit more).  Put that all together and it's a much better deal than pizzas that are no better but come from a Chicago pizza institution.  But these guys should stick to pizza:  the $3.49 small salad is 80% iceberg lettuce and just not very good; the BarBQ wings have no crispness at all; the garlic breadsticks lacking taste.

27.description: this place is a nightmare. In the year 2014 why does it take 2 hours for a pizza to arrive and they arrived with THE WRONG PIZZA!!!! called them to tell them we received the wrong pizza and then they HUNG UP THE PHONE. 2 hours later (again) they arrived with another WRONG PIZZA!!!

32.description: This pizza is awful.  Just really really bad.  I would rather have a frozen Home Run Inn Pizza.  Yes I'm from the east coast but god I'd rather eat papa johns.

54.description: Our building always orders pizza on Bear's games.  I eat it because I am lazy and hungry on Sundays...not because it is good.Sarpino's is really greasy with not a lot of flavor.  The sausage looks like pepperoni....its really weird.  I think if you blind taste tested me, I wouldn't be able to tell the difference.

48.description: Horrible delivery!!  Waited 45 minutes for the pizza to arrive.  They got the order wrong.  Then I waited another NINETY MINUTES for the correct pizza to arrive.  Sarpino's had no remorse, just coldly explained "sorry, we're backed up."  To top it off, the pizza was pretty mediocre.  I strongly recommend avoiding this place.  It's Chicago, there's so many better places to order from.

44.description: Never actually been inside, always just order delivery through website.  Service is pretty good on the couple occasions I've had to call the store.  Decent pizza and calzones.  Mostly got the 4 star for fast delivery and great prices and deals.  Pizza itself is a 3 star, calzones and dipping sauces are 4 stars.

24.description: Great service, fast delivery! I order from here super late all the time and they never fail me. And the pizza is tasty! I get the personal vegetarian and it rocks my world. Highly recommended.

7.description: I ordered a calzone and Mac and Cheese bites using their online ordering system at 11:45 AM, my lunch is at 2, so I chose to have a delayed order at 2 pm. Come 2:25, I am wondering where my food is so I call the store the girl on the phone says the driver needs 15 minutes...I told her I didn't understand why it would take so long, I placed the order 2 hours and she could give no explanation expect asking if I wanted to cancel the order. I finally got the food at 3 PM, just in time to have my lunch hour over. The service is awful here. The calzone and Mac and Cheese bites were very good however. When ordering from here I would recommend calling your order in and picking it up to avoid waiting for your food forever.

49.description: *UPDATE* Loved here when I first order and STILL I love them! They must have customer profile on the computer because It's really comfortable when I call and they just say my name and the location which I'm very appreciated. (not repeat my information like 100 times every time I order) Food is great, service is awesome. people who answering the phone, they are nice to me. One day, the owner was take care of my order and he gave me a discount because he said I'm a loyal customer :) Definitely, I call you guys again for another pasta!

40.description: Dear Sarpino's,I am very unpleased with the experience I have had with your location at 158 West Divison, Chicago IL 60610 and also with your General Manager, Alex.  Here is my issue:I bought a Restaurant.com certificate, 2 years ago, for that location. I called on Monday, September 3, 2012 to make sure it was still redeemable. I was told yes, by a female employee, but only for carry-out, not for delivery. I placed the order on Wednesday, September 5, 2012 online, and in the comments section I put "I have a Restaurant.com certificate", figuring if there was a problem, someone would contact me PRIOR to driving to the location to pick up my order. I get to the location, talk to the employee, (who also later said he was the manager on duty), and he tells me the total. I present my Restaurant.com certificate and he tells me he doesn't know what to do, so he'll talk to the manager. He comes back after a few minutes and tells me that the company, Sarpino's, no longer uses Restaurant.com certificates- sorry. He said he spoke to his general manager, Alex, and he was told that they ended their contract with them over a year ago and it would not be accepted. So, I assumed maybe there was some miscommunication, and I asked to speak to the general manager myself. I was told he wasn't there. So I asked to talk to a regular manager, and that's when the young gentleman I had be talking to said he was the manager and offered to call Alex so I could speak to him. The conversation with Alex, via cell phone, was long and drawn out. I had to ask him more than once to stop talking over me so I had a chance to rebuttal the negative accusations he was making about me, the paying customer. He told me that they would not accept the Restaurant.com certificate and when I started to ask questions as to why, he was very rude and unprofessional. I should have counted how many times the words MONEY and BUISNESS came out of his mouth. That is all he was concerned with. He did not utter the word CUSTOMER or HAPPY once. Alex: We do not have an account with them for over a year ma'am, they notified all the customers and told them they had 2 months to use them, we did that as a CURTEOSY for youMe: No one notified me?Alex: That's Restauarnt.com's fault. You need to call them. They need to give you the money back. I can't lose money for my businessMe: I understand you don't have an account with them anymore, meaning you don't sell them, but I bought this 2 years ago, and it clearly states at the bottom there is no expiration dateAlex: We don't have an account ma'am. It is no good. You need to call them. You're not a regular customer obviously if you've had it for 2 years. You haven't spent $25 in 2 years.Me: I've never ordered from Sarpino's before. I was waiting for the right time and thought tonight would be perfect. Alex:  You bought it because it was a good deal, right? Our business lost a lot of money from these certificates so we cancelled our account.Me: No, I bought it because I have heard good things about your pizza and wanted to try it. The certificate never expires.Alex: I can print anything, I can print 30, 40 certificates onlineMe: So, are you saying I'm a fraud? That this isn't a real certificate?Alex: Well, how do I know?Me: There's a validation number to call?Alex: Did you call it?Me: No, I don't work hereAlex: What do you want me to do? I cannot use it.  I'll give you $15 off.Me: Well, I had to spend $35 to use it, so $15 off is still more money than I was planning to spendAlex: How much were you planning to spend?Me: $10.Alex: NO NO NO. I'd be losing money. $15 offMe: Well sir, you're about to lose a customer. The food has already been made; you're going to lose money either way. This entire experience, from ordering to pick up, to talking on the phone and going round and round with someone only concerned about his money, not the customer, took up over an hour of my time. Needless to say, I left. I was done listening to this guy waste my time, (and I was starving), and had to think of another source for dinner. Once I cooled off, ate, and started to relax, I called Restaurant.com to find out what exactly was the case. I talked to Melanie, who was a very sweet and very kind. I told her what had happen. She looked up my account, saw the unused certificate, and looked up Sarpino's account to see the status of it: ACTIVE. Yes, Sarpino's: your account is still active. So, Alex- you lied to me. Not only was my time wasted, but I was lied to by the general manager. Restauart.com has sent a notification to the relations department and hopefully something will be done so another innocent customer will not be treated this way. For all you know, we might have loved the food so much, we would have ordered it every week. Word of mouth goes a long way in a big city, such as Chicago, and my mouth has nothing good to say about your compan

53.description: It's hard for any pizza delivery to disappoint half drunk people in a hotel at 1AM.  So I give Sardino's a thumbs up for bringing the pie really quickly, and  - - Hey! That last piece is MINE suckah.  A large pizza with pepperoni and mushrooms plus three sodas was twenty bucks plus tip.  Money well spent, considering it was 20 degrees outside.

30.description: I ordered from this place for lunch a personal sausage & mushroom pizza it arrived promptly and the pizza was still piping hot. It was sitting in big ass pool of grease like it was deep fried and thrown in the box even after I used paper towels to absorb some of the grease it was still dripping grease. Besides the grease fest the flavor was okay

46.description: The food was delicious the first few times that I ordered from here. Lately the Pizza has really gone down hill. I wont order from here again. The appatizers were still edible but the last 3 pizzas i had were all garbage.

1.description: The menu looked amazingly good. The amazing part stopped there. I got the vegetarian pizza, which was bland and extremely watery from the tomatoes. I've had organic pizza with more flavor. The chicken wings were way too soft. No crunch at all. It was like eating mini chicken breasts, not wings. That would be okay if I actually ordered chicken breast...A lot left to be desired. No flavor in either dishes. Highly disappointed.

55.description: I can't speak to the pizza yet, but soon I will. Meantime, this place is across from where I live. As I just arrived in the neighborhood from Santa Monica, CA -- where my final meal from Santa Monica Pizza Kitchen was so bad, I threw it out -- I was still craving a good, old fashioned spaghetti and meatballs dish. To my more than pleasant surprise, the spaghetti with meat sauce was mighty tasty! I ordered meatballs with it, which were really unnecessary - since the meat sauce actually had chunks of meat in it!  The breadsticks were served with extra marina for dipping - yay! The personal size portion is enough for me to get 3 meals out of it, so this is a bargain for sure. And next time, I'll order online to get the 15%. After collecting five receipts I get a free meal! Let the games begin. This will be my go-to neighborhood pasta joint! We're gonna have a great relationship!

9.description: Best calzone I've ever had, definitely recommend the Italian. Very soft bread and crunchy veggies, tastes phenomenal! I absolutely love their pizza too, it's my favorite go to pizza that isn't the classic Chicago deep dish style. Their crust is the best! Love the service at the Gold Coast location too, you can't go wrong with this place! Plus free delivery and no minimum charge is definitely a perk! 100% satisfied every time.

26.description: Not horrible pizza, but it took a really long time and wasn't hot anymore when it arrived.

25.description: Use to order from this place with some consistency but enough is enough.  I guess the delivery is free for a reason because if you live with in a mile you can walk there and pick up your food just as fast.  Tonight I ordered Mac and cheese bites well done and cheese cake at about 9:00.  I got an update food was out for delivery at 9:20.  I live 7 blocks away and it took 45 min for the driver to get here, leaving me hotter than the Mac and cheese bites. When I asked the driver his it could possibly take 45 min to go 6-7 blocks he told me traffic.... It was almost insulting.  Bottom line even got cheep pizza you have to forget this place.

12.description: I have to say that their calzones are the best. Usually we order from sarpinos over the weekend on the pizza night. We do look up other pizza places to order from but honestly, we settle back with Sarpino's. We sure know they won't mess up the order and give a delicious pizza for the money's worth. We have been ordering pizzas from here for more than a year now and I am glad that my husband found this place!!

59.description: OK.Fast delivery which is free.Pizza is OK. Good at times. Nothing spectacular. Skimpy on the toppings.In the end I say try it if you haven't.

21.description: Good Pizza Sloooooooow delivery!

17.description: Keeping my drunk stomach full

10.description: What has happened to them? When you order online, you used to get a confirmation. Then a status update. Then an "order out for delivery." The last two times I had to call after an hour. I was told " the driver left 40 minutes ago. It usually takes an Never again.

5.description: This place can literally go fuck themselves. Ordered a large pizza and waited over 3 hours for it. When we called them to check several times, they just started hanging up on our calls to avoid us. We watched the entire Kill Bill volume 2 STARVING to our deaths and these assholes can't even speak to us over the phone to explain their extreme lack of any business ethics. FUCK YOUUUUUUUUUPs: still pizza-less.

3.description: First and foremost, this Sarpino's stumbled out of the gate with an individual that refused to speak English and Spanish. After a solid ten plus minutes and requesting the manager twice, we successfully placed an order. At the end of the order we asked for a ballpark on delivery time. The delivery was late by approximately fifteen minutes. Not horrible, but coachable room for improvement.The food was greasy which one could expect, except for the one box that was saturated in oil and came apart with the pizza.  Not looking forward to processing this through my system after seeing the damaged cardboard.Nothing impressive here on the wings, garlic bread, or pizza. Likely the first and last order I will trust to this location and Sarpino's as a whole. Courteous delivery driver - 2 stars
