35.description: Free delivery which doesn't happen often in Chicago.  Ordered some calzones and they were so tasty!  Basic fast food Italian but sometimes that's what you need.

19.description: Great service, fast delivery! I order from here super late all the time and they never fail me. And the pizza is tasty! I get the personal vegetarian and it rocks my world. Highly recommended.

28.description: TERRIBLE experience ordering pizza. Would not honor VALID coupons. Very displeased with my experience. Zero stars. Two thumbs down. HUGE disappointment.

45.description: LISTEN closely. Very Closely. DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT, under any circumstances ( starving children, gun to the head etc) ORDER SARPINOS CHICKEN WINGS. You are better off going to an aldi and microwaving wings for half time instructed. Bearly any meat, soggy as hell, and fat. giant veils of fat. I've had the pizza before and liked it but these wings will scare me away for life.I would of voted ZERO if it let me.

33.description: Pizza is pretty good, but the sandwiches are not. The delivery is usually on time and there's no delivery fee.

43.description: Why so many bad reviews??A place that delivers at all hours of the night and for FREE isn't supposed to be created equal to Lou Malnati's, Pizano's, etc. so I think if people stop comparing the two places/situations to eachother, they'd see that Sarpino's isn't so bad afterall.In fact, I like Sarpinos alot.  The garlic breadsticks are pretty good, and the free dipping sauce is nice (I liked the creamy garlic one, best.)  And the pizza is really well distributed as far as chesse to sauce to crust ratio :)The delivery (through Grubhub) was ahead of the estimated time, and the food was still hot and in good shape.  And best of all, it was super cheap.All in all, it's a win in my book!

2.description: Terrible customer service. I shouldn't even give one star! Although many challenges from the first phone call with the female answering the phone the major issue was being quoted 45 min to receive our pizza but 1 hour later I need to call to inquire how much longer. Same female asks me for 10 more minutes, that the driver is out delivering now. For us, ok no problem.........15 more minutes I call again. Now a male gets on the phone, the manager, explains that my pizza is sitting there, female on the phone was confused and thought it was for pick up. For me I could not understand this as I indicated multiple times delivery, in addition we went over my address many times thoroughly.....Manager, why would she need my address for pick up?Too many really great pizza places in Chicago no room for a place like this. Thank you for offering me to get that very same pizza out to me after it had been sitting there and you finally stepped in to see what the challenges were with your phone person. Also thank you for offering to make a new pizza after my appalled reply that you were going to deliver the pizza I ordered an hour and a half earlier. Try this for the future of your business: hire people that speak the common language. That will prevent simple errors. Make sure to have someone following up on ALL the work being done by the new employee. A true embarrassment for a Chicago establishment.

18.description: I really enjoy Sarpino's pizza.  I love that they have so many fun toppings to choose from.  This is the only place where I found they have sun dried tomatoes!  Their delivery time is quick and the orders have all been perfect.  I'll keep ordering from them :-)

41.description: This Sarpino's has fast, free delivery. I think that the pizza is actually pretty good for the price. They're very accurate. I don't think they've gotten an order wrong yet. They're happy to give you a well-done bake if you ask for it. My personal favorite is a well-done pizza with BBQ sauce, onions, and chicken strips. With the deals they're always offering, a large with those toppings will set you back only about $15 with tip. Very reasonable!I've had only one issue with them in the years I've been ordering. Their online ordering interface once had a bug which led to me being double charged for an order. The staff promptly refunded the charge after I brought it to their attention.

52.description: Took the easy way out and ordered via GrubHub.com for delivery to our Hotel. It was late on a Friday evening, but the service was very quick. The food was GREAT. I got a large bacon, pepperoni, & mushroom, and a medium chicken alfredo pizza, and both were VERY tasty (loved the creamy garlic dipping sauce thrown in for free). I also go a pepperoni calzone that was easily the best I've ever eaten, and that was AFTER I warmed it up as leftovers! Throw in a free order of chicken tenders (no processed chicken bites), and I was happy as heck! This is a solid place I would order from again when I'm back in Chi-Town!

50.description: It gets the job done when we have a late night at the office and it's 2 blocks away.     They get an extra star for their wonderful selection of dipping sauces.  In which, garlic one is my favorite.  Each store has different deals which can include buy one get one free/free wings etc....  I usually get the NY Deli pizza which includes pepperoni, Salami, spicy Italian sausage, Canadian ham, spicy ground beef and mozzarella cheese and of course, nice heeping amount of jalapenos.       Their delivery time can vary, we waited anywhere from 30-60 mins so it can get annoying.  Try it out, it's not your local favorite pizzeria but it gets the job done.

4.description: Ordered a pizza and didn't get delivery without a phone call. Late night delivery is questionable at best. Avoid at all costs. Ridiculously terrible customer service.

6.description: When I think of Sarpino's, the scene from The Christmas Story where the family went to a Chinese restaurant for the holiday comes to mind. It is not the first, second or third pick for pizza but when there's no other option...it's the best choice. Delivery was fast. The ingredients were ok. Price was cheap. This place has created a niche in a city obsessed with pizza.

22.description: Good food and fast delivery. Food was hot and fresh when received. The gentleman who delivered was friendly.

15.description: I didn't order the pizza...just the Greek Salad, but it was actually pretty good. Better than I expected, and delivery time was less than an hour on a Saturday night, prime time.

57.description: Here's what you need to know about this place: They deliver. At 3am. And it's good. Crust was probably my favorite part--nice chewy texture to it. The sauce was also well seasoned with a nice tang. We got cheese pizza so I can't comment on the toppings, but their cheezy bread sticks are nice too.

20.description: Probably the fastest pizza delivery in Chicago and the pizza is always full of flavor and still Ridiculous hot!!!    I love their Santa Fe Chicken Pizza from their Gourmet Pizza :-) Whenever my friends want late night or just good delivery pizza I raise my hand and shout out Sarpino's

36.description: I ordered a pizza to be half sausage and half tomato. It arrived at my residence a half hour later than the quoted 35 minute delivery time. The pizza was wrong and was all sausage. I called the store and the manager didn't want to refund me or switch it out. He said it wasn't his fault and that I hadn't specified even though I had and there were others around me that had heard me place the order. I'm a vegetarian so that was the reasoning to split a pizza with a friend and make half the pizza with non-meat toppings. I asked him why I would order an entire pizza that I couldn't eat. He replied that "This isn't my first year working here," and I retorted with, "This isn't my first time ordering pizza." I asked what I should do with the pizza and he suggested, "Just throw it away." It wasn't until I threatened to call the cops that he offered to send the driver back in an hour. The driver later arrived back without incident with a cash refund.Before I had threatened, the manager said the best he could do was to give me 50% off my next order and I asked him how this experience would make me a return customer. I never asked for free food, I just wanted a refund.Haven't ordered there since and this was a few months ago.

14.description: Use to order from this place with some consistency but enough is enough.  I guess the delivery is free for a reason because if you live with in a mile you can walk there and pick up your food just as fast.  Tonight I ordered Mac and cheese bites well done and cheese cake at about 9:00.  I got an update food was out for delivery at 9:20.  I live 7 blocks away and it took 45 min for the driver to get here, leaving me hotter than the Mac and cheese bites. When I asked the driver his it could possibly take 45 min to go 6-7 blocks he told me traffic.... It was almost insulting.  Bottom line even got cheep pizza you have to forget this place.

58.description: Great food and great drinks, what more could you ask for. Place is nice and the ambience is good too. I like the music here as well. Drinking beer has been a good experience here.

56.description: Was there with a large group to celebrate.  First round of beers was skuzzy, tasted like mildew, didn't say anything because sh** happens no biggy. Second beer, bartender mis-heard us and brought us mixed drinks instead of beers. We corrected him politely thinking it was no big deal, we weren't in a hury, but guy threw a little sissy fit. He wouldn't look at is, poured our beers into tiny glasses and charged us a crazy amount, then yanked the credit card out of my friends hand instead of waiting for him to put it into the bill fold, and threw the bill fold down on the counter after he had run the card with a poor attitude. This type of behavior is petty, so we simply left and went to a bar across the street, which worked out much better.

29.description: So delicious. Had the Chicago dogs and it was cool to go to a trendy place with quality food as a traveler. The Bloody Mary is quite good and the staff were all great.

42.description: Pretty cool place but they didn't turn the lights on so I wasn't really able to see anything... Had to look at the beer list using my phone light. The food looked really good but the drinks were a little pricey. It definitely attracts a certain crowd of people but that is also just Old Town in general.

23.description: Came here for brunch once. My server was super polite and the fireplace was a nice touch on a chilly November day. There's a sports bar in the back but the front room, which was pretty classy, had no bar overtones- it was odd to see such contrast, but it works really well.I ordered a bacon egg and cheese biscuit and the three cheese mac and cheese.  I'm a connoisseur of mac and cheese, and that was amazing, The cheese had a great consistency and the cavatappi pasta was a good choice. The biscuit sandwich, on the other hand, was just okay. It looked out of this world when it came to me, but it was bland. The disappointing thing was that it was such a good biscuit and quality bacon, but the egg wasn't seasoned.That being said, I'm definitely going to try this place again- the service and that mac and cheese definitely require that I give this place the benefit of the doubt.

47.description: Loved the vibe of Old Town Social and liked the food. Our server was wearing a jumper which is pretty cool and had her hair so high up on her head that when she looked down to write our order down it all flipped into her face. Much like our server, I think Old Town Social has a bit of an identity crisis - part lounge, part sports bar, part fancy burger restaurant, part casual eatery. But that may be what they are going for.Drinkz.One of my favorite things at Old Town Social is that they offer flights of their beers on draft! Suh weet! 3 beer tastings for $10. Me likey. They don't keep their beer menu on BeerMenus.com completely up to date which is a bit disappointing when you go in planning on having one beer and have to settle for another. My favorite beer I tried the evening I went was 3 Sheeps Nimble Lips Noble Tongue #6 - Bahhhhhhdass. Additionally they do flights of scotch, whiskey and bourbon. Eatz.The deviled eggs come 6 in an order for $6. 2 each of the 'normal' deviled eggs, 2 spicy deviled eggs and 2 sesame curry eggs.Frites in a fancy cone with house made ketchup & mayo for $5. I liked the fries but they weren't necessarily anything special. I have to say though it seemed like a huge order and great deal for the price. I also liked that they provided mayo, wootwoot!OTS Burger comes with sunnyside up organic egg, housemade bacon, gruyere for $13. Nothing on the side for that price, mind you. I really enjoyed this burger. Though I asked for the burger medium and I reckon it was done medium well. Ah well. It tasted good to me all the same!Old Town Social feels very Mad Men-esque to me with various shapes, sizes & colors of furniture throughout but the TVs ruined it for me playing sports with no one watching. Overall though, loved the options at OTS, prices aren't horrific and food is good.

8.description: This place use to be decent.. they suck now... went out for some food. Got a raw burger and 3 duck wings for $12... sweet deal.....and bonus is  bad service, never coming back.

31.description: Service was BADDDD. Clueless, slow, and even rude at times. We were a large group as well, so this is rather inexcusable.I ordered the fried cheese curds. Meh.I'm giving it two stars because I have hope for this place. I had heard decent things before having been, and I am willing to give it one more try.

34.description: We had a birthday party here a couple of weeks ago and I was very happy with the food and service.  The only thing that sort of put me off was the person I dealt with booking the party.  He just seemed very put out booking an event.  It was like he hated his job, had a lifeless voice, and didn't really know what he was doing.  I don't think I would book an event with him again, but over all OTS is great to come to.

16.description: Went here for Valentines Day and was sadly disappointed. We arrived for our reservation around 8:30p and were promptly seated. We ordered drinks, a vodka soda and a less-than-stellar Manhattan. To start, we ordered the pretzel bites which were actually amazing. Complete with beer cheese and stone ground mustard dipping sauces. We also went with the cheese curds which were equally awesome. Everything went quickly downhill from there.My BF ordered the burger and fries, which arrived barely warm. I ordered the grilled cheese and tomato soup which was cold as well. I asked them to bring out some hot soup, but it's clear that they just reheated what they brought to me originally. At this point our server disappeared, which allowed plates to pile up. My BF ordered a second drink when she finally returned, hoping it would be better. No such luck.Overall this was just an unfortunate experience. Seems like a better place to have a few drinks at the bar, and not plan on dinner as well.

13.description: I think my hopes for Old Town Social were too high. I had made a 9:15 Sunday night reservation for after a Second City show. This was the last night of my family's visit to Chicago and we were hoping for a memorable meal to cap off the trip. Instead we ended up waiting a REALLY long time for our food in an otherwise empty restaurant. From beginning to end, the service was just sooo slow. From drinks to food to the check to extra utensils we were continually having to flag down our server to ask for things. Maybe it was the fact that it was late on a Sunday night and really empty so some of the staff had been sent home, who knows. Anyway, once the food finally came it was decent enough... Our party got the fried pickles to start, some burgers, some salads, some grilled cheeses with tomato soup. I didn't hear anyone complain. And we at least got to watch the Panthers beat the Eagles--this is a great spot for sports. Because the food was good. I am willing to hope this was just an off night and try again!

11.description: No no no.I came here tonight and the waitress was so unattentive. 6 people -- no water for 30 minutes? Then we get our duck wings -- was burned (also expect to pay $12 for 3 pieces ... burned pieces). I like the vibe but we weren't treated very well and we had to wait a long time for our food and ask explicitly for the water. The waitstaff said a manager would come over but no one arrived.It was disappointing too because it was a birthday celebration and it just put a damper to the evening.

39.description: I just ordered the grilled cheese and tomato soup. The soup was described as creamy on the menu. The soup Old Town Social gave me was literally orange water. "Creamy" would be the complete opposite word I would use to de describe it. It's quite disgusting someone in the restaurant business would ever think it was okay to give that to a customer. Honestly think they added 3/4 water to make it appear like a bigger portion. Would never eat here again. Appalled.

37.description: I used to really like it here.  The cute little room off to the left of the entrance has a lounge feel that I've always found interesting and comfortable.  The food used to be good, I swear!  Something's definitely changed here...Went with a friend.  The service was INSANELY slow.  I'm not even a picky person but it was so obviously slow and the server clearly didn't even realize how bad it was.  We ordered some appetizers and it took maybe an hour to get them all, maybe longer - so strange!  We had a beet salad, chicken/waffles, cheese curds, and corn dogs.  They were not appetizers.  The chicken/waffles was a legit entree... why would this be on the appetizer menu?!  We were thinking we were ordering little bites, but it was a straight up Belgian waffle with a chicken breast... ookkkaayyyyy... Corn dogs, also not mini as we anticipated - three full sized corn dogs came out as an appetizer like we were at a small town carnival...  Is this place supposed to be classy?  I could have made much better food at home! Overall, I'd only come back here for drinks.  The food was lame and strange, not into it.

0.description: I was invited to old town social to host a Friday happy hour for some friends and we had a great time! The environment was fun and the room they put us in still allowed us to hear the music, but also not too loud where we couldn't catch up.The prices here are reasonable to begin with, but our happy hour package came with even more discounted deals...$5 cocktails, drafts, and wine. Also we got a free appetizer for ever two people that came. Like I said though even without the specials we received the price would of still been reasonable.As for the food my favorite would have to be the Mac and Cheese. I could of used another one of those!! The Goat Cheese Cheesecake was also pretty good. In the main dining area there are plenty of tvs to watch the game. This place is pretty big. I will be back in the future. I had a great time!

38.description: Julio is the best bartender! That dude attends customers in a timely manner and delivers the drinks in an instant. Old town social is a chill spot to get some drinks and foods. I got a burger, I forgot the name of it, but honestly it was the best burger I have ever tasted! It is located in a nice area as well. Went on a Saturday and they closed at 3. However, there are more bars open in old town that are within a walking distance. Definitely plan on coming back here.

51.description: Pretty decent place... The interior decor is beautiful and it's nice and open. The menu is pretty meh, not many options aside from sandwiches and burgers, and a few salads. Service is good, but maybe a little too attentive when you're just trying to have a conversation with your friend. Then again I guess that's better than being neglected, right?Had the shrimp po' boy and wasn't super impressed, too much bread and not enough shrimp. However, the fries and burrata were both on POINT. So delicious! The aoili that came with the fries was also really good... I thought about eating it with a spoon.  But declined because my pants are barely fitting these days. Anyway, this is an okay option for the neighborhood, and since I'm within walking distance, it makes it really convenient for me. Though I wouldn't go out of your way to go here. I also think it gets a little "douche-y" on the weekends.

27.description: This is my kind of place.  If you like to graze you will love it too.  I know it's supposed to be a sports bar but to me it doesn't have the vibe.  Lovely interior and I want to know who decorated the place, it's awesome!If you like charcuterie, exotic cheeses, deviled eggs, etc. you will be in heaven.  Their Belgain frites are decadent strips of perfectly fried potatoes with sea salt and when dipped in the garlic aioli they are heavenly.  Screw the fat and calories, I am in heaven.Great spot for brunch too.  Yep, I could easily eat breakfast, lunch and dinner here every single day and be a fat and happy camper.Others have mentioned issues with slow service.  I've been here three times and never had an issue.  I've never been with a large group so perhaps they struggle with that.I love this place.

32.description: Such a cool place. Love the atmosphere. Antiques and truss wooden ceiling. Came here for brunch on a Sunday. Ordered the old town breakfast and a Bloody Mary. Amazing beer menu with explanation of each. Bloody Mary is the best !  Comes with a side of beer. Salami, cheese, pickled okra,blue cheese stuffed olive and a stuffed pepper. Not cheap but good!!  Potato casserole is delicious. Eggs are so fresh. Love the food. Server Annie was so nice!!!  Will definitely be back!!

54.description: Old town social was super cool! The burger are juicy, the drinks are specialty, and they have a great meat and cheese menu if you're going just for drinks. I loved the lighting and real wood fire in the secluded room on the side of the restaurant. The service was a little slow and as always(in Chicago) the drinks were pricey but I would love to go back! Try the pretzel bites!!

48.description: Ventured here on a Friday night during a Blackhawks game, so there was quite a crowd. Thankfully they have pretty ample seating with lots of TVs mounted on the wall, yet without diminishing the refined restaurant feeling. They have lots of patio seating as well for all you folks who enjoy the great outdoors...Excellent beer list, with a great variety of new and exotic drafts to try out. I was served a delicious burger that was up to the Chicago Burger Standard...a rating system I just came up with. It wasnt the best burger I've ever had, but its definitely a burger I'd bring home to meet mom.The biggest downside of the night was that our waitress seemed to be sporting an Invisibility Cloak for a good portion of the night. We sat for a good 15 minutes before we even saw her to ask for the check. Might have just been a busy night, but it seemed understaffed for a Friday night.

44.description: My first visit to Old Town Social was on Kentucky Derby day. I do like the space, plentiful televisions, nice decor, not too crowded (well some parts were quite crowded while others, not so much. Interesting). They also have a little outdoor patio area for the warmer days. The food: I ordered a shrimp po'boy and it was tasty. It's no New Orleans po'boy, but no regrets. Tip: if you find yourself torn between the regular fries and the sweet potato fries, go for the sweet potato. They're crispier.Drinks: It was Derby day so keeping with tradition, I ordered a mint julep. Or rather, I ordered a copper mug of minty ice that may have had liquid at the bottom. The Pesco mule is yummy, though not as strong as I think a drink of that price should be. I eventually made my way to beer was much happier. Music: They had a DJ for a while who was awesome, he was in touch with my inner 90's child. Then he left and the music sort of nose dived. Service: The waitress was cool enough, I had no issues with my order and I don't think the wait was that long. I was, however, a little perplexed that we had this table full of empty plates and glasses that kept piling...and piling...aaaaand piling...until we eventually cleared them from our table ourselves. All in all, while I don't think I'd go out with the goal of coming to Old Town Social, if I happened to be in the vicinity, sure I'd come back.

24.description: Incredible Bloody Mary's!  The pretzel bites were awesome and the tacos were great.  The tortillas are made fresh daily, which is something you don't see many places.

7.description: What happened to this place???Unfortunately, the food has really gone down hill -- how do you go from serving delicious pork belly eggs Benedict to eggs Benedict with what tastes like a heap of mayonnaise as hollandaise (tastes like it came from a can).  And if you're going to serve a chefs omelette, it should taste like an actual chef made it -- really, $12 for an omelette I can make at home and doesn't even come with a piece of toast or some potatoes or anything (literally a tiny omelette on a bread plate and nothing else). The service is still great, but the food no longer delivers....and there are plenty of other options close by that provide both.

49.description: Dig this place for brunch or for a night out with friends for a game.  It can fill up fast if there is a significant game on such as March Madness or something but it's a fun time.  Good drinks, I prefer the brunch music over the week nights but either way, I'd come here again.  Cool neighborhood hang out spot!

40.description: I returned to OTS for an event that I was obliged to attend and received a surprisingly more positive experience!  I didn't notice the same bar tender who was rude to me before.  Instead the bar tender was very nice, and even gave my boyfriend and I a free drink when we had to wait 10+ minutes to be served at the bar.  OTS does have a great DJ as well!

53.description: Well I liked it.  And it wasn't just because our server,  whose name I can't remember was so nice,  smart, sweet, incredibly cute or that she was spot on about how good the tartar sauce was for the fish and chips.  No I liked it, or should I say also liked it because the menu was current and on trend, food hot and tasty,  drinks good, through the beer seemed expensive, service great and the place had a good buzz and inviting vibe. I felt was a little more of a mature crowd not necessarily in age but in character. We sat by the fireplace in the "parlor room" which is a charming space where we could sit and talk comfortably and still hear the music and peek at the game du jour if need be.  The chicken wings were hot. .. but so tasty with their house made sauce and dip. The Fish and Chips special very good,  lightly battered with fish that was not greasy or oily. The fries were well seasoned.  Word has it they do a mean Cubano so I'll be back!

30.description: This place has gone way down hill in the past couple of years. My family of 6 came here for Mother's Day only to be kept waiting outside (along with several other families) in the freezing cold until the doors opened. The manager could not have been less concerned by our incessant knocking. You would think that if a restaurant is taking reservations at 11:00 AM (when they open), they would at least open the doors a few minutes in advance (or take later reservations instead of making their customers wait outside). The service was extremely slow and the server inattentive (taking half the table's order at a time and then leaving). We piled empty plates up on the ledge of the balcony to get them out of our way and no one came to take them for 30 minutes. The food used to be amazing here, but now what they refer to as a salad is half a plate of wilted, soggy mesclun with a sad, under-seasoned excuse for dressing. We also had the ask the staff to turn down the music several times during the meal. I understand that they operate as a bar at night, but our mother's do not need to shout at us from across the table over the beat of nagging techno music at 11:00 AM on a Sunday. Unless your mom rolls like that. In which case, party on.

46.description: It's an ok place to go, but I don't prefer stopping here if I can avoid it.The good stuff:-They have pretty good food in my opinion-The service is nice-The decor is niceThe lousy stuff:-The drinks aren't my thing, the old fashioned has so much ice in it it tastes like someone poured water in it (They didn't, but don't fill the glass with 30 cubes).-It's in the middle of nowhere for old town in general. The only thing close to it is in the Sedgwick stop so it is kind of annoying to get to/from if you are out.-It gets really packed on Friday/Saturday so it is uncomfortable or you have to wait forever to sit around.While I don't dislike it I certainly don't make an effort to come here.

1.description: Been here close to an hour and still waiting for the food. With such a limited menu one would expect that it would come out in less then an hour. Wasn't a huge fan to begin with, but now even with Old Town Social being on my block, I'll walk the extra block to go just about anywhere else.On the upside, I've had desert here before and they have pretty good bingets.

55.description: Went here for Valentines Day and was sadly disappointed. We arrived for our reservation around 8:30p and were promptly seated. We ordered drinks, a vodka soda and a less-than-stellar Manhattan. To start, we ordered the pretzel bites which were actually amazing. Complete with beer cheese and stone ground mustard dipping sauces. We also went with the cheese curds which were equally awesome. Everything went quickly downhill from there.My BF ordered the burger and fries, which arrived barely warm. I ordered the grilled cheese and tomato soup which was cold as well. I asked them to bring out some hot soup, but it's clear that they just reheated what they brought to me originally. At this point our server disappeared, which allowed plates to pile up. My BF ordered a second drink when she finally returned, hoping it would be better. No such luck.Overall this was just an unfortunate experience. Seems like a better place to have a few drinks at the bar, and not plan on dinner as well.

9.description: This place was pretty bad. Came here for cocktails with friends and was sorely disappointed. A couple people ordered the same drink and said it tasted like vomit. Didn't believe them so tasted it, and oh my god, it was vomitous... wish I remembered what it was. Waitress took forever to take our check and didn't even comment that there were 3 full drinks when we were leaving. How can a place offer something so terrible tasting on their menu?

26.description: Ambience check, good food check, nice staff check, and overall experience check--all the previous descriptors are qualities I look for in my experience when going out. Old town social is a place that is a breathe of fresh air after a long work week to come and unwind. The setting is laid back but presents with an upscale vibe. My friend and I ordered the animal burger which was AMAZING and the Brutatta ( excuse the spelling if I butchered it-lol). For an appetizer we had the sweet potato fries with advocate dip. No complaints about the food or the fabulous bottle of white wine we ordered! I had a good time and I recommend Old Town Social for a chill evening!

25.description: The food is fantastic. Coming from someone who isn't a huge guac fan, I'm already craving more. It's more of a whipped consistency which might deter guacaholics who enjoy the chunks, but the flavor is on point. I was also subject to a variety of tacos, chicken wings, and some smokey mac and cheese. All of which were phenomenal. The atmosphere was nice, service was great. The food though, will be the reason I return.

12.description: Came here for brunch once. My server was super polite and the fireplace was a nice touch on a chilly November day. There's a sports bar in the back but the front room, which was pretty classy, had no bar overtones- it was odd to see such contrast, but it works really well.I ordered a bacon egg and cheese biscuit and the three cheese mac and cheese.  I'm a connoisseur of mac and cheese, and that was amazing, The cheese had a great consistency and the cavatappi pasta was a good choice. The biscuit sandwich, on the other hand, was just okay. It looked out of this world when it came to me, but it was bland. The disappointing thing was that it was such a good biscuit and quality bacon, but the egg wasn't seasoned.That being said, I'm definitely going to try this place again- the service and that mac and cheese definitely require that I give this place the benefit of the doubt.

59.description: Surprisingly, this place is not just a single's bar. It's actually quite a good restaurant, too. Good food, good service and a good vibe.Full disclaimer: I met my girlfriend here more than three years ago. Music was cracking and we were dancing, and then we agreed to meet again for a date. Then we fell in love. For this Valentine's Day, I realized we had never been back, so I made a reservation at Old Town Social. I was doing it mainly for sentimental value -- not because I expected it to be good. I put in the note on my online reservation that we had met there 3 years earlier and never returned.When we arrived, a bucket of ice was at our table and they had seated us right next to the big back bar where we had first met. Then the manager came out and gave us a complimentary bottle of Prosecco on ice. It was a really nice touch. We loved our dinner on top of it all, the price was right.Five stars.

21.description: Great place for dinner.  Literally a block or two from the Sedgwick stop on the Brown Line, so very convenient location on North Ave.We went there on a Saturday night at around 5-6 PM and it wasn't very busy.  We were seated right away and placed at a candle lit window table in the front area.  The decor of the main room was a rustic social club feel, but the front room we were in was a bit more homey.  My gf mentioned that the furniture reminded her of her grandma's house, take that as you will.Our waitress was VERY attentive, not surprising as we were one of two active tables at the time.  She was very friendly and engaging as well.  Ordered the whiskey/scotch flight, but they were out of both Glenlivet and Johnnie Walker Black so they upgraded me free of charge!I got the Ranchero Burger which was awesome.  They even substituted the fries for sweet potato fries with no hassle, also delicious!  She got the Animal Style Burger which was good as well.  She never finishes a whole burger, but she did this one!Overall, it was a great experience and moderately priced.  About $70 for two entrees, whiskey flight, beer, and a martini.  Will definitely be back again, maybe for brunch!

17.description: Not a fan. I've come here a few times and every time I've come there was at least one problem that was glaringly obvious.  The first time I came here I enjoyed the vibe, drinks, and coziness of the bar.... But it was, no joke, at least 85 degrees in this bar. It was a hot day, but they are either not working with a proper AC or were not prepared for how hot it was going to be. Everyone in this place was roasting. Secondly, the table service was slower than molasses and a drink my cousin ordered never came.Bought a round for some friends and one of my pals ordered scotch, neat. Didn't ask for anything special, but the bill came and it was top shelf scotch. I know that's a classic scheme from a bartender, but to choose one of the top shelves without even pointing to it on the menu is cold. Again, table service was extremely slow. Now to end on a good note. There was one bartender I met there who was extremely helpful. The bar itself is cool and the vibe it brings is young and fun.  Watch out for your $$$ and don't expect great service (with the exception of a bearded bartender)

10.description: Service was BADDDD. Clueless, slow, and even rude at times. We were a large group as well, so this is rather inexcusable.I ordered the fried cheese curds. Meh.I'm giving it two stars because I have hope for this place. I had heard decent things before having been, and I am willing to give it one more try.

5.description: I fell victim to one of those Buzzfeed-esque "20 sandwiches to eat in Chicago" articles, and the pork belly Reuben got a mention, so I packed my parents in the car and drove over. Pork belly has a magnet effect on my heart. And it was ... fine. The bread got a little soggy and all I could really taste was the sauerkraut. My aunt hated her turkey sandwich (that's on her; who orders a turkey sandwich?). My mom liked the fried chicken sandwich. My stepfather enjoyed the beef bourgignon, which was a special. Here's the thing though: BUY MORE DISHES, RESTAURANTS! If the alternative is to come up to people two seconds after they've finished their meal, then just bite the bullet, go on RestaurantDepot.com or whatever, and stop reaching for my plate when I still have food there and other people are eating. If I have to stop chewing to answer when you ask if it's ok to take my plate, you're doing it wrong. The busboy entered my mom's personal space to squeeze a glass past her shoulder. Are you that hard up for glassware? It's weird and unsettling and just stop.

3.description: Beautiful interior, and okay/good food. However...We met up here with some friends, and the music was so loud we could barely hear each other speak. The entrées are overpriced and under portioned.They have high chairs, but are not super kid friendly (we have a 15 month old). As a side note, I'm from Seattle, and was super excited for the aoli. I love aolis. Not this one. It tasted like mayonnaise from a jar.I wouldn't recommend this place.

35.description: Julio was the best! He gave us the best customer service I ever had at a bar. His drink recommendations proved to be the best,  it seems like he watches a lot of episodes from Bar Rescue since he kept everything very clean and organized. I am for sure going back to go watch the Chicago Blackhawks games because of the great atmosphere.

19.description: This is my kind of place.  If you like to graze you will love it too.  I know it's supposed to be a sports bar but to me it doesn't have the vibe.  Lovely interior and I want to know who decorated the place, it's awesome!If you like charcuterie, exotic cheeses, deviled eggs, etc. you will be in heaven.  Their Belgain frites are decadent strips of perfectly fried potatoes with sea salt and when dipped in the garlic aioli they are heavenly.  Screw the fat and calories, I am in heaven.Great spot for brunch too.  Yep, I could easily eat breakfast, lunch and dinner here every single day and be a fat and happy camper.Others have mentioned issues with slow service.  I've been here three times and never had an issue.  I've never been with a large group so perhaps they struggle with that.I love this place.

28.description: Really enjoyed this place!  Would have been 5 stars if I could have gotten a glass of port wine after dinner.  Amazed that they don't have any ports on hand.  Maybe they will add it to the dessert options?!

45.description: My friend and I dined here on a Tuesday night after a cold Cubs game. It was most definitely a very nice warm welcome. Service was good and food came out promptly. But both my friend and I felt really sick the next day. I'm pretty sure I got some sort of f.p. But no idea from what dish. I really like the food here, so I'll continue to go, I'll just be very careful with what I order next time.

33.description: Enjoyed the mini hot dogs that tasted pretty good but the atmosphere is somewhat lacking, perhaps it's because we went in the day time and maybe it's more of an evening place but for Chicago where there are countless incredible places, this one was ok-certainly an enjoyable meal but not high on the list

43.description: Quality of food was not equal to the prices charged. Two of my friends had the beet salad which was tiny and not worth the cost. And they charged $6 to add chicken which made the salad close to $20 which is just silly for this place. I had the turkey burger which was over cooked and super dense and tough. I've had many turkey burgers in my life and this was definitely the worst. And their sandwiches don't come with fries but cost $13+. There are better places in the area with better food and cheaper costs. I think they want to be more upscale but it's not really working. Bar scene is good. No complaints there during the late night hours. Not a good place for dinner though.

2.description: I came here for brunch with some friends on Sunday. I have never been here before but I heard a mix of things about this place. My friend claimed they had the best bloody marys. I love bloody marys and never turn one down. We sat down on this weird couch with a table it was kinda cool but also a bit uncomfortable. It was more of a like a coffee table set up.// bloody mary - dont recall the price -  The bloody mary has almost too much crap on top of it. I reallllyyy liked the pickled okra. It was so tasty and I love okra. The bloody could have been a bit thicker but the flavor was there. I dont like the massive amount of cheese they put on top of the bloody. // chicken and waffles - 14$ -I split this with a friend.. it wasn't that large. It was just okay. The waffle was not as crispy as I like it and same goes for the chicken.  The butter and maple syrup did taste good on it but I feel like if you are gonna pull of this dish, you gotta do a way better job with it. // old town breakfast - 10$ - My friend got this, it was pretty decent. I tried the potatoes casserole, it was pretty good. The sausage was decent but nothing to rave about. // Sweet potatoes fries - 5$ - the fries were better but the avocado dip was really weird. it was a bit sour almost. I did not really like it. all in all, this place is good for a Sunday Funday where all you wanna do is continue drinking from saturday night [you lush but I definitely encourage this behavior], but I wouldn't go back for the food. It was just average and pretty highly priced for the smaller portions.

18.description: Well I liked it.  And it wasn't just because our server,  whose name I can't remember was so nice,  smart, sweet, incredibly cute or that she was spot on about how good the tartar sauce was for the fish and chips.  No I liked it, or should I say also liked it because the menu was current and on trend, food hot and tasty,  drinks good, through the beer seemed expensive, service great and the place had a good buzz and inviting vibe. I felt was a little more of a mature crowd not necessarily in age but in character. We sat by the fireplace in the "parlor room" which is a charming space where we could sit and talk comfortably and still hear the music and peek at the game du jour if need be.  The chicken wings were hot. .. but so tasty with their house made sauce and dip. The Fish and Chips special very good,  lightly battered with fish that was not greasy or oily. The fries were well seasoned.  Word has it they do a mean Cubano so I'll be back!

41.description: I made a reservation because we had a large group. They suggested a paired down menu for brunch. Everyone in our group really enjoyed their choices. I had biscuits and gravy which totally hit the spot that morning. Also, we showed up early for our reservation and they seated us early, which was super nice. That way we could order drinks while we waited for our other guests to arrive. The Bloody Mary's were really good--spicy! My only complaint was that it seemed like our server would take a long time to check on us; I felt like I had to keep asking for refills...the place did not seem very busy at the time either. But it wasn't a huge deal at all. Def will come back when I'm in Chicago again.

52.description: Somewhat classy sports bar, which means that it'll be noisy and the service is not always fast.  For Sunday brunch this morning, with the place half full it still took 30 minutes to get 2 burgers and sides, and even then one burger didn't come with all its toppings.Pros: Beet salad is tasty (just not that filling), burgers are solid, OTS burger great (comes with aoili, which is not mentioned on the menu), good make-your-own burger with lots of toppings, desert donut with chocolate sauce, excellent and large drink menu (including cocktails, I liked the Writer's Vice with elderflower liquor)Cons: bar gets noisy when crowded or when games are on, Mac N Cheese side small and not very flavorful, belgian fries are just regular shoe-string fries (so nothing special), aoili tastes incredibly similar to mayonnaise, used a Gilt City voucher and were told of other, non-stated restrictions while trying to use it, prices of all non-burger items too expensive

50.description: Old Town Social is my favorite place to go with medium to large sized groups! It's a really spacious restaurant/lounge/bar and the decor and ambience is really interesting and cool. The crowd is really awesome too -- not pretentious, very relaxed vibe.The food is amazing! The charcuterie plates, pretzels and dips, the various cheese-filled things, and tasty breads and spreads! The cocktails are also top-notch. Servers are friendly and prompt!I'm always looking for an excuse to come to Old Town Social.

4.description: Loved the vibe of Old Town Social and liked the food. Our server was wearing a jumper which is pretty cool and had her hair so high up on her head that when she looked down to write our order down it all flipped into her face. Much like our server, I think Old Town Social has a bit of an identity crisis - part lounge, part sports bar, part fancy burger restaurant, part casual eatery. But that may be what they are going for.Drinkz.One of my favorite things at Old Town Social is that they offer flights of their beers on draft! Suh weet! 3 beer tastings for $10. Me likey. They don't keep their beer menu on BeerMenus.com completely up to date which is a bit disappointing when you go in planning on having one beer and have to settle for another. My favorite beer I tried the evening I went was 3 Sheeps Nimble Lips Noble Tongue #6 - Bahhhhhhdass. Additionally they do flights of scotch, whiskey and bourbon. Eatz.The deviled eggs come 6 in an order for $6. 2 each of the 'normal' deviled eggs, 2 spicy deviled eggs and 2 sesame curry eggs.Frites in a fancy cone with house made ketchup & mayo for $5. I liked the fries but they weren't necessarily anything special. I have to say though it seemed like a huge order and great deal for the price. I also liked that they provided mayo, wootwoot!OTS Burger comes with sunnyside up organic egg, housemade bacon, gruyere for $13. Nothing on the side for that price, mind you. I really enjoyed this burger. Though I asked for the burger medium and I reckon it was done medium well. Ah well. It tasted good to me all the same!Old Town Social feels very Mad Men-esque to me with various shapes, sizes & colors of furniture throughout but the TVs ruined it for me playing sports with no one watching. Overall though, loved the options at OTS, prices aren't horrific and food is good.

6.description: Not to bad of a place for a first time. The room is dark but has nice comfy sofa's by the large windows.  We felt secluded in our nice little nook area so that I could catch up with friends.  We ordered a few drinks, mine in particular was the Tiki as I'm not trying to give up on summer yet. The drink was pretty refreshing.  My friend ordered a Hemingway which I particularly didn't care for as it had a weird after taste. We also ordered a plate of cheeses, Triple Creme Brie & the Smoked Marisa which was my favorite.  The room is very spacious and good to bring for first dates.  It seems that everyone in there was on a first date. There were lots of people at the bar cheering for their sport since there were several TV's blaring different games. I want to come back and taste some of their brunch items.  Bookmarked for sure.

22.description: Stopped in for some drinks after volleyball with a group of friends and we tried each appetizer on the menu - literally!  They were all VERY tasty, but can't comment on the other menu items.  The atmosphere is more of a upscale gastropub, with a good beer and craft cocktail selection.  Service was top-notch, too.

15.description: My first visit to Old Town Social was on Kentucky Derby day. I do like the space, plentiful televisions, nice decor, not too crowded (well some parts were quite crowded while others, not so much. Interesting). They also have a little outdoor patio area for the warmer days. The food: I ordered a shrimp po'boy and it was tasty. It's no New Orleans po'boy, but no regrets. Tip: if you find yourself torn between the regular fries and the sweet potato fries, go for the sweet potato. They're crispier.Drinks: It was Derby day so keeping with tradition, I ordered a mint julep. Or rather, I ordered a copper mug of minty ice that may have had liquid at the bottom. The Pesco mule is yummy, though not as strong as I think a drink of that price should be. I eventually made my way to beer was much happier. Music: They had a DJ for a while who was awesome, he was in touch with my inner 90's child. Then he left and the music sort of nose dived. Service: The waitress was cool enough, I had no issues with my order and I don't think the wait was that long. I was, however, a little perplexed that we had this table full of empty plates and glasses that kept piling...and piling...aaaaand piling...until we eventually cleared them from our table ourselves. All in all, while I don't think I'd go out with the goal of coming to Old Town Social, if I happened to be in the vicinity, sure I'd come back.

57.description: Went to this place tonight, ordered 2 lagunitas. Bar tender brings 2 margaritas and I say "oh sorry I said lagunitas." The guy cops a serious attitude, pours the drinks into tiny glasses and yanks my debit card out of my hand. Then he comes by and slams the bill down and walks off. I had a group of friends meeting me here that I took down the street to another bar as a result of this asshole.

20.description: ExcellentOld English Scottish pub like settingExcellent appetizers Best bartendersGreat locationOutdoor beautiful     Good Job!

36.description: No no no.I came here tonight and the waitress was so unattentive. 6 people -- no water for 30 minutes? Then we get our duck wings -- was burned (also expect to pay $12 for 3 pieces ... burned pieces). I like the vibe but we weren't treated very well and we had to wait a long time for our food and ask explicitly for the water. The waitstaff said a manager would come over but no one arrived.It was disappointing too because it was a birthday celebration and it just put a damper to the evening.

14.description: It's an ok place to go, but I don't prefer stopping here if I can avoid it.The good stuff:-They have pretty good food in my opinion-The service is nice-The decor is niceThe lousy stuff:-The drinks aren't my thing, the old fashioned has so much ice in it it tastes like someone poured water in it (They didn't, but don't fill the glass with 30 cubes).-It's in the middle of nowhere for old town in general. The only thing close to it is in the Sedgwick stop so it is kind of annoying to get to/from if you are out.-It gets really packed on Friday/Saturday so it is uncomfortable or you have to wait forever to sit around.While I don't dislike it I certainly don't make an effort to come here.

58.description: After mixed experiences with three different barbers in Chicago, a friend recommended I check out Old Town Barbershop. This is a great shop that I've finally settled on thanks to Dustin, who does a great haircut and is a good guy. He has had world-class training,  so I always walk out with a top-notch cut without paying the high prices or putting up with the atmosphere of a more expensive salon type place. Definitely highly recommend to others.

56.description: I've been searching high and low for a welcoming neighborhood barbershop since I moved to Chicago last year. Most were mediocre at best. Old town barbershop is ahead of the pack. Upon arrival, Dustin greeted me with a firm handshake and a gleaming smile. His long, flowing locks of luscious hair put me at absolute ease. I sat in the leather throne and he immediately pumped me up and went to town.We lost ourselves in words and, before I knew it, I was transformed into Ryan Gosling. Girls started throwing themselves at me left and right. Casting agents swarmed me into submission. Through the clamor of screaming females and contracts being written up, I asked how I could ever repay him. He replied, loudly, "With just a few dollars for the haircut.. And maybe a tip."Needless to say, I tipped. I feel beautiful.Dustin rocks.

29.description: I've never had a hairstyle I felt comfortable in. Thanks to Dustin, I feel good, look great, and never stop getting compliments. Everyone at OTBS is fun and friendly. Dustin, however, always stays a notch above all.

42.description: This was my first trip to a barbershop for a haircut in 18 years, since I always had friends cutting for me. When I walked in I felt at home. The mood is friendly and relaxed and the place is just nice and clean (and well decorated, and it smells good).Britni cut my hair and did a great job. I gave a quick description of what I wanted and it was expertly done. She also did a complimentary shampoo and neck shave, which is something I didn't realize I needed in my life until today. I walked out of there looking and smelling like a boss (in my opinion) and was totally relaxed.Very glad I found this place and I will definitely be back. I was looking for a place that was not a weak chain and not an expensive salon -- just a nice, reasonably priced place with friendly, skilled staff. This shop fits the bill perfectly. Give it a shot -- you will not be disappointed!

23.description: Britni killed it! I don't know how she knew exactly what I was looking for after just a few questions. I have crazy hair that is hard to deal with, but she gave me the perfect haircut my first time in.

47.description: I've been going to Old Town Barbershop for years, since back when it was owned by Ike.  I'm not only impressed with the complete overhaul of the shop that Sheree and Jeff have modeled, but the talent they've brought in too. I'm currently going to Jasmine to get my hair cut and she's doing a phenomenal job.

8.description: I've been going to Ali every week for more than a year now. She is fantastic. She knows how to sculpt my hair in a way that works well in the office and at home. I also  happen to travel a lot for work, and she is always accommodating with her schedule. If I'm going to be gone for a long period of time, she also will cut my hair so that it stays current in-between appointments. I appreciate her work and her customer-focused attitude overall. Highly recommend.

31.description: I have been going to Dustin exclusively for (a couple years already?) and have always left the shop with an awesome cut. That being said, everyone in there is really nice and the vibe is fun and laid-back. Street parking is pretty easy to find and if you bike, there are plenty of lock-ups - and free air - outside of the bike shop next door. If you haven't tried this place yet, it's definitely worth a shot!

34.description: Great barbershop with even better employees.  Everyone is extremely sociable and welcoming. Been getting my hair cut by Richard C for the last 6 months or so and he does an absolutely great job every time. Their online scheduling system is a breeze to use. Vibe in the barbershop is laid back and easy going. Flat screens are usually playing SportsCenter or a big game. Music is good. Haircuts are better. Can't beat the old fashioned straight edge neck shave, plus included shampoo and styling. Would highly recommend Richard C and any of the staff to anyone looking for a great haircut and all around experience.

16.description: How good is your stylist? Have you followed her thru a change in salons? Do you txt her pictures of your haircut saying 'thank you'? Does she now cut the hair of your friends and family? Do you call her for a last minute cut and she does everything she can to fit you in? I'll answer great to the first question and yes to the rest. If you can't answer great and yes I'd suggest you call Georgia Triantafilis.

13.description: Georgia gave me the best haircut I've ever had! I came in not knowing only that I wanted something different. I gave her creative freedom to "make me look good" and she did a great job. While her creativity and experience with men's hair styles drove the direction of my haircut, Georgia made sure to let me know what she was planning to do to make sure I was comfortable with her intentions before she started. I felt very comfortable with her. Georgia is an extremely talented, attentive and personable stylist who I would highly recommend to everyone! Chocolate chip cookies in the waiting area weren't bad either.

11.description: I've been going to Old Town Barbershop (OTB) ever since I moved to Chicago over a year ago.  Since day one, I've been beyond satisfied with the buzz cut provided by my super awesome barber, Dustin.  Dustin's a really good guy, and meticulous with his work.  I tend to opt for a buzz cut, and after seeing him in action, it isn't as simple as one would assume.  There's a great vibe to the place, and everybody is so nice and laid back.  For all you sports fans, OTB does have a nice flat screen, and there tends to be a game on.  Getting an appointment is super easy through OTB's online booking page.  For $27, it's a steal for a professionally done haircut w/ wash, condition, old school neck shave with a straight-edge, and styling.  If OTB served beer, it'd easily be a 6-star establishment!

39.description: If you are looking for a great place to get a haircut then this is the place. I was jumping around with different locations and decided to book an appointment with Ali. I haven't been disappointed. She does a fantastic job for a reasonable price. I highly recommend her and this place!

37.description: Old Town Barbershop is one of the best barber shops in Chicago. They give very good haircuts here.

0.description: Discovered Old Town Barbershop a couple months back and it's GREAT!  Great atmosphere, location, service and price!I've seen Allison at OTBS 3x now and she does a fantastic job... I've always gotten nothing short of a great haircut and conversation.  I have my haircut place for years to come.

38.description: I've been going to Old Town Barbershop (OTB) ever since I moved to Chicago over a year ago.  Since day one, I've been beyond satisfied with the buzz cut provided by my super awesome barber, Dustin.  Dustin's a really good guy, and meticulous with his work.  I tend to opt for a buzz cut, and after seeing him in action, it isn't as simple as one would assume.  There's a great vibe to the place, and everybody is so nice and laid back.  For all you sports fans, OTB does have a nice flat screen, and there tends to be a game on.  Getting an appointment is super easy through OTB's online booking page.  For $27, it's a steal for a professionally done haircut w/ wash, condition, old school neck shave with a straight-edge, and styling.  If OTB served beer, it'd easily be a 6-star establishment!

51.description: Old Town Barbershop is the best! Sheree cut my husband's hair and she did an AMAZING job - she even cleaned up his eyebrow!!!!! The entire staff is friendly and welcoming and my husband will definitely be going back. Walk ins are welcome! Thank you Sheree!!!!

27.description: Great staff, very welcoming, highly recommend Old Town.

32.description: I'll start by noting that I've never had a horrible haircut here. But they've never gotten it quite right.The reason that's particularly disappointing? Almost every time, I've shown the stylist a picture of what I wanted.In previous instances, it's never been on-the-nose exactly what I envisioned, but it was close enough that I didn't mind.This last time (which will be the last time), it was so far off from what I wanted that it was simply too much let it slide without commenting here. My stylist today seems to be running on auto-pilot and, from start to finish, didn't really seemed engaged to the level you'd expect from a $30+ (after tip) haircut.Maybe she was having an off day, so I'd rather not call her out here, but like I said, it was really disappointing and I'll be spending my money elsewhere in the future.

54.description: Best barbershop in the city! I found this place through Yelp reviews. Great stylists, easy online booking process, friendly atmosphere, amazing haircuts.

48.description: I have had haircuts here by both Jeff and Sheree.  They do a great job.  Get you in and get you out without feeling rushed or running way behind.  Friendly conversation actually makes getting a haircut an enjoyable experience vs the hassle it is at most other chop shops.

44.description: I been coming to Old Town Barbershop for a few months now, since I moved to Old Town.  I love the abiance of the place, it looks like it was made for Guys. Chrissy was the first one to cut my hair and I have been making appointments with her ever since.  She does a good job cutting my hair and making recommendations.  The haircut comes with a shampoo and shave for the back of your neck too, which is always a plus.

24.description: I've only been here once and it was a fine experience.  Cool atmosphere - at least 4 chairs were filled with customers getting cuts. Jasmine gave me a nice cut which included a wash and clean up of the neck area with a folding straight edge razor.  I would suggest calling to make an appointment in advance is probably a best practice as while I was there they had to turn away a walk in as they were busy all day.  They take credit card for payment and you can place a tip on it which furthers the convenience. Not too shabby for a $30 cut on Wells.

7.description: Old Town Barbershop is hands down the best place to get a men's hair cut in Old Town and the Near North area. Nothing but good things to say!Dustin Free's haircuts have gotten me job offers and saved relationships.

49.description: Got my first haircut on American soil here after being in the Peace Corps for 3 years. Dustin did an awesome job and I couldn't have been happier with the cut. No BS just a great haircut. Will be going back whenever I'm in Chicago.

40.description: Popped in there today to get our friends beard taken off. They were actually closing but Jeff welcomed us in anyway. It is such a cool barbers and Jeff is awesome, he made our experience really fun! He did an excellent job on the beard!

53.description: I've followed Richard C from his last shop to this awesome barbershop in old town. Richard is attentive and always delivers what's been asked for. Shop is tastefully decorated and other barbers seem like they have dedicated clientele as well. All good signs as far I'm concerned. Highly recommend these guys.

30.description: After the first time i went to old town barbershop i liked this place, now i have gone twice and i love it.  When i walked into the shop i had hair down to my shoulders, looking a little like "Jesus".  I asked Jasmine to make me look professional, and she did an amazing job.  My second time in was about 8 weeks later, I had Ali and she is a dream! She took the art work that Jasmine had done and turned it into a Monet.  I highly recommend this place, they defiantly know what they are doing.

46.description: I highly recommend this place.  I have had haircuts in many parts of the US, but this is the best haircut I've ever had. I've been coming here for more than a year.

1.description: Friendly, efficient, and very reasonably priced, especially for the neighborhood.

55.description: These guys are great! Jeff was on vacation so booked with Richard.  He's been there two months and transferring clientele. He's funny and gives an excellent haircut. I'd highly recommend Richard, Jeff or anyone of the crew. Great experience and great haircut. Thank You!

9.description: First time I went, Richard cut my hair and did a great job. Still $30 is a little more than what I'm used to paying for a haircut, but at least I was satisfied with the hair-do. Second time I went, someone different cut my hair and the outcome was definitely not the same quality (definitely not worth $30). Hopefully third time is a charm, but I'll definitely be requesting Richard.

26.description: I followed one of the barbers over here, Richard, and have been customer for about a year. The experience here is incredible. Sheree and Jeff have nailed it. The location is amazing, the shop is well appointed with all fixtures from Restoration Hardware and the atmosphere is very low key and welcoming. All the stylists are young and all very talented. They have an online booking system and use Square for payment which is awesome.They recently increased the price of a cut from $27 to $30 but it is still well worth it.  Go see Richard - you won't regret it!

25.description: Old Town Barbershop is hands down the best place to get a men's hair cut in Old Town and the Near North area. Nothing but good things to say!Dustin Free's haircuts have gotten me job offers and saved relationships.

12.description: I just moved to Chicago and was looking for a good barbershop. While the staff  and ambiance was extremely welcoming here, the prices were high. I am a bald guy and all that I wanted was my head shaved. It was $36 for a shave I could have gotten for $10 somewhere else. Also, I told the person shaving my head that I wanted it shaved down to the skin. When done I still could feel hair all over. I wanted a smooth shaved head and for the price, didn't get what I paid for. She used a straight razor to shave the back of my neck but never used the razor for the rest of my head. Terribly disappointed.

59.description: Love this place!! Go see Dustin, he's confident and a great barber and I'm always happy when I leave the shop. I like that he's always learning his craft and he truly listens to what I want. He's not in my neighborhood, but the trip is well worth it!

21.description: Most definitely the best barbershop I've ever been to. Every time I come here... I look ridiculous upon entering and I feel like a damn model when I leave. Dustin just crushed it! I love this place, the vibe, the people... And of course the end result. Let Dustin cut your hair... Trust me!

17.description: I followed one of the barbers over here, Richard, and have been customer for about a year. The experience here is incredible. Sheree and Jeff have nailed it. The location is amazing, the shop is well appointed with all fixtures from Restoration Hardware and the atmosphere is very low key and welcoming. All the stylists are young and all very talented. They have an online booking system and use Square for payment which is awesome.They recently increased the price of a cut from $27 to $30 but it is still well worth it.  Go see Richard - you won't regret it!

10.description: If you are looking for an old school barber this is the place to go. From the barber chairs down to the barbers themselves, Old Town Barbershop is the best. I started coming when I moved into the area about 3 years ago and even though I have moved 15 minutes west I still come in for a haircut here. If you are looking for a barbershop this is the place to go, easy to get to and you usually don't have to wait long. I would highly recommend it.

5.description: This place deserves all five stars. The interior is dope, everyone I've spoken to has been kind, the price is reasonable, and Ali is awesome. I get a consistently awesome haircut every time, and it's always a pleasant experience. Can't imagine how it could be improved.

3.description: Overall, a nice barbershop with a great interior and service. However, it wasn't the best haircut I've had. The fade wasn't as clean as I'd like and I definitely got less compliments on this cut than my prior ones. Prices are also on the higher side than what I'm used to for downtown Chicago.  All in all, a decent barbershop but not my favorite.

35.description: I decided to try this place mainly for the overall 5-star reviews on yelp. The stylist did not appear to have gone through a formal barber/stylist training: she totally relies on attachment combs instead of razor tip,which I think I can do it myself once acquiring some proper equipment online. If you go to Success School in the Loop, the apprentices there are probably more competent. Maybe I did not meet the right barber yesterday.

19.description: I've only been here once and it was a fine experience.  Cool atmosphere - at least 4 chairs were filled with customers getting cuts. Jasmine gave me a nice cut which included a wash and clean up of the neck area with a folding straight edge razor.  I would suggest calling to make an appointment in advance is probably a best practice as while I was there they had to turn away a walk in as they were busy all day.  They take credit card for payment and you can place a tip on it which furthers the convenience. Not too shabby for a $30 cut on Wells.

28.description: Was a walk-in; team accommodated me; excellent haircut by Richard -will go back on next visit.

45.description: Allison has cut my hair for the last 5 years, and it was great to learn she's now a part of the Old Town Barbershop team! The place has a true classic barbershop feel, relaxed and comfortable atmosphere and friendly staff.Can't recommend this place enough and be sure to ask for Allison, I haven't had a bad cut yet!

33.description: I've been going to Sheree for 7 years now, so my opinion is probably pretty biased at this point, but I really can't recall ever having a bad experience - either in terms of the overall visit or the haircut itself. Everyone at the shop is always very friendly and the atmosphere is warm and relaxed. The quality of the service is consistently exceptional. And whether you're a  new client or old friend, Sheree seems to treat all of her clients as equals and provides the same quality service/attention to detail visit after visit. She's also great at understanding what you're looking for in a "style/look" even if you have a hard time expressing it.For 99% of my visits I've had my haircut by Sheree, but every once in a while I've had to schedule with someone else - Jeff (her brother) and Dustin - and have always been just as happy with the results, so don't be afraid to branch out!I admit I don't have much to compare to since I've only been going here , but given my experiences I can't imagine going anywhere else.PLUS some days there's a dog (Buick)!

43.description: I am 30 years old. I have had two people cut my hair (outside of dares to shave my head where small children have teamed up to buzz my head). One is a barber in rural Wisconsin with 8 fingers and a penchant for hunting and saf-t-pops. The other is Jeff at Old Town Barbershop.Jeff is a Great barber. In fact, one time Jeff couldn't cut my hair because he was booked, and I really needed a cut before a wedding, so Dustin cut my hair instead (oh shit, I guess that means three people have cut my hair ... not good to lie in the first paragraph of a review ... ) Anyway, Dustin did a great job, and even better, Jeff liked the way Dustin did my hair so much he asked Dustin to show him a few things. The guy (Jeff) owns the place with his Sister Sheree (who is awesome and a total babe - hey girl hey, but taken - sorry dudes) and yet he is still trying to get better. He had been cutting my hair for 3 or 4 years and said "you know what, I think I can do this a little better". I already thought he was doing a great job, but Jeff takes his craft seriously. To me that says it all. for $27 this is the best haircut in town. Their space is nice, the staff is awesome. You can book online (I recommend this because there is a "leave a comment" section when you book and you can write ANYTHING you want in there). If you're a dude, and you don't want to go to one of those "bro - boobs - football" haircut places, and you think it is absurd to pay $60 for a man's hair-cut (which it is) you need to be going here.MikeP.S. I think they even have playboy magazine [giggles]

2.description: I've been going to Ali at Old Town Barbershop for about 2 years now, and I can honestly say that I've never gotten a better haircut or had a better experience at the barber. Ali is always hilarious and welcoming, making the time fly by, and she consistently gives me a great haircut.I've never left feeling like I didn't get what I asked for, and more importantly - she's not afraid to give you some advice when you're unsure of what to get (which is great for me, because like most guys I know nothing about hair). I've also been to at least 5 other barbershops or men's salons in the city before OTB, and this is definitely the best experience I've ever had. I'll be sticking to OTB and Ali for all of my time in Chicago, and I would 100% recommend to others!

18.description: Austin gave me a great haircut. All my experiences here have been great! They really know what they are doing

41.description: Was stuck in Chicago after my flight got canceled and needed a fresh cut. Thank goodness I stumbled across this place in yelp. Booking an appt was easy, place was clean and the barbers know what they're doing. Very satisfied! Highly recommended for contemporary cuts.

52.description: There are three things every decent man needs: A fine suite, a good pipe, and a comfortable barber. With an excess of cheap, unschooled, franchise saloons that you'd be embarrassed to call yourself a regular at, there is a barber shop that puts them to shame. It's brilliant location in the beautiful and historic old town, it's vintage rustic yet clean interior, and it's incredible employees prove their longevity and commitment to the finer things in life. Don't be barraged by the horrendous $5 cheap cut. Don't be influenced by the $10 watch-sports-while-we-cut-your-hair disgrace. Be a man, cut the crap and book an appointment.

50.description: Been here a few times now and Jasmine does a great job.  I'm in and out in about 15 minutes.  Highly recommend Old Town Barbershop!!!

4.description: Professional and precise.I always try and leave a review of every place I go, so they're not only rated by people who love or hate the business.That being said, this place was a great experience. The staff, atmosphere, and decor couldn't have been better. I'm loving my haircut right now. A definite highlight is when the barber used a straight edge to shave my neck.If you're looking for an old-fashioned gentleman's barber shop, with class and perfectionist results, this is your place to be.

6.description: I've been seeing Dustin for a few years now so this is long overdue.  I've had plenty of different people try get me the results I wanted but nobody could get it quite right.  I like a super tight fade up the sides and keep length on top that falls nicely.  The first time, Dustin looked at a picture of what I wanted and didn't bat an eye.  Best cut I had ever had.  Since then, he's come to me with plenty of ideas as well of new styles to try and seeing as I'm always open to trying new things and trust him, I always let him and the result is always perfect.  He's a perfectionist and great at his job.

22.description: First time customer here.  Cool interior that fits in in the Old Town neighborhood.  Was matched up with Dustin through my online appointment and I could not be more pleased.  Great conversation, great haircut. great barbershop.

15.description: I've been going to Sheree for 7 years now, so my opinion is probably pretty biased at this point, but I really can't recall ever having a bad experience - either in terms of the overall visit or the haircut itself. Everyone at the shop is always very friendly and the atmosphere is warm and relaxed. The quality of the service is consistently exceptional. And whether you're a  new client or old friend, Sheree seems to treat all of her clients as equals and provides the same quality service/attention to detail visit after visit. She's also great at understanding what you're looking for in a "style/look" even if you have a hard time expressing it.For 99% of my visits I've had my haircut by Sheree, but every once in a while I've had to schedule with someone else - Jeff (her brother) and Dustin - and have always been just as happy with the results, so don't be afraid to branch out!I admit I don't have much to compare to since I've only been going here , but given my experiences I can't imagine going anywhere else.PLUS some days there's a dog (Buick)!

57.description: Great spot for a haircut. Everyone there is talented but Dustin is the guy to see for a perfect fade. Don't make your appointment Sunday afternoons bc that is my time.

20.description: If you are looking for a great haircut, great conversation and an awesome experience then Austin is your stylist. I had been a previous client of hers when we both lived in Kalamazoo and coming to her when I moved to Chicago was by far the easiest decision I could make. She's great for getting "the usual" or at recommending things if you want to change it up. Hands down the best haircut you'll get!

36.description: My hair was a complete mess when I came in to the Old town Barber shop. I just want to thank Britni so much for giving me an awesome haircut. She is fantastic. I showed her a picture of the style I wanted & she nailed it. Don't even get me started on the neck shave, it felt great & made me feel refreshed. Last but not least she gave me a lesson on how to style my hair with this fantastic Paul Mitchell Reformer.She clearly knows what she is doing guys.  Every one of my friends & family has been complimenting my hair ! It's a great feeling :)!

14.description: I'll start by noting that I've never had a horrible haircut here. But they've never gotten it quite right.The reason that's particularly disappointing? Almost every time, I've shown the stylist a picture of what I wanted.In previous instances, it's never been on-the-nose exactly what I envisioned, but it was close enough that I didn't mind.This last time (which will be the last time), it was so far off from what I wanted that it was simply too much let it slide without commenting here. My stylist today seems to be running on auto-pilot and, from start to finish, didn't really seemed engaged to the level you'd expect from a $30+ (after tip) haircut.Maybe she was having an off day, so I'd rather not call her out here, but like I said, it was really disappointing and I'll be spending my money elsewhere in the future.
