58.description: Good for basic gel fills, but they can be very rushed at times.  Their pedicures are only so-so and can vary from bad to fairly decent.  Depending upon who you get (Helen is not bad) their gel fills are holding up pretty well and look very good for at least two weeks; they also will do them fairly thin and then they look amazingly natural.  Overall the store is bright and clean.  I prefer the pedicures in the chairs, but they will also do them when you are getting your nails done.  With both at the same time it takes about 45 minutes to an hour to get both my nails and feet done.  It is not the closest to my house, but the experience is fairly typical of a Vietnamese salon and my nails are looking very good. Accepts Visa & MasterCard - no American Express.

56.description: If you want a manicure CHOP CHOP, this is your place.  I, on the other hand, prefer my manicurist to take her time.  The good news is they have a lot of nail polish colors to choose from but the rushed manicure left a bad impression and I won't go back.

29.description: I wish I could give this place negative stars!  I first gave it a try in the summer after a trip to the beach so I was sandy and needed a pedi.  What I left with was something my 4 year old could have done. Bleeding cuticles and a messy paint job.So here it is a few months later and I think okay my regular place was booked I'll give it another try.  What a waste of $!!  I specifically asked that she be careful not to paint my cuticles because as soon as you wash your hands they peel and look like a jagged mess.  Nope, she did not listen to anything I said.  There was a fuzz, she painted right over it.  I had to "bump" it for her to redo that nail. The nail in the coffin was when I was getting ready to leave, not one person offered to help me with my shoes or coat.  They just sat there playing on their phones, all of them!Will not be back.  Management seriously needs to start managing!

42.description: Elite is my new favorite nail spa in Old Town.  I used to go to Magnifique down the street, but I'm so glad I went the extra distance and wandered into Elite a couple of weeks ago.  For $37 you can get a spa manicure and pedicure.  You also get a free box of your own nail supplies that they pull out each time you come -- just don't forget your box number!  I've only been twice, but I've had excellent results each time.  The place is very clean and the staff is very friendly.

23.description: I will say that the only good thing about this place is that they are pretty clean. However, I have gotten a pedicure here 2-3 times and its my own fault that I go back.  They rush through the pedicure doing a very mediocre job with your nails.  It looks sloppy, and they skip steps to the pedicure.

47.description: I've been coming here for the past 4 years and have never been disappointed. It's always accommodating to my pedicure whims and I've never been disappointed. Some girls are better than others, but I've always been pretty satisfied (and they just hold on tight to my highly ticklish feet and get it exfoliated which I definitely appreciate!!!). I'm going to miss this place in Ann Arbor next year!

8.description: The first time, my boyfriend went there, they did a fabulous job. His nails looked great. Today he went in and they wanted to charge $5 extra just to buff his nails. The woman was extremely dry and took wreckless care of his hands. His cuticles were unfinished and he still has to go home to fix them. She acted like she was scared to apply lotion and massage his hands. Extremely poor and rude service. This is the last time he will be back there.

31.description: They were nice but super fast and messy. DON'T RUSH! We're here to relax and pay for good service. She had to re-do my nail polish once and they still were not great. I got home and looked at my toes and a 10 year old could have painted them neater. SO disappointed!!! It's $37 for a crappy job. I tried it out but will never be back and continue to go to Old Town Nails.

34.description: Went in for gel mani ....mess 37$ and couldn't get the polish to set. She kept adding coat after coat after coat. Five days later the whole shellac just starting peeling.....who cares I thought, as I was busy with other things in my life. I work across the street , and went back for regular mani few weeks later as was in bind. Nail rep UGH! ; Didn't ask what shape, was unfriendly, did it quickly, wasn't thorough , and during the dry time noticed she did half ass on few fingers and it was bubbling. Said something the receptionist. Receptionist threw on another coat, but  it's only 5 hours later...looks week old already. WILL NOT BE BACK! It's in great location, it could be a great a great place if they would shape up! But other than that- boo elite nail! Got recommended to place down street from co-worker.

16.description: I had to ask them to re-do my manicure because it was done so poorly the first time. The owner ended up re-doing them and even she couldn't believe how bad they looked. The girl cut my cuticles until they bled. I'll never go back here!

13.description: DO NOT GO HERE! The most rude service I have ever had. They did a terrible job and when I came back to have them fixed  they were very rude to me. Go somewhere else! I will never be back. Disgusted.

11.description: So  I have mixed feelings about this place based on who you get. I have had friends and myself go and gotten a woman who does not care at all about doing your nails. I went to get a no chip and a pedi and she basically just painted my entire toes outside of the nail and then tried to use nail polish remover to make it look nice- it did not and I complained and she gave me attitude. The no chip and pedi is $55 However, I have also gone and gotten a very nice woman who does an amazing job and been pleased with my no chip manis from her and she does them very quickly - faster than other salons. There is no parking only street and that can be tricky based on what time you go.

39.description: My mom was in town and we thought getting our nails done with BYOB would be a fun and relaxing way to start the evening and weekend... which it would have been, but not at Elite.  We each did the spa pedicure which was little more than a polish change.  She trimmed my nails, pumiced my feet for a quick minute, slapped some lotion on my calves and proceeded to polish.  It didn't include any kind of foot massage which, to me, is an essential part of a spa pedicure.As for the BYOB, we asked for glasses as we sat down to which no one replied except for some quizzical looks.  When we explained that they advertise it's BYOB so we brought wine, still nothing.  Eventually someone showed up with a couple cups.  By the time we started sipping our wine, we were about to the polishing stage.  Which shows both how quickly the pedicure was over and how long it took to produce a couple cups.I gave them two stars despite our disappointment since my toenails did look nice and if you are looking for a quick 15 minute pedi, this could be the place for you.

37.description: This review is for their no-chip manicures.Came in for the first time with a friend who lives around the corner. Their no-chip manicure colors are not displayed on painted tile samples...you must choose a color by looking at the tiny example printed on the bottle. Unlike regular nail polish, no-chip polish is in jars or white bottles so you REALLY can't get a sense of the color when it's not painted on a sample. Further, they had VERY few selections. Barely any lighter summer colors. I was really disappointed. The woman who did my nails did not speak to me. She didn't smile. It was unpleasant. It's been all I can do to keep the polish on my nails 2 weeks. Alas, right before the 2 week mark, my index finger flaked off. I have never had a no-chip last such a short time.I will not be back; I will not recommend.

0.description: Initially my friend and I weren't going to come here because of the lack of stars, but since we were hitting up Second City for a show immediately after (& the place down the street couldn't take us straight away) we agreed to get our feet pampered here... And boy were they ever, but for a price! I walked in not knowing how much a pedicure would be and apparently they gave me the DELUXE pedicure so it wound up being $38.... That's how much it would be for both a mani and pedi in LA, but I guess, "when in Chicago"... And the man who attended to my toes did tell me if I flew to Chicago once a month to get a pedicure, he's give me a 50% discount- WHAT A BARGAIN! Ha Ha Ha!Overall though, my friend and I had a good experience, we both loved all the scrubs that were rubbed on our feet, and the hot stones were a nice touch. Not a bad pedicure but it also didn't BLOW US OUT OF THE FOOT BATH.... Aka: we weren't downright willing to pay $38 for what we got. Alas, we did get to relax after walking the streets of Chicago... Sometimes you just need to spend a little extra on your feet!

38.description: I had a no-chip manicure here two weeks ago ($35).  It peeled off in 12 days. No-I did not pick at it.  I have had no-chip done at other places and it lasted a solid 3 weeks and did not peel off.  Will definitely not go back.

51.description: THIS REVIEW IS IN REGARDS TO THE "BASIC PEDICURE" SERVICE.I'm glad I have a good sense of humor, or else I would not have taken my experience here so lightly. I walk in and tell the Mother Hen at the front desk that I want a pedicure. She explains there are two kinds of pedicures: the $20 basic one and then the $25 spa one. I ask what the difference is. She explains, but all I can make out is "cooling foot gel". Big whup. So I say, screw the cooling foot gel and tell her I'll do the $20 basic pedicure. She then plops me down into an armchair at a manicure station, and I figure she must be mistaken. "Nono," I say, "I wanted a pedicure." She nods in agreement. Two minutes later, a technician with a portable bubbly foot spa hobbles over. (You know--the things they sell at Bed, Bath and Beyond. LOLOLOL.) I was beside myself when I realized she was aiming at me. At this point, I wish I'd paid the $5 for the "spa pedicure", which not only includes what must be some legendary cooling foot gel but a pedicure chair AND water from a plumbing source. But whatever--I go with it.She then turns the portable tub on. HILARIOUS. The damn thing reverberated off the floor and throughout the salon. It was so loud! It was as if the salon was trying to shame me for choosing the cheaper pedicure option. The technician then props my foot up on a stool so high off the ground, I'm pretty sure she got a free tip, if you know what I mean. Good thing I'm limber.There I was, sitting in a president's chair at a manicure station, with my feet in a portable foot spa, my feet above my shoulders, with the foot spa violently vibrating against the floor. I was a sight to see.The service itself was so-so. Nothing to write Yelp about. I guess I'd return, but if I did, the first thing out of my mouth would be, "SPA PEDICURE, PLEASE."In sum: IF YOU DO GET A PEDICURE HERE, GET THE "SPA PEDICURE". It's worth the $5 more than the basic one, I'm positive.

27.description: This place is terrible. I usually get my nails done downtown near my work, but on occasion I have to go near home. As this is the place closest to my house I have gone hear a time or two and they have pretty much always been a disappointment. I gave them another shot this weekend and it was by far the worst they have done yet. I simply needed a polish change. What I got was attititude and a polish job I could have done better myself. I did not have cash with me and was unable to leave a tip on my card. As a result, I had planned to get cash and come back with a tip once my nails were complete. I did not however mention this to the woman doing my nails and because she seemed to assume she would not be getting tipped she rushed through the polish job and upon finishing immediately ran away to watch videos on her iPad.My nails turned out un-even, lumpy, full of air bubbles, and dried with marks on them from the fan. They also were not cleaned up around the edges and I had polish all over my fingers - a look I could have accomplished on my own. The polish started well above my cuticle and on some nails did not make it to the tips. The only good thing I can report is that the few times I've been here (all of which have resulted in terrible polish jobs) they have been willing to fix my nails. So, unless you have time to get your nails done twice, I don't reccommend wasting your time or money.

32.description: Not a fan of this place. The women who did the nails were nice. But the overall service left a lot to be desired. There was a general lack of attention to detail and underwhelming sense of hospitality. It felt a little like a factory. -The painting was uneven and sloppy-They charged more than the advertised price-They forgot to give me my credit card back and blamed me when I called them to see if they had it

54.description: Many people seem to think this place is horrible. I, on the other hand, had a great experience here. I usually don't have the time for a full manicure so I usually go with a simple polish change. I have tried a few other nail salons in the neighborhood and Elite nails trims the cuticles, files, and clips with just a polish change! Although with all the hype of Magnifique, I think I may need to try there next time.

48.description: Based on the mixed reviews, it sounds like this place is hit or miss.  In my case, sadly, it was a total flop in my flip-flops.After a long day of working on my feet, I was really looking forward to treating myself to a pedicure.  The place was crazy busy - which I took to be a good sign.  It's gorgeous outside and all the women in my 'hood want to beautify their feet.  I opted for the "spa" manicure and only waited 5-10 minutes to be seated.  Another great sign.  Or so I thought.Not great was the half-hour plus wait (it could have been longer I lost track of time) for someone to get to me before my tootsies turned pruney.  By the time a nail technician came over, the salon had almost emptied out.  Lucky for them, I was too tired to fight.  Just gimme the bloody pedi for pete's sake.The leg and foot massage was OK - fine for what I paying.  I asked for a French manicure thinking that I would have a nice clean look for my toes.  When the nail chick was finished, I was disappointed.  Ugh!!!   The way she painted on the "French" made my toes look even stubbier on my teeny size 5 1/2 feet.  Good grief.This place might be only two blocks away, but these feet will keep walking until I find a salon that knows how to take care of their customers.

44.description: I have been going to Elite Nails for three years, and have always had a great experience there. My manicures generally last almost two weeks, before chipping. (The pedicures last much longer, of course.) All the manicurists are friendly, and do a good job.

24.description: Given them two chances and my "No Chip" manicure has chipped a week later and my cuticles look horrible. I'm not a fan. People who work there act annoyed when you walk in.

7.description: I live in Old Town and I have given this place many chances. I got the worst manicure I've ever had. And I've gotten several pedicures. I went again today with my boyfriend and he got a long pedicure massage while I got nothing (same price) the lady asked us if we wanted 10 minute massages, and I said yes. The man doing my pedicure said "my hands are tired" and they both missed out on that extra money. I have never written a help review, but this place is seriously terrible. I highly recommend Old Town Nails.

49.description: I've been going to Elite Nails Spa for about 5 years. It's right down the street from me, there is never a wait, and they do a good job for the money. You're not going to get the spa treatment you would at an upscale salon, but for $12, you can't complain about a no nonsense pedicure. When I first went I knew it was good simply by the vast number of regulars that are in there on a daily basis. That speaks volumes.

40.description: I needed a quick manicure last weekend and Elite took me right away. They did a great job for what I was looking for. (and it was only $12!) There were also a lot of people who were regulars that came in. Since they're so close to where I live, I'll give this salon another shot next time I need a mani/pedi!

53.description: I went to Elite Nails Salon on a Sunday around 5pm (Feb. 2009) I don't know if they will have updated the listing yet, but the current yelp phone number and a couple other details are incorrect. The correct phone number is (312) 397-9395 and while yes, it does *look* like they're located on North Ave. their actual address is 1446 N. Wells. ATMOSPHERE: The place is well-lit, cheerful, clean and no frills. There's a comfortable waiting area away from the door and a coat rack (I know I hate having to move my coat, etc around with me while getting my nails done). Everyone was extremely polite, cheerful and attentive. SERVICES: They offer facial and body waxing and everything nail related. Their business card also says that they do permanent makeup and eyelash extensions. A standard manicure is $12, pedicure $20, gel/silk/acrylic nails are $35 ($25 fill-ins). MY EXPERIENCE: My guy pal and I both got pedicures and manicures (he requested that I say, for the record, he did not get polish :) We were there on a Sunday around 5pm, there were about three other customers and the staff was very efficient. The pedicures were very relaxing and didn't take forever-- my feet and toes looked absolutely BEAUTIFUL when they were done. He had a standard manicure, and they also had a "Winter Special" where you get a free paraffin wax hand treatment and lavender foot scrub for free if you get a mani-pedi. I got my gels redone (after my bad experience at Fairy Nails in Hyde Park two weeks prior). They now look incredible. Like one other yelper mentioned, they do a nice thin gel that looks VERY natural. It doesn't feel like I have giant pieces of plexiglas on top of my nails like my previous set of gels felt like. VERDICT: I really enjoyed my experience, as did my friend, and I would definitely go back again!

30.description: I had a terrible experience here. I had a friend come in from out of town and we wanted to get mani & pedis. We were in the area and decided to try this place. BAD DECISION. Please save your time and money. Not only was the quality of the work poor, the manager was rude and we ended up being victims of a bait and switch, being quoted one price when we walked in and asked to pay another when the work was done. This place was so bad, I joined Yelp JUST to review this place.

46.description: I came in on a Saturday afternoon with a co-worker.  I had both a mani and pedi done at the same time.   Not because I wanted them at the same time, but they wanted to turn chairs as fast as they could and I figured it would be ok since my co-worker has been here and the past and hasn't complained of awful service.  I had one chic doing my feet and one doing my nails.  I giggle like crazy when someone touches my feet.   I can't help it.  I am ticklish. The nazi doing my nails kept giving me the stare of death to stay still.  Now really?  Do you expect me to stay still for both of you when you guys have all 4 of my limbs frozen?  Of course she was muttering something in her own native language e to the other tech, but really now am I supposed to come back when I feel a little intimidated and threatened?  It should be a relaxing visit not one where I'm on edge.  I won't be back.

1.description: I adore this salon. I've gone to MANY others and this place is the most consistent. I've only had one girl who I didn't like my gel result, but now I have my regular tech and when they aren't available I have a reliable back up.Weekends get pretty busy so call ahead,  but I usually go during the day on a week day and I never wait. They have the best selection of colors in no chip around.Waxing is great. My brows are always on point.I was convinced to try lip once. She said I needed it :( NEVER AGAIN. It made my entire lip break out and I looked like I had herpes for a week. Traumatic.

55.description: I have been searching endlessly  for a nail place who does good work on acrylic/gel nails.  I happened upon this place for a full set and I could not be more disappointed and angry.  By the time all was said and done, I was in there for 2 hours.  2 hours!?  Are you kidding me??  The man that did my nails should have his license taken away.  He barely spoke any English and did a HORRIBLE job on my nails.  I felt very rushed and misunderstood.  I asked him for square shaping, he shaped them round.  I  had to keep asking him to repeat the filing so they would be straight across.  Ugh!  When I was "done", I was shuffled over to the dryer area and as I was looking at my nails and how horrible and uneven they were, I was just livid.  I could not believe I had been in there for that long and then to wind up with nasty looking nails!  I tried to get someone's attention, but nobody would even look at me.  Right after I left, I went across the street to Old Town Nails to have a nail tech "fix" it.  I cannot say enough bad things about this nail salon.  PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE GIRLS!!!  I will NEVER go here again and I will warn my friends about this place.

9.description: Have been coming here for past 5 years..... Last 3 months, they hardlyhave any staff, and most are very very unhappy and surly, don't know what has happened..... Hang and Lee are the best people to go to.If they aren't there will not ever visit again.

26.description: I don't really understand all the negative reviews of this place. I had a perfectly satisfactory experience. Especially for the price. I think ladies need to temper their expectations a little. This isn't a high class spa, it's a walk in nail salon. I went the afternoon of New Year's Eve and was expecting a wait, but they got me right in. The nail tech was perfectly capable, and my nails look good. Have they looked better? Yes, but I also didn't just spend an arm and a leg. The salon itself is not bright and shiny, but it's not dirty either.  It was clean enough.As for people complaining their no chip doesn't last long enough- it's never guaranteed how long they will last. Some people have oily nails that don't hold the polish as well as others. Some people work with their hands more. It doesn't always mean the tech did a bad job. Overall, I was content with my manicure and I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

25.description: This review is for no-chip manicures only.I first came to this spot the week before Christmas. I wanted a sparkly no-chip that would last me though NYE and my normal salon didn't have the right color selections. Even though almost every chair was taken here, the ladies got me a seat without an appointment and helped me pick out a base color plus a sparkly top coat that was exactly what I wanted. No-chips are tough because most of the time the bottles are white, but they will try out a couple colors on their own nails to show you what it will look like.The manicure lasted for 3 weeks without a single chip. I only got it removed because my nails were growing out too much. The technician was super cute and friendly too. The only reason this is not my fave spot is because, just as others have noted, the manicure is not perfect. There was some polish on my cuticles and there were some small spots that were missed. Sometimes these things are easy to fix with a regular mani, but with a no-chip you are stuck with the errors for a few weeks :(

12.description: I don't really understand all the negative reviews of this place. I had a perfectly satisfactory experience. Especially for the price. I think ladies need to temper their expectations a little. This isn't a high class spa, it's a walk in nail salon. I went the afternoon of New Year's Eve and was expecting a wait, but they got me right in. The nail tech was perfectly capable, and my nails look good. Have they looked better? Yes, but I also didn't just spend an arm and a leg. The salon itself is not bright and shiny, but it's not dirty either.  It was clean enough.As for people complaining their no chip doesn't last long enough- it's never guaranteed how long they will last. Some people have oily nails that don't hold the polish as well as others. Some people work with their hands more. It doesn't always mean the tech did a bad job. Overall, I was content with my manicure and I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

59.description: This has been "my nail place" since it has opened, but lately, I only go their when I am in a pinch for time.   Which is what I did today after my baby went down for a nap and my husband came home this afternoon.  I didn't have time for a pedi and just wanted a quick polish change.  They were packed but I only waited about 10 minutes.  Okay, so this young girl comes over to do my toes and she puts my foot on her leg, no table, no chair, but her skinny little leg.  It was completely uncomfortable and she did a terrible job (of course how could she do a good job when she had to balance my foot on her leg).  Can you say creepy and crazy?!I will not go here again.  I would much rather pay up for a nice pedi with Lydia down the street at Salon 1800!  Plus I hate to waste precious "mommy" time (as people say) on a botched pedi.

21.description: I go here because I can always get in and they are open on Mondays! However, my no chip always chips within a few days. Not badly, but it does. So considering that I just use this place on an as need basis, if I need it last minute. The staff is decent and they do have a clean nice environment.

17.description: My friend and I meandered here due to the fact we couldn't find another nail shop I looked up previous. Although this was not our desired location they delivered! Can't wait to go back again for some much needed pampering.

10.description: I've been trying to find a local nail salon in my area that does a great job with no-chip French manicure/ pedicure . Found it!  I love spoiling myself with a French manicure/ pedicure.

5.description: A few months ago I wanted a quick no chip manicure as close to my house as possible. I typically shy away from places with low stars, but figured I would give it a chance. Elite was amazing!! They did a wonderful job on my nails and the no chip lasted over two weeks! I now go every two to three weeks and am addicted. Best no chip I have ever gotten! Not to mention everyone is very friendly and helpful!

3.description: One of the nicer nail salons in Old Town. Very clean and a nice assortment of polishes. The pedicures are finished off with hot stones which feels great! Prices are pretty reasonable.

35.description: The price is right but the mani/pedi is not. The pedicurist (and you get a different manicurist) slightly clipped my toes, then ran an emery board 3 times across the top of them. No shaping, left with ragged edges. Water in the "spa" was lukewarm. I guess you get what you pay for.

19.description: Solid nail place. This is in the neighborhood where I work so I've been here a handful of times. If you get a good tech your no-chip will be flawless. I'm on a budget so I usually go every three weeks and aside from nail growth, the no-chip is always perfect. Don't expect much small talk they mostly yell amongst themselves but they've got tvs and you can catch the news (or a crappy music video. lol) They have a decent color selection, plenty of OPI, of course. I always walk in and I never have to wait, there's always someone who can take me right away. Since I've been going there my nails have grown SO much so obviously their technique is good. I have one of those cards, you get 5 services and then the next one is $5 off. I definitely feel like my $35 is well spent here.

28.description: This place is the ABSOLUTE WORST. I got a "no chip" manicure here; I put that in quotes because it chipped less than 36 hours later. And again less than 48 hours later (after I had gone back for a touch up). Because this was the week of Thanksgiving, I was not able to come back for another touch up until a week later. Then the "manager" refused to give me a refund because "only two nails chipped" and "I didn't come back immediately" even though I called when the nail chipped the second time, gave my name, information, etc. I stated regardless, the no chip is guaranteed for at least ten days; she again stated it was "only two nails". I countered by asking if the no chip was only guaranteed for ten nails, not individually; she had nothing to say but still refused to give a refund. WASTE OF MONEY. The service is rude, the management is rude, the product is crap. I've been getting no chips for four years and never had this happen. If you want a REAL no chip, done well by friendly people who honor guarantees, go to Elegant Nails on Clark and North or Magnificent Nails about a block east. The service is less expensive and waaaaay higher quality.

45.description: Definitely agree with other reviewers that this place is a hit or miss, depending on the manicurist you get. However, what I like the most about this place is that every single time I came in, I NEVER had to wait! They are quick and cheap and I have never had any issues with them.

33.description: disappointed +PISSED. i was in the area and found them open. i badly needed a new gel nails set (hands) and they explained to me that i had nothing to worry about, they know what they are doing. well? yes they did a nice pink and white set for me for $45 +tips which took like an hour of work because the girl was a little slow and another came to help. i get gel nails because i dont want to have to worry about my nails chipping or being damaged or having to file them and having to go to a salon every week... i want to have peace of mind for at least 40 days until i am ready to get a refill or a new set. that's why i pay $55 normally, but they were $10 cheaper. well? after 3 weeks, even though they looked shiny and unchipped, they started falling off which i absolutely hate because your hands look ridiculous. this NEVER happened to me before even when i badly needed a new set, and i've been getting gel nails for 3 years now. after the 2nd nail fell off, i decided to remove the entire set. normally, it should take a whole lot of time to remove a set, after soaking your fingers in acetone and warm water, cutting the edges, pulling hard etc...and it can be painful. Well not this time! it hardly took less than 1 minute to remove 8 nails. Bottom line: they use very cheap and inefficient glue (which probably justifies their lower prices) and your gel nails will NOT last as long as they should. So you end up paying $45+tip every 3 weeks. i think that's not honest, and i wont be returning. now i have to find an hour this week to go get them done at my usual salon, Nail Perfection.

43.description: I take care of my own nails really well on a regular basis, so when I go to a spa (which is rare) I expect them to easily be able to do a good job. I file, shape, trim, buff my nails/cuticles/skin enough that any nail tech working on me just has to maintain and do a good paint job. At Elite this past week, they couldn't even do that. A friend and I went after work on a Wed, with only a handful of other customers in the salon. We asked the [super awkward] front desk girl for the mani-pedi special and she said the regular option ($28) wasn't available but we could do the spa ($32). No explanation. We said OK (glad we got the spa in the end, only redeeming thing from the whole ordeal were the massage chairs. No cooling gel was used, so not sure what else the "spa" included that day).  After a few seconds of soaking, my girl started on my toes, and within 5-6 min she had taken off the previous polish, "filed" my feet and nails, and "trimmed" my cuticles. Once I got home, however, I saw she didn't really do anything. The few bits that needed fixing weren't touched, and my nails were different lengths. I got a 1 min leg massage that was OK, and she painted in a surprising few minutes. When she grabbed my stuff I was shocked it was already time to get up. My friend's tech also rushed through the process and sadly didn't even give her a leg/foot massage (in an attempt to stay on par with my speedy tech??). We both sat dazed at our mani stations when I realized I hadn't picked out a finger color yet. I asked the girl (who was suddenly another person-- my initial tech had disappeared) if I could pick my color and she said "I'll get it, I know what you want" ??? NO, no you don't. I hobbled over to the wall after her and I said I wanted a very natural light blush/beige color. She grabbed 3 very white looking bottles and sat down. So i followed her, stupidly, and let her do a color that she said I wanted. I was all caught up in their mad rush. I file my fingernails regularly, but she said "oh you have beautiful nails" and barely touched them with the file at all. Yes, they were already shaped, but it would have been nice to file them down a bit so they wouldn't be ungodly long in a week. Her cuticle trimming was nonexistent and she quickly painted. Within 10 minutes my manicure was over. I waited another 5 min for my friend to finish, we sprayed the quick dry spray and jetted out of there. We both lamented the fingernail job-- the paint covered many of my still-there cuticles, ensuring it would soon start peeling off at the edges-- but my friends was the worst. Her poor hands had needed some work, and they got none. Her previous red polish was still under her nails so it looked like her fingernails were bloody. Hangnails and cuticles were hanging on jaggedly around nearly every nail. Her pale pink polish was put on unevenly so it looked liney. What a crazy bad job from a professional! As expected, the paint around my cuticles started peeling the next day. By Fri (2 days) it was wearing off the tips of my nails. I don't do hard labor, and I hadn't even been doing the dishes. I really wanted it to last until Sunday for a party. But by Sat I HAD to take it off (and trim my own cuticles), it looked so horrid. We were quite disappointed in Elite, and next time we'll be checking out Magnifique or going back to our usual Old Town Nails.

2.description: Will not be returning Elite Nail ever again. I had a no chip for my hands and just a normal pedi. The water wasn't even warm when i was soaking my feet! The lady was really rough on my feet and it hurts alot. The no chip was even worse. Terrible shapes! The lady got mad at me for taking my hands out of the UV light because it was burning my fingers!!!! No. No. NO.DO NOT GO THERE.

18.description: I've been coming here for a few years since I live in the area. The store is definitely under a new management and personally, it's a great step up from the previous owner. Their services is wonderful, I usually go for the no-chip since it works best for me! I don't understand the negativity towards this place but the current staff and new owner are very welcoming and I would recommend this to anyone who's in the area!

41.description: When I think about getting my nails done i am always happy and excited. This is the "alone" time i take for myself to feel beautiful and pampered. I usually go with my girlfriends to our usual beauty spot but UNFORTUNATELY they were not about to attend last week. Considering that we all travel halfway which is about a 30 minute drive from my home i decided to simply go to one close to home.  My experience was less than mediocre. The people working there were extremely rude and unfriendly. The worst part of all is that my toe caught a mild infection. This incident was not a mistake it was due to the foolish untrained woman working. She was not careful and seemed very rushed when working. I WILL NEVER COME HERE AGAIN and they should be hearing from my lawyer very soon. Please be advised to run the other way!

52.description: I am very surprised to see the low rating for this nail salon. I also am wondering if some people are confused as to what salon this is. This salon is inbetween Dinotto's and Old Town Ale House, on North Avenue. I have been going to this salon for almost 3 years and get mani/pedi's a couple times per month. The great thing is M-W mani/pedi for $28 ... $4 more for the spa chair (so worth it!). My mani lasts for about a week (thats as good as it gets for me) and my toes can sometimes last up to a month! They also have an amazing color selection. There is nothing worse than going to a nail salon and having a crappy arrangement of colors to choose from. They also do a good job with the brow wax.For the price, service, location and color selection ... I definitely say it's a 4 star place.

50.description: Ladies, I think we have a definitional problem here.At most places, an ordinary pedicure involves a seat in a tall chair with an attached basin, and a "spa" pedicure involves the addition of some nebulous, overpriced add ons like a $7 foot scrub or whatever.  That is NOT the case here!  Here, if you do the ordinary pedicure, it's a portable basin on the floor while you sit in a manicure chair.  (I think it's $20--which, let's be honest, you can NOT complain about, because $20 is outrageously cheap for a pedi).  The "spa" pedicure involves cooling gel (the afforementioned nebulous add on) but, more importantly, a seat in an amazing massaging pedicure chair.  I almost made the same mistake some of the other reviewers on here made, and demanded an "ordinary" pedicure.  But as soon as I saw the portable tub, I said "SPA!"  And it was only $25!They are incredibly nice here and do an incredible job; my pedicures last a month.  Last time I went, my friend and I sat in the massaging chairs reading magazines for about an hour (even after our pedis were done); I can't think of many nail places that would allow a client to just sit around even after they were done.  If you're in the neighborhood, stop by!  I plan on driving here and never going anywhere else for a (spa) pedi again.

4.description: I was disappointed with Nancy's service. She rushed through my pedicure and did not trim my cuticles or buff the nail. The polish came out sloppy. I do not feel it was worth the $30 at all. She took a bit more time with the manicure but I have still had a whole lot better quality for the same price at other salons near by. I do not plan on coming back.

6.description: My go to old town pedicure spot! Typically there is never a wait and it's very affordable. Plus, they do a hit rock massage with every pedicure which is great (as such I don't think there's any need to get the deluxe pedicure).

22.description: Reasonable price for a mani-pedi. I walked in without an appointment and they were able to sit me down almost right away. The nail technician was very nice. My only concern is that I never saw them open a new/sterilized kit for me, or those customers sitting next to me, on either side, so I ma not sure what the situation is there, and I might not return here because of this concern... On a more positive note, my pedicure looks great a week after and counting :-)

15.description: I love this place. They do an awesome job and they get you in and out in a timely manner. I am in  wheelchair and they did a awesome job with me. I had Hang as my nail tech and when I say she was awesome I mean she was awesome. Give this place a try I guarantee you will not be disappointed.

57.description: This review is for the Clybourn location. The signed and coupon I got in the mail boasted "under new management" not to be confused with Elite Nail SALON. So whatever I have a coupon and it's in walking distance.  I got there and the place was pretty empty. The pedicure soak and massage was nice. I like the addition of the hot clothes.The manicure was also okay, but I didn't get a good vibe from the ladies there.  Don't get me wrong, I understand that you get what you pay for and there were obvious regulars at this locale, but while I was getting a mani, another girl was sitting behind the front desk testing every ring tone in her phone and when I was done with my mani and led back to the dungeon of magazines, I got no assistance in setting my stuff down.  I sat there for a long time because I am a clutz and didn't want to ruin the nail job but soon after I was seated down, the woman turned on some asian chinese humor/obstacle course show on the tv behind the front desk or a computer or whatever and were just sitting and watching it.  I found this very unprofessional. A lot of people hate their jobs but don't watch TV at work. At least pretend that you're happy to see me come in and not breaking up your tv time!Since they couldn't see me getting ready to leave and were watching TV, I had to put my own plastic on my feet and put my own shoes on and coat and keys thus of course messing up the nail job.If this place is under new management and their flaunting it, I'd hate to see what the old was like! I'm going to stick to Rose Nails on Lincoln even though it's a further walk now that I've moved. Sure it's the same kind of quick in and out manicure pedicure factory owned by that creepy nail pimp on his cell phone all the time, but it's much cleaner, brighter and their wait area is in the front by the windows so when the workers see you struggling to saran wrap your feet they can come help you....and they have that great separate room for large parties

20.description: Solid nail place. This is in the neighborhood where I work so I've been here a handful of times. If you get a good tech your no-chip will be flawless. I'm on a budget so I usually go every three weeks and aside from nail growth, the no-chip is always perfect. Don't expect much small talk they mostly yell amongst themselves but they've got tvs and you can catch the news (or a crappy music video. lol) They have a decent color selection, plenty of OPI, of course. I always walk in and I never have to wait, there's always someone who can take me right away. Since I've been going there my nails have grown SO much so obviously their technique is good. I have one of those cards, you get 5 services and then the next one is $5 off. I definitely feel like my $35 is well spent here.

36.description: Won't be back. A lot of people have said, "You get what you pay for" here, but I don't think I even got that. $25 + tip for a 10 minute pedicure is a joke. I was wincing while my cuticles were being cut, have never had shorter nails in my life, despite being very specific about the length I wanted, and was rushed through the whole procedure during an empty, mid-week lull.

14.description: Elite Nails is the best in Old Town! The girls (and now some guys) are fantastic and the work is professional and always perfect. Kim, Sally, Nancy, Lilly, Gina, Ann, Salena all wonderful, thanks ladies!

58.description: Soon as you walk in Marc Anthony and Pitbull blaring from the speakers and on the video screens. I didn't know the song but I kept wondering who authorized that selection for the Friday night jams. It's like a big meat market when you walk through, with most people at the tables looking around, or you have so it seems the livelier set of people at the bar. The whole bar setup is kinda weird where it's almost impossible to get a drink on the 1st floor.  About an hour end it got a little better and they played Biggie, then my hopes were quickly dashed with more top 40 garbage for the fraternity/sorority crowd. To sum up the crowd I walked by and saw one girl with her Burberry jacket turned inside out just to show off the label and the pattern, it was so obvious that was the route she was going. What a douchebag.In the end, it's just one of the many bars up and down Wells. Not bad, not great.

56.description: The Pour House is always a safe bet. They've got an expansive beer selection and really can't be beat there. The TVs are huge and the place has a nice, open feel. My one complaint is that it can be too loud sometimes, but I suppose that's true of most bars.

29.description: I was visiting Chicago and my friend recommended I visit old town Pour House because I'm a craft beer enthusiast and this bar has the largest selection of craft drafts around. Well, I loved it! The bar itself is pretty large, there's huge long tables surrounding the bar area, a long bar with plenty of seating, and tons of dining tables, indoors or outside on the patio.We had a few beers at the bar, then moved to the outside patio for food.  The bartender was awesome. I wasn't sure which beer to try, I narrowed it down to 2, and instead of choosing one or the other, she informed me that I could buy half pours of each!  Brilliant!  I LOVE bars that offer half pours. Sometimes you need more than just a sample, but you don't want to buy the full glass. I love that!  I had a few local IL beers, and some others from breweries that I love. The food was also great. The little pretzel bites were simple but delicious.. such fluffy soft pretzels with a yummy cheese dip. I ordered the fish tacos, which were pretty good but too spicy for me, and my friend got a salad which was a good size and looked good also. Great bar, great service, great atmosphere, and amazing beer selections. I'll come back next time I'm in Chicago!

42.description: Good food, douche-baggery abounds, oh sweet you have a collared shirt and work in an office? Come here and have a great time farting into your bar stools, cuz you are super unique. Damn yuppies with your pressed slacks and penchant for whatever college you went to. Nobody is impressed more than the bratender (did you see what I did there) But the food is really good. Tons of TV's and loud douche bags, only come here with people you don't really want to have a conversation with.zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz next

23.description: Aaron is a great waiter!  He really made us feel like special guests.

47.description: Great place to watch sports. Laid back mature crowd. Does not have that bar feel. More like a sports restaurant if you will

8.description: We came to pour house as a stop on our Old Town brunch beverage hunt. Lots of good options and plenty of TVs to watch college football on. Clean, friendly and price efficient. I approve!

31.description: Best things about Pour House : the burgers,  cheese curds,  beer selection,  and all the TVs. I haven't tried many of the other food options but other people tell me they are just OK. When I brought my family in during their visit,  they enjoyed the burgers and beer selection with no complaints. I usually sit at the bar because the table service is slow and inconsistent.  If it's a busy night,  plan on waiting awhile to even get your server's attention.  With that said,  the bartenders are usually great and attentive. Avoid weekends if you're not into the Trixie/Chad atmosphere.  During the week is the best.

34.description: A huge bar by Old Town standards. Decent beer list. A very adequate place to have a few.

16.description: I came here on a Friday night with my friend for drinks. The place is super hip inside. They have a bunch of taps and bottles, all lined up and lit up with cool lights. There are two floors, and after ordering our drinks, we went and sat upstairs.We got drinks that you can't really F up. I got a makers on the rocks, and my friend got a Glenlivet on the rocks. Super simple. Can't mess them up. Although the bar was busy, the bartenders moved pretty fast.The tables could be wiped down a little more often, but I guess once you're busy, it's hard to keep up with the drunk crowd. Drinks are also pricey, but it's Old Town and a hip place. So I get it. I peeked at the photos of the food that they have here, and it looks really good. Looks like I'll have to pop in again at an earlier time for food....and more booze, of course!

13.description: Pretty atmosphere. Great tv watching. Tasty beer and burgers (although we had to send the burger back because he was extremely under cooked/almost raw but burned on the outside). Slow and unaware service. Slow Sunday late lunch and wait staff hardly came around. I will come back. For beer and sport games. Not food.

11.description: I was visiting Chicago and my friend recommended I visit old town Pour House because I'm a craft beer enthusiast and this bar has the largest selection of craft drafts around. Well, I loved it! The bar itself is pretty large, there's huge long tables surrounding the bar area, a long bar with plenty of seating, and tons of dining tables, indoors or outside on the patio.We had a few beers at the bar, then moved to the outside patio for food.  The bartender was awesome. I wasn't sure which beer to try, I narrowed it down to 2, and instead of choosing one or the other, she informed me that I could buy half pours of each!  Brilliant!  I LOVE bars that offer half pours. Sometimes you need more than just a sample, but you don't want to buy the full glass. I love that!  I had a few local IL beers, and some others from breweries that I love. The food was also great. The little pretzel bites were simple but delicious.. such fluffy soft pretzels with a yummy cheese dip. I ordered the fish tacos, which were pretty good but too spicy for me, and my friend got a salad which was a good size and looked good also. Great bar, great service, great atmosphere, and amazing beer selections. I'll come back next time I'm in Chicago!

39.description: Nothing special and poor service. Went with a group for drinks and apps and the waiter came to our table only once. Had to go the the bar to get my drink. Plenty of other places up and down the street to go for beer and decent food. Good beer selection and a cool looking place, but I don't think I'll go back.

37.description: This place had nice decor and looked modern, but lacked personality and probably had the worst server in my life! I think her name was kelly, but she never introduced herself and was instantly rude because two out of the six people in our group weren't drinking....she was obviously pissed about that. They did order a lot of food and the rest of us drank enough to make up for it with shots and drinks. She never came to us and when she did she was rushing away with an attitude. I'm pretty sure she was drinking on the job because she seemed more and more tipsy whenever we can get her attention. I would never return here for any occasion EVER! Manager was also just as rude and horrible. The nicest people were the hosts and bouncers who were super friendly.

0.description: Love this place. It is super fun, and very chill. Love the ambience and the crowd. I also like the interiors and the fact that I have never had trouble finding a TV screen to look at, from where I am sitting. It's a little far from where I live, otherwise I will be here way too much. They have a decent drinks menu too!

38.description: What's there to say about this place.  Great sports bar in old town with a good beer and food menu.  It doesn't get quite as douche as Benchmark does late night either.  Good open space but it does get packed for games.   They only do lunch on Fridays which is a bummer since I live down the street.  This last visit I went with the pulled pork sandwich.  Sandwich was piled high with pulled pork and love that it now comes with an onion ring on top.  Brilliant idea whoever came up with that!  The bbq sauce was good.  Had a bit too much pepper for my taste so I didn't use as much of it as I typically would.  I feel like I like the bbq sauce at Boundary better than Pour House even though they are owned by the same group.  Either way...the sandwich is good and I'd eat it again.

51.description: I have been here quite a few times, and each time is a great experience! The beer selection is very extensive, which is nice when I want to try something different. And if I don't know exactly what I want, the bartenders and servers are very knowledgeable about all of the different options, and are very good at steering me in the right direction. It's a busy place, but worth a bit of a wait if necessary! The space itself is also gorgeous. I did take off one star, though, because they no longer offer the crab dip, and the food menu as a whole has ben pared down quite a bit recently.

27.description: We heard it gets busy quick here, so we got there a little earlier on a Friday afternoon (around 4) and were seated promptly.  The outdoor tables were already taken, but they set us up inside and opened the large sliding window for an open air feel.  While we sat next to the window, the A/C was strong enough that it was actually a bit chilly.  Tables filled up quickly during our visit.  Several large TVs with with multiple channels on, great for game day.Like many before me have said, very large beer selection with a decent assortment of spirits/liquors as well.  I tried a few different craft beers and that's definitely the main draw of this place.  She got a few cocktails, one of which was a Moscow Mule (her fav), but was lacking in strength.  Decent prices for drinks.We also ordered food as well.  The shareable Truffle Mac and Cheese was great.  Definitely seemed house made and not just some sauce out of a can or jar mixed with macaroni.  It was a fairly large portion size, probably meant for 4-6 people as we had about half of it left over for just the two of us.  Our entrees were average, a salad and a burger.  Nothing special about either, but nothing bad either if a bit expensive for what it was.Total bill for 4 drinks, 1 app, and 2 entrees ran us about $100.  Service was great, she was quick and attentive with no issues.Overall, it's a good place to go to watch a game and try a few different craft beers, but I'd eat elsewhere due to the price of food.

32.description: I want to preface this review by saying that I'm the kind of person that usually calls restaurants/service providers if I receive outstanding service, because I think it's unfortunate that most people only take the time review a restaurant/salon/etc if something goes awfully wrong. It speaks volumes that I'm writing a one star review. It's not my style.As every girl's night out begins, we ordered a round of drinks. I went up to get a drink for my friend and myself, and I ordered the same no frills drink, a rum-soda-water. I saw the bartender pour dark rum into the drink, which I have a particular aversion to. Without a word (understandable, it's a loud bar), he put them in front of me and went back to serve others. Since it was so crowded, I got the other bartender's attention and told him I wanted clear, not dark, and he insisted the drink was brown because it was reflecting the brass of the bar. I quickly assured him that I saw bartender 1 pour dark rum, and that the watered-down-coke-looking drink wasn't due to the color of the bar (I'll give him props for creativity). He said he couldn't do anything, because he didn't pour it. Fine.I got ahold of bartender 1, and told him the scenario. He said that I should have specified. I apologized, and told him that the first time (and everywhere else I had ordered that drink in my life), clear rum was used. I felt bad for being a princess and was about to leave, but just thought I might as well ask if he could remake it. He looked at me and walked away. Being an optimist, I assumed he was walking away to enthusiastically re-make my drinks (Clearly, wasn't following my sage advice about expectations = reality, oops).Ten minutes went by. I'm pretty sure my other girlfriends thought that I had been swallowed whole by the jungle that is the bar and was never returning. I hopped off the barstool, drink-less, and looked at my other best friend to leave. She assured me that I should get what I want, and called the bartender over to ask him he would remake our drinks. He once again stated that I should have specified (okay, dad), and I started repeating my apology and rationalization. Halfway through, he grabs the drinks he originally poured from in front of me, rashly chucks them in the garbage, pours new drinks, and shoves them in my face without a straw or anything, glares at me, and moves away. I was shocked. If i wanted to be treated poorly at a bar, I would have invited my high school frenemies to join my GNO.Needless to say, I didn't drink my drink and went home. I was so upset in how I had been treated over a simple request. I never raised my voice or was argumentative. It's really unfortunate that one encounter has tainted my whole review of the bar, but it was so upsetting. I hope now he knows that clear rum goes with clear soda and to maybe use a little more tact when working in a customer-facing job.

54.description: I've been to this place twice and both times were memorable moments for me. My parents in from California had an awesome time here my first time in 2012. They were taken aback by the huge space and beers on tap. They loved it.Just this past November was my last time in Pour House. Pour House did a phenomenal job with reservations and making sure that my boyfriend and I were well taken care of -as it was his 30th birthday. We sat on the second floor where it was a little more private but still had the flatscreen TVs to watch games. My boyfriend is huge on football and loved all of the screens. He seems tough to satisfy with food and the Pour House worked just perfectly for his taste. I was bummed that they didn't do anything for birthdays but their overall customer service was so good I couldn't complain! The server and busser did an awesome job on checking in frequently and maintaining the cleanliness of their tables. As a server myself, that is a huge plus! No one likes to sit on tables with empty dishes in front of them. On the way out the security guards pitched in a Happy Birthday for my boyfriend which they didn't even have to do. It was sweet!

48.description: My review will be somewhat limited since I only had drinks at the place- but I liked the atmosphere. Place is huge as well. Menu looked interesting. If you're a solo dining, this might be a good bet since the bar area was huge.

44.description: Love this place! Went for a football watch party and had a great time. Food was good and the drinks have a healthy pour. Service was great even though it was packed for the game. Will definitely go back.

24.description: A sports-restaurant, if you will.Plenty of TV's, beer options, wine, and a menu resembling that of most sports bars. I love Belgian beers (strong... medium to dark), and we were suggested two stout's that were 'classics.' They were both terrible. I  love Delirium (Tremons is good, but my least favorite of the Deliriums), and they had nothing like it. Crispy calamri (w/ Marinara and tartar sauce on the side): 4Duck-topped nachos (w/ peppers, various cheeses, softened tortilla chips): 3.5DJ was there on a Sunday. Crowd was clean-cut, and fun. Energy was present. Service was good. Wouldn't mind returning to the beautiful loft-life/Abercrombie-style feel, but nothing to plan for.

7.description: Stopped in here and we were the first people there.  This place is massive.  Thats the first thing I thought. You could have your entire bro fraternity in here and might lose a couple of "Chads or Treys" in this place. The main floor itself dwarfs many other places and this place has 2 floors.There are also a ton of massive TVs which I assume play every sport you would want to watch.  The food is pretty good. Highly recommend the white bean hummus, it was the biggest hit.  They only have beer on tap, no bottle or can service.  Cant say I know another place like that.  Pretty cool.  Nice little spot.

49.description: The place was crowdy but really nice to have a beer. I like the atmosphere with the big screens and the bar is so cool.

40.description: Cocktails are terrible!! We took Margaritas and a Mai Tai and it was so disgusting we almost threw up everywhere.  Mai Tai? I'd rather it be Your Tai.  Actually, i wouldn't wish that on even my worst enemies.  For the "Margarita", imagine a drink 95% sour mix and 5% of... 5% of... I have no idea.  5% broken dreams and dirty dish water.  Everything was nasty and overpriced.  Save yourself a visit and pay someone to smack you in the face instead- it would be a much better use of $10.

53.description: Nice place to go for a beer and cheese curds. Cocktails aren't that great. The Pink Stiletto was blah...tasted flat. But still got charged for it.

30.description: Went for dinner with a friend around 6:30, and the place was practically empty but service was still pretty slow. The food was just okay, but my friend liked his cider. There are tons of tv screens all over, which is a little distracting if you want to have a conversation but is great for watching any kind of sports. Go for the drinks and get dinner elsewhere beforehand.

46.description: This is a great spot to watch a game with a large group, as there are plenty of screens all around. As well, the craft beer selection is excellent--really like doing a sampler. The food is also really solid--upscale bar food. I enjoy the mac & cheese and fried pickles the most. Their brunch is also pretty good. I would make a reservation in advance if you're coming with a larger group, though that's limited to certain nights of the week. It can get really busy for big games and during football season. Definitely worth going to if you're out and about in Old Town.

1.description: I've been a fan of this place since I first visited Chicago a couple years back. On the several occasions I've been here I typically have come by for dinner and a beer as this place reminds me of an upscale gastropub. Food has always been good and beer selection is even better. Lots and lots of taps that always get rotated through so the beer is always fresh. Also there's a ton of TVs if you want to catch a game and I'm sure you won't miss a play. Go hawks!The only con for me is the crowd here on Friday and Saturday nights. Not my crowd, I'll leave it at that. Food can actually get kind of pricey here and could push your bill past the $30 / per person mark ($$$). But other than that I don't have any real complaints.Anyways, come for the beer and a bite. Maybe catch a game while you're here. 'Til next time cheers!

55.description: Great atmosphere.Service was awesome and very attentiveMenu was very good and solid.Beer selection was very strong and varied so good variety.Great place to meet friendsTONS of TVs, so you can watch whatever you want.

9.description: Went on a Friday night and it was clearly the place to be. I was torn about how to review the Old Town Pour House. The place is super cool. Tons of huge TVs everywhere you look, beautiful dark woods. It has an upscale steak house look but approachable, young, and trendy.Go for the TV and beer. They have a HUGE selection on draft. Don't go for the food. We ordered the fried pickles - battered instead of breaded. They were a doughy mess. More batter than pickle and soggy on the bottom. Yuck. Then I had the pulled pork sandwich which was somehow too dry and the house made BBQ sauce was too rich. And the boring whole wheat bun was dry. My friend had a burger she described as "eh". I'd be back for the TV and beer. But I'll probably eat somewhere else beforehand.

26.description: Most of the time I come here, it's so loud you can't hear yourself think. The last time I was there it wasn't too bad, but also a little early for a Saturday night. Our waitress was a doll and they have tons of screens for sports which is great. Top 40s is playing which can be polarizing, but I don't mind it. Overall it's a good place to start the night, but I want dancing and a more fun dance/night club.

25.description: Went here for a friends birthday party. Had a great time - one thing I noticed  was security kept asking our party (of about 30) to keep moving and wasn't being consistent of asking others to move. Bartenders were phenomenal, great drinks, very friendly, would definitely come here again.

12.description: I came here for the first time before seeing a show at Second City. While the food was overall good, I would recommend coming here more for how cool the restaurant looks with the beautiful wood work. When I walked in I was immediately wowed by how grand it is. It seems like it used to be a fancy hotel or bank. This would be a good spot for watching a sports game because there are numerous large tv's, the bar is big, and the sound was turned up when the Blackhawks game came on. Our food was good - we ordered the risotto and the pork sandwich. They also have an impressive craft beer list and tons of beers on tap. Overall good spot!

59.description: Great craft beer selection, good food, awesome atmosphere!Lacking in the staff department as we didn't really get great service sitting at the bar, and none of the other staff were really that warm or friendly. Food was flavorful and a few unique takes- can't beat the atmosphere and location.

21.description: I thought this place was great.  It's exactly what I envision when I think of the perfect sports bar.  Great atmosphere, huge TVs, beer list for a mile, and great food.  Only complaint (if any) is that the food was very expensive, but maybe not for Chicago.  but $15 for wings? It did come with an amazing side salad though.

17.description: Great atmosphere.Service was awesome and very attentiveMenu was very good and solid.Beer selection was very strong and varied so good variety.Great place to meet friendsTONS of TVs, so you can watch whatever you want.

10.description: Tons of TVs, shit load of Beers on tap and so so cocktails and food. 4 stars for the amount of TVs. Bartendresses can be slightly twaty at times and act like there crotch don't stink, but hey, it's Old Town.

5.description: Been here a few times for drinks. Super spacious spot for old town and the service is pretty good considering the large crowds on weekend evenings. In terms of food, I would highly recommend the duck confite nachos, double layer chips with topping on both layers topped with duck, jalapeños, avocado and some amazing sauce. I'll definitely be back.

3.description: When Pour House was newer a few years ago, I really loved coming here.  Recently my friend and I stopped in on our way to a Second City show to grab a quick bite and our experience was underwhelming.The food and drink menu hasn't been updated in who knows how long and the variety of dishes offered is just odd...no real rhyme or reason to everything.  I guess there's something for everyone, but it ranges from higher end steak dishes to wraps to soups to salads.  I prefer that places focus on a few key types of foods (a variety of burgers, or pizzas, or shareable items for example) because then you know they really zone in on a great product.In our most recent experience at Pour House the food was but nothing to write home about.  We had the wraps and some soups, as well as the cheese curds.  Good, but not something every other bar on Wells can't offer.  Honestly, after we'd left we had restaurant regret as we walked by some of the new spots recently opened nearby.I do love the sorts bar vibe of Pour House and I would likely come back for games and to have a good beer but that'd be about it.  There are just a lot of other really cool places to go in Old Town and for me Pour House is low on the totem pole as far as places I'll return.

35.description: This place has a really great vibe and the inside is nice. It's decked out with plenty of TVs so it's a great spot to stop in and catch a game and there is a good selection of beer. My group only split appetizers, but they were AMAZING. Pickle chips, pretzel nuggets, and duck confit nachos. I can only assume all the other food would be great as well, but at least be sure to grab a little something to eat if you stop by.

19.description: I thought this place was great.  It's exactly what I envision when I think of the perfect sports bar.  Great atmosphere, huge TVs, beer list for a mile, and great food.  Only complaint (if any) is that the food was very expensive, but maybe not for Chicago.  but $15 for wings? It did come with an amazing side salad though.

28.description: I live just down the street and don't come here very often which I think says a little something.  From a food standpoint it's just ok.  The serving sizes are pretty small given the price and nothing has ever blown me away.  As a bar - they need to figure out the table arrangement at night.  Those long tables take up so much room and it makes everything get very crowded.  The guys who "work" the stairs are always on a power trip, but even when you can get upstairs its insanely hot because for some reason they refuse to use AC up there.  Also, the line to get in moves crazy slow.This is a huge place with great TV set up and beer selection, and in a prime location - however beyond that there isn't anything worth writing home about.

45.description: Awesome place to go when your out clubbing on a week end night - packed, lots of fun, cool and beautiful people, loud music videos on large TV screens, drop dead gorgeous girls.Can't comment on the food because didn't have any.But what I can comment on is the atmosphere - spectacular, and the service - the absolute worse in the world. Getting a drink on a Saturday night? You will have better luck wining the lottery. There are two girl bartenders that call the shots - I mean they decide who gets served, and when they get served. These two bartender girls treat the customers like shit, and they really do believe that they are doing you a favor by getting you a drink. So I'm waiting at the bar for my drink, and waiting, so I tell her "hey! how do I get a drink here?" She responds, "you wait until I look at you." Who does this impolite, disrespectful bitch think she is talking to me that way?And the security guys? Really strange, I mean you can't stand here, or you can sit up high on the chair, or you can't leave your coat on the bar stool, or you can't do this, or you can't do that. Reminded me of security guys at a strip joint.So, if you can get yourself that drink, stay away from the security guys, great and fun place.

33.description: Good for drinks if beer is your drink, large beer selection. Food menu was surprisingly good as well. Its a large location, lots of space for groups but can get very busy. When it gets busy it also gets rather loud so talking can be challenging. But its good if you want to catch the game with your friends.

43.description: I went here on a Saturday night. I'd recommend arriving before 11 to avoid the line. Prices are average. It gets super busy and loud. A woman a few tables over threw up, but the staff was able to clean it up quickly. If you're looking for a busy bar with music and a lot of people, I'd recommend this.

2.description: #29Old Town Pour House is a super fun bar and restaurant with lots of excitement.  I am so glad we added this to our Chicago bar hopping list.  OTPH offers a beautifully warm atmosphere and amazing food with really reasonable prices--especially for the location. My GF Lauren decided to make this place her choice for drinks before heading to Second City, yes we did everything touristy and fun on this trip. Located in the Old Town neighborhood of Chicago, OTPH is nestled neatly into a wonderful area to end up drunk--no matter your age or status--good job Lauren!OTPH is huge inside; so do not judge a book by its cover.  From the street, the place looked like another tiny little Chicago pub, but inside it was beautifully decorated, inviting and last but not least--FUN.  There is an upstairs area and the lower level, all filled with happy Chicagoans eating and drinking.  The walls are lined with big TV's to watch the Black Hawks, the Bulls, the Cubs--whatever. Replete with high ceilings, dark wood and cool people, this bar was beautiful. It looked so clean and well decorated.  There was a restaurant inside as well, but that was not why we came.  With ample room between tables and large walkways in a dimly lit large space, OTPH was really awesome.There was also a fabulous cocktail selection, but OTPH is better known for the beer.  The Pour House offers almost 100 beers on tap, which can be time consuming as one decides what to order.  None to worry, the bartender was so patient with us.  He had amazing suggestions, samples and tons of knowledge. It was about $7-8 for a beer, which seemed fine for Nick, and I stuck with my usual martini--dirty ;) There was also a wide selection of food to choose from, and if we had not already pigged out before we came I most definitely would have indulged. For brunch, the pancakes and hash look wonderful and if I happen in for dinner I would try the Salmon--which would have been my first choice that night, so this just means I need to return on my next trip to the Windy City.Stephani Smiles for OTPH ;)#somanybeerssolittletime

18.description: A group of my friends came here for dinner at around 7 on a Saturday night. We got a table upstairs, no problem and then stayed to drink until 11ish, which was great because we already had that table before the rush came in. Our waitress was less than friendly but our food was great.

41.description: Beautiful bar! Love the wings. Hubby loved the beer selection! Would definitely be back!

52.description: Went on a Friday night and it was clearly the place to be. I was torn about how to review the Old Town Pour House. The place is super cool. Tons of huge TVs everywhere you look, beautiful dark woods. It has an upscale steak house look but approachable, young, and trendy.Go for the TV and beer. They have a HUGE selection on draft. Don't go for the food. We ordered the fried pickles - battered instead of breaded. They were a doughy mess. More batter than pickle and soggy on the bottom. Yuck. Then I had the pulled pork sandwich which was somehow too dry and the house made BBQ sauce was too rich. And the boring whole wheat bun was dry. My friend had a burger she described as "eh". I'd be back for the TV and beer. But I'll probably eat somewhere else beforehand.

50.description: Go for the tv's, great service, beer selection and atmosphere. Do not go for the burgers... Stale bun, raw frozen patty.  I really think a McDonalds cheeseburger would win this fight.

4.description: Really loved our dinner here. Flew in to O'Hare, took the train to our condo, then hoofed it over here for our first Chicago meal. Sat up front by the windows and ordered a beer and a flight to begin. Asked the server a couple of key questions around their beers on tap (stouts and porters are my thing) and he was so gracious and helpful. We really wanted to try things we can't get in California and there's a boatload of that here. Wasn't expecting much with the food, but I ordered the trout with farro and it was truly delicious. Hubby had the meatloaf and loved it. In fact, he loved it so much he went back a couple of days later with his brother and wife, while I convalesced after too much beer at the beer festival we were in town for. But that's a whole other story...

6.description: What's there to say about this place.  Great sports bar in old town with a good beer and food menu.  It doesn't get quite as douche as Benchmark does late night either.  Good open space but it does get packed for games.   They only do lunch on Fridays which is a bummer since I live down the street.  This last visit I went with the pulled pork sandwich.  Sandwich was piled high with pulled pork and love that it now comes with an onion ring on top.  Brilliant idea whoever came up with that!  The bbq sauce was good.  Had a bit too much pepper for my taste so I didn't use as much of it as I typically would.  I feel like I like the bbq sauce at Boundary better than Pour House even though they are owned by the same group.  Either way...the sandwich is good and I'd eat it again.

22.description: We came to pour house as a stop on our Old Town brunch beverage hunt. Lots of good options and plenty of TVs to watch college football on. Clean, friendly and price efficient. I approve!

15.description: Drinks are definitely priced on the higher end, but besides that this is a great place to spend a Saturday night. At least it was for me and my friends from Milwaukee! It's a pretty big place and moving around and navigating through this place wasn't too hard. They have multiple TV screens which definitely helped watching and catching up on all the NCAA football games. Our bartender was very efficient especially with it being a busy night, and they do make sure they have enough bartenders to make sure everyone is attended to without too long of a waiting. Oh yes... I'm definitely a fan of this place.

57.description: Cool space. Went one time right after work and it was nice to be there without many people. Tons of tvs and good list of drinks. But....Went again last night and it was pretty crowded. They asked to check my bag, which was a first for me at a bar. First thing person sees is a folder of graded papers and books I'm teaching, dude keeps digging. They asked me to open my water bottle. They smelled it (it was water), then asked me to step outside and pour it out. Again, first for a bar. My wife and I walked in trying to find a small table for a small group. We went upstairs and we got to the top of the stairs, started to look around, and not even several seconds after we got to the top, a security guard told us we can't stand there. My wife looked at me and we nodded, saying "let's leave." Never have seen so many security guards at a bar, nonetheless one on Well Street. Not my kind of crowd. Probably won't ever go back.

20.description: Cool atmosphere, good food, great beer selection. The only drawback was that when we arrived at 6pm on a Saturday, they were out of almost all of their specialty "imported beer growlers" due to a recent half-price happy hour promotion. I will definitely be back!

36.description: There are few times that I leave a restaurant fuming but the service was enough to do the job. From the bouncer to the manager to the bartenders-- I felt as if they were looking at me like a peasant who had accidentally read the  sign as "The Poor House"That's not all-- they failed to listen to what we were ordering. When the food arrived, it was missing components listed on the menu.  It ruined my appetite.  I will never come back.  The barbecue chicken tasted ok though, so that's why I gave it an extra star.

14.description: I went here on a Saturday night. I'd recommend arriving before 11 to avoid the line. Prices are average. It gets super busy and loud. A woman a few tables over threw up, but the staff was able to clean it up quickly. If you're looking for a busy bar with music and a lot of people, I'd recommend this.

1.description: I've been a customer for years and after today, i will never return. The person who  claimed he was the "owner"  was extremely rude when i told him i couldn't pick up my planters immediately, even though i told them when i would pick them up when i purchased $100 of flowers for 3 planters.  He said he was not his responsibility to "keep them alive".  When they realized they misunderstood, there was still no apology - just complete disrespect.  Also, while I was there, there was another couple explaining that their very expensive flowers were dying and were basically told "It was not their problem".   This was the worst experience I have ever had at a local business.
