9.description: When I was younger, I used to go nurseries like this with my mom and found them to be quite boring. I'm definitely not a gardener.  I only know you a need reasonable amount of soil and water to keep a plant alive...right? Well, I am determined this summer to grow some basics. After the heavy rain finally settled down (knock on wood), I finally made my way over here to check out what they had to offer - plants and hopefully some suggestions/advice. I wondered aimlessly for a bit and inspected things that caught my eye. I picked at those little description things tucked into each little potted plant, trying to figure out which would fit best according to my sun and [lots of] water exposure. I asked for advice what I should start with and was given a few good suggestions. Some of the smaller flowers were about $1.49/tray, while the bigger plants were up to $20+ something. After some thought, I went with a potted freesia, a little pot of mini roses, and a small bag of organic soil, which seemed like a good start for now. They do have a delivery service for $25 I'm considering, but I have to see how well I do with keeping these plants alive. I would love to get next a couple of those jasmine plants but are just too big to carry on my own.

23.description: I have had several bad experiences at this place.  The selection is pretty good and some of the staff people are very helpful but the owners (could be the managers but I assume they are owners) are surly, not very nice at all.  I had the owner/manager come up to me and tell me I was taking up too much of the salesperson's time, even though We had already picked out about $150 of plants that I was buying and still shopping for more.  That made me change my mind about buying anything so I didn't, and felt I had wasted a lot of time and been insulted. My neighbors had them landscape their patio with flowers, trees, and shrubs.  All the trees and shrubs died over the winter.   I will not be returning to Old Town Gardens

5.description: My wife and I just had an outrageous experience here. She bought plants on Saturday as a complete novice to gardening. She then got a call from the manager or owner today saying that they had sold us too many. We hadn't planted them all yet, so she volunteered to take some back. When she got to the nursery the owner insinuated that she had knowingly taken too many plants and lacked common sense. He then demanded that she give him more money. It was quite unbelievable. Speaking to him later, he refused to apologize and hung the phone up on us twice. We will never go here again and will tell everyone we know to do the same.Rude!

25.description: This is by far the best place I have ever purchased plants. The staff and owners are incredibly knowledgeable of the products they sell and top-notch recommendations. Each year I try and do a little something different in my little back-yard - I have been going here for about three summers now and ever since the first year the owner Gina has remembered my name and that I have a dog - so dog friendly plants only! Stop by during the Christmas season and find your tree, wreathes, fresh holly, garland etc. here. The trees smell perfect - exactly how a Christmas tree should smell. In fact, it might be weird, but I have had guests compliment the smell of the tree!They may be a tad pricey - but for something that you will enjoy all summer or during your holiday season, quality over quantity.

12.description: Decent selection, and a nice staff.  Felt strange that they throw out their own prices on certain items, but what can you do.

21.description: I am an avid gardener and my garden is on display in the Sheffield Garden walk. All of my plants and pottery are from Old Town Gardens both in Old Town and their Spring stand at Menard's on Clybourn. They deliver healthy BEAUTIFUL plants and flowers and always seem to have interesting rare species. Some things in my garden from them are 18 years old and still growing! Geenah is a sweet heart and her husband Michael is a a really funny guy. I like to buy from local family businesses like this.They also pick out and deliver my Fraser Fir Christmas tree every year. FRESH No dropped needles (even when I forget to water)I Highly recommend this business.

16.description: Old Town Garden is really nice.  The people here are so knowledgeable and willing to answer any questions you might have.I live a couple of blocks from here and I don't have a car.  About a month ago, I walked over and purchased alot of stuff I couldn't possibly carry myself.  They loaned me their dolly to drag all my stuff down the street.  The guy was super cool and said, " just bring it back when your done."  They are awesome there.  However, it can get expensive there.  I rarely leave there without spending over 50 bucks.But they are really cool with providing organic plant feed and soil which i found most beneficial.I do wish that they had more things like bird feeders and wind chimes.  I really like wind chimes!

17.description: I am an avid gardener and my garden is on display in the Sheffield Garden walk. All of my plants and pottery are from Old Town Gardens both in Old Town and their Spring stand at Menard's on Clybourn. They deliver healthy BEAUTIFUL plants and flowers and always seem to have interesting rare species. Some things in my garden from them are 18 years old and still growing! Geenah is a sweet heart and her husband Michael is a a really funny guy. I like to buy from local family businesses like this.They also pick out and deliver my Fraser Fir Christmas tree every year. FRESH No dropped needles (even when I forget to water)I Highly recommend this business.

10.description: I only bought a cheap plastic tray, but the customer service was some of the best that I've encountered in Chicago.

11.description: This review is limited to its Christmas trees and to one experience because I actually had a good experience there last year.  But this year I spent over $200 for an overgrown Charlie Brown Christmas tree.  This resulted from the failure of the delivery guys to cut the bottom of the tree when they delivered it and before they placed it in the Christmas tree stand.  Therefore, the tree wouldn't drink water.  My tree looks so bad that I probably won't even have a Christmas tree on Christmas and if I do it'll be barren because I'm going to have to take my ornaments off so they don't fall and break.  Because I waited to call and complain, I was told the only thing he could do was allow me to buy a new tree and pay for it to be delivered (again).  Huh?  How is that offering me anything???  And never mind that the delivery guys' failure to cut the bottom is the ONLY cause of the situation so it really doesn't matter when I called.If you choose to buy your tree from here, just make sure that the delivery guys do their jobs.

26.description: The first three or four times i walked through old town i couldnt help but peek in this place, you can smell all the flowers from the side walk, once i finally went in i couldnt leave without spending $20, and if i had a car and didnt have to carry it i wouldve got more.  every plant looks so lively and perfect, the staff must be very good at taking care of them, unfortunately for the plants i am not

22.description: It's so weird, buying flowers makes me feel like my mom.But this was a really cute little place. The flowers seemed alive and not remotely droopy or sad-looking or dead, and the guys working here were super helpful and funny.

0.description: What a little gem! I love you Old Town Gardens.So let me preface this review by saying, I am not a gardener. Unfortunately, I have killed every single plant I've tried to grow and cultivate in the past five years. It's like one of things that I get really excited about and then lose interest two days later and the poor plant suffers.The thing that really sold me was when the nice gentlemen at the cash register told me that I overfed my plant when "he starts to leak water out of the pot". Okay, I absolutely love the fact that he referred to the plant as a "he". That is a true friend to the flower.There was also a nice girl there who gave us lots of flower advice (i.e., what flowers were good in the sun, which ones were hard to kill, which flowers looked pretty together, which smelled the best, etc).They tried to sell us soil but I immediately begged for them to pack it for us themselves and I pretty much knew I'd somehow kill it when I tried to plant them in a pot. They happily obliged.A bit pricey for flowers but everyone there made it worthwhile!Also, as a side note, I brought two little 5 year olds here last week and everyone who worked there was super sweet and patient with the little guys! Always a plus for me!

20.description: My first stop for summer gardening needs (though I've added Adams & Son to the list). Reasonably priced flowers, and I think they even have a larger display of plants in Menard's parking lot than they do on Wells. Packaged in little boxes for easy El/bus carrying.

19.description: This place is fantastic! The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful--even better than that, they know their stuff and were honest about it.  My mom is an avid gardener and came to visit from Virginia determined to get me set up with the right kind of window boxes--she was extremely impressed with what we walked away with and with the prices.  I'm embarrassed to admit I let her do most of the planting, but she kept talking about how healthy the plants were and how lucky I was to get them.  It might be helpful to know that we'd been to one of the big box stores for plants two years ago and the plants all had bugs or disease that stifled their lives. Last year we went to a fancier garden place closer to our home at Clark and Ashland last year.  Those plants were CRAZY expensive and honestly I found it a bit overwhelming and the staff a bit pretentious.  My plants looked okay, but I got way more bang for my buck and I got way better guidance at Old Town Gardens.  Lastly, thanks to Old Town Gardens, I have a cute red watering can that's both functional and charming!  I'll definitely be telling my friends (hence my first Yelp! review ever) and I'll be going back there next year.

2.description: Can I give zero stars?  This was THE WORST nursery and experience EVER!  Rude owner!  Horrible selection!  Bad service!  The owner cared more about his ego than helping his customers. Being that it was the end of season we understood that there was not much to choose from. He had no desire to help us and just kept reciting "You're late! You're late!"  Then why even be selling your flowers?  Then he tried to charge us a ridiculous price for flowers that he even admitted were not great. When we asked if he could help us out with price he completely snapped at us, started yelling, took our flowers away, and kicked us out.  We were completely respectful the entire time and he was horrible to us. He also yelled at us as my baby lay there sleeping in his stroller. Beyond disrespectful man with no heart. He is a truly horrible soul who does not deserve your business. We just went to another nursery. They were helpful, friendly, had a great selection, and honest prices. Much happier!

18.description: While it is fun to walk through this place when the flowers are blooming and the weather is beautiful, I will never shop there ever again.  The owner is one of the rudest, meanest, misogynistic jerks I have ever met.  My first experience with him was when I interviewed for a job.  I am a perennial plant expert with several years experience in the business.  The center is near my home and my kids are older now and I don't need to be home as much for them as in the past.  I love gardening.  During the interview, the owner told me I was stupid because I identified a cedar as a juniper.  Both are conifers - not my area of expertise.  I walked out.  His wife is really nice, though so I continued to shop there occasionally. For example,  I bought a flat of English ivy this summer that was so tangled, overgrown, and old that I could not separate the pots.  These plugs had been growing into each other for months.  The jerky owner wouldn't take it back even though I only got about 5 usable plants out of the flat of 30+ plugs for almost $40.  The perennials - about which I am an expert - always look sad, neglected and leggy.  Watering is obviously not a priority.This Christmas the owner was  pushy, annoying and in-my-face about buying one of their custom made wreaths, fresh trees and garland made on site.  When I told him i was not interested, he persisted.  i asked him to leave me alone twice and I had to walk out in order to get away from him.  he is creepy and rude.  He believes women are second class citizens and he treats us accordingly.  I will never go back.  I would not recommend this place to anyone with self-dignity.  There is a great garden center in Andersonville that everyone should go to!

13.description: I've worked with Chris several times on both a personal and professional level and have always found him to be attentive, knowledgable and generous.  Old Town Gardens has made several donations of plants and flowers to the children's charity at which I work.  They have brightened out office for not only the staff, but the ill children and their families who come to us in need.  OTG has helped us share sunshine and beauty to troubled families and ill children.I've likewise worked with Chris directly for personal decor issues and his knowledge is impressive.

4.description: Worst experience ever. One of the lady that works there asked us to leave if we are not buying any. She was very rude and showed us the exit to leave.I would never go there again. Worst customer service ever.

24.description: Old Town Garden is really nice.  The people here are so knowledgeable and willing to answer any questions you might have.I live a couple of blocks from here and I don't have a car.  About a month ago, I walked over and purchased alot of stuff I couldn't possibly carry myself.  They loaned me their dolly to drag all my stuff down the street.  The guy was super cool and said, " just bring it back when your done."  They are awesome there.  However, it can get expensive there.  I rarely leave there without spending over 50 bucks.But they are really cool with providing organic plant feed and soil which i found most beneficial.I do wish that they had more things like bird feeders and wind chimes.  I really like wind chimes!

6.description: This place is a total scam and a rip-off! I found this place on yelp, I picked it based on the 4 stars (fake status ) it had. I bought few plants for around 600$, the plants died after 3 months bc the owner sold us sick plants. I tried calling and emailing him many times and he would never call or email back. When I finally got a hold of him, and told him about the plants, he tried blaming it on me, and did not offer a solution or any kind of expected exchange of the plants. He's an absolute scam, I would stay away from this "old town garden". Don't get fooled by the good reviews, I found out from his old employee that mostly of them are written by employees and family members!!

15.description: It's so weird, buying flowers makes me feel like my mom.But this was a really cute little place. The flowers seemed alive and not remotely droopy or sad-looking or dead, and the guys working here were super helpful and funny.

7.description: I placed an order to have winter creeper planted in my garden and got an appointment 2-3 weeks out.  The workers never showed up, and when the owner finally called me back a few hours later, he said he is turning the work down because there is too much shades from what he saw when he passed by, and giving me another choice would be significantly more expensive and he didn't think I would be up for it therefore he didn't want to waste time talking to me about it.  What's surprising is that he never asked if the garden is shaded when I initially told him the ground cover would be planted in a garden with 4 trees; he never called when he decided that his workers shouldn't come to the appointment he set; and he shouldn't even talk to me about alternatives.  When I come to Yelp and saw all the other reviews, I felt I'm probably better off not having dealt with him after all.

8.description: Unfortunately, the worst service I have ever experienced.  Unreliable, rude and disrespectful to customers.  There are so many flower services in Chicago with great selection and service, but above all I prefer to support good people.  This is not the case with this company - nobody should have to deal with these people.  Specially when you are the one paying!

3.description: Love this garden shop!  They have beautiful pots and plants.  The staff has always been very friendly.  Great location!  Stop by and support a local business!

14.description: I pass by this shop on my way to Nookies. If you are new to plants like I am, it is a little intimidating. I was admiring their bonsai trees and finally decided to stroll in. The man working asked me a lot of questions about my place and which window the plant would be in, what kind of heating I have, how much maintenance can I afford to give the plant, etc. With that information he helped me choose the right one. It was in a pale green porcelain pot with beautiful stones and moss inside growing up the intertwined trunk of the tree. He taught me how to take care of him with monthly and weekly maintenance. I followed the advice and the bonsai is still thriving 4 months later. Thank-you Old Town Gardens.

58.description: umm.. YUM. I love this place! I ordered delivery and for me and the fiance, it was only $17! AND it came within 30 minutes. DEAL! I'm going to throw it out there...this might be my favorite Thai place in the city. It was delicious, not greasy or too heavy, and I loved the "hot meter" on their website. It allows you to pick between five (or six?) levels of spiciness. Being the huge spice baby I am, (even mild salsa is sometimes too hot for me) I loved the fact that I could pick the absolute mildest type of spice. Big bonus points in my book.I ordered Basil Fried Rice with Tofu and the soon-to-be ordered Chicken Fried Rice. My rice dish was so delicious and full of fresh pineapple. The tofu was awesome as well. The entire dish felt healthy and I am super pumped to finish the rest of this tomorrow (the sizes are pretty big). This is definitely my new to-go Thai joint.

56.description: Thai Aroma may not look like much from the outside, but it is consistently excellent and reasonably priced.  I highly recommend the red curry with chicken and the Thai iced tea.

29.description: Just had Thai Aroma yesterday carry out.  The Thai Basil fried rice with vegetable was very tasty and their Aroma Noddle where good also. But as for their fried tofu although cooked but it lack seasoning.  So that is why they were just okay for me.

42.description: Lunch special is really cheap here - $6 for soup salad and main. Quality is just OK. Pad Thai was decent but others not so much. Don't think I would recommend this place other than for its lunch specials.

23.description: Just got Thai Aroma's lunch special with some spicy basil chicken and an egg roll. So good! Delicious, fragrant meat and veggies with bamboo shoots and string bean (BONUS!) so it's a little more than your standard chicken/ onions & peppers. Bamboo and ginger really add some brightness. Medium-hot spiciness was the perfect amount of attitude without yielding tears and sniffles, which get annoying at my mostly-phone-based job.Prices here are standard for the area. Can't find cheaper thai of this quality; have exhausted all options.I have ordered delivery pad thai from here before with kind of so-so results, but after ordering delivery pad thai from my favorite untouchable thai place, I've realized it just isn't a dish that travels well. The pineapple fried rice is also stellar, as well as the panang curry!

47.description: Have been here a few times for dinner, and they have a nice selection of Thai food. I tried the aroma pad thai, with the glass noodles and chicken and shrimp. It had a lot of veggies in it, and they didn't skimp on the meat. We started off with the tempura, and the peanut sauce to dip it in is delicious, just enough heat not to overpower the vegetables which are fried perfectly.On a different night I got the green curry noodle hot, and woof, I was sweating a bit, but the heat didn't take away from the flavor of the dish for me. The broccoli and the bamboo shoot were cooked enough, but still had the needed crunch to to the dish.My boyfriend had the pad thai with duck and it was perfectly smoky, and tender. There was a lot of meat added to the top of the dish. We really like the ambiance in there it's quiet and BYOB. It's a nice place for an easy going dinner, nothing fancy

8.description: Would've been 1 star had the food and the apologies not be so prevalent. Monday Night football but we didn't order til 9pm so we thought, sure, it'll be here within 20-30 min. Tried ordering online and couldn't because the place was outside their delivery area - THREE blocks away. So we justified a call to ask for delivery... (couldn't pick up as it's not even 20 degrees out and sure, we can afford the $3 delivery charge, right?)Cool. Phone guy super nice. Says he'll take our order over the phone. Takes order with minimal repeating order again. Says 45min-1 hour. You're THAT busy on the Monday before Thanksgiving? To deliver three blocks away.. Okay. Okay. So we are now on a wait til almost 10pm for our food. No joke we had to call in at 10pm as there was no sign of our frozen food or delivery guy. Phone guy (said he remembered who I was?) said I ordered AN egg roll for delivery (no... but we did order Panang Curry w/ Chicken medium spicy (YUMMMM), Pad Thai w/ chicken (rubbery.. presumably from waiting in its take out box for an hour) and some crab rangoon (also super YUM). Delivery shows up at 10:15 (ordered at 8:58). Again, nice delivery guy... Good attempt at customer service. I have so much more respect for people who try to make things right than those who wash their hands of things that are clearly in their control. The panang curry was excellent and after reheating our food (save the pad thai) it was a meal worth saving. Presenting now with food coma and bedtime soon.

31.description: The menu on the website stated the lunch special was $5.99. We were very unhappy when it was delivered that they charged us 3.00 delivery fee EACH and we were charged 6.99. I called the place after and the woman was rude and asked "do you really want just one dollar back." (Ummm yes? But I guess not since you are making me feel like I am cheap...) So what was supposed to be a light $6 dollar lunch turned into $11 bucks with all the hidden charges. It doesn't seem like a lot unless you are an intern/college student like me on limited funds. I felt deceived. On top of that, the food was very bland and the chicken was dry and tasteless. Thank God for soy sauce. But they only give you one packet so it doesn't go far. I could forgive this place if the food was good but it really wasn't. Best Advice : Go somewhere else, anywhere else!

34.description: great tofu. best panang curry in the city. all the classics are amazing here.

16.description: There are some good Thai restaurants in Chicago, a lot of mediocre ones, and places like Thai Aroma. Mind you, this was my first time ordering, but given the abundance of Thai restaurants in Chicago--seriously, it's absurd--I think it'll be my last.I ordered Tom Kha soup, potstickers, and soba noodles. I was sick at the time. The broth of the Tom Kha soup was okay, not great, but the ingredients were super cheap. A few bits of lemongrass and that adorable little asian variety of mushroom were included, but the majority of the soup was spinach, white mushrooms (the kind you find all over the grocery store), and quartered vine tomatoes. Those last three ingredients are generally not something you'd expect in tom kha soup and just made it taste like something from Papa John's.The potstickers were filled with chicken that tasted like it came out of a can and was old. The soba noodles also came with balls of the can chicken and--huzzah--more spinach. Spinach everywhere.Don't get me wrong, I like spinach, tomatoes, and white mushrooms, but those are not things that belong or taste well in the dishes I ate. I'm not sure if they don't know the proper recipes of the dishes they cook or if they don't care. I don't care to find out.

13.description: I highly recommend the Shrimp Won Ton Soup and Crab Rangoon both are great, huge portions and cooked perfectly. Lunch special is a great deal. Also Chicken Pad Woon Sen is very good I will definitely be reordering

11.description: You should give it a try. I order massaman chicken, Tom kha soup, and Tom yum chicken soup and its was very tasty. The staff is very friendly and always happy to help. Each dish is less than $10, all the dishes are available with or without spicy peppers.

39.description: I ordered delivery from the North Avenue location. I appreciate that you can place your order online. They have a good variety of dishes; all are very reasonably priced and the portions are so large you can easily share one dish between two people and will probably have leftovers.This was my 2nd time having their food. The first time it was very bland; this time it was more flavorful, but I was disappointed when my seafood rice arrived they used imitation crab meat which gave too much of a sweet flavor for my taste.They do have a $10 minimum for delivery + a $3 charge, so this option may not be the best for a single diner on a budget. The staff is friendly and the food arrives quickly.I believe its a family run chain also and I patronize small businesses when possible since I am a small business owner also. I wouldn't go out of my way (not a destination restaurant), but if I wanted to order in, they would be on my list of possibles.

37.description: If this place was more consistent, I could give them a higher rating. On the plus side, when they say "spicy", they mean "SPICY!" That's a very good thing to me, as so many other Thai places are just too bland. Sadly, their meat is of variable quality. I usually get one of the dishes with ground chicken, and I've found gristle and even bone in my food more often than not. Sometimes the meat is fine, other times I give up halfway through my meal after chewing on too many disgusting bits that should have been trimmed before the meat was ground. Perhaps vegetarian is the only way to go with Thai Aroma.

0.description: I've been reading some of the negative reviews posted here and I must say that they must be one off situations. I've been ordering the same 2 dishes from Thai Aroma for the last two years and have never had any issues. Always tastes great and always timely (I'm a carry out customer only). I highly recommend their Pad Sieu with Chicken and their Green Curry with Chicken dish.

38.description: Live next door, wonderful smells waft our ways. Standard Pad Thai, aroma pad Thai, lard na, Rama broccoli, crab Rangoon, all top notch. I could go on and on. Good price lunch specials. Don't get the chicken wings. Good hangover blaster.

51.description: Decent Thai food at a good price.  I mostly eat their lunch special because it's cheap and they give you a LOT of food.$6.66 gets you a meal, an appetizer, and soup if you eat in....no soup on to-go orders.  Most of the appetizers are kinda bland, but the crab rangoon is great.Cheap, quick, and gets the job done.

27.description: Standard Thai place. Large menu with a lot of options. I had Pad Sew Ew which was good. My date loved her Panang Curry. Dinning room is small, but nice. They appear to do a really good carryout business.

32.description: the food was verey tastless, the crazy noodles was so so so soft,when we informed the manager she asked us if we want to put in a order and pay for something else.  She flat out refuse to  accommodate us with a different dish, but in reality it is the worst food and service that I have had and I have been put in 3 different situation to visit them and all 3 times the food was gross, fried rice, cashew chicken and now the crazy noodles. might as well cook my own rice and veg and add some salt and pepper!!!!!!!

54.description: this place is fine.  but i'd stay away from the ribs appetizer.  it wasnt very good.  wife liked the pad thai

48.description: I love this place. I have been eating here for years and the food is consistently delicious. First of all I support every place that is BYOB. Second the lunch special is out of this world. For a good price you get soup, an appetizer and a entree. I love the fried rice, the pad Thai and the basil chicken. Overall a great place to grab a delicious inexpensive meal.

44.description: I ordered lunch here yesterday for delivery.They are a block and a half down ( I know I am lazy, but whatever).I ordered at 11 am and it took over an hour to get to me.The delivery driver was very friendly so that's a plus.I ordered the Pad Woon Sen and a Thai Iced Tea.Why this took over an hour beats me.The Thai Ice Tea was just that; you can't really F that up.As for the Pad Woon Sen, the Chicken was as if it was dehydrated. It was jerky like. The rest of the veggies were lacking any kind or moisture as well.It tasted very old, as if it was last nights batch just microwaved.I am saddened because I thought this would be my lunch time gem.I guess not.And warning, if you order anything medium hot, its very spicy.

24.description: I LOVE Thai Aroma, they always deliver early and the portions are good for the price... but I do have complaints-Tom Kha soup isn't as rich with coconut as other restaurants, there isn't any eggplant in the green curry (which is why I ordered it, thinking they were out of that ingredient. Nope. They just omit it.

7.description: Great food and quick.  Enjoy the staff as well.  The dining environment isn't great compared to the rest of old town but the food makes up for it.  I use their take out option more frequent anyways.

49.description: Panang Noodle hit the spot! Large portion, small prices. AND you can BYOB. What's not to love? Only negative, it was sooo hot inside the restaurant, and not because I ordered my dish spicy.

40.description: This place is still great.  I dine with or order carry out from Thai Aroma at least once or twice a month.  It's a BYOB so if you dine in, don't forget to bring wine or beer!

53.description: Stopped in for lunch (take out). I have walked by this place a number of times, as my dentist's office is a few doors down. I had just left the dentist and was on my way to the El stop (headed back to work), so, I decided to give it a try. I ordered the Yellow Curry w/Chicken, no carrots. They got the order right and brought it to me very quickly all packaged up. They gave it to me in a plastic bag with handles. I proceeded to walk to the El stop and the train came quickly. As I was sitting on the train, with the food on my lap, I noticed a lot of heat coming from the bag. It was burning my lap. Turns out that on the short walk from the restaurant to the El while I was holding the bag by its handles exactly as they had given it to me, almost the entire dish had seeped out of the container and was sloshing around in the bottom of the plastic bag. This was all due to an ill fitting lid on the food container. Then, what I was able to salvage (when I got back to my office) was mediocre at best. The sauce was extremely greasy and barely had a curry or coconut milk flavor. It was basically a bland sauce with some chilies thrown in (I asked for a heat level of 3 out of 6). I also orderd brown rice, which I guess was left in the crock pot too long. It was dry/overcooked/crusty. This place is cheap, but that's about all they have going for them. There are way better places to have Thai food in the city.

30.description: In a pinch, I was starving and ordered Thai Aroma since my car needed a jump and I was waiting for my friend to show up with cables. I wanted to get Thai food from Ben's Noodle and Rice up where I used to live in Edgewater (it's the best I've had in the city). So I ordered what I usually get at Ben's. Pad Thai. Extra spicy. Chicken. Add Cilantro. With the craving I had for Thai, I couldn't wait to eat. I opened up the bowl. First thing I noticed. No cilantro. Second thing I noticed - no green onions - any good Thai place always includes green onions in their pad thai. Third. The chicken was overcooked and very dry. At least it was edible, but I threw out my leftovers. Even now that I live in Old Town, I'd drive back up to Edgewater just to get Ben's. In summary: Pass this place up. There are far better Thai options in this city.

46.description: The food is pretty good and reasonably priced, but the people who work there are VERY rude!  I love the way they cook their tofu and the curry fried rice.  If this restaurant wasn't so conveniently close to my office, I'd be really put off by the staff and probably wouldn't go back.  Would it kill them to smile?

1.description: Ordered the red and the yellow curries to eat at the restaurant and was very disappointed. The red curry was topped with an obviously frozen vegetable mix. The yellow curry included a few bulky vegetable pieces that were overcooked. The service wasn't friendly and the decor was lacking.

55.description: I like this place, food tastes great, they are BYOB, which is nice. I usually stop by there to get some food to go, as this place on my way home. I takes them 5-10 mins to provide me with my food.

9.description: I've been here many, many times and had it delivered twice.It's night and day with delivery vs. eating in. They need to step up the delivery 1000%. It never tastes as good, takes forever and wrong things/missing things happen often.Dining in is a whole other story. The Panang noodle is amazing, as is the Crazy Cousin. My go to for the past few months has been the spicy noodle - delicious. Their spice levels are legit - order carefully!

26.description: This place is close to work, and I had a thai craving so I decided to go. It was completely empty which I thought was strange for lunch time. The decor was also pretty plain. The waitress was very friendly and attentive from the moment I walked in until I left which was the best part of the experience. They have a lunch special which includes an appetizer and entree for $6.99. I ordered the crab rangoon and pad thai. A small bowl of "soup" was brought out with my appetizer. The soup was mostly broth with some rice and chicken. It was ok so I can't complain. The crab rangoon was freshly made and smelled great, however there was tons of creams cheese and I'm still not sure if I actually tasted crab.I love cream cheese so I didn't mind, but I'm sure others would. My pad thai was good but as I read from another Yelper didn't include green onions which is strange. It was also pretty oily which after a while begins to upset the stomach.I really wanted to love this place, or at least look forward to going back  since it is conveniently close to work but unfortunately that's a no. If as much effort was put into the food as there was in making the website, perhaps they would have gotten a better review from me.

25.description: There are some good Thai restaurants in Chicago, a lot of mediocre ones, and places like Thai Aroma. Mind you, this was my first time ordering, but given the abundance of Thai restaurants in Chicago--seriously, it's absurd--I think it'll be my last.I ordered Tom Kha soup, potstickers, and soba noodles. I was sick at the time. The broth of the Tom Kha soup was okay, not great, but the ingredients were super cheap. A few bits of lemongrass and that adorable little asian variety of mushroom were included, but the majority of the soup was spinach, white mushrooms (the kind you find all over the grocery store), and quartered vine tomatoes. Those last three ingredients are generally not something you'd expect in tom kha soup and just made it taste like something from Papa John's.The potstickers were filled with chicken that tasted like it came out of a can and was old. The soba noodles also came with balls of the can chicken and--huzzah--more spinach. Spinach everywhere.Don't get me wrong, I like spinach, tomatoes, and white mushrooms, but those are not things that belong or taste well in the dishes I ate. I'm not sure if they don't know the proper recipes of the dishes they cook or if they don't care. I don't care to find out.

12.description: FAREWELL TO A FORMER FAVEFor years, Thai Aroma was a personal fave - the place I had to introduce to out-of-town friends for their once-incomparable Aroma fried rice. But the owners have let quality and service slip badly. The food's now "meh" and their drivers are argumentative and RUDE. Done!

59.description: This is a great BYOB joint in Old Town.  While it's not anything spectacularly out of the norm, it's quick and tasty.  I alternate between the garlic chicken and chicken pad thai.  When it's particularly blustery, the Udon soup does the job!  Would I go out of my way to go here? Probably not.Is it a standby when I'm in the area? Definitely.

21.description: Holy crap the pot stickers are awful. Don't get those. Everything else though, fairly solid. Food good, quick, and fast. Nice people working there too. Just don't get the pot stickers.

17.description: Holy crap the pot stickers are awful. Don't get those. Everything else though, fairly solid. Food good, quick, and fast. Nice people working there too. Just don't get the pot stickers.

10.description: This place is VERY inconsistent.  I live a block away and I've been eating here for 3 years.  Sometimes it's good...sometimes it's bad but it is generally below average.  I usually get the crazy noodles and when it is done right, it is quite good.  When picking up I always go 5 min after they say it will be ready as the time they give you is not always accurate. Not the cleanest place either.  My fiancé said our napkins smelled like gasoline tonight!  If I didn't live so close I wouldn't go here...

5.description: Food was ok, not good enough to make me go back.I got the lunch special but the appetizer was small, not filling.

3.description: DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY FROM HERE!!!Hey, I can understand one screw up, but tonight was the final straw.  It took them over an hour and a half to deliver my food....No lie.  No football game on, weather was fine, no snow, no rain, no exceptional traffic.  No major events going on...AN HOUR AND A HALF...AGAIN!!!!Needless to say the food was cold, cold noodles, cold chicken.DON'T BOTHERTHEY DON'T CARE.

35.description: Not good food. I had the spicy catfish curry, and the catfish was like rubber.  Only good thing about this place is that it was BYOB, and we didn't have to wait for a table on a Friday night.

19.description: This place is close to work, and I had a thai craving so I decided to go. It was completely empty which I thought was strange for lunch time. The decor was also pretty plain. The waitress was very friendly and attentive from the moment I walked in until I left which was the best part of the experience. They have a lunch special which includes an appetizer and entree for $6.99. I ordered the crab rangoon and pad thai. A small bowl of "soup" was brought out with my appetizer. The soup was mostly broth with some rice and chicken. It was ok so I can't complain. The crab rangoon was freshly made and smelled great, however there was tons of creams cheese and I'm still not sure if I actually tasted crab.I love cream cheese so I didn't mind, but I'm sure others would. My pad thai was good but as I read from another Yelper didn't include green onions which is strange. It was also pretty oily which after a while begins to upset the stomach.I really wanted to love this place, or at least look forward to going back  since it is conveniently close to work but unfortunately that's a no. If as much effort was put into the food as there was in making the website, perhaps they would have gotten a better review from me.

28.description: I always have a great experience with this place!!  The Crab Rangoon are probably the best I've had in Chicago!!  Delivery is fast and the food is always hot when it gets here!

45.description: Delicious Pad Thai.   BYOB which is another plus although I have not dined in yet.I wish I could give a better review on this place but I've never gotten past the Pad Thai.

33.description: Recently updated decor. Much better than before! Still great service, food, staff and prices!

43.description: Meh - you could definitely find much better in Chicago without looking too hard.  I ordered Green Curry, which was watery and not overly flavorful.  My friend had the Panang Curry, which had more flavor.  The potstickers were pretty plain as well.  Given the decor, I imagine they run more of a take-out business.

2.description: Terrible bland food.  Potstickers were definitely frozen as were the vegetables. Meat tasted of poor quality

18.description: I live right down the street from this place and I am a huge fan! We actually ordered it last night because of the snow and our Sunday hangovers. I got the pad thai medium spicy. It...was...spicy, just how I wanted it! I was planning to have the leftovers for lunch but it was so good I ate the whole thing! Again, no gluten free soy sauce but I have learned to live without it.You can order online and it is quick, cheaply priced, and warm! I highly suggest this place!

41.description: Pretty decent. I got my food to go and sometimes that backfires if the tupperware they use is cheap. The noodles can get hard and cold, etc. I ordered my Pad Thai hot and I really enjoyed it. A generous portion as well. Made for two meals. Good flavor mixed with the hot sauce. While inside, the seating, although small had a pretty cozy feel to it. Definitely worth checking out if you're a fan of Pad Thai and Thai food all together.Peace.

52.description: Hmmm...girlfriend and I went to dinner here Sunday night - early evening.  Loads of street parking available which is great (even though we live walking distance)...Ambiance is lacking a bit, but I didn't expect it to be above average.  This was our first time here and we will definitely be back - although we may opt for carry out instead.I ordered the Lemon Grass Tofu with brown rice ($2.50 up charge), it was tasty - firm tofu, not too mushy, and they allowed me to determine how spicy I wanted the dish.  I have an issue with spicy food, so medium was just right for me.My girlfriend ordered Pad Thai w/ chicken.  She really enjoyed it (she dumps about half the jar of chili sauce on her plate) so I found it hard to believe how anyone can enjoy it...regardless, she thought it was tasty - I thought it tasted like the smell of a zoo...  just  my opinion - I'm very pick about thai food, so I tend to stay away from dishes with fish sauce.All in all, pretty good; would recommend this place for a cheap dinner any day of the week.

50.description: My favorite dish here is the Thai marinated chicken and rice. This dish is what keeps me coming back! It's priced right and you get a ton of food.The only time I don't get the Thai marinated chicken is when I order the lunch special. You get a lot of food for a good price. The staff are also really nice. This place knows how to keep me coming back for more!

4.description: I somewhat feel bad for this post be I have been a fan for a long time of Thai Aroma but today's actions were too much. I have ordered the same thing from this place every other week for months, and like normal I placed my picked up order and never had an issue. But this time the rudeness from the clerk was beyond belief. Times must be tough bc she tried to charge me for the free hot sauce, when I asked her again she continued to say it was .75 cents. The owner came out and yelled at her for charging guest for free hot sauce. Pick better employees and I hope that .75 cents makes up for the $30 I spend a month.

6.description: I'm not even kidding you when I say I've been ordering the same dish from Thai Aroma for the last 6 years, almost every single Sunday. And by "almost" I mean I may have missed a half a dozen Sunday's over the years... Which was most likely due to being out of town traveling someplace or another. I have been known to schedule travel days around Sunday's for this exact reason. No joke. Thai aroma and HBO!! It's what I live for!!Anyway.... Love the potstickers and the sauce (I've never tried another sauce that even comes close to their potsticker sauce). I always order the Jungle Curry medium with chicken and extra veggies. Which is a spicy curry dish without the coconut. Which makes me feel like a little less of a fatty... But it doesn't stop me from eating some of my husband's chicken pad Thai. Every. Single. Time. "Sorry Adam, I ate half your pad Thai.. Again! "The only issue I've ever run into over the years is that their brown rice can sometimes been pretty bleh - like over cooked or a day old or something. But it hasn't stopped me from coming back. Every place has problems from time to time.  Anyway... I look forward to this dish every week! Definitely check it out! Oh and their delivery is super fast if you live anywhere nearby.

22.description: I live right down the street from this place and I am a huge fan! We actually ordered it last night because of the snow and our Sunday hangovers. I got the pad thai medium spicy. It...was...spicy, just how I wanted it! I was planning to have the leftovers for lunch but it was so good I ate the whole thing! Again, no gluten free soy sauce but I have learned to live without it.You can order online and it is quick, cheaply priced, and warm! I highly suggest this place!

15.description: Decent Thai food in Old Town. I can't say this place blew me away, but it's not bad for the area. The portions are larger than normal. There were generous amounts of chicken in my Pad Thai and the Crab Rangoons were really tasty. Ask for extra sauce for your noodles though, felt they were a little on the dry side. I'd check this place out again since it's close to me.

57.description: FIrst time here, hopefully not the last. Though Old Town is not My Town, it's close enough to make this a regular stop.I really enjoyed the Panang Curry. I asked for it to be "#5 hot" which is one below the "#6" that carries a warning. I didn't find it to be very hot, but it was still really quite good. I liked the fresh vegetables quite a bit, and the amount of chicken was surprisingly ample.The small dining room lends itself more toward community discussion (e.g., unavoidable eavesdropping) than intimiate conversation, so this wouldn't be a place to take a date and let her know that the test came back positive.

20.description: Food- just okay. Been ordering from them for a while now as they're right by us/our children's' schools. They have unfortunately done a poor job with their recent hires. Ordered for take out, but my little girls decided upon entry they would like to stay to eat there. An ask- resulted in an eye roll and a grunt. But no worries, we ate fast out of our to-go boxes and were almost out in about 20 minutes. Still a small tip was left (about 10%). When I asked for hot sauce, the staff (of one) raised her voice and told me she had "packed the bag" herself and there was hot sauce in there. When I said I didn't find one, she proceeded to go to my take out bag to rummage for it! whilst yelling accusatorially. She scared my little kids, and shocked me. To which I promptly asked her for my check back and scratched off her tip, told her that I would ensure my friends in the neighborhood and otherwise would hear of this. Such a shame they're in my neighborhood and a nice one at that with such shabby hires.

36.description: Worst pad thai I have ever had. It was greasy and frankly, didn't taste much like pad thai. The green curry noodles were delicious. Tom kah soup was average. Overall, I would not return.

14.description: Just awful.  The restaurant sent the wrong order, and then when we called to get it fixed they yelled at us and told us it wasn't their problem (and, to top it off, that we ordered the wrong thing)... We ate one of the spring rolls, which were dry and not at all fresh.  There are too many thai restaurants in the city for one this bad to exist!!
